\t Xediw qˤač’aw, qizanyos t’alam bodixanusi žek’u zown.
\m xediw qˤač’aw qizan-s t’alam b-odi-xanusi žek’u zow-n
\g husband rough family-GEN1 care III-do-NEG.PRS.PRT man be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The husband was a rough man who did not do the family's duty.

\t Axʷa xexbi risk’ač’inir yisä baru qacis muɣ bowa ciqaɣort’a yegirxo zown.
\m ax-a xexbi r-isk’a-č’i-nir yisi-a baru qaci-s muɣ b-ow-a ciq-aɣor-t’a y-egir-x zow-n
\g belly-IN.ESS children III.PL-keep-NEG.FUT.CVB-PURP.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG wife firewood-GEN1 bundle III-bring-INF forest-IN.VERS-DISTR II-send-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He sent the wife to bring a bundle of firewood from the forest, so that she wouldn't keep the child in the belly.

\t Sidaquł yiłar ciqqo Allahes ašuni bukayn.
\m sidaquł yiła-r ciq-q Allah-s ašuni b-ukad-n
\g one.day DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT forest-POSS.ESS God-GEN1 belt III-see-PST.UNW
\l One day she saw a rainbow in the forest.

\t Yiła nełaq (ašunoq) harizi rodin där ukrus nak’ila yołäsi kid yodiroƛƛin.
\m yiła-a neła-q ašuni-q harizi r-odi-n di-r ukru-s nak’ila yoł-asi kid y-odi-r-ƛ-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS belt-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PST.UNW me-LAT silver-GEN1 little.finger be-RES.PRT girl II-do-CAUS-OPT-QUOT
\l She begged it (the rainbow), if she could get a girl with a silver pinkie.

\t Łarašawni ɣˤanazas maduhalłiqtow esiws kid zown.
\m łarašaw-ni ɣˤanabi-s maduhalłi-q-tow esiw-s kid zow-n
\g pregnant-DEF woman-GEN1 neighbourhood-POSS.ESS-EMPH brother-GEN1 daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In the pregnant woman's neighbourhood lived her brother's daughter.

\t Xedyos zulmun č’alʕizi boqno yedu esiwz kidbedäɣor yik’in.
\m xediw-s zulmu-n č’alʕizi b-oq-n yedu esiw-z kid-däɣor y-ik’i-n
\g husband-GEN1 tyranny-TOP harass III-become-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG brother-GEN2 daughter-APUD.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l When she couldn't bear her husband's tyranny any longer, she went to her brother's daughter.

\t Sidaquł yiłar mesedyos nak’ila yołäsi kid yodin.
\m sidaquł yiła-r mesed-s nak’ila yoł-asi kid y-odi-n
\g one.day DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT gold-GEN1 little.finger be-RES.PRT girl II-do-PST.UNW
\l One day she gave birth to a girl that had a golden pinky.

\t Yiła kid neširuxay raɣäɣor yoqa gurow yegirxo zownanu.
\m yiła-a kid neširu-xay raɣi-aɣor y-oq-a gurow y-egir-x zow-n-anu
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG girl evening-AD.ABL veranda-IN.VERS II-become-INF except II-send-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l She didn't allow the girl to go anywere else than the veranda in the evening.

\t Neširuxay maħor ža yaqrun, sadaq šet’urtow gʷanɣizi roqxo zown.
\m neširu-xay maħor ža y-oq-run sadaq šet’ur-tow gʷanɣizi r-oq-x zow-n
\g evening-AD.ABL outside DEM1.SG II-become-IMM.ANT.CVB all around-EMPH illuminate IV-become-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Right after she had gone outside in the evening, everything around was getting bright.

\t Kid yaq’ˤiłnosi, ʕuraw ʕoloqbi bayx zown žan esirno, amma eniw razi yoqxo zownanu ža sidxokin yegiranix.
\m kid y-aq’ˤił-nosi ʕuraw ʕoloq-bi b-ay-x zow-n ža-n esir-n amma eniw razi y-oq-x zow-n-anu ža sida-x-kin y-egir-ani-x
\g girl II-grow.up-ANT.CVB many young.person-PL I.PL-come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.SG-TOP ask-PST.UNW but mother agree II-become-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.SG one.OBL-AD.ESS-even II-send-MSD-AD.ESS
\l When the girl was grown up, many boys were coming and asked for her hand, but the mother was not content about sending her to any of them.

\t Sida maqˤizoni ʕaƛa bečedaw žek’us ɣudƛ’ay ɣudƛ’or ħalaq’ oqxo uži ik’ix zown.
\m sida maqˤi-zo-ni ʕaƛ-a bečedaw žek’u-s ɣudi-ƛ’ay ɣudi-ƛ’or ħalaq’ oq-x uži ik’i-x zow-n
\g one.OBL far.away-ATTR.OBL-DEF village-IN.ESS wealthy man-GEN1 day-SUPER.ABL day-SUPER.LAT meager become-IPFV.CVB son go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In a village far away, a rich man's son was getting thinner day by day.

\t Nesi žaz babiya sidaquł q’orol ɣˤanabin yiqirno nełaq esin, hemedur ɣudƛ’ay ɣudƛ’or dey uži ħalaq’ oqxo ik’ixƛin.
\m nesi uži-z babiw-a sidaquł q’orol ɣˤanabi-n y-iqir-n neła-q esi-n hemedur ɣudi-ƛ’ay ɣudi-ƛ’or di-s uži ħalaq’ oq-x ik’i-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-GEN2 father-ERG one.day widowed woman-TOP II-find-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW so day-SUPER.ABL day-SUPER.LAT me-GEN1 boy meager become-IPFV.CVB go-PRS-QUOT
\l One day the boy's father found a widow and told her that his boy is becoming meager day by day.

\t Q’orol ɣˤanaza eƛin:
\m q’orol ɣˤanabi-a eƛi-n
\g widowed woman-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The widow said:

\t Mi där ukrus šit’u neƛnäy, di iyran ža šida ħalaq’ oqxo yałrułiƛin.”
\m mi di-r ukru-s šit’u neƛ-näy di iyr-an ža šida ħalaq’ oq-x yoł-rułi-ƛin
\g you me-LAT silver-GEN1 plate give-CND.CVB me find.out-FUT.DEF DEM1.SG why meager become-IPFV.CVB be-MSD-QUOT
\l "When you give me a plate full of silver, I will find out why he is becoming meager."

\t Bečedawni žek’u razi oqno.
\m bečedaw-ni žek’u razi oq-n
\g wealthy-DEF man agree become-PST.UNW
\l The wealthy man agreed.

\t Q’orolay žaz idurno yik’in, nesir yiynč’ey neširu ža kecxozo taxeƛno yuqˤełno, ʕenekizi yoqno yičin.
\m q’orolay uži-z idu-r-n y-ik’i-n nesi-r y-iy-č’ey neširu ža kec-xozo tax-ƛ-n y-uqˤeł-n ʕenekizi y-oq-n y-iči-n
\g widow boy-GEN2 home-LAT-and II-go-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT II-know-NEG.PST.UNW at.night DEM1.SG sleep-PRS.PRT.OBL bed-SUB.ESS-TOP II-hide-PST.UNW listen II-become-PFV.CVB II-be-PST.UNW
\l The widow went to the boy's home, without him knowing, and at night hid under his bed while he was sleeping, and listened.

\t Uži kecnosi, nesä mušin kurno nełar eƛix teqno:
\m uži kec-nosi nesi-a muši-n kur-n neła-r eƛi-x teq-n
\g boy sleep-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG breath-and exhale-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW
\l After the boy went to sleep, she heard him sighing and saying:

\t Hemeła maqˤizo ʕaƛasi där moƛał yukayru mesedyos nak’ila yałruni kid yiqinč’inäy di anƛ’imoq’az äxuƛin.”
\m hemeła maqˤi-zo ʕaƛ-asi di-r moƛu-ł y-ukad-ru mesed-s nak’ila yoł-ru-ni kid y-iqi-č’i-näy di anƛ’i-q’az exu-ƛin
\g then far.away-ATTR.OBL village-RES.PRT me-LAT dream-CONT.ESS II-see-PST.PRT gold-GEN1 little.finger be-PST.PRT-DEF girl II-get-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB me week-POSS.ESS.DIST(?) die-QUOT
\l "Then, if I don't get the girl from the village far away with the golden pinky, that I saw in my dream, I will die in a week."

\t Sasaqozox žarno yiynč’ey maħorno yoqno, q’orola žaz babiwq esin nesiƛ’ yałru q’ʷariłiłäy.
\m sasaqozox uži-r-n y-iy-č’ey maħor-n y-oq-n q’orol uži-z babiw-q esi-n nesi-ƛ’ yoł-ru q’ʷariłi-łay
\g early.morning boy-LAT-TOP II-know-NEG.PST.UNW outside-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB widowed boy-GEN2 father-POSS.ESS tell-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS be-PST.PRT sadness-CONT.ABL
\l In the morning, she secretly went outside; the widow told the boy's father of the sadness that was on him.

\t Q’orol ɣˤanazar bayru q’ut’imoxor šebinno teƛno yegirno.
\m q’orol ɣˤanabi-r b-odi-ru q’ut’i-xor šebin-n teƛ-n y-egir-n
\g widowed woman-LAT III-do-PST.PRT agreement-AD.LAT thing-TOP give-PFV.CVB II-send-PST.UNW
\l He gave the widow what was agreed upon and sent her away.

\t Bik’in žedu mesedyos nak’ila yałruni kidbez eniwder bayn.
\m b-ik’i-n žedu mesed-s nak’ila yoł-ru-ni kid-z eniw-der b-ay-n
\g I.PL-go-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL gold-GEN1 little.finger be-PST.PRT-DEF girl-GEN2 mother-APUD.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l They went on and came to the mother of the girl with the golden pinky.

\t K’emotya kidno yuqˤek’no yičin zown nełas eniw.
\m k’emot’-a kid-n y-uqˤek’-n y-iči-n zow-n neła-s eniw
\g wooden.case-IN.ESS girl-TOP II-shut-PFV.CVB II-be-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 mother
\l The girl's mother locked her away in a chest.

\t Xizaɣor esiwz kidbä yiłqor eƛin, yisiq’ay igun, bečedawn deber uži äqinč’i kid xedyox yegirinč’ey min yok’äłinč’iƛin.
\m xizaɣor esiw-z kid-a yiła-qor eƛi-n yisi-q’ay igu-n bečedaw-n mi-r uži iqi-č’i kid xediw-x y-egir-č’ey mi-n y-ok’eł-č’i-ƛin
\g finally brother-GEN2 girl-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-EQU2 rich-and wealthy-and you-LAT boy get-NEG.FUT daughter husband-AD.ESS II-send-NEG.PST.UNW you-TOP II-escape-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l Finally the brother's girl said to her that she won't find any man as rich and wealthy, so that the daughter couldn't do anything else than to take him as a husband.

\t Xizaɣor bertenno bodin, kid bečedawni žek’us žax yegirno.
\m xizaɣor berten-n b-odi-n kid bečedaw-ni žek’u-s uži-x y-egir-n
\g finally marriage-TOP I.PL-do-PFV.CVB girl wealthy-DEF man-GEN1 son-AD.ESS II-send-PST.UNW
\l Finally they married and sent the girl to the son of the rich man.

\t Boƛƛ’o zaman bik’inosi, kidbä neła nełdaɣor eniw yižin.
\m boƛƛ’o zaman b-ik’i-nosi kid-a neła-a neła-daɣor eniw y-iži-n
\g middle time III-go-ANT.CVB girl-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.VERS motherII II-lead-PST.UNW
\l In the meantime, the girl took her mother to her own place.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder ža ɣˤanabi xedyoz zulmuqayn yok’ełno, Allahzo ašunoz kumakyoƛaza raħatyoƛ’ zown.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder ža ɣˤanabi xediw-z zulmu-qay-n y-ok’-ł-n Allah-zo ašuni-z kumak-ƛaza raħat-ƛ’ zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after DEM1.SG woman husband-GEN2 tyranny-POSS.ABL-and II-beat-POT-PFV.CVB God-ATTR.OBL belt-GEN2 help-SUB.VERS recreation-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After that, the woman got repose from her husband's tyranny and his beatings with the help of the rainbow.

\t Zownƛax zown anuƛax sis ɣˤanabi.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis ɣˤanabi
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT one woman
\l Once upon a time there was a woman.

\t Neła eƛni netintow ʕaƛoxay maqˤi, qunyox, yoɣxo zown.
\m neła-a eƛni netin-tow ʕaƛ-xay maqˤi qun-x y-oɣ-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG winter always-EMPH village-AD.ABL far.away farmstead-AD.ESS II-spend.time-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l She always spent the winter at a farm far away from the village.

\t Sida quł eƛnoq yaq’ˤu, žek’u maħor oqełxanuzo ħalał, isi yayn.
\m sida qu-ł eƛni-q y-aq’ˤu žek’u maħor oq-ł-xanuzo ħalał isi y-ay-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS winter-POSS.ESS II-much man outside become-POT-NEG.PRS.PRT.OBL with.difficulties snow II-come-PST.UNW
\l One day in winter it snowed so hard, that people couldn't even go outside.

\t Sasaq maħor yoqzaƛ’or, yiłas ɣˤutku ciqez posurä šet’u rutiräsi resuzaƛ’, neła nasin žedu tataniłanix iduɣor regirno.
\m sasaq maħor y-oq-zaƛ’or yiła-s ɣˤutku ciq-z posu-a šet’u r-utir-asi r-esu-zaƛ’ neła-a nasin žedu tatanił-ani-x idu-ɣor r-egir-n
\g in.the.morning outside II-become-POST.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 house forest-GEN2 cattle-ERG around IV-gather-RES.PRT IV-appear-CSL.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG all DEM1.IPL warmthen.oneself-MSD-AD.ESS home-IN.ALL IV-send-PST.UNW
\l The morning when she went outside, the wild animals gathered around her house; she let them into her house, which could be warmthened.

\t Boc’an, zeybin, ɣuro yałza rečuƛ, aɣˤnä teł rišin, aɣbi girimabin kurno idutow xecin, bełis čanyabin, resobin čolow yałza hiɣar regirno.
\m boc’a-n zey-bi-n ɣuro yoł-za reču-ƛ aɣˤni-a teł r-iši-n aɣi-bi giri-bi-n kur-n idu-tow xeci-n bełi-s čan-bi-n reso-bi-n čolow yoł-za hiɣu-ar r-egir-n
\g wolf.PL-and bear-PL-and cows be-LCV.CVB cattleshed-SUB.ESS cowshed-IN.ESS inside IV-drive.in-PST.UNW bird-PL pole-PL-TOP erect-PFV.CVB home-EMPH leave-PST.UNW wild.goat-GEN1 she.goat-PL-and roe-PL-and straw be-LCV hayloft-IN.LAT IV-send-PST.UNW
\l She drove the wolves and bears into the cowshed where the cows were, erected poles for the birds to give [them] a home, and sent the wild goats and roes into the half-open shed where there was straw.

\t Sida quł łäƛ’or gulun bižin xizor yutin yedu yayzaƛ’or, nasin yiłas ɣuro zeyzan, boc’än rac’äsi resun.
\m sida qu-ł łi-ƛ’or gulu-n b-iži-n xizor y-uti-n yedu y-ay-zaƛ’or nasin yiła-s ɣuro zey-bi-a-n boc’a-a-n r-ac’-asi r-esu-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS water-SUPER.LAT horse-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB back II-turn.back-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG II-come-POST.CVB all DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 cows bear-PL-ERG-and wolf.PL-ERG-and IV-eat-RES.PRT IV-find-PST.UNW
\l One day when she came back from leading a horse to a watering place, it turned out that the bears and wolves had eaten up all her cows.

\t Nediwtow q’ʷariłi bayzaƛ’, dahawtow yuyn ʕiyayn, bisno sis bexora hibon łoxt’a ža bok’xo nasin boc’an, zeybin maħor roxirno.
\m nediw-tow q’ʷariłi b-ay-zaƛ’ dahaw-tow yuyn ʕiyad-n b-is-n sis bexora hibo-n łox-t’a ža b-ok’-x nasin boc’a-n zey-bi-n maħor r-oxir-n
\g such-EMPH sadness III-come-CSL.CVB a.little-EMPH and(?) cry-PST.UNW I.PL-take-PFV.CVB one lengthy stick-TOP thrice-DISTR DEM1.SG III-beat-IPFV.CVB all wolf.PL-and bear-PL-and outside III.PL-chase-PST.UNW
\l Because of such a tragedy, she began to cry a little, took a long stick, beated it three times and chased off all the wolves and bears.

\t Ixdax, isi yecinosi, nasin ciqes, posu yiła maħor regirno.
\m ixdax isi y-eci-nosi nasin ciq-s posu yiła maħor r-egir-n
\g in.spring snow II-thaw-ANT.CVB all forest-GEN1 cattle DEM2.IISG.OBL outside IV-let-PST.UNW
\l In spring, after the snow had thawed, she let all the wild animals out.

\t Boc’ä ɣuron rac’äsi roqzaƛ’, roda šebinon koƛ’inč’ey, yedu ʕaƛaɣor yik’in.
\m boc’a-a ɣuro-n r-ac’-asi r-oq-zaƛ’ r-odi-a šebinon koƛ’i-č’ey yedu ʕaƛ-aɣor y-ik’i-n
\g wolf.PL-ERG cows-TOP IV-eat-RES.PRT IV-become-CSL.CVB IV-do-INF something understand.to-NEG.PST.UNW DEM2.IISG village-IN.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l Because the wolves wanted to eat the cows, she didn't know what to do and went into the village.

\t Elor yiłar ɣudes bełiz čanyaza ɣˤay yayrxo rayx zown.
\m elo-r yiła-r ɣudes bełi-z čan-bi-a ɣˤay y-ayr-x r-ay-x zow-n
\g there-LAT DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT daily wild.goat-GEN2 she.goat-PL-ERG milk II-bring-IPFV.CVB IV-come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The wild goats were daily coming to bring her milk.

\t Sida quł, ɣudod, maħazayzo ɣuɣaymo yedu moƛaxay č’arik’no.
\m sida qu-ł ɣudod maħor-azay-zo ɣuɣay-mo yedu moƛu-xay č’arik’-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS at.midnight outside-IN.ABL.DIST-ATTR.OBL noise-ERG DEM2.IISG sleep-AD.ABL wake.up-PST.UNW
\l One day at midnight a noise from far outside woke her up from her sleep.

\t Yizin maħorno yoqno yezunosi, ɣuros reqenno bayrno rayäsi, eƛnoq yiłas posu rac’runi boc’an, zeybin resun.
\m y-izi-n maħor-n y-oq-n y-ezu-nosi ɣuro-s reqen-n b-ayr-n r-ay-asi eƛni-q yiła-s posu r-ac’-ru-ni boc’a-n zey-bi-n r-esu-n
\g II-get.up-PFV.CVB outside-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB II-look-ANT.CVB cows-GEN1 herd-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB III.PL-come-RES.PRT winter-POSS.ESS DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 cattle IV-eat-PST.PRT-DEF wolf.PL-and bear-PL-and III.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l After she got up, went outside and had a look, the wolves and bears that had eaten her cattle in winter, turned up leading a cow herd.

\t Ɣˤanazader ɣuron regirno, eluq ħalikataw šebin deber roqsiƛin ƛ’iräy žan yoɣno, nełar q’omexno bodin, roqno žeda žedaz q’aymozaƛ’ar ciqaɣor rik’in.
\m ɣˤanabi-der ɣuro-n r-egir-n elu-q ħalikataw šebin mi-r r-oq-s-ƛin ƛ’iräy ža-n y-oɣ-n neła-r q’omex-n b-odi-n r-oq-n žedu-a žeda-az q’aymobi-ƛ’ar ciq-aɣor r-ik’i-n
\g woman-APUD.LAT cows-TOP IV-send-PST.UNW we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS mean thing you-LAT IV-happen-PST.WIT-QUOT from.above DEM1.SG-TOP II-take.away-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT farewell-TOP III-do-PST.UNW IV-begin-PST.UNW DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IIPL.OBL-IN.ESS.DIST settlement-SUPER.VERS forest-IN.VERS IV-go-PST.UNW
\l The cows were sent to the woman, "We've done something mean to you", they said; they apologized to her, said farewell to her and began to go towards the forest over their own settlement.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder yiłade idu yig, ʕaƛoz xalq’imor teƛanircennan yaq’ˤu ɣˤay yičix zown.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder yiła-de idu y-ig ʕaƛ-z xalq’i-r teƛ-ani-r-ace-n-nan y-aq’ˤu ɣˤay y-iči-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after DEM2.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS home II-much village-GEN2 people-LAT give-MSD-LAT-TERM-TOP-INT II-many milk II-be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After that, she had so much milk at home that she could give it away to the villagers.

\t T’ok’ow yedu qunyoxar yik’inč’eytow, paraxat yoqno ʕaƛox yičin.
\m t’ok’ow yedu qun-xar y-ik’i-č’ey-tow paraxat y-oq-n ʕaƛ-x y-iči-n
\g anymore DEM2.IISG farmstead-AD.VERS II-go-NEG.PST.UNW-EMPH calm II-become-PFV.CVB village-AD.ESS II-be-PST.UNW
\l She didn't go to the farmstead anymore, and found peace near the village.

\t Sis zown xan.
\m sis zow-n xan
\g one be.NPRS-PST.UNW khan
\l There was a king.

\t Nesis zown łˤono uži.
\m nesi-s zow-n łˤono uži
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW three son
\l He had 3 sons.

\t Boƛƛo sis zaman bik’inosi, xan roƛa utirno.
\m b-oƛƛo sis zaman b-ik’i-nosi xan r-oƛ-a utir-n
\g III-middle one time III-go-ANT.CVB khan IV-be.sick-INF turn-PST.UNW
\l After a while, the king became sick.

\t Nesä žazar wasiyat bodin:
\m nesi-a uži-bi-r wasiyat b-odi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG son-PL-LAT legacy III-do-PST.UNW
\l He left his sons his last will:

\t Dey xexbi, di exun xizyo t’ubazi odin łiynosi, meži łˤonon esnabi bitazoni ɣˤutkar bezu, elo mežur ʕuraw mesed yołƛin”.
\m di-s xexbi di exu-n xizyo t’ubazi odi-n łiy-nosi meži łˤono-n esyu-bi bitasi-ni ɣˤutku-ar b-ezu-u elo mežu-r ʕuraw mesed yoł-ƛin
\g me-GEN1 children me die-PFV.CVB after fulfill do-PST.UNW end-ANT.CVB you.PL three-TOP brother-PL next-DEF room-IN.LAT I.PL-look-IMPR there you(I).PL.OBL-LAT much gold be-QUOT
\l "My children, when I have died and the funeral is done, you three brothers look into the next room, there is much gold for you."

\t Nełƛ’osi kʷaxatow xan exun.
\m nełƛ’osi kʷaxa-tow xan exu-n
\g of.that.time quickly-EMPH khan die-PST.UNW
\l The king died very soon, then.

\t Bitazoni ɣˤutkarno bik’in bezunosi, elo yizir mesedyos q’ˤano saħ besun.
\m bitasi-ni ɣˤutku-ar-n b-ik’i-n b-ezu-nosi elo yizi-r mesed-s q’ˤano saħ b-esu-n
\g next-DEF room-IN.LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB I.PL-look-ANT.CVB there DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT gold-GEN1 two sah III-find-PST.UNW
\l After they went to look into the next room, they found 2 Sah (5 kg) of gold there.

\t Eženi esiya beɣet’ani esnazaqor eƛin:
\m eže-ni esyu-a b-eɣe-t’a-ni esyu-bi-qor eƛi-n
\g old-DEF brother-ERG I.PL-young-DISTR-DEF brother-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l The eldest brother said to his younger brothers:

\t Dey esnabi, babiya badiru wasiyatyoƛ’ req’un t’o mesedyos łˤono saħ biča bay, amma t’o q’ˤano taraw saħ anu.
\m di-s esyu-bi babiw-a b-adiru wasiyat-ƛ’ req’un t’o mesed-s łˤono saħ b-iči-a b-ay amma t’o q’ˤano taraw saħ anu
\g me-GEN1 brother-PL father-ERG III-fulfilled legacy-SUPER.ESS in.accordance.with here gold-GEN1 three sah I.PL-be-INF III-must but here two except.for sah be.NEG
\l "My brothers, according to father's fulfilled legacy, 3 Sah of gold must be here, but here is nothing more than 2 Sah.

\t Sideni saħ ługon boqłin elułäy, sidä bisäsi biča bayxƛin”.
\m sideni saħ ługon b-oq-łin elu-łay sida-a b-is-asi b-iči-a b-ay-x-ƛin
\g other sah someone III-happen-CNC.CVB we(I).OBL-CONT.ABL one.OBL-IN.ESS I.PL-take-RES.PRT I.PL-be-INF III-must-PRS-QUOT
\l It must be the case that someone of us has taken the other Sah."

\t Oƛƛozoni esiya, di bisäsi anu elay mesedƛin, inkar boyn, hemedurtow eɣenän, xizyogon eženi esiyan ot’ bisno.
\m oƛƛo-zo-ni esyu-a di b-is-asi anu ele-ay mesed-ƛin inkar b-odi-n hemedur-tow eɣe-ni-a-n xizyogon eže-ni esyu-a-n ot’ b-is-n
\g middle-ATTR.OBL-DEF brother-ERG me III-take-RES.PRT be.NEG here-IN.ABL gold-QUOT rejection III-do-PST.UNW so-EMPH young-DEF-ERG-TOP then old-DEF brother-ERG-TOP rejection III-take-PST.UNW
\l The middle brother rejected this, saying that he were not the one who took the gold, and so did the younger brother; after that also the eldest brother rejected it.

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, - eƛin eženi esiya, - eli łˤonon xander bik’a bay - ele howlo räy łu mesed bäsrułiƛin”.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin - eƛi-n eže-ni esyu-a - eli łˤono-n xan-der b-ik’i-a b-ay - ele howlo r-äy łu mesed b-is-rułi-ƛin
\g so IV-turn.up-CNDCVB-QUOT - say-PSTUNW old-DEF brother-ERG - we three-and khan-APUD.LAT I.PL-go-INF I.PL-must - there there IV-know.FUTIND who.ERG gold III-take-MSD-QUOT
\l "If it turns out this way," said the eldest brother, "we three must go to the king -- there it will be known who has taken the gold."

\t Neła quł sasaqtow łˤonon esnabi q’ˤač’azin boqno xander bik’in.
\m neła-a qu-ł sasaq-tow łˤono-n esyu-bi q’ˤač’azi-n b-oq-n xan-der b-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning-EMPH three-and brother-PL dress.up-and III-become-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.LAT III-go-PST.UNW
\l On that day in the morning, the three brothers dressed up and went to the king.

\t Hunix bik’iƛ’orey, žedur ħumukulis ruɣu resun.
\m huni-x b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy žedu-r ħumukuli-s ruɣu r-esu-n
\g way-AD.ESS I.PL-go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT camel-GEN1 prints IV-find-PST.UNW
\l While being on their way, they found the hoofprints of a camel.

\t Eženi esiya beɣet’ani esnazaqor eƛin:
\m eže-ni esyu-a b-eɣe-t’a-ni esyu-bi-qor eƛi-n
\g old-DEF brother-ERG I.PL-young-DISTR-DEF brother-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l The eldest brother said to his younger brothers:

\t Howt’aza bitor didiw ħumukuli bäk’iru di biyran mežur retinäy:
\m howt’a-aza bitor didiw ħumukuli b-ik’i-ru di b-iyr-an mežu-r r-eti-näy
\g there-IN.VERS.DIST thither which camel III-go-PST.PRT me III-recognize-FUT.DEF you(I).PL.OBL-LAT IV-want-CND.CVB
\l If you want, I will find out for you what camel went from there.

\t Kut’yoƛ’asi nełas k’onč’u šiqˤono yołƛin”.
\m kut’yoƛ’asi neła-s k’onč’u šiqˤono yoł-ƛin
\g right DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 foot lame be-QUOT
\l Its right foot is lame.

\t Nełas keč’oƛ’asi ozuri becono yołƛin”.
\m neła-s keč’oƛ’asi ozuri becono yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 left eye blind be-QUOT
\l Its left eye is blind."

\t Eɣenigon esiya eƛin:
\m eɣe-ni-gon esyu-a eƛi-n
\g young-DEF-CNTR brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The youngest brother said:

\t Nełaz gugyoƛ’ zawrunigon šebin din riyranƛin:
\m neła-z gugu-ƛ’ zow-ru-ni-gon šebin di-n r-iyr-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 back-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF-CNTR thing me-TOP IV-explain-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l And I will explain what was on its back:

\t Kut’yoƛ’aza puƛ’aza nełaƛ’ nucos sik zown”.
\m kut’yo-ƛ’aza pu-ƛ’aza neła-ƛ’ nuci-s sik zow-n
\g right.side-SUPER.VERS.DIST side-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS honey-GEN1 waterskin be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l On its right side there was a waterskin with honey.

\t Howža xabarno boyn, boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, yizir taqˤo iłe dandir nexxo žek’u ukayn.
\m howža xabar-n b-odi-n b-oƛƛo b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow yizi-r taqˤo iłe dandir nex-x žek’u ukad-n
\g DEM4.SG story-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB III-middle III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT over.there as towards come-IPFV.CVB man see-PST.UNW
\l Not much later after that conversation, they saw a man coming towards them.

\t Žedude igor aynosi, salamno teƛno, nesä žeduq esirno:
\m žedu-de igo-r ay-nosi salam-n teƛ-n nesi-a žedu-q esir-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS near-LAT come-ANT.CVB greeting-and give-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l After he came closer to them, he said hello and asked them:

\t Howt’o hunäza bik’ixnan mežuł ħumukuli c’oxiyäƛin?”
\m howt’o huni-aza b-ik’i-x-nan mežu-ł ħumukuli c’ox-ya-ƛin
\g here way-IN.VERS.DIST III-go-IPFV.CVB-INT you(I).PL.OBL-CONT.ESS camel meet-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l "Did you meet a camel, while you were going along this way?"

\t Eženi esiya nesiqor eƛin:
\m eže-ni esyu-a nesi-qor eƛi-n
\g old-DEF brother-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l The eldest brother said to him:

\t Ħumukuliƛa bukaynč’u elur, amma nełas sipat debeq esan elaƛin”.
\m ħumukuli-ƛa b-ukad-č’u elu-r amma neła-s sipat mi-q esi-an elu-a-ƛin
\g camel-INDEF III-see-NEG.PST.WIT we(I).OBL-LAT but DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 appearance you-POSS.ESS tell-FUT.DEF we(I).OBL-ERG-QUOT
\l "We didn't see any camel, but we will tell you how it looks."

\t Nedur resunäy, eso huduƛin”, - eƛin nesi žek’a.
\m nedur r-esu-näy esi-o hudu-ƛin - eƛi-n nesi žek’u-a
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB tell-IMPR so-QUOT - say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG
\l "If that's the case, then say so!", said the man.

\t Eženi esiya eƛin:
\m eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n
\g old-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The eldest brother said:

\t Debez ħumukulis kut’yoƛ’asi k’onč’u šiqˤono zowwäƛin?”
\m mi-z ħumukuli-s kut’yoƛ’asi k’onč’u šiqˤono zow-ya-ƛin
\g you-GEN2 camel-GEN1 right leg lame be.NPRS-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l "Was your camel's right foot lame?"

\t Zowsƛin”, eƛin žek’a.
\m zow-s-ƛin eƛi-n žek’u-a
\g be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW man-ERG
\l "It was", said the man.

\t Oƛƛozoni esiya eƛin:
\m oƛƛo-zo-ni esyu-a eƛi-n
\g middle-ATTR.OBL-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The middle brother said:

\t Debez ħumukulis keč’oƛ’asi ozuri becono zowwäƛin?”
\m mi-z ħumukuli-s keč’oƛ’asi ozuri becono zow-ya-ƛin
\g you-GEN2 camel-GEN1 left eye blind be.NPRS-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l "Was you camel's left eye blind?"

\t Zowsƛin”, eƛin nesä.
\m zow-s-ƛin eƛi-n nesi-a
\g be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "It was", said he.

\t Eɣenigon esiya eƛin:
\m eɣe-ni-gon esyu-a eƛi-n
\g young-DEF-CNTR brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The youngest brother said:

\t Ħumukuliƛ’ kut’yoƛ’aza puƛ’aza nucos sik zowwäƛin?”
\m ħumukuli-ƛ’ kut’yo-ƛ’aza pu-ƛ’aza nuci-s sik zow-ya-ƛin
\g camel-SUPER.ESS right.side-SUPER.VERS.DIST side-SUPER.VERS.DIST honey-GEN1 waterskin be.NPRS-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l "Was there a waterskin with honey on the camel's right side?"

\t Zowsƛin”, nesiƛ’no hemedurtow ža žek’u razi oqno.
\m zow-s-ƛin nesi-ƛ’-n hemedur-tow ža žek’u razi oq-n
\g be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP so-EMPH DEM1.SG man agree become-PST.UNW
\l "There was", the man agreed this time as well.

\t Esnazaq sipat esin łiynosi nesi žek’a eƛin:
\m esyu-bi-q sipat esi-n łiy-nosi nesi žek’u-a eƛi-n
\g brother-PL-POSS.ESS appearance tell-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l After they finished telling him about its appearance, the man said to the brothers:

\t Dey ħumukuli bukaynč’uƛinno eƛix meža, nełas c’ik’iw sipatno esix.
\m di-s ħumukuli b-ukad-č’u-ƛin-n eƛi-x mežu-a neła-s c’ik’iw sipat-n esi-x
\g me-GEN1 camel III-see-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT-TOP say-IPFV.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 entire appearance-TOP tell-PRS
\l "You say that you haven't seen my camel, and you tell me its entire appearance.

\t Nełas där maʕna bič’zi boqxanu.
\m neła-s di-r maʕna bič’zi b-oq-x-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 me-LAT sense understand III-become-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l I don't understand what this means.

\t Däz pikruxor, meža ža dey ħumukuli bok’k’äsi yoł, dey däqor xizor neƛƛin!”
\m di-z pikru-xor mežu-a ža di-s ħumukuli b-ok’ek’-asi yoł di-s di-qor xizor neƛ-ƛin
\g me-GEN2 idea-AD.LAT you(I).PL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG me-GEN1 camel III-steal-RES.PRT be me-GEN1 me-POSS.LAT back give-QUOT
\l Methinks, you have stolen my camel, give it back to me!"

\t Eženi esiya eƛin:
\m eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n
\g old-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The eldest brother said:

\t Debi ħumukuli ela bok’k’äsi anu.
\m mi-s ħumukuli elu-a b-ok’ek’-asi anu
\g you-GEN1 camel we(I).OBL-ERG I.PL-steal-RES.PRT be.NEG
\l "We didn't steal your camel.

\t Eluł debi daʕba besunäy, min elude sadaq xander ƛa!”
\m elu-ł mi-s daʕba b-esu-näy mi-n elu-de sadaq xan-der ƛa
\g we(I).OBL-CONT.ESS you-GEN1 dispute III-exist-CND.CVB you-TOP we(I).OBL-APUD.ESS together khan-APUD.LAT go.IMPR
\l If you want to have a dispute with us, let's go to the king together!"

\t Ik’anƛin”, yedan razi oqno, sadaq elay bitor hunix boqno.
\m ik’i-an-ƛin yeda-n razi oq-n sadaq ele-ay bitor huni-x b-oq-n
\g go-FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM2.ISG-TOP agree become-PST.UNW all there-IN.ABL thither way-AD.ESS III-become-PST.UNW
\l "We will go", he agreed and all got on their way from there.

\t Nasin yizi xan yałru mečoƛ’or bayn.
\m nasin yizi xan yoł-ru moči-ƛ’or b-ay-n
\g all DEM2.IPL.OBL khan be-PST.PRT field-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l They all came to the place that belonged to the king.

\t Xanä žedu łˤonon esnabi nesä nesiz iduɣorno bižin paraq’atno boyn, žedude adäz bišʷan ħaƛin ža maħor oqno.
\m xan-a žedu łˤono-n esyu-bi nesi-a nesi-z idu-ɣor-n b-iži-n paraq’at-n b-odi-n žedu-de adäz bišʷa-n ħaƛi-n ža maħor oq-n
\g khan-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL three-TOP brother-PL DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 home-IN.ALL-and III-lead-PFV.CVB arranging-and III-do-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS ahead food-and organize-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG outside become-PST.UNW
\l The king invited the three brothers into his home, made an arrangement(?), organized a meal for them and went outside.

\t Esnabi zawruni ɣˤutkoz madaxor xanä wazir egirno, žeda elo teł badiru xabarno teqerno xizyo nesiq esanix.
\m esyu-bi zow-ru-ni ɣˤutku-z ma-xor xan-a wazir egir-n žedu-a elo teł b-odi-ru xabar-n teqerno xizyo nesi-q esi-ani-x
\g brother-PL be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF room-GEN2 gate-AD.LAT khan-ERG vizier send-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG there inside I.PL-do-PST.PRT story-TOP aloud after DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-MSD-AD.ESS
\l The king sent a vizier to the door of the room where the brothers were, to overhear their conversation and to tell him about it afterwards.

\t Ža xan q’ˤuya ɣˤutkaɣorno ik’in nesä nesis ħalt’i boyx ičin.
\m ža xan q’ˤuya ɣˤutku-aɣor-n ik’i-n nesi-a nesi-s ħalt’i b-odi-x iči-n
\g DEM1.SG khan other room-IN.VERS-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 work III-do-IPFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l The king went into the other room and started to do his work.

\t Acxor wazir aynosi, nesir eženi esiya eƛix teqno:
\m ac-xor wazir ay-nosi nesi-r eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-x teq-n
\g door-AD.LAT vizier come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT old-DEF brother-ERG say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW
\l When the vizier came to the door, he heard the eldest brother say:

\t Howsi xaneł laɣes maħ yołƛin”.
\m howsi xan-ł laɣ-s maħ yoł-ƛin
\g that khan-CONT.ESS slave-GEN1 smell be-QUOT
\l "That king smells like a slave."

\t Oƛƛozogon esiya eƛin:
\m oƛƛo-zo-gon esyu-a eƛi-n
\g middle-ATTR.OBL-CNTR brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The middle brother said:

\t Howła reƛił ɣˤʷays maħ yołƛin”.
\m howła reƛ-ł ɣˤʷay-s maħ yoł-ƛin
\g DEM3.IISG.OBL meat-CONT.ESS dog-GEN1 smell be-QUOT
\l "This meat smells like dog."

\t Eɣenägon eƛix teqno:
\m eɣe-ni-a-gon eƛi-x teq-n
\g young-DEF-ERG-CNTR say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW
\l And he heard the younger brother say:

\t Howła šadał aqˤuros maħ yołƛin”.
\m howła ša-ł aqˤu-s maħ yoł-ƛin
\g DEM3.IISG.OBL wine-CONT.ESS urine-GEN1 smell be-QUOT
\l "This wine smells like urine."

\t Žedus eƛixosi šebin łiynosi, wazirä ža xabar ik’in xanqo esin.
\m žedu-s eƛi-xosi šebin łiy-nosi wazir-a ža xabar ik’i-n xan-q esi-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 say-PRS.PRT thing end-ANT.CVB vizier-ERG DEM1.SG story go-PFV.CVB khan-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW
\l After they had said these things, the vizier went to the king to tell him about it.

\t Xanä žedu nesä nesidäɣorno goƛ’in sosi eženi esiwq esirno:
\m xan-a žedu nesi-a nesi-däɣor-n goƛ’i-n sosi eže-ni esiw-q esir-n
\g khan-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.VERS-TOP call-PFV.CVB at.first old-DEF brother-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l The king called them to himself and first asked the eldest brother:

\t Łinaƛ’aza däł laɣes maħ yołƛin mi eƛäƛin?”
\m łinaƛ’aza di-ł laɣ-s maħ yoł-ƛin mi eƛi-a-ƛin
\g why me-CONT.ESS slave-GEN1 smell be-QUOT you say-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l "Why did you say that I smell like a slave?"

\t Nesä žawab teƛno:
\m nesi-a žawab teƛ-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l He answered:

\t Eniwn goƛ’in esir mi, neła deber neł sualyor žawab naƛƛin”.
\m eniw-n goƛ’i-n esir mi neła-a mi-r neła sual-r žawab neƛ-ƛin
\g mother-TOP call-PFV.CVB ask you DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL question-LAT answer give-QUOT
\l "Call your mother and ask, she will give you an answer to this question."

\t Xanä eniwn goƛ’in esirno nełaq:
\m xan-a eniw-n goƛ’i-n esir-n neła-q
\g khan-ERG mother-TOP call-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l The king called his mother and asked her:

\t Eni, bit’un eso mi däq, däł laɣes maħ nazay boqa bayxƛin?”
\m eni bit’un esi-o mi di-q di-ł laɣ-s maħ nazay b-oq-a b-ay-x-ƛin
\g mother truely tell-IMPR you me-POSS.ESS me-CONT.ESS slave-GEN1 smell from.where III-happen-INF III-come-PRS-QUOT
\l "Mother, tell me the truth, where does it come from that I smell like a slave?"

\t Eniya eƛin:
\m eni-a eƛi-n
\g mother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The mother said:

\t Walla, dey uži, debi babiwn mi iłetow xan zows.
\m wallah di-s uži mi-s babiw-n mi iłe-tow xan zow-s
\g wallah me-GEN1 son you-GEN1 father-TOP you as-EMPH khan be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l "By God, my son, your father was a king, just like you.

\t Sida quł ža t’o ʕaƛay ik’inosi, där žek’ude kecan retin di debez babiwz laɣde kecsi.
\m sida qu-ł ža t’o ʕaƛ-ay ik’i-nosi di-r žek’u-de kec-a-n r-eti-n di mi-z babiw-z laɣ-de kec-s
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.SG here village-IN.ABL go-ANT.CVB me-LAT man-APUD.ESS sleep-INF-and IV-want-PFV.CVB me you-GEN2 father-GEN2 slave-APUD.ESS sleep-PST.WIT
\l One day, after he had left this village, I wanted to sleep with a man, and so I slept with your father's slave.

\t Hemełƛ’aza oqno esa beɣula mi laɣes maħ yołäsiƛin”.
\m hemeł-ƛ’aza oq-n esu-a beɣula mi laɣ-s maħ yoł-asi-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS.DIST become-PFV.CVB find-INF maybe you slave-GEN1 smell be-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l That might be why you seem to smell like a slave."

\t Oƛƛozo esiwq esirno xanä:
\m oƛƛo-zo esiw-q esir-n xan-a
\g middle-ATTR.OBL brother-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l The king asked the middle brother:

\t Neł reƛiłer ɣˤʷays maħ nazay baya bayxƛin?”
\m neła reƛ-łer ɣˤʷay-s maħ nazay b-ay-a b-ay-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL meat-CONT.LAT dog-GEN1 smell from.where III-come-INF III-come-PRS-QUOT
\l "Where does the dog's smell in the meat come from?"

\t Nesä eƛin:
\m nesi-a eƛi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l He said:

\t Ža däƛ’ay rig debeq bˤeƛ’xozoni aħä äsiƛin”.
\m ža di-ƛ’ay r-ig mi-q bˤeƛ’-x-zo-ni aħo-a esi-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG me-SUPER.ABL IV-much you-POSS.ESS sheep-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF shepherd-ERG tell-QUOT
\l "The shepherd will tell you more about it than I."

\t Goƛ’in aħon, xanä nesiq esirno:
\m goƛ’i-n aħo-n xan-a nesi-q esir-n
\g call-PFV.CVB shepherd-TOP khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l The king called the shepherd and asked him:

\t Hemełƛ’o bexayn zawruni ƛelez reƛiłer maħ nazay baya bayxƛin?”
\m hemeł-ƛ’ b-exʷad-n zow-ru-ni ƛeli-z reƛ-łer maħ nazay b-ay-a b-ay-x-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS III-slaughter-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF lamb-GEN2 meat-CONT.LAT smell from.where III-come-INF III-come-PRS-QUOT
\l "Where does the smell of this lamb's meat, that has been slaughtered, come from?"

\t Bˤeƛ’xozoni aħozä eƛin:
\m bˤeƛ’-x-zo-ni aħo-a eƛi-n
\g sheep-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF shepherd-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The shepherd said:

\t Walla, xan, howža ƛeli bayruntow, nełas eniw bexus.
\m wallah xan howža ƛeli b-odi-run-tow neła-s eniw b-exu-s
\g wallah khan DEM4.SG lamb III-do-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 mother III-die-PST.WIT
\l "By God, o king, right after the lamb was born, its mother died.

\t ƛeligon bexa betinč’ey nełaq di čiba xirersi.
\m ƛeli-gon b-exu-a b-eti-č’ey neła-q di čiba xirer-s
\g lamb-CNTR III-die-INF III-want-NEG.PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS me bitch nurse-PST.WIT
\l I didn't want the lamb to die, so I made a bitch nurse it.

\t Hemełƛ’az nełas reƛ ɣˤʷays maħ yołäsi roqno räsuƛin”.
\m hemeł-ƛ’az neła-s reƛ ɣˤʷay-s maħ yoł-asi r-oq-n r-esu-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS.DIST DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 meat dog-GEN1 smell be-RES.PRT IV-become-PFV.CVB IV-find-QUOT
\l This might be why its meat smells like dog.

\t Eɣeni esiwq xanä, däz šadał aqˤuros maħ nazay boqa bayxƛin esirnosi, nesä eƛin:
\m eɣe-ni esiw-q xan-a di-z ša-ł aqˤu-s maħ nazay b-oq-a b-ay-x-ƛin esir-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n
\g young-DEF brother-POSS.ESS khan-ERG me-GEN2 wine-CONT.ESS urine-GEN1 smell from.where III-become-INF III-come-PRS-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l When the king asked the younger brother, how it came that his wine smells like urine, he said:

\t Goƛ’in ža boyxozo žek’uq esirnäy, nesir rig räyƛin”.
\m goƛ’i-n ža b-odi-xozo žek’u-q esir-näy nesi-r r-ig r-iy-ƛin
\g call-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG III-do-PRS.PRT.OBL man-POSS.ESS ask-CND.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-much IV-know-QUOT
\l "When you call the one who made the wine and ask him, he will know it better."

\t Goƛ’in ša boyxozo žek’uq esirnosi, nesä eƛin:
\m goƛ’i-n ša b-odi-xozo žek’u-q esir-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n
\g call-PFV.CVB wine III-do-PRS.PRT.OBL man-POSS.ESS ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l When he called the man who made the wine and asked him, he said:

\t Walla xan, di ša bodanix k’udi q’uq’iƛ’orey, elo šet’u butäsi hadambi boqzaƛ’, aqˤu kuča maħorno oqa iynč’ey howlo tełer kučis.
\m wallah xan di ša b-odi-ani-x k’udi q’uq’i-ƛ’oräy elo šet’u b-uti-asi hadambi b-oq-zaƛ’ aqˤu kuči-a maħor-n oq-a iy-č’ey howlo tełer kuči-s
\g wallah khan me wine III-do-MSD-AD.ESS vine press.out-SIM.CVB there around III-turn.back-RES.PRT people III-happen-CSL.CVB urine defecate-INF outside-TOP become-INF know-NEG.PST.UNW there into defecate-PST.WIT
\l "By God, o king, while I was pressing out the grapes to make the wine, there were people who were walking around there and without me knowing took a piss in there."

\t Hudu ža ša aqˤuros maħ yołäsi boqno bäsuƛin”.
\m hudu ža ša aqˤu-s maħ yoł-asi b-oq-n b-esu-ƛin
\g so DEM1.SG wine urine-GEN1 smell be-RES.PRT III-become-PFV.CVB III-find-QUOT
\l So this is how this wine began to smell like urine."

\t Xan c’aq’tow ħikmałiłer egin, nece ʕaq’ilaw yizi xexzar didur di diwan bodanƛin.
\m xan c’aq’-tow ħikmałi-łer egi-n nece ʕaq’ilaw yizi xexbi-r didur di diwan b-odi-an-ƛin
\g khan too-EMPH astonishment-CONT.LAT stand.still-PFV.CVB so.much intelligent DEM2.IPL.OBL children-LAT how me judgement III-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The king stood still in astonishment about how he could make a judgement for these so intelligent children.

\t Sosi yisä ħumukulis bet’erhanno goƛ’in nesis murad esirnosi, nesä eƛin:
\m sosi yisi-a ħumukuli-s bet’erhan-n goƛ’i-n nesi-s murad esir-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n
\g at.first DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG camel-GEN1 master-TOP call-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 wish ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l At first he called the owner of the camel and asked what he desired, the owner said:

\t Hunix där yizi esnabi c’oxnosi, dey ħumukuli bukaynč’aƛin esirzaƛ’, yizä bukaynč’uƛin ot’ bisxo, amma nełas kinaw sipat biyx yizir.
\m huni-x di-r yizi esyu-bi c’ox-nosi di-s ħumukuli b-ukad-č’u-a-ƛin esir-zaƛ’ yizi-a b-ukad-č’u-ƛin ot’ b-is-x amma neła-s kinaw sipat b-iy-x yizi-r
\g way-AD.ESS me-LAT DEM2.IPL.OBL brother-PL meet-ANT.CVB me-GEN1 camel III-see-NEG.PST.WIT-Q-QUOT ask-CSL.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG III-see-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT rejection III-take-IPFV.CVB but DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 entire appearance III-know-PRS DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT
\l "After I met these brothers on the way, I asked if they hadn't seen my camel, and they rejected having seen it, but they knew it's entire appearance.

\t Hudu dey šak bik’ix yizä bok’ek’no bäsuƛin”.
\m hudu di-s šak b-ik’i-x yizi-a b-ok’ek’-n b-esu-ƛin
\g so me-GEN1 suspicion III-go-IPFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG III-steal-PFV.CVB III-appear-QUOT
\l So my suspicion will be that they appear to have stolen it."

\t Xanä eženi esiwq esirno:
\m xan-a eže-ni esiw-q esir-n
\g khan-ERG old-DEF brother-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l The king asked the eldest brother:

\t Deber ža ħumukuli bukayn besunč’inäy, nazay deber nełas kut’yos k’onč’u šiqˤono yałrułi yiyxƛin?”
\m mi-r ža ħumukuli b-ukad-n b-esu-č’i-näy nazay mi-r neła-s kut’yo-s k’onč’u šiqˤono yoł-rułi y-iy-x-ƛin
\g you-LAT DEM1.SG camel III-see-PFV.CVB III-exist-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB from.where you-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 right.side-GEN1 foot lame be-MSD II-know-PRS-QUOT
\l "If you haven't seen this camel, how do you know that its right foot is lame?"

\t Eženi esiya eƛin:
\m eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n
\g old-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The eldest brother said:

\t Där ħumukulis ruɣu hunä resus.
\m di-r ħumukuli-s ruɣu huni-a r-esu-s
\g me-LAT camel-GEN1 prints way-IN.ESS IV-find-PST.WIT
\l "I found the camel's hoofprints on the way.

\t Nełäz ruɣuƛ’ bercingo xal boyzaƛ’, neła bˤula gibaq bitirxot’a bižin.
\m neła-az ruɣu-ƛ’ bercingo xal b-odi-zaƛ’ neła-a bˤula gibu-q b-itir-x-t’a b-iži-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS.DIST prints-SUPER.ESS good examination III-do-CSL.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG hoof dust-POSS.ESS III-touch-IPFV.CVB-DISTR III-take.out-PST.UNW
\l When I examined its hoofprints thoroughly, [I saw that] it only touches the dust with one hoof.

\t Nełƛ’aza di nełas kut’yoƛ’asi k’onč’u šiqˤono yołƛin eƛis”.
\m neła-ƛ’aza di neła-s kut’yoƛ’asi k’onč’u šiqˤono yoł-ƛin eƛi-s
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS.DIST me DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 right foot lame be-QUOT say-PST.WIT
\l This is why I said that its right foot is lame."

\t Oƛƛozo esiwq esirnosi, nesä eƛin:
\m oƛƛo-zo esiw-q esir-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n
\g middle-ATTR.OBL brother-POSS.ESS ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l When he asked the middle brother, this one said:

\t Neła kut’yoƛ’aza puƛ’azasi gurow bix rac’xo bik’in anu.
\m neła-a kut’yo-ƛ’aza pu-ƛ’aza-si gurow bix r-ac’-x b-ik’i-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG right.side-SUPER.VERS.DIST side-SUPER.VERS.DIST-ATTR except grass IV-eat-IPFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l "It doesn't go anywhere else than to the right side to eat grass.

\t Hudu där riys nełas keč’oƛ’asi ozuri rexasi yałrułiƛin”.
\m hudu di-r r-iy-s neła-s keč’oƛ’asi ozuri r-exu-asi yoł-rułi-ƛin
\g so me-LAT IV-know-PST.WIT DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 left eye IV-die-RES.PRT be-MSD-QUOT
\l So I knew that it has a left eye that is blind."

\t Eɣeni esiwq xanä deber łinax riyä kut’yoƛ’aza puƛ’aza nełaƛ’ ƛ’iri nuci zawrułiƛin esirnosi, nesä eƛin:
\m eɣe-ni esiw-q xan-a mi-r łinax r-iy-a kut’yo-ƛ’aza pu-ƛ’aza neła-ƛ’ ƛ’iri nuci zow-rułi-ƛin esir-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n
\g younger-DEF brother-POSS.ESS khan-ERG you-LAT how IV-know-Q right.side-SUPER.VERS.DIST side-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS above honey be.NPRS-MSD-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l When the king asked the younger brother, how he knew that it had honey on its right side, he said:

\t Ža där riys hunix kut’yoƛ’aza puƛ’aza nucoƛ’osi t’ut’ bik’ix zawruƛ’azaƛin”.
\m ža di-r r-iy-s huni-x kut’yo-ƛ’aza pu-ƛ’aza nuci-ƛ’-si t’ut’ b-ik’i-x zow-ru-ƛ’aza-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG me-LAT IV-know-PST.WIT way-AD.ESS right.side-SUPER.VERS.DIST side-SUPER.VERS.DIST honey-SUPER.ESS-ATTR fly III-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-SUPER.VERS.DIST-QUOT
\l This I know because there flew a bee on the right side of the way.

\t Ža łˤoran esnazas esixosi šebin łiynosi, xanä diwanno beč’no ħumukulis bet’erhan eɣurno.
\m ža łˤora-n esyu-bi-s esi-xosi šebin łiy-nosi xan-a diwan-n b-eč’-n ħumukuli-s bet’erhan eɣur-n
\g DEM1.SG three.OBL-TOP brother-PL-GEN1 tell-PRS.PRT thing end-ANT.CVB khan-ERG judgement-TOP III-cut-PFV.CVB camel-GEN1 master lose-PST.UNW
\l After the three brothers finished telling the things, the king made the judgement that the camel's owner lost.

\t Howži xan yiziz daʕbaƛ’or utiłno.
\m howži xan yizi-z daʕba-ƛ’or uti-ł-n
\g now khan DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN2 dispute-SUPER.LAT turn.back-POT-PST.UNW
\l Now the king could return to their dispute.

\t Esnaza nesiq žeda žedus murad esinosi, xanä žeduq sis imadu esin:
\m esyu-bi-a nesi-q žedu-a žedu-s murad esi-nosi xan-a žedu-q sis imadu esi-n
\g brother-PL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 wish tell-ANT.CVB khan-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS one tale tell-PST.UNW
\l After the brothers told him their wish, the king told them a fairy tale.

\t Sis zown c’aq’tow sider sis betäsi užin kidno.
\m sis zow-n c’aq’-tow sida-r sis b-eti-asi uži-n kid-n
\g one be.NPRS-PST.UNW very-EMPH one.OBL-LAT one I.PL-love-RES.PRT boy-and girl-and
\l Once there was a boy and a girl who loved each other very much.

\t Sida quł kidbä nesi žaqor eƛin:
\m sida qu-ł kid-a nesi uži-qor eƛi-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS girl-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l One day the girl said to the boy:

\t Xizyogon žoyä eƛin kidbeqor:
\m xizyogon uži-a eƛi-n kid-qor
\g then boy-ERG say-PST.UNW girl-POSS.LAT
\l Then the boy said to the girl:

\t "Mi yowan yoqinč’ey q’ˤuya ɣˤanabi yowłiri, sosi din ałni debeq bic’reran, nełaq bic’erzaƛ’orƛin".
\m mi y-ow-an y-oq-č’ey q’ˤuya ɣˤanabi y-ow-łiri sosi di-n ałni mi-q b-ic’-r-r-a-n neła-q b-ic’-r-zaƛ’or-ƛin
\g you II-marry-FUT.DEF II-happen-NEG.PST.UNW other woman II-bring-CND.CVB.IRR at.first me-TOP hug you-POSS.ESS III-hug-CAUS-CAUS-INF-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS III-hug-CAUS-POST.CVB-QUOT
\l 'If it happens that I have to marry another woman, I will also first come to you to embrace you, before I embrace her.'

\t Howža xabarno boqno, boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, yedu kid q’ˤuyazix yegirno.
\m howža xabar-n b-oq-n b-oƛƛo b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow yedu kid q’ˤuya-zo-x y-egir-n
\g DEM4.SG story-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB III-middle III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM2.IISG girl other-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS II-let-PST.UNW
\l Not much later after this conversation, that girl was given to someone else.

\t Neła quł neširu xedyoq neła harizi royn:
\m neła qu-ł neširu xediw-q neła-a harizi r-odi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS at.night husband-POSS.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG request IV-do-PST.UNW
\l That night she begged her husband:

\t "Behizi roqnäy, däq baša atinƛin di debeq harizi royx.
\m behizi r-oq-näy di-q baša iti-n-ƛin di mi-q harizi r-odi-x
\g permit IV-become-CND.CVB me-POSS.ESS finger touch-PROHIB-QUOT me you-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PRS
\l 'If it's possible, don't touch me!

\t Deyn sida där etix zawruni žasno q’ut’i boqäsi yoł:
\m di-s-n sida di-r eti-x zow-ru-ni uži-s-n q’ut’i b-oq-asi yoł
\g me-GEN1-TOP one.OBL me-LAT love-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF boy-GEN1-TOP agreement III-become-RES.PRT be
\l The agreement I have with the boy I was in love with, is:

\t Nagaħ sidxor sis baynč’inäy, sosi sida sidqo reƛ’a ritirera yoł, q’ˤuyziq ritira regirinč’eyƛin".
\m nagaħ sida-xor sis b-ay-č’i-näy sosi sida-a sida-q reƛ’a r-itir-r-a yoł q’ˤuya-zo-q r-itir-a r-egir-č’ey-ƛin
\g suddenly one.OBL-AD.LAT one I.PL-come-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB at.first one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.ESS hand IV-touch-CAUS-INF be other-ATTR.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-touch-INF IV-let-NEG.PST.UNW-QUOT
\l When we suddenly won't come together, at first we will touch each other, before touching anyone else.'

\t Nesi žader yik’anir xedya nełar izmu teƛno.
\m nesi uži-der y-ik’i-ani-r xediw-a neła-r izmu teƛ-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-APUD.LAT II-go-MSD-LAT husband-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT permission give-PST.UNW
\l The husband gave her the permission to go to this boy.

\t Ža nesi žadäɣorƛin yik’iƛ’oräy, nełał hunix, oc’ira ƛˤeba adäztow nełqor roƛ’i boqno zawru, k’ačaɣˤ c’oxno.
\m ža nesi uži-däɣor-ƛin y-ik’i-ƛ’oräy neła-ł huni-x oc’ira ƛˤeb-a adäz-tow neła-qor roƛ’i b-oq-n zow-ru k’ačaɣˤ c’ox-n
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-APUD.VERS-QUOT II-go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS way-AD.ESS ten.OBL year-IN.ESS before-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT love III-become-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT bandit meet-PST.UNW
\l While going to this boy, she met a bandit on her way, who ten years before fell in love with her.

\t Nesä nełqor eƛin:
\m nesi-a neła-qor eƛi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l He said to her:

\t "Yaqˤułenč’e mi däder dandixno, narčey mi däqay yok’äłƛin?".
\m yaqˤułenč’e mi di-der dandix-n narčey mi di-qay y-ok’eł-ƛin
\g today you me-APUD.LAT gather-PST.UNW where you me-POSS.ABL II-escape-QUOT
\l 'Today you came to me, where will you escape from me to?'.

\t Nesä k’oƛin yiqirnosi, nełä harizi royn nesiq:
\m nesi-a k’oƛi-n y-iqir-nosi neła-a harizi r-odi-n nesi-q
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG run-PFV.CVB II-stop-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG request IV-do-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l After he seized her, she begged him:

\t "Deyn hemesi pulanaw etixozosno q’ut’i boqäsi zowsƛin:
\m di-s-n hemesi pulanaw etixosi-s-n q’ut’i b-oq-asi zow-s-ƛin
\g me-GEN1-and DEM4.ISG.OBL some lover-GEN1-and agreement III-become-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l 'I have a lover's agreement, which went like this:

\t Nesiq reƛ’a ritirerzaƛ’or łaqnokin ritirerač’inƛin.
\m nesi-q reƛ’a r-itir-r-zaƛ’or ła-q-n-kin r-itir-r-ač’in-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS hand IV-touch-CAUS-POST.CVB who.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP-even IV-touch-CAUS-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Before he touches me, no one else may touch me.

\t Xediyan di neła bayru q’ut’imoxor izmun neƛno nesi žadaɣor yegirsiƛin.
\m xediw-a-n di neła-a b-odi-ru q’ut’i-xor izmu-n neƛ-n nesi uži-daɣor y-egir-s-ƛin
\g husband-ERG-TOP me DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG III-do-PST.PRT agreement-AD.LAT permission-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-APUD.VERS II-let-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l And my husband let me go to this boy and also gave her the permission to have a (marriage) contract.

\t Debeqno hemedurtow harizi royx di nesidäɣor yegirno xecƛin!"
\m mi-q-n hemedur-tow harizi r-odi-x di nesi-däɣor y-egir-n xeci-ƛin
\g you-POSS.ESS-TOP so-EMPH request IV-do-IPFV.CVB me DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.VERS II-let-PST.UNW leave-QUOT
\l So I also ask you, please let me go to him!'

\t "Xedyo yegäru miƛin, - eƛin nesä, - din yegiranƛin".
\m xediw-a y-egir-ru mi-ƛin - eƛi-n nesi-a - di-n y-egir-an-ƛin
\g husband-ERG II-let-PST.PRT you-QUOT - say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG - me-TOP II-let-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l 'Your husband let you go,' he said, 'so I will let you, too.'

\t Elay ža yoqno etixozoder yik’in.
\m ele-ay ža y-oq-n etixosi-der y-ik’i-n
\g there-IN.ABL DEM1.SG II-become-PST.UNW lover-APUD.LAT II-go-PST.UNW
\l From there she went to her lover and they came together.

\t Xizyo xanä žedu esnazaq esirno:
\m xizyo xan-a žedu esyu-bi-q esir-n
\g after khan-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL brother-PL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards the king asked the brothers:

\t Mežuz pikruxor, žedu łˤorłäyn tełäy baħarčiłi yołäsi šebi iča ayx:
\m mežu-z pikru-xor žedu łˤora-łay-n teł-ay baħarčiłi yoł-asi šebi iči-a ay-x
\g you(I).PL.OBL-GEN2 idea-AD.LAT DEM1.IPL.OBL three.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP inside-IN.ABL braveness be-RES.PRT who be-Q must-PRS
\l "In your opinion, who of the three must be the bravest:

\t Xediwä, k’ačaɣˤä, etixosiyäƛin?”
\m xediw-a k’ačaɣˤ-a etixosi-a-ƛin
\g husband-Q bandit-Q lover-Q-QUOT
\l The husband, the bandit or the lover?"

\t Eženi esiya eƛin:
\m eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n
\g old-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The eldest brother said:

\t Di baħarčiłi xedyos rik’zi radiƛin”.
\m di baħarčiłi xediw-s rik’zi r-odi-ƛin
\g me braveness husband-GEN1 honor IV-do-QUOT
\l "I will admire the husband's braveness."

\t Oƛƛozo eƛin:
\m oƛƛo-zo eƛi-n
\g middle-ATTR.OBL say-PST.UNW
\l The middle one said:

\t Di baħarčiłi etixozonis rik’zi radiƛin”.
\m di baħarčiłi etixosi-ni-s rik’zi r-odi-ƛin
\g me braveness lover-DEF-GEN1 honor IV-do-QUOT
\l "I admire the lover's braveness."

\t Hič’č’a eɣenä eƛin:
\m hič’č’a eɣe-ni-a eƛi-n
\g the.most young-DEF-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The youngest one said:

\t Där t’o baħarčiyaw žek’u k’ačaɣˤ iyxƛin”.
\m di-r t’o baħarčiyaw žek’u k’ačaɣˤ iy-x-ƛin
\g me-LAT here brave man bandit know-PRS-QUOT
\l "I know that the bandit is the brave man here."

\t Xizyo xanä eƛin:
\m xizyo xan-a eƛi-n
\g after khan-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l Then the king said:

\t Mesedyołäy sis saħ bok’äk’ru iča ayx mežus eɣeni esiwƛin”.
\m mesed-łay sis saħ b-ok’ek’-ru iči-a odi-x mežu-s eɣe-ni esiw-ƛin
\g gold-CONT.ABL one sah III-steal-PST.PRT be-INF do-IPFV.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 young-DEF brother-QUOT
\l "Your younger brother is the one who stole the one Sah from the gold."

\t Ɣowlotown eɣeni esiwn muk’ur oqno.
\m ɣowlo-tow-n eɣe-ni esiw-n muk’ur oq-n
\g there-EMPH-TOP young-DEF brother-TOP confess become-PST.UNW
\l And then the younger brother confessed.

\t K’eneč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu!
\m k’eneč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu-u
\g egg pearl day IV-become.clean-IMPR
\l May the day be as bright as egg and bead!

\t Sida obiws łˤono uži zown.
\m sida obiw-s łˤono uži zow-n
\g one.OBL father-GEN1 three son be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l A father had three sons.

\t Žedu łˤorän esnaza sida kidbeƛ’ reƛ’a eräsi zown.
\m žedu łˤora-a-n esyu-bi-a sida kid-ƛ’ reƛ’a er-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL three.OBL-ERG-TOP brother-PL-ERG one.OBL girl-SUPER.ESS hand put-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Those three brothers were proposed to the same girl.

\t Sida quł neł kidber łˤonon esnabi hunix dandir c’oxno.
\m sida qu-ł neła kid-r łˤono-n esyu-bi huni-x dandir c’ox-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-LAT three-TOP brother-PL way-AD.ESS together meet-PST.UNW
\l One day, that girl met the three brothers on the way.

\t Yiła žeduqor eƛin:
\m yiła-a žedu-qor eƛi-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l She said to them:

\t Meži łˤonontow esira däder nexłin, mežurno riyx ža, hudun di mežułäy sider gurow yäqinč’i.
\m meži łˤono-n-tow esir-a di-der nex-łin mežu-r-n r-iy-x ža hudun di mežu-łay sida-r gurow y-iqi-č’i
\g you.PL three-TOP-EMPH ask-INF me-APUD.LAT come-CNC.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-LAT-TOP IV-know-PRS DEM1.SG nevertheless me you(I).PL.OBL-CONT.ABL one.OBL-LAT except II-get-NEG.FUT
\l "You three have come to me in order to ask me out, you know that, and so I won't get to any of you except for one.

\t Nełƛ’aza rayn, di mežuqor łˤorqorno łˤonot’a ɣˤuruš neƛan.
\m neła-ƛ’aza r-ay-n di mežu-qor łˤora-qor-n łˤono-t’a ɣˤuruš neƛ-an
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS.DIST IV-come-PFV.CVB me you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.LAT three.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP three-DISTR ruble give-FUT.DEF
\l Therefore, I will give the three of you three rubles.

\t Nełaƛ bazaryay risno där hič’č’a rigu šebin rayärux di yik’a yołƛin”.
\m neła-ƛ bazar-ay r-is-n di-r hič’č’a r-igu šebin r-ayr-ru-x di y-ik’i-a yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUB.ESS bazar-IN.ABL IV-take-PFV.CVB me-LAT the.most IV-good thing IV-bring-PST.PRT-AD.ESS me II-go-INF be-QUOT
\l I will go to the one who brings me the best thing from the market."

\t Esnabi razin boqno, nełqay łˤonot’a ɣˤurušno yisno, bazaryaɣor bik’in.
\m esyu-bi razi-n b-oq-n neła-qay łˤono-t’a ɣˤuruš-n y-is-n bazar-aɣor b-ik’i-n
\g brother-PL agree-and I.PL-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL three-DISTR ruble-and II-take-PFV.CVB bazar-IN.VERS I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l The brothers agreed, took the three rubles from her and went to the market.

\t Hič’č’a adäz eženi esiwr bazarya łˤora ɣˤurušyoƛ teƛxo q’ut’u bukaynosi, nesä bazarganqo esirno:
\m hič’č’a adäz eže-ni esiw-r bazar-a łˤora ɣˤuruš-ƛ teƛ-x q’ut’u b-ukad-nosi nesi-a bazargan-q esir-n
\g the.most ahead old-DEF brother-LAT bazar-IN.ESS three.OBL ruble-SUB.ESS sell-IPFV.CVB earthen.jug III-see-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG merchant-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l First of all, the eldest brother saw a jug on the market for three rubles, and asked the merchant:

\t Nece xira, łˤora ɣˤurušyoƛ, yedu q’ut’u teƛxo boqzaƛ’, yiłas hunarno eso mi däqƛin?”.
\m nece xira łˤora ɣˤuruš-ƛ yedu q’ut’u teƛ-x b-oq-zaƛ’ yiła-s hunar-n esi-o mi di-q-ƛin
\g so.much expensive three.OBL ruble-SUB.ESS DEM2.IISG earthen.jug sell-IPFV.CVB III-happen-CSL.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 talent-TOP tell-IMPR you me-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l "So expensive, you're selling this jug for three rubles, tell me about its ability!"

\t Bazarganä eƛin:
\m bazargan-a eƛi-n
\g merchant-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The merchant said:

\t Yedu q’ut’u łäs bic’no sasaqorno xecin, elosi łi ħaƛurnäy, exuƛ’osi žek’u č’agu oqxosiƛin”.
\m yedu q’ut’u łi-s b-ic’-n sasaq-qor-n xeci-n elo-si łi ħaƛu-r-näy exu-ƛ’-si žek’u č’agu oq-xosi-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG earthen.jug water-GEN1 III-fill-PFV.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT-and leave-PFV.CVB there-ATTR water drink-CAUS-CND.CVB die-PCT.CVB-ATTR man alive become-PRS.PRT-QUOT
\l "If you fill this jug with water and leave it until the morning and then give it someone to drink, a dying man will become alive again."

\t Eženi žoyä ža q’ut’u bisno nesi bazarganqay.
\m eže-ni uži-a ža q’ut’u b-is-n nesi bazargan-qay
\g old-DEF son-ERG DEM1.SG earthen.jug I.PL-take-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL merchant-POSS.ABL
\l The eldest son took the jug from the merchant.

\t Oƛƛozo žar bazarya teƛxo butni besun.
\m oƛƛo-zo uži-r bazar-a teƛ-x butni b-esu-n
\g middle-ATTR.OBL son-LAT bazar-IN.ESS sell-IPFV.CVB burka III-find-PST.UNW
\l The middle son found a burka on sale on the market.

\t Yiłas hunar šebi yołƛin nesä bazarganqo esirnosi, nesä eƛin:
\m yiła-s hunar šebi yoł-ƛin nesi-a bazargan-q esir-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 talent what be-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG merchant-POSS.ESS ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "What's its talent", he asked the merchant, and he said:

\t Yiłaƛ’no zown ik’inäy, beciz bolžalyos huni mi sida minutałer xäciƛin”.
\m yiła-ƛ’-n zow-n ik’i-näy buci-z bolžal-s huni mi sida minut-łer xeci-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB go-CND.CVB month-GEN2 period-GEN1 way you one.OBL minute-CONT.LAT leave-QUOT
\l "When you're riding on it, you will need one minute for a month's journey."

\t Ɣˤaɣˤun izin nesä ža butni bazaryay bisno bižin.
\m ɣˤaɣˤu-n izi-n nesi-a ža butni bazar-ay b-is-n b-iži-n
\g be.happy-and get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG burka bazar-IN.ABL III-buy-PFV.CVB III-carry-PST.UNW
\l He got happy and bought the burka from the market.

\t Eɣeni esiwr bazarya teƛxo bezuxosi č’ikayn yukayn bazarganqo esirno:
\m eɣe-ni esiw-r bazar-a teƛ-x b-ezu-xosi č’ikay-n y-ukad-n bazargan-q esir-n
\g young-DEF brother-LAT bazar-IN.ESS sell-IPFV.CVB III-look-PRS.PRT mirror-and II-see-PFV.CVB merchant-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l The younger brother saw a mirror for sale at the market and asked the merchant:

\t Łˤora ɣˤurušyoƛ yedu teƛxo yoqzaƛ’, yiłas hunar šebi yołƛin?”.
\m łˤora ɣˤuruš-ƛ yedu teƛ-x y-oq-zaƛ’ yiła-s hunar šebi yoł-ƛin
\g three.OBL ruble-SUB.ESS DEM2.IISG give-PRS II-become-CSL.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 talent what be-QUOT
\l "Three rubles does it cost, what is its ability?"

\t Łˤora beciz bolžalyos hunice maqˤi deber yetixosi kid yoqłin, neł č’ikayär ezunäy, debeł ža adäz yičirxosi”.
\m łˤora buci-z bolžal-s huni-ce maqˤi mi-r y-eti-xosi kid y-oq-łin neła č’ikay-ar ezu-näy mi-ł ža adäz y-iči-r-xosi
\g three.OBL month-GEN2 period-GEN1 way-EQU1 far.away you-LAT II-love-PRS.PRT girl II-happen-CNC.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL mirror-IN.LAT look-CND.CVB you-CONT.ESS DEM1.SG before II-be-CAUS-PRS.PRT
\l "Even if the girl that you love is as far away as a 3 months' journey, when you look into that mirror, she will be put in front of you."

\t Eɣeni esiya ža č’ikay yisno.
\m eɣe-ni esyu-a ža č’ikay y-is-n
\g young-DEF brother-ERG DEM1.SG mirror II-buy-PST.UNW
\l The younger brother bought this mirror.

\t Neła kidbä täƛruni łˤorat’a ɣˤurušyozaƛ bazaryay risxosi šebinabin risno, esnabi urɣizi boqno ʕaƛaɣor bik’a.
\m neła kid-a teƛ-ru-ni łˤora-t’a ɣˤuruš-bi-ƛ bazar-ay r-is-xosi šebin-bi-n r-is-n esyu-bi urɣizi b-oq-n ʕaƛ-aɣor b-ik’i-a
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-ERG give-PST.PRT-DEF three.OBL-DISTR ruble-PL-SUB.ESS bazar-IN.ABL IV.PL-buy-PRS.PRT thing-PL-TOP IV.PL-buy-PFV.CVB brother-PL thinking III-become-PST.UNW village-IN.VERS III-go-INF
\l Having bought the things for the 3 roubles each, that the girl gave to them, they thought about going (back?) to the village.

\t Sidade kikxor baynosi, elo ence q’ˤidan bičin bišƛ’oräy, eɣeni esiws ħamay č’ikay yˤoƛ’un yoƛixno.
\m sida-de kik-xor b-ay-nosi elo ence q’ˤida-n b-iči-n b-iš-ƛ’oräy eɣe-ni esiw-s ħam-ay č’ikay y-ˤoƛ’u-n y-oƛix-n
\g one.OBL-APUD.ESS spring-AD.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB there a.little down-and I.PL-sit-PFV.CVB I.PL-eat-SIM.CVB young-DEF brother-GEN1 chest-IN.ABL mirror II-fall-PFV.CVB II-appear-PST.UNW
\l They came to a spring; and when they barely sat down and ate, the mirror fell from the younger brother's arms.

\t Q’ˤidayn yisno č’ikayä bezunosi, žeda esirxosi kid yexux yukarno.
\m q’ˤida-ay-n y-is-n č’ikay-a b-ezu-nosi žedu-a esir-xosi kid y-exu-x y-ukar-n
\g down-IN.ABL-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB mirror-IN.ESS I.PL-look-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL-ERG ask-PRS.PRT girl II-die-PRS II-show-PST.UNW
\l And when they looked at the mirror, after taking it up from below, it showed the girl that they had asked out dying.

\t Bet’un k’oƛin łˤonon esnabi butnoƛ’no zown nełqor eƛin:
\m b-et’u-n k’oƛi-n łˤono-n esyu-bi butni-ƛ’-n zow-n neła-qor eƛi-n
\g I.PL-jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB three-TOP brother-PL burka-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l The three brothers jumped onto the burka and said to it:

\t Ela esirxosi kid yexux, xexłiƛ’ nełder bayr eliƛin!”.
\m elu-a esir-xosi kid y-exu-x xexłi-ƛ’ neła-der b-ayr eli-ƛin
\g we(I).OBL-ERG ask-PRS.PRT girl II-die-PRS quickness-SUPER.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT III-bring we-QUOT
\l "The girl that we asked is dying, quick, bring us to her!"

\t Ozuri buqin bˤaɣˤizaƛ’or žedu neł kidbederno baynosi, yeženi esiyagon nesä bisno zawruni č’edosni q’ut’un łäs bic’no, kidbez haqan et’no, ža saɣ yodin.
\m ozuri b-uqi-n b-ˤaɣˤi-zaƛ’or žedu neła kid-der-n b-ay-nosi y-eže-ni esyu-a-gon nesi-a b-is-n zow-ru-ni č’edo-s-ni q’ut’u-n łi-s b-ic’-n kid-z haqu-a-n et’-n ža saɣ y-odi-n
\g eye III-close-PFV.CVB III-open-POST.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-APUD.LAT-TOP I.PL-come-ANT.CVB II-old-DEF brother-ERG-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG III-buy-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF clay-GEN1-DEF earthen.jug-and water-GEN1 III-fill-PFV.CVB girl-GEN2 mouth-IN.ESS-and pour-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG cure II-do-PST.UNW
\l Before the wink of an eye, they arrived at the girl's; the elder brother filled the clay jug he bought with water, poured it into her mouth and cured her.

\t Yuyxor yutinosi kidbä esnazaqor eƛin:
\m y-uy-xor y-uti-nosi kid-a esyu-bi-qor eƛi-n
\g II-true-AD.LAT II-turn.back-ANT.CVB girl-ERG brother-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l When the girl sat up again, she said to the brothers:

\t Meži łˤonon esnabin yoł, mežułäy sider gurow di yuyn yäqinč’i.
\m meži łˤono-n esyu-bi-n yoł mežu-łay sida-r gurow di yuyn y-iqi-č’i
\g you.PL three-TOP brother-PL-TOP be you(I).PL.OBL-CONT.ABL one.OBL-LAT except me and(?) II-get-NEG.FUT
\l "You are three brothers and I won't get to any of you except for one.

\t Łaxtow di nexanƛin?”.
\m ła-x-tow di nex-an-ƛin
\g who.OBL-AD.ESS-EMPH me come-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l To whom shall I come?"

\t Mi di saɣ yoys, däx horoƛin”, - eženi esiya eƛin.
\m mi di saɣ y-odi-s di-x horo-ƛin - eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n
\g you me cure II-do-PST.WIT me-AD.ESS come.IMPR-QUOT - old-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "I cured you, come to me", said the eldest brother.

\t Oƛƛozonägon eƛin:
\m oƛƛo-zo-ni-a-gon eƛi-n
\g middle-ATTR.OBL-DEF-ERG-CNTR say-PST.UNW
\l The middle one said:

\t Däz butna eli ozuri buqin bˤaɣizaƛ’or dowder bayrinč’us yołi, mi łemu yexa zowsƛin”.
\m di-z butni-a eli ozuri b-uqi-n b-ˤaɣˤi-zaƛ’or mi-der b-ayr-č’u-s yołi mi łemu y-exu-a zow-s-ƛin
\g me-GEN2 burka-ERG we eye III-close-PFV.CVB III-open-POST.CVB you-APUD.LAT I.PL-bring-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT however you then.would II-die-INF be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "If my burka hadn't brought us to you before the wink of an eye, then you would have died."

\t Däz č’ikayägon mi yukarinč’us yołi, łarnokin debi roƛxosi yałrułin riya zownč’u, min yexa zowsƛin”, - eƛin eɣeni esiya.
\m di-z č’ikay-gon mi y-ukar-č’u-s yołi ła-r-n-kin mi-s r-oƛ-xosi yoł-ru-łi-n r-iy-a zow-č’u mi-n y-exu-a zow-s-ƛin - eƛi-n eɣe-ni esyu-a
\g me-GEN2 mirror-CNTR you II-show-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT if who.OBL-LAT-TOP-even you-GEN1 IV-be.sick-PRS.PRT be-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and IV-know-INF be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT you-TOP II-die-INF be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT - say-PST.UNW young-DEF brother-ERG
\l "If my mirror hadn't shown you, nobody would have known that you were sick, and you would have died", said the younger brother.

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, - eƛin kidbä, - meži łˤoran esnaza sidä sidƛ’ay bežin šebin riszaƛ’, mežatow xal bodo di łux yik’a yayƛin”.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin - eƛi-n kid-a - meži łˤora-n esyu-bi-a sida-a sida-ƛ’ay b-eži-n šebin r-is-zaƛ’ mežu-a-tow xal b-odi-o di łu-x y-ik’i-a y-ay-ƛin
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT - say-PST.UNW girl-ERG - you.PL three.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG one.OBL-IN.ESS one.OBL-SUPER.ABL III-win-PFV.CVB thing IV-take-CSL.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-ERG-EMPH examination III-do-IMPR me who.OBL-AD.ESS II-go-INF II-must-QUOT
\l "If that is so", said the girl, "you three brothers found such things, one better than the other, now figure out: to whom I shall go?

\t Sis zown beže, oc’ira łˤora kilometra bexora is.
\m sis zow-n b-eže oc’ira łˤora kilometro-a bexora is
\g one be.NPRS-PST.UNW III-big ten.OBL three.OBL kilometer-ERG lengthy bull
\l There was a 13 kilometer long ox.

\t Sis ixiw ceyn bayn ža is elay neła bok’no bižin.
\m sis ixiw cey-n b-ay-n ža is ele-ay neła-a b-ok’-n b-iži-n
\g one big eagle-and III-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG bull there-IN.ABL DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG I.PL-beat-PFV.CVB I.PL-carry-PST.UNW
\l And a big eagle came, struck this bull down and carried it away from there.

\t Ceyä ža ħonƛ’orno bižin, sida ixiw t’ekzo šilazan eqerno bac’xo zown.
\m cey-a ža ħon-ƛ’or-n b-iži-n sida ixiw t’eka-zo šilu-bi-a-n eqer-n b-ac’-x zow-n
\g eagle-ERG DEM1.SG mountain-SUPER.LAT-and III-carry-PFV.CVB one.OBL big he.goat-ATTR.OBL horn-PL-IN.ESS-and put-PFV.CVB III-eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The eagle carried it onto a mountain, put it on the horns of a big goat and ate.

\t T’eker šebi eƛakin riyn anu nełaz šilazaƛ’ roqxosi šebin.
\m t’eka-r šebi eƛi-a-kin r-iy-n anu neła-z šilu-bi-ƛ’ r-oq-xosi šebin
\g he.goat-LAT what say-INF-even IV-know-PST.UNW be.NEG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 horn-PL-SUPER.ESS IV-happen-PRS.PRT thing
\l The goat didn't even notice what happened on its horns.

\t Isno ceyä bac’no łiyrno, t’ekzo šilazaƛ’ ƛuzabi ƛexun.
\m is-n cey-a b-ac’-n łiyr-n t’eka-zo šilu-bi-ƛ’ ƛuza-bi ƛexu-n
\g bull-TOP eagle-ERG III-eat-PFV.CVB finish-PFV.CVB he.goat-ATTR.OBL horn-PL-SUPER.ESS bone-PL remain-PST.UNW
\l When the eagle finished eating the bull, the bones remained on the goat's horns.

\t Nesis ozuri roƛa rutirzaƛ’, ʕaƛaɣor žamaʕatyoƛ’or xabar begirno, däz ozäɣor räk’iru šebi eƛa räynč’iru šebin roɣʷa horoƛin.
\m nesi-s ozuri r-oƛ-a r-utir-zaƛ’ ʕaƛ-aɣor žamaʕat-ƛ’or xabar b-egir-n di-z ozuri-aɣor r-ik’i-ru šebi eƛi-a r-iy-č’i-ru šebin r-oɣ-a horo-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 eye IV-be.sick-INF IV-turn-CSL.CVB village-IN.VERS population-SUPER.LAT story III-send-PFV.CVB me-GEN2 eye-IN.VERS IV-go-PST.PRT what say-INF IV-know-NEG.FUT-PST.PRT thing IV-take.away-INF come.IMPR-QUOT
\l Because his eye got hurt, he told it to the people in the village, "Something I don't know came into my eye; come and take it out!"

\t Elay bizin žamaʕat bik’in.
\m ele-ay b-izi-n žamaʕat b-ik’i-n
\g there-IN.ABL III-get.up-PFV.CVB population III-go-PST.UNW
\l The people got up from there and went to him.

\t Žeda žedude sadaq, aħoziz ozzäy landi roɣʷa, qura oc’ira gamušyozas reƛ’un rižun.
\m žedu-a žedu-de sadaq aħo-z ozuri-ay landi r-oɣ-a qura oc’ira gamuš-bi-s reƛ’un r-iži-n
\g DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS together shepherd-GEN2 eye-IN.ABL splinter IV-take.away-INF twenty.OBL ten.OBL buffalo-PL-GEN1 together III.PL-lead-PST.UNW
\l They came together with 200 buffalos, to remove the splinter from the shepherd's eye.

\t Nasin reƛ’ubin t’aħin ħaƛ’ala aħoziz ozäy ises c’iɣu ƛisin yoɣno.
\m nasin reƛ’u-bi-n t’aħi-n ħaƛ’ala aħo-z ozuri-ay is-s c’iɣu ƛisi-n y-oɣ-n
\g all pair-PL-TOP combined-and hardly shepherd-GEN2 eye-IN.ABL bull-GEN1 shoulder.blade pull-PFV.CVB II-take.away-PST.UNW
\l All the pairs [of buffalos] combined could hardly pull out the bull's shoulder.blade from the eye of the shepherd.

\t Xalq’ima ža gamušyozaq ƛisirno ʕaƛaɣorno yižin, žeda žedus c’ik’iw ʕaƛno kušin, neł c’iɣuƛ’ ƛ’iri bodin.
\m xalq’i-a ža gamuš-bi-q ƛisi-r-n ʕaƛ-aɣor-n y-iži-n žedu-a žedu-s c’ik’iw ʕaƛ-n kuši-n neła c’iɣu-ƛ’ ƛ’iri b-odi-n
\g people-ERG DEM1.SG buffalo-PL-POSS.ESS pull-CAUS-PFV.CVB village-IN.VERS-and II-carry-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 entire village-and demolish-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL shoulder.blade-SUPER.ESS above III-do-PST.UNW
\l The people made the buffalo pull it into the village, demolished their entire village and rebuilt it on the shoulder.blade.

\t Sida zamanał, neširuxayt’a šebi eƛa riyxanuzo łinan c’iɣaƛ’ ƛ’iri yałru ʕaƛ k’ek’-bik’erxot’a zown.
\m sida zaman-ł neširu-xay-t’a šebi eƛi-a r-iy-xanuzo łi-nan c’iɣu-ƛ’ ƛ’iri yoł-ru ʕaƛ k’ek’~ik’-r-x-t’a zow-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ESS at.night-AD.ABL-DISTR what say-INF IV-know-NEG.PRS.PRT.OBL water-INT shoulder.blade-SUPER.ESS above be-PST.PRT village move-CAUS-IPFV.CVB-DISTR be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l One time, at night the village on the shoulder.blade was moved by something unknown.

\t Hudu žamaʕatyo tummabin teƛno biqˤin bičanix ʕoloqbi begirno.
\m hudu žamaʕat-a tupi-bi-n teƛ-n b-iqˤi-n b-iči-ani-x ʕoloq-bi b-egir-n
\g so population-ERG rifle-PL-TOP give-PFV.CVB I.PL-watch-PST.UNW I.PL-be-MSD-AD.ESS young.person-PL I.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l So the people gave rifles and sent the young men to [protect?] it.

\t Žeda elo sis ixiw ziru č’aq’ˤirno.
\m žedu-a elo sis ixiw ziru č’aq’ˤir-n
\g DEM1.IPL-ERG there one big fox kill-PST.UNW
\l They killed a big fox there.

\t Nełaƛ’ ƛ’iräy ħošin boɣno, q’ˤunader boƛi bok’no.
\m neła-ƛ’ ƛ’iräy ħoši-n b-oɣ-n q’ˤuna-der b-oƛi b-ok’-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS from.above hide-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB two.OBL-APUD.LAT III-half III-beat-PST.UNW
\l And they took away its hide and cut it into two halves.

\t Boƛik’a ħošos ʕaƛoz xalq’imoqor bokobi roqno, boƛik’unigon sida q’orol ɣˤanazas kuła rodacekin ʕeze boqno anu.
\m boƛik’u-a ħoši-s ʕaƛ-z xalq’i-qor boko-bi r-oq-n boƛik’u-ni-gon sida q’orol ɣˤanabi-s kuła r-odi-ace-kin ʕeze b-oq-n anu
\g half-ERG hide-GEN1 village-GEN2 people-POSS.LAT fur.coat-PL IV-become-PFV.CVB half-DEF-CNTR one.OBL widowed woman-GEN1 sleeve IV-do-TERM-even be.enough III-become-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l One half of the hide became fur coats for the people of the village, the other half wasn't even enough for the sleeve of one widow.

\t Howła imadał hič’č’a ixiw šebi yoł: isä, ceyä, t’ekayä, aħoyä, ziruyä, q’orol ɣˤanabiyä?
\m howła imadu-ł hič’č’a ixiw šebi yoł isä cey-a t’eka-a aħo-a ziru-a q’orol ɣˤanabi-a
\g DEM3.IISG.OBL tale-CONT.ESS the.most big who be conceive eagle-Q he.goat-Q shepherd-Q fox-Q widowed woman-Q
\l Who is the biggest one in this tale: The bull, the eagle, the goat, the shepherd, the fox or the widow?

\t Sis zownƛax Goqiƛin eƛäsi miskinaw žek’u.
\m sis zow-n-ƛax Goqi-ƛin eƛi-asi miskinaw žek’u
\g one be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT Goqi-QUOT say-RES.PRT poor man
\l Once there was a poor man named Goqi.

\t Nesis ɣˤutku ʕaƛoz č’imäza zown.
\m nesi-s ɣˤutku ʕaƛ-z č’imu-aza zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 house village-GEN2 corner-IN.VERS.DIST be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His house was located in the suburb of a village.

\t Ža ɣudes ciqaɣort’a ik’ix Allahqo harizi oqxo zown: däłäy žek’ułersi žek’u odoƛin.
\m ža ɣudes ciq-aɣor-t’a ik’i-x Allah-q harizi oq-x zow-n di-łay žek’u-łer-si žek’u odi-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG daily forest-IN.VERS-DISTR go-IPFV.CVB God-POSS.ESS request become-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW me-CONT.ABL man-CONT.LAT-ATTR man do-IMPR-QUOT
\l Every day, he went into the forest and asked God: Make me a respectable man.

\t Yedu yisis zigari q’oyil zirur teqxo zown.
\m yedu yisi-s zigari q’oyil ziru-r teq-x zow-n
\g DEM2.IISG DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 complaint daily fox-LAT hear-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Every day, a fox heard his complaint.

\t Nełaz rok’ƛ’or pikru bayn, Goqir kumak bodanƛin.
\m neła-z rok’u-ƛ’or pikru b-ay-n Goqi-r kumak b-odi-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT idea I.PL-come-PST.UNW Goqi-LAT help III-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l And he thought of helping Goqi.

\t Zira sida quł nesiqor eƛin:
\m ziru-a sida qu-ł nesi-qor eƛi-n
\g fox-ERG one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l One day, the fox said to him:

\t Wey Goqi, mi di kikinäy, Allahä deber kiʕangi maʕišat bičärƛin”.
\m wey Goqi mi di kiki-näy Allah-a mi-r kiʕangi maʕišat b-ičir-ƛin
\g hey Goqi you me feed-CND.CVB God-ERG you-LAT some fortune III-hand.over-QUOT
\l "Hey Goqi, if you feed me, God will set up a fortune for you."

\t Goqi zira äƛiru łinaƛ’no bužzin oqno, nesä ža iduɣorno bižin, q’ˤanon sadaq bičix zown.
\m Goqi ziru-a eƛi-ru łina-ƛ’-n bužzi-n oq-n nesi-a ža idu-ɣor-n b-iži-n q’ˤano-n sadaq b-iči-x zow-n
\g Goqi fox-ERG say-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP trust-TOP become-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG home-IN.ALL-and I.PL-lead-PFV.CVB two-and together I.PL-live-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Goqi believed what the fox said, he took him home and the two lived together.

\t Sida quł Goqix kidno esirno xanderno bik’in zira eƛin:
\m sida qu-ł Goqi-x kid-n esir-n xan-der-n b-ik’i-n ziru-a eƛi-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS Goqi-AD.ESS daughter-TOP ask-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.LAT-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB fox-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l One day, the fox went to the king to ask for his daughter to be promised for Goqi, and said:

\t Xan, di nexäsi yoł čara, res anusi debi kid däz Goqix esiranixƛin”.
\m xan di nex-asi yoł čara res anu-si mi-s kid di-z Goqi-x esir-ani-x-ƛin
\g khan me come-RES.PRT be ability possibility be.NEG-ATTR you-GEN1 daughter me-GEN2 Goqi-AD.ESS ask-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l "King, I have come to you in order to ask for your daughter to be married to my Goqi."

\t Xanä eƛin:
\m xan-a eƛi-n
\g khan-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The king said:

\t Di dowzo Goqix kid egiran, amma där ža ukada ayƛin”.
\m di mi-zo Goqi-x kid egir-an amma di-r ža ukad-a ay-ƛin
\g me you-ATTR.OBL Goqi-AD.ESS daughter send-FUT.DEF but me-LAT DEM1.SG see-INF must-QUOT
\l "I will send my daughter to your Goqi, but I have to see him."

\t Ziru k’oƛin bik’in xanqo ukaranix Goqi owa.
\m ziru k’oƛi-n b-ik’i-n xan-q ukar-ani-x Goqi ow-a
\g fox run-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PST.UNW khan-POSS.ESS show-MSD-AD.ESS Goqi bring-INF
\l The fox ran away to bring Goqi in order to show him to the king.

\t Xanesno nełasno baqru xabar nesiq esinosi, Goqi ħayran oqno ƛexun.
\m xan-s-n neła-s-n b-oq-ru xabar nesi-q esi-nosi Goqi ħayran oq-n ƛexu-n
\g khan-GEN1-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-and III-happen-PST.PRT story DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-ANT.CVB Goqi be.astonished become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l After telling him what the king and he said, Goqi was astonished.

\t Nesä eƛin:
\m nesi-a eƛi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l He said:

\t Zira ħal bayrinč’ey yeda xandäɣor oɣno.
\m ziru-a ħal b-ayr-č’ey yeda xan-däɣor oɣ-n
\g fox-ERG strength III-bring-NEG.PST.UNW DEM2.ISG khan-APUD.VERS clean.up-PST.UNW
\l Nevertheless, the fox pesuaded him to go to the king.

\t Hunix bik’iƛ’oräy, žedu sida iħixor baynosi, nesiq yałruni šeƛ’u roɣno iħiq rižirno.
\m huni-x b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy žedu sida iħu-xor b-ay-nosi nesi-q yoł-ru-ni šeƛ’u r-oɣ-n iħu-q r-iži-r-n
\g way-AD.ESS I.PL-go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IPL one.OBL river-AD.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT-DEF clothing IV-take.away-PFV.CVB river-POSS.ESS IV-carry-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l While they were on their way, after they came to a river, he took off Goqi's clothings and threw them into the river.

\t Howlo lilyoxtow yedan xecin, xanderno bik’in ziru c’ok’inayn:
\m howlo lilyo-x-tow yeda-n xeci-n xan-der-n b-ik’i-n ziru c’ok’inad-n
\g there river.bank-AD.ESS-EMPH DEM2.ISG-and leave-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.LAT-and I.PL-go-PFV.CVB fox scold-PST.UNW
\l When they left the river bank there and went to the king, the fox scolded:

\t Ža debi ƛe didiw zown?
\m ža mi-s ƛe didiw zow-n
\g DEM1.SG you-GEN1 bridge which be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "What kind of bridge was that of yours?

\t Iħuƛ’ boqƛ’oräy, ƛen bˤoƛ’un dahaw šebin ƛexus Goqi łiyä ižanir.
\m iħu-ƛ’ b-oq-ƛ’oräy ƛe-n b-ˤoƛ’u-n dahaw šebin ƛexu-s Goqi łi-a iži-ani-r
\g river-SUPER.ESS I.PL-become-SIM.CVB bridge-and III-fall-PFV.CVB a.little thing remain-PST.WIT Goqi water-ERG carry-MSD-LAT
\l When we wanted to cross the river, the bridge broke apart and Goqi was almost carried away by the water.

\t Hudun beže taliħ boqsi: nesiztow hunaryoƛ’aza lilyoxaɣor ok’ełsi.
\m hudun b-eže taliħ b-oq-s nesi-z-tow hunar-ƛ’aza lilyo-xaɣor ok’eł-s
\g nevertheless III-big fortune III-happen-PST.WIT DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2-EMPH talent-SUPER.VERS.DIST river.bank-AD.VERS escape-PST.WIT
\l Nevertheless, the luck was on his side: Because of his talent, he escaped to the river bank.

\t Nesiqosi šeƛ’u łiyän rižin, ža howlotow adoru ƛexasi dowdäɣor nexa oqinč’ey.
\m nesi-q-si šeƛ’u łi-a-n r-iži-n ža howlo-tow adoru ƛexu-asi mi-däɣor nex-a oq-č’ey
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-ATTR clothing water-ERG-TOP IV-carry-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG there-EMPH naked remain-RES.PRT you-APUD.VERS come-INF become-NEG.PST.UNW
\l And the water carried his clothes away, he remained naked there and could not come to you.

\t Nesiqor gulun, šeƛ’un neƛa ray miƛin”.
\m nesi-qor gulu-n šeƛ’u-n neƛ-a r-ay mi-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT horse-and clothing-and give-INF IV-must you-QUOT
\l You must lend him clothes and a horse."

\t Xanä hič’č’a riguni šeƛ’un, gulun nesir rižanix ziruqor teƛno.
\m xan-a hič’č’a r-igu-ni šeƛ’u-n gulu-n nesi-r r-iži-ani-x ziru-qor teƛ-n
\g khan-ERG very IV-pretty-DEF clothing-and horse-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-carry-MSD-AD.ESS fox-POSS.LAT give-PST.UNW
\l The king gave the fox a horse and very pretty clothes to carry them to him.

\t Zira bik’in, xanä täƛruni, Goqiq šeƛ’un šeƛ’urno, guluƛ’no zowerno xandäɣor hunix boqno.
\m ziru-a b-ik’i-n xan-a teƛ-ru-ni Goqi-q šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-r-n gulu-ƛ’-n zowr-n xan-däɣor huni-x b-oq-n
\g fox-ERG III-go-PFV.CVB khan-ERG give-PST.PRT-DEF Goqi-POSS.ESS clothing-and put.on-CAUS-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.ESS-and seat-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.VERS way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The fox left, let Goqi put on the clothes and get on the horse given by the king and so they went on their way to the king.

\t Azbaryoxor baynosi, xanes biguni ɣira erno Goqix kid yegiranir.
\m azbar-xor b-ay-nosi xan-s b-igu-ni ɣira er-n Goqi-x kid y-egir-ani-r
\g palace-AD.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB khan-GEN1 III-good-DEF wish put-PFV.CVB Goqi-AD.ESS daughter II-send-MSD-LAT
\l When they arrived at the palace, the king wished to send his daughter to Goqi.

\t Hudayzikotow beže bertenno bodin, xanä nesix, ziruz kumakyoƛ’aza, kidno yegirno.
\m hudayziko-tow b-eže berten-n b-odi-n xan-a nesi-x ziru-z kumak-ƛ’aza kid-n y-egir-n
\g the.next.day-EMPH III-big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS fox-GEN2 help-SUPER.VERS.DIST daughter-TOP II-send-PST.UNW
\l The next day they had a big wedding; due to the help of the fox, the king gave him his daughter.

\t Din zows elo bertenyoł, hudun mešok’labi dandi at’iłsi.
\m di-n zow-s elo berten-ł hudun mešok’la-bi dandi at’ił-s
\g me-TOP be.NPRS-PST.WIT there marriage-CONT.ESS nevertheless moustache-PL only become.wet-PST.WIT
\l I was there at the wedding as well, but only moustaches got wet.

\t Eɣeni esiw siskin eynoynč’u.
\m eɣe-ni esiw siskin eynod-č’u
\g young-DEF brother any work-NEG.PST.WIT
\l "Our younger brother didn't work at all.

\t Iduɣor nexƛ’oräygon, bahanar šeƛ’urqo ħurno biħisƛin”.
\m idu-ɣor nex-ƛ’oräy-gon bahana-r šeƛ’u-r-q ħur-n b-iħi-s-ƛin
\g home-IN.ALL come-SIM.CVB-CNTR excuse-LAT clothing-LAT-POSS.ESS dust-TOP III-smear-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Also, when he comes home, he smears dirt on his clothes as an excuse."

\t Roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey, yeda maduhalłiq yałru ʕaƛaɣor ik’in.
\m r-odi-a šebin koƛ’i-č’ey yeda maduhalłi-q yoł-ru ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-n
\g IV-do-INF thing understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB DEM2.ISG neighbourhood-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT village-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l Not knowing what to do, he went to a village that was in the neighbourhood.

\t Sidaquł bara yisiqor eƛin:
\m sidaquł baru-a yisi-qor eƛi-n
\g one.day wife-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l One day his wife said to him:

\t Enda ƛelin teƛno deber mi šeƛ’u risoƛin”.
\m enda ƛeli-n teƛ-n mi-r mi šeƛ’u r-is-o-ƛin
\g DEM3b.SG lamb-TOP sell-PFV.CVB you-LAT you clothing IV-buy-IMPR-QUOT
\l "Sell that lamb and buy clothes for yourself!"

\t Q’ˤano äƛiru ɣudƛ’o sasaq izin bazaryaɣor teƛanixƛin čanyan adäz boc’no yedan ik’in.
\m q’ˤano äƛiru ɣudi-ƛ’ sasaq izi-n bazar-aɣor teƛ-ani-x-ƛin čan-n adäz b-oc’-n yeda-n ik’i-n
\g two ORD day-SUPER.ESS in.the.morning get.up-PFV.CVB bazar-IN.VERS sell-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT she.goat-and ahead III-drive-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG-and go-PST.UNW
\l On the second day in the morning, he got up, and went to drive the she.goat ahead in order to sell it on the market.

\t Bazarno resunč’ey eɣeni esiya ƛelin bown xizor utin nexƛ’oräy, hunix räsuru č’ʷadma teł žan bicin, iduɣor nexno.
\m bazar-n r-esu-č’ey eɣe-ni esyu-a ƛeli-n b-ow-n xizor uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy huni-x r-esu-ru č’ʷad-a teł ža-n b-ici-n idu-ɣor nex-n
