\g bazar-TOP IV-find-NEG.PST.CVB young-DEF brother-ERG lamb-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB back turn.back-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB way-AD.ESS IV-exist-PST.PRT ruin-IN.ESS inside DEM1.SG-TOP III-tie-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL come-PST.UNW
\l The younger brother didn't find the market, and when he came back with the lamb, he tied it to a ruin, which was on the way, and went home.

\t Šebi roqäƛin bara bayan bisnosi, nesä esin, hemedur bazarno resunč’ey, ƛelin iduɣor bowa retinč’ey, howlo hunix räsuru č’ʷadma teł bicin nexsiƛin.
\m šebi r-oq-a-ƛin baru-a bayan b-is-nosi nesi-a esi-n hemedur bazar-n r-esu-č’ey ƛeli-n idu-ɣor b-ow-a r-eti-č’ey howlo huni-x r-esu-ru č’ʷad-a teł b-ici-n nex-s-ƛin
\g what IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT wife-ERG specification III-take-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG tell-PFV.CVB so bazar-TOP IV-find-NEG.PST.CVB lamb-TOP home-IN.ALL III-bring-INF IV-want-NEG.PST.CVB there way-AD.ESS IV-exist-PST.PRT ruin-IN.ESS inside III-tie-PFV.CVB come-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "What happened?", the wife wanted a clear explanation, so he told her that he didn't find the market and didn't want to bring the lamb back home, so he tied it to a ruin which was on the way and came home.

\t Yisiqor yigza ħalał baru c’ok’inayn, ƛelin maħ xecin nexzaƛ’.
\m yisi-qor y-ig-za ħal-ł baru c’ok’inad-n ƛeli-n ma-x xeci-n nex-zaƛ’
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT II-much-ZA strength-CONT.ESS wife scold-PFV.CVB lamb-TOP outside-AD.ESS leave-PFV.CVB come-CSL.CVB
\l His wife scolded him quite much, because he came and left the lamb outside.

\t Neła quł sasaqosi, qˤašacekin ičinč’ey, č’ʷadma bäciru ƛeli bowa ik’inosi, eɣeni esiwr ƛuzabi gurow resun anu.
\m neła qu-ł sasaqosi qˤaši-ace-kin iči-č’ey č’ʷad-a b-ici-ru ƛeli b-ow-a ik’i-nosi eɣe-ni esiw-r ƛuza-bi gurow r-esu-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning get.up-TERM-even be-NEG.PST.CVB ruin-IN.ESS III-tie-PST.PRT lamb III-get-INF go-ANT.CVB young-DEF brother-LAT bone-PL except IV-find-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l The next day, even before it got morning, he went to get the lamb which was tied to the ruin, and the young brother found nothing but bones.

\t Howži yeda č’ʷadmoƛ’or iħanadanix utin:
\m howži yeda č’ʷad-ƛ’or iħanad-ani-x uti-n
\g now DEM2.ISG ruin-SUPER.LAT fight-MSD-AD.ESS turn.back-PST.UNW
\l Now he began to fight with the ruin:

\t Hemeł zamanał, sidaɣ mečoƛ’ č’ʷadma teł gondu yoqno.
\m hemeł zaman-ł sidaɣ moči-ƛ’ č’ʷad-a teł gondu y-oq-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL time-CONT.ESS in.one.place place-SUPER.ESS ruin-IN.ESS inside big.hole II-happen-PST.UNW
\l At this time, a big hole appeared somewhere in the ruin.

\t Žan bižin yeda iduɣor ik’in.
\m ža-n b-iži-n yeda idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l So he brought it home.

\t Bara ƛeli bowwäƛin esirnosi, yisä nełaq raqru sadaq šebin esin.
\m baru-a ƛeli b-ow-ya-ƛin esir-nosi yisi-a neła-q r-oq-ru sadaq šebin esi-n
\g wife-ERG lamb III-bring-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-happen-PST.PRT all thing tell-PST.UNW
\l His wife asked, if he brought the lamb, and he told her everything that had happened.

\t Xizyo žeda eƛin, nesä elo č’ʷadma čanya bicäsi zown besunäy, ela isʷa ricanƛin.
\m xizyo žedu-a eƛi-n nesi-a elo č’ʷad-a čan b-ici-asi zow-n b-esu-näy elu-a is-a r-ici-an-ƛin
\g after DEM1.IPL-ERG say-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG there ruin-IN.ESS she.goat III-follow-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB III-find-CND.CVB we(I).OBL-ERG bull-ERG IV-tie-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Then they said that if he tied the she.goat to the family's house, we will tie a bull to it.

\t Neła quł sasaqtow, qaħłi begiracekin bičinč’ey ixinabin rižin q’ˤanon esnabi č’ʷadmay micxir bowa bik’in.
\m neła qu-ł sasaq-tow qaħłi b-egir-ace-kin b-iči-č’ey ixin-bi-n r-iži-n q’ˤano-n esyu-bi č’ʷad-ay micxir b-ow-a b-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning-EMPH dawn III-let-TERM-even III-be-NEG.PST.UNW bag-PL-TOP IV-carry-PFV.CVB two-TOP brother-PL ruin-IN.ABL money III-get-INF I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l The next morning even before dawn, carrying a bag, the two brothers went to get the money out of the ruin.

\t Łinasnokin pikru boynč’ey, esnabi ɣˤulabi caƛix qidobi kuša boqno.
\m łina-s-n-kin pikru b-odi-č’ey esyu-bi ɣˤul-bi caƛi-x qido-bi kuši-a b-oq-n
\g what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-even idea III-do-NEG.PST.CVB brother-PL stone-PL throw-IPFV.CVB wall-PL demolish-INF I.PL-begin-PST.UNW
\l Without thinking, the brothers began demolishing the wall by throwing stones.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder žeda łałnokin t’ok’ow ħalikataw šebin royn anu.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder žedu-a ła-ł-n-kin t’ok’ow ħalikataw šebin r-odi-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after DEM1.IPL-ERG who.OBL-CONT.ESS-TOP-even anymore mean thing IV-do-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l After that, they didn't do anything mean to anyone anymore.

\t Esin šebi, xecin šebi sida beɣe ʕaƛa res anusi, baru yowace oqäsi ʕoloqanaw uži zown.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi sida b-eɣe ʕaƛ-a res anu-si baru y-ow-ace oq-asi ʕoloqanaw uži zow-n
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what one.OBL III-young village-IN.ESS possibility be.NEG-ATTR wife II-marry-TERM become-RES.PRT young boy be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l What is to be said, what is to be left out -- there lived a young boy, without the necessary subsistence, being in the right age to marry a woman.

\t Ža reƛ’izał maxšel, hunar yołäsi, saɣaw ci rik’äsi uži zown.
\m ža reƛ’a-bi-ł maxšel hunar yoł-asi saɣaw ci r-ik’i-asi uži zow-n
\g DEM1.SG hand-PL-CONT.ESS skill talent be-RES.PRT healthy name IV-go-RES.PRT boy be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He was a boy who was known for his talent and skill at his hands.

\t Cin nesiƛ’ Musaƛin zown.
\m ci-n nesi-ƛ’ Musa-ƛin zow-n
\g name-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS Musa-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l And his name was Musa.

\t Maduhalłiq yałru xande ħalt’oł ža zown: nesis azbarno c’unzi rodin.
\m maduhalłi-q yoł-ru xan-de ħalt’i-ł ža zow-n nesi-s azbar-n c’unzi r-odi-n
\g neighbourhood-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT khan-APUD.ESS work-CONT.ESS DEM1.SG be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 palace-TOP guard IV-do-PST.UNW
\l He was working at the neighbouring king: He guarded his palace.

\t Q’ˤuyan, adäzar keze baqru, ħalt’i boyx zown nesä.
\m q’ˤuya-n adäz-ar keze b-oq-ru ħalt’i b-odi-x zow-n nesi-a
\g other-TOP ahead-IN.LAT meet III-happen-PST.PRT work III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l He was also doing other work that he could get.

\t Sidaquł Musader xanes kid yayn.
\m sidaquł Musa-der xan-s kid y-ay-n
\g one.day Musa-APUD.LAT khan-GEN1 daughter II-come-PST.UNW
\l One day, the king's daughter came to Musa.

\t Nełar ža ʕaq’ˤu etix zown, hudun Musa hiƛ’ar anusi ičix zown - miskinaw oqzaƛ’ ža däx yuyn yegärinč’i, yuyn näxinč’iƛin.
\m neła-r ža aq’ˤu eti-x zow-n hudun Musa hiƛ’ar anu-si iči-x zow-n - miskinaw oq-zaƛ’ ža di-x yuyn y-egir-č’i yuyn nex-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.SG much love-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB nevertheless Musa worry be.NEG-ATTR be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW - poor become-CSL.CVB DEM1.SG me-AD.ESS and(?) II-send-NEG.FUT and(?) come-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l She loved him very much, but Musa didn't care about this, thinking: "Because I am so poor, he wont give me to her and she won't come to me either."

\t Neła elay harizin rodin nasin ħalt’uqanbin boxirno, Musał adäz bečnazaƛ’orno c’oxno eƛin:
\m neła-a ele-ay harizi-n r-odi-n nasin ħalt’uqan-bi-n b-oxir-n Musa-ł adäz bečni-bi-ƛ’or-n c’ox-n eƛi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG there-IN.ABL request-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB all worker-PL-TOP I.PL-chase-PFV.CVB Musa-CONT.ESS ahead knee-PL-SUPER.LAT-and pounce-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l She asked all workers to get away from there, felt on her knees before Musa and said:

\t Sosi mi där k’ałazi yoqa izmu neƛƛin”.
\m sosi mi di-r k’ałazi y-oq-a izmu neƛ-ƛin
\g at.first you me-LAT speech II-happen-INF permission give-QUOT
\l At first, give me the permission to speak to you.

\t Xizyo hečk’erno yizin, yegirno mown xecin, Musaq łox uban bodin esirno:
\m xizyo hečk’er-n y-izi-n y-egir-n mow-n xeci-n Musa-q łox uba-n b-odi-n esir-n
\g after upright-TOP II-get.up-PFV.CVB II-let-PFV.CVB tear-and leave-PFV.CVB Musa-POSS.ESS thrice kiss-and III-do-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW
\l After she got up again, she shed a tear, gave Musa 3 kisses and asked him:

\t Deber di yetixa, mi di yowa yołäƛin?”
\m mi-r di y-eti-x-a mi di y-ow-a yoł-a-ƛin
\g you-LAT me II-love-PRS-Q you me II-marry-INF be-Q-QUOT
\l "Do you love me, will you marry me?"

\t Diƛa mi yowanƛin, - eƛin Musa, - debeztow babiya yegirnäy”.
\m di-ƛa mi y-ow-an-ƛin - eƛi-n Musa-a - mi-z-tow babiw-a y-egir-näy
\g me-INDEF you II-marry-FUT.DEF-QUOT - say-PST.UNW Musa-ERG - you-GEN2-EMPH father-ERG II-let-CND.CVB
\l "I will marry you", said Musa, "if you father lets you go."

\t Xanes kidgon ʕiyayxtow ʕiyayx yičäsi zown roda šebinon łaħin.
\m xan-s kid-gon ʕiyad-x-tow ʕiyad-x y-iči-asi zow-n r-odi-a šebinon łaħi-n
\g khan-GEN1 daughter-CNTR cry-IPFV.CVB-EMPH cry-IPFV.CVB II-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB IV-do-INF something forget-PST.UNW
\l The king's daughter, who was just crying and crying, didn't know what to do.

\t Sida mixƛ’o maduhalłiq yałru xanä qacis gulu begirno bayrno Musa tełer karuni xanƛ’or (nesiƛ’ ʕAwdunasirƛin ci zown).
\m sida mixƛ’o maduhalłi-q yoł-ru xan-a qaci-s gulu b-egir-n b-ayr-n Musa tełer kur-ru-ni xan-ƛ’or nesi-ƛ’ ʕAwdunasir-ƛin ci zow-n
\g one.OBL at.a.time neighbourhood-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT khan-ERG firewood-GEN1 horse III-let-PFV.CVB III-bring-PFV.CVB Musa into throw-PST.PRT-DEF khan-SUPER.LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS Awdunasir-QUOT name be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l One evening, the neighbouring king came sent a wooden horse to the king who threw Musa into jail (his name was Abdulnasir).

\t Ža gulu sis čuret’ bak’run hawaƛ’ bik’in, ʕoƛno ħonno xecin bitazar bayxosi zown.
\m ža gulu sis čuret’ b-ok’-run hawa-ƛ’ b-ik’i-n ʕoƛno ħon-n xeci-n bita-azar b-ay-xosi zow-n
\g DEM1.SG horse one whip III-beat-IMM.ANT.CVB air-SUPER.ESS III-go-PST.UNW seven mountain-TOP leave-PFV.CVB distance-IN.LAT.DIST III-come-PRS.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l This horse went into the air after one beat with the whip, and leaving behind seven mountains, went far into the distance.

\t Gulu begirno bayäru xanä ʕAwdunasireł adäz masala erno: neł guluƛ’no zown nesider ayru žek’ur xanłi teƛa yołƛin, amma guluƛ’no zown egirno xanä žek’u ayrinč’inäy, nesis kid q’ˤuyza xanzo žaxno yegirno, raƛ’no roɣno xanłiƛ’aygon žan kura yołƛin.
\m gulu b-egir-n b-ayr-ru xan-a ʕAwdunasir-ł adäz masala er-n neła gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n nesi-der ay-ru žek’u-r xanłi teƛ-a yoł-ƛin amma gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n egir-n xan-a žek’u ayr-č’i-näy nesi-s kid q’ˤuya-bi-a xan-zo uži-x-n y-egir-n raƛ’-n r-oɣ-n xanłi-ƛ’ay-gon ža-n kur-a yoł-ƛin
\g horse III-send-PFV.CVB III-lead-PST.PRT khan-ERG Awdunasir-CONT.ESS ahead task put-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT come-PST.PRT man-LAT khanate give-INF be-QUOT but horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB send-PFV.CVB khan-ERG man bring-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter other-PL-ERG khan-ATTR.OBL son-AD.ESS-TOP II-send-PFV.CVB land-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB throne-SUPER.ABL-CNTR DEM1.SG-TOP throw-INF be-QUOT
\l The king who had sent the horse assigned Awdunasir a task: He would give the kingdom to the man who came to him riding that horse, but if it does not bring a man, then he would send his daughter to another king's son, take away his land and throw him off the throne.

\t Roda šebinno koƛ’inč’ey, ža xan c’aq’ q’ʷaridno oqno ičäsi zown.
\m r-odi-a šebin-n koƛ’i-č’ey ža xan c’aq’ q’ʷarid-n oq-n iči-asi zow-n
\g IV-do-INF thing-TOP understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.SG khan very sadness-TOP become-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The king became very sad and didn't know what to do.

\t Sidaquł yisä nesiz xanłiƛ’osi nasin ʕoloqbi sidaɣor butirno, yołä mežuł teł yiła guluƛ’ zowanix bažari yołäsi žek’uƛin esirnosi, nasin p’es anusi wˤałer q’ˤimbin kurno bičin.
\m sidaquł yisi-a nesi-z xanłi-ƛ’-si nasin ʕoloq-bi sida-aɣor b-utir-n yoł-a mežu-ł teł yiła gulu-ƛ’ zow-ani-x bažari yoł-asi žek’u-ƛin esir-nosi nasin p’es anu-si wˤał-r q’ˤim-bi-n kur-n b-iči-n
\g one.day DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 khanate-SUPER.ESS-ATTR all young.person-PL one.OBL-IN.VERS I.PL-gather-PFV.CVB be-Q you(I).PL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside DEM2.IISG.OBL horse-SUPER.ESS ride-MSD-AD.ESS skill be-RES.PRT man-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB all sound be.NEG-ATTR downward-LAT head-PL-TOP throw-PFV.CVB I.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l One day he let all young men of his own kingdom come together and asked who among them would be the one that had the skill to ride that horse, all were silent and kept their heads down.

\t Xizyo xanes kidbä yik’in Musaq raqru łinałäyn esin.
\m xizyo xan-s kid-a y-ik’i-n Musa-q r-oq-ru łina-łay-n esi-n
\g after khan-GEN1 daughter-ERG II-go-PFV.CVB Musa-POSS.ESS IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP tell-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, the king's daughter went and told Musa about what had happened.

\t Musa ɣˤaɣˤun izin xanzo kidbez ƛ’oq’ˤa uban bodin eƛin:
\m Musa ɣˤaɣˤu-n izi-n xan-zo kid-z ƛ’oq’ˤo-a uba-n b-odi-n eƛi-n
\g Musa be.happy-and get.up-PFV.CVB khan-ATTR.OBL daughter-GEN2 forehead-IN.ESS kiss-and III-do-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l Musa rejoiced, gave the king's daughter a kiss on the forehead and said:

\t Di guluƛ’ zowan, mi däde sadaq zownäyƛin”.
\m di gulu-ƛ’ zow-an mi di-de sadaq zow-näy-ƛin
\g me horse-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-FUT.DEF you me-APUD.ESS together ride-CND.CVB-QUOT
\l "I will ride that horse, if you ride together with me".

\t Kidno razi yoqno.
\m kid-n razi y-oq-n
\g girl-TOP agree II-become-PST.UNW
\l The girl agreed.

\t Xexłiƛ’ k’oƛin babiwderno yik’in, hemesi tusnaq’äzo užir teƛxa mi izmu guluƛ’ zowanirƛin, nełaq eƛin rok’äłrun, xan kid žek’anixƛin iza oqno.
\m xexłi-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n babiw-der-n y-ik’i-n hemesi tusnaq’-a-zo uži-r teƛ-x-a mi izmu gulu-ƛ’ zow-ani-r-ƛin neła-q eƛi-n r-ok’eł-run xan kid žek’-ani-x-ƛin izi-a oq-n
\g quickness-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB father-APUD.LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB DEM4.ISG.OBL prison-IN.ESS-ATTR.OBL boy-LAT give-IPFV.CVB-Q you permission horse-SUPER.ESS ride-MSD-LAT-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS say-PFV.CVB IV-escape-IMM.ANT.CVB khan daughter beat-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT get.up-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l She quickly ran to her father, and when the words "Do you give the permission that the boy in prison can ride the horse?" broke out of her, the king got up to slap his daughter.

\t Xizyogon urɣizin oqno, tusnaq’äsini uži egirno däder aƛin, amru bodin.
\m xizyogon urɣizi-n oq-n tusnaq’-asi-ni uži egir-n di-der a-ƛin amru b-odi-n
\g then thinking-TOP begin-PFV.CVB prison-RES.PRT-DEF boy let-PFV.CVB me-APUD.LAT bring.IMP-QUOT command III-do-PST.UNW
\l Then he thought about it and ordered the boy out of the prison to him.

\t Xanä nesiqor xabar boynosi, uži razi oqno.
\m xan-a nesi-qor xabar b-odi-nosi uži razi oq-n
\g khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT story III-do-ANT.CVB boy agree become-PST.UNW
\l When the king told him the story, the boy agreed.

\t Guluƛ’ zowa adäza Musa nesiqor eƛin:
\m gulu-ƛ’ zow-a adäza Musa nesi-qor eƛi-n
\g horse-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-INF before Musa DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l Before mounting the horse, Musa said to him:

\t Sosi reƛ’ibi risa min, kidno bitazoni ɣˤutkaɣor horoƛin”.
\m sosi reƛ’a-bi r-is-a mi-n kid-n bitasi-ni ɣˤutku-aɣor horo-ƛin
\g at.first hand-PL IV.PL-take-INF you-and daughter-and next-DEF room-IN.VERS go.IMPR-QUOT
\l "At first you and your daughter will go to the next room to shake hands."

\t Qacis gulu łaci biłe hawaƛ’ boržizi boqno bik’inosi, ʕoƛno ħonno xecin sidade gogaƛ’or bayn.
\m qaci-s gulu łaci b-iłe hawa-ƛ’ boržizi b-oq-n b-ik’i-nosi ʕoƛno ħon-n xeci-n sida-de goga-ƛ’or b-ay-n
\g firewood-GEN1 horse wind III-as air-SUPER.ESS fly I.PL-happen-PFV.CVB III-go-ANT.CVB seven mountain-TOP leave-PFV.CVB one.OBL-APUD.ESS meadow-SUPER.LAT III-come-PST.UNW
\l After the wooden horse flew through the air like the wind, it left seven mountains behind and came to a meadow.

\t Elo yizi q’ˤunän rok’uɣʷeymoł bičin sasaqor ɣudi qˤaširno.
\m elo yizi q’ˤuna-a-n rok’uɣʷey-ł b-iči-n sasaq-qor ɣudi qˤašir-n
\g there DEM2.IPL.OBL two.OBL-ERG-TOP fun-CONT.ESS I.PL-be-PFV.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT day dawn-PST.UNW
\l There the two had fun until the next morning.

\t Sasaqosi bizin bišƛ’oräy, nazay eƛa biynč’ey bˤoƛ’un ʕansa hečk’er yiził adäz bičin.
\m sasaqosi b-izi-n b-iš-ƛ’oräy nazay eƛi-a b-iy-č’ey b-ˤoƛ’u-n ʕansa hečk’er yizi-ł adäz b-iči-n
\g in.the.morning I.PL-get-PFV.CVB I.PL-eat-SIM.CVB from.where say-INF I.PL-know-NEG.PST.CVB I.PL-fall-PFV.CVB walking.stick upright DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS before I.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l In the morning when they got up and ate, a stick fell down from somewhere and stood upright before them.

\t Musagon kʷayärno bisno eƛin:
\m Musa-a-gon kʷay-ar-n b-is-n eƛi-n
\g Musa-ERG-CNTR hand-IN.LAT-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l Then Musa took it in his hand and said:

\t Howła gulułäy ɣˤʷay bodoƛin”.
\m howła gulu-łay ɣˤʷay b-odi-o-ƛin
\g DEM3.IISG.OBL horse-CONT.ABL dog III-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l Make a dog out of this horse!

\t Qacisni gulu ɣˤʷayƛ’orno butin, k’oƛin bik’in xanes kid xanno.
\m qaci-s-ni gulu ɣˤʷay-ƛ’or-n b-uti-n k’oƛi-n b-ik’i-n xan-s kid xan-n
\g firewood-GEN1-DEF horse dog-SUPER.LAT-and III-turn.back-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 daughter bite-PST.UNW
\l The wooden horse turned into a dog, ran and bit the king's daughter.

\t Xexłiƛ’ eƛin ɣˤʷaygon yałru qaciz guluƛ’or butirno.
\m xexłi-ƛ’ eƛi-n ɣˤʷay-gon yoł-ru qaci-z gulu-ƛ’or b-utir-n
\g quickness-SUPER.ESS say-PFV.CVB dog-CNTR be-PST.PRT firewood-GEN2 horse-SUPER.LAT III-turn-PST.UNW
\l He quickly said [something] and what has been a dog transformed back into the wooden horse.

\t Nełas yałru žedur mumpaʕat biynosi, yizä ža ʕansa muroƛ’orno butirno, kidbez kočorał caƛin.
\m neła-s yoł-ru žedu-r mumpaʕat b-iy-nosi yizi-a ža ʕansa muro-ƛ’or-n b-utir-n kid-z kočori-ł caƛi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 be-PST.PRT DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT benefit I.PL-know-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG walking.stick needle-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-turn-PFV.CVB girl-GEN2 forelock-CONT.ESS stick-PST.UNW
\l When they understood the benefit of it, they turned this walking stick into a needle and put it into the girl's hair.

\t Guluƛ’no zown sosigon Musa čuret’ bok’nosi, reč’yałer yizirabi xanzo ɣˤutkox igor bayn.
\m gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n sosi-gon Musa-a čuret’ b-ok’-nosi reč’-łer yizirabi xan-zo ɣˤutku-x igo-r b-ay-n
\g horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB at.first-CNTR Musa-ERG whip III-beat-ANT.CVB quickness-CONT.LAT DEM2.PL khan-ATTR.OBL house-AD.ESS near-LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l When he was on the horse, Musa first beated the whip, and in an instant they came to the king's house.

\t Idazayn oƛixno nesä yizi tełxorno goƛ’in, ƛ’irir zahrun ƛešun adäz bišʷa ħaƛin, bišƛ’oräytow bexuran yiziƛin.
\m idu-azay-n oƛix-n nesi-a yizi teł-xor-n goƛ’i-n ƛ’iri-r zahru-n ƛešu-n adäz bišʷa ħaƛi-n b-iš-ƛ’oräy-tow b-exur-an yizi-ƛin
\g home-IN.ABL.DIST-TOP appear-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL inside-AD.LAT-and call-PFV.CVB above-LAT poison-and pour-PFV.CVB before food organize-PFV.CVB I.PL-eat-SIM.CVB-EMPH I.PL-kill-FUT.DEF DEM2.IPL.OBL-QUOT
\l Coming out of the house, he called them inside, organized dinner and poured poison in it, to kill them when they eat.

\t Xanes ħillan čuqˤno, kidbä ʕansaqor, bišodyołäysi zahru bok’ek’ƛinno eƛin, xizyo bercingo bišno.
\m xan-s ħilla-n čuqˤ-n kid-a ʕansa-qor bišod-łay-si zahru b-ok’ek’-ƛin-n eƛi-n xizyo bercingo b-iš-n
\g khan-GEN1 trickery-TOP notice-PFV.CVB daughter-ERG walking.stick-POSS.LAT food-CONT.ABL-ATTR poison III-steal-QUOT-TOP say-PFV.CVB after good I.PL-eat-PST.UNW
\l Noticing the king's trickery, and the daughter told the walking stick to remove the poison in the food, whereafter they ate well.

\t Xan urqizin oqno ičäsi zown, hoboyä hik’eyä yizi bexuxƛin.
\m xan urqizi-n oq-n iči-asi zow-n hoboy-a hik’ey-a yizi b-exu-x-ƛin
\g khan thinking-TOP begin-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB now-Q long.ago-Q DEM2.IPL.OBL I.PL-die-PRS-QUOT
\l Then the king started pondering if they're still alive or already died.

\t Bišno-butin siskin šebin yizir roqinč’izaƛ’, hudäyziko xanä nasin xalq’in bak’arizi bodin eƛin:
\m b-iš~uti-n siskin šebin yizi-r r-oq-č’i-zaƛ’ hudäyziko xan-a nasin xalq’i-n bak’arizi b-odi-n eƛi-n
\g I.PL-eat-PFV.CVB any thing DEM2.IPL-LAT IV-happen-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB day.after.tomorrow khan-ERG all people-and gathering I.PL-do-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l On the second day, when nothing had happened to them after they ate, the king gathered all people together and said:

\t Di yaqˤuł xizor ik’ix, däz meča xanłun yeda užin egirno, di nesis hič’č’a eženi wazirłun oqxoƛin”.
\m di yaqˤuł xizor ik’i-x di-z meča xan-łun yeda uži-n egir-n di nesi-s hič’č’a eže-ni wazir-łun oq-x-ƛin
\g me today back go-PRS me-GEN2 instead.of khan-LHUN DEM2.ISG boy-and send-PFV.CVB me DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 the.most old-DEF vizier-LHUN become-PRS-QUOT
\l "I abdicate today; instead of me, I let this boy be king, I become his eldest vizier."

\t Musa suƛƛitow eƛin:
\m Musa suƛƛi-tow eƛi-n
\g Musa suddenly-EMPH say-PST.UNW
\l Then Musa suddenly said:

\t Di xanłi royxanu.
\m di xanłi r-odi-x-anu
\g me khanship IV-do-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l "I won't be king.

\t Žek’uz raƛ’ma xanłi royzaƛ’or, q’ˤimez raƛ’ma laɣłun di ičan.
\m žek’u-z raƛ’-a xanłi r-odi-zaƛ’or q’ˤim-z raƛ’-a laɣ-łun di iči-an
\g man-GEN2 land-IN.ESS khanship IV-do-POST.CVB oneself-GEN2 land-IN.ESS slave-LHUN me live-FUT.DEF
\l Before I become king in someone else's country, I'll live as a slave in my own country.

\t Där howža qacis gulun neƛ, din hunix egirƛin”.
\m di-r howža qaci-s gulu-n neƛ di-n huni-x egir-ƛin
\g me-LAT DEM4.SG firewood-GEN1 horse-TOP give me-TOP way-AD.ESS let-QUOT
\l Give me that wooden horse and let me go."

\t Ža nesä eƛizaƛ’, yeda xan ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤun izin, xalq’in žaƛ’ razi boqno.
\m ža nesi-a eƛi-zaƛ’ yeda xan ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu-n izi-n xalq’i-n uži-ƛ’ razi b-oq-n
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-CSL.CVB DEM2.ISG khan much be.happy-TOP get-PFV.CVB people-TOP boy-SUPER.ESS agree I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l When he said that, the king got very glad, and the people were okay with the boy.

\t Žar gulun teƛno, žedur riguƛay rigu bišʷan erno, xanä reže rok’uɣʷeyn rodin, žedus hunin regirno.
\m uži-r gulu-n teƛ-n žedu-r r-igu-ƛay r-igu bišʷa-n er-n xan-a r-eže rok’uɣʷey-n r-odi-n žedu-s huni-n r-egir-n
\g boy-LAT horse-and give-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT IV-good-SUB.ABL IV-good food-and put-PFV.CVB khan-ERG IV-big banquet-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 way-and IV-let-PST.UNW
\l So the king gave the horse to the boy, gave them really good food, organized a large meal and let them go their way.

\t Musa sis čuret’ bak’run, qaciz gula hawaƛ’ łaci biłe bižin yizi kidbez babiwz ʕaƛar bayrno.
\m Musa-a sis čuret’ b-ok’-run qaci-z gulu-a hawa-ƛ’ łaci b-iłe b-iži-n yizi kid-z babiw-z ʕaƛ-ar b-ayr-n
\g Musa-ERG one whip III-beat-IMM.ANT.CVB firewood-GEN2 horse-ERG air-SUPER.ESS wind I.PL-as I.PL-carry-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL girl-GEN2 father-GEN2 village-IN.LAT I.PL-bring-PST.UNW
\l After Musa cracked the whip, the wooden horse carried them through the air, like the wind, and brought them into the village of the girl's father's.

\t Xan ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu izin kidno, yisiƛ’ay q’ʷariłi bok’äk’runi misikin užin saɣłiƛ’, nesis muradno t’ubazi bodin xizor butin bayzaƛ’.
\m xan ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu izi-n kid-n yisi-ƛ’ay q’ʷariłi b-ok’ek’-ru-ni misikin uži-n saɣłi-ƛ’ nesi-s murad-n t’ubazi b-odi-n xizor b-uti-n b-ay-zaƛ’
\g khan much be.happy get-PFV.CVB daughter-and DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL sadness III-steal-PST.PRT-DEF poor boy-and health-SUPER.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 wish-TOP fulfill III-do-PFV.CVB back I.PL-turn.back-PFV.CVB I.PL-come-CSL.CVB
\l The king got very happy that his wish came true, that his daughter and the young boy who helped him out of distress came home safely.

\t ʕAwdunasirä nasin xalq’in butirno eƛin:
\m ʕAwdunasir-a nasin xalq’i-n b-utir-n eƛi-n
\g Awdunasir-ERG all people-TOP I.PL-gather-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l Awdunasir let all people gather and said unto them:

\t Ele rukayxa mežur, misikin xalq’imon boda keze boqzaƛ’ bečedawt’anizar kumakno boyn, xʷasar boyx.
\m ele r-ukad-x-a mežu-r misikin xalq’i-a-n b-odi-a keze b-oq-zaƛ’ bečedaw-t’a-ni-bi-r kumak-n b-odi-n xʷasar b-odi-x
\g here IV-see-IPFV.CVB-Q you(I).PL.OBL-LAT poor people-ERG-TOP III-do-INF meet III-become-CSL.CVB wealthy-DISTR-DEF-PL-LAT help-and III-do-PFV.CVB rescue III-do-PRS
\l "You see, also poor people can rescue and help rich people when they need it.

\t Yaqˤułäy soder yeda Musa xanłun iča yołƛin”.
\m yaqˤuł-ay soder yeda Musa xan-łun iči-a yoł-ƛin
\g today-IN.ABL after DEM2.ISG Musa khan-LHUN be-INF be-QUOT
\l From that day on he shall be king Musa."

\t Xanłin, nasin maʕišatno Musaqor teƛno, ixiw bertenno bodin kidno yegirno.
\m xanłi-n nasin maʕišat-n Musa-qor teƛ-n ixiw berten-n b-odi-n kid-n y-egir-n
\g khanate-and all fortune-and Musa-POSS.LAT give-PFV.CVB big marriage-and III-do-PFV.CVB daughter-and II-send-PST.UNW
\l He gave Musa his kingdom and all his fortune, and gave him his daughter and organized a great wedding.

\t Neł zamanał din, Musas miskinawni halmaɣ, bertenyołer goƛ’äsi zows.
\m neła zaman-ł di-n Musa-s miskinaw-ni halmaɣ berten-łer goƛ’i-asi zow-s
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL time-CONT.ESS me-TOP Musa-GEN1 poor-DEF friend marriage-CONT.LAT call-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l At that time I, Musa's poor friend, was called to that wedding as well.

\t Di elor ayzaƛ’, ža ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤun izin, nełquł sasaqtow nesä di eženi wazirłun xecis.
\m di elo-r ay-zaƛ’ ža ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu-n izi-n nełquł sasaq-tow nesi-a di eže-ni wazir-łun xeci-s
\g me there-LAT come-CSL.CVB DEM1.SG much be.happy-TOP get-PFV.CVB on.that.day in.the.morning-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG me big-DEF vizier-LHUN leave-PST.WIT
\l Because I came, he got very happy and the next morning he made me the grand vizier.

\t Žin č’agu yołƛax ža baħarči.
\m žin č’agu yoł-ƛax ža baħarči
\g now alive be-QUOT DEM1.SG brave.young.man
\l It is said that this brave younge man is still alive today.

\t Žedu sis ečru k’et’u zown.
\m žedu sis ečru k’et’u zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL one old cat be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They had an old cat.

\t Nełaq aw biqix zownanu.
\m neła-q aw b-iqi-x zow-n-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS mouse III-get-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l He didn't catch any mice.

\t Sidaquł yizä ža k’et’u bižin ciqor begirno.
\m sidaquł yizi-a ža k’et’u b-iži-n ciq-qor b-egir-n
\g one.day DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG cat I.PL-take.out-PFV.CVB forest-POSS.LAT III-send-PST.UNW
\l One day they took the cat out and sent him into the forest.

\t K’et’uƛ’orno bezun, tamašan boqno zira esirno:
\m k’et’u-ƛ’or-n b-ezu-n tamaša-n b-oq-n ziru-a esir-n
\g cat-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-look-PFV.CVB be.surprised-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB fox-ERG ask-PST.UNW
\l The fox looked at the cat, was surprised and asked:

\t Mi šebi yołƛin?”
\m mi šebi yoł-ƛin
\g you who be-QUOT
\l "Who are you?"

\t Di ciqes xan yołƛin”, - k’et’a žawab teƛno.
\m di ciq-s xan yoł-ƛin - k’et’u-a žawab teƛ-n
\g me forest-GEN1 khan be-QUOT - cat-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "I am the king of the forest", answered the cat.

\t Zira ža neła nełde sadaq iduɣor bižin.
\m ziru-a ža neła-a neła-de sadaq idu-ɣor b-iži-n
\g fox-ERG DEM1.SG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS together home-IN.ALL III-lead-PST.UNW
\l The fox took him with him to his own home.

\t Zamanałäy žedus žeduł c’aq’ muši biłin.
\m zaman-łay žedu-s žedu-ł c’aq’ muši b-iłi-n
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM1.IIPL-GEN1 DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS very smell III-approach-PST.UNW
\l Suddenly a very strong smell approached them.

\t Sidaquł ziru sisxoli k’et’ur rac’a šebinon k’edin bik’in.
\m sidaquł ziru sisxoli k’et’u-r r-ac’-a šebinon k’edi-n b-ik’i-n
\g one.day fox alone cat-LAT IV-eat-INF something search-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB
\l One day, the fox went away alone to search something to eat for the cat.

\t Mat’in biqirno ziru xizor nexxo zown.
\m mat’i-n b-iqir-n ziru xizor nex-x zow-n
\g duck-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB fox back come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l And the fox caught a duck and came back.

\t Hunix nełade dandir c’axru boc’ä nełqay ža dawla boɣƛ’oräy, zira eƛin:
\m huni-x neła-de dandir c’ox-ru boc’i-a neła-qay ža dawla b-oɣ-ƛ’oräy ziru-a eƛi-n
\g way-AD.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS towards meet-PST.PRT wolf-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL DEM1.SG prey III-take.away-SIM.CVB fox-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l On the way, when a wolf that was coming towards him wanted to take the prey away from him, the fox said:

\t Yedu mat’i di ciqez xaner bižix, sis miƛ’in bown min horoƛin”.
\m yedu mat’i di ciq-z xan-r b-iži-x sis miƛ’i-n b-ow-n mi-n horo-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG duck me forest-GEN2 khan-LAT III-carry-PRS one ram-TOP III-get-PFV.CVB you-TOP go.IMPR-QUOT
\l "I am carrying this duck to the king of the forest, go get a ram!"

\t Elaygon bitor bik’iƛ’oräy, nełar hunix zey keze baqno.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy neła-r huni-x zey keze b-oq-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither III-go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT way-AD.ESS bear meet III-become-PST.UNW
\l While he went on, he met a bear on the way.

\t Žan hemedurtow mat’i boɣa c’oxnosi, zira eƛin:
\m ža-n hemedur-tow mat’i b-oɣ-a c’ox-nosi ziru-a eƛi-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP so-EMPH duck III-take.away-INF meet-ANT.CVB fox-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l And he also came to take away the duck, so the fox said:

\t Yeda di ciqez xaner bižix, min nełar sis is baƛin”.
\m yeda di ciq-z xan-r b-iži-x mi-n neła-r sis is b-a-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG me forest-GEN2 khan-LAT III-carry-PRS you-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT one bull III-bring.IMP-QUOT
\l "I'm bringing this to the king of the forest, bring him a bull!"

\t Q’ˤunaäƛiru ɣudƛ’o miƛ’i bayrno boc’in, isno gugyoq caƛin zeyn ziruz ɣˤutkoxorno rayn, maħlaytow qˤaƛin:
\m q’ˤuna-äƛiru ɣudi-ƛ’ miƛ’i b-ayr-n boc’i-n is-n gugu-q caƛi-n zey-n ziru-z ɣˤutku-xor-n r-ay-n maħla-ay-tow qˤaƛin
\g two.OBL-ORD day-SUPER.ESS ram III-bring-PFV.CVB wolf-TOP bull-TOP back-POSS.ESS throw-PFV.CVB bear-TOP fox-GEN2 house-AD.LAT-TOP III.PL-come-PFV.CVB court-IN.ABL-EMPH loudly
\l On the second day, the wolf came to the fox's house bringing a ram and the bear came with a bull thrown over his back, a loud voice shouted from the backyard:

\t Zirulaw, mi äƛiru šebinon rown eli nexsi!
\m ziru-law mi eƛi-ru šebinon r-ow-n eli nex-s
\g fox-VOC you say-PST.PRT something IV-bring-PFV.CVB we come-PST.WIT
\l "Mr.(?) Fox, we have come to bring what you said!

\t Bukar hoboy eluq ciqes xanƛin!”
\m b-ukar hoboy elu-q ciq-s xan-ƛin
\g III-show now we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS forest-GEN1 khan-QUOT
\l Show us the king of the forest now!"

\t Zira eƛin:
\m ziru-a eƛi-n
\g fox-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The fox said:

\t Ozer rukaynč’iza ruqˤeł, yałi ža mežuƛ’ c’axƛin”.
\m ozuri-r r-ukad-č’i-za r-uqˤeł yałi ža mežu-ƛ’ c’ox-ƛin
\g eye-LAT III.PL-see-NEG.FUT-LCV.CVB III.PL-hide else DEM1.SG you(I).PL.OBL-SUPER.ESS pounce-QUOT
\l "Hide where his eyes will not see you, or else he'll pounce on you.

\t Boc’i maħla ɣˤunoqay räšruni ƛˤebrezał buqˤełno, zey hemełtow ažomzo kosyar bizin.
\m boc’i maħla-a ɣˤuni-qay r-eš-ru-ni ƛˤeb-bi-ł b-uqˤeł-n zey hemeł-tow ažo-zo kos-r b-izi-n
\g wolf court-IN.ESS hornless.goat-POSS.ABL IV-fall-PST.PRT-DEF leaf-PL-CONT.ESS III-hide-PFV.CVB bear DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH tree-ATTR.OBL peak-LAT III-get.up-PST.UNW
\l The wolf who ate from the goat hide in the garden between the leaves, the bear climbed up on the crest of a tree.

\t Xizyo dandi zira k’et’u maħor begirno.
\m xizyo dandi ziru-a k’et’u maħor b-egir-n
\g after soon fox-ERG cat outside III-send-PST.UNW
\l Short after, the fox sent the cat outside.

\t Mekoq bexux yałru k’et’u sosi bik’in miƛ’eƛ’ c’oxno, xizyogon isƛ’o łeɣin.
\m meko-q b-exu-x yoł-ru k’et’u sosi b-ik’i-n miƛ’i-ƛ’ c’ox-n xizyogon is-ƛ’ łeɣi-n
\g hunger-POSS.ESS III-die-IPFV.CVB be-PST.PRT cat at.first III-go-PFV.CVB ram-SUPER.ESS pounce-PFV.CVB then bull-SUPER.ESS grasp-PST.UNW
\l The starving cat first went and pounced on to the ram, then clinged to the bull.

\t Bexuratow bexurxo yiła di hoboyƛin, boc’i bet’un k’oƛin bizin boxin elay.
\m b-exur-a-tow b-exur-x yiła-a di hoboy-ƛin boc’i b-et’u-n k’oƛi-n b-izi-n b-oxi-n ele-ay
\g III-kill-INF-EMPH III-kill-IPFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG me now-QUOT wolf III-jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB III-get-PFV.CVB III-run.away-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL
\l "He's going to kill me now!", the wolf jumped up and ran away.

\t Nełaq bˤuƛ’nogon k’et’u boxin ɣunoq soder bizin.
\m neła-q b-ˤuƛ’-n-gon k’et’u b-oxi-n ɣun-q soder b-izi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS III-be.afraid-PFV.CVB-CNTR cat III-run.away-PFV.CVB tree-POSS.ESS after III-get.up-PFV.CVB
\l The cat got frightened, ran away and got up a tree.

\t Hoboy yedu däƛ’or nexxoƛin, zeygon ɣunoqayn bˤoƛ’un, q’ˤidayn bizin zebu yoɣno boxin.
\m hoboy yedu di-ƛ’or nex-x-ƛin zey-gon ɣun-qay-n b-ˤoƛ’u-n q’ˤida-ay-n b-izi-n zebu y-oɣ-n b-oxi-n
\g now DEM2.IISG me-SUPER.LAT come-PRS-QUOT bear-CNTR tree-POSS.ABL-and III-fall-PFV.CVB down-IN.ABL-and III-get-PFV.CVB running II-take.away-PFV.CVB III-run.away-PST.UNW
\l "Now he's coming to me!", the bear fell off the tree, got down and ran away quickly.

\t Zirun, k’et’un yołi boc’än, zeyän bayäru dawlaƛ’ žin yołƛax.
\m ziru-n k’et’u-n yołi boc’i-a-n zey-a-n b-ayr-ru dawla-ƛ’ žin yoł-ƛax
\g fox-and cat-and indeed wolf-ERG-and bear-ERG-and III-bring-PST.PRT prey-SUPER.ESS now be-QUOT
\l And now the fox and the cat went to the prey that the wolf and the bear have brought that day.

\t Zownƛax sis ažoƛ q’ˤida bičäsi ziru.
\m zow-n-ƛax sis ažo-ƛ q’ˤida b-iči-asi ziru
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT one tree-SUB.ESS under III-sit-RES.PRT fox
\l Once there was a fox sitting under a tree.

\t Haqoƛer reƛno risno ažoƛ’ bayn ɣʷˤadi heqnosi, zira nełxor eƛin:
\m haqu-ƛer reƛ-n r-is-n ažo-ƛ’ b-ay-n ɣʷˤadi heq-nosi ziru-a neła-xor eƛi-n
\g mouth-SUB.LAT meat-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB tree-SUPER.ESS III-come-PFV.CVB crow sit.down-ANT.CVB fox-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-AD.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l When a crow sat down onto the tree with a piece of meat in its beak, the fox said to him:

\t Dowƛ’ay bercinawn, dowzoƛ’ay bercinaw haraƛ’ yołäsin där dunyalzo gugyoƛ’ aɣi bukaynč’u.
\m mi-ƛ’ay bercinaw-n mi-z-ƛ’ay bercinaw haraƛ’ yoł-asi-n di-r dunyal-zo gugu-ƛ’ aɣi b-ukad-č’u
\g you-SUPER.ABL beautiful-TOP you-GEN2-SUPER.ABL beautiful voice be-RES.PRT-TOP me-LAT world-ATTR.OBL back-SUPER.ESS bird III-see-NEG.PST.WIT
\l "I have never seen such a beautiful bird like you, having the most beautiful voice in the world.

\t Där sis debi haraƛ’ teqra bäti, behizi roqnäyƛin”.
\m di-r sis mi-s haraƛ’ teqer-a b-eti behizi r-oq-näy-ƛin
\g me-LAT one you-GEN1 voice listen.to-INF III-want permit IV-become-CND.CVB-QUOT
\l I want to hear your voice, if I may!"

\t Baq’ˤu urɣizi boqxo bičinč’ey, ɣʷˤadä q’ˤʷa-q’ˤʷa-q’ˤʷaƛin haraƛ’ bayrun, haqoƛäy reƛ q’ˤidar rˤaƛ’un.
\m b-aq’ˤu urɣizi b-oq-x b-iči-č’ey ɣʷˤadi-a q’ˤʷa-q’ˤʷa-q’ˤʷa-ƛin haraƛ’ b-odi-run haqu-ƛay reƛ q’ˤida-r r-ˤaƛ’u-n
\g III-much thinking III-become-IPFV.CVB III-be-NEG.PST.CVB crow-ERG crah-crah-crah-QUOT voice I.PL-do-IMM.ANT.CVB mouth-SUB.ABL meat down-LAT IV-fall-PST.UNW
\l Without thinking much, the crow let its voice caw and the piece of meat fell down out of his mouth.

\t Ziragon k’oƛin bik’in riqirno žan rac’no, ɣʷˤader barkalan boyn, neła nełaz hunix bik’in.
\m ziru-a-gon k’oƛi-n b-ik’i-n r-iqir-n ža-n r-ac’-n ɣʷˤadi-r barkala-n b-odi-n neła-a neła-z huni-x b-ik’i-n
\g fox-ERG-CNTR jump-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-and IV-eat-PFV.CVB crow-LAT thank-and III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 way-AD.ESS III-go-PST.UNW
\l The fox then jumped and took it away and ate it, thanked the crow and went on his way.

\t Zownƛax zown anuƛax onočun, mamalayn.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax onoču-n mamalay-n
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT hen-and rooster-and
\l Once upon a time there was a hen and a rooster.

\t Žeda sadaqay ʕumru boyx zown.
\m žedu-a sadaq-ay ʕumru b-odi-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL-ERG together-IN.ABL life III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They where living together.

\t Mamalay ɣudes ciqaɣor qaciƛ’or bik’ix zown, onoču iduza beynoyx, iduzasi royx bičix zown.
\m mamalay ɣudes ciq-aɣor qaci-ƛ’or b-ik’i-x zow-n onoču idu-za b-eynod-x idu-za-si r-odi-x b-iči-x zow-n
\g rooster daily forest-IN.VERS firewood-SUPER.LAT III-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB hen home-ZA III-work-IPFV.CVB home-ZA-ATTR IV-do-PRS III-be-PRS be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Every day the rooster went into the forest for firewood, and the hen was at home doing the housework.

\t Netintow mamalayä at’iwt’a qaca rayrxo zown, nełaqgon c’i era onočar isałxo zown.
\m netin-tow mamalay-a at’iw-t’a qaca r-ayr-x zow-n neła-q-gon c’i er-a onoču-r isał-x zow-n
\g always-EMPH rooster-ERG wet-DISTR firewood IV-bring-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-CNTR fire put-INF hen-LAT be.difficult-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The rooster always brought wet firewood, and it was difficult for the hen to light a fire with it.

\t Šida mi yaqˤułgon at’iw qaca rayräƛin onoču c’ok’inayzaƛ’, mamalayä di kecno ƛexunƛint’a žawab teƛxo zown.
\m šida mi yaqˤuł-gon at’iw qaca r-ayr-a-ƛin onoču c’ok’inad-zaƛ’ mamalay-a di kec-n ƛexu-n-ƛin-t’a žawab teƛ-x zow-n
\g why you today-CNTR wet firewood IV-bring-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT hen scold-CSL.CVB rooster-ERG me sleep-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB-QUOT-DISTR answer give-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l When the hen scolded: "Why have you brought wet firewood again, today?", the rooster answered that he slept in.

\t Onočas pikru boqno, ciqaɣor ža bik’inosi, nełał xizay xal bodin bičanƛin.
\m onoču-s pikru b-oq-n ciq-aɣor ža b-ik’i-nosi neła-ł xizay xal b-odi-n b-iči-an-ƛin
\g hen-GEN1 idea III-become-PFV.CVB forest-IN.VERS DEM1.SG III-go-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind examination III-do-PFV.CVB III-be-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The hen had the idea to follow him, when he goes to the forest.

\t Hudayziko onoču mamalaył xizay biynč’ey ciqaɣor bik’in.
\m hudayziko onoču mamalay-ł xizay b-iy-č’ey ciq-aɣor b-ik’i-n
\g the.next.day hen rooster-CONT.ESS behind III-know-NEG.PST.CVB forest-IN.VERS III-go-PST.UNW
\l The next day, the hen secretly followed the rooster into the forest.

\t Neširur mamalay howožatow at’iw qacan rayrno xizor butin baynosi, onoča esirno:
\m neširu-r mamalay howža-tow at’iw qaca-n r-ayr-n xizor b-uti-n b-ay-nosi onoču-a esir-n
\g at.night-LAT rooster DEM4.SG-EMPH wet firewood-TOP IV-bring-PFV.CVB back III-turn.back-PFV.CVB III-come-ANT.CVB hen-ERG ask-PST.UNW
\l At night, when the rooster came back bringing this wet firewood again, the hen asked:

\t Sadaq ʕon rižäsi zowzaƛ’, yaqˤułgon šida mi at’iw qaca rayräƛin?”
\m sadaq ʕo-n r-iži-asi zow-zaƛ’ yaqˤuł-gon šida mi at’iw qaca r-ayr-a-ƛin
\g together ax-TOP IV-carry-RES.PRT be.NPRS-CSL.CVB today-CNTR why you wet firewood IV-bring-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l "Why did you bring wet firewood today again, although you carried the axe with you?"

\t Kecno ƛexunƛin”, - eƛin mamalayä.
\m kec-n ƛexu-n-ƛin - eƛi-n mamalay-a
\g sleep-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW-QUOT - say-PST.UNW rooster-ERG
\l "I slept in", said the rooster.

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, - eƛin onoča, - sasaq qaciƛ’or di bik’a yołƛin”.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin - eƛi-n onoču-a - sasaq qaci-ƛ’or di b-ik’i-a yoł-ƛin
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT - say-PST.UNW hen-ERG - tomorrow firewood-SUPER.LAT me III-go-INF be-QUOT
\l "If that's the case," said the hen, "I will go after firewood tomorrow."

\t Nełquł sasaq č’ˤurqotow bizin onoču qaciƛ’or bik’in.
\m nełquł sasaq č’ˤurqo-tow b-izi-n onoču qaci-ƛ’or b-ik’i-n
\g on.that.day tomorrow in.the.morning-EMPH III-get.up-PFV.CVB hen firewood-SUPER.LAT III-go-PST.UNW
\l The next day, in the early morning, the hen got up and went after firewood.

\t Iħuxor baynosi, neła łox c’iw-li-wit’ƛin” qˤaƛin.
\m iħu-xor b-ay-nosi neła-a łox c’iw~li~wit’-ƛin qˤaƛi-n
\g river-AD.LAT III-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG thrice tsiwliwit-QUOT shout-PST.UNW
\l When she came to the river, she shouted "tsiwliwit" three times.

\t Łu mi nediw bodäƛin?”, - esirno mamalayä.
\m łu mi nediw b-odi-a-ƛin - esir-n mamalay-a
\g who.ERG you such III-do-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT - ask-PST.UNW rooster-ERG
\l "Who did this to you?", asked the rooster.

\t Ħuł bayn debez onoča boysƛin”, - žawab teƛno łoħra.
\m ħuł b-ay-n mi-z onoču-a b-odi-s-ƛin - žawab teƛ-n łoħro-a
\g yesterday III-come-PFV.CVB you-GEN2 hen-ERG III-do-PST.WIT-QUOT - answer give-PST.UNW frog-ERG
\l "Yesterday your hen came and did this", answered the frog.

\t Mamalay qaciqorno, yił- nełqorno bezux bičinč’ey durimoƛ’ bik’in onočaƛ’ biħanayn nełasno łoħros yiłetown k’onč’un yecurno, nełdäy hozur boqno, neła nełaz ɣˤutkaɣor bik’in.
\m mamalay qaci-qor-n yiła neła-qor-n b-ezu-x b-iči-č’ey durimoƛ’ b-ik’i-n onoču-ƛ’ b-iħanad-n neła-s-n łoħro-s y-iłe-tow-n k’onč’u-n y-ecu-r-n neła-day hozur b-oq-n neła-a neła-z ɣˤutku-aɣor b-ik’i-n
\g rooster firewood-POSS.LAT-and DEM2.IISG.OBL DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-and III-look-IPFV.CVB III-be-NEG.PST.CVB running III-go-PFV.CVB hen-SUPER.ESS III-fight-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-and frog-GEN1 II-as-EMPH-PFV.CVB leg-and II-break-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ABL separately III-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 house-IN.VERS III-go-PST.UNW
\l Without looking for firewood or any other things, he ran off to the hen, had a fight [with her] and broke her leg just like the frog's, seperated from her and went to his own house.

\t Šomoƛa ɣudi rik’inosi, mamalay onočadär bik’a bayn.
\m šomo-ƛa ɣudi r-ik’i-nosi mamalay onoču-dar b-ik’i-a b-ay-n
\g how.many-INDEF day IV-go-ANT.CVB rooster hen-APUD.VERS III-go-INF III-come-PFV.CVB
\l After some days had passed, the rooster came to the hen.

\t Onoču sosisi begirxanuƛin inkarno boyn bičäsi zown, yaqˤułno łoħrodär bik’iƛin.
\m onoču sosi-si b-egir-x-anu-ƛin inkar-n b-odi-n b-iči-asi zow-n yaqˤuł-n łoħro-dar b-ik’i-ƛin
\g hen at.first-ATTR III-let-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT rejection-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB III-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB today-TOP frog-APUD.VERS III-go-QUOT
\l "I won't let you in", the hen rejected at first, "Go to the frog again, today!"

\t Mamalayä nełar t’ok’ow bik’ač’inƛin rexuxanusi rožin teƛno, nece bayn čerayzaƛ’ onoča ža idur begirno.
\m mamalay-a neła-r t’ok’ow b-ik’i-ač’in-ƛin r-exu-xanusi roži-n teƛ-n nece b-ay-n čerad-zaƛ’ onoču-a ža idu-r b-egir-n
\g rooster-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT anymore III-go-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT IV-die-NEG.PRS.PRT word-TOP give-PFV.CVB so.much III-come-PFV.CVB beg-CSL.CVB hen-ERG DEM1.SG home-LAT III-let-PST.UNW
\l The rooster gave his word, that he would not go to her anymore, and since he begged so much, the hen let him home.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder žedur žedu bič’zin boqno, t’ok’ow mamalay iħuxor łoħroderno bik’ix zown anu, netin quqäsi gurow qacan rayrxo zown anu.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder žedu-r žedu bič’zi-n b-oq-n t’ok’ow mamalay iħu-xor łoħro-der-n b-ik’i-x zow-n anu netin quqäsi gurow qaca-n r-ayr-x zow-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT DEM1.IPL.OBL understand-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB anymore rooster river-AD.LAT frog-APUD.LAT-TOP III-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG always dry except firewood-TOP IV-bring-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l After that, they understood each other, the rooster didn't go to the frog at the river anymore and always brought dry firewood only.

\t Zownƛax sis c’odoraw xan.
\m zow-n-ƛax sis c’odoraw xan
\g be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT one clever khan
\l Once there was a wise king.

\t Nesir sis budum ukayn minaraƛ’or izix.
\m nesi-r sis budum ukad-n minara-ƛ’or izi-x
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT one muezzin see-PFV.CVB minaret-SUPER.LAT get.up-PRS
\l He saw a muezzin getting up the minaret.

\t Ža soder iziƛ’oräy, qoqoƛix izix zown, wˤałer oqƛ’oräy ʕiyayx oqxo zown.
\m ža soder izi-ƛ’oräy qoqoƛi-x izi-x zow-n wˤał-r oq-ƛ’oräy ʕiyad-x oq-x zow-n
\g DEM1.SG after get.up-SIM.CVB laugh-IPFV.CVB get.up-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB downward-LAT become-SIM.CVB cry-IPFV.CVB become-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l While he was going up, he laughed, and while he was going down, he cryed.

\t Sidaquł xanä idurno goƛ’in budumqor eƛin:
\m sidaquł xan-a idu-r-n goƛ’i-n budum-qor eƛi-n
\g one.day khan-ERG home-LAT-TOP call-PFV.CVB muezzin-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l One day, the king called the muezzin to his home and said:

\t Mi minaraɣor iziƛ’oräy qoqoƛix izixozosno, wˤałer oqzey ʕiyayx oqxosi yałrułisno ʕalamałi däq esoƛin”.
\m mi minara-ɣor izi-ƛ’oräy qoqoƛi-x izi-xozo-s-n wˤał-r oq-zey ʕiyad-x oq-xosi yoł-rułi-s-n ʕalamałi di-q esi-o-ƛin
\g you minaret-IN.ALL get.up-SIM.CVB laugh-IPFV.CVB get.up-PRS.PRT.OBL-GEN1-TOP downward-LAT become-SIMCVB cry-IPFV.CVB begin-PRS.PRT be-MSD-GEN1-TOP amazement me-POSS.ESS tell-IMPR-QUOT
\l "Tell me the wonder why you are laughing when you go up the minaret and why you are crying when you go down!"

\t Budunä eƛin:
\m budum-a eƛi-n
\g muezzin-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The muezzin said:

\t Xan, č’agu ƛexuƛ mi!
\m xan č’agu ƛexu-ƛ mi
\g khan alive remain-OPT you
\l "King, [long] may you live!

\t Sidaquł sasaqosi akbar roɣa di minaraƛ’or izis.
\m sidaquł sasaqosi akbar r-oɣ-a di minara-ƛ’or izi-s
\g one.day in.the.morning call.for.prayer IV-take.away-INF me minaret-SUPER.LAT get.up-PST.WIT
\l One day in the morning I went up the minaret to call for the prayer.

\t Akbar roɣno łäyrun, bayn sida ceyä iqirno ižin di maqˤi mečoƛ’ sida c’aq’ bercinaw baɣmar kursi.
\m akbar r-oɣ-n łiy-run b-ay-n sida cey-a iqir-n iži-n di maqˤi moči-ƛ’ sida c’aq’ bercinaw baɣ-r kur-si
\g call.for.prayer IV-take.away-PFV.CVB end-IMM.ANT.CVB III-come-PFV.CVB one.OBL eagle-ERG take.away-PFV.CVB take.out-PFV.CVB me far.away place-SUPER.ESS one.OBL very beautiful garden-LAT throw-ATTR
\l At the end of my call for the prayer, an eagle came and took me away to a far place and threw me into a very beautiful garden.

\t Elo där c’aq’ bercinaw ɣˤanabi yesus.
\m elo di-r c’aq’ bercinaw ɣˤanabi y-esu-s
\g there me-LAT very beautiful woman II-find-PST.WIT
\l There I found a very beautiful woman.

\t Däderno yayn neła eƛis:
\m di-der-n y-ay-n neła-a eƛi-s
\g me-APUD.LAT-TOP II-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.WIT
\l She came to me and said:

\t ƛirba, ig ayƛ!
\m ƛirba ig ay-ƛ
\g guest good come-OPT
\l 'Welcome, guest!

\t Di deber łˤora ɣudi ƛirbałi rodinosi, xabaryada yoł dowqor.
\m di mi-r łˤora ɣudi ƛirbałi r-odi-nosi xabar-da yoł mi-qor
\g me you-LAT three.OBL day hospitality IV-do-ANT.CVB story-COND be you-POSS.LAT
\l After I have been your host for three days, I will talk to you.

\t Min däqor łˤora ɣudin q’adaraw roži äƛinƛin”.
\m mi-n di-qor łˤora ɣudi-n q’adaraw roži eƛi-n-ƛin
\g you-TOP me-POSS.LAT three.OBL day-TOP bad word say-PROHIB-QUOT
\l And don't you say a bad word in these three days!'

\t Siskin ɣudi rik’izaƛ’ortow, nełaz bercinłä ʕadalno oyn c’oxno nełaq.
\m siskin ɣudi r-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow neła-z bercinłi-a ʕadal-n odi-n c’ox-n neła-q
\g anything day IV-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 beauty-ERG intoxication-TOP do-PFV.CVB pounce-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l Even before any day has passed, her beauty drugged him and he pounced on to her.

\t Bercinawni ɣˤanaza t’ok’ow ƛ’iri xabarkin boynč’ey, mi xiyantaw žek’u zownƛin däqorno eƛin, ceyqor amru boys, yeda žek’u yałzar ižin kuroƛin.
\m bercinaw-ni ɣˤanabi-a t’ok’ow ƛ’iri xabar-kin b-odi-č’ey mi xiyantaw žek’u zow-n-ƛin di-qor-n eƛi-n cey-qor amru b-odi-s yeda žek’u yoł-za-r iži-n kur-o-ƛin
\g beautiful-DEF woman-ERG anymore above story-even III-do-NEG.PST.CVB you betraying man be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT me-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB eagle-POSS.LAT command III-do-PST.WIT DEM2.ISG man be-LCV.CVB-CAUS take.out-PFV.CVB throw-IMPR-QUOT
\l The beautful woman, not having said anything; 'You were a traitor', she said to me, and ordered the eagle: 'Take this man to where he came from and throw him out!'

\t Ceyä di isno own minaraƛ’or egirsi.
\m cey-a di is-n ow-n minara-ƛ’or egir-s
\g eagle-ERG me take-PFV.CVB bring-PFV.CVB minaret-SUPER.LAT let-PST.WIT
\l The eagle picked me up and brought me to the minaret again.

\t Minaraƛ’ay wˤałer oqno soder ezunosi dandi ža bercinawni ɣˤanabi elo ƛ’iri yukayx - hudu di wˤałer oqzey ʕiyayx oqxo.
\m minara-ƛ’ay wˤał-r oq-n soder ezu-nosi dandi ža bercinaw-ni ɣˤanabi elo ƛ’iri y-ukad-x - hudu di wˤał-r oq-zey ʕiyad-x oq-x
\g minaret-SUPER.ABL downward-LAT become-PFV.CVB upward look-ANT.CVB only DEM1.SG beautiful-DEF woman there above II-see-IPFV.CVB - so me downward-LAT become-SIMCVB cry-IPFV.CVB become-IPFV.CVB
\l When I walk down the minaret and look up I only see this beautiful woman -- so I am crying when I walk down.

\t Ža yiqiranƛingon soder izin ƛ’irir aynosi, ža elo yesuxanu - hudu di qoqoƛix soder izixƛin.
\m ža y-iqir-an-ƛin-gon soder izi-n ƛ’iri-r ay-nosi ža elo y-esu-x-anu - hudu di qoqoƛi-x soder izi-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG II-take.away-FUT.DEF-QUOT-CNTR upward get.up-PFV.CVB above-LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG there II-find-IPFV.CVB-NEG - so me laugh-IPFV.CVB after get.up-IPFV.CVB-QUOT
\l I go upward to take her with me, but I can't find her -- so I am laughing, when I go up.

\t Ele howda ʕalamałi yoł nełas.
\m ele howda ʕalamałi yoł neła-s
\g there DEM3.SG feature be DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1
\l This is the reason.

\t Xan č’agu ƛexuƛ mi!”
\m xan č’agu ƛexu-ƛ mi
\g khan alive remain-OPT you
\l King, long may you live!"

\t Budumä äsiru xabaryoƛ’ xan c’aq’ ʕažaibno oqno, nesir micxirno teƛno, ƛ’irigon bigu saɣyatno bodin, žan egirno.
\m budum-a esi-ru xabar-ƛ’ xan c’aq’ ʕažaib-n oq-n nesi-r micxir-n teƛ-n ƛ’iri-gon b-igu saɣyat-n b-odi-n ža-n egir-n
\g muezzin-ERG tell-PST.PRT story-SUPER.ESS khan very surprise-TOP become-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT money-and give-PFV.CVB above-CNTR III-good present-and III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-and send-PST.UNW
\l The king was very surprised about what the muezzin told, he gave him money and nice presents and let him go.

\t Esin šebi, xecin šebi sis zown xan.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi sis zow-n xan
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what one be.NPRS-PST.UNW khan
\l What is to be said, what is to be left out -- there was a king.

\t Nesis zown łˤono uži.
\m nesi-s zow-n łˤono uži
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW three son
\l He had three sons.

\t Xanä eɣeni žaqor eƛäsi zown:
\m xan-a eɣe-ni uži-qor eƛi-asi zow-n
\g khan-ERG young-DEF son-POSS.LAT say-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The king said to his younger son:

\t Dowƛ’or ħal bayza quł, enła ɣˤutka yałru imyoq ħobo bok’oƛin”.
\m mi-ƛ’or ħal b-ay-za qu-ł enła-a ɣˤutku-a yoł-ru im-q ħobo b-ok’-o-ƛin
\g you-SUPER.LAT trouble III-come-LCV.CVB day-CONT.ESS DEM3b.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS house-IN.ESS be-PST.PRT pole-POSS.ESS leg III-beat-IMPR-QUOT
\l "On a day when you have trouble, kick against a pillar that is in the house."

\t Nełƛ’osi baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow xan exun.
\m nełƛ’osi b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow xan exu-n
\g of.that.time III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH khan die-PST.UNW
\l Not much time passed since then, until the king died.

\t Babiya bayru wasimoxor łˤoran esnaza irsi bułirno nazoƛ’no sist’a saħ bayn.
\m babiw-a b-odi-ru wasi-xor łˤora-n esyu-bi-a irsi b-ułir-n nasi-ƛ’-n sist’a saħ b-ay-n
\g father-ERG III-do-PST.PRT testament-AD.LAT three.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG heir III-share-PFV.CVB which-SUPER.ESS-TOP one.each sah III-come-PST.UNW
\l According to the father's testament, the three brothers should share the heir and they should receive one Sah each.

\t Neł šaharya teł sid xanes kid zown.
\m neła šahar-a teł sida xan-s kid zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL city-IN.ESS inside one.OBL khan-GEN1 daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In that city, one king had a daughter.

\t Ža kid yowanƛin esiranix eženi uži ik’inosi, neła nesiq roži neƛaniƛ mesedyos saħ esin.
\m ža kid y-ow-an-ƛin esir-ani-x eže-ni uži ik’i-nosi neła-a nesi-q roži neƛ-ani-ƛ mesed-s saħ esi-n
\g DEM1.SG girl II-marry-FUT.DEF-QUOT ask-MSD-AD.ESS old-DEF son go-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS word give-MSD-SUB.ESS gold-GEN1 sah tell-PST.UNW
\l When the older son went to ask if he could marry that girl, she gave him her word for the Sah of gold.

\t Ža nełqor biqinosi, xanez kidbä nesi žax yik’anix inkar bodin.
\m ža neła-qor b-iqi-nosi xan-z kid-a nesi uži-x y-ik’i-ani-x inkar b-odi-n
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT III-get-ANT.CVB khan-GEN2 daughter-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-AD.ESS II-go-MSD-AD.ESS rejection III-do-PST.UNW
\l After he got it for her, the princess refused to go to this boy.

\t Howži šebitow radi, šebitow räs diƛin, rok’ƛ’or pikrun bayn ža uži dunyalqo ik’in.
\m howži šebi-tow r-odi šebi-tow r-is di-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or pikru-n b-ay-n ža uži dunyal-q ik’i-n
\g now what-EMPH IV-do what-EMPH IV-take me-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT idea-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG boy world-POSS.ESS go-PST.UNW
\l "What shall I do now, what shall I take?", so the boy got the idea to go through the world.

\t Nełƛ’osigon oƛƛosi esiw neł xanzo kidbeder, däx barułun horoƛin, esirno ik’in.
\m nełƛ’osi-gon oƛƛo-si esiw neła xan-zo kid-der di-x baru-łun horo-ƛin esir-n ik’i-n
\g of.that.time-CNTR middle-ATTR brother DEM1.IISG.OBL khan-ATTR.OBL daughter-APUD.LAT me-AD.ESS wife-LHUN come.IMPR-QUOT ask-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l Then the middle brother went to the princess, "Come and be my wife!"

\t Nesiqorno hemedurtow, mesedyos saħ neƛnäy nexanƛin, eƛin.
\m nesi-qor-n hemedur-tow mesed-s saħ neƛ-näy nex-an-ƛin eƛi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP so-EMPH gold-GEN1 sah give-CND.CVB come-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l And she said to him as well: "If you give me your Sah of gold, I will come."

\t Mesedyos saħno bižin ža uži nełqay roži riqira ik’in.
\m mesed-s saħ-n b-iži-n ža uži neła-qay roži r-iqir-a ik’i-n
\g gold-GEN1 sah-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG boy DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL word IV-take.away-INF go-PST.UNW
\l Carrying the Sah of gold, the boy went to take her word (hand).

\t Mesed biqinosi, xanez kidbä nesix yik’anix razi yoqinč’ey žan oxirno.
\m mesed b-iqi-nosi xan-z kid-a nesi-x y-ik’i-ani-x razi y-oq-č’ey ža-n oxir-n
\g gold III-get-ANT.CVB khan-GEN2 daughter-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS II-go-MSD-AD.ESS agree II-become-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP chase-PST.UNW
\l After getting the gold, the princess didn't agree and chased him away.

\t Ži payda anuƛin, žan dunyalqo ik’in.
\m ži payda anu-ƛin ža-n dunyal-q ik’i-n
\g now use be.NEG-QUOT DEM1.SG-TOP world-POSS.ESS go-PST.UNW
\l "Now, that was useless!", he said and also went through the world.

\t Xizyogon eɣeni esiw ik’in, däx barułun horoƛin, howžatow xanes kidno esirno.
\m xizyogon eɣe-ni esiw ik’i-n di-x baru-łun horo-ƛin howža-tow xan-s kid-n esir-n
\g then young-DEF brother go-PFV.CVB me-AD.ESS wife-LHUN come.IMPR-QUOT DEM4.SG-EMPH khan-GEN1 daughter-TOP ask-PST.UNW
\l Then the younger brother went and asked that princess: "Be my wife!"

\t Nesiqorno nexanƛin eƛin, mesedyos saħ neƛnäy.
\m nesi-qor-n nex-an-ƛin eƛi-n mesed-s saħ neƛ-näy
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP come-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW gold-GEN1 sah give-CND.CVB
\l "I will come," she said also to him, "when you give me a Sah of gold."

\t Žan bižin nesä nełar teƛno.
\m ža-n b-iži-n nesi-a neła-r teƛ-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT give-PST.UNW
\l And he carried it and then gave it to her.

\t Xanez kidbä mesed biqinosi, oxirno eɣenin esiw.
\m xan-z kid-a mesed b-iqi-nosi oxir-n eɣe-ni-n esiw
\g khan-GEN2 daughter-ERG gold III-get-ANT.CVB chase-PST.UNW young-DEF-TOP brother
\l When the princess got the gold, she chased also the youngest brother away.

\t Šebitow hoboy radiƛin, ža uži mekoyx, oč’iłxo ičäsi zown.
\m šebi-tow hoboy r-odi-ƛin ža uži mekod-x oč’ił-x iči-asi zow-n
\g what-EMPH now IV-do-QUOT DEM1.SG boy be.hungry-IPFV.CVB freeze-IPFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "What shall I do now?", the boy said and remained hungry and freezing.

\t Zamanałäy babiya nesiqor badiru wasiyat eɣeni esiwz rok’ƛ’or bayn:
\m zaman-łay babiw-a nesi-qor b-odi-ru wasiyat eɣe-ni esiw-z rok’u-ƛ’or b-ay-n
\g time-CONT.ABL father-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT III-do-PST.PRT legacy young-DEF brother-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT III-come-PST.UNW
\l After a while, the younger brother remembered his father's legacy:

\t Ɣˤutkazoni imyoq ħobon bok’no rok’er rätiru šebin harizi roynäy roqxosi yołƛin.
\m ɣˤutku-a-zo-ni im-q ħobo-n b-ok’-n rok’u-r r-eti-ru šebin harizi r-odi-näy r-oq-xosi yoł-ƛin
\g house-IN.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF pole-POSS.ESS leg-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB heart-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT thing request IV-do-CND.CVB IV-happen-PRS.PRT be-QUOT
\l "If you kick a pole in the house and ask for what your heart desires, it will become true."

\t Izin užä neł imyoq ħobo bok’nosi, nazay eƛa riynč’ey reƛ’iqoy rˤoƛ’un.
\m izi-n uži-a neła im-q ħobo b-ok’-nosi nazay eƛi-a r-iy-č’ey reƛ’iqoy r-ˤoƛ’u-n
\g get.up-PFV.CVB boy-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL pole-POSS.ESS leg III-beat-ANT.CVB from.where say-INF IV-know-NEG.PST.CVB glove IV-fall-PST.UNW
\l When he got up and kicked the pole, a glove fell down he didn't know from where.

\t Yedugon łinarey rˤoƛ’us?
\m yedu-gon łinar-ey r-ˤoƛ’u-s
\g DEM2.IISG-CNTR why-DUB IV-fall-PST.WIT
\l And why the heck has this fallen down?

\t Ričas ži babiya bayru wasimoƛ’ req’unƛin”, - eƛin uži reƛ’iqoyä tełer ezunosi, magalazaƛ’ rayzaƛ’or, elo teł anuru šebintow zown anu.
\m r-iči-as ži babiw-a b-odi-ru wasi-ƛ’ req’un-ƛin - eƛi-n uži reƛ’iqoy-a tełer ezu-nosi magalu-bi-ƛ’ r-ay-zaƛ’or elo teł anu-ru šebin-tow zow-n anu
\g IV-be-FUT2 now father-ERG III-do-PST.PRT testament-SUPER.ESS in.accordance.with-QUOT - say-PFV.CVB boy glove-IN.ESS into look-ANT.CVB bread-PL-SUPER.ESS IV-come-POST.CVB there inside be.NEG-PST.PRT thing-EMPH be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l "May it be according to my father's testament, now.", said the boy and when he looked inside the glove, and it was nothing inside except for bread.

\t Yeda ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤun izin, hoboy ik’an di xanes kid esiranixƛin, oqno maħor.
\m yeda ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu-n izi-n hoboy ik’i-an di xan-s kid esir-ani-x-ƛin oq-n maħor
\g DEM2.ISG very be.happy-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB now go-FUT.DEF me khan-GEN1 daughter ask-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT become-PST.UNW outside
\l He got very happy, said: "Now I will go to the princess and ask her [to marry me].", and he went outside.

\t Ik’in nełaq reƛ’iqoy rukarnosi, didiw ža yałru sosisi riynč’ey neła eƛin:
\m ik’i-n neła-q reƛ’iqoy r-ukar-nosi didiw ža yoł-ru sosi-si r-iy-č’ey neła-a eƛi-n
\g go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS glove IV-show-ANT.CVB which DEM1.SG be-PST.PRT at.first-ATTR IV-know-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l He went and showed her the glove, and at first, when she didn't know what kind of glove this was, she said:

\t Nediwt’a reƛ’iqoybi elzox oč’ino yołƛin”.
\m nediw-t’a reƛ’iqoy-bi ela-zo-x oč’ino yoł-ƛin
\g such-DISTR glove-PL we(II-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS nine be-QUOT
\l "We have nine of such gloves."

\t Ruysi reƛ’iqoybi resʷa behila mežzoxƛin, - eƛin žoyä, - amma endiw däzoq’aw anu žeduƛin”.
\m r-uysi reƛ’iqoy-bi r-esu-a behila mežu-zo-x-ƛin - eƛi-n uži-a - amma endiw di-zo-q’aw anu žedu-ƛin
\g IV.PL-simple glove-PL IV-find-INF perhaps you(I).PL.OBL-ATTR.OBL-ADV-QUOT - say-PST.UNW boy-ERG - but such.a me-ATTR.OBL-EQU2 be.NEG DEM1.IPL-QUOT
\l "One might perhaps find simple gloves at your's," the boy said, "but they're not like the one I have."

\t Ža debi reƛ’iqoy bat’iyawtowä riča rayx?
\m ža mi-s reƛ’iqoy bat’iyaw-tow-a r-iči-a r-odi-x
\g DEM1.SG you-GEN1 glove other-EMPH-Q IV-be-INF IV-do-PRS
\l "So is this glove of yours [not] like the others?

\t Hay yezanix neƛ daqorƛin”, - eƛin kidbä.
\m hay y-ezu-ani-x neƛ di-qor-ƛin - eƛi-n kid-a
\g so.then II-look-MSD-AD.ESS give me-POSS.LAT-QUOT - say-PST.UNW girl-ERG
\l So then give it to me so I can have a look!", said the girl.

\t Žoyä yezanixƛin kidbeqor reƛ’iqoy teƛno.
\m uži-a y-ezu-ani-x-ƛin kid-qor reƛ’iqoy teƛ-n
\g boy-ERG II-look-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT girl-POSS.LAT glove give-PST.UNW
\l The boy gave the glove to the girl, so that she could have a look.

\t Hoboygon žar ʕoƛnontow čara bexun.
\m hoboy-gon uži-r ʕoƛno-n-tow čara b-exu-n
\g now-CNTR boy-LAT seven-TOP-EMPH possibility III-die-PST.UNW
\l Now the boy totally ran out of possibilities.

\t Hemedur q’ʷaridno oqno ičin zawru yeda, babiya nesiqor boyn zawruni wasiyat rok’ƛ’or bayn.
\m hemedur q’ʷarid-n oq-n iči-n zow-ru yeda babiw-a nesi-qor b-odi-n zow-ru-ni wasiyat rok’u-ƛ’or b-ay-n
\g so sadness-TOP become-PFV.CVB be-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT DEM2.ISG father-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT III-do-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF legacy heart-SUPER.LAT III-come-PST.UNW
\l So, being so sad, he recalled the legacy handed down to him by his father.

\t Elayn izin imyoq ħobo bok’nosi, nazay eƛa biynč’ey t’as bˤoƛ’un bayn.
\m ele-ay-n izi-n im-q ħobo b-ok’-nosi nazay eƛi-a b-iy-č’ey t’as b-ˤoƛ’u-n b-ay-n
\g here-IN.ABL-and get.up-PFV.CVB pole-POSS.ESS leg III-beat-ANT.CVB from.where say-INF III-know-NEG.PST.CVB washbowl III-fall-PFV.CVB III-come-PST.UNW
\l So he got up from there and kicked the pole, and out of who-knows-where a bowl fell down.

\t Yedugon łinarey bˤoƛ’us?
\m yedu-gon łinar-ey b-ˤoƛ’u-s
\g DEM2.IISG-CNTR why-DUB III-fall-PST.WIT
\l "And why the heck has this fallen down?!

\t Ričas ži babiya bayru wasimoxorƛin”, - eƛin užä.
\m r-iči-as ži babiw-a b-ay-ru wasi-xor-ƛin - eƛi-n uži-a
\g IV-be-FUT2 now father-ERG III-come-PST.PRT testament-AD.LAT-QUOT - say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l Now father's will will be fulfilled.

\t Izin neł t’asmar kakičurin royn, elosi łi maħor čˤaƛin.
\m izi-n neła t’as-r kakičuri-n r-odi-n elo-si łi maħor čˤaƛi-n
\g get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL washbowl-LAT ablution-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB there-ATTR water outside pour.out-PST.UNW
\l He got up to that bowl, did his ablution, and poured the water out again.

\t Ža łi micxiryoƛ’or rutin.
\m ža łi micxir-ƛ’or r-uti-n
\g DEM1.SG water money-SUPER.LAT IV-turn-PST.UNW
\l And this water turned into money/jewelry.

\t Howžigonä ža däx nexxanuƛin, t’asno bižin ik’in yisi užä ža xanez kidbeq bukarno.
\m howži-gon-a ža di-x nex-x-anu-ƛin t’as-n b-iži-n ik’i-n yisi uži-a ža xan-z kid-q b-ukar-n
\g now-CNTR-Q DEM1.SG me-AD.ESS come-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT washbowl-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-ERG DEM1.SG khan-GEN2 daughter-POSS.ESS III-show-PST.UNW
\l "Well, shouldn't she come to me now?", the boy carried the washbowl to the princess and showed it to her.

\t Neła eƛin:
\m neła-a eƛi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l She said:

\t Nediwt’a t’as elzox oc’ino bäsuƛin”.
\m nediw-t’a t’as ela-zo-x oc’ino b-esu-ƛin
\g such-DISTR washbowl we(II-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS ten III-exist-QUOT
\l "We have ten of such washbowls."

\t Dey biłe bäsunč’i mežzoxosin t’asƛin!”, - eƛin užä.
\m di-s b-iłe b-esu-č’i meža-zo-x-si-n t’as-ƛin - eƛi-n uži-a
\g me-GEN1 III-as III-exist-NEG.FUT you(II-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS-ATTR-TOP washbowl-QUOT - say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l The washbowls that you have are not like mine.

\t Debi didiw yoł ža huduƛin?”, - esirno kidbä.
\m mi-s didiw yoł ža hudu-ƛin - esir-n kid-a
\g you-GEN1 which be DEM1.SG so-QUOT - ask-PST.UNW girl-ERG
\l "So how is this one of yours?", asked the girl.

\t Yiła t’asma łin et’no q’ˤidaɣor čˤaƛinäy, ža łi micxiryoƛ’or rutixosiƛin”, - esin žoyä.
\m yiła t’as-a łi-n et’-n q’ˤida-ɣor čˤaƛi-näy ža łi micxir-ƛ’or r-uti-xosi-ƛin - esi-n uži-a
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL washbowl-IN.ESS water-TOP pour-PFV.CVB down-IN.ALL pour.out-CND.CVB DEM1.SG water money-SUPER.LAT IV-turn-PRS.PRT-QUOT - tell-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "If one pours water into this bowl and pours it out again, this water turns into money/jewelry", the boy told.

\t Nedur, ža t’as mi där neƛnäy nexan debex diƛin”, - eƛin xanes kidbä.
\m nedur ža t’as mi di-r neƛ-näy nex-an mi-x di-ƛin - eƛi-n xan-s kid-a
\g so DEM1.SG washbowl you me-LAT give-CND.CVB come-FUT.DEF you-AD.ESS me-QUOT - say-PST.UNW khan-GEN1 daughter-ERG
\l "So, if you give me this washbowl, I will come to you.", said the princess.

\t Aƛ’irno nesiqay žan boɣno, roži teƛinč’ey xizor oxirno.
\m aƛ’ir-n nesi-qay ža-n b-oɣ-n roži teƛ-č’ey xizor oxir-n
\g cheat-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL DEM1.SG-and III-take.away-PFV.CVB word give-NEG.PST.CVB back chase-PST.UNW
\l She cheated and took it away from him, not keeping her word, and chased him back.

\t Šebitow di žigon rodanƛin, uži wˤałer q’ˤimno rˤoƛ’urno oqno iduɣor ik’in.
\m šebi-tow di žigon r-odi-an-ƛin uži wˤał-r q’ˤim-n r-ˤoƛ’u-r-n oq-n idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g what-EMPH me again.now IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT boy downward-LAT head-TOP IV-fall-CAUS-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l "And what shall I do now?", the boy hang his head and went home.

\t Hemedurtow imyoq ħobo bok’nosi, pandur bˤoƛ’un bayn.
\m hemedur-tow im-q ħobo b-ok’-nosi pandur b-ˤoƛ’u-n b-ay-n
\g so-EMPH pole-POSS.ESS leg III-beat-ANT.CVB lute III-fall-PFV.CVB III-come-PST.UNW
\l So he kicked the pole again, and a lute fell down.

\t Yedugon łinarey bˤoƛ’usƛin? - eƛin žoyä - ži bičas babiwz wasimoƛ’ req’unƛin”.
\m yedu-gon łinar-ey b-ˤoƛ’u-s-ƛin - eƛi-n uži-a - ži b-iči-as babiw-z wasi-ƛ’ req’un-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG-CNTR why-DUB III-fall-PST.WIT-QUOT - say-PST.UNW boy-ERG - now III-be-FUT2 father-GEN2 testament-SUPER.ESS in.accordance.with-QUOT
\l "Why the heck has this fallen down?", said the boy, "Now my father's will will be fulfilled."

\t Hemedur yeda zawzay, pandurya tełäzay q’ˤanoquno oc’ino łelaw, q’ˤanoquno oc’ino guluƛ’no zown saldatbi boƛixno.
\m hemedur yeda zow-zay pandur teł-azay q’ˤanoqu-n oc’ino łelaw q’ˤanoqu-n oc’ino gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n saldat-bi b-oƛix-n
\g so DEM2.ISG be.NPRS-SIM.CVB lute inside-IN.ABL.DIST forty-TOP ten by.foot forty-TOP ten horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB soldier-PL I.PL-appear-PST.UNW
\l When he was like this, 50 soldiers by foot and 50 soldiers on horses appeared out of the lute.

\t Maħor boqno łiyzaƛ’ortow, nesä žedu tełxorno biħurno žigon oqno ik’in xanez kidbeq pandur bukaranix.
\m maħor b-oq-n łiy-zaƛ’or-tow nesi-a žedu teł-xor-n b-iħu-r-n žigon oq-n ik’i-n xan-z kid-q pandur b-ukar-ani-x
\g outside I.PL-become-PFV.CVB end-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL inside-AD.LAT-TOP I.PL-come.to-CAUS-PFV.CVB again.now become-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW khan-GEN2 daughter-POSS.ESS lute III-show-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Before all of them could get outside, he instructed them to go back inside and once again went to the princess to show her the lute.

\t K’oƛin ik’in žoyä kidbeq pandur bukarnosi, neła eƛin:
\m k’oƛi-n ik’i-n uži-a kid-q pandur b-ukar-nosi neła-a eƛi-n
\g run-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB boy-ERG girl-POSS.ESS lute III-show-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l They boy ran to the girl and when he showed her the lute, she said:

\t Nediwt’a panduryabi elzox šomoƛała besʷanƛin”.
\m nediw-t’a pandur-bi ela-zo-x šomo-ƛa-ła b-esu-an-ƛin
\g such-DISTR lute-PL we(II-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS how.many-INDEF-DUB III-have-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l "We should have some such lutes."

\t Ža neła äƛirudetow sadaq žoyä pandurya tełäzay q’ˤanoquno oc’ino łelaw, hemecetowgon guluƛ’ zowäsi saldatbi boƛik’no.
\m ža neła-a eƛi-ru-de-tow sadaq uži-a pandur teł-azay q’ˤanoqu-n oc’ino łelaw hemece-tow-gon gulu-ƛ’ zow-asi saldat-bi b-oƛik’-n
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-APUD.ESS-EMPH together boy-ERG lute inside-IN.ABL.DIST forty-and ten by.foot as.many-EMPH-CNTR horse-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-RES.PRT soldier-PL I.PL-let.appear-PST.UNW
\l As soon as the girl and the boy were saying this, 50 soldiers on foot and as many on horses appeared from inside the lute.

\t Xizyo žeda eƛin:
\m xizyo žedu-a eƛi-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IPL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, they said:

\t Murad šebi debi yoł?
\m murad šebi mi-s yoł
\g wish what you-GEN1 be
\l "What is your wish?

\t Šebi deber ela roda retixƛin?”
\m šebi mi-r elu-a r-odi-a r-eti-x-ƛin
\g what you-LAT we(I).OBL-ERG IV-do-INF IV-want-PRS-QUOT
\l What do you want us to do?"

\t Mežuqay dar žäd ħažataw šebin anuƛin, - eƛin žoyä, - meži hoboy tełxor biħuƛin”.
\m mežu-qay di-r žäd ħažataw šebin anu-ƛin - eƛi-n uži-a - meži hoboy teł-xor b-iħu-ƛin
\g you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.ABL me-LAT still necessary thing be.NEG-QUOT - say-PST.UNW boy-ERG - you.PL now inside-AD.LAT I.PL-come.to-QUOT
\l "There's still nothing necessary from you for me", said the boy, "go back inside again, now!"

\t Nasin saldatbi tełxor biħu-bičin.
\m nasin saldat-bi teł-xor b-iħu~iči-n
\g all soldier-PL inside-AD.LAT I.PL-go.back-PST.UNW
\l All the soldiers went back inside.

\t Xanes kid ħayran yoqno ƛexun neła eƛin:
\m xan-s kid ħayran y-oq-n ƛexu-n neła-a eƛi-n
\g khan-GEN1 daughter be.astonished II-become-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The princess stood there in surprise and said:

\t Žigoƛ’ay nexan debex di mi där howda pandur neƛnäyƛin”.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay nex-an mi-x di mi di-r howda pandur neƛ-näy-ƛin
\g now-SUPER.ABL come-FUT.DEF you-AD.ESS me you me-LAT DEM3.SG lute give-CND.CVB-QUOT
\l "Now I will come to you, if you give me that lute of yours."

\t Neƛxanuƛin, - eƛin žoyä nełqor, - adäyt’an aƛ’irsi mi diƛin”.
\m neƛ-x-anu-ƛin - eƛi-n uži-a neła-qor - ad-ay-t’a-n aƛ’ir-s mi di-ƛin
\g give-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT - say-PST.UNW boy-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT - before-IN.ABL-DISTR-TOP cheat-PST.WIT you me-QUOT
\l "I don't give it to you," said the boy, "you have cheated me before several times."

\t Nexanƛin yigtow yedu kid ƛ’iri yutinosi, žoyä pandur teƛno ičin yiłar.
\m nex-an-ƛin y-ig-tow yedu kid ƛ’iri y-uti-nosi uži-a pandur teƛ-n iči-n yiła-r
\g come-FUT.DEF-QUOT II-much-EMPH DEM2.IISG daughter above II-return-ANT.CVB boy-ERG lute give-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT
\l "I will come", the girl insisted very much, and the boy gave her the lute.

\t Žan biqirno yisiqay, xanez kidbä uži oxerno.
\m ža-n b-iqir-n yisi-qay xan-z kid-a uži oxi-r-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL khan-GEN2 daughter-ERG boy run.away-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l The princess took it away from him and then made him run away.

\t Užir łinasnotow čaran bexun, ži ik’ix di dunyalqoƛin, eƛin oqno ik’in elay sida baydanƛ’or ayn.
\m uži-r łina-s-n-tow čara-n b-exu-n ži ik’i-x di dunyal-q-ƛin eƛi-n oq-n ik’i-n ele-ay sida baydan-ƛ’or ay-n
\g boy-LAT what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-EMPH possibility-TOP III-die-PFV.CVB now go-PRS me world-POSS.ESS-QUOT say-PFV.CVB begin-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL one.OBL field-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Now that all the possibilities are gone for the boy, he said "I shall wander through the world now", and began to go away until he came to a field.

\t Elo yeda zamanałäy mekoda utirno.
\m elo yeda zaman-łay meko-da utir-n
\g there DEM2.ISG time-CONT.ABL hunger-COND turn-PST.UNW
\l There he got hungry after a while.

\t Baydanyay dahaw bitay riłe nesir henešyos ɣun rukayn.
\m baydan-ay dahaw bita-ay r-iłe nesi-r heneš-s ɣun r-ukad-n
\g field-IN.ABL a.little distance-IN.ABL IV-as DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT apple-GEN1 tree IV-see-PST.UNW
\l A little further away in the field, he saw and apple tree.

\t Nełaq sida puƛ’aza aluk’at’a, sida puƛ’aza c’udat’a henešyabi zown.
\m neła-q sida pu-ƛ’aza aluk’a-t’a sida pu-ƛ’aza c’uda-t’a heneš-bi zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS one.OBL side-SUPER.VERS.DIST white-DISTR one.OBL side-SUPER.VERS.DIST red-DISTR apple-PL be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l On one side it had white apples, and on the other side red apples.

\t Elay mekoyx yałru yisä bet’urno neł ɣunoqay c’udani heneš bac’nosi, nesiłäy ɣun roqno.
\m ele-ay mekod-x yoł-ru yisi-a b-et’ur-n neła ɣun-qay c’uda-ni heneš b-ac’-nosi nesi-łay ɣun r-oq-n
\g there-IN.ABL be.hungry-IPFV.CVB be-PST.PRT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG III-pull.out-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL tree-POSS.ABL red-DEF apple III-eat-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ABL tree IV-become-PST.UNW
\l Then, he - being hungry - plucked a red apple from that tree and ate it, he became a tree.

\t Allah šebitow roqä yedu där?
\m Allah šebi-tow r-oq-a yedu di-r
\g God what-EMPH IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT DEM2.IISG me-LAT
\l "Allah, what the heck has happened to me?

\t Hoboy di šebi rodanƛin?”, - eƛin nesä bet’urno aluk’anigon heneš bac’nosi, yeda yałru insanƛ’or utin.
\m hoboy di šebi r-odi-an-ƛin - eƛi-n nesi-a b-et’ur-n aluk’a-ni-gon heneš b-ac’-nosi yeda yoł-ru insan-ƛ’or uti-n
\g now me what IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT - say-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG III-pull.out-PFV.CVB white-DEF-CNTR apple III-eat-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG be-PST.PRT human-SUPER.LAT turn-PST.UNW
\l What shall I do now?", he said, plucked a white apple this time, ate it and turned into the human that he was.

\t Rigutow rigu hoboyƛin, rok’ƛ’orno rayn žoyä ɣunoqosi aluk’anin, c’udanin henešno but’in oqno xanzo kidbedäɣor ik’in.
\m r-igu-tow r-igu hoboy-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n uži-a ɣun-q-si aluk’a-ni-n c’uda-ni-n heneš-n b-ut’i-n oq-n xan-z kid-däɣor ik’i-n
\g IV-good-EMPH IV-good now-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB boy-ERG tree-POSS.ESS-ATTR white-DEF-and red-DEF-and apple-TOP III-collect-PFV.CVB begin-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 daughter-APUD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l "Very well, now.", thought the boy, plucked a white and a red apple from the tree and went to the princess.

\t Nełaq ža heneš bukarnosi, esirno žaq:
\m neła-q ža heneš b-ukar-nosi esir-n uži-q
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG apple III-show-ANT.CVB ask-PST.UNW boy-POSS.ESS
\l When he showed her this apple, she asked the boy:

\t Där howža heneš neƛnäy, nexan debex diƛin”.
\m di-r howža heneš neƛ-näy nex-an mi-x di-ƛin
\g me-LAT DEM4.SG apple give-CND.CVB come-FUT.DEF you-AD.ESS me-QUOT
\l "If you give me that apple, I will come to you."

\t Užä teƛa rätinč’irus riłen royn sosisi ičäsi zown.
\m uži-a teƛ-a r-eti-č’i-ru-si r-iłe-n r-odi-n sosi-si iči-asi zow-n
\g boy-ERG give-INF IV-want-NEG.FUT-PST.PRT-ATTR IV-as-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB at.first-ATTR wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The boy hesitated at first and pretended not be willing to give her the apple.

\t Užä inkar badiruce ža yežigon, neƛ henešƛin, ƛ’iri yutin.
\m uži-a inkar b-odi-ru-ce ža y-eži-gon neƛ heneš-ƛin ƛ’iri y-uti-n
\g boy-ERG rejection III-do-PST.PRT-EQU1 DEM1.SG II-more-CNTR give apple-QUOT above II-turn-PST.UNW
\l The more the boy rejected, the more she insisted on "Give me the apple!"

\t Bisno žoyä c’udani heneš teƛno.
\m b-is-n uži-a c’uda-ni heneš teƛ-n
\g III-take-PFV.CVB boy-ERG red-DEF apple give-PST.UNW
\l The boy took a red apple and gave it to her.

\t Ža bac’no łäyrun, xanez kidbełäy ɣun roqno.
\m ža b-ac’-n łiy-run xan-z kid-łay ɣun r-oq-n
\g DEM1.SG III-eat-PFV.CVB end-IMM.ANT.CVB khan-GEN2 daughter-CONT.ABL tree IV-become-PST.UNW
\l Just when she finished eating it, the princess turned into a tree.

\t Hemedurtow žan xecin, užin oqno iduɣor ik’in.
\m hemedur-tow ža-n xeci-n uži-n oq-n idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g so-EMPH DEM1.SG-TOP leave-PFV.CVB boy-TOP become-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l The boy left her that way and went home.

\t Kidbez babiya, xanä, nasin doxturbi goƛ’in nesä nesiderno butirno eƛin:
\m kid-z babiw-a xan-a nasin doxtur-bi goƛ’i-n nesi-a nesi-der-n b-utir-n eƛi-n
\g girl-GEN2 father-ERG khan-ERG all doctor-PL call-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT-TOP I.PL-gather-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l The girl's father - the king - called all doctors, gathered them around himself and said:

\t Däz kidbełäy ɣun roqno.
\m di-z kid-łay ɣun r-oq-n
\g me-GEN2 daughter-CONT.ABL tree IV-become-PST.UNW
\l "My daughter has turned into a tree."

\t Ža yuyxor yutäru žek’ux yegira yoł di yedu kidƛin”.
\m ža y-uy-xor y-uti-a-ru žek’u-x y-egir-a yoł di yedu kid-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG II-true-AD.LAT II-turn.back-INF-PST.PRT man-AD.ESS II-send-INF be me DEM2.IISG daughter-QUOT
\l I shall give my daughter out to the man who turns her back into her true self.

\t Xizyogon nasin xalq’i butirno nesi xanä, howža uži ƛexuzaƛ’or, kidber daru bodanixƛin.
\m xizyogon nasin xalq’i b-utir-n nesi xan-a howža uži ƛexu-zaƛ’or kid-r daru b-odi-ani-x-ƛin
\g then all people III-gather-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL khan-ERG DEM4.SG boy remain-POST.CVB daughter-LAT medicine III-do-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l Then, the king gathered all the people, except for that boy, to cure his daughter.

\t Łaqnokin ža kid yuyxor yutirełno anu.
\m ła-q-n-kin ža kid y-uy-xor y-utir-ł-n anu
\g who.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP-even DEM1.SG daughter II-true-AD.LAT II-turn-POT-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l And not a single person was able to turn her into the real daughter.

\t Xanä wazirzaqor amru boyn:
\m xan-a wazir-bi-qor amru b-odi-n
\g khan-ERG vizier-PL-POSS.LAT command III-do-PST.UNW
\l The king commanded his viziers:

\t Howža uži ent’o däder ayr; nesiqkinda dey kid yuyxor yutanƛin”.
\m howža uži ent’o di-der ayr nesi-q-kin-da di-s kid y-uy-xor y-uti-an-ƛin
\g DEM4.SG boy here me-APUD.LAT bring DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-even-COND me-GEN1 daughter II-true-AD.LAT II-turn.back-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l "Bring that boy to me; he might be able to turn my daughter back."

\t Hemełaqułtow ža uži ayrno nesider.
\m hemełaqu-ł-tow ža uži ayr-n nesi-der
\g that.day-CONT.ESS-EMPH DEM1.SG boy bring-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT
\l On this very day, the boy was brought to him.

\t Xanä kid yegiranƛin nesił q’ut’in boyn, ža uži kid yuyxor yutiranix egirno.
\m xan-a kid y-egir-an-ƛin nesi-ł q’ut’i-n b-odi-n ža uži kid y-uy-xor y-utir-ani-x egir-n
\g khan-ERG daughter II-send-FUT.CVB-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS agreement-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG boy girl II-true-AD.LAT II-turn-MSD-AD.ESS let-PST.UNW
\l The king agreed with him to give him his daughter, and the boy began to turn her back into a real girl.

\t Nesi žoyä nełar boƛik’no čantay aluk’ani heneš teƛno.
\m nesi uži-a neła-r b-oƛik’-n čanta-ay aluk’a-ni heneš teƛ-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT III-push.out-PFV.CVB pocket-IN.ABL white-DEF apple give-PST.UNW
\l The boy gave her the white apple that he took out of his pocket.

\t Ža bac’run, nełłäy yałru xanes kid yoqno.
\m ža b-ac’-run neła-łay yoł-ru xan-s kid y-oq-n
\g DEM1.SG III-eat-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ABL be-PST.PRT khan-GEN1 daughter II-become-PST.UNW
\l After she ate it, she turned back from what she was, into the princess.

\t Xizyo užä eƛin nełqor:
\m xizyo uži-a eƛi-n neła-qor
\g afterwards boy-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l After this, the boy said to her:

\t Ha hoboy, dey mesedyos saħno, t’asno, reƛ’iqoyn, pandurno neƛƛin”.
\m ha hoboy di-s mesed-s saħ-n t’as-n reƛ’iqoy-n pandur-n neƛ-ƛin
\g well now me-GEN1 gold-GEN1 sah-and washbowl-and glove-and lute-and give-QUOT
\l "Well now, give me back my sah of gold, my washbowl, my glove and my lute."

\t Mesedyos saħno, t’asno, reƛ’iqoyn, pandurno boɣno xanez kidbeqay, xanägon nesi žax žan yegirno.
\m mesed-s saħ-n t’as-n reƛ’iqoy-n pandur-n b-oɣ-n xan-z kid-qay xan-a-gon nesi uži-x ža-n y-egir-n
\g gold-GEN1 sah-and washbowl-and glove-and lute-and III-take.away-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 daughter-POSS.ABL khan-ERG-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-AD.ESS DEM1.SG-TOP II-send-PST.UNW
\l The king took away the sah of gold, the washbowl, the glove and the lute, and sent it back to the boy.

\t Zamanałäygon kidbez babiwz mečar xanłun ža užin oqno.
\m zaman-łay-gon kid-z babiw-z meča-r xan-łun ža uži-n oq-n
\g time-CONT.ABL-CNTR girl-GEN2 father-GEN2 instead-LAT khan-LHUN DEM1.SG boy-TOP become-PST.UNW
\l After a while, the boy became king instead of the girl's father.

\t Din nesi xander ʕarzaƛ’ ayäsi zows.
\m di-n nesi xan-der ʕarza-ƛ’ ay-asi zow-s
\g me-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL khan-APUD.LAT complaint-SUPER.ESS come-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l And I also came to this king with a complaint.

\t Dey ʕarza nesä bissi.
\m di-s ʕarza nesi-a b-is-s
\g me-GEN1 complaint DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG III-take-PST.WIT
\l He dealt with my complaint.

\t Yedu šebin där rukadäsi anu.
\m yedu šebin di-r r-ukad-asi anu
\g DEM2.IISG thing me-LAT IV-see-RES.PRT be.NEG
\l I haven't seen this thing.

\t Žuka žek’ur rigu ɣudi rukaynoƛ!
\m žuka žek’u-r r-igu ɣudi r-ukad-n-ƛ
\g bad man-LAT IV-good day IV-see-PROHIB-OPT
\l Let a bad man not see a good day!

\t C’unt’i, c’ʷant’i t’ekzo šilaƛ’, t’eq’urzo aħyaƛ!
\m c’unt’i c’ʷant’i t’eka-zo šilu-ƛ’ t’eq’ur-zo aħya-ƛ
\g tsunti tswanti he.goat-ATTR.OBL horn-SUPER.ESS biennial.goat-ATTR.OBL ear-SUB.ESS
\l Tsunti-tswanti, over the horn of a goat, under the ear of a biennial goat.

\t Hay horočo, babilabi, di mežuq ʕAliqiličes kesu esan - däq šet’un butin biči xabaryabi teqerno biča retäsi meži besunäy.
\m hay horo-čo babiw-la-bi di mežu-q ʕAliqilič-s kesu esi-an - di-q šet’u-n b-uti-n b-iči xabar-bi teqer-n b-iči-a r-eti-asi meži b-esu-näy
\g so.then come.IMPR-INT father-END-PL me you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.ESS Aliqilich-GEN1 secret tell-FUT.DEF - me-POSS.ESS around-and I.PL-turn.back-PFV.CVB I.PL-sit story-PL listen.to-PFV.CVB III-be-INF IV-want-RES.PRT you.PL I.PL-find-CND.CVB
