\l So come here, daddies, I will tell you the fairy tale of Aliqilich - sit around me, if you want to hear the stories aloud.

\t Zownƛax zownanuƛax yiła eluz wilayatyoł sis barun yexun ƛexasi žek’u.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax yiła elu-z wilayat-ł sis baru-n y-exu-n ƛexu-asi žek’u
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL we(I).OBL-GEN2 province-CONT.ESS one wife-TOP II-die-PFV.CVB remain-RES.PRT man
\l Once upon a time there was a man in our province, whose wife had died.

\t Nesiƛ’ cigon ʕUmarqiličƛin zown.
\m nesi-ƛ’ ci-gon ʕUmarqilič-ƛin zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS name-CNTR Umarqilich-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His name was Umarqilich.

\t Nesisgon łˤono uži zown.
\m nesi-s-gon łˤono uži zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR three son be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had three sons.

\t Hič’č’a eženi užiƛ’ ʕIsaqiličƛin, oƛƛozoniƛ’ Musaqiličƛin, hič’č’a eɣʷeniƛ’ ʕAliqiličƛin cirabi zown.
\m hič’č’a eže-ni uži-ƛ’ ʕIsaqilič-ƛin oƛƛo-zo-ni-ƛ’ Musaqilič-ƛin hič’č’a eɣʷe-ni-ƛ’ ʕAliqilič-ƛin ci-bi zow-n
\g the.most old-DEF son-SUPER.ESS Isaqilich-QUOT middle-ATTR.OBL-DEF-SUPER.ESS Musaqilich-QUOT the.most young-DEF-SUPER.ESS Aliqilich-QUOT name-PL be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The eldest son was named Isaqilich, the middle one Musaqilich and the youngest Aliqilich.

\t Roƛno mežiƛ’or ik’inosi, yisi ʕUmarqiličä ʕIsaqiličqor eƛin:
\m r-oƛ-n muži-ƛ’or ik’i-nosi yisi ʕUmarqilič-a ʕIsaqilič-qor eƛi-n
\g III.PL-be.sick-PFV.CVB mattress-SUPER.LAT go-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL Umarqilich-ERG Isaqilich-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l After he became sick and went to bed, Umarqilich said to Isaqilich:

\t Mi dey hič’č’a eženi užin yoł.
\m mi di-s hič’č’a eže-ni uži-n yoł
\g you me-GEN1 the.most old-DEF son-TOP be
\l "You are my eldest son.

\t Mi där quluq bodinäy, žeduqay bałgo sis šebin esanƛin”.
\m mi di-r quluq b-odi-näy žedu-qay bałgo sis šebin esi-an-ƛin
\g you me-LAT duty III-do-CND.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ABL secretly one thing tell-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l If you look after me, I will tell you a secret that the others don't know."

\t Yizi q’ˤunän bigu q’ut’i bodin, hudu yisi babiyagon yisiq bałgołi esin:
\m yizi q’ˤuna-a-n b-igu q’ut’i b-odi-n hudu yisi babiw-a-gon yisi-q bałgołi esi-n
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL two.OBL-ERG-TOP III-good agreement I.PL-do-PFV.CVB so DEM2.ISG.OBL father-ERG-CNTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS secret tell-PST.UNW
\l The two of them made a proper agreement and so the father told him the secret:

\t Howt’o di pu bak’ru mečoƛ waħo gondun yič’in elo teł ukrus saħ eqräsi yołƛin”.
\m howt’o di pu b-ok’-ru moči-ƛ waħo gondu-n y-ič’i-n elo teł ukru-s saħ eqer-asi yoł-ƛin
\g here me side III-beat-PST.PRT place-SUB.ESS below big.hole-TOP II-dig-PFV.CVB there inside silver-GEN1 sah put-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l "Here where I built up this side, I digged a hole where I put a Sah of silver inside."

\t Siħirawni ʕUmarqiličä łˤoran užiqay quluqno biqa betin, ža xabar nazonoqno sida sidqay bałgo esin.
\m siħiraw-ni ʕUmarqilič-a łˤora-n uži-qay quluq-n b-iqi-a b-eti-n ža xabar nazono-q-n sida-a sida-qay bałgo esi-n
\g cunning-DEF Umarqilich-ERG three.OBL-TOP son-POSS.ABL duty-TOP III-get-INF III-want-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG story all-POSS.ESS-TOP one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.ABL secretly tell-PST.UNW
\l The cunning Umarqilich wanted to get help from the three sons and told each of them the story secretly.

\t Elo yizir didiwnkin ukru besun anu.
\m elo yizi-r didiw-n-kin ukru b-esu-n anu
\g there DEM2.IPL-LAT which-TOP-even silver I.PL-find-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l There they didn't find any silver at all.

\t Xizyo yizir babiya baƛ’ärułi čuqˤno.
\m xizyo yizi-r babiw-a b-aƛ’ir-rułi čuqˤ-n
\g after DEM2.IPL-LAT father-ERG I.PL-cheat-MSD turn.out-PST.UNW
\l Then they realized that their father had cheated them.

\t Hudunon xexzaqor babiya moƛałt’a eƛix zown, q’ˤanoqu ɣudi ret’ace däz šudaxor baħnaynäy, mežur ža di äƛiru ukru bäqiƛin.
\m huduno-n xexbi-qor babiw-a moƛu-ł-t’a eƛi-x zow-n q’ˤanoqu ɣudi r-et’u-ace di-z šuda-xor b-aħnad-näy mežu-r ža di eƛi-ru ukru b-iqi-ƛin
\g nevertheless-TOP children-POSS.LAT father-ERG dream-CONT.ESS-DISTR say-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB forty day IV-part-TERM me-GEN2 graveyard-AD.LAT I.PL-walk.around-CND.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-LAT DEM1.SG me say-PST.PRT silver III-get-QUOT
\l Nevertheless, the father said to the children in their dream: 'When you come walking to my grave before 40 days have passed, I will get said silver for you.'

\t Musaqilično, ʕIsaqilično babiwz šudaxaɣor bik’ixƛin sida q’orol ɣˤanazaz ƛ’emiƛxorno bik’in kecnot’a bičix zown.
\m Musaqilič-n ʕIsaqilič-n babiw-z šuda-xaɣor b-ik’i-x-ƛin sida q’orol ɣˤanabi-z ƛ’emi-ƛxor-n b-ik’i-n kec-n-t’a b-iči-x zow-n
\g Musaqilich-and Isaqilich-and father-GEN2 graveyard-AD.VERS I.PL-go-IPFV.CVB-QUOT one.OBL widowed woman-GEN2 hayloft-SUB.LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB sleep-PFV.CVB-DISTR I.PL-be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Musaqilich and Isaqilich pretended to go to their father's grave, and went to a widow's hayloft to sleep there.

\t ʕAliqilič yołi ɣudes neširuxay babiwz šudaƛ’ort’a ik’ix sasaqor elo ɣudin qˤaširno iduɣort’a nexxo zown.
\m ʕAliqilič yołi ɣudes neširu-xay babiw-z šuda-ƛ’or-t’a ik’i-x sasaq-qor elo ɣudi-n qˤašir-n idu-ɣor-t’a nex-x zow-n
\g Aliqilich however daily evening-AD.ABL father-GEN2 graveyard-SUPER.LAT-DISTR go-IPFV.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT there day-TOP dawn-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL-DISTR come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Aliqilich went to his father's grave every evening, spent the time there until the morning began, and went back home.

\t Sidaquł neširu šudax yeda yałzay, roƛiquraɣor xizor šilabi yołäsi, ƛ’iri hisno raqˤäsi sis miƛ’i bayn.
\m sidaquł neširu šuda-x yeda yoł-zay roƛiqur-aɣor xizor šilu-bi yoł-asi ƛ’iri his-n r-ˤaqi-asi sis miƛ’i b-ay-n
\g one.day at.night graveyard-AD.ESS DEM2.ISG be-SIM.CVB at.midnight-IN.VERS back horn-PL be-RES.PRT above spring.wool-TOP IV-show.up-RES.PRT one ram I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l One night while they were at the grave, at mighnight came a ram that had its horns backwards and accumulated whool.

\t Yisiz babiws šudaƛ’osi ħimu yaganix biħun yedu.
\m yisi-z babiw-s šuda-ƛ’-si ħimu y-agi-ani-x b-iħu-n yedu
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 father-GEN1 graveyard-SUPER.ESS-ATTR tombstone II-lick-MSD-AD.ESS I.PL-come.to-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG
\l It came to lick the tombstone on his father's grave.

\t Sasaqor ħimun yagin, č’urqˤo boqno bik’in.
\m sasaq-qor ħimu-n y-agi-n č’urqˤo b-oq-n b-ik’i-n
\g tomorrow-POSS.LAT tombstone-TOP II-lick-PFV.CVB in.the.morning III-begin-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.UNW
\l It licked the tombstone until the next day, and when the morning set it, it went away.

\t Yaqˤułƛa bok’ełsi mi däqay, ɣudegon baynosi ezʷan dowƛ’o diƛin pikrun boyn, iduɣorno ik’in yeda ħadur oqno ičin.
\m yaqˤuł-ƛa b-ok’eł-s mi di-qay ɣude-gon b-ay-nosi ezu-an mi-ƛ’ di-ƛin pikru-n b-odi-n idu-ɣor-n ik’i-n yeda ħadur oq-n iči-n
\g today-INDEF III-escape-PST.WIT you me-POSS.ABL tomorrow-CNTR III-come-ANT.CVB look-FUT.DEF you-SUPER.ESS me-QUOT idea-and III-do-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG prepare become-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l "Today you escaped from me, but tomorrow I will see you when you come", he thought, went home and prepared oneself.

\t C’eruc’an risno neširu ik’in ičin yeda babiwz šudax.
\m c’eruc’a-n r-is-n neširu ik’i-n iči-n yeda babiw-z šuda-x
\g bow-and IV-take-PFV.CVB evening go-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG father-GEN2 graveyard-AD.ESS
\l He took his bow, went on in the evening and rested at his father's grave.

\t Hemełatow ʕužƛ’o bayno ža miƛ’i babiwz šudaƛ’osi ħimu yaganix boqno.
\m hemeła-tow ʕužƛ’o b-ay-n ža miƛ’i babiw-z šuda-ƛ’-si ħimu y-agi-ani-x b-oq-n
\g then-EMPH in.time III-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG ram father-GEN2 graveyard-SUPER.ESS-ATTR tombstone II-lick-MSD-AD.ESS III-begin-PST.UNW
\l At this time the ram came and began licking the tombstone on his father's grave.

\t ʕAliqiličä nełaz c’eruc’a caƛin.
\m ʕAliqilič-a neła-z c’eruc’a caƛi-n
\g Aliqilich-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 bow throw-PST.UNW
\l Aliqilich shot with his bow.

\t C’eruc’a č’aq’ˤinosi, ža miƛ’i elay łuq’zin boqno boxin bok’ełno.
\m c’eruc’a č’aq’ˤi-nosi ža miƛ’i ele-ay łuq’zi-n b-oq-n b-oxi-n b-ok’eł-n
\g bow hit-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG ram there-IN.ABL hurt-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-escape-PST.UNW
\l After the arrow hit it, the ram was wounded and tried to run away.

\t Sasaqosi ʕAliqilič nełaz ruɣuł xizay ik’in.
\m sasaqosi ʕAliqilič neła-z ruɣu-ł xizay ik’i-n
\g in.the.morning Aliqilich DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 prints-CONT.ESS behind go-PST.UNW
\l The next morning, Aliqilich followed its prints.

\t Miƛ’zo raqˤyołäy bešnayx zawru iyoł xizayn ik’in sidaɣ žopono ciqär ayn.
\m miƛ’i-zo raqˤ-łay b-ešnad-x zow-ru iyo-ł xizay-n ik’i-n sidaɣ žopono ciq-ar ay-n
\g ram-ATTR.OBL wound-CONT.ABL III-drip-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT blood-CONT.ESS behind-TOP go-PFV.CVB in.one.place dense forest-IN.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He went behind the blood that was dripping out of the ram's wound and came into a dense forest, someplace.

\t Neł ciqeł teł ik’iƛ’oräy, yeda yoƛƛo ciqa teł yałru baydanƛ’or ayn.
\m neła ciq-ł teł ik’i-ƛ’oräy yeda y-oƛƛo ciq-a teł yoł-ru baydan-ƛ’or ay-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL forest-CONT.ESS inside go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG II-middle forest-IN.ESS inside be-PST.PRT plain-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l While going through the forest, he came to a clearance that was in the middle of the forest.

\t Šet’ur ezuzaƛ’, sis ƛ’iri yałru as taraw rukayxanuƛax elo.
\m šet’ur ezu-zaƛ’ sis ƛ’iri yoł-ru as taraw r-ukad-x-anu-ƛax elo
\g around look-CSL.CVB one above be-PST.PRT sky except.for IV-see-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT there
\l When looking around, he didn't see anything else there than the sky that was above him.

\t Neła baydanƛ’or aynosi, miƛ’zo iyos ruɣubin łiyn, šet’u utiƛ’oräy, yeda waħozoni dunyalƛ’orno ˤoƛ’un, sida ɣˤutkoz ƛ’ˤuƛ’ ƛ’iri c’oxno.
\m neła baydan-ƛ’or ay-nosi miƛ’i-zo iyo-s ruɣu-bi-n łiy-n šet’u uti-ƛ’oräy yeda waħo-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’or-n ˤoƛ’u-n sida ɣˤutku-z ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’ ƛ’iri c’ox-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL plain-SUPER.LAT come-ANT.CVB ram-ATTR.OBL blood-GEN1 prints-PL-TOP end-PFV.CVB around turn.back-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG below-ATTR.OBL-DEF earth-SUPER.LAT-TOP fall-PFV.CVB one.OBL house-GEN2 roof-SUPER.ESS on hit-PST.UNW
\l After he came to that plain, the ram's blood spots ended; when he turned around, he fell onto the earth/world below, and on the roof of a house.

\t Rok’un q’ʷarid roqno ʕAliqilič ʕiyada iħun.
\m rok’u-n q’ʷarid r-oq-n ʕAliqilič ʕiyad-a iħu-n
\g heart-TOP sadness IV-become-PFV.CVB Aliqilich cry-INF come.to-PST.UNW
\l His heart became sad and Aliqilich started to cry.

\t Neła ɣˤutka teł sis q’orolayn, nełas kidno zown.
\m neła ɣˤutku-a teł sis q’orolay-n neła-s kid-n zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL house-IN.ESS inside one widow-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter-TOP be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Inside this house was a widow with her daughter.

\t ƛ’ˤu bešnada boqnosi, neła q’orolayä kidbeqor eƛin:
\m ƛ’ˤu b-ešnad-a b-oq-nosi neła q’orolay-a kid-qor eƛi-n
\g roof III-leak-INF III-begin-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL widow-ERG daughter-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l When the roof began to leak, the widow said to her daughter:

\t K’oƛočo yiguni, ƛ’ˤuƛ’or yezu šida yedu wˤałer rešnada roqä, yagi qemayä regirxoƛin?”
\m k’oƛi-o-čo y-igu-ni ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or y-ezu šida yedu wˤał-r r-ešnad-a r-oq-a yagi qema-a r-egir-x-ƛin
\g run-IMPR-INT II-good-DEF roof-SUPER.LAT II-look why DEM2.IISG downward-LAT IV-drip-INF IV-begin-Q or rain-Q IV-let-PRS-QUOT
\l "Run, my dear, look at the roof why it is beginning to leak (downward) or if it's raining."

\t Hudu yedu ʕalamałi šebi biča bayx?
\m hudu yedu ʕalamałi šebi b-iči-a b-ay-x
\g so DEM2.IISG miracle what III-be-INF III-must-PRS
\l "So what can this wonder be?

\t Yik’ičo, dey kid, ƛ’ˤuƛ’ˤor yezu šebi elo yołƛin” - eniya kid ƛ’ˤuƛ’ˤor yeza yegirno.
\m y-ik’i-čo di-s kid ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or y-ezu šebi elo yoł-ƛin - eni-a kid ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or y-ezu-a y-egir-n
\g II-go-INT me-GEN1 daughter roof-SUPER.LAT II-look what there be-QUOT - mother-ERG daughter roof-SUPER.LAT II-look-INF II-send-PST.UNW
\l Go, my daughter, look what is on the roof." - [thus] the mother sent the daughter to look on the roof.

\t Elo yezun-yoƛ’ˤun yaynosi kidbä eƛin:
\m elo y-ezu~oƛ’ˤu-n y-ay-nosi kid-a eƛi-n
\g there II-examine-PFV.CVB II-come-ANT.CVB girl-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l After coming back from looking up there, the girl said:

\t Xizyo yizä ža iduɣorno own esirno nesiq, didur šebi roqno mi t’or keze oqäƛin.
\m xizyo yiza-a ža idu-ɣor-n ow-n esir-n nesi-q didur šebi r-oq-n mi t’o-r keze oq-a-ƛin
\g after DEM2.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG home-IN.ALL-TOP bring-PFV.CVB ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS how what IV-happen-PFV.CVB you here-LAT meet become-Q-QUOT
\l Then they let him into the house and asked him what had happened and how he came here.

\t Yisägon šinaw raqru łinałäyn esin žedaq.
\m yisi-a-gon šinaw r-oq-ru łina-łay-n esi-n žeda-q
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR every IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP tell-PST.UNW DEM1.IIPL.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l And so he told them everything about it.

\t Yeda ƛirba mekoyxo äsuƛin, yizi bišʷa rodanił c’oxno.
\m yeda ƛirba mekod-x esu-ƛin yizi bišʷa r-odi-ani-ł c’ox-n
\g DEM2.ISG guest be.hungry-IPFV.CVB find-QUOT DEM2.IPL food IV-do-MSD-CONT.ESS meet-PST.UNW
\l "The guest seems to be hungry", and they they met up to make food.

\t Gegmun ɣirƛin at’ q’uq’anir łi roqinč’izaƛ’ yiza yisiqor eƛin:
\m gegmu-n ɣir-ƛin at’ q’uq’i-ani-r łi r-oq-č’i-zaƛ’ yiza yisi-qor eƛi-n
\g flour-TOP sieve-QUOT dough knead-MSD-LAT water IV-begin-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB DEM2.IIPL.OBL DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l They sifted the flour and because there was no water to knead the dough, they said to him:

\t Dahawgon ʕiyad mi mow nexʷanir, łäz mečʷa at’ q’uq’anix et’aƛin.
\m dahaw-gon ʕiyad mi mow nex-ani-r łi-z meča at’ q’uq’i-ani-x et’-a-ƛin
\g a.little-CNTR cry you tear come-MSD-LAT water-GEN2 instead.of dough knead-MSD-AD.ESS pour-INF-QUOT
\l "Cry a little so that a tear comes, so we can pour it into the dough for kneading instead of water."

\t Šida, mežude t’o łi ruyä anuƛin, - esirno ʕAliqiličä.
\m šida mežu-de t’o łi r-uy-a anu-ƛin - esir-n ʕAliqilič-a
\g why you(I).PL.OBL-APUD.ESS here water IV-indeed-Q be.NEG-QUOT - ask-PST.UNW Aliqilich-ERG
\l "Why isn't there any water at your's?", asked Aliqilich.

\t Łiƛa yoł eludeƛin, - yizä yizis q’ʷariłi esin, - amma nełaƛ’ ƛ’iri aždaħ baq’ˤułno bičäsi yoł.
\m łi-ƛa yoł elu-de-ƛin - yizi-a yizi-s q’ʷariłi esi-n - amma neła-ƛ’ ƛ’iri aždaħ b-aq’ˤuł-n b-iči-asi yoł
\g water-INDEF be we(I).OBL-APUD.ESS-QUOT - DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 sadness tell-PST.UNW - but DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS above dragon III-cover-PFV.CVB III-be-RES.PRT be
\l "We have some water", they told with grief, "but a dragon is covering it."

\t ƛirbargon łi neƛxanusi ža aždaħ didiw biča bayxƛin, nesä ža kid łäƛ’or yegirno.
\m ƛirba-r-gon łi neƛ-xanusi ža aždaħ didiw b-iči-a b-ay-x-ƛin nesi-a ža kid łi-ƛ’or y-egir-n
\g guest-LAT-CNTR water give-NEG.PRS.PRT DEM1.SG dragon which III-be-Q III-must-PRS-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG girl water-SUPER.LAT II-send-PST.UNW
\l "What kind of dragon must that be that doesn't give water to a guest!", he [said and] sent the girl for water.

\t Hudu neła mežur łi neƛxosi anaƛin? - esirno yisä neła q’orolaq.
\m hudu neła-a mežu-r łi neƛ-xosi anu-a-ƛin - esir-n yisi-a neła q’orol-q
\g so DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you(I).PL.OBL-LAT water give-PRS.PRT be.NEG-Q-QUOT - ask-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL widow-POSS.ESS
\l "So he's not giving you water?", he asked the widow.

\t Neła elur łi neƛxosi, ƛˤebaxay sosit’a ela nełar yac’anix kid teƛnäy.
\m neła-a elu-r łi neƛ-xosi ƛˤebaxay sosit’a elu-a neła-r y-ac’-ani-x kid teƛ-näy
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-LAT water give-PRS.PRT yearly once we(I).OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT II-eat-MSD-AD.ESS girl give-CND.CVB
\l "He gives us water, if once a year we give him a girl to eat.

\t Däzno uyran kidbełäy, ele howda sistow sis ƛexus.
\m di-z-n uyno-n kid-łay ele howda sis-tow sis ƛexu-s
\g me-GEN2-TOP four-TOP daughter-CONT.ABL here DEM3.SG one-EMPH one remain-PST.WIT
\l And of my four, only this one here remained.

\t Elus t’o raq’ˤu kidbabi łiyrsi yiła aždaħäƛin, - esin yiła.
\m elu-s t’o r-aq’ˤu kid-bi łiyr-s yiła aždaħ-a-ƛin - esi-n yiła-a
\g we(I).OBL-GEN1 here II.PL-much daughter-PL finish-PST.WIT DEM2.IISG.OBL dragon-ERG-QUOT - tell-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG
\l That dragon ate up many of our daughters", she said.

\t Łäƛ’or yäk’iru yiła kidber neł aždaħä, ƛirbar retäsi roqzaƛ’ƛin, bic’no sis tungi teƛno.
\m łi-ƛ’or y-ik’i-ru yiła kid-r neła aždaħ-a ƛirba-r r-eti-asi r-oq-zaƛ’-ƛin b-ic’-n sis tungi teƛ-n
\g water-SUPER.LAT II-go-PST.PRT DEM2.IISG.OBL girl-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL dragon-ERG guest-LAT IV-want-RES.PRT IV-happen-CSL.CVB-QUOT III-fill-PFV.CVB one copper.jug give-PST.UNW
\l The dragon gave the girl that went to look for water a jug filled with water, because that happened to be what the guest wanted.

\t Žan bown iduɣor nexƛ’oräy, dandir c’axru xalq’imo sida esirno, sida esirno yiłqay ħaƛanix łi.
\m ža-n b-ow-n idu-ɣor nex-ƛ’oräy dandir c’ox-ru xalq’i sida-a esir-n sida-a esir-n yiła-qay ħaƛu-ani-x łi
\g DEM1.SG-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL come-SIM.CVB together meet-PST.PRT people one.OBL-ERG ask-PFV.CVB one.OBL-ERG ask-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL drink-MSD-AD.ESS water
\l And while coming home with it, of the people that she met one asked her, if he could drink some water from her.

\t Idur yayzaƛ’or, elo teł hut’bi at’ik’ace gurow łi ƛexunanu.
\m idu-r y-ay-zaƛ’or elo teł hut’-bi at’ik’-ace gurow łi ƛexu-n-anu
\g home-LAT II-come-POST.CVB there inside lip-PL moisten-TERM except water remain-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l When coming  home, there was merely enough water inside to moisten one's lips with.

\t Yiła łinasno payda anu därƛin pikrun boyn, tungin bisno yeda ʕAliqiličtow łäƛ’or ik’in.
\m yiła łina-s-n payda anu di-r-ƛin pikru-n b-odi-n tungi-n b-is-n yeda ʕAliqilič-tow łi-ƛ’or ik’i-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL what.OBL-GEN1-TOP use be.NEG me-LAT-QUOT idea-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB copper.jug-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG Aliqilich-EMPH water-SUPER.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l "I have no use for that", thought Aliqilich, took the jug and went to get water.

\t Sosi bic’no ik’inosi, aždaħä yisiqor roži eƛinanu.
\m sosi b-ic’-n ik’i-nosi aždaħ-a yisi-qor roži eƛi-n-anu
\g at.first III-fill-PFV.CVB go-ANT.CVB dragon-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT word say-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l When he first filled the jug, the dragon didn't say a word to him.

\t Idur ayzaƛ’or sidä ħaƛun, sidä ħaƛun ža łi nesiqayn hemedurtow łiyrno.
\m idu-r ay-zaƛ’or sida-a ħaƛu-n sida-a ħaƛu-n ža łi nesi-qay-n hemedur-tow łiyr-n
\g home-LAT come-POST.CVB one.OBL-ERG drink-PFV.CVB one.OBL-ERG drink-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG water DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL-and so-EMPH finish-PST.UNW
\l When he went home, someone wanted to drink and another one wanted to drink, so this water was empty as well for him.

\t Hudaygon yeda łäƛ’or tungin bižin ik’in, nełaƛ’no aždaħä yisiqor roži eƛin anu.
\m hudaygon yeda łi-ƛ’or tungi-n b-iži-n ik’i-n nełƛ’o-n aždaħ-a yisi-qor roži eƛi-n anu
\g the.next.day DEM2.ISG water-SUPER.LAT copper.jug-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB at.that.time-TOP dragon-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT word say-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l The next day he went to get water with the jug and the dragon didn't say a word to him at that time.

\t Łox äƛiru ik’inosin, neła yisiqor xabarkin boyn anu.
\m łox äƛiru ik’i-nosi-n neła-a yisi-qor xabar-kin b-odi-n anu
\g thrice ORD go-ANT.CVB-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT story-even III-do-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l Also the third time when he went, he did not say anything to him.

\t Tungin bic’no nexƛ’osi, hemedurtow hunix dandir c’axru xalq’imo ħaƛun łiyra, žan lamusyoqay, dahawtow łi xecäsi zown.
\m tungi-n b-ic’-n nex-ƛ’-si hemedur-tow huni-x dandir c’ox-ru xalq’i ħaƛu-n łiyr-a ža-n lamus-qay dahaw-tow łi xeci-asi zow-n
\g copper.jug-TOP III-fill-PFV.CVB come-PCT.CVB-ATTR so-EMPH way-AD.ESS together meet-PST.PRT people drink-PFV.CVB finish-INF DEM1.SG-TOP conscience-POSS.ABL a.little-EMPH water leave-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Right when he came from filling the jug, the people that he met on the way drank up, and from this conscience, leaving hardly and water.

\t Iduɣor ayƛ’oräy, ačqˤaq quqix kikoƛ’osi xexbin risno sida q’orolayä yoƛixno esirno:
\m idu-ɣor ay-ƛ’oräy ačqˤa-q quqi-x kiko-ƛ’-si xexbi-n r-is-n sida q’orolay-a y-oƛix-n esir-n
\g home-IN.ALL come-SIM.CVB thirst-POSS.ESS dry.out-IPFV.CVB breast-SUPER.ESS-ATTR child-TOP III.PL-take-PFV.CVB one.OBL widow-ERG II-appear-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW
\l When coming home, he saw the widow with her child (at her breast), which almost died of thirst, and asked:

\t Hay iguni uži, därƛa mi łi neƛinč’iłin urɣel anu.
\m hay igu-ni uži di-r-ƛa mi łi neƛ-č’i-łin urɣel anu
\g so.then good-DEF boy me-LAT-INDEF you water give-NEG.FUT-CNC.CVB sorrow be.NEG
\l "So then, good boy, although you can't give me water, (I) don't worry (about myself).

\t Howła däz xexzas tatuwa quqix, behizi roqnäy, hut’bi rešak’ace łi neƛ, debertow ažru bäqi”.
\m howła di-z xexbi-s tatu-a quqi-x behizi r-oq-näy hut’-bi r-ešak’-ace łi neƛ mi-r-tow ažru b-iqi
\g DEM3.IISG.OBL me-GEN2 child-GEN1 cheerfulness-Q dry.out-IPFV.CVB permit IV-become-CND.CVB lip-PL IV-moisten-TERM water give you-LAT-EMPH recompense III-get
\l My child is getting weak; if it is possible, give her enough water to moisten her lips, she will recompensate you."

\t Xexzaqno ħaƛurno, nełarno teƛno yeda uyrax äƛirugon łi ric’a ik’in.
\m xexbi-q-n ħaƛu-r-n neła-r-n teƛ-n yeda uyno-x äƛiru-gon łi r-ic’-a ik’i-n
\g child-POSS.ESS-TOP drink-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG four-ADV ORD-CNTR water IV-fill-INF go-PST.UNW
\l He gave the child to drink, and he went to give her water for the fourth time.

\t Howži yedu aždaħ yisiƛ’or bizin eƛin:
\m howži yedu aždaħ yisi-ƛ’or b-izi-n eƛi-n
\g now DEM2.IISG dragon DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT III-get.up-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l Now the dragon came over him, got up and said:

\t Sosiƛa ƛirba, k’oxƛa ƛirba, łoxno ƛirba, hudaygon šebi retäsiƛin!
\m sosi-ƛa ƛirba k’ox-ƛa ƛirba łox-n ƛirba hudaygon šebi r-eti-asi-ƛin
\g at.first-INDEF guest twice-INDEF guest thrice-and guest the.next.day what IV-want-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l "The first time a guest, the second time a guest, and the third time a guest, what do you want the next day?"

\t Xabar anuzo hut’er, k’al yäsruce kiri bäči.
\m xabar anu-zo hut’-r k’al y-is-ru-ce kiri b-iči
\g story be.NEG-ATTR.OBL lip-LAT fast II-take-PST.PRT-EQU1 reward III-be
\l "The silent mouth will get the reward, just like in the fast.

\t Deberno p’es anusi bičinäy, rigu räčiƛin, - eƛin yeda tungi bic’a iħun.
\m mi-r-n p’es anu-si b-iči-näy r-igu r-iči-ƛin - eƛi-n yeda tungi b-ic’-a iħu-n
\g you-LAT-TOP sound be.NEG-ATTR III-be-CND.CVB IV-good IV-be-QUOT - say-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG copper.jug III-fill-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l It will be good also for you to be quiet", he said and came to fill the jug.

\t Däq aq’ˤlu mołixosiya oqno mi aparak’ƛin, - eƛin aždaħ bizin yisiƛ’ łeɣin.
\m di-q ʕaq’lu mołi-xosi-a oq-n mi aparak’-ƛin - eƛi-n aždaħ b-izi-n yisi-ƛ’ łeɣi-n
\g me-POSS.ESS advice teach-PRS.PRT-Q become-PFV.CVB you newcomer-QUOT - say-PFV.CVB dragon III-get.up-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS clutch-PST.UNW
\l "You want to teach me an advice, newcomer?", said the dragon, got up and grasped him.

\t Aždaħä ʕAliqilič izirno ok’no xot’obi cuciłace raƛ’moƛxor šiširno.
\m aždaħ-a ʕAliqilič izir-n ok’-n xot’o-bi cucił-ace raƛ’-ƛxor šišir-n
\g dragon-ERG Aliqilich lift-PFV.CVB beat-PFV.CVB foot-PL be.stuck-TERM earth-SUB.LAT stick-PST.UNW
\l The dragon lifted Aliqilich and beat him into the ground until his feet were stuck.

\t Oh, mi nedurä q’urumsaq zownƛin, bizirno bok’nosi, yisägon yedu bečnabi cuciłace raƛ’moƛxor šiširno.
\m oh mi nedur-a q’urumsaq zow-n-ƛin b-izir-n b-ok’-nosi yisi-a-gon yedu bečni-bi cucił-ace raƛ’-ƛxor šišir-n
\g oh you so-Q villain be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT III-lift-PFV.CVB III-beat-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR DEM2.IISG knee-PL be.stuck-TERM earth-SUB.LAT stick-PST.UNW
\l "Oh, what villain are you?!", he lifted and beat the dragon into the ground until his knees were stuck.

\t Howlaygon yiła yeda izirno ok’no ʕAliqilič bečnazaxar raƛ’moƛxor cucik’no.
\m howlay-gon yiła-a yeda izir-n ok’-n ʕAliqilič bečni-bi-xar raƛ’-ƛxor cucik’-n
\g from.there-CNTR DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG lift-PFV.CVB beat-PFV.CVB Aliqilich knee-PL-AD.VERS earth-SUB.LAT put-PST.UNW
\l And from there the dragon lifted and beat Aliqilich into the earth up to his knees.

\t Yisägon bizirno q’ˤidan bok’no aždaħ ašuƛäyd raƛ’moƛxor cucik’no.
\m yisi-a-gon b-izir-n q’ˤida-n b-ok’-n aždaħ ašu-ƛay-d raƛ’-ƛxor cucik’-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR III-lift-PFV.CVB down-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB dragon waist-SUB.ABL-TERM earth-SUB.LAT put-PST.UNW
\l Then he beat the dragon down and put him into the earth up to the waist.

\t Aždaħägon yedan hemedurtow ašuƛayd cucik’no.
\m aždaħ-a-gon yeda-n hemedur-tow ašu-ƛay-d cucik’-n
\g dragon-ERG-CNTR DEM2.ISG-TOP so-EMPH waist-SUB.ABL-TERM put-PST.UNW
\l So the dragon put him in up to the waist as well.

\t Hudu mi nedurä zown, k’ačaɣˤƛin, bizirno bok’no meč’oƛäyrcen cucik’no, mač’an roɣno maħor bexuranixƛin oqno yeda.
\m hudu mi nedur-a zow-n k’ačaɣˤ-ƛin b-izir-n b-ok’-n meč’o-ƛer-ce-n cucik’-n mač’a-n r-oɣ-n maħor b-exur-ani-x-ƛin oq-n yeda
\g so you so-Q be.NPRS-PST.UNW bandit-QUOT III-lift-PFV.CVB III-beat-PFV.CVB hug-SUB.LAT-EQU1-TOP put-PFV.CVB dagger-TOP IV-take.away-TOP outside III-kill-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT begin-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG
\l "You meant like this, you bandit?", Aliqilich lifted him, and beat him in up to his neck, then drew his dagger and was about to kill the dragon.

\t Harizi boqno ža:
\m harizi b-oq-n ža
\g request III-become-TOP DEM1.SG
\l The dragon begged:

\t Xecčo, baħarči, bexarno di, ela halmaɣłin risan, zendiqno bičan, łäƛ’ ƛ’iri xanłin rodanƛin.
\m xeci-čo baħarči b-exur-n di elu-a halmaɣłi-n r-is-an zendi-q-n b-iči-an łi-ƛ’ ƛ’iri xanłi-n r-odi-an-ƛin
\g leave-INT brave.young.man III-kill-PROHIB me we(I).OBL-ERG friendship-TOP IV-take-FUT.DEF company-POSS.ESS-and I.PL-live-FUT.DEF water-SUPER.ESS above khanship-and IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l "Spare me, brave young man, don't kill me, we will become friends, we will live together, and rule over the water."

\t Debeł halmaɣłin risno, łäƛ’ ƛ’iri xanłi rodaniƛäy anu di dowder iħada nexäsiƛin, eƛin rizirno yisä mač’a.
\m mi-ł halmaɣłi-n r-is-n łi-ƛ’ ƛ’iri xanłi r-odi-ani-ƛay anu di mi-der iħad-a nex-asi-ƛin eƛi-n r-izir-n yisi-a mač’a
\g you-CONT.ESS friendship-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB water-SUPER.ESS above khanship IV-do-MSD-SUB.ABL be.NEG me you-APUD.LAT fight-INF come-RES.PRT-QUOT say-PFV.CVB IV-lift-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG dagger
\l "I won't accept your friendship with you and I won't rule over the water, I came to you in order to fight!", he said and lifted the dagger.

\t Nedur resunäy, di bexunosi, däz iyos zok’in ric’o, däz axʷay č’aɣˤirno roɣo, žubin boɣo.
\m nedur r-esu-näy di b-exu-nosi di-z iyo-s zok’i-n r-ic’-o di-z ax-ay č’aɣˤir-n r-oɣ-o žubi-n b-oɣ-o
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB me III-die-ANT.CVB me-GEN2 blood-GEN1 mug-and IV-fill-IMPR me-GEN2 belly-IN.ABL bowel-and IV-take.away-IMPR liver-and III-take.away-IMPR
\l "In that case, after I died, fill the mug with my blood, take the bowel out of my belly and also take away my liver!

\t Žubi bac’näy, debi ʕumru bexoräł, č’aɣˤir ašuƛ ricinäy, mi q’uwataw aq, däz lagiłäy boƛäxru zok’ice iyo lagiq biħinäy, mi łarnokin ukayxanusi aq.
\m žubi b-ac’-näy mi-s ʕumru b-exorił č’aɣˤir ašu-ƛ r-ici-näy mi q’uwataw oq di-z laga-łay b-oƛix-ru zok’i-ce iyo laga-q b-iħi-näy mi ła-r-n-kin ukad-xanusi oq
\g liver III-eat-CND.CVB you-GEN1 life III-become.longer bowel waist-SUB.ESS IV-tie-CND.CVB you strong become me-GEN2 body-CONT.ABL III-appear-PST.PRT mug-EQU1 blood body-POSS.ESS III-smear-CND.CVB you who.OBL-LAT-TOP-even see-NEG.PRS.PRT become
\l When you eat my liver, your life will become longer; if you tie my bowel around your waist, you will become strong; and when you smear blood from my body from the mug on your body, nobody will see you.

\t Ža deber dey wasiyat yołƛin, - eƛin aždaħä.
\m ža mi-r di-s wasiyat yoł-ƛin - eƛi-n aždaħ-a
\g DEM1.SG you-LAT me-GEN1 legacy be-QUOT - say-PST.UNW dragon-ERG
\l This is my legacy for you." said the dragon.

\t ʕAliqiličä rok’no mač’an, aždaħes meč’ bet’urno boɣno kurno.
\m ʕAliqilič-a r-ok’-n mač’a-n aždaħ-s meč’ b-et’ur-n b-oɣ-n kur-n
\g Aliqilich-ERG IV-beat-PFV.CVB saber-and dragon-GEN1 neck III-pull.out-PFV.CVB III-take.away-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l Aliqilich stroke with his saber, cut off the dragon's neck and threw it away.

\t Neła äƛiruxor, nełas č’aɣˤirno, žubin boɣno, iyon zok’är biqirno.
\m neła-a eƛi-ru-xor neła-s č’aɣˤir-n žubi-n b-oɣ-n iyo-n zok’i-ar b-iqir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 bowel-and liver-and III-take.away-PFV.CVB blood-TOP mug-IN.LAT III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l As the dragon said, he took out his bowel and liver, and put the blood into the mug.

\t Ɣˤʷayä žubi bac’nosi, howlotow bexun ža.
\m ɣˤʷay-a žubi b-ac’-nosi howlo-tow b-exu-n ža
\g dog-ERG liver III-eat-ANT.CVB there-EMPH III-die-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l After the dog had eaten the liver, it died on the spot.

\t Č’aɣˤirgon ɣunoq ricinosi, neła ža reč’no roɣno.
\m č’aɣˤir-gon ɣun-q r-ici-nosi neła-a ža r-eč’-n r-oɣ-n
\g bowel-CNTR tree-POSS.ESS IV-tie-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG IV-cut-PFV.CVB IV-take.away-PST.UNW
\l After he tied the bowel around a tree, it cut it down.

\t Iyos räc’runi zok’i aħinoƛ’ riħurnosi, neła ža yecirno yižin.
\m iyo-s r-ic’-ru-ni zok’i aħin-ƛ’ r-iħur-nosi neła-a ža y-eci-r-n y-iži-n
\g blood-GEN1 IV-fill-PST.PRT-DEF mug rock-SUPER.ESS IV-pour-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG II-melt-CAUS-PFV.CVB II-take.out-PST.UNW
\l And when he poured out the blood-filled mug out over a rock, it melted it and decayed.

\t Hay q’urumsaq, rigu šebin mołin zown anu mi däqƛin pikrun boyn, łäs tungin bic’no yeda q’oroladäɣor ik’in.
\m hay q’urumsaq r-igu šebin mołi-n zow-n anu mi di-q-ƛin pikru-n b-odi-n łi-s tungi-n b-ic’-n yeda q’orol-däɣor ik’i-n
\g so.then villain IV-good thing teach-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG you me-POSS.ESS-QUOT idea-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB water-GEN1 copper.jug-TOP III-fill-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG widow-APUD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l "So then, you villain, no good thing have you told me!", he thought, filled his jug with water and went to the widow.

\t Šebi mežar roqäsi, łinaq meži ʕiyayxƛin?”, - esirno yisä.
\m šebi meža-r r-oq-asi łina-q meži ʕiyad-x-ƛin - esir-n yisi-a
\g what you(II-LAT IV-happen-RES.PRT what.OBL-POSS.ESS you.PL cry-PRS-QUOT - ask-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "Whay happened to you, what are you crying about?", he asked.

\t Way, mi exurno äsuƛin ʕiyayx zowsƛin”, - esin yizä.
\m way mi exur-n esu-ƛin ʕiyad-x zow-s-ƛin - esi-n yiza-a
\g o.dear you kill-PFV.CVB appear-QUOT cry-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT - tell-PST.UNW DEM2.IIPL.OBL-ERG
\l "O dear, we were crying because we thought you had been killed!", they said.

\t Č’agu yeda ayzaƛ’, yizirabigon ɣˤaɣˤu rizin.
\m č’agu yeda ay-zaƛ’ yizirabi-gon ɣˤaɣˤu r-izi-n
\g alive DEM2.ISG come-CSL.CVB DEM2.PL-CNTR be.happy II.PL-get.up-PST.UNW
\l When he came back alive, they were very happy.

\t Yisä ža q’orola xander yegirno, ža aždaħ bexursiƛin esanix.
\m yisi-a ža q’orol xan-der y-egir-n ža aždaħ b-exur-s-ƛin esi-ani-x
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG widow khan-APUD.LAT II-send-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG dragon III-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT tell-MSD-AD.ESS
\l He sent the widow to the king to tell him that the dragon was killed.

\t Xanzo madaxor yaynosi, yiła teł iduɣor xanqor qˤaƛin:
\m xan-zo ma-xor y-ay-nosi yiła-a teł idu-ɣor xan-qor qˤaƛi-n
\g khan-ATTR.OBL gate-AD.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS inside home-IN.ALL khan-POSS.LAT shout-PST.UNW
\l When she came to the king's court, she shouted to the king inside the house:

\t Debeq di sis bigu xabar esinäy, šebi näƛ mi därƛin?”
\m mi-q di sis b-igu xabar esi-näy šebi neƛ mi di-r-ƛin
\g you-POSS.ESS me one III-good story tell-CND.CVB what give you me-LAT-QUOT
\l "When I tell you something good, what will you give me?"

\t Ukrus bic’no q’ili neƛanƛin, - žawabno teƛno xanä esirno, - šebi aždaħer teƛanix kidä yowäƛin?”
\m ukru-s b-ic’-n q’ili neƛ-an-ƛin - žawab-n teƛ-n xan-a esir-n - šebi aždaħ-r teƛ-ani-x kid-a y-ow-a-ƛin
\g silver-GEN1 III-fill-PFV.CVB qili give-FUT.DEF-QUOT - answer-TOP give-PFV.CVB khan-ERG ask-PST.UNW - what dragon-LAT give-MSD-AD.ESS daughter-ERG II-get-INF-QUOT
\l "I will give you one qili of silver", answered the king and asked: "What did your daughter get to give to the dragon?"

\t Anu, xan, deyno, debin kidbabi nełar howži ħaram roqsi, šidaƛin eƛiłi ža aždaħ bexursiƛin”, - esin q’orola.
\m anu xan di-s-n mi-s-n kid-bi neła-r howži ħaram r-oq-s šida-ƛin eƛi-łi ža aždaħ b-exur-s-ƛin - esi-n q’orol-a
\g be.NEG khan me-GEN1-and you-GEN1-and daughter-PL DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT now prohibition IV-become-PST.WIT why-QUOT say-CND.CVB.IRR DEM1.SG dragon III-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT - tell-PST.UNW widow-ERG
\l "No, king, he won't get my and your daughters, because he was killed", said the widow.

\t Šebi ža nediw baħarči oƛixa, owo ža ent’o däderƛin”, - amru bodin xanä neła q’orolaqor.
\m šebi ža nediw baħarči oƛi-xa ow-o ža ent’o di-der-ƛin - amru b-odi-n xan-a neła q’orol-qor
\g what DEM1.SG such brave.young.man half-INT bring-IMPR DEM1.SG here me-APUD.LAT-QUOT - command III-do-PST.UNW khan-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL widow-POSS.LAT
\l "Who is this brave young man? Bring him here to me!", ordered the king the widow.

\t Baq’ˤu šaharyasi ʕoloqbi boƛixno di, di ža aždaħ bexursiƛin.
\m b-aq’ˤu šahar-a-si ʕoloq-bi b-oƛix-n di di ža aždaħ b-exur-s-ƛin
\g III-much city-IN.ESS-ATTR young.person-PL I.PL-appear-PFV.CVB me me DEM1.SG dragon III-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Many young men from the city came and claimed they had killed the dragon.

\t Yiła q’orolagon yeda ʕAliqilič ayrno xander.
\m yiła q’orol-a-gon yeda ʕAliqilič ayr-n xan-der
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL widow-ERG-CNTR DEM2.ISG Aliqilich bring-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.LAT
\l And the widow brought Aliqilich to the king.

\t Elo nazosno daʕba boqno, howži yisi xanqor eƛin:
\m elo nazo-s-n daʕba b-oq-n howži yisi xan-qor eƛi-n
\g there everyone.OBL-GEN1-TOP dispute III-become-PFV.CVB now DEM2.ISG.OBL khan-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l There everyone argued and then they said to the king:

\t Xan, mi debez xalq’imoƛ’ä bužzi aq, aq’iw maħ yołäsi ensi žek’uƛ’ä bužzi aqƛin?”
\m xan mi mi-z xalq’i-ƛ’-a bužzi oq aq’iw maħ yoł-asi endu-si žek’u-ƛ’-a bužzi oq-ƛin
\g khan you you-GEN2 people-SUPER.ESS-Q trust become foreign spirit be-RES.PRT this-ATTR man-SUPER.ESS-Q trust become-QUOT
\l "King, will you trust your people, [or] will you trust a man with a foreign spirit?"

\t Howži yisi ʕAliqiličä yiziqor eƛin:
\m howži yisi ʕAliqilič-a yizi-qor eƛi-n
\g now DEM2.ISG.OBL Aliqilich-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l Now Aliqilich said to them:

\t Di aždaħ bexursiƛin meži daƛ’ bužzi boqxo besunč’inäy, nełał mežus daʕban besunäy, bik’in aždaħes q’ˤim rowo xanqo rukaranixƛin”.
\m di aždaħ b-exur-s-ƛin meži di-ƛ’ bužzi b-oq-x b-esu-č’i-näy neła-ł mežu-s daʕba-n b-esu-näy b-ik’i-n aždaħ-s q’ˤim r-ow-o xan-q r-ukar-ani-x-ƛin
\g me dragon III-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT you.PL me-SUPER.ESS trust III-become-IPFV.CVB III-exist-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 dispute-TOP III-have-CND.CVB I.PL-go-PFV.CVB dragon-GEN1 head IV-get-IMPR khan-POSS.ESS IV-show-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l "If you don't believe me that I killed the dragon and you are having a dispute on that, go and get the dragon's head to show it to the king!"

\t K’oƛin bik’in yizirabi sist’a c’oxłin, q’ˤanot’a c’oxłin, c’ik’iwtow c’oxłin aždaħes q’ˤim žeduq q’ˤiday k’ek’-rik’no anu.
\m k’oƛi-n b-ik’i-n yizirabi sist’a c’ox-łin q’ˤanot’a c’ox-łin c’ik’iw-tow c’ox-łin aždaħ-s q’ˤim žedu-q q’ˤida-ay r-k’ek’~ik’-n anu
\g run-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.PL one.at.a.time meet-CNC.CVB two.at.a.time meet-CNC.CVB all-EMPH meet-CNC.CVB dragon-GEN1 head DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS down-IN.ABL IV-move-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l Although running around, they came together one at a time, two at a time, and then all together, but couldn't lift the dragon's head up to them.

\t Izin äk’iru ʕAliqiličä yołi aħyan rˤołun, bašiqno rixintow aždaħes q’ˤim rayrno.
\m izi-n ik’i-ru ʕAliqilič-a yołi aħya-n rˤołu-n baša-q-n r-ixi-n-tow aždaħ-s q’ˤim r-ayr-n
\g get.up-PFV.CVB go-PST.PRT Aliqilich-ERG however ear-and drill-PFV.CVB finger-POSS.ESS-and IV-hang-PFV.CVB-EMPH dragon-GEN1 head IV-bring-PST.UNW
\l Aliqilich, who got up and came, pierced its ear, and brought the dragon's head on one finger.

\t Xizyo xanä eƛin yisiqor:
\m xizyo xan-a eƛi-n yisi-qor
\g after khan-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l After that, the king said to him:

\t Debertow yätiru sis barun yižo mi t’ay, roƛik’u xanłin riso daqäy, howt’otow ičiƛin”.
\m mi-r-tow y-eti-ru sis baru-n y-iži-o mi t’ay r-oƛƛik’u xanłi-n r-is-o di-qay howt’o-tow iči-ƛin
\g you-LAT-EMPH II-love-PST.PRT one wife-and II-take.out-IMPR you from.here IV-half khanate-TOP IV-take-IMPR me-POSS.ABL here-EMPH be-QUOT
\l "Take the wife you love with you, take half of the kingdom from me, but stay here!"

\t Di däz raƛ’mar ayro mežaƛin, - eƛin yisä yizuqor.
\m di di-z raƛ’-r ayr-o mežu-a-ƛin - eƛi-n yisi-a yizi-qor
\g me me-GEN2 land-LAT bring-IMPR you(I).PL.OBL-ERG-QUOT - say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l "Bring me to my land!", he said to them.

\t Hudunon yiza raq’u harizi roda biħuzaƛ’, ʕAliqiličä beže barkalan teƛno žeduqor eƛin:
\m huduno-n yiza r-aq’ˤu harizi r-odi-a b-iħu-zaƛ’ ʕAliqilič-a b-eže barkala-n teƛ-n žedu-qor eƛi-n
\g nevertheless-TOP DEM2.IIPL.OBL IV-much request IV-do-INF III-begin-CSL.CVB Aliqilich-ERG III-big thank-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l Nevertheless, when they began to beg him very much, Aliqilich thanked them alot and said to them:

\t Žek’uz raƛ’ma xanłun ičizaƛ’or, däztow raƛ’ma laɣłun rigu därƛin.
\m žek’u-z raƛ’-a xan-łun iči-zaƛ’or di-z-tow raƛ’-a laɣ-łun r-igu di-r-ƛin
\g man-GEN2 land-IN.ESS khan-LHUN be-POST.CVB me-GEN2-EMPH land-IN.ESS slave-LHUN IV-good me-LAT-QUOT
\l "Before I become king over a someone's land, I would rather be a slave in my land.

\t Mežus res besunäy, di ƛ’irizoni raƛ’mar ayroƛin!”
\m mežu-s res b-esu-näy di ƛ’iri-zo-ni raƛ’-r ayr-o-ƛin
\g you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 possibility III-exist-CND.CVB me above-ATTR.OBL-DEF land-LAT bring-IMPR-QUOT
\l If you can, bring me to my land above!"

\t Mi elo ƛ’irir iziranix elus resno, maħalno anu.
\m mi elo ƛ’iri-r izir-ani-x elu-s res-n maħal-n anu
\g you there above-LAT lift-MSD-AD.ESS we(I).OBL-GEN1 possibility-TOP might-TOP be.NEG
\l "We do not have the ability and might to lift you up there.

\t Bukayxa eloš bitay qala?
\m b-ukad-x-a eloš bita-ay qala
\g III-see-PRS-Q over.there distance-IN.ABL fortress
\l Do you see the fortress there in the distance?

\t Neła qalameƛ waħo sasiw ɣutku yoł.
\m neła qala-ƛ waħo sasiw ɣˤutku yoł
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL fortress-SUB.ESS below gloomy house be
\l Below the fortress, there is a gloomy house.

\t Ɣudes sasaqaza elorno rayn sis aluk’a sideni qˤaba miƛ’bi riħanayxosi yoł.
\m ɣudes sasaq-aza elo-r-n r-ay-n sis aluk’a sideni qˤaba miƛ’i-bi r-iħanad-xosi yoł
\g daily in.the.morning-IN.VERS.DIST there-LAT-and III.PL-come-PFV.CVB one white other black ram-PL III.PL-fight-PRS.PRT be
\l Every day in the morning, one white and one black ram came and were fighting.

\t Aluk’ani biqirnäy, neła mi ƛ’irizoni raƛ’moƛ’or ayär, qˤabani biqirnäy waħazoni raƛ’moƛ’or ayärƛin, - eƛi- mołin egirno yizä yeda.
\m aluk’a-ni b-iqir-näy neła-a mi ƛ’iri-zo-ni raƛ’-ƛ’or ayr qˤaba-ni b-iqir-näy waħo-zo-ni raƛ’-ƛ’or ayr-ƛin - eƛi mołi-n egir-n yizi-a yeda
\g white-DEF III-catch-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you above-ATTR.OBL-DEF land-SUPER.LAT bring black-DEF III-catch-CND.CVB below-ATTR.OBL-DEF land-SUPER.LAT bring-QUOT - say teach-PFV.CVB send-PST.UNW DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG
\l When you catch the white one, it will bring you to the land above; if you catch the black one, it will bring you to the land below", they taught him and let him go.

\t Howži elorno ik’in, žedu miƛ’bi roƛixace ʕAliqilič ezun ičin.
\m howži elo-r-n ik’i-n žedu miƛ’i-bi r-oƛix-ace ʕAliqilič ezu-n iči-n
\g now there-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL ram-PL III.PL-appear-TERM Aliqilich look-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l So now Aliqilich went there and looked for the rams to appear.

\t Zamanaƛ’aza elor äƛiruxortow q’ˤano miƛ’in bayn, riħadanix riħun.
\m zaman-ƛ’aza elo-r eƛi-ru-xor-tow q’ˤano miƛ’i-n b-ay-n r-iħad-ani-x r-iħu-n
\g time-SUPER.VERS.DIST there-LAT say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT-EMPH two ram-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB III.PL-fight-MSD-AD.ESS III.PL-come.to-PST.UNW
\l After some time, two said rams came there and started to fight.

\t Aluk’ani biqirxoƛin zawru yeda yisis reƛ’a qˤabaniƛ’ č’aq’ˤin.
\m aluk’a-ni b-iqir-x-ƛin zow-ru yeda yisi-s reƛ’a qˤaba-ni-ƛ’ č’aq’ˤi-n
\g white-DEF III-win-IPFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.PRT DEM2.ISG DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 hand black-DEF-SUPER.ESS hit-PST.UNW
\l When he was catching the white one, his hand touched the black one.

\t Ižin waħazoni raƛ’moƛ’or ayrxo yeda.
\m iži-n waħo-zo-ni raƛ’-ƛ’or ayr-x yeda
\g carry-PFV.CVB below-ATTR.OBL-DEF land-SUPER.LAT bring-PRS DEM2.ISG
\l It took him and brought him to the land below.

\t Režigon rok’u q’ʷarid roqno yisis.
\m r-eži-gon rok’u q’ʷarid r-oq-n yisi-s
\g IV-more-CNTR heart sadness IV-become-PROHIB DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1
\l He became even more sad...

\t Howži t’o roda šebin anuƛin, ik’in yeda elay ayno sida šaharyar.
\m howži t’o r-odi-a šebin anu-ƛin ik’i-n yeda ele-ay ay-n sida šahar-ar
\g now here IV-do-INF thing be.NEG-QUOT go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG there-IN.ABL come-PST.UNW one.OBL city-IN.LAT
\l "Now there's nothing I can do", he said, and so he went on from there and came to a city.

\t Elo yisir siskin ukayza žek’utow esun anu.
\m elo yisi-r siskin ukad-za žek’u-tow esu-n anu
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT anything see-LCV.CVB man-EMPH find-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l There he didn't find any person, wherever he looked.

\t Yedu šebi ʕalamałi riča rayxƛin yeda bazaryar ik’inosi, elon siskin besun anu:
\m yedu šebi ʕalamałi r-iči-a r-ay-x-ƛin yeda bazar-ar ik’i-nosi elo-n siskin b-esu-n anu
\g DEM2.IISG what miracle IV-be-INF IV-must-PRS-QUOT DEM2.ISG bazar-IN.LAT go-ANT.CVB there-TOP anything III-find-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l "What wonder could this be?"; when he went to the market, he didn't find anything there:

\t Yoł yałzatow q’aybin xecin bazarganbin boxäsi besun elay.
\m yoł yoł-za-tow q’ay-bi-n xeci-n bazargan-bi-n b-oxi-asi b-esu-n ele-ay
\g be be-LCV.CVB-EMPH article-PL-TOP leave-PFV.CVB merchant-PL-TOP I.PL-run.away-RES.PRT I.PL-find-PST.UNW there-IN.ABL
\l He found that the merchants had left their goods where they were and had ran away.

\t Sida zamanałäy akin raɣˤin ɣutkazay yoƛixno yeže ɣˤanaza yisiqor qˤaƛin:
\m sida zaman-łay aki-n r-ˤaɣˤi-n ɣˤutku-azay y-oƛix-n y-eže ɣˤanabi-a yisi-qor qˤaƛi-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ABL window-TOP IV-open-PFV.CVB house-IN.ABL.DIST II-appear-PFV.CVB II-old woman-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT shout-PST.UNW
\l Suddenly an old woman opened a window, looked out of her house and shouted at him:

\t Welečo, aq’iw maħ yołalini žek’u, oxi uqˤło.
\m wele-čo aq’iw maħ yoł-ali-ni žek’u oxi uqˤeł-o
\g look.out.IMP-INT foreign smell be-ATTR-DEF man run.away hide-IMPR
\l "Look out, man with the foreign spirit, run away and hide!

\t Aždaħƛ’or batiruni bikori nexxo yoł, madazaħ räsuru šinaw šebin neła rac’xosi yołƛin!”
\m aždaħ-ƛ’or b-uti-ru-ni bikori nex-x yoł ma-bi-x r-esu-ru šinaw šebin neła-a r-ac’-xosi yoł-ƛin
\g dragon-SUPER.LAT III-turn.back-PST.PRT-DEF snake come-IPFV.CVB be outside-PL-AD.ESS IV-find-PST.PRT every thing DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG IV-eat-PRS.PRT be-QUOT
\l A snake that turned into a dragon is coming and it will eat up everything it finds!"

\t Äzuru yisir ciqez raʕalłix yałruni sida ixiw ɣunoq soder bizix aždaħ-bikori bukayn.
\m ezu-ru yisi-r ciq-z raʕalłi-x yoł-ru-ni sida ixiw ɣun-q soder b-izi-x aždaħ~bikori b-ukad-n
\g look-PST.PRT DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT forest-GEN2 edge-AD.ESS be-PST.PRT-DEF one.OBL big tree-POSS.ESS upward III-get.up-IPFV.CVB dragon~snake III-see-PST.UNW
\l Looking around, he saw a dragon-snake climbing a tree that was standing at the edge of the forest.

\t Neła ɣunoƛ’ ƛ’iri ceyes xexoyabi teł yołäsi muži zown.
\m neła ɣun-ƛ’ ƛ’iri cey-s xexoy-bi teł yoł-asi muži zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL tree-SUPER.ESS above eagle-GEN1 young.animal-PL inside be-RES.PRT nest be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l On that tree there was a nest with young eagles inside.

\t Žedu xexoyabi rac’anixƛin bizixƛax ža bikori.
\m žedu xexoy-bi r-ac’-ani-x-ƛin b-izi-x-ƛax ža bikori
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL young.animal-PL III.PL-eat-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT III-get.up-PRS-QUOT DEM1.SG snake
\l The snake got up to eat the young eagles.

\t T’ok’ow boda darun koƛ’inč’ey, čaran bexun, ƛ’iri šet’u butix ceyno yołƛax.
\m t’ok’ow b-odi-a daru-n koƛ’i-č’ey čara-n b-exu-n ƛ’iri šet’u b-uti-x cey-n yoł-ƛax
\g anymore III-do-INF medicine-TOP understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB possibility-TOP III-die-PFV.CVB above around III-turn.back-IPFV.CVB eagle-TOP be-QUOT
\l Not knowing what to do - the situation was desperate - the eagle circled around, up there.

\t Howlay äk’inoƛin qˤaƛanayx yeženi ɣˤanabin xecin ʕAliqilič k’oƛin ik’in.
\m howlay ik’i-n-ƛin qˤaƛanad-x y-eže-ni ɣˤanabi-n xeci-n ʕAliqilič k’oƛi-n ik’i-n
\g from.there go-PROHIB-QUOT yell-IPFV.CVB II-old-DEF woman-TOP leave-PFV.CVB Aliqilich run-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l Yelling "Don't go away!", Aliqilich left the old woman and ran.

\t Bikoride igaɣor ayƛ’oräy, neła ceyes xexoy biqirƛ’orey, roɣno mač’an bikorzo rok’no.
\m bikori-de igo-aɣor ay-ƛ’oräy neła-a cey-s xexoy b-iqir-ƛ’oräy r-oɣ-n mač’a-n bikori-zo r-ok’-n
\g snake-APUD.ESS near-IN.VERS come-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG eagle-GEN1 young.animal III-take.away-SIM.CVB IV-take.away-PFV.CVB saber-and snake-ATTR.OBL IV-hit-PST.UNW
\l When he came closer to the snake as it was taking away the eagle's chick, he took the saber and hit the snake.

\t Hoboy hudu haqazay zahru čˤaƛirxotow yisiƛ’aɣor butin bikori.
\m hoboy hudu haqu-azay zahru čˤaƛir-x-tow yisi-ƛ’aɣor b-uti-n bikori
\g now so mouth-IN.ABL.DIST poison spill-IPFV.CVB-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS III-turn.back-PST.UNW snake
\l Now, spilling the poison out of her mouth, the snake turned over to him.

\t Adäzar q’oldenno kurno sosigon yisä rok’no mač’a.
\m adäz-ar q’olden-n kur-n sosi-gon yisi-a r-ok’-n mač’a
\g ahead-IN.LAT armor-TOP throw-PFV.CVB once-CNTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG IV-hit-PST.UNW saber
\l He threw his armor in front of himself and once again stroke with his saber.

\t Lagiqay bat’an roqno bikores q’ˤim geler rik’in.
\m laga-qay bat’a-n r-oq-n bikori-s q’ˤim geler r-ik’i-n
\g body-POSS.ABL seperation-TOP IV-become-PFV.CVB snake-GEN1 head head.over.heals IV-go-PST.UNW
\l The snake's head got seperated from the body and tumbled away.

\t Yisä yisir łˤora ɣudi bertenno erno, bercinawƛ’ay bercinawt’a kidbabin rukarno, howt’aytow barun yižoƛin harizin rodin, roƛik’u xanłin riso howt’otow uyn iči, mi iłe baħarči naynkin t’ok’ow elur äqinč’iƛin.
\m yisi-a yisi-r łˤora ɣudi berten-n er-n bercinaw-ƛ’ay bercinaw-t’a kid-bi-n r-ukar-n howt’ay-tow baru-n y-iži-o-ƛin harizi-n r-odi-n r-oƛƛik’u xanłi-n r-is-o howt’o-tow uy-n iči mi iłe baħarči naynkin t’ok’ow elu-r iqi-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT three.OBL day marriage-and put-PFV.CVB beautiful-SUPER.ABL beautiful-DISTR girl-PL-and II.PL-show-PFV.CVB from.here-EMPH wife-TOP II-take.out-IMPR-QUOT request-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB IV-half khanate-TOP IV-take-IMPR here-EMPH just-TOP be you as brave.young.man from.nowhere anymore we(I).OBL-LAT get-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l He arranged a 3-day lasting marriage for him, presented girls that were prettier than pretty, "Choose a wife from here!", he begged, "Settle down here and take half of the kingdom, from nowhere will we ever get such a brave young man as you, anymore!"

\t Razi oqno anu ʕAliqilič.
\m razi oq-n anu ʕAliqilič
\g agree become-PFV.CVB be.NEG Aliqilich
\l Aliqilich did not agree.

\t Žek’uz raƛ’ma xanłun ičizaƛ’or, däztow raƛ’ma laɣłun rigu, mežus res besunäy, di däztow raƛ’mar ayroƛin”, - harizi rodin yisä.
\m žek’u-z raƛ’-a xan-łun iči-zaƛ’or di-z-tow raƛ’-a laɣ-łun r-igu mežu-s res b-esu-näy di di-z-tow raƛ’-r ayr-o-ƛin - harizi r-odi-n yisa-a
\g man-GEN2 land-IN.ESS khan-LHUN be-POST.CVB me-GEN2-EMPH land-IN.ESS slave-LHUN IV-good you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 possibility III-have-CND.CVB me me-GEN2-EMPH land-LAT bring-IMPR-QUOT - request IV-do-PST.UNW he-ERG
\l "Before getting the kingship over someone's country, it's better to be a slave in my own country; if you have the ability, bring me back to my country!", he begged.

\t Eluqƛa iziräłinč’i mi elo ƛ’irir, hudunon eloš neła ceyqo harizi rodan elaƛin”, - eƛin xanä.
\m elu-q-ƛa izir-ł-č’i mi elo ƛ’iri-r huduno-n eloš neła cey-q harizi r-odi-an elu-a-ƛin - eƛi-n xan-a
\g we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS-INDEF lift-POT-NEG.FUT you there above-LAT nevertheless-TOP over.there DEM1.IISG.OBL eagle-POSS.ESS request IV-do-FUT.DEF we(I).OBL-ERG-QUOT - say-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l "We cannot lift you up there, so we will beg that eagle over there", said the king.

\t Bik’in yiziri neła ceyder, žedus murad bič’zi boqnosi neła eƛin:
\m b-ik’i-n yiziri neła-a cey-der žedu-s murad bič’zi b-oq-nosi neła-a eƛi-n
\g III-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG eagle-APUD.LAT DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 wish understand III-become-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l They went to that eagle, and when he had understood their wish, the eagle said:

\t Dey ruħ łiyäsi yoł, hudunon nesi baħarčis ela murad t’ubazi boda bay.
\m di-s ruħ łiy-asi yoł huduno-n nesi baħarči-s elu-a murad t’ubazi b-odi-a b-ay
\g me-GEN1 power end-RES.PRT be nevertheless-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL brave.young.man-GEN1 we(I).OBL-ERG wish fulfill III-do-INF I.PL-must
\l "My power has ended, so we must fulfill this brave young man's wish.

\t Meža łˤonoqu isno bexʷad, nełas reƛno ero däz sida lelƛ’o, puräzonigon lelaƛ’ howžedatow isʷas iyos ric’no zidyabin ero, gugyoƛ’gon žan zowro, hemełƛ’o dey rok’u rayx ža ƛ’irizoni dunyalƛ’ar iziräł daqƛin”.
\m mežu-a łˤonoqu is-n b-exʷad neła-s reƛ-n er-o di-z sida lel-ƛ’ pu-zo-ni-gon lel-ƛ’ howžeda-tow is-bi-s iyo-s r-ic’-n zidya-bi-n er-o gugu-ƛ’-gon ža-n zowr-o hemeł-ƛ’ di-s rok’u r-ay-x ža ƛ’iri-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’ar izir-ł di-q-ƛin
\g you(I).PL.OBL-ERG sixty bull-TOP III-slaughter DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 meat-TOP put-IMPR me-GEN2 one.OBL wing-SUPER.ESS side-ATTR.OBL-DEF-CNTR wing-SUPER.ESS DEM4.PL.OBL-EMPH bull-PL-GEN1 blood-GEN1 IV.PL-fill-PFV.CVB wineskin-PL-TOP put-IMPR back-SUPER.ESS-CNTR DEM1.SG-TOP seat-IMPR DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS me-GEN1 heart IV-come-IPFV.CVB DEM1.SG above-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.VERS lift-POT me-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l Slaughter 60 bulls, put their meat onto one of my wings, on the other wing put wineskins filled with those bulls' blood; and seat him onto my back; thereafter, I am convinced, I will be able to lift him into the upper world."

\t Howži yiza neła ceyä äƛiruxor łˤonoqu isno bexayn, nełas reƛno, iyon ceyez lelazaƛ’no erno, gugyoƛ’gon ʕAliqilično zowrno, ƛ’irizo raƛ’maɣor begirno yizirabi.
\m howži yiza neła cey-a äƛiru-xor łˤonoqu is-n b-exʷad-n neła-s reƛ-n iyo-n cey-z lel-bi-ƛ’-n er-n gugu-ƛ’-gon ʕAliqilič-n zowr-n ƛ’iri-zo raƛ’-ɣor b-egir-n yizirabi
\g now DEM2.IIPL.OBL DEM1.IISG.OBL eagle-ERG ORD-AD.LAT sixty bull-TOP III-slaughter-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 meat-and blood-and eagle-GEN2 wing-PL-SUPER.ESS-TOP put-PFV.CVB back-SUPER.ESS-CNTR Aliqilich-TOP seat-PFV.CVB above-ATTR.OBL land-IN.ALL III-send-PST.UNW DEM2.PL
\l Now they slaughtered 60 bulls according to what the eagle said, put their meat and blood onto the eagle's wings, seated Aliqilich onto his back and sent them into the land above.

\t Q’ʷˤaɣˤƛin eƛin bitor bezunosi nełaz haqar reƛ kurxo zowno, q’ʷˤaɣˤƛin eƛin ninor bezunosi iyos zok’i et’xo zowno nesä nełaz haqa.
\m q’ʷˤaɣˤ-ƛin eƛi-n bitor b-ezu-nosi neła-z haqu-ar reƛ kur-x zow-n q’ʷˤaɣˤ-ƛin eƛi-n ninor b-ezu-nosi iyo-s zok’i et’-x zow-n nesi-a neła-z haqu-a
\g screak-QUOT say-PFV.CVB thither III-look-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 mouth-IN.LAT meat throw-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB screak-QUOT say-PFV.CVB hither III-look-ANT.CVB blood-GEN1 mug pour-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 mouth-ERG
\l When the eagle screaked and looked to the one side, Aliqilich threw the meat into the eagle's mouth; when he screaked and looked to the other side, he poured the mug with the blood into his mouth.

\t Bizin ʕAliqiličzo raƛ’mar bayanix oc’ino gali ƛäxurun ceyez gugyoƛ’ erno zawruni šebin łiyn.
\m b-izi-n ʕAliqilič-z raƛ’-r b-ay-ani-x oc’ino gali ƛexu-run cey-z gugu-ƛ’ er-n zow-ru-ni šebin łiy-n
\g III-get.up-PFV.CVB Aliqilich-GEN2 land-LAT III-come-MSD-AD.ESS ten step remain-IMM.ANT.CVB eagle-GEN2 back-SUPER.ESS put-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF thing end-PST.UNW
\l They flew upwards and just ten steps before coming up to Aliqilich's country, the things that were on the eagle's back ended.

\t Howži q’ʷˤaɣˤƛin bezun bitor kurno anu reƛ, q’ʷˤaɣˤƛin bezun ninor et’no anu iyo.
\m howži q’ʷˤaɣˤ-ƛin b-ezu-n bitor kur-n anu reƛ q’ʷˤaɣˤ-ƛin b-ezu-n ninor et’-n anu iyo
\g now screak-QUOT III-look-PFV.CVB thither throw-PFV.CVB be.NEG meat screak-QUOT III-look-PFV.CVB hither pour-PFV.CVB be.NEG blood
\l Now when he screaked and looked to the one side, he didn't throw in any meat, and when he screaked and looked to the other side, he didn't pour in any blood.

\t Wayčo, baħarči, egixwa mi däqƛin!” - aħi bodin ceyä.
\m way-čo baħarči egi-x-a mi di-q-ƛin - aħi b-odi-n cey-a
\g o.dear-INT brave.young.man loosen-PRS-Q you me-POSS.ESS-QUOT - alarm III-do-PST.UNW eagle-ERG
\l "Hey, brave young man, I cannot keep you anymore!", warned the eagle.

\t Roda šebinon koƛ’inč’ey yisä bečnaqay reč’no reƛ kurno, howlaytow ric’no iyos zok’in et’no haqa.
\m r-odi-a šebinon koƛ’i-č’ey yisi-a bečni-qay r-eč’-n reƛ kur-n howlay-tow r-ic’-n iyo-s zok’i-n et’-n haqu-a
\g IV-do-INF something understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG knee-POSS.ABL IV-cut-PFV.CVB meat throw-PFV.CVB from.there-EMPH IV-fill-PFV.CVB blood-GEN1 mug-TOP pour-PST.UNW mouth-IN.ESS
\l Not knowing what else to do, he cut meat off from his knee and threw it to the eagle, them he filled the blood into a mug and poured it into its mouth.

\t Izirno ƛ’irizoni dunyalƛ’or ayrno.
\m izir-n ƛ’iri-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’or ayr-n
\g lift-PFV.CVB above-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.LAT bring-PST.UNW
\l And he brought him up into the upper world.

\t Ha howži ays mi, baħarči, oqčo q’ˤidarƛin”, - eƛin ceyä nesiqor.
\m ha howži ay-s mi baħarči oq-čo q’ˤida-r-ƛin - eƛi-n cey-a nesi-qor
\g well now come-PST.WIT you brave.young.man become-INT down-LAT-QUOT - say-PST.UNW eagle-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l "Well now there you are, brave young man, please get down", said the eagle to him.

\t Šebi deber roqno, šida mi šiqˤonyayxƛin?”
\m šebi mi-r r-oq-n šida mi šiqˤonyad-x-ƛin
\g what you-LAT IV-happen-PST.UNW why you limp-PRS-QUOT
\l "What happened to you, why are you limping?"

\t Reƛno łiyn k’onč’aqay reč’no kuräsi zows, howlaytow iyos zok’in ric’äsi zowsƛin”, - esin yisä.
\m reƛ-n łiy-n k’onč’u-qay r-eč’-n kur-asi zow-s howlay-tow iyo-s zok’i-n r-ic’-asi zow-s-ƛin - esi-n yisi-a
\g meat-TOP end-PFV.CVB leg-POSS.ABL IV-cut-PFV.CVB throw-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT from.there-EMPH blood-GEN1 mug-TOP IV-fill-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT - tell-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "When the meat ended, I cut some from my leg and threw it to you, and from there I filled the blood into a mug", he told.

\t Waħ, debiya nece huinaw reƛ zownƛin, bečnayn roƛik’no yiła ža reƛ.
\m waħ mi-s-a nece huinaw reƛ zow-n-ƛin b-ečnad-n r-oƛik’-n yiła-a ža reƛ
\g whoa you-GEN1-Q so.much delicious meat be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT III-vomit-PFV.CVB IV-push.out-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG meat
\l "Whoa, that oh so delicious meat was yours?!", he said and reurgitated the meat.

\t Žan yałza łeɣirno, ceyä ƛ’irigon mecno biħin, ʕAliqiličes k’onč’un saɣ yoqno.
\m ža-n yoł-za łeɣir-n cey-a ƛ’iri-gon mec-n b-iħi-n ʕAliqilič-s k’onč’u-n saɣ y-oq-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP be-LCV.CVB glue-PFV.CVB eagle-ERG above-CNTR tongue-TOP III-smear-PFV.CVB Aliqilich-GEN1 leg-TOP cure II-become-PST.UNW
\l Holding him where he was, the eagle licked above him with his tongue, and Aliqilich's leg got cured.

\t Ceyn neła nełaz raƛ’maɣor boržizin boqno bik’in, yedan iduɣor nexno.
\m cey-n neła-a neła-z raƛ’-ɣor boržizi-n b-oq-n b-ik’i-n yeda-n idu-ɣor nex-n
\g eagle-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 land-IN.ALL fly-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG-TOP home-IN.ALL come-PST.UNW
\l When the eagle flew into his own country, also he returned home.

\t Yeda iduɣor nexa keze oqno sida žopono ciqłäza egin.
\m yeda idu-ɣor nex-a keze oq-n sida žopono ciq-łaza egi-n
\g DEM2.ISG home-IN.ALL come-INF meet become-PFV.CVB one.OBL dense forest-CONT.VERS.DIST let.go-PST.UNW
\l In order to get to his home, he had to walk through a dense forest.

\t Sida ɣudi ik’in, q’ˤuna ɣudi ik’in, łˤora äƛiza quł ʕAliqilič sida maydanƛ’or ayn.
\m sida ɣudi ik’i-n q’ˤuna ɣudi ik’i-n łˤora äƛiru-zo-a qu-ł ʕAliqilič sida maydan-ƛ’or ay-n
\g one.OBL day go-PFV.CVB two.OBL day go-PFV.CVB three.OBL ORD-ATTR.OBL-IN.ESS day-CONT.ESS Aliqilich one.OBL clearance-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He went one day, two days, and on the third day Aliqilich came to a clearance.

\t Elo teł yisir osiw qala besun.
\m elo teł yisi-r osiw qala b-esu-n
\g there inside DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT high fortress III-find-PST.UNW
\l There he found a high fortress.

\t Mekodäsin, akiłäsin, tatu bexasin yeda elo tełxor ik’in.
\m mekod-asi-n akił-asi-n tatu b-exu-asi-n yeda elo teł-xor ik’i-n
\g be.hungry-RES.PRT-TOP get.tired-RES.PRT-TOP power III-die-RES.PRT-and DEM2.ISG there inside-AD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l Being hungry, tired and at the end of his powers, he went inside.

\t Elogon yisir suratce bercinaw kid yesun.
\m elo-gon yisi-r surat-ce bercinaw kid y-esu-n
\g there-CNTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT painting-EQU1 beautiful girl II-find-PST.UNW
\l And there he found a girl as beautiful as a painting.

\t Hay i wele, howži oxi mi t’ay, dey xediw aynäy, exar nesä mi.
\m hay i wele howži oxi mi t’ay di-s xediw ay-näy exur nesi-a mi
\g so.then and look.out.IMP now run.away you from.here me-GEN1 husband come-CND.CVB kill DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you
\l "So then, now run away from here, when my husband comes home, he will kill you!

\t Sida baħarčä q’ˤanon xexbi rexurno, c’aq’ cimyor izäsi zows žaƛin”.
\m sida baħarči-a q’ˤano-n xexbi r-exur-n c’aq’ cim-r izi-asi zow-s ža-ƛin
\g one.OBL brave.young.man-ERG two-TOP children III.PL-kill-PFV.CVB very malice-LAT get-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT DEM1.SG-QUOT
\l A brave young man has killed his two children, he got very furious."

\t Waħ, łu nesis žedu xexbi rexura rayx, - esirno ʕAliqiličä neł kidbeq, - žeda nesi baħarčir šebi zaral bodäsiƛin?”
\m waħ łu nesi-s žedu xexbi r-exur-a r-ay-x - esir-n ʕAliqilič-a neła kid-q - žedu-a nesi baħarči-r šebi zaral b-odi-asi-ƛin
\g whoa who.ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 DEM1.IPL.OBL children III.PL-kill-INF IV-come-IPFV.CVB - ask-PST.UNW Aliqilich-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-POSS.ESS - DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL brave.young.man-LAT what harm III-do-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l "Whoa, who would kill his children?", asked Aliqilich the girl, "What did they do to this brave young man?"

\t Łu bexaru biyxanuƛin, - eƛin bercinawni kidbä, - eƛix ža elus maħ yołäsi žek’u zown.
\m łu b-exur-ru b-iy-x-anu-ƛin - eƛi-n bercinaw-ni kid-a - eƛi-x ža elu-s maħ yoł-asi žek’u zow-n
\g who.ERG I.PL-kill-PST.PRT I.PL-know-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT - say-PST.UNW beautiful-DEF girl-ERG - say-PRS DEM1.SG we(I).OBL-GEN1 spirit be-RES.PRT man be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "One doesn't know who killed them", said the beautiful girl, "it is said it was a man of our spirit.

\t Nesir didiw zaral žeda badirun biyxanu.
\m nesi-r didiw zaral žedu-a b-odi-ru-n b-iy-x-anu
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT which harm DEM1.IPL-ERG III-do-PST.PRT-TOP III-know-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l Neither does one know what harm they did to him.

\t Uži howt’o waħozo raƛ’moƛ’ łäz kikƛ’o aq’ˤułno ičäsi zown.
\m uži howt’o waħo-zo raƛ’-ƛ’ łi-z kik-ƛ’ aq’ˤuł-n iči-asi zow-n
\g son here below-ATTR.OBL land-SUPER.ESS water-GEN2 spring-SUPER.ESS cover-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Our son was covering a spring of water in the land below here.

\t Elozo xalq’imor łi teƛxanuƛin exurno ža.
\m elo-zo xalq’i-r łi teƛ-x-anu-ƛin exur-n ža
\g there-ATTR.OBL people-LAT water give-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT kill-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l He was killed because he didn't gave water to the people there.

\t Kid elaygon waħozoni dunyalƛ’o yexurno...”
\m kid ele-ay-gon waħo-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’ y-exur-n
\g daughter there-IN.ABL-CNTR below-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.ESS II-kill-PST.UNW
\l Our daughter got killed in the world below that one..."

\t Ha howži riysi där žaƛin, - esin yisägon yisirtow raqru łinałayn.
\m ha howži r-iy-s di-r ža-ƛin - esi-n yisi-a-gon yisi-r-tow r-oq-ru łina-łay-n
\g well now IV-know-PST.WIT me-LAT DEM1.SG-QUOT - tell-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT-EMPH IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP
\l "Well, I understood this now", he told about what had happened to him.

\t - elus maħ yołäsi migon nay t’or keze yoqäsi?”
\m - elu-s maħ yoł-asi mi-gon nay t’o-r keze y-oq-asi
\g - we(I).OBL-GEN1 spirit be-RES.PRT you-CNTR from.where here-LAT meet II-become-RES.PRT
\l "And from where did you, having our spirit, get here?"

\t Di yoł yiła eluz wilayatzo naib Žabulawes aždaħä yok’ek’no yowäsi kidƛin, - esin yiła, - däƛ’ Baxumesedoƛin cin yoł.
\m di yoł yiła elu-z wilayat-zo naib Žabulaw-s aždaħ-a y-ok’ek’-n y-ow-asi kid-ƛin - esi-n yiła-a - di-ƛ’ Baxumesedo-ƛin ci-n yoł
\g me be DEM2.IISG.OBL we(I).OBL-GEN2 province-ATTR.OBL governor Jabulaw-GEN1 dragon-ERG II-steal-PFV.CVB II-bring-RES.PRT daughter-QUOT - tell-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG - me-SUPER.ESS Bakhumesed-QUOT name-TOP be
\l "I am the daughter of our province's governor Jabulaw, who got stolen by a dragon." she said, "my name is Bakhumesedo.

\t ʕIla howži, ik’i mi t’ayƛin” - čara bexun nełar.
\m ʕila howži ik’i mi t’ay-ƛin - čara b-exu-n neła-r
\g enough now go you from.here-QUOT - possibility III-die-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT
\l Enough now, go away!", she said as her possibilities ended.

\t Aždaħes xexbi rexarun di yoł ža, aždaħtow bexurxosin di yołƛin!”, - eƛin ičin ʕAliqilič aždaħ bayace.
\m aždaħ-s xexbi r-exur-ru-n di yoł ža aždaħ-tow b-exur-xosi-n di yoł-ƛin - eƛi-n iči-n ʕAliqilič aždaħ b-ay-ace
\g dragon-GEN1 children III.PL-kill-PST.PRT-TOP me be DEM1.SG dragon-EMPH III-kill-PRS.PRT-TOP me be-QUOT - say-PFV.CVB wait-PST.UNW Aliqilich dragon III-come-TERM
\l "I am the one who killed the dragon's children, and I will also kill the dragon!", Aliqilich said and waited until the dragon came.

\t Sida zamanałäza raƛ’tow šešerxo eƛix bayn aždaħ:
\m sida zaman-łaza raƛ’-tow šešer-x eƛi-x b-ay-n aždaħ
\g one.OBL time-CONT.VERS.DIST earth-EMPH shake-IPFV.CVB say-IPFV.CVB III-come-PST.UNW dragon
\l After a while, the earth shook when the dragon came and said:

\t Šebi t’or yayäsiƛin?”
\m šebi t’o-r y-ay-asi-ƛin
\g who here-LAT II-come-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l Who came here?"

\t Ele di t’o yoł, däder biħadanix boq maħorƛin”, - eƛin nesä žawab boyn.
\m ele di t’o yoł di-der b-iħad-ani-x b-oq maħor-ƛin - eƛi-n nesi-a žawab b-odi-n
\g here me here be me-APUD.LAT III-fight-MSD-AD.ESS III-become outside-QUOT - say-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG answer III-do-PST.UNW
\l "Here I am, come out to me and fight!", he answered.

\t ƛirba žek’uƛ’ di biħanayxosi anu.
\m ƛirba žek’u-ƛ’ di b-iħanad-xosi anu
\g guest man-SUPER.ESS me III-fight-PRS.PRT be.NEG
\l "I do not fight with a guest.

\t Mi där madaħ esus yołi exura zows.
\m mi di-r madaħ esu-s yołi exur-a zow-s
\g you me-LAT outside find-PST.WIT however kill-INF be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l Had I found you outside, I would have killed you.

\t Mi šebi žek’u t’or ayäsiƛin?” - esirno aždaħä yisiq.
\m mi šebi žek’u t’o-r ay-asi-ƛin - esir-n aždaħ-a yisi-q
\g you what man here-LAT come-RES.PRT-QUOT - ask-PST.UNW dragon-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l What kind of man are you to come here?", asked him the dragon.

\t Di yoł debi xexbin rexurno, howži mi bexuranix nexʷasi žek’uƛin”, - eƛin ʕAliqiličä.
\m di yoł mi-s xexbi-n r-exur-n howži mi b-exur-ani-x nex-asi žek’u-ƛin - eƛi-n ʕAliqilič-a
\g me be you-GEN1 children-TOP III.PL-kill-PFV.CVB now you III-kill-MSD-AD.ESS come-RES.PRT man-QUOT - say-PST.UNW Aliqilich-ERG
\l "I am a man who killed your children, and now came to kill you", said Aliqilich.

\t Ha, miyä ža dey tušman, oqčo howži maħorƛinno!” - eƛin yedu aždaħ maħor boqno.
\m ha mi-a ža di-s tušman oq-čo howži maħor-ƛin-n - eƛi-n yedu aždaħ maħor b-oq-n
\g well you-Q DEM1.SG me-GEN1 enemy become-INT now outside-QUOT-TOP - say-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG dragon outside III-become-PST.UNW
\l "Well, so you are my enemy, then come out now!", said the dragon and got outside.

\t Ža maħor oqƛ’oräy, nesiłtow xizay yoƛixno Baxumesedagon ʕAliqiličqor č’ikay teƛno, reč’no nełas q’ˤim č’ikayä rezurinč’inäy, nełas ruħ baɣinč’iƛin.
\m ža maħor oq-ƛ’oräy nesi-ł-tow xizay y-oƛix-n Baxumesedo-a-gon ʕAliqilič-qor č’ikay teƛ-n r-eč’-n neła-s q’ˤim č’ikay-a r-ezu-r-č’i-näy neła-s ruħ b-oɣ-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG outside become-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-EMPH from.behind II-appear-PST.UNW Bakhumesed-ERG-CNTR Aliqilich-POSS.LAT mirror give-PFV.CVB IV-cut-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 head mirror-IN.ESS IV-look-CAUS-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 power III-take.away-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l When Aliqilich got outside, Bakhumesedo appeared behind him and gave him a mirror, saying: "When you cut his head off and don't show it to himself in the mirror, you won't take away his power."

\t Howži łeɣin biħadanix, sidä sis bizirxo bok’xo yiła aždaħä ħaltown bayrinč’ey baq’ˤu aq’ˤuba bukayn yisi ʕAliqiličer.
\m howži łeɣi-n b-iħad-ani-x sida-a sis b-izir-x b-ok’-x yiła aždaħ-a ħal-tow-n b-ayr-č’ey b-aq’ˤu aq’ˤuba b-ukad-n yisi ʕAliqilič-r
\g now grasp-PFV.CVB I.PL-fight-MSD-AD.ESS one.OBL-ERG one I.PL-lift-IPFV.CVB I.PL-beat-IPFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL dragon-ERG strength-EMPH-TOP III-bring-NEG.PST.CVB III-much torture III-see-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL Aliqilich-LAT
\l Now they grasped each other to fight, lifting and beating each other up and that dragon tired Aliqilich out very much.

\t Roɣno rok’no mač’a, ret’urno q’ˤim kurno.
\m r-oɣ-n r-ok’-n mač’a r-et’ur-n q’ˤim kur-n
\g IV-take.away-PFV.CVB IV-beat-PST.UNW saber IV-pull.out-PFV.CVB head throw-PST.UNW
\l He took his saber, hit him and cut the dragon's head off.

\t Aždaħägon risno yałzatown erno.
\m aždaħ-a-gon r-is-n yoł-za-tow-n er-n
\g dragon-ERG-CNTR IV-take-PFV.CVB be-LCV.CVB-EMPH-TOP put-PST.UNW
\l But the dragon took it and put it back where it was.

\t Sosigon sidä sidqo łeɣin izirno ʕAliqilič q’ˤidan ok’no ašuƛäyd raƛ’moƛxor cucik’no.
\m sosi-gon sida-a sida-q łeɣi-n izir-n ʕAliqilič q’ˤida-n ok’-n ašu-ƛay-d raƛ’-ƛxor cucik’-n
\g again-CNTR one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.ESS grasp-PFV.CVB lift-PFV.CVB Aliqilich down-TOP beat-PFV.CVB waist-SUB.ABL-TERM earth-SUB.LAT put-PST.UNW
\l Again they grasped each other and then he lifted Aliqilich and beat him down into the earth up to the waist.

\t Yisägon rok’no mač’a ret’urno aždaħes q’ˤim kurno.
\m yisi-a-gon r-ok’-n mač’a r-et’ur-n aždaħ-s q’ˤim kur-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR IV-beat-PFV.CVB saber IV-pull.out-PFV.CVB dragon-GEN1 head throw-PST.UNW
\l Again(?) he pulled out his saber and beated the dragon's head off.

\t Baxumeseda äƛiru šebin rok’ƛ’o č’aq’ˤinosi, ʕAliqiličä k’oƛin ik’in aždaħes q’ˤim č’ikayä rezurno.
\m Baxumesedo-a eƛi-ru šebin rok’u-ƛ’ č’aq’ˤi-nosi ʕAliqilič-a k’oƛi-n ik’i-n aždaħ-s q’ˤim č’ikay-a r-ezur-n
\g Bakhumesed-ERG say-PST.PRT thing heart-SUPER.ESS fall.down-ANT.CVB Aliqilich-ERG run-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB dragon-GEN1 head mirror-IN.ESS IV-show-PST.UNW
\l When he remembered what Bakhumesed said, Aliqilich ran and showed the dragon's head in the mirror to himself.

\t Nełaz q’ˤimqon lagiqnotown c’i łeɣin.
\m neła-z q’ˤim-q-n laga-q-n-tow-n c’i łeɣi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 head-POSS.ESS-and body-POSS.ESS-and-EMPH-and fire grasp-PST.UNW
\l Its head and its body caught fire.

\t Aždaħes yaqru nˤoƛun łacqo yižirno, nełas zawru šinaw xazina mesedno bižin, Baxumesedun guluƛ’ zowrno Kidiro Žabulawder ik’in.
\m aždaħ-s y-oq-ru nˤoƛu-n łaci-q y-iži-r-n neła-s zow-ru šinaw xazina mesed-n b-iži-n Baxumesedo-n gulu-ƛ’ zowr-n Kidiro Žabulaw-der ik’i-n
\g dragon-GEN1 II-become-PST.PRT ashes-TOP wind-POSS.ESS II-carry-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.PRT every treasure gold-and III-carry-PFV.CVB Bakhumesed-and horse-SUPER.ESS seat-PFV.CVB Kidero Jabulaw-APUD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l He let the wind carry away ashes of the dragon, took all the gold from its treasures, seated Bakhumesed on a horse, and went to Jabulaw in Kidero.

\t Ɣˤaɣˤu äziru Žabulawägon yisix Baxumesedun yegirno, yisiqor naibłin teƛno, ɣˤutkoƛ’orno egirno.
\m ɣˤaɣˤu izi-ru Žabulaw-a-gon yisi-x Baxumesedo-n y-egir-n yisi-qor naibłi-n teƛ-n ɣˤutku-ƛ’or-n egir-n
\g be.happy get-PST.PRT Jabulaw-ERG-CNTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS Bakhumesed-and II-send-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT governorship-and give-PFV.CVB house-SUPER.LAT-TOP send-PST.UNW
\l Jabulaw, who became happy, gave Bakhumesed's hand to him, gave him the governorship and sent him to a house.

\t Digon ayäsi elo žeduz bertenyołer nesi ʕAliqiličä där łeno ukru neƛsi yedu kesubi caxxosi oqzaƛ’.
\m di-gon ay-asi elo žedu-z berten-łer nesi ʕAliqilič-a di-r łeno ukru neƛ-s yedu kesu-bi cax-xosi oq-zaƛ’
\g me-CNTR come-RES.PRT there DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 marriage-CONT.LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL Aliqilich-ERG me-LAT five silver give-PST.WIT DEM2.IISG tale-PL write-PRS.PRT become-CSL.CVB
\l And I came to their marriage as well, and Aliqilich gave me 5 silver (coins), because I am writing down those tales.

\t Neła łera ukrułäy sis Žamaler teƛsi, sideni Arsener teƛsi, sidenigon Pat’imater teƛsi.
\m neła łera ukru-łay sis Žamal-r teƛ-s sideni Arsen-r teƛ-s sideni-gon Pat’imat-r teƛ-s
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL five.OBL silver-CONT.ABL one Jamal-LAT give-PST.WIT other Arsen-LAT give-PST.WIT other-CNTR Fatima-LAT give-PST.WIT
\l Of those five silver (coins) I gave one to Jamal, another one to Arsen and another one to Fatima.

\t Łˤonosi žiman eqerno iduɣor bowƛ’oräy, kak royxo Riħoxaz äčiru q’ˤidarno bˤoƛ’un t’ok’ow dicegon k’ediłin biqinč’u däq.
\m łˤono-si žimu-a-n eqer-n idu-ɣor b-ow-ƛ’oräy kak r-odi-x Riħox-az iči-ru q’ˤida-r-n b-ˤoƛ’u-n t’ok’ow dice-gon k’edi-łin b-iqi-č’u di-q
\g three-ATTR pocket-IN.ESS-TOP put-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL III-bring-SIM.CVB prayer IV-do-IPFV.CVB Rixox-IN.ESS.DIST be-PST.PRT down-LAT-TOP III-fall-PFV.CVB anymore how.much-CNTR search-CNC.CVB III-get-NEG.PST.WIT me-POSS.ESS
\l I put three (coins) in my pocket and when bringing them home, I did a prayer in Rikhokh and they fell down and I couldn't find them anymore no matter how much I searched.

\t Neła ukruƛ’aygon xiriyaw kesu däqno ƛexus mežuq esanix.
\m neła ukru-ƛ’ay-gon xiriyaw kesu di-q-n ƛexu-s mežu-q esi-ani-x
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL silver-SUPER.ABL-CNTR valuable tale me-POSS.ESS-TOP remain-PST.WIT you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-MSD-AD.ESS
\l But the tale is more valuable than the silver and remains for me to tell you.

\t Zownƛax zownč’eyƛax bˤeƛon, boc’in, zirun, qˤayno.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-č’ey-ƛax bˤeƛo-on boc’i-n ziru-n qˤay-n
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-NEG.PST.CVB-QUOT pig-CND wolf-and fox-and hare-and
\l Once upon a time there were a pig, a wolf, a fox and a hare.

\t Sidaquł žedu nasin sadaqorno rutin ħukmu boyn:
\m sidaquł žedu nasin sadaq-r-n r-uti-n ħukmu b-odi-n
\g one.day DEM1.IPL.OBL all together-LAT-TOP III.PL-turn.back-PFV.CVB decision III-do-PST.UNW
\l One day they gathered together and made a decision:

\t Yaqˤułtow ħonƛ’ar miƛ’eł xizay boc’in begirno, neła ža bayrnosi, nasin šet’un rutin riša yołƛin.
\m yaqˤuł-tow ħon-ƛ’ar miƛ’i-ł xizay boc’i-n b-egir-n neła-a ža b-ayr-nosi nasin šet’u-n r-uti-n r-iš-a yoł-ƛin
\g today-EMPH mountain-SUPER.VERS ram-CONT.ESS from.behind wolf-TOP III-send-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG III-bring-ANT.CVB all around-TOP III.PL-turn.back-PFV.CVB III.PL-eat-INF be-QUOT
\l Today the wolf will be sent into the mountains to bring a ram, and then it will be eaten.

\t Boc’ägon neła nełde sadaq kumakyorƛin zirun bižin.
\m boc’i-a-gon neła-a neła-de sadaq kumak-r-ƛin ziru-n b-iži-n
\g wolf-ERG-CNTR DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS together help-LAT-QUOT fox-TOP III-carry-PST.UNW
\l The wolf took the fox with him for help.

\t Bˤeƛägon qˤay łäƛ’or begirno.
\m bˤeƛo-a-gon qˤay łi-ƛ’or b-egir-n
\g pig-ERG-CNTR hare water-SUPER.LAT I.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l And the pig sent the hare for water.

\t Neširutow bˤeƛä c’idoƛ’or ƛoħon rizirno, qˤay łäxay buta begirno.
\m neširu-tow bˤeƛo-a c’i-ƛ’or ƛoħo-n r-izir-n qˤay łi-xay b-uti-a b-egir-n
\g at.night-EMPH pig-ERG fire-SUPER.LAT pan-TOP IV-lift-PFV.CVB hare water-AD.ABL III-return-INF III-send-PST.UNW
\l At night, the pig put the pan on the fire and sent the hare for water again.

\t Nełar neširuxay rukayx zown anu.
\m neła-r neširu-xay r-ukad-x zow-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT at.night-AD.ABL IV-see-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l It couldn't see anything in the night.

\t Q’aymoxor baynosi, bˤeƛä šida boxäƛin esirnosi, qˤayä elo didiwƛa žek’u yołƛin eƛin.
\m q’ay-xor b-ay-nosi bˤeƛo-a šida b-oxi-a-ƛin esir-nosi qˤay-a elo didiw-ƛa žek’u yoł-ƛin eƛi-n
\g shelter-AD.LAT III-come-ANT.CVB pig-ERG why III-run.away-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB hare-ERG there which-INDEF man be-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l After coming to the tent, the pig asked: "Why did you run away?" and the hare said: "There is some man there!"

\t Aħugon łäxor qˤaydegon sadaq zirun bik’in elo bäsuru k’et’uq mi šebiƛin esirnosi, k’et’a di žek’u yołƛin eƛin.
\m aħugon łi-xor qˤay-de-gon sadaq ziru-n b-ik’i-n elo b-esu-ru k’et’u-q mi šebi-ƛin esir-nosi k’et’u-a di žek’u yoł-ƛin eƛi-n
\g again water-AD.LAT hare-APUD.ESS-CNTR together fox-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB there III-exist-PST.PRT cat-POSS.ESS you who-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB cat-ERG me man be-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l Again, the fox, together with the hare, went to the water, where the cat was, and asked: "Who are you?" - "I'm a man!" said the cat.

\t Xizyogon zira šebi ža debez ħiroƛ’ƛin esirnosi, k’et’a tupi yołƛin eƛin.
\m xizyogon ziru-a šebi ža mi-z ħiro-ƛ’-ƛin esir-nosi k’et’u-a tupi yoł-ƛin eƛi-n
\g then fox-ERG what DEM1.SG you-GEN2 shoulder-SUPER.ESS-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB cat-ERG rifle be-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l When the fox asked: "What is that on your shoulder?", the cat said: "It's a rifle."

\t Sosisi zirusno, qˤaysno ʕuraw zer rok’u regin, xizyo ža k’et’u yałru biynosi łˤonon žedu reƛ raħira rik’in.
\m sosi-si ziru-s-n qˤay-s-n ʕuraw zer rok’u r-egi-n xizyo ža k’et’u yoł-ru b-iy-nosi łˤono-n žedu reƛ r-aħi-r-a r-ik’i-n
\g at.first-ATTR fox-GEN1-and hare-GEN1-and very shuddering heart IV-loosen-PFV.CVB after DEM1.SG cat be-PST.PRT III-know-ANT.CVB three-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL meat IV-cook-CAUS-INF III.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l At first, the fox's and the hare's hearts where shuddering, but after they knew it was the cat, the three of them went to cook the meat.

\t Bˤeƛo buqˤełno, ažoz k’odrezaxazay aħyabin roƛik’no kecno bičin, k’et’u c’idox tataniłxo zown.
\m bˤeƛo b-uqˤeł-n ažo-z k’od-bi-xazay aħya-bi-n r-oƛik’-n kec-n b-iči-n k’et’u c’i-x tatanił-x zow-n
\g pig III-hide-PFV.CVB tree-GEN2 bunch-PL-AD.ABL.DIST ear-PL-TOP IV.PL-push.out-PFV.CVB sleep-PFV.CVB III-be-PFV.CVB cat fire-AD.ESS warmthen.oneself-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The pig was hiding behind a bunch of trees, pushing out its ears and sleeping, while the cat was warming itself by the fire.

\t Ža rukayxow, k’et’uz elo aw yołƛin rok’ƛ’orno rayn bet’un bˤeƛez q’ˤimƛ’or k’oƛin.
\m ža r-ukad-xow k’et’u-z elo aw yoł-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n b-et’u-n bˤeƛo-z q’ˤim-ƛ’or k’oƛi-n
\g DEM1.SG IV-see-SEQ cat-GEN2 there mouse be-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB III-jump-PFV.CVB pig-GEN2 head-SUPER.LAT jump-PST.UNW
\l Seeing this, the cat thought there was a mouse and jumped onto the pig's head.

\t Bˤeƛoqgon ixiw qˤaƛun regin, ciqaɣor boxin.
\m bˤeƛo-q-gon ixiw qˤaƛu-n r-egi-n ciq-aɣor b-oxi-n
\g pig-POSS.ESS-CNTR big shout-TOP IV-let.go-PFV.CVB forest-IN.VERS III-run.away-PFV.CVB
\l The pig emitted loud shouts and ran away into the forest.

\t Boc’ezno, qˤayzno, ziruznogon žedaƛ’or ixiwtow žanawar bays bäsuƛin rok’ƛ’orno rayn sidqo sis riqinč’ey k’iriłno roxin.
\m boc’i-z-n qˤay-z-n ziru-z-n-gon žeda-ƛ’or ixiw-tow žanawar b-ay-s b-esu-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n sida-q sis r-iqi-č’ey k’irił-n r-oxi-n
\g wolf-GEN2-and hare-GEN2-and fox-GEN2-and-CNTR DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUPER.LAT big-EMPH wild.animal III-come-PST.WIT III-exist-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PST.UNW one.OBL-POSS.ESS one IV-get-NEG.PST.CVB run.away-PFV.CVB IV-run.away-PST.UNW
\l The wolf, the hare and the fox thought that an animal, larger than themselves, was coming, they ran away, one running faster than the other.

\t Elo zawru miƛ’es c’ik’iw reƛ k’et’ur ƛexun.
\m elo zow-ru miƛ’i-s c’ik’iw reƛ k’et’u-r ƛexu-n
\g there be.NPRS-PST.PRT ram-GEN1 entire meat cat-LAT remain-PST.UNW
\l So the ram's entire meat, which was there, remained for the cat.

\t ʕOƛiran ɣudi baɣʷˤacet’a rac’ace ʕeze roqno k’et’ur boc’esno, zirusno nełar ƛäxuruni dawla.
\m ʕoƛira-n ɣudi b-aɣˤu-ace-t’a r-ac’-ace ʕeze r-oq-n k’et’u-r boc’i-s-n ziru-s-n neła-r ƛexu-ru-ni dawla
\g seven.OBL-TOP day III-be.full-TERM-DISTR IV-eat-TERM be.enough IV-become-PFV.CVB cat-LAT wolf-GEN1-and fox-GEN1-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT remain-PST.PRT-DEF prey
\l And for seven days, there was enough of the prey that remained from the wolf and the fox, left for the cat to get sated.

\t Kidbä eƛin:
\m kid-a eƛi-n
\g daughter-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The daughter said:

\t Babiw kodyox ik’is, eniw neside dandir ʕiyada yik’isƛin”.
\m babiw kodyox ik’i-s eniw nesi-de dandir ʕiyad-a y-ik’i-s-ƛin
\g father to.the.fireplace go-PST.WIT mother DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS together cry-INF II-go-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "Father went to an evening gathering, mother went to cry for him at the meeting."

\t ƛirbar kidbä äƛiru łinasno maʕnan biynč’ey xander ik’in, hemeł kidbä däz sualyor hemedur žawab neƛsiƛin.
\m ƛirba-r kid-a eƛi-ru łina-s-n maʕna-n b-iy-č’ey xan-der ik’i-n hemeł kid-a di-z sual-r hemedur žawab neƛ-s-ƛin
\g guest-LAT girl-ERG say-PST.PRT what.OBL-GEN1-TOP sense-TOP III-know-NEG.PST.CVB khan-APUD.LAT go-PFV.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL girl-ERG me-GEN2 question-LAT so answer give-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The guest didn't understand why the girl said that, went to the king and said "This girl has given me such an answer on my question."

\t Xanä eƛin:
\m xan-a eƛi-n
\g khan-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The king said:

\t Mi nełqor eƛo:
\m mi neła-qor eƛi-o
\g you DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-IMPR
\l "Tell her:

\t Ža saɣyatno bown bownč’ey, zown zownč’ey dädäɣor nexoƛin”.
\m ža saɣyat-n b-ow-n b-ow-č’ey zow-n zow-č’ey di-däɣor nex-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG present-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB III-bring-NEG.PST.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB ride-NEG.PST.CVB me-APUD.VERS come-IMPR-QUOT
\l This present [to bring or not to bring, to be or not to be]; come to me!"

\t Aɣin bisno, adäzgon boc’no t’ekan kid xandäɣor yik’in.
\m aɣi-n b-is-n adäz-gon b-oc’-n t’eka-n kid xan-däɣor y-ik’i-n
\g bird-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB ahead-CNTR III-drive-PFV.CVB he.goat-TOP girl khan-APUD.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l Having taken a bird and chased a goat ahead, the girl went to the king.

\t Elor yaynosi, yiła xanqor aɣi teƛxo zown.
\m elo-r y-ay-nosi yiła-a xan-qor aɣi teƛ-x zow-n
\g there-LAT II-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG khan-POSS.LAT bird give-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After she arrived there, she wanted to give the bird to the king.

\t Nesä reƛ’a regirƛ’oräy, aɣi boxin.
\m nesi-a reƛ’a r-egir-ƛ’oräy aɣi b-oxi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG hand IV-let-SIM.CVB bird III-run.away-PST.UNW
\l When he opened his hand, the bird flew away.

\t Xan ħayran oqno ezun ƛexun.
\m xan ħayran oq-n ezu-n ƛexu-n
\g khan be.astonished become-PFV.CVB look-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l The king remained looking surprised.

\t Beže bertenno boyn, xanä ža kid barułun yown.
\m b-eže berten-n b-odi-n xan-a ža kid baru-łun y-ow-n
