\g III-big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB khan-ERG DEM1.SG girl wife-LHUN II-marry-PST.UNW
\l A big marriage was arranged and the king married that girl.

\t Neł bertenyołer hokobin sadaq gulubin rayrno tabanaw xalq’i bayn.
\m neła berten-łer hoko-bi-n sadaq gulu-bi-n r-ayr-n tabanaw xalq’i b-ay-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL marriage-CONT.LAT carriage-PL-and together horse-PL-and III.PL-bring-PFV.CVB enough people III-come-PST.UNW
\l To that marriage came many people, bringing carriages and horses.

\t Hemełaquł sida sirya k’eč’oli bodin.
\m hemełaqu-ł sida siryo-a k’eč’oli b-odi-n
\g that.day-CONT.ESS one.OBL mare-ERG foal III-do-PST.UNW
\l That day, one mare gave birth to a foal.

\t Ža k’eč’oli hokomxo zown.
\m ža k’eč’oli hoko-x zow-n
\g DEM1.SG foal carriage-AD.ESS be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The foal was at the carriage.

\t Siryos bet’erhanesno, hokožek’usno k’eč’oliƛäy bitor q’ecen boqno:
\m siryo-s bet’erhan-s-n hokožek’u-s-n k’eč’oli-ƛay bitor q’ecen b-oq-n
\g mare-GEN1 master-GEN1-and coachman-GEN1-and foal-SUB.ABL thither argument I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l An argument over the foal arose between the mare's master's and the coachman:

\t Dey yoł yeduƛin sis, dey yołƛin sis.
\m di-s yoł yedu-ƛin sis di-s yoł-ƛin sis
\g me-GEN1 be DEM2.IISG-QUOT one me-GEN1 be-QUOT one
\l "It is mine" said one of them, "it's mine" said the other.

\t Amma k’eč’oli hokomeł xizay baħnayx zown.
\m amma k’eč’oli hoko-ł xizay b-aħnad-x zow-n
\g but foal carriage-CONT.ESS from.behind III-walk.around-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l But the foal was walking around behind the carriage.

\t Daʕba łiyranixƛin žedu q’ˤanon xander bik’in.
\m daʕba łiyr-ani-x-ƛin žedu q’ˤano-n xan-der b-ik’i-n
\g dispute finish-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT DEM1.IPL two-TOP khan-APUD.LAT I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l In order to resolve the dispute, they both went to the king.

\t Xanä hokožek’ur k’eč’olin xecin, daʕbałäy žedun boɣno.
\m xan-a hokožek’u-r k’eč’oli-n xeci-n daʕba-łay žedu-n b-oɣ-n
\g khan-ERG coachman-LAT foal-TOP leave-PFV.CVB dispute-CONT.ABL DEM1.IPL-TOP III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l The king left the foal to the coachman and freed them from their dispute.

\t Siryos bet’erhanä q’ʷaridno oqno sadaq šebin ik’in ec’noni xanzo baruq esin.
\m siryo-s bet’erhan-a q’ʷarid-n oq-n sadaq šebin ik’i-n ec’no-ni xan-zo baru-q esi-n
\g mare-GEN1 master-ERG sadness-TOP become-PFV.CVB all thing go-PFV.CVB new-DEF khan-ATTR.OBL wife-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW
\l The mare's master became sad and told the king's new wife how all the things happened.

\t Neła eƛin nesiqor:
\m neła-a eƛi-n nesi-qor
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l She said to him:

\t Sasaq nexno maħlay xanqor qˤaƛo mi, c’ik’iw raładyołäy besurobin roqno, žeda debi räƛiru šebin rac’noƛin.
\m sasaq nex-n maħla-ay xan-qor qˤaƛi-o mi c’ik’iw raład-łay besuro-bi-n r-oq-n žedu-a mi-s r-iƛi-ru šebin r-ac’-n-ƛin
\g tomorrow come-PFV.CVB court-IN.ABL khan-POSS.LAT shout-IMPR you all sea-CONT.ABL fish-PL-TOP III.PL-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-ERG you-GEN1 IV-plant-PST.PRT thing IV.PL-eat-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l "Come tomorrow and shout from the court tomorrow, that all the fish got out of the sea and ate what you planted."

\t Xanä dowqor neti deber raładyołäy besurobi madaħor roqno rukadäƛin eƛinosi, mi eƛo, qaciz hoka k’eč’oli boyzaƛ’, raładyołäy besurobi madaħor raqruyä raq’ˤuƛin”.
\m xan-a mi-qor neti mi-r raład-łay besuro-bi madaħor r-oq-n r-ukad-a-ƛin eƛi-nosi mi eƛi-o qaci-z hoko-a k’eč’oli b-odi-zaƛ’ raład-łay besuro-bi madaħor r-oq-ru-a r-aq’ˤu-ƛin
\g khan-ERG you-POSS.LAT when you-LAT sea-CONT.ABL fish-PL outside III.PL-become-PFV.CVB III.PL-see-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT say-ANT.CVB you say-IMPR firewood-GEN2 carriage-IN.ESS foal III-do-CSL.CVB sea-CONT.ABL fish-PL outside III.PL-become-PST.PRT-Q III.PL-much-QUOT
\l After the king said to you: "When did you saw fish coming out of the sea?", say that because the foal was born on the wooden carriage, is it more (of a surprise) for fish to come out of the sea?

\t Hudayzikotow maħlarno ik’in siryoz bet’erhanä xanez bara äƛiruxor qˤaƛin.
\m hudayziko-tow maħla-ar-n ik’i-n siryo-z bet’erhan-a xan-z baru-a äƛiru-xor qˤaƛi-n
\g the.next.day-EMPH court-IN.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB mare-GEN2 master-ERG khan-GEN2 wife-ERG ORD-AD.LAT shout-PST.UNW
\l The next day, the mare's master went to the court and shouted what the king's wife told him.

\t Xizyo xanä nesir žawab teƛno:
\m xizyo xan-a nesi-r žawab teƛ-n
\g after khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT answer give-PST.UNW
\l After that, the king answered him:

\t Mi ʕadalä oqno, neti deber teqä raładyołäy maħor besurobi roqnoƛin?”
\m mi ʕadal-a oq-n neti mi-r teq-a raład-łay maħor besuro-bi r-oq-n-ƛin
\g you intoxication-Q become-PFV.CVB when you-LAT hear-Q sea-CONT.ABL outside fish-PL III.PL-become-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l "Where you drunked, when you hear that the fish came out of the sea?"

\t Siryoz bet’erhanä eƛin:
\m siryo-z bet’erhan-a eƛi-n
\g mare-GEN2 master-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l The mare's master said:

\t Hoka k’eč’oli badiru raładyołäy madaħor besurobi raqruyä raq’ˤuƛin”.
\m hoko-a k’eč’oli b-odi-ru raład-łay madaħor besuro-bi r-oq-ru-a r-aq’ˤu-ƛin
\g carriage-IN.ESS foal III-do-PST.PRT sea-CONT.ABL outside fish-PL III.PL-become-PST.PRT-Q III.PL-much-QUOT
\l "Is it really that much (of a surprise) fish came out of the sea, than a foal was born on the carriage?"

\t Idur aynosi, xanä ec’noni baruqor eƛin:
\m idu-r ay-nosi xan-a ec’no-ni baru-qor eƛi-n
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB khan-ERG new-DEF wife-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l After coming home, the king said to his new wife:

\t Sida idu q’ˤuna xaner moči boqxosi anu.
\m sida idu q’ˤuna xan-r moči b-oq-xosi anu
\g one.OBL home two.OBL khan-LAT place I.PL-become-PRS.PRT be.NEG
\l In one home there is no place for two kings.

\t Deber rätiru šebinon risno debez mi eni- obiydäɣor yik’iƛin”.
\m mi-r r-eti-ru šebinon r-is-n mi-z mi eni obiw-däɣor y-ik’i-ƛin
\g you-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT something IV-take-PFV.CVB you-GEN2 you mother father-APUD.VERS II-go-QUOT
\l Take whatever you want, then go to your parents.

\t Elor baynosi, yizi q’ˤanon bik’in hiɣa bixił kecno.
\m elo-r b-ay-nosi yizi q’ˤano-n b-ik’i-n hiɣu-a bix-ł kec-n
\g there-LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL two-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB hayloft-IN.ESS hay-CONT.ESS sleep-PST.UNW
\l When they came there, the two of them went into the hayloft to sleep in the hay.

\t Ħaƛuxozoxay uyxor aynosi, xanä esirno:
\m ħaƛu-xozo-xay uyxor ay-nosi xan-a esir-n
\g drink-PRS.PRT.OBL-AD.ABL alright come-ANT.CVB khan-ERG ask-PST.UNW
\l After the king came to senses, he asked:

\t Nazay di t’or ayäƛin?”
\m nazay di t’o-r ay-a-ƛin
\g from.where me here-LAT come-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l "How did I came here?"

\t Bara eƛin:
\m baru-a eƛi-n
\g wife-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l His wife said:

\t Di mi ows eluz boqno zawru q’ut’imoxor.
\m di mi ow-s elu-z b-oq-n zow-ru q’ut’i-xor
\g me you bring-PST.WIT we(I).OBL-GEN2 III-happen-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT agreement-AD.LAT
\l "I brought you, because of the agreement we had.

\t Mi eƛis, där rätiru šebinon risno eni- obiydäɣor yik’iƛin.
\m mi eƛi-s di-r r-eti-ru šebinon r-is-n eni obiw-däɣor y-ik’i-ƛin
\g you say-PST.WIT me-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT something IV-take-PFV.CVB mother father-APUD.VERS II-go-QUOT
\l You said, I could take what I want and go to my parents.

\t Ele, där etixosi min own din nexsiƛin”.
\m ele di-r eti-xosi mi-n ow-n di-n nex-s-ƛin
\g here me-LAT love-PRS.PRT you-TOP bring-PFV.CVB me-TOP come-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l So there, I took my beloved you and I came."

\t Mi dey ħal bayrinč’uƛin, xanä sadaq barun yoɣno, žeda žeduz ɣˤutkaɣor nexno.
\m mi di-s ħal b-ayr-č’u-ƛin xan-a sadaq baru-n y-oɣ-n žedu-a žedu-z ɣˤutku-aɣor nex-n
\g you me-GEN1 strength III-bring-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT khan-ERG together wife-TOP II-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 house-IN.VERS come-PST.UNW
\l "You win", the king took his wife and they went to their house together.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder xanä xalq’imoł teł rit’uqłi rodaniƛ’ ƛ’iri ičix zown.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder xan-a xalq’i-ł teł rit’uqłi r-odi-a-ni-ƛ’ ƛ’iri iči-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after khan-ERG people-CONT.ESS inside justice IV-do-INF-DEF-SUPER.ESS above be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After that, the king tried to serve justice among the people.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l Kuruch, pearl; day, become clean; sun, come.

\t Sis zown zirun zeyn.
\m sis zow-n ziru-n zey-n
\g one be.NPRS-PST.UNW fox-and bear-and
\l Once there was a fox and a bear.

\t Žedu sadaq ričix zown.
\m žedu sadaq r-iči-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL together III.PL-be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They lived together.

\t Ixdaxasi zaman baynosi, žeda sadaqay moči biƛin.
\m ixdax-si zaman b-ay-nosi žedu-a sadaq-ay moči b-iƛi-n
\g in.spring-ATTR time III-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL-ERG together-IN.ABL field III-plough-PST.UNW
\l When the spring came, they ploughed the field together.

\t Sidaquł azu kosiƛ’oräy, zirun, zeyn hemedurtow sadaq mečołxor rik’in.
\m sidaquł azu kosi-ƛ’oräy ziru-n zey-n hemedur-tow sadaq moči-łxor r-ik’i-n
\g one.day harvest gather-SIM.CVB fox-and bear-and so-EMPH together field-CONT.VERS III.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l One day, while gathering the harvest, the fox and the bear went to the field together.

\t Zeyä q’ˤogedtow qˤiči kosix zown, zira sist’a ƛ’ara but’ix bičäsi zown.
\m zey-a q’ˤog-d-tow qˤiči kosi-x zow-n ziru-a sist’a ƛ’ara b-ut’i-x b-iči-asi zow-n
\g bear-ERG hay.bale-INSTR-EMPH harvest gather-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB fox-ERG one.at.a.time ear.of.corn III-rip.out-IPFV.CVB III-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The bear packed the harvest together in hay bales, the fox was the one who ripped out the ears one after another.

\t Mečołer raynosi, boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, zira im-m-m-m, im-m-m-mƛin eƛin.
\m moči-łer r-ay-nosi b-oƛƛo b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow ziru-a im~m~m~m im~m~m~m-ƛin eƛi-n
\g field-CONT.LAT III.PL-come-ANT.CVB III-middle III-much time I.PL-go-POST.CVB-EMPH fox-ERG mhmhmh mhmhmh-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l After coming to the field, not much time passed until the fox said: "Mhmhmh, mhmhmh!"

\t Šebi roqno, ziruƛin?” - zeyä esirno.
\m šebi r-oq-n ziru-ƛin - zey-a esir-n
\g what IV-happen-PST.UNW fox-QUOT - bear-ERG ask-PST.UNW
\l "What happened, fox?", asked the bear.

\t Zey, däz halmaɣer uži odin.
\m zey di-z halmaɣ-r uži odi-n
\g bear me-GEN2 friend-LAT son do-PST.UNW
\l "Bear, a friend of mine has born a son.

\t Di nesiƛ’ ci ceda bik’a bayxƛin.”
\m di nesi-ƛ’ ci cedi-a b-ik’i-a b-ay-x-ƛin
\g me DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS name name-INF I.PL-go-INF I.PL-must-PRS-QUOT
\l I must go give him a name."

\t Nedur resunäy bik’i huduƛin” - eƛin zeyä.
\m nedur r-esu-näy b-ik’i hudu-ƛin - eƛi-n zey-a
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB III-go so-QUOT - say-PST.UNW bear-ERG
\l "If that's the case, then go!", said the bear.

\t Šebi ci cedäƛin?” - esirno zeyä.
\m šebi ci cedi-a-ƛin - esir-n zey-a
\g what name name-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT - ask-PST.UNW bear-ERG
\l "How was he named?", asked the bear.

\t Meč’oƛäyr bayäru cedisƛin” - eƛin zira.
\m meč’-ƛer b-ayr-ru cedi-s-ƛin - eƛi-n ziru-a
\g neck-SUB.LAT III-bring-PST.PRT name-PST.WIT-QUOT - say-PST.UNW fox-ERG
\l "He was named 'up-to-the-neck'", said the fox.

\t Daɣaw bičintowgon zira im-m-m-m, im-m-m-mƛin eƛin.
\m daɣaw b-iči-n-tow-gon ziru-a im~m~m~m im~m~m~m-ƛin eƛi-n
\g a.bit III-wait-PFV.CVB-EMPH-CNTR fox-ERG mhmhmh mhmhmh-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l Waiting for a while, the fox said "Mhmhmh, mhmhmh."

\t Šebi roqno, ziruƛin?” - esirno zeyä.
\m šebi r-oq-n ziru-ƛin - esir-n zey-a
\g what IV-happen-PST.UNW fox-QUOT - ask-PST.UNW bear-ERG
\l "What happened, fox?", asked the bear.

\t Däz halmaɣer uži odinƛin” - eƛin zira.
\m di-z halmaɣ-r uži odi-n-ƛin - eƛi-n ziru-a
\g me-GEN2 friend-LAT son do-PST.UNW-QUOT - say-PST.UNW fox-ERG
\l "A friend of mine has born a son", said the fox.

\t Bik’i hudu cin cedin horoƛin” - eƛin zeyä.
\m b-ik’i hudu ci-n cedi-n horo-ƛin - eƛi-n zey-a
\g III-go so name-TOP name-PFV.CVB come.IMPR-QUOT - say-PST.UNW bear-ERG
\l "So go, give him a name and come back!", said the bear.

\t Bezunč’ey ziru idurno bik’in, boƛƛäyr riłis q’ut’un bižin xizor butin yałza mečołxor zeydäɣor bik’in.
\m b-ezu-č’ey ziru idu-r-n b-ik’i-n b-oƛƛo-ƛer rił-s q’ut’u-n b-iži-n xizor b-uti-n yoł-za moči-łxor zey-däɣor b-ik’i-n
\g III-look-NEG.PST.CVB fox home-LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB III-middle-SUB.LAT butter-GEN1 earthen.jug-TOP III-take.out-PFV.CVB back III-turn.back-PFV.CVB be-LCV.CVB field-CONT.VERS bear-APUD.VERS III-go-PST.UNW
\l Without looking back, the fox went home, ate the butter out of the earthen jug up to the half, returned back to the field and went to the bear.

\t Zeyä šebi ci cedäƛin esirnosi, zira boƛƛäyr bayäru cedisƛin eƛin.
\m zey-a šebi ci cedi-a-ƛin esir-nosi ziru-a b-oƛƛo-ƛer b-ayr-ru cedi-s-ƛin eƛi-n
\g bear-ERG what name name-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB fox-ERG III-middle-SUB.LAT III-bring-PST.PRT name-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l After the bear had asked, what name they gave him, the fox said, they named him 'up-to-the-middle'.

\t Sida saʕatyacegon mečołno beynoyn zira im-m-m-m, im-m-m-mƛin eƛin.
\m sida saʕat-ace-gon moči-ł-n b-eynod-n ziru-a im~m~m~m im~m~m~m-ƛin eƛi-n
\g one.OBL hour-TERM-CNTR field-CONT.ESS-TOP III-work-PFV.CVB fox-ERG mhmhmh mhmhmh-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l And after working on the field for one hour, the fox said "Mhmhmh, mhmhmh!"

\t Hoboygon šebi roqno, ziruƛin?” - esirno zeyä.
\m hoboy-gon šebi r-oq-n ziru-ƛin - esir-n zey-a
\g now-CNTR what IV-happen-PST.UNW fox-QUOT - ask-PST.UNW bear-ERG
\l "And what happened now, fox?", asked the bear.

\t Däz halmaɣer sisgon uži odinƛin” - eƛin zira.
\m di-z halmaɣ-r sis-gon uži odi-n-ƛin - eƛi-n ziru-a
\g me-GEN2 friend-LAT one-CNTR son do-PST.UNW-QUOT - say-PST.UNW fox-ERG
\l "My friend has born another son", said the fox.

\t Bik’i hudu cin cedin horoƛin” - eƛin zeyä.
\m b-ik’i hudu ci-n cedi-n horo-ƛin - eƛi-n zey-a
\g III-go so name-TOP name-PST.UNW come.IMPR-QUOT - say-PST.UNW bear-ERG
\l "So go, give him a name and come back!", said the fox.

\t Zira hemedurtow idurno bik’in sadaq q’ut’uma yałru rił ragin łiyrno.
\m ziru-a hemedur-tow idu-r-n b-ik’i-n sadaq q’ut’u-a yoł-ru rił r-agi-n łiyr-n
\g fox-ERG so-EMPH home-LAT-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB all earthen.jug-ERG be-PST.PRT butter IV-lick-PFV.CVB finish-PST.UNW
\l So the fox went home and licked up all the butter that was in the earthen jug.

\t Mečołer baynosi šebi ci cedäƛin zeyä esirnosi, zira iƛ’aqor bayru cedisƛin eƛin.
\m moči-łer b-ay-nosi šebi ci cedi-a-ƛin zey-a esir-nosi ziru-a iƛ’u-qor b-ay-ru cedi-s-ƛin eƛi-n
\g field-CONT.LAT III-come-ANT.CVB what name name-Q-QUOT bear-ERG ask-ANT.CVB fox-ERG bottom-POSS.LAT III-come-PST.PRT name-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l When he came back to the field, the bear asked what name they gave him, and then the fox said, they named him "up-to-the-bottom".

\t Hay riguƛin, reynoyx neširur ričin.
\m hay r-igu-ƛin r-eynod-x neširu-r r-iči-n
\g so.then IV-good-QUOT IV-work-IPFV.CVB evening-LAT III.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l Well then, he said, so they worked until the evening.

\t Močin kosin łiyn idur raynosi, zeyä q’ut’un bisno esirno:
\m moči-n kosi-n łiy-n idu-r r-ay-nosi zey-a q’ut’u-n b-is-n esir-n
\g field-TOP gather-PFV.CVB end-PFV.CVB home-LAT III.PL-come-ANT.CVB bear-ERG earthen.jug-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW
\l And after they finished gathering the crop and went home, the bear took the jug and asked:

\t T’ay rił łu ragäƛin?”
\m t’ay rił łu r-agi-a-ƛin
\g from.here butter who.ERG IV-lick-Q-QUOT
\l "Who licked the butter out of it?"

\t Zira eƛin: c’idoq gugu yukarčey, hemełƛ’o xizyo łu rägiru räyƛin.”
\m ziru-a eƛi-n c’i-q gugu y-ukar-čey hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo łu r-agi-ru r-äy-ƛin
\g fox-ERG say-PFV.CVB fire-POSS.ESS back II-show-INTS DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after who.ERG IV-lick-PST.PRT IV-know.FUTIND-QUOT
\l The fox said: "Expose your back to the fire, afterwards, we will know, who licked it away."

\t Zeyä gugu c’eyƛ’oräy, enduräz biynč’ey bik’in zira xizaz c’i atinosi, zeyq regin:
\m zey-a gugu c’ey-ƛ’oräy endur-az b-iy-č’ey b-ik’i-n ziru-a xizaz c’i iti-nosi zey-q r-egi-n
\g bear-ERG back heat.up-SIM.CVB that.way-IN.ESS.DIST III-know-NEG.PST.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB fox-ERG from.behind fire touch-ANT.CVB bear-POSS.ESS IV-let.go-PST.UNW
\l When the bear heated his back, the fox secretly approached and when he set him on fire, the bear said:

\t Di ragin zown.
\m di r-agi-n zow-n
\g me IV-lick-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "I licked it up.

\t C’i rit’roƛin.”
\m c’i r-it’r-o-ƛin
\g fire IV-extinguish-IMPR-QUOT
\l Extinguish the fire!"

\t Kecnosi zira riłiqosi hut’-mˤali ragi-rac’ƛ’oräy, zeyä esirno:
\m kec-nosi ziru-a rił-q-si hut’~mˤali r-agi-ac’-ƛ’oräy zey-a esir-n
\g sleep-ANT.CVB fox-ERG butter-POSS.ESS-ATTR front.part.of.the.face IV-lick.up-eat-SIM.CVB bear-ERG ask-PST.UNW
\l After they went to sleep, the fox licked up butter from his face, and the bear asked:

\t Zirulaw, mi šebi rac’xoƛin?”
\m ziru-law mi šebi r-ac’-x-ƛin
\g fox-VOC you what IV-eat-PRS-QUOT
\l "My dear fox, what are you eating?"

\t Dey di roɣno ozuri rac’xo, debi min rac’oƛin” - žawab teƛno zira.
\m di-s di r-oɣ-n ozuri r-ac’-x mi-s mi-n r-ac’-o-ƛin - žawab teƛ-n ziru-a
\g me-GEN1 me IV-take.away-PFV.CVB eye IV-eat-PRS you-GEN1 you-TOP IV-eat-IMPR-QUOT - answer give-PST.UNW fox-ERG
\l "I eat the eye I have removed, eat yours too!", answered the fox.

\t Xizyo zeyä neła nełas ozurabi roɣno rac’no.
\m xizyo zey-a neła-a neła-s ozuri-bi r-oɣ-n r-ac’-n
\g after bear-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 eye-PL IV.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB IV-eat-PST.UNW
\l Then the bear took out his own eyes and ate them.

\t Sasaqosi zira eƛin: ƛa ħažƛ’aɣor rik’an q’anon sadaqƛin.”
\m sasaqosi ziru-a eƛi-n ƛa ħaž-ƛ’aɣor r-ik’i-an q’ˤano-n sadaq-ƛin
\g in.the.morning fox-ERG say-PST.UNW go.IMPR hajj-SUPER.VERS IV-go-FUT.DEF two-TOP together-QUOT
\l In the morning, the fox said: "Come, let's go on hajj (pilgrimage) together."

\t Didur di ħažƛ’o bik’an, däz ozzar šebin rukayxanuwaƛin?” - zeyä eƛin.
\m didur di ħaž-ƛ’ b-ik’i-an di-z ozuri-bi-r šebin r-ukad-x-anu-ya-ƛin - zey-a eƛi-n
\g how me hajj-SUPER.ESS III-go-FUT.DEF me-GEN2 eye-PL-LAT thing IV-see-PRS-NEG-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT - bear-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "How should I go on hajj, when my eyes can't see a thing?", the bear said.

\t Zira eƛin: rigu huni yałza sadaq rik’an, žuka huni yałza reƛ’ixno bisno di boɣanƛin.”
\m ziru-a eƛi-n r-igu huni yoł-za sadaq r-ik’i-an žuka huni yoł-za reƛ’a-x-n b-is-n di b-oɣ-an-ƛin
\g fox-ERG say-PST.UNW IV-good way be-LCV.CVB together III.PL-go-FUT.DEF bad way be-LCV.CVB hand-AD.ESS-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB me III-take.away-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The fox said: "We will go together where there's a good road, and I'll take you by the hand on a bad way"

\t Zira hudun zey muk’urno bodin, q’ˤanon žedu hunix roqno.
\m ziru-a hudun zey muk’ur-n b-odi-n q’ˤano-n žedu huni-x r-oq-n
\g fox-ERG nevertheless bear confess-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB two-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL way-AD.ESS III.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l Nevertheless, the fox convinced the bear so the two of them got on their way.

\t Sidaɣ osiw qoqƛ’or raynosi, zira, ent’az rigu huni yołƛin, zey qoqƛ’ay wˤałer begirno.
\m sidaɣ osiw qoq-ƛ’or r-ay-nosi ziru-a ent’a-az r-igu huni yoł-ƛin zey qoq-ƛ’ay wˤał-r b-egir-n
\g in.one.place high cliff-SUPER.LAT III.PL-come-ANT.CVB fox-ERG from.here-IN.ESS.DIST IV-good way be-QUOT bear cliff-SUPER.ABL downward-LAT III-let-PST.UNW
\l They came to a high cliff in one place, so the fox said "Here is a good way!", and let the bear go down from the cliff.

\t Waħa keran c’oxno, zeyn bexun.
\m waħo kero-a-n c’ox-n zey-n b-exu-n
\g below ravine-IN.ESS-TOP hit-PFV.CVB bear-TOP III-die-PST.UNW
\l The bear fell into the ravine below and died.

\t Zirur ɣˤutkun, kosin zawru sadaq qˤičin, c’ik’iw maʕišatno ƛexun, paraxat zirun bičin.
\m ziru-r ɣˤutku-n kosi-n zow-ru sadaq qˤiči-n c’ik’iw maʕišat-n ƛexu-n paraxat ziru-n b-iči-n
\g fox-LAT house-TOP gather-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT together harvest-TOP entire fortune-TOP remain-PFV.CVB calm fox-TOP III-be-PST.UNW
\l The house, the harvest that had been gathered and the entire fortune remained for the fox, and so the fox lived happily ever after.

\t Zownƛax zownanuƛax q’ˤano halmaɣ netintow sadaq bełiƛ’ bik’ixosi.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax q’ˤano halmaɣ netin-tow sadaq bełi-ƛ’ b-ik’i-xosi
\g be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT two friend always-EMPH together hunting-SUPER.ESS I.PL-go-PRS.PRT
\l Once upon a time, there were two friends, who always went hunting.

\t Žedułäy sis zown netintow buyxor mec esixosi, sidenä heresi gurow esix zown anu.
\m žedu-łay sis zow-n netin-tow b-uy-xor mec esi-xosi sida-ni-a heresi gurow esi-x zow-n anu
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ABL one be.NPRS-PFV.CVB always-EMPH III-true-AD.LAT language tell-PRS.PRT one.OBL-DEF-ERG false except tell-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l One of them was always telling the truth, the other one told nothing but lies.

\t Sidaquł yizi q’ˤanon bełiƛ’ bik’in.
\m sidaquł yizi q’ˤano-n bełi-ƛ’ b-ik’i-n
\g one.day DEM2.IPL.OBL two-TOP wild.goat-SUPER.ESS I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l One day the two of them went hunting.

\t Neła quł yiził siskin ciqes šebin dandi keze roqno anu.
\m neła qu-ł yizi-ł siskin ciq-s šebin dandi keze r-oq-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS anything forest-GEN1 thing only meet IV-become-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l That day, they didn't encounter anything at all in the forest.

\t Heresi mec esixozo eƛin:
\m heresi mec esi-xozo eƛi-n
\g false language tell-PRS.PRT.OBL say-PST.UNW
\l The liar said:

\t Buqbetax godek’anär baynosi, ʕoloqza bełi biqiyä yaqˤułƛin esirnäy, biqisƛin, eƛanƛin”.
\m buqbeta-x godek’an-ar b-ay-nosi ʕoloq-bi-a bełi b-iqi-ya yaqˤuł-ƛin esir-näy b-iqi-s-ƛin eƛi-an-ƛin
\g sunset-AD.ESS village.square-IN.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB young.person-PL-ERG deer III-get-PST.WIT.Q today-QUOT ask-CND.CVB III-get-PST.WIT-QUOT say-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l If the people ask "Caught a deer today?", when we come to the godekan [gathering at the village square] at sunset, I will say "Yes, we did."

\t Buqbetałer ʕaƛarno bik’in, dahaw iduzan bičin, godek’anyaɣor ʕoloqzałxor boqno.
\m buqbeta-łer ʕaƛ-ar-n b-ik’i-n dahaw idu-za-n b-iči-n godek’an-aɣor ʕoloq-bi-łxor b-oq-n
\g sunset-CONT.LAT village-IN.LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB a.little home-DIST-TOP I.PL-be-PFV.CVB village.square-IN.VERS young.person-PL-CONT.VERS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l At sunset they went into the village, spent some time at home, and went to the people at the godekan.

\t Adäz elor bit’araw mec esixosini ayn.
\m adäz elo-r bit’araw mec esi-xosi-ni ay-n
\g ahead there-LAT true language tell-PRS.PRT-DEF come-PST.UNW
\l The one who always said the truth went ahead.

\t ʕOloqza yisiq bełi biqiyäƛin esirnosi, nesä eƛin:
\m ʕoloq-bi-a yisi-q bełi b-iqi-ya-ƛin esir-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n
\g young.person-PL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS wild.goat III-get-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l When the people asked him, if they got a deer, he said:

\t Bukada bukays, amma hil č’aq’ˤinč’uƛin”.
\m b-ukad-a b-ukad-s amma hil č’aq’ˤi-č’u-ƛin
\g I.PL-see-INF I.PL-see-PST.WIT but bullet fall.down-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "We looked and looked, but the bullet didn't hit."

\t Nesiłgon xizaz iłetow salamno teƛno, žeduł teł heresi mec esixosi ayn q’ˤida ičin.
\m nesi-ł-gon xizaz iłe-tow salam-n teƛ-n žedu-ł teł heresi mec esi-xosi ay-n q’ˤida iči-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-CNTR from.behind as-EMPH greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside false language tell-PRS.PRT come-PFV.CVB down sit-PST.UNW
\l The liar came greeting from behind, went to join them and sat down.

\t ʕOloqza esirno:
\m ʕoloq-bi esir-n
\g young.person-PL ask-PST.UNW
\l The people asked:

\t Šebi roqä yaqˤuł bełisno, debinƛin?”
\m šebi r-oq-a yaqˤuł bełi-s-n mi-s-n-ƛin
\g what IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT today deer-GEN1-and you-GEN1-and-QUOT
\l "What happened to the deer and you, today?"

\t Čanno suƛƛi boƛixno sis hil karun, bˤulamzałäy aħyałerno c’oxno łˤora k’onč’aƛ’or boxin bik’isƛin”, - žawab teƛno heresi mec esixoza.
\m čan-n suƛƛi b-oƛix-n sis hil kur-run bˤula-bi-łay aħya-łer-n c’ox-n łˤora k’onč’u-ƛ’or b-oxi-n b-ik’i-s-ƛin - žawab teƛ-n heresi mec esi-xozo-a
\g deer-TOP suddenly III-appear-PFV.CVB one bullet throw-IMM.ANT.CVB hoof-PL-CONT.ABL ear-CONT.LAT-TOP hit-PFV.CVB three.OBL leg-SUPER.LAT III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.WIT-QUOT - answer give-PST.UNW false language tell-PRS.PRT.OBL-ERG
\l "A deer suddenly appeared and the bullet that was shot, hit it through the legs and pierced the ear, so it ran away on its three legs", answered the liar.

\t Nasin ʕoloqbi waħƛin bik’in, didur aħyałäy bˤulamzałer sis hil c’oxxoƛin.
\m nasin ʕoloq-bi waħƛi-n b-ik’i-n didur aħya-łay bˤula-bi-łer sis hil c’ox-x-ƛin
\g all young.person-PL laughter-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB how ear-CONT.ABL hoof-PL-CONT.LAT one bullet hit-PRS-QUOT
\l And all the people went "Whoa! How could one bullet hit it from the ear to the hoofs?"

\t Eƛa šebinon koƛ’inč’ey haqa ogun heresi mec esixosini ƛexasi yałzay, buyxor mec esixosini ħalarno oƛixno eƛin:
\m eƛi-a šebinon koƛ’i-č’ey haqu-a ogu-n heresi mec esi-xosi-ni ƛexu-asi yoł-zay b-uy-xor mec esi-xosi-ni ħal-ar-n oƛix-n eƛi-n
\g say-INF something understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB mouth-IN.ESS gape-PFV.CVB false language tell-PRS.PRT-DEF remain-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB III-true-AD.LAT language tell-PRS.PRT-DEF strength-IN.LAT-TOP appear-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l While the liar stood there with an open mouth not knowing what to say, and the one who always said the truth came to help and said:

\t Meži nełaƛ’ ħayran baqno:
\m meži neła-ƛ’ ħayran b-oq-n
\g you.PL DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS be.astonished I.PL-become-PROHIB
\l "Don't be astonished about this:

\t Nesä tupi caƛiƛ’oräy, čanmo bˤulamed aħya ħaħxo zownƛin”.
\m nesi-a tupi caƛi-ƛ’oräy čan-mo bˤula-d aħya ħaħ-x zow-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG rifle shoot.with-SIM.CVB deer-ERG hoof-INSTR ear scratch-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l When he threw the rifle, the goat was scratching its ear with a hoof."

\t ʕAƛos ʕoloqbi nesiƛ’ bužzi boqno.
\m ʕaƛ-s ʕoloq-bi nesi-ƛ’ bužzi b-oq-n
\g village-GEN1 young.person-PL DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS trust I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The village people trusted him.

\t Iduɣor bik’iƛ’oräy, buyxor mec esixoza hersiqanqor eƛin:
\m idu-ɣor b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy b-uy-xor mec esi-xozo-a hersiqan-qor eƛi-n
\g home-IN.ALL I.PL-go-SIM.CVB III-true-AD.LAT language tell-PRS.PRT.OBL-ERG liar-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l When they went home, the one who always told the truth said to the liar:

\t Esa koƛ’inč’izaƛ’, heresi mec esa baynč’i.
\m esi-a koƛ’i-č’i-zaƛ’ heresi mec esi-a b-ay-č’i
\g tell-INF understand.to-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB false language tell-INF I.PL-must-NEG.FUT
\l "When you don't know what to say, you shouldn't tell a lie.

\t Nełarno maxšel betixosi.
\m neła-r-n maxšel b-eti-xosi
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT-TOP skill III-want-PRS.PRT
\l And that requires skill.

\t T’ok’ow heresi mec esanix rok’ƛ’or rayärnoƛin.”
\m t’ok’ow heresi mec esi-ani-x rok’u-ƛ’or r-ayr-n-ƛin
\g anymore false language tell-MSD-AD.ESS heart-SUPER.LAT IV-bring-PROHIB-QUOT
\l Don't come up with the idea of telling lies again.

\t Zownƛax zown anuƛax ʕoƛno esiwn, žeduł tełgon sis esiyn.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax ʕoƛno esiw-n žedu-ł teł-gon sis esyu-n
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT seven brother-and DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside-CNTR one sister-and
\l Once upon a time there were seven brothers, and among them was one sister.

\t Nełaƛ’ ci Umukusƛin zown.
\m neła-ƛ’ ci Umukus-ƛin zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS name Umukus-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Her name was Umukus.

\t Yizä yedu iday maħortow yegirxo zown anu.
\m yizi-a yedu idu-ay maħor-tow y-egir-x zow-n anu
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG home-IN.ABL outside-EMPH II-let-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l They didn't let her out of the house.

\t Žedu esnabi ɣudes bełiƛ’t’a bik’ix zown.
\m žedu esyu-bi ɣudes bełi-ƛ’-t’a b-ik’i-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL brother-PL daily hunting-SUPER.ESS-DISTR I.PL-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Every day the brothers went hunting.

\t Sisxoli idu yičin Umukuser č’alʕizi roqxo zown.
\m sisxoli idu y-iči-n Umukus-r č’alʕizi r-oq-x zow-n
\g alone home II-sit-PFV.CVB Umukus-LAT bore IV-become-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Umukus, who was sitting at home lonely, was bored of this.

\t Sidaquł yiła esnazaqor eƛin:
\m sidaquł yiła-a esyu-bi-qor eƛi-n
\g one.day DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG brother-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l One day, she said to her brothers:

\t Sisxoli idu yičin där ʕuraw žuka riyx.
\m sisxoli idu y-iči-n di-r ʕuraw žuka r-iy-x
\g alone home II-sit-PFV.CVB me-LAT very bad IV-feel-PRS
\l "I feel very bad sitting alone at home.

\t Meža barubi raƛin”.
\m mežu-a baru-bi r-ow-ƛin
\g you(I).PL.OBL-ERG wife-PL II.PL-marry-QUOT
\l Find wives to marry!"

\t Esnabi razi boqnosi, hudayzikotow yedu žedur baruzał xizay maħor yoqno.
\m esyu-bi razi b-oq-nosi hudayziko-tow yedu žedu-r baru-bi-ł xizay maħor y-oq-n
\g brother-PL agree I.PL-become-ANT.CVB the.next.day-EMPH DEM2.IISG DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT wife-PL-CONT.ESS behind outside II-become-PST.UNW
\l After the brothers agreed, she went outside the next day to look for wives for them.

\t Nełƛ’osi kʷaxatow ʕoƛiran esnaza bertenno bodin, barubin rown.
\m nełƛ’osi kʷaxa-tow ʕoƛira-n esyu-bi-a berten-n b-odi-n baru-bi-n r-ow-n
\g of.that.time quickly-EMPH seven.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG marriage-TOP I.PL-do-PFV.CVB wife-PL-TOP II.PL-marry-PST.UNW
\l Shortly afterwards, the seven brothers organized a marriage and married.

\t Hudunon žeda ža esiy maħor yegirxo zown anu.
\m huduno-n žedu-a ža esyu maħor y-egir-x zow-n anu
\g nevertheless-TOP DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.SG sister outside II-let-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l Nevertheless, they didn't let their sister go outside.

\t Esnaza nełas nece t’alam boyzaƛ’, baruzar ža yetix zown anu.
\m esyu-bi-a neła-s nece t’alam b-odi-zaƛ’ baru-bi-r ža y-eti-x zow-n anu
\g brother-PL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 so.much care III-do-CSL.CVB wife-PL-LAT DEM1.SG II-like-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l Because the brothers cared so much for her, their wives didn't like her.

\t Sida quł esnazas barubi urɣizi roqno sisxolisini žedaz xedyozas esiy zeroqozo cugumäɣor kuranix.
\m sida qu-ł esyu-bi-s baru-bi urɣizi r-oq-n sisxolisi-ni žeda-az xediw-bi-s esyu zeru-q-zo cugu-aɣor kur-ani-x
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS brother-PL-GEN1 wife-PL thinking II.PL-become-PFV.CVB lonely-DEF DEM1.IIPL.OBL-IN.ESS.DIST husband-PL-GEN1 sister bouza-POSS.ESS-ATTR.OBL barrel-IN.VERS throw-MSD-AD.ESS
\l One day, the brothers' wives planned to throw their husbands' lonely sister into a barrel of bouza.

\t Bełiƛ’ esnabi bäk’äsi yałzay, eɣeni esiwz bara k’orin boyn nazon q’ˤidan ričin bac’ƛ’oräy, Umukusez haqa bašiqˤoy šišin, k’ori boyƛ’orey eɣeni esiwz baruqay rˤaƛ’uruni.
\m bełi-ƛ’ esyu-bi b-ik’i-si yoł-zay eɣe-ni esiw-z baru-a k’ori-n b-odi-n nazo-n q’ˤida-n r-iči-n b-ac’-ƛ’oräy Umukus-z haqu-a bašiqˤoy šiši-n k’ori b-odi-ƛ’oräy eɣe-ni esiw-z baru-qay r-ˤaƛ’u-ru-ni
\g hunting-SUPER.ESS brother-PL I.PL-go-ATTR be-SIM.CVB young-DEF brother-GEN2 wife-ERG oatmeal-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB everyone.OBL-TOP down-TOP II.PL-sit-PFV.CVB III-eat-SIM.CVB Umukus-GEN2 mouth-IN.ESS ring get.stuck-PST.UNW oatmeal III-do-SIM.CVB young-DEF brother-GEN2 wife-POSS.ABL IV-fall-PST.PRT-DEF
\l When the brothers were going hunting, the youngest brother's wife made an oatmeal and when everyone sat down and ate, a ring that fell off the youngest brother's wife when she made the oatmeal, got stuck in Umukus' mouth.

\t Nełagon roɣno neła nełaz bašił erno.
\m neła-a-gon r-oɣ-n neła-a neła-z baša-ł er-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 finger-CONT.ESS put-PST.UNW
\l She [Umukus] took it out and put it on her finger.

\t Ža bašiqˤoy nełar eɣeni esiya risäsi zown.
\m ža bašiqˤoy neła-r eɣe-ni esyu-a r-is-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.SG ring DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT young-DEF brother-ERG IV-buy-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l This ring was the one that the youngest brother bought her.

\t Rišno łiynosi, p’es anusi baruza Umukus cugumä tełer zeruyałer kurno.
\m r-iš-n łiy-nosi p’es anu-si baru-bi-a Umukus cugu-a tełer zeru-łer kur-n
\g II.PL-eat-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB sound be.NEG-ATTR wife-PL-ERG Umukus barrel-IN.ESS into bouza-CONT.LAT throw-PST.UNW
\l After they finished eating, the wives silently threw Umukus into the bouza inside the barrel.

\t Bełiƛ’ bäk’izay esnabi baynosi, idu esiy Umukus yesunč’izaƛ’, baruzaq, nar ža yik’äƛin, esirno.
\m bełi-ƛ’ b-ik’i-zay esyu-bi b-ay-nosi idu esyu Umukus y-esu-č’i-zaƛ’ baru-bi-q nar ža y-ik’i-a-ƛin esir-n
\g hunting-SUPER.ESS I.PL-go-SIM.CVB brother-PL I.PL-come-ANT.CVB home sister Umukus II-have-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB wife-PL-POSS.ESS where DEM1.SG II-go-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-PST.UNW
\l When the brothers came back from hunting, their sister Umukus wasn't at home, so they asked their wives where she went.

\t Nazon žeda sidä riłe eƛin:
\m nasi-n žedu-a sida-a r-iłe eƛi-n
\g which-TOP DEM1.IPL-ERG one.OBL-ERG II.PL-as say-PST.UNW
\l So they said as if as one:

\t Buqbetaxtow maħor yaqzay soder t’ok’ow yukaynč’uƛin”.
\m buqbeta-x-tow maħor y-oq-zay soder t’ok’ow y-ukad-č’u-ƛin
\g sunset-AD.ESS-EMPH outside II-become-SIM.CVB after anymore II-see-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "We didn't see her anymore, after she went outside at sunset."

\t Nar yedu yik’a yayxƛin, esnabi urɣelyozałer begäsi zown.
\m nar yedu y-ik’i-a y-ay-x-ƛin esyu-bi urɣel-bi-łer b-egi-asi zow-n
\g where DEM2.IISG II-go-INF II-must-PRS-QUOT brother-PL sorrow-PL-CONT.LAT I.PL-stand.still-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "Where might she have gone to?", the brothers got desperate.

\t Sida zamanałäy, eženi esiya eɣeni esiw zeru łek’ira egirno.
\m sida zaman-łay eže-ni esyu-a eɣe-ni esiw zeru łek’ir-a egir-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ABL old-DEF brother-ERG young-DEF brother bouza stir-INF send-PST.UNW
\l After a while, the eldest brother sent the youngest brother to stir the bouza.

\t Łek’irełinč’uƛin xizor utin ayn.
\m łek’ir-ł-č’u-ƛin xizor uti-n ay-n
\g stir-POT-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT back turn.back-PFV.CVB come-PST.UNW
\l He came back, saying: "I couldn't stir it."

\t Šida ža debeq łek’irełxanuƛin, hoq’ˤot’ani esnabi bik’in.
\m šida ža mi-q łek’ir-ł-x-anu-ƛin hoq’ˤo-t’a-ni esyu-bi b-ik’i-n
\g why DEM1.SG you-POSS.ESS stir-POT-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT other-DISTR-DEF brother-PL I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l "Why can't you stir it?", the other brothers went to him.

\t Žedun hemedurtow łek’irełinč’ey bayn.
\m žedu-n hemedur-tow łek’ir-ł-č’ey b-ay-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-TOP so-EMPH stir-POT-NEG.PST.CVB I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l And so they also couldn't stir it and came back.

\t Xizyogon eženi esiw ik’in, nesiqno šebin roqinč’izaƛ’, q’ˤim ƛ’iyoħor rutirno cugu kurno.
\m xizyogon eže-ni esiw ik’i-n nesi-q-n šebin r-oq-č’i-zaƛ’ q’ˤim ƛ’iyoħo-r r-utir-n cugu kur-n
\g then old-DEF brother go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP thing IV-happen-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB head down-LAT IV-turn-PFV.CVB barrel throw-PST.UNW
\l Then the eldest brother went and nothing happend, so he lowered his head and threw the barrel over.

\t Elo teł yexasi esiw yesunosi, yedu šebin šebi t’o idu roqxoƛin baruzaq esirzaƛ’, elar riyxosi šebin anuƛin, inkar bisno ričin.
\m elo teł y-exu-asi esiw y-esu-nosi yedu šebin šebi t’o idu r-oq-x-ƛin baru-bi-q esir-zaƛ’ ele-ar r-iy-xosi šebin anu-ƛin inkar b-is-n r-iči-n
\g there inside II-die-RES.PRT sister II-find-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG thing what here home IV-happen-PRS-QUOT wife-PL-POSS.ESS ask-CSL.CVB here-IN.LAT IV-know-PRS.PRT thing be.NEG-QUOT rejection III-take-PFV.CVB II.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l When they found their dead sister inside, and asked their wives: "What happened here at home?", they rejected: "We don't know anything about this here."

\t Neła quł sasaq esnaza Umukusno šušin, nełas šeƛ’u šudaƛ’ ƛ’iri eqerno.
\m neła qu-ł sasaq esyu-bi-a Umukus-n šuši-n neła-s šeƛ’u šuda-ƛ’ ƛ’iri eqer-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning brother-PL-ERG Umukus-TOP bury-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 clothing graveyard-SUPER.ESS above put-PST.UNW
\l The next morning, the brothers burried Umukus and put her clothes onto the grave

\t Sida q’orolays mamalay zown ɣudes šudaƛ’orno bik’in akbar roɣxo bičixosi.
\m sida q’orolay-s mamalay zow-n ɣudes šuda-ƛ’or-n b-ik’i-n akbar r-oɣ-x b-iči-xosi
\g one.OBL widow-GEN1 rooster be.NPRS-PFV.CVB daily graveyard-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB call.for.prayer IV-take.away-IPFV.CVB III-be-PRS.PRT
\l A widow had a rooster, who went to the graveyard every day to crow.

\t Nełaz k’onč’azax šudaƛ’osi šeƛ’u rutix zown.
\m neła-z k’onč’u-bi-x šuda-ƛ’-si šeƛ’u r-uti-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 foot-PL-AD.ESS graveyard-SUPER.ESS-ATTR clothing IV-turn.back-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l It came back with the clothes from the grave around its feet.

\t Nełƛ’o ža bežigon q’oq’oƛix zown.
\m nełƛ’o ža b-eži-gon q’oq’oƛi-x zow-n
\g then DEM1.SG III-more-CNTR crow-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Then it crowed even more.

\t Šebey roqsiƛin, q’orolayä šudaƛ’orno yik’in mamalayz k’onč’azaqay šeƛ’u roɣxo zown.
\m šebi-ey r-oq-s-ƛin q’orolay-a šuda-ƛ’or-n y-ik’i-n mamalay-z k’onč’u-bi-qay šeƛ’u r-oɣ-x zow-n
\g what-DUB IV-happen-PST.WIT-QUOT widow-ERG graveyard-SUPER.LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB rooster-GEN2 foot-PL-POSS.ABL clothing IV-take.away-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "What happened?", the widow said and went to the grave and took the clothings from the rooster's feet.

\t Nełaƛ’no mamalay q’oq’oƛixosin, akbar roɣxosin bičinč’izaƛ’, šudno rič’in tełer yezunosi, elo yiłar bercinaw kid yesun.
\m nełƛ’o-n mamalay q’oq’oƛi-xosi-n akbar r-oɣ-xosi-n b-iči-č’i-zaƛ’ šud-n r-ič’i-n tełer y-ezu-nosi elo yiła-r bercinaw kid y-esu-n
\g then-TOP rooster crow-PRS.PRT-and call.for.prayer IV-take.away-PRS.PRT-TOP III-cease-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB grave-TOP IV-dig-PFV.CVB into II-look-ANT.CVB there DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT beautiful girl II-find-PST.UNW
\l Then the rooster still didn't stop crowing and cackling, so she dug out the grave, looked inside and found a beautiful girl.

\t Q’orolaz maduhalłiq sis baru anusi žek’u ičix zown.
\m q’orol-z maduhalłi-q sis baru anu-si žek’u iči-x zow-n
\g widow-GEN2 neighbourhood-POSS.ESS one wife be.NEG-ATTR man be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In the widow's neighbourhood there was an unmarried man.

\t Nesiderno yik’in yiła eƛin:
\m nesi-der-n y-ik’i-n yiła-a eƛi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l She went to him and said:

\t Däde idu bercinaw kid yoł, deber retinäy mi ža barułun yižoƛin”.
\m di-de idu bercinaw kid yoł mi-r r-eti-näy mi ža baru-łun y-iži-o-ƛin
\g me-APUD.ESS home beautiful girl be you-LAT IV-want-CND.CVB you DEM1.SG wife-LHUN II-take.out-IMPR-QUOT
\l "There's a beautiful girl at my home; if you want, take her as a wife."

\t Q’orolaz idu kid yałrułi esnazar čuqˤnosi, žedu nełdäɣor bezanixƛin bik’in.
\m q’orol-z idu kid yoł-rułi esyu-bi-r čuqˤ-nosi žedu neła-däɣor b-ezu-ani-x-ƛin b-ik’i-n
\g widow-GEN2 home girl be-MSD brother-PL-LAT turn.out-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.VERS I.PL-look-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l After it became clear to the brothers that the girl was at the widow's house, they went to see her.

\t Nełde idur baynosi, šakno oqno eɣeni esiya kidbeq ħaƛanix łi esiro.
\m neła-de idu-r b-ay-nosi šak-n oq-n eɣe-ni esyu-a kid-q ħaƛu-ani-x łi esir-o
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS home-LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB suspicion-TOP become-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother-ERG girl-POSS.ESS drink-MSD-AD.ESS water ask-IMPR
\l When they came to the house where she was, the youngest brother became suspicious and asked the girl if she wanted to drink some water.

\t Keč’oz reƛ’id neła neƛƛ’oräy, eɣeni esiya kut’yozod neƛƛin eƛin.
\m keč’o-z reƛ’a-d neła-a neƛ-ƛ’oräy eɣe-ni esyu-a kut’yo-zo-d neƛ-ƛin eƛi-n
\g left.side-GEN2 hand-INSTR DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG give-SIM.CVB young-DEF brother-ERG right.side-ATTR.OBL-INSTR give-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l When she stretched out her left hand, the younger brother said: "Give me your right hand."

\t Łi teƛƛ’oräy, kidbez bašił nesir nesätow barur sayɣat radiruni bašiqˤoy rukayn.
\m łi teƛ-ƛ’oräy kid-z baša-ł nesi-r nesi-a-tow baru-r sayɣat r-odi-ru-ni bašiqˤoy r-ukad-n
\g water give-SIM.CVB girl-GEN2 finger-CONT.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-EMPH wife-LAT present IV-do-PST.PRT-DEF ring IV-see-PST.UNW
\l When he gave her the water, he saw on the girl's finger the ring that he himself had given to his wife as a present.

\t Žedur žedu esnabi yałru biynosi, Umukusä nesiq kinaw raqru łinałäy esin.
\m žedu-r žedu esyu-bi yoł-ru b-iy-nosi Umukus-a nesi-q kinaw r-oq-ru łina-łay esi-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT DEM1.IPL.OBL brother-PL be-PST.PRT I.PL-know-ANT.CVB Umukus-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS entire IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW
\l When they knew they were brother and sister, Umukus told him about everything that happened.

\t Elay idurno bik’in, esnaza nasin barubi guluz maħizaqorno ricin raƛ’no xecirno roxirno.
\m ele-ay idu-r-n b-ik’i-n esyu-bi-a nasin baru-bi gulu-z maħi-bi-qor-n r-ici-n raƛ’-n xeci-r-n r-oxir-n
\g there-IN.ABL home-LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB brother-PL-ERG all wife-PL horse-GEN2 tail-PL-POSS.LAT-TOP II.PL-tie-PFV.CVB land-TOP leave-CAUS-PFV.CVB II.PL-chase-PST.UNW
\l The brothers went home, tied all their wives onto their horses' tails and chased them out of the country.

\t Xizyo q’orolaz maduhalxo žeda beže bertenno boyn sistow sis yałruni esiwn yegirno, žedan q’ˤuya ʕaƛozałäy barubin rown paraxat bičin.
\m xizyo q’orol-z maduhal-x žedu-a b-eže berten-n b-odi-n sis-tow sis yoł-ru-ni esiw-n y-egir-n žeda-a-n q’ˤuya ʕaƛ-za-łay baru-bi-n r-ow-n paraxat b-iči-n
\g after widow-GEN2 neighbor-AD.ESS DEM1.IPL-ERG III-big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB one-EMPH one be-PST.PRT-DEF sister-TOP II-send-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG-TOP other village-DIST-CONT.ABL wife-PL-TOP II.PL-marry-PFV.CVB calm I.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards they sent their only sister to a big marriage at the widow's neighbor, and also they married wives from other villages and lived happily ever after.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Sis zown eniwn nełasgon łˤono kidno.
\m sis zow-n eniw-n neła-s-gon łˤono kid-n
\g one be.NPRS-PST.UNW mother-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR three daughter-TOP
\l Once there was a mother who had three daughters.

\t Sidaquł žedu ciqaɣor qaciƛ’or rik’in.
\m sidaquł žedu ciq-aɣor qaci-ƛ’or r-ik’i-n
\g one.day DEM1.IPL.OBL forest-IN.VERS firewood-SUPER.LAT II.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l One day they went into the forest to get firewood.

\t Neširaɣor qacis muɣbin rown nexƛ’oräy, där muɣ boq’ˤiłxoƛin eniya eƛinosi, sis rečiwsi riłe qaca tełäy roɣno q’ˤidar kuroƛin, kidbaza eƛin.
\m neširu-aɣor qaci-s muɣ-bi-n r-ow-n nex-ƛ’oräy di-r muɣ b-oq’ˤił-x-ƛin eni-a eƛi-nosi sis r-ečiw-si r-iłe qaca teł-ay r-oɣ-n q’ˤida-r kur-o-ƛin kid-bi eƛi-n
\g at.night-IN.VERS firewood-GEN1 bundle-PL-TOP III.PL-bring-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB me-LAT bundle III-be.heavy-PRS-QUOT mother-ERG say-ANT.CVB one IV-thick-ATTR IV-as firewood inside-IN.ABL IV-take.away-PFV.CVB down-LAT throw-IMPR-QUOT daughter-PL say-PST.UNW
\l When they were coming back with a bundle of firewood in the evening and the mother said: "The bundle is too heavy for me", the daughters said: "Take a thick bunch of firewood and throw it out."

\t Q’ˤida muɣno hiƛirno, neła ža hič’č’a rečiwsi riqirno qaca q’ˤidar karun, nełłäy bikorin boqno, bet’unč’ey žedałtow xizay nexxo zown.
\m q’ˤida muɣ-n hiƛir-n neła-a ža hič’č’a r-ečiw-si r-iqir-n qaca q’ˤida-r kur-run neła-łay bikori-n b-oq-n b-et’u-č’ey žeda-ł-tow xizay nex-x zow-n
\g down bundle-TOP place.comfortably-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG the.most IV-thick-ATTR IV-take.away-PFV.CVB firewood down-LAT throw-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ABL snake-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB III-stay.behind-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS-EMPH behind come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l She put the bundle down, and the thickest piece of firewood that she threw down, turned into a snake, which didn't stay behind, but followed them.

\t Neła eniw yuƛ’ˤerxo zown, där sis kid neƛinč’inäy, yexura yoł mi diƛin.
\m neła-a eniw y-ˤuƛ’er-x zow-n di-r sis kid neƛ-č’i-näy y-exur-a yoł mi di-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG mother II-scare-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB me-LAT one girl give-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB II-kill-INF be you me-QUOT
\l It scared the mother: "If you don't give me a girl, I will kill you!"

\t T’ok’ow roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey, eniya sossi eženi kidbeq bikorxo yik’ixaƛin esirno, neła yik’ixanuƛin inkar boynosi yoƛƛozoqor eƛin, žan razi yoqno anu.
\m t’ok’ow r-odi-a šebin koƛ’i-č’ey eni-a sossi eže-ni kid-q bikori-x y-ik’i-x-a-ƛin esir-n neła-a y-ik’i-x-anu-ƛin inkar b-odi-nosi y-oƛƛo-zo-qor eƛi-n ža-n razi y-oq-n anu
\g anymore IV-do-INF thing understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB mother-ERG first old-DEF daughter-POSS.ESS snake-AD.ESS II-go-IPFV.CVB-INF-QUOT ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG II-go-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT rejection III-do-ANT.CVB II-middle-ATTR.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP agree II-become-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l Not knowing what to do anymore, the mother asked her eldest daughter first, if she would go to the snake; she rejected: "I won't go."; then she talked to the middle daughter, who also disagreed.

\t Yeɣeni kidbeq esirnosi yołi, deber rätiru zamanał mi äƛiru šebin roda ħaduraw di yołƛin, eniwqor eƛin.
\m y-eɣe-ni kid-q esir-nosi yołi mi-r r-eti-ru zaman-ł mi eƛi-ru šebin r-odi-a ħaduraw di yoł-ƛin eniw-qor eƛi-n
\g II-young-DEF daughter-POSS.ESS ask-ANT.CVB however you-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT time-CONT.ESS you say-PST.PRT thing IV-do-INF prepared me be-QUOT mother-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l When she asked the youngest daughter, she said to her mother: "I'm ready to do whatever you say, whenever you want."

\t Howlaytow bitor adäz bikorin, xizaz kidno hunix boqno bikorzo iduɣorƛin bik’in.
\m howlay-tow bitor adäz bikori-n xizaz kid-n huni-x b-oq-n bikori-zo idu-ɣor-ƛin b-ik’i-n
\g from.there-EMPH thither ahead snake-TOP from.behind daughter-TOP way-AD.ESS III-become-PFV.CVB snake-ATTR.OBL home-IN.ALL-QUOT III-go-PST.UNW
\l From then on, the snake went ahead with the daughter following it, until it came to the snake's house.

\t Zamanałäy yizi sidaɣ q’ˤunader huni č’ˤaƛäłza mečoƛ’or baynosi, sidaɣaza hunä kid yegirno, sidaɣaza bikori bik’in.
\m zaman-łay yizi sidaɣ q’ˤuna-der huni č’ˤaƛił-za moči-ƛ’or b-ay-nosi sidaɣ-aza huni-a kid y-egir-n sidaɣ-aza bikori b-ik’i-n
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM2.IPL.OBL in.one.place two.OBL-APUD.LAT way be.cut-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.LAT III-come-ANT.CVB in.one.place-IN.VERS.DIST way-ERG girl II-send-PFV.CVB in.one.place-IN.VERS.DIST snake III-go-PST.UNW
\l When, after a while, they came to a point where the road forked, the snake sent the girl the one way and itself went the other one.

\t Tabanaw hunäsi hunä yik’in yedu sidaɣ ɣˤutkoxor yaynosi, tełxor yoqno.
\m tabanaw huni-a-si huni-a y-ik’i-n yedu sidaɣ ɣˤutku-xor y-ay-nosi teł-xor y-oq-n
\g long way-IN.ESS-ATTR way-IN.ESS II-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG in.one.place house-AD.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB inside-AD.LAT II-become-PST.UNW
\l When she came to a house somewhere on the long way she was going on, she went inside.

\t Elo yiłar istowlix q’ˤida ičäsi bercinaw uži esun.
\m elo yiła-r istowli-x q’ˤida iči-asi bercinaw uži esu-n
\g there DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT table-AD.ESS down sit-RES.PRT beautiful boy find-PST.UNW
\l There she found a handsome boy sitting at a table.

\t Ħayran yoqno yezun ƛexun kid, moƛałä yedu di yaqˤułƛin.
\m ħayran y-oq-n y-ezu-n ƛexu-n kid moƛu-ł-a yedu di yaqˤuł-ƛin
\g be.astonished II-become-PFV.CVB II-look-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB girl dream-CONT.ESS-Q DEM2.IISG me today-QUOT
\l The girl was surprised and remained looking (at him), "Is this day a dream?"

\t Nełqułtow žedus berten bodin.
\m nełquł-tow žedu-s berten b-odi-n
\g on.that.day-EMPH DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 marriage III-do-PST.UNW
\l They married on the same day.

\t ƛˤebaƛ’aza žedur uži odin.
\m ƛˤeb-ƛ’aza žedu-r uži odi-n
\g year-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT son do-PST.UNW
\l After a year, they got a son.

\t Zamanałäy kidber eniwdäɣorno, esnazadäɣorno yik’anix rok’u k’oƛin.
\m zaman-łay kid-r eniw-däɣor-n esyu-bi-däɣor-n y-ik’i-ani-x rok’u k’oƛi-n
\g time-CONT.ABL girl-LAT mother-APUD.VERS-and sister-PL-APUD.VERS-and II-go-MSD-AD.ESS heart jump-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, the girl wanted to go to her mother and her sisters.

\t Haq’udär yik’anix xedyoqay izmu esirnosi, nesägon łˤora becän yičin, hulon rexurno horoƛin yegirno.
\m haq’u-dar y-ik’i-ani-x xediw-qay izmu esir-nosi nesi-a-gon łˤora buci-a-n y-iči-n hul-on r-exur-n horo-ƛin y-egir-n
\g family-APUD.VERS II-go-MSD-AD.ESS husband-POSS.ABL permission ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR three.OBL month-IN.ESS-TOP II-be-PFV.CVB miss-CND IV-kill-PFV.CVB come.IMPR-QUOT II-let-PST.UNW
\l When she asked her husband for permission to go to her family, he let her go with the words: "You may stay three months, then, after [you killed the boredom(?)] come back!"

\t Sasaqtow yizin, užin q’ˤogxo isno yedu eniwdäɣor yik’in.
\m sasaq-tow y-izi-n uži-n q’ˤog-x is-n yedu eniw-däɣor y-ik’i-n
\g in.the.morning-EMPH II-get.up-PFV.CVB son-TOP hay.bale-AD.ESS take-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG mother-APUD.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l The next morning she got up, put her son into a hay bale and went to her mother.

\t Haq’uł q’ˤano buci boɣnosi, eniya daʕba bičirno yiłał, debez mi ɣˤutkoƛ’or yuti, xedyor rätinč’iƛin.
\m haq’u-ł q’ˤano buci b-oɣ-nosi eni-a daʕba b-iči-r-n yiła-ł mi-z mi ɣˤutku-ƛ’or y-uti xediw-r r-eti-č’i-ƛin
\g family-CONT.ESS two month III-spend.time-ANT.CVB mother-ERG dispute III-be-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS you-GEN2 you house-SUPER.LAT II-turn.back husband-LAT IV-love-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l After spending two months at her family's, the mother had up a dispute with her: "Go back to your house and your husband won't like it."

\t Yeženi kidbä, din yegir yiłde sadaq hunin regirnoƛin, eniwq esirnosi, yegirzaƛ’ šida yik’inč’uƛin bixzin yoqno eƛin.
\m y-eže-ni kid-a di-n y-egir yiła-de sadaq huni-n r-egir-n-ƛin eniw-q esir-nosi y-egir-zaƛ’ šida y-ik’i-č’u-ƛin bixzi-n y-oq-n eƛi-n
\g II-old-DEF daughter-ERG me-TOP II-let DEM2.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS together way-TOP IV-send-PFV.CVB-QUOT mother-POSS.ESS ask-ANT.CVB II-let-CSL.CVB why II-go-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT angry-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l When the eldest daughter asked her mother: "Let me go with her together so I can see her off!", and the mother angrily said: "Why didn't you go when I let you?"

\t Hunin regirno xizor yutin nexanƛin, yigtow yedu ƛ’iri yutizaƛ’, eniyan yegirno.
\m huni-n r-egir-n xizor y-uti-n nex-an-ƛin y-ig-tow yedu ƛ’iri y-uti-zaƛ’ eni-a-n y-egir-n
\g way-TOP IV-let-PFV.CVB back II-turn.back-PFV.CVB come-FUT.DEF-QUOT II-good-EMPH DEM2.IISG above II-turn.back-CSL.CVB mother-ERG-TOP II-let-PST.UNW
\l When she insisted: "I will see her off and come back again!", the mother let her go.

\t Q’ˤanon esnabi sadaq hunix roqno.
\m q’ˤano-n esyu-bi sadaq huni-x r-oq-n
\g two-TOP sister-PL together way-AD.ESS II.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l And so the two sisters went on their way together.

\t Uži yeženi esiya ižix zown.
\m uži y-eže-ni esyu-a iži-x zow-n
\g boy II-old-DEF sister-ERG carry-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The eldest sister carried the boy.

\t Sida zamanałäy yiła yeda uži c’enno ʕiyayrno.
\m sida zaman-łay yiła-a yeda uži c’en-n ʕiyad-r-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ABL DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG boy pinch-PFV.CVB cry-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l At some point in time, she pinched the boy and made him cry.

\t Łinaqey ža ʕiyayxƛin žas eniya esirnosi, yisir dowqosi pardagi retinƛin eƛin.
\m łina-qay ža ʕiyad-x-ƛin uži-s eni-a esir-nosi yisi-r mi-q-si pardagi r-eti-n-ƛin eƛi-n
\g what.OBL-POSS.ABL DEM1.SG cry-PRS-QUOT boy-GEN1 mother-ERG ask-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT you-POSS.ESS-ATTR scarf IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l When the boy's mother asked: "Why does he cry?", she said: "He wants your scarf."

\t Yeženi esiya nełqay pardagin risno, neła nełƛ’osinigon yeɣeni esiwqor teƛno.
\m y-eže-ni esyu-a neła-qay pardagi-n r-is-n neła-a nełƛ’osi-ni-gon y-eɣe-ni esiw-qor teƛ-n
\g II-old-DEF sister-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL scarf-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG of.that.time-DEF-CNTR II-young-DEF sister-POSS.LAT give-PST.UNW
\l The elder sister took the scarf from her and then in turn gave the one on herself to the younger sister.

\t Xizyogon hemedurtow yeženi esiya ža uži c’enno ʕiyayrno.
\m xizyogon hemedur-tow y-eže-ni esyu-a ža uži c’en-n ʕiyad-r-n
\g again so-EMPH II-old-DEF sister-ERG DEM1.SG boy pinch-PFV.CVB cry-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l Then the eldest sister pinched the boy again and made him cry.

\t Nesiz eniya esirno:
\m nesi-z eni-a esir-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 mother-ERG ask-PST.UNW
\l His mother asked:

\t Šebi žigon nesir retäƛin?”
\m šebi žigon nesi-r r-eti-a-ƛin
\g what again.now DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-want-Q-QUOT
\l "What does he want again, now?"

\t Yeženi esiya žawab teƛno:
\m y-eže-ni esyu-a žawab teƛ-n
\g II-old-DEF sister-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l The eldest sister answered:

\t Dowqosi ged där ħažan yetin ʕiyayx yedaƛin”.
\m mi-q-si ged di-r ħaži-an y-eti-n ʕiyad-x yeda-ƛin
\g you-POSS.ESS-ATTR shirt me-LAT exchange-FUT.DEF II-want-PFV.CVB cry-PRS DEM2.ISG-QUOT
\l "He cries, because he wants that I exchange your dress with mine."

\t Ħažin q’ˤunan esnaza gedmabi hunix rik’iƛ’tow.
\m ħaži-n q’ˤuna-n esyu-bi-a ged-bi huni-x r-ik’i-ƛ’-tow
\g exchange-PFV.CVB two.OBL-TOP sister-PL-ERG shirt-PL way-AD.ESS II.PL-go-PCT.CVB-EMPH
\l The two sisters exchanged their shirts while on their way.

\t Łox äƛirugon nełatow c’enno uži ʕiyayn, žigon šebi nesir retäƛin, eniya bayan bisnosi, yeženi esiya eƛin:
\m łox äƛiru-gon neła-a-tow c’en-n uži ʕiyad-n žigon šebi nesi-r r-eti-a-ƛin eni-a b-ay-an b-is-nosi y-eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n
\g thrice ORD-CNTR DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-EMPH pinch-PFV.CVB boy cry-PFV.CVB again.now what DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-want-Q-QUOT mother-ERG III-must-FUT.DEF III-take-ANT.CVB II-old-DEF sister-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l When she pinched the boy for the third time and he cried, again, his mother asked, what he wanted again now, so the eldest sister said:

\t Eloša raładyołsi aluk’ani gagalin betin yeda ʕiyayxƛin”.
\m eloša raład-ł-si aluk’a-ni gagali-n b-eti-n yeda ʕiyad-x-ƛin
\g there sea-CONT.ESS-ATTR white-DEF flower-TOP III-want-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG cry-PRS-QUOT
\l He is crying because he want's to have that white flower over there in the sea.

\t Ža gagali bet’uranƛin raładyoz lilyoxarno yik’in žas eniw wˤał yužinosi, yeženi esiya yedu q’ˤiƛin raładyaɣorno kurno, užin ižin yeɣeni esiwz iduɣor yik’in.
\m ža gagali b-et’ur-an-ƛin raład-z lilyo-xar-n y-ik’i-n uži-s eniw wˤał y-uži-nosi y-eže-ni esyu-a yedu q’ˤiƛi-n raład-ɣor-n kur-n uži-n iži-n y-eɣe-ni esiw-z idu-ɣor y-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG flower III-pull.out-FUT.DEF-QUOT sea-GEN2 river.bank-AD.VERS-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB boy-GEN1 mother downward II-bow.down-ANT.CVB II-old-DEF sister-ERG DEM2.IISG push-PFV.CVB sea-IN.ALL-TOP throw-PFV.CVB boy-TOP take.out-PFV.CVB II-young-DEF sister-GEN2 home-IN.ALL II-go-PST.UNW
\l When the boy's mother, saying "I will pick this flower", went to the bank of the sea and bowed down, the eldest sister pushed her into the sea, took the boy and went to the younger sister's home.

\t Idur yaynosi, xedyoz eniya, qidoq tungi bok’oƛin yiłqor eƛinosi, bok’no neła qidoq.
\m idu-r y-ay-nosi xediw-z eni-a qido-q tungi b-ok’-o-ƛin yiła-qor eƛi-nosi b-ok’-n neła-a qido-q
\g home-LAT II-come-ANT.CVB husband-GEN2 mother-ERG wall-POSS.ESS copper.jug III-beat-IMPR-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-ANT.CVB III-beat-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG wall-POSS.ESS
\l After she came home, the husband's mother said to her: "Strike the jug against the wall." and she struck it against the wall.

\t Xizyogon ziys meɣu yeč’oƛin yegirnosi, žan t’it’i-yeč’no yayn.
\m xizyogon ziya-s meɣu y-eč’-o-ƛin y-egir-nosi ža-n y-t’it’i~eč’-n y-ay-n
\g then cow-GEN1 udder II-cut-IMPR-QUOT II-send-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP II-cut.into.pieces-PFV.CVB II-come-PST.UNW
\l Then she sent her to cut the cow's udder, and she cut it into pieces and came back.

\t Yedu baru dey anu, yedu q’ˤuya ɣˤanabi yäsuƛin”.
\m yedu baru di-s anu yedu q’ˤuya ɣˤanabi y-esu-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG wife me-GEN1 be.NEG DEM2.IISG other woman II-appear-QUOT
\l This is not my wife, she seems to be another woman.

\t Sabru bodin iči, zamanałäy debertow räyƛin”, - eniya eƛin.
\m sabru b-odi-n iči zaman-łay mi-r-tow r-äy-ƛin - eni-a eƛi-n
\g patience III-do-PFV.CVB be time-CONT.ABL you-LAT-EMPH IV-know.FUTIND-QUOT - mother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "Be patient, eventually you will know.", said the mother.

\t Eɣeni uži aq’ˤiłno, ʕoloqan oqa isäsi zown.
\m eɣe-ni uži aq’ˤił-n ʕoloqan oq-a is-asi zow-n
\g young-DEF boy grow.up-PFV.CVB young become-INF take-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The small boy grew up, and soon he became a young man.

\t Sida quł yizä yeda režin rayn ɣurox egirno.
\m sida qu-ł yizi-a yeda reži-n r-ay-n ɣuro-x egir-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG queue-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB cows-AD.ESS send-PST.UNW
\l One day, ...(???).

\t Ħonƛ’orno izin, regirno bixiłer ɣuron muši begiranix yeda q’ˤida ičinosi, nazay eƛa biynč’ey sis aɣi boƛixno yisiqor insanzo mecreƛ’no xabaryayn eƛin:
\m ħon-ƛ’or-n izi-n r-egir-n bix-łer ɣuro-n muši b-egir-ani-x yeda q’ˤida iči-nosi nazay eƛi-a b-iy-č’ey sis aɣi b-oƛix-n yisi-qor insan-zo mec-ƛ’-n xabaryad-n eƛi-n
\g mountain-SUPER.LAT-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB IV-send-PFV.CVB grass-CONT.LAT cows-TOP breath III-let-MSD-AD.ESS DEM2.ISG down sit-ANT.CVB from.where say-INF III-know-NEG.PST.CVB one bird III-appear-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT human-ATTR.OBL language-SUPER.ESS-TOP talk-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l He climbed up the mountain and sent the cows onto the grass, and when he sat down to take a breath, a bird appeared out of nowhere and told him in human language:

\t Di mi ɣurox egiranƛin odäsi zownč’u.
\m di mi ɣuro-x egir-an-ƛin odi-asi zow-č’u
\g me you cows-AD.ESS send-FUT.DEF-QUOT do-RES.PRT be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT
\l I didn't give birth to you to have you pasture the cows.

\t Ži roda šebin anuƛin”.
\m ži r-odi-a šebin anu-ƛin
\g now IV-do-INF thing be.NEG-QUOT
\l But now there is nothing to do.

\t Žan eƛin ozƛäy bok’ełno.
\m ža-n eƛi-n ozuri-ƛay b-ok’eł-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP say-PFV.CVB eye-SUB.ABL III-escape-PST.UNW
\l Having said this, it flew out of sight.

\t Neła quł užä ɣuro kamirno.
\m neła qu-ł uži-a ɣuro kamir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS boy-ERG cows lose-PST.UNW
\l On that day, the boy lost the cows.

\t Šida ɣuro kamiräƛin, babiya dahaw ʕedeʕizi oynosi, moƛa iqirno ƛexun diƛin, babiwq heresi mec yesa bayn.
\m šida ɣuro kamir-a-ƛin babiw-a dahaw ʕedeʕizi odi-nosi moƛu-a iqir-n ƛexu-n di-ƛin babiw-q heresi mec y-esi-a b-ay-n
\g why cows lose-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT father-ERG a.little hurrying do-ANT.CVB sleep-IN.ESS take.away-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW me-QUOT father-POSS.ESS false language II-tell-INF III-must-PST.UNW
\l "Why have you lost the cows?", the father scolded a little, so he had to tell his father the lie the he had fallen asleep.

\t Žek’us roži rayxosi šebin radin t’ok’owƛin”, - eƛin ičin babiw.
\m žek’u-s roži r-ay-xosi šebin r-odi-n t’ok’ow-ƛin - eƛi-n iči-n babiw
\g man-GEN1 word IV-come-PRS.PRT thing IV-do-PFV.CVB anymore-QUOT - say-PFV.CVB cease-PSTUNW father
\l "Don't do that again, so that other people don't scold you!", the father remained saying.

\t Hudayzikogon ɣurox uži egirnosi, hemedurtow boƛixno aɣi užiqor xabaryayn:
\m hudayziko-gon ɣuro-x uži egir-nosi hemedur-tow b-oƛix-n aɣi uži-qor xabaryad-n
\g the.next.day-CNTR cows-AD.ESS boy send-ANT.CVB so-EMPH III-appear-PST.UNW bird boy-POSS.LAT tell-PST.UNW
\l The next day the boy was sent to pasture the cows, when the bird appeared again and told him:

\t Di mi ɣurox egiranƛin odäsi zownč’u.
\m di mi ɣuro-x egir-an-ƛin odi-asi zow-č’u
\g me you cows-AD.ESS send-FUT.DEF-QUOT do-RES.PRT be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT
\l "I didn't give birth to you to have you pasture the cows.

\t Ži roda šebin anuƛin”.
\m ži r-odi-a šebin anu-ƛin
\g now IV-do-INF thing be.NEG-QUOT
\l But now there is nothing to do."

\t Žan eƛin hemedurtow ozƛäy gugin.
\m ža-n eƛi-n hemedur-tow ozuri-ƛay gugi-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP say-PFV.CVB so-EMPH eye-SUB.ABL escape-PST.UNW
\l Having said this, he flew out of sight.

\t Neła qułno yisi žaq ɣuro kamin.
\m neła qu-ł-n yisi uži-q ɣuro kami-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS-TOP DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-POSS.ESS cows get.lost-PST.UNW
\l On that day the cows got lost to the boy again.

\t Idur aynosi, žigoƛ’aygon kamirno ɣuro rayrzaƛ’, babiw c’ok’inayn.
\m idu-r ay-nosi žigo-ƛ’ay-gon kamir-n ɣuro r-ayr-zaƛ’ babiw c’ok’inad-n
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB now-SUPER.ABL-CNTR lose-PFV.CVB cows IV-bring-CSL.CVB father scold-PST.UNW
\l After coming home, having lost the cows again now, the father scolded.

\t Žoyä babiwq raqru šebin esin:
\m uži-a babiw-q r-oq-ru šebin esi-n
\g boy-ERG father-POSS.ESS IV-happen-PST.PRT thing tell-PST.UNW
\l The boy told the father what had happened:

\t Hemedur däł adäzarno bayn, insanzo mecreƛ’ xabaryayn aɣä di mi ɣurox egiranƛin odäsi zownč’u, ži roda šebin anuƛinno eƛin ozƛäy gugisƛin.
\m hemedur di-ł adäz-ar-n b-ay-n insan-zo mec-ƛ’ xabaryad-n aɣi-a di mi ɣuro-x egir-an-ƛin odi-asi zow-č’u ži r-odi-a šebin anu-ƛin-n eƛi-n ozuri-ƛay gugi-s-ƛin
\g so me-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB human-ATTR.OBL language-SUPER.ESS tell-PFV.CVB bird-ERG me you cows-AD.ESS send-FUT.DEF-QUOT do-RES.PRT be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT now IV-do-INF thing be.NEG-QUOT-TOP say-PFV.CVB eye-SUB.ABL escape-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "So, a bird arrived in front of me and talked in human language, saying: 'I didn't give birth to you to have you pasture the cows. But now there's nothing to do.', and escaped out of sight.

\t T’ok’ow babiw sabrun boyn ičin.
\m t’ok’ow babiw sabru-n b-odi-n iči-n
\g more father patience-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB sit-PST.UNW
\l The father remained silently.

\t Neła quł sasaqozoxgon ɣurox žade sadaq babiwn ik’in.
\m neła qu-ł sasaqozox-gon ɣuro-x uži-de sadaq babiw-n ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS early.morning-CNTR cows-AD.ESS boy-APUD.ESS together father-TOP go-PST.UNW
\l The next day in the early morning, the father went together with the boy to pasture the cows.

\t Insan mi esunäy däz kʷayär horo, yałi, eli maxsaryoƛ’ bisinč’ey, xizor bik’iƛin”.
\m insan mi esu-näy di-z kʷay-ar horo yałi eli maxsar-ƛ’ b-is-č’ey xizor b-ik’i-ƛin
\g human you exist-CND.CVB me-GEN2 hand-IN.LAT come.IMPR else we joke-SUPER.ESS I.PL-take-NEG.PST.CVB back I.PL-go-QUOT
\l "If you are a human, come into my hand, or else this joke won't bluff us and we'll go back"

\t Ža nesä äƛirun, bet’un k’oƛin ɣunoqayn boqno babiwz koyär nexno.
\m ža nesi-a eƛi-ru-n b-et’u-n k’oƛi-n ɣun-qay-n b-oq-n babiw-z kʷay-ar nex-n
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-TOP III-jump-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB tree-POSS.ABL-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB father-GEN2 hand-IN.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l After he had said this, it jumped up and ran [flew] off the tree and came into the father's hand.

\t Yisägon bisno iduɣorno bižin, aɣzaqozoni bak’imar begirno.
\m yisi-a-gon b-is-n idu-ɣor-n b-iži-n aɣi-bi-q-zo-ni bak’i-ar b-egir-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR III-take-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB bird-PL-POSS.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF enclosure-IN.LAT III-let-PST.UNW
\l He took it, carried it home and put it into the hen coop.

\t Yeženigon esiya, šebin resun yisirƛin, bak’ima tełäyn begirno aɣi q’ˤidar kurnosi, nełłäy qˤirič’ roqno.
\m y-eže-ni-gon esyu-a šebin r-esu-n yisi-r-ƛin bak’i-a teł-ay-n b-egir-n aɣi q’ˤida-r kur-nosi neła-łay qˤirič’ r-oq-n
\g II-old-DEF-CNTR sister-ERG thing IV-find-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT-QUOT enclosure-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL-TOP III-let-PFV.CVB bird down-LAT throw-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ABL scissors IV-become-PST.UNW
\l The older sister said "He found something!", let the bird out of the coop and threw it on the ground, so he turned into a pair of scissors.

\t Yedu där ħažat roqxosiƛin, q’ˤidayn risno yeženi esiya qˤirič’ k’emot’ya šeƛ’ureł teł eqerno.
\m yedu di-r ħažat r-oq-xosi-ƛin q’ˤida-ay-n r-is-n y-eže-ni esyu-a qˤirič’ k’emot’-a šeƛ’u-ł teł eqer-n
\g DEM2.IISG me-LAT necessity IV-become-PRS.PRT-QUOT down-IN.ABL-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB II-old-DEF sister-ERG scissors wooden.case-IN.ESS clothing-CONT.ESS inside put-PST.UNW
\l "This is what I need!", the older sister said, took up the scissors and put them to the clothings in her wardrobe.

\t Qˤirič’yogon k’emot’ya teł zawru nasin šeƛ’u t’it’i-reč’no.
\m qˤirič’-gon k’emot’-a teł zow-ru nasin šeƛ’u r-t’it’i~eč’-n
\g scissors-CNTR wooden.case-IN.ESS inside be.NPRS-PST.PRT all clothing IV-cut.into.pieces-PST.UNW
\l But the pair of scissors cut all the clothes that were inside the wardrobe into pieces.

\t Šeƛ’ures k’emot’yar t’it’ubi rodäsi resunosi, yeženi esiya qˤirič’ roɣno maħor kurno.
\m šeƛ’u-s k’emot’-ar t’it’u-bi r-odi-asi r-esu-nosi y-eže-ni esyu-a qˤirič’ r-oɣ-n maħor kur-n
\g clothing-GEN1 wooden.case-IN.LAT piece-PL III.PL-do-RES.PRT IV-find-ANT.CVB II-old-DEF sister-ERG scissors IV-take.away-PFV.CVB outside throw-PST.UNW
\l The older sister found the clothings in the wooden case that were cut to pieces, took the scissors and threw them outside.

\t Elo ža qˤirič’ onočaƛ’or rutin.
\m elo ža qˤirič’ onoču-ƛ’or r-uti-n
\g there DEM1.SG scissors hen-SUPER.LAT IV-turn-PST.UNW
\l There these scissors turned into a hen.

\t Žagon ečruni ɣˤanaza iduɣor bižin yik’in.
\m ža-gon ečru-ni ɣˤanabi-a idu-ɣor b-iži-n y-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG-CNTR old-DEF woman-ERG home-IN.ALL III-carry-PFV.CVB II-go-PST.UNW
\l And and old woman carried it to her home.

\t Sida quł ečruni ɣˤanaza maħor yaqrus riłen rodin, xalno bodin yičin.
\m sida qu-ł ečru-ni ɣˤanabi-a maħor y-oq-ru-si r-iłe-n r-odi-n xal-n b-odi-n y-iči-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS old-DEF woman-ERG outside II-become-PST.PRT-ATTR IV.PL-as-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB examination-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB II-wait-PST.UNW
\l One day the old woman pretended to go outside, but waited and payed attention.

\t Neła idur bown zawruni onoču reč’yałer kidbeƛ’orno butin, iduzasi royƛ’orey, k’oƛin yik’in ečruni ɣˤanaza ža kid yiqirno.
\m neła idu-r b-ow-n zow-ru-ni onoču reč’-łer kid-ƛ’or-n b-uti-n idu-bi-si r-odi-ƛ’oräy k’oƛi-n y-ik’i-n ečru-ni ɣˤanabi-a ža kid y-iqir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL home-LAT III-bring-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF hen quickness-CONT.LAT girl-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-turn-PFV.CVB home-PL-ATTR IV-do-SIM.CVB run-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB old-DEF woman-ERG DEM1.SG girl II-catch-PST.UNW
\l The hen that she had brought home quickly turned into a girl and while she did the house[work] then, the old woman ran and caught this girl.

\t Hemeł qułtow ečruni ɣˤanaza naysinan ʕaƛozał xabar begirno, däde idu aq’iw kid yołƛin.
\m hemeł qu-ł-tow ečru-ni ɣˤanabi-a naysinan ʕaƛ-bi-ł xabar b-egir-n di-de idu aq’iw kid yoł-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS-EMPH old-DEF woman-ERG everywhere village-PL-CONT.ESS story III-send-PFV.CVB me-APUD.ESS home foreign girl be-QUOT
\l On this day, the old woman spread the story everywhere in among the villages: "I have an alien girl at home!"

\t Ža xabarno teqno obiwn, užin bezanixƛin bik’inosi, yisir suƛƛi yukayruntow yiyn yedu yisis baru yałru.
\m ža xabar-n teq-n obiw-n uži-n b-ezu-ani-x-ƛin b-ik’i-nosi yisi-r suƛƛi y-ukad-run-tow y-iy-n yedu yisi-s baru yoł-ru
\g DEM1.SG story-TOP hear-PFV.CVB father-and son-and I.PL-look-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT I.PL-go-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT immediately II-see-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH II-know-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 wife be-PST.PRT
\l Having heard of this story, the father and his son went to have a look and he immediately knew when seeing her, that it was his wife.

\t Nełan, dey užiƛin, žaq ałni bic’no.
\m neła-a-n di-s uži-ƛin uži-q ałni b-ic’-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-TOP me-GEN1 son-QUOT son-POSS.ESS hug III-hug-PST.UNW
\l She also said: "My son!", and gave him a hug.

\t Elay bitor, ɣˤaɣˤun bizin, łˤonon iduɣor bik’inosi, yeženi esiw yesun, idu yiłe, q’ˤidan yičin yičäsi.
\m ele-ay bitor ɣˤaɣˤu-n b-izi-n łˤono-n idu-ɣor b-ik’i-nosi y-eže-ni esiw y-esu-n idu y-iłe q’ˤida-n y-iči-n y-iči-asi
\g there-IN.ABL thither be.happy-TOP I.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB three-TOP home-IN.ALL I.PL-go-ANT.CVB II-old-DEF sister II-find-PFV.CVB home II-as down-TOP II-sit-PST.UNW II-wait-RES.PRT
\l The three of them were very delighted, so when they went home, they found the older sister, sitting at home waiting.

\t Qiƛ’orok’uƛ’ay yeɣeni esiw yukaynosi, yiła nełar radiru kinaw šebinon roƛixno adäz ričin, howlortow rok’un ret’un žan yexun.
\m qiƛ’orok’uƛ’ay y-eɣe-ni esiw y-ukad-nosi yiła-a neła-r r-odi-ru kinaw šebinon r-oƛix-n adäz r-iči-n howlo-r-tow rok’u-n r-et’u-u-n ža-n y-exu-n
\g by.accident II-young-DEF sister II-see-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT IV-do-PST.PRT entire something IV-appear-PFV.CVB ahead IV-be-PFV.CVB there-LAT-EMPH heart-TOP IV-jump-IMPR-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP II-die-PST.UNW
\l When she happened to see her younger sister, everthing appeared in front of her(?), she got a heart-attack and died.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder yizä sadaq paraxat ʕumru bižin.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder yizi-a sadaq paraxat ʕumru b-iži-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG together calmly life III-lead-PST.UNW
\l After that, they led a peaceful life together.

\t Eniyagon reže sadaq’a rułirno:
\m eni-a-gon r-eže sadaq’a r-ułir-n
\g mother-ERG-CNTR IV-big alms IV-share-PST.UNW
\l And the mother shared large alms:

\t Žas baru, hawšinaw q’ʷariłin biqin, xizaɣor idur yutizaƛ’.
\m uži-s baru hawšinaw q’ʷariłi-n b-iqi-n xizaɣor idu-r y-uti-zaƛ’
\g son-GEN1 wife so.much sadness-TOP III-get-PFV.CVB finally home-LAT II-turn.back-CSL.CVB
\l The son's wife, having endured so much sadness, has finally come back home.

\t Din žeduƛ’ xal bodin ičäsi zows.
\m di-n žedu-ƛ’ xal b-odi-n iči-asi zow-s
\g me-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS examination III-do-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l And I watched them as well.

\t Esin šebi xecin šebi zownƛax, zown anuƛax sis aɣi.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis aɣi
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT one bird
\l Once upon a time there was a bird.

\t Neła sida yečiw ačit’yoq muži bodäsi zown.
\m neła-a sida y-ečiw ačit’-q muži b-odi-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG one.OBL II-thick pine-POSS.ESS nest III-do-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l It was building a nest on a thick pine tree.

\t Elo neła łˤono k’eneč’ et’äsi zown.
\m elo neła-a łˤono k’eneč’ et’-asi zow-n
\g there DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG three egg lay-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l There it layed three eggs.

\t Zamanaƛ’ay neła łˤono xexoy boɣno.
\m zaman-ƛ’ay neła-a łˤono xexoy b-oɣ-n
\g time-SUPER.ABL DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG three young.animal III-hatch-PST.UNW
\l After a while, it hatched three nestlings.

\t Xexoybi roɣno kʷaxatow, ɣunoxorno bayn zira aɣiqor qˤaƛin, där sis xexoy kurinč’inäy, maħin rok’no ɣunno recurno debi di sadaq xexoybi rac’a yołƛin.
\m xexoy-bi r-oɣ-n kʷaxa-tow ɣun-xor-n b-ay-n ziru-a aɣi-qor qˤaƛi-n di-r sis xexoy kur-č’i-näy maħi-n r-ok’-n ɣun-n r-ecur-n mi-s di sadaq xexoy-bi r-ac’-a yoł-ƛin
\g young.animal-PL IV.PL-hatch-PFV.CVB soon-EMPH tree-AD.LAT-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB fox-ERG bird-POSS.LAT shout-PFV.CVB me-LAT one young.animal throw-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB tail-TOP IV-beat-PFV.CVB tree-TOP IV-break-PFV.CVB you-GEN1 me all young.animal-PL III.PL-eat-INF be-QUOT
\l Very soon after the nestlings hatched, a fox came to the tree and shouted to the bird: "If you don't throw me one nestling down, I'll knock down the tree with my tail and eat up all your nestlings!"

\t Hoboy nazon xexoyzaƛ’ay bok’äłƛin, aɣes rok’u ret’ux zown.
\m hoboy nazo-n xexoy-bi-ƛ’ay b-ok’eł-ƛin aɣi-s rok’u r-et’u-x zow-n
\g now all.OBL-TOP young.animal-PL-SUPER.ABL III-lose-QUOT bird-GEN1 heart IV-jump-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The bird was very afraid: "Now I will lose all of my nestlings!"

\t Sis xexoy yiłar kurnäy, q’ˤano där ƛäxuƛin, rok’ƛ’or pikrun bayn, dicego zaħmat roqłin, yiła zirur xexoy kurno.
\m sis xexoy yiła-r kur-näy q’ˤano di-r ƛexu-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or pikru-n b-ay-n dice-go zaħmat r-oq-łin yiła-a ziru-r xexoy kur-n
\g one young.animal DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT throw-CND.CVB two me-LAT remain-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT idea-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB how.much-COND trouble IV-become-CNC.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG fox-LAT young.animal throw-PST.UNW
\l "If I throw him down one nestling, I will still keep two", thought the bird and although it was quite difficult, it threw a nestling to the fox...

\t Aɣi ʕuraw q’ʷarid boqno.
\m aɣi ʕuraw q’ʷarid b-oq-n
\g bird very sadness III-become-PST.UNW
\l The bird became very sad.

\t Q’ˤano äƛiru ɣudƛ’ogon zap’aniłnotow bayn zira eƛin, kurxo besunäy xexoy kuro, yałi di maħin rok’no ɣun recura yołƛin.
\m q’ˤano eƛi-ru ɣudi-ƛ’-gon zap’anił-n-tow b-ay-n ziru-a eƛi-n kur-x b-esu-näy xexoy kur-o yałi di maħi-n r-ok’-n ɣun r-ecur-a yoł-ƛin
\g two say-PST.PRT day-SUPER.ESS-CNTR firmly-TOP-EMPH III-come-PFV.CVB fox-ERG say-PFV.CVB throw-IPFV.CVB III-appear-CND.CVB young.animal throw-IMPR else me tail-TOP IV-beat-PFV.CVB tree IV-break-INF be-QUOT
\l On the second day, the fox came firmly and said: "Throw me down a nestling, or else I'll knock down the tree with my tail!"

\t Sis nełarno kurno siskin där ƛexandaƛin, aɣzo rok’ƛ’orno rayn, dicego rok’er zaħmat roqłin, zirur sis xexoy kurno.
\m sis neła-r-n kur-n siskin di-r ƛexu-an-da-ƛin aɣi-zo rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n dice-go rok’u-r zaħmat r-oq-łin ziru-r sis xexoy kur-n
\g one DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT-TOP throw-PFV.CVB anything me-LAT remain-FUT.DEF-COND-QUOT bird-ATTR.OBL heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB how.much-COND heart-LAT trouble IV-become-CNC.CVB fox-LAT one young.animal throw-PST.UNW
\l "Throwing one down, there will still remain one for me.", thought the bird and although it was difficult, it threw one nestling to the fox.

\t Kutak q’ʷarid boqno aɣi q’anon xexoy zira bac’zaƛ’.
\m kutak q’ʷarid b-oq-n aɣi q’ˤano-n xexoy ziru-a b-ac’-zaƛ’
\g too.much sadness III-become-PFV.CVB bird two-TOP young.animal fox-ERG III-eat-CSL.CVB
\l The bird became even more sad because the fox has eaten two nestlings now.

\t Hemeł zamanał aɣderno bayn nełaƛ’osi ɣudin rukayn, ɣʷˤadä esirno, łinaq mi nece q’ʷarid boqäsiƛin.
\m hemeł zaman-ł aɣi-der-n b-ay-n neła-ƛ’-si ɣudi-n r-ukad-n ɣʷˤadi-a esir-n łina-q mi nece q’ʷarid b-oq-asi-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL time-CONT.ESS bird-APUD.LAT-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-ATTR day-TOP IV-see-PFV.CVB crow-ERG ask-PFV.CVB what.OBL-POSS.ESS you so.much sadness III-become-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l At this time, seeing its condition, a crow came to the bird and asked: "Why are you so sad?"

\t Aɣä esin, ɣunoxorno bayn, zira maħin rok’no rutirno žan caƛin, nasin xexoyabi roɣa yołƛin, däqay q’ˤanon xexoy boɣsi, sistow sis därno xecinƛin.
\m aɣi-a esi-n ɣun-xor-n b-ay-n ziru-a maħi-n r-ok’-n r-utir-n ža-n caƛi-n nasin xexoy-bi r-oɣ-a yoł-ƛin di-qay q’ˤano-n xexoy b-oɣ-s sis-tow sis di-r-n xeci-n-ƛin
\g bird-ERG tell-PFV.CVB tree-AD.LAT-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB fox-ERG tail-TOP IV-beat-PFV.CVB IV-turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP throw-PFV.CVB all young.animal-PL IV-take.away-INF be-QUOT me-POSS.ABL two-TOP young.animal III-take.away-PST.WIT one-EMPH one me-LAT-TOP leave-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The bird said: "A fox has come to the tree and wanted to throw it down with a beat of his tail to take away all my nestlings, two nestlings he took, so just a single one he left for me."

\t Way ʕabdalƛin, eƛin ɣʷˤadä, ʕonodkin nece yečiw ačit’ rigzaxay yoƛ’ˤuxanusi, maħin rok’no ziruq žaya yˤoƛ’uxƛin.
\m way ʕabdal-ƛin eƛi-n ɣʷˤadi-a ʕo-d-kin nece y-ečiw ačit’ r-ig-za-xay y-ˤoƛ’u-xanusi maħi-n r-ok’-n ziru-q ža-a y-ˤoƛ’u-x-ƛin
\g o.dear fool-QUOT say-PFV.CVB crow-ERG ax-INSTR-even so.much II-thick pine IV-good-ZA-AD.ABL II-fall-NEG.PRS.PRT tail-TOP IV-beat-PFV.CVB fox-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG-Q II-fall-PRS-QUOT
\l "O you fool", said the crow, "Even with an axe it is almost impossible to fell such a thick pine, [how] could a fox fell it with the beat of its tail?"

\t Ɣʷˤadä nediw ʕaq’lu boyzaƛ’, aɣi ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤun bizin, bayxana žigoƛ’aygon ža ziruƛin.
\m ɣʷˤadi-a nediw ʕaq’lu b-odi-zaƛ’ aɣi ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu-n b-izi-n b-ay-x-anu-a žigo-ƛ’ay-gon ža ziru-ƛin
\g crow-ERG such advice III-do-CSL.CVB bird much be.happy-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB III-come-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q already-SUPER.ABL-CNTR DEM1.SG fox-QUOT
\l When the crow gave such an advice, the bird rejoiced and... [this fox didn't want to come already???].

\t Łˤono äƛiru ɣudƛ’ogon ziru ɣunoxorno bayn aɣixor qˤaƛin, kurnäy där xexoy kuro, yäłi ɣunno rutirno minnan nełde sadaq bac’a yołƛin.
\m łˤono eƛi-ru ɣudi-ƛ’-gon ziru ɣun-xor-n b-ay-n aɣi-xor qˤaƛi-n kur-näy di-r xexoy kur-o yałi ɣun-n r-utir-n mi-n-nan neła-de sadaq b-ac’-a yoł-ƛin
\g three say-PST.PRT day-SUPER.ESS-CNTR fox tree-AD.LAT-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB bird-AD.LAT shout-PFV.CVB throw-CND.CVB me-LAT young.animal throw-IMPR else tree-TOP IV-turn-PFV.CVB you-TOP-INT DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS together III-eat-INF be-QUOT
\l On the third day, the fox came to the tree again and shouted to the bird: "Throw me down your nestling, or else I will throw the tree over and eat you together with it!"

\t Aɣä žawab teƛno, insanqo ʕonodkin rigzaxay yutixanusi ačit’, debeq maħin rok’noyä ža yutixƛin.
\m aɣi-a žawab teƛ-n insan-q ʕo-d-kin r-ig-za-xay y-uti-xanusi ačit’ mi-q maħi-n r-ok’-n-a ža y-uti-x-ƛin
\g bird-ERG answer give-PFV.CVB human-POSS.ESS ax-INSTR-even IV-good-ZA-AD.ABL II-turn-NEG.PRS.PRT pine you-POSS.ESS tail-TOP IV.PL-beat-PFV.CVB-Q DEM1.SG II-turn-PRS-QUOT
\l The bird answered: "Even a human can hardly chop the tree down with an axe, how could you beat it down with your tail?"

\t Ža aɣes täqrun zira eƛin, debeq ža äsirus haqu yoč’ik’oƛƛin.
\m ža aɣi-s teq-run ziru-a eƛi-n mi-q ža esi-ru-s haqu y-oč’ik’-ƛ-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG bird-GEN1 hear-IMM.ANT.CVB fox-ERG say-PFV.CVB you-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG tell-PST.PRT-GEN1 mouth II-freeze-OPT-QUOT
\l After hearing what the bird said, the fox said: "May the mouth freeze to the one who told you that!"

\t T’ok’ow roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey, q’ˤuyzaɣaɣor dawlaƛ’ zirun bik’in.
\m t’ok’ow r-odi-a šebin koƛ’i-č’ey q’ˤuyzaɣ-aɣor dawla-ƛ’ ziru-n b-ik’i-n
\g anymore IV-do-INF thing understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB somwhere.else-IN.VERS prey-SUPER.ESS fox-TOP III-go-PST.UNW
\l Not knowing what to do anymore, the fox went after prey somewhere else.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder neła nełas xexoy kikix bercingo aɣin bičin.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder neła-a neła-s xexoy kiki-x bercingo aɣi-n b-iči-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 young.animal feed-IPFV.CVB good bird-TOP III-be-PST.UNW
\l After that, it fed its nestling and was a good bird.

\t Zownƛax zown anuƛax sis žek’u.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis žek’u
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT one man
\l Once upon a time there was a man.

\t Nesis łˤono kid zown.
\m nesi-s łˤono kid zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 three daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had three daughters.

\t Didurnotow ħal bayrinč’izaƛ’, babiw razin oqno, hič’č’a yeženiqor č’ikay, yoƛƛozoqor muri, yeɣeniqor hiƛun teƛno yizirabi mežar hunix ħažat raqƛin, žedun ełuyaƛ’or regirno.
\m didur-n-tow ħal b-ayr-č’i-zaƛ’ babiw razi-n oq-n hič’č’a y-eže-ni-qor č’ikay y-oƛƛo-zo-qor muri y-eɣe-ni-qor hiƛu-n teƛ-n yizirabi meža-r huni-x ħažat r-oq-ƛin žedu-n ełu-ƛ’or r-egir-n
\g how-TOP-EMPH strength III-bring-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB father agree-TOP become-PFV.CVB the.most II-old-DEF-POSS.LAT mirror II-middle-ATTR.OBL-POSS.LAT needle II-young-DEF-POSS.LAT comb-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM2.PL you(II-LAT way-AD.ESS necessity IV-become-QUOT DEM1.IPL-TOP bilberry-SUPER.LAT IV-send-PST.UNW
\l Because they didn't give in in any way, that the father agreed and gave the oldest one a mirror, the middle one a needle and the younger one a comb, said "These things will become useful for you on your way!" and sent them to get bilberries.

\t Ciqqo ełu yut’ixno ričin, biynč’ey zamanno bik’in, sasiłno.
\m ciq-q ełu y-ut’i-x-n r-iči-n b-iy-č’ey zaman-n b-ik’i-n sasił-n
\g forest-POSS.ESS bilberry II-collect-IPFV.CVB-TOP IV-be-PFV.CVB III-know-NEG.PST.CVB time-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB get.dark-PST.UNW
