\l They were collecting bilberries in the forest and didn't notice how the time went by and it got dark.

\t Ič’č’an yeɣeni esiya sasiłzaƛ’ortown, xexłiƛ’ iduɣor ƛaƛin daʕba bičirłin, nełqor žedu ʕenekizi roqnoanu.
\m ič’č’a-n y-eɣe-ni esyu-a sasił-zaƛ’or-tow-n xexłi-ƛ’ idu-ɣor ƛa-ƛin daʕba b-iči-r-łin neła-qor žedu ʕenekizi r-oq-n-anu
\g the.most-TOP II-young-DEF sister-ERG get.dark-POST.CVB-EMPH-TOP quickness-SUPER.ESS home-IN.ALL go.IMPR-QUOT dispute III-be-CAUS-CNC.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT DEM1.IPL listen II.PL-become-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l Although the youngest sister argued: "We have to go home quick before it gets dark!", the didn't listen to her.

\t Sasiłnosi narnokin rik’an koƛ’inč’ey łˤonon esnabi ciqqotow ƛexun.
\m sasił-nosi nar-n-kin r-ik’i-an koƛ’i-č’ey łˤono-n esyu-bi ciq-q-tow ƛexu-n
\g get.dark-ANT.CVB where-TOP-even II.PL-go-FUT.CVB understand.to-NEG.PSTUNW three-TOP sister-PL forest-POSS.ESS-EMPH remain-PST.UNW
\l After it got dark, the three sisters didn't know where to go and remained in the forest.

\t Sida zamanałäy maqˤi riłe yizar c’i rukayn.
\m sida zaman-łay maqˤi r-iłe yiza-r c’i r-ukad-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ABL far.away IV-as DEM2.IIPL.OBL-LAT fire IV-see-PST.UNW
\l Suddenly, they saw a fire far away.

\t Ɣˤutkoxor rik’in, acno yaɣˤin tełer rezunosi, elo žedar yeɣe kid yesun.
\m ɣˤutku-xor r-ik’i-n ac-n y-ˤaɣˤi-n tełer r-ezu-nosi elo žeda-r y-eɣe kid y-esu-n
\g house-AD.LAT II.PL-go-PFV.CVB door-TOP II-open-PFV.CVB to.the.inside II.PL-look-ANT.CVB there DEM1.IIPL.OBL-LAT II-young girl II-find-PST.UNW
\l They went to the house and opened the door, and when they looked inside, they found a young girl there.

\t Łˤonon žedu rukaynosi, yeɣeni kid yezun ƛexun, yizigon nazay t’or keze roqäƛin.
\m łˤono-n žedu r-ukad-nosi y-eɣe-ni kid y-ezu-n ƛexu-n yizi-gon nazay t’o-r keze r-oq-a-ƛin
\g three-TOP DEM1.IPL II.PL-see-ANT.CVB II-young-DEF girl II-look-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL-CNTR from.where here-LAT meet II.PL-become-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l When the young girl saw the three of them, it remained looking [surprised] and asked, where they had come from.

\t Esnaza esin, hemedur hunin łaħin, t’ok’ow nar rik’an koƛ’inč’ey, c’idoxor nexno howt’or raysƛin.
\m esyu-bi-a esi-n hemedur huni-n łaħi-n t’ok’ow nar r-ik’i-an koƛ’i-č’ey c’i-xor nex-n howt’o-r r-ay-s-ƛin
\g sister-PL-ERG tell-PFV.CVB so way-TOP forget-PFV.CVB anymore where II.PL-go-FUT.DEF understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB fire-AD.LAT come-PFV.CVB here-LAT II.PL-come-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The sisters told, that they lost their way and didn't know where to go anymore, so they came here to the fire.

\t Idu yäsuru kidbä eƛin, elin hemedur meži riłetow hunin łaħin rayäsi.
\m idu y-esu-ru kid-a eƛi-n eli-n hemedur meži r-iłe-tow huni-n łaħi-n r-ay-asi
\g home II-find-PST.PRT girl-ERG say-PFV.CVB we-TOP so you.PL II.PL-as-EMPH way-TOP forget-PFV.CVB II.PL-come-RES.PRT
\l The girl that they found in the house said: "Just like you, we lost our way and came here.

\t Sasaq qˤašizaƛ’or yiłzaqay rok’łinč’inäy, aždaħä meži rac’ƛin.
\m sasaq qˤaši-zaƛ’or yiła-za-qay r-ok’eł-č’i-näy aždaħ-a meži r-ac’-ƛin
\g in.the.morning set.in-POST.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ZA-POSS.ABL II.PL-escape-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB dragon-ERG you.PL II.PL-eat-QUOT
\l When you don't leave this place before dawn, a dragon will eat you."

\t Sasaqor kidbeden ričin, neła äƛiruxor, qˤašizaƛ’ortow rizin elay roxin nexƛ’oräy, maqˤiräytow xizaz nexxo aždaħes haraƛ’ teqno.
\m sasaq-qor kid-de-n r-iči-n neła-a äƛiru-xor qˤaši-zaƛ’or-tow r-izi-n ele-ay r-oxi-n nex-ƛ’oräy maqˤi-r-ay-tow xizaz nex-x aždaħ-s haraƛ’ teq-n
\g in.the.morning-POSS.LAT girl-APUD.ESS-TOP II.PL-wait-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG ORD-AD.LAT set.in-POST.CVB-EMPH II.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL II.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB far.away-LAT-IN.ABL-EMPH from.behind come-IPFV.CVB dragon-GEN1 voice hear-PST.UNW
\l In the morning, they waited with the girl, as she said, and before the sun set it, they got up and while they were running away, they could here the dragon's voice behind them.

\t Nełqay roxin rik’iƛ’oräy, yeženi esiya babiya neƛno zawruni č’ikay q’ˤidar kurno.
\m neła-qay r-oxi-n r-ik’i-ƛ’oräy y-eže-ni esyu-a babiw-a neƛ-n zow-ru-ni č’ikay q’ˤida-r kur-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL II.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB II.PL-go-SIM.CVB II-old-DEF sister-ERG father-ERG give-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF mirror down-LAT throw-PST.UNW
\l While they were running away from it, the eldest sister threw down the mirror that their father had given her.

\t Esnazał xizaz ixiw raład boqno.
\m esyu-bi-ł xizaz ixiw raład b-oq-n
\g sister-PL-CONT.ESS behind big sea III-become-PST.UNW
\l And a big sea formed behind the sisters.

\t Łˤoran esnazaq aždaħ čerayx zown, raładyoł boqanix där kumak bodoƛin.
\m łˤora-n esyu-bi-q aždaħ čerad-x zow-n raład-ł b-oq-ani-x di-r kumak b-odi-o-ƛin
\g three.OBL-TOP sister-PL-POSS.ESS dragon beg-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB sea-CONT.ESS III-become-MSD-AD.ESS me-LAT help III-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l The dragon was begging the three sisters: "Help me getting over this sea!"

\t Hudun neła kʷanin bok’no, taqˤorno boqno, kidbabi riqira risƛ’oräy, yoƛƛozoni esiya q’ˤidar muri kurno.
\m hudun neła-a kʷani-n b-ok’-n taqˤo-r-n b-oq-n kid-bi r-iqir-a r-is-ƛ’oräy y-oƛƛo-zo-ni esyu-a q’ˤida-r muri kur-n
\g nevertheless DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG swimming-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB over.there-LAT-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB girl-PL II.PL-take.away-INF II.PL-take-SIM.CVB II-middle-ATTR.OBL-DEF sister-ERG down-LAT needle throw-PST.UNW
\l Nevertheless, it swam across it and got there, and when it tried to catch the girls, the middle one threw the needle down.

\t Aždaħeł adäza ixiw gibas ħon yoqno.
\m aždaħ-ł adäza ixiw gibu-s ħon y-oq-n
\g dragon-CONT.ESS before big dust-GEN1 mountain II-become-PST.UNW
\l And in front of the dragon, a big mountain of sand was formed.

\t Dicegon ža soder bizanƛin hunƛ’izi boqłin, pˤaƛirno bižin yałza wˤałertow bayx zown.
\m dice-gon ža soder b-izi-an-ƛin hunƛ’izi b-oq-łin pˤaƛir-n b-iži-n yoł-za wˤał-r-tow b-ay-x zow-n
\g how.much-CNTR DEM1.SG upward III-get.up-FUT.CVB-QUOT trying III-become-CNC.CVB glide.off-PFV.CVB III-carry-PFV.CVB be-LCV.CVB downward-LAT-EMPH III-come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l But how much it tried to get upwards, it always glided off and came down where it was.

\t Esnabi, muši kuracekin ričinč’ey, aždaħqay raqruce maqˤir roxin rik’anił ričix zown.
\m esyu-bi muši kur-ace-kin r-iči-č’ey aždaħ-qay r-oq-ru-ace maqˤi-r r-oxi-n r-ik’i-ani-ł r-iči-x zow-n
\g sister-PL breath throw-TERM-even II.PL-be-NEG.PST.CVB dragon-POSS.ABL IV-become-PST.PRT-TERM far.away-LAT II.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB II.PL-go-MSD-CONT.ESS II.PL-be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The sisters, not even waiting a single breath, were running away from the dragon to get far away from it.

\t Igaɣor bayƛ’oräy, hič’č’an yeɣeni esiyagon, babiya nełqor teƛno zawruni, hiƛu kurno.
\m igo-aɣor b-ay-ƛ’oräy hič’č’a-n y-eɣe-ni esyu-a-gon babiw-a neła-qor teƛ-n zow-ru-ni hiƛu kur-n
\g near-IN.VERS III-come-SIM.CVB the.most-TOP II-young-DEF sister-ERG-CNTR father-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT give-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF comb throw-PST.UNW
\l When it came closer, the youngest sister threw down the comb that their father had given to her.

\t Aždaħeł adäz čečiw ciq rizin.
\m aždaħ-ł adäz čečiw ciq r-izi-n
\g dragon-CONT.ESS before dense forest IV-get.up-PST.UNW
\l And in front of the dragon grew a dense forest.

\t Hudun aždaħ sis ɣun recurxo, sidaƛ’aza bet’un k’oƛix esnazał xizay k’oƛin nexxo zown.
\m hudun aždaħ sis ɣun r-ecur-x sida-ƛ’aza b-et’u-n k’oƛi-x esyu-bi-ł xizay k’oƛi-n nex-x zow-n
\g nevertheless dragon one tree IV-break-IPFV.CVB one.OBL-SUPER.VERS.DIST III-jump-PFV.CVB run-IPFV.CVB sister-PL-CONT.ESS behind run-PFV.CVB come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Nevertheless the dragon - breaking one tree - jumped onto [another] one and cam running behind the sisters.

\t Sida mixƛ’o ža ciqno łiyn, nasin šebin adäz ričinosi, žedar ʕaƛos xalq’i bukayn, žedu k’edix žedał xizay maħor boqäsi.
\m sida mixƛ’o ža ciq-n łiy-n nasin šebin adäz r-iči-nosi žeda-r ʕaƛ-s xalq’i b-ukad-n žedu k’edi-x žeda-ł xizay maħor b-oq-asi
\g one.OBL at.a.time DEM1.SG forest-TOP end-PFV.CVB all thing before II.PL-be-ANT.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-LAT village-GEN1 people III-see-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL search-IPFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS behind outside III-become-RES.PRT
\l When the forest ended at once and everything was in sight, they saw some villagers that were searching for them.

\t Xalq’in, ʕaƛno bukaynosi, aždaħ nełaq ža biqinč’ey neła nełaz iduɣor, ciqaɣor, boxin.
\m xalq’i-n ʕaƛ-n b-ukad-nosi aždaħ neła-q ža b-iqi-č’ey neła-a neła-z idu-ɣor ciq-aɣor b-oxi-n
\g people-and village-and III-see-ANT.CVB dragon DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG III-get-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 home-IN.ALL forest-IN.VERS III-run.away-PST.UNW
\l When the dragon saw the people and the village, it ran back to its own home, towards the forest.

\t Č’ago, saɣłiƛ’ kidbabi rukaynosi, babiw ɣˤaɣˤu izin.
\m č’ago saɣłi-ƛ’ kid-bi r-ukad-nosi babiw ɣˤaɣˤu izi-n
\g alive health-SUPER.ESS girl-PL II.PL-see-ANT.CVB father be.happy get-PST.UNW
\l When the father saw the girls alive and healthy, he got very happy.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder žedu kidbabi ħalaxor regirnokin ciqaɣor rik’ix zownanu.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder žedu kid-bi ħal-xor r-egir-n-kin ciq-aɣor r-ik’i-x zow-n-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after DEM1.IPL girl-PL strength-AD.LAT II.PL-let-PFV.CVB-even forest-IN.VERS II.PL-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l After that, the girl couldn't even with force go into the forest anymore.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Sida quł roƛa yutirnosi, eniya kidbeqor eƛin, mi babiwqor eƛo, nagaħ di yexunäy hoboda bašiqˤoy c’oxxosi taraw nesä ɣˤanabi yawnoƛƛin.
\m sida qu-ł r-oƛ-a y-utir-nosi eni-a kid-qor eƛi-n mi babiw-qor eƛi-o nagaħ di y-exu-näy hoboda bašiqˤoy c’ox-xosi taraw nesi-a ɣˤanabi y-ow-n-ƛ-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS IV-hurt-INF II-begin-ANT.CVB mother-ERG daughter-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB you father-POSS.LAT say-IMPR suddenly me II-die-CND.CVB that ring match-PRS.PRT except.for DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG woman II-marry-PROHIB-OPT-QUOT
\l One day, when the mother started to feel pain, she told her daughter: "Tell your father that when I suddenly die, he may only marry a woman who matches this ring!"

\t Nełƛ’osi kʷaxatow nełas eniw yexun.
\m nełƛ’osi kʷaxa-tow neła-s eniw y-exu-n
\g of.that.time soon-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 mother II-die-PST.UNW
\l Short time later, her mother died.

\t Boƛƛo zamanno bik’in, babiw baru yowa oqnosi, nesiqor bašiqˤoyn teƛno, kidbä eƛin, eniws wasi zows dowqor, howda bašiqˤoy c’oxxosi taraw mi baru yawnoƛƛin.
\m b-oƛƛo zaman-n b-ik’i-n babiw baru y-ow-a oq-nosi nesi-qor bašiqˤoy-n teƛ-n kid-a eƛi-n eniw-s wasi zow-s mi-qor howda bašiqˤoy c’ox-xosi taraw mi baru y-ow-n-ƛ-ƛin
\g III-middle time-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB father wife II-marry-INF begin-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT ring-TOP give-PFV.CVB daughter-ERG say-PFV.CVB mother-GEN1 testament be.NPRS-PST.WIT you-POSS.LAT DEM3.SG ring match-PRS.PRT except.for you wife II-marry-PROHIB-OPT-QUOT
\l After a while, when the father intented to find a[nother] wife, the daughter gave him the ring and said: "Mother's last wish was that you may only marry a woman who matches this ring."

\t Ruy neł best’al eniya yiła kidbeƛ’ ʕuraw ɣudi rayrxo zown, c’ik’iw iduzasin, maħasin ħalt’i neła best’al kidbeƛ’or kurno xecix zown.
\m r-uy neła best’al eni-a yiła kid-ƛ’ ʕuraw ɣudi r-ayr-x zow-n c’ik’iw idu-bi-si-n ma-si-n ħalt’i neła-a best’al kid-ƛ’or kur-n xeci-x zow-n
\g IV-just DEM1.IISG.OBL step mother-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL girl-SUPER.ESS many day IV-bring-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB entire home-PL-ATTR-TOP outside-ATTR-TOP work DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG step daughter-SUPER.LAT throw-PFV.CVB leave-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l But the stepmother tortured the girl many days and threw all the work in the house and outside onto her stepdaughter.

\t Best’al eniya nełaƛ’ rayrxosi ɣudin q’urƛ’or rizin, kidbä ħukmu boyn, eniwsni bašiqˤoyn nełqay riqirno, yoxanixƛin.
\m best’al eni-a neła-ƛ’ r-ayr-xosi ɣudi-n q’ur-ƛ’or r-izi-n kid-a ħukmu b-odi-n eniw-s-ni bašiqˤoy-n neła-qay r-iqir-n y-oxi-ani-x-ƛin
\g step mother-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS IV-bring-PRS.PRT day-TOP throat-SUPER.LAT IV-get-PFV.CVB girl-ERG decision III-do-PFV.CVB mother-GEN1-DEF ring-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL IV-take.away-PFV.CVB II-run.away-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l The fact that the stepmother bothered her so much went on her nerves and she decided to take her mother's ring away from her in order to run away.

\t Sida quł neła nełasno, eniwsno sidaƛ’or šeƛ’un rutirno, žan rižin ciqaɣor yoxin.
\m sida qu-ł neła-a neła-s-n eniw-s-n sida-ƛ’or šeƛ’u-n r-utir-n ža-n r-iži-n ciq-aɣor y-oxi-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-and mother-GEN1-and one.OBL-SUPER.LAT clothing-TOP IV-gather-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP IV-carry-PFV.CVB forest-IN.VERS II-run.away-PST.UNW
\l One day she collected the clothes of herself and her mother and carrying them escaped into the forest.

\t (Ža kid c’aq’ bercinaw, ƛ’iräy ozuri boɣa retixanusi yiłe zown.)
\m ža kid c’aq’ bercinaw ƛ’iräy ozuri b-oɣ-a r-eti-xanusi y-iłe zow-n
\g DEM1.SG girl very beautiful from.above eye III-take.away-INF IV-want-NEG.PRS.PRT II-as be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l (That girl was so beautiful, that one wouldn't want to keep the eyes from her.)

\t Sidaɣ žopono ciqa tełer yaynosi, yiła ħošin šeƛ’un, sida osiy ažoq soder yizin.
\m sidaɣ žopono ciq-a tełer y-ay-nosi yiła-a ħoši-n šeƛ’u-n sida osiy ažo-q soder y-izi-n
\g in.one.place dense forest-IN.ESS into II-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG hide-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB one.OBL high tree-POSS.ESS upward II-get.up-PST.UNW
\l After she came into the dense forest, she put on a hide and climbed up a high tree.

\t Hemełƛ’o łˤono bełiqubi boƛixno.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ łˤono bełiqu-bi b-oƛix-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS three hunter-PL I.PL-appear-PST.UNW
\l At this time, three hunters appeared

\t Žedułäy sidä ɣunoqor c’eruc’a kurƛ’oräy, sidenä karnoƛin eč’erno, łinax riyx insan esaniƛin.
\m žedu-łay sida-a ɣun-qor c’eruc’a kur-ƛ’oräy sida-ni-a kur-n-ƛin eč’er-n łinax r-iy-x insan esu-ani-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL-CONT.ABL one.OBL-ERG tree-POSS.LAT bow shoot.from-SIM.CVB one.OBL-DEF-ERG shoot.from-PROHIB-QUOT stop-PFV.CVB how IV-know-IPFV.CVB human exist-MSD-QUOT
\l When one of them wanted to shoot the tree with his bow, another one stopped him saying: "Don't shoot! How do you know if there is a person?!".

\t Łˤono äƛiruni bełiqa qˤaƛin, insan esunäy roži roɣo, bełi besunäy ela c’eruc’a caƛixƛin.
\m łˤono äƛiru-ni bełiqu-a qˤaƛi-n insan esu-näy roži r-oɣ-o bełi b-esu-näy elu-a c’eruc’a caƛi-x-ƛin
\g three ORD-DEF hunter-ERG shout-PFV.CVB human find-CND.CVB word IV-take.away-IMPR deer III-find-CND.CVB we(I).OBL-ERG bow shoot.with-PRS-QUOT
\l The third hunter shouted: "If you are a human, say something; if you are an animal, we will shoot you with the bow!"

\t Di insan yołƛinno, eƛin, kid ažoqay q’ˤidar yoqno.
\m di insan yoł-ƛin-n eƛi-n kid ažo-qay q’ˤida-r y-oq-n
\g me human be-QUOT-TOP say-PFV.CVB girl tree-POSS.ABL down-LAT II-become-PST.UNW
\l Saying "I am a human!", the girl got down from the tree.

\t Bełiquza nełaq, nazay ža t’or yayäƛin esirnosi, hemedur eniwn yexun, best’alłiƛ’no ƛexun bet’erbaqi bodanix maħor yoqäsiƛin esin.
\m bełiqu-bi-a neła-q nazay ža t’o-r y-ay-a-ƛin esir-nosi hemedur eniw-n y-exu-n best’alłi-ƛ’-n ƛexu-n bet’erbaqi b-odi-ani-x maħor y-oq-asi-ƛin esi-n
\g hunter-PL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS from.where DEM1.SG here-LAT II-come-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB so mother-TOP II-die-PFV.CVB orphanhood-SUPER.ESS-TOP remain-PFV.CVB life III-do-MSD-AD.ESS outside II-become-RES.PRT-QUOT tell-PST.UNW
\l When the hunters asked her, from where she came, she said that her mother died and she lived in orphanhood and went outside to make a living.

\t Howlotow kidno xecin bełiqubi žeda žeduz hunix bik’in.
\m howlo-tow kid-n xeci-n bełiqu-bi žedu-a žedu-z huni-x b-ik’i-n
\g there-EMPH girl-TOP leave-PFV.CVB hunter-PL DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 way-AD.ESS I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l Leaving the girl there, the hunters went on their own way.

\t Žeduł teł obiy anusi best’al uži zown.
\m žedu-ł teł obiw anu-si best’al uži zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside father be.NEG-ATTR orphan boy be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Among them was an orphan boy who had no father.

\t Elayn boqno dahawtow bitaɣor bik’inosi, yisi žoyä žeduqor eƛin, di ža kid yowanix ik’ix, däz ža c’aq’ rok’äwa yisäƛin.
\m ele-ay-n b-oq-n dahaw-tow bita-aɣor b-ik’i-nosi yisi uži-a žedu-qor eƛi-n di ža kid y-ow-ani-x ik’i-x di-z ža c’aq’ rok’u-a-a y-is-a-ƛin
\g there-IN.ABL-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB a.little-EMPH distance-IN.VERS I.PL-go-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB me DEM1.SG girl II-marry-MSD-AD.ESS go-PRS me-GEN2 DEM1.SG much heart-IN.ESS-Q II-take-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l When they had gone just a little further, that boy said to them: "I am going to marry this girl; did she really take me into her heart?"

\t Halmaɣza eč’erno yeda, debez eniwr nełas hut’-mˤalin, kočorin rätinč’iƛin.
\m halmaɣ-bi-a eč’er-n yeda mi-z eniw-r neła-s hut’~mˤali-n kočori-n r-eti-č’i-ƛin
\g friend-PL-ERG stop-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG you-GEN2 mother-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 front.part.of.the.face-and forelock-and III.PL-like-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l The friends stopped him[, saying]: "Your mother won't like her face and hair!"

\t Yeda uži žeduł teł rok’u q’uq’ix ik’a retinč’ey ik’ix zown.
\m yeda uži žedu-ł teł rok’u q’uq’i-x ik’i-a r-eti-č’ey ik’i-x zow-n
\g DEM2.ISG boy DEM1.IPL-CONT.ESS inside heart press.out-IPFV.CVB go-INF IV-want-NEG.PST.CVB go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Pulling himself together the boy went with them against his will.

\t Zamanałäy, yeda uži, ža yižinč’ey di ik’ixanu meži bik’iƛin, xizorno utin, kidno yižin ʕaƛaɣor ik’in.
\m zaman-łay yeda uži ža y-iži-č’ey di ik’i-x-anu meži b-ik’i-ƛin xizor-n uti-n kid-n y-iži-n ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-n
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM2.ISG boy DEM1.SG II-carry-NEG.PST.CVB me go-IPFV.CVB-NEG you.PL I.PL-go-QUOT back-TOP return-PFV.CVB girl-TOP II-take.out-PFV.CVB village-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l At one point in time, the boy couldn't bear it any longer and, [saying] "I won't go, you go [alone]!", he returned, took the girl with him and went towards the village.

\t Idurno ik’in, kidno yukarno užä eniwqor eƛin, eni, deber kumakyor di kid yowsƛin.
\m idu-r-n ik’i-n kid-n y-ukar-n uži-a eniw-qor eƛi-n eni mi-r kumak-r di kid y-ow-s-ƛin
\g home-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB girl-TOP II-show-PFV.CVB boy-ERG mother-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB mother you-LAT help-LAT me girl II-bring-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l When he went home, he showed the girl to his mother and saying: "Mother, I brought this girl for helping you."

\t Nełas kuckinwa bigu anu, łinar ža mi yowäƛin, nesir žawabyor, bixzi yoqno yiłetow, eƛin eniya.
\m neła-s kuc-kin-a b-igu anu łinar ža mi y-ow-a-ƛin nesi-r žawab-r bixzi y-oq-n y-iłe-tow eƛi-n eni-a
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 form-even-Q III-pretty be.NEG why DEM1.SG you II-bring-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT answer-LAT angry II-become-PFV.CVB II-as-EMPH say-PST.UNW mother-ERG
\l "She doesn't even look pretty, why did you bring her?", answered him the mother as if getting angry.

\t Ža kid žeda netintow pečmox ħošin šeƛ’urno xecix zown.
\m ža kid žedu-a netin-tow peč-x ħoši-n šeƛ’u-r-n xeci-x zow-n
\g DEM1.SG girl DEM1.IPL-ERG always-EMPH oven-AD.ESS hide-TOP put.on-CAUS-PFV.CVB leave-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They always kept her at the oven and dressed her in a skin.

\t Sida quł, kidno howlotow xecin, eniwn, užin ʕaƛa bik’ixozo sida bertenyołxor bik’in.
\m sida qu-ł kid-n howlo-tow xeci-n eniw-n uži-n ʕaƛ-a b-ik’i-xozo sida berten-łxor b-ik’i-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS girl-TOP there-EMPH leave-PFV.CVB mother-and son-and village-IN.ESS I.PL-go-PRS.PRT.OBL one.OBL marriage-CONT.VERS I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l One day, they left the girl there like this again and mother and son went to a marriage in the village.

\t Yizi bok’äłrun, kidbä ƛ’iräy ħošin boɣno, bercinaw šeƛ’un šeƛ’un, bašiłgon bašiqˤoyn erno bertenyołxor yik’in.
\m yizi b-ok’eł-run kid-a ƛ’iräy ħoši-n b-oɣ-n bercinaw šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n baša-ł-gon bašiqˤoy-n er-n berten-łxor y-ik’i-n
\g DEM2.IPL I.PL-go.away-IMM.ANT.CVB girl-ERG from.above hide-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB beautiful clothing-and clothing-and finger-CONT.ESS-CNTR ring-and put-PFV.CVB marriage-CONT.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l After they went away, the girl took off the hide, put on beautiful clothes and the ring on her finger and went to the marriage.

\t Nazon yedu, q’ˤidakin yiča yegirinč’ey, łočyaƛ’ yoɣxo zown.
\m nazo-n yedu q’ˤida-kin y-iči-a y-egir-č’ey łoč-ƛ’ y-oɣ-x zow-n
\g all.OBL-TOP DEM2.IISG down-even II-sit-INF II-let-NEG.PST.CVB dance-SUPER.ESS II-take.away-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Everyone, not even letting her sit down, invited her to a dance.

\t Zamanałäy, łarnokin yukaynč’ey, yedu kid iduɣorno yik’in, šeƛ’un roɣno neła nełas ħošin šeƛ’un, yałzatow pečmox kecno yičin.
\m zaman-łay ła-r-n-kin y-ukad-č’ey yedu kid idu-ɣor-n y-ik’i-n šeƛ’u-n r-oɣ-n neła-a neła-s ħoši-n šeƛ’u-n yoł-za-tow peč-x kec-n y-iči-n
\g time-CONT.ABL who.OBL-LAT-TOP-even II-see-NEG.PST.CVB DEM2.IISG girl home-IN.ALL-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB clothing-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 hide-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB be-LCV.CVB-EMPH oven-AD.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB II-be-PST.UNW
\l After a while, the girl went home with nobody seeing her, took off the clothes, put on her hide, and went to sleep at the oven where she was.

\t Bertenyołäy ža bašiqˤoy yałruni kid guginosi, yisi žas tatun bexun, xexłiƛ’ idurno ik’in, mežä pun bok’no ičin.
\m berten-łay ža bašiqˤoy yoł-ru-ni kid gugi-nosi yisi uži-s tatu-n b-exu-n xexłi-ƛ’ idu-r-n ik’i-n muži-a pu-n b-ok’-n iči-n
\g marriage-CONT.ABL DEM1.SG ring be-PST.PRT-DEF girl escape-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-GEN1 cheerfulness-TOP III-die-PFV.CVB quickness-SUPER.ESS home-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB mattress-IN.ESS side-TOP III-hit-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l When the girl with the ring had disappeared from the marriage, the boy lost his cheerfulness and quickly went home and to bed.

\t Yaynosi eniya esirno nesiq, łinaq nece q’ʷarid oqno ičäsi, debi ruyä roƛxoƛin.
\m y-ay-nosi eni-a esir-n nesi-q łina-q nece q’ʷarid oq-n iči-asi mi-s r-uy-a r-oƛ-x-ƛin
\g II-come-ANT.CVB mother-ERG ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS what.OBL-POSS.ESS so.much sadness become-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT you-GEN1 IV-indeed-Q IV-be.sick-PRS-QUOT
\l When the mother came home, she asked: "What are you so sad about, are you sick?"

\t Užä eƛin, anƛ’imarsi där hunixor qˤašo ero, mesedyos bašiqˤoy yałruni kid k’eda di ik’ix.
\m uži-a eƛi-n anƛ’i-r-si di-r huni-xor qˤaši-o er-o mesed-s bašiqˤoy yoł-ru-ni kid k’edi-a di ik’i-x
\g boy-ERG say-PFV.CVB week-LAT-ATTR me-LAT way-AD.LAT get.up-IMPR put-IMPR gold-GEN1 ring be-PST.PRT-DEF girl search-INF me go-PRS
\l The boy answered: "Pack provisions for me for a way of one week, I'm going to search the girl with the golden ring."

\t Ža yukayzaƛ’or dey rok’u ħalkizi roqxanu.
\m ža y-ukad-zaƛ’or di-s rok’u ħalkizi r-oq-x-anu
\g DEM1.SG II-see-POST.CVB me-GEN1 heart calm.down IV-become-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l My heart won't hold stil until I have seen her.

\t Biša royn łiyƛ’oräy, yedugon łuƛan goƛ’in maħor yok’äłrun, kidbä yizin magala teł bašiqˤoyn eqerno, yik’in neła nełaz pečmoxozoni mežä kecno yičin.
\m bišʷa r-odi-n łiy-ƛ’oräy yedu-gon łu-ƛa-n goƛ’i-n maħor y-ok’eł-run kid-a y-izi-n magalu-a teł bašiqˤoy-n eqer-n y-ik’i-n neła-a neła-z peč-xozo-ni muži-a kec-n y-iči-n
\g food IV-do-PFV.CVB end-SIM.CVB DEM2.IISG-CNTR who.OBL-INDEF-TOP call-PFV.CVB outside II-go.away-IMM.ANT.CVB girl-ERG II-get.up-PFV.CVB bread-IN.ESS inside ring-TOP put-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 oven-PRS.PRT.OBL-DEF mattress-IN.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB II-be-PST.UNW
\l When she finished preparing the food and someone called outside and she went away, the girl got up, put the ring inside the bread and went back to sleep in the bed at the oven.

\t Eniwq royn łäyruni magalabin eƛuk’ya teł erno, mesedyos bašiqˤoy yałruni kid k’eda hunix oqno.
\m eniw-q r-odi-n łiy-ru-ni magalu-bi-n eƛuk’-a teł er-n mesed-s bašiqˤoy yoł-ru-ni kid k’edi-a huni-x oq-n
\g mother-POSS.ESS IV-do-PFV.CVB end-PST.PRT-DEF bread-PL-TOP leather.sack-IN.ESS inside put-PFV.CVB gold-GEN1 ring be-PST.PRT-DEF girl search-INF way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l The mother put the finished breads into a sack and got on her way to search the girl with the golden ring.

\t Yeda uži, bišʷannan rok’ƛ’ay šuƛ’in, q’ˤuna anƛ’ima hunix ik’in.
\m yeda uži bišʷa-n-nan rok’u-ƛ’ay šuƛ’i-n q’ˤuna anƛ’i-a huni-x ik’i-n
\g DEM2.ISG boy food-TOP-INT heart-SUPER.ABL forget-PFV.CVB two.OBL week-IN.ESS way-AD.ESS go-PST.UNW
\l The boy forgot about food entirely and went on his way for two weeks.

\t Meko rok’ƛ’or raynosi, sida ʕaƛoz raʕalłix išʷanixƛin q’ˤida ičin.
\m meko rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-nosi sida ʕaƛ-z raʕalłi-x iš-ani-x-ƛin q’ˤida iči-n
\g hunger heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come-ANT.CVB one.OBL village-GEN2 suburb-AD.ESS eat-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT down sit-PST.UNW
\l When he noticed his hunger, he sat down to eat at the suburb of a village.

\t Eƛuk’ya tełäy bišʷan roɣno, eniya badiruni magalu bac’anixƛin yisä boƛƛo becarun, mesedyos bašiqˤoy roƛixno.
\m eƛuk’-a teł-ay bišʷa-n r-oɣ-n eni-a b-odi-ru-ni magalu b-ac’-ani-x-ƛin yisi-a b-oƛƛo b-ecur-run mesed-s bašiqˤoy r-oƛix-n
\g leather.sack-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL food-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB mother-ERG III-do-PST.PRT-DEF bread III-eat-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG III-middle III-break-IMM.ANT.CVB gold-GEN1 ring IV-appear-PST.UNW
\l He took the food out of the sack, and when he broke the bread that his mother made in the middle in order to eat it, a golden ring showed up.

\t Užir suƛƛitow čuqˤno, ža bašiqˤoy neła kidbez bašiłsi yałrułi.
\m uži-r suƛƛi-tow čuqˤ-n ža bašiqˤoy neła kid-z baša-ł-si yoł-rułi
\g boy-LAT suddenly-EMPH notice-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG ring DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-GEN2 finger-CONT.ESS-ATTR be-MSD
\l The boy suddenly noticed that this ring was from the finger of that girl.

\t Ditow nexanƛin, eƛin eniya.
\m di-tow nex-an-ƛin eƛi-n eni-a
\g me-EMPH come-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW mother-ERG
\l "I'm coming myself!", said the mother.

\t Ay, ža yegirƛin, et’un c’oxno ičin uži.
\m ay ža y-egir-ƛin et’u-n c’ox-n iči-n uži
\g come DEM1.SG II-let-QUOT stay.behind-PFV.CVB hit-PFV.CVB be-PFV.CVB boy
\l "No, let her do it!", he insisted without accepting a compromise.

\t Kid neside igor yayrun, užä nełqay ħošos šeƛ’un roɣno mesedyos bašiqˤoy ernosi, adäyzoƛ’aygon bercinaw ža užir yukayn.
\m kid nesi-de igo-r y-ay-run uži-a neła-qay ħoši-s šeƛ’u-n r-oɣ-n mesed-s bašiqˤoy er-nosi adäy-zo-ƛ’ay-gon bercinaw ža uži-r y-ukad-n
\g girl DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS near-LAT II-come-IMM.ANT.CVB boy-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL hide-GEN1 clothing-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB gold-GEN1 ring put-ANT.CVB earlier-ATTR.OBL-SUPER.ABL-CNTR beautiful DEM1.SG boy-LAT II-see-PST.UNW
\l When the girl came to him, the boy took off her hide-clothes and put the golden ring on her, and the boy saw that she was much more beautiful than before.

\t Xizyogon nesä q’ˤuna äƛiru t’alamqosi eniwq madazartow rekan kurerno, acno serun, kidno iduɣor yegirno, yeda eniwdäɣor ik’in.
\m xizyogon nesi-a q’ˤuna eƛi-ru t’ala-q-si eniw-q ma-azar-tow reka-n kur-r-n ac-n seru-n kid-n idu-ɣor y-egir-n yeda eniw-däɣor ik’i-n
\g then DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG two.OBL say-PST.PRT floor-POSS.ESS-ATTR mother-POSS.ESS outside-IN.LAT.DIST-EMPH key-TOP throw-CAUS-PFV.CVB door-TOP unlock-PFV.CVB girl-TOP home-IN.ALL II-let-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG mother-APUD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l After that, he let his mother throw the keys to the second floor outside, unlocked the door, let the girl into his house and went to his mother.

\t Yeduyä ža mesedyos bašiqˤoy zawruni kidƛin eniya esirnosi, p’es anusi užä eniw kidbeƛ’ yezura ƛ’iri t’alamäzoni ɣˤutkaɣor yižin.
\m yedu-a ža mesed-s bašiqˤoy zow-ru-ni kid-ƛin eni-a esir-nosi p’es anu-si uži-a eniw kid-ƛ’ y-ezur-a ƛ’iri t’ala-a-z-ni ɣˤutku-aɣor y-iži-n
\g DEM2.IISG-Q DEM1.SG gold-GEN1 ring be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF girl-QUOT mother-ERG ask-ANT.CVB sound be.NEG-ATTR boy-ERG mother girl-SUPER.ESS II-show-INF above floor-IN.ESS-GEN2-DEF room-IN.VERS II-lead-PST.UNW
\l When the mother asked: "Is she the girl with the golden ring?", the boy looked at her silently and lead her into the room upstairs to let her look at the girl.

\t Kid yukaynosi, eniw haganiłno ƛexun, becä žedzox yičix zawru kid nece bercinaw yałru nełar howži gurow riynč’izaƛ’.
\m kid y-ukad-nosi eniw haganił-n ƛexu-n buci-a žeda-z-x y-iči-x zow-ru kid nece bercinaw yoł-ru neła-r howži gurow r-iy-č’i-zaƛ’
\g girl II-see-ANT.CVB mother be.amazed-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB month-IN.ESS DEM1.IIPL.OBL-GEN2-AD.ESS II-live-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT girl so.much beautiful be-PST.PRT DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT now except IV-know-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB
\l Having seen the girl, the mother was amazed that the girl was living with them for one month and because she only now noticed how beautiful the girl was.

\t Howlotow yiła ƛ’iräy uži oɣno, dey ʕayib boqsi idu yičin howžär nełqor yutin yezunč’ey yičizaƛ’.
\m howlo-tow yiła-a ƛ’iräy uži oɣ-n di-s ʕayib b-oq-s idu y-iči-n howži-ar neła-qor y-uti-n y-ezu-č’ey y-iči-zaƛ’
\g there-EMPH DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG from.above boy take.away-PFV.CVB me-GEN1 fault III-happen-PST.WIT home II-live-PFV.CVB now-IN.LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT II-return-PFV.CVB II-look-NEG.PST.CVB II-be-CSL.CVB
\l Then she apologized to the boy: "It was my fault, because I didn't pay attention on her again, since she has been living with us, until now."

\t Łˤora ɣudƛ’az beže bertenno bodin, idur kidno yown.
\m łˤora ɣudi-ƛ’az b-eže berten-n b-odi-n idu-r kid-n y-ow-n
\g three.OBL day-SUPER.ESS.DIST III-big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB home-LAT girl-TOP II-bring-PST.UNW
\l They organized a three days lasting marriage and he brought the girl home.

\t Bełiqubin tamaša boqno ƛexun, nece bercinaw ža kid yesuzaƛ’.
\m bełiqu-bi-n tamaša b-oq-n ƛexu-n nece bercinaw ža kid y-esu-zaƛ’
\g hunter-PL-TOP be.surprised I.PL-become-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB so.much beautiful DEM1.SG girl II-exist-CSL.CVB
\l The hunters were astonished that such a beautiful girl existed.

\t Ele hemedur eniwz bašiqˤoyz kumakyoƛ’aza taliħ besun best’al kidber, žukani best’al eniwqayn yok’ełno.
\m ele hemedur eniw-z bašiqˤoy-z kumak-ƛ’aza taliħ b-esu-n best’al kid-r žuk-ani best’al eniw-qay-n y-ok’eł-n
\g there so mother-GEN2 ring-GEN2 help-SUPER.VERS.DIST happiness III-find-PFV.CVB step daughter-LAT worse-MSD step mother-POSS.ABL-TOP II-escape-PST.UNW
\l Thus, the step daughter has found happiness with the help of her mother's ring and could escape from her evil step mother.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Zownƛax zownanuƛax sis bečedaw žek’u.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax sis bečedaw žek’u
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT one wealthy man
\l Once upon a time, there was a rich man.

\t Nesis q’ˤano gani zown.
\m nesi-s q’ˤano gani zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 two bull.calf be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had two young bulls.

\t Nesä žedu biƛno ƛˤeb yayace reynodanix ruhun roynč’ey, regiƛ’ regirno xecäsi zown.
\m nesi-a žedu biƛno ƛˤeb y-ay-ace r-eynod-ani-x ruhun r-odi-č’ey r-egi-ƛ’ r-egir-n xeci-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL eight year II-come-TERM III.PL-work-MSD-AD.ESS teach III.PL-do-NEG.PST.CVB III.PL-loosen-PCT.CVB III.PL-let-PFV.CVB leave-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He couldn't teach them how to work for eight years, loosened them and let them go.

\t Sida quł yeda žek’u ganzaq ƛexyabin ƛisiran, riƛułno ƛeɣanƛin oqnosi, didurnokin yizä yisiqor meč’ teƛnoanu, ƛ’iri reƛ’u äruntow, žeda boda t’ira xecix zownanu.
\m sida qu-ł yeda žek’u gani-bi-q ƛexu-bi-n ƛisi-r-an riƛu-ł-n ƛeɣ-an-ƛin oq-nosi didur-n-kin yiza-a yisi-qor meč’ teƛ-n-anu ƛ’iri reƛ’u er-run-tow žedu-a b-odi-a t’ira xeci-x zow-n-anu
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.ISG man bull.calf-PL-POSS.ESS log-PL-and pull-CAUS-FUT.DEF field-CONT.ESS-TOP exploit-FUT.DEF-QUOT begin-ANT.CVB how-TOP-even DEM2.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT neck give-PFV.CVB-NEG above yoke put-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM1.IIPL-ERG I.PL-do-INF caprice leave-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l One day the man started to utilize the bulls to pull logs and to plough the field, but they didn't comply at all, and when he put the yoke on them, they didn't feel like it at all.

\t Xizyo bečedawni žek’a naysinan xabar begirno, howziri ganbi reynodaniƛ’or kuczi radiru žek’ur di sis gani teƛa yołƛin.
\m xizyo bečedaw-ni žek’u-a naysinan xabar b-egir-n howziri gani-bi r-eynod-ani-ƛ’or kuczi r-odi-ru žek’u-r di sis gani teƛ-a yoł-ƛin
\g afterwards wealthy-DEF man-ERG everywhere story III-let-PFV.CVB DEM3.PL bull.calf-PL III.PL-work-MSD-SUPER.LAT teach III.PL-do-PST.PRT man-LAT me one bull.calf give-INF be-QUOT
\l After that, the rich man spread the word, that he would give one bull to the person, who would be able to make these bulls work.

\t Oƛixatow žek’u oƛixxo zownanu.
\m oƛix-a-tow žek’u oƛix-x zow-n-anu
\g appear-INF-EMPH man appear-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l But there was no such man at all.

\t Zamanałäy yisider sid miskinaw haq’us užä ayn eƛin, däq regirnäy, žedu di reynodanix ruhun rodanƛin.
\m zaman-łay yisi-der sida miskinaw haq’u-s uži-a ay-n eƛi-n di-q r-egir-näy žedu di r-eynod-ani-x ruhun r-odi-an-ƛin
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM2.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT one.OBL poor family-GEN1 boy-ERG come-PFV.CVB say-PFV.CVB me-POSS.ESS III.PL-send-CND.CVB DEM1.IPL me III.PL-work-MSD-AD.ESS teach III.PL-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l After a while, a boy from a poor family came to him and said: "If you send them to me, I'll teach them how to work."

\t Bečedawni žek’a nesi žaq q’ˤanontow ganbi regirno.
\m bečedaw-ni žek’u-a nesi uži-q q’ˤano-n-tow gani-bi r-egir-n
\g wealthy-DEF man-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-POSS.ESS two-TOP-EMPH bull.calf-PL III.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l And the rich man sent the two bulls to this boy.

\t Užä nesä nesidäɣorno rižin ik’in, siskin žedar rac’anix šebin teƛinč’ey quqa łera ɣudi rečuƛ rišin ričirno.
\m uži-a nesi-a nesi-däɣor-n r-iži-n ik’i-n siskin žeda-r r-ac’-ani-x šebin teƛ-č’ey quqa łera ɣudi reču-ƛ r-iši-n r-ičir-n
\g boy-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.VERS-TOP III.PL-lead-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB anything DEM1.IIPL.OBL-LAT IV-eat-MSD-AD.ESS thing give-NEG.PST.CVB hungry five.OBL day cattleshed-SUB.ESS III.PL-drive.in-PFV.CVB III.PL-stop-PST.UNW
\l The boy led them to himself and gave them nothing to eat for 5 days, making them hungry, and he drove them into the shed.

\t Iłira äƛiru ɣudƛ’o užä dahawtow koyä bixno risno ik’in, rečuƛäy mäħorno roɣno, ƛ’iri reƛ’un erno xizazgon gutanno yicin mečołxor rižin.
\m iłira eƛi-ru ɣudi-ƛ’ uži-a dahaw-tow kʷay-a bix-n r-is-n ik’i-n reču-ƛay maħor-n r-oɣ-n ƛ’iri reƛ’u-n er-n xizaz-gon gutan-n y-ici-n moči-łxor r-iži-n
\g six.OBL say-PST.PRT day-SUPER.ESS boy-ERG a.little-EMPH hand-IN.ESS hay-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB cattleshed-SUB.ABL outside-TOP III.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB above yoke-TOP put-PFV.CVB from.behind-CNTR plow-TOP II-tie-PFV.CVB field-CONT.VERS III.PL-lead-PST.UNW
\l On the sixth day, the boy went to take a little hay in his hand, took them out of the shed, put a yoke around them, tied a plow behind it and lead them into the field.

\t Kʷaxatow žoyä nesä nesisno, bečedawni žek’usno močibi riƛin łiyrno, maduhalzasnonan riƛaniƛ’or boqno.
\m kʷaxa-tow uži-a nesi-a nesi-s-n bečedaw-ni žek’u-s-n moči-bi r-iƛi-n łiyr-n maduhal-bi-s-n-nan r-iƛi-ani-ƛ’or b-oq-n
\g quickly-EMPH boy-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-TOP wealthy-DEF man-GEN1-TOP field-PL III.PL-plough-PFV.CVB finish-PFV.CVB neighbor-PL-GEN1-TOP-INT III.PL-plough-MSD-SUPER.LAT I.PL-begin-PST.UNW
\l Soon the boy finished plowing his own and the wealthy man's fields, and they even began to plough those of the neighbours.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo bečedawni žek’uƛ’or xabar bayn, užä ganbin ruhun rodin, riƛubigon riƛin łiyrxoƛin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo bečedaw-ni žek’u-ƛ’or xabar b-ay-n uži-a gani-bi-n ruhun r-odi-n riƛu-bi-gon r-iƛi-n łiyr-x-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after wealthy-DEF man-SUPER.LAT story III-come-PFV.CVB boy-ERG bull.calf-PL-TOP teach III.PL-do-PFV.CVB field-PL-CNTR IV.PL-plough-PFV.CVB finish-PRS-QUOT
\l After that, the story that the boy taught the bulls to work and is now plowing all the fields, got to the rich man.

\t Yisä užin bogmoƛ’ goƛ’in, nesir beže barkalan bodin, ganin teƛno egirno.
\m yisi-a uži-n bog-ƛ’ goƛ’i-n nesi-r b-eže barkala-n b-odi-n gani-n teƛ-n egir-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG boy-TOP meal-SUPER.ESS call-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT III-big thank-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB bull.calf-TOP give-PFV.CVB let-PST.UNW
\l He invited the boy for dinner, thanked him thoroughly, gave him one bull and let him go.

\t Xizyogon hemesitow bečedawni žek’a naysinan xabar begirno, dey kid yeynodaniƛ’or ruhun yayru žek’ux yegira yołƛin.
\m xizyogon hemesi-tow bečedaw-ni žek’u-a naysinan xabar b-egir-n di-s kid y-eynod-ani-ƛ’or ruhun y-odi-ru žek’u-x y-egir-a yoł-ƛin
\g then DEM4.ISG.OBL-EMPH wealthy-DEF man-ERG everywhere story III-let-PFV.CVB me-GEN1 daughter II-work-MSD-SUPER.LAT teach II-do-PST.PRT man-AD.ESS II-send-INF be-QUOT
\l Then that very same rich man spread the story everywhere, that he would marry his daughter off to the man who would teach her how to work.

\t Nediw roq’ˤ ƛ’irir risxosi žek’u oƛixinč’ey ʕuraw mix bik’in.
\m nediw roq’ˤ ƛ’iri-r r-is-xosi žek’u oƛix-č’ey ʕuraw mix b-ik’i-n
\g such burden above-LAT IV-take-PRS.PRT man appear-NEG.PST.CVB much time III-go-PST.UNW
\l Much time passed when no one appeared to take such a burden on themselves.

\t Zamanałäy, howžatow miskinawni uži oƛixno, di ža yeynodaniƛ’or ruhun yodanƛin.
\m zaman-łay howža-tow miskinaw-ni uži oƛix-n di ža y-eynod-ani-ƛ’or ruhun y-odi-an-ƛin
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM4.SG-EMPH poor-DEF boy appear-PFV.CVB me DEM1.SG II-work-MSD-SUPER.LAT teach II-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l After a while, that poor boy appeared[, saying]: "I will teach her how to work."

\t Yisi užä yedu kid idurno yižin, sasaqozox nasin moƛaxay bizinosi, eƛin, eni, mi hek’uyax eč’uri roda yik’inäy, yiła iduzasi radi, di ciqaɣor ik’anƛin.
\m yisi uži-a yedu kid idu-r-n y-iži-n sasaqozox nasin moƛu-xay b-izi-nosi eƛi-n eni mi hek’u-x eč’uri r-odi-a y-ik’i-näy yiła-a idu-bi-si r-odi di ciq-aɣor ik’i-an-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-ERG DEM2.IISG girl home-LAT-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB early.morning all sleep-AD.ABL III-get.up-ANT.CVB say-PFV.CVB mother you potatoe-AD.ESS weeding IV-do-INF II-go-CND.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG home-PL-ATTR IV-do me forest-IN.VERS go-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The boy took the girl home and in the early morning, when everyone got up from their sleeps, he said: "Mother, if you go to weed the potatoes, she will do the housework and I will go into the forest."

\t Neširu kinaw ħalt’imabin łiyrno nasin iduzaɣor butinosi, sida sidqo badiru ħalt’ozałäy esin.
\m neširu kinaw ħalt’i-bi-n łiyr-n nasin idu-bi-ɣor b-uti-nosi sida-a sida-q b-odi-ru ħalt’i-bi-łay esi-n
\g evening entire work-PL-TOP finish-PFV.CVB all home-PL-IN.ALL III-return-ANT.CVB one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.ESS I.PL-do-PST.PRT work-PL-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW
\l By the evening, when everyone has finished their works and returned home, they told each other about the work they did.

\t Eniya eƛin, hek’uyax eč’uri rodisƛin, užä esin di eƛnoqor redu ħadur boysƛin, kidbeq esanix šebin riqinanu, neła siskin šebin rodäsi roqinč’izaƛ’.
\m eni-a eƛi-n hek’u-x eč’uri r-odi-s-ƛin uži-a esi-n di eƛni-qor redu ħadur b-odi-s-ƛin kid-q esu-ani-x šebin r-iqi-n-anu neła-a siskin šebin r-odi-asi r-oq-č’i-zaƛ’
\g mother-ERG say-PFV.CVB potatoe-AD.ESS weeding IV-do-PST.WIT-QUOT boy-ERG tell-PFV.CVB me winter-POSS.LAT firewood prepare III-do-PST.WIT-QUOT girl-POSS.ESS find-MSD-AD.ESS thing IV-get-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG anything thing IV-do-RES.PRT IV-begin-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB
\l The mother said, she weeded the potatoes; the boy said: "I prepared firewood for the winter."; and the girl couldn't find anything to tell, because she had done nothing.

\t Xizyo žoyä eƛin, eni, eli beynodäsi boqzaƛ’, elur boƛik’ut’a ħak’o keze boqxo yaqˤuł, yił kidber siskin šebin keze roqxanu.
\m xizyo uži-a eƛi-n eni eli b-eynod-asi b-oq-zaƛ’ elu-r boƛik’u-t’a ħak’o keze b-oq-x yaqˤuł yiła kid-r siskin šebin keze r-oq-x-anu
\g afterwards boy-ERG say-PFV.CVB mother we III-work-RES.PRT I.PL-begin-CSL.CVB we(I).OBL-LAT half-DISTR khinkali meet I.PL-become-IPFV.CVB today DEM2.IISG.OBL girl-LAT anything thing meet IV-become-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l Afterwards the boy said: "Mother, we will get half of the khinkali each today, that girl will get nothing, because she hasn't done a thing."

\t Eynoyxosi gurow žek’u išxosi anuƛin.
\m eynod-xosi gurow žek’u iš-xosi anu-ƛin
\g work-PRS.PRT except man eat-PRS.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l Only someone who works will eat.

\t Howži yedu yeynodaniƛ’or kuczi yoqsiƛin žas rok’un č’eze roqnosi, kidbes babiw goƛ’a žek’u egirno.
\m howži yedu y-eynod-ani-ƛ’or kuczi y-oq-s-ƛin uži-s rok’u-n č’eze r-oq-nosi kid-s babiw goƛ’i-a žek’u egir-n
\g now DEM2.IISG II-work-MSD-SUPER.LAT learn II-become-PST.WIT-QUOT boy-GEN1 heart-TOP convinced[?] IV-become-ANT.CVB girl-GEN1 father invite-INF man send-PST.UNW
\l Convinced that she now has learned to work, the boy sent someone to invite the girl's father.

\t Acno yaɣˤin babiw iduɣor oqƛ’oräy, bic’äsi t’as maħor čaƛˤanix bisno yik’ix dandir kid c’oxno.
\m ac-n y-ˤaɣˤi-n babiw idu-ɣor oq-ƛ’oräy b-ic’-asi t’as maħor čˤaƛi-ani-x b-is-n y-ik’i-x dandir kid c’ox-n
\g door-TOP II-open-PFV.CVB father home-IN.ALL become-SIM.CVB III-fill-RES.PRT washbowl outside pour.out-MSD-AD.ESS III-take-PFV.CVB II-go-IPFV.CVB towards daughter meet-PST.UNW
\l Opening the door, the father got home, as he met his daughter carrying a full washbowl to pour it out outside.

\t Howlotow neła babiwqor maħor čˤaƛanix t’asno teƛno, eƛin, baba, yiła ɣˤutka eynoyxosi gurow žek’u išxosi anuƛin.
\m howlo-tow neła-a babiw-qor maħor čˤaƛi-ani-x t’as-n teƛ-n eƛi-n baba yiła ɣˤutku-a eynod-xosi gurow žek’u iš-xosi anu-ƛin
\g there-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG father-POSS.LAT outside pour.out-MSD-AD.ESS washbowl-TOP give-PFV.CVB say-PFV.CVB daddy DEM2.IISG.OBL house-IN.ESS work-PRS.PRT except man eat-PRS.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l There she gave her father the bowl in order to pour it outside and said: "Daddy, in this house only someone who works, gets to eat!"

\t Hudayzikotow bertenno bodin, miskinaw oqłin ʕaq’ilawni žax nesi žek’a äƛiruxor, kidno yegirno.
\m hudayziko-tow berten-n b-odi-n miskinaw oq-łin ʕaq’ilaw-ni uži-x nesi žek’u-a äƛiru-xor kid-n y-egir-n
\g the.next.day-EMPH marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB poor become-CNC.CVB intelligent-DEF boy-AD.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG ORD-AD.LAT girl-TOP II-send-PST.UNW
\l The next day the wedding was arranged and the girl was - as this man had told - married off to the intelligent though poor boy.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Žedus zown sis uži.
\m žedu-s zow-n sis uži
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW one son
\l They had one son.

\t Žan zown małiru risxanusi, t’ubaraw ʕaq’lus anusi iłe.
\m ža-n zow-n mołi-ru r-is-xanusi t’ubaraw ʕaq’lu-s anu-si iłe
\g DEM1.SG-TOP be.PST-GER teach-PST.PRT IV-take-NEG.PRSPRT full mind-GEN1 be.NEG-LNK as
\l And he was disobedient and had a defective mind.

\t Sidakin kidbä nesix yik’anix roži teƛxo zownanu.
\m sida-kin kid-a nesi-x y-ik’i-ani-x roži teƛ-x zow-n-anu
\g one.OBL-even girl-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS II-go-MSD-AD.ESS word give-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l Not even one girl promised to marry him.

\t Sistow sis kid nesix yik’anix razi yoqno.
\m sis-tow sis kid nesi-x y-ik’i-ani-x razi y-oq-n
\g one-EMPH one girl DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS II-go-MSD-AD.ESS agree II-become-PST.UNW
\l One single girl [finally] agreed to come to him.

\t Didiwgon ža oqłin di nesix yik’ixƛin, kid yet’un k’oƛin yičin.
\m didiw-gon ža oq-łin di nesi-x y-ik’i-x-ƛin kid y-et’u-n k’oƛi-n y-iči-n
\g which-CNTR DEM1.SG happen-CNC.CVB me DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS II-go-PRS-QUOT girl II-jump-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB II-be-PST.UNW
\l "No matter what happens to him, I will go to him!," the girl [said and] ran away.

\t Kʷaxatow bertenno boyn yedu kid nesi žoyä yižin.
\m kʷaxa-tow berten-n b-odi-n yedu kid nesi uži-a y-iži-n
\g soon-EMPH marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG girl DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG II-lead-PST.UNW
\l Soon they celebrated their wedding and the boy took the girl with him.

\t Hič’č’a adäzaytow soder eni- babiwde idu zawru yisä yisis ʕamal boda oqno, dicegon bara eƛiłin ya qaca ret’urxo zownanu, ya łi rowa ik’ix zownanu, ya q’ˤuya iduzo ħalt’oqor utin ezux zownanu.
\m hič’č’a ad-azay-tow soder eni babiw-de idu zow-ru yisi-a yisi-s ʕamal b-odi-a oq-n dice-gon baru-a eƛi-łin ya qaca r-et’ur-x zow-n-anu ya łi r-ow-a ik’i-x zow-n-anu ya q’ˤuya idu-zo ħalt’i-qor uti-n ezu-x zow-n-anu
\g the.most in.front-IN.ABL.DIST-EMPH after mother father-APUD.ESS home be.NPRS-PST.PRT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 behaviour III-do-INF begin-PFV.CVB how.much-CNTR wife-ERG say-CNC.CVB neither firewood IV-hack-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG neither water IV-bring-INF go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG neither other home-ATTR.OBL work-POSS.LAT turn-PFV.CVB look-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l Right from the beginning he started to behave like in the house of his parents; how much his wife would say, he neither hacked firewood, nor did he go and bring water, nor did he do look for or did any other housework.

\t Sida quł bara yeda išrinč’ey quqa xecin.
\m sida qu-ł baru-a yeda iš-r-č’ey quqa xeci-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS wife-ERG DEM2.ISG eat-CAUS-NEG.PST.CVB hungry leave-PST.UNW
\l One day the wife didn't prepare food for him and left him hungry.

\t Xediya bišʷa esirnosi, sosi iduzasi ħalt’i bodo, xizyo bišʷa din rodanƛin, yiła harihun tarbiya mołix zown nesiq.
\m xediw-a bišʷa esir-nosi sosi idu-bi-si ħalt’i b-odi-o xizyo bišʷa di-n r-odi-an-ƛin yiła-a harihun tarbiya mołi-x zow-n nesi-q
\g husband-ERG food ask-ANT.CVB at.first home-PL-ATTR work III-do-IMPR afterwards food me-TOP IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG slowly upbringing teach-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l When the husband asked for food, she slowly taught him some upbringing: "First you do the housework, afterwards I'll prepare the food!"

\t Idur baynosi, yiła nesiq žeduƛ’osi qaca ret’urerno, xizyogon łäxor egirno, didiw zawru, didiw mežus di uži odäƛin.
\m idu-r b-ay-nosi yiła-a nesi-q žedu-ƛ’-si qaca r-et’ur-r-n xizyogon łi-xor egir-n didiw zow-ru didiw mežu-s di uži odi-a-ƛin
\g home-LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.IPL-SUPER.ESS-ATTR firewood IV-hack-CAUS-PFV.CVB then water-AD.LAT send-PFV.CVB which be.NPRS-PST.PRT which you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 me boy do-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Having come home, she let him hack the firewood, sent him to get water [and said]: "How was your son and what have I made out of him?"

\t Žaz bara eƛin, bercingo eƛi- mołinäy posukin ʕenekizi roqxonč’eƛin.
\m ža-z baru-a eƛi-n bercingo eƛi mołi-näy posu-kin ʕenekizi r-oq-x-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG-GEN2 wife-ERG say-PFV.CVB well say teach-CND.CVB cattle-even listen IV-become-IPFV.CVB-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l His wife said: "If you teach well, even animals will listen."

\t Boƛƛo zaman bik’inosi, bara xediw bet’erbaqi boda ik’anix muk’ur oyn.
\m b-oƛƛo zaman b-ik’i-nosi baru-a xediw bet’erbaqi b-odi-a ik’i-ani-x muk’ur odi-n
\g III-middle time III-go-ANT.CVB wife-ERG husband life III-do-INF go-MSD-AD.ESS confess do-PST.UNW
\l After some time has passed, the wife confessed that she went to live with her husband.

\t Hunixor yisä łäs q’ˤano sikno eqerno, bišʷan erno, kumakyorgon, ħaƛirxo ik’anix, xizay k’oƛin yayn bara hibon teƛno.
\m huni-xor yisi-a łi-a-s q’ˤano sik-n eqer-n bišʷa-n er-n kumak-r-gon ħaƛir-x ik’i-ani-x xizay k’oƛi-n y-ay-n baru-a hibo-n teƛ-n
\g way-AD.LAT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG water-ERG-GEN1 two waterskin-TOP put-PFV.CVB food-TOP put-PFV.CVB help-LAT-CNTR put-IPFV.CVB go-MSD-AD.ESS behind run-PFV.CVB II-come-PFV.CVB wife-ERG stick-TOP give-PST.UNW
\l He put two waterskins onto the way, packed some food, and came running behind in order to go put(?), when his wife came running behind him and gave him a stick to go with, which he should put down for help.

\t Saparyox oqno, qˤašdes zaman baynosi, yeda sida ɣunoƛ rešt’izi oqno.
\m sapar-x oq-n qˤaš-s zaman b-ay-nosi yeda sida ɣun-ƛ rešt’izi oq-n
\g journey-AD.ESS become-PFV.CVB provisions-GEN1 time III-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG one.OBL tree-SUB.ESS take.a.rest become-PST.UNW
\l He went on the journey, and when it was time for lunch, he took a rest under a tree.

\t Elo ɣeduƛ q’ˤida ičäsi yałzay, yisir taqˤaza oc’ino ħumukulin bown hemeł buħima nexxo oc’ino žek’u ukayn.
\m elo ɣedu-ƛ q’ˤida iči-asi yoł-zay yisi-r taqˤo-aza oc’ino ħumukuli-n b-ow-n hemeł buħi-a nex-x oc’ino žek’u ukad-n
\g there shade-SUB.ESS under sit-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT over.there-IN.VERS.DIST ten camel-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL heat-IN.ESS come-IPFV.CVB ten man see-PST.UNW
\l While he was sitting in the shade, he saw ten men with ten camels coming in the heat.

\t Žedu nexxo bukayrun, suƛƛi yisä gondun yič’in elo teł q’ˤanon sikno, bišʷan eqerno ƛ’irir č’edo rayrno ičin.
\m žedu nex-x b-ukad-run suƛƛi yisi-a gondu-n y-ič’i-n elo teł q’ˤano-n sik-n bišʷa-n eqer-n ƛ’iri-r č’edo r-ayr-n iči-n
\g DEM1.IPL come-IPFV.CVB I.PL-see-IMM.ANT.CVB immediately DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG big.hole-TOP II-dig-PFV.CVB there inside two-TOP waterskin-TOP food-TOP put-PFV.CVB above-LAT earth IV-bring-PFV.CVB sit-PST.UNW
\l When he saw them coming, he immediately dug a hole, put his food and his two waterskins inside, put earth over it and sat down.

\t Zamanałäy yizi yeda rešt’izi aqza mečoƛ’or ačqˤayx, mekoyxno bayn, salamno teƛno žaq ħaƛanir łi esirno, deber ela micxir neƛanƛin.
\m zaman-łay yizi yeda rešt’izi oq-za moči-ƛ’or ačqˤad-x mekod-x-n b-ay-n salam-n teƛ-n uži-q ħaƛu-ani-r łi esir-n mi-r elu-a micxir neƛ-an-ƛin
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM2.IPL DEM2.ISG take.a.rest become-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.LAT be.thirsty-IPFV.CVB be.hungry-IPFV.CVB-TOP I.PL-come-PFV.CVB greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB boy-POSS.ESS drink-MSD-LAT water ask-PFV.CVB you-LAT we(I).OBL-ERG money give-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l After a while, they were thirsty and hungry and came to where he was resting, saluted him and asked the boy for some water to drink: "We will give you some money."

\t Nełacegon ħarzayaw dunyalƛ’o šebin šebi yołƛin, uži et’un q’ˤidayn k’oƛin sikrebin, bišʷan raqˤru mečoƛ’orno ik’in, bara teƛno zawruni hibo bok’no.
\m neła-ace-gon ħarzayaw dunyal-ƛ’ šebin šebi yoł-ƛin uži et’u-n q’ˤida-ay-n k’oƛi-n sik-bi-n bišʷa-n r-uqˤeł-ru moči-ƛ’or-n ik’i-n baru-a teƛ-n zow-ru-ni hibo b-ok’-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-TERM-CNTR abundant earth-SUPER.ESS thing what be-QUOT boy come.off-PFV.CVB down-IN.ABL-TOP jump-PFV.CVB waterskin-PL-TOP food-TOP IV.PL-hide-PST.PRT place-SUPER.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB wife-ERG give-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF stick III-beat-PST.UNW
\l "What things on earth are as abundant as it [i.e. water]?", the boy [said and] jumped up and went to the place were the food and the waterskin is was, and beat down the stick that his wife had given him.

\t Sisini łäs ric’alini sikno roƛik’no, žeduqor ħaƛa teƛno.
\m sisi-ni łi-s r-ic’-ali-ni sik-n r-oƛik’-n žedu-qor ħaƛu-a teƛ-n
\g other-DEF water-GEN1 IV-fill-ATTR-DEF waterskin-TOP IV-pull.out-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-POSS.LAT drink-INF give-PST.UNW
\l He pulled out a skin filled with water and gave it to them to drink.

\t Dahowtow łi žeda elo teł xecin.
\m dahow-tow łi žedu-a elo teł xeci-n
\g few-EMPH water DEM1.IPL-ERG there inside leave-PST.UNW
\l They only left little water inside.

\t Encegon elo neside mušin begirno, ader ħumukulibin roɣno, hunix yizin boqno.
\m ence-gon elo nesi-de muši-n b-egir-n ader ħumukuli-bi-n r-oɣ-n huni-x yizi-n b-oq-n
\g a.little-CNTR there DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS air-TOP III-let-PFV.CVB forward camel-PL-TOP III.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB way-AD.ESS DEM2.IPL-TOP I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l They rested with him there for a little while and then began to drive on their camels and got on their way.

\t Bitaɣor bok’äłrun, žeda žeduƛ xabarno boqno, ħumukulizaƛ’osini boƛik’u mesed teƛno yołin howža hibo bisan nesi žaqay, nełas elur beže raħat biča yoł, šidaƛin eƛiłiri ačqˤaynosi ža bak’za ħaƛanix łin roƛixnäy, mekoynosigon hemedurtow bišʷan riqinäy, t’ok’ow elur q’ʷˤariłi łinasƛin.
\m bita-aɣor b-ok’eł-run žeda žedu-ƛ xabar-n b-oq-n ħumukuli-bi-ƛ’-si-ni boƛik’u mesed teƛ-n yołi-n howža hibo b-is-an nesi uži-qay neła-s elu-r b-eže raħat b-iči-a yoł šida-ƛin eƛi-łiri ačqˤad-nosi ža b-ok’-za ħaƛu-ani-x łi-n r-oƛix-näy mekod-nosi-gon hemedur-tow bišʷa-n r-iqi-näy t’ok’ow elu-r q’ʷariłi łinas-ƛin
\g distance-IN.VERS I.PL-go.away-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL DEM1.IPL.OBL-SUB.ESS story-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB camel-PL-SUPER.ESS-ATTR-DEF half gold give-PFV.CVB however-TOP DEM4.SG stick III-buy-FUT.DEF DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-POSS.ABL DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 we(I).OBL-LAT III-big recreation III-be-INF be why-QUOT say-CND.CVB.IRR be.thirsty-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG III-hit-LCV.CVB drink-MSD-AD.ESS water-TOP IV-appear-CND.CVB be.hungry-ANT.CVB-CNTR so-EMPH food-TOP IV-get-CND.CVB more we(I).OBL-LAT sadness why-QUOT
\l After they disappered into the distance, they told themselves: "We will buy that stick from this boy for half of the gold on the camels; it will be such a relieve for us! [why?]", they would say(?), "Why would we be anymore sad, if, when we are thirsty, we hit it and water appears for drinking; and when we are hungry, we get food that way."

\t Ik’in eženi žek’a nesir rätiru łinałäyn yisiq esinosi, yeda uži sosisi teƛa rätinč’irus riłen zown, yedu hibon teƛno di mekoyxno, ačqˤayxnoyä ičanƛin.
\m ik’i-n eže-ni žek’u-a nesi-r r-eti-ru łina-łay-n yisi-q esi-nosi yeda uži sosi-si teƛ-a r-eti-č’i-ru-si r-iłe-n zow-n yedu hibo-n teƛ-n di mekod-x-n ačqˤad-x-n-a iči-an-ƛin
\g go-PFV.CVB old-DEF man-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG boy at.first-ATTR give-INF IV-want-NEG.FUT-PST.PRT-ATTR IV-as-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG stick-TOP sell-PFV.CVB me be.hungry-IPFV.CVB-TOP be.thirsty-IPFV.CVB-TOP-Q be-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l When the eldest man went and told him what he wanted, the boy pretended to be not wanting to give it to him at first: "When I sold you the stick, will I remain hungry and thirsty?"

\t Xizyo royn ičäsi hudun muk’ur oqno uži, neł hiboreƛ q’aymos bic’äsit’a łeno ħumukuli neƛanƛin bazarganä eƛinosi.
\m xizyo r-odi-n iči-asi hudun muk’ur oq-n uži neła hibo-ƛ q’ay-s b-ic’-asi-t’a łeno ħumukuli neƛ-an-ƛin bazargan-a eƛi-nosi
\g afterwards IV-do-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT nevertheless agree become-PFV.CVB boy DEM1.IISG.OBL stick-SUB.ESS article-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT-DISTR five camel give-FUT.DEF-QUOT merchant-ERG say-ANT.CVB
\l Then the boy agreed nevertheless, when the merchant said that he would give him the load from 5 camels for the stick.

\t Xalq’imo ʕadalawniƛ’ ayrxo zawruni žoyä, qaciz hiboreƛ łenon riguƛ’ay rigut’a šeƛ’ures bic’äsi ħumukulin ader boɣno, ʕaƛaɣorƛin hunix oqno.
\m xalq’i-a ʕadalaw-ni-ƛ’ ayr-x zow-ru-ni uži-a qaci-z hibo-ƛ łeno-n r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu-t’a šeƛ’u-s b-ic’-asi ħumukuli-n ader b-oɣ-n ʕaƛ-aɣor-ƛin huni-x oq-n
\g people-ERG stupid-DEF-SUPER.ESS call-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF boy-ERG firewood-GEN2 stick-SUB.ESS five-TOP IV-pretty-SUPER.ABL IV-pretty-DISTR clothing-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT camel-TOP forward III-take.away-PFV.CVB village-IN.VERS-QUOT way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l The boy whom the people called "the dumb one", gave his wooden stick away for five camels packed with the prettiest clothings, then he got on his way to the village.

\t Bazarganbin boxin biłe bik’in nełzaqay, hibo boɣanix hoboyä hik’eyä uži xizay oƛixxoƛin.
\m bazargan-bi-n b-oxi-n b-iłe b-ik’i-n neła-bi-qay hibo b-oɣ-ani-x hoboy-a hik’ey-a uži xizay oƛix-x-ƛin
\g merchant-PL-TOP I.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB I.PL-as I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-PL-POSS.ABL stick III-take.away-MSD-AD.ESS now-Q later-Q boy from.behind appear-IPFV.CVB-QUOT
\l And the merchants went away from there hastily, [being afraid that] sooner or later this boy might appear behind them to take the stick away.

\t Yeda uži regirno adäz ħumukulibin ʕaƛoxar ik’iƛ’orey, hunix nesił mešizaxosi aħo c’oxno.
\m yeda uži r-egir-n adäz ħumukuli-bi-n ʕaƛ-xar ik’i-ƛ’oräy huni-x nesi-ł meši-bi-x-si aħo c’ox-n
\g DEM2.ISG boy IV-send-PFV.CVB ahead camel-PL-TOP village-AD.VERS go-SIM.CVB way-AD.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS bull.calf-PL-AD.ESS-ATTR shepherd meet-PST.UNW
\l While the boy was driving his camels ahead into a village, he met a shepherd with some calves on the way.

\t Ħumukuliƛ’ ƛ’iräy riguƛ’ay rigu šeƛ’un roɣno, žan aħoziqor teƛno eƛin, nagaħ howt’aza oc’ino žek’un, łeno waranin boƛixnäy, šebi roynon žedu mi ričok’ƛin.
\m ħumukuli-ƛ’ ƛ’iräy r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu šeƛ’u-n r-oɣ-n ža-n aħo-qor teƛ-n eƛi-n nagaħ howt’a-aza oc’ino žek’u-n łeno warani-n b-oƛix-näy šebi r-odi-n-on žedu mi ričok’-ƛin
\g camel-SUPER.ESS from.above IV-pretty-SUPER.ABL IV-pretty clothing-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP shepherd-POSS.LAT give-PFV.CVB say-PFV.CVB suddenly there-IN.VERS.DIST ten man-TOP five camel-TOP III-appear-CND.CVB what IV-do-PFV.CVB-CND DEM1.IPL you detain-QUOT
\l Having pulled the prettiest clothings from the camel, he gave it to the shepherd and said: "When suddenly there appear ten men with five camels, do something to detain them."

\t Dahawgon ik’inosi neside guluzaxosi aħo keze oqno.
\m dahaw-gon ik’i-nosi nesi-de gulu-bi-x-si aħo keze oq-n
\g a.little-CNTR go-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS horse-PL-AD.ESS-ATTR shepherd meet become-PST.UNW
\l When he went a little further, a shepherd with horses came towards him.

\t Nesirno howžatow sayɣatno boyn, hemedurtow nesiqorno eƛin.
\m nesi-r-n howža-tow sayɣat-n b-odi-n hemedur-tow nesi-qor-n eƛi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT-TOP DEM4.SG-EMPH present-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB so-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PST.UNW
\l To him he gave the same present and said the same thing.

\t Xizyogon ža uži butnoƛ’ pun bok’no äčiru žek’uder ayn.
\m xizyogon ža uži butni-ƛ’ pu-n b-ok’-n iči-ru žek’u-der ay-n
\g again DEM1.SG boy burka-SUPER.ESS side-TOP III-hit-PFV.CVB be-PST.PRT man-APUD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Then the boy came to a man who was lying on his burka.

\t Nesirno aħozizar bayru biłetow sayɣatno boyn, bazarganbi howt’aza boƛixnäy, beč’er žeduƛin harizin rodin, roc’no adäz łenon ħumukulibin ʕaƛaɣor esʷałno yedan ik’in.
\m nesi-r-n aħo-bi-r b-ay-ru b-iłe-tow sayɣat-n b-odi-n bazargan-bi howt’a-aza b-oƛix-näy b-eč’er žedu-ƛin harizi-n r-odi-n r-oc’-n adäz łeno-n ħumukuli-bi-n ʕaƛ-aɣor esʷał-n yeda-n ik’i-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT-TOP shepherd-PL-LAT I.PL-come-PST.PRT I.PL-as-EMPH present-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB merchant-PL there-IN.VERS.DIST I.PL-appear-CND.CVB I.PL-stop DEM1.IPL-QUOT request-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB IV-urge-PFV.CVB ahead five-TOP camel-PL-TOP village-IN.VERS hurry.up-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG-TOP go-PST.UNW
\l And he also gave to him the same present as to the shepherds who had come, and begged him: "When merchants appear over there, stop them!"; then he urged the five camels forward and hastily went into the village.

\t Bazarganbi mešizaxozo aħoderno bayn esirno nesiq, howt’aza bitor łeno ħumukulin bižin ik’ix žek’u ukaynč’a deberƛin.
\m bazargan-bi meši-bi-x-zo aħo-der-n b-ay-n esir-n nesi-q howt’a-aza bitor łeno ħumukuli-n b-iži-n ik’i-x žek’u ukad-č’u-a mi-r-ƛin
\g merchant-PL bull.calf-PL-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL shepherd-APUD.LAT-TOP I.PL-come-PFV.CVB ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS there-IN.VERS.DIST thither five camel-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB go-IPFV.CVB man see-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT.INT you-LAT-QUOT
\l The merchants came to the shepherd with the calves and asked him: "Have you seen a man leading five camels going there?"

\t Buħi baqruntow yizi mešibi iduɣor raxiƛin, žawab boyn aħa žedur.
\m buħi b-oq-run-tow yizi meši-bi idu-ɣor r-oxi-ƛin žawab b-odi-n aħo-a žedu-r
\g heat III-become-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM2.IPL bull.calf-PL home-IN.ALL III.PL-run.away-QUOT answer III-do-PFV.CVB shepherd-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT
\l "Just when it gets hot, these calves will run home", the shepherd answered them.

\t Bazarganbi sosigon ƛ’iri butin eƛin, debeq ela mešizałäy esirxanu, łeno waranin bižin ik’ix žek’u c’oxinč’a debełƛin esirxo.
\m bazargan-bi sosi-gon ƛ’iri b-uti-n eƛi-n mi-q elu-a meši-bi-łay esir-x-anu łeno warani-n b-iži-n ik’i-x žek’u c’ox-č’u-a mi-ł-ƛin esir-x
\g merchant-PL again-CNTR above I.PL-return-PFV.CVB say-PFV.CVB you-POSS.ESS we(I).OBL-ERG bull.calf-PL-CONT.ABL ask-IPFV.CVB-NEG five camel-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB go-IPFV.CVB man meet-NEG.PST.WIT-Q you-CONT.ESS-QUOT ask-PRS
\l The merchants insisted on it again and said: "We're not asking you about the calves, we're asking you if you haven't met a man leading five camels."

\t Mešizaxozo eƛin, buq bäturuntow muqno caƛin yizi mešibi ʕaƛaɣor rik’ixosiƛin.
\m meši-bi-x-zo eƛi-n buq b-etu-run-tow muq-n caƛi-n yizi meši-bi ʕaƛ-aɣor r-ik’i-xosi-ƛin
\g bull.calf-PL-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL say-PFV.CVB sun III-set-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH line-TOP draw-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL bull.calf-PL village-IN.VERS III.PL-go-PRS.PRT-QUOT
\l The one with the calves said: "Right after the sun sets, " ...

\t Yisä eli baƛ’irxoƛin žedu ʕaƛoxarno bezun bik’in.
\m yisi-a eli b-aƛ’ir-x-ƛin žedu ʕaƛ-xar-n b-ezu-n b-ik’i-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG we I.PL-cheat-IPFV.CVB-QUOT DEM1.IPL village-AD.VERS-TOP I.PL-look-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l "He's deceiving us," they [said and] went to look toward the village.

\t Bazarganbi guluzaxozo aħozider baynosi, nesiqayn hemedurtow bayan bisno, t’aza ħumukulibin roc’no ik’ix debełi sis uži c’oxinč’aƛin.
\m bazargan-bi gulu-bi-x-zo aħo-der b-ay-nosi nesi-qay-n hemedur-tow bayan b-is-n t’aza ħumukuli-bi-n r-oc’-n ik’i-x mi-łi sis uži c’ox-č’u-a-ƛin
\g merchant-PL horse-PL-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL shepherd-APUD.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL-TOP so-EMPH information III-take-PFV.CVB from.here camel-PL-TOP III.PL-drive-PFV.CVB go-IPFV.CVB you-NMLZ one boy meet-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l When the merchants came to the shepherd with the horses, they wanted to take his information, if

\t Guluza di akik’xanuƛin, žawab teƛno guluzaxozo aħa.
\m gulu-bi-a di akik’-x-anu-ƛin žawab teƛ-n gulu-bi-x-zo aħo-a
\g horse-PL-ERG me tire-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW horse-PL-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL shepherd-ERG
\l "Horses don't make me tired," answered the horse shepherd.

\t Debeq esäru łinarno mi žawab neƛ, guluzałäygon łu debeq esiräƛin, yiziri ƛ’iri butin.
\m mi-q esir-ru łinar-n mi žawab neƛ gulu-bi-łay-gon łu mi-q esir-a-ƛin yiziri ƛ’iri b-uti-n
\g you-POSS.ESS ask-PST.PRT why-TOP you answer give horse-PL-CONT.ABL-CNTR who.ERG you-POSS.ESS ask-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT DEM2.IPL above I.PL-return-PST.UNW
\l "Answer the question we asked you! And who asked you about the horses?", they insisted.

\t Där retinäy di guluƛ’no zawƛin, eƛin žeduqor guluzaxoza.
\m di-r r-eti-näy di gulu-ƛ’-n zow-ƛin eƛi-n žedu-qor gulu-bi-x-zo-a
\g me-LAT IV-want-CND.CVB me horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL-POSS.LAT horse-PL-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-ERG
\l "I will ride on a horse whenever I want," said the horseman.

\t Yedan ʕabdal yołƛin, bazarganbi elaygon bitor bik’in.
\m yeda-n ʕabdal yoł-ƛin bazargan-bi ele-ay-gon bitor b-ik’i-n
\g DEM2.ISG-TOP fool be-QUOT merchant-PL there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l "He is an idiot as well," [said] the merchants [and] went away from there.

\t Butnoƛ’ pun bok’no äčiru žek’ur bazarganbi igoxxo bukayruntow, q’ecno rutirno, nełaƛ’ ƛ’iri k’ukno eqerno, yizi bayace butnoƛ’ puƛ’orno c’oxno, k’ukyoƛ’or ezun ičin.
\m butni-ƛ’ pu-n b-ok’-n iči-ru žek’u-r bazargan-bi igox-x b-ukad-run-tow q’ec-n r-utir-n neła-ƛ’ ƛ’iri k’uk-n eqer-n yizi b-ay-ace butni-ƛ’ pu-ƛ’or-n c’ox-n k’uk-ƛ’or ezu-n iči-n
\g burka-SUPER.ESS side-TOP III-hit-PFV.CVB be-PST.PRT man-LAT merchant-PL approach-IPFV.CVB I.PL-see-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH dirt-TOP IV-gather-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS above cap-TOP put-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL I.PL-come-TERM burka-SUPER.ESS side-SUPER.LAT-TOP hit-PFV.CVB cap-SUPER.LAT look-PFV.CVB wait-PST.UNW
\l When the person lying on his burka saw the merchants approaching, he collected dirt, put a cap over it and lied down on the burka again until they came; then he waited watching his cap.

\t ƛ’irir baynosi, bazarganza esirno nesiq, łeno ħumukulin boc’no howt’aza ik’ix deber uži ukaynč’aƛin.
\m ƛ’iri-r b-ay-nosi bazargan-bi-a esir-n nesi-q łeno ħumukuli-n b-oc’-n howt’a-aza ik’i-x mi-r uži ukad-č’u-a-ƛin
\g above-LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB merchant-PL-ERG ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS five camel-TOP III-drive-PFV.CVB there-IN.VERS.DIST go-IPFV.CVB you-LAT boy see-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l When they had come closer, the merchants asked him: "Have you seen a boy going in this direction driving five camels?"

\t Nesä žawab teƛno, meža šebigo royłin k’ukyoƛ yałru šebin di mežuq rukarinč’iƛin.
\m nesi-a žawab teƛ-n mežu-a šebi-go r-odi-łin k’uk-ƛ yoł-ru šebin di mežu-q r-ukar-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG answer give-PFV.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-ERG what-COND IV-do-CNC.CVB cap-SUB.ESS be-PST.PRT thing me you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-show-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l He replied: "Although you do what[ever?](?), I won't show you what I got under the cap."

\t Rukarƛin, yizi ʕuraw ƛ’iri butinosi, butnoƛ’ pun bok’no ičin zawruni žek’a eƛin, di bitaɣorno ik’in ayzaƛ’or, yedu k’uk biqirno bičinäy, mežuq di t’o yałru šebin rukaranƛin.
\m r-ukar-ƛin yizi ʕuraw ƛ’iri b-uti-nosi butni-ƛ’ pu-n b-ok’-n iči-n zow-ru-ni žek’u-a eƛi-n di bita-aɣor-n ik’i-n ay-zaƛ’or yedu k’uk b-iqir-n b-iči-näy mežu-q di t’o yoł-ru šebin r-ukar-an-ƛin
\g IV-show-QUOT DEM2.IPL much above I.PL-turn-ANT.CVB burka-SUPER.ESS side-TOP III-hit-PFV.CVB be-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF man-ERG say-PFV.CVB me distance-IN.VERS-TOP go-PFV.CVB come-POST.CVB DEM2.IISG cap III-take.away-PFV.CVB III-be-CND.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.ESS me here be-PST.PRT thing IV-show-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l "Show it!", [they said and] when they insisted heavily, the man lying on the burka said: "When you hold my cap while I will go away and come back, I will show you the thing that is here."

\t Bazarganbi k’uk biqiran begirno, ža yołi žedur ukaynč’izaɣorno ik’in, butnoƛ’ pun caƛin, žeduƛ’ ezun ičäsi zown.
\m bazargan-bi k’uk b-iqir-a-n b-egir-n ža yołi žedu-r ukad-č’i-za-aɣor-n ik’i-n butni-ƛ’ pu-n caƛi-n žedu-ƛ’ ezu-n iči-asi zow-n
\g merchant-PL cap III-stop-INF-TOP III-let-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG however DEM1.IPL-LAT see-NEG.FUT-LCV.CVB-IN.VERS-TOP go-PFV.CVB burka-SUPER.ESS side-TOP throw-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-SUPER.ESS look-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The merchants stopped holding the cap; he, however, went to a place were they couldn't see him, put himself on the burka and waited watching them.

\t Nesiqorno bezun bičin yiziq ʕuraw mix bik’in.
\m nesi-qor-n b-ezu-n b-iči-n yizi-q ʕuraw mix b-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP I.PL-look-PFV.CVB I.PL-wait-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS much time III-go-PST.UNW
\l Waiting and looking for him, much time passed for them.

\t Yeda ayatow aynč’izaƛ’, nazon žeda, šebi yedu t’o nece rigu šebinƛin, k’ukyoƛxor reƛ’abi regirnosi, q’ecas ric’äsit’a roƛixno.
\m yeda ay-a-tow ay-č’i-zaƛ’ nazo-n žedu-a šebi yedu t’o nece r-igu šebin-ƛin k’uk-ƛxor reƛ’a-bi r-egir-nosi q’ec-as r-ic’-asi-t’a r-oƛix-n
\g DEM2.ISG come-INF-EMPH come-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB all.OBL-TOP DEM1.IPL-ERG what DEM2.IISG here so.much IV-pretty thing-QUOT cap-SUB.LAT hand-PL IV.PL-let-ANT.CVB dirt-FUT2 IV.PL-fill-RES.PRT-DISTR IV.PL-appear-PST.UNW
\l Because he really didn't come, they all put their hands under the cap [to see] what oh-so-pretty thing there is, and the took it out full of dirt.

\t Yisän eli baƛ’irsiƛin, elaygon bitor bazarganbi hunix boqno, waranibin rižin äk’iru žaz ʕaƛaɣorno bezun.
\m yisi-a-n eli b-aƛ’ir-s-ƛin ele-ay-gon bitor bazargan-bi huni-x b-oq-n warani-bi-n r-iži-n ik’i-ru uži-z ʕaƛ-aɣor-n b-ezu-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP we I.PL-cheat-PST.WIT-QUOT here-IN.ABL-CNTR thither merchant-PL way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PFV.CVB camel-PL-TOP III.PL-lead-PFV.CVB go-PST.PRT boy-GEN2 village-IN.VERS-TOP I.PL-look-PST.UNW
\l "He cheated us as well," the merchants [said and] got on their way away from their and looked for the village of the boy who went leading the camels.

\t Elor baynosi, yizä žas ɣˤutkun resurno, idurno, bik’in eƛin, mi eli baƛ’irno, elus ħumukulibin, žedaƛ’ ƛ’iri zawru q’ayn elus eluqor xizor butirno neƛƛin.
\m elo-r b-ay-nosi yizi-a uži-s ɣˤutku-n r-esur-n idu-r-n b-ik’i-n eƛi-n mi eli b-aƛ’ir-n elu-s ħumukuli-bi-n žeda-ƛ’ ƛ’iri zow-ru q’ay-n elu-s elu-qor xizor b-utir-n neƛ-ƛin
\g there-LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL-ERG boy-GEN1 house-TOP IV-find-PFV.CVB home-LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB say-PFV.CVB you we I.PL-cheat-PFV.CVB we(I).OBL-GEN1 camel-PL-TOP DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS on be.NPRS-PST.PRT article-TOP we(I).OBL-GEN1 we(I).OBL-POSS.LAT back III-give.back-PFV.CVB give-QUOT
\l When they arrived there, they found the boy's house, went inside and said: "You tricked us, give us back our camels and the goods that were on them!"

\t Mežus kinaw šebin di xizor rutirno mežus mežuqor neƛan, meža ža karamałi yołalini hibo dey däqor bayrnäyƛin, žawab teƛno žoyä žedur.
\m mežu-s kinaw šebin di xizor r-utir-n mežu-s mežu-qor neƛ-an mežu-a ža karamałi yoł-ali-ni hibo di-s di-qor b-ayr-näy-ƛin žawab teƛ-n uži-a žedu-r
\g you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 entire thing me back IV-give.back-PFV.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.LAT give-FUT.DEF you(I).PL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG miracle be-ATTR-DEF stick me-GEN1 me-POSS.LAT III-bring-CND.CVB-QUOT answer give-PFV.CVB boy-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT
\l "I will give all your things back to you, if you give me back my magic wand," answered the boy them.

\t Bazarganza eƛin, debi hibo ela becursiƛin.
\m bazargan-bi-a eƛi-n mi-s hibo elu-a b-ecur-s-ƛin
\g merchant-PL-ERG say-PST.UNW you-GEN1 stick we(I).OBL-ERG III-break-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The merchants said: "We broke your stick."

\t Nedur resunäy, däqay mežur ħumukulibin, žedaƛ’osi šebinon räqinč’iƛin, eƛin oqno yeda užin ičin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy di-qay mežu-r ħumukuli-bi-n žeda-ƛ’-si šebinon r-iqi-č’i-ƛin eƛi-n oq-n yeda uži-n iči-n
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB me-POSS.ABL you(I).PL.OBL-LAT camel-PL-TOP DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS-ATTR something III.PL-get-NEG.FUT-QUOT say-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG boy-TOP remain-PST.UNW
\l "If that's the case, you won't get the camels and what is on them from me," said the boy and remained.

\t Didurnotow yiziq sidaƛ’or hut’ rutinč’izaƛ’, yizis šarʕimoƛ’ bik’anix q’ut’i boqno.
\m didur-n-tow yizi-q sida-ƛ’or hut’ r-uti-č’i-zaƛ’ yizi-s šarʕi-ƛ’ b-ik’i-ani-x q’ut’i b-oq-n
\g how-TOP-EMPH DEM2.IPL-POSS.ESS one.OBL-SUPER.LAT lip IV-turn-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB DEM2.IPL-GEN1 Sharia.court-SUPER.ESS I.PL-go-MSD-AD.ESS agreement III-become-PST.UNW
\l Because they could not reach a consensus, they agreed to go to the Sharia.

\t Xizyo ža ela cimyoqaysi becurno boɣsiƛin.
\m xizyo ža elu-a cim-q-ay-si b-ecur-n b-oɣ-s-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.SG we(I).OBL-ERG malice-POSS.ESS-IN.ABL-ATTR III-break-PFV.CVB III-take.away-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Afterwards we broke it out of rage and threw it away."

\t Becurinč’ey di täƛru biłetow däqorno meža hibo bayrsi yołi, din mežus mežuqor rutirno kinaw šebin neƛa zowsƛin.
\m b-ecur-č’ey di teƛ-ru b-iłe-tow di-qor-n mežu-a hibo b-ayr-s yołi di-n mežu-s mežu-qor r-utir-n kinaw šebin neƛ-a zow-s-ƛin
\g III-break-NEG.PST.CVB me give-PST.PRT III-as-EMPH me-POSS.LAT-TOP you(I).PL.OBL-ERG stick III-bring-PST.WIT indeed me-TOP you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.LAT IV-give.back-PFV.CVB entire thing give-INF be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "If you hadn't broken it, you could have brought me back one that were as the one I gave to you, then I would have given you back all your stuff."

\t C’aq’ bit’araw eƛisƛin, dibirän eƛin, q’ˤimbin wˤałer rˤoq’urno bazarganbin bik’in, žar q’aymos ric’äsi ħumukulibin xecin.
\m c’aq’ bit’araw eƛi-s-ƛin dibir-a-n eƛi-n q’ˤim-bi-n wˤał-r r-ˤoq’ur-n bazargan-bi-n b-ik’i-n uži-r q’ay-s r-ic’-asi ħumukuli-bi-n xeci-n
\g very true say-PST.WIT-QUOT imam-ERG-TOP say-PFV.CVB head-PL-TOP downward-LAT IV.PL-lower-PFV.CVB merchant-PL-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB boy-LAT article-GEN1 IV-fill-RES.PRT camel-PL-TOP leave-PST.UNW
\l "Very well said," said the imam and the merchants hung their hads and went away, leaving the camels with the goods to the boy.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’, ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Žeda besurozaƛ’ay ʕumru boyx zown.
\m žedu-a besuro-bi-ƛ’ay ʕumru b-odi-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL-ERG fish-PL-SUPER.ABL life III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They were living from fishing.

\t Sida quł užiz rok’ƛ’or rayn, netintow däde sadaq babiwn äčinč’i, din besurobi riqiranix ruhun oqa ayƛin.
\m sida qu-ł uži-z rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-n netin-tow di-de sadaq babiw-n iči-č’i di-n besuro-bi r-iqir-ani-x ruhun oq-a ay-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS son-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come-PFV.CVB always-EMPH me-APUD.ESS together father-TOP live-NEG.FUT me-TOP fish-PL III.PL-catch-MSD-AD.ESS learn become-INF must-QUOT
\l One day the son thought: "My father won't always live with me, I need to learn how to catch fish."

\t Užä žawab teƛno, yaqˤuł di besurozaƛ’or ik’ixƛin.
\m uži-a žawab teƛ-n yaqˤuł di besuro-bi-ƛ’or ik’i-x-ƛin
\g son-ERG answer give-PFV.CVB today me fish-PL-SUPER.LAT go-PRS-QUOT
\l The son replied: "Today I am going fishing."

\t Sosisi egirxanuƛin babiw ƛ’iri utin, xizyo necetow nesir retizaƛ’, egirno xecin.
\m sosi-si egir-x-anu-ƛin babiw ƛ’iri uti-n xizyo nece-tow nesi-r r-eti-zaƛ’ egir-n xeci-n
\g at.first-ATTR let-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT father above turn-PFV.CVB afterwards so.much-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-want-CSL.CVB let-PST.UNW leave-PFV.CVB
\l At first the father insisted in not letting him go, but then - because he wanted it so much - he let him leave.

\t Neła quł užiq siskin besuron biqinanu, hudu haq’un quqa ƛexun.
\m neła qu-ł uži-q siskin besuro-n b-iqi-n-anu hudu haq’u-n quqa ƛexu-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS boy-POSS.ESS any fish-TOP III-get-PFV.CVB-NEG so family-TOP hungry remain-PST.UNW
\l On that day, the boy didn't get any fish, so the family remained hungry.

\t Hudayzikon uži besurozaƛ’or ik’in, hemedurtow biqinč’ey aynosi, babiw igza ħalał aƛ’in.
\m hudayziko-n uži besuro-bi-ƛ’or ik’i-n hemedur-tow b-iqi-č’ey ay-nosi babiw ig-za ħalał aƛ’i-n
\g the.next.day-TOP boy fish-PL-SUPER.LAT go-PFV.CVB so-EMPH III-get-NEG.PST.CVB come-ANT.CVB father well-ZA with.difficulties scold-PST.UNW
\l The next day when the boy went after fish again, didn't catch any either and came back, the father scolded him pretty much.

\t Łˤono äƛiru ɣudełno, babiws ħal bayrinč’ey, besurozaƛ’or užitow ik’in.
\m łˤono äƛiru ɣudi-ł-n babiw-s ħal b-ayr-č’ey besuro-bi-ƛ’or uži-tow ik’i-n
\g three ORD day-CONT.ESS-TOP father-GEN1 strength III-bring-NEG.PST.UNW fish-PL-SUPER.LAT boy-EMPH go-PST.UNW
\l And on the third day, although the father was against it, the boy went fishing nonetheless.

\t Neła quł ħaƛ’ala yisiq łˤono besuro biqin.
\m neła qu-ł ħaƛ’ala yisi-q łˤono besuro b-iqi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS hardly DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS three fish III-get-PST.UNW
\l On that day, he hardly caught three fish.

\t Bisno q’ˤano besuron bac’ad boyn, łˤono äƛiru boyƛ’oräy, nełaz k’esma aɣiw qˤod yesun.
\m b-is-n q’ˤano besuro-n bac’ad b-odi-n łˤono eƛi-ru b-odi-ƛ’oräy neła-z k’es-a aɣiw qˤod y-esu-n
\g III-take-PFV.CVB two fish-TOP clean III-do-PFV.CVB three say-PST.PRT III-do-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 gullet-IN.ESS perforated hole II-find-PST.UNW
\l He took two fish and cleaned them, and when he took the third one, he found a hole in its gullet.

\t Bercingo xal boynosi, besuroz qeqa teł t’akan c’oxäsi yesun.
\m bercingo xal b-odi-nosi besuro-z qeq-a teł t’akan c’ox-asi y-esu-n
\g well examination III-do-ANT.CVB fish-GEN2 throat-IN.ESS inside glass hit-RES.PRT II-find-PST.UNW
\l When he examined it better, he found a broken glass.

\t Žan elay yoɣno, sosi łäłxor kuranƛin oqno yeda.
\m ža-n ele-ay y-oɣ-n sosi łi-łxor kur-an-ƛin oq-n yeda
\g DEM1.SG-TOP there-IN.ABL II-take.away-PFV.CVB at.first water-CONT.VERS throw-FUT.DEF-QUOT begin-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG
\l He took it out of there and at first wanted to throw it into the water.

\t Xizyogon, łi ħaƛa yołin yetas yeduƛin, rok’ƛ’or pikrun bayn, xecin.
\m xizyogon łi ħaƛu-a yołi-n y-eti-as yedu-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or pikru-n b-ay-n xeci-n
\g then water drink-INF indeed-TOP II-want-FUT2 DEM2.IISG-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT idea-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW
\l Then he thought, it might be useful to drink water with, and so he left.

\t K’ox äƛiru ħaƛunosin, hemedurtown yic’no.
\m k’ox eƛi-ru ħaƛu-nosi-n hemedur-tow-n y-ic’-n
\g again say-PST.PRT drink-ANT.CVB-TOP so-EMPH-TOP II-fill-PST.UNW
\l When he drank once more, it filled itself again.

\t T’akanyar bayru mesedno ħiƛ’oqax butirno čantan eqerno, łˤonon besuron bižin uži iduɣor ik’in.
\m t’akan-ar b-ay-ru mesed-n ħiƛ’oqu-x b-utir-n čanta-n eqer-n łˤono-n besuro-n b-iži-n uži idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g glass-IN.LAT III-come-PST.PRT gold-TOP handkerchief-AD.ESS III-gather-PFV.CVB pocket-TOP put-PFV.CVB three-TOP fish-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB boy home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l The boy gathered the gold that came int the glass into a handkerchief, put it inside his pocket and carried the three fish home.

\t Hunix ik’iƛ’oräy, yisir łˤonon roƛnoxut’a bazarganbi keze boqno.
\m huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy yisi-r łˤono-n r-oƛnoxu-t’a bazargan-bi keze b-oq-n
\g way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT three-TOP IV-sick-DISTR merchant-PL meet I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l While walking on his way, he encountered three sick merchants.

\t Yiziqor doxturä eƛäsi zown, besuro bac’näy neła roƛxosi ričär mežusƛin.
\m yizi-qor doxtur-a eƛi-asi zow-n besuro b-ac’-näy neła r-oƛ-xosi r-ičir mežu-s-ƛin
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT doctor-ERG say-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB fish III-eat-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL IV-be.sick-PRS.PRT IV-stop you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1-QUOT
\l A doctor had said to them: "If you eat fish, this will stop you from being sick."

\t Užiq žedur besurobi rukayzaƛ’, elur neƛƛin harizi rodin.
\m uži-q žedu-r besuro-bi r-ukad-zaƛ’ elu-r neƛ-ƛin harizi r-odi-n
\g boy-POSS.ESS DEM1.IPL-LAT fish-PL III.PL-see-CSL.CVB we(I).OBL-LAT give-QUOT request IV-do-PST.UNW
\l When they saw the fish, they begged the boy: "Give them to us!"

\t Nełaƛ’ užin razi oqno.
\m neła-ƛ’ uži-n razi oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS boy-TOP agree become-PST.UNW
\l The boy agreed on that.

\t Q’ˤanosi bazargan žeda žeduz hunixno bik’in, sideni ħumukuliƛ’ zowrno uži ʕaƛar ayra nexno.
\m q’ˤano-si bazargan žedu-a žedu-z huni-x-n b-ik’i-n sideni ħumukuli-ƛ’ zowr-n uži ʕaƛ-ar ayr-a nex-n
\g two-ATTR merchant DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 way-AD.ESS-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB the.other.one camel-SUPER.ESS seat-PFV.CVB boy village-IN.LAT bring-INF come-PST.UNW
\l Two merchants went on their way, the other one seated the boy onto the camel and brought him into the village.

\t Yizi nexxo bukayrun, žas babiw žedus hunärƛin nexƛ’oräy, užä xexłiƛ’ ħumukuliƛ’ay q’ayn boɣno bazargan xizor utirno.
\m yizi nex-x b-ukad-run uži-s babiw žedu-s huni-ar-ƛin nex-ƛ’oräy uži-a xexłi-ƛ’ ħumukuli-ƛ’ay q’ay-n b-oɣ-n bazargan xizor utir-n
\g DEM2.IPL come-IPFV.CVB I.PL-see-IMM.ANT.CVB boy-GEN1 father DEM1.IPL-GEN1 way-IN.LAT-QUOT come-SIM.CVB boy-ERG quickness-SUPER.ESS camel-SUPER.ABL article-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB merchant back turn-PST.UNW
\l When the boy's father came on their way as he saw them coming, the boy quickly took the goods off the camel and the merchant went back.

\t Di žek’anč’e babiw nexxoƛin, yoł yałzatow q’ayn xecin užin oxin.
\m di žek’-a-n-č’e babiw nex-x-ƛin yoł yoł-za-tow q’ay-n xeci-n uži-n oxi-n
\g me beat-INF-TOP-INTS father come-PRS-QUOT be be-LCV.CVB-EMPH article-TOP leave-PFV.CVB boy-TOP run.away-PST.UNW
