\l Thinking that the father came to beat him, the boy left the goods where they were and ran away.

\t Yedu q’ay idur bayrƛin baruqorno eƛin, babiw užił xizay k’oƛin.
\m yedu q’ay idu-r b-ayr-ƛin baru-qor-n eƛi-n babiw uži-ł xizay k’oƛi-n
\g DEM2.IISG article home-LAT III-bring-QUOT wife-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB father son-CONT.ESS behind run-PST.UNW
\l "Bring these goods into the house!", the father told his wife and ran behind his son.

\t Uži yołi sida šaharyaɣorno ik’in, elo raht’ateles ħalt’i k’eyx aħnayx zown.
\m uži yołi sida šahar-aɣor-n ik’i-n elo raht’atele-s ħalt’i k’edi-x aħnad-x zow-n
\g boy however one.OBL city-IN.VERS-TOP go-PFV.CVB there servant-GEN1 work search-IPFV.CVB walk.around-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The boy however went to a city and walked around searching for a work as a servant.

\t Zamanałäy yeda sida xander ħalt’in esirno aynosi, nesä indowrizas aħołun egirno.
\m zaman-łay yeda sida xan-der ħalt’i-n esir-n ay-nosi nesi-a indowri-bi-s aħo-łun egir-n
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM2.ISG one.OBL khan-APUD.LAT work-TOP ask-PFV.CVB come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG turkey-PL-GEN1 shepherd-LHUN let-PST.UNW
\l After some time, he came to ask for work at the king's, and that one let him work as a turkey herder.

\t Sida quł užä neširaɣor indowribin rayrno, čantay t’akanno yisno eƛin, howt’o mečoƛ’ ɣˤutkun, elo teł rigu ist’owlin, nełaqgon šet’ur q’ˤuribin roqoƛƛin.
\m sida qu-ł uži-a neširu-aɣor indowri-bi-n r-ayr-n čanta-ay t’akan-n y-is-n eƛi-n howt’o moči-ƛ’ ɣˤutku-n elo teł r-igu istowli-n neła-q-gon šet’ur q’ˤuri-bi-n r-oq-ƛ-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS boy-ERG evening-IN.VERS turkey-PL-TOP III.PL-bring-PFV.CVB pocket-IN.ABL glass-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB say-PFV.CVB here field-SUPER.ESS house-TOP there inside IV-good table-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-CNTR around chair-PL-and IV.PL-become-OPT-QUOT
\l One day the young man brought the turkeys [home] in the evening, took the glass out of his pocke and said: "May here on the field be a house and inside a good table and chairs around it!"

\t Ɣˤutkaɣor bäk’izaz puƛ’aza q’ˤano rut’ugan rixoƛ ƛ’irin caxno, sidaƛ’ sisxoli xanes kid yayoƛƛin”, sideniƛ’gon nasin xalq’i bayoƛƛin”.
\m ɣˤutku-aɣor b-ik’i-zaz pu-ƛ’aza q’ˤano rut’uga-n r-ixi-ƛ ƛ’iri-n cax-n sida-ƛ’ sisxoli xan-s kid y-ay-ƛ-ƛin sideni-ƛ’-gon nasin xalq’i b-ay-ƛ-ƛin
\g house-IN.VERS III-go-LOC.ORIG side-SUPER.VERS.DIST two carpet-TOP IV-hang-OPT above-TOP write-PFV.CVB one.OBL-SUPER.ESS alone khan-GEN1 daughter II-come-OPT-QUOT the.other.one-SUPER.ESS-CNTR all people III-come-OPT-QUOT
\l And over the entrance to the house, let there hang two carpets on which shall be written on the one side: "May the princess come alone!" and on the other one: "May all people come!"!

\t Hudayziko xanez kidbä neła nełas ɣarabaš yezu-yoƛ’ˤanix łeno minutno beč’no bazaryaɣor yegirno.
\m hudayziko xan-z kid-a neła neła-s ɣarabaš y-ezu~oƛ’ˤu-ani-x łeno minut-n b-eč’-n bazar-aɣor y-egir-n
\g the.next.day khan-GEN2 daughter-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 servant II-examine-MSD-AD.ESS five minute-TOP III-cut-PFV.CVB bazar-IN.VERS II-send-PST.UNW
\l The next day, the princess sent her own servant to the market for five minutes to have a look.

\t Ɣarabaš oc’ira minutya kʷat’izin yoqno yayn.
\m ɣarabaš oc’ira minut-a kʷat’izi-n y-oq-n y-ay-n
\g servant ten.OBL minute-IN.ESS be.late-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB II-come-PST.UNW
\l The servant came ten minutes late.

\t Šida mi elo nece mixƛ’or yičäƛin, xanes kid c’ok’inayn nełqor.
\m šida mi elo nece mix-ƛ’or y-iči-ƛin xan-s kid c’ok’inad-n neła-qor
\g why you there so.much time-SUPER.LAT II-wait-QUOT khan-GEN1 daughter scold-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l "Why did it take you so much time?", the princess scolded her.

\t Mi yik’äsi zows yołi, elotow łemu ƛäxuƛin, žawab teƛno ɣarabašä.
\m mi y-ik’i-asi zow-s yołi elo-tow łemu ƛexu-ƛin žawab teƛ-n ɣarabaš-a
\g you II-go-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT indeed there-EMPH then.would remain-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW servant-ERG
\l "If you had gone, you would have stayed there.", answered the servant.

\t Sida quł xanes kid bazaryaɣorno yik’in, xizor yutin nexƛ’oräy, nesi žaz ɣˤutkaɣor yik’in.
\m sida qu-ł xan-s kid bazar-aɣor-n y-ik’i-n xizor y-uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy nesi uži-z ɣˤutku-aɣor y-ik’i-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS khan-GEN1 daughter bazar-IN.VERS-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB back II-return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-GEN2 house-IN.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l One day, the princess went to the market and when she came back, the came toward the house of that boy.

\t Ža madaxor yaynosi, oƛixno k’oƛin užä, tełxor yoqƛin, iduɣor goƛ’in.
\m ža ma-xor y-ay-nosi oƛix-n k’oƛi-n uži-a teł-xor y-oq-ƛin idu-ɣor goƛ’i-n
\g DEM1.SG door-AD.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB appear-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB boy-ERG inside-AD.LAT II-become-QUOT home-IN.ALL invite-PST.UNW
\l When she came to the door, the boy came running and invited her into the home: "Come inside!"

\t Teł idu yiłar riguƛ’ay rigu bišadyos ric’äsi istowli resun.
\m teł idu yiła-r r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu bišad-s r-ic’-asi istowli r-esu-n
\g inside home DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT IV-pretty-SUPER.ABL IV-pretty food-GEN1 IV-fill-RES.PRT table IV-find-PST.UNW
\l Inside the house, she found a table set with the best food.

\t Q’ˤanon q’ˤidan bičin biš-butin łiynosi, užä nełqor ħaƛanix łäsno yic’no besuroz haqa yesun zawruni t’akan teƛno.
\m q’ˤano-n q’ˤida-n b-iči-n b-iš~uti-n łiy-nosi uži-a neła-qor ħaƛu-ani-x łi-s-n y-ic’-n besuro-z haqu-a y-esu-n zow-ru-ni t’akan teƛ-n
\g two-TOP down-TOP I.PL-sit-PFV.CVB I.PL-eat-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB boy-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT drink-MSD-AD.ESS water-GEN1-TOP II-fill-PFV.CVB fish-GEN2 mouth-IN.ESS II-find-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF glass give-PST.UNW
\l The two sat down and when they had finished eating, the boy filled the glass he found in the fish's mouth with water and gave it to her to drink.

\t Łi ħaƛun łäyrun, mesedyos ža yic’nosi, xanes kid tamaša yoqno ƛexun.
\m łi ħaƛu-n łiy-run mesed-s ža y-ic’-nosi xan-s kid tamaša y-oq-n ƛexu-n
\g water drink-PFV.CVB end-IMM.ANT.CVB gold-GEN1 DEM1.SG II-fill-ANT.CVB khan-GEN1 daughter be.surprised II-become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l When the princess finished drinking the water, it filled with gold and she was very surprised.

\t Howlotow xanez kidbes nesiqor roƛ’i boqno.
\m howlo-tow xan-z kid-s nesi-qor roƛ’i b-oq-n
\g there-EMPH khan-GEN2 daughter-GEN1 DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT love III-become-PST.UNW
\l Then the princess fell in love with him.

\t Cimyoqaysi xanä ža kid qaciz k’emot’ya tełerno kurno, yoɣno łäłxor yižirno.
\m cim-q-ay-si xan-a ža kid qaci-z k’emot’-a tełer-n kur-n y-oɣ-n łi-łxor y-iži-r-n
\g malice-POSS.ESS-IN.ABL-ATTR khan-ERG DEM1.SG daughter firewood-GEN2 wooden.case-IN.ESS into-TOP throw-PFV.CVB II-take.away-PFV.CVB water-CONT.VERS II-take.out-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l The malicious king locked his daughter in a wooden chest and let her throw into the river.

\t Neł iħux sis ʕaƛ zown.
\m neła iħu-x sis ʕaƛ zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL river-AD.ESS one village be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Along the river was a village.

\t Elozo ʕaƛoz žamaʕatyo łiyä rayäru qaciƛ’ay bet’erbaqi boyx zown.
\m elo-zo ʕaƛ-z žamaʕat-a łi-a r-ayr-ru qaci-ƛ’ay bet’erbaqi b-odi-x zow-n
\g there-ATTR.OBL village-GEN2 population-ERG water-IN.ESS IV-bring-PST.PRT firewood-SUPER.ABL life III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The population of this village there made a living from the wood brought along the river.

\t Sidaɣ lalašin łi räk’iza mečoƛ’, xanes kid teł yałruni k’emot’ ɣˤanazaq yiqin.
\m sidaɣ lalaši-n łi r-ik’i-za moči-ƛ’ xan-s kid teł yoł-ru-ni k’emot’ ɣˤanabi-q y-iqi-n
\g in.one.place spread-PFV.CVB water IV-go-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.ESS khan-GEN1 daughter inside be-PST.PRT-DEF wooden.case woman-POSS.ESS II-get-PST.UNW
\l In one place, where the river spread out, the wooden chest with the princess inside got to a woman.

\t Idurno yižin yiła yaɣˤin tełer yezunosi, bercinaw ƛ’iräy ozuri boɣa betixanusi, kid yesun.
\m idu-r-n y-iži-n yiła-a y-ˤaɣˤi-n tełer y-ezu-nosi bercinaw ƛ’iräy ozuri b-oɣ-a b-eti-xanusi kid y-esu-n
\g home-LAT-TOP II-carry-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG II-open-PFV.CVB to.the.inside II-look-ANT.CVB beautiful from.above eye III-take.away-INF III-want-NEG.PRS.PRT girl II-find-PST.UNW
\l She carried it home, opened it and when she looked inside, she found a girl so beautiful that she didn't want to take her eyes off from her.

\t K’emot’yay maħorno yoqno kidbä eƛin, mi łinaqnokin yaƛ’ˤno.
\m k’emot’-ay maħor-n y-oq-n kid-a eƛi-n mi łina-q-n-kin y-ˤuƛ’-n
\g wooden.case-IN.ABL outside-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB girl-ERG say-PFV.CVB you what.ERG-POSS.ESS-TOP-even II-be.afraid-PROHIB
\l The girl got out of the chest and said: "Don't be afraid of anything!

\t Di debi kid, mi dey eniw yiča yoł howžäy soderƛin.
\m di mi-s kid mi di-s eniw y-iči-a yoł howži-ay soder-ƛin
\g me you-GEN1 daughter you me-GEN1 mother II-be-INF be now-IN.ABL after-QUOT
\l From now on, I am your daughter and you are my mother.

\t Sida quł kidbä eniwłun yäsruni ɣˤanabi neła nełaz bašiłäy bašiqˤoyn roɣno, bazaryaɣor teƛa yegirno.
\m sida qu-ł kid-a eniw-łun y-is-ru-ni ɣˤanabi neła neła-z baša-łay bašiqˤoy-n r-oɣ-n bazar-aɣor teƛ-a y-egir-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS girl-ERG mother-LHUN II-take-PST.PRT-DEF woman DEM1.IISG.OBL DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 finger-CONT.ABL ring-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB bazar-IN.VERS sell-INF II-let-PST.UNW
\l One day, the girl let the woman who had become her mother sell the ring that she took off her finger on the market.

\t Yedu risxozo žek’uqor mi eƛoƛin, eƛin kidbä nełqor, debeq yiłas bašiqˤoy baha bäzinč’iƛin.
\m yedu r-is-xozo žek’u-qor mi eƛi-o-ƛin eƛi-n kid-a neła-qor mi-q yiła-s bašiqˤoy baha b-izi-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG IV-buy-PRS.PRT.OBL man-POSS.LAT you say-IMPR-QUOT say-PFV.CVB girl-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT you-POSS.ESS DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 ring price III-get-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l "Say to the person who wants to buy it:" the girl told her, "'You won't affort the price.'

\t Bäziƛin nesä eƛinäy, ža mi däder aƛin.
\m b-izi-ƛin nesi-a eƛi-näy ža mi di-der a-ƛin
\g III-get-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-CND.CVB DEM1.SG you me-APUD.LAT bring.IMP-QUOT
\l When he says: 'I will!', bring him to me!"

\t Neła quł sasaqtow ža ɣˤanabi bašiqˤoyn koyär risno rukarxo bazarya yäčizay, ayn sida užä nełas baha šebiƛin esirnosi, neła debeq yiłas baha bäzinč’iƛin eƛin.
\m neła qu-ł sasaq-tow ža ɣˤanabi bašiqˤoy-n kʷay-ar r-is-n r-ukar-x bazar-a y-iči-zay ay-n sida uži-a neła-s baha šebi-ƛin esir-nosi neła-a mi-q yiła-s baha b-izi-č’i-ƛin eƛi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning-EMPH DEM1.SG woman ring-TOP hand-IN.LAT IV-take-PFV.CVB IV-show-IPFV.CVB bazar-IN.ESS II-be-SIM.CVB come-PFV.CVB one.OBL boy-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 price what-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you-POSS.ESS DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 price III-get-NEG.FUT-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l The next day in the morning, the woman was showing around the ring on her hand, and while being on the market, a boy came and asked: "What's its price?"; she said: "You won't afford its price."

\t Däq nełas baha bäziƛin užä eƛinosi, yiła yeda idur kidbeder ayrno.
\m di-q neła-s baha b-izi-ƛin uži-a eƛi-nosi yiła-a yeda idu-r kid-der ayr-n
\g me-POSS.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 price III-get-QUOT boy-ERG say-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG home-LAT girl-APUD.LAT lead-PST.UNW
\l "I will be able to afford its price.", the boy said, and she led him home to the girl.

\t Neširu beciƛ’ q’ˤanon maħorno boqno, t’akanno yisno užä eƛin, ulkałkin anunč’uruq’aw, xanbin, wazirbin bišxosi, riguƛ’ay rigu teł šebin yołäsi magazin roqoƛƛin.
\m neširu buci-ƛ’ q’ˤano-n maħor-n b-oq-n t’akan-n y-is-n uži-a eƛi-n ulka-ł-kin anu-č’u-ru-q’aw xan-bi-n wazir-bi-n b-iš-xosi r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu teł šebin yoł-asi magazin r-oq-ƛ-ƛin
\g evening moon-SUPER.ESS two-TOP outside-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB glass-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB boy-ERG say-PFV.CVB country-CONT.ESS-even be.absent-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.PRT-EQU2 khan-PL-TOP vizier-PL-TOP I.PL-eat-PRS.PRT IV-good-SUPER.ABL IV-good inside thing be-RES.PRT shop IV-become-OPT-QUOT
\l In the evening by moonlight, the two got outside and the boy took the glass and said: "May there be a shop where the best things are in, which the kings and viziers eat...."

\t Sasaqor žeda äƛiza mečoƛ’ yizir bercinaw magazinno, elotow teł xanzarsi biłe bišxosi močin, icozaƛ’gon biguƛ’ay bigu q’ayn besun.
\m sasaq-qor žedu-a eƛi-za moči-ƛ’ yizi-r bercinaw magazin-n elo-tow teł xan-bi-r-si b-iłe b-iš-xosi moči-n ico-bi-ƛ’-gon b-igu-ƛ’ay b-igu q’ay-n b-esu-n
\g in.the.morning-POSS.LAT DEM1.IPL-ERG say-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.ESS DEM2.IPL-LAT beautiful shop-TOP there-EMPH inside khan-PL-LAT-ATTR I.PL-as I.PL-eat-PRS.PRT place-TOP shelf-PL-SUPER.ESS-CNTR III-good-SUPER.ABL III-good article-TOP III-find-PST.UNW
\l In the morning, on the place where they spoke, they found a beautiful shop with the best articles on the shelfs and a place to eat like for a king in it.

\t Sida quł elor bišanixƛin xanno, nesisgon wazirbin bayn.
\m sida-a qu-ł elo-r b-iš-ani-x-ƛin xan-n nesi-s-gon wazir-bi-n b-ay-n
\g one.OBL-Q day-CONT.ESS there-LAT I.PL-eat-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT khan-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR vizier-PL-and I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l One day, the king and his vizier came there in order to eat.

\t Babiw išƛ’oräy, kidbä nesił adäz mesedyos yic’äsi t’akan eqerno.
\m babiw iš-ƛ’oräy kid-a nesi-ł adäz mesed-s y-ic’-asi t’akan eqer-n
\g father eat-SIM.CVB daughter-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before gold-GEN1 II-fill-RES.PRT glass put-PST.UNW
\l While the father was eating, his daughter put the glass full of gold in front of him.

\t (Nesir riyx zownanu ža nesis kid yałrułi).
\m nesi-r r-iy-x zow-n-anu ža nesi-s kid yoł-rułi
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-know-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter be-MSD
\l (He didn't know it was his daughter).

\t Išno łiynosi, xan ƛ’iri utin, ža t’akan där neƛƛin.
\m iš-n łiy-nosi xan ƛ’iri uti-n ža t’akan di-r neƛ-ƛin
\g eat-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB khan above turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG glass me-LAT give-QUOT
\l When he finished eating, the king insisted: "Give me this glass!"

\t Bayru q’ut’oƛ’ xan razi oqno.
\m b-odi-ru q’ut’i-ƛ’ xan razi oq-n
\g I.PL-do-PST.PRT agreement-SUPER.ESS khan agree become-PST.UNW
\l The king agreed on the contract to do so.

\t Elus xan oxisƛin, nesiłgon xizaz wazirbin čˤaƛin bik’in.
\m elu-s xan oxi-s-ƛin nesi-ł-gon xizaz wazir-bi-n čˤaƛi-n b-ik’i-n
\g we(I).OBL-GEN1 khan run.away-PST.WIT-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-CNTR behind vizier-PL-TOP rush-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l [Saying] "Our king ran away!", his viziers went running behind him.

\t Ɣˤalu seranix indowrizaxosi aħo goƛ’anix xanä wazirbi begirno baynosi, k’oƛin yik’in kidbätow serun.
\m ɣˤalu seru-ani-x indowri-bi-x-si aħo goƛ’i-ani-x xan-a wazir-bi b-egir-n b-ay-nosi k’oƛi-n y-ik’i-n kid-a-tow seru-n
\g saddle unlock-MSD-AD.ESS turkey-PL-AD.ESS-ATTR shepherd call-MSD-AD.ESS khan-ERG vizier-PL I.PL-let-PFV.CVB I.PL-come-ANT.CVB run-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB daughter-ERG-EMPH unlock-PST.UNW
\l He sent his viziers to call the turkey herder to open the saddle, but his daughter came running and opened it.

\t Xanä ixiw bertenno boyn, indowrizaz aħozix kidno yegirno.
\m xan-a ixiw berten-n b-odi-n indowri-bi-z aħo-x kid-n y-egir-n
\g khan-ERG big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB turkey-PL-GEN2 shepherd-AD.ESS daughter-TOP II-let-PST.UNW
\l The king organized a big wedding and married his daughter off to the turkey herder.

\t Zownƛax zownanuƛax q’ˤano bazargan.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax q’ˤano bazargan
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT two merchant
\l Once upon a time there were two merchants.

\t Žedude sadaq kumakyor xalq’in zown.
\m žedu-de sadaq kumak-r xalq’i-n zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL-APUD.ESS together help-LAT people-TOP be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l And they had people with them for help.

\t Sid bazarganes xexbi zownanu.
\m sida bazargan-s xexbi zow-n-anu
\g one.OBL merchant-GEN1 child be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l One merchant had no child.

\t Bayn yizirabi ƛirbałix sid žek’ude idur.
\m b-ay-n yizirabi ƛirbałi-x sida žek’u-de idu-r
\g I.PL-come-PFV.CVB DEM2.PL hospitality-AD.ESS one.OBL man-APUD.ESS home-LAT
\l Then came home to a man as guests.

\t Elo idu besun iłno užin, mežä k’ʷač’nox yiziräsi ɣˤanabin.
\m elo idu b-esu-n iłno uži-n muži-a k’ʷač’no-x y-izir-asi ɣˤanabi-n
\g there home I.PL-find-PFV.CVB six son-TOP mattress-IN.ESS groan-IPFV.CVB II-lift-RES.PRT woman-TOP
\l There at home they found six sons and in the bed a groaning woman.

\t Xexbi anuru bazarganƛ’o ci Žungutaw zown.
\m xexbi anu-ru bazargan-ƛ’ ci Žungutaw zow-n
\g child be.NEG-PST.PRT merchant-SUPER.ESS name Jungutav be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The name of the merchant who had no children was Jungutav.

\t Nesä ƛirbaq esirno, yedu ɣˤanabi šida qˤaƛanayx ʕiyayxƛin.
\m nesi-a ƛirba-q esir-n yedu ɣˤanabi šida qˤaƛanad-x ʕiyad-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG guest-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG woman why yell-IPFV.CVB cry-PRS-QUOT
\l He asked the guest: "Why is this woman yelling and crying?"

\t Xedya žawab teƛno, neła xexbi rodixƛin.
\m xediw-a žawab teƛ-n neła-a xexbi r-odi-x-ƛin
\g husband-ERG answer give-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG child III.PL-do-PRS-QUOT
\l The husband answered: "She is giving birth to a child."

\t Mi äƛiruxor ričiƛƛin, razi oqno neł ɣˤutkos bet’erhan.
\m mi äƛiru-xor r-iči-ƛ-ƛin razi oq-n neła ɣˤutku-s bet’erhan
\g you ORD-AD.LAT IV-be-OPT-QUOT agree become-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL house-GEN1 master
\l "May it be as you said!", agreed the master of that house.

\t Neł ɣˤanazar uži odin.
\m neła ɣˤanabi-r uži odi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-LAT son do-PST.UNW
\l A son was born to the woman.

\t Ciqqor baynosi, užä ʕiyada bašla bodin.
\m ciq-qor b-ay-nosi uži-a ʕiyad-a bašla b-odi-n
\g forest-POSS.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB boy-ERG cry-INF begin III-do-PST.UNW
\l When they came to a forest, the boy began to cry.

\t Žeda ža sidaɣ łˤebozał ƛ’iriɣor hut’-mˤalin roƛik’no uqˤno.
\m žedu-a ža sidaɣ ƛˤeb-bi-ł ƛ’iri-ɣor hut’~mˤali-n r-oƛik’-n uqˤi-n
\g DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.SG in.one.place leaf-PL-CONT.ESS on-IN.ALL front.part.of.the.face-TOP IV-push.out-PFV.CVB hide-PST.UNW
\l They hid him somewhere with only his face out of the leaves.

\t Elo igoza ciqqo ečrut’ani xalq’imos qunno, beƛ’ˤes reqenno zown, amma žedus xexbi zownanu.
\m elo igo-za ciq-q ečru-t’a-ni xalq’i-s qun-n bˤeƛ’-s reqen-n zow-n amma žedu-s xexbi zow-n-anu
\g there near-ZA forest-POSS.ESS old-DISTR-DEF people-GEN1 farmstead-TOP sheep-GEN1 herd-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB but DEM1.IPL-GEN1 child be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l In the neighboring forest, there was some old people's farmstead with a heard of sheep, but they didn't have a child.

\t Qunyox yałru bežet’anizaz beƛ’ˤes reqenyoł sis čanya zown q’ˤano cek’i bodäsi.
\m qun-x yoł-ru b-eže-t’a-ni-zaz bˤeƛ’-s reqen-ł sis čan zow-n q’ˤano cek’i b-odi-asi
\g farmstead-AD.ESS be-PST.PRT I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF-LOC.ORIG sheep-GEN1 herd-CONT.ESS one she.goat be.NPRS-PFV.CVB two goat.kid III-do-RES.PRT
\l The oldest one, who was on the farmstead, had a goat in his herd which gave birth to two goat kids.

\t Zamanałäy čanyan, cek’bintow ħalaq’ roqa roqno.
\m zaman-łay čan-n cek’i-bi-n-tow ħalaq’ r-oq-a r-oq-n
\g time-CONT.ABL she.goat-and goat.kid-PL-and-EMPH meager III.PL-become-INF III.PL-begin-PST.UNW
\l After a while, the she.goat and the goat kids began to become meager.

\t Ža čanya nar eƛa biynč’ey reqenyołäy gugixt’a zown.
\m ža čan nar eƛi-a b-iy-č’ey reqen-łay gugi-x-t’a zow-n
\g DEM1.SG she.goat where say-INF III-know-NEG.PST.CVB herd-CONT.ABL escape-IPFV.CVB-DISTR be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The she.goat didn't know what to do anymore and escaped from the herd.

\t Aħozä c’aq’ xal bodin zown, nar ža čanya gugixƛin.
\m aħo-a c’aq’ xal b-odi-n zow-n nar ža čan gugi-x-ƛin
\g shepherd-ERG much examination III-do-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW where DEM1.SG she.goat escape-PRS-QUOT
\l The shepherd examined closely, where this goat escaped to.

\t Xizaz aħo nexxo ukayrun, čanya ozƛäy bok’ełxo zown.
\m xizaz aħo nex-x ukad-run čan ozuri-ƛay b-ok’eł-x zow-n
\g from.behind shepherd come-IPFV.CVB see-IMM.ANT.CVB she.goat eye-SUB.ABL III-escape-PRS be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Seeing the shepherd coming from behind, the goat escaped from his eye.

\t Hudun, xizaɣor aħozä biyrno čanya bik’ixosi moči.
\m hudun xizaɣor aħo-a b-iyr-n čan b-ik’i-xosi moči
\g nevertheless finally shepherd-ERG III-recognize-PFV.CVB she.goat III-go-PRS.PRT place
\l Nevertheless the shepherd finally found out the place where the goat went to.

\t Neła ɣˤay xirerxo zown bazarganä ciqqo eqäruni žaq.
\m neła-a ɣˤay xirer-x zow-n bazargan-a ciq-q eqer-u-ni uži-q
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG milk nurse-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW merchant-ERG forest-POSS.ESS put-IMPR-DEF boy-POSS.ESS
\l It was giving milk to the boy who was put into the forest by the merchants.

\t Bik’in ečrut’ani xalq’in łˤebozałäyn oɣno ža uži iduɣor own.
\m b-ik’i-n ečru-t’a-ni xalq’i-n ƛˤeb-bi-łay-n oɣ-n ža uži idu-ɣor ow-n
\g I.PL-go-PFV.CVB old-DISTR-DEF people-TOP leaf-PL-CONT.ABL-TOP take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG boy home-IN.ALL bring-PST.UNW
\l The old people went, took the boy out of the leaves and brought him home.

\t Bežet’anibi ʕurawtow ɣˤaɣˤun bizin, nesiƛ’ Tabuldiƛin cin erno.
\m b-eže-t’a-ni-bi ʕuraw-tow ɣˤaɣˤu-n b-izi-n nesi-ƛ’ Tabuldi-ƛin ci-n er-n
\g I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF-PL much-EMPH be.happy-TOP I.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS Tabuldi-QUOT name-TOP put-PST.UNW
\l The oldest ones were very glad and gave him the name Tabuldi.

\t Ža uži esarus aħozir ixiw sayɣatno bodin, egirno xizor.
\m ža uži esu-ru-s aħo-r ixiw sayɣat-n b-odi-n egir-n xizor
\g DEM1.SG boy find-PST.PRT-GEN1 shepherd-LAT big present-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB send-PST.UNW back
\l The boy gave the shepherds who had found him a big present and sent them back.

\t Ečrut’anibin, Tabuldin sis haq’u biłe ciqqo bercinaw t’abiʕatyoł ʕumrun, maʕišatno bodix bičin.
\m ečru-t’a-ni-bi-n Tabuldi-n sis haq’u b-iłe ciq-q bercinaw t’abiʕat-ł ʕumru-n maʕišat-n b-odi-x b-iči-n
\g old-DISTR-DEF-PL-and Tabuldi-and one family III-as forest-POSS.ESS beautiful nature-CONT.ESS life-TOP fortune-TOP III-do-IPFV.CVB I.PL-be-PFV.CVB
\l The old people and Tabuldi lived together like a family in the forest and lead a beautiful life in the nature and made a fortune.

\t Žaqˤułno esix žedu elo yołƛin.
\m žaqˤuł-n esi-x žedu elo yoł-ƛin
\g today-TOP tell-IPFV.CVB DEM1.IPL there be-QUOT
\l It is said that they are still there today.

\t Žedu qunyox bičix zown.
\m žedu qun-x b-iči-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL farmstead-AD.ESS I.PL-live-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They were living on a farm.

\t Mužmares kakno rodin, narey yeda uži ok’łä bˤeƛ’däyƛin, eza ik’izaƛ’, req’ezin oqno kecäsi esun.
\m mužmar-s kak-n r-odi-n nar-ey yeda uži ok’eł-a bˤeƛ’-day-ƛin ezu-a ik’i-zaƛ’ req’ezi-n oq-n kec-asi esu-n
\g Friday-GEN1 prayer-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB where-DUB DEM2.ISG son escape-PST.WIT.INT sheep-APUD.ABL-QUOT look-INF go-CSL.CVB approach-TOP become-PFV.CVB sleep-RES.PRT find-PST.UNW
\l He did the Friday's prayer, and went to see where his son went to from the flock of sheep, and when he approached him, he found him asleep.

\t Igorno ik’in babiya č’arik’nosi, užir retinanu, dahawgon šida di moƛał xecinč’uƛin.
\m igo-r-n ik’i-n babiw-a č’arik’-nosi uži-r r-eti-n-anu dahaw-gon šida di moƛu-ł xeci-č’u-ƛin
\g near-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB father-ERG wake.up-ANT.CVB son-LAT IV-like-PFV.CVB-NEG a.little-CNTR why me dream-CONT.ESS leave-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The father came closer and after waking him up, the son didn't like it [and said]: "Why didn't you let me sleep a little more?"

\t Howlotow babiw hemece ƛ’iri utin žaƛ’ šida mi ža eƛä, šebi deber moƛał rukayx zowäƛin.
\m howlo-tow babiw hemece ƛ’iri uti-n uži-ƛ’ šida mi ža eƛi-a šebi mi-r moƛu-ł r-ukad-x zow-a-ƛin
\g there-EMPH father as.many above return-PFV.CVB son-SUPER.ESS why you DEM1.SG say-PST.WIT.INT what you-LAT dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Then the father replied to the son: "Why do you say this, what did you see in your dream?"

\t Esinč’inäy bazarganzar teƛa yołƛin ʕuƛ’erxo zown.
\m esi-č’i-näy bazargan-bi-r teƛ-a yoł-ƛin ˤuƛ’er-x zow-n
\g tell-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB merchant-PL-LAT give-INF be-QUOT scare-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "If you don't tell, I will sell you to the merchants!", he scared him.

\t Užä ot’ bisno ičin, mi šebigon rodiłin äsinč’iƛin.
\m uži-a ot’ b-is-n iči-n mi šebi-gon r-odi-łin esi-č’i-ƛin
\g son-ERG rejection III-take-PFV.CVB be-PFV.CVB you what-CNTR IV-do-CNC.CVB tell-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l The son was rejecting, "Whatever you do, I won't tell."

\t Elay nesä ik’in baruq raqru łinałäyn esinosi, neła eƛin, neširu t’ekan bexʷad, užin goƛ’o, xizyo di nesiq esiranƛin.
\m ele-ay nesi-a ik’i-n baru-q r-oq-ru łina-łay-n esi-nosi neła-a eƛi-n neširu t’eka-n b-exʷad uži-n goƛ’i-o xizyo di nesi-q esir-an-ƛin
\g there-IN.ABL DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG go-PFV.CVB wife-POSS.ESS IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP tell-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PFV.CVB evening he.goat-TOP III-slaughter boy-TOP call-IMPR afterwards me DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l He went away and told his wife what had happened, and she said: "Slaughter a goat tonight, call the boy and afterwards I will ask him."

\t Bexʷayn t’ekan, ƛoħaɣor nełas reƛno riħurno, goƛ’in uži.
\m b-exʷad-n t’eka-n ƛoħo-aɣor neła-s reƛ-n r-iħur-n goƛ’i-n uži
\g III-slaughter-PFV.CVB he.goat-TOP pan-IN.VERS DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 meat-TOP IV-pour-PFV.CVB call-PST.UNW son
\l So he slaughtered the goat, put its meat into a pan and called his son.

\t T’ogon žade puħorno yik’in, ƛ’iri yutin eniw, eso däq, šebi deber moƛał rukayx zowäƛin.
\m t’o-gon uži-de pu-xor-n y-ik’i-n ƛ’iri y-uti-n eniw esi-o di-q šebi mi-r moƛu-ł r-ukad-x zow-a-ƛin
\g there-CNTR son-APUD.ESS side-AD.LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB above II-turn-PFV.CVB mother tell-IMPR me-POSS.ESS what you-LAT dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l There, the mother went beside him and insisted: "Tell me, what did you see in your dream?"

\t Eniwqorno hemedurtow, esa k’ʷeze yaqinč’i däqƛin ičin.
\m eniw-qor-n hemedur-tow esi-a k’ʷeze y-oq-č’i di-q-ƛin iči-n
\g mother-POSS.LAT-TOP so-EMPH tell-INF can II-become-NEG.FUT me-POSS.ESS-QUOT be-PST.UNW
\l To his mother he was the same: "I cannot tell you."

\t Xizyo, babiya äƛiruxor, ža uži bazarganzar teƛno.
\m xizyo babiw-a äƛiru-xor ža uži bazargan-bi-r teƛ-n
\g afterwards father-ERG ORD-AD.LAT DEM1.SG boy merchant-PL-LAT give-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, the father sold his boy off to the merchants, as he said.

\t ƛ’iri xabar boynč’ey bazarganzadetow sadaq oqno užin ik’in.
\m ƛ’iri xabar b-odi-č’ey bazargan-bi-de-tow sadaq oq-n uži-n ik’i-n
\g above story III-do-NEG.PST.CVB merchant-PL-APUD.ESS-EMPH together begin-PFV.CVB boy-TOP go-PST.UNW
\l Without further conversation, the boy went together with the merchants.

\t Hunix bik’iƛ’oräy, sasiłnosi yizi nasin sidaɣ łin, c’in, qacan anuza gogaƛ’ rešt’izi boqno.
\m huni-x b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy sasił-nosi yizi nasin sidaɣ łi-n c’i-n qaca-n anu-za goga-ƛ’ rešt’izi b-oq-n
\g way-AD.ESS I.PL-go-SIM.CVB get.dark-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL all in.one.place water-and fire-and firewood-and be.absent-LCV.CVB meadow-SUPER.ESS take.a.rest I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l While they were on their way, it got dark and they all took a rest on a meadow without any firewood, fire or water.

\t Boč’ik’xo, ačqˤayx, bazarganbi butnozaxarno butin kecno bičin.
\m b-oč’ik’-x ačqˤad-x bazargan-bi butni-bi-xar-n b-uti-n kec-n b-iči-n
\g I.PL-feel.cold-IPFV.CVB be.thirsty-IPFV.CVB merchant-PL burka-PL-AD.VERS-TOP I.PL-turn-PFV.CVB sleep-PFV.CVB I.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l Feeling cold and being thirsty, the merchants wrapped themselves into their burkas and fell asleep.

\t Yisi žar moƛał neł gogaƛäz łäs oreznin, bišʷan rizäsi c’in, qacisgon ɣeryabin rukayn.
\m yisi uži-r moƛu-ł neła goga-ƛäz łi-s orezni-n bišʷa-n r-izi-asi c’i-n qaci-s-gon ɣer-bi-n r-ukad-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-LAT dream-CONT.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL meadow-SUB.ESS.DIST water-GEN1 pond-and food-and IV-get-RES.PRT fire-and firewood-GEN1-CNTR pile-PL-and IV.PL-see-PST.UNW
\l In his dream, the boy saw a pond of water under the meadow, food, a fire and a pile of firewood.

\t Sidenigon bazarganqor č’arik’no hemedurtow eƛin butnoƛäzay ezunosi, c’idos lapi bukayn.
\m sideni-gon bazargan-qor č’arik’-n hemedur-tow eƛi-n butni-ƛäzay ezu-nosi c’i-s lapi b-ukad-n
\g other-CNTR merchant-POSS.LAT wake.up-PFV.CVB so-EMPH say-PFV.CVB burka-SUB.ABL.DIST look-ANT.CVB fire-GEN1 flare III-see-PST.UNW
\l He woke up another merchant and told him so, and when he looked out of his burka, he saw the flare of a fire.

\t Nesä sadaq bazarganbin č’arik’no, c’idoxaɣor bik’inosi, elogon łäs kikno besun, bišʷan resun.
\m nesi-a sadaq bazargan-bi-n č’arik’-n c’i-xaɣor b-ik’i-nosi elo-gon łi-s kik-n b-esu-n bišʷa-n r-esu-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG all merchant-PL-TOP wake.up-PFV.CVB fire-AD.VERS I.PL-go-ANT.CVB there-CNTR water-GEN1 spring-and III-find-PFV.CVB food-and IV.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l He woke up all the merchants and they went to the fire, where they found a spring of water and food.

\t Di žeduqƛin, žawab teƛno nesä, där bˤeƛ’xo yałzay yukayru moƛu esinč’uƛin.
\m di žedu-q-ƛin žawab teƛ-n nesi-a di-r bˤeƛ’-x yoł-zay y-ukad-ru moƛu esi-č’u-ƛin
\g me DEM1.IPL-POSS.ESS-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG me-LAT sheep-AD.ESS be-SIM.CVB II-see-PST.PRT dream tell-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l He answered "I didn't tell them what I dreamed of while herding the sheep."

\t Howža yisiq eƛin rok’äłrungon žedu yisiƛ’or butin, eluqgon esinč’inäy, ela mi xaner teƛa yołƛin.
\m howža yisi-q eƛi-n r-ok’eł-run-gon žedu yisi-ƛ’or b-uti-n elu-q-gon esi-č’i-näy elu-a mi xan-r teƛ-a yoł-ƛin
\g DEM4.SG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS say-PFV.CVB IV-lose-IMM.ANT.CVB-CNTR DEM1.IPL DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT I.PL-turn-PFV.CVB we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS-CNTR tell-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB we(I).OBL-ERG you khan-LAT give-INF be-QUOT
\l When he had said that to him, they insisted: "When you don't tell us, we will give you to the king."

\t Xizyo žedagon ža ižin xaner teƛno.
\m xizyo žeda-gon ža iži-n xan-r teƛ-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CNTR DEM1.SG lead-PFV.CVB khan-LAT give-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards they brought and gave him to the king.

\t Nesä ža mat’izaxor egirno.
\m nesi-a ža mat’i-bi-xor egir-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG duck-PL-AD.LAT let-PST.UNW
\l He let him look after the ducks.

\t Xanes zown sis bercinaw kid.
\m xan-s zow-n sis bercinaw kid
\g khan-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW one beautiful daughter
\l The king had one beautiful daughter.

\t Zamanałäy žedus žeduqor roƛ’i boqno.
\m zaman-łay žedu-s žedu-qor roƛ’i b-oq-n
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM1.IPL-GEN1 DEM1.IPL-POSS.LAT love III-become-PST.UNW
\l After a while, they fell in love with each other.

\t Kidbä yik’in mat’izaxay oɣo žaƛin babiwqor eƛinosi, nesä inkar bodin, eläy oɣłin nełƛ’ay bigza mečoƛ’or di ža egärinč’iƛin.
\m kid-a y-ik’i-n mat’i-bi-xay oɣ-o ža-ƛin babiw-qor eƛi-nosi nesi-a inkar b-odi-n ele-ay oɣ-łin neła-ƛ’ay b-ig-za moči-ƛ’or di ža egir-č’i-ƛin
\g girl-ERG II-go-PFV.CVB duck-PL-AD.ABL take.away-IMPR DEM1.SG-QUOT father-POSS.LAT say-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG rejection III-do-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL take.away-CNC.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL III-well-ZA place-SUPER.LAT me DEM1.SG let-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l When the daughter went and told her father: "Let him away from the ducks!", he rejected and said: "I won't let him to a place better than this one."

\t Žeduł roƛosi šebin čuqˤnosi, xanä wazirzaqorno eƛin uži tełer kurerno.
\m žedu-ł r-oƛƛo-si šebin čuqˤ-nosi xan-a wazir-bi-qor-n eƛi-n uži tełer kur-r-n
\g DEM1.IPL-CONT.ESS IV-middle-ATTR thing notice-ANT.CVB khan-ERG vizier-PL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB boy to.the.inside throw-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l When he noticed what is between them, the king told his viziers to throw the boy into jail.

\t Ža xanzo kidber ʕuraw isałno, k’eneč’cet’a gurow yišxo zownanu.
\m ža xan-z kid-r ʕuraw isał-n k’eneč’-ce-t’a gurow y-iš-x zow-n-anu
\g DEM1.SG khan-GEN2 daughter-LAT very be.difficult-PFV.CVB egg-EQU1-DISTR except II-eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l This was very difficult for the king's daughter, and she didn't eat anything but food in the size of an egg anymore.

\t Hemecegon där neƛxosi bišʷa raq’ˤik’ƛin babiwqorno eƛin, ƛäxuru neła nazonoqayn ruqˤno tusnaq’är užir rižixt’a yik’ix zown.
\m hemece-gon di-r neƛ-xosi bišʷa r-aq’ˤik’-ƛin babiw-qor-n eƛi-n ƛexu-ru neła-a nazono-qay-n r-uqˤi-n tusnaq’-ar uži-r r-iži-x-t’a y-ik’i-x zow-n
\g as.many-CNTR me-LAT give-PRS.PRT food IV-increase-QUOT father-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB remain-PST.PRT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG all-POSS.ABL-TOP IV-hide-PFV.CVB prison-IN.LAT boy-LAT IV-lead-PRS-DISTR II-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "Increase the food that you are giving to me!", she said to her father, ...

\t Sida zamanał, maduhalłiqozo ħukmatyoz xanä yisiƛ’or begirno geres hibo bayrno naza boq’ˤiw, naza kikiw yałru biyrƛin.
\m sida zaman-ł maduhalłi-q-zo ħukmat-z xan-a yisi-ƛ’or b-egir-n ger-s hibo b-ayr-n na-aza b-oq’ˤiw na-aza kikiw yoł-ru b-iyr-ƛin
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ESS neighbourhood-POSS.ESS-ATTR.OBL country-GEN2 khan-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT III-send-PFV.CVB iron-GEN1 stick III-bring-PFV.CVB where-IN.VERS.DIST III-heavy where-IN.VERS.DIST light be-PST.PRT III-find.out-QUOT
\l At one point in time, the king of a neighboring country sent to him an iron stick [with the message]: "Find out where it's heavy and where's it's light."

\t Nagaħ ža riyrinč’inäy dowde dandir di ƛˤori boda yołƛin.
\m nagaħ ža r-iyr-č’i-näy mi-de dandir di ƛˤori b-odi-a yoł-ƛin
\g suppose DEM1.SG IV-find.out-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB you-APUD.ESS towards me war III-do-INF be-QUOT
\l "If you don't find it out, I will start a war against you."

\t Xanä q’ʷaridno oqno wˤałer rˤoƛ’arzay q’ˤimkin rizirxo zownanu, t’ok’ow roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey.
\m xan-a q’ʷarid-n oq-n wˤał-r r-ˤoƛ’ur-zay q’ˤim-kin r-izir-x zow-n-anu t’ok’ow r-odi-a šebin koƛ’i-č’ey
\g khan-ERG sadness-TOP become-PFV.CVB downward-LAT IV-let.fall-SIM.CVB head-even IV-lift-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG anymore IV-do-INF thing understand.to-NEG.PST.UNW
\l The king became sad and while he hung his head, he didn't lift it up again and didn't know what to do anymore.

\t Sida quł tusnaq’är žader q’ʷaridno yoqno xanes kid yayn, šebi roqnoƛin nesä bayan bisnosi, yiłä nełäz babiwƛ’or bayru q’ʷariłiłäy esin.
\m sida qu-ł tusnaq’-ar uži-der q’ʷarid-n y-oq-n xan-s kid y-ay-n šebi r-oq-n-ƛin nesi-a bayan b-is-nosi yiła-a neła-az babiw-ƛ’or b-ay-ru q’ʷariłi-łay esi-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS prison-IN.LAT boy-APUD.LAT sadness-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 daughter II-come-PFV.CVB what IV-happen-PST.UNW-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG information III-take-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS.DIST father-SUPER.LAT III-come-PST.PRT sadness-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW
\l One day, the sad princess came to the boy into the prison and when he wanted to know what had happened, she told about the sadness that came upon her father.

\t Nełaq mi rasgi q’ʷarid yaqnoƛin, žoyä nełas rok’u čučzi royn.
\m neła-q mi rasgi q’ʷarid y-oq-n-ƛin uži-a neła-s rok’u čučzi r-odi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS you at.all sadness II-become-PROHIB-QUOT boy-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 heart loosen IV-do-PST.UNW
\l "Don't be sad at all about it!", he calmed her down.

\t Howt’ay yäk’irun, där moƛał rukaysƛin babiwqor eƛo mi, soderno kurno ƛ’ˤiyor nexƛ’oräy, geres hibos boq’ˤugani pu wˤałxor butin nexno raƛ’moƛxorgon šäšiƛin.
\m howt’ay y-ik’i-run di-r moƛu-ł r-ukad-s-ƛin babiw-qor eƛi-o mi soder-n kur-n ƛ’ˤiyor nex-ƛ’oräy ger-s hibo-s b-oq’ˤiw-ga-ni pu wˤał-xor b-uti-n nex-n raƛ’-ƛxor-gon šiši-ƛin
\g from.here II-go-IMM.ANT.CVB me-LAT dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-PST.WIT-QUOT father-POSS.LAT say-IMPR you upward-TOP throw-PFV.CVB downward come-SIM.CVB iron-GEN1 stick-GEN1 III-heavy-ATTR-DEF side downward-AD.LAT III-turn-PFV.CVB come-PFV.CVB earth-SUB.LAT-CNTR get.stuck-QUOT
\l "When you go again, tell your father that you have seen it in a dream: He shall throw it upward and when it comes down again, the iron stick's heavier side will turn downward and get stuck in the earth."

\t Elayn k’oƛin yik’in neła hemedur där moƛał rukaysƛin, užä małiru šebin babiwq esin.
\m ele-ay-n k’oƛi-n y-ik’i-n neła-a hemedur di-r moƛu-ł r-ukad-s-ƛin uži-a mołi-ru šebin babiw-q esi-n
\g here-IN.ABL-TOP run-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG so me-LAT dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-PST.WIT-QUOT boy-ERG teach-PST.PRT thing father-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW
\l So she ran away and told her father: "I have seem it in a dream!" and what the boy had explained to her.

\t Xizyogon hemesitow xanä begirno q’ˤano t’umi bayrno, howzałäy nasi guluči, nasi aqiw yałru biyrƛin.
\m xizyogon hemesi-tow xan-a b-egir-n q’ˤano t’umi b-ayr-n howza-łay nasi guluči nasi aqiw yoł-ru b-iyr-ƛin
\g then DEM4.ISG.OBL-EMPH khan-ERG III-let-PFV.CVB two pigeon III-bring-PST.UNW these.OBL-CONT.ABL which male which female be-PST.PRT III-find.out-QUOT
\l Then, that king had two pigeons be brought[ to him, saying]: "Find out, which is male and which is female!"

\t Žigon xan q’ʷariłiłer egin.
\m žigon xan q’ʷariłi-łer egi-n
\g again.now khan sadness-CONT.LAT stand.still-PST.UNW
\l Again, the king was sad.

\t K’oƛin yik’in žader kid ixiwt’a muši kurxo yičin.
\m k’oƛi-n y-ik’i-n uži-der kid ixiw-t’a muši kur-x y-iči-n
\g run-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB boy-APUD.LAT daughter big-DISTR air throw-IPFV.CVB II-be-PST.UNW
\l His daughter came running and moaned heavily at the boy.

\t Šebi roqno deber, tusnaq’ä yałru dikinwa necet’a ixiw muši kurxanuƛin, žoyä bayan bisnosi, neła hemedur q’ˤano t’umi bayräsi yoł, žedałäy nasi guluči, nasi aqiw bat’a boda koƛ’inč’ey ƛexasiƛin esin.
\m šebi r-oq-n mi-r tusnaq’-a yoł-ru di-kin-a nece-t’a ixiw muši kur-x-anu-ƛin uži-a bayan b-is-nosi neła-a hemedur q’ˤano t’umi b-ayr-asi yoł žeda-łay nasi guluči nasi aqiw bat’a b-odi-a koƛ’i-č’ey ƛexu-asi-ƛin esi-n
\g what IV-happen-PFV.CVB you-LAT prison-IN.ESS be-PST.PRT me-even-Q so.much-DISTR big air throw-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT boy-ERG information III-take-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG so two pigeon III-bring-RES.PRT be DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ABL which male which female seperation III-do-INF understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB remain-RES.PRT-QUOT tell-PST.UNW
\l "What happened to you? Even I, who I am in prison, don't moan so much!", the boy wanted to know, and she told him so: "Two pigeons were brought and it remains unknown how to distinguish which of them is male and which is female!"

\t Q’ʷarid boqa bayxozoce šebin anu žaƛin, kidbes žoyä rok’u ɣˤaɣˤu rizirno.
\m q’ʷarid b-oq-a b-ay-xozo-ace šebin anu ža-ƛin kid-s uži-a rok’u ɣˤaɣˤu r-izir-n
\g sadness III-become-INF III-come-PRS.PRT.OBL-TERM thing be.NEG DEM1.SG-QUOT girl-GEN1 boy-ERG heart be.happy IV-lift-PST.UNW
\l "There is nothing to be sad about", the boy made the girl's heart happy.

\t Howt’ay yäk’irun moƛał rukays därƛin eso nesiq, łˤora ɣudƛ’o q’ˤanon t’umibi quqan xecin žedar biša kurnosi, gulučini t’umi šet’u butix bäči, aqugani bišno łiyaceƛin.
\m howt’ay y-ik’i-run moƛu-ł r-ukad-s di-r-ƛin esi-o nesi-q łˤora ɣudi-ƛ’ q’ˤano-n t’umi-bi quqa-n xeci-n žeda-r bišʷa kur-nosi guluči-ni t’umi šet’u b-uti-x b-iči aqiw-ga-ni b-iš-n łiy-ace-ƛin
\g from.here II-go-IMM.ANT.CVB dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-PST.WIT me-LAT-QUOT tell-IMPR DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS three.OBL day-SUPER.ESS two-TOP pigeon-PL hungry-TOP leave-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-LAT food throw-ANT.CVB male-DEF pigeon around III-turn-IPFV.CVB III-be female-ATTR-DEF III-eat-PFV.CVB end-TERM-QUOT
\l "When you go out, - I saw it in a dream -", he told him(?), "leave the two pigeons hungry for 3 days, then, after you throw food onto them, the male pigeon will turn around until the female pigeon has finished eating."

\t Elay babiwderno yik’in, užä małiruxor, hemedurtow där moƛał rukaysƛin, neła esin.
\m ele-ay babiw-der-n y-ik’i-n uži-a mołi-ru-xor hemedur-tow di-r moƛu-ł r-ukad-s-ƛin neła-a esi-n
\g there-IN.ABL father-APUD.LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB boy-ERG teach-PST.PRT-AD.LAT so-EMPH me-LAT dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-PST.WIT-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG tell-PST.UNW
\l She went out and to her father, and told him, after what the boy had explained: "I saw it like this in a dream!"

\t Xanä žedu t’umbi łˤora ɣudi quqan xecin rišerƛ’oräy, aqugani bišno łiyace gulučini t’umi šet’u butix bičin.
\m xan-a žedu t’umi-bi łˤora ɣudi quqa-n xeci-n r-iš-r-ƛ’oräy aqiw-ga-ni b-iš-n łiy-ace guluči-ni t’umi šet’u b-uti-x b-iči-n
\g khan-ERG DEM1.IPL pigeon-PL three.OBL day hungry-TOP leave-PFV.CVB III.PL-eat-CAUS-SIM.CVB female-ATTR-DEF III-eat-PFV.CVB end-TERM male-DEF pigeon around III-turn-IPFV.CVB III-be-PST.UNW
\l The king left those pigeons hungry for three days, and when he fed them, the male one turned around until the female one had finished eating.

\t Xizyo gulučinin bišno.
\m xizyo guluči-ni-n b-iš-n
\g afterwards male-DEF-TOP III-eat-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards the male one ate as well.

\t Hudayƛ’aygon maduhalłiqozoni xanä begirno q’ˤano gulu bayrno nasi yizałäy ʕoloqanaw, nasi ečru yałru bat’a boda koƛ’inč’inäy, di dowde dandir ƛˤori boda yołƛin.
\m hudayƛ’aygon maduhalłi-q-zo-ni xan-a b-egir-n q’ˤano gulu b-ayr-n nasi yiza-łay ʕoloqanaw nasi ečru yoł-ru bat’a b-odi-a koƛ’i-č’i-näy di mi-de dandir ƛˤori b-odi-a yoł-ƛin
\g on.the.next.day neighbourhood-POSS.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF khan-ERG III-let-PFV.CVB two horse III-bring-PFV.CVB which DEM2.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ABL young which old be-PST.PRT seperation III-do-INF understand.to-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB me you-APUD.ESS towards war III-do-INF be-QUOT
\l On the next day, the neighboring king had two horses be brought to him, [saying:] "If you don't know how to find out which of them is young and which is old, I will make war on you!"

\t Xanƛ’o reže ɣudi zown, roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey.
\m xan-ƛ’ r-eže ɣudi zow-n r-odi-a šebin koƛ’i-č’ey
\g khan-SUPER.ESS IV-big day be.NPRS-PFV.CVB IV-do-INF thing understand.to-NEG.PST.UNW
\l It was a big hazzle for the king and he didn't know what to do.

\t Babiwƛ’ nediw ɣudi rukayzaƛ’, kid žigon yizin žader tusnaq’ärno yik’in akixor yaynosi, ixiw muši kurno.
\m babiw-ƛ’ nediw ɣudi r-ukad-zaƛ’ kid žigon y-izi-n uži-der tusnaq’-ar-n y-ik’i-n aki-xor y-ay-nosi ixiw muši kur-n
\g father-SUPER.ESS such day IV-see-CSL.CVB girl again.now II-get.up-PFV.CVB boy-APUD.LAT prison-IN.LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB window-AD.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB big air throw-PST.UNW
\l When she saw the hazzle on her father, the girl got up again and went into the prison to the boy, and moaned, when she came to the window.

\t Žigon šebi roqnoƛin, užä bayan bisnosi, neła kinaw raqru šebin esin.
\m žigon šebi r-oq-n-ƛin uži-a bayan b-is-nosi neła-a kinaw r-oq-ru šebin esi-n
\g again.now what IV-happen-PST.UNW-QUOT boy-ERG information III-take-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG entire IV-happen-PST.PRT thing tell-PST.UNW
\l When the boy asked: "What happened?" again, she told all the things that happened.

\t Mi q’ʷarid yaqnoƛin, eƛin užä.
\m mi q’ʷarid y-oq-n-ƛin eƛi-n uži-a
\g you sadness II-become-PROHIB-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "Don't be sad!", said the boy.

\t Howt’ay yäk’irun mi babiwqor där moƛał rukaysƛin eƛo, łˤora ɣudi žedu gulubi rišerłin, łi ħaƛurinč’eyn xecin, iħä łäƛ’or žedu rižinosi, ʕoloqanawni gulu łi ħaƛa boƛƛäɣor bäk’i, ečrunä lilyoxaytow ħaƛuƛin.
\m howt’ay y-ik’i-run mi babiw-qor di-r moƛu-ł r-ukad-s-ƛin eƛi-o łˤora ɣudi žedu gulu-bi r-iš-r-łin łi ħaƛu-r-č’ey-n xeci-n iħu-a łi-ƛ’or žedu r-iži-nosi ʕoloqanaw-ni gulu łi ħaƛu-a b-oƛƛo-aɣor b-ik’i ečru-ni-a lilyo-xay-tow ħaƛu-ƛin
\g from.here II-go-IMM.ANT.CVB you father-POSS.LAT me-LAT dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-PST.WIT-QUOT say-IMPR three.OBL day DEM1.IPL horse-PL IV-eat-CAUS-CNC.CVB water drink-CAUS-NEG.PST.CVB-and leave-PFV.CVB river-IN.ESS water-SUPER.LAT DEM1.IPL III.PL-lead-ANT.CVB young-DEF horse water drink-INF III-middle-IN.VERS III-go old-DEF-ERG river.bank-AD.ABL-EMPH drink-QUOT
\l "When you go, say to your father that I saw it in a dream: Although you feed those horses for three days, you don't give them water to drink, then you lead them over the water into a river; the young horse will go to the middle to drink water, the old one will drink from the riverbank instead."

\t Elay yik’in kidbä, där hemedur moƛu yukaysƛin, babiwqor nesi užä äsiru łinałäyn eƛin.
\m ele-ay y-ik’i-n kid-a di-r hemedur moƛu y-ukad-s-ƛin babiw-qor nesi uži-a esi-ru łina-łay-n eƛi-n
\g here-IN.ABL II-go-PFV.CVB girl-ERG me-LAT so dream II-see-PST.WIT-QUOT father-POSS.LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG tell-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP say-PST.UNW
\l The girl went away and [saying] "I had a dream like this!", told to her father about what that boy had told.

\t Xanä žedu gulubi łˤora ɣudi łi teƛinč’eyn rišerno łäƛ’or regirnosi, ʕoloqanawni gulu boƛƛäɣor bik’in, ečrunä lilyoxaytow ħaƛun neł qułtow žedu xizorno regirno, enda ečru, enda ʕoloqanaw yołƛin kaɣatno caxno.
\m xan-a žedu gulu-bi łˤora ɣudi łi teƛ-č’ey-n r-iš-r-n łi-ƛ’or r-egir-nosi ʕoloqanaw-ni gulu b-oƛƛo-aɣor b-ik’i-n ečru-ni-a lilyo-xay-tow ħaƛu-n neła qu-ł-tow žedu xizor-n r-egir-n enda ečru enda ʕoloqanaw yoł-ƛin kaɣat-n cax-n
\g khan-ERG DEM1.IPL horse-PL three.OBL day water give-NEG.PST.CVB-and III.PL-eat-CAUS-PFV.CVB water-SUPER.LAT III.PL-let-ANT.CVB young-DEF horse III-middle-IN.VERS III-go-PFV.CVB old-DEF-ERG river.bank-AD.ABL-EMPH drink-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS-EMPH DEM1.IPL back-TOP III.PL-send-PFV.CVB DEM3b.SG old DEM3b.SG young be-QUOT letter-TOP write-PST.UNW
\l The king didn't give these horses water, but fed them for three days, then he let them onto the water and the young horse went into the middle and the old one drank from the riverbank; on that day, he sent them back, writing a letter[ stating]: "This one is old.", "This one is young."

\t Łˤono nesił adäza erno zawruni masala t’ubazi bodinosi, yeda xan askarno bižin nesi xanƛ’o iħanadanix ik’in.
\m łˤono nesi-ł adäza er-n zow-ru-ni masala t’ubazi b-odi-nosi yeda xan askar-n b-iži-n nesi xan-ƛ’ iħanad-ani-x ik’i-n
\g three DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before put-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF task fulfill III-do-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG khan army-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL khan-SUPER.ESS fight-MSD-AD.ESS go-PST.UNW
\l Having fulfilled the three tasks that were put before him, the other king led an army against this king to go fighting.

\t Žedu elozay bok’äłrungon, xanez kidbä k’oƛin yik’in tusnaq’ay maħor uži egirno.
\m žedu elo-zo-ay b-ok’eł-run-gon xan-z kid-a k’oƛi-n y-ik’i-n tusnaq’-ay maħor uži egir-n
\g DEM1.IPL there-ATTR.OBL-IN.ABL III-escape-IMM.ANT.CVB-CNTR khan-GEN2 daughter-ERG run-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB prison-IN.ABL outside boy let-PST.UNW
\l They escaped from there and the king's daughter ran and let the boy out of the prison.

\t Tełäy aqrun, nesä šeƛ’un xiszi rodin, sis ganin biqirno, ozyoł xizay oqno.
\m teł-ay oq-run nesi-a šeƛ’u-n xiszi r-odi-n sis gani-n b-iqir-n oz-ł xizay oq-n
\g inside-IN.ABL become-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG clothing-TOP change IV-do-PFV.CVB one bull.calf-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB army-CONT.ESS behind become-PST.UNW
\l Having gotten out, he changed clothes, took a bull.calf and got behind the army.

\t Ganƛ’on zown neširur yiził xizay yik’in, raładyoł taqˤorno boqa biynč’ey sidaɣ gogaƛ’ rešt’izi boqäsi besun.
\m gani-ƛ’-n zow-n neširu-r yizi-ł xizay y-ik’i-n raład-ł taqˤo-r-n b-oq-a b-iy-č’ey sidaɣ goga-ƛ’ rešt’izi b-oq-asi b-esu-n
\g bull.calf-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB evening-LAT DEM2.IPL-CONT.ESS behind II-go-PFV.CVB sea-CONT.ESS over.there-LAT-TOP I.PL-become-INF I.PL-know-NEG.PST.CVB in.one.place meadow-SUPER.ESS take.a.rest I.PL-become-RES.PRT I.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l And on the bull.calf, he went behind them in the evening and found them taking a rest on a meadow somewhere, not knowing how to get over the sea.

\t Neširu xanä elo nasin sidaɣor butirnosi, xanä eƛin, di łi ħaƛuxosi t’akan sasaqor howt’or yayäru žek’ux kid yegira yołƛin.
\m neširu xan-a elo nasin sida-aɣor b-utir-nosi xan-a eƛi-n di łi ħaƛu-xosi t’akan sasaq-qor howt’o-r y-ayr-ru žek’u-x kid y-egir-a yoł-ƛin
\g evening khan-ERG there all one.OBL-IN.VERS I.PL-gather-ANT.CVB khan-ERG say-PFV.CVB me water drink-PRS.PRT glass tomorrow-POSS.LAT here-LAT II-bring-PST.PRT man-AD.ESS daughter II-send-INF be-QUOT
\l In the evening the king gather everyone together and said: "I will marry my daughter off to the man who can bring my water-drinking-glass here tomorrow!"

\t Ža täqrun, ganƛ’on zown ik’in zawruni uži t’umin boqno, bik’in xanzo kidbez akix heqno.
\m ža teq-run gani-ƛ’-n zow-n ik’i-n zow-ru-ni uži t’umi-n b-oq-n b-ik’i-n xan-z kid-z aki-x heq-n
\g DEM1.SG hear-IMM.ANT.CVB bull.calf-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF boy pigeon-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 daughter-GEN2 window-AD.ESS sit.down-PST.UNW
\l Having heard this, the boy, who was riding on the bull.calf, turned into a pigeon, flew away and sat down on the princess' window.

\t Nełagon eniwqay izmun bisno, ža t’umi bexurač’inƛin nełqay rožin riqirno, akin raɣˤin tełxor begärun, bik’in kidbez q’ˤimƛ’o heqno.
\m neła-gon eniw-qay izmu-n b-is-n ža t’umi b-exur-ač’in-ƛin neła-qay roži-n r-iqir-n aki-n r-ˤaɣˤi-n teł-xor b-egir-run b-ik’i-n kid-z q’ˤim-ƛ’ heq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-CNTR mother-POSS.ABL permission-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG pigeon III-kill-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL word-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB window-TOP IV-open-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT III-let-IMM.ANT.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB girl-GEN2 head-SUPER.ESS sit.down-PST.UNW
\l It [the pigeon] asked permission from the mother and took her word that she would never kill this pigeon; she opened the window and let it inside, and it flew in and sat down on the girl's head.

\t Kidbägon elayn bisno neła nełaz pardagix bicin.
\m kid-a-gon ele-ay-n b-is-n neła-a neła-z pardagi-x b-ici-n
\g girl-ERG-CNTR there-IN.ABL-PFV.CVB III-take-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 scarf-AD.ESS III-tie-PST.UNW
\l The girl then went and took it and tied it to her own scarf.

\t Xizyo nesä kinaw raqru šebinon esin, xaner nesäq nesä łi ħaƛuxosini t’akan yetinƛin esirno.
\m xizyo nesi-a kinaw r-oq-ru šebinon esi-n xan-r nesi-a-q nesi-a łi ħaƛu-xosi-ni t’akan y-eti-n-ƛin esir-n
\g afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG entire IV-happen-PST.PRT something tell-PFV.CVB khan-LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-POSS.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG water drink-PRS.PRT-DEF glass II-want-PFV.CVB-QUOT ask-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, he told everything that happened and the king asked for the water-drinking-glass that he wanted.

\t Kidbä yisno mesedyosni t’akan teƛno.
\m kid-a y-is-n mesed-s-ni t’akan teƛ-n
\g girl-ERG II-take-PFV.CVB gold-GEN1-DEF glass give-PST.UNW
\l The girl took the golden glass and gave it to him.

\t Žałäy t’umin boqno, kidbägon akin raɣˤin begirno.
\m uži-łay t’umi-n b-oq-n kid-a-gon aki-n r-ˤaɣˤi-n b-egir-n
\g boy-CONT.ABL pigeon-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB girl-ERG-CNTR window-TOP IV-open-PFV.CVB III-let-PST.UNW
\l The boy became a pigeon again, and the girl opened the window and let it out.

\t Neł t’umä ža t’akan yižin xaneł purłäzan eqerno, elaygon bitor hawaƛ’ žedu biħada bik’ixozo xanzo akixor bik’in.
\m neła t’umi-a ža t’akan y-iži-n xan-ł pu-łaza-n eqer-n ele-ay-gon bitor hawa-ƛ’ žedu b-iħad-a b-ik’i-xozo xan-z aki-xor b-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL pigeon-ERG DEM1.SG glass II-carry-PFV.CVB khan-CONT.ESS side-CONT.VERS.DIST-TOP put-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither air-SUPER.ESS DEM1.IPL III-fight-INF III-go-PRS.PRT.OBL khan-GEN2 window-AD.LAT III-go-PST.UNW
\l The pigeon carried this glass, put it next to the king and from there flew to the king's window, from which they went out to fight.

\t Elor baynosi, č’ikin boqno c’aramäz begin iduɣorno bik’in, žedus xabarno teqerno bičin.
\m elo-r b-ay-nosi č’iki-n b-oq-n c’arama-az b-egi-n idu-ɣor-n b-ik’i-n žedu-s xabar-n teqer-n b-iči-n
\g there-LAT III-come-ANT.CVB flea-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB crack-IN.ESS.DIST III-go.into-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-GEN1 story-TOP listen.to-PFV.CVB III-be-PST.UNW
\l When it arrived there, it became a flea, went inside through a crack and listened to what they said.

\t Bara xanqor hoboy eluƛ’or oz nexxowaƛin eƛinosi, nesä eƛin, nexłin žedur huni räynč’i.
\m baru-a xan-qor hoboy elu-ƛ’or oz nex-x-a-ƛin eƛi-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n nex-łin žedu-r huni r-iy-č’i
\g wife-ERG khan-POSS.LAT now we(I).OBL-SUPER.LAT army come-PRS-Q-QUOT say-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW come-CNC.CVB DEM1.IPL-LAT way IV-know-NEG.FUT
\l When the kings wife asked the king: "Is the army coming towards us now?", he said: "Although they will come, they won't know the way.

\t Huni yoł ganƛ’on zown uži näxzaz regin.
\m huni yoł gani-ƛ’-n zow-n uži nex-zaz r-egi-n
\g way be bull.calf-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB boy come-LOC.ORIG IV-go.into-PFV.CVB
\l The way is going where the boy on the bull came from.

\t Hunin resun žedu nexłin, sadaq mesed gogaƛ’orno boɣno čuret’no bok’no nełas di nˤoƛu yadi.
\m huni-n r-esu-n žedu nex-łin sadaq mesed goga-ƛ’or-n b-oɣ-n čuret’-n b-ok’-n neła-s di nˤoƛu y-odi
\g way-TOP IV-find-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL come-CNC.CVB all gold meadow-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB whip-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 me ashes II-do
\l And even if they come, when they find the way, I will take away all the gold onto a meadow and with the beat of my whip, I'll transform it into ashes.

\t Xizyogon kidbezno, debezno, däzno čuret’no bok’no, ħolaq’awt’a ʕomoybin rodin, ža čuret’ nˤoƛał buqˤan łärnokin bäsunč’iza.
\m xizyogon kid-z-n mi-z-n di-z-n čuret’-n b-ok’-n ħalaq’aw-t’a ʕomoy-bi-n r-odi-n ža čuret’ nˤoƛu-ł b-uqˤi-an ła-r-n-kin b-esu-č’i-za
\g then daughter-GEN2-TOP you-GEN2-and me-GEN2-and whip-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB thin-DISTR donkey-PL-TOP III.PL-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG whip ashes-CONT.ESS III-hide-FUT.DEF who.OBL-LAT-TOP-even III-find-NEG.FUT-LCV.CVB
\l Then with the beats of our daughter's, your and my whip, we will turn into thin donkeys and hide the whip in the ashes where no one can find it.

\t Žeduq bexurno xabar łiynosi, c’aramałäz begin ža č’iki maħorno boqno, t’umƛ’orno butin boržizin boqno bik’in.
\m žedu-q b-exur-n xabar łiy-nosi c’arama-łaz b-egi-n ža č’iki maħor-n b-oq-n t’umi-ƛ’or-n b-uti-n boržizi-n b-oq-n b-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IPL-POSS.ESS I.PL-kill-PFV.CVB story end-ANT.CVB crack-CONT.ESS.DIST III-go.into-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG flea outside-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB pigeon-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-turn-PFV.CVB fly-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.UNW
\l After they finished talking, the flea went outside through a crack, turned into a pigeon again and flew away.

\t Gogaƛ’or baynosi, užiƛ’orno butin, ik’in ozyode sadaq kecno ičin.
\m goga-ƛ’or b-ay-nosi uži-ƛ’or-n b-uti-n ik’i-n oz-de sadaq kec-n iči-n
\g meadow-SUPER.LAT III-come-ANT.CVB boy-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-turn-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB army-APUD.ESS together sleep-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l When it arrived at the meadow, it became the boy again and went to sleep next to the army.

\t Xanes wazir č’ariłno puħo t’akan yukaynosi, nesis cim bizin, łu yedu mesedyos t’akan t’or yayrnoƛin.
\m xan-s wazir č’arił-n puħo t’akan y-ukad-nosi nesi-s cim b-izi-n łu yedu mesed-s t’akan t’o-r y-ayr-n-ƛin
\g khan-GEN1 vizier wake.up-PFV.CVB next.to glass II-see-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 malice III-get.up-PFV.CVB who.ERG DEM2.IISG gold-GEN1 glass here-LAT II-bring-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l When the king's vizier woke up and saw the glass at his side, he became angry[ and asked]: "Who brought this golden glass here?"

\t Elayn izin t’akanno yisno, et’un guluƛ’orno k’oƛin, elar bižin, t’ar bižin bigza ħalał žan akik’no, xizyo yižin xande t’akanno eqerno.
\m ele-ay-n izi-n t’akan-n y-is-n et’u-n gulu-ƛ’or-n k’oƛi-n ele-ar b-iži-n t’ar b-iži-n b-ig-za ħalał ža-n akik’-n xizyo y-iži-n xan-de t’akan-n eqer-n
\g here-IN.ABL-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB glass-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.LAT-TOP jump-PFV.CVB there-IN.LAT III-lead-PFV.CVB thither III-lead-PFV.CVB III-very-ZA with.difficulties DEM1.SG-TOP tire-PFV.CVB afterwards II-carry-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.ESS glass-TOP put-PST.UNW
\l He got up from there, took the glass and jumped onto a horse, lead it here and there, which tired him quite much, and then he carried the glass back and put it next to the king.

\t Moƛaxay izinosi, xan ħayran oqno ƛexun puħo t’akan yukaynosi.
\m moƛu-xay izi-nosi xan ħayran oq-n ƛexu-n puħo t’akan y-ukad-nosi
\g sleep-AD.ABL get-ANT.CVB khan be.astonished become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW next.to glass II-see-ANT.CVB
\l When the king got up from sleeping, he was surprised when he saw the glass at his side.

\t Žeduq neł gogaƛ’or baynč’ey łˤono bucin, łˤono ɣudin, łˤono saʕatno rik’äsi zown.
\m žedu-q neła goga-ƛ’or b-ay-č’ey łˤono buci-n łˤono ɣudi-n łˤono saʕat-n r-ik’i-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL-POSS.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL meadow-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-NEG.PST.CVB three month-and three day-and three hour-and III.PL-go-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They didn't come to that meadow for three months, three days and three hours.

\t Yedu t’akan łu t’or yayräƛin nesä bayan bisnosi, oƛixno k’oƛin nesistow wazirä di yowsƛin eƛin.
\m yedu t’akan łu t’o-r y-ayr-a-ƛin nesi-a bayan b-is-nosi oƛix-n k’oƛi-n nesi-s-tow wazir-a di y-ow-s-ƛin eƛi-n
\g DEM2.IISG glass who.ERG here-LAT II-bring-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG information III-take-ANT.CVB appear-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH vizier-ERG me II-bring-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l When he wanted to know: "Who brought this glass here?", his vizier came running and said: "I brought it!"

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, utin nesiƛ’ar xan debex di kid yegira yoł, amma ža t’akan mi yayrno yesunč’inäy, debi di meč’ beč’a yołƛin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin uti-n nesi-ƛ’ar xan mi-x di kid y-egir-a yoł amma ža t’akan mi y-ayr-n y-esu-č’i-näy mi-s di meč’ b-eč’-a yoł-ƛin
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS khan you-AD.ESS me daughter II-send-INF be but DEM1.SG glass you II-bring-PFV.CVB II-exist-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB you-GEN1 me neck III-cut-INF be-QUOT
\l "If that's the case", the king turned to him, "I will marry my daughter off to you, but if it's not the case that you brought the glass, I will cut off your head."

\t Sasaq bizinosi, ža uži ganƛ’on zown hunix oqno.
\m sasaq b-izi-nosi ža uži gani-ƛ’-n zow-n huni-x oq-n
\g in.the.morning III-get.up-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG boy bull.calf-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l The next morning, when he got up, the boy got on his way riding on the bull.

\t Wazirzagon ozno boɣno nesił xizay bik’anƛin.
\m wazir-bi-a-gon oz-n b-oɣ-n nesi-ł xizay b-ik’i-an-ƛin
\g vizier-PL-ERG-CNTR army-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind I.PL-go-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The viziers led the army out and went to follow him.

\t Kidbezno, baruzno, nesizno bok’nosigon, žedułäy ħalaq’awt’a ʕomoybi roqno.
\m kid-z-n baru-z-n nesi-z-n b-ok’-nosi-gon žedu-łay ħalaq’aw-t’a ʕomoy-bi r-oq-n
\g daughter-GEN2-TOP wife-GEN2-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2-and III-beat-ANT.CVB-CNTR DEM1.IPL-CONT.ABL thin-DISTR donkey-PL III.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l And after cracking also [for?] his daughter, his wife and himself, they became thin donkeys.

\t Ža čuret’no nˤoƛał buqˤno.
\m ža čuret’-n nˤoƛu-ł b-uqˤi-n
\g DEM1.SG whip-TOP ashes-CONT.ESS III-hide-PST.UNW
\l The whip he hid in the ashes.

\t Elor bayrun xanes oz partalq’ay butiranił c’oxno.
\m elo-r b-ay-run xan-s oz partal-q’ay b-utir-ani-ł c’ox-n
\g there-LAT III-come-IMM.ANT.CVB khan-GEN1 army belongings-EQU2 III-turn-MSD-CONT.ESS meet-PST.UNW
\l When the king's army arrived there, they started gathering the belongings.

\t Nesi užä yołi nˤoƛas ixinabi ric’no, ʕomoyƛ’no erno hunix oqno, dicegon žedu, ža nˤoƛugon łinar yižixƛin, nesiqor baƛ’ix bičiłin.
\m nesi uži-a yołi nˤoƛu-s ixin-bi r-ic’-n ʕomoy-ƛ’-n er-n huni-x oq-n dice-gon žedu ža nˤoƛu-gon łinar y-iži-x-ƛin nesi-qor b-aƛ’i-x b-iči-łin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG however ashes-GEN1 bag-PL IV.PL-fill-PFV.CVB donkey-SUPER.ESS-TOP put-PFV.CVB way-AD.ESS become-PFV.CVB how.much-CNTR DEM1.IPL DEM1.SG ashes-CNTR why II-carry-PRS-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT I.PL-scold-IPFV.CVB I.PL-be-CNC.CVB
\l The boy however filled his bags with ashes, put them onto the donkey and went on his way, although they were scolding him much: "Why are you carrying these ashes?!"

\t Elogon xanä wazirbin butirno, sosigon łu yedu dey mesedyosni t’akan yayräƛin esirnosi, oƛixno hemesitow wazirä eƛin, di yayrinč’a žaƛin.
\m elo-gon xan-a wazir-bi-n b-utir-n sosi-gon łu yedu di-s mesed-s-ni t’akan y-ayr-a-ƛin esir-nosi oƛix-n hemesi-tow wazir-a eƛi-n di y-ayr-č’u-a ža-ƛin
\g there-CNTR khan-ERG vizier-PL-TOP I.PL-gather-PFV.CVB again-CNTR who.ERG DEM2.IISG me-GEN1 gold-GEN1-DEF glass II-bring-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB appear-PFV.CVB DEM4.ISG.OBL-EMPH vizier-ERG say-PFV.CVB me II-bring-NEG.PST.WIT-Q DEM1.SG-QUOT
\l There, the king gathered his viziers, and when he asked: "Who again brought this golden glass of mine?", that vizier appeared and said: "Haven't I brought it?"

\t Xizyo xanä kidbeq esirnosi, t’akanyoł xizay howda wazir idur ayäƛin, ža wazir aynč’u, enda aysƛin, ganƛ’o zowali uži ukarno.
\m xizyo xan-a kid-q esir-nosi t’akan-ł xizay howda wazir idu-r ay-a-ƛin ža wazir ay-č’u enda ay-s-ƛin gani-ƛ’ zow-ali uži ukar-n
\g afterwards khan-ERG daughter-POSS.ESS ask-ANT.CVB glass-CONT.ESS behind DEM3.SG vizier home-LAT come-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT DEM1.SG vizier come-NEG.PST.WIT DEM3b.SG come-PST.WIT-QUOT bull.calf-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-ATTR boy show-PST.UNW
\l Then, when the king asked his daughter: "Did this vizier come home for the glass?", [she said:] "This vizier didn't come, he came!" and showed him the boy on the bull calf.

\t Neła t’umiqay bˤaƛ’uru ħuli babiwz k’ukyoł boqun, miƛ’iłäy räšruni mesedyosnigon his ħamarno čˤaƛin esirno, baba, req’ezi roqxaƛin.
\m neła t’umi-qay b-ˤaƛ’u-ru ħuli babiw-z k’uk-ł b-oqu-n miƛ’i-łay r-eš-ru-ni mesed-s-ni-gon his ħam-ar-n čˤaƛi-n esir-n baba req’ezi r-oq-x-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL pigeon-POSS.ABL III-fall-PST.PRT feather father-GEN2 cap-CONT.ESS III-stick-PFV.CVB ram-CONT.ABL IV-fall-PST.PRT-DEF gold-GEN1-DEF-CNTR spring.wool chest-IN.LAT-TOP throw-PFV.CVB ask-PFV.CVB daddy approach IV-become-PRS-Q-QUOT
\l She put the feather that fell from that pigeon onto her father's hat, and threw the golden whool that fell from the ram onto the chest and asked: "Daddy, does it fit?"

\t C’aq’ req’ezi roqxo, dey kidƛin, babiyan žawab teƛno.
\m c’aq’ req’ezi r-oq-x di-s kid-ƛin babiw-a-n žawab teƛ-n
\g much approach IV-become-PRS me-GEN1 daughter-QUOT father-ERG-TOP answer give-PST.UNW
\l "It fits very well, my daughter", answered the father.

\t Xanä wazires meč’no beč’no, t’akan nesiqor yayäruni žax, ixiw bertenno bodin, kidno yegirno.
\m xan-a wazir-s meč’-n b-eč’-n t’akan nesi-qor y-ayr-ru-ni uži-x ixiw berten-n b-odi-n kid-n y-egir-n
\g khan-ERG vizier-GEN1 neck-TOP III-cut-PFV.CVB glass DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT II-bring-PST.PRT-DEF boy-AD.ESS big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB daughter-TOP II-send-PST.UNW
\l The king cut off the vizier's head, arranged a big wedding and gave his daughter to the boy who brought him his glass.

\t Däzoq’aw ɣˤutkun rodoƛin, xanä eƛin kidbez xedyoqor, maday madargon mesedyos ƛen eroƛin.
\m di-zo-q’aw ɣˤutku-n r-odi-o-ƛin xan-a eƛi-n kid-z xediw-qor ma-day ma-dar-gon mesed-s ƛe-n er-o-ƛin
\g me-ATTR.OBL-EQU2 house-TOP IV-do-IMPR-QUOT khan-ERG say-PFV.CVB daughter-GEN2 husband-POSS.LAT door-APUD.ABL door-APUD.VERS-CNTR gold-GEN1 bridge-TOP put-IMPR-QUOT
\l "Build a house like mine", said the king to his daughter's husband, "and construct a golden bridge from door to door!"

\t Sasaqtow moƛaxay izizaƛ’or, nesä äƛiruxor rodäsi reže ɣˤutkun, nesiz maday kidbez madär kuräsi mesedyos ƛen bukayzaƛ’, xan haqan ogun ezun ƛexun.
\m sasaq-tow moƛu-xay izi-zaƛ’or nesi-a äƛiru-xor r-odi-asi r-eže ɣˤutku-n nesi-z ma-day kid-z ma-dar kur-asi mesed-s ƛe-n b-ukad-zaƛ’ xan haqu-a-n ogu-n ezu-n ƛexu-n
\g in.the.morning-EMPH sleep-AD.ABL get.up-POST.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG ORD-AD.LAT IV-do-RES.PRT IV-big house-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 door-APUD.ABL daughter-GEN2 door-APUD.VERS erect-RES.PRT gold-GEN1 bridge-TOP III-see-CSL.CVB khan mouth-IN.ESS-TOP gape-PFV.CVB look-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l The next morning after getting up from sleeping, he built a big house as said, and when the king saw the golden bridge erected from his door to his daughter's door, he remained looking at it with an open mouth.

\t Mesedyoztow ƛäƛ’ kidbedäɣorgon ik’inosi, elo mesedyos ric’äsi istowli resun.
\m mesed-z-tow ƛe-ƛ’ kid-däɣor-gon ik’i-nosi elo mesed-s r-ic’-asi istowli r-esu-n
\g gold-GEN2-EMPH bridge-SUPER.ESS daughter-APUD.VERS-CNTR go-ANT.CVB there gold-GEN1 IV-fill-RES.PRT table IV-find-PST.UNW
\l When he went over the golden bridge to his daughter, he found a table filled with gold there.

\t Ik’in yisä reƛ’a atinosi, mesed nˤoƛaƛ’or butin.
\m ik’i-n yisi-a reƛ’a iti-nosi mesed nˤoƛu-ƛ’or b-uti-n
\g go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG hand touch-ANT.CVB gold ashes-SUPER.LAT III-turn-PST.UNW
\l When he went and touched it with his hand, the gold turned into ashes.

\t Xizorgon roɣnosi, yałru mesed boqno.
\m xizor-gon r-oɣ-nosi yoł-ru mesed b-oq-n
\g back-CNTR IV-take.away-ANT.CVB be-PST.PRT gold III-become-PST.UNW
\l When he took it back, it turned back into the gold that it was.

\t Žeduq ža moƛugon esis yołi, di yałruxor ƛexa zowsƛin.
\m žedu-q ža moƛu-gon esi-s yołi di yoł-ru-xor ƛexu-a zow-s-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG dream-CNTR tell-PST.WIT indeed me be-PST.PRT-AD.LAT remain-INF be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Had I told them this dream instead, I would have remained what I was.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder eniwn, babiwn žade paraxat bercinłiƛ’ xanzo ʕaƛa ʕumru bodix bičin.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder eniw-n babiw-n uži-de paraxat bercinłi-ƛ’ xan-z ʕaƛ-a ʕumru b-odi-x b-iči-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after mother-and father-and son-APUD.ESS calmly beauty-SUPER.ESS khan-GEN2 village-IN.ESS life III-do-IPFV.CVB III-be-PST.UNW
\l After that, the mother and the father lived beautifully and calmly in the village of the king, next to their son.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that end's well.

\t Esin šebi, xecin šebi sis zown q’ˤano halmaɣ.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi sis zow-n q’ˤano halmaɣ
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what one be.NPRS-PST.UNW two friend
\l Once upon a time there were two friends.

\t Žedułäy sis zown igu, sis zown žuka.
\m žedu-łay sis zow-n igu sis zow-n žuka
\g DEM1.IPL-CONT.ABL one be.NPRS-PFV.CVB good one be.NPRS-PST.UNW bad
\l One of them was good, one of them was bad.

\t Sida quł žedu sadaq hunix bik’a keze boqno.
\m sida qu-ł žedu sadaq huni-x b-ik’i-a keze b-oq-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.IPL together way-AD.ESS I.PL-go-INF meet I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l One day they happened to go somewhere together.

\t Hunix mekʷa c’oxnosi, žeda sosi iguni halmaɣes bišʷa rac’no łiyrno.
\m huni-x meko c’ox-nosi žedu-a sosi igu-ni halmaɣ-s bišʷa r-ac’-n łiyr-n
\g way-AD.ESS hunger meet-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL-ERG at.first good-DEF friend-GEN1 food IV-eat-PFV.CVB finish-PST.UNW
\l When they became hungry on their way, the first ate up the good friend's food.

\t Xizyo iguni halmaɣƛ’o mekʷan c’oxno, žukaniq bišʷan esirno, sosigon bišno žedu.
\m xizyo igu-ni halmaɣ-ƛ’ meko-n c’ox-n žuk-ani-q bišʷa-n esir-n sosi-gon b-iš-n žedu
\g afterwards good-DEF friend-SUPER.ESS hunger-TOP meet-PFV.CVB worse-MSD-POSS.ESS food-TOP ask-PFV.CVB at.first-CNTR I.PL-eat-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL
\l Afterwards, the good friend got hungry and asked the bad one for food, and they ate first.

\t K’ox äƛirugon mekoyn iguni halmaɣä biša esirnosi, nesä inkar boyn, deber di sosi neƛinč’aƛin.
\m k’ox äƛiru-gon mekod-n igu-ni halmaɣ-a bišʷa esir-nosi nesi-a inkar b-odi-n mi-r di sosi neƛ-č’u-a-ƛin
\g twice ORD-CNTR be.hungry-PFV.CVB good-DEF friend-ERG food ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG rejection III-do-PST.UNW you-LAT me at.first give-NEG.PST.WIT-Q-QUOT
\l When the good friend was hungry for the second time, he asked for food, but he [the other one] rejected: "Didn't I give you something first?"

\t Xizyogon žukani halmaɣä eƛin, deber bišʷa retinäy, roɣno mi där sis ozuri neƛƛin.
\m xizyogon žuk-ani halmaɣ-a eƛi-n mi-r bišʷa r-eti-näy r-oɣ-n mi di-r sis ozuri neƛ-ƛin
\g then worse-MSD friend-ERG say-PST.UNW you-LAT food IV-want-CND.CVB IV-take.away-PFV.CVB you me-LAT one eye give-QUOT
\l Then the bad friend said: "If you want food, take one eye out and give it to me!"

\t Mekos nece ħal boqzaƛ’, roɣno ozuri teƛnosi dandi, žukani halmaɣä igunir rac’a biša teƛno.
\m meko-s nece ħal b-oq-zaƛ’ r-oɣ-n ozuri teƛ-nosi dandi žuk-ani halmaɣ-a igu-ni-r r-ac’-a bišʷa teƛ-n
\g hunger-GEN1 so.much strength III-become-CSL.CVB IV-take.away-PFV.CVB eye give-ANT.CVB now worse-MSD friend-ERG good-DEF-LAT IV-eat-INF food give-PST.UNW
\l Because the hunger's strength got so big, he took away his eye and gave it to him, and the bad friend gave the good one food to eat, right away.

\t Xizyogon mekʷa c’oxno iguni halmaɣä žukaniq bišʷa esirnosi, q’ˤano äƛirugon ozuri roɣno nesir teƛzaƛ’or išernoanu ža žukani halmaɣä.
\m xizyogon meko c’ox-n igu-ni halmaɣ-a žuk-ani-q bišʷa esir-nosi q’ˤano äƛiru-gon ozuri r-oɣ-n nesi-r teƛ-zaƛ’or iš-r-n-anu ža žuk-ani halmaɣ-a
\g again hunger meet-PFV.CVB good-DEF friend-ERG worse-MSD-POSS.ESS food ask-ANT.CVB two ORD-CNTR eye IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT give-POST.CVB eat-CAUS-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.SG worse-MSD friend-ERG
\l Again, the good friend became hungry and asked the bad one for food, and the bad friend didn't let him eat before he didn't take away his second eye and gave it to him.

\t Hemedur q’ˤunan ozurazaƛ’ayn ok’ek’no iguni halmaɣ žukanä, howlotow žan xecin oxin nesidäy.
\m hemedur q’ˤuna-n ozuri-bi-ƛ’ay-n ok’ek’-n igu-ni halmaɣ žuk-anu-a howlo-tow ža-n xeci-n oxi-n nesi-day
\g so two.OBL-TOP eye-PL-SUPER.ABL-TOP steal-PFV.CVB good-DEF friend worse-NEG-ERG there-EMPH DEM1.SG-TOP leave-PFV.CVB run.away-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ABL
\l So the bad one had stolen the two eyes from the the good friend, left him there and ran away from him.

\t Hudun ža ozzatawni žek’u harihun ƛaƛaƛix ik’in, sidaɣ aɣˤuxor keze oqno.
\m hudun ža ozuri-bi-taw-ni žek’u harihun ƛaƛaƛi-x ik’i-n sidaɣ aɣˤu-xor keze oq-n
\g nevertheless DEM1.SG eye-PL-without-DEF man slowly feel.up-IPFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB in.one.place mill-AD.LAT meet become-PST.UNW
\l Nevertheless, this eyeless man went slowly feeling up and got to a mill someplace.

\t Elor aynosi, mogolarno izin, kecno ičin.
\m elo-r ay-nosi mogolo-ar-n izi-n kec-n iči-n
\g there-LAT come-ANT.CVB granary-IN.LAT-TOP get-PFV.CVB sleep-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l Having arrived there, he got into the granary and went to sleep.

\t Hemeła qułtow mogolxo elo aɣˤuxor zeyn, zirun, boc’in rayn.
\m hemeła qu-ł-tow mogolo-x elo aɣˤu-xor zey-n ziru-n boc’i-n r-ay-n
\g then day-CONT.ESS-EMPH granary-AD.ESS there mill-AD.LAT bear-and fox-and wolf-and IV.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l The next day, a bear, a fox and a wolf came there to the mill at the granary.

\t Zeyä žedaqor eƛin, hemeł beženi ʕaƛa łi anuƛax.
\m zey-a žeda-qor eƛi-n hemeł b-eže-ni ʕaƛ-a łi anu-ƛax
\g bear-ERG DEM1.IIPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM4.IISG.OBL III-big-DEF village-IN.ESS water be.NEG-QUOT
\l The bear said to them: "It's said that there's no water in this big village.

\t Elo ʕaƛoł roƛƛo ixiw naħuz ɣuna teł łi yołƛax.
\m elo ʕaƛ-ł r-oƛƛo ixiw naħu-z ɣun-a teł łi yoł-ƛax
\g there village-CONT.ESS IV.PL-middle big oak-GEN2 tree-IN.ESS inside water be-QUOT
\l There's supposed to be water inside a big oak in the middle of the village.

\t Elay ža maħor łi roƛäk’rur, žamaʕatyo ʕaƛos boƛƛik’u ric’q’i neƛxoƛax.
\m ele-ay ža maħor łi r-oƛik’-ru-r žamaʕat-a ʕaƛ-s b-oƛƛik’u ric’q’i neƛ-x-ƛax
\g there-IN.ABL DEM1.SG outside water IV-pull.out-PST.PRT-LAT assembly-ERG village-GEN1 III-half wealth give-PRS-QUOT
\l They say that the assembly of the village would give half their wealth in order to get the water out there.

\t Žaƛa šebiƛin, boc’ä eƛin, pulanaw xan untizi oqäsiƛax.
\m ža-ƛa šebi-ƛin boc’i-a eƛi-n pulanaw xan untizi oq-asi-ƛax
\g DEM1.SG-INDEF what-QUOT wolf-ERG say-PFV.CVB a.certain khan be.sick become-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l How's that?", and the wolf said: "It's said that some king became sick."

\t Nesiztow bˤeƛ’eł yałru biƛurox aluk’ani bˤeƛ’q’ˤus reƛ rac’näy, ža xan saɣ oqxosi yałrułin xalq’imor riyxanu.
\m nesi-z-tow bˤeƛ’-ł yoł-ru biƛu-x aluk’a-ni bˤeƛ’q’ˤu-s reƛ r-ac’-näy ža xan saɣ oq-xosi yoł-ru-łi-n xalq’i-r r-iy-x-anu
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2-EMPH sheep-CONT.ESS be-PST.PRT belly-AD.ESS white-DEF sheep-GEN1 meat IV-eat-CND.CVB DEM1.SG khan cure become-PRS.PRT be-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and people-LAT IV-know-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l When he eats the meat of a sheep from his flock, which is white on its belly, this king will be healed; but the people don't know this.

\t Łemu boƛƛik’u ric’q’i xanqayn bäqiƛin.
\m łemu b-oƛƛik’u ric’q’i xan-qay-n b-iqi-ƛin
\g otherwise III-half wealth khan-POSS.ABL-TOP III-get-QUOT
\l Otherwise, get half of the wealth from the king!"

\t Žagon šebiƛin, zira eƛin.
\m ža-gon šebi-ƛin ziru-a eƛi-n
\g DEM1.SG-CNTR what-QUOT fox-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "How's that?", said the fox.

\t Sisgon xalq’imor riyxanusi šebin, łiłiroƛ’ ƛ’iri sis ažo yoł.
\m sis-gon xalq’i-r r-iy-xanusi šebin łiłiro-ƛ’ ƛ’iri sis ažo yoł
\g one-CNTR people-LAT IV-know-NEG.PRS.PRT thing ditch-SUPER.ESS above one tree be
\l "One thing that the people don't know is that there's a tree above the ditch.

\t Nełaq yoqäsi q’ˤano ƛˤeb yoł.
\m neła-q y-oq-asi q’ˤano ƛˤeb yoł
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS II-become-RES.PRT two leaf be
\l There are two leaves growing on it.

\t Becawni žek’a ža ozzaq yiħinäy, neła kanłi bayrxoƛax.
\m becaw-ni žek’u-a ža ozuri-bi-q y-iħi-näy neła-a kanłi b-ayr-x-ƛax
\g blind-DEF man-ERG DEM1.SG eye-PL-POSS.ESS II-smear-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG light III-bring-PRS-QUOT
\l If the blind man smears them onto his eyes, it brings back his eyesight.

\t Žeda bexurxozo xabaryoqor aħyan kurno aɣˤuz mogola tełerno oqno ozatawni žek’un ičäsi zown.
\m žedu-a b-exur-xozo xabar-qor aħya-n kur-n aɣˤu-z mogolo-a tełer-n oq-n ozuri-taw-ni žek’u-n iči-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL-ERG III-kill-PRS.PRT.OBL story-POSS.LAT ear-TOP spread.out-PFV.CVB mill-GEN2 granary-IN.ESS into-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB eye-without-DEF man-TOP wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After they finished talking(?), the blind man perked up his ears, got into the mill's granary and waited.

\t Zeyn, zirun, boc’in elo sasaqorno ričin, qˤašiƛ’aɣor roqno rik’in.
\m zey-n ziru-n boc’i-n elo sasaq-qor-n r-iči-n qˤaši-ƛ’aɣor r-oq-n r-ik’i-n
\g bear-and fox-and wolf-and there in.the.morning-POSS.LAT-TOP III.PL-wait-PFV.CVB dawn-SUPER.VERS III.PL-become-PFV.CVB III.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l The bear, the fox and the wolf waited there until the morning and when it got dawn, they went away.

\t Qˤašinosi ža žek’u izin mogolay q’ˤidarno oqno, harihun łiłiroxsi łiłiroxno ik’in, zira äƛiruni ɣun resurno.
\m qˤaši-nosi ža žek’u izi-n mogolo-ay q’ˤida-r-n oq-n harihun łiłiro-x-si łiłiro-x-n ik’i-n ziru-a eƛi-ru-ni ɣun r-esur-n
\g dawn-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG man get.up-PFV.CVB granary-IN.ABL down-LAT-and become-PFV.CVB slowly ditch-AD.ESS-ATTR ditch-AD.ESS-TOP go-PFV.CVB fox-ERG say-PST.PRT-DEF tree IV-find-PST.UNW
\l When it dawned, the man got up and down from the granary, and slowly went to the ditch's ditch(?) and found the tree the fox has talked about

\t Nełaqno izin reƛ’iqor yiqi yäqiru ƛˤeb ozqo yiħixt’a kurxo zown.
\m neła-q-n izi-n reƛ’a-qor y-iqi y-iqi-ru ƛˤeb ozuri-q y-iħi-x-t’a kur-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB hand-POSS.LAT II-get II-get-PST.PRT leaf eye-POSS.ESS II-smear-IPFV.CVB-DISTR throw-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He reached up with his hand and smeared a plucked leaf onto an eye, and threw it away.

\t Zamanałäy yisiq ozzałer kanłi bayrxosi ƛˤeb yiqin.
\m zaman-łay yisi-q ozuri-bi-łer kanłi b-ayr-xosi ƛˤeb y-iqi-n
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS eye-PL-CONT.LAT light III-bring-PRS.PRT leaf II-get-PST.UNW
\l After a while, he picked up a leaf that brought back his eyesight to his eyes again.

\t Sisgon ƛˤeb yet’urno yiħinosi, hoq’ˤonigon ozłer kanłi bayn.
\m sis-gon ƛˤeb y-et’ur-n y-iħi-nosi hoq’ˤo-ni-gon ozuri-łer kanłi b-ay-n
\g one-CNTR leaf II-pull.out-PFV.CVB II-smear-ANT.CVB other-DEF-CNTR eye-CONT.LAT light III-come-PST.UNW
\l He pulled out a single leaf and after smearing it [onto his eye], the other eye got its eyesight back.

\t Q’ˤunan ozzar rukaynosi, aɣˤuxay bitor hunix oqno yeda zeyä äƛiruni hemeł ʕaƛaɣor.
\m q’ˤuna-n ozuri-bi-r r-ukad-nosi aɣˤu-xay bitor huni-x oq-n yeda zey-a eƛi-ru-ni hemeł ʕaƛ-aɣor
\g two.OBL-TOP eye-PL-LAT IV-see-ANT.CVB mill-AD.ABL thither way-AD.ESS become-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG bear-ERG say-PST.PRT-DEF DEM4.IISG.OBL village-IN.VERS
\l When both of his eyes saw again, he got on his way away from the mill to the village that the bear had talked about.

\t Elo yisä godek’anya q’ˤida bäčiru ʕoloqzaq łi esirnosi, sidä izin zok’är aqˤun kučin teƛƛ’oräy, nesä eƛin, eleley, yedu šebi šebin, insanä aqˤuyä łäz meča ħaƛuƛin, nediw šebin behizi raqinč’iƛin.
\m elo yisi-a godek’an-a q’ˤida b-iči-ru ʕoloq-bi-q łi esir-nosi sida-a izi-n zok’i-ar aqˤu-n kuči-n teƛ-ƛ’oräy nesi-a eƛi-n eleley yedu šebi šebin insan-a aqˤu-a łi-z meča ħaƛu-ƛin nediw šebin behizi r-oq-č’i-ƛin
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG village.square-IN.ESS down III-sit-PST.PRT young.person-PL-POSS.ESS water ask-ANT.CVB one.OBL-ERG get.up-PFV.CVB mug-IN.LAT urine-TOP defecate-TOP give-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW behold DEM2.IISG what thing human-ERG urine-Q water-GEN2 instead.of drink-QUOT such thing permit IV-become-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l There he asked a young person who sat at the village square for water, and one got up, pissed into a mug and gave it to him and he said: "Behold, what is this? A human is not allowed such a thing as to drink urine instead of water!"

\t Hudu ela šebi rodan, t’o ʕaƛa t’ok’ow łin roqinč’inäy, elurno bac’adaw kikes łi räti riqinäyƛin, eƛin nesi žek’uqor žamaʕatyoz ʕoloqza.
\m hudu elu-a šebi r-odi-an t’o ʕaƛ-a t’ok’ow łi-n r-oq-č’i-näy elu-r-n bac’adaw kik-s łi r-eti r-iqi-näy-ƛin eƛi-n nesi žek’u-qor žamaʕat-z ʕoloq-bi-a
\g so we(I).OBL-ERG what IV-do-FUT.DEF here village-IN.ESS anymore water-TOP IV-happen-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB we(I).OBL-LAT-TOP clean spring-GEN1 water IV-want IV-get-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL man-POSS.LAT assembly-GEN2 young.person-PL-ERG
\l "So what shall we do? If there's no more water in the village here, we want water from a clean spring if we could get it.", said the young person to this man.

\t Xizyo nesä žeduqor eƛin, howt’o ʕaƛa di łi roƛik’näy, šebi meža där baha boyxƛin.
\m xizyo nesi-a žedu-qor eƛi-n howt’o ʕaƛ-a di łi r-oƛik’-näy šebi mežu-a di-r baha b-odi-x-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW here village-IN.ESS me water IV-pull.out-CND.CVB what you(I).PL.OBL-ERG me-LAT price III-do-PRS-QUOT
\l Afterwards he said to them: "If I pull out water here in the village, what price do you pay me?"

\t Žeda eƛin, ʕaƛos boƛik’u ric’q’i neƛa yołƛin.
\m žedu-a eƛi-n ʕaƛ-s boƛik’u ric’q’i neƛ-a yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL-ERG say-PST.UNW village-GEN1 half wealth give-INF be-QUOT
\l They said: "We will give [you] half the wealth of the village!"

\t Bik’i däqor ʕo risoƛin, eƛin nesi žek’a.
\m b-ik’i di-qor ʕo r-is-o-ƛin eƛi-n nesi žek’u-a
\g I.PL-go me-POSS.LAT ax IV-take-IMPR-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG
\l "Go and get me an ax!", said the man.

\t Elaygon bitor ža boc’ä äƛiruni untarawni xander ik’in.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor ža boc’i-a eƛi-ru-ni untaraw-ni xan-der ik’i-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither DEM1.SG wolf-ERG say-PST.PRT-DEF sick-DEF khan-APUD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l From there, he went away to the sick king that the wolf had told about.

\t Nesider aynosi yisi žek’a esirno nesiq, ha xan, šida kecno ičäsi mi, šebi roqno deberƛin.
\m nesi-der ay-nosi yisi žek’u-a esir-n nesi-q ha xan šida kec-n iči-asi mi šebi r-oq-n mi-r-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL man-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS well khan why sleep-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT you what IV-happen-PST.UNW you-LAT-QUOT
\l When the man arrived at his place, he asked him: "Hey king, why do you sleep, what happened to you?"

\t Roƛxo deyƛin, eƛin xanä.
\m r-oƛ-x di-s-ƛin eƛi-n xan-a
\g IV.PL-be.sick-IPFV.CVB me-GEN1-QUOT say-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l "My ___ is sick", said the king.
