\t Di saɣ oynäyƛin, eƛin nesi iguni žek’a, šebi baha mi där boyxƛin.
\m di saɣ odi-näy-ƛin eƛi-n nesi igu-ni žek’u-a šebi baha mi di-r b-odi-x-ƛin
\g me cure do-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL good-DEF man-ERG what price you me-LAT III-do-PRS-QUOT
\l "When I cure you," said the good man, "what price do you give me?"

\t Xanä urɣizikin oqxo ičinč’ey nesir žawab teƛno, boƛƛik’u dey ric’q’i neƛa yoł deberƛin.
\m xan-a urɣizi-kin oq-x iči-č’ey nesi-r žawab teƛ-n b-oƛƛik’u di-s ric’q’i neƛ-a yoł mi-r-ƛin
\g khan-ERG thinking-even become-IPFV.CVB be-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT answer give-PFV.CVB III-half me-GEN1 wealth give-INF be you-LAT-QUOT
\l The king wasn't thinking and answered him: "I will give you half of my wealth!"

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, eƛin nesi žek’a, sis žek’u egir debez bˤeƛ’łäy biƛurox aluk’ani bˤeƛ’q’ˤu bowanix.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin eƛi-n nesi žek’u-a sis žek’u egir mi-z bˤeƛ’-łay biƛu-x aluk’a-ni bˤeƛ’q’ˤu b-ow-ani-x
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG one man send you-GEN2 sheep-CONT.ABL belly-AD.ESS white-DEF sheep III-bring-MSD-AD.ESS
\l "If that's the case," said the man, "send a man to bring the sheep from your flock which is white on the belly!"

\t Ħonƛ’ay ža bˤeƛ’q’ˤun bayrno, bexʷayn nełas reƛ xanqo rac’ernosi, ža saɣ oqno.
\m ħon-ƛ’ay ža bˤeƛ’q’ˤu-n b-ayr-n b-exʷad-n neła-s reƛ xan-q r-ac’-r-nosi ža saɣ oq-n
\g mountain-SUPER.ABL DEM1.SG sheep-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB III-slaughter-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 meat khan-POSS.ESS IV-eat-CAUS-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG cure become-PST.UNW
\l That sheep was brought from the mountain, slaughtered and when he let the king eat its meat, he got cured.

\t Xande idur aynosi, nesir elo teł cemä ozzataw kid yukaynosi, iguni žek’a esirno, di nełaz ozzałer kanłi bayrnäy, šebi mi där baha neƛxoƛin.
\m xan-de idu-r ay-nosi nesi-r elo teł cemi-a ozuri-bi-taw kid y-ukad-nosi igu-ni žek’u-a esir-n di neła-z ozuri-bi-łer kanłi b-ayr-näy šebi mi di-r baha neƛ-x-ƛin
\g khan-APUD.ESS home-LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT there inside corner-IN.ESS eye-PL-without girl II-see-ANT.CVB good-DEF man-ERG ask-PST.UNW me DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 eye-PL-CONT.LAT light III-bring-CND.CVB what you me-LAT price give-PRS-QUOT
\l When he came to a house with the king and saw a blind girl in a corner inside there, the good man asked: "When I bring back her eyesight, what price do you give me?"

\t Yedu kid debex yegira yołƛin, eƛin xanä.
\m yedu kid mi-x y-egir-a yoł-ƛin eƛi-n xan-a
\g DEM2.IISG girl you-AD.ESS II-send-INF be-QUOT say-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l "I will marry her off to you", said the king.

\t Howlotow ičin nesi žek’a čantay yisno q’ˤanon ƛˤeb xanez kidbez ozzaq yiħinosi, q’ˤunantow ozzałer kanłi bayn.
\m howlo-tow iči-n nesi žek’u-a čanta-ay y-is-n q’ˤano-n ƛˤeb xan-z kid-z ozuri-bi-q y-iħi-nosi q’ˤuna-n-tow ozuri-bi-łer kanłi b-ay-n
\g there-EMPH sit-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG pocket-IN.ABL II-take-PFV.CVB two-TOP leaf khan-GEN2 daughter-GEN2 eye-PL-POSS.ESS II-smear-ANT.CVB two.OBL-TOP-EMPH eye-PL-CONT.LAT light III-come-PST.UNW
\l The man sat there, took two leaves out of his pocket and when he smeared it onto her eyes, the light came back to her two eyes.

\t Xanä nesix ixiw bertenno boyn kidno yegirno, boƛik’u nesis ric’q’in, ɣˤutkun, posun teƛno, howlotow xande puräza iguni žek’un ičin.
\m xan-a nesi-x ixiw berten-n b-odi-n kid-n y-egir-n boƛik’u nesi-s ric’q’i-n ɣˤutku-n posu-n teƛ-n howlo-tow xan-de pu-aza igu-ni žek’u-n iči-n
\g khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB daughter-TOP II-send-PFV.CVB half DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 wealth-and house-and cattle-and give-PFV.CVB there-EMPH khan-APUD.ESS side-IN.VERS.DIST good-DEF man-TOP be-PST.UNW
\l The king organized a big marriage and married off his daughter, gave half his wealth, his house and cattle to him and the good man was to the king's side.

\t Xizyo nesä tukamƛ’ozoni žek’uq esirno, mi ozurabin roɣno ƛexun zowali žek’u anaƛin.
\m xizyo nesi-a tukam-ƛ’-z-ni žek’u-q esir-n mi ozuri-bi-n r-oɣ-n ƛexu-n zow-ali žek’u anu-a-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG shop-SUPER.ESS-GEN2-DEF man-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW you eye-PL-TOP IV.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-ATTR man be.NEG-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Afterwards, he asked the man in the shop: "Weren't you the man whom I took the eyes away from?"

\t Yołƛin, žawab teƛno nesä esirnok’ur.
\m yoł-ƛin žawab teƛ-n nesi-a esirnok’u-r
\g be-QUOT answer give-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG beggar-LAT
\l "I am." he answered the beggar.

\t Ozurabin roɣno, aɣˤʷarno ik’in, mogolarno izin ičinäy, hemediw maʕišat neƛxoƛin.
\m ozuri-bi-n r-oɣ-n aɣˤu-ar-n ik’i-n mogolo-ar-n izi-n iči-näy hemediw maʕišat neƛ-x-ƛin
\g eye-PL-TOP IV.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB mill-IN.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB granary-IN.LAT-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB be-CND.CVB such.a fortune sell-PRS-QUOT
\l After you took my eyes, I went into a mill and when I got up into the granary, I was given such a fortune.

\t Howlaytow aɣˤʷarno ik’in, nesä nesis ozurabin roɣno, mogolarno izin ičin.
\m howlay-tow aɣˤu-ar-n ik’i-n nesi-a nesi-s ozuri-bi-n r-oɣ-n mogolo-ar-n izi-n iči-n
\g from.there-EMPH mill-IN.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 eye-PL-TOP IV.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB granary-IN.LAT-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l And so, from there he [the other guy] went into the mill, took his eyes out and got up into the granary.

\t Hudod elor zeyn, boc’in, zirun rayn.
\m hudod elo-r zey-n boc’i-n ziru-n r-ay-n
\g at.night there-LAT bear-and wolf-and fox-and III.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l At night, the bear, the wolf and the fox came there.

\t Elo žedas žedaƛ xabarno boqno zeyä eƛin, ħuł di eƛin zawruni ʕaƛa žaqˤuł łi roƛixnoƛin.
\m elo žeda-s žeda-ƛ xabar-n b-oq-n zey-a eƛi-n ħuł di eƛi-n zow-ru-ni ʕaƛ-a žaqˤuł łi r-oƛix-n-ƛin
\g there DEM1.IIPL.OBL-GEN1 DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUB.ESS story-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB bear-ERG say-PST.UNW yesterday me say-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF village-IN.ESS today water IV-appear-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l There, they spoke with each other and the bear said: "Yesterday there appeared water in the village I had told you about."

\t Wallaƛin, eƛin boc’ä, howža xanez bˤeƛ’eł zawru biƛurox aluk’ani bˤeƛ’q’ˤu yaqˤułer narƛa bok’ełnoƛin.
\m wallah-ƛin eƛi-n boc’i-a howža xan-z bˤeƛ’-ł zow-ru biƛu-x aluk’a-ni bˤeƛ’q’ˤu yaqˤuł-r nar-ƛa b-ok’eł-n-ƛin
\g wallah-QUOT say-PFV.CVB wolf-ERG DEM4.SG khan-GEN2 sheep-CONT.ESS be.NPRS-PST.PRT belly-AD.ESS white-DEF sheep today-LAT where-INDEF III-escape-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l "I swear," said the wolf, "the sheep with the white belly which was among the flock of sheep of that king there escaped somewhere today."

\t Xizyogon zira eƛin, walla, howža di eƛix zowali łiłiroƛ’ozoni ɣunoqay yaqˤułer ƛˤebno yok’ek’no.
\m xizyogon ziru-a eƛi-n wallah howža di eƛi-x zow-ali łiłiro-ƛ’-z-ni ɣun-qay yaqˤuł-r ƛˤeb-n y-ok’ek’-n
\g then fox-ERG say-PST.UNW wallah DEM4.SG me say-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-ATTR ditch-SUPER.ESS-GEN2-DEF tree-POSS.ABL today-LAT leaf-TOP II-steal-PST.UNW
\l Then the fox said: "By God, someone stole the leaf from the tree on that ditch I talked about.

\t Howt’o aɣˤʷa teł žek’uyey zowsƛin.
\m howt’o aɣˤu-a teł žek’u-ey zow-s-ƛin
\g here mill-IN.ESS inside man-DUB be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l And there seemed to be a man inside this mill!"

\t Šebiƛa žek’u t’o zown äsuƛin, žedus xabar boqnosi, zeyä eloza naysinan bezu-bˤoƛ’a ziru begirno.
\m šebi-ƛa žek’u t’o zow-n esu-ƛin žedu-s xabar b-oq-nosi zey-a elo-za naysinan b-ezu~oƛ’ˤu-a ziru b-egir-n
\g who-INDEF man here be.NPRS-PFV.CVB find-QUOT DEM1.IPL-GEN1 story III-become-ANT.CVB bear-ERG there-ZA everywhere III-examine-INF fox III-send-PST.UNW
\l After saying "Someone has to find the man here!", the bear sent the fox to look everywhere there.

\t Bizin aɣˤuz mogolar bezunosi, nełar elo žek’u esun.
\m b-izi-n aɣˤu-z mogolo-ar b-ezu-nosi neła-r elo žek’u esu-n
\g III-get.up-PFV.CVB mill-GEN2 granary-IN.LAT III-look-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT there man find-PST.UNW
\l When he got up to look into the mill's granary, he found the man there.

\t Suƛƛitow zira aħi boyn, haxar, et’o teł žek’u yołƛin.
\m suƛƛi-tow ziru-a aħi b-odi-n haxar et’o teł žek’u yoł-ƛin
\g immediately-EMPH fox-ERG alarm III-do-PFV.CVB now here inside man be-QUOT
\l Immediately the fox raised an alarm: "Now, there is a man inside here!"

\t K’eneč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu.
\m k’eneč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu
\g egg pearl day IV-become.clean
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Zownƛax zown anuƛax sis ečru ʕomoy.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis ečru ʕomoy
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT one old donkey
\l Once upon a time there was an old donkey.

\t Eƛni yayƛ’oräy, ža sida quł neła nełar ɣˤutku rodanix halmaɣłin k’eyn maħor boqno.
\m eƛni y-ay-ƛ’oräy ža sida qu-ł neła-a neła-r ɣˤutku r-odi-ani-x halmaɣłi-n k’edi-n maħor b-oq-n
\g winter II-come-SIM.CVB DEM1.SG one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT house IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS friendship-TOP search-PFV.CVB outside III-become-PST.UNW
\l When the winter was coming, he went outside and looked for friends to build a house for him.

\t Hunix bik’iƛ’oräy nełade dandir mamalay c’oxno.
\m huni-x b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy neła-de dandir mamalay c’ox-n
\g way-AD.ESS III-go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS towards rooster meet-PST.UNW
\l While going on his way, he met a rooster.

\t Neła ʕomoyq harizi rodin, din sadaq bižoƛin.
\m neła-a ʕomoy-q harizi r-odi-n di-n sadaq b-iži-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG donkey-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PFV.CVB me-TOP together III-carry-IMPR-QUOT
\l He asked the donkey: "Carry me with you!"

\t ƛa huduƛin, ʕomoy mamalayn sadaq boɣno hunix boqno.
\m ƛa hudu-ƛin ʕomoy mamalay-n sadaq b-oɣ-n huni-x b-oq-n
\g go.IMPR so-QUOT donkey rooster-TOP together III-take.away-PFV.CVB way-AD.ESS III-become-PST.UNW
\l "So let's go!", and the donkey took the rooster and went on the way.

\t Xizyogon žedar hunix k’et’u keze boqno.
\m xizyogon žeda-r huni-x k’et’u keze b-oq-n
\g then DEM1.IIPL.OBL-LAT way-AD.ESS cat meet III-become-PST.UNW
\l Then they met a cat on their way.

\t Nełan hemedurtow harizi rodin žedaq, din bižo sadaqƛin.
\m neła-a-n hemedur-tow harizi r-odi-n žeda-q di-n b-iži-o sadaq-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-TOP so-EMPH request IV-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-POSS.ESS me-TOP III-carry-IMPR together-QUOT
\l And he asked them likewise: "Carry me with you!"

\t Elaygon bitor žeda žedude sadaq hunix k’et’un boɣno.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor žeda-a žedu-de sadaq huni-x k’et’u-n b-oɣ-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS together way-AD.ESS cat-TOP III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l From there they took the cat with them further on their way.

\t Dahawtow bitaɣor rik’inosi, yiził dandir meši c’oxno.
\m dahaw-tow bita-aɣor r-ik’i-nosi yizi-ł dandir meši c’ox-n
\g a.little-EMPH distance-IN.VERS IV-go-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS towards bull.calf meet-PST.UNW
\l After they went a little further, they met a calf.

\t Žan hemedurtow ešurno yizä yiził, roqno elay bitor uynon sadaq rik’in.
\m ža-n hemedur-tow ešur-n yizi-a yizi-ł r-oq-n ele-ay bitor uyno-n sadaq r-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP so-EMPH take.along-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS III.PL-become-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL thither four-TOP together III.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l So they took him along with them as well and from there the four went further together.

\t Hemedur uynon rok’uɣʷeymoƛ’ hunix rik’iƛ’oräy, žedar bexuräsi boc’i besun.
\m hemedur uyno-n rok’uɣʷey-ƛ’ huni-x r-ik’i-ƛ’oräy žeda-ar b-exur-asi boc’i b-esu-n
\g so four-TOP fun-SUPER.ESS way-AD.ESS III.PL-go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-IN.LAT III-kill-RES.PRT wolf III-find-PST.UNW
\l So when the four of them went on their way happily, they found a wolf who was killed.

\t ʕOmoyä łinax riyx yedu elur ħažat boqaniƛin, halmaɣłiqorno eƛin, neła nełaz gugyoƛ’orno bizirerno, elay bitor bižin.
\m ʕomoy-a łinax r-iy-x yedu eli-r ħažat b-oq-ani-ƛin halmaɣłi-qor-n eƛi-n neła-a neła-az gugu-ƛ’or-n b-izir-r-n ele-ay bitor b-iži-n
\g donkey-ERG how IV-know-PRS DEM2.IISG we-LAT necessity III-become-MSD-QUOT friendship-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS.DIST back-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-lift-CAUS-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL thither III-carry-PST.UNW
\l The donkey said to his friends: "How does one know [how] it can become useful for us.", had [the wolf] lifted on his back and carried it further.

\t Yizi nasin sidaɣ aɣˤuxor rayn.
\m yizi nasin sidaɣ aɣˤu-xor r-ay-n
\g DEM2.IPL all in.one.place mill-AD.LAT III.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l They all came to a mill.

\t Elo tełäzay zurmasno, q’ilisno sas teqxo zown.
\m elo teł-azay zurma-s-n q’ili-s-n sas teq-x zow-n
\g there inside-IN.ABL.DIST zurna-GEN1-and drum-GEN1-and noise hear-GER be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l There they heard the noise of a zurna and a drum from inside.

\t Madaza bäxuruni boc’in xecin, žedu aɣˤʷaɣor roqno.
\m ma-aza b-exu-ru-ni boc’i-n xeci-n žedu aɣˤu-aɣor r-oq-n
\g outside-IN.VERS.DIST III-die-PST.PRT-DEF wolf-TOP leave-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL mill-IN.VERS III.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l They left the dead wolf outside and entered the mill.

\t Elo yizar boc’as berten besun.
\m elo yiza-r boc’a-s berten b-esu-n
\g there DEM2.IIPL.OBL-LAT wolf.PL-GEN1 marriage III-find-PST.UNW
\l There they found the wedding of wolves.

\t Žedu ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu rizin ƛirbabi bayzaƛ’.
\m žedu ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu r-izi-n ƛirba-bi b-ay-zaƛ’
\g DEM1.IIPL much be.happy III.PL-get.up-PST.UNW guest-PL I.PL-come-CSL.CVB
\l They got very happy, when guests came.

\t Bertenyoł, keč’ qˤaƛoƛin, boc’ä ʕomoyq harizi rodin.
\m berten-ł keč’ qˤaƛi-o-ƛin boc’a-a ʕomoy-q harizi r-odi-n
\g marriage-CONT.ESS song sing-IMPR-QUOT wolf.PL-ERG donkey-POSS.ESS request III.PL-do-PST.UNW
\l On the marriage, the wolves asked the donkey: "Sing a song!"

\t Nełagon žedaƛ’ortow kurno, sosi meža qˤaƛoƛin.
\m neła-a-gon žeda-ƛ’or-tow kur-n sosi meži-a qˤaƛi-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUPER.LAT-EMPH throw-PFV.CVB at.first you.PL-ERG sing-IMPR-QUOT
\l But he threw it back at them: "You sing [one] first!"

\t Boc’ä keč’ qˤaƛa baybik bodin, dalay, dalay sida bogmor ʕomoy, dalay, dalay sidagon bogmor mamalay, sidenigon bogmor k’et’un, mešinƛin.
\m boc’a-a keč’ qˤaƛi-a baybik b-odi-n dalay dalay sida bog-r ʕomoy dalay dalay sida-gon bog-r mamalay sideni-gon bog-r k’et’u-n meši-n-ƛin
\g wolf.PL-ERG song sing-INF begin III-do-PST.UNW dalay dalay one.OBL meal-LAT donkey dalay dalay one.OBL-CNTR meal-LAT rooster other-CNTR meal-LAT cat-and bull.calf-and-QUOT
\l The wolves began to sing a song: "Dalay, dalay, a donkey for one meal; dalay, dalay, a rooster for another meal; and a cat and a calf for yet another meal."

\t Boc’a rigtow rˤuƛ’no.
\m boc’a r-ig-tow r-ˤuƛ’-n
\g wolf.PL III.PL-very-EMPH III.PL-be.afraid-PST.UNW
\l The wolves were very afraid.

\t Enduräza rik’in tamadaqorno eƛin, äƛiruxorno bexurna yizä boc’iƛin, žedułäy sis bezanix madaɣor bik’in.
\m endur-aza r-ik’i-n tamada-qor-n eƛi-n eƛi-ru-xor-n b-exur-na yiza-a boc’i-ƛin žedu-łay sis b-ezu-ani-x ma-daɣor b-ik’i-n
\g that.way-IN.VERS.DIST III.PL-go-PFV.CVB toastmaster-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB.INT DEM2.IIPL.OBL-ERG wolf-QUOT DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ABL one III-look-MSD-AD.ESS outside-APUD.VERS III-go-PST.UNW
\l They went that way and said to the toastmaster: "[???]"; one of them went outside to took whether they had killed the wolf as they said.

\t Elo ʕomoyä bayäruni bexasi boc’i bukaynosi, nasin boc’a elin rexar yizäƛin, aɣˤʷa tełäy roxin.
\m elo ʕomoy-a b-ayr-ru-ni b-exu-asi boc’i b-ukad-nosi nasin boc’a eli-n r-exur yiza-a-ƛin aɣˤu-a teł-ay r-oxi-n
\g there donkey-ERG III-bring-PST.PRT-DEF III-die-RES.PRT wolf III-see-ANT.CVB all wolf.PL we-TOP III.PL-kill DEM2.IIPL.OBL-ERG-QUOT mill-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL III.PL-run.away-PST.UNW
\l When they saw the dead wolf that the donkey had brought, all the wolves said: "They will kill us!", ran out of the mill and away.

\t Elur yiłaƛ’ay mustaħiq’aw močin bäsunč’i, ži eƛnoqor ħadur roqanix zamanno bayn, howt’otow ričanƛin, žedas ħukmu boqno.
\m eli-r yiła-ƛ’ay mustaħiq’aw moči-n b-esu-č’i ži eƛni-qor ħadur r-oq-ani-x zaman-n b-ay-n howt’o-tow r-iči-an-ƛin žeda-s ħukmu b-oq-n
\g we-LAT DEM2.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL suitable place-TOP III-find-NEG.FUT now winter-POSS.LAT preparation III.PL-become-MSD-AD.ESS time-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB here-EMPH III.PL-live-FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM1.IIPL.OBL-GEN1 decision III-become-PST.UNW
\l "We won't find a place more suitable than this one; now the time has come to prepare for the winter; we will live here." was their decision.

\t Mamalayägon, di rešonazałäy šebin rut’ix bäčiƛin, eƛin.
\m mamalay-a-gon di rešoni-bi-łay šebin r-ut’i-x b-iči-ƛin eƛi-n
\g rooster-ERG-CNTR me garbage-PL-CONT.ABL thing IV-collect-IPFV.CVB III-be-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l The rooster then said: "I will be collecting things out of the garbage."

\t Xizaɣor ʕomoyn mešin gurow reynoynanu.
\m xizaɣor ʕomoy-n meši-n gurow r-eynod-n-anu
\g finally donkey-and bull.calf-and except III.PL-work-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l Finally, only the donkey and the calf were working.

\t Rok’ƛ’o anuzaytow, yayn eƛni c’oxno, yegirno isi, rizin roč’i.
\m rok’u-ƛ’ anu-zay-tow y-ay-n eƛni c’ox-n y-egir-n isi r-izi-n roč’i
\g heart-SUPER.ESS be.absent-SIM.CVB-EMPH II-come-PFV.CVB winter hit-PFV.CVB II-send-PFV.CVB snow III.PL-get.up-PST.UNW frost
\l Suddenly, the winter came and sent snow, and frost came.

\t ʕOmoyn, mešin yołi tełxorno riħun, eƛnoqor rutäruni bix tatanaxorno roqno rac’xo zown.
\m ʕomoy-n meši-n yołi teł-xor-n r-iħu-n eƛni-qor r-utir-ru-ni bix tatana-xor-n r-oq-n r-ac’-x zow-n
\g donkey-and bull.calf-and however inside-AD.LAT-TOP III.PL-sit.down-PFV.CVB winter-POSS.LAT IV-gather-PST.PRT-DEF hay warmth-AD.LAT-TOP III.PL-become-PFV.CVB IV-eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The donkey and the calf, however, sat down inside in the warmth and ate the hay that had been gathered for the winter.

\t Sosisi ʕomoyn, mešin ričäsi zown regirxanuƛin, mežan ela riłetow eƛnoqor ħadurłi roda yałiƛin.
\m sosi-si ʕomoy-n meši-n r-iči-asi zow-n r-egir-x-anu-ƛin meži-a-n eli-a r-iłe-tow eƛni-qor ħadurłi r-odi-a yałi-ƛin
\g at.first-LNK donkey-and bull.calf-and III.PL-remain-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB III.PL-let-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT you.PL-ERG-TOP we-ERG III.PL-as-EMPH winter-POSS.LAT preparation IV-do-INF else-QUOT
\l At first, the donkey and the calf remained not letting them in: "You must as well, just like us, make preparation for the winter!"

\t Xizyogon nece čeranayzaƛ’, žedux rok’un rexun, regirno.
\m xizyogon nece čeranad-zaƛ’ žedu-x rok’u-n r-exu-n r-egir-n
\g then so.much beg-CSL.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-AD.ESS heart-TOP IV-die-PFV.CVB III.PL-let-PST.UNW
\l Then they begged so much that the others pittied them and let them in.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Zownƛax zownanuƛax sis bečedaw žek’u.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax sis bečedaw žek’u
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT one wealthy man
\l Once upon a time there was a rich man.

\t Nesis łˤono uži zown.
\m nesi-s łˤono uži zow-n
\g he.OBL-GEN1 three son be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had three sons.

\t Užibi baq’ˤiłnosi babiya eƛin, howži mežur barubi rowa mixno bays, meža hemeł guħƛ’orno bizin c’eruc’abi kuro.
\m uži-bi b-aq’ˤił-nosi babi-a eƛi-n howži meži-r baru-bi r-ow-a mix-n b-ay-s meži-a hemeł guħ-ƛ’or-n b-izi-n c’eruc’a-bi kur-o
\g son-PL I.PL-grow.up-ANT.CVB dad-ERG say-PST.UNW now you.PL-LAT wife-PL II.PL-marry-INF time-TOP III-come-PST.WIT you.PL-ERG DEM4.IISG.OBL hill-SUPER.LAT-TOP I.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB bow-PL throw-IMPR
\l When the sons grew up, the father said: "Now the time has come that you marry wives; climb on this hill and shoot with your bows.

\t Łaz ƛ’ˤuƛ’o c’eruc’a c’oxxo, hemeła ɣˤutkay kid yowa yołƛin.
\m ła-z ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’ c’eruc’a c’ox-x hemeła ɣˤutku-ay kid y-ow-a yoł-ƛin
\g who.OBL-GEN2 roof-SUPER.ESS bow hit-IPFV.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL house-IN.ABL daughter II-marry-INF be-QUOT
\l Whose roof you hit with the bow, the daughter from that house you will marry.

\t Guħƛ’orno bizin, łˤoran esnaza kurno c’eruc’a.
\m guħ-ƛ’or-n b-izi-n łˤora-n esyu-bi-a kur-n c’eruc’a
\g hill-SUPER.LAT-TOP I.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB three.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG throw-PST.UNW bow
\l The three brothers climbed up the hill and shot with their bows.

\t Bežet’ani esnazas c’eruc’abi č’aq’ˤin žedu biłetow bečedawt’anizas ɣutkozas ƛ’ˤazaƛ’.
\m b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-s c’eruc’a-bi č’aq’ˤi-n žedu b-iłe-tow bečedaw-t’a-ni-bi-s ɣˤutku-bi-s ƛ’ˤu-bi-ƛ’
\g I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL-GEN1 bow-PL hit-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL I.PL-as-EMPH wealthy-DISTR-DEF-PL-GEN1 house-PL-GEN1 roof-PL-SUPER.ESS
\l The elder brothers' bows hit the roofs of houses of wealthy ones just like them.

\t Eɣeni esiws c’eruc’a resatow resux zownanu.
\m eɣe-ni esiw-s c’eruc’a r-esu-a-tow r-esu-x zow-n-anu
\g young-DEF brother-GEN1 bow IV-find-INF-EMPH IV-find-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW-NEG
\l The younger brother's bow didn't find anything at all.

\t Babiya esirxo zown, žin c’eruc’a resunč’aƛin.
\m babi-a esir-x zow-n žin c’eruc’a r-esu-č’u-a-ƛin
\g dad-ERG ask-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW again bow IV-find-NEG.PST.WIT-Q-QUOT
\l The father was asking: "Didn't your bow find anything again?"

\t Yedugon šebi t’o roqxoƛin tamaša oqno ƛexun ža.
\m yedu-gon šebi t’o r-oq-x-ƛin tamaša oq-n ƛexu-n ža
\g DEM2.IISG-CNTR what here IV-happen-PRS-QUOT astonished become-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG
\l "What's happening here?", he stood there astonished.

\t Ayn babiw eɣeni žader, žin resunč’a c’eruc’aƛin.
\m ay-n babiw eɣe-ni uži-der žin r-esu-č’u-a c’eruc’a-ƛin
\g come-PST.UNW father young-DEF son-APUD.LAT again IV-find-NEG.PST.WIT-Q bow-QUOT
\l The father came to his young son[ and asked]: "Did you find your bow again?"

\t Raładyoz lilyox c’eruc’an resus, howža łoħron xizaz nexsiƛin, žawab teƛno žoyä babiwr.
\m raład-z lilyo-x c’eruc’a-n r-esu-s howža łoħro-n xizaz nex-s-ƛin žawab teƛ-n uži-a babiw-r
\g sea-GEN2 river.bank-AD.ESS bow-TOP IV-find-PST.WIT DEM4.SG frog-TOP from.behind come-PST.WIT-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW son-ERG father-LAT
\l "I found the bow at the sea shore, [and] that frog came behind me.", the son answered the father.

\t Howži roda šebin anu, Allahä näƛru łinaƛ’no razi boqa bay eliƛin, eƛin babiya.
\m howži r-odi-a šebin anu Allah-a neƛ-ru łina-ƛ’-n razi b-oq-a b-ay eli-ƛin eƛi-n babi-a
\g now IV-do-INF thing be.absent God-ERG give-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP accept I.PL-become-INF I.PL-must we-QUOT say-PST.UNW dad-ERG
\l "Now there's nothing to do about it, we have to accept what God has given to us," said the father.

\t Eɣeni esiyan, łoħran sadaq ʕumru boda baybik bodin.
\m eɣe-ni esyu-a-n łoħro-a-n sadaq ʕumru b-odi-a baybik b-odi-n
\g young-DEF brother-ERG-and frog-ERG-and together life III-do-INF begin III-do-PST.UNW
\l The younger brother and the frog began to live together.

\t Sida quł madaħazay yeda ayzaƛ’or šet’ur bac’ad rodäsi ɣˤutku resun.
\m sida qu-ł madaħ-azay yeda ay-zaƛ’or šet’ur bac’ad r-odi-asi ɣˤutku r-esu-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS outside-IN.ABL.DIST DEM2.ISG come-POST.CVB around clean IV-do-RES.PRT house IV-find-PST.UNW
\l One day, when he came from outside, he found the house all cleaned everywhere.

\t Tamaša oqno ƛexun eɣeni esiw, łuey yedu t’o idu nediw bercinłi rodisƛin.
\m tamaša oq-n ƛexu-n eɣe-ni esiw łu-ey yedu t’o idu nediw bercinłi r-odi-s-ƛin
\g astonished become-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother who.ERG-DUB DEM2.IISG here home such beauty IV-do-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The younger brother got very surprised: "Who the heck has done such a beauty here at home?"

\t Q’ˤano äƛiru ɣudƛ’ogon yeda ayzaƛ’or resun istowliƛ’ riguƛ’ay rigu biša eqräsi.
\m q’ˤano eƛi-ru ɣudi-ƛ’-gon yeda ay-zaƛ’or r-esu-n istowli-ƛ’ r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu biša eqer-asi
\g two say-PST.PRT day-SUPER.ESS-CNTR DEM2.ISG come-POST.CVB IV-find-PFV.CVB table-SUPER.ESS IV-rich-SUPER.ABL IV-rich food put-RES.PRT
\l On the second day then, when he came, he found the richest food put on the table.

\t Hoboyƛa yedu bišʷa ħadur radiru žek’u iyrinč’ey xecač’inƛin, oqno yeda uži.
\m hoboy-ƛa yedu bišʷa ħadur r-odi-ru žek’u iyr-č’ey xeci-ač’in-ƛin oq-n yeda uži
\g now-INDEF DEM2.IISG food preparation IV-do-PST.PRT man find.out-NEG.PST.CVB leave-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT begin-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG boy
\l "Now I will find out the man who has prepared this food," began the boy.

\t Maħor äk’irusno rodin, acxazay ezun ičin.
\m maħor ik’i-ru-s-n r-odi-n ac-xazay ezu-n iči-n
\g outside go-PST.PRT-GEN1-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB door-AD.ABL.DIST look-PFV.CVB wait-PST.UNW
\l He did as if he went outside and looked behind the door.

\t Taxƛäzayn boƛixno, yisiłtow adäza łoħra ƛ’iräy qalno kurno, tełäzay bercinaw kid yoƛixno.
\m tax-ƛäzay-n b-oƛix-n yisi-ł-tow adäza łoħro-a ƛ’iräy qal-n kur-n teł-azay bercinaw kid y-oƛix-n
\g ottoman-SUB.ABL.DIST-TOP III-appear-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-EMPH before frog-ERG from.above skin-TOP spread.out-PFV.CVB inside-IN.ABL.DIST beautiful girl II-appear-PST.UNW
\l From the ottoman, that frog appeared, teared off his skin and a beautiful girl appeared.

\t Ža nediw tamašałi rukaynosi, acno yaɣˤin, idurno ik’in, pečmaɣor łoħros qal kurno.
\m ža nediw tamašałi r-ukad-nosi ac-n y-ˤaɣˤi-n idu-r-n ik’i-n peč-aɣor łoħro-s qal kur-n
\g DEM1.SG such wonder IV-see-ANT.CVB door-TOP II-open-PFV.CVB home-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB oven-IN.VERS frog-GEN1 skin throw-PST.UNW
\l Having seen such a wonder, he opened the door, went home and threw the frog's skin into the oven.

\t Neł mixƛ’o kidbä eƛin, debeztow žukzar ža mi qal c’idaɣor kursiƛin.
\m neła mixƛ’o kid-a eƛi-n mi-z-tow žukzar ža mi qal c’i-daɣor kur-s-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL at.a.time girl-ERG say-PST.UNW you-GEN2-EMPH to.spite DEM1.SG you skin fire-APUD.VERS throw-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l At that time the girl said: "You threw the skin into the oven to spite [me]!"

\t Hemedur sadaq ʕumru bodix zown eɣeni užän, łoħrołäy yaqruni bercinawni kidbän.
\m hemedur sadaq ʕumru b-odi-x zow-n eɣe-ni uži-a-n łoħro-łay y-oq-ru-ni bercinaw-ni kid-a-n
\g so together life III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB young-DEF boy-ERG-and frog-CONT.ABL II-become-PST.PRT-DEF beautiful-DEF girl-ERG-and
\l So the young boy and the beautiful girl that became of the frog were living together.

\t Sida quł yizider babiw ayn.
\m sida qu-ł yizi-der babiw ay-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IPL.OBL-APUD.LAT father come-PST.UNW
\l One day, the father came to them.

\t Žaz baruƛ’no ezun babiws ʕuraw rok’u ƛexun.
\m uži-z baru-ƛ’-n ezu-n babiw-s ʕuraw rok’u ƛexu-n
\g boy-GEN2 wife-SUPER.ESS-TOP look-PFV.CVB father-GEN1 much heart remain-PST.UNW
\l The father looked at the boy's wife and became very envious.

\t Babiya sida quł uži idurno goƛ’in eƛin, howła ʕaƛor ʕuraw k’udi bayrinč’inäy, mi di exura yołƛin.
\m babi-a sida qu-ł uži idu-r-n goƛ’i-n eƛi-n howła ʕaƛ-r ʕuraw k’udi b-ayr-č’i-näy mi di exur-a yoł-ƛin
\g dad-ERG one.OBL day-CONT.ESS son home-LAT-TOP invite-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW DEM3.IISG.OBL village-LAT many vine III-bring-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB you me kill-INF be-QUOT
\l The father one day invited the son to his home and said: "If [you] don't bring many vines to that village, I will kill you."

\t Idurno ayn wˤałer q’ˤimno kurno xediw ičizaq, bara esirno, šebi roqno.
\m idu-r-n ay-n wˤał-r q’ˤim-n kur-n xediw iči-zaq baru-a esir-n šebi r-oq-n
\g home-LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB downward-LAT head-TOP throw-PFV.CVB husband be-CSL.CVB wife-ERG ask-PST.UNW what IV-happen-PST.UNW
\l Because, when the husband came home with his head down, his wife asked: "What happened?

\t Šida mi nece q’ʷaridno oqno ičäsiƛin.
\m šida mi nece q’ʷarid-n oq-n iči-asi-ƛin
\g why you so.much sadness-TOP become-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l Why have you become so sad?"

\t Xediya eƛin, babiya däł adäza zaħmataw masala ersi.
\m xediw-a eƛi-n babi-a di-ł adäza zaħmataw masala er-s
\g husband-ERG say-PST.UNW dad-ERG me-CONT.ESS before difficult task put-PST.WIT
\l The husband said: "My father has put a difficult task before me.

\t ʕAƛor ʕeziyaw k’udi däq biqira bayxƛin.
\m ʕaƛ-r ʕeziyaw k’udi di-q b-iqir-a b-ay-x-ƛin
\g village-LAT many vine me-POSS.ESS III-take.away-INF III-must-PRS-QUOT
\l I must deliver enough vines to the village."

\t Mi rasgi q’ʷarid aqnoƛin, eƛin bara, raładyoz raʕalłixorno ik’in sis qˤaƛu rodo mi, elay bitor roda rayxosi šebin debertow ray.
\m mi rasgi q’ʷarid oq-no-ƛin eƛi-n baru-a raład-z raʕalłi-xor-n ik’i-n sis qˤaƛu r-odi-o mi ele-ay bitor r-odi-a r-ay-xosi šebin mi-r-tow r-ay
\g you at.all sadness become-PROHIB-QUOT say-PST.UNW wife-ERG sea-GEN2 edge-AD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB one shout IV-do-IMPR you there-IN.ABL thither IV-do-INF IV-must-PRS.PRT thing you-LAT-EMPH IV-come
\l "Don't be sad at all!", said his wife, "Go to the edge of the sea and give a shout, then will the thing come to you what you will have to do."

\t Raładyoz raʕalłixorno ik’in eɣeni žoyä qˤaƛu rak’run, yoƛixno k’oƛin sis ɣˤanabi.
\m raład-z raʕalłi-xor-n ik’i-n eɣe-ni uži-a qˤaƛu r-ok’-run y-oƛix-n k’oƛi-n sis ɣˤanabi
\g sea-GEN2 edge-AD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB young-DEF boy-ERG shout IV-beat-IMM.ANT.CVB II-appear-PFV.CVB jump-PST.UNW one woman
\l And when the young boy went to the edge of the sea and shouted, a woman appeared and jumped out.

\t Yiła esirno, šebi deber retinƛin.
\m yiła-a esir-n šebi mi-r r-eti-n-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW what you-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l She asked: "What do you want?"

\t Eɣʷeni žoyä esin, łinas ħal yisiƛ’ yałrułi.
\m eɣʷe-ni uži-a esi-n łinas ħal yisi-ƛ’ yoł-rułi
\g young-DEF boy-ERG tell-PST.UNW why trouble DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS be-MSD
\l The young boy told why he was in trouble.

\t Raładyołxorno yiħun, muhumozas qotno ric’no yoƛixno eƛin, šibaw žek’uz akä sist’a muhu eqro, elay bitorsi debi ħalt’i anuƛin.
\m raład-łxor-n y-iħu-n muhu-bi-s qot-n r-ic’-n y-oƛix-n eƛi-n šibaw žek’u-z aki-a sist’a muhu eqer-o ele-ay bitor-si mi-s ħalt’i anu-ƛin
\g sea-CONT.VERS-TOP II-come.to-PFV.CVB granule-PL-GEN1 handfull-TOP IV-fill-PFV.CVB II-appear-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW every man-GEN2 window-IN.ESS one.at.a.time granule put-IMPR here-IN.ABL thither-ATTR you-GEN1 work be.absent-QUOT
\l She went into the sea, filled her hand with grains, reappeared and said: "Put one grain into the window of each man, besides that there's no more work for you."

\t Elayn ik’in, nesä šibaw žek’uz akä raładyazay yoƛixno ɣˤanaza näƛru muhubi eqerxo aħnayn.
\m ele-ay-n ik’i-n nesi-a šibaw žek’u-z aki-a raład-zay y-oƛix-n ɣˤanabi-a neƛ-ru muhu-bi eqer-x aħnad-n
\g there-IN.ABL-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG every man-GEN2 window-IN.ESS sea-SIM.CVB II-appear-PFV.CVB woman-ERG give-PST.PRT granule-PL put-IPFV.CVB walk.around-PST.UNW
\l After going away, he walked around putting the grains that the woman that had appeared from the sea gave to him into the windows of each man.

\t Qˤašizaƛ’or, nesiz babiwz ɣˤutkoƛ’ay baybik bodin, nazon ʕaƛa yałru ɣˤutkozas akizax ʕeze boqacet’a k’udi besun.
\m qˤaši-zaƛ’or nesi-z babiw-z ɣˤutku-ƛ’ay baybik b-odi-n nazo-n ʕaƛ-a yoł-ru ɣˤutku-z-as aki-bi-x ʕeze b-oq-ace-t’a k’udi b-esu-n
\g dawn-POST.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 father-GEN2 house-SUPER.ABL begin III-do-PFV.CVB all.OBL-TOP village-IN.ESS be-PST.PRT house-GEN2-FUT2 window-PL-AD.ESS be.enough III-become-TERM-DISTR vine III-exist-PST.UNW
\l Before dawn, he began at his father's house and there was enough vine in all the houses' windows.

\t Neła quł sasaqosigon babiya eƛin, ɣudegon nazorno ʕaƛor ʕuraw pulaw riqir, yałi exura yołƛin.
\m neła qu-ł sasaqosi-gon babi-a eƛi-n ɣude-gon nazo-r-n ʕaƛ-r ʕuraw pulaw r-iqir yałi exur-a yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning-CNTR dad-ERG say-PST.UNW tomorrow-CNTR all.OBL-LAT-TOP village-LAT much rice IV-take.away else kill-INF be-QUOT
\l The next morning, the father said: "Bring alot of pilaw to everyone in the village tomorrow, or else I will kill you."

\t Neła qułno idur q’ʷaridaw yeda ayzaƛ’, bara esirno, yaqˤułgon łinax q’ʷarid oqnoƛin.
\m neła qu-ł-n idu-r q’ʷaridaw yeda ay-zaƛ’ baru-a esir-n yaqˤuł-gon łinax q’ʷarid oq-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS-TOP home-LAT sad DEM2.ISG come-CSL.CVB wife-ERG ask-PST.UNW today-CNTR how sadness become-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l That day, because he came home said, his wife asked: "Why did you come home sad today as well?"

\t Nesä babiya adäz äru masalałäy esin.
\m nesi-a babi-a adäz er-ru masala-łay esi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG dad-ERG ahead put-PST.PRT task-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW
\l He told about the task that his father had put in front of him.

\t Bara eƛin, yaqˤułno hemedurtow raładyoz raʕalłixorno ik’in qˤaƛo.
\m baru-a eƛi-n yaqˤuł-n hemedur-tow raład-z raʕalłi-xor-n ik’i-n qˤaƛi-o
\g wife-ERG say-PST.UNW today-TOP so-EMPH sea-GEN2 edge-AD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB shout-IMPR
\l His wife said: "Today go to the edge of the sea as well and shout."

\t Neła deber kumak badiƛin.
\m neła-a mi-r kumak b-odi-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you-LAT help III-do-QUOT
\l She will help you.

\t Q’ˤano äƛirugon ɣudƛ’o eɣeni esiw raładyoz raʕalłixor ik’in.
\m q’ˤano äƛiru-gon ɣudi-ƛ’ eɣe-ni esiw raład-z raʕalłi-xor ik’i-n
\g two ORD-CNTR day-SUPER.ESS young-DEF brother sea-GEN2 edge-AD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l On the second day, the younger brother went to the edge of the sea.

\t Haraƛ’ badirun, ɣˤanabin yoƛixno hemedurtow šebi retinƛin esirno eɣeni esiwq.
\m haraƛ’ b-odi-run ɣˤanabi-n y-oƛix-n hemedur-tow šebi r-eti-n-ƛin esir-n eɣe-ni esiw-q
\g voice III-do-IMM.ANT.CVB woman-TOP II-appear-PFV.CVB so-EMPH what IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT ask-PST.UNW young-DEF brother-POSS.ESS
\l After he shouted, the woman appeared and again she asked the younger brother: "What do you want?"

\t Nesä nesiƛ’ yałru q’ʷariłi esin nełaq.
\m nesi-a nesi-ƛ’ yoł-ru q’ʷariłi esi-n neła-q
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS be-PST.PRT sadness tell-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l He told her of the sadness that was on him.

\t Adäz riłetow muhumabin teƛno egirno šibawz akä eqroƛin.
\m adäz r-iłe-tow muhu-bi-n teƛ-n egir-n šibaw-z aki-a eqer-o-ƛin
\g before IV-as-EMPH granule-PL-TOP give-PFV.CVB send-PST.UNW every-GEN2 window-IN.ESS put-IMPR-QUOT
\l As before, she gave him grains and sent him away[, saying]: "Put those in every window!"

\t Neširuzoƛ’ ʕaƛa šibawz ɣˤutkoz akä neł ɣˤanaza näƛru muhumabin eqerno, eɣeni esiw iduɣor ik’in.
\m neširu-zo-ƛ’ ʕaƛ-a šibaw-z ɣˤutku-z aki-a neła ɣˤanabi-a neƛ-ru muhu-bi-n eqer-n eɣe-ni esiw idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g evening-ATTR.OBL-SUPER.ESS village-IN.ESS every-GEN2 house-GEN2 window-IN.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-ERG give-PST.PRT granule-PL-TOP put-PST.UNW young-DEF brother home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l In the evening the younger brother put the grains that woman had given to him into the windows of each house and went home.

\t Łˤora äƛirugon ɣudƛ’o goƛ’in babiya nesiqor eƛin, mi dey q’ˤano masala t’ubazi boys.
\m łˤora äƛiru-gon ɣudi-ƛ’ goƛ’i-n babi-a nesi-qor eƛi-n mi di-s q’ˤano masala t’ubazi b-odi-s
\g three.OBL ORD-CNTR day-SUPER.ESS invite-PFV.CVB dad-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you me-GEN1 two task fulfillment III-do-PST.WIT
\l On the third day the father invited him and said to him: "You fulfilled two of my tasks.

\t Łox äƛirugon, debez yäxuruni eniwderno ik’in, nełaq esir, mesedyos mač’an, tupin, ašunin na mečoƛ’ eqräsiƛinno, mi alžanayä, žuržaħayä yołƛin.
\m łox äƛiru-gon mi-z y-exu-ru-ni eniw-der-n ik’i-n neła-q esir mesed-s mač’a-n tupi-n ašuni-n na moči-ƛ’ eqer-asi-ƛin-n mi alžan-a-a žuržaħ-a-a yoł-ƛin
\g thrice ORD-CNTR you-GEN2 II-die-PST.PRT-DEF mother-APUD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask gold-GEN1 dagger-and rifle-and belt-and where place-SUPER.ESS put-RES.PRT-QUOT-TOP you paradise-IN.ESS-Q hell-IN.ESS-Q be-QUOT
\l For the third time, go to your dead mother and ask her, where she put the golden dagger, rifle and belt, and whether she is in heaven or in hell!"

\t Łox äƛirugon esirno bara xedyoq, šida mi q’ʷaridƛin.
\m łox äƛiru-gon esir-n baru-a xediw-q šida mi q’ʷarid-ƛin
\g thrice ORD-CNTR ask-PST.UNW wife-ERG husband-POSS.ESS why you sadness-QUOT
\l For the third time, the wife asked his husband: "Why are you sad?"

\t Esin xediya babiya äsiru xabar.
\m esi-n xediw-a babi-a esi-ru xabar
\g tell-PST.UNW husband-ERG dad-ERG tell-PST.PRT story
\l The husband told what his dad had said.

\t Hemedurtow, łox äƛirugon egirno xediw raładyoz raʕalłixor.
\m hemedur-tow łox äƛiru-gon egir-n xediw raład-z raʕalłi-xor
\g so-EMPH thrice ORD-CNTR send-PST.UNW husband sea-GEN2 edge-AD.LAT
\l And so, for the third time, she sent her husband to the edge of the sea.

\t Qˤaƛin haraƛ’ bodinosi, raładyołäy howžatow ɣˤanabi yoƛixno.
\m qˤaƛi-n haraƛ’ b-odi-nosi raład-łay howža-tow ɣˤanabi y-oƛix-n
\g shout-PFV.CVB voice III-do-ANT.CVB sea-CONT.ABL DEM4.SG-EMPH woman II-appear-PST.UNW
\l He shouted and out of the sea came that woman.

\t Neła žaqor eƛin, t’ay ik’iƛ’orey, deber bˤeƛ’xo aħo äsu.
\m neła uži-qor eƛi-n t’ay ik’i-ƛ’oräy mi-r bˤeƛ’-x aħo esu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL boy-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW from.here go-SIM.CVB you-LAT sheep-AD.ESS shepherd find
\l She said to the boy: "When you go away from here, you will find a shepherd with a flock of sheep.

\t Elay bitorgon ik’iƛ’orey, deber sis žek’u äsu kʷayä zamzames łi roqłin ža ħaƛa roqinč’ey ƛexasi.
\m ele-ay bitor-gon ik’i-ƛ’oräy mi-r sis žek’u esu kʷay-a zamzame-s łi r-oq-łin ža ħaƛu-a r-oq-č’ey ƛexu-asi
\g there-IN.ABL thither-CNTR go-SIM.CVB you-LAT one man find hand-IN.ESS sacred-GEN1 water IV-become-CNC.CVB DEM1.SG drink-INF IV-begin-NEG.PST.CVB remain-RES.PRT
\l And when you go further from there, you will find a man with holy water in his hands, but he won't drink it.

\t Žeduqor bitor hunix ik’iƛ’orey siskin xabar bexarno.
\m žedu-qor bitor huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy siskin xabar b-exur-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT thither way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB anything story III-kill-PST.UNW
\l When you go further on the way, the story will go on.

\t Elaygon bitor ik’iƛ’oräy, yäsu deber aluk’a ɣˤul.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor ik’i-ƛ’oräy y-esu mi-r aluk’a ɣˤul
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither go-SIM.CVB II-find you-LAT white stone
\l And when you go further, you will find a white stone.

\t Žan bitor yiq’ˤirno waħaz egin ik’inosi, deber elo ixiw gondu yukay, elogon tełxor oqnosi, q’ˤida yičäsi eniw yäsu.
\m ža-n bitor y-iq’ˤir-n waħo-az egi-n ik’i-nosi mi-r elo ixiw gondu y-ukad elo-gon teł-xor oq-nosi q’ˤida y-iči-asi eniw y-esu
\g DEM1.SG-TOP thither II-move.aside-PFV.CVB below-IN.ESS.DIST go.into-PFV.CVB go-ANT.CVB you-LAT there big big.hole II-see there-CNTR inside-AD.LAT become-ANT.CVB down II-sit-RES.PRT mother II-find
\l After you have moved it aside and went below it, you will see a big hole, and inside you will see your mother sitting there.

\t Uži raładyoz ɣˤanaza äƛiruxor ik’in.
\m uži raład-z ɣˤanabi-a eƛi-ru-xor ik’i-n
\g boy sea-GEN2 woman-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l The boy went to what the woman from the sea told him.

\t Eɣeni uži žeduqor xabar bodinč’ey ik’in.
\m eɣe-ni uži žedu-qor xabar b-odi-č’ey ik’i-n
\g young-DEF boy DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT story III-do-NEG.PST.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l The young boy went on without talking to them.

\t Dahawgon bitor ik’inosi, gugyoq łin ričin ħaƛa utiłxanusi žek’u esun.
\m dahaw-gon bitor ik’i-nosi gugu-q łi-n r-iči-n ħaƛu-a uti-ł-xanusi žek’u esu-n
\g a.little-CNTR thither go-ANT.CVB back-POSS.ESS water-TOP IV-be-PFV.CVB drink-INF turn-POT-NEG.PRS.PRT man find-PST.UNW
\l He went a little further and found the man who had water on his back but didn't drink it.

\t Aluk’ani ɣˤulader aynosi, žan sidaɣar yiq’ˤirno imxaɣor oqno ik’inosi, žar eniw yesun.
\m aluk’a-ni ɣˤul-der ay-nosi ža-n sidaɣ-ar y-iq’ˤir-n imxu-aɣor oq-n ik’i-nosi uži-r eniw y-esu-n
\g white-DEF stone-APUD.LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP in.one.place-IN.LAT II-move.aside-PFV.CVB cave-IN.VERS become-PFV.CVB go-ANT.CVB boy-LAT mother II-find-PST.UNW
\l After he arrived at the white stone, he moved it aside and got into the cave and then he found his mother.

\t Yet’un hečk’er k’oƛin eniya esirno, nazay mi t’or ayäƛin.
\m y-et’u-n hečk’er k’oƛi-n eni-a esir-n nazay mi t’o-r ay-a-ƛin
\g II-jump-PFV.CVB upright jump-PFV.CVB mother-ERG ask-PST.UNW from.where you here-LAT come-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The mother jumped up and asked: "Where did you come from here!"

\t Nesis eniw čamaligo ƛˤebał adäz yexasi zown.
\m nesi-s eniw čamaligo ƛˤeb-ł adäz y-exu-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 mother several year-CONT.ESS before II-die-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His mother had died several years before.

\t Žoyä babiya łinał xizay egärułi esin.
\m uži-a babi-a łina-ł xizay egir-ru-łi esi-n
\g boy-ERG dad-ERG what.OBL-CONT.ESS behind send-PST.PRT-NMLZ tell-PST.UNW
\l The boy told what the father has sent him for.

\t Eniya eƛin, babiwqor eƛo, di alžanä yołƛin.
\m eni-a eƛi-n babiw-qor eƛi-o di alžan-a yoł-ƛin
\g mother-ERG say-PST.UNW father-POSS.LAT say-IMPR me paradise-IN.ESS be-QUOT
\l The mother said: "Say to your father, that I am in heaven."

\t Mesedyos mač’an, ašunin babiya raqˤza yoł.
\m mesed-s mač’a-n ašuni-n babi-a r-uqˤi-za yoł
\g gold-GEN1 dagger-and belt-and dad-ERG III.PL-hide-LCV be
\l The golden dagger and the belt are where your father hid them.

\t Mač’a meč’ beč’oƛ, tupi rok’eł c’oxoƛ, ašunä oƛƛo eč’oƛƛin.
\m mač’a meč’ b-eč’-ƛ tupi rok’u-ł c’ox-ƛ ašuni-a oƛƛo eč’-ƛ-ƛin
\g dagger neck III-cut-OPT rifle heart-CONT.ESS hit-OPT belt-ERG middle cut-OPT-QUOT
\l May the dagger cut his neck, may the rifle hit is heart and may the belt cut him in the middle!

\t Žan eƛin eniw ozƛäy gugin.
\m ža-n eƛi-n eniw ozuri-ƛay gugi-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP say-PST.UNW mother eye-SUB.ABL escape-PST.UNW
\l Having said that, the mother disappeared.

\t Aħozä eƛin, adäz di bˤeƛ’ žek’uz mečołer regirxo zowsƛin, neła howži bišʷa rac’akin utik’xanu gugyoq roqłin.
\m aħo-a eƛi-n adäz di bˤeƛ’ žek’u-z moči-łer r-egir-x zow-s-ƛin neła-a howži bišʷa r-ac’-a-kin utik’-x-anu gugu-q r-oq-łin
\g shepherd-ERG say-PST.UNW before me sheep man-GEN2 field-CONT.LAT III.PL-send-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG now food IV-eat-INF-even have.time-IPFV.CVB-NEG back-POSS.ESS IV-become-CNC.CVB
\l The shepherd said: "I sent the sheep to another man's field before, that's why I don't have time to eat food, although it's on my back."

\t Gugyoq ričin łi ħaƛa koƛ’ixanuzogon žek’a eƛin, di ʕumruł sid žek’ur ħaƛa łi teƛinč’uƛin.
\m gugu-q r-iči-n łi ħaƛu-a koƛ’i-xanuzo-gon žek’u-a eƛi-n di ʕumru-ł sida žek’u-r ħaƛu-a łi teƛ-č’u-ƛin
\g back-POSS.ESS IV-be-PFV.CVB water drink-INF understand.to-NEG.PRSPRT.OBL-CNTR man-ERG say-PST.UNW me life-CONT.ESS one.OBL man-LAT drink-INF water give-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The man who couldn't drink the water on his back said: "I didn't give water to anyone for drinking, in my life."

\t Nełƛ’az ʕolo howži hemeł ħalaƛ’or ayäsiƛin.
\m neła-ƛ’az ʕolo howži hemeł ħal-ƛ’or ay-asi-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS.DIST for.the.sake.of now DEM4.IISG.OBL trouble-SUPER.LAT come-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l And now, because of this, I've come into such trouble now.

\t Xizor utin yeda uži raładyoz raʕalłixor aynosi, yoƛixno łäłäzay neła ɣˤanaza esirno, šebi roqä däz esiws užiƛin.
\m xizor uti-n yeda uži raład-z raʕalłi-xor ay-nosi y-oƛix-n łi-łazay neła ɣˤanabi-a esir-n šebi r-oq-a di-z esiw-s uži-ƛin
\g back turn.back-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG boy sea-GEN2 edge-AD.LAT come-ANT.CVB II-appear-PFV.CVB water-CONT.ABL.DIST DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-ERG ask-PST.UNW what IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT me-GEN2 sister-GEN1 boy-QUOT
\l When the boy went back and came to the edge of the sea, that woman appeared out of the water again and asked: "What happened, my nephew?"

\t Raqru šebin nełaqno esin, ik’in yeda iduɣor.
\m r-oq-ru šebin neła-q-n esi-n ik’i-n yeda idu-ɣor
\g IV-happen-PST.PRT thing DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP tell-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG home-IN.ALL
\l He told her what had happened and went home.

\t Babiw ƛ’irir ayrun, žoyä esin nesiq eniya äƛiruxor, wallahi eniwn alžanä yoł.
\m babiw ƛ’iri-r ay-run uži-a esi-n nesi-q eni-a eƛi-ru-xor wallahi eniw-n alžan-a yoł
\g father above-LAT come-IMM.ANT.CVB boy-ERG tell-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS mother-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT by.God mother-TOP paradise-IN.ESS be
\l When the father came, the boy told him what the mother had said: "By God, mother is in heaven!

\t Ža mesedyos mač’an mi raqˤza yoł, mač’a meč’ beč’oƛ, tupi rok’eł č’aq’ˤiƛ, ašunä oƛi eč’oƛƛin eniya eƛisƛin.
\m ža mesed-s mač’a-n mi r-uqˤi-za yoł mač’a meč’ b-eč’-ƛ tupi rok’u-ł č’aq’ˤi-ƛ ašuni-a oƛi eč’-ƛ-ƛin eni-a eƛi-s-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG gold-GEN1 dagger-TOP you IV-hide-LCV be dagger neck III-cut-OPT rifle heart-CONT.ESS hit-OPT belt-ERG half cut-OPT-QUOT mother-ERG say-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Mother said, that golden dagger is where you hide it, may the dagger cut your neck, may the rifle hit your heart and may the belt cut you into halves."

\t Ža xabar žaq esin baqrun, babiws mač’a q’ˤim ret’urxo, tupi rok’eł c’oxxo, ašuno oƛi eč’xo.
\m ža xabar uži-q esi-n b-oq-run babiw-s mač’a q’ˤim r-et’ur-x tupi rok’u-ł c’ox-x ašuni oƛi eč’-x
\g DEM1.SG story boy-POSS.ESS tell-PFV.CVB III-happen-IMM.ANT.CVB father-GEN1 dagger head IV-hack-IPFV.CVB rifle heart-CONT.ESS hit-IPFV.CVB belt half cut-PRS
\l Right after the boy had said that, the fathers dagger cut off his head, the rifle shot his heart and the belt cut him into halves.

\t Eniwrno ʕuraw aq’ˤuba č’aguyaw mixƛ’o babiya teƛxo zown.
\m eniw-r-n ʕuraw aq’ˤuba č’aguyaw mixƛ’o babi-a teƛ-x zow-n
\g mother-LAT-TOP much torture living at.a.time dad-ERG give-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The mother was tortured very much as well by the father, when she was still alive.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder užän, baran kʷarkal anusi ʕumru bižin.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder uži-a-n baru-a-n kʷarkal anu-si ʕumru b-iži-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after boy-ERG-and wife-ERG-and obstacle be.absent-ATTR life III-lead-PST.UNW
\l After this, the boy and his wife lead a life without obstacles.

\t Zownƛax zown anuƛax Mirzaƛin sis žek’u.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax Mirza-ƛin sis žek’u
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT Mirza-QUOT one man
\l Once upon a time there was a man named Mirza.

\t Nesis łˤono ʕomoy zown.
\m nesi-s łˤono ʕomoy zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 three donkey be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had three donkeys.

\t Sida quł Mirza qaca rowanix łˤonontow ʕomoybin rižin ciqaɣor ik’in.
\m sida qu-ł Mirza-a qaca r-ow-ani-x łˤono-n-tow ʕomoy-bi-n r-iži-n ciq-aɣor ik’i-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS Mirza-ERG firewood IV-bring-MSD-AD.ESS three-TOP-EMPH donkey-PL-TOP III.PL-lead-PFV.CVB forest-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l One day, Mirza lead his three donkeys into the forest in order to bring firewood.

\t ʕOmoybin rišʷanix ʕalaxyoƛ’or regirno, ža qaca roda ciqełxor oqno.
\m ʕomoy-bi-n r-iš-ani-x ʕalax-ƛ’or r-egir-n ža qaca r-odi-a ciq-ł-xor oq-n
\g donkey-PL-TOP III.PL-eat-MSD-AD.ESS clearing-SUPER.LAT III.PL-let-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG firewood IV-do-INF forest-CONT.ESS-AD.LAT become-PST.UNW
\l He let the donkeys onto a clearing so they could eat, and went into the forest to collect the firewood.

\t Elo rišxo žedaƛ žedu ʕomoybi yałzay, ƛ’irir bayn boc’ä eƛin, meži di howži rexurno rac’a yołƛin.
\m elo r-iš-x žeda-ƛ žedu ʕomoy-bi yoł-zay ƛ’iri-r b-ay-n boc’i-a eƛi-n meži di howži r-exur-n r-ac’-a yoł-ƛin
\g there III.PL-eat-IPFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUB.ESS DEM1.IPL donkey-PL be-SIM.CVB above-LAT III-come-PFV.CVB wolf-ERG say-PST.UNW you.PL me now III.PL-kill-PFV.CVB III.PL-eat-INF be-QUOT
\l While the donkeys were among themselves there are ate, a wolf came along and said to the donkeys: "I will kill and eat you!"

\t ʕOmoyza nełxor eƛin, howži mi eli rexurnäy, Mirza min bexar.
\m ʕomoy-bi-a neła-xor eƛi-n howži mi eli r-exur-näy Mirza-a mi-n b-exur
\g donkey-PL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-AD.LAT say-PST.UNW now you we III.PL-kill-CND.CVB Mirza-ERG you-TOP III-kill
\l The donkeys said to him: "Now, if you kill us, Mirza will kill you too.

\t Nełƛ’ay neširu, sasiłnosi, rečuƛertow nexnäy rigu ana deberƛin.
\m neła-ƛ’ay neširu sasił-nosi reču-ƛer-tow nex-näy r-igu anu-a mi-r-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL evening get.dark-ANT.CVB cattleshed-SUB.LAT-EMPH come-CND.CVB III.PL-good be.NEG-Q you-LAT-QUOT
\l Above that, wouldn't it be better for you if you come into the cattleshed after it got evening?"

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, eƛin boc’ä, meža mežaƛ’osi cirabi esoƛin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin eƛi-n boc’i-a meža-a meža-ƛ’-si ci-bi esi-o-ƛin
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW wolf-ERG you(II-ERG you(II-SUPER.ESS-ATTR name-PL tell-IMPR-QUOT
\l "If that's the case," said the wolf, "tell me your names!"

\t Sida ʕomoyä eƛin, däƛ’ ci Ħišoƛin yołƛin, sidenägon ʕAbdal yołƛin, łˤora äƛirägon Qˤaƛuƛin yołƛin.
\m sida ʕomoy-a eƛi-n di-ƛ’ ci ħiši-o-ƛin yoł-ƛin sideni-a-gon ʕabdal yoł-ƛin łˤora äƛiru-a-gon qˤaƛu-ƛin yoł-ƛin
\g one.OBL donkey-ERG say-PST.UNW me-SUPER.ESS name lock-IMPR-QUOT be-QUOT the.other.one-ERG-CNTR fool be-QUOT three.OBL ORD-ERG-CNTR shout-QUOT be-QUOT
\l One donkey said: "My name is Hisho [Shut].", another one said: "Mine is Abdal [Idiot]." and the third one said: "I am Qatlhu [Shout]."

\t ʕOmoyzaƛ’osi cirabin riyrno, boc’i boqno ciqaɣor bik’in.
\m ʕomoy-bi-ƛ’-si ci-bi-n r-iyr-n boc’i b-oq-n ciq-aɣor b-ik’i-n
\g donkey-PL-SUPER.ESS-ATTR name-PL-TOP III.PL-learn-PFV.CVB wolf III-become-PFV.CVB forest-IN.VERS III-go-PST.UNW
\l Having learned the names of the donkeys, the wolf went into the forest.

\t Qaca royn łiynosi, ʕomoybin ric’no Mirza ʕaƛaɣor ik’in.
\m qaca r-odi-n łiy-nosi ʕomoy-bi-n r-ic’-n Mirza-a ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-n
\g firewood IV-do-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB donkey-PL-TOP III.PL-fill-PFV.CVB Mirza-ERG village-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l After Mirza finished collecting firewood, he charged the donkeys and went into the village.

\t Neširu, sasiłnosi, ʕomoybi yałru rečuxor boc’i bayn.
\m neširu sasił-nosi ʕomoy-bi yoł-ru reču-xor boc’i b-ay-n
\g evening get.dark-ANT.CVB donkey-PL be-PST.PRT cattleshed-AD.LAT wolf III-come-PST.UNW
\l In the evening, after it got dark, the wolf came to the cattleshed where the donkeys were.

\t Ac ħišäsi yesuzaƛ’, boc’ä qˤaƛin, ħišixosi, ac seroƛin.
\m ac ħiši-asi y-esu-zaƛ’ boc’i-a qˤaƛi-n ħiši-xosi ac seru-o-ƛin
\g door lock-RES.PRT II-exist-CSL.CVB wolf-ERG shout-PST.UNW lock-PRS.PRT door unlock-IMPR-QUOT
\l Because the door was locked, the wolf shouted: "It's locked, unlock the door!"

\t Ac ħišäsi zownč’us yołi mi eli rac’as łemuƛin, tełäzay ʕomoyä žawab teƛno.
\m ac ħiši-asi zow-č’us yołi mi eli r-ac’-as łemu-ƛin teł-azay ʕomoy-a žawab teƛ-n
\g door lock-RES.PRT be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT however you we III.PL-eat-FUT2 otherwise-QUOT inside-IN.ABL.DIST donkey-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "If the door wasn't locked, you would eat us!", answered a donkey from inside.

\t Xizyogon qˤaƛin boc’ä, ʕabdal, ac yaɣˤoƛin.
\m xizyogon qˤaƛi-n boc’i-a ʕabdal ac y-ˤaɣˤi-o-ƛin
\g again shout-PST.UNW wolf-ERG fool door II-open-IMPR-QUOT
\l Again the wolf shouted: "Abdal/Idiot, open the door!"

\t ʕAbdal di zows yołƛin, eƛin ʕomoyä, ciqqotow łemuri mi di bac’ƛin.
\m ʕabdal di zow-s yoł-ƛin eƛi-n ʕomoy-a ciq-q-tow łemu-ri mi di b-ac’-ƛin
\g fool me be.NPRS-PST.WIT be-QUOT say-PST.UNW donkey-ERG forest-POSS.ESS-EMPH otherwise-IRR you me III-eat-QUOT
\l "If I were a fool," said a donkey, "you would've eaten me in the forest."

\t Łox äƛirugon boc’ä rečuƛxor qˤaƛin, qˤaƛanayxosi, di tełxor begirƛin.
\m łox äƛiru-gon boc’i-a reču-ƛxor qˤaƛi-n qˤaƛanad-xosi di teł-xor b-egir-ƛin
\g thrice ORD-CNTR wolf-ERG cattleshed-SUB.LAT shout-PST.UNW yell-PRS.PRT me inside-AD.LAT III-let-QUOT
\l For the third time, the wolf shouted into the cattleshed: "Shout, let me inside!"

\t Łˤora äƛiru ʕomoyä žawab teƛno, di qˤaƛanayru mixƛ’o, deber roqxosi šebin rukay hoboyƛin.
\m łˤora eƛi-ru ʕomoy-a žawab teƛ-n di qˤaƛanad-ru mixƛ’o mi-r r-oq-xosi šebin r-ukad hoboy-ƛin
\g three.OBL say-PST.PRT donkey-ERG answer give-PST.UNW me yell-PST.PRT late.at.night you-LAT IV-happen-PRS.PRT thing IV-see now-QUOT
\l The third donkey answered: "When I cry late at night, you'll see what happens then!"

\t Žan eƛin, ʕomoyä baqruce haraƛ’no boyn ħoʕoƛin.
\m ža-n eƛi-n ʕomoy-a b-oq-ru-ace haraƛ’-n b-odi-n ħoʕoƛi-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP say-PST.UNW donkey-ERG III-become-PST.PRT-TERM voice-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB shout-PST.UNW
\l The donkey said that, and shouted as loud as he could.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder łinasnokin ħinq’i anusi ciqaɣor ʕomoybin rik’ix zown.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder łina-s-n-kin ħinq’i anu-si ciq-aɣor ʕomoy-bi-n r-ik’i-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after what.ERG-GEN1-TOP-even danger be.absent-ATTR forest-IN.VERS donkey-PL-TOP III.PL-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After that, the donkeys went into the forest without any danger.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Esin šebi, xecin šebi sis zown ɣˤanabi.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi sis zow-n ɣˤanabi
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what one be.NPRS-PST.UNW woman
\l Once upon a time, there was a woman.

\t Nełas ʕoƛno uži gurow siskin kid zown anu.
\m neła-s ʕoƛno uži gurow siskin kid zow-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 seven son except any daughter be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l Except her seven sons, she didn't have any daughter.

\t Sida quł yedu dibirder yik’in, där kid yodixosi sabaw caxoƛin.
\m sida qu-ł yedu dibir-der y-ik’i-n di-r kid y-odi-xosi sabaw cax-o-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IISG imam-APUD.LAT II-go-PST.UNW me-LAT daughter II-do-PRS.PRT amulet write-IMPR-QUOT
\l One day she went to the imam [and said]: "Write me an amulet, which lets me have a daughter!"

\t Dibirä eƛin, mužmarƛ’o yik’in hemeła kikxay mi łi ħaƛunäy, deber kid yadiƛin.
\m dibir-a eƛi-n mužmar-ƛ’ y-ik’i-n hemeła kik-xay mi łi ħaƛu-näy mi-r kid y-odi-ƛin
\g imam-ERG say-PST.UNW Friday-SUPER.ESS II-go-PFV.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL spring-AD.ABL you water drink-CND.CVB you-LAT daughter II-do-QUOT
\l The imam said: "When you go on Friday and drink water out of that spring, you will have a daughter."

\t Dibirä äƛiruxor, kikxay neła ɣˤanaza yik’in łi ħaƛun.
\m dibir-a eƛi-ru-xor kik-xay neła ɣˤanabi-a y-ik’i-n łi ħaƛu-n
\g imam-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT spring-AD.ABL DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-ERG II-go-PFV.CVB water drink-PST.UNW
\l As the imam said, the woman went to drink water out of the spring.

\t Oč’ira beciƛ’azay, nełar bercinaw kid yodin, ruy nełas sistow sis ƛ’oq’ˤa ozuri zown.
\m oč’ira buci-ƛ’azay neła-r bercinaw kid y-odi-n r-uy neła-s sis-tow sis ƛ’oq’ˤo-a ozuri zow-n
\g nine month-SUPER.ABL.DIST DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT beautiful daughter II-do-PFV.CVB IV-just DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 one-EMPH one forehead-IN.ESS eye be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Nine months later, a beautiful daughter was born to her, just that she had only one eye on the forehead.

\t Neła ɣˤanazas raq’ˤu bˤeƛ’ zown.
\m neła ɣˤanabi-s r-aq’ˤu bˤeƛ’ zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-GEN1 III.PL-many sheep be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l That woman had many sheep.

\t Sida zamanałäy, ža bˤeƛ’ ɣudƛ’ay ɣudƛ’or dahełxo rik’a roqno.
\m sida zaman-łay ža bˤeƛ’ ɣudi-ƛ’ay ɣudi-ƛ’or daheł-x r-ik’i-a r-oq-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ABL DEM1.SG sheep day-SUPER.ABL day-SUPER.LAT decrease-IPFV.CVB III.PL-go-INF III.PL-begin-PST.UNW
\l After a while, the sheep began to become fewer from day to day.

\t Sida quł eženi uži ɣudod xal boda ik’inosi, rečuƛ cemä yisir sis ozuri yołali nesistow esiw yukayn ƛ’ariyaw beƛ’q’ˤu łet’ix.
\m sida qu-ł eže-ni uži ɣudod xal b-odi-a ik’i-nosi reču-ƛ cemi-a yisi-r sis ozuri yoł-ali nesi-s-tow esiw y-ukad-n ƛ’ariyaw bˤeƛ’q’ˤu łet’i-x
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS old-DEF son at.midnight examination III-do-INF go-ANT.CVB cattleshed-SUB.ESS corner-IN.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT one eye be-ATTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH sister II-see-PST.UNW fat sheep pick-IPFV.CVB
\l One day, when the oldest son went to check it out at midnight, in a corner of the shed he saw his one-eyed sister picking a fat sheep.

\t Neła ža beƛ’q’ˤu bac’anix łet’ix yałrułi nesir čuqˤnosi, c’eruc’a caƛin.
\m neła-a ža bˤeƛ’q’ˤu b-ac’-ani-x łet’i-x yoł-rułi nesi-r čuqˤ-nosi c’eruc’a caƛi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG sheep III-eat-MSD-AD.ESS pick-IPFV.CVB be-MSD DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT notice-ANT.CVB bow shoot.with-PST.UNW
\l When he noticed that she was picking that sheep in order to eat it, he shot with his bow.

\t Kid yoxin yik’in rikinä kecno yičin.
\m kid y-oxi-n y-ik’i-n rikini-a kec-n y-iči-n
\g girl II-run.away-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB cradle-IN.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB II-be-PST.UNW
\l The girl ran away and went to sleep in her cradle.

\t Sasaq idurno ik’in užä eniwq esin kidbełäy, bˤeƛ’ rac’xosi boc’i” idutow zown, gugira yay ža yiłzaqayƛin.
\m sasaq idu-r-n ik’i-n uži-a eniw-q esi-n kid-łay bˤeƛ’ r-ac’-xosi boc’i idu-tow zow-n gugi-r-a y-ay ža yiła-bi-qay-ƛin
\g in.the.morning home-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB boy-ERG mother-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW girl-CONT.ABL sheep III.PL-eat-PRS.PRT wolf home-EMPH be.NPRS-PFV.CVB escape-CAUS-INF II-must DEM1.SG DEM2.IISG.OBL-PL-POSS.ABL-QUOT
\l In the morning, the boy went home and told his mother of the girl: "The 'wolf' who eats the sheep was in our home, it has to be removed from this place."

\t Yedu gugirzaƛ’or diƛin, eƛin eniya cimyarno yizin, ʕoƛnon meži gugiranƛin.
\m yedu gugi-r-zaƛ’or di-ƛin eƛi-n eni-a cim-ar-n y-izi-n ʕoƛno-n meži gugi-r-an-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG escape-CAUS-POST.CVB me-QUOT say-PST.UNW mother-ERG malice-IN.LAT-TOP II-get.up-PFV.CVB seven-TOP you.PL escape-CAUS-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l "Before I chase her away," said the mother in anger, "I will chase you seven away as well!"

\t Eniya äƛiru rožbin rok’er ʕeze roqinč’ey, eženi užä eniwq q’ˤano magalun hunixor ererno, iday maħor oqno.
\m eni-a eƛi-ru roži-bi-n rok’u-r ʕeze r-oq-č’ey eže-ni uži-a eniw-q q’ˤano magalu-n huni-xor er-r-n idu-ay maħor oq-n
\g mother-ERG say-PST.PRT word-PL-TOP heart-LAT be.enough IV.PL-become-NEG.PST.CVB old-DEF son-ERG mother-POSS.ESS two bread-TOP way-AD.LAT put-CAUS-PFV.CVB home-IN.ABL outside become-PST.UNW
\l The words that the mother had spoken didn't please his heart enough, so the oldest son let the mother give two breads to him for the way and left the home.

\t Elus sis ħon xecin, žek’us q’ˤano xecin sida baydanƛ’or ayn.
\m elu-s sis ħon xeci-n žek’u-s q’ˤano xeci-n sida baydan-ƛ’or ay-n
\g we(I).OBL-GEN1 one mountain leave-PFV.CVB man-GEN1 two leave-PFV.CVB one.OBL field-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He left our one mountain and two other mountains behind him and came to a field.

\t ƛ’iri xabarkin boynč’ey yeda razin oqno, hunixor eniya erno zowali žedu q’ˤunqorno sist’a magalabin teƛno.
\m ƛ’iri xabar-kin b-odi-č’ey yeda razi-n oq-n huni-xor eni-a er-n zow-ali žedu q’ˤuna-qor-n sist’a magalu-bi-n teƛ-n
\g above story-even III-do-NEG.PST.CVB DEM2.ISG agree-TOP become-PFV.CVB way-AD.LAT mother-ERG put-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-ATTR DEM1.IPL two.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP one.at.a.time bread-PL-TOP give-PST.UNW
\l Without further discussion he agreed and gave the breads that his mother made for the way to the two of them, one for each.

\t Yizä yeda uži, elus ʕeziyaw maʕišatno yołƛin, žeda žedude iduɣorno ižin, deber rätiru šeƛ’u łet’in šeƛ’oƛin bitazoni ɣˤutka tełer egirno.
\m yizi-a yeda uži elu-s ʕeziyaw maʕišat-n yoł-ƛin žeda-a žedu-de idu-ɣor-n iži-n mi-r r-eti-ru šeƛ’u łet’i-n šeƛ’u-o-ƛin bitasi-ni ɣˤutku-a tełer egir-n
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG boy we(I).OBL-GEN1 many fortune-TOP be-QUOT DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS home-IN.ALL-TOP lead-PFV.CVB you-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT clothing pick-PFV.CVB put.on-IMPR-QUOT next-DEF room-IN.ESS into let-PST.UNW
\l They lead this boy into their own home[, saying]: "We're very rich, pick any clothes you want and put them on.", and let him into the next room.

\t Hemedur riguƛ’ay rigu rac’xo, riguƛ’ay rigu šeƛ’ux yisi žoyä yizide šomoƛa buci boɣno.
\m hemedur r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu r-ac’-x r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu šeƛ’u-x yisi uži-a yizi-de šomo-ƛa buci b-oɣ-n
\g so IV-good-SUPER.ABL IV-good IV-eat-IPFV.CVB IV-good-SUPER.ABL IV-good put.on-IPFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS how.many-INDEF month III-spend.time-PST.UNW
\l So, eating the best [food] and wearing the best [clothes], the boy spent many months with them.

\t Där eniwn, esnabin bukada betinƛin.
\m di-r eniw-n esyu-bi-n b-ukad-a b-eti-n-ƛin
\g me-LAT mother-and brother-PL-and I.PL-see-INF I.PL-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l I wanted to see my mother and my brothers."

\t Ozatawni eniya eƛin, ʕaƛaɣor ik’iłin, deber mežiz iday gurow kanłi bukaynč’i.
\m ozuri-taw-ni eni-a eƛi-n ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-łin mi-r meži-z idu-ay gurow kanłi b-ukad-č’i
\g eye-without-DEF mother-ERG say-PST.UNW village-IN.VERS go-CNC.CVB you-LAT you.PL-GEN2 home-IN.ABL except light III-see-NEG.FUT
\l The blind mother said: "Although you go into the village, you will only see the light of your home.

\t ʕAdada huni raq debiƛin.
\m ʕadada huni r-oq mi-s-ƛin
\g to.no.purpose way IV-become you-GEN1-QUOT
\l Your way will be of no purpose.

\t Šebi royłin yeda uži ik’inč’ey ičinanu.
\m šebi r-odi-łin yeda uži ik’i-č’ey iči-n-anu
\g what IV-do-CNC.CVB DEM2.ISG boy go-NEG.PST.CVB be-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l No matter what to do, the boy had to go.

\t Ik’in, neširur yeda ʕaƛ bukayza mečoƛ’or aynosi, yizzoxay gurow č’ura rukayx zownanu.
\m ik’i-n neširu-r yeda ʕaƛ b-ukad-za moči-ƛ’or ay-nosi yizi-zo-xay gurow č’ura r-ukad-x zow-n-anu
\g go-PFV.CVB evening-LAT DEM2.ISG village III-see-LCV place-SUPER.LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ATTR.OBL-AD.ABL except light IV-see-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l He went on and in the evening, when he came to a place where he could see the village, he saw only light coming from his [house].

\t Neł č’uramxor ɣˤutkoxorno ik’in akäz ezunosi, sis ozuri yołali esiya q’ˤiryoƛ’ geler žek’uzas q’ˤimbi kurxo yukayn.
\m neła č’ura-xor ɣˤutku-xor-n ik’i-n aki-az ezu-nosi sis ozuri yoł-ali esyu-a q’ˤir-ƛ’ geler žek’u-bi-s q’ˤim-bi kur-x y-ukad-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL light-AD.LAT house-AD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB window-IN.ESS.DIST look-ANT.CVB one eye be-ATTR sister-ERG floor-SUPER.ESS head.over.heals man-PL-GEN1 head-PL throw-IPFV.CVB II-see-PST.UNW
\l He went to the house with light, looked into the window and saw his one-eyed sister throwing people's heads over the floor.

\t Mada gulun bicin tełxor ik’anix ac žek’nosi, neła žedu q’ˤimbi taxeƛ ruqˤno.
\m ma-a gulu-n b-ici-n teł-xor ik’i-ani-x ac žek’-nosi neła-a žedu q’ˤim-bi tax-ƛ r-uqˤi-n
\g gate-IN.ESS horse-TOP III-tie-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT go-MSD-AD.ESS door beat-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IIPL head-PL ottoman-SUB.ESS IV.PL-hide-PST.UNW
\l He tied the horse outside to the gate and when he knocked on the door to go inside, she hid the heads under the sofa.

\t Idurno yayngon yiła, mi gulu bayrno zown anuwaƛin, esiwqor eƛinosi, nesir neła gulu bac’rułi čuqˤno.
\m idu-r-n y-ay-n-gon yiła-a mi gulu b-ayr-n zow-n anu-a-ƛin esiw-qor eƛi-nosi nesi-r neła-a gulu b-ac’-rułi čuqˤ-n
\g home-LAT-TOP II-come-PFV.CVB-CNTR DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG you horse III-bring-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-Q-QUOT brother-POSS.LAT say-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG horse III-eat-MSD notice-PST.UNW
\l When she went back into the house and said to the brother: "Didn't you bring a horse along?", he noticed that she had eaten the horse.

\t Deber di łi rowa yik’ixƛin esiwqorno eƛin yedu maħor yoqno.
\m mi-r di łi r-ow-a y-ik’i-x-ƛin esiw-qor-n eƛi-n yedu maħor y-oq-n
\g you-LAT me water IV-bring-INF II-go-PRS-QUOT brother-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG outside II-become-PST.UNW
\l "I go to bring you some water." she said to her brother and went outside.

\t Hemełƛ’o boƛixno awä k’eneč’no, mešno, gagaru ɣˤulno yayrno užiqor eƛin, xexłiƛ’ yiła ɣˤutkay maħor ik’inč’inäy, esiw yayrun neła mi exura yoł.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ b-oƛix-n aw-a k’eneč’-n meš-n gagaru ɣˤul-n y-ayr-n uži-qor eƛi-n xexłi-ƛ’ yiła ɣˤutku-ay maħor ik’i-č’i-näy esiw y-ay-run neła-a mi exur-a yoł
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS III-appear-PFV.CVB mouse-ERG egg-and broom-and smooth stone-and II-bring-PFV.CVB boy-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB quickness-SUPER.ESS DEM2.IISG.OBL house-IN.ABL outside go-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB sister II-come-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you kill-INF be
\l At this time, a mouse appeared bringing an egg, a broom and a smooth stone, and said to the boy: "If you don't get out of the house quickly, your sister will kill you when she comes back.

\t T’ok’ow debeł xizay esiwn nexa k’ʷeze yaqinč’iƛin.
\m t’ok’ow mi-ł xizay esiw-n nex-a k’ʷeze y-oq-č’i-ƛin
\g anymore you-CONT.ESS behind sister-TOP come-INF can II-become-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l Then your sister won't be able to follow you anymore."

\t Idur aynosigon, yexurno ža k’eneč’ žeduz ozzaq yiħoƛin.
\m idu-r ay-nosi-gon y-exur-n ža k’eneč’ žedu-z ozuri-bi-q y-iħi-o-ƛin
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB-CNTR II-kill-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG egg DEM1.IIPL-GEN2 eye-PL-POSS.ESS II-smear-IMPR-QUOT
\l "After you come home, crack the egg and smear it on their eyes."

\t Ža xabarno esin, aw adäzay gugin.
\m ža xabar-n esi-n aw ad-azay gugi-n
\g DEM1.SG story-TOP tell-PFV.CVB mouse in.front-IN.ABL.DIST escape-PST.UNW
\l Having told this, the mouse ran out of sight.

\t Yiła äƛiru šebin bit’araw räsuƛin, žas rok’ƛ’orno rayn, xexłiƛ’ maħor oqno.
\m yiła-a eƛi-ru šebin bit’araw r-esu-ƛin uži-s rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n xexłi-ƛ’ maħor oq-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT thing true IV-appear-QUOT boy-GEN1 heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB quickness-SUPER.ESS outside become-PST.UNW
\l "What it said, might be true!", thought the boy and went outside quickly.

\t Łäs tungin bic’no nexxo yedu yukayrun, yeda nełqay oxin ik’iƛ’oräy, mi ži daqäy ok’ła moči anuƛin, tungin q’ˤidar kurno yeɣeni esiw xizay k’oƛin.
\m łi-s tungi-n b-ic’-n nex-x yedu y-ukad-run yeda neła-qay oxi-n ik’i-ƛ’oräy mi ži di-qay ok’eł-a moči anu-ƛin tungi-n q’ˤida-r kur-n y-eɣe-ni esiw xizay k’oƛi-n
\g water-GEN1 copper.jug-TOP III-fill-PFV.CVB come-IPFV.CVB DEM2.IISG II-see-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL run.away-PFV.CVB go-SIM.CVB you now me-POSS.ABL escape-INF place be.NEG-QUOT copper.jug-TOP down-LAT throw-PFV.CVB II-young-DEF sister behind run-PST.UNW
\l When he saw his younger sister coming back with a copper jug filled with water, he ran away from her, while she said: "Now there's no place you could escape from me [to]!", threw the jug down and ran behind him.

\t Ža igor yayƛ’oräy, awä äƛiruxor, meš kurnosi nełał adäz žopono ciq roƛixno.
\m ža igo-r y-ay-ƛ’oräy aw-a eƛi-ru-xor meš kur-nosi neła-ł adäz žopono ciq r-oƛix-n
\g DEM1.SG near-LAT II-come-SIM.CVB mouse-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT broom throw-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before dense forest IV-appear-PST.UNW
\l When she came near, he - as the mouse had said - threw the broom and before her appeared a dense forest.

\t Nar yik’a koƛ’inč’ey, sasiw ɣudin roqzaƛ’, ža kid sasaqor ciqqotow ƛexun.
\m nar y-ik’i-a koƛ’i-č’ey sasiw ɣudi-n r-oq-zaƛ’ ža kid sasaq-qor ciq-q-tow ƛexu-n
\g where II-go-INF understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB gloomy day-TOP IV-become-CSL.CVB DEM1.SG girl in.the.morning-POSS.LAT forest-POSS.ESS-EMPH remain-PST.UNW
\l Not knowing where to go, and because the day became gloomy, the girl stayed in the forest until morning.

\t Neł zamanał nesä ʕuraw huni xecin.
\m neła zaman-ł nesi-a ʕuraw huni xeci-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL time-CONT.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG much way leave-PST.UNW
\l At this time, he already went quite far.

\t Sasaqgon yizin nesił xizay yeɣeni esiw yoƛixnosi, yisä gagaruni ɣˤul kurno.
\m sasaq-gon y-izi-n nesi-ł xizay y-eɣe-ni esiw y-oƛix-nosi yisa-a gagaru-ni ɣˤul kur-n
\g in.the.morning-CNTR II-get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind II-young-DEF sister II-appear-ANT.CVB he-ERG smooth-DEF stone throw-PST.UNW
\l When it got morning and his younger sister appeared behind him, he threw the smooth stone.

\t Nełał adäz osiw, gagaru ħon yoqno.
\m neła-ł adäz osiw gagaru ħon y-oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before high smooth mountain II-become-PST.UNW
\l And before her, a high and smooth mountain came into being.

\t Nełaq soder yizin ƛ’iri kosyar yayƛ’oräy, pˤaƛirno ƛ’iräy wˤałertow yik’ix zown.
\m neła-q soder y-izi-n ƛ’iri kos-r y-ay-ƛ’oräy pˤaƛir-n ƛ’iräy wˤał-r-tow y-ik’i-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS upward II-get.up-PFV.CVB above peak-LAT II-come-SIM.CVB glide.off-PFV.CVB from.above downward-LAT-EMPH II-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l When she climbed up the mountain, she glided off again.

\t Asoqtow bitin žedu ɣˤaɣˤu bizizaq, qiƛ’orok’uƛ’äy ƛ’irir best’alawni uži ayzaƛ’.
\m as-q-tow b-iti-n žedu ɣˤaɣˤu b-izi-zaq qiƛ’orok’uƛ’äy ƛ’iri-r best’alaw-ni uži ay-zaƛ’
\g sky-POSS.ESS-EMPH III-touch-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL be.happy I.PL-get.up-CSL.CVB by.chance above-LAT step-DEF son come-CSL.CVB
\l They were happy sky-high, when their step-son happened to come.

\t Idur ayruntow yexurno k’eneč’ žedu q’ˤunzontow ozzaq yiħinosi, sider sis bukayłin, ɣudi qˤašizaƛ’orkin žedu bužzi boqno anu, ozzałer kanłi baysƛin, hemece ɣˤaɣˤu bizizaq.
\m idu-r ay-run-tow y-exur-n k’eneč’ žedu q’ˤuna-zo-n-tow ozuri-bi-q y-iħi-nosi sida-r sis b-ukad-łin ɣudi qˤaši-zaƛ’or-kin žedu bužzi b-oq-n anu ozuri-bi-łer kanłi b-ay-s-ƛin hemece ɣˤaɣˤu b-izi-zaq
\g home-LAT come-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH II-kill-PFV.CVB egg DEM1.IPL.OBL two.OBL-ATTR.OBL-TOP-EMPH eye-PL-POSS.ESS II-smear-ANT.CVB one.OBL-LAT one I.PL-see-CNC.CVB day dawn-POST.CVB-even DEM1.IPL trust I.PL-become-PST.UNW be.NEG eye-PL-CONT.LAT light III-come-PST.WIT-QUOT as.many be.happy I.PL-get.up-CSL.CVB
\l After he came home, he crushed an egg, smeared it on each of their eyes, and although they could see each other again, they couldn't believe it when it got dawn, and were even more happy when the light came into their eyes.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder łˤoran łinasno q’ʷariłi anusi ʕumru bižix zown.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder łˤora-n łina-s-n q’ʷariłi anu-si ʕumru b-iži-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after three.OBL-TOP what.OBL-GEN1-TOP sadness be.absent-ATTR life III-lead-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After that, the three lead a life without any sadness.

\t Kʷaxatow sida igozo ʕaƛay nesi žax łet’in sis bercinaw kidno yown.
\m kʷaxa-tow sida igo-zo ʕaƛ-ay nesi uži-x łet’i-n sis bercinaw kid-n y-ow-n
\g soon-EMPH one.OBL near-ATTR.OBL village-IN.ABL DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-AD.ESS pick-PFV.CVB one beautiful girl-TOP II-marry-PST.UNW
\l Soon, that boy picked a beautiful girl from the neighboring village and married her.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Žedus iłno uži zown.
\m žedu-s iłno uži zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL-GEN1 six son be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They had six sons.

\t Hič’č’a eženi uži balahce siħiraw zown, hudu nesiqor C’irduxƛin eƛix zown.
\m hič’č’a eže-ni uži balah-ce siħiraw zow-n hudu nesi-qor C’irdux-ƛin eƛi-x zow-n
\g the.most old-DEF son misfortune-EQU1 cunning be.NPRS-PFV.CVB so DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT Tsirdukh-QUOT say-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The oldest son was cunning like a misfortune, so they called him Tsirdukh.

\t Harihun maʕišat bodix bäčiru yizirabi, sida quł xizor rutixanusi roƛnin c’oxno babiwn eniwn bexun iłnon esnabi best’alłiƛ’ ƛexun.
\m harihun maʕišat b-odi-x b-iči-ru yizirabi sida qu-ł xizor r-uti-xanusi roƛni-n c’ox-n babiw-n eniw-n b-exu-n iłno-n esyu-bi best’alłi-ƛ’ ƛexu-n
\g slowly fortune III-do-IPFV.CVB III-be-PST.PRT DEM2.IIPL one.OBL day-CONT.ESS back IV-turn.back-NEG.PRS.PRT disease-TOP hit-PFV.CVB father-and mother-and I.PL-die-PFV.CVB six-TOP brother-PL orphanhood-SUPER.ESS remain-PST.UNW
\l They slowly made their fortune, and one day an irreversible disease hit them and the father and the mother died, so the six brothers remained orphans.

\t C’ik’iw qizanyos q’ʷariłi C’irduxƛ’or bˤoƛ’un.
\m c’ik’iw qizan-s q’ʷariłi C’irdux-ƛ’or b-ˤoƛ’u-n
\g all family-GEN1 sadness Tsirdukh-SUPER.LAT III-fall-PST.UNW
\l All the family's sadness fell unto Tsirdukh.

\t Sida ɣudi bik’in, q’ˤuna ɣudi bik’in łˤora äƛiza ɣudiƛ’o yizirabi sidaɣ qunyoxor bayn.
\m sida ɣudi b-ik’i-n q’ˤuna ɣudi b-ik’i-n łˤora eƛi-za ɣudi-ƛ’ yizirabi sidaɣ qun-xor b-ay-n
\g one.OBL day I.PL-go-PFV.CVB two.OBL day I.PL-go-PFV.CVB three.OBL say-LCV day-SUPER.ESS DEM2.IIPL in.one.place farmstead-AD.LAT III-come-PST.UNW
\l They went one day, they went two days, and on the third day they came to a farmstead somewhere.

\t Ža Qartay zown.
\m ža Qartay zow-n
\g DEM1.SG Qartay be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l That was Qartay (the witch).

\t Ha, mežus huni regiroƛ, naɣor bik’ixƛin, esirno neła Qartayä.
\m ha mežu-s huni r-egir-ƛ na-aɣor b-ik’i-x-ƛin esir-n neła Qartay-a
\g well you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 way IV-send-OPT where-IN.VERS I.PL-go-PRS-QUOT ask-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL Qartay-ERG
\l "Well, may you go your way, where are you going?", asked Qartay.

\t Walah, eli paydax boqsi.
\m walla eli payda-x b-oq-s
\g wallah we use-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PST.WIT
\l "By God, we became...(???)

\t Ħalt’in bodan dandi keze roqnäy, barubin rižanƛin, eƛin C’irduxä nełqor.
\m ħalt’i-n b-odi-an dandi keze r-oq-näy baru-bi-n r-iži-an-ƛin eƛi-n C’irdux-a neła-qor
\g work-TOP III-do-FUT.CVB regularly meet II.PL-become-CND.CVB wife-PL-TOP II.PL-take.out-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW Tsirdukh-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l "When we find some work to do [regularly?], we will find some wives.", said Tsirdukh to her.

\t Horo dädäɣor.
\m horo di-däɣor
\g come.IMPR me-APUD.VERS
\l "Come to me!

\t Beynoda retinäy däde mežur ħalt’in yoł, deytow iłno kidno yoł mežux regiranixƛin, eƛin yiła yizirabi iduɣor bižin.
\m b-eynod-a r-eti-näy di-de mežu-r ħalt’i-n yoł di-s-tow iłno kid-n yoł mežu-x r-egir-ani-x-ƛin eƛi-n yiła-a yizirabi idu-ɣor b-iži-n
\g I.PL-work-INF IV-want-CND.CVB me-APUD.ESS you(I).PL.OBL-LAT work-and be me-GEN1-EMPH six daughter-and be you(I).PL.OBL-AD.ESS IV.PL-let-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.PL home-IN.ALL I.PL-lead-PST.UNW
\l If you want to work, there's work for you at my place, and also my six daughters to be sent to you." she said and let them into her home.

\t C’irdux bˤeƛ’es aħołun keze oqno.
\m C’irdux bˤeƛ’-s aħo-łun keze oq-n
\g Tsirdukh sheep-GEN1 shepherd-LHUN meet become-PST.UNW
\l Tsirdukh got to work as a shepherd.

\t Yizä ɣudes sist’a bˤeƛ’es šebin rac’xot’a zown.
\m yizi-a ɣudes sist’a bˤeƛ’-s šebin r-ac’-x-t’a zow-n
\g DEM2.IPL-ERG daily one.at.a.time sheep-GEN1 thing IV-eat-IPFV.CVB-DISTR be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Everyday they ate one sheep, one at a time.

\t Xizyo C’irduxä yiłaqor eƛin, ele dowde beynoyx eluq ƛˤebno yays, howži bayru q’ut’imoxor elux debi kidbabin regir, elurno ela eluz ʕaƛaɣorno bik’in maʕišat boda retinƛin.
\m xizyo C’irdux-a yiła-qor eƛi-n ele mi-de b-eynod-x elu-q ƛˤeb-n y-ay-s howži b-ay-ru q’ut’i-xor elu-x mi-s kid-bi-n r-egir elu-r-n ela-a elu-z ʕaƛ-aɣor-n b-ik’i-n maʕišat b-odi-a r-eti-n-ƛin
\g afterwards Tsirdukh-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW here you-APUD.ESS I.PL-work-IPFV.CVB we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS year-TOP II-come-PST.WIT now I.PL-come-PST.PRT agreement-AD.LAT we(I).OBL-AD.ESS you-GEN1 daughter-PL-TOP II.PL-send we(I).OBL-LAT-TOP we(II-ERG we(I).OBL-GEN2 village-IN.VERS-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB fortune III-do-INF IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l Afterwards, Tsirdukh said to her: "One year has passed that we worked here at your place, now we've come, so give us your daughters according to the agreement, we want to go back into our village to make a fortune."

\t Sosi di posurƛ’o yeza yik’anƛin, Qartay maħorno yoqno, kʷaxatow xizor yutin yayn eƛin, rečuƛerƛa yaynč’u.
\m sosi di posu-ƛ’ y-ezu-a y-ik’i-an-ƛin Qartay maħor-n y-oq-n kʷaxa-tow xizor y-uti-n y-ay-n eƛi-n reču-ƛer-ƛa y-ay-č’u
\g at.first me cattle-SUPER.ESS II-look-INF II-go-FUT.DEF-QUOT Qartay outside-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB soon-EMPH back II-return-PFV.CVB II-come-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW cattleshed-SUB.LAT-INDEF II-come-NEG.PST.WIT
\l "First I will go to have to look for the cattle", Qartay went outside and soon returned, saying: "I didn't come into the shed.

\t Däz beženi ɣˤʷačulis madaxortow ɣˤʷačni teqzaƛ’ tełxorkin yik’inč’uƛin.
\m di-z b-eže-ni ɣˤʷačuli-s ma-xor-tow ɣˤʷačni teq-zaƛ’ teł-xor-kin y-ik’i-č’u-ƛin
\g me-GEN2 III-old-DEF he.goat-GEN1 door-AD.LAT-EMPH chewing hear-CSL.CVB inside-AD.LAT-even II-go-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Because I heard the chewing of my old goat at the door, I didn't go inside.

\t Neširu yizirabi nasin sadaq kecerno.
\m neširu yizirabi nasin sadaq kec-r-n
\g evening DEM2.PL all together sleep-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l In the evening they all went to sleep together

\t Sida puƛ’aza užibi, sida puƛ’aza žeduz annazaqar annabin rutirno kidbabi.
\m sida pu-ƛ’aza uži-bi sida pu-ƛ’aza žedu-z anna-bi-qar anna-bi-n r-utir-n kid-bi
\g one.OBL side-SUPER.VERS.DIST boy-PL one.OBL side-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 knee-PL-POSS.VERS knee-PL-TOP II.PL-gather-PST.UNW girl-PL
\l On one side the boys had gathered and on one side, knee next to knee, gathered the girls.

\t C’ik’iw moƛa bisnosi, geres ħosno bisno Qartayä ɣoɣorik’anix pečma teł ʕamoƛ’ erno.
\m c’ik’iw moƛu b-is-nosi ger-s ħos-n b-is-n Qartay-a ɣoɣorik’-ani-x peč-a teł ʕam-ƛ’ er-n
\g all sleep I.PL-take-ANT.CVB iron-GEN1 stick-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB Qartay-ERG make.red.hot-MSD-AD.ESS oven-IN.ESS inside coal-SUPER.ESS put-PST.UNW
\l After everyone went to sleep, Qartay took an iron stick and put it on some coals inside the oven to make it red-hot.

\t Ža ħos ɣoɣoriłnosi, yiła žeduq esirno, šebi izäsi, šebi kecäsi yołƛin.
\m ža ħos ɣoɣorił-nosi yiła-a žedu-q esir-n šebi izi-asi šebi kec-asi yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG stick become.red.hot-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW who get.up-RES.PRT who sleep-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l When the stick has become red-hot, she asked them: "Who is awake and who is sleeping?"

\t Izäsi C’irdux, q’ˤuyasinibi kecäsiƛin, C’irduxä žawab bodin.
\m izi-asi C’irdux q’ˤuya-si-ni-bi kec-asi-ƛin C’irdux-a žawab b-odi-n
\g get.up-RES.PRT Tsirdukh other-ATTR-DEF-PL sleep-RES.PRT-QUOT Tsirdukh-ERG answer III-do-PST.UNW
\l "Tsirdukh is awake, the others are sleeping." answered Tsirdukh.

\t Waħ, šebi nesir roqnoƛin, Qartayä esirno.
\m waħ šebi nesi-r r-oq-n-ƛin Qartay-a esir-n
\g whoa who DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-happen-PST.UNW-QUOT Qartay-ERG ask-PST.UNW
\l "Oh, what happened with it?", said Qartay.

\t Eli keca adäz, eniya bexayn baħirno c’uda ƛeli neƛxosi.
\m eli kec-a adäz eni-a b-exʷad-n b-aħi-r-n c’uda ƛeli neƛ-xosi
\g we sleep-INF before mother-ERG III-slaughter-PFV.CVB III-cook-CAUS-PFV.CVB red lamb give-PRS.PRT
\l "Before we slept, our mother slaughtered, cooked and gave us the hot lamb.

\t Ža däz rok’ƛ’or baysƛin, C’irduxä eƛin.
\m ža di-z rok’u-ƛ’or b-ay-s-ƛin C’irdux-a eƛi-n
\g DEM1.SG me-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT III-come-PST.WIT-QUOT Tsirdukh-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l That's what I remembered.", Tsirdukh said.

\t Žan bac’nogon yiziri kecno.
\m ža-n b-ac’-n-gon yiziri kec-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP III-eat-PFV.CVB-CNTR they sleep-PST.UNW
\l After having eaten it, they went to sleep.

\t Boƛƛogon zaman bik’inosi, hemedurtow sosigon neła esirno.
\m b-oƛƛo-gon zaman b-ik’i-nosi hemedur-tow sosi-gon neła-a esir-n
\g III-middle-CNTR time III-go-ANT.CVB so-EMPH again-CNTR DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW
\l After a while, she asked it again.

\t C’irduxän adäza biłetown žawab teƛno.
\m C’irdux-a-n adäza b-iłe-tow-n žawab teƛ-n
\g Tsirdukh-Q-TOP before III-as-EMPH-TOP answer give-PST.UNW
\l And Tsirdukh gave the same answer as before.

\t Waħ, žigon šebitow nesir retinƛin, esirno neła.
\m waħ žigon šebi-tow nesi-r r-eti-n-ƛin esir-n neła-a
\g whoa again.now what-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT ask-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG
\l "Oh, what does he want again now?", she asked.

\t Eniya kʷaraħid et’no, ɣired rown łi ħaƛurxo zawru zamanno rok’ƛ’or bayn moƛutow yayxanuƛin, eƛin yisä.
\m eni-a kʷaraħi-d et’-n ɣir-d r-ow-n łi ħaƛu-r-x zow-ru zaman-n rok’u-ƛ’or b-ay-n moƛu-tow y-ay-x-anu-ƛin eƛi-n yisa-a
\g mother-ERG perforated.spoon-INSTR pour-PFV.CVB sieve-INSTR IV-bring-PFV.CVB water drink-CAUS-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT time-TOP heart-SUPER.LAT III-come-PFV.CVB sleep-EMPH II-come-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT say-PST.UNW he-ERG
\l "I cannot sleep because I remember the time that our mother poured water with a colander and brought it to drink in a sieve.", he said.

\t Howži yiła kʷaraħin, ɣirno bisno łi rowa yik’in.
\m howži yiła-a kʷaraħi-n ɣir-n b-is-n łi r-ow-a y-ik’i-n
\g now DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG perforated.spoon-and sieve-and III-take-PFV.CVB water IV-bring-INF II-go-PST.UNW
\l Now she took a colander and a sieve and went to bring the water.

\t Qartay maħor yäk’irun, C’irduxä izin užibi käczaɣor kidbabi, kidbabi käczaɣor užibin butirno, neła łi rayrace ičin.
