\m Qartay maħor y-ik’i-run C’irdux-a izi-n uži-bi kec-za-aɣor kid-bi kid-bi kec-za-aɣor uži-bi-n b-utir-n neła-a łi r-ayr-ace iči-n
\g Qartay outside II-go-IMM.ANT.CVB Tsirdukh-ERG get.up-PFV.CVB boy-PL sleep-LCV-IN.VERS girl-PL girl-PL sleep-LCV-IN.VERS boy-PL-TOP III-turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG water IV-bring-TERM be-PST.UNW
\l Right after Qartay went outside, Tsirdukh got up, put the girls to the place where the boys slept and the boys to the place where the girls slept, all before she brought the water.

\t Łin ħaƛun, rok’un hiƛirno, paraxatno oqno C’irduxno kecno.
\m łi-n ħaƛu-n rok’u-n hiƛir-n paraxat-n oq-n C’irdux-n kec-n
\g water-TOP drink-PFV.CVB heart-TOP place.comfortably-PFV.CVB calmly-TOP become-PFV.CVB Tsirdukh-TOP sleep-PST.UNW
\l Tsirdukh drank the water, got comfortable, became calm and fell asleep.

\t Dahawce yičintow Qartayä esirno, äziru šebi, kacru šebiƛin.
\m dahaw-ace y-iči-n-tow Qartay-a esir-n izi-ru šebi kec-ru šebi-ƛin
\g a.little-TERM II-wait-PFV.CVB-EMPH Qartay-ERG ask-PST.UNW get.up-PST.PRT who sleep-PST.PRT who-QUOT
\l Qartay waited a little and then asked: "Who is awake, who's sleeping?"

\t Łox esirno dandir žawab biqinč’izaƛ’, yizirabi kecsi howžiƛin, ɣoɣoräk’ru ħos risno užizasƛin eƛin kidbazas meč’oƛ’no eqerno, yik’in kecno.
\m łox esir-n dandir žawab b-iqi-č’i-zaƛ’ yizirabi kec-s howži-ƛin ɣoɣorik’-ru ħos r-is-n uži-bi-s-ƛin eƛi-n kid-bi-s meč’-ƛ’-n eqer-n y-ik’i-n kec-n
\g thrice ask-PFV.CVB together answer III-get-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB DEM2.PL sleep-PST.WIT now-QUOT make.red.hot-PST.PRT stick IV-take-PFV.CVB boy-PL-GEN1-QUOT say-PFV.CVB girl-PL-GEN1 neck-SUPER.ESS-TOP put-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB sleep-PST.UNW
\l Because she had asked three times without getting an answer, [saying] "Now they're sleeping", she took the red-hot stick and - thinking it were the boys - put it onto the necks of the girls and went to sleep.

\t Di mečołxor yik’isƛin.
\m di moči-łxor y-ik’i-s-ƛin
\g me field-CONT.VERS II-go-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l I went to the field."

\t Howlo ɣeduƛ žan eqro iduɣor yik’i, dey kid, t’o yičinäy mi beqä yäsƛin, qˤaƛin yiła, dahawgon bix kosa yiħun.
\m howlo ɣedu-ƛ ža-n eqer-o idu-ɣor y-ik’i di-s kid t’o y-iči-näy mi buq-a y-is-ƛin qˤaƛi-n yiła-a dahaw-gon bix kosi-a y-iħu-n
\g there shade-SUB.ESS DEM1.SG-TOP put-IMPR home-IN.ALL II-go me-GEN1 daughter here II-sit-CND.CVB you sun-ERG II-take-QUOT shout-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG a.little-CNTR hay gather-INF II-begin-PST.UNW
\l "Put it into the shadow and go home, my daughter, if you sit here, you'll get a sunstroke!" she shouted and began to gather the hay a little.

\t C’irduxno, nesis esnabin buqˤełno nełaƛ’ bezun bičäsi zown.
\m C’irdux-n nesi-s esyu-bi-n b-uqˤeł-n nełƛ’o b-ezu-n b-iči-asi zow-n
\g Tsirdukh-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 brother-PL-and I.PL-hide-PFV.CVB then I.PL-look-PFV.CVB I.PL-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Tsirdukh and his brothers hid and then were looking.

\t Šebičo di rodan, narčo k’oƛanƛin.
\m šebi-čo di r-odi-an nar-čo k’oƛi-an-ƛin
\g what-INT me IV-do-FUT.CVB where-INT run-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l What the heck shall I do, where the heck shall I run to?"

\t ʕIyayx yedun xecin C’irduxno, nesis esnabin elaygon bitor bik’in.
\m ʕiyad-x yedu-n xeci-n C’irdux-n nesi-s esyu-bi-n ele-ay-gon bitor b-ik’i-n
\g cry-IPFV.CVB DEM2.IISG-TOP leave-PFV.CVB Tsirdukh-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 brother-PL-and there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l Tsirdukh and his brothers left her crying and went away from there.

\t Sida ɣudin bik’in, q’ˤuna äƛiru ɣudƛ’o yizirabi łebelawzas sida šaharyar bayn.
\m sida ɣudi-n b-ik’i-n q’ˤuna eƛi-ru ɣudi-ƛ’ yizirabi łebelaw-bi-s sida šahar-ar b-ay-n
\g one.OBL day-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB two.OBL say-PST.PRT day-SUPER.ESS DEM2.PL Tlyarata-PL-GEN1 one.OBL city-IN.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l They went one day, and on the second day arrived at the city of the Tlyarata people.

\t Elozo xanesgon iłno kid zown.
\m elo-zo xan-s-gon iłno kid zow-n
\g there-ATTR.OBL khan-GEN1-CNTR six daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The king there had six daughters.

\t Elo nełade ƛirbałix yałzay, neširu Qartay maħor yoqacen ičin, izin nełaz mežił ok’bi rok’no xecin.
\m elo neła-de ƛirbałi-x yoł-zay neširu Qartay maħor y-oq-ace-n iči-n izi-n neła-az muži-ł ok’-bi r-ok’-n xeci-n
\g there DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS hospitality-AD.ESS be-SIM.CVB at.night Qartay outside II-become-TERM-PFV.CVB wait-PFV.CVB get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS.DIST mattress-CONT.ESS nail-PL III.PL-beat-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW
\l When he was there at her's as a guest, he waited until Qartay got out at night, got up, beated nails into her mattress and left them there.

\t Qartay moƛa yiqärun, izin nesä ža muži łebelawzas xander bižin.
\m Qartay moƛu-a y-iqir-run izi-n nesi-a ža muži łebelaw-bi-s xan-der b-iži-n
\g Qartay sleep-ERG II-take.away-IMM.ANT.CVB get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG mattress Tlyarata-PL-GEN1 khan-APUD.LAT III-carry-PST.UNW
\l When Qartay was caught by sleep, he got up, and carried that mattress to the king of the Tlyarata people.

\t K’ox äƛirugon xanä egirno ža bišom litra ɣˤays boɣxosini Qartays gulu bowanirƛin.
\m k’ox äƛiru-gon xan-a egir-n ža bišom litra ɣˤay-s b-oɣ-xosi-ni Qartay-s gulu b-ow-a-nir-ƛin
\g twice ORD-CNTR khan-ERG send-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG hundred liter milk-GEN1 III-hatch-PRS.PRT-DEF Qartay-GEN1 horse III-bring-INF-GER.PURP-QUOT
\l But for the second time, the king sent him to bring Qartay's horse which gives 100 liters of milk.

\t Roda šebin anuƛin, oqno ik’in.
\m r-odi-a šebin anu-ƛin oq-n ik’i-n
\g IV-do-INF thing be.NEG-QUOT begin-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l "There's nothing I can do about it" [he said], and went on.

\t Adäza c’oq’iw bexora koyä hibon bisno, C’irdux rečuƛ uqˤełno ičin.
\m adäza c’oq’iw bexora kʷay-a hibo-n b-is-n C’irdux reču-ƛ uqˤeł-n iči-n
\g ahead pointed lengthy hand-IN.ESS stick-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB Tsirdukh cattleshed-SUB.ESS hide-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l Having taken the long pointed stick in his hand before himself, Tsirdukh hid in the shed.

\t Nełaƛ’no razi oqinč’ey, xanä Qartay nesider yayrno gurow kidbabi regärinč’iƛin sisgon žeduł adäza misal erno.
\m nełƛ’o-n razi oq-č’ey xan-a Qartay nesi-der y-ayr-n gurow kid-bi r-egir-č’i-ƛin sis-gon žedu-ł adäza misal er-n
\g then-TOP agree become-NEG.PST.CVB khan-ERG Qartay DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT II-bring-PFV.CVB except girl-PL II.PL-let-NEG.FUT-QUOT one-CNTR DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS ahead problem put-PST.UNW
\l Then once again the king didn't agree, he put another problem before him: "I won't send girls to you, except for if you bring Qartay."

\t Yowanix däƛ’ ričiƛ, amma maħor yegiranix debeƛ’ yołƛin, xanqorno eƛin, qaciz ust’ares šeƛ’un šeƛ’un, C’irdux hunix oqno.
\m y-ow-ani-x di-ƛ’ r-iči-ƛ amma maħor y-egir-ani-x mi-ƛ’ yoł-ƛin xan-qor-n eƛi-n qaci-z ust’ar-s šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n C’irdux huni-x oq-n
\g II-bring-MSD-AD.ESS me-SUPER.ESS IV-be-OPT but outside II-let-MSD-AD.ESS you-SUPER.ESS be-QUOT khan-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB firewood-GEN2 master-GEN1 clothing-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB Tsirdukh way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l "May it be up to me to bring her, but it's up to you to let her outside" Tsirdukh said to the king, put on carpenter clothes and got on his way.

\t Qartayder aynosi, neła nesiqay bayan bisno, mi šebi, łina hunaryos žek’u yołƛin.
\m Qartay-der ay-nosi neła-a nesi-qay bayan b-is-n mi šebi łina hunar-s žek’u yoł-ƛin
\g Qartay-APUD.LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL specification III-take-PST.UNW you who what.OBL talent-GEN1 man be-QUOT
\l When he came to Qartay, she wanted to know from him: "Who are you and what talent do you have?"

\t Di k’emot’yabi royx aħnayxosi qacis ust’ar yołƛin, nesä žawab teƛno.
\m di k’emot’-bi r-odi-x aħnad-xosi qaci-s ust’ar yoł-ƛin nesi-a žawab teƛ-n
\g me wooden.case-PL II.PL-do-IPFV.CVB walk.around-PRS.PRT firewood-GEN1 master be-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "I am a carpenter working around making wooden cases." he answered.

\t Nedur resunäy, sis k’emot’ därno yodoƛin, ƛ’iri yedu yutin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy sis k’emot’ di-r-n y-odi-o-ƛin ƛ’iri yedu y-uti-n
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB one wooden.case me-LAT-TOP II-do-IMPR-QUOT above DEM2.IISG II-turn-PST.UNW
\l "If that's the case, make me one wooden case!" she insisted.

\t Xizaɣorgon tełtow žan xecin acmołnonan ok’bi rok’nosi, Qartayä eƛin, ha, howži, yił badiru ħalt’os deber keze roqxosi šebin neƛanix maħor yegir diƛin.
\m xizaɣor-gon teł-tow ža-n xeci-n acmoł-n-nan ok’-bi r-ok’-nosi Qartay-a eƛi-n ha howži yiła b-odi-ru ħalt’i-s mi-r keze r-oq-xosi šebin neƛ-ani-x maħor y-egir di-ƛin
\g finally-CNTR inside-EMPH DEM1.SG-TOP leave-PST.UNW door-TOP-INT nail-PL III.PL-beat-ANT.CVB Qartay-ERG say-PST.UNW well now DEM2.IISG.OBL III-do-PST.PRT work-GEN1 you-LAT meet IV-become-PRS.PRT thing give-MSD-AD.ESS outside II-let me-QUOT
\l Finally, he left her inside, and after he had beated nails into the door, Qartay said: "Well now, let me out to give you something for the work that you have done!"

\t Yegiranir mi di elo teł yišäsi anuƛin, yisän žawab teƛno.
\m y-egir-a-nir mi di elo teł y-iši-asi anu-ƛin yisi-a-n žawab teƛ-n
\g II-let-INF-GER.PURP you me there inside II-lock.up-RES.PRT be.NEG-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP answer give-PST.UNW
\l "I didn't lock you in there to let you out again", he answered.

\t Ža C’irdux yałrun iyn, łinasnotow čaran bexun p’estow anusi ɣamasya teł Qartayn ƛexun.
\m ža C’irdux yoł-run iy-n łina-s-n-tow čara-n b-exu-n p’es-tow anu-si ɣamas-a teł Qartay-n ƛexu-n
\g DEM1.SG Tsirdukh be-IMM.ANT.CVB know-PFV.CVB what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-EMPH possibility-TOP III-die-PFV.CVB sound-EMPH be.NEG-ATTR box-IN.ESS inside Qartay-TOP remain-PST.UNW
\l She [then] knew it was Tsirdukh and that there was no way out, and without any sound, Qartay stayed in the box.

\t Žan xander yižin C’irduxno ik’in.
\m ža-n xan-der y-iži-n C’irdux-n ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP khan-APUD.LAT II-carry-PFV.CVB Tsirdukh-TOP go-PST.UNW
\l Tsirdukh carried her to the king.

\t Mada ɣamasno eqerno iłnon esnabin, iłnon xanes kidbabin geres kawumos yoq’ˤugani acno yisno ɣunoq bizin.
\m ma-a ɣamas-n eqer-n iłno-n esyu-bi-n iłno-n xan-s kid-bi-n ger-s kawu-s y-oq’ˤiw-ga-ni ac-n y-is-n ɣun-q b-izi-n
\g yard-IN.ESS box-TOP put-PFV.CVB six-TOP brother-PL-and six-and khan-GEN1 girl-PL-and iron-GEN1 gate-GEN1 II-heavy-ATTR-DEF door-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB tree-POSS.ESS III-get.up-PST.UNW
\l He put the box into the yard, and the six brothers and the six princesses took the heavy door of the iron gate and climbed up a tree.

\t Cuƛer yäzurun, yiłar ɣunoq bäzirubi bukayn.
\m cuƛer y-ezu-run yiła-r ɣun-q b-izi-ru-bi b-ukad-n
\g upward II-look-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT tree-POSS.ESS I.PL-get.up-PST.PRT-PL I.PL-see-PST.UNW
\l When she looked upward, she saw those who got up into the tree.

\t C’irduxƛ’o ozuri c’axrun, sis qˤaƛun rok’no Qartay ɣunoq yiza c’oxno, žaqˤułgon narey mi däqay ok’łanƛin.
\m C’irdux-ƛ’ ozuri c’ox-run sis qˤaƛu-n r-ok’-n Qartay ɣun-q yiza c’ox-n žaqˤuł-gon nar-ey mi di-qay ok’eł-an-ƛin
\g Tsirdukh-SUPER.ESS eye meet-IMM.ANT.CVB one shout-TOP IV-beat-PFV.CVB Qartay tree-POSS.ESS DEM2.IIPL.OBL pounce-PFV.CVB today-CNTR where-DUB you me-POSS.ABL escape-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Just when Qartay discovered Tsirdukh, she gave out a shout, pounced to/up the tree, [saying]: "Where will you escape to from me today?"

\t Neł kawumoz acmoq rexoriłno zawru ɣˤʷak’un riqirno yizanƛin yaqru ža, ƛ’irir ža yoq’ˤugani acno yoƛ’ˤun Qartayn ƛ’iƛ’iłno yexun.
\m neła kawu-z ac-mo-q r-exorił-n zow-ru ɣˤʷak’u-n r-iqir-n y-izi-an-ƛin y-oq-ru ža ƛ’iri-r ža y-oq’ˤiw-ga-ni ac-n y-ˤoƛ’u-n Qartay-n ƛ’iƛ’ił-n y-exu-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL gate-GEN2 door-ERG-POSS.ESS IV-hang-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT hook-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB II-get.up-FUT.CVB-QUOT II-begin-PST.PRT DEM1.SG above-LAT DEM1.SG II-heavy-ATTR-DEF door-TOP II-fall-PFV.CVB Qartay-TOP get.crushed-PFV.CVB II-die-PST.UNW
\l Qartay took the hook that hang at the door of that gate, began to get up; the heavy door fell down, Qartay got crushed and died.

\t Xizyo ɣunoqay iłnon esnabi q’ˤidarno boqno, xanes kidbabin roɣno, beže bertenno bodin iłiran esnaza iłnon esnabin rižin.
\m xizyo ɣun-qay iłno-n esyu-bi q’ˤida-r-n b-oq-n xan-s kid-bi-n r-oɣ-n b-eže berten-n b-odi-n iłira-n esyu-bi-a iłno-n esyu-bi-n r-iži-n
\g afterwards tree-POSS.ABL six-TOP brother-PL down-LAT-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 girl-PL-TOP II.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB III-big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB six.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG six-TOP sister-PL-TOP II.PL-take.out-PFV.CVB
\l Afterwards, the six brothers got down from the tree, took the princesses along and celebrated a big marriage; and the six brothers took the six sisters with them.

\t Neła bertenyołer din goƛ’is.
\m neła berten-łer di-n goƛ’i-s
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL marriage-CONT.LAT me-TOP invite-PST.WIT
\l I was also invited to this marriage.

\t Qacis q’ili Qudi Musaz Maħama bok’si, ħošos zurma Xantuz ʕAlä pˤaƛus, keč’ Maʕat’iz Ruq’än, Amirħanzan qˤaƛis, istowlizaq šet’ur łočyoƛ’ Xaluman Ošk’oris Ramazanno k’oƛis, ɣodos ʕarada Metirozya pˤoƛirsi, dabaɣyos tupi K’it’i Ramazanä kursi, meys tamanča Qebozya ašuƛ ricis, Ešiƛ’oza łelmay butnos mač’ibi roɣsi, Newoza bexada qacis t’eka bayrsi, Kidiraygon ʕomoyƛ’no zown Šapk’ilaw ays.
\m qaci-s q’ili Qudi Musa-z Maħama-a b-ok’-s ħoši-s zurma Xantu-z ʕAli-a pˤaƛu-s keč’ Maʕat’i-z Ruq’i-a-n Amirħanza-a-n qˤaƛi-s istowli-bi-q šet’ur łoč-ƛ’ Xaluma-n Ošk’ori-s Ramazan-n k’oƛi-s ɣod-s ʕarada Metirozi-a pˤoƛi-r-s dabaɣ-s tupi K’it’i Ramazan-a kur-s mey-s tamanča Qebozi-a ašu-ƛ r-ici-s Ešiƛ’obi-a łel-ay butni-s mač’i-bi r-oɣ-s Newobi-a b-exʷad-a qaci-s t’eka b-ayr-s Kidiro-ay-gon ʕomoy-ƛ’-n zow-n Šapk’ilaw ay-s
\g firewood-GEN1 drum Qudi Musa-GEN2 Magomed-ERG III-beat-PST.WIT hide-GEN1 zurna Khantu-GEN2 Ali-ERG thrash-PST.WIT song Ma'ati-GEN2 Ruqiyat-ERG-and Amirhanza-ERG-and sing-PST.WIT table-PL-POSS.ESS around dance-SUPER.ESS Khaluma-and Oshkori-GEN1 Ramazan-and jump-PST.WIT lime.tree-GEN1 cannon Metrada.people-ERG explode-CAUS-PST.WIT leather-GEN1 rifle Kiti Ramazan-ERG shoot.from-PST.WIT birch-GEN1 pistol Khebatli.people-ERG belt-SUB.ESS IV-tie-PST.WIT Shaytl.people-ERG sheath-IN.ABL burka-GEN1 dagger-PL IV.PL-take.away-PST.WIT Mokok.people-ERG III-slaughter-INF firewood-GEN1 he.goat III-bring-PST.WIT Kidero-IN.ABL-CNTR donkey-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB Shapkilaw come-PST.WIT
\l Qudi Musa's Magomed beated the wooden drum, Xantu's Ali played the zurna, Ma'ati's Ruqi and Amirhanza sang a song, Khaluma and Oshkori's Ramazan danced around the tables, people from Metrada fired a lime gun, Kiti Ramazan shot with a leather rifle, the Khebatli people put tied a birch pistol to their belt, people from Shaytl pulled burka daggers out of the sheath, the Mokok people slaughtered brought a wooden goat for slaughtering, and Shapkilaw came from Kidero riding on a donkey.

\t Istowlizaƛ’ anunč’uru niʕmatyabin zownč’u, dicegon rac’łin axʷarno raynč’u, dicegon zeru ħaƛułin q’ˤimłerno bizinč’u.
\m istowli-bi-ƛ’ anu-č’u-ru niʕmat-bi-n zow-č’u dice-gon r-ac’-łin ax-ar-n r-ay-č’u dice-gon zeru ħaƛu-łin q’ˤim-łer-n b-izi-č’u
\g table-PL-SUPER.ESS be.absent-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.PRT bliss-PL-TOP be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT how.much-CNTR IV-eat-CNC.CVB belly-IN.LAT-TOP IV-come-NEG.PST.WIT how.much-CNTR bouza drink-CNC.CVB head-CONT.LAT-TOP III-get.up-NEG.PST.WIT
\l There were no blisses that were [not] absent from the tables, so that, no matter how much one ate, they didn't come into the belly, and how much booze one drank, it didn't get up into the head.

\t Hemedur žedurabin xecin din oqno ik’is Kidirozaq yedu kesu esanix.
\m hemedur žedu-ra-bi-n xeci-n di-n oq-n ik’i-s Kidirobi-q yedu kesu esi-ani-x
\g so DEM1.IPL-ATTR-PL-TOP leave-PFV.CVB me-TOP become-PFV.CVB go-PST.WIT Kidero.people-POSS.ESS DEM2.IISG tale tell-MSD-AD.ESS
\l So I left them again and went to tell this tale to the people from Kidero.

\t Asaqozagon łˤono henešno bayrsi, sis yedu kesu urɣizi badirur, sis äsirur, sideni teqärur.
\m Asaqobi-a-gon łˤono heneš-n b-ayr-s sis yedu kesu urɣizi b-odi-ru-r sis esi-ru-r sideni teqer-ru-r
\g Asakh.people-ERG-CNTR three apple-TOP III-bring-PST.WIT one DEM2.IISG tale thinking III-do-PST.PRT-LAT one tell-PST.PRT-LAT the.other.one listen.to-PST.PRT-LAT
\l And the people from Asakh brought three apples; one from the one who invented the story, one for the one who told this story and another one for the one, who listened to the story.

\t Esin šebi, xecin šebi zownƛax ʕoƛno bełiqan.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi zow-n-ƛax ʕoƛno bełiqan
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT seven hunter
\l Was has been told, what has been left, it's said that there were seven hunters.

\t Žedułäy bełiqanzar biša rodanix sis idu ičix zown.
\m žedu-łay bełiqan-bi-r bišʷa r-odi-ani-x sis idu iči-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ABL hunter-PL-LAT food IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS one home be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Of them, one stayed at home to make food for the [other] hunters.

\t Sida quł sis bełiqan idu biša rodan xecin, nasin ciqaɣor bik’in.
\m sida qu-ł sis bełiqan idu bišʷa r-odi-an xeci-n nasin ciq-aɣor b-ik’i-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS one hunter home food IV-do-FUT.CVB leave-PFV.CVB all forest-IN.VERS III-go-PST.UNW
\l One day, they all left one hunter at home to make food, and went into the forest.

\t Bišan ħadur rodin ičäsi yałzay, mamalayƛ’no zown, ruk’ice mešok’la yołäsi sis t’omce žek’u oƛixno k’oƛin salam teƛno, assalamu ʕalaykumƛin.
\m bišʷa-n ħadur r-odi-n iči-asi yoł-zay mamalay-ƛ’-n zow-n ruk’i-ce mešok’la yoł-asi sis t’om-ce žek’u oƛix-n k’oƛi-n salam teƛ-n assalamu ʕalaykum-ƛin
\g food-TOP preparation IV-do-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB rooster-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB cubit-EQU1 moustache be-RES.PRT one span-EQU1 man appear-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB greeting give-PST.UNW peace. ...be.with.you-QUOT
\l While he was preparing the food, a man in the size of a span with a moustache in the length of one cubit came riding on a rooster, jumped off and greeted: "Peace be with you!"

\t Waʕaleykum salamƛin, eƛin bełiqanä.
\m waʕaleykum salam-ƛin eƛi-n bełiqan-a
\g and.with.you. ...peace-QUOT say-PST.UNW hunter-ERG
\l "And peace be with you!" said the hunter.

\t Bełiqanä yisir ƛoħay boɣno sis ħak’on, nełdergon met’rin teƛno.
\m bełiqan-a yisi-r ƛoħo-ay b-oɣ-n sis ħak’o-n neła-der-gon met’ri-n teƛ-n
\g hunter-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT pan-IN.ABL III-take.away-PFV.CVB one khinkali-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT-CNTR piece.of.meat-TOP give-PST.UNW
\l The hunter took one khinkali out of the pan for him and gave a piece of meat next to it.

\t Täƛru łinaƛ’no razin oqinč’ey, t’omceni žek’a žigon esirno bišʷa, yiłaq dey ax roqinč’uƛin.
\m teƛ-ru łina-ƛ’-n razi-n oq-č’ey t’om-ce-ni žek’u-a žigon esir-n bišʷa yiła-q di-s ax r-oq-č’u-ƛin
\g give-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP accept-TOP become-NEG.PST.CVB span-EQU1-DEF man-ERG again.now ask-PST.UNW food DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS me-GEN1 belly IV-become-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Not having accepted what he was given, the span-sized man asked again for food: "I won't get my fill from that."

\t Bełiqanza bayn bišʷa esirnosi, nesä raqru šebin esin, hemedur mamalayƛ’no zown, ruk’ice mešok’la yołäsi t’omce žek’un ayn, kinaw mežur radiru bišʷan rac’no ik’isƛin.
\m bełiqan-bi-a b-ay-n bišʷa esir-nosi nesi-a r-oq-ru šebin esi-n hemedur mamalay-ƛ’-n zow-n ruk’i-ce mešok’la yoł-asi t’om-ce žek’u-n ay-n kinaw mežu-r r-odi-ru bišʷa-n r-ac’-n ik’i-s-ƛin
\g hunter-PL-ERG I.PL-come-PFV.CVB food ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG IV-happen-PST.PRT thing tell-PST.UNW so rooster-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB cubit-EQU1 moustache be-RES.PRT span-EQU1 man-TOP come-PFV.CVB entire you(I).PL.OBL-LAT IV-do-PST.PRT food-TOP IV-eat-PFV.CVB go-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l When the hunters came and asked for food, he told what had happened: "So on a rooster came riding a man in the size of a span, with a moustache in the size of a cubit, ate up the entire food that I made for you, and went away."

\t Mi eli baƛ’irxoƛin, bełiqanbi bužzi boqnoanu nesä äsiru łinaƛ’no.
\m mi eli b-aƛ’ir-x-ƛin bełiqan-bi bužzi b-oq-n-anu nesi-a esi-ru łina-ƛ’-n
\g you we III-cheat-PRS-QUOT hunter-PL trust III-become-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG tell-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP
\l "You're cheating us!", the hunters didn't trust in what he had told them.

\t Hudäyzikogon idu biša rodanix sideni bełiqan ičin.
\m hudäyziko-gon idu bišʷa r-odi-ani-x sideni bełiqan iči-n
\g day.after.tomorrow-CNTR home food IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS other hunter be-PST.UNW
\l The [second?] day after that, another hunter stayed home to make food.

\t Nesiq bišʷa rodin łäyrun, mamalayƛ’no zown howžatow t’omceni žek’u oƛixno k’oƛin salamno teƛno, q’ˤida ičin łäyrun bišʷa esirno.
\m nesi-q bišʷa r-odi-n łiy-run mamalay-ƛ’-n zow-n howža-tow t’om-ce-ni žek’u oƛix-n k’oƛi-n salam-n teƛ-n q’ˤida iči-n łiy-run bišʷa esir-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS food IV-do-PFV.CVB end-IMM.ANT.CVB rooster-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM4.SG-EMPH span-EQU1-DEF man appear-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB down sit-PFV.CVB end-IMM.ANT.CVB food ask-PST.UNW
\l When he was just finished making the food, that very span-sized man appeared riding on the rooster, jumped off, greeted, and right when he sat down, he asked for food.

\t Yisi bełiqanän ƛoħay boɣno sis ħak’on nełdergon met’rin teƛno.
\m yisi bełiqan-a-n ƛoħo-ay b-oɣ-n sis ħak’o-n neła-der-gon met’ri-n teƛ-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL hunter-ERG-TOP pan-IN.ABL III-take.away-PFV.CVB one khinkali-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT-CNTR piece.of.meat-TOP give-PST.UNW
\l And the hunter also took one khinkali out of the pan and put a piece of meat next to it.

\t Täƛru šebin rac’no łiynosi, yiłaq di aɣˤunč’uƛin t’omceni žek’u ʕoƛirin bełiqanzarzoni bišadyoƛ’ ik’in c’oxno.
\m teƛ-ru šebin r-ac’-n łiy-nosi yiła-q di aɣˤu-č’u-ƛin t’om-ce-ni žek’u ʕoƛira-n bełiqan-bi-r-z-ni bišad-ƛ’ ik’i-n c’ox-n
\g give-PST.PRT thing IV-eat-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS me be.full-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT span-EQU1-DEF man seven.OBL-TOP hunter-PL-LAT-GEN2-DEF food-SUPER.ESS go-PFV.CVB pounce-PST.UNW
\l When he finished the thing he was given, [saying] "I didn't get full from that.", the span-sized man went and pounced on the food for the seven hunters.

\t Elay ža oxirƛ’oräy, t’omceni žek’a mešok’lałäy boɣno musno, bełiqan imyoqorno icin, kinaw bišan rac’no, et’un k’oƛin mamalayƛ’no zown, oqno ik’in.
\m ele-ay ža oxir-ƛ’oräy t’om-ce-ni žek’u-a mešok’la-łay b-oɣ-n mus-n bełiqan im-qor-n ici-n kinaw bišʷa-n r-ac’-n et’u-n k’oƛi-n mamalay-ƛ’-n zow-n oq-n ik’i-n
\g there-IN.ABL DEM1.SG chase-SIM.CVB span-EQU1-DEF man-ERG moustache-CONT.ABL III-take.away-PFV.CVB hair-TOP hunter pole-POSS.LAT-TOP tie-PFV.CVB entire food-TOP IV-eat-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB rooster-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l When he chased him away from there, the span-sized man took a hair out of his moustache, tied the hunter to a pole, ate up the entire food, jumped on his rooster and rode away.

\t Bayn bełiqanza bišʷa esirnosi, nesän žeduq raqru šebin esin, hemedurtow mamalayƛ’no zown t’omceni žek’un ayn, nasintow bišʷa rac’a ža oqnosi elay ža oɣƛ’oräy, mešok’lałäy musno boɣno nesä di ɣunoqor icisƛin mus bukarno.
\m b-ay-n bełiqan-bi-a bišʷa esir-nosi nesi-a-n žedu-q r-oq-ru šebin esi-n hemedur-tow mamalay-ƛ’-n zow-n t’om-ce-ni žek’u-n ay-n nasin-tow bišʷa r-ac’-a ža oq-nosi ele-ay ža oɣ-ƛ’oräy mešok’la-łay mus-n b-oɣ-n nesi-a di ɣun-qor ici-s-ƛin mus b-ukar-n
\g I.PL-come-PFV.CVB hunter-PL-ERG food ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-happen-PST.PRT thing tell-PST.UNW so-EMPH rooster-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB span-EQU1-DEF man-TOP come-PFV.CVB all-EMPH food IV-eat-INF DEM1.SG begin-ANT.CVB there-IN.ABL DEM1.SG take.away-SIM.CVB moustache-CONT.ABL hair-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG me tree-POSS.LAT tie-PST.WIT-QUOT hair III-show-PST.UNW
\l When the hunters came and asked for food, he also told them what had happened: "So a span-sized man came riding on a rooster, and when he began to eat up all the food and I wanted to take him away from there, he took a hair out of his moustache and tied me to a tree." and he showed them the hair.

\t Žigoƛ’aygon bełiqanza bišʷa rodanix q’ˤano žek’u xecin, hudukinda žeda ħal bayranƛin.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon bełiqan-bi-a bišʷa r-odi-ani-x q’ˤano žek’u xeci-n hudu-kin-da žedu-a ħal b-ayr-an-ƛin
\g again-SUPER.ABL-CNTR hunter-PL-ERG food IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS two man leave-PFV.CVB so-even-COND DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG strength III-bring-FUT.CVB-QUOT
\l This time, the hunters left two men there to make the food, so that maybe in this way they would be strong enough.

\t Žeduq bišʷa łäyrułer, mamalayƛ’no zown howžatow t’omceni žek’u ayn.
\m žedu-q bišʷa łiy-ru-łer mamalay-ƛ’-n zow-n howža-tow t’om-ce-ni žek’u ay-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS food end-PST.PRT-CONT.LAT rooster-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM4.SG-EMPH span-EQU1-DEF man come-PST.UNW
\l When they finished the food, that very span-sized man came riding on the rooster again.

\t Žan rac’no łiyrno, p’es anusi c’ik’iwtow bišʷa rac’a ħuruƛ’or ik’iƛ’oräy, sid bełiqanä ža t’omceni žek’u oxira aqrun mešok’lałay boɣno musno, ɣunoqor icin kurno.
\m ža-n r-ac’-n łiyr-n p’es anu-si c’ik’iw-tow bišʷa r-ac’-a ħuru-ƛ’or ik’i-ƛ’oräy sida bełiqan-a ža t’om-ce-ni žek’u oxir-a oq-run mešok’la-łay b-oɣ-n mus-n ɣun-qor ici-n kur-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP IV-eat-PFV.CVB finish-PFV.CVB voice be.absent-ATTR all-EMPH food IV-eat-INF basin-SUPER.LAT go-SIM.CVB one.OBL hunter-ERG DEM1.SG span-EQU1-DEF man chase-INF begin-IMM.ANT.CVB moustache-CONT.ABL III-take.away-PFV.CVB hair-TOP tree-POSS.LAT tie-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l When he had finished eating it and went to the basin to eat all the food without saying anything, one hunter began to chase the span-sized man away and he took a hair out of his moustache and tied him to a tree.

\t Didurnokin t’omceni žek’a ħal bayrinč’izaƛ’, sideni bełiqanä roɣno k’onč’ałer tupi caƛin.
\m didur-n-kin t’om-ce-ni žek’u-a ħal b-ayr-č’i-zaƛ’ sideni bełiqan-a r-oɣ-n k’onč’u-łer tupi caƛi-n
\g how-TOP-even span-EQU1-DEF man-ERG strength III-bring-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB the.other.one hunter-ERG IV-take.away-PFV.CVB leg-CONT.LAT rifle shoot.with-PST.UNW
\l As they couldn't overcome him, the other hunter took a rifle and shot him in the leg.

\t Neširaɣor bełiqanbi baynosi, žeduq raqru šebin esin.
\m neširu-aɣor bełiqan-bi b-ay-nosi žedu-q r-oq-ru šebin esi-n
\g evening-IN.VERS hunter-PL I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-happen-PST.PRT thing tell-PST.UNW
\l In the evening, when the hunters came, they told them what had happened.

\t Ħaduraw biša roqzaƛ’, bišno axbin rodin, ʕoƛnontow bełiqan t’omceni žek’a bešnoyx bäžiru iyoz ruɣuƛ’ bik’in.
\m ħaduraw bišʷa r-oq-zaƛ’ b-iš-n ax-bi-n r-odi-n ʕoƛno-n-tow bełiqan t’om-ce-ni žek’u-a b-ešnod-x b-iži-ru iyo-z ruɣu-ƛ’ b-ik’i-n
\g prepared food IV-happen-CSL.CVB III-eat-PFV.CVB belly-PL-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB seven-TOP-EMPH hunter span-EQU1-DEF man-ERG III-dribble-IPFV.CVB I.PL-lead-PST.PRT blood-GEN2 prints-SUPER.ESS I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l Because there was prepared food, the seven hunters ate and filled their bellies, and followed the trace of blood that lead to the span-sized man.

\t Hunix bik’iƛ’oräytow, raƛ’moƛ tełxor gondu yesun.
\m huni-x b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy-tow raƛ’-ƛ teł-xor gondu y-esu-n
\g way-AD.ESS I.PL-go-SIM.CVB-EMPH earth-SUB.ESS inside-AD.LAT big.hole II-find-PST.UNW
\l While they were going on their way, the found a hole that lead inside the earth.

\t Elo mušin begirno, howt’aɣor iħun äsuƛin, ašunä ročyoxno icin, t’omceni žek’uz tupi caƛiruni bełiqan tełxor egiranix žeda q’ut’i bodin.
\m elo muši-n b-egir-n howt’a-ɣor iħu-n esu-ƛin ašuni-a roč-x-n ici-n t’om-ce-ni žek’u-z tupi caƛi-ru-ni bełiqan teł-xor egir-ani-x žedu-a q’ut’i b-odi-n
\g there air-TOP III-let-PFV.CVB there-IN.ALL come.to-PFV.CVB appear-QUOT belt-IN.ESS rope-AD.ESS-TOP tie-PFV.CVB span-EQU1-DEF man-GEN2 rifle shoot.with-PST.PRT-DEF hunter inside-AD.LAT let-MSD-AD.ESS DEM1.IPL-ERG agreement III-do-PST.UNW
\l They thought [let the air/breath/smell?] "He appears to have went in there.", tied [...] to a rope in their belt, and they agreed to let the hunter that shot the span-sized man with the rifle inside the hole.

\t Nesä eƛin, tełäzay roč k’ek’-rik’ernosi, di meža izirƛin.
\m nesi-a eƛi-n teł-azay roč k’ek’~ik’-r-nosi di mežu-a izir-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW inside-IN.ABL.DIST rope move-CAUS-ANT.CVB me you(I).PL.OBL-ERG lift-QUOT
\l He said: "When I move the rope from down there, lift me up!"

\t Tełxor egirno zamanaƛ’azay roč k’ek’-rik’ärun, yizä ža raƛ’moƛ’aɣor izirno.
\m teł-xor egir-n zaman-ƛ’azay roč k’ek’~ik’-r-run yizi-a ža raƛ’-ƛ’aɣor izir-n
\g inside-AD.LAT let-PFV.CVB time-SUPER.ABL.DIST rope move-CAUS-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG earth-SUPER.VERS lift-PST.UNW
\l They let him inside, and just when after some time the rope was moved, they lifted him onto the earth.

\t Hudayƛ’aygon hemedurtow ročyoxno icin egirnosi, ƛ’iri yałruni bełiqanzas q’ut’i boqno, žigoƛ’ay roč k’ek’erłin ela ža izirač’inƛin.
\m hudayƛ’aygon hemedur-tow roč-x-n ici-n egir-nosi ƛ’iri yoł-ru-ni bełiqan-bi-s q’ut’i b-oq-n žigo-ƛ’ay roč k’ek’-r-łin elu-a ža izir-ač’in-ƛin
\g on.the.next.day so-EMPH rope-AD.ESS-TOP tie-PFV.CVB let-ANT.CVB above be-PST.PRT-DEF hunter-PL-GEN1 agreement III-become-PFV.CVB again-SUPER.ABL rope move-CAUS-CNC.CVB we(I).OBL-ERG DEM1.SG lift-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The next day[time?], when they let him [down], tied to the rope, the hunters that were above, agreed: "When he moves the rope again, we won't lift him up."

\t Bełiqanä roč k’ek’erłin, yizä bayru q’ut’oxor, ža izirnoanu.
\m bełiqan-a roč k’ek’-r-łin yizi-a b-ay-ru q’ut’i-xor ža izir-n-anu
\g hunter-ERG rope move-CAUS-CNC.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG I.PL-come-PST.PRT agreement-AD.LAT DEM1.SG lift-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l When the hunter moved the rope, they - according to the agreement they come upon - didn't lift him up.

\t Yizä izirinč’izaƛ’, bełiqan ƛ’iyor, gonda tełxortow, ik’in.
\m yizi-a izir-č’i-zaƛ’ bełiqan ƛ’iyor gondu-a teł-xor-tow ik’i-n
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG lift-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB hunter downwards big.hole-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT-EMPH go-PST.UNW
\l Because they didn't lift him up, the hunter went downwards into the hole.

\t Elo yeda hemesi t’omceni žek’uz azbaryoxor ayn.
\m elo yeda hemesi t’om-ce-ni žek’u-z azbar-xor ay-n
\g there DEM2.ISG DEM4.ISG.OBL span-EQU1-DEF man-GEN2 palace-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l There he came to that span-sized man's palace.

\t Ža azbar ʕoƛno kawu yołäsi zown.
\m ža azbar ʕoƛno kawu yoł-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.SG palace seven gate be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The palace had seven gates.

\t Bayzatow ʕoƛiran kawumoqosi rekarbi rixäsi resun.
\m b-ay-za-tow ʕoƛira-n kawu-q-si reka-bi r-ixi-asi r-esu-n
\g III-come-LCV-EMPH seven.OBL-TOP gate-POSS.ESS-ATTR key-PL IV.PL-hang-RES.PRT IV.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l Where he arrived, he found keys hanging on the seven gates.

\t Šet’ur didiwnkin xalq’i bukaynč’izaƛ’, bełiqanä rekarbin risno kawubi sera iħun.
\m šet’ur didiw-n-kin xalq’i b-ukad-č’i-zaƛ’ bełiqan-a reka-bi-n r-is-n kawu-bi seru-a iħu-n
\g around which-TOP-even people III-see-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB hunter-ERG key-PL-TOP IV.PL-take-PFV.CVB gate-PL unlock-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l Because he didn't see any people around, the hunter took the keys and began to unlock the gates.

\t Iłnon kawu serun, nasin ric’q’is ric’äsi resun.
\m iłno-n kawu seru-n nasin ric’q’i-s r-ic’-asi r-esu-n
\g six-TOP gate unlock-PFV.CVB all wealth-GEN1 IV-fill-RES.PRT IV-find-PST.UNW
\l He had unlocked six gates and found all filled with wealth.

\t ʕOƛno äƛiru kawun serun ezunosi, bełiqaner azbarya teł sis bercinaw kid yesun.
\m ʕoƛno eƛi-ru kawu-n seru-n ezu-nosi bełiqan-r azbar-a teł sis bercinaw kid y-esu-n
\g seven say-PST.PRT gate-TOP unlock-PFV.CVB look-ANT.CVB hunter-LAT palace-IN.ESS inside one beautiful girl II-find-PST.UNW
\l When he had unlocked the seventh gate and looked inside, he found a beautiful girl inside the palace.

\t Yeda ukayruntow, neł kidbes yisiqor roƛ’i boqno.
\m yeda ukad-run-tow neła kid-s yisi-qor roƛ’i b-oq-n
\g DEM2.ISG see-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-GEN1 DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT love III-become-PST.UNW
\l Immediately when she saw him, she fell in love with him.

\t Neła eƛin, mi nazay t’or ayä.
\m neła-a eƛi-n mi nazay t’o-r ay-a
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW you from.where here-LAT come-PST.WIT.INT
\l He said: "How did you came here?

\t T’omceni žek’u aynäy, nesä mi exarƛin.
\m t’om-ce-ni žek’u ay-näy nesi-a mi exur-ƛin
\g span-EQU1-DEF man come-CND.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you kill-QUOT
\l When the span-sized man comes, he will kill you!"

\t Xizyogon esirno nesä, nesi t’omceni žek’ur roqäsi šebintow yołä, łuq’zinan oqäsi zowä žaƛin.
\m xizyogon esir-n nesi-a nesi t’om-ce-ni žek’u-r r-oq-asi šebin-tow yoł-a łuq’zi-nan oq-asi zow-a ža-ƛin
\g then ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL span-EQU1-DEF man-LAT IV-happen-RES.PRT thing-EMPH be-PST.WIT.INT hurt-INT become-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT.INT DEM1.SG-QUOT
\l Then he asked: "Did anything happen to the span-sized man, was he hurt?"

\t Neła žawab teƛno, k’onč’ał łuƛa hil c’oxerno, t’ok’ow ʕuzru anu nesiłƛin.
\m neła-a žawab teƛ-n k’onč’u-ł łu-ƛa hil c’ox-r-n t’ok’ow ʕuzru anu nesi-ł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG answer give-PST.UNW leg-CONT.ESS who.ERG-INDEF bullet hit-CAUS-PFV.CVB more deficiency be.NEG DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-QUOT
\l She answered: "Someone shot a bullet into his leg, another deficiency he doesn't have."

\t Bełiqanä esirno nełaq, mi nesis kidä, baruyä yaqƛin.
\m bełiqan-a esir-n neła-q mi nesi-s kid-a baru-a y-oq-ƛin
\g hunter-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS you DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter-Q wife-Q II-become-QUOT
\l The hunter asked her: "Are you his daughter or his wife?"

\t Di nesis kid yołƛin, esin neła.
\m di nesi-s kid yoł-ƛin esi-n neła-a
\g me DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter be-QUOT tell-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG
\l "I'm his daughter", she said.

\t Hudu xedyox yik’inč’ey, nece yeže yizace šida yičäsiƛin bełiqanä esirnosi, neła esin nesiq, t’omceni žek’ur yegira retixanuƛin.
\m hudu xediw-x y-ik’i-č’ey nece y-eže y-izi-ace šida y-iči-asi-ƛin bełiqan-a esir-nosi neła-a esi-n nesi-q t’om-ce-ni žek’u-r y-egir-a r-eti-x-anu-ƛin
\g so husband-AD.ESS II-go-NEG.PST.CVB so.much II-old II-get-TERM why II-wait-RES.PRT-QUOT hunter-ERG ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG tell-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS span-EQU1-DEF man-LAT II-let-INF IV-want-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l When the hunter asked: "So why don't you go to a husband but wait until you get old?", she said to him: "The span-sized man doesn't want to let me [go]."

\t Xizaɣor yiła harizi rodin nesiq, mi howža žek’u exurnäy, deber di barułun yičanƛin.
\m xizaɣor yiła-a harizi r-odi-n nesi-q mi howža žek’u exur-näy mi-r di barułi-n y-iči-an-ƛin
\g finally DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG request IV-do-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS you DEM4.SG man kill-CND.CVB you-LAT me wifehood-TOP II-be-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Finally she asked him: "When you kill that man, I will be your wife."

\t Nełaƛ’osi ža ħal bukayn, yeda bełiqan tupin risno t’omceni žek’u ayace iqˤin ičin.
\m neła-ƛ’-si ža ħal b-ukad-n yeda bełiqan tupi-n r-is-n t’om-ce-ni žek’u ay-ace iqˤi-n iči-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-ATTR DEM1.SG condition III-see-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG hunter rifle-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB span-EQU1-DEF man come-TERM watch-PFV.CVB wait-PST.UNW
\l The hunter saw the condition upon her, took his rifle and waited and watched until the span-sized man came.

\t Madaƛäz oƛäxrun, bełiqanä tupin caƛin žan exurno neła kidbeqor eƛin, t’ok’ow dunyalƛ’o deber ħinq’i yołäsi moči yołäƛin.
\m ma-ƛäz oƛix-run bełiqan-a tupi-n caƛi-n ža-n exur-n neła-a kid-qor eƛi-n t’ok’ow dunyal-ƛ’ mi-r ħinq’i yoł-asi moči yoł-a-ƛin
\g gate-SUB.ESS.DIST appear-IMM.ANT.CVB hunter-ERG rifle-TOP shoot.with-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP kill-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG girl-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW anymore earth-SUPER.ESS you-LAT danger be-RES.PRT place be-Q-QUOT
\l Just when he appeared under the gate, the hunter shot from his rifle killed him and said to the girl: "Is there any dangerous place for you in the world anymore?"

\t Anu där t’ok’ow łinaqazaykin ħinq’iƛin, žawab nełan teƛno.
\m anu di-r t’ok’ow łina-qazay-kin ħinq’i-ƛin žawab neła-an teƛ-n
\g be.NEG me-LAT anymore what.OBL-POSS.ABL.DIST-even danger-QUOT answer DEM1.IISG.OBL-FUT.DEF give-PST.UNW
\l And she answered: "There's no dangerous place for me anymore."

\t Xizyo nesä esin neł kidbeq, kinaw raqru łanałäyn, didur nesä ža k’onč’ałer łuq’zi adirułäyn.
\m xizyo nesi-a esi-n neła kid-q kinaw r-oq-ru łana-łay-n didur nesi-a ža k’onč’u-łer łuq’zi odi-ru-łay-n
\g afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG tell-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-POSS.ESS entire IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-and how DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG leg-CONT.LAT hurt do-PST.PRT-CONT.ABL-and
\l Afterwards he told that girl everything that had happened and how he hurt his leg.

\t T’omceni žek’us bełiqaner nasin ric’q’in ƛexun, barułungon nesis kidno yown, maʕišat bodix howlotow žan ičin.
\m t’om-ce-ni žek’u-s bełiqan-r nasin ric’q’i-n ƛexu-n barułi-n-gon nesi-s kid-n y-ow-n maʕišat b-odi-x howlo-tow ža-n iči-n
\g span-EQU1-DEF man-GEN1 hunter-LAT all wealth-TOP remain-PFV.CVB wifehood-TOP-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter-TOP II-marry-PFV.CVB fortune III-do-IPFV.CVB there-EMPH DEM1.SG-TOP live-PST.UNW
\l All the span-sized man's wealth remained for the hunter, he married his daughter, and lived there making a great fortune.

\t Č’irin č’iki ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m č’irin č’iki ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Chirin flea day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Zown zownanuƛax sida ʕaƛox igo ixiw aždaħ.
\m zow-n zow-n-anu-ƛax sida ʕaƛ-x igo ixiw aždaħ
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT one.OBL village-AD.ESS near big dragon
\l Once upon a time there was a big dragon near a village.

\t Nełas łˤono kid zown.
\m neła-s łˤono kid zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 three daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had five daughters.

\t Didurnotow ʕaƛos xalq’imos ħal bayrxo zownanu.
\m didur-n-tow ʕaƛ-s xalq’i-s ħal b-ayr-x zow-n-anu
\g how-TOP-EMPH village-GEN1 people-GEN1 strength III-bring-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l And the village's people couldn't defeat him in any way.

\t Žedu aždaħzo ɣutkoƛ’ ƛ’irir bayn.
\m žedu aždaħ-z ɣˤutku-ƛ’ ƛ’iri-r b-ay-n
\g DEM1.IPL dragon-GEN2 house-SUPER.ESS on-LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l They came to the house of the dragon.

\t Neła žedu esnabi iduɣor goƛ’in, där nešurur rac’anix šebin riqisƛin.
\m neła-a žedu esyu-bi idu-ɣor goƛ’i-n di-r neširu-r r-ac’-ani-x šebin r-iqi-s-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL brother-PL home-IN.ALL invite-PFV.CVB me-LAT evening-LAT IV-eat-MSD-AD.ESS thing IV-get-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l He invited the brothers into his home: "I got something for dinner."

\t Žedur bigu bogno boyn buyn bišerno, łˤonontow sida taxƛ’o sadaq kecerno.
\m žedu-r b-igu bog-n b-odi-n b-uy-n b-iš-r-n łˤono-n-tow sida tax-ƛ’ sadaq kec-r-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT III-good meal-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB I.PL-indeed-TOP I.PL-eat-CAUS-PFV.CVB three-TOP-EMPH one.OBL ottoman-SUPER.ESS together sleep-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l He made them a good meal and indeed fed them, and let the three sleep together on one ottoman.

\t Ič’an eɣeniƛ’ C’iɣruk’ƛin ci zown.
\m ič’a-n eɣe-ni-ƛ’ C’iɣruk’-ƛin ci zow-n
\g most-TOP young-DEF-SUPER.ESS Tsighruk-QUOT name be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The name of the youngest was Tsighruk.

\t Madaħ mečoƛ’ ža c’aq’ t’eq’erbašiƛ’or ičix zown.
\m madaħ moči-ƛ’ ža c’aq’ t’eq’erbaši-ƛ’or iči-x zow-n
\g outside place-SUPER.ESS DEM1.SG very cautiousness-SUPER.LAT be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In places outside, he was very cautious.

\t C’ik’iw yizi kecnosi, neł aždaħä c’in erno ɣoɣoru ʕamołno eqerno geres hibo ɣoɣorik’a boqno.
\m c’ik’iw yizi kec-nosi neła aždaħ-a c’i-n er-n ɣoɣoru ʕam-ł-n eqer-n ger-s hibo ɣoɣorik’-a b-oq-n
\g all DEM2.IPL sleep-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL dragon-ERG fire-TOP put-PFV.CVB hot coal-CONT.ESS-TOP put-PFV.CVB iron-GEN1 stick make.red.hot-INF III-begin-PST.UNW
\l When all of them slept, the dragon made a fire, put an iron staff onto the coals and began to make it red-hot.

\t Ža neła royxosi šebin rukaynosi, C’iɣruk’ä ħamori kurno.
\m ža neła-a r-odi-xosi šebin r-ukad-nosi C’iɣruk’-a ħamori kur-n
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG IV-do-PRS.PRT thing IV-see-ANT.CVB Tsighruk-ERG cough exhale-PST.UNW
\l When he saw what he was doing, Tsighruk coughed.

\t Aždaħä esirno, šebi deber retinƛin.
\m aždaħ-a esir-n šebi mi-r r-eti-n-ƛin
\g dragon-ERG ask-PST.UNW what you-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The dragon asked: "What did you want?"

\t Däz eniya neširuxayt’a bexayn miƛ’in eli bišerxosiƛin, C’iɣruk’ä žawab bodin.
\m di-z eni-a neširu-xay-t’a b-exʷad-n miƛ’i-n eli b-iš-r-xosi-ƛin C’iɣruk’-a žawab b-odi-n
\g me-GEN2 mother-ERG evening-AD.ABL-DISTR III-slaughter-PFV.CVB ram-TOP we I.PL-eat-CAUS-PRS.PRT-QUOT Tsighruk-ERG answer III-do-PST.UNW
\l "My mother slaughtered a ram every night and fed us", he replied.

\t Debez eniwq baqru hunarä däq boqxanuƛin, aždaħä žedur miƛ’i bexayn.
\m mi-z eniw-q b-oq-ru hunar-a di-q b-oq-x-anu-ƛin aždaħ-a žedu-r miƛ’i b-exʷad-n
\g you-GEN2 mother-POSS.ESS III-happen-PST.PRT talent-ERG me-POSS.ESS III-become-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT dragon-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT ram III-slaughter-PST.UNW
\l "Your mother's talent isn't mine", the dragon said and slaughtered a ram for them.

\t Neširutow moƛaxayn bizirno, sosigon bišerno yiła yizi kecerno.
\m neširu-tow moƛu-xay-n b-izi-r-n sosi-gon b-iš-r-n yiła-a yizi kec-r-n
\g at.night-EMPH sleep-AD.ABL-TOP I.PL-get.up-CAUS-PFV.CVB again-CNTR I.PL-eat-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL sleep-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l At night he woke them up from their sleep, fed them again and put them to bed.

\t Xizyogon howžatow geresni hibo aždaħä ɣoɣorik’ƛ’orey, C’iɣruk’ä ħamori kurno.
\m xizyogon howža-tow ger-s-ni hibo aždaħ-a ɣoɣorik’-ƛ’oräy C’iɣruk’-a ħamori kur-n
\g again DEM4.SG-EMPH iron-GEN1-DEF stick dragon-ERG make.red.hot-SIM.CVB Tsighruk-ERG cough exhale-PST.UNW
\l Again, when the dragon heated that iron staff, Tsighruk coughed.

\t Boɣno kurno c’iday hibon esirno, šebi deber retinƛin.
\m b-oɣ-n kur-n c’i-day hibo-n esir-n šebi mi-r r-eti-n-ƛin
\g III-take.away-PFV.CVB throw-PFV.CVB fire-APUD.ABL stick-TOP ask-PST.UNW what you-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l He took the stick out of the fire, threw it away and asked. "What did you want?"

\t C’iɣruk’a eƛin, däz eniya moƛał iħäy ɣired łi rowx rukaysƛin.
\m C’iɣruk’-a eƛi-n di-z eni-a moƛu-ł iħu-ay ɣir-d łi r-ow-x r-ukad-s-ƛin
\g Tsighruk-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN2 mother-ERG dream-CONT.ESS river-IN.ABL sieve-INSTR water IV-bring-IPFV.CVB IV-see-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Tsighruk said: "I dreamed how my mother was bringing water from the river with a sieve."

\t Debez eniwq baqru hunarä däq boqxanuƛin ɣirno bisno iħaɣor łi rowanix bik’in.
\m mi-z eniw-q b-oq-ru hunar-a di-q b-oq-x-anu-ƛin ɣir-n b-is-n iħu-aɣor łi r-ow-ani-x b-ik’i-n
\g you-GEN2 mother-POSS.ESS III-happen-PST.PRT talent-ERG me-POSS.ESS III-happen-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT sieve-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB river-IN.VERS water IV-bring-MSD-AD.ESS III-go-PST.UNW
\l "Your mother's talent isn't mine", [he said], took a sieve and went to the river to fetch water.

\t Aždaħ bäk’irun C’iɣruk’a nesä nesis esnabin bizirno, žedus meča xisizi rodin šeƛ’un nełastow kidbabi kecerno.
\m aždaħ b-ik’i-run C’iɣruk’-a nesi-a nesi-s esyu-bi-n b-izi-r-n žedu-s meča xisizi r-odi-n šeƛ’u-n neła-s-tow kid-bi kec-r-n
\g dragon III-go-IMM.ANT.CVB Tsighruk-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 brother-PL-TOP I.PL-get.up-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-GEN1 instead.of exchange IV-do-PFV.CVB clothing-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH daughter-PL sleep-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l Just when the dragon was gone, Tsighruk woke up his own brothers, exchanged the clothings of the dragons daughters against theirs and put the daughters back to sleep.

\t Aždaħ bigza ħalał buyn akiłno, boɣno kurno ɣirno, idurno nexno ɣoɣorik’no hibon užizaz akix eqerno.
\m aždaħ b-ig-za ħalał b-uy-n akił-n b-oɣ-n kur-n ɣir-n idu-r-n nex-n ɣoɣorik’-n hibo-n uži-bi-z aki-x eqer-n
\g dragon III-very-ZA with.difficulties III-indeed-TOP get.tired-PFV.CVB III-take.away-PFV.CVB throw-PFV.CVB sieve-TOP home-LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB make.red.hot-PFV.CVB stick-TOP boy-PL-GEN2 window-AD.ESS put-PST.UNW
\l The dragon got tired with all those difficulties, took the sieve and threw it away, came home, heated the staff again and put it to the boys' window.

\t Sasaqosi moƛaxayn bizin, aždaħä yeɣeni kidbeqorƛin eƛin, Maryam där bišan riso, ič’an eɣeni užiz iyos q’ut’un bic’o mečołxor raƛin.
\m sasaqosi moƛu-xay-n b-izi-n aždaħ-a y-eɣe-ni kid-qor-ƛin eƛi-n Maryam di-r bišʷa-n r-is-o ič’a-n eɣe-ni uži-z iyo-s q’ut’u-n b-ic’-o moči-łxor r-ow-ƛin
\g in.the.morning sleep-AD.ABL-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB dragon-ERG II-young-DEF daughter-POSS.LAT-QUOT say-PST.UNW Maryam me-LAT food-TOP IV-take-IMPR most-TOP young-DEF boy-GEN2 blood-GEN1 earthen.jug-TOP III-fill-IMPR field-CONT.VERS IV-bring-QUOT
\l In the morning, after getting up from his sleep, the dragon said to - what he supposed was - his youngest daughter: "Maryam, take the food to me and fill the earthen jug with the youngest boy's blood and bring them to the field!"

\t C’iɣruk’ä yeɣeni kidbes iyos q’ut’un bic’no, nełastow ħamorok’un roɣno adäz eqerno, maqˤäytow aždaħqor qˤaƛin, biša ħaƛis, howži idur bik’iƛin.
\m C’iɣruk’-a y-eɣe-ni kid-s iyo-s q’ut’u-n b-ic’-n neła-s-tow ħamorok’u-n r-oɣ-n adäz eqer-n maqˤi-ay-tow aždaħ-qor qˤaƛi-n bišʷa ħaƛi-s howži idu-r b-ik’i-ƛin
\g Tsighruk-ERG II-young-DEF daughter-GEN1 blood-GEN1 earthen.jug-TOP III-fill-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH breast-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB ahead put-PFV.CVB far.away-IN.ABL-EMPH dragon-POSS.LAT shout-PST.UNW food organize-PST.WIT now home-LAT III-go-QUOT
\l Tsighruk filled the youngest daughter's blood into an earthen jug, took her breast and put it before himself and shouted from far away to the dragon: "I organized the food, now I'm going home!"

\t Mečoz č’imä bišan eqerno, C’iɣruk’ esnazał xizay ik’in.
\m moči-z č’imu-a bišʷa-n eqer-n C’iɣruk’ esyu-bi-ł xizay ik’i-n
\g field-GEN2 corner-IN.ESS food-TOP put-PFV.CVB Tsighruk brother-PL-CONT.ESS behind go-PST.UNW
\l Tsighruk put the food into a corner of the field and went behind his brothers.

\t Aždaħä bišanix baybik bodin.
\m aždaħ-a b-iš-ani-x baybik b-odi-n
\g dragon-ERG III-eat-MSD-AD.ESS begin III-do-PST.UNW
\l The dragon began to eat.

\t Sosi iyos q’ut’u ħaƛun, xizyo bišƛ’oräy ħamorok’uƛ’ ozuri c’oxnosi, nełaq ixiwtow qˤaƛu regin, way dey Maryamƛin.
\m sosi iyo-s q’ut’u ħaƛu-n xizyo b-iš-ƛ’oräy ħamorok’u-ƛ’ ozuri c’ox-nosi neła-q ixiw-tow qˤaƛu r-egi-n way di-s Maryam-ƛin
\g at.first blood-GEN1 earthen.jug drink-PFV.CVB afterwards III-eat-SIM.CVB breast-SUPER.ESS eye meet-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS big-EMPH shout IV-emit-PST.UNW o.dear me-GEN1 Maryam-QUOT
\l First, he drank the jug with the blood, afterwards, while eating, his eye met the breast and a big shout emitted from him: "O dear, my Maryam!"

\t Nełaz ħamorok’uƛ’ zawru muhruzaxor, ža Maryames yałru riyn.
\m neła-z ħamorok’u-ƛ’ zow-ru muhru-bi-xor ža Maryam-s yoł-ru r-iy-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 breast-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-PST.PRT birthmark-PL-AD.LAT DEM1.SG Maryam-GEN1 be-PST.PRT IV-know-PST.UNW
\l From the birthmarks that were on her breast, he knew it was Maryam.

\t Yiłar roda šebinon łaħin, esnazał xizay k’oƛin.
\m yiła-r r-odi-a šebinon łaħi-n esyu-bi-ł xizay k’oƛi-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT IV-do-INF something leave.behind-PFV.CVB brother-PL-CONT.ESS from.behind run-PST.UNW
\l He left the things that were to be done by him and ran behind the brothers.

\t Ža bayzaƛ’or łˤonon esnabi iħun boɣno taqˤaɣorgon bok’łäsi zown.
\m ža b-ay-zaƛ’or łˤono-n esyu-bi iħu-n b-oɣ-n taqˤo-aɣor-gon b-ok’eł-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.SG III-come-POST.CVB three-TOP brother-PL river-TOP III-cross-PFV.CVB over.there-IN.VERS-CNTR I.PL-escape-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Before he came, the three brothers crossed a river and escaped to there.

\t C’iɣruk’ä xizyogon ħukmu bodix aždaħes mesedyos teł ric’alini sabani rok’ek’a.
\m C’iɣruk’-a xizyogon ħukmu b-odi-x aždaħ-s mesed-s teł r-ic’-ali-ni sabani r-ok’ek’-a
\g Tsighruk-ERG then decision III-do-PRS dragon-GEN1 gold-GEN1 inside IV-fill-ATTR-DEF blanket IV-steal-INF
\l Tsighruk then decided to steal the blanket filled with the dragon's gold.

\t Ža ħalt’ołxor bik’ixosi zamanno biyrno, risno muran, bik’in aždaħzo idurno sabanił roqun.
\m ža ħalt’i-łxor b-ik’i-xosi zaman-n b-iyr-n r-is-n muri-bi-n b-ik’i-n aždaħ-z idu-r-n sabani-ł r-oqu-n
\g DEM1.SG work-CONT.VERS III-go-PRS.PRT time-TOP III-find.out-PFV.CVB III.PL-take-PFV.CVB needle-PL-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB dragon-GEN2 home-LAT-TOP blanket-CONT.ESS III.PL-stick-PST.UNW
\l He found out the time that he [the dragon] goes to work, took needles, went to the dragon's home and stuck them into the blanket.

\t Buħima halizi bodinosi, idurno bik’in sabaniƛ’or boƛ’ˤun.
\m buħi-a halizi b-odi-nosi idu-r-n b-ik’i-n sabani-ƛ’or b-ˤoƛ’u-n
\g heat-ERG excite III-do-ANT.CVB home-LAT-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB blanket-SUPER.LAT III-fall-PST.UNW
\l When the heat excited him [the dragon], he went home and fell onto the blanket.

\t Dice č’iki boqno t’oƛin rok’ƛ’orno rayn nełaz, lagiłxor mura rik’inosi, risno sabani maħor kurno.
\m dice č’iki b-oq-n t’o-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n neła-z laga-łxor muri-bi r-ik’i-nosi r-is-n sabani maħor kur-n
\g how.many flea III-become-PST.UNW here-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 body-CONT.VERS needle-PL III.PL-go-ANT.CVB IV-take-PFV.CVB blanket outside throw-PST.UNW
\l "How many fleas are here?!", he thought and after the needles went into his body, he took the blanket and threw it outside.

\t C’iɣruk’ägon ža sabanin risno oxin ik’in elay.
\m C’iɣruk’-a-gon ža sabani-n r-is-n oxi-n ik’i-n ele-ay
\g Tsighruk-ERG-CNTR DEM1.SG blanket-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB run.away-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW there-IN.ABL
\l And Tsighruk took the blanket and ran away from there.

\t Aždaħ maħor boqnosi, resunanu sabani.
\m aždaħ maħor b-oq-nosi r-esu-n-anu sabani
\g dragon outside III-become-ANT.CVB IV-find-PFV.CVB-NEG blanket
\l When the dragon went outside, he didn't find the blanket.

\t Ža łas ħalt’i yałrun čuqˤno k’oƛin yedu xizay.
\m ža ła-s ħalt’i yoł-run čuqˤ-n k’oƛi-n yedu xizay
\g DEM1.SG who.OBL-GEN1 work be-IMM.ANT.CVB notice-PFV.CVB run-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG behind
\l Just when he noticed who's work this was, he ran behind [him].

\t C’iɣruk’ yołi iħuƛ’ taqˤorgon oqno ok’łäsi zown.
\m C’iɣruk’ yołi iħu-ƛ’ taqˤo-r-gon oq-n ok’eł-asi zow-n
\g Tsighruk however river-SUPER.ESS over.there-LAT-CNTR become-PFV.CVB escape-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Tsighruk, however, crossed a river and escaped.

\t Ixiw qˤaƛun rok’no, łinasnotown čaran bexun, aždaħ xizor butin.
\m ixiw qˤaƛu-n r-ok’-n łina-s-n-tow-n čara-n b-exu-n aždaħ xizor b-uti-n
\g big shout-TOP IV-beat-PFV.CVB what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-EMPH-TOP possibility-TOP III-die-PFV.CVB dragon back III-return-PST.UNW
\l The dragon emitted a loud shout, he had no possibilities and returned.

\t C’iɣruk’es xizyogon aždaħtow bok’ek’anixƛin rok’ƛ’or pikru bayn.
\m C’iɣruk’-s xizyogon aždaħ-tow b-ok’ek’-ani-x-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or pikru b-ay-n
\g Tsighruk-GEN1 again dragon-EMPH III-steal.from-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT idea III-come-PST.UNW
\l Tsighruk thought of stealing from the dragon again.

\t C’ik’iwtow humerno, šeƛ’un xiszi rodin, nełdäɣorno ik’in esirno, ɣamas yodixosi žek’u etinaƛin.
\m c’ik’iw-tow humer-n šeƛ’u-n xiszi r-odi-n neła-däɣor-n ik’i-n esir-n ɣamas y-odi-xosi žek’u eti-n-a-ƛin
\g entire-EMPH face-and clothing-and change IV-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.VERS-TOP go-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW box II-do-PRS.PRT man want-PST.UNW-Q-QUOT
\l He changed his entire face and his clothes, went to him [the dragon] and asked if he wanted a man that makes boxes.

\t Aždaħä eƛin, yedu mi däz rok’ƛ’ositow šebinwa esirä.
\m aždaħ-a eƛi-n yedu mi di-z rok’u-ƛ’-s-tow šebin-a esir-a
\g dragon-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG you me-GEN2 heart-SUPER.ESS-GEN1-EMPH thing-Q ask-PST.WIT.INT
\l The dragon said: "You have asked exactly what I had on my mind.

\t Walah, sis ɣamas yodira yetäsi zows där adäytow soder.
\m walla sis ɣamas y-odi-r-a y-eti-asi zow-s di-r adäy-tow soder
\g wallah one box II-do-CAUS-INF II-want-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT me-LAT earlier-EMPH after
\l By God, I wanted to have someone make a box for so long!

\t C’iɣruk’ä ixiw ɣamas yodanix bašla bodin.
\m C’iɣruk’-a ixiw ɣamas y-odi-ani-x bašla b-odi-n
\g Tsighruk-ERG big box II-do-MSD-AD.ESS begin III-do-PST.UNW
\l Tsighruk began to make a big box.

\t Yodin łiyƛ’orey, nesä aždaħqor eƛin, hay i wele, k’ʷaħal boqinč’ey, tełerno boqno šet’ur č’uramƛ’o bezučey aɣ-ač’iwnan ƛexuna yedu däqƛin.
\m y-odi-n łiy-ƛ’oräy nesi-a aždaħ-qor eƛi-n hay i wele k’ʷaħal b-oq-č’ey tełer-n b-oq-n šet’ur č’ura-ƛ’ b-ezu-u-čey aɣ~ač’iw-nan ƛexu-n-a yedu di-q-ƛin
\g II-do-PFV.CVB end-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG dragon-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW so.then and look.out.IMP be.lazy III-become-NEG.PST.CVB to.the.inside-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB around light-SUPER.ESS III-look-IMPR-INTS hole~ridden-INT remain-PST.UNW-Q DEM2.IISG me-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l When he finished it, he asked the dragon: "So look, please don't be lazy, and get inside and look around for any light if I left anything hole-ridden."

\t Tełerno boqno aždaħä k’ek’-bik’no ɣamas ok’zay yoɣek’no.
\m tełer-n b-oq-n aždaħ-a k’ek’~ik’-n ɣamas ok’-bi-ay y-oɣek’-n
\g to.the.inside-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB dragon-ERG move-PFV.CVB box nail-PL-IN.ABL II-pull.out-PST.UNW
\l The dragon went inside and moved, and the box was pulled out from the nails.

\t ƛ’irigon C’iɣruk’ä acno yuqin naysinan ok’bi rok’no.
\m ƛ’iri-gon C’iɣruk’-a ac-n y-uqi-n naysinan ok’-bi r-ok’-n
\g above-CNTR Tsighruk-ERG door-TOP II-close-PFV.CVB everywhere nail-PL III.PL-beat-PST.UNW
\l But then Tsighruk closed the door and put in nails everywhere.

\t Šet’urno bezu-bˤoƛ’un, neła nasin č’urambi rukayxosi močibi äsiruxorgon, nesä ok’bi paqˤƛirxo ik’ix zown.
\m šet’ur-n b-ezu~oƛ’ˤu-n neła-a nasin č’ura-bi r-ukad-xosi moči-bi esi-ru-xor-gon nesi-a ok’-bi paqˤƛir-x ik’i-x zow-n
\g around-TOP III-examine-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG all light-PL IV.PL-see-PRS.PRT place-PL tell-PST.PRT-AD.LAT-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG nail-PL hit-IPFV.CVB go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He [Tsighruk] struck in nails to where he [the dragon], looking around and seeing all the light, told.

\t T’ok’ow elo tełäy boqełxanuzoxor ɣamasya žan bišin C’iɣruk’ä eƛin, hoboy debi ɣudbi łiysƛin.
\m t’ok’ow elo teł-ay b-oq-ł-xanuzo-xor ɣamas-a ža-n b-iši-n C’iɣruk’-a eƛi-n hoboy mi-s ɣudi-bi łiy-s-ƛin
\g anymore there inside-IN.ABL III-become-POT-NEG.PRS.PRT.OBL-AD.LAT box-IN.ESS DEM1.SG-TOP III-lock.up-PFV.CVB Tsighruk-ERG say-PST.UNW now you-GEN1 day-PL end-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Tsighruk locked him in the box so that he couldn't get out there anymore, and said: "Now your days are numbered!"

\t Aždaħä raɣru ixiw qˤaƛuma, C’iɣruk’ łaymoƛ’ay iža dahaw šebin xecin.
\m aždaħ-a r-oɣ-ru ixiw qˤaƛu-a C’iɣruk’ łay-ƛ’ay iži-a dahaw šebin xeci-n
\g dragon-ERG IV-hatch-PST.PRT big shout-ERG Tsighruk mind-SUPER.ABL carry-INF a.little thing leave-PST.UNW
\l The shout that the dragon emitted distracted Tsighruk a little bit.

\t Nesä ža ɣamas hokomƛ’on erno iħuxaɣor yižiƛ’oräy, łas haraƛ’ teqnosigon, nełaq roč’uganitow qˤaƛu regin.
\m nesi-a ža ɣamas hoko-ƛ’-on er-n iħu-xaɣor y-iži-ƛ’oräy łi-s haraƛ’ teq-nosi-gon neła-q roč’i-ga-ni-tow qˤaƛu r-egi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG box carriage-SUPER.ESS-CND put-PFV.CVB river-AD.VERS II-carry-SIM.CVB water-GEN1 voice hear-ANT.CVB-CNTR DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS frost-ATTR-DEF-EMPH shout IV-emit-PST.UNW
\l He put the box onto a carriage and while carrying it to a river, but when he heared the water's voice, it emitted a frosty shout.

\t Suƛitow nesä iħä łäłxor ɣamasno kurno.
\m suƛƛi-tow nesi-a iħu-a łi-łxor ɣamas-n kur-n
\g suddenly-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG river-IN.ESS water-CONT.VERS box-TOP throw-PST.UNW
\l And suddenly he threw the box into the water in the river.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder didiwnkin mišayat boyx zownanu neł ʕaƛoz žamaʕatyor, ya posu t’ok’ow narnokin rok’ełnoanu, ya räƛiru qˤiči łukin rexurnoanu.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder didiw-n-kin mišayat b-odi-x zow-n-anu neła ʕaƛ-z žamaʕat-r ya posu t’ok’ow nar-n-kin r-ok’eł-n-anu ya r-iƛi-ru qˤiči łu-kin r-exur-n-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after which-TOP-even obstacle III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.IISG.OBL village-GEN2 population-LAT neither cattle anymore where-TOP-even IV-escape-PFV.CVB-NEG neither IV-plant-PST.PRT harvest who.ERG-even IV-kill-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l After that no obstacle occured to the village's population anymore; neither did any cattle escape, nor did anyone kill the planted harvest.

\t Aždaħ t’aʕizi bayru C’iɣruk’er c’ik’iwzä barkala teƛno.
\m aždaħ t’aʕizi b-odi-ru C’iɣruk’-r c’ik’iw-bi-a barkala teƛ-n
\g dragon dissappear III-do-PST.PRT Tsighruk-LAT all-PL-ERG thank give-PST.UNW
\l And everyone thanked Tsighruk who has destroyed the dragon.

\t Esin šebi, xecin šebi zownƛax zown anuƛax sis žek’u.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis žek’u
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT one man
\l Once upon a time there was a man.

\t Nesis q’ˤano uži zown.
\m nesi-s q’ˤano uži zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 two son be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had two sons.

\t Babiya užizaqor eƛin, exunosi meža di azbaryan šušo, ƛ’irigon ciyon ƛešoƛin.
\m babi-a uži-bi-qor eƛi-n exu-nosi mežu-a di azbar-a-n šuši-o ƛ’iri-gon ciyo-n ƛešu-o-ƛin
\g dad-ERG son-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW die-ANT.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-ERG me palace-IN.ESS-TOP bury-IMPR above-CNTR salt-TOP pour-IMPR-QUOT
\l The father said to his sons: "When [I] die, bury me in the palace, and pour salt on it!"

\t Užiza babiws wasin t’ubazi bodin, nesä äƛiruxor, ƛ’irirgon ciyon ƛešun.
\m uži-bi-a babiw-s wasi-n t’ubazi b-odi-n nesi-a eƛi-ru-xor ƛ’iri-r-gon ciyo-n ƛešu-n
\g son-PL-ERG father-GEN1 testament-TOP fulfill III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT above-LAT-CNTR salt-TOP pour-PST.UNW
\l The sons fulfilled the father's testament and - according to what he had said - poured salt on it.

\t Šibaw ɣudƛ’o šudaƛ’ay ciyo raganix sis ixiw miƛ’it’a bayx zown.
\m šibaw ɣudi-ƛ’ šuda-ƛ’ay ciyo r-agi-ani-x sis ixiw miƛ’i-t’a b-ay-x zow-n
\g every day-SUPER.ESS graveyard-SUPER.ABL salt IV-lick-MSD-AD.ESS one big ram-DISTR III-come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Every day a big ram was coming to lick the salt from the grave.

\t Sida quł eženi uži ža biqiranƛin aqru, boxin bok’ełno.
\m sida qu-ł eže-ni uži ža b-iqir-an-ƛin oq-ru b-oxi-n b-ok’eł-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS old-DEF son DEM1.SG III-catch-FUT.CVB-QUOT begin-PST.PRT III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-escape-PST.UNW
\l One day, the oldest son tried to catch it, but it escaped and ran away.

\t Q’ˤano äƛirugon ɣudƛ’o gulun ħadur bodin, bayrun biqiranƛin babiws šudaƛ’orno ik’in ezun ičin.
\m q’ˤano äƛiru-gon ɣudi-ƛ’ gulu-n ħadur b-odi-n b-ay-run b-iqir-an-ƛin babiw-s šuda-ƛ’or-n ik’i-n ezu-n iči-n
\g two ORD-CNTR day-SUPER.ESS horse-TOP prepare III-do-PFV.CVB III-come-IMM.ANT.CVB III-catch-FUT.CVB-QUOT father-GEN1 graveyard-SUPER.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB look-PFV.CVB wait-PST.UNW
\l On the second day, he prepared a horse and went to wait looking to the father's graveyard in order to catch it right when it comes.

\t Miƛ’i boƛäxrun, et’un guluƛ’orno k’oƛin oqno xizay.
\m miƛ’i b-oƛix-run et’u-n gulu-ƛ’or-n k’oƛi-n oq-n xizay
\g ram III-appear-IMM.ANT.CVB jump-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.LAT-TOP run-PFV.CVB begin-PST.UNW from.behind
\l Just when the ram appeared, he jumped onto his horse and began to ride behind it.

\t Boxin žan, xizay k’oƛin yizirin bik’iƛ’oräy, sidaɣ ɣˤayz iħuƛ’ozoni ƛeraxor bayza mečoƛ’, ozƛäy bˤeƛ’q’u bok’ełno.
\m b-oxi-n ža-n xizay k’oƛi-n yiziri-n b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy sidaɣ ɣˤay-z iħu-ƛ’-zo-ni ƛe-xor b-ay-za moči-ƛ’ ozuri-ƛay bˤeƛ’q’ˤu b-ok’eł-n
\g III-run.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP from.behind run-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL-TOP I.PL-go-SIM.CVB in.one.place milk-GEN2 river-SUPER.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF bridge-AD.LAT III-come-LCV place-SUPER.ESS eye-SUB.ABL sheep III-escape-PST.UNW
\l While it ran away and they were riding behind it, the sheep escaped from his eye at the place where it came to the bridge over a milk river.

\t Ža gagirun, suƛi gula neł iħay ɣˤay ħaƛurun, gulun, užintown ɣˤuler butix.
\m ža gugi-run suƛƛi gulu-a neła iħu-ay ɣˤay ħaƛu-run gulu-n uži-n-tow-n ɣˤul-r b-uti-x
\g DEM1.SG escape-IMM.ANT.CVB suddenly horse-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL river-IN.ABL milk drink-IMM.ANT.CVB horse-and boy-and-EMPH-TOP stone-LAT I.PL-turn-PRS
\l Right after it had escaped, the horse suddenly drank the milk from that river and the horse and the boy turned to stone.

\t Sasaqgon miƛ’i šudaƛ’or ciyo raganix bayn.
\m sasaq-gon miƛ’i šuda-ƛ’or ciyo r-agi-ani-x b-ay-n
\g tomorrow-CNTR ram graveyard-SUPER.LAT salt IV-lick-MSD-AD.ESS III-come-PST.UNW
\l And on the next day, the ram came to the graveyard to lick the salt again.

\t Eɣenigon esiw ža biqiranƛin oqno, hemedurtow nesiqayn boxin bok’ełno.
\m eɣe-ni-gon esiw ža b-iqir-an-ƛin oq-n hemedur-tow nesi-qay-n b-oxi-n b-ok’eł-n
\g young-DEF-CNTR brother DEM1.SG III-catch-FUT.CVB-QUOT begin-PFV.CVB so-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL-TOP III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-escape-PST.UNW
\l The young brother tryed to catch it, and just as before it escaped and ran away from him.

\t Nesän hudayziko sasaqtow izin gulun ħadur bodin xalmoƛ’or ičin.
\m nesi-a-n hudayziko sasaq-tow izi-n gulu-n ħadur b-odi-n xal-ƛ’or iči-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP the.next.day in.the.morning-EMPH get.up-PFV.CVB horse-TOP prepare III-do-PFV.CVB examination-SUPER.LAT be-PST.UNW
\l He got up the next morning, prepared a horse and examined.

\t Miƛ’i bayrun, guluƛ’no zown eɣeni esiw k’oƛin nełał xizay.
\m miƛ’i b-ay-run gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n eɣe-ni esiw k’oƛi-n neła-ł xizay
\g ram III-come-IMM.ANT.CVB horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother run-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS from.behind
\l Just when the ram came, the young brother rode on the horse and followed it.

\t Boxin bik’ixozo miƛ’ił xizay bˤałno gulun ik’ixosi yeda, ɣˤayz iħuƛ’ozoni ƛeroƛ’ taqˤor boqƛ’oräy, ža miƛ’i yisä bexurno iħäɣor kurno.
\m b-oxi-n b-ik’i-xozo miƛ’i-ł xizay b-ˤał-n gulu-n ik’i-xosi yeda ɣˤay-z iħu-ƛ’-zo-ni ƛe-ƛ’ taqˤo-r b-oq-ƛ’oräy ža miƛ’i yisi-a b-exur-n iħu-aɣor kur-n
\g III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-go-PRS.PRT.OBL ram-CONT.ESS from.behind III-strike-PFV.CVB horse-TOP go-PRS.PRT DEM2.ISG milk-GEN2 river-SUPER.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF bridge-SUPER.ESS over.there-LAT I.PL-become-SIM.CVB DEM1.SG ram DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG III-kill-PFV.CVB river-IN.VERS throw-PST.UNW
\l He striked his horse and rode behind the escaping ram, and when it got over the bridge over the milk river, he killed the ram and threw it into the river.

\t Elay bitor ik’iƛ’oräy, yeda eɣeni esiw sidaɣ ʕaƛar ayn.
\m ele-ay bitor ik’i-ƛ’oräy yeda eɣe-ni esiw sidaɣ ʕaƛ-ar ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL thither go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG young-DEF brother in.one.place village-IN.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l While going away from there, the young brother came into a village someplace.

\t Elo yisir šeƛ’urez meča ħošan lagiq šet’u rutirno ahli besun.
\m elo yisi-r šeƛ’u-z meča ħoša-n laga-q šet’u r-utir-n ahli b-esu-n
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT clothing-GEN2 instead.of hides-TOP body-POSS.ESS around IV-turn-PFV.CVB people III-find-PST.UNW
\l There he found people wearing hides around their body instead of clothes.

\t Yisä esirno žeduq, šida meži nedur bičäsiƛin.
\m yisi-a esir-n žedu-q šida meži nedur b-iči-asi-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS why you.PL so III-live-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l He asked them: "Why do you live that way?"

\t Elus šeƛ’ures bic’äsi gama raładyoł boƛor bayrułer tełxor biħusƛin, žawab teƛno žeda nesir.
\m elu-s šeƛ’u-s b-ic’-asi gama raład-ł b-oƛƛo-r b-ay-ru-łer teł-xor b-iħu-s-ƛin žawab teƛ-n žedu-a nesi-r
\g we(I).OBL-GEN1 clothing-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT boat sea-CONT.ESS III-middle-LAT III-come-PST.PRT-CONT.LAT inside-AD.LAT III-come.to-PST.WIT-QUOT answer give-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT
\l "The boat filled with our clothes sank when it came to the middle of the sea.", they answered him.

\t Sasaq gamiƛ’no zowrno, yizä yeda uži ɣˤayz iħuƛ’ ƛ’iri ižix.
\m sasaq gama-ƛ’-n zowr-n yizi-a yeda uži ɣˤay-z iħu-ƛ’ ƛ’iri iži-x
\g tomorrow boat-SUPER.ESS-TOP seat-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG boy milk-GEN2 river-SUPER.ESS on take.out-PRS
\l The next day, they seated the boy on a boat, and took him out on the milk river.

\t Eɣeni esiw šet’ur ezu-ʕoƛ’ux, xal bodix ik’ix zown.
\m eɣe-ni esiw šet’ur ezu~oƛ’ˤu-x xal b-odi-x ik’i-x zow-n
\g young-DEF brother around examine-IPFV.CVB examination III-do-IPFV.CVB go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The young brother went examining and looking around.

\t Boƛƛ’or bayrułer, nesir yizis gama tełxor ƛisix sis kid yukayn.
\m boƛƛ’o-r b-ay-ru-łer nesi-r yizi-s gama teł-xor ƛisi-x sis kid y-ukad-n
\g middle-LAT I.PL-come-PST.PRT-CONT.LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 boat inside-AD.LAT pull-IPFV.CVB one girl II-see-PST.UNW
\l When they came to the middle [of the sea], he saw a girl pulling their boat downwards.

\t Neła mixƛ’o yisä k’oƛin nełas kodi biqirno.
\m neła-a mix-ƛ’ yisi-a k’oƛi-n neła-s kodi b-iqir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG time-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG run-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 hair III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l At that time, he ran and took her by her hair.

\t Didurnokin eɣeni esiws ħal bayrxo zownanu neła, kodi begirinč’eygon yedan zank’izin oqno ičäsi zown.
\m didur-n-kin eɣe-ni esiw-s ħal b-ayr-x zow-n-anu neła-a kodi b-egir-č’ey-gon yeda-n zank’izi-n oq-n iči-asi zow-n
\g how-TOP-even young-DEF brother-GEN1 strength III-bring-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG hair III-let-NEG.PST.UNW-CNTR DEM2.ISG-TOP persist-TOP become-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The young brother couldn't overcome her in any way, but he didn't let her hair go.

\t Zamanałäy bet’un kodin nexno, begirno gaman xecin yedu kid raładyołxor yiħun.
\m zaman-łay b-et’u-n kodi-n nex-n b-egir-n gama-n xeci-n yedu kid raład-łxor y-iħu-n
\g time-CONT.ABL III-come.off-PFV.CVB hair-TOP come-PFV.CVB III-let-PFV.CVB boat-TOP leave-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG girl sea-CONT.VERS II-come.to-PST.UNW
\l After some time, the hair came off and the girl let go of the boat and went into the sea.

\t Gama lilyoxaɣor bok’ełnosi, nazon ʕaƛoz ahlimos rok’un ħalkizi roqno.
\m gama lilyo-xaɣor b-ok’eł-nosi nazo-n ʕaƛ-z ahli-mo-s rok’u-n ħalkizi r-oq-n
\g boat river.bank-AD.VERS III-escape-ANT.CVB all.OBL-TOP village-GEN2 people-ERG-GEN1 heart-TOP calm.down IV-become-PST.UNW
\l When the boat escaped to the beach, all the village's citizens calmed down.

\t Hemece ɣˤaɣˤu bizizaq, howlotow žamaʕatyoz ahlimos q’ut’i boqno ʕaƛa teł hič’č’a bercinawni kid žax yegira.
\m hemece ɣˤaɣˤu b-izi-zaq howlo-tow žamaʕat-z ahli-s q’ut’i b-oq-n ʕaƛ-a teł hič’č’a bercinaw-ni kid uži-x y-egir-a
\g as.many be.happy III-get.up-CSL.CVB there-EMPH population-GEN2 people-GEN1 agreement III-become-PST.UNW village-IN.ESS inside the.most beautiful-DEF girl boy-AD.ESS II-send-INF
\l Because they were so glad, the citizen there decided that the boy should get the most beautiful girl in the village.

\t Yisä eƛin, mežus där raq’ˤu šebin ħažat anu, gulun, šeƛ’un, tupin neƛ meča din egirno xec.
\m yisi-a eƛi-n mežu-s di-r r-aq’ˤu šebin ħažat anu gulu-n šeƛ’u-n tupi-n neƛ meča di-n egir-n xeci
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 me-LAT IV-many thing necessity be.absent horse-and clothing-and rifle-and give instead me-TOP send-PFV.CVB leave
\l He said: "I don't need your many things, just give me a horse, clothes and a rifle instead and let me go."

\t ʕOƛno ħonno, ʕoƛno iħun xecin ik’inosi, sida ʕaƛar ayn.
\m ʕoƛno ħon-n ʕoƛno iħu-n xeci-n ik’i-nosi sida ʕaƛ-ar ay-n
\g seven mountain-and seven river-and leave-PFV.CVB go-ANT.CVB one.OBL village-IN.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l After he walked past seven mountains and seven rivers, he came into a village.

\t Elo ƛirbałix sida ɣˤanazader keze oqnosi, yisir neł ʕaƛnos xalq’i sidaɣor butäsi bukayn.
\m elo ƛirbałi-x sida ɣˤanabi-der keze oq-nosi yisi-r neła ʕaƛ-n-s xalq’i sida-aɣor b-uti-asi b-ukad-n
\g there hospitality-AD.ESS one.OBL woman-APUD.LAT meet become-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL village-and-GEN1 people one.OBL-IN.VERS III-turn-RES.PRT III-see-PST.UNW
\l When he became the guest of a woman there, he saw the people of the village gathering in some place.

\t Žedu bigtow q’ʷaridno boqno bičäsi boqzaƛ’, eɣeni esiya neł ečruni ɣˤanazaq esirno, žedu šida nece q’ʷaridno boqno bičäsiƛin.
\m žedu b-ig-tow q’ʷarid-n b-oq-n b-iči-asi b-oq-zaƛ’ eɣe-ni esyu-a neła ečru-ni ɣˤanabi-q esir-n žedu šida nece q’ʷarid-n b-oq-n b-iči-asi-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL III-much-EMPH sadness-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB I.PL-be-RES.PRT I.PL-become-CSL.CVB young-DEF brother-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL old-DEF woman-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL why so.much sadness-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB I.PL-be-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l Because they were very sad, the younger brother asked that old woman: "Why are they so sad?"

\t Yiła žawab bodin, hič’č’an bečedawni žek’us sistow sis yałruni uži iyrinč’ey ok’ek’no.
\m yiła-a žawab b-odi-n hič’č’a-n bečedaw-ni žek’u-s sis-tow sis yoł-ru-ni uži iyr-č’ey ok’ek’-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG answer III-do-PST.UNW the.most-TOP wealthy-DEF man-GEN1 one-EMPH one be-PST.PRT-DEF son find.out-NEG.PST.CVB steal.from-PST.UNW
\l She answered: "Someone has stolen the only son of the richest man, without him knowing."

\t Xizyo ečruni ɣˤanabi ʕaƛos xalq’i batizarno yik’in eƛin, däde idur sis uži ayäsi yoł, šebigo boqłin hunar boqinč’inäy ža t’orkin keze aqinč’iƛin.
\m xizyo ečru-ni ɣˤanabi ʕaƛ-s xalq’i b-uti-za-r-n y-ik’i-n eƛi-n di-de idu-r sis uži ay-asi yoł šebi-go b-oq-łin hunar b-oq-č’i-näy ža t’o-r-kin keze oq-č’i-ƛin
\g afterwards old-DEF woman village-GEN1 people III-turn-LCV-LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW me-APUD.ESS home-LAT one boy come-RES.PRT be what-COND III-become-CNC.CVB talent III-become-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB DEM1.SG here-LAT-even meet become-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l Afterwards, the old woman went to where the village's people gathered and said: "A boy has come to my home, if he had no talent, he wouldn't have come here."

\t Elogon nesä ža miƛ’in bexurno bäsu.
\m elo-gon nesi-a ža miƛ’i-n b-exur-n b-esu
\g there-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG ram-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB III-exist
\l "He might have killed the ram there."

\t Bečedawni žek’a goƛ’in idurno esirno nesiq, dey uži iqira k’ʷeze aqä debeqƛin.
\m bečedaw-ni žek’u-a goƛ’i-n idu-r-n esir-n nesi-q di-s uži iqir-a k’ʷeze oq-a mi-q-ƛin
\g wealthy-DEF man-ERG invite-PFV.CVB home-LAT-TOP ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS me-GEN1 son catch-INF can become-Q you-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l The rich man invited him into his home and asked him: "Will you be able to find my son?"

\t K’ʷeze oqnäy iqiran di debi užiƛin, žawab teƛno nesä.
\m k’ʷeze oq-näy iqir-an di mi-s uži-ƛin žawab teƛ-n nesi-a
\g can become-CND.CVB catch-FUT.DEF me you-GEN1 son-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "If I can, I will find your son", he answered.

\t Ža hunix oqnosi xalq’imo eč’erxo zown, äk’ino elaɣor min ok’äk’ƛin.
\m ža huni-x oq-nosi xalq’i-a eč’er-x zow-n ik’i-no ele-aɣor mi-n ok’ek’-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG way-AD.ESS become-ANT.CVB people-ERG stop-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB go-PROHIB here-IN.VERS you-and steal.from-QUOT
\l When he got on his way, the people were stopping him: "Don't go here, you will be stolen as well!"

\t Žeduq yeda eč’ra k’ʷeze oqnoanu.
\m žedu-q yeda eč’er-a k’ʷeze oq-n-anu
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM2.ISG stop-INF can become-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l They could not stop him.

\t Hunix ik’iƛ’oräy, hič’č’a adäza ža sida gondaƛ’or keze oqno.
\m huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy hič’č’a adäza ža sida gondu-ƛ’or keze oq-n
\g way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB the.most ahead DEM1.SG one.OBL big.hole-SUPER.LAT meet become-PST.UNW
\l While he was going on his way, he came to a hole in front of him

\t Elo tełxor oqƛ’orey, yisir č’ikays rodäsi ɣˤutku rukayn.
\m elo teł-xor oq-ƛ’oräy yisi-r č’ikay-s r-odi-asi ɣˤutku r-ukad-n
\g there inside-AD.LAT become-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT glass-GEN1 IV-do-RES.PRT house IV-see-PST.UNW
\l When he went inside there, he saw a house made of glass.

\t Yeda ukayrun, šebiƛa sis kid yoxin yik’iƛ’oräy, nełał xizay k’oƛin yisä nełas xot’oqosi riqirno.
\m yeda ukad-run šebi-ƛa sis kid y-oxi-n y-ik’i-ƛ’oräy neła-ł xizay k’oƛi-n yisi-a neła-s xot’o-q-si r-iqir-n
\g DEM2.ISG see-IMM.ANT.CVB who-INDEF one girl II-run.away-PFV.CVB II-go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS from.behind run-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 foot-POSS.ESS-ATTR IV-take.away-PST.UNW
\l And right when he saw that there was some girl who was trying to run away, he ran behind her and took what she had on her feet.

\t Žan risno iduza ezu-ʕoƛ’uƛ’oräy, yisir bečedawni žek’us uži esun.
\m ža-n r-is-n idu-za ezu~oƛ’ˤu-ƛ’oräy yisi-r bečedaw-ni žek’u-s uži esu-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB home-ZA examine-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT wealthy-DEF man-GEN1 son find-PST.UNW
\l Taking it into the house, he looked around and found the rich man's son.

\t Žan ayrno eɣeni esiw aynosi, c’ik’iw ʕaƛos xalq’i ɣˤaɣˤu bizin.
\m ža-n ayr-n eɣe-ni esiw ay-nosi c’ik’iw ʕaƛ-s xalq’i ɣˤaɣˤu b-izi-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP bring-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother come-ANT.CVB all village-GEN1 people be.happy III-get.up-PST.UNW
\l When the young brother came bringing him, all the village's people got happy.

\t Yisir ʕaƛa bercinaw kid teƛno.
\m yisi-r ʕaƛ-a bercinaw kid teƛ-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT village-IN.ESS beautiful girl give-PST.UNW
\l They gave him a beautiful girl in the village.

\t Yeda nełaƛ’ razi oqinč’izaƛ’, baqru q’ut’imoxor ƛ’irigon yisir gulun, tupingon teƛno.
\m yeda neła-ƛ’ razi oq-č’i-zaƛ’ b-oq-ru q’ut’i-xor ƛ’iri-gon yisi-r gulu-n tupi-n-gon teƛ-n
\g DEM2.ISG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS accept become-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB III-become-PST.PRT agreement-AD.LAT above-CNTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT horse-and rifle-and-CNTR give-PST.UNW
\l Because he didn't accept her and according to the agreement that had been made, they gave him a horse and a gun.

\t Bisno yaraɣno, guluƛ’no zown yeda buq boƛäxzaɣor ik’iƛ’orey, ayn sida beže ʕaƛar.
\m b-is-n yaraɣ-n gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n yeda buq b-oƛix-za-aɣor ik’i-ƛ’oräy ay-n sida b-eže ʕaƛ-ar
\g III-take-PFV.CVB weapon-TOP horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG sun III-appear-LCV-IN.VERS go-SIM.CVB come-PST.UNW one.OBL III-big village-IN.LAT
\l He took the weapon, sat on the horse and when he rode towards the sunrise, he came into a big village

\t Neł ʕaƛos xalq’i besun yisir asaɣor reƛ’ibin kurno, qema regirƛin Allahqo harizi boqxo.
\m neła ʕaƛ-s xalq’i b-esu-n yisi-r as-aɣor reƛ’a-bi-n kur-n qema r-egir-ƛin Allah-q harizi b-oq-x
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL village-GEN1 people III-find-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT sky-IN.VERS hand-PL-TOP spread.out-PFV.CVB rain IV-send-QUOT God-POSS.ESS request III-become-IPFV.CVB
\l He found the people of the village spreading out their hands into the sky pleading God: "Send us rain!"

\t Yisä esirno, šebi retin meži harizi boqxoƛin.
\m yisi-a esir-n šebi r-eti-n meži harizi b-oq-x-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW what IV-want-PFV.CVB you.PL request I.PL-become-PRS-QUOT
\l He asked: "What are you asking for?"

\t Ža nesä risno čantaɣor eqärun, regirno xecin qema.
\m ža nesi-a r-is-n čanta-aɣor eqer-run r-egir-n xeci-n qema
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG III.PL-take-PFV.CVB pocket-IN.VERS put-IMM.ANT.CVB IV-let-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW rain
\l As soon as he took them and put them into a pocket, it started to rain.

\t Elozo ʕaƛos xalq’imo yisir micxir teƛa boqno, amma eɣeni esiya eƛin, där mežus bečełi ħažat anu.
\m elo-zo ʕaƛ-s xalq’i-a yisi-r micxir teƛ-a b-oq-n amma eɣe-ni esyu-a eƛi-n di-r mežu-s bečełi ħažat anu
\g there-ATTR.OBL village-GEN1 people-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT money give-INF III-begin-PFV.CVB but young-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW me-LAT you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 riches necessity be.absent
\l The people in the village there began to give him money, but the young brother said: "I don't need your riches.

\t Sis bigu gulun, ec’no šeƛ’un neƛ meža där, din hunix egirƛin.
\m sis b-igu gulu-n ec’no šeƛ’u-n neƛ mežu-a di-r di-n huni-x egir-ƛin
\g one III-good horse-and new clothing-and give you(I).PL.OBL-ERG me-LAT me-TOP way-AD.ESS let-QUOT
\l Give me a good horse, new clothes and let me go my way!"

\t Boɣno žeduqay bigu gulun, nełaƛ’no zown buq boƛäxza puƛ’aɣor ik’in.
\m b-oɣ-n žedu-qay b-igu gulu-n neła-ƛ’-n zow-n buq b-oƛix-za pu-ƛ’aɣor ik’i-n
\g III-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ABL III-good horse-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB sun III-appear-LCV side-SUPER.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l He took the good horse from them, and rode on it towards the sunrise.

\t Sis ħon xecix, q’ano xecix, łˤono äƛiru xecinosi sida sasiw ciqor nišiw huni yałza mečoƛ’or ayn.
\m sis ħon xeci-x q’ˤano xeci-x łˤono eƛi-ru xeci-nosi sida sasiw ciq-qor nišiw huni yoł-za moči-ƛ’or ay-n
\g one mountain leave-IPFV.CVB two leave-IPFV.CVB three say-PST.PRT leave-ANT.CVB one.OBL gloomy forest-POSS.LAT narrow way be-LCV place-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Passing one mountain, passing two, and when he was passing the third one, he came to a place where there was a narrow way into a gloomy forest.

\t Ža hunin risno ik’iƛ’orey, sida maydanƛ’or keze oqno.
\m ža huni-n r-is-n ik’i-ƛ’oräy sida maydan-ƛ’or keze oq-n
\g DEM1.SG way-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB go-SIM.CVB one.OBL clearance-SUPER.LAT meet become-PST.UNW
\l When he took the way, he came to a clearance.

\t Neł maydanzo č’imä nesir łˤono t’ala yołäsi ɣˤutku rukayn.
\m neła maydan-z č’imu-a nesi-r łˤono t’ala yoł-asi ɣˤutku r-ukad-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL clearance-GEN2 corner-IN.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT three floor be-RES.PRT house IV-see-PST.UNW
\l In a corner of that clearance, he saw a house with three floors.

\t Elo tełza ezu-ʕoƛ’unosi, eɣeni esiwr siskin besunanu.
\m elo teł-za ezu~oƛ’ˤu-nosi eɣe-ni esiw-r siskin b-esu-n-anu
\g there inside-ZA examine-ANT.CVB young-DEF brother-LAT anyone I.PL-find-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l When he took a look inside, the younger brother didn't find anyone.

\t Łˤono äƛiru t’alamzo čardaħäɣor oqnosi, raɣiƛ aɣzas šeƛ’u ƛ’iräy roɣxo łˤonon bercinawt’a kidbabi rukayn.
\m łˤono eƛi-ru t’ala-z čardaħi-aɣor oq-nosi raɣi-ƛ aɣi-bi-s šeƛ’u ƛ’iräy r-oɣ-x łˤono-n bercinaw-t’a kid-bi r-ukad-n
\g three say-PST.PRT floor-GEN2 balcony-IN.VERS become-ANT.CVB veranda-SUB.ESS bird-PL-GEN1 clothing from.above IV-take.away-IPFV.CVB three-TOP beautiful-DISTR girl-PL II.PL-see-PST.UNW
\l When he came to the balcony on the third floor, he saw three beautiful girls undressing of birds' clothes under the veranda.

\t Ič’an yeženä eƛix teqno, deygon hunar šebi, šeƛ’ures bic’äsi gama ƛisiƛ’orey, dey kodin bet’urno, daqay gama baɣruni užix yik’a räti darƛin.
\m ič’a-n y-eže-ni-a eƛi-x teq-n di-s-gon hunar šebi šeƛ’u-s b-ic’-asi gama ƛisi-ƛ’oräy di-s kodi-n b-et’ur-n di-qay gama b-oɣ-ru-ni uži-x y-ik’i-a r-eti di-r-ƛin
\g most-TOP II-old-DEF-ERG say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW me-GEN1-CNTR talent what clothing-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT boat pull-SIM.CVB me-GEN1 hair-TOP III-pull.out-PFV.CVB me-POSS.ABL boat III-take.away-PST.PRT-DEF boy-AD.ESS II-go-INF IV-want me-LAT-QUOT
\l He heard the oldest one say: "What talent do I have? I'll want to marry the boy who took the boat full of clothes away from me after he pulled out my hair, while I was pulling on the boat."

\t Yoƛƛozo kidbä eƛin, di bečedaw žek’us uži ok’ek’äsi zows, nesił xizayn ayn, däqay xot’oqosin roɣno axiru užix därno yik’a rätiƛin.
\m y-oƛƛo-zo kid-a eƛi-n di bečedaw žek’u-s uži ok’ek’-asi zow-s nesi-ł xizay-n ay-n di-qay xot’o-q-si-n r-oɣ-n oxi-ru uži-x di-r-n y-ik’i-a r-eti-ƛin
\g II-middle-ATTR.OBL girl-ERG say-PST.UNW me wealthy man-GEN1 son steal.from-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS from.behind-TOP come-PFV.CVB me-POSS.ABL foot-POSS.ESS-ATTR-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB run.away-PST.PRT boy-AD.ESS me-LAT-TOP II-go-INF IV-want-QUOT
\l The middle girl said: "I'll also want to marry the boy who, when I stole the rich man's son, came after him, took my footwear from me and ran away."

\t Ič’an yeɣenägon eƛin, digon qema regirinč’ey asno riqirno yičäsi zows.
\m ič’a-n y-eɣe-ni-a-gon eƛi-n di-gon qema r-egir-č’ey as-n r-iqir-n y-iči-asi zow-s
