\g most-TOP II-young-DEF-ERG-CNTR say-PST.UNW me-CNTR rain IV-let-NEG.PST.CVB sky-TOP IV-catch-PFV.CVB II-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l And then the youngest one said: "And I was catching the sky and didn't let it rain.

\t Oƛixno sida užä tupin caƛin dey bašan bašiqˤoyn sadaq bet’ursi, xizyo däqgon qeman riħunč’u.
\m oƛix-n sida uži-a tupi-n caƛi-n di-s baša-n bašiqˤoy-n sadaq b-et’ur-s xizyo di-q-gon qema-n r-iħu-č’u
\g appear-PFV.CVB one.OBL boy-ERG rifle-TOP shoot.with-PFV.CVB me-GEN1 finger-and ring-and together III-pull.out-PST.WIT afterwards me-POSS.ESS-CNTR rain-TOP IV-begin-NEG.PST.WIT
\l And a boy appeared and with his rifle shot my finger and my ring off and afterwards the rain began.

\t Därgon nesi užix yik’a retin.
\m di-r-gon nesi uži-x y-ik’i-a r-eti-n
\g me-LAT-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-AD.ESS II-go-INF IV-want-PST.UNW
\l And I want to marry that boy too."

\t Sida zamanałäy eɣeni esiya nasin žeda roƛäk’ru šebinabi yizas xot’ozaxor kurnosi, łˤonontow yisił adäzarno rayn esirno, šebi deber elaqay ħažat roqnoƛin.
\m sida zaman-łay eɣe-ni esyu-a nasin žeda-a r-oƛik’-ru šebin-bi yiza-s xot’o-bi-xor kur-nosi łˤono-n-tow yisi-ł adäz-ar-n r-ay-n esir-n šebi mi-r ela-qay ħažat r-oq-n-ƛin
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ABL young-DEF brother-ERG all DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG IV-appear-PST.PRT thing-PL DEM2.IIPL.OBL-GEN1 foot-PL-AD.LAT throw-ANT.CVB three-TOP-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW what you-LAT we(II-POSS.ABL necessity IV-become-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l After some time, the young brother threw the things that they listed to their feet, and they went before him and asked: "What do you need from us?"

\t Kidbaza łˤono pu yołäsi šebinno rayrno eƛin, deber rätiru šebinno radi yiła, ätizarno ayärƛin.
\m kid-bi-a łˤono pu yoł-asi šebin-n r-ayr-n eƛi-n mi-r r-eti-ru šebin-n r-odi yiła-a eti-za-r-n ayr-ƛin
\g girl-PL-ERG three side be-RES.PRT thing-TOP IV-bring-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW you-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT thing-TOP IV-do DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG want-LCV-LAT-TOP bring-QUOT
\l The girls brought the things to their three sides and said: "This will do what you want and it will bring your where you want."

\t Nełaƛ’no zown ʕaƛarno nexnogon eɣeni esiya eƛin, dey eženi esiw esurƛin.
\m neła-ƛ’-n zow-n ʕaƛ-ar-n nex-n-gon eɣe-ni esyu-a eƛi-n di-s eže-ni esiw esur-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB village-IN.LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB-CNTR young-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN1 big-DEF brother find-QUOT
\l Sitting down on it, the young brother came home to the village and said: "Find my big brother!"

\t Suƛitow eženi esiwn ayrno, gulun bayrno.
\m suƛƛi-tow eže-ni esiw-n ayr-n gulu-n b-ayr-n
\g immediately-EMPH big-DEF brother-TOP bring-PFV.CVB horse-TOP III-bring-PST.UNW
\l And it immediately brought his big brother and the horse.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder babiwz šudaƛ’or siskin baynanu.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder babiw-z šuda-ƛ’or siskin b-ay-n-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after father-GEN2 graveyard-SUPER.LAT anyone I.PL-come-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l After that, no one came to the father's graveyard anymore.

\t Q’ˤunan esnaza rigut’a rodin ɣutkabin paraxat ʕumru bodix bičin.
\m q’ˤuna-n esyu-bi-a r-igu-t’a r-odi-n ɣˤutku-bi-n paraxat ʕumru b-odi-x b-iči-n
\g two.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG IV-pretty-DISTR IV-do-PFV.CVB house-PL-TOP calmly life III-do-IPFV.CVB III-be-PST.UNW
\l And the two brothers built pretty houses and lead a calm life.

\t Zownoƛax zown anuƛax sis bełiqan.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis bełiqan
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT one hunter
\l Once upon a time there was a hunter.

\t Šibaw ɣudeł bełiƛ’ ik’in dawla biqirinč’ey netikin ža xizor utix zownanu.
\m šibaw ɣudi-ł bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-n dawla b-iqir-č’ey neti-kin ža xizor uti-x zow-n-anu
\g every day-CONT.ESS hunting-SUPER.ESS go-PFV.CVB prey III-catch-NEG.PST.CVB when-even DEM1.SG back return-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l Every day he went hunting and didn't return until he got prey.

\t Nesä neła bełis łˤono but’a yodix zown, sis but’a awarager, sis miskinzar, sideni q’ˤimä q’ˤimzo haq’ur iduɣor yowx zown.
\m nesi-a neła bełi-s łˤono but’a y-odi-x zow-n sis but’a awarag-r sis miskin-bi-r sideni q’ˤim-a q’ˤim-z haq’u-r idu-ɣor y-ow-x zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL hunting-GEN1 three part II-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB one part prophet-LAT one poor-PL-LAT the.other.one oneself-ERG oneself-GEN2 family-LAT home-IN.ALL II-bring-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He always made three parts of what he hunted, one part he gave to the prophet, one to the poor, and the other part he brought to his own family's home.

\t Šibaw ɣudi bełiqan mažgityar mogoles kak roda ayx zown.
\m šibaw ɣudi bełiqan mažgit-ar mogol-s kak r-odi-a ay-x zow-n
\g every day hunter mosque-IN.LAT night-GEN1 prayer IV-do-INF come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Every day he was coming into the mosque to do the night prayer.

\t Dibirän šidaƛa nesiƛ’ c’aq’ xal bičirno ičix zown.
\m dibir-a-n šida-ƛa nesi-ƛ’ c’aq’ xal b-ičir-n iči-x zow-n
\g imam-ERG-TOP why-INDEF DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS very examination III-stop-PFV.CVB be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l And the imam for some reason was watching him.

\t Sida quł bełiƛ’ äk’izay xizor utin nexƛ’orey, neside dandir bikori c’oxno.
\m sida qu-ł bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-zay xizor uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy nesi-de dandir bikori c’ox-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS hunting-SUPER.ESS go-SIM.CVB back return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS towards snake meet-PST.UNW
\l One day, when he was coning back from hunting, he ran into a snake.

\t Neła eƛin, däł xizay tušmanbi nexxo, žedu bok’łace, di axaɣor begirƛin.
\m neła-a eƛi-n di-ł xizay tušman-bi nex-x žedu b-ok’eł-ace di ax-aɣor b-egir-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me-CONT.ESS from.behind enemy-PL come-IPFV.CVB DEM1.IPL I.PL-go.away-TERM me belly-IN.VERS III-let-QUOT
\l It said: "Enemies are coming behind me, let me into your belly until they went away!"

\t Bełiqanä nełas äƛirun rodin ža axar begirno.
\m bełiqan-a neła-s eƛi-ru-n r-odi-n ža ax-ar b-egir-n
\g hunter-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 say-PST.PRT-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG belly-IN.LAT III-let-PST.UNW
\l The hunter did what it said and let her into his belly.

\t Nełał xizay k’oƛin rayru ɣˤʷaybi maqˤiƛ’or rok’ełnosi, bełiqanä bikoriqor eƛin, maħor boq, howži debi tušmanbin rukayzay rok’ełsiƛin.
\m neła-ł xizay k’oƛi-n r-ay-ru ɣˤʷay-bi maqˤi-ƛ’or r-ok’eł-nosi bełiqan-a bikori-qor eƛi-n maħor b-oq howži mi-s tušman-bi-n r-ukad-za-ay r-ok’eł-s-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS from.behind run-PFV.CVB III.PL-come-PST.PRT dog-PL far.away-SUPER.LAT III.PL-go.away-ANT.CVB hunter-ERG snake-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW outside III-become now you-GEN1 enemy-PL-TOP III.PL-see-LCV-IN.ABL III.PL-escape-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l After the dogs that were running behind it, went far away, the hunter said to the snake: "Come out, now your enemies went out of sight."

\t Bikorä žawab bodin, maħor baqinč’iƛin t’otow bičin bok’ełxosi ħal yoł dey.
\m bikori-a žawab b-odi-n maħor b-oq-č’i-ƛin t’o-tow b-iči-n b-ok’eł-xosi ħal yoł di-s
\g snake-ERG answer III-do-PST.UNW outside III-become-NEG.FUT-QUOT here-EMPH III-live-PFV.CVB III-escape-PRS.PRT condition be me-GEN1
\l The snake answered: "I won't come outside, I have the opportunity to live here."

\t Neł zamanał bełiqanä eƛin, howła purqay ħalkiłiƛ’aɣor ok’łace sabru bodin bičiƛin.
\m neła zaman-ł bełiqan-a eƛi-n howła pu-qay ħalkiłi-ƛ’aɣor ok’eł-ace sabru b-odi-n b-iči-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL time-CONT.ESS hunter-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM3.IISG.OBL field-POSS.ABL relaxation-SUPER.VERS go.away-TERM patience III-do-PFV.CVB III-wait-QUOT
\l That time the hunter said: "Wait in patience until I go away to relax from that field."

\t Bikorä bełiqanes č’aɣˤiryabi rac’a bašla bodin zown yałi.
\m bikori-a bełiqan-s č’aɣˤir-bi r-ac’-a bašla b-odi-n zow-n yałi
\g snake-ERG hunter-GEN1 bowel-PL IV-eat-INF begin III-do-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW else
\l Then the snake started to eat the hunter's bowels.

\t Nesä nedur harizi royzaƛ’, sabru bodin bičin bełiqan ħalkaraw mečoƛ’aɣor ok’ełzaƛ’or.
\m nesi-a nedur harizi r-odi-zaƛ’ sabru b-odi-n b-iči-n bełiqan ħalkaraw moči-ƛ’aɣor ok’eł-zaƛ’or
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG so request IV-do-CSL.CVB patience III-do-PFV.CVB III-wait-PST.UNW hunter even field-SUPER.VERS go.away-POST.CVB
\l Because he asked, the snake waited patiently until the hunter went away to an even field.

\t Bełiqan sodxorzoq iziƛ’orey, sidaɣ ħalkaraw mečoƛ’ ɣunoƛ q’ˤida ičäsi łˤonon žek’u esun.
\m bełiqan sod-xor-zo-q izi-ƛ’oräy sidaɣ ħalkaraw moči-ƛ’ ɣun-ƛ q’ˤida iči-asi łˤono-n žek’u esu-n
\g hunter above-AD.LAT-ATTR.OBL-POSS.ESS get.up-SIM.CVB in.one.place even place-SUPER.ESS tree-SUB.ESS under sit-RES.PRT three-TOP man find-PST.UNW
\l While the hunter went upwards, he found three men sitting under a tree on an even place somewhere.

\t Nesis hut’-mˤalay ƛ’er bisäsi bukayzaƛ’ hunixoza esirno, šebi deber roqnoƛin.
\m nesi-s hut’~mˤali-ay ƛ’er b-is-asi b-ukad-zaƛ’ huni-x-zo-a esir-n šebi mi-r r-oq-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 front.part.of.the.face-IN.ABL color III-take-RES.PRT III-see-CSL.CVB way-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW who you-LAT IV-happen-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l When they saw the color vanishing from his face, the travellers asked: "What happened to you?"

\t Bełiqanä žeduq didur bikorä nesiz gugya kuła rayrułäy esin.
\m bełiqan-a žedu-q didur bikori-a nesi-z gugu-a kuła r-odi-ru-łay esi-n
\g hunter-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS how snake-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 back-IN.ESS sleeve IV-do-PST.PRT-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW
\l The hunter told them how the snake deceived him.

\t Hunixozo sida žek’a hi yac’oƛin ɣunoqay yet’urno łˤeb teƛno.
\m huni-xozo sida žek’u-a hi y-ac’-o-ƛin ɣun-qay y-et’ur-n ƛˤeb teƛ-n
\g way-PRS.PRT.OBL one.OBL man-ERG take.IMP II-eat-IMPR-QUOT tree-POSS.ABL II-pull.out-PFV.CVB leaf give-PST.UNW
\l One travelling man, [saying] "Take and eat it!", pulled out a leaf from the tree and gave it to him.

\t Q’ˤano äƛiru hunixoza bełiqaner yet’urno ƛˤeb teƛƛ’oräy, axʷay bikori qˤaƛanada boqno, ƛˤeb yāc’no di maħor boqxoƛin.
\m q’ˤano äƛiru huni-x-zo-a bełiqan-r y-et’ur-n ƛˤeb teƛ-ƛ’oräy ax-ay bikori qˤaƛanad-a b-oq-n ƛˤeb y-ac’-no di maħor b-oq-x-ƛin
\g two ORD way-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-ERG hunter-LAT II-pull.out-PFV.CVB leaf give-SIM.CVB belly-IN.ABL snake yell-INF III-begin-PST.UNW leaf II-eat-PROHIB me outside III-become-PRS-QUOT
\l When the second traveller pulled out a leaf and gave it to the hunter, the snake started to yell from within his belly: "Don't eat the leaf, I'm coming out!"

\t Q’ˤano äƛiru ƛˤeb yac’nosi, dahawgon bikoris tatu łiyn.
\m q’ˤano eƛi-ru ƛˤeb y-ac’-nosi dahaw-gon bikori-s tatu łiy-n
\g two say-PST.PRT year II-eat-ANT.CVB a.little-CNTR snake-GEN1 power end-PST.UNW
\l When he ate the second leaf, the snake's power ended a little more.

\t Łˤono äƛirunigon hunixoza täƛru łˤeb yac’nosi, t’it’ubin roqno bełiqanez rečnoł bikorin boƛixno maħor.
\m łˤono eƛi-ru-ni-gon huni-x-zo-a teƛ-ru ƛˤeb y-ac’-nosi t’it’u-bi-n r-oq-n bełiqan-z rečni-ł bikori-n b-oƛix-n maħor
\g three say-PST.PRT-DEF-CNTR way-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-ERG give-PST.PRT year II-eat-ANT.CVB piece-PL-TOP IV-become-PFV.CVB hunter-GEN2 vomiting-CONT.ESS snake-TOP III-appear-PFV.CVB outside
\l When he ate the leaf that the third traveller gave him, the snake turned to pieces and came out through the hunter's vomiting.

\t Buyxor laga baynosi, bełiqanä žeduq esirno, mežuƛ’ ci šebiƛin.
\m b-uyxor laga b-ay-nosi bełiqan-a žedu-q esir-n mežu-ƛ’ ci šebi-ƛin
\g III-true body III-come-ANT.CVB hunter-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-SUPER.ESS name what-QUOT
\l When he came to senses, the hunter asked them: "What're your names?"

\t Sidä riłe nazon eƛin, eluƛ’ ci sadaq’a yołƛin.
\m sida-a r-iłe nazo-n eƛi-n elu-ƛ’ ci sadaq’a yoł-ƛin
\g one.OBL-ERG IV-as all.OBL-TOP say-PST.UNW we(I).OBL-SUPER.ESS name alms be-QUOT
\l And as one they said: "Our name is Alms!"

\t Žeduqor big bičiƛinno eƛin, bełiqan hunix oqno nesä nesiz ʕaƛaɣor ik’anix.
\m žedu-qor b-ig b-iči-ƛin-n eƛi-n bełiqan huni-x oq-n nesi-a nesi-z ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-ani-x
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT I.PL-well I.PL-be-QUOT-TOP say-PFV.CVB hunter way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 village-IN.VERS go-MSD-AD.ESS
\l The hunter said to them: "Farewell!" and got on his way to go to his own village.

\t Bełiqanqor ezun mažgitägon dibirno zown ičäsi, yeda dice žaqˤuł kʷat’izi oqxoƛin.
\m bełiqan-qor ezu-n mažgit-a-gon dibir-n zow-n iči-asi yeda dice žaqˤuł kʷat’izi oq-x-ƛin
\g hunter-POSS.LAT look-PFV.CVB mosque-IN.ESS-CNTR imam-TOP be.NPRS-PST.UNW wait-RES.PRT DEM2.ISG how.much today be.late become-PRS-QUOT
\l And in the mosque the imam was waiting for the hunter, [saying:] "How late he is today!"

\t ʕAƛar ayrun, bełiqanä idu nesä nesirsini but’an eqerno, mažgitäɣor ik’in.
\m ʕaƛ-ar ay-run bełiqan-a idu nesi-a nesi-r-si-ni but’a-n eqer-n mažgit-aɣor ik’i-n
\g village-IN.LAT come-IMM.ANT.CVB hunter-ERG home DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT-ATTR-DEF part-TOP put-PFV.CVB mosque-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l Just when he came to the village, the hunter put the part that was for himself down at home and went to the mosque.

\t Dibirä esirno nesiq, žaqˤuł mi šida kʷat’izi oqäƛin.
\m dibir-a esir-n nesi-q žaqˤuł mi šida kʷat’izi oq-a-ƛin
\g imam-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS today you why be.late become-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The imam asked him: "Why were you late today?"

\t Dibirä esirno nesiq, mi žeduq cirabi esirinč’aƛin.
\m dibir-a esir-n nesi-q mi žedu-q ci-bi esir-č’u-a-ƛin
\g imam-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS you DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS name-PL ask-NEG.PST.WIT-Q-QUOT
\l The imam asked him: "Haven't you asked for their names?"

\t Di cirabi esirnosi, žeda eluƛ’ ci sadaq’a yołƛin maxsaryoƛ’ din isno eƛisƛin, bełiqanä žawab teƛno.
\m di ci-bi esir-nosi žedu-a elu-ƛ’ ci sadaq’a yoł-ƛin maxsar-ƛ’ di-n is-n eƛi-s-ƛin bełiqan-a žawab teƛ-n
\g me name-PL ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-SUPER.ESS name alms be-QUOT joke-SUPER.ESS me-TOP take-PFV.CVB say-PST.WIT-QUOT hunter-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "When I asked for the names, they said: 'Our name is Alms' and were kidding me." answered the hunter.

\t Neł mixƛ’o dibirä eƛin, žeda debeq c’aq’tow bit’araw esin.
\m neła mixƛ’o dibir-a eƛi-n žedu-a mi-q c’aq’-tow bit’araw esi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL at.a.time imam-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG you-POSS.ESS much-EMPH true tell-PST.UNW
\l Thereupon the imam said: "They told you the very truth!"

\t Žeduƛ’ ci sadaq’a yołƛin.
\m žedu-ƛ’ ci sadaq’a yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS name alms be-QUOT
\l Their name is Alms."

\t Łˤora but’ałäy ciqot’a mi xecix zawruni sida neł but’ałäy sadaq’a räqiru xalq’i yoł žeduƛin.
\m łˤora but’a-łay ciq-t’a mi xeci-x zow-ru-ni sida neła but’a-łay sadaq’a r-iqi-ru xalq’i yoł žedu-ƛin
\g three.OBL part-CONT.ABL forest-DISTR you leave-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF one.OBL DEM1.IISG.OBL part-CONT.ABL alms IV-get-PST.PRT people be DEM1.IPL-QUOT
\l They are the people who got the alms from that part of the three parts you were leaving in the forest.

\t Barur xediw etix zownanu.
\m baru-r xediw eti-x zow-n-anu
\g wife-LAT husband love-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l The wife didn't love her husband.

\t Nełas q’ˤuya etali zown.
\m neła-s q’ˤuya etali zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 other lover be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l She had another lover.

\t Žedu q’ˤunesno q’ut’i boqno šebi rodinon ža nesi xedyoxay yok’ek’anix.
\m žedu q’ˤuna-s-n q’ut’i b-oq-n šebi r-odi-nan ža nesi xediw-xay y-ok’ek’-ani-x
\g DEM1.IPL two.OBL-GEN1-TOP agreement I.PL-become-PFV.CVB what IV-do-INT DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL husband-AD.ABL II-remove-MSD-AD.ESS
\l The two of them agreed to remove her from that husband by all means.

\t Barusno nełaz etalisno rok’ƛ’o yałru šebin xedyor čuqˤäsi zown.
\m baru-s-n neła-z etali-s-n rok’u-ƛ’ yoł-ru šebin xediw-r čuqˤ-asi zow-n
\g wife-GEN1-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 lover-GEN1-and heart-SUPER.ESS be-PST.PRT thing husband-LAT notice-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The husband noticed the thing that the wife and her lover planned.

\t Sida quł ciqaɣor äk’izay, xedyor ƛ’iräzay yecasi, teł aɣiw ažo yesun.
\m sida qu-ł ciq-aɣor ik’i-zay xediw-r ƛ’iri-azay y-ecu-asi teł aɣiw ažo y-esu-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS forest-IN.VERS go-SIM.CVB husband-LAT above-IN.ABL.DIST II-break-RES.PRT inside hollow tree II-find-PST.UNW
\l One day, while he was going into the forest, the husband found a tree that was hollow inside and had been broken from above.

\t Ža ažo ałni bayłxanuce yečiw, ƛ’iräz žek’u oqła bihayaw yiłe zown.
\m ža ažo ałni b-odi-ł-x-anu-ace y-ečiw ƛ’iri-az žek’u oq-ła bihayaw y-iłe zow-n
\g DEM1.SG tree hug III-do-POT-IPFV.CVB-NEG-TERM II-thick above-IN.ESS.DIST man become-DUB easy II-as be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The tree was so thick that one couldn't give it a hug, and it was easy for a man to get inside from above.

\t Idur ayrun, xediya baruqor eƛin, där ciqqo riynoxu esus, nesir c’ik’iw šebin riyxƛin.
\m idu-r ay-run xediw-a baru-qor eƛi-n di-r ciq-q riynoxu esu-s nesi-r c’ik’iw šebin r-iy-x-ƛin
\g home-LAT come-IMM.ANT.CVB husband-ERG wife-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW me-LAT forest-POSS.ESS sheikh find-PST.WIT DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT all thing IV-know-PRS-QUOT
\l Right when he came home, the husband said to his wife: "I found a sheikh in the forest and he knows everything."

\t Nazay deber teqäsi ciqqo riynoxu ičixosiƛin.
\m nazay mi-r teq-asi ciq-q riynoxu iči-xosi-ƛin
\g from.where you-LAT hear-RES.PRT forest-POSS.ESS sheikh live-PRS.PRT-QUOT
\l "From where did you hear that there's a sheikh living in the forest?"

\t Hudu šebigo roqłin mi esirnosi, riyä nesir debez rok’ƛ’osiƛin, c’aq’ ʕašiq’no yoqno esirno bara.
\m hudu šebi-go r-oq-łin mi esir-nosi r-iy-a nesi-r mi-z rok’u-ƛ’-s-ƛin c’aq’ ʕašiq’-n y-oq-n esir-n baru-a
\g so what-COND IV-become-CNC.CVB you ask-ANT.CVB IV-know-PST.WIT.INT DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT you-GEN2 heart-SUPER.ESS-GEN1-QUOT very passionate-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW wife-ERG
\l "So when you asked [???], he knows what's on your heart?", the wife asked very passionately.

\t Xedya žawab teƛno, däq q’ˤoq’ˤorut’a magalabi zows, nesir rigu bišʷa retixosi yołƛin.
\m xediw-a žawab teƛ-n di-q q’ˤoq’ˤoru-t’a magalu-bi zow-s nesi-r r-igu bišʷa r-eti-xosi yoł-ƛin
\g husband-ERG answer give-PST.UNW me-POSS.ESS hollow-DISTR bread-PL be.NPRS-PST.WIT DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-good food IV-like-PRS.PRT be-QUOT
\l The husband answered: "I had hollow breads with me; and he likes good food."

\t Hudunon bužzi yoqnoanu baru.
\m hudu-nan bužzi y-oq-n-anu baru
\g so-INT believe II-become-PFV.CVB-NEG wife
\l Nevertheless, the wife didn't believe it.

\t Nełas rok’u qepƛix ričäsi zown netiey ɣudi qˤašanƛin.
\m neła-s rok’u qepƛi-x r-iči-asi zow-n neti-ey ɣudi qˤaši-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 heart beat-IPFV.CVB IV-wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB when-DUB day dawn-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Her heart was beating and waited for the dawn to come.

\t Sasaqaza bišʷan risno xediw q’ˤuyzaɣaɣor ik’ixƛin baruqorno eƛin, ik’in ciqqo ɣuna teł uqˤełno ičin.
\m sasaq-aza bišʷa-n r-is-n xediw q’ˤuyzaɣ-aɣor ik’i-x-ƛin baru-qor-n eƛi-n ik’i-n ciq-q ɣun-a teł uqˤeł-n iči-n
\g in.the.morning-IN.VERS.DIST food-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB husband somwhere.else-IN.VERS go-IPFV.CVB-QUOT wife-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PST.UNW go-PFV.CVB forest-POSS.ESS tree-IN.ESS inside hide-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l The next morning, the husband took some food and said to his wife: "I'm going somewhere", went to the forest and hid inside the tree.

\t Royn łiynosi, ƛ’irigon riłno riħin ɣop’damun rodin, čantan ric’no riynoxu yałzaɣor durimoƛ’ yiłe yik’in.
\m r-odi-n łiy-nosi ƛ’iri-gon rił-n r-iħi-n ɣop’damu-n r-odi-n čanta-n r-ic’-n riynoxu yoł-za-aɣor durimoƛ’ y-iłe y-ik’i-n
\g IV-do-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB above-CNTR butter-TOP IV-smear-PFV.CVB greasy-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB pocket-TOP IV-fill-PFV.CVB sheikh be-LCV-IN.VERS running II-as II-go-PST.UNW
\l When she finished preparing it, she spread greasy butter on it, filled her pocket with it and went running to the pleace where the sheikh was.

\t Neł ɣunoxor yaynosi, baybik bodin yiła qˤaƛanada, riynoxu, mi na egi yoł, oƛix ader, hič’č’a deber retixosi bišan rowäsi yołƛin.
\m neła ɣun-xor y-ay-nosi baybik b-odi-n yiła-a qˤaƛanad-a riynoxu mi na egi yoł oƛix ader hič’č’a mi-r r-eti-xosi bišʷa-n r-ow-asi yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL tree-AD.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB begin III-do-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG yell-INF sheikh you where ?? be appear forward very you-LAT IV-like-PRS.PRT food-TOP IV-bring-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l When she came to the tree, she began to yell: "Sheikh, where are you? Come out, I'm bringing your favorite food!"

\t Yigza ħalał barun qˤaƛanada yegirno xecin, xiszi rožin rodin, xediya eƛin, di ent’o yoł, šebi deber retinƛin.
\m y-ig-za ħal-ł baru-n qˤaƛanad-a y-egir-n xeci-n xiszi roži-n r-odi-n xediw-a eƛi-n di ent’o yoł šebi mi-r r-eti-n-ƛin
\g II-good-ZA strength-CONT.ESS wife-TOP yell-INF II-let-PFV.CVB leave-PFV.CVB change word-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB husband-ERG say-PST.UNW me here be what you-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l Letting his wife shout out quite loudly, the husband changed his voice and said: "I am here, what do you want?"

\t Bokon šeƛ’un k’omo iłen oqno imxa teł xediwn zown.
\m boko-n šeƛ’u-n k’omo iłe-n oq-n imxu-a teł xediw-n zow-n
\g fur.coat-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB ball as-TOP become-PFV.CVB cave-IN.ESS inside husband-TOP be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l And the husband, putting on a fur coat, rolled himself into a ball and was inside the cave.

\t Bara ɣunoxorno yik’in, gonda tełxor akrošawt’ani magalazas čantan kurno, riynoxuq nełar ħažataw, q’ʷarʕaraw łinałäyn esirno.
\m baru-a ɣun-xor-n y-ik’i-n gondu-a teł-xor akri-šaw-t’a-ni magalu-bi-s čanta-n kur-n riynoxu-q neła-r ħažataw q’ʷarʕaraw łina-łay-n esir-n
\g wife-ERG tree-AD.LAT-TOP II-go-PST.UNW big.hole-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT cheese-ATTR-DISTR-DEF bread-PL-GEN1 pocket-TOP spread.out-PFV.CVB sheikh-POSS.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT necessary necessary what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP ask-PST.UNW
\l The wife went to the tree, spread out the pocket with the cheese breads into the hole and asked the sheikh what would be necessary.

\t Ža xabar äsirun neła, akäłru baħrä biłe, maħor mec boƛik’no.
\m ža xabar esi-run neła-a akił-ru baħri-a b-iłe maħor mec b-oƛik’-n
\g DEM1.SG story tell-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG get.tired-PST.PRT hound-ERG III-as outside tongue III-push.out-PST.UNW
\l When he had said this, she poked her tongue out like a tired hound.

\t Hudu šebi di rodinäy xedyoxay bat’an yoqno där etixosi äqiƛin, esirno riynoxuq.
\m hudu šebi di r-odi-näy xediw-xay bat’a-n y-oq-n di-r etixosi iqi-ƛin esir-n riynoxu-q
\g so what me IV-do-CND.CVB husband-AD.ABL seperation-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB me-LAT lover get-QUOT ask-PST.UNW sheikh-POSS.ESS
\l "So what shall I do to get rid of my husband and get my lover?", she asked the sheikh.

\t Nesä eƛin, wallahi, xedyor mi dunyalƛ’ay yaq’ˤun yetix, šebi roqłin nesä mi bat’a yadinč’iƛin.
\m nesi-a eƛi-n wallahi xediw-r mi dunyal-ƛ’ay y-ˤaq’ˤu-n y-eti-x šebi r-oq-łin nesi-a mi bat’a y-odi-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW by.God husband-LAT you world-SUPER.ABL II-much-TOP II-love-IPFV.CVB what IV-happen-CNC.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you seperation II-do-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l He said: "By God, your husband loves you more than the world; no matter what happens, he won't leave you."

\t Yigtow ža ƛ’iri yičizaƛ’ riynoxa eƛin: di sabawyabin caxxosianu, šidaƛin eƛiłiri šayt’anza där ʕaq’uba neƛxoƛin, amma dey nesirsi sis daru yołƛin.
\m y-ig-tow ža ƛ’iri y-iči-zaƛ’ riynoxu-a eƛi-n di sabaw-bi-n cax-xosi-anu šida-ƛin eƛi-łiri šayt’an-bi di-r ʕaq’uba neƛ-x-ƛin amma di-s nesi-r-si sis daru yoł-ƛin
\g II-much-EMPH DEM1.SG above II-remain-CSL.CVB sheikh-ERG say-PST.UNW me amulet-PL-TOP write-PRS.PRT-NEG why-QUOT say-CND.CVB.IRR devil-PL me-LAT torture give-PRS-QUOT but me-GEN1 DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT-ATTR one medicine be-QUOT
\l But because she insisted so much, the sheikh said: "I don't write a talisman, and if I told you why, the devils would give me torture, but I have one medicine for him."

\t Were, were, esoƛin, baru ƛ’iri yutin.
\m were were esi-o-ƛin baru ƛ’iri y-uti-n
\g well well tell-IMPR-QUOT wife above II-turn-PST.UNW
\l "Well well, tell me!", the wife insisted.

\t Mežini ža c’udani mešorin bexayn, q’ˤim, qˤošo ƛexuzaƛ’or q’ˤuyasi šebin žek’uq rac’rinč’ey, sasaq neširut’a c’ik’iw ža nełas reƛ łiyace xedyoq rac’er.
\m meži-ni ža c’uda-ni mešori-n b-exʷad-n q’ˤim qˤošo ƛexu-zaƛ’or q’ˤuya-si šebin žek’u-q r-ac’-r-č’ey sasaq neširu-t’a c’ik’iw ža neła-s reƛ łiy-ace xediw-q r-ac’-r
\g you.PL-DEF DEM1.SG red-DEF heifer-TOP III-slaughter-PFV.CVB head leg remain-POST.CVB other-ATTR thing man-POSS.ESS IV-eat-CAUS-NEG.PST.CVB tomorrow at.night-DISTR all DEM1.SG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 meat end-TERM husband-POSS.ESS IV-eat-CAUS
\l "Slaughter the red heifer, and don't give your man anything else to eat until only the head and the legs remain; and tomorrow night, let your husband eat all the meat.

\t Keč’oƛ’asi pu łiynosi nesis kanłi bäs, kut’yoƛ’asi łiynosi äxu.
\m keč’oƛ’asi pu łiy-nosi nesi-s kanłi b-is kut’yoƛ’asi łiy-nosi exu
\g left side end-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 light III-take right end-ANT.CVB die
\l When he finishes the left side, he will lose his eyesight and when he finishes the right side, he will die.

\t Di debeq riyrno xecix, hemeł reƛiłäy encekin šebin žek’ur riqinäy, daru baqinč’iƛin.
\m di mi-q r-iyr-n xeci-x hemeł reƛ-łay ence-kin šebin žek’u-r r-iqi-näy daru b-oq-č’i-ƛin
\g me you-POSS.ESS IV-explain-PFV.CVB leave-IPFV.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL meat-CONT.ABL a.little-even thing man-LAT IV-get-CND.CVB medicine III-happen-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l I warn you; if anyone else will get even a little piece of that meat, the medicine won't work.

\t Howži deber retinäy bexad, retinč’inäy bexaynƛin, eƛin riynoxa mešorłäy.
\m howži mi-r r-eti-näy b-exʷad r-eti-č’i-näy b-exʷad-n-ƛin eƛi-n riynoxu-a mešori-łay
\g now you-LAT IV-want-CND.CVB III-slaughter IV-want-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB III-slaughter-PROHIB-QUOT say-PST.UNW sheikh-ERG heifer-CONT.ABL
\l Now if you want to, then slaughter it, and if you don't want to, don't slaughter it!", said the sheikh about the heifer.

\t Nediwt’a mešori šomon bac’äsi dey nesi tušmanä siskin mumpaʕat anusi.
\m nediw-t’a mešori šomo-n b-ac’-asi di-s nesi tušman-a siskin mumpaʕat anu-s
\g such-DISTR heifer how.many-TOP III-eat-RES.PRT me-GEN1 DEM1.ISG.OBL enemy-ERG any benefit be.NEG-PST.WIT
\l "My enemy who eats many such heifers won't have any benefit.

\t Barkala deber riynoxu.
\m barkala mi-r riynoxu
\g thank you-LAT sheikh
\l Thank you, sheikh.

\t Exunosi alžan deber biqiƛƛin, nesir bara saɣłin rodin, encetow qacan rižin, kʷaxatow iduɣor yik’in.
\m exu-nosi alžan mi-r b-iqi-ƛ-ƛin nesi-r baru-a saɣłi-n r-odi-n ence-tow qaca-n r-iži-n kʷaxa-tow idu-ɣor y-ik’i-n
\g die-ANT.CVB paradise you-LAT III-get-OPT-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT wife-ERG health-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB a.little-EMPH firewood-TOP IV-take.out-PFV.CVB quickly-EMPH home-IN.ALL II-go-PST.UNW
\l May you get the paradise, when you die!", the wife wished him health, picked up some firewood and quickly went home.

\t Aq’ˤu mixƛ’or ičinč’eytow imxayn oqno šayxno ayn idur.
\m aq’ˤu mix-ƛ’or iči-č’ey-tow imxu-ay-n oq-n šayx-n ay-n idu-r
\g much time-SUPER.LAT wait-NEG.PST.CVB-EMPH cave-IN.ABL-TOP become-PFV.CVB sheikh-TOP come-PST.UNW home-LAT
\l Not waiting too long, the sheikh got out of the cave and came home.

\t Idur xediw ayrun baru daʕba boda c’oxno, ɣudi adäy eluq mešori bexada bayx, šidaƛin eƛiłiri nełqay didiwnkin mumpaʕat anu, ʕadada käkirułi gurow.
\m idu-r xediw ay-run baru daʕba b-odi-a c’ox-n ɣudi adäy elu-q mešori b-exʷad-a b-ay-x šida-ƛin eƛi-łiri neła-qay didiw-n-kin mumpaʕat anu ʕadada kiki-rułi gurow
\g home-LAT husband come-IMM.ANT.CVB wife dispute III-do-INF meet-PFV.CVB day earlier we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS heifer III-slaughter-INF III-must-IPFV.CVB why-QUOT say-CND.CVB.IRR DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL which-TOP-even benefit be.NEG to.no.purpose feed-MSD except
\l As soon as the husband had come home, the wife started to insist: "Soon this day we have to slaughter the heifer, because there's no benefit whatsoever from it except for feeding [it] in vain."

\t Xediw ičäsi zown žiƛbon xecin, k’oxäygon meši bodinč’inäy, bexʷadanƛin.
\m xediw iči-asi zow-n žiƛbo-n xeci-n k’ox-ay-gon meši b-odi-č’i-näy b-exʷad-an-ƛin
\g husband remain-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW this.year-TOP leave-PFV.CVB again-IN.ABL-CNTR bull.calf III-do-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB III-slaughter-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The husband remained [in his opinion]: "We'll leave it this year and if it doesn't calve again, we shall slaughter it."

\t Xizaɣor, ƛ’iri baru yutizaƛ’, xediw mešori bexada razi oqno.
\m xizaɣor ƛ’iri baru y-uti-zaƛ’ xediw mešori b-exʷad-a razi oq-n
\g finally above wife II-turn-CSL.CVB husband heifer III-slaughter-INF agree become-PST.UNW
\l Finally, because the wife convinced him, the husband agreed to slaughter the heifer.

\t Hemełƛ’otow goƛ’in šet’uräzay maduhalbin, riynoxa äƛiruxor mešorin bexayn, q’asap badiru xalq’imoqkin q’ˤuya reƛ rac’erno begirno iduzaɣor.
\m hemeł-ƛ’-tow goƛ’i-n šet’ur-azay maduhal-bi-n riynoxu-a eƛi-ru-xor mešori-n b-exʷad-n q’asap b-odi-ru xalq’i-q-kin q’ˤuya reƛ r-ac’-r-n b-egir-n idu-bi-ɣor
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-EMPH invite-PFV.CVB around-IN.ABL.DIST neighbor-PL-TOP sheikh-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT heifer-TOP III-slaughter-PFV.CVB cutting III-do-PST.PRT people-POSS.ESS-even other meat IV-eat-CAUS-PFV.CVB I.PL-send-PST.UNW home-PL-IN.ALL
\l Then they invited the neighbors from all around, slaughtered the heifer as the sheikh said, and let the people who did the cutting eat other meat and sent them to their homes again.

\t Yałzatow rekan eqerno, taxƛ’o kecno ičin.
\m yoł-za-tow reka-n eqer-n tax-ƛ’ kec-n iči-n
\g be-LCV-EMPH key-TOP put-PFV.CVB ottoman-SUPER.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l He put the key where it was and slept on the sofa.

\t Baru ƛ’irir yayrun xediya eƛin, dey ozurabi zemriłxo rik’ixƛin.
\m baru ƛ’iri-r y-ay-run xediw-a eƛi-n di-s ozuri-bi zemrił-x r-ik’i-x-ƛin
\g wife above-LAT II-come-IMM.ANT.CVB husband-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN1 eye-PL become.dark-IPFV.CVB IV-go-PRS-QUOT
\l As soon as the wife came to him again, the husband said: "My eyes are going to become dark."

\t Q’ˤano äƛirugon ɣudƛ’o, buq bayru mixƛ’o xediya eƛin, žaqˤułgon dunyalkinwa yedu qˤašixanuƛin.
\m q’ˤano äƛiru-gon ɣudi-ƛ’ buq b-ay-ru mixƛ’o xediw-a eƛi-n žaqˤuł-gon dunyal-kin-a yedu qˤaši-x-anu-ƛin
\g two ORD-CNTR day-SUPER.ESS sun III-come-PST.PRT at.a.time husband-ERG say-PST.UNW today-CNTR world-even-Q DEM2.IISG dawn-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l On the second day, at the time the sun came out, the husband said: "And today even the world doesn't seem to dawn at all."

\t Kutak ɣˤaɣˤu yizix baru, hoboyƛa yisis kanłi bissiƛin.
\m kutak ɣˤaɣˤu y-izi-x baru hoboy-ƛa yisi-s kanłi b-is-s-ƛin
\g too.much be.happy II-get.up-IPFV.CVB wife now-INDEF DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 light III-take-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The wife became really really happy: "Now his eyesight has been taken."

\t Roƛƛ’o q’ˤanogon anƛ’ rik’inosi, hemedurtow riyrinč’ey rekan riqirno, dice reƛ ƛexunƛin xal bodinosi, sida quł rac’ace ƛexasi resun.
\m r-oƛi-ƛ’ q’ˤano-gon anƛ’ r-ik’i-nosi hemedur-tow r-iyr-č’ey reka-n r-iqir-n dice reƛ ƛexu-n-ƛin xal b-odi-nosi sida qu-ł r-ac’-ace ƛexu-asi r-esu-n
\g IV-half-SUPER.ESS two-CNTR week IV-go-ANT.CVB so-EMPH IV-explain-NEG.PST.CVB key-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB how.much meat remain-PFV.CVB-QUOT examination III-do-ANT.CVB one.OBL day-CONT.ESS IV-eat-TERM remain-RES.PRT IV-find-PST.UNW
\l After two weeks had passed, he took the key away without letting her know in the same way, and took a look how much meat would remain, and he found that it would remain to eat for one day.

\t Xedya mežay bitor zigara bizira baybik bodin.
\m xediw-a muži-ay bitor zigara b-izir-a baybik b-odi-n
\g husband-ERG mattress-IN.ABL thither complaint III-lift-INF begin III-do-PST.UNW
\l The husband began to moan from his mattress.

\t Barur riyx žaqˤuł xediw exuxosi yałrułi.
\m baru-r r-iy-x žaqˤuł xediw exu-xosi yoł-rułi
\g wife-LAT IV-know-PRS today husband die-PRS.PRT be-MSD
\l The wife knew that today the husband would die.

\t ƛirbas ħurmat bodo, baru, dey tatu łiyxƛin.
\m ƛirba-s ħurmat b-odi-o baru di-s tatu łiy-x-ƛin
\g guest-GEN1 respect III-do-IMPR wife me-GEN1 power end-PRS-QUOT
\l Respect the guest, wife, my power is ending."

\t Etali pun bok’no neti yeda ɣut’xoƛin idu iłe taxƛ’o kecno ičäsi zown.
\m etali pu-n b-ok’-n neti yeda ɣut’-x-ƛin idu iłe tax-ƛ’ kec-n iči-asi zow-n
\g lover side-TOP III-hit-PFV.CVB when DEM2.ISG pass.away-IPFV.CVB-QUOT home as ottoman-SUPER.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l And the lover lay down to sleep on the sofa, just like at home, and waited for him to pass away.

\t Łäħor tungi bic’a baru yäk’irun, xediya hečk’erno izin xizaɣorsi reƛis karu met’rin axay yoɣno, boboru qiqos ħuk’no ric’no, etixozoz haqa et’no.
\m łi-xor tungi b-ic’-a baru y-ik’i-run xediw-a hečk’er-n izi-n xizaɣor-si reƛ-s kur-ru met’ri-n ax-ay y-oɣ-n boboru qiqo-s ħuk’-n r-ic’-n etixosi-z haqu-a et’-n
\g water-AD.LAT copper.jug III-fill-INF wife II-go-IMM.ANT.CVB husband-ERG upright-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB finally-ATTR meat-GEN1 throw-PST.PRT piece.of.meat-and belly-IN.ABL II-take.away-PFV.CVB hot bouillon-GEN1 scoop-and IV-fill-PFV.CVB lover-GEN2 mouth-IN.ESS pour-PST.UNW
\l Just when the wife went to the water to fill a jug, the husband got up, took the last piece of meat and filled a scoop with hot soup and poured it into the lover's mouth.

\t Q’ˤida yuyoƛ’or žan kurno, ħoyaƛ’aygon nesiƛ’or rutirno ƛoħon kurno, xediw nesä nesiz mežä ik’in kecno.
\m q’ˤida yu-ƛ’or ža-n kur-n ħo-ƛ’ay-gon nesi-ƛ’or r-utir-n ƛoħo-n kur-n xediw nesi-a nesi-z muži-a ik’i-n kec-n
\g down floor-SUPER.LAT DEM1.SG-and throw-PFV.CVB oven-SUPER.ABL-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT IV-turn-PFV.CVB pan-and throw-PFV.CVB husband DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 mattress-IN.ESS go-PFV.CVB sleep-PST.UNW
\l And the husband threw it down onto the floor and the pan off from the oven onto him, and went to sleep on his own mattress.

\t Xediya eƛin, t’o didiwƛa sis, quy bizis, ozataw där bat’a roda šebintow riynč’uƛin.
\m xediw-a eƛi-n t’o didiw-ƛa sis quy b-izi-s ozuri-taw di-r bat’a r-odi-a šebin-tow r-iy-č’u-ƛin
\g husband-ERG say-PST.UNW here which-INDEF one noise III-get.up-PST.WIT eye-without me-LAT seperation IV-do-INF thing-EMPH IV-know-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The husband said: "There was some kind of noise, I - being blind - cannot tell one thing from the other."

\t ʕUraw q’ʷariłiƛ’or yegin baru, howži šebitow rodanƛin.
\m ʕuraw q’ʷariłi-ƛ’or y-egi-n baru howži šebi-tow r-odi-an-ƛin
\g much sadness-SUPER.LAT II-let.go-PST.UNW wife now what-EMPH IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The wife became very sad [and said]: "What shall I do now?!"

\t Ħalarno izin xedya eƛin, c’udani mamalays ħuli ozqo biħinäy, ozłer kanłi bayxƛin där teqäsi zows.
\m ħal-ar-n izi-n xediw-a eƛi-n c’uda-ni mamalay-s ħuli ozuri-q b-iħi-näy ozuri-łer kanłi b-ay-x-ƛin di-r teq-asi zow-s
\g trouble-IN.LAT-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB husband-ERG say-PST.UNW red-DEF rooster-GEN1 feather eye-POSS.ESS III-smear-CND.CVB eye-CONT.LAT light III-come-IPFV.CVB-QUOT me-LAT hear-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l The husband got up to help and said: "If one smears the red rooster's feather on the eye, the eyesight comes back... I've heard."

\t Q’ˤunƛ’orno ƛ’irir č’edon rayrno, žedun šušin, iduɣor xediwn nexno.
\m q’ˤuna-ƛ’or-n ƛ’iri-r č’edo-n r-ayr-n žedu-n šuši-n idu-ɣor xediw-n nex-n
\g two.OBL-SUPER.LAT-TOP on-LAT earth-TOP IV-bring-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-TOP bury-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL husband-TOP come-PST.UNW
\l The husband put earth onto the two, burried them and came home.

\t Sisgon barun yown, riynoxu žin paraxat ʕumru boyx č’agu yołƛax.
\m sis-gon baru-n y-ow-n riynoxu žin paraxat ʕumru b-odi-x č’agu yoł-ƛax
\g one-CNTR wife-TOP II-marry-PFV.CVB sheikh now calm life III-do-IPFV.CVB alive be-QUOT
\l It's said that the "sheikh" married another wife and still leads a calm life now.

\t Zewnoƛax oc’ino halmaɣ, ceyn, ɣʷˤadin, cek’eryon, elbon, onočun, mat’in, ʕomoyn, mešin, cek’in, ƛelin.
\m zow-n-ƛax oc’ino halmaɣ cey-n ɣʷˤadi-n cek’eryo-n elbo-n onoču-n mat’i-n ʕomoy-n meši-n cek’i-n ƛeli-n
\g be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT ten friend eagle-and crow-and sparrow-and pigeon-and hen-and duck-and donkey-and bull.calf-and goat.kid-and lamb-and
\l Once there were ten friends: An eagle, a crow, a sparrow, a pigeon, a hen, a duck, a donkey, a bull calf, goat kid and a lamb.

\t Nazon žeda sidaƛ’orno rutin ixiw ɣˤutku rodin.
\m nazo-n žeda-a sida-ƛ’or-n r-uti-n ixiw ɣˤutku r-odi-n
\g all.OBL-TOP DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG one.OBL-SUPER.LAT-TOP III.PL-turn-PFV.CVB big house IV-do-PST.UNW
\l They all came together and built a big house.

\t Žeduł teł cek’i ešunanu.
\m žedu-ł teł cek’i ešu-n-anu
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside goat.kid be.located-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l The goat kid was not among them.

\t Xizyo žedu nasin Allahqo, qema regirƛin, harizi roqno.
\m xizyo žedu nasin Allah-q qema r-egir-ƛin harizi r-oq-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IIPL all God-POSS.ESS rain IV-send-QUOT request III.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards they all asked God: "Let it rain!"

\t Žedus harimoxor ixiw qeman, zigolun regirno.
\m žedu-s hari-xor ixiw qema-n zigolu-n r-egir-n
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-GEN1 request-AD.LAT big rain-and hail-and II.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l And on their request, much rain and hail was sent.

\t Cek’i guzqay guzqor k’oƛix boč’ik’xo bičäsi zewn.
\m cek’i guz-qay guz-qor k’oƛi-x b-oč’ik’-x b-iči-asi zow-n
\g goat.kid rock-POSS.ABL rock-POSS.LAT run-IPFV.CVB III-feel.cold-IPFV.CVB III-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The goat kid ran from rock to rock and felt cold.

\t ʕOmoyqor cek’ä eƛin, din iduɣor begirƛin.
\m ʕomoy-qor cek’i-a eƛi-n di-n idu-ɣor b-egir-ƛin
\g donkey-POSS.LAT goat.kid-ERG say-PST.UNW me-TOP home-IN.ALL III-let-QUOT
\l The goat kid said to the donkey: "Let me into the home!"

\t Neł q’ʷariłiƛ’ cek’i bukaynosi, ʕomoyä eƛin, iħäy łäs yic’no muš yownäy, begiranƛin.
\m neła q’ʷariłi-ƛ’ cek’i b-ukad-nosi ʕomoy-a eƛi-n iħu-ay łi-s y-ic’-n muš y-ow-näy b-egir-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL sadness-SUPER.ESS goat.kid III-see-ANT.CVB donkey-ERG say-PST.UNW river-IN.ABL water-GEN1 II-fill-PFV.CVB pot II-bring-CND.CVB III-let-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l When the donkey saw the sad goat kid, he said: "If you bring a pot filled with water from the river, I'll let you in."

\t Elay bik’in cek’ä iħäy łäs yic’no mušno yown nexƛ’oräy, nełał xizay k’oƛin zey nexxo zown.
\m ele-ay b-ik’i-n cek’i-a iħu-ay łi-s y-ic’-n muš-n y-ow-n nex-ƛ’oräy neła-ł xizay k’oƛi-n zey nex-x zow-n
\g there-IN.ABL III-go-PFV.CVB goat.kid-ERG river-IN.ABL water-GEN1 II-fill-PFV.CVB pot-TOP II-bring-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind run-PFV.CVB bear come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The goat kid went away from there, brought a pot filled with water from the river and when it came back, a bear was running behind it.

\t ʕOmoyqor cek’ä maqˤäytow qˤaƛin, were, were däł xizay k’oƛin zey nexxo ac yaɣˤo.
\m ʕomoy-qor cek’i-a maqˤi-ay-tow qˤaƛi-n were were di-ł xizay k’oƛi-n zey nex-x ac y-ˤaɣˤi-o
\g donkey-POSS.LAT goat.kid-ERG far.away-IN.ABL-EMPH shout-PST.UNW well well me-CONT.ESS behind run-PFV.CVB bear come-IPFV.CVB door II-open-IMPR
\l The goat kid shouted to the donkey from far away: "Well, well, a bear is running behind me, open the door!"

\t Tełxor k’oƛin cek’i bok’äłrun, aceƛ zeys meč’no biqin.
\m teł-xor k’oƛi-n cek’i b-ok’eł-run ac-ƛ zey-s meč’-n b-iqi-n
\g inside-AD.LAT run-PFV.CVB goat.kid III-escape-IMM.ANT.CVB door-SUB.ESS bear-GEN1 neck-TOP III-get-PST.UNW
\l As soon as the goat kid ran inside and escaped, the bear's neck got stuck in the door.

\t Din begirƛin, rigu raq’ˤu esin zeyä.
\m di-n b-egir-ƛin r-igu r-aq’ˤu esi-n zey-a
\g me-TOP III-let-QUOT IV-good IV-much tell-PST.UNW bear-ERG
\l "Let me in as well!", the bear begged.

\t Rok’un rexun ʕomoyä zeyn iduɣor begirno.
\m rok’u-n r-exu-n ʕomoy-a zey-n idu-ɣor b-egir-n
\g heart-TOP IV-die-PFV.CVB donkey-ERG bear-TOP home-IN.ALL III-let-PST.UNW
\l The donkey felt sorry and let the bear into the home.

\t Lelazaƛ’osi aɣbi girimozaƛ’or rizin, mešin, ƛelin ʕomoyn hisonä teł kecno, cek’in, zeyn sadaq baširyox kecäsi zewn.
\m lel-bi-ƛ’-si aɣi-bi giri-bi-ƛ’or r-izi-n meši-n ƛeli-n ʕomoy-n hisono-a teł kec-n cek’i-n zey-n sadaq bašir-x kec-asi zow-n
\g wing-PL-SUPER.ESS-ATTR bird-PL pole-PL-SUPER.LAT III.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB bull.calf-and lamb-and donkey-and trough-IN.ESS inside sleep-PFV.CVB goat.kid-TOP bear-and together fireplace-AD.ESS sleep-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The birds with wings got up on poles, the bull, the lamb and the donkey slept inside a trough, the goat kid and the bear were sleeping together at the fireplace.

\t Zamanaƛ’aza cek’ä weeni rizirno.
\m zaman-ƛ’aza cek’i-a weeni r-izir-n
\g time-SUPER.VERS.DIST goat.kid-ERG bleat IV-lift-PST.UNW
\l After a while, the goat kid emitted a bleat.

\t Šew rax miƛin, esirno ʕomoyä zeyq.
\m šew r-odi-x mi-ƛin esir-n ʕomoy-a zey-q
\g what IV-do-PRS you-QUOT ask-PST.UNW donkey-ERG bear-POSS.ESS
\l "What are you doing?", asked the donkey the bear.

\t Žigoƛ’aygon mi cek’qo qˤaƛu rizirłi, ela mi bexura yołƛin, ʕomoyä eƛin.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon mi cek’i-q qˤaƛu r-izir-łi ela-a mi b-exur-a yoł-ƛin ʕomoy-a eƛi-n
\g again-SUPER.ABL-CNTR you goat.kid-POSS.ESS shout IV-lift-CND.CVB.IRR we(II-ERG you III-kill-INF be-QUOT donkey-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l If you make the goat kid shout again, we will kill you!", said the donkey.

\t Baq’ˤu mix bik’izaƛ’orgon hemedurtow weeƛirno zeyä cek’i.
\m b-aq’ˤu mix b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-gon hemedur-tow weeƛi-r-n zey-a cek’i
\g III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-CNTR so-EMPH bleat-CAUS-PST.UNW bear-ERG goat.kid
\l After quite some time has passed, the bear caused the goat kid to bleat again.

\t Šew mi žigon raxƛin, esirno žigon ʕomoyä.
\m šew mi žigon r-odi-x-ƛin esir-n žigon ʕomoy-a
\g what you again.now IV-do-PRS-QUOT ask-PST.UNW again.now donkey-ERG
\l "What are you doing again now?", asked the donkey again.

\t Elay cołizin roqno nasin halmaɣbi rizin zeyƛ’ c’oxno.
\m ele-ay cołizi-n r-oq-n nasin halmaɣ-bi r-izi-n zey-ƛ’ c’ox-n
\g there-IN.ABL unite-TOP III.PL-become-PFV.CVB all friend-PL III.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB bear-SUPER.ESS pounce-PST.UNW
\l Then all the friends united, got up and pounced on the bear.

\t Šebitowey meža där rodanƛin pikrun ban, zey qoqoƛix bičäsi zewn.
\m šebi-tow-ey meža-a di-r r-odi-an-ƛin pikru-n b-odi-n zey qoqoƛi-x b-iči-asi zow-n
\g what-EMPH-DUB you(II-ERG me-LAT IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT idea-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB bear laugh-IPFV.CVB III-wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "What are you going to do to me anyway?", thought the bear and waited laughing.

\t Halmaɣzaz cołimoz q’uwatyo žek’no zeyes qoqoƛixtewn ruħ boɣno bexun.
\m halmaɣ-bi-z cołi-z q’uwat-a žek’-n zey-s qoqoƛi-x-tow-n ruħ b-oɣ-n b-exu-n
\g friend-PL-GEN2 unity-GEN2 force-ERG beat-PFV.CVB bear-GEN1 laugh-IPFV.CVB-EMPH-TOP power III-take.away-PFV.CVB III-die-PST.UNW
\l The force of the friends' unity beated the bear, and he died laughing.

\t Esin šebi xecin šebi zownƛax zownanuƛax ya hawaƛ’ anusi, ya raƛ’moƛ’ anusi sidaɣ ħonƛ’o zirun ɣʷˤadin.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax ya hawa-ƛ’ anu-si ya raƛ’-ƛ’ anu-si sidaɣ ħon-ƛ’ ziru-n ɣʷˤadi-n
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT neither air-SUPER.ESS be.NEG-ATTR neither land-SUPER.ESS be.NEG-ATTR in.one.place mountain-SUPER.ESS fox-and crow-and
\l Once upon a time there was neither in the air nor on the land, [but] on some mountain a fox and a crow.

\t Žeda esnaza biłe sadaq ʕumru bodix zown.
\m žedu-a esyu-bi-a b-iłe sadaq ʕumru b-odi-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL-ERG brother-PL-ERG III-as together life III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They were living together like brothers.

\t Sida sider sisini muhukin boƛi bok’xo zown.
\m sida-a sida-r sisi-ni muhu-kin b-oƛi b-ok’-x zow-n
\g one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-LAT other-DEF granule-even III-half III-beat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They were even sharing every single grain among each other.

\t Sida quł ziru čanaqanłiƛ’ bik’in.
\m sida qu-ł ziru čanaqanłi-ƛ’ b-ik’i-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS fox hunt-SUPER.ESS III-go-PST.UNW
\l One day the fox went hunting.

\t Ɣʷˤadi ɣunoƛ’ neła nełaz mežä kecno bičäsi zown.
\m ɣʷˤadi ɣun-ƛ’ neła-a neła-z muži-a kec-n b-iči-asi zow-n
\g crow tree-SUPER.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 nest-IN.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB III-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The crow was sleeping in its own nest on a tree.

\t Bayn ziru elus ħon sis xecin, žek’us q’ˤano xecin, iħubin, ciqbin xecin sida keroqor bayn.
\m b-ay-n ziru elu-s ħon sis xeci-n žek’u-s q’ˤano xeci-n iħu-bi-n ciq-bi-n xeci-n sida kero-qor b-ay-n
\g III-come-PFV.CVB fox we(I).OBL-GEN1 mountain one leave-PFV.CVB man-GEN1 two leave-PFV.CVB river-PL-and forest-PL-and leave-PFV.CVB one.OBL ravine-POSS.LAT III-come-PST.UNW
\l The fox passed our one mountain, another two, rivers and forests and came to a ravine.

\t Eloza bezu-bˤoƛ’unosi, zirur boƛik’u bac’äsi ƛeles q’ulaʕi besun.
\m elo-za b-ezu~oƛ’ˤu-nosi ziru-r boƛik’u b-ac’-asi ƛeli-s q’ulaʕi b-esu-n
\g there-ZA III-examine-ANT.CVB fox-LAT half III-eat-RES.PRT lamb-GEN1 carcass III-find-PST.UNW
\l When he looked around there, he found the carcass of a half-eaten lamb.

\t Žan bižin ziru ɣʷˤadidäɣor bik’in.
\m ža-n b-iži-n ziru ɣʷˤadi-däɣor b-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB fox crow-APUD.VERS III-go-PST.UNW
\l And the fox carried it to the crow.

\t Hunix bik’iƛ’oräy, zira reƛiƛ’ sis haqu caƛinanu.
\m huni-x b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy ziru-a reƛ-ƛ’ sis haqu caƛi-n-anu
\g way-AD.ESS III-go-SIM.CVB fox-ERG meat-SUPER.ESS one mouth throw-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l While going on his way, the fox didn't put his mouth on the meat.

\t Adäz ƛeles boƛik’uni q’ulaʕin erno, ziran, ɣʷˤadan q’ˤunän sadaqay rac’no.
\m adäz ƛeli-s boƛik’u-ni q’ulaʕi-n er-n ziru-a-n ɣʷˤadi-a-n q’ˤuna-a-n sadaq-ay r-ac’-n
\g ahead lamb-GEN1 half-DEF carcass-TOP put-PFV.CVB fox-ERG-and crow-ERG-and two.OBL-ERG-TOP together-IN.ABL IV-eat-PST.UNW
\l Having put the lamb's half carcass down, the fox and the crow, they both ate together.

\t Hawaƛ’ k’oƛin bik’in ɣʷˤadi.
\m hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n b-ik’i-n ɣʷˤadi
\g air-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.UNW crow
\l The crow flew.

\t Siskintow šebin rac’a riqinč’izaƛ’, xizor butin nexƛ’oräy, hawaƛ’ay sidaɣ ħonƛ’o ɣʷˤader simildis muhu bukayn.
\m siskin-tow šebin r-ac’-a r-iqi-č’i-zaƛ’ xizor b-uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy hawa-ƛ’ay sidaɣ ħon-ƛ’ ɣʷˤadi-r simildi-s muhu b-ukad-n
\g anything-EMPH thing IV-eat-INF IV-get-NEG.FUT-CSL.CVB back III-return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB air-SUPER.ABL in.one.place mountain-SUPER.ESS crow-LAT maize-GEN1 granule III-see-PST.UNW
\l Because the crow didn't get anything to eat, it returned, and meanwhile it saw a maize grain on some mountain from the air.

\t Howda boqłin bižan zirurƛin boržizi boqno ɣʷˤadi iduɣor nexƛ’oräy, nełał adäzar osiw ħon keze yoqno.
\m howda b-oq-łin b-iži-an ziru-r-ƛin boržizi b-oq-n ɣʷˤadi idu-ɣor nex-ƛ’oräy neła-ł adäz-ar osiw ħon keze y-oq-n
\g DEM3.SG III-become-CNC.CVB III-carry-FUT.DEF fox-LAT-QUOT flight III-become-PFV.CVB crow home-IN.ALL come-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT high mountain meet II-become-PST.UNW
\l "Although it's just that, I'll carry it to the fox.", [said the crow and] while it was flying back home, a high mountain came towards it.

\t Sodxor biziƛ’oräy, zirur bowxosi muhu ɣʷˤadqo biynč’ey bigiłno.
\m sod-xor b-izi-ƛ’oräy ziru-r b-ow-xosi muhu ɣʷˤadi-q b-iy-č’ey b-igi-ł-n
\g above-AD.LAT III-get.up-SIM.CVB fox-LAT III-bring-PRS.PRT granule crow-POSS.ESS III-know-NEG.PST.CVB III-swallow-POT-PST.UNW
\l While getting over it, the crow accidentally swallowed the grain that it was bringing to the fox.

\t Baq’ˤu q’ʷarid boqno ɣʷˤadi howži, didurtow di ziruł adäzar bik’anƛin.
\m b-aq’ˤu q’ʷarid b-oq-n ɣʷˤadi howži didur-tow di ziru-ł adäz-ar b-ik’i-an-ƛin
\g III-much sadness III-become-PFV.CVB crow now how-EMPH me fox-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT III-go-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The crow became very sad, [thinking]: "Now, how will I go before the fox?"

\t Q’ʷaridno boqno ɣʷˤadä eƛin, wallahi, šomon ħon xecin bik’is di, hudun šebintow riqinč’ey nexƛ’oräy, sidaɣ simildis muhu besun howdagon boqłin bižanƛin bowƛ’oräy, adäzar osiw ħonno keze yoqno soder biziƛ’oräy biynč’ey bigin bok’ełsi.
\m q’ʷarid-n b-oq-n ɣʷˤadi-a eƛi-n wallahi šomo-n ħon xeci-n b-ik’i-s di hudun šebin-tow r-iqi-č’ey nex-ƛ’oräy sidaɣ simildi-s muhu b-esu-n howda-gon b-oq-łin b-iži-an-ƛin b-ow-ƛ’oräy adäz-ar osiw ħon-n keze y-oq-n soder b-izi-ƛ’oräy b-iy-č’ey b-igi-n b-ok’eł-s
\g sadness-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB crow-ERG say-PST.UNW by.God how.many-TOP mountain leave-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.WIT me nevertheless thing-EMPH IV-get-NEG.PST.CVB come-SIM.CVB in.one.place maize-GEN1 granule III-find-PFV.CVB DEM3.SG-CNTR III-become-CNC.CVB III-take.out-FUT.DEF-QUOT III-bring-SIM.CVB ahead-IN.LAT high mountain-TOP meet II-become-PFV.CVB upward III-get.up-SIM.CVB III-know-NEG.PST.CVB III-swallow-PFV.CVB III-lose-PST.WIT
\l The crow became sad and said: "By God, I passed so many mountains; nevertheless while I didn't get anything, I found a grain of maize somewhere and [thinking:] "I will take it anyway!", so while I carried it here anyway, I encountered a high mountain, and while flying higher, I accidentally swallowed and [thus] lost it.

\t Hemedur din nexsiƛin.
\m hemedur di-n nex-s-ƛin
\g so me-TOP come-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l And so I came here."

\t Zira eƛin, nedur resunäy, hawaƛ’osi mi rutir, q’ˤidasi di rutiran.
\m ziru-a eƛi-n nedur r-esu-näy hawa-ƛ’-si mi r-utir q’ˤida-si di r-utir-an
\g fox-ERG say-PST.UNW so IV-exist-CND.CVB air-SUPER.ESS-ATTR you IV-gather down-ATTR me IV-gather-FUT.DEF
\l The fox said: "If that's the case, collect what's in the air and I will collect what's on the ground.

\t Yałi eluł boƛƛ’o ƛˤori biča yołƛin.
\m yałi elu-ł boƛƛ’o ƛˤori b-iči-a yoł-ƛin
\g else we(I).OBL-CONT.ESS between war III-be-INF be-QUOT
\l Or else there will be war between us!"

\t Ɣʷˤadi q’ʷaridno boqno, hawaƛ’osi oz rutira bik’in.
\m ɣʷˤadi q’ʷarid-n b-oq-n hawa-ƛ’-si oz r-utir-a b-ik’i-n
\g crow sadness-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB air-SUPER.ESS-ATTR army IV-gather-INF III-go-PST.UNW
\l The crow became sad and went to gather the airborne army.

\t Zira koyä tupi yołäsi sis zaʕipaw uži iqirno.
\m ziru-a kʷay-a tupi yoł-asi sis zaʕipaw uži iqir-n
\g fox-ERG hand-IN.ESS rifle be-RES.PRT one sickly boy find-PST.UNW
\l The fox found a sickly boy with a rifle in his hand.

\t Ɣʷˤadir sida ɣunoz ariƛ’ heqäsi cey bukayn.
\m ɣʷˤadi-r sida ɣun-z ara-ƛ’ heq-asi cey b-ukad-n
\g crow-LAT one.OBL tree-GEN2 branch-SUPER.ESS sit.down-RES.PRT eagle III-see-PST.UNW
\l The crow saw an eagle sitting on a branch of a tree.

\t Zira iqäru žoyä ceyz tupi caƛinosi, igo yałru ariƛ’no c’oxno, cey k’ek’-bik’noanu.
\m ziru-a iqir-ru uži-a cey-z tupi caƛi-nosi igo yoł-ru ara-ƛ’-n c’ox-n cey k’ek’~ik’-n-anu
\g fox-ERG find-PST.PRT boy-ERG eagle-GEN2 rifle shoot.with-ANT.CVB near be-PST.PRT branch-SUPER.ESS-TOP hit-PFV.CVB eagle move-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l The boy that the fox had found, shot the eagle with his rifle and hit a branch that was near, the eagle didn't move.

\t K’ox äƛiru caƛin, hil dahaw ceyde igo yiłe č’aq’ˤinosi, nełaƛ’no k’ek’-bik’noanu.
\m k’ox eƛi-ru caƛi-n hil dahaw cey-de igo y-iłe č’aq’ˤi-nosi nełƛ’o-n k’ek’~ik’-n-anu
\g twice say-PST.PRT shoot.with-PFV.CVB bullet a.little eagle-APUD.ESS near II-as hit-ANT.CVB then-TOP move-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l He shot a second time, and when the bullet hit something near the eagle, it didn't move then either.

\t Łox äƛiru žoyä karuni tupis hil ceyde pureł č’aq’ˤin.
\m łox eƛi-ru uži-a kur-ru-ni tupi-s hil cey-de pu-ł č’aq’ˤi-n
\g thrice say-PST.PRT boy-ERG shoot.from-PST.PRT-DEF rifle-GEN1 bullet eagle-APUD.ESS side-CONT.ESS hit-PST.UNW
\l The third time the rifle's bullet shot from the boy hit next to the eagle.

\t Nełaƛ’no cey zek’ beginanu.
\m nełƛ’o-n cey zek’ b-egi-n-anu
\g then-TOP eagle jerk III-emit-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l And even then the eagle didn't get startled.

\t Yedu šebi ʕažaibłiƛin, uži ceyde puħorno ik’in, žan bisno iduɣor ik’in.
\m yedu šebi ʕažaibłi-ƛin uži cey-de pu-xor-n ik’i-n ža-n b-is-n idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g DEM2.IISG what surprise-QUOT boy eagle-APUD.ESS side-AD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l "What a surprise is that!", [said] the boy went next to the eagle and took him home.

\t Ɣʷˤadin zirun žeda žedudäɣorno rik’in halmaɣłin rexurno.
\m ɣʷˤadi-n ziru-n žedu-a žedu-däɣor-n r-ik’i-n halmaɣłi-n r-exur-n
\g crow-TOP fox-and DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IIPL.OBL-APUD.VERS-TOP IV-go-PFV.CVB friendship-TOP IV-kill-PST.UNW
\l The crow and the fox went to each other and ended their friendship.

\t Iday maħorkin begirinč’ey, nesi užä ža cey łˤora becä kikin.
\m idu-ay maħor-kin b-egir-č’ey nesi uži-a ža cey łˤora buci-a kiki-n
\g home-IN.ABL outside-even III-let-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG DEM1.SG eagle three.OBL month-IN.ESS feed-PST.UNW
\l Not even letting it outside, that boy fed the eagle for three days.

\t Xizyo cey maħorno boqno neła nełaz gugyoƛ’ ƛ’iri užin zowrno, boržizin boqno iħubin, ħonbin xecin bik’in raładyoƛ’ ƛ’irir bayn.
\m xizyo cey maħor-n b-oq-n neła-a neła-z gugu-ƛ’ ƛ’iri uži-n zowr-n boržizi-n b-oq-n iħu-bi-n ħon-bi-n xeci-n b-ik’i-n raład-ƛ’ ƛ’iri-r b-ay-n
\g afterwards eagle outside-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 back-SUPER.ESS on boy-TOP seat-PFV.CVB flight-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB river-PL-and mountain-PL-and leave-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB sea-SUPER.ESS on-LAT III-come-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, the eagle went outside, seated the boy on its own back, flew away past rivers and mountains and came to the sea.

\t Osaxorno bizin ceyä wˤałer kurxo zown uži, nesiƛ’ay aderno bik’in roładyołer ayzaƛ’or iqirxo izirxo zown.
\m osa-xor-n b-izi-n cey-a wˤał-r kur-x zow-n uži nesi-ƛ’ay ader-n b-ik’i-n raład-łer ay-zaƛ’or iqir-x izir-x zow-n
\g height-AD.LAT-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB eagle-ERG downward-LAT throw-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB boy DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL forward-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB sea-CONT.LAT come-POST.CVB catch-IPFV.CVB lift-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The eagle flew into the height and dropped the boy, flew down and before he [the boy] came to the sea, it catched him and lifted him up.

\t Hemedur k’ox bizin cey soder hawaƛ’ay wˤałer uži kuranix.
\m hemedur k’ox b-izi-n cey soder hawa-ƛ’ay wˤał-r uži kur-ani-x
\g so twice III-get.up-PST.UNW eagle upward air-SUPER.ABL downward-LAT boy throw-MSD-AD.ESS
\l So he got upward into the air a second time to throw the boy downward.

\t Łox äƛiza, užin iqirno ceyä yisiq esirno, ʕuƛ’xo zowäƛin.
\m łox eƛi-za uži-n iqir-n cey-a yisi-q esir-n ˤuƛ’-x zow-a-ƛin
\g thrice say-LCV boy-TOP take.away-PFV.CVB eagle-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW be.afraid-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l On the third time, the eagle took up the boy and asked him: "Were you afraid?"

\t Kutak ʕuƛ’xo zowsƛin, eƛin žoyä.
\m kutak ˤuƛ’-x zow-s-ƛin eƛi-n uži-a
\g too.much be.afraid-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "I was extremely afraid.", said the boy.

\t Din hemedurtow bˤuƛ’xo zowsƛin, eƛin ceyä, mi däƛ’orno rutirno tupi caƛiƛ’oräy.
\m di-n hemedur-tow b-ˤuƛ’-x zow-s-ƛin eƛi-n cey-a mi di-ƛ’or-n r-utir-n tupi caƛi-ƛ’oräy
\g me-TOP so-EMPH III-be.afraid-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW eagle-ERG you me-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-turn-PFV.CVB rifle shoot.with-SIM.CVB
\l "And I was likewise afraid", said the eagle, "when you turned a rifle on me and shot."

\t Neł mixƛ’o ceyä žaqor eƛin, di dowqor yeɣe k’emot’ neƛan, ža mi dowz ɣˤutkoxor ayzaƛ’or yaɣˤinƛin.
\m neła mixƛ’o cey-a uži-qor eƛi-n di mi-qor y-eɣe k’emot’ neƛ-an ža mi mi-z ɣˤutku-xor ay-zaƛ’or y-ˤaɣˤi-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL at.a.time eagle-ERG boy-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW me you-POSS.LAT II-small wooden.case give-FUT.CVB DEM1.SG you you-GEN2 house-AD.LAT come-POST.CVB II-open-PROHIB-QUOT
\l At that time the eagle said to the boy: "I will give you a small wooden case; don't you open it before you get to your house!"

\t Ceyqor big bičiƛinno eƛin, neła näƛru sayɣatno bisno uži iduɣor ik’in.
\m cey-qor b-ig b-iči-ƛin-n eƛi-n neła neƛ-ru sayɣat-n b-is-n uži idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g eagle-POSS.LAT III-well III-be-QUOT-TOP say-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL give-PST.PRT present-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB boy home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l The boy said "Farewell!" to the eagle, took the present given to him and went home.

\t Dahawgon q’ʷarid oqno uži, yedu šebi däq roqä, šida di ceyq ʕenekizi oqinč’uƛin.
\m dahaw-gon q’ʷarid oq-n uži yedu šebi di-q r-oq-a šida di cey-q ʕenekizi oq-č’u-ƛin
\g a.little-CNTR sadness become-PFV.CVB boy DEM2.IISG what me-POSS.ESS IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT why me eagle-POSS.ESS listen become-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The boy became a little sad, [saying:] "What happened to me; why didn't I listen to the eagle?"

\t Hemeł zamanał žader yexora kot’u yołäsi sis ečru žek’u oƛixno k’oƛin žaq esirno, šida mi nece q’ʷarid ičäsiƛin.
\m hemeł zaman-ł uži-der y-exora kot’u yoł-asi sis ečru žek’u oƛix-n k’oƛi-n uži-q esir-n šida mi nece q’ʷarid iči-asi-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL time-CONT.ESS boy-APUD.LAT II-long beard be-RES.PRT one old man appear-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB boy-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW why you so.much sadness be-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l Some time later an old man with a long beard came running and asked the boy: "Why are you so sad?"

\t Žoyä eƛin, howda ɣˤutku k’emot’ya tełer rutira k’ʷeze roqinč’ey ƛexasiƛin.
\m uži-a eƛi-n howda ɣˤutku k’emot’-a tełer r-utir-a k’ʷeze r-oq-č’ey ƛexu-asi-ƛin
\g boy-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM3.SG house wooden.case-IN.ESS into IV-turn-INF can IV-become-NEG.PST.CVB remain-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l The boy said: "I can't turn this house into the wooden case anymore."

\t Ečruni žek’a kot’aq reƛ’an riħin, ɣˤutku k’emot’ya tełxor rutirno.
\m ečru-ni žek’u-a kot’u-q reƛ’a-n r-iħi-n ɣˤutku k’emot’-a teł-xor r-utir-n
\g old-DEF man-ERG beard-POSS.ESS hand-TOP IV-smear-PFV.CVB house wooden.case-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT IV-turn-PST.UNW
\l The old man rubbed his hand on the beard and the house turned into the wooden case.

\t Nesir beže barkalan boyn, uži iduɣor nexno.
\m nesi-r b-eže barkala-n b-odi-n uži idu-ɣor nex-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT III-big thank-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB boy home-IN.ALL come-PST.UNW
\l The boy thanked him very much and came home.

\t Idur ayza qułtow, neširu kʷat’izi baqru mixƛ’o, iday maħorno oqno, ɣˤutkoł adäzarno ik’in, yisä k’emot’ yaɣˤirun, elo ixiw ɣˤutku roqno.
\m idu-r ay-za qu-ł-tow neširu kʷat’izi b-oq-ru mixƛ’o idu-ay maħor-n oq-n ɣˤutku-ł adäz-ar-n ik’i-n yisi-a k’emot’ y-ˤaɣˤi-run elo ixiw ɣˤutku r-oq-n
\g home-LAT come-ZA day-CONT.ESS-EMPH at.night be.late III-become-PST.PRT late.at.night home-IN.ABL outside-TOP become-PFV.CVB house-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG wooden.case II-open-IMM.ANT.CVB there big house IV-become-PST.UNW
\l On the day when he came home, when it has become late at night, he got outside his home, went in front of his house and right when he opened the box, a big house came into being there.

\t Sasaqozox žaƛ’ay ader moħor yaqru eniw, mada ixiw ɣutku resunosi, tamaša yoqno ƛexun.
\m sasaqozox uži-ƛ’ay ader maħor y-oq-ru eniw ma-a ixiw ɣˤutku r-esu-nosi tamaša y-oq-n ƛexu-n
\g early.morning boy-SUPER.ABL earlier outside II-become-PST.PRT mother outside-IN.ESS big house IV-find-ANT.CVB astonished II-become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l Early in the morning, his mother got out earlier than the boy and was very astonished when she found the big house outside.

\t Idurno yik’in užin č’arik’no eniya eƛin, eliz mada łuƛa ixiw ɣˤutku rodinƛin.
\m idu-r-n y-ik’i-n uži-n č’arik’-n eni-a eƛi-n eli-z ma-a łu-ƛa ixiw ɣˤutku r-odi-n-ƛin
\g home-LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB boy-TOP wake.up-PFV.CVB mother-ERG say-PST.UNW we-GEN2 outside-IN.ESS who.OBL-INDEF big house IV-do-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The mother went home, woke up the boy and said: "Someone built a big house outside of ours."

\t Moƛaxayn izin žoyän esin, ža žedus ɣˤutku yałrułi.
\m moƛu-xay-n izi-n uži-a-n esi-n ža žedu-s ɣˤutku yoł-rułi
\g sleep-AD.ABL-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB boy-ERG-TOP tell-PST.UNW DEM1.SG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 house be-MSD
\l The boy got up from his sleep and told that it is their house.

\t Kʷaxatow žax bertenno bodin eniwn, užin, barun nełƛ’ay soder łinasnotow q’ʷariłi anusi bičix zown.
\m kʷaxa-tow uži-x berten-n b-odi-n eniw-n uži-n baru-n neła-ƛ’ay soder łina-s-n-tow q’ʷariłi anu-si b-iči-x zow-n
\g soon-EMPH boy-AD.ESS marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB mother-TOP boy-and wife-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-EMPH sadness be.absent-ATTR I.PL-live-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Soon the mother arranged a marriage for the boy and the boy and his wife henceforward were living without any sadness whatsoever.

\t Sis zownoƛax zownč’eyƛax babiw.
\m sis zow-n-ƛax zow-č’ey-ƛax babiw
\g one be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-NEG.PST.CVB-QUOT father
\l Once upon a time there was a father.

\t Nesis užin, kidno zownoƛax.
\m nesi-s uži-n kid-n zow-n-ƛax
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 son-and daughter-and be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l It's said that he had a son and a daughter.

\t Sida quł kidbeder halmaɣbin rayno, yizä yizade sadaq yedu ełuyax yižin.
\m sida qu-ł kid-der halmaɣ-bi-n r-ay-n yiza-a yiza-de sadaq yedu ełu-x y-iži-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS daughter-APUD.LAT friend-PL-TOP II.PL-come-PFV.CVB DEM2.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.IIPL.OBL-APUD.ESS together DEM2.IISG bilberry-AD.ESS II-lead-PST.UNW
\l One day, some (female) friends came to the daughter, and took her with them to the bilberries.

\t Že kid ełu yut’ix soder yizixno yičin, kidbazadäy yok’ełno.
\m že kid ełu y-ut’i-x soder y-izi-x-n y-iči-n kid-bi-day y-ok’eł-n
\g DEF1.IISG girl bilberry II-collect-IPFV.CVB upward II-get.up-IPFV.CVB-TOP II-be-PFV.CVB girl-PL-APUD.ABL II-escape-PST.UNW
\l While the girl collected bilberries and got higher, she got lost from the girls.

\t Kidbazał xizay yedu kid elar yaħnayx, t’ar yaħnayx yičin yiłaq ɣudi sasiłno.
\m kid-bi-ł xizay yedu kid ele-ar y-aħnad-x t’ar y-aħnad-x y-iči-n yiła-q ɣudi sasił-n
\g girl-PL-CONT.ESS from.behind DEM2.IISG girl there-IN.LAT II-walk.around-IPFV.CVB thither II-walk.around-IPFV.CVB II-be-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS day get.dark-PST.UNW
\l While the girl walked around hither and thither behind the girls, it got dark around her.

\t Šebintow roda koƛ’inč’ey kid ƛexunosi, nełder zey bayn.
\m šebin-tow r-odi-a koƛ’i-č’ey kid ƛexu-nosi neła-der zey b-ay-n
\g thing-EMPH IV-do-INF understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB girl remain-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT bear III-come-PST.UNW
\l When - not knowing what to do - the girl was remaining there, a bear came to her.

\t Zeyä ža neła nełdäɣor yižin.
\m zey-a ža neła-a neła-däɣor y-iži-n
\g bear-ERG DEM1.SG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.VERS II-lead-PST.UNW
\l The bear led her to himself.

\t Neła rac’ru bišʷan rac’erno yičiräsi zown kid.
\m neła-a r-ac’-ru bišʷa-n r-ac’-r-n y-ičir-asi zow-n kid
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG IV-eat-PST.PRT food-TOP IV-eat-CAUS-PFV.CVB II-restrain-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB girl
\l He fed the girl with the food that he ate and kept her.

\t ƛˤeb yik’inosi, sida quł dawlaƛ’ zey maħor boqäsi yałzay, kid nełdayn yoxin ʕaƛaɣor yik’in.
\m ƛˤeb y-ik’i-nosi sida qu-ł dawla-ƛ’ zey maħor b-oq-asi yoł-zay kid neła-day-n y-oxi-n ʕaƛ-aɣor y-ik’i-n
\g year II-go-ANT.CVB one.OBL day-CONT.ESS prey-SUPER.ESS bear outside III-become-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB girl DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ABL-TOP II-run.away-PFV.CVB village-IN.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l A year went by, and one day while the bear went outside for prey, the girl ran away from him and went into a village.

\t Xizyo nełar uži odin.
\m xizyo neła-r uži odi-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT son do-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, a boy was born to her.

\t Nesiƛ’ Zeyes Aħyaƛin cin cedin.
\m nesi-ƛ’ zey-s aħya-ƛin ci-n cedi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS bear-GEN1 ear-QUOT name-TOP name-PST.UNW
\l She gave him the name "Bear Ear".

\t Ža uži zey iłetown aq’ˤiłxo ik’ix zowno.
\m ža uži zey iłe-tow-n aq’ˤił-x ik’i-x zow-n
\g DEM1.SG boy bear as-EMPH-TOP grow.up-IPFV.CVB go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l That boy grew up just like the bear.

\t Sida quł ʕaƛoz xalq’imoq łin rixra regirinč’ey, sida kikƛ’o aždaħ baq’ˤułno.
\m sida qu-ł ʕaƛ-z xalq’i-q łi-n r-ixer-a r-egir-č’ey sida kik-ƛ’ aždaħ b-aq’ˤuł-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS village-GEN2 people-POSS.ESS water-TOP IV-take-INF IV-let-NEG.PST.CVB one.OBL spring-SUPER.ESS dragon III-cover-PST.UNW
\l One day, a dragon covered a spring and didn't let the people of the village fetch water.

\t Aždaħä łi ħaƛuraniƛ, sist’a žek’u ac’anix žamaʕatyoqay oɣxo zown.
\m aždaħ-a łi ħaƛu-r-ani-ƛ sist’a žek’u ac’-ani-x žamaʕat-qay oɣ-x zow-n
\g dragon-ERG water drink-LAT-MSD-SUB.ESS one.at.a.time man eat-MSD-AD.ESS population-POSS.ABL take.away-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The dragon took away one man at a time from the population to eat them, in exchange for letting them drink from the water.

\t Sida quł aždaħ baq’ˤułno zawruni kikxar łäħor Zeyes Aħya ik’in.
\m sida qu-ł aždaħ b-aq’ˤuł-n zow-ru-ni kik-xar łi-xor zey-s aħya ik’i-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS dragon III-cover-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF spring-AD.VERS water-AD.LAT bear-GEN1 ear go-PST.UNW
\l One day Bear Ear went to the spring the dragon was covering to get water.

\t Aždaħä nesiq łäs sis q’ˤut’u bic’erno.
\m aždaħ-a nesi-q łi-s sis q’ut’u b-ic’r-n
\g dragon-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS water-GEN1 one earthen.jug III-fill-PST.UNW
\l The dragon filled him one jug of water.

\t Xizor utin nexƛ’oräy, hemece ačqˤayx zawru xalq’imo ža łi ħaƛun łiyrno.
\m xizor uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy hemece ačqˤad-x zow-ru xalq’i-a ža łi ħaƛu-n łiyr-n
\g back return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB as.many be.thirsty-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT people-ERG DEM1.SG water drink-PFV.CVB finish-PST.UNW
\l While he was going back, many thirsty people drank up that water.

\t K’ox eƛagon Zeyes Aħya łäs q’ut’u bic’a ik’inosi, aždaħä žan bic’a begirno t’ok’ow näxnoƛin nesiq riyerno.
\m k’ox eƛi-a-gon zey-s aħya łi-s q’ut’u b-ic’-a ik’i-nosi aždaħ-a ža-n b-ic’-a b-egir-n t’ok’ow nex-n-ƛin nesi-q r-iyr-n
\g twice say-INF-CNTR bear-GEN1 ear water-GEN1 earthen.jug III-fill-INF go-ANT.CVB dragon-ERG DEM1.SG-TOP III-fill-INF III-let-PFV.CVB anymore come-PROHIB-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-explain-PST.UNW
\l The second time Bear Ear went to fill the jug with water, the dragon let him fill it and let him know: "Don't come anymore!"

\t K’ox äƛizayn hemedurtow xalq’imon ħaƛun Zeyes Aħyaq idur zok’ice dandi łi rayn.
\m k’ox eƛi-zay-n hemedur-tow xalq’i-a-n ħaƛu-n zey-s aħya-q idu-r zok’i-ace dandi łi r-odi-n
\g twice say-SIM.CVB-PFV.CVB so-EMPH people-ERG-TOP drink-PFV.CVB bear-GEN1 ear-POSS.ESS home-LAT mug-TERM only water IV-do-PST.UNW
\l Also the second time the people drank it up likewise, and Bear Ear could only bring enough water for a mug home.

\t Ža maxsarno bacin, łox äƛiru hunix Zeyes Aħya bˤałayn risno oč’ino q’ˤim yołali aždaħno bexurno xalq’imoƛ’ay yedu ɣudi roɣanƛintow ik’in.
\m ža maxsar-n b-aci-n łox eƛi-ru huni-x zey-s aħya bˤałay-n r-is-n oč’ino q’ˤim yoł-ali aždaħ-n b-exur-n xalq’i-ƛ’ay yedu ɣudi r-oɣ-an-ƛin-tow ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG joke-TOP III-bother-PFV.CVB thrice say-PST.PRT way-AD.ESS bear-GEN1 ear dagger-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB nine head be-ATTR dragon-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB people-SUPER.ABL DEM2.IISG day IV-take.away-FUT.CVB-QUOT-EMPH go-PST.UNW
\l Being bothered by this mockery, Bear Ear took his dagger and went to kill the dragon with the nine heads and to take this burden off the people.

\t Tabanaw biħanayn žedu q’ˤanon.
\m tabanaw b-iħanad-n žedu q’ˤano-n
\g long I.PL-fight-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL two-TOP
\l The two of them fought very long.

\t Zeyes Aħya bˤałay rok’xo aždaħes q’ˤim ret’urxo roɣxo zown, nełaz meča ʕoƛnot’a roƛixxo zown.
\m zey-s aħya-a bˤałay r-ok’-x aždaħ-s q’ˤim r-et’ur-x r-oɣ-x zow-n neła-z meča ʕoƛno-t’a r-oƛix-x zow-n
\g bear-GEN1 ear-ERG dagger IV-hit-IPFV.CVB dragon-GEN1 head IV-hack-IPFV.CVB IV-take.away-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 instead.of seven-DISTR IV-appear-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Bear Ear hit with his dagger and chopped off a head of the dragon, and instead of it, seven [more heads] were appearing.

\t Nesir riyx zown suƛƛitow nełas q’ˤimbi reč’no roɣinč’inäy, neła ħal bayrxanusiłi.
\m nesi-r r-iy-x zow-n suƛƛi-tow neła-s q’ˤim-bi r-eč’-n r-oɣ-č’i-näy neła-a ħal b-ayr-xanusi-łi
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-know-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB at.once-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 head-PL IV.PL-cut-PFV.CVB IV-take.away-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG trouble III-bring-NEG.PRS.PRT-CND.CVB.IRR
\l He knew that if he didn't cut off all the heads at once, he wouldn't defeat it.

\t Xizaɣor hudun yisä sis sanaʕałin biqirno suƛƛitow nasin q’ˤimbin reč’no, aždaħ bexurno łaƛ’ay boɣno kurno.
\m xizaɣor hudun yisi-a sis sanaʕałi-n b-iqir-n suƛƛi-tow nasin q’ˤim-bi-n r-eč’-n aždaħ b-exur-n łi-ƛ’ay b-oɣ-n kur-n
\g finally nevertheless DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG one chance-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB at.once-EMPH all head-PL-TOP IV.PL-cut-PFV.CVB dragon III-kill-PFV.CVB water-SUPER.ABL III-take.away-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l Finally nevertheless he took a chance, cut off all the heads at once, killed the dragon and threw it off the water.

\t Ža balah žeduƛ’ ƛ’iräy bok’ek’zaƛ’ ahli ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤun bizin, nełƛ’ay soder žeda Zeyes Aħya narnokin egirinč’ey, nesis adabno, ħurmatno bodin ičira yołƛin ƛ’iri risno.
\m ža balah žedu-ƛ’ ƛ’iräy b-ok’ek’-zaƛ’ ahli ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu-n b-izi-n neła-ƛ’ay soder žedu-a zey-s aħya nar-n-kin egir-č’ey nesi-s adab-n ħurmat-n b-odi-n ičir-a yoł-ƛin ƛ’iri r-is-n
\g DEM1.SG misfortune DEM1.IPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS from.above III-remove-CSL.CVB people very be.happy-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after DEM1.IPL-ERG bear-GEN1 ear where-TOP-even let-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 esteem-and respect-and III-do-PFV.CVB restrain-INF be-QUOT above IV-take-PST.UNW
\l The people were very glad that he had taken the misfortune from them, and after that, they didn't want to let Bear Ear go anywhere, gave him respect and esteem and insisted in keeping him.

\t Asaq sida ʕaƛa čanyabi kikix Bac’ali zown.
\m Asaq sida ʕaƛ-a čan-bi kiki-x Bac’ali zow-n
\g Asakh one.OBL village-IN.ESS she.goat-PL feed-IPFV.CVB Batsali be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In one Asakh viallage there was [a guy named] Batsali feeding the goats.

\t Žedu sasaq ħonƛ’aɣor roxirnosi, neširaɣor žedar žedu rutin iduɣor rayx zown.
\m žedu sasaq ħon-ƛ’aɣor r-oxir-nosi neširu-aɣor žeda-r žedu r-uti-n idu-ɣor r-ay-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL in.the.morning mountain-SUPER.VERS III.PL-chase-ANT.CVB evening-IN.VERS DEM1.IIPL.OBL-LAT DEM1.IIPL III.PL-return-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL III.PL-come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In the morning he chased them onto a mountain, towards the evening they came back home by themselves.

\t Sida quł čanyabi raynč’ey ričin.
\m sida qu-ł čan-bi r-ay-č’ey r-iči-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS she.goat-PL III.PL-come-NEG.PST.CVB III.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l One day, the goats were not coming.

\t Hudayzikotow Bac’ali žedu k’eda ik’inosi, zeyn keze boqno nełaq esirno, meža dey čanyabi rac’iyäƛin.
\m hudayziko-tow Bac’ali žedu k’edi-a ik’i-nosi zey-n keze b-oq-n neła-q esir-n meža-a di-s čan-bi r-ac’-ya-ƛin
\g the.next.day-EMPH Batsali DEM1.IIPL search-INF go-ANT.CVB bear-TOP meet III-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB you(II-ERG me-GEN1 she.goat-PL III.PL-eat-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l The next day, when Batsali went to search them, he met a bear and asked him: "Have y'all eaten my goats?"

\t Di rac’inč’uƛin, žawab teƛno neła.
\m di r-ac’-č’u-ƛin žawab teƛ-n neła-a
\g me III.PL-eat-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG
\l "I haven't eaten them", he answered.

\t Mi rac’no resunč’inäy, ezur di haqarƛin, ƛ’iri Bac’ali utin.
\m mi r-ac’-n r-esu-č’i-näy ezu-r di haqu-ar-ƛin ƛ’iri Bac’ali uti-n
\g you III.PL-eat-PFV.CVB IV-exist-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB look-CAUS me mouth-IN.LAT-QUOT above Batsali turn-PST.UNW
\l "If it's not the case that you have eaten them, let me look into your mouth!", Batsali insisted.

\t Haqan bogurno tełer ezun elo čanyazas ruɣutow rukaynč’izaƛ’, nesä ža zey begirno.
\m haqu-a-n b-ogu-r-n tełer ezu-n elo čan-bi-s ruɣu-tow r-ukad-č’i-zaƛ’ nesi-a ža zey b-egir-n
\g mouth-IN.ESS-TOP III-gape-CAUS-PFV.CVB into look-PFV.CVB there she.goat-PL-GEN1 prints-EMPH IV-see-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG bear III-let-PST.UNW
\l He let him gape, looked into his mouth, and because he didn't see any footprints of the goats there, he let that bear go.

\t Elaygon bitor čanyabi k’edix ik’iƛ’oräy, neside dandir čarman ricin nexxo ziru č’aq’ˤin.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor čan-bi k’edi-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy nesi-de dandir čarma-n r-ici-n nex-x ziru č’aq’ˤi-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither she.goat-PL search-IPFV.CVB go-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS towards turban-TOP IV-tie-PFV.CVB come-IPFV.CVB fox hit-PST.UNW
\l While going away from there searching the goats, a fox with a turban ran into him.

\t Miyä däz čanyazaƛ’ č’aq’ˤaƛin, Bac’ali ziruƛ’or oqno.
\m mi-a di-z čan-bi-ƛ’ č’aq’ˤi-a-ƛin Bac’ali ziru-ƛ’or oq-n
\g you-Q me-GEN2 she.goat-PL-SUPER.ESS fall.down-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT Batsali fox-SUPER.LAT begin-PST.UNW
\l "Did you assault my goats?", Batsali began on the fox.

\t Debez čanyazaƛ’ č’aq’ˤäsianu diƛin, zira eƛin, deber bukayxana di ħežƛ’azay qizanyor šebinno rižin bik’ixƛin.
\m mi-z čan-bi-ƛ’ č’aq’ˤi-asi-anu di-ƛin ziru-a eƛi-n mi-r b-ukad-x-anu-a di ħež-ƛ’azay qizan-r šebin-n r-iži-n b-ik’i-x-ƛin
\g you-GEN2 she.goat-PL-SUPER.ESS fall.down-RES.PRT-NEG me-QUOT fox-ERG say-PST.UNW you-LAT III-see-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q me hajj-SUPER.ABL.DIST family-LAT thing-TOP IV-carry-PFV.CVB III-go-PRS-QUOT
\l "I didn't assault your goat," said the fox, "don't you see I am coming from the hajj with things for my family?"

\t Begirno xecin Bac’alä ziru.
\m b-egir-n xeci-n Bac’ali-a ziru
\g III-let-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW Batsali-ERG fox
\l Batsali let the fox go and left.

\t Xizyogon nesił boc’i c’oxno.
\m xizyogon nesi-ł boc’i c’ox-n
\g then DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS wolf meet-PST.UNW
\l Then he met a wolf.

\t Cimno bizin Bac’alä esirno, miyä dey čanyabi rac’äƛin.
\m cim-n b-izi-n Bac’ali-a esir-n mi-a di-s čan-bi r-ac’-a-ƛin
\g malice-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB Batsali-ERG ask-PST.UNW you-ERG me-GEN1 she.goat-PL III.PL-eat-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Getting cross, Batsali asked: "Did you eat my goats?!"

\t Rac’inč’uƛin, boc’ä ot’ bisno.
\m r-ac’-č’u-ƛin boc’i-a ot’ b-is-n
\g III.PL-eat-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT wolf-ERG rejection III-take-PST.UNW
\l "Didn't eat them," the wolf rejected.

\t Suƛƛi yisir boc’zo k’icazał šišäsi ɣˤit’an, hut’zaqgon tutäsi iyon bukaynosi, hay malʕun, miwa dey čanyabi rac’noƛin, Bac’ali boc’ƛ’or oqno.
\m suƛƛi yisi-r boc’i-z k’icu-bi-ł šiši-asi ɣˤit’a-n hut’-bi-q-gon tuti-asi iyo-n b-ukad-nosi hay malʕun mi-a di-s čan-bi r-ac’-n-ƛin Bac’ali boc’i-ƛ’or oq-n
\g suddenly DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT wolf-GEN2 tooth-PL-CONT.ESS get.stuck-RES.PRT goat.wool-and jaws-PL-POSS.ESS-CNTR be.stained-RES.PRT blood-TOP III-see-ANT.CVB so.then villain you-Q me-GEN1 she.goat-PL III.PL-eat-PST.UNW-QUOT Batsali wolf-SUPER.LAT begin-PST.UNW
\l Suddenly, when he saw the goat wool stuck between the wolf's teeth and the blood staining on his jaws, Batsali began on the wolf: "So then, you villain, have you eaten my goats?"

\t Yisis rigu rok’ƛ’o anuƛin, nesiqay zebun yoɣno boc’i boxin.
\m yisi-s r-igu rok’u-ƛ’ anu-ƛin nesi-qay zebu-n y-oɣ-n boc’i b-oxi-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 IV-good heart-SUPER.ESS be.NEG-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL running-TOP II-take.away-PFV.CVB wolf III-run.away-PST.UNW
\l "He's bad-tempered", [thought] the wolf [and] ran away from him.

\t Nełał xizay k’oƛin Bac’ali ik’iƛ’oräy, boc’i imxa tełxor boxin.
\m neła-ł xizay k’oƛi-n Bac’ali ik’i-ƛ’oräy boc’i imxu-a teł-xor b-oxi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS from.behind run-PFV.CVB Batsali go-SIM.CVB wolf cave-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT III-run.away-PST.UNW
\l While Batsali was running behind him, the wolf fled into a cave.

\t Imxuxgon maħor ža boƛixaceƛin Bac’alin ičin.
\m imxu-x-gon maħor ža b-oƛix-ace-ƛin Bac’ali-n iči-n
\g cave-AD.ESS-CNTR outside DEM1.SG III-appear-TERM-QUOT Batsali-TOP wait-PST.UNW
\l And Batsali waited outside the cave until he (the wolf) would appear.

\t Yeda rigzaxay t’ay äk’inč’iƛin, boc’ä harizi rodin, rigza ħalał qema regirƛin.
\m yeda r-ig-za-xay t’ay ik’i-č’i-ƛin boc’i-a harizi r-odi-n r-ig-za ħal-ł qema r-egir-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG IV-well-ZA-AD.ABL from.here go-NEG.FUT-QUOT wolf-ERG request IV-do-PST.UNW IV-well-ZA strength-CONT.ESS rain IV-let-QUOT
\l [Thinking] "He won't get away from there anyway," the wolf requested: "Let it rain heavily!"

\t Qema regirnosi, Bac’alägon harizi rodin, Allah, kuro däz ħirozaqor butniƛin.
\m qema r-egir-nosi Bac’ali-a-gon harizi r-odi-n Allah kur-o di-z ħiro-bi-qor butni-ƛin
\g rain IV-let-ANT.CVB Batsali-ERG-CNTR request IV-do-PST.UNW God throw-IMPR me-GEN2 shoulder-PL-POSS.LAT burka-QUOT
\l When it had started to rain, Batsali requested: "God, throw a burka over my shoulders!"

\t Yisiz gugyoƛ’or bˤaƛ’un butni bayn.
\m yisi-z gugu-ƛ’or b-ˤaƛ’u-n butni b-ay-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 back-SUPER.LAT III-fall-PFV.CVB burka III-come-PST.UNW
\l And a burka fell over his back.

\t Sida mixƛ’o ƛ’iräzay qemas ixiw ix boƛixno.
\m sida mixƛ’o ƛ’iri-azay qema-s ixiw ix b-oƛix-n
\g one.OBL at.a.time above-IN.ABL.DIST rain-GEN1 big torrent III-appear-PST.UNW
\l At some point in time, a big torrent of rain came from above.

\t Bac’alä łi boc’i teł yałruni imxaɣor rutirno.
\m Bac’ali-a łi boc’i teł yoł-ru-ni imxu-aɣor r-utir-n
\g Batsali-ERG water wolf inside be-PST.PRT-DEF cave-IN.VERS IV-turn-PST.UNW
\l Batsali turned the water into the cave which the wolf was inside.

\t Łäs gondu yäc’ruxor, boc’i ƛ’iriɣor bizirxo bižix zown.
\m łi-s gondu y-ic’-ru-xor boc’i ƛ’iri-ɣor b-izir-x b-iži-x zow-n
\g water-GEN1 big.hole II-fill-PST.PRT-AD.LAT wolf above-IN.ALL III-lift-IPFV.CVB III-carry-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l According to the hole being filled with water, it carried the wolf upward.

\t ƛ’iriɣor boƛixnosi, Bac’alä q’ˤimqo šebinon rok’no žan bexurno, nełqay ħoši boɣno.
\m ƛ’iri-ɣor b-oƛix-nosi Bac’ali-a q’ˤim-q šebinon r-ok’-n ža-n b-exur-n neła-qay ħoši b-oɣ-n
\g above-IN.ALL III-appear-ANT.CVB Batsali-ERG head-POSS.ESS something III.PL-beat-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL hide III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l When he appeared above, Batsali beated something over his head, killed him and took off his hide.

\t Bazaryaɣorno ik’in nesä boc’es ħošin teƛno, nełaƛ bäqiru micxiryoƛ Bac’alä čanyabin risno.
\m bazar-aɣor-n ik’i-n nesi-a boc’i-s ħoši-n teƛ-n neła-ƛ b-iqi-ru micxir-ƛ Bac’ali-a čan-bi-n r-is-n
\g bazar-IN.VERS-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG wolf-GEN1 hide-TOP sell-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUB.ESS III-get-PST.PRT money-SUB.ESS Batsali-ERG she.goat-PL-TOP III.PL-buy-PST.UNW
\l He went to the market, sold the wolf's hide and for the money he got for it Batsali bought goats.

\t Yaqˤułno yołƛax Bac’ali aderzoxortow čanyabi kikix, sasaq roxirno, neširaɣor žedar žedu rayn.
\m yaqˤuł-n yoł-ƛax Bac’ali ader-zo-xor-tow čan-bi kiki-x sasaq r-oxir-n neširu-aɣor žeda-r žedu r-ay-n
\g today-TOP be-QUOT Batsali forward-ATTR.OBL-AD.LAT-EMPH she.goat-PL feed-IPFV.CVB in.the.morning III.PL-chase-PFV.CVB evening-IN.VERS DEM1.IIPL.OBL-LAT DEM1.IIPL III.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l Today, it's said, Batsali is living just as before feeding the goats, chased the in the morning and they came back towards the evening by themselves.

\t Sis zown eniwn užin.
\m sis zow-n eniw-n uži-n
\g one be.NPRS-PST.UNW mother-and son-and
\l There was a mother and her son.

\t Žedu c’aq’ miskinłiƛ’ zown.
\m žedu c’aq’ miskin-łi-ƛ’ zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL very poor-NMLZ-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They lived in great poverty.

\t Šibaw ɣudi uži ciqaɣor ik’ix qaca royx, teƛxo hemedur bet’erbaqi boyx zown žeda.
\m šibaw ɣudi uži ciq-aɣor ik’i-x qaca r-odi-x teƛ-x hemedur bet’erbaqi b-odi-x zow-n žedu-a
\g every day son forest-IN.VERS go-IPFV.CVB firewood IV-do-IPFV.CVB give-IPFV.CVB so life III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG
\l Every day the son was going to the forest, collecting and selling firewood; so they were living their life.

\t Sida quł ciqaɣor qaca roda uži ik’inosi, nesir aɣzaz xexoyzadäɣor ɣunoq bizix bikori bukayn.
