\m sida qu-ł ciq-aɣor qaca r-odi-a uži ik’i-nosi nesi-r aɣi-bi-z xexoy-bi-däɣor ɣun-q b-izi-x bikori b-ukad-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS forest-IN.VERS firewood IV-do-INF boy go-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT bird-PL-GEN2 young.animal-PL-APUD.VERS tree-POSS.ESS III-get.up-IPFV.CVB snake III-see-PST.UNW
\l One day, when the boy went to the forest to get firewood, he saw a snake getting up a tree towards some bird chicks.

\t Užä ʕon rok’no bikorin bexurno boɣno kurno ik’anƛin aqru yeda, xexoyza eč’erno žedas eniw yayace t’o ičiƛin.
\m uži-a ʕo-n r-ok’-n bikori-n b-exur-n b-oɣ-n kur-n ik’i-an-ƛin oq-ru yeda xexoy-bi-a eč’er-n žeda-s eniw y-ay-ace t’o iči-ƛin
\g boy-ERG ax-TOP IV-hit-PFV.CVB snake-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB III-take.away-PFV.CVB throw-PFV.CVB go-FUT.CVB-QUOT become-PST.PRT DEM2.ISG young.animal-PL-ERG stop-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-GEN1 mother II-come-TERM there wait-QUOT
\l The boy struck his ax, killed the snake, took it and threw it away and thought of going, but the chicks stopped him until their mother would come.

\t Eniw yayrun uži exura k’oƛin.
\m eniw y-ay-run uži exur-a k’oƛi-n
\g mother II-come-IMM.ANT.CVB boy kill-INF jump-PST.UNW
\l As soon as the mother came, she jumped to kill the boy.

\t Xexoyza c’iwni rizirno, xec eni, nesä eluƛ’or nexxosi bikori bexursiƛin.
\m xexoy-bi-a c’iwni r-izir-n xec eni nesi-a elu-ƛ’or nex-xosi bikori b-exur-s-ƛin
\g young.animal-PL-ERG tweet IV-lift-PFV.CVB enough mother DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-SUPER.LAT come-PRS.PRT snake III-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The chicks lifted a tweet: "Enough, mommy, he killed a snake that was coming over us!"

\t Xexoyzas eniya šebi deber retinƛin žaq esirnosi, p’es anusi ičin.
\m xexoy-bi-s eni-a šebi mi-r r-eti-n-ƛin uži-q esir-nosi p’es anu-si iči-n
\g young.animal-PL-GEN1 mother-ERG what you-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT boy-POSS.ESS ask-ANT.CVB voice be.absent-ATTR remain-PST.UNW
\l When the chicks' mother asked the boy: "What do you want?", he remained silent.

\t Xizyo aɣä nesir meɣu teƛno.
\m xizyo aɣi-a nesi-r meɣu teƛ-n
\g afterwards bird-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT udder give-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, the bird gave him an udder.

\t Nesiq neła meɣyoqor didur eƛa rayxosi yałrułi mołin.
\m nesi-q neła-a meɣu-qor didur eƛi-a r-ay-xosi yoł-rułi mołi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG udder-POSS.LAT how say-INF IV-must-PRS.PRT be-MSD teach-PST.UNW
\l Him she taught how one has to speak to the udder.

\t Wele meɣu deberno, därno, eniwrno ʕeziyaw bišʷa roƛik’ƛin.
\m wele meɣu mi-r-n di-r-n eniw-r-n ʕeziyaw bišʷa r-oƛik’-ƛin
\g look.out.IMP udder you-LAT-and me-LAT-and mother-LAT-and much food IV-let.appear-QUOT
\l "Look out, udder, let appear much food for you, me and the mother!"

\t Howži ža uži iduɣor ik’in.
\m howži ža uži idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g now DEM1.SG boy home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l Now the boy went home.

\t Idur aynosi, yisir ciqaɣor erno bišʷan łiyn eniwn nan mekoyx yesuzaƛ’ žoyä meɣyoqor eƛin, wele meɣu deberno, därno, eniwrno ʕeziyaw bišʷa roƛik’ƛin.
\m idu-r ay-nosi yisi-r ciq-aɣor er-n bišʷa-n łiy-n eniw-n nan mekod-x y-esu-zaƛ’ uži-a meɣu-qor eƛi-n wele meɣu mi-r-n di-r-n eniw-r-n ʕeziyaw bišʷa r-oƛik’-ƛin
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT forest-IN.VERS put-PFV.CVB food-and end-PFV.CVB mother-and even be.hungry-IPFV.CVB II-find-CSL.CVB boy-ERG udder-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB look.out.IMP udder you-LAT-and me-LAT-and mother-LAT-and much food IV-let.appear-QUOT
\l When he came home, he found the food put for [the way into] the forest finished and his mother being hungry, so the boy said to the udder: "Look out, udder, let appear much food for you, me and the mother!"

\t Užir retäsi zown xanes kid esiranix eniw yegira.
\m uži-r r-eti-asi zow-n xan-s kid esir-ani-x eniw y-egir-a
\g boy-LAT IV-want-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW khan-GEN1 daughter ask-MSD-AD.ESS mother II-send-INF
\l The boy wanted to send his mother to ask for the king's daughter.

\t Eniw yoqäsi zown užiq bič’zi roda miskinaw debex bečedaw xanes kid näxinč’iƛin.
\m eniw y-oq-asi zow-n uži-q bič’zi r-odi-a miskinaw mi-x bečedaw xan-s kid nex-č’i-ƛin
\g mother II-begin-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB boy-POSS.ESS explain IV-do-INF poor you-AD.ESS wealthy khan-GEN1 daughter come-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l The mother began explaining to the boy: "The wealthy princess won't come to the poor you."

\t Didur roqłin, žoyä eniw muk’ur yodin xanes kid esira yik’a.
\m didur r-oq-łin uži-a eniw muk’ur y-odi-n xan-s kid esir-a y-ik’i-a
\g how IV-happen-CNC.CVB boy-ERG mother persuade II-do-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 daughter ask-INF II-go-INF
\l Somehow the boy persuaded his mother into going to ask the king's daughter.

\t Xanez ɣˤutka tełxor yik’a nično boqno eniw madaxay bitor yik’iłnoanu.
\m xan-z ɣˤutku-a teł-xor y-ik’i-a nič-n b-oq-n eniw ma-xay bitor y-ik’i-ł-n-anu
\g khan-GEN2 house-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT II-go-INF be.ashamed-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB mother yard-AD.ABL thither II-go-POT-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l The mother was ashamed to go inside the king's house and wasn't able to go further than the yard.

\t Xizyo madaxosinin ayn, xandärno yižin neła nełas muradyołäy esin, wallahi, di žax debi kid esira nexäsi yołƛin.
\m xizyo ma-x-si-ni-n ay-n xan-dar-n y-iži-n neła-a neła-s murad-łay esi-n wallahi di uži-x mi-s kid esir-a nex-asi yoł-ƛin
\g afterwards yard-AD.ESS-ATTR-DEF-TOP come-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.VERS-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 wish-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW by.God me son-AD.ESS you-GEN1 daughter ask-INF come-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l Then the house-serf came, lead her to the king, and she told [him] of her wish: "By God, I have come to ask out the kings daughter to marry my son."

\t Xanä suƛƛitow žawab teƛno, däzoq riłäsi ɣˤutkun, č’ikaysgon ƛen bodinäy, yegiranƛin.
\m xan-a suƛƛi-tow žawab teƛ-n di-zo-q r-iłi-asi ɣˤutku-n č’ikay-s-gon ƛe-n b-odi-näy y-egir-an-ƛin
\g khan-ERG suddenly-EMPH answer give-PST.UNW me-ATTR.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-resemble-RES.PRT house-and glass-GEN1-CNTR bridge-and III-do-CND.CVB II-send-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The king suddenly answered: "If you build a house that resembles mine and a bridge made of glass, I will send her."

\t Eniw iduɣorno yik’in, žaq xanä äsiru xabar esin.
\m eniw idu-ɣor-n y-ik’i-n uži-q xan-a esi-ru xabar esi-n
\g mother home-IN.ALL-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB son-POSS.ESS khan-ERG tell-PST.PRT story tell-PST.UNW
\l The mother went home and told her son what the king said.

\t Sasaqtow izin žoyä ros bič’anix bašla bodin.
\m sasaq-tow izi-n uži-a ros b-ič’i-ani-x bašla b-odi-n
\g in.the.morning-EMPH get.up-PFV.CVB boy-ERG base III-dig-MSD-AD.ESS begin III-do-PST.UNW
\l In the morning the boy got up and began to dig the base.

\t ʕAnsan koyä yołäsi ƛ’irir ayru ečru žek’a žaqay bayan bisno šebi t’o sasaqtow rodixƛin.
\m ʕansa-n kʷay-a yoł-asi ƛ’iri-r ay-ru ečru žek’u-a uži-qay bayan b-is-n šebi t’o sasaq-tow r-odi-x-ƛin
\g walking.stick-TOP hand-IN.ESS be-RES.PRT above-LAT come-PST.PRT old man-ERG boy-POSS.ABL information III-take-PST.UNW what here in.the.morning-EMPH IV-do-PRS-QUOT
\l An old man got up with a walking stick in his hand and wanted to know from the boy: "What are you doing here in the morning?"

\t Žoyä ɣˤutku rodixƛin eženi žek’uqno esin meɣyoqor eƛin, xanes riłe ɣˤutkun, č’ikays ƛen boqoƛƛin.
\m uži-a ɣˤutku r-odi-x-ƛin eže-ni žek’u-q-n esi-n meɣu-qor eƛi-n xan-s r-iłe ɣˤutku-n č’ikay-s ƛe-n b-oq-ƛ-ƛin
\g boy-ERG house IV-do-PRS-QUOT old-DEF man-POSS.ESS-TOP tell-PFV.CVB udder-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 IV-as house-and glass-GEN1 bridge-and III-become-OPT-QUOT
\l The boy told the old man: "Building a house." and said to the udder: "May there become a house like the king's and a bridge of glass!"

\t Hag oqno ƛexun ečruni žek’u.
\m hag oq-n ƛexu-n ečru-ni žek’u
\g amazingly become-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB old-DEF man
\l The old man was amazed.

\t Meɣu där neƛ, deber di ʕansa neƛanƛin daʕba boyn ičin ečruni žek’u.
\m meɣu di-r neƛ mi-r di ʕansa neƛ-an-ƛin daʕba b-odi-n iči-n ečru-ni žek’u
\g udder me-LAT give you-LAT me walking.stick give-FUT.DEF-QUOT dispute III-do-PFV.CVB be-PFV.CVB old-DEF man
\l "Give me the udder and I will give you the walking stick!", the old man argued.

\t Neł ʕansas hunar zown amru badirun, boƛ’araw žek’u exurxosi.
\m neła ʕansa-s hunar zow-n amru b-odi-run boƛ’araw žek’u exur-xosi
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL walking.stick-GEN1 talent be.NPRS-PFV.CVB command III-do-IMM.ANT.CVB any man kill-PRS.PRT
\l This walking stick's talent was that just by giving a command, it kills any man.

\t Žeda meɣun, ʕansan ħažin.
\m žedu-a meɣu-n ʕansa-n ħaži-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG udder-and walking.stick-and exchange-PST.UNW
\l They exchanged udder and walking stick.

\t Amma žoyä esinanu meɣyoqor šebi eƛa rayxosi yałrułi.
\m amma uži-a esi-n-anu meɣu-qor šebi eƛi-a r-ay-xosi yoł-rułi
\g but boy-ERG tell-PFV.CVB-NEG udder-POSS.LAT what say-INF IV-must-PRS.PRT be-MSD
\l But the boy didn't tell what one has to say to the udder.

\t Boƛƛ’o zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, meɣu xizor yutin yayn.
\m boƛƛ’o zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow meɣu xizor y-uti-n y-ay-n
\g middle time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH udder back II-turn-PFV.CVB II-come-PST.UNW
\l Before much time had passed, the udder came back.

\t Ɣˤutkun, ƛen rodin łiyzaƛ’, žoyä eniw k’ox äƛirugon kidno esirno xander yegirno.
\m ɣˤutku-n ƛe-n r-odi-n łiy-zaƛ’ uži-a eniw k’ox äƛiru-gon kid-n esir-n xan-der y-egir-n
\g house-and bridge-and III.PL-do-PFV.CVB end-CSL.CVB boy-ERG mother twice ORD-CNTR girl-TOP ask-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.LAT II-send-PST.UNW
\l When the house and the bridge were finished, the boy sent his mother to the king a second time to ask for the girl.

\t Däzoq riłäsi mada ɣun roƛik’oƛƛin, xanä eniw sosigon madaƛäytow xizor yutirno.
\m di-zo-q r-iłi-asi ma-a ɣun r-oƛik’-ƛ-ƛin xan-a eniw sosi-gon ma-ƛay-tow xizor y-utir-n
\g me-ATTR.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-resemble-RES.PRT yard-IN.ESS tree IV-let.appear-OPT-QUOT khan-ERG mother again-CNTR yard-SUB.ABL-EMPH back II-give.back-PST.UNW
\l "May there appear a tree in my yard that resembles mine!", the king sent the mother back from his court again.

\t Hemedurtow meɣyoqorno eƛin, xanzoq riłäsi mada ɣun roƛik’no.
\m hemedur-tow meɣu-qor-n eƛi-n xan-z-q r-iłi-asi ma-a ɣun r-oƛik’-n
\g so-EMPH udder-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2-POSS.ESS IV-resemble-RES.PRT yard-IN.ESS tree IV-let.appear-PFV.CVB
\l So he said to the udder, and let a tree appear in the yard that resembled the king's one.

\t Xizyogon xanä dey oz bišroƛin eƛinosi, žoyä meɣyoqorno eƛin žedun bišerno.
\m xizyogon xan-a di-s oz b-iš-r-o-ƛin eƛi-nosi uži-a meɣu-qor-n eƛi-n žedu-n b-iš-r-n
\g then khan-ERG me-GEN1 army III-eat-CAUS-IMPR-QUOT say-ANT.CVB boy-ERG udder-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-TOP I.PL-eat-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l Then, when the king said: "Let my army eat!", the boy said [it] to his udder and let them eat.

\t Xizyogon kid esirno bik’inosi, xanä kid yegiranix inkartow bodin.
\m xizyogon kid esir-n b-ik’i-nosi xan-a kid y-egir-ani-x inkar-tow b-odi-n
\g then girl ask-PFV.CVB III-go-ANT.CVB khan-ERG daughter II-send-MSD-AD.ESS rejection-EMPH III-do-PST.UNW
\l Then they went to ask the girl, but the king rejected giving off his daughter for marriage.

\t Neł mixƛ’o žoyä ʕansa begirno, xanes sadaq askar t’it’oƛin.
\m neła mix-ƛ’ uži-a ʕansa b-egir-n xan-s sadaq askar t’it’-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL time-SUPER.ESS boy-ERG walking.stick III-send-PST.UNW khan-GEN1 all army destroy-IMPR-QUOT
\l At this time, the boy sent his walking stick: "Destroy the king's entire army!"

\t ʕAnsa sadaq xanes askar bexurnosi dandi xan harizi oqno, dey sadaq xanłin, kidno deber yiča yoł, mi dey askar č’agu bodinäyƛin.
\m ʕansa sadaq xan-s askar b-exur-nosi dandi xan harizi oq-n di-s sadaq xanłi-n kid-n mi-r y-iči-a yoł mi di-s askar č’agu b-odi-näy-ƛin
\g walking.stick all khan-GEN1 army III-kill-ANT.CVB now khan request become-PST.UNW me-GEN1 all khanate-and daughter-and you-LAT II-be-INF be you me-GEN1 army alive III-do-CND.CVB-QUOT
\l After the walking stick had called the king's entire army, the king now requested: "My entire kingdom and my daughter will be yours, if you make my army alive again!"

\t Xizyogon žoyä ʕansan begirno xanes oz č’agun rodin, xande sadaq iduɣor begirno.
\m xizyogon uži-a ʕansa-n b-egir-n xan-s oz č’agu-n r-odi-n xan-de sadaq idu-ɣor b-egir-n
\g then boy-ERG walking.stick-TOP III-send-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 army alive-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.ESS together home-IN.ALL III-send-PST.UNW
\l Then the boy sent his walking stick, made the king's army alive again and sent them(?) home together with the king.

\t Hemedur miskinłiƛ’no, best’alłiƛ’no sisxoli eniwde aq’ˤiłno zawruni žoyä, xanno muk’ur oyn, nesis kidno yown, ixiw bertenno bodin.
\m hemedur miskin-łi-ƛ’-n best’alłi-ƛ’-n sisxoli eniw-de aq’ˤił-n zow-ru-ni uži-a xan-n muk’ur odi-n nesi-s kid-n y-ow-n ixiw berten-n b-odi-n
\g so poor-NMLZ-SUPER.ESS-TOP orphanhood-SUPER.ESS-and alone mother-APUD.ESS grow.up-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF boy-ERG khan-TOP persuade do-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter-TOP II-marry-PFV.CVB big marriage-TOP III-do-PST.UNW
\l That's how the boy who grew up in poverty and orphanhood by his single mother persuaded the king, married his daughter and prepared a big marriage.

\t Žeda žedudäɣorgon eniwn yown paraxat bercinłiƛ’ bičix zown.
\m žedu-a žedu-däɣor-gon eniw-n y-ow-n paraxat bercinłi-ƛ’ b-iči-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.VERS-CNTR mother-TOP II-bring-PFV.CVB calmly beauty-SUPER.ESS I.PL-live-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They brought the mother to themselves and lead a beautiful and calm life.

\t Amma nesi žoyä xanłi risnoanu.
\m amma nesi uži-a xanłi r-is-n-anu
\g but DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG khanship IV-take-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l But the boy didn't take up the kingship.

\t Zownƛax zownanuƛax ʕelmu t’et’räsi Maħamaƛin ci yołäsi sida ʕaƛa žek’u.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax ʕelmu t’et’r-asi Maħama-ƛin ci yoł-asi sida ʕaƛ-a žek’u
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT science learn-RES.PRT Magomed-QUOT name be-RES.PRT one.OBL village-IN.ESS man
\l Once upon a time there was a man learned in sciences in a village, whose name was Magomed.

\t Q’ʷarʕelyoƛ’ sida ʕaƛaɣorno ik’in, xizor utin nexƛ’oräy, nesił dandir nesistow ʕaƛasi Aħmadƛin sis ʕoloqanaw uži keze oqno.
\m q’ʷarʕel-ƛ’ sida ʕaƛ-aɣor-n ik’i-n xizor uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy nesi-ł dandir nesi-s-tow ʕaƛ-asi Aħmad-ƛin sis ʕoloqanaw uži keze oq-n
\g need-SUPER.ESS one.OBL village-IN.VERS-TOP go-PFV.CVB back return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS towards DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH village-RES.PRT Akhmed-QUOT one young boy meet become-PST.UNW
\l When he went to a village out of need and came back, he met a young boy named Akhmed from his village.

\t Q’ˤanon sadaq ʕaƛaɣor nexxo zown.
\m q’ˤano-n sadaq ʕaƛ-aɣor nex-x zow-n
\g two-TOP together village-IN.VERS come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The two went to the village together.

\t Zamanałäy, Maħama hunix akiłnosi, q’ˤida ičin.
\m zaman-łay Maħama huni-x akił-nosi q’ˤida iči-n
\g time-CONT.ABL Magomed way-AD.ESS get.tired-ANT.CVB down sit-PST.UNW
\l After a while, Magomed got tired on his way and sat down.

\t Aħmadä ečruni žek’uqor eƛin, howt’o deber q’ˤida iča kokoru qˤiƛci riqixyołiƛin.
\m Aħmad-a ečru-ni žek’u-qor eƛi-n howt’o mi-r q’ˤida iči-a kokoru qˤiƛci r-iqi-x-yołi-ƛin
\g Akhmed-ERG old-DEF man-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW here you-LAT down sit-INF soft pillow IV-get-PRS-COND.IRR-QUOT
\l Akhmed said to the old man: "If we only could get you a soft pillow to sit down here..."

\t Elayn bizin, q’ˤanon boqno hunix ʕaƛaɣor.
\m ele-ay-n b-izi-n q’ˤano-n b-oq-n huni-x ʕaƛ-aɣor
\g there-IN.ABL-TOP I.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB two-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB way-AD.ESS village-IN.VERS
\l The two got up from there and on their way to the village.

\t Xizyogon Maħama akiłno q’ˤida bičinosi, Aħmadä eƛin, howt’o deber zowa gulu biqixyołiƛin.
\m xizyogon Maħama akił-n q’ˤida b-iči-nosi Aħmad-a eƛi-n howt’o mi-r zow-a gulu b-iqi-x-yołi-ƛin
\g again Magomed get.tired-PFV.CVB down I.PL-sit-ANT.CVB Akhmed-ERG say-PST.UNW here you-LAT ride-INF horse III-get-PRS-COND.IRR-QUOT
\l Again Magomed got tired and when they sat down, Akhmed said: "If we only could get a horse for you to ride on it..."

\t Mi šebi, hunizaxno dowƛer guluyä bičira betin.
\m mi šebi huni-bi-x-n mi-ƛer gulu-a b-ičir-a b-eti-n
\g you what way-PL-AD.ESS-TOP you-SUB.LAT horse-Q III-restrain-INF III-want-PST.UNW
\l "Why do you want to restrain a horse under you on the ways?

\t Mi ʕadalaw uži äsuƛin, Maħama nesiqor eƛin.
\m mi ʕadalaw uži esu-ƛin Maħama-a nesi-qor eƛi-n
\g you stupid boy exist-QUOT Magomed-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l You are a stupid boy.", Magomed said to him.

\t Xizyogon hunix bik’iƛ’orey, riƛu riƛix žek’u esun.
\m xizyogon huni-x b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy riƛu r-iƛi-x žek’u esu-n
\g again way-AD.ESS I.PL-go-SIM.CVB field IV-plough-IPFV.CVB man find-PST.UNW
\l When they got on their way again, they found a man ploughing a field.

\t Aħmadä riƛu riƛixozo žek’uq esirno, žiƛbosiyä, eƛ’isiyä yedu mi riƛu riƛixƛin.
\m Aħmad-a riƛu r-iƛi-xozo žek’u-q esir-n žiƛbo-si-a eƛ’i-si-a yedu mi riƛu r-iƛi-x-ƛin
\g Akhmed-ERG field IV-plough-PRS.PRT.OBL man-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW this.year-ATTR-Q last.year-ATTR-Q DEM2.IISG you field IV-plough-PRS-QUOT
\l Akhmed asked the man who was ploughing the field: "Are you ploughing this year's or last year's field?"

\t Riƛu riƛixoza eƛin, žiƛbosi riƛixƛin.
\m riƛu r-iƛi-xozo-a eƛi-n žiƛbo-si r-iƛi-x-ƛin
\g field IV-plough-PRS.PRT.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW this.year-ATTR IV-plough-PRS-QUOT
\l The plougher said: "I'm ploughing this year's."

\t Maħama žigon aƛ’in Aħmadqor, mi ʕabdal esunč’inäy eƛ’isi riƛu žiƛbo räƛiyäƛin.
\m Maħama-a žigon aƛ’i-n Aħmad-qor mi ʕabdal esu-č’i-näy eƛ’i-si riƛu žiƛbo r-iƛi-a-ƛin
\g Magomed-ERG again.now scold-PST.UNW Akhmed-POSS.LAT you fool exist-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB last.year-ATTR field this.year IV-plough-Q-QUOT
\l Again now Magomed scolded Akhmed: "If you weren't a fool, would you plough last year's field this year?"

\t ʕOloqanawni žoyä didiwkin nesir žawab teƛnoanu.
\m ʕoloqanaw-ni uži-a didiw-kin nesi-r žawab teƛ-n-anu
\g young-DEF boy-ERG which-even DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT answer give-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l The young boy didn't give him any answer.

\t ʕAƛoz raʕalłix äxuru žek’u šuša ižin bik’ix yizide dandir žamaʕatyos xalq’i c’oxno.
\m ʕaƛ-z raʕalłi-x exu-ru žek’u šuši-a iži-n b-ik’i-x yizi-de dandir žamaʕat-s xalq’i c’ox-n
\g village-GEN2 edge-AD.ESS die-PST.PRT man bury-INF carry-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-IPFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS towards population-GEN1 people meet-PST.UNW
\l At the edge of the village, some people from the population came toward them carrying a dead man to bury him.

\t Yiziqgon Aħmadä esirno žiƛboyä yeda, eƛ’iyä exasiƛin.
\m yizi-q-gon Aħmad-a esir-n žiƛbo-a yeda eƛ’i-a exu-asi-ƛin
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS-CNTR Akhmed-ERG ask-PST.UNW this.year-Q DEM2.ISG last.year-Q die-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l Akhmed asked them: "Has he died this year or last year?"

\t Yisir bexaru xabar aħyałer bik’ix zownanuƛin, Maħama p’es anusitow ičin.
\m yisi-r b-exur-ru xabar aħya-łer b-ik’i-x zow-n-anu-ƛin Maħama p’es anu-si-tow iči-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT I.PL-kill-PST.PRT story ear-CONT.LAT III-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT Magomed voice be.NEG-ATTR-EMPH wait-PST.UNW
\l "No matter what I say, he won't hear", Magomed [thought and] waited silently.

\t Idur aynosi, Maħama nesistow ʕoloqanawni kidbeqor eƛin, žaqˤuł ʕaƛaɣor nexƛ’oräy, där Aħmad keze oqsi.
\m idu-r ay-nosi Maħama-a nesi-s-tow ʕoloqanaw-ni kid-qor eƛi-n žaqˤuł ʕaƛ-aɣor nex-ƛ’oräy di-r Aħmad keze oq-s
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB Magomed-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH young-DEF daughter-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW today village-IN.VERS come-SIM.CVB me-LAT Akhmed meet become-PST.WIT
\l When he came home, Magomed said to his young daughter: "Today, when I came into the village, I met Akhmed.

\t Akiłno q’ˤida di ičinosi, nesä howt’o deber kokoru qˤiƛci riqixyołiƛin eƛis.
\m akił-n q’ˤida di iči-nosi nesi-a howt’o mi-r kokoru qˤiƛci r-iqi-x-yołi-ƛin eƛi-s
\g get.tired-PFV.CVB down me sit-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG here you-LAT soft pillow IV-get-PRS-COND.IRR-QUOT say-PST.WIT
\l When I got tired and sat down, he said: "If we only could get you a soft pillow to sit down here..."

\t Kidbä eƛin, nesis xabar bit’araw yołƛin.
\m kid-a eƛi-n nesi-s xabar bit’araw yoł-ƛin
\g daughter-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 story true be-QUOT
\l The daughter said: "What he said, is true."

\t Q’ˤogce bix eqersiyołi, q’ˤida äčiza kokoru qˤiƛci roqxosiƛin.
\m q’ˤog-ce bix eqer-s-yołi q’ˤida iči-za kokoru qˤiƛci r-oq-xosi-ƛin
\g hay.bale-EQU1 hay put-PST.WIT-COND.IRR down sit-LCV soft pillow IV-become-PRS.PRT-QUOT
\l If one had put a bale of hay to where one sits, it would become a soft pillow.

\t Xizyogon q’ˤida bäčiza nesä eƛisƛin, esin babiya, howt’o deber zowanix bigu gulu biqixyołiƛin.
\m xizyogon q’ˤida b-iči-za nesi-a eƛi-s-ƛin esi-n babi-a howt’o mi-r zow-ani-x b-igu gulu b-iqi-x-yołi-ƛin
\g then down I.PL-sit-LCV DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.WIT-QUOT tell-PST.UNW dad-ERG here you-LAT ride-MSD-AD.ESS III-good horse III-get-PRS-COND.IRR-QUOT
\l "Then he said, where we were sitting:" said the father, "'If we only could get a horse for you to ride on it...'."

\t Žan nesis bit’araw yołƛin, eƛin kidbä, dowqor beč’no bigu hibo neƛsiyołi, nełan ʕuraw bigu kumak badiƛin.
\m ža-n nesi-s bit’araw yoł-ƛin eƛi-n kid-a mi-qor b-eč’-n b-igu hibo neƛ-s-yołi neła-a-n ʕuraw b-igu kumak b-odi-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 true be-QUOT say-PST.UNW daughter-ERG you-POSS.LAT III-cut-PFV.CVB III-good stick give-PST.WIT-COND.IRR DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-TOP very III-good help III-do-QUOT
\l "That of him is true," said the girl, "if he carved a good cane and gave it to you, it would have been a good help."

\t Elur hunix riƛu riƛix žek’u esus.
\m elu-r huni-x riƛu r-iƛi-x žek’u esu-s
\g we(I).OBL-LAT way-AD.ESS field IV-plough-IPFV.CVB man find-PST.WIT
\l "On the way we found a man ploughing a field.

\t Aħmadä esirsiƛin nesiq, esin babiya, eƛ’isiyä, žiƛbosiyä yedu riƛu riƛixƛin.
\m Aħmad-a esir-s-ƛin nesi-q esi-n babi-a eƛ’i-si-a žiƛbo-si-a yedu riƛu r-iƛi-x-ƛin
\g Akhmed-ERG ask-PST.WIT-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW dad-ERG last.year-ATTR-Q this.year-ATTR-Q DEM2.IISG field IV-plough-PRS-QUOT
\l Akhmed asked him," said the father, "if he was ploughing last year's or this year's field."

\t Kidbä eƛin, žan nesis ruyxor yołƛin.
\m kid-a eƛi-n ža-n nesi-s r-uyxor yoł-ƛin
\g daughter-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.SG-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 IV-true be-QUOT
\l His daughter said: "That of him is true."

\t Eƛ’isi riƛu žek’us žiƛbosi q’ˤimes ričixosiƛin.
\m eƛ’i-si riƛu žek’u-s žiƛbo-si q’ˤim-s r-iči-xosi-ƛin
\g last.year-ATTR field man-GEN1 this.year-ATTR oneself-GEN1 IV-be-PRS.PRT-QUOT
\l "Last year's field was someone else's, this year's field is his own."

\t ʕAƛoz raʕalłixorgon baynosiƛin, eƛin babiya, elude dandir šuša žek’u ižin bik’ixozo xalq’imoqgon Aħmadä esirsi, eƛ’iyä yeda žek’u exasi, yagi žiƛboyäƛin.
\m ʕaƛ-z raʕalłi-xor-gon b-ay-nosi-ƛin eƛi-n babi-a elu-de dandir šuši-a žek’u iži-n b-ik’i-xozo xalq’i-q-gon Aħmad-a esir-s eƛ’i-a yeda žek’u exu-asi yagi žiƛbo-a-ƛin
\g village-GEN2 edge-AD.LAT-CNTR I.PL-come-ANT.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW dad-ERG we(I).OBL-APUD.ESS towards bury-INF man carry-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PRS.PRT.OBL people-POSS.ESS-CNTR Akhmed-ERG ask-PST.WIT last.year-Q DEM2.ISG man die-RES.PRT or this.year-Q-QUOT
\l "When we came to the edge of the village," said the father, "Akhmed asked the people that were coming towards us carrying a man to bury him: 'Has this man died last year or this year?'."

\t Žan bit’araw yoł nesisƛin, eƛin kidbä.
\m ža-n bit’araw yoł nesi-s-ƛin eƛi-n kid-a
\g DEM1.SG-TOP true be DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-QUOT say-PST.UNW daughter-ERG
\l "That of him is true.", said his daughter.

\t Nełas maʕna boqxo, kinawnigi maʕišatno bižinä, yagi siskin šebin rižinč’eyä ik’ixƛin.
\m neła-s maʕna b-oq-x kinawnigi maʕišat-n b-iži-n-a yagi siskin šebin r-iži-č’ey-a ik’i-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 sense III-become-IPFV.CVB entire fortune-TOP III-take.out-PFV.CVB-Q or any thing IV-take.out-NEG.PST.CVB-Q go-PRS-QUOT
\l "That means, that he either went to take all the fortune, or that he didn't take any other things."

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, Maħama kidbeqor eƛin, akrošaw magalun bižo, yik’in nesiqor eƛo, asno eräsi yoł, bucin žäd bic’äsianuƛin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin Maħama-a kid-qor eƛi-n akri-šaw magalu-n b-iži-o y-ik’i-n nesi-qor eƛi-o as-n er-asi yoł buci-n žäd b-ic’-asi-anu-ƛin
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT Magomed-ERG daughter-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW cheese-ATTR bread-TOP III-take.out-IMPR II-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-IMPR fog-TOP put-RES.PRT be moon-TOP still III-fill-RES.PRT-NEG-QUOT
\l "If that is the case," Magomed said to his daughter, "take this cheese bread, go and say to him: ''Fog has come up, and the moon is still not full."

\t Kidbä akrošaw magalun bižin, Aħmaddäɣorno yik’in, babiya äsiru xabarno nesiq esin.
\m kid-a akri-šaw magalu-n b-iži-n Aħmad-däɣor-n y-ik’i-n babi-a esi-ru xabar-n nesi-q esi-n
\g daughter-ERG cheese-ATTR bread-TOP III-take.out-PFV.CVB Akhmed-APUD.VERS-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB dad-ERG tell-PST.PRT story-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW
\l The daughter took the cheese bread, went to Akhmed and told him what her father told her.

\t Aħmadägon boƛƛik’u magalun bac’no eƛin, asno rocasi yoł, bucin bic’äsi yołƛin.
\m Aħmad-a-gon b-oƛƛik’u magalu-n b-ac’-n eƛi-n as-n r-ocu-asi yoł buci-n b-ic’-asi yoł-ƛin
\g Akhmed-ERG-CNTR III-half bread-TOP III-eat-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW fog-TOP IV-become.clean-RES.PRT be moon-TOP III-fill-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l Akhmed ate half of the bread and said: "The fog has become clean and the moon has become full."

\t Nesis xabar kidbä babiwq esinosi, yeda däƛ’ay ʕilmu t’et’räsi ʕalim žek’u äsuƛin, Maħama Aħmadxo kidno yegirno, ixiw bertenno bodin.
\m nesi-s xabar kid-a babiw-q esi-nosi yeda di-ƛ’ay ʕelmu t’et’r-asi ʕalim žek’u esu-ƛin Maħama-a Aħmad-x kid-n y-egir-n ixiw berten-n b-odi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 story girl-ERG father-POSS.ESS tell-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG me-SUPER.ABL science learn-RES.PRT trained man exist-QUOT Magomed-ERG Akhmed-AD.ESS daughter-TOP II-send-PFV.CVB big marriage-TOP III-do-PST.UNW
\l When the girl told her father what he said, Magomed said: "He is a better learned and trained man than I" and married his daughter of to Akhmed and prepared a big wedding.

\t Zownƛax zownanuƛax ɣudes bełiƛ’ aħnayxosi sis bełiqan.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax ɣudes bełi-ƛ’ aħnad-xosi sis bełiqan
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT daily hunting-SUPER.ESS walk.around-PRS.PRT one hunter
\l Once upon a time there was a hunter who went on a hunt every day.

\t Sida quł ciqzaq naysinan aħna-ik’in, bełin biqinč’ey yeda xizor utin nexxo zown.
\m sida qu-ł ciq-bi-q naysinan aħna~ik’i-n bełi-n b-iqi-č’ey yeda xizor uti-n nex-x zow-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS forest-PL-POSS.ESS everywhere walk.for.a.while-PFV.CVB deer-TOP III-get-NEG.PST.CVB DEM2.ISG back return-PFV.CVB come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l One day he walked through the forests everywhere for a while, and not getting any prey, was coming back.

\t Ciqez č’imä sida osiw ɣunƛ’o ƛ’iri bičäsi yisir cey bukayn.
\m ciq-z č’imu-a sida osiw ɣun-ƛ’ ƛ’iri b-iči-asi yisi-r cey b-ukad-n
\g forest-GEN2 corner-IN.ESS one.OBL high tree-SUPER.ESS on III-sit-RES.PRT DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT eagle III-see-PST.UNW
\l At the edge of the forest he saw an eagle sitting on a high tree.

\t Yedukin bexurinč’ey xecač’inƛin, bełiqanä nełƛ’aɣor c’eruc’a rutirno.
\m yedu-kin b-exur-č’ey xeci-ač’in-ƛin bełiqan-a neła-ƛ’aɣor c’eruc’a r-utir-n
\g DEM2.IISG-even III-kill-NEG.PST.CVB leave-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT hunter-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS bow IV-turn-PST.UNW
\l "I won't leave without killing him", the hunter [thought and] turned his bow unto it.

\t Ceyä eƛin, mi di bexarno, xizyo di nagon boqłin debez rigzar bäsu, mežustow kici yoł, radiru rigłi šuƛ’ixosi anuƛin.
\m cey-a eƛi-n mi di b-exur-n xizyo di na-gon b-oq-łin mi-z r-ig-za-r b-esu mežu-s-tow kici yoł r-odi-ru r-ig-łi šuƛ’i-xosi anu-ƛin
\g eagle-ERG say-PST.UNW you me III-kill-PROHIB afterwards me where-CNTR III-become-CNC.CVB you-GEN2 IV-good-ZA-LAT III-exist you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1-EMPH proverb be IV-do-PST.PRT IV-good-NMLZ forget-PRS.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l The eagle said: "Don't kill me! I'll will be a help for you somewhere; you have a proverb: 'A done good is not forgotten'."

\t Bełiqanä iduɣor bižin kikin ža cey.
\m bełiqan-a idu-ɣor b-iži-n kiki-n ža cey
\g hunter-ERG home-IN.ALL III-carry-PFV.CVB feed-PST.UNW DEM1.SG eagle
\l The hunter carried the eagle home and fed it.

\t Ɣunoxor baynosi, osaxorno bizin cey ƛ’iräy ƛ’iyor tupäsi hil biłen nexno ɣunoł c’oxno.
\m ɣun-xor b-ay-nosi osa-xor-n b-izi-n cey ƛ’iräy ƛ’iyor tupi-a-si hil b-iłe-n nex-n ɣun-ł c’ox-n
\g tree-AD.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB height-AD.LAT-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB eagle from.above downwards rifle-IN.ESS-ATTR bullet III-as-TOP come-PFV.CVB tree-CONT.ESS pounce-PST.UNW
\l When they came to the tree, the eagle got up into the height, came downwards from above like a gun's bullet and pounced on the tree.

\t Bełiqanä cey idun bičirno sidagon anƛ’ima kikin.
\m bełiqan-a cey idu-n b-ičir-n sida-gon anƛ’i-a kiki-n
\g hunter-ERG eagle home-TOP III-restrain-PFV.CVB one.OBL-CNTR week-IN.ESS feed-PST.UNW
\l The hunter kept the eagle at home and fed it for another week.

\t Xizyogon žedu hemełatow ɣunoxor bik’in.
\m xizyogon žedu hemeła-tow ɣun-xor b-ik’i-n
\g again DEM1.IPL DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH tree-AD.LAT I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l Then they went to that tree again.

\t Osaxor hawaƛ’orno bizin, tupäsi hil biłe wˤałerno nexno bik’in ɣunoq c’oxno.
\m osa-xor hawa-ƛ’or-n b-izi-n tupi-a-si hil b-iłe wˤał-r-n nex-n b-ik’i-n ɣun-q c’ox-n
\g height-AD.LAT air-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB rifle-IN.ESS-ATTR bullet III-as downward-LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB tree-POSS.ESS pounce-PST.UNW
\l It got up into the height through the air, and came down like a gun's bullet again and pounced on the tree.

\t Žigoƛ’ay ɣun q’ˤunader č’ˤaƛiłno roƛƛi regin.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay ɣun q’ˤuna-der č’ˤaƛił-n r-oƛƛi r-egi-n
\g now-SUPER.ABL tree two.OBL-APUD.LAT be.cut-PFV.CVB IV-middle IV-break.apart-PST.UNW
\l This time the tree broke apart into two halves.

\t Ceyä eƛin, howži däłer ħal bays, mi däƛ’ ƛ’iri zowƛin.
\m cey-a eƛi-n howži di-łer ħal b-ay-s mi di-ƛ’ ƛ’iri zow-ƛin
\g eagle-ERG say-PST.UNW now me-CONT.LAT strength III-come-PST.WIT you me-SUPER.ESS on ride-QUOT
\l The eagle said: "Now my strength has come back to me; ride on me!"

\t K’ox äƛirugon bełiqu ƛ’irin zowerno, cey raładyoƛ’aza boržizi boqno.
\m k’ox äƛiru-gon bełiqu ƛ’iri-n zowr-n cey raład-ƛ’aza boržizi b-oq-n
\g twice ORD-CNTR hunter above-TOP seat-PFV.CVB eagle sea-SUPER.VERS.DIST flight III-become-PST.UNW
\l A second time the eagle seated the hunter above and flew towards the sea.

\t ʕUƛ’iyä miƛin, ceyä yisiq esirno.
\m ˤuƛ’-ya mi-ƛin cey-a yisi-q esir-n
\g be.afraid-PST.WIT.Q you-QUOT eagle-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l "Where you afraid?", asked him the eagle.

\t Wallah, ʕuƛ’siƛin, yisä žawab teƛno.
\m wallah ˤuƛ’-s-ƛin yisi-a žawab teƛ-n
\g wallah be.afraid-PST.WIT-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "By God, I was afraid!", he answered.

\t Hemedurtow din bˤuƛ’si, mi däƛ’or c’eruc’a rutirnosiƛin, eƛin ceyä.
\m hemedur-tow di-n b-ˤuƛ’-s mi di-ƛ’or c’eruc’a r-utir-nosi-ƛin eƛi-n cey-a
\g so-EMPH me-TOP III-be.afraid-PST.WIT you me-SUPER.LAT bow IV-turn-ANT.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW eagle-ERG
\l "I was afraid likewise, when you turned the bow unto me.", said the eagle.

\t Elay xizor butin nexƛ’oräy, ceyä esirno, deber siskin šebin rukayxaƛin.
\m ele-ay xizor b-uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy cey-a esir-n mi-r siskin šebin r-ukad-x-a-ƛin
\g there-IN.ABL back I.PL-return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB eagle-ERG ask-PST.UNW you-LAT any thing IV-see-PRS-Q-QUOT
\l When they were coming back from there, the eagle asked: "Do you see anything?"

\t Sis gut’ riłe šebin rukayxƛin, eƛin bełiqanä.
\m sis gut’ r-iłe šebin r-ukad-x-ƛin eƛi-n bełiqan-a
\g one smoke IV-as thing IV-see-PRS-QUOT say-PST.UNW hunter-ERG
\l "I see something like smoke.", said the hunter.

\t Elo dey beže esiw yoł, neła debeq esär, esiw xʷasar badirus šebi deber di neƛanƛin.
\m elo di-s b-eže esiw yoł neła-a mi-q esir esiw xʷasar b-odi-ru-s šebi mi-r di neƛ-an-ƛin
\g there me-GEN1 III-old brother be DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you-POSS.ESS ask brother rescue III-do-PST.PRT-GEN1 what you-LAT me give-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l "There is my elder brother, he will ask you: 'What shall I give to you for saving my brother?'

\t Mi eƛo, ža čanta taraw, q’ˤuya šebin där retinanu, q’ˤuya sayɣat di bäsinč’iƛin.
\m mi eƛi-o ža čanta taraw q’ˤuya šebin di-r r-eti-n-anu q’ˤuya sayɣat di b-is-č’i-ƛin
\g you say-IMPR DEM1.SG pocket except.for other thing me-LAT IV-want-PFV.CVB-NEG other present me III-take-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l You have to say: 'I don't want any other thing than this pocket, another present I won't take.'"

\t Yiziri gut’ zawru mečoƛ’or bayn.
\m yiziri gut’ zow-ru moči-ƛ’or b-ay-n
\g DEM2.IPL smoke be.NPRS-PST.PRT place-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l They came to the place where the smoke was.

\t Maħaza bełiqun xecin, ža cey tełxor bik’in.
\m ma-xaza bełiqu-n xeci-n ža cey teł-xor b-ik’i-n
\g outside-AD.VERS.DIST hunter-TOP leave-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG eagle inside-AD.LAT III-go-PST.UNW
\l The eagle left the hunter outside and went inside.

\t Teł zawru ceyä yiłaq esirno, yedu insanes maħ nay mi t’or bowäƛin.
\m teł zow-ru cey-a yiła-q esir-n yedu insan-s maħ nay mi t’o-r b-ow-a-ƛin
\g inside be.NPRS-PST.PRT eagle-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG human-GEN1 smell from.where you here-LAT III-bring-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The eagle that was inside asked him: "Where did you bring that human smell from?"

\t Yiła esin, bełiqa di iduɣorno bižin, kikin saɣ boysƛin.
\m yiła-a esi-n bełiqu-a di idu-ɣor-n b-iži-n kiki-n saɣ b-odi-s-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG tell-PST.UNW hunter-ERG me home-IN.ALL-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB feed-PFV.CVB cure III-do-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l He told [him]: "A hunter led me to his home, fed and cured me."

\t Nedur resunäy, ža tełxor goƛ’oƛin, eƛin beženi esiya.
\m nedur r-esu-näy ža teł-xor goƛ’i-o-ƛin eƛi-n b-eže-ni esyu-a
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB DEM1.SG inside-AD.LAT invite-IMPR-QUOT say-PST.UNW III-old-DEF brother-ERG
\l "If that's the case, invite him inside!", said the older brother.

\t Bełiqa eƛin, eloša ƛ’iri iƛ’u yołäsi čanta neƛ där, dowqay di q’ˤuya šebin räsič’iƛin.
\m bełiqu-a eƛi-n eloša ƛ’iri iƛ’u yoł-asi čanta neƛ di-r mi-qay di q’ˤuya šebin r-is-č’i-ƛin
\g hunter-ERG say-PST.UNW there above lid be-RES.PRT pocket give me-LAT you-POSS.ABL me other thing IV-take-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l The hunter said: "Give me the pocket with the lid above, there; I won't take any other thing from you."

\t Rigu ƛirbałin rodin, ža čantan saɣyatyos teƛno, ceyä bełiqan hunix egirno, neła čantaƛ’osi iƛ’u idur ayzaƛ’or yizärnoƛin.
\m r-igu ƛirbałi-n r-odi-n ža čanta-n saɣyat-s teƛ-n cey-a bełiqan huni-x egir-n neła-a čanta-ƛ’-si iƛ’u idu-r ay-zaƛ’or y-izir-n-ƛin
\g IV-good hospitality-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG pocket-TOP present-GEN1 give-PFV.CVB eagle-ERG hunter way-AD.ESS send-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG pocket-SUPER.ESS-ATTR lid home-LAT come-POST.CVB II-lift-PROHIB-QUOT
\l Being a good host, the eagle gave the pocket as a present and sent the hunter on his way [saying]: "Don't lift the pocket's lid before you came home!"

\t Nesä xʷasar badiruni ceyä, neła nełaƛ’no zowerno, yeda raładno xecin bitaɣor oɣno.
\m nesi-a xʷasar b-odi-ru-ni cey-a neła-a neła-ƛ’-n zowr-n yeda raład-n xeci-n bita-aɣor oɣ-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG rescue III-do-PST.PRT-DEF eagle-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP seat-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG sea-TOP leave-PFV.CVB distance-IN.VERS take.away-PST.UNW
\l The eagle he had rescued seated him onto itself and leaving the sea took him away into the distance.

\t Elay bitor ik’iƛ’oräy akiłno, mekoyn bełiqus tatu łiyn.
\m ele-ay bitor ik’i-ƛ’oräy akił-n mekod-n bełiqu-s tatu łiy-n
\g there-IN.ABL thither go-SIM.CVB get.tired-PFV.CVB be.hungry-PFV.CVB hunter-GEN1 power end-PST.UNW
\l While he went away from there, he got tired and hungry and the hunter's power ended.

\t Yiła čantakin ana rac’anix šebinƛin, rok’ƛ’orno rayn, nełas iƛ’u yizirno.
\m yiła-a čanta-kin anu-a r-ac’-ani-x šebin-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n neła-s iƛ’u y-izir-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS pocket-even be.NEG-Q IV-eat-MSD-AD.ESS thing-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 lid II-lift-PST.UNW
\l "Isn't there anything to eat in this pocket?", he thought and lifted its lid.

\t Elo roqno sis ixiw bercinaw ɣˤutkun, sidadäza puƛ’aza bik’ixƛax ɣˤays iħu, sidadäzagon łäs iħu.
\m elo r-oq-n sis ixiw bercinaw ɣˤutku-n sida-däza pu-ƛ’aza b-ik’i-x-ƛax ɣˤay-s iħu sida-däza-gon łi-s iħu
\g there IV-become-PFV.CVB one big beautiful house-TOP one.OBL-APUD.VERS.DIST side-SUPER.VERS.DIST III-go-PRS-QUOT milk-GEN1 river one.OBL-APUD.VERS.DIST-CNTR water-GEN1 river
\l There came a big beautiful house into being, with a milk river flowing on the one side and a water river on the other.

\t Howži bełiqanes ʕuraw rok’un raq’ˤiłno, roda šebinon koƛ’inč’ey ƛexun yeda.
\m howži bełiqan-s ʕuraw rok’u-n r-aq’ˤił-n r-odi-a šebinon koƛ’i-č’ey ƛexu-n yeda
\g now hunter-GEN1 very heart-TOP IV-increase-PFV.CVB IV-do-INF something understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB remain-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG
\l Now the hunter got very upset and remained not knowing what to do.

\t Hemełƛ’o elo ƛ’irir sis eže žek’u ayn.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ elo ƛ’iri-r sis eže žek’u ay-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS there above-LAT one old man come-PST.UNW
\l Then there came an old man.

\t Hemece rigu ɣˤutkun ričin, łinaq mi q’ʷarid oqxoƛin, esirno eženä.
\m hemece r-igu ɣˤutku-n r-iči-n łina-q mi q’ʷarid oq-x-ƛin esir-n eže-ni-a
\g such IV-pretty house-TOP IV-be-PFV.CVB what.OBL-POSS.ESS you sadness become-PRS-QUOT ask-PST.UNW old-DEF-ERG
\l "That is such a pretty house, what are you so sad about?", asked the old one.

\t Bełiqa eƛin, däz madax yedu nediw ɣˤutku där roqa räti, didur eƛa riynč’ey howt’or rayza čantaƛ’osi iƛ’u yoɣełno yik’isƛin.
\m bełiqu-a eƛi-n di-z ma-x yedu nediw ɣˤutku di-r r-oq-a r-eti didur eƛi-a r-iy-č’ey howt’o-r r-ay-za čanta-ƛ’-si iƛ’u y-oɣ-ł-n y-ik’i-s-ƛin
\g hunter-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN2 yard-AD.ESS DEM2.IISG such house me-LAT IV-become-INF IV-want how say-INF IV-know-NEG.PST.CVB here-LAT IV-come-LCV pocket-SUPER.ESS-ATTR lid II-take.away-POT-PFV.CVB II-go-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The hunter said: "I would like such a house to be in my yard, but accidentally somehow the pocket's lid opened here where I came to and went away."

\t Qura ƛˤebaƛ’aza di äƛiru šebin neƛanix mi ƛ’iri risnäy, di yedu nasin šebin tełxor čantaɣor rutiranƛin, eƛin eženä.
\m qura ƛˤeb-ƛ’aza di eƛi-ru šebin neƛ-ani-x mi ƛ’iri r-is-näy di yedu nasin šebin teł-xor čanta-aɣor r-utir-an-ƛin eƛi-n eže-ni-a
\g twenty.OBL year-SUPER.VERS.DIST me say-PST.PRT thing give-MSD-AD.ESS you above IV-take-CND.CVB me DEM2.IISG all thing inside-AD.LAT pocket-IN.VERS IV-gather-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW old-DEF-ERG
\l "If you promise to give [me] after 20 years all the things I said, I will bring all the things into the inside of the pocket again.", said the old one.

\t Bełiqu nełaƛ’ razi oqno.
\m bełiqu neła-ƛ’ razi oq-n
\g hunter DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS agree become-PST.UNW
\l The hunter agreed on that.

\t Eženi žek’an ža nasin awal tełxor butirno.
\m eže-ni žek’u-a-n ža nasin awal teł-xor b-utir-n
\g old-DEF man-ERG-TOP DEM1.SG all house inside-AD.LAT III-gather-PST.UNW
\l And the old man brought all this structure inside.

\t Nesä nesiz ʕaƛar aynosi, ɣˤutkoz madax, q’ˤida čantan eqerno, bełiqanä nełaƛ’osi iƛ’u yizirnosi, elon hemediwtow ixiw ɣˤutku roqno.
\m nesi-a nesi-z ʕaƛ-ar ay-nosi ɣˤutku-z ma-x q’ˤida čanta-n eqer-n bełiqan-a neła-ƛ’-si iƛ’u y-izir-nosi elo-n hemediw-tow ixiw ɣˤutku r-oq-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 village-IN.LAT come-ANT.CVB house-GEN2 yard-AD.ESS down pocket-TOP put-PFV.CVB hunter-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-ATTR lid II-lift-ANT.CVB there-TOP such.a-EMPH big house IV-become-PST.UNW
\l After the hunter came into his own village, in his house's yard he put down the pocket, and when he lifted the lid on it, there came the exact same big house into being.

\t Sidadäza puƛ’aza ɣˤays iħu boƛixno, sidadäzagon łäs iħu boƛixno.
\m sida-däza pu-ƛ’aza ɣˤay-s iħu b-oƛix-n sida-däza-gon łi-s iħu b-oƛix-n
\g one.OBL-APUD.VERS.DIST side-SUPER.VERS.DIST milk-GEN1 river III-appear-PFV.CVB one.OBL-APUD.VERS.DIST-CNTR water-GEN1 river III-appear-PST.UNW
\l On the one side a milk river appeared, and on the other side a water river appeared.

\t Kʷaxatow bełiqanä barun yown, ƛˤeb ħišiłzaƛ’or žedur q’ˤuƛas q’ˤano uži odin.
\m kʷaxa-tow bełiqan-a baru-n y-ow-n ƛˤeb ħišił-zaƛ’or žedu-r q’ˤuƛa-s q’ˤano uži odi-n
\g soon-EMPH hunter-ERG wife-TOP II-marry-PFV.CVB year be.over-POST.CVB DEM1.IPL-LAT twin-GEN1 two son do-PST.UNW
\l Soon the hunter married a wife, and before a year was over, two twin boys were born to them.

\t Sideƛ’ Ħasanƛin, sideƛ’ Ħusenƛin cirabin cedin.
\m sida-ƛ’ Ħasan-ƛin sida-ƛ’ Ħusen-ƛin ci-bi-n cedi-n
\g one.OBL-SUPER.ESS Hassan-QUOT one.OBL-SUPER.ESS Hussein-QUOT name-PL-TOP name-PST.UNW
\l They named one Hassan, and one Hussein.

\t Qura ƛˤebaƛ’aza oƛixno k’oƛin ža ečruni žek’u, sis uži där neƛa ayƛin.
\m qura ƛˤeb-ƛ’aza oƛix-n k’oƛi-n ža ečru-ni žek’u sis uži di-r neƛ-a ay-ƛin
\g twenty.OBL year-SUPER.VERS.DIST appear-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG old-DEF man one son me-LAT give-INF must-QUOT
\l Twenty years later, the old man appeared [and said]: "One sone has to be given to me!"

\t Bełiqanän, baran eƛin, elusno q’ˤano gurow anu, q’ˤimes xexbi žek’ur teƛäłinč’iƛin.
\m bełiqan-a-n baru-a-n eƛi-n elu-s-n q’ˤano gurow anu q’ˤim-s xexbi žek’u-r teƛ-ł-č’i-ƛin
\g hunter-ERG-and wife-ERG-and say-PST.UNW we(I).OBL-GEN1-TOP two except be.absent oneself-GEN1 children man-LAT give-POT-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l The hunter and his wife said: "We have nothing except the two, we can't give our own children to some man!"

\t Xexłi bodin däł xizay uži egirƛin, eženi žek’u nesä nesiz hunix ik’in.
\m xexłi b-odi-n di-ł xizay uži egir-ƛin eže-ni žek’u nesi-a nesi-z huni-x ik’i-n
\g quickness III-do-PFV.CVB me-CONT.ESS behind son send-QUOT old-DEF man DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 way-AD.ESS go-PST.UNW
\l "Quickly, send your son after me!", [said] the old man and went on his way.

\t Užizar ža xabarno teqno, žedu daʕbałer begin, di ik’ixƛin Ħasan, ay di ik’ixƛin Ħusen.
\m uži-bi-r ža xabar-n teq-n žedu daʕba-łer b-egi-n di ik’i-x-ƛin Ħasan ay di ik’i-x-ƛin Ħusen
\g boy-PL-LAT DEM1.SG story-TOP hear-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL dispute-CONT.LAT I.PL-go.into-PST.UNW me go-PRS-QUOT Hassan must me go-PRS-QUOT Hussein
\l When the boys heard that, they started a dispute: "I am going!", said Hassan; "No, I am going!" said Hussein.

\t Xizaɣor Ħusen ežin, ža ik’inƛax nesi eženił xizay, yaraɣno bisno guluƛ’no zown.
\m xizaɣor Ħusen eži-n ža ik’i-n-ƛax nesi eže-ni-ł xizay yaraɣ-n b-is-n gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n
\g finally Hussein win-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG go-PFV.CVB-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL old-DEF-CONT.ESS behind weapon-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PST.UNW
\l Finally Hussein won [he will go, it's said???], he took a weapon, sat on a horse and followed the old one.

\t Yeda hunix ik’iƛ’oräy, yisir qˤaƛu teqno, mi nesi žek’uł xizay äk’ino, nesä mi exarƛin.
\m yeda huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy yisi-r qˤaƛu teq-n mi nesi žek’u-ł xizay ik’i-n nesi-a mi exur-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT shout hear-PST.UNW you DEM1.ISG.OBL man-CONT.ESS behind go-PROHIB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you kill-QUOT
\l While he was going on the way, he heard a shout: "Don't you go behind that man, he will kill you!"

\t Exurnäy exuroƛ, exunäy exuƛ, rätiru roqoƛƛin, eƛin Ħusenä, eženił xizay ik’inč’ey dey res anuƛin.
\m exur-näy exur-ƛ exu-näy exu-ƛ r-eti-ru r-oq-ƛ-ƛin eƛi-n Ħusen-a eže-ni-ł xizay ik’i-č’ey di-s res anu-ƛin
\g kill-CND.CVB kill-OPT die-CND.CVB die-OPT IV-want-PST.PRT IV-become-OPT-QUOT say-PFV.CVB Hussein-ERG old-DEF-CONT.ESS behind go-NEG.PST.CVB me-GEN1 possibility be.NEG-QUOT
\l "If he kills me, he shall kill me; if I die, I shall die; may it happen whatever wants to.", said Hussein and followed the old man, "I don't have the possibility not to go."

\t Xizyogon hemediwtow roži yołäsi qˤaƛu teqno yisir, eženiz mada reže ɣun yoł, nesä mi ža ɣun reč’anix egär.
\m xizyogon hemediw-tow roži yoł-asi qˤaƛu teq-n yisi-r eže-ni-z ma-a r-eže ɣun yoł nesi-a mi ža ɣun r-eč’-ani-x egir
\g then such.a-EMPH word be-RES.PRT shout hear-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT old-DEF-GEN2 yard-IN.ESS IV-big tree be DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you DEM1.SG tree IV-cut-MSD-AD.ESS send
\l Then he heard a shout from the same voice: "In the old man's yard is a big tree, he will send you to chop that tree down.

\t Mi nesiqor eƛo, sosi mitow reč’oƛin.
\m mi nesi-qor eƛi-o sosi mi-tow r-eč’-o-ƛin
\g you DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-IMPR at.first you-EMPH IV-cut-IMPR-QUOT
\l Say to him: 'You chop first!'

\t Xizyogon nesä äƛi, magalu ešadƛin, mi žan ešayn, yałi nesä mi ħoyä tełer karƛin.
\m xizyogon nesi-a eƛi magalu ešad-ƛin mi ža-n ešad-n yałi nesi-a mi ħo-a tełer kur-ƛin
\g then DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say bread bake-QUOT you DEM1.SG-TOP bake-PFV.CVB else DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you oven-IN.ESS into throw-QUOT
\l Then he will say: 'Bake bread!', and when you don't bake the bread, he will throw you into the oven."

\t Xizyo magalu boɣa ža oqƛ’oräy, ħaƛin tełxor kuroƛin, mołin nesiq neła qˤaƛumo.
\m xizyo magalu b-oɣ-a ža oq-ƛ’oräy ħaƛi-n teł-xor kur-o-ƛin mołi-n nesi-q neła qˤaƛu-mo
\g afterwards bread III-take.away-INF DEM1.SG begin-SIM.CVB push-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT throw-IMPR-QUOT teach-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL shout-ERG
\l Afterwards, while he is starting to take out the bread, push him inside!", taught him that voice.

\t Ħusen eženis ɣˤutkoxor ayn.
\m Ħusen eže-ni-s ɣˤutku-xor ay-n
\g Hussein old-DEF-GEN1 house-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Hussein came to the old man's house.

\t Nesä yisiqor eƛin, enda ɣun reč’oƛin.
\m nesi-a yisi-qor eƛi-n enda ɣun r-eč’-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM3b.SG tree IV-cut-IMPR-QUOT
\l He said to him: "Chop down that tree!"

\t Didur ža reč’xosi där riyxanu, sosi mitow reč’oƛin, eƛin Ħusenä nesiqor.
\m didur ža r-eč’-xosi di-r r-iy-x-anu sosi mi-tow r-eč’-o-ƛin eƛi-n Ħusen-a nesi-qor
\g how DEM1.SG IV-cut-PRS.PRT me-LAT IV-know-IPFV.CVB-NEG at.first you-EMPH IV-cut-IMPR-QUOT say-PST.UNW Hussein-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l "I don't know how to chop it down, you chop first!", said Hussein to him.

\t Xizyo nesi eženä reč’no ža ɣun.
\m xizyo nesi eže-ni-a r-eč’-n ža ɣun
\g afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL old-DEF-ERG IV-cut-PST.UNW DEM1.SG tree
\l Afterwards the old man chopped down that tree.

\t Qacan č’ˤaƛin, c’in erno eƛin eženä Ħusenqor, howži mi magalu bodoƛin.
\m qaca-n č’ˤaƛi-n c’i-n er-n eƛi-n eže-ni-a Ħusen-qor howži mi magalu b-odi-o-ƛin
\g firewood-TOP split-PFV.CVB fire-TOP put-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW old-DEF-ERG Hussein-POSS.LAT now you bread III-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l "Split firewood, put on a fire," said the old man to Hussein, "and then make bread!"

\t Magalun boynanu yisä.
\m magalu-n b-odi-n-anu yisi-a
\g bread-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l He also didn't make the bread.

\t Ħoyäy magalu boɣoƛin Ħusenqor eƛinosi, mi bukarƛin ičin Ħusen.
\m ħo-ay magalu b-oɣ-o-ƛin Ħusen-qor eƛi-nosi mi b-ukar-ƛin iči-n Ħusen
\g oven-IN.ABL bread III-take.away-IMPR-QUOT Hussein-POSS.LAT say-ANT.CVB you III-show-QUOT wait-PST.UNW Hussein
\l When he said to Hussein: "Take the bread out of the oven!", Hussein waited [saying]: "You show me!"

\t Magalu boɣanixƛin eženi žek’a ħoyäɣor reƛ’a regirnosi, Ħusenä yeda q’ˤiƛin tełxor kurno.
\m magalu b-oɣ-ani-x-ƛin eže-ni žek’u-a ħo-aɣor reƛ’a r-egir-nosi Ħusen-a yeda q’ˤiƛi-n teł-xor kur-n
\g bread III-take.away-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT old-DEF man-ERG oven-IN.VERS hand IV-let-ANT.CVB Hussein-ERG DEM2.ISG push-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT throw-PST.UNW
\l When the old man let his hand into the oven in order to pull out the bread, Hussein pushed him inside.

\t Di t’ay oɣoƛin eženi qˤaƛanayłin, aħyakin kurinč’ey, nesä nesiz guluƛ’no zown, oqno iduɣor ik’in.
\m di t’ay oɣ-o-ƛin eže-ni qˤaƛanad-łin aħya-kin kur-č’ey nesi-a nesi-z gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n oq-n idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g me from.here take.away-IMPR-QUOT old-DEF yell-CNC.CVB ear-even spread.out-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l Although the old man yelled: "Take me out of here!", he didn't even listen, sat upon his own horse and went home.

\t Hemełaƛ’ay soder bełiqanes haq’u paraq’at zown.
\m hemeła-ƛ’ay soder bełiqan-s haq’u paraq’at zow-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after hunter-GEN1 family calmly be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After that, the hunter's family lived peacefully.

\t K’uruč’, k’eč’ ɣudi rocu buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Žedur xexbi rodix zownanu.
\m žedu-r xexbi r-odi-x zow-n-anu
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT children IV-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l They didn't get any children.

\t Sida quł ciqqo yałzay, xedyoder eže žek’un ayn, esirno, šebi deber roqno, šida mi q’ʷarid oqnoƛin.
\m sida qu-ł ciq-q yoł-zay xediw-der eže žek’u-n ay-n esir-n šebi mi-r r-oq-n šida mi q’ʷarid oq-n-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS forest-POSS.ESS be-SIM.CVB husband-APUD.LAT old man-TOP come-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW what you-LAT IV-happen-PFV.CVB why you sadness become-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l One day, while being in the forest, and old man came to the husband and asked him: "What happened to you, why are you so sad?"

\t Ruyxor esinäy, elur xexbi rodixanu.
\m r-uyxor esi-näy elu-r xexbi r-odi-x-anu
\g IV-true tell-CND.CVB we(I).OBL-LAT children IV-do-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l "To tell you the truth, we don't get any children.

\t Nełƛ’aza di aq’ˤu pikrazał ƛexux roda šebin koƛ’inč’eyƛin, žawab teƛno xedya.
\m neła-ƛ’aza di aq’ˤu pikru-bi-ł ƛexu-x r-odi-a šebin koƛ’i-č’ey-ƛin žawab teƛ-n xediw-a
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS.DIST me much idea-PL-CONT.ESS remain-IPFV.CVB IV-do-INF thing understand.to-NEG.PST.UNW-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW husband-ERG
\l Because of this, I - remaining very thoughtful - don't know what to do.", answered the husband.

\t Sis di äƛiru rodinäy, mežur xexbi boda yołƛin, eƛin nesi eženi žek’a.
\m sis di eƛi-ru r-odi-näy mežu-r xexbi b-odi-a yoł-ƛin eƛi-n nesi eže-ni žek’u-a
\g one me say-PST.PRT III.PL-do-CND.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-LAT children I.PL-do-INF be-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL old-DEF man-ERG
\l "If you do what I say, you will get children.", said the old man.

\t Xexbi rodinäy, mi äƛiru din rodanƛin, xediyan roži teƛno.
\m xexbi r-odi-näy mi eƛi-ru di-n r-odi-an-ƛin xediw-a-n roži teƛ-n
\g children III.PL-do-CND.CVB you say-PST.PRT me-TOP IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT husband-ERG-TOP word give-PST.UNW
\l The husband gave his word: "If we get children, I'll do what you say."

\t Xizyo nesi eženä boƛik’no xedyoqor q’ˤano heneš teƛno, sis nesir, sideni baruq bac’roƛinno eƛin, ozƛäy gugin.
\m xizyo nesi eže-ni-a b-oƛik’-n xediw-qor q’ˤano heneš teƛ-n sis nesi-r sideni baru-q b-ac’-r-o-ƛin-n eƛi-n ozuri-ƛay gugi-n
\g afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL old-DEF-ERG III-pull.out-PFV.CVB husband-POSS.LAT two apple give-PFV.CVB one DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT the.other.one wife-POSS.ESS III-eat-CAUS-IMPR-QUOT-TOP say-PST.UNW eye-SUB.ABL escape-PST.UNW
\l Then that old man pulled out two apples and gave them to the husband, one for him; "Give your wife the other one to eat!", he said and disappeared from his eyes.

\t Boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow žedur q’ˤanon užibi bodin.
\m b-oƛƛo b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow žedu-r q’ˤano-n uži-bi b-odi-n
\g III-middle III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT two-TOP son-PL I.PL-do-PST.UNW
\l After some time has passed, two sons were born to them.

\t Žeduƛ’ Ħasan sidƛ’o, Ħusenƛin sideniƛ’ cirabin ceyn.
\m žedu-ƛ’ Ħasan sida-ƛ’ Ħusen-ƛin sideni-ƛ’ ci-bi-n cedi-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS Hassan one.OBL-SUPER.ESS Hussein-QUOT the.other.one-SUPER.ESS name-PL-TOP name-PST.UNW
\l They named one of them Hassan and the other one Hussein.

\t Sida zamanałäy, xexbi bežet’a boqnosi henešyabi täƛruni eženi žek’us xabar bayn, sissi uži nesir egiroƛ, nesiqor ezun ža sida kikxo äčiƛin.
\m sida zaman-łay xexbi b-eže-t’a b-oq-nosi heneš-bi teƛ-ru-ni eže-ni žek’u-s xabar b-ay-n sis-si uži nesi-r egir-ƛ nesi-qor ezu-n ža sida kik-x iči-ƛin
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ABL children I.PL-old-DISTR I.PL-become-ANT.CVB apple-PL give-PST.PRT-DEF old-DEF man-GEN1 story III-come-PFV.CVB one-ATTR boy DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT send-OPT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT look-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG one.OBL spring-AD.ESS wait-QUOT
\l At one time, when the children had become older, the story came [to them] of the old man who gave the apples, and one boy was to be sent to him and he would wait on a spring looking for him.

\t Neła quł Ħusen zown ciqaɣor ik’äsi.
\m neła qu-ł Ħusen zow-n ciq-aɣor ik’i-asi
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS Hussein be.NPRS-PST.UNW forest-IN.VERS go-RES.PRT
\l On that day, Hussein had gone into the forest.

\t Ħasan idu zown.
\m Ħasan idu zow-n
\g Hassan home be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Hassan was at home.

\t Izin yeda, eženi žek’a bukaruni mečoƛ’or di ik’ixƛin yiziqorno eƛin, hunix oqno.
\m izi-n yeda eže-ni žek’u-a b-ukar-ru-ni moči-ƛ’or di ik’i-x-ƛin yizi-qor-n eƛi-n huni-x oq-n
\g get.up-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG old-DEF man-ERG III-show-PST.PRT-DEF place-SUPER.LAT me go-PRS-QUOT DEM2.IPL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l He got up and said to them: "I am going to the place that the old man had shown.", and went on his way.

\t Ža ik’in kʷaxatow Ħusenno ayn.
\m ža ik’i-n kʷaxa-tow Ħusen-n ay-n
\g DEM1.SG go-PFV.CVB soon-EMPH Hussein-TOP come-PST.UNW
\l He went, and soon also Hussein came.

\t Ay, di ik’ix, nesiƛ’ adäz di exuƛƛin, aceł c’eruc’an caƛin, bˤaƛoyn gulun, et’un k’oƛin nełaƛ’no zown Ħusen hunix oqno.
\m ay di ik’i-x nesi-ƛ’ adäz di exu-ƛ-ƛin ac-ł c’eruc’a-n caƛi-n b-ˤaƛod-n gulu-n et’u-n k’oƛi-n neła-ƛ’-n zow-n Ħusen huni-x oq-n
\g must me go-PRS DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS before me die-OPT-QUOT door-CONT.ESS bow-TOP shoot.with-PFV.CVB III-harness-PFV.CVB horse-TOP jump-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB Hussein way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l "No, I am going, may I die before him!", Hussein [said and] shot at the door with his bow, harnessed the horse, and quickly rode on his way on it.

\t Sida zamanałäy, Ħusenä Ħasan hunix ik’iƛ’tow iqirno.
\m sida zaman-łay Ħusen-a Ħasan huni-x ik’i-ƛ’-tow iqir-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ABL Hussein-ERG Hassan way-AD.ESS go-PCT.CVB-EMPH catch-PST.UNW
\l After some time, Hussein caught Hassan while he was walking on the way.

\t Ħusen igtow ƛ’irin utin ža xizor utiranix eƛin, dowƛ’osi q’ʷariłi bisanir di ik’ix mi xizorno uti, di aceł caƛäsi c’eruc’a yoł, nagaħ där sis šebin roqnäy, nełas iyo boƛäx, c’ik’iw šebin ruyxor rik’inäy ɣˤay yešnayƛin.
\m Ħusen ig-tow ƛ’iri-n uti-n ža xizor utir-ani-x eƛi-n mi-ƛ’-si q’ʷariłi b-is-ani-r di ik’i-x mi xizor-n uti di ac-ł caƛi-asi c’eruc’a yoł nagaħ di-r sis šebin r-oq-näy neła-s iyo b-oƛix c’ik’iw šebin r-uyxor r-ik’i-näy ɣˤay y-ešnad-ƛin
\g Hussein well-EMPH above-TOP turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG back turn-MSD-AD.ESS say-PST.UNW you-SUPER.ESS-ATTR sadness III-take-MSD-LAT me go-PRS you back-TOP return me door-CONT.ESS shoot.with-RES.PRT bow be suppose me-LAT one thing IV-happen-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 blood III-appear entire thing IV-alright IV-go-CND.CVB milk II-drip-QUOT
\l Hussein insisted and said to make him turn back: "I am coming to take away the sadness on you, go back! I have shot with the bow at the door; suppose something will happen to me, it's [the arrow's] blood will appear, and if everything will go alright, then milk will drip out."

\t Žan eƛin Ħusen hunix oqno.
\m ža-n eƛi-n Ħusen huni-x oq-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP say-PFV.CVB Hussein way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l Hussein said that and went on his way.

\t Kikxor aynosi, łin ħaƛun, Ħusen muši begira q’ˤida ičin.
\m kik-xor ay-nosi łi-n ħaƛu-n Ħusen muši b-egir-a q’ˤida iči-n
\g spring-AD.LAT come-ANT.CVB water-TOP drink-PFV.CVB Hussein breath III-let-INF down sit-PST.UNW
\l After Hussein came to the spring, he drank the water and sat down to take a breath.

\t Ukru däqay kʷaxatow łäy, aq’ˤlu yołi netäy netintow däde sadaq ƛäxuƛin, Ħusenä žawab teƛno.
\m ukru di-qay kʷaxa-tow łiy ʕaq’lu yołi neti-ay netintow di-de sadaq ƛexu-ƛin Ħusen-a žawab teƛ-n
\g silver me-POSS.ABL soon-EMPH end advice however when-IN.ABL always me-APUD.ESS together remain-QUOT Hussein-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "Silver will soon end from me; an advice, however, will always remain with me.", answered Hussein.

\t Rigutow riguƛin, eƛin eženi žek’a.
\m r-igu-tow r-igu-ƛin eƛi-n eže-ni žek’u-a
\g IV-good-EMPH IV-good-QUOT say-PST.UNW old-DEF man-ERG
\l "Well, well!", said the old man.

\t Nedur resunäy, mi di eƛixosi šebin teqerno iči.
\m nedur r-esu-näy mi di eƛi-xosi šebin teqer-n iči
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB you me say-PRS.PRT thing listen.to-PFV.CVB be
\l "If that's the case, listen carefully to what I am saying!

\t Dowqor nesi eženi žek’a qaca reč’oƛin eƛinosi, sosi mitow reč’o, xizyo di reč’anƛin eƛo.
\m mi-qor nesi eže-ni žek’u-a qaca r-eč’-o-ƛin eƛi-nosi sosi mi-tow r-eč’-o xizyo di r-eč’-an-ƛin eƛi-o
\g you-POSS.LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL old-DEF man-ERG firewood IV-cut-IMPR-QUOT say-ANT.CVB at.first you-EMPH IV-cut-IMPR afterwards me IV-cut-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-IMPR
\l When the old man says to you: 'Chop firewood!', say: 'First you chop! Then I will chop.'

\t Xizyogon nesä dowqor ħoyä tełäy magalu boɣoƛin eƛinosi, hemedurtow sosi mi boɣo xizyo di boɣanƛin eƛo.
\m xizyogon nesi-a mi-qor ħo-a teł-ay magalu b-oɣ-o-ƛin eƛi-nosi hemedur-tow sosi mi b-oɣ-o xizyo di b-oɣ-an-ƛin eƛi-o
\g then DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you-POSS.LAT oven-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL bread III-take.away-IMPR-QUOT say-ANT.CVB so-EMPH at.first you III-take.away-IMPR afterwards me III-take.away-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-IMPR
\l Then, when he asks you: 'Take the bread out of the oven!', say likewise: 'First you take it out, then I will take it out!'

\t Magalu boɣa ža aqruntow, migon bisno ħoyaɣortow kuroƛin.
\m magalu b-oɣ-a ža oq-run-tow mi-gon b-is-n ħo-aɣor-tow kur-o-ƛin
\g bread III-take.away-INF DEM1.SG begin-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH you-CNTR III-take-PFV.CVB oven-IN.VERS-EMPH throw-IMPR-QUOT
\l Right after he began taking the bread out, take him and throw him into the oven!"

\t Eženi žek’ur barkalan zahir bodin, Ħusen nesä nesiz hunix oqno.
\m eže-ni žek’u-r barkala-n zahir b-odi-n Ħusen nesi-a nesi-z huni-x oq-n
\g old-DEF man-LAT thank-TOP express III-do-PFV.CVB Hussein DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l Hussein thanked the old man and went on his way.

\t Ik’in Ħusen babiwƛ’or kaɣat yayäruni eženi žek’uder ayn.
\m ik’i-n Ħusen babiw-ƛ’or kaɣat y-ayr-ru-ni eže-ni žek’u-der ay-n
\g go-PFV.CVB Hussein father-SUPER.LAT letter II-bring-PST.PRT-DEF old-DEF man-APUD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Hussein went on and came to the old man who brought his father a letter.

\t Ħusenä salamno teƛno, iduɣor oqno.
\m Ħusen-a salam-n teƛ-n idu-ɣor oq-n
\g Hussein-ERG greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL become-PST.UNW
\l Hussein gave a greeting and went into the house.

\t Eženi žek’u qaca ret’urxo esuzaƛ’, Ħusenä eƛin, di c’aq’ akiłäsi yoł, yaqˤułsi mitow ret’urƛin.
\m eže-ni žek’u qaca r-et’ur-x esu-zaƛ’ Ħusen-a eƛi-n di c’aq’ akiłäsi yoł yaqˤuł-si mi-tow r-et’ur-ƛin
\g old-DEF man firewood IV-hack-IPFV.CVB find-CSL.CVB Hussein-ERG say-PST.UNW me very tired be today-ATTR you-EMPH IV-hack-QUOT
\l Because he found the old man chopping firewood, Hussein said: "I am very tired, you hack today's [wood]!"

\t Eženä p’es anusi nesä nesistow ret’urno.
\m eže-ni-a p’es anu-si nesi-a nesi-s-tow r-et’ur-n
\g old-DEF-ERG sound be.NEG-ATTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH IV-hack-PST.UNW
\l The old man hacked his own [wood] without saying anything.

\t Sosi mi däq rukar, didur elo tełäy ža boɣxosi, xizyo din deber kumak bodanƛin, Ħusenän eƛin.
\m sosi mi di-q r-ukar didur elo teł-ay ža b-oɣ-xosi xizyo di-n mi-r kumak b-odi-an-ƛin Ħusen-a-n eƛi-n
\g at.first you me-POSS.ESS IV-show how there inside-IN.ABL DEM1.SG III-take.away-PRS.PRT afterwards me-TOP you-LAT help III-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT Hussein-ERG-TOP say-PST.UNW
\l "First you show me how to take it out of there, afterwards I will help you too.", Hussein said.

\t Ričiƛƛin pikrun bodin, nesä nesistow boɣa iħun.
\m r-iči-ƛ-ƛin pikru-n b-odi-n nesi-a nesi-s-tow b-oɣ-a iħu-n
\g IV-be-OPT-QUOT idea-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH III-take.away-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l "So be it!", he thought and began to take it out himself.

\t Xizaɣorsi magalu boɣƛ’oräy, Ħusenä ža q’ˤiƛin tełxorno kurno, ħoyos ac yuqin yičirno elo ža ik’un łiyace.
\m xizaɣor-si magalu b-oɣ-ƛ’oräy Ħusen-a ža q’ˤiƛi-n teł-xor-n kur-n ħo-s ac y-uqi-n y-ičir-n elo ža ik’u-n łiy-ace
\g finally-ATTR bread III-take.away-SIM.CVB Hussein-ERG DEM1.SG push-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT-TOP throw-PFV.CVB oven-GEN1 door II-close-PFV.CVB II-restrain-PFV.CVB there DEM1.SG burn-PFV.CVB end-TERM
\l While he was taking the last bread out, Hussein pushed him inside, shut the oven's door and restrained it until he was burned up there.

\t Ža abužahalno adäzay ok’ek’no, nesiz iduza ezu-ʕoƛ’uƛ’oräy, q’ˤidaza insanes ƛuzabi rukayn.
\m ža abužahal-n ad-azay ok’ek’-n nesi-z idu-za ezu~oƛ’ˤu-ƛ’oräy q’ˤida-za insan-s ƛuza-bi r-ukad-n
\g DEM1.SG devil-TOP in.front-IN.ABL.DIST steal.from-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 home-ZA examine-SIM.CVB down-ZA human-GEN1 bone-PL IV.PL-see-PST.UNW
\l [He] took away this devil, and while he was examining his home, he saw human bones down there.

\t Šebi mi t’o royxƛin, esirno nesä eženi žek’a di t’or ħalaxor yayrsi.
\m šebi mi t’o r-odi-x-ƛin esir-n nesi-a eže-ni žek’u-a di t’o-r ħal-xor y-ayr-s
\g what you here IV-do-PRS-QUOT ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG old-DEF man-ERG me here-LAT strength-AD.LAT II-bring-PST.WIT
\l "What are you doing here?", he asked, "The old man had brought me here forcibly.

\t Xexłiƛ’ yiłzaqay mi ok’łinč’inäy, nesä debeq rigu rukarinč’i.
\m xexłi-ƛ’ yiła-za-qay mi ok’eł-č’i-näy nesi-a mi-q r-igu r-ukar-č’i
\g quickness-SUPER.ESS DEM2.IISG.OBL-ZA-POSS.ABL you escape-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you-POSS.ESS IV-good IV-show-NEG.FUT
\l If you won't get away quickly from here, he won't let you see anything good anymore."

\t Di ža ħoyä tełerno kurno ik’ursiƛin, eƛin Ħusenä.
\m di ža ħo-a tełer-n kur-n ik’u-r-s-ƛin eƛi-n Ħusen-a
\g me DEM1.SG oven-IN.ESS into-TOP throw-PFV.CVB burn-CAUS-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW Hussein-ERG
\l I threw him into the oven and let him burn.", said Hussein.

\t Kid ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu yizin.
\m kid ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu y-izi-n
\g girl very be.happy II-get.up-PST.UNW
\l The girl got very happy.

\t Ħusenä elo q’ˤiryoł c’eruc’an riƛ’irno, nełqorno eƛin, di guluzał xizay ʕaƛaɣor ik’ix.
\m Ħusen-a elo q’ˤir-ł c’eruc’a-n r-iƛ’ir-n neła-qor-n eƛi-n di gulu-bi-ł xizay ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-x
\g Hussein-ERG there floor-CONT.ESS bow-TOP IV-plunge-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PST.UNW me horse-PL-CONT.ESS behind village-IN.VERS go-PRS
\l Hussein plunged the bow on the floor there and said to her: "I am going to the village for horses.

\t Där sis taliħ q’araw šebin roqnäy c’eruc’a riƛ’arza mečoƛ’azay iyo boƛäx, huni bit’zi roqnäy ɣˤay yešnayƛin.
\m di-r sis taliħ q’araw šebin r-oq-näy c’eruc’a r-iƛ’ir-za moči-ƛ’azay iyo b-oƛix huni bit’zi r-oq-näy ɣˤay y-ešnad-ƛin
\g me-LAT one fortune lacking thing IV-happen-CND.CVB bow IV-plunge-LCV place-SUPER.ABL.DIST blood III-appear way be.straight IV-become-CND.CVB milk II-drip-QUOT
\l If anything unfortunate happens to me, blood will appear from the place I plunged my bow into, and if the way goes alright, milk will drop out."

\t Ža neł kidbeqorno eƛin yeda hunix oqno ik’iƛ’oräy, nesił dandir aždaħ c’oxno.
\m ža neła kid-qor-n eƛi-n yeda huni-x oq-n ik’i-ƛ’oräy nesi-ł dandir aždaħ c’ox-n
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG way-AD.ESS become-PFV.CVB go-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS towards dragon meet-PST.UNW
\l And having said that to the girl, while he was walking on his way, a dragon came towards him.

\t Ħusen ukayrun aždaħä eƛin, dowqo däz enda ɣˤul łox caƛin č’aq’ˤinäy, mi di boƛi begir, c’oxinč’inäy mi di ac’a yołƛin.
\m Ħusen ukad-run aždaħ-a eƛi-n mi-q di-z enda ɣˤul łox caƛi-n č’aq’ˤi-näy mi di b-oƛi b-egi-r c’ox-č’i-näy mi di ac’-a yoł-ƛin
\g Hussein see-IMM.ANT.CVB dragon-ERG say-PST.UNW you-POSS.ESS me-GEN2 DEM3b.SG stone thrice throw-PFV.CVB hit-CND.CVB you me III-half III-break.apart-CAUS hit-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB you me eat-INF be-QUOT
\l Right after he saw Hussein, the dragon said: "If you throw and hit me with this stone within three attempts, break me apart in the middle! If you don't hit me, I am going to eat you."

\t Neł q’ut’imoƛ’ Ħusen razi oqno.
\m neła q’ut’i-ƛ’ Ħusen razi oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL agreement-SUPER.ESS Hussein agree become-PST.UNW
\l On this agreement Hussein agreed.

\t Łoxnon łox nesä nełaz ɣˤul caƛin, sosikin c’oxinč’izaƛ’, aždaħä Ħusen gulunnantow sadaq igin kurno.
\m łox-nan łox nesi-a neła-z ɣˤul caƛi-n sosi-kin c’ox-č’i-zaƛ’ aždaħ-a Ħusen gulu-n-nan-tow sadaq igi-n kur-n
\g thrice-INT thrice DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 stone throw-PFV.CVB at.first-even hit-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB dragon-ERG Hussein horse-TOP-INT-EMPH together swallow-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l Three times in a row he threw the stone at it and because he didn't hit it, the dragon swallowed Hussein along with his horse.

\t Ik’in, ik’in babiwƛ’or kaɣat yegirno zawruni ečruni žek’uder ayn.
\m ik’i-n ik’i-n babiw-ƛ’or kaɣat y-egir-n zow-ru-ni ečru-ni žek’u-der ay-n
\g go-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB father-SUPER.LAT letter II-send-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF old-DEF man-APUD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He went and went and came to the old man who had sent the letter to his father.

\t Nesä nesiq Ħusen äk’iru huni rukarno.
\m nesi-a nesi-q Ħusen ik’i-ru huni r-ukar-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS Hussein go-PST.PRT way IV-show-PST.UNW
\l He showed him the way that Hussein went.

\t Elaygon bitor bˤałno gulun ik’in, neširur sidaɣ ɣˤutkoxor ayn.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor b-ˤał-n gulu-n ik’i-n neširu-r sidaɣ ɣˤutku-xor ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither III-strike-PFV.CVB horse-TOP go-PFV.CVB evening-LAT in.one.place house-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l From there he stroke his horse and went on and in the evening arrived at a house in some place.

\t Guluƛ’ay et’un q’ˤidarno k’oƛin, madax žan bicin, harihun ezux-ʕoƛ’ux ɣˤutka tełxor oqnosi, nesir elo ža kid yesun.
\m gulu-ƛ’ay et’u-n q’ˤida-r-n k’oƛi-n ma-x ža-n b-ici-n harihun ezu~oƛ’ˤu-x ɣˤutku-a teł-xor oq-nosi nesi-r elo ža kid y-esu-n
\g horse-SUPER.ABL come.off-PFV.CVB down-LAT-TOP jump-PFV.CVB gate-AD.ESS DEM1.SG-TOP III-tie-PFV.CVB slowly examine-IPFV.CVB house-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT become-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT there DEM1.SG girl II-find-PST.UNW
\l He jumped down from his horse, tied it to the gate, and when he went into the house examining slowly, he found the girl there.

\t Suƛƛi ža yukayrun, Ħusenłäy nesä esirnosi, kidbä elo ɣˤutka teł kinaw raqru šebinno esin, nesä q’ˤida q’ˤiryoł caƛiru c’eruc’az hilmołäzay bešnoyx iyon bukarno.
\m suƛƛi ža y-ukad-run Ħusen-łay nesi-a esir-nosi kid-a elo ɣˤutku-a teł kinaw r-oq-ru šebin-n esi-n nesi-a q’ˤida q’ˤir-ł caƛi-ru c’eruc’a-z hil-łazay b-ešnod-x iyo-n b-ukar-n
\g immediately DEM1.SG II-see-IMM.ANT.CVB Hussein-CONT.ABL DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-ANT.CVB girl-ERG there house-IN.ESS inside entire IV-happen-PST.PRT thing-TOP tell-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG down floor-CONT.ESS throw-PST.PRT bow-GEN2 arrow-CONT.ABL.DIST III-dribble-IPFV.CVB blood-TOP III-show-PST.UNW
\l Immediately when he saw her, he asked for Hussein, and the girl told everything that happened inside the house there, and he showed the blood that was dribbling out of the bow's arrow that was shot down on the floor.

\t Nełqazay Ħasaner riyn c’eruc’as hilno q’ˤiryoł caƛin, Ħusen guluzał xizay ʕaƛaɣor nexno zawrułin, nesirgon hunix aždaħno keze boqno, neła axʷaɣor ägirułin.
\m neła-qazay Ħasan-r r-iy-n c’eruc’a-s hil-n q’ˤir-ł caƛi-n Ħusen gulu-bi-ł xizay ʕaƛ-aɣor nex-n zow-ru-łi-n nesi-r-gon huni-x aždaħ-n keze b-oq-n neła-a ax-aɣor igi-ru-łi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL.DIST Hassan-LAT IV-know-PFV.CVB bow-GEN1 arrow-TOP floor-CONT.ESS stick-PFV.CVB Hussein horse-PL-CONT.ESS behind village-IN.VERS come-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT-CNTR way-AD.ESS dragon-TOP meet III-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG belly-IN.VERS swallow-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and
\l From her he knew that Hussein sticked his bow's arrow into the floor and went to the village for horses, and that he met a dragon on the way, which swallowed him into his belly.

\t Xizaɣorsini xabar neła šak yoqno biłe esin.
\m xizaɣor-si-ni xabar neła-a šak y-oq-n b-iłe esi-n
\g finally-ATTR-DEF story DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG suspicion II-become-PFV.CVB III-as tell-PST.UNW
\l The final story she told suspiciously.

\t Nedur resunäy, inšaallah, Ħusenno din kʷaxatow xizor butin bayanƛin, nełqorno eƛin, et’un guluƛ’orno k’oƛin, Ħasan hunix oqno.
\m nedur r-esu-näy inšaallah Ħusen-n di-n kʷaxa-tow xizor b-uti-n b-ay-an-ƛin neła-qor-n eƛi-n et’u-n gulu-ƛ’or-n k’oƛi-n Ħasan huni-x oq-n
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB so.God.will Hussein-and me-and soon-EMPH back I.PL-return-PFV.CVB I.PL-come-FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.LAT-TOP jump-PFV.CVB Hassan way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l "If that's the case, so God will, Hussein and I will soon come back.", he told her, jumped onto his horse and got on his way.

\t Dandir aždaħ c’oxnosi, Ħuseneł biłetow yiła yisiłno q’ut’i boyx, łox ɣˤul caƛin sosikin nełaz c’oxnäy, yisä ža boƛƛi begira bayx, sosikin c’oxinč’inäy, aždaħä ža igix.
\m dandir aždaħ c’ox-nosi Ħusen-ł b-iłe-tow yiła-a yisi-ł-n q’ut’i b-odi-x łox ɣˤul caƛi-n sosi-kin neła-z c’ox-näy yisi-a ža b-oƛƛi b-egi-r-a b-ay-x sosi-kin c’ox-č’i-näy aždaħ-a ža igi-x
\g towards dragon meet-ANT.CVB Hussein-CONT.ESS III-as-EMPH DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-TOP agreement III-do-IPFV.CVB thrice stone throw-PFV.CVB once-even DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 hit-CND.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG III-middle III-break.apart-CAUS-INF III-must-IPFV.CVB once-even hit-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB dragon-ERG DEM1.SG swallow-PRS
\l When he came to the dragon, he was making the same agreement as with Hussein with him, that if he throws a stone three times and hits him at least once, he must break him apart in the middle, if he doesn't hit him at least once, the dragon would be swallowing him.

\t Neł q’ut’oƛ’ Ħasanno razi oqno.
\m neła q’ut’i-ƛ’ Ħasan-n razi oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL agreement-SUPER.ESS Hassan-TOP agree become-PST.UNW
\l On that agreement also Hassan agreed.

\t Išamt’a bisxo caƛin, łoxnon łox c’oxerno.
\m išam-t’a b-is-x caƛi-n łox-nan łox c’ox-r-n
\g aim-DISTR III-take-IPFV.CVB throw-PFV.CVB thrice-INT thrice hit-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l Taking aim each time he threw, he hit it three times in a row.

\t Bayru q’ut’oxor, Ħasanä rełimay bˤałayn roɣno aždaħzo rok’nosi, boƛƛi begirno.
\m b-odi-ru q’ut’i-xor Ħasan-a rełi-ay bˤałay-n r-oɣ-n aždaħ-z r-ok’-nosi b-oƛƛi b-egi-r-n
\g III-do-PST.PRT agreement-AD.LAT Hassan-ERG sheath-IN.ABL dagger-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB dragon-GEN2 IV-hit-ANT.CVB III-middle III-break.apart-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l According to the agreement they did, Hassan took his dagger out of the sheath and stabbed it into the dragon and broke him apart in the middle.

\t Din zows elo, nucin ragis, zerun ħaƛus, ruy mešok’labi taraw at’iłinč’u.
\m di-n zow-s elo nuci-n r-agi-s zeru-n ħaƛu-s r-uy mešok’la-bi taraw at’ił-č’u
\g me-TOP be.NPRS-PST.WIT there honey-TOP IV-lick-PST.WIT bouza-TOP drink-PST.WIT IV-indeed moustache-PL except.for become.wet-NEG.PST.WIT
\l I was there as well, I ate honey, I drank booze, and indeed only the moustaches got wet!

\t Zownƛax zownanuƛax Mamali-Maħamaƛin ci yołäsi habihan.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax Mamali~Maħama-ƛin ci yoł-asi habihan
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT Mamali~Magomed-QUOT name be-RES.PRT miller
\l Once upon a time there was a miller named Mamali-Magomed.

\t Sida quł nesider ziru bayn, debex di xanes kid yowanƛin.
\m sida qu-ł nesi-der ziru b-ay-n mi-x di xan-s kid y-ow-an-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT fox III-come-PST.UNW you-AD.ESS me khan-GEN1 daughter II-bring-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l One day a fox came to him [saying]: "I will marry the princess off to you!"

\t Neła quł sasaqtow moƛaxayn bizin, ixinno risno, q’ˤanon gagalazał xizay ħonƛ’aɣor boqno.
\m neła qu-ł sasaq-tow moƛu-xay-n b-izi-n ixin-n r-is-n q’ˤano-n gagali-bi-ł xizay ħon-ƛ’aɣor b-oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning-EMPH sleep-AD.ABL-TOP I.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB bag-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB two-TOP flower-PL-CONT.ESS behind mountain-SUPER.VERS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The next morning, the two of them got up from their sleep, took a back and went to the mountain for flowers.

\t Eleley, dice bercinaw, rigu šeƛ’u rižixƛin, bezun nasin xalq’in ƛexun.
\m eleley dice bercinaw r-igu šeƛ’u r-iži-x-ƛin b-ezu-n nasin xalq’i-n ƛexu-n
\g behold how.much beautiful IV-pretty clothing IV-carry-PRS-QUOT III-look-PFV.CVB all people-TOP remain-PST.UNW
\l "Behold, what beautiful and pretty clothes are being carried away!", all the people remained looking.

\t Nełƛ’osi kʷaxatow, habihanno zirun xanes kid esiranix bik’in.
\m nełƛ’osi kʷaxa-tow habihan-n ziru-n xan-s kid esir-ani-x b-ik’i-n
\g of.that.time soon-EMPH miller-and fox-and khan-GEN1 daughter ask-MSD-AD.ESS I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l Soon after that, the miller and the fox went to ask for the king's daughter.

\t Elaɣor bik’iƛ’oräy, zirude dandir ixiw bˤeƛ’es reqenno, žedał tełgon bik’ix ixiw ɣˤʷayn keze boqno.
\m ele-aɣor b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy ziru-de dandir ixiw bˤeƛ’-s reqen-n žeda-ł teł-gon b-ik’i-x ixiw ɣˤʷay-n keze b-oq-n
\g there-IN.VERS I.PL-go-SIM.CVB fox-APUD.ESS together big sheep-GEN1 herd-and DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside-CNTR I.PL-go-IPFV.CVB big dog-and meet III-become-PST.UNW
\l When they went there, the fox met a big flock of sheep and a large dog walking among them.

\t Ziruq ža eƛin rok’äłrun, nełał xizay ɣˤʷay k’oƛin.
\m ziru-q ža eƛi-n r-ok’eł-run neła-ł xizay ɣˤʷay k’oƛi-n
\g fox-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG say-PFV.CVB IV-lose-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS from.behind dog run-PST.UNW
\l Right after the fox had said that, the dog came running behind it.

\t Boxin sida beže got’ełxor ziru k’oƛinosi, nełałtow xizaygon ɣˤʷayn k’oƛin.
\m b-oxi-n sida b-eže got’i-łxor ziru k’oƛi-nosi neła-ł-tow xizay-gon ɣˤʷay-n k’oƛi-n
\g III-run.away-PFV.CVB one.OBL III-big haystack-CONT.VERS fox run-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-EMPH from.behind-CNTR dog-TOP run-PST.UNW
\l After the fox ran away into a big haystack, the dog [still] ran behind it.

\t Elo k’edanayx ɣˤʷay yałzay, sidaɣaza got’eł gondun yoɣno, ziru bixiq c’i atagon reʕizi boqno.
\m elo k’edanad-x ɣˤʷay yoł-zay sidaɣ-aza got’i-ł gondu-n y-oɣ-n ziru bix-q c’i at-a-gon reʕizi b-oq-n
\g there search-IPFV.CVB dog be-SIM.CVB in.one.place-IN.VERS.DIST haystack-CONT.ESS big.hole-TOP II-take.away-PFV.CVB fox hay-POSS.ESS fire light-INF-CNTR have.no.time III-become-PST.UNW
\l While the dog was being searching there, the fox made a hole in some place in the haystack and hurried to set fire to the hay.

\t Tełtow ɣˤʷayn bik’un, kinaw ža bˤeƛ’es reqenno, ɣˤutkubin, maʕišatno zirurno, habihanerno ƛexun.
\m teł-tow ɣˤʷay-n b-ik’u-n kinaw ža bˤeƛ’-s reqen-n ɣˤutku-bi-n maʕišat-n ziru-r-n habihan-r-n ƛexu-n
\g inside-EMPH dog-TOP III-burn-PFV.CVB entire DEM1.SG sheep-GEN1 herd-and house-PL-and fortune-and fox-LAT-and miller-LAT-and remain-PST.UNW
\l The dog inside burned, and the entire flock of sheep, the house and the fortune all remained for the fox and the miller.

\t Nediw ža habihanes bečełin rukayn, yisix xanes kidno nexno.
\m nediw ža habihan-s bečełi-n r-ukad-n yisi-x xan-s kid-n nex-n
\g such DEM1.SG miller-GEN1 riches-TOP IV-see-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS khan-GEN1 daughter-TOP come-PST.UNW
\l When she saw that the miller had so much riches, the princess married him.

\t Sida quł zira Mamali-Maħamaqor eƛin, di bexunosi, č’edoł šušinč’ey, ƛ’en kudin yałza kobora teł eqroƛin.
\m sida qu-ł ziru-a Mamali~Maħama-qor eƛi-n di b-exu-nosi č’edo-ł šuši-č’ey ƛ’e-n kudi-n yoł-za koboro-a teł eqer-o-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS fox-ERG Mamali~Magomed-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW me III-die-ANT.CVB earth-CONT.ESS bury-NEG.PST.CVB malt-and oat.flour-and be-LCV granary-IN.ESS inside put-IMPR-QUOT
\l One day the fox said to Mamali-Magomed: "When I have died, don't bury me into the earth, put me inside the granary where the malt and the oat flour is."

\t Ričiƛ, mi äƛiru rodanƛin habihan razi oqno.
\m r-iči-ƛ mi eƛi-ru r-odi-an-ƛin habihan razi oq-n
\g IV-be-OPT you say-PST.PRT IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT miller agree become-PST.UNW
\l "So be it, I will do what you said.", agreed the miller.

\t Roƛƛo ʕuraw ɣudbi rik’inosi, zira bäxurusno rodin bičin.
\m r-oƛƛo ʕuraw ɣudi-bi r-ik’i-nosi ziru-a b-exu-ru-s-n r-odi-n b-iči-n
\g IV-middle many day-PL IV-go-ANT.CVB fox-ERG III-die-PST.PRT-GEN1-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB III-be-PST.UNW
\l After many days had passed, the fox pretended to be dead.

\t Habihanägon k’onč’azaxno bisno šemqaɣor boɣno bižirno.
\m habihan-a-gon k’onč’u-bi-x-n b-is-n šem-qaɣor b-oɣ-n b-iži-r-n
\g miller-ERG-CNTR leg-PL-AD.ESS-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB dump-POSS.VERS III-take.away-PFV.CVB III-carry-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l The miller took it at its legs and carried it to the dump.

\t Nedurä mi dey wasi t’ubazi bodix zownƛin, elayn bizin ziru xanes kidbederno bik’in esin nełaq ža ɣˤutkun, maʕišatno ɣˤʷays yałrułin, žatown habihan yołƛinno.
\m nedur-a mi di-s wasi t’ubazi b-odi-x zow-n-ƛin ele-ay-n b-izi-n ziru xan-s kid-der-n b-ik’i-n esi-n neła-q ža ɣˤutku-n maʕišat-n ɣˤʷay-s yoł-ru-łi-n ža-tow-n habihan yoł-ƛin-n
\g so-Q you me-GEN1 testament fulfill III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT there-IN.ABL-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB fox khan-GEN1 daughter-APUD.LAT-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB tell-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG house-and fortune-and dog-GEN1 be-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and DEM1.SG-EMPH-and miller be-QUOT-TOP
\l "So you have fulfilled my wish?", [said] the fox[,] got up from there, went to the king's daughter and told her that the house and the fortune all belong to the dog and that he is just a miller.

\t Hemełƛ’otown Mamali-Maħamas yoł yałza ɣˤutkun elosi maʕišatno xecin, xanes kidno yoxin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’-tow-n Mamali~Maħama-s yoł yoł-za ɣˤutku-n elo-si maʕišat-n xeci-n xan-s kid-n y-oxi-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-EMPH-TOP Mamali~Magomed-GEN1 be be-LCV house-and there-ATTR fortune-and leave-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 daughter-TOP II-run.away-PST.UNW
\l Then, the king's daughter left the house which was Mamali-Magomed's, and also the fortune there, and ran away.

\t Habihan ziru ƛ’iräy boɣa ik’in, t’ok’ow debeł teł di nediw šebin ʕumruł rodač’inƛin.
\m habihan ziru ƛ’iräy b-oɣ-a ik’i-n t’ok’ow mi-ł teł di nediw šebin ʕumru-ł r-odi-ač’in-ƛin
\g miller fox from.above III-take.away-INF go-PFV.CVB anymore you-CONT.ESS inside me such thing life-CONT.ESS IV-do-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The miller went to apologize to the fox: "I won't do such a thing to you in my life anymore."

\t Habihanƛ’osi q’ʷariłin bukayn, ziru ƛ’iräyn boqno, xanzo kidbederno bik’in eƛin, ƛ’iräy yoq, mi di yaƛ’irsi.
\m habihan-ƛ’-si q’ʷariłi-n b-ukad-n ziru ƛ’iräy-n b-oq-n xan-z kid-der-n b-ik’i-n eƛi-n ƛ’iräy y-oq mi di y-aƛ’ir-s
\g miller-SUPER.ESS-ATTR sadness-TOP III-see-PST.UNW fox from.above-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 daughter-APUD.LAT-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW from.above II-become you me II-cheat-PST.WIT
\l The fox saw the sadness that was upon the miller, forgave [him], went to the king's daughter and said: "Forgive [me], I cheated you."

\t Ža ɣˤutkun bˤeƛ’es reqenno Mamali-Maħamas yołƛin.
\m ža ɣˤutku-n bˤeƛ’-s reqen-n Mamali~Maħama-s yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG house-and sheep-GEN1 herd-and Mamali~Magomed-GEN1 be-QUOT
\l This house and the flock of sheep is Mamali-Magomed's.

\t Kʷaxatow xanes kid habihandäɣor nexno.
\m kʷaxa-tow xan-s kid habihan-däɣor nex-n
