\g soon-EMPH khan-GEN1 daughter miller-APUD.VERS come-PST.UNW
\l Soon the king's daughter returned to the miller.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder łˤoran paraxat, rok’uɣʷeymoł ʕumru bižix zown.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder łˤora-n paraxat rok’uɣʷey-ł ʕumru b-iži-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after three.OBL-TOP calmly fun-CONT.ESS life III-lead-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After that, the three of them lived together happily and calmly.

\t Howžin yiłas siħru bäsuƛin habihanes rok’ƛ’orno rayn, bižin ƛ’e yałza bˤoƛ’ä teł eqerno.
\m howži-n yiła-s siħru b-esu-ƛin habihan-s rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n b-iži-n ƛ’e yoł-za bˤoƛ’i-a teł eqer-n
\g now-TOP DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 slyness III-exist-QUOT miller-GEN1 heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB III-carry-PFV.CVB malt be-LCV larder-IN.ESS inside put-PST.UNW
\l "Now it might be his slyness again." the miller thought, carried it and put it into the larder where the malt was.

\t Zira bigza ħalał ƛ’en bagin, zamanaƛ’azay xexoybin roɣno.
\m ziru-a b-ig-za ħal-ł ƛ’e-n b-agi-n zaman-ƛ’azay xexoy-bi-n r-oɣ-n
\g fox-ERG III-very-ZA condition-CONT.ESS malt-TOP III-lick-PFV.CVB time-SUPER.ABL.DIST young.animal-PL-TOP III.PL-hatch-PST.UNW
\l The fox licked enough malt and after some time, it got youngs.

\t Ele hemedur habihaner ħillan bodin, neła nełaz rok’ƛ’osi muradno t’ubazi bodin.
\m ele hemedur habihan-r ħilla-n b-odi-n neła-a neła-z rok’u-ƛ’-si murad-n t’ubazi b-odi-n
\g there so miller-LAT trickery-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.ESS-ATTR wish-TOP fulfill III-do-PST.UNW
\l So there it tricked the miller and fulfilled it's own heart's desire.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay!
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu-u buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean-IMPR sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Sis zown bečedaw žek’u.
\m sis zow-n bečedaw žek’u
\g one be.NPRS-PST.UNW wealthy man
\l There was a rich man.

\t Nesis sistow sis uži zown.
\m nesi-s sis-tow sis uži zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 one-EMPH one son be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had one single son.

\t Ečriłno exʷa zaman baynosi, nesä žaqor wasi bodin, di exunosi deber rätiza ɣˤutkun rodo, yexoriłxosin, k’ot’oniłxosin, aluk’an, qˤaban yoqxosi gurow barun yawno.
\m ečrił-n exu-a zaman b-ay-nosi nesi-a uži-qor wasi b-odi-n di exu-nosi mi-r r-eti-za ɣˤutku-n r-odi-o y-exorił-xosi-n k’ot’onił-xosi-n aluk’a-n qˤaba-n y-oq-xosi gurow baru-n y-aw-n
\g get.old-PFV.CVB die-INF time III-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG son-POSS.LAT testament III-do-PST.UNW me die-ANT.CVB you-LAT IV-want-LCV house-TOP IV-do-IMPR II-become.longer-PRS.PRT-and become.shorter-PRS.PRT-and white-and black-and II-become-PRS.PRT except wife-TOP II-mouse-TOP
\l He got older and when the time has come to die, he gave his testament to the son: "When I have died, you build a house where you want, but don't marry a woman except for one being black and white, be she long or short.

\t Nagaħ dey wasi debeq t’ubazi boda k’ʷeze boqinč’inäy, ƛexeƛ yałru akamxor ročno regirno ɣanq’izin oqno exuƛin.
\m nagaħ di-s wasi mi-q t’ubazi b-odi-a k’ʷeze b-oq-č’i-näy ƛex-ƛ yoł-ru aka-xor roč-n r-egir-n ɣanq’izi-n oq-n exu-ƛin
\g suppose me-GEN1 testament you-POSS.ESS fulfill III-do-INF can III-happen-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB ceiling-SUB.ESS be-PST.PRT hook-AD.LAT rope-TOP IV-let-PFV.CVB strangle-TOP become-PFV.CVB die-QUOT
\l Suppose you can't fulfill my testament, then bind a rope to a hook under the ceiling, hang yourself and die!"

\t Boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, babiwn exun, ža uži sisxoli ƛexun.
\m b-oƛƛo b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow babiw-n exu-n ža uži sisxoli ƛexu-n
\g III-middle III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH father-TOP die-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG son alone remain-PST.UNW
\l Before much time has passed, the father died and the son remained alone.

\t Yisis q’ˤano dandi ʕagaraw žek’u zown ƛexasi, babiws esiwn, nesis kid yisis yacʕalno.
\m yisi-s q’ˤano dandi ʕagaraw žek’u zow-n ƛexu-asi babiw-s esiw-n nesi-s kid yisi-s yacʕal-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 two only related man be.NPRS-PFV.CVB remain-RES.PRT father-GEN1 brother-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 female.cousin-and
\l He had only two relatives remaining, the father's brother and his daughter, his cousin.

\t Babiws esiw bečedaw žek’u zown.
\m babiw-s esiw bečedaw žek’u zow-n
\g father-GEN1 brother wealthy man be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The father's brother was a rich man.

\t Raq’ˤu ɣˤutkubin rodin, žedałxortow kinaw idu yałru maʕišatno bik’in łiyn.
\m r-aq’ˤu ɣˤutku-bi-n r-odi-n žeda-łxor-tow kinaw idu yoł-ru maʕišat-n b-ik’i-n łiy-n
\g IV.PL-many house-PL-TOP IV.PL-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.VERS-EMPH entire home be-PST.PRT fortune-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB end-PST.UNW
\l He built many houses and the entire fortune that was in his home went away through them.

\t Yisiz idu lagiƛ baħa mužikin ƛexun zownanu.
\m yisi-z idu laga-ƛ b-aħ-a muži-kin ƛexu-n zow-n-anu
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 home body-SUB.ESS III-lay-INF mattress-even remain-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l And at his home not even a mattress remained to be laid under his body.

\t Babiya äƛiruq’aw, yexoriłxosi, k’ot’oniłxosi, aluk’a qˤaba yoqxosi, barun yiqinanu.
\m babi-a eƛi-ru-q’aw y-exorił-xosi k’ot’onił-xosi aluk’a qˤaba y-oq-xosi baru-n y-iqi-n-anu
\g dad-ERG say-PST.PRT-EQU2 II-become.longer-PRS.PRT become.shorter-PRS.PRT white black II-become-PRS.PRT wife-TOP II-get-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l He didn't get a wife that was black and white and longer and shorter, as the father had said.

\t Howži yisi žoyä, t’ok’ow urɣel čučzi boda nesis igorsi žek’un oqinč’izaƛ’, yacʕalqo kinaw raqru šebinno esin, eƛin, yaqˤuł dey xizaɣorsi ɣudi yoł ƛexasi.
\m howži yisi uži-a t’ok’ow urɣel čučzi b-odi-a nesi-s igo-r-si žek’u-n oq-č’i-zaƛ’ yacʕal-q kinaw r-oq-ru šebin-n esi-n eƛi-n yaqˤuł di-s xizaɣor-si ɣudi yoł ƛexu-asi
\g now DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-ERG more sorrow loosen III-do-INF DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 near-LAT-ATTR man-TOP become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB female.cousin-POSS.ESS entire IV-happen-PST.PRT thing-TOP tell-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW today me-GEN1 finally-ATTR day be remain-RES.PRT
\l Now that boy, because there was no close person to him to relieve his sorrow a bit more, he told his cousin everything that has happened and said: "Today is my last day.

\t Babiws wasi t’ubazi boqinč’izaƛ’, nesä äƛirun rodin, meč’oxor q’aq’at’un kurno exʷa ayx diƛin.
\m babiw-s wasi t’ubazi b-oq-č’i-zaƛ’ nesi-a eƛi-ru-n r-odi-n meč’-xor q’aq’at’u-n kur-n exu-a ay-x di-ƛin
\g father-GEN1 testament fulfill III-become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB neck-AD.LAT noose-TOP throw-PFV.CVB die-INF must-PRS me-QUOT
\l Because my father's testament won't get fulfilled, I must do what he said, put a noose around my neck and die."

\t Xexłiƛ’ idurno yik’in, yiłä yedu xabar babiwq esinosi, nesä nesidäɣor esiws uži goƛ’a yedu yegirno.
\m xexłi-ƛ’ idu-r-n y-ik’i-n yiła-a yedu xabar babiw-q esi-nosi nesi-a nesi-däɣor esiw-s uži goƛ’i-a yedu y-egir-n
\g quickness-SUPER.ESS home-LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG story father-POSS.ESS tell-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.VERS brother-GEN1 son invite-INF DEM2.IISG II-let-PST.UNW
\l She went home quickly, and when she told this story to her father, he let her invite his brother's son to himself.

\t K’oƛin yedu yäk’iru, q’ˤuriƛ’orno izin meč’oxor q’aq’at’u kurxo esun.
\m k’oƛi-n yedu y-ik’i-ru q’ˤuri-ƛ’or-n izi-n meč’-xor q’aq’at’u kur-x esu-n
\g run-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG II-go-PST.PRT chair-SUPER.LAT-TOP get-PFV.CVB neck-AD.LAT noose throw-IPFV.CVB exist-PST.UNW
\l She ran away and he had already gotten on a chair and thrown a noose around his neck.

\t Idur yayruntow yiła eƛin, xexłiƛ’ babiya mi goƛ’ixƛin.
\m idu-r y-ay-run-tow yiła-a eƛi-n xexłi-ƛ’ babi-a mi goƛ’i-x-ƛin
\g home-LAT II-come-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW urgence-SUPER.ESS dad-ERG you invite-PRS-QUOT
\l Right after she came [to his] home, she said: "My father invites you urgently!"

\t Yaqˤuł iłe ɣuden goƛ’a ay nesiq di iduɣor.
\m yaqˤuł iłe ɣude-n goƛ’i-a ay nesi-q di idu-ɣor
\g today as tomorrow-TOP invite-INF must DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS me home-IN.ALL
\l "Tomorrow too, just as today, he must invite me to his home.

\t Där exuntow riguƛin, žoyä eƛin.
\m di-r exu-n-tow r-igu-ƛin uži-a eƛi-n
\g me-LAT die-PFV.CVB-EMPH IV-good-QUOT boy-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l I would rather die.", said the boy.

\t Yigtow yedu ƛ’iri yutinosi, wacʕal žedzoxaɣor ik’a muk’ur oqno.
\m y-ig-tow yedu ƛ’iri y-uti-nosi wacʕal žedu-zo-xaɣor ik’i-a muk’ur oq-n
\g II-much-EMPH DEM2.IISG above II-turn-ANT.CVB male.cousin DEM1.IPL.OBL-ATTR.OBL-AD.VERS go-INF agree become-PST.UNW
\l When she insisted very much, the cousin agreed to go to their [place].

\t Idur ža aynosi, šida mi meč’oxor akan begirno exux zowäƛin, babiwz esiya esirnosi, nesä eƛin, där babiya bodäsi wasi zows keze raqza ɣˤutkubi rodoƛin...
\m idu-r ža ay-nosi šida mi meč’-xor aka-n b-egir-n exu-x zow-a-ƛin babiw-z esyu-a esir-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n di-r babi-a b-odi-asi wasi zow-s keze r-oq-za ɣˤutku-bi r-odi-o-ƛin
\g home-LAT DEM1.SG come-ANT.CVB why you neck-AD.LAT hook-TOP III-let-PFV.CVB die-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT father-GEN2 brother-ERG ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me-LAT dad-ERG III-do-RES.PRT testament be.NPRS-PST.WIT meet IV-become-LCV house-PL IV.PL-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l When he came home and his uncle asked: "Why have you been dying, having a noose around your neck?", he answered: "My father stated in his testament, that I have to make houses where I get to..."

\t Esiƛ’ nesiq xabarno xecirno elo yoƛor k’oƛin kidbä eƛin, neł rožes maʕna deber meq’ bič’zi boqno.
\m esi-ƛ’ nesi-q xabar-n xeci-r-n elo y-oƛƛo-r k’oƛi-n kid-a eƛi-n neła roži-s maʕna mi-r meq’ bič’zi b-oq-n
\g tell-PCT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS story-TOP leave-CAUS-PFV.CVB there II-middle-LAT run-PFV.CVB girl-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL word-GEN1 sense you-LAT incorrectly understand III-become-PST.UNW
\l "Let him cease the story while he's talking!", the girl ran into the middle of there and said: "You misunderstood the sense of these words.

\t Nełas maʕna yoł, keze aqza ƛirbałi rodoƛin.
\m neła-s maʕna yoł keze oq-za ƛirbałi r-odi-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 sense be meet become-LCV hospitality IV-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l The sense of his words was: 'Be a guest whereever you go to!'"

\t Sisgon däqor babiya eƛin zowsƛin, esin žoyä, yexoriłxosin, k’ot’oniłxosin, qˤaba, aluk’a yoqxosin gurow baru yawnoƛin.
\m sis-gon di-qor babi-a eƛi-n zow-s-ƛin esi-n uži-a y-exorił-xosi-n k’ot’onił-xosi-n qˤaba aluk’a y-oq-xosi-n gurow baru y-ow-n-ƛin
\g one-CNTR me-POSS.LAT dad-ERG say-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT tell-PST.UNW boy-ERG II-become.longer-PRS.PRT-TOP become.shorter-PRS.PRT-and black white II-become-PRS.PRT-and except wife II-marry-PROHIB-QUOT
\l "My father said another thing to me:", told the boy, "Don't marry a wife unless she's becoming longer and shorter and is black and white."

\t Yet’un k’oƛin kidbä eƛin, ža šebin t’ubazi rodanix di ƛ’iri risxoƛin.
\m y-et’u-n k’oƛi-n kid-a eƛi-n ža šebin t’ubazi r-odi-ani-x di ƛ’iri r-is-x-ƛin
\g II-jump-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB girl-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.SG thing fulfill IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS me above IV-take-PRS-QUOT
\l The girl jumped up, ran and said: "I am taking over in order to fulfill this thing."

\t Howži uži ozzał ogun.
\m howži uži ozuri-bi-ł ogu-n
\g now boy eye-PL-CONT.ESS gape-PST.UNW
\l Now the boy was making big eyes.

\t Nedur resunäy k’ot’oniłƛin žoyä eƛinosi, ele k’ot’oniłinč’aƛin kid k’omo yiłen yoqno q’ˤida yičin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy k’ot’onił-ƛin uži-a eƛi-nosi ele k’ot’onił-č’u-a-ƛin kid k’omo y-iłe-n y-oq-n q’ˤida y-iči-n
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB become.shorter-QUOT boy-ERG say-ANT.CVB here become.shorter-NEG.PST.WIT-Q-QUOT girl ball II-as-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB down II-sit-PST.UNW
\l When the boy said: "If that's the case, get shorter!", the girl said: "Here, am I not getting shorter?", sat down and became like a ball.

\t Yexoriłƛin eƛinosigon, ele yexoriłinč’aƛin hečk’erno yizin.
\m y-exorił-ƛin eƛi-nosi-gon ele y-exorił-č’u-a-ƛin hečk’er-n y-izi-n
\g II-become.longer-QUOT say-ANT.CVB-CNTR here II-become.longer-NEG.PST.WIT-Q-QUOT upright-TOP II-get.up-PST.UNW
\l And when he said "Get longer!", she said "Here, am I not getting longer?" and got up upright again.

\t Qˤaba yoqƛin žoyä eƛinosi, kidbä adäzar kočori bayrno, aluk’a yoqƛingon eƛinosi, adäzay kočori butirno xizor kurno, ele yoqsiƛin.
\m qˤaba y-oq-ƛin uži-a eƛi-nosi kid-a adäz-ar kočori b-ayr-n aluk’a y-oq-ƛin-gon eƛi-nosi ad-azay kočori b-utir-n xizor kur-n ele y-oq-s-ƛin
\g black II-become-QUOT boy-ERG say-ANT.CVB girl-ERG ahead-IN.LAT forelock III-bring-PFV.CVB white II-become-QUOT-CNTR say-ANT.CVB in.front-IN.ABL.DIST forelock I.PL-turn-PFV.CVB back throw-PFV.CVB here II-become-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l When the boy said: "Get black!", the girl brought her hair ahead, and when he said: "Get white!", he turned her hair away from the front and threw it on her back[, saying]: "Here, I got."

\t Nedur resunäy, mi därsitow ɣˤanabiwa zownƛin, howlotow babiwn nełas yałzay, maharno erno daramno boyn, nesi žoyä yacʕaltow yowx.
\m nedur r-esu-näy mi di-r-si-tow ɣˤanabi-a zow-n-ƛin howlo-tow babiw-n neła-s yoł-zay mahar-n er-n daram-n b-odi-n nesi uži-a yacʕal-tow y-ow-x
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB you me-LAT-ATTR-EMPH woman-Q be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT there-EMPH father-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 be-SIM.CVB wedding-TOP put-PFV.CVB trade-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG female.cousin-EMPH II-marry-PRS
\l "If that's the case, aren't you a woman exactly for me?", and while the father was hers(?) there, they organized a wedding, traded and that boy married his cousin.

\t Sadaq bik’in idur baynosigon, howła ƛexeƛ bok’ali kiciresgon sis maʕna bäsuƛin, bara rok’uƛ’ esurno ža.
\m sadaq b-ik’i-n idu-r b-ay-nosi-gon howła ƛex-ƛ b-ok’-ali kici-s-gon sis maʕna b-esu-ƛin baru-a rok’u-ƛ’ esur-n ža
\g together I.PL-go-PFV.CVB home-LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB-CNTR DEM3.IISG.OBL ceiling-SUB.ESS III-hit-ATTR hook-GEN1-CNTR one sense III-exist-QUOT wife-ERG heart-SUPER.ESS find-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG
\l When they went home together, his wife reminded him: "There might be a sense to this hook under the ceiling."

\t Howži yedu micxir łar biča bayƛin bara esirnosi, yisä där biča bayƛin eƛin.
\m howži yedu micxir ła-r b-iči-a b-ay-ƛin baru-a esir-nosi yisi-a di-r b-iči-a b-ay-ƛin eƛi-n
\g now DEM2.IISG money who.OBL-LAT III-be-INF III-must-QUOT wife-ERG ask-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG me-LAT III-be-INF III-must-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l When the wife asked, "For whom is that money now?", he said: "It must be for me."

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, eƛin bara, t’ay deber di uyno ɣˤurušno neƛan, nełaƛ ʕaq’lu bisanix mi pulanaw žek’uder sida ʕaƛar ik’iƛin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin eƛi-n baru-a t’ay mi-r di uyno ɣˤuruš-n neƛ-an neła-ƛ ʕaq’lu b-is-ani-x mi pulanaw žek’u-der sida ʕaƛ-ar ik’i-ƛin
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PFV.CVB wife-ERG from.here you-LAT me four ruble-TOP give-FUT.DEF DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUB.ESS advice III-take-MSD-AD.ESS you a.certain man-APUD.LAT one.OBL village-IN.LAT go-QUOT
\l "If that's the case," said his wife, "I will give you four rubles from here; go to a village to a certain man in order to buy an advice with it."

\t Uyno ɣˤurušno yisno, xediw hunix oqno.
\m uyno ɣˤuruš-n y-is-n xediw huni-x oq-n
\g four ruble-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB husband way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l The husband took the four rubles and went on his way.

\t Ža ik’a ayxosi ʕaƛ ʕuraw maqˤi zown.
\m ža ik’i-a ay-xosi ʕaƛ ʕuraw maqˤi zow-n
\g DEM1.SG go-INF must-PRS.PRT village very far.away be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The village where he had to go, was very far away.

\t Xediw adäzay ok’äłrun, bara kušin ža ɣˤutku rosyoƛ’orno rayrno, ec’no ɣˤutku rodanix bašla bodin ustarbin begirno.
\m xediw ad-azay ok’eł-run baru-a kuši-n ža ɣˤutku ros-ƛ’or-n r-ayr-n ec’no ɣˤutku r-odi-ani-x bašla b-odi-n ustar-bi-n b-egir-n
\g husband in.front-IN.ABL.DIST go.away-IMM.ANT.CVB wife-ERG demolish-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG house base-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-bring-PFV.CVB new house IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS begin III-do-PFV.CVB expert-PL-TOP III-let-PST.UNW
\l When her husband had gone away from her, the wife demolished that house and brought it down to the base, and she let the experts begin to build a new house.

\t ƛexƛäy bˤaƛ’uru kinaw ɣˤutkoƛ micxirno łiyrno, xedyoqor yezun yedun yičin.
\m ƛex-ƛay b-ˤaƛ’u-ru kinaw ɣˤutku-ƛ micxir-n łiyr-n xediw-qor y-ezu-n yedu-n y-iči-n
\g ceiling-SUB.ABL III-fall-PST.PRT entire house-SUB.ESS money-TOP finish-PFV.CVB husband-POSS.LAT II-look-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG-TOP II-wait-PST.UNW
\l The money that had fallen from the ceiling was finished for the entire house, and she waited and looked for the husband.

\t Yeda ʕaq’lu mołixozo ečruni žek’uder aynosi, ža zikru eƛix esun.
\m yeda ʕaq’lu mołi-xozo ečru-ni žek’u-der ay-nosi ža zikru eƛi-x esu-n
\g DEM2.ISG advice teach-PRS.PRT.OBL old-DEF man-APUD.LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG religious.recitation say-IPFV.CVB find-PST.UNW
\l When he came to the old man who was to teach the advice, he found him reciting religious chants.

\t Eženi žek’u sadaq šebin riyxosi šayx zown.
\m eže-ni žek’u sadaq šebin r-iy-xosi šayx zow-n
\g old-DEF man all thing IV-know-PRS.PRT sheikh be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The old man was a sheikh who knew everything.

\t Debi zikru łiyace ičäsi zowsƛin, užä žawab teƛno.
\m mi-s zikru łiy-ace iči-asi zow-s-ƛin uži-a žawab teƛ-n
\g you-GEN1 religious.recitation end-TERM wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT boy-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "I was waiting until your recitation is finished.", answered the boy.

\t Dey zikru netikin łiyxosianu.
\m di-s zikru neti-kin łiy-xosi-anu
\g me-GEN1 religious.recitation when-even end-PRS.PRT-NEG
\l "My recitation never ends.

\t Šebi zowä deber, nełƛ’asi eso miƛin, eƛin ečruni žek’a.
\m šebi zow-a mi-r neła-ƛ’-si esi-o mi-ƛin eƛi-n ečru-ni žek’u-a
\g what be.NPRS-INF you-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-ATTR tell-IMPR you-QUOT say-PST.UNW old-DEF man-ERG
\l So tell me what you have to tell!", said the old man.

\t Di debeq ʕaq’lu mołiranix nexäsi yołƛin, eƛin užä.
\m di mi-q ʕaq’lu mołi-r-ani-x nex-asi yoł-ƛin eƛi-n uži-a
\g me you-POSS.ESS advice teach-CAUS-MSD-AD.ESS come-RES.PRT be-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "I've come to ask you for advice", said the boy.

\t Dey užiƛin, eƛin eženi žek’a, sida ʕaq’lus baha sis ɣˤuruš yołƛin.
\m di-s uži-ƛin eƛi-n eže-ni žek’u-a sida ʕaq’lu-s baha sis ɣˤuruš yoł-ƛin
\g me-GEN1 son-QUOT say-PST.UNW old-DEF man-ERG one.OBL advice-GEN1 price one ruble be-QUOT
\l "My son," said the old man, "the price of an advice is one ruble."

\t Nedur resunäy di raziyaw yołƛin, nesä esace teqerno ičin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy di raziyaw yoł-ƛin nesi-a esi-ace teqer-n iči-n
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB me ready be-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG tell-TERM listen.to-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l "If that's the case, I am ready.", and he listened until he told him.

\t Waħħo gibu bukayn gurow, iħu taqˤor baɣnoƛinno, eƛin šeyxä, žaqay ɣˤurušno yoɣno.
\m waħo-x gibu b-ukad-n gurow iħu taqˤo-r b-oɣ-n-ƛin-n eƛi-n šayx-a uži-qay ɣˤuruš-n y-oɣ-n
\g below-AD.ESS sand III-see-PFV.CVB except river over.there-LAT III-cross-PROHIB-QUOT-TOP say-PFV.CVB sheikh-ERG boy-POSS.ABL ruble-TOP II-take.away-PST.UNW
\l "Don't cross the river unless you see the sand below!", said the sheikh and took the ruble from the boy.

\t Užiz rok’ƛ’or pikru bayn, dice ixiw ʕaq’lu nesä däq mołäƛin.
\m uži-z rok’u-ƛ’or pikru b-ay-n dice ixiw ʕaq’lu nesi-a di-q mołi-a-ƛin
\g boy-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT idea III-come-PST.UNW how.much big advice DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG me-POSS.ESS teach-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The boy thought: "How big an advice did he give me?!"

\t Yisiz rok’ƛ’osi šebin eženi žek’ur riyx.
\m yisi-z rok’u-ƛ’-si šebin eže-ni žek’u-r r-iy-x
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.ESS-ATTR thing old-DEF man-LAT IV-know-PRS
\l The old man knew what he thought.

\t Xizyogon žoyä sisgon ʕaq’lu mołoƛin nesiqor eƛinosi, hudun mi di bayru ʕaq’luƛ’ razi oqxanuwaƛin eƛintow ičin.
\m xizyogon uži-a sis-gon ʕaq’lu mołi-o-ƛin nesi-qor eƛi-nosi hudun mi di b-odi-ru ʕaq’lu-ƛ’ razi oq-x-anu-ya-ƛin eƛi-n-tow iči-n
\g again boy-ERG one-CNTR advice teach-IMPR-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-ANT.CVB nevertheless you me III-do-PST.PRT advice-SUPER.ESS accept become-IPFV.CVB-NEG-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT say-PFV.CVB-EMPH wait-PST.UNW
\l When the boy said to him again: "Give me another advice!", he said: "You won't accept my advice anyway."

\t Žar čuqˤno nesiz rok’ƛ’osi šebin eženi žek’a riyärułi.
\m uži-r čuqˤ-n nesi-z rok’u-ƛ’-si šebin eže-ni žek’u-a r-iyr-rułi
\g boy-LAT notice-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.ESS-ATTR thing old-DEF man-ERG IV-find.out-MSD
\l The boy noticed that the old man found out what he thought.

\t Hudun ži ɣˤuruš neƛnäy sisgon bodan deber di ʕaq’luƛin razi oqno eženi.
\m hudun ži ɣˤuruš neƛ-näy sis-gon b-odi-an mi-r di ʕaq’lu-ƛin razi oq-n eže-ni
\g nevertheless now ruble give-CND.CVB one-CNTR III-do-FUT.DEF you-LAT me advice-QUOT agree become-PST.UNW old-DEF
\l "Nevertheless, if you give me a ruble, I'll give you another advice.", agreed the old man.

\t Q’ˤano äƛirugon nesä žaqay ɣˤurušno yisno, mi qˤišodäy soder ħon xäcinƛin, ʕaq’lun bodin.
\m q’ˤano äƛiru-gon nesi-a uži-qay ɣˤuruš-n y-is-n mi qˤišod-ay soder ħon xeci-n-ƛin ʕaq’lu-n b-odi-n
\g two ORD-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG boy-POSS.ABL ruble-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB you at.noon-IN.ABL after mountain leave-PROHIB-QUOT advice-TOP III-do-PST.UNW
\l For the second time he took a ruble from the boy and gave him the advice: "Don't go up the mountain after it got dark!"

\t Xizyogon, hemedurtow dice ixiw ʕaq’lu yisä där žigoƛ’äygon bodäƛin nesiz rok’ƛ’or rayn.
\m xizyogon hemedur-tow dice ixiw ʕaq’lu yisi-a di-r žigoƛ’äy-gon b-odi-a-ƛin nesi-z rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-n
\g again so-EMPH how.much big advice DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG me-LAT once.again-CNTR III-do-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come-PST.UNW
\l Again, he thought: "What a similarly big advice did he give me once again?!"

\t Sosigon žoyä łˤono ɣˤurušno teƛno, eženi žek’uqor ʕaq’lu bodoƛin eƛin.
\m sosi-gon uži-a łˤono ɣˤuruš-n teƛ-n eže-ni žek’u-qor ʕaq’lu b-odi-o-ƛin eƛi-n
\g again-CNTR boy-ERG three ruble-TOP give-PFV.CVB old-DEF man-POSS.LAT advice III-do-IMPR-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l Again, the boy gave him the third ruble and said to the old man: "Give me an advice!"

\t Miƛin, eƛin nesä, k’ot’ono, c’ec’mabi c’uda, ozurabi niga, kodi aluk’a ɣˤanazaƛ’ bužzi aqno, nełqay maqˤixno ičiƛin.
\m mi-ƛin eƛi-n nesi-a k’ot’ono c’ec’-bi c’uda ozuri-bi niga kodi aluk’a ɣˤanabi-ƛ’ bužzi oq-n neła-qay maqˤi-x-n iči-ƛin
\g you-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG short eyelash-PL red eye-PL green hair white woman-SUPER.ESS trust become-PROHIB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL far.away-AD.ESS-TOP be-QUOT
\l "Don't", he said, "believe in a short woman with her eyelashes red, her eyes green and her hair white, but keep away from her!"

\t Sisgon ʕaq’lu mołoƛin ƛ’iri uži utinosi, hunix ik’izaƛ’ deberno ħažat yaq ža xizor ƛäxuruni sisini ɣˤurušƛin, endurtow esin eženi žek’a ʕaq’lu, boƛ’araw royxozo łinałno cim xizor biq’ˤir, sabru ader adek’ƛin.
\m sis-gon ʕaq’lu mołi-o-ƛin ƛ’iri uži uti-nosi huni-x ik’i-zaƛ’ mi-r-n ħažat y-oq ža xizor ƛexu-ru-ni sisi-ni ɣˤuruš-ƛin endur-tow esi-n eže-ni žek’u-a ʕaq’lu boƛ’araw r-odi-xozo łina-ł-n cim xizor b-iq’ˤir sabru ader adek’-ƛin
\g one-CNTR advice teach-IMPR-QUOT above boy turn.back-ANT.CVB way-AD.ESS go-CSL.CVB you-LAT-TOP necessary II-become DEM1.SG back remain-PST.PRT-DEF other-DEF ruble-QUOT that.way-EMPH tell-PFV.CVB old-DEF man-ERG advice any IV-do-PRS.PRT.OBL what.OBL-CONT.ESS-TOP malice back III-move.aside patience forward push.forward-QUOT
\l When the boy insisted: "Give me another advice!", the old man said the advice that way: "When you go on your way, the remaining ruble will become necessary for you. Anything evil that might be done should be moved aside, and patience should be pushed forward."

\t Howži nesi žek’a ža uži debez mi hunix ik’iƛin egirno.
\m howži nesi žek’u-a ža uži mi-z mi huni-x ik’i-ƛin egir-n
\g now DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG DEM1.SG boy you-GEN2 you way-AD.ESS go-QUOT let-PST.UNW
\l Now the man let the boy go: "Go on your way!"

\t Elay oqno ik’iƛ’oräy, yisir hunix xalq’i keze boqno.
\m ele-ay oq-n ik’i-ƛ’oräy yisi-r huni-x xalq’i keze b-oq-n
\g there-IN.ABL become-PFV.CVB go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT way-AD.ESS people meet III-become-PST.UNW
\l While he was getting away from there, he met some people on the way.

\t Žeda yeda ader egirno eli xizaz bayanƛin.
\m žedu-a yeda ader egir-n eli xizaz b-ay-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG forward send-PFV.CVB we behind I.PL-come-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l They sent him ahead, [saying]: "We'll come behind."

\t Ža uži qˤilon ok’ełno, sidaɣ ɣˤuɣˤura iħuz lilyoxor ayn.
\m ža uži qˤilo-n ok’eł-n sidaɣ ɣˤuɣˤuru iħu-z lilyo-xor ay-n
\g DEM1.SG boy erroneously-TOP go.away-PFV.CVB in.one.place muddy river-GEN2 river.bank-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l The boy went a wrong way and came to a muddy river bank somewhere.

\t Elo waħo gibu bukayx zownanu.
\m elo waħo gibu b-ukad-x zow-n-anu
\g there below sand III-see-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l He didn't see the sand below, there.

\t Sosisi łäł taqˤor oqanix yisis pikru boqäsi zown.
\m sosi-si łi-ł taqˤo-r oq-ani-x yisi-s pikru b-oq-asi zow-n
\g at.first-ATTR water-CONT.ESS over.there-LAT become-MSD-AD.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 idea III-become-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His first idea was to get through the water.

\t Xizyo šeyxä äƛiru šebin yisiz rok’ƛ’or raynosi ičiqeqełno.
\m xizyo šayx-a eƛi-ru šebin yisi-z rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-nosi ičiqeqeł-n
\g afterwards sheikh-ERG say-PST.PRT thing DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come-ANT.CVB pause-PST.UNW
\l Then he remembered what the sheikh had said and paused.

\t Hemedur iħuz raʕalłix yeda yałzay, guluƛ’no zown žek’u oƛixno.
\m hemedur iħu-z raʕalłi-x yeda yoł-zay gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n žek’u oƛix-n
\g so river-GEN2 edge-AD.ESS DEM2.ISG be-SIM.CVB horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB man appear-PST.UNW
\l So while he was at the edge of the river, a man riding on a horse appeared.

\t Užide igorno ayn, šebi mi t’o rodixƛin, nesiqay bayan bisno.
\m uži-de igo-r-n ay-n šebi mi t’o r-odi-x-ƛin nesi-qay bayan b-is-n
\g boy-APUD.ESS near-LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB what you here IV-do-PRS-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL information III-take-PST.UNW
\l He came near the boy and wanted to know from him: "What are you doing here?"

\t Yisan esin, iħu taqˤor boɣa koƛ’inč’ey ƛexasi yołƛin.
\m yisi-a-n esi-n iħu taqˤo-r b-oɣ-a koƛ’i-č’ey ƛexu-asi yoł-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP tell-PST.UNW river over.there-LAT III-cross-INF understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB remain-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l And he said: "I don't know how to cross the river to the other side."

\t Šebi toxaw xabar bexurxoƛin, yisä yedu gulu łäłer k’oƛirno.
\m šebi toxaw xabar b-exur-x-ƛin yisi-a yedu gulu łi-łer k’oƛi-r-n
\g what weak story III-kill-PRS-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG horse water-CONT.LAT run-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l "What a weak story!", he [said and] made his horse run into the water.

\t Boƛƛäɣor bayzaƛ’ortow, gulun, nełaƛ’gon ƛ’irisini ža č’uħarawni žek’un ɣˤuɣˤuruni neł iħä butirno caƛin, boɣno bižin ƛ’iräy wˤałer.
\m b-oƛƛo-aɣor b-ay-zaƛ’or-tow gulu-n neła-ƛ’-gon ƛ’iri-si-ni ža č’uħaraw-ni žek’u-n ɣˤuɣˤuru-ni neła iħu-a b-utir-n caƛi-n b-oɣ-n b-iži-n ƛ’iräy wˤał-r
\g III-middle-IN.VERS I.PL-come-POST.CVB-EMPH horse-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-CNTR on-ATTR-DEF DEM1.SG proud-DEF man-and muddy-DEF DEM1.IISG.OBL river-IN.ESS I.PL-turn-PFV.CVB stick-PFV.CVB I.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB I.PL-take.out-PFV.CVB from.above downward-LAT
\l Before they reached the middle, the horse and the proud man on it got stuck in that muddy river, and it pulled them downward.

\t Zamanałäy gulu ƛ’iriɣor boƛixno, ža žek’u na eƛa t’ok’ow iynanu.
\m zaman-łay gulu ƛ’iri-ɣor b-oƛix-n ža žek’u na eƛi-a t’ok’ow iy-n-anu
\g time-CONT.ABL horse above-IN.ALL III-appear-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG man where say-INF anymore know-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l After some time, the horse appeared on the surface, but no one knew where the man was.

\t Igorno ik’in ezuzaƛ’, guluƛ’ ƛ’iri q’ˤanon micxiryos ric’äsi ħurženyabi resun.
\m igo-r-n ik’i-n ezu-zaƛ’ gulu-ƛ’ ƛ’iri q’ˤano-n micxir-s r-ic’-asi ħuržen-bi r-esu-n
\g near-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB look-CSL.CVB horse-SUPER.ESS on two-TOP money-GEN1 III.PL-fill-RES.PRT bag-PL III.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l When he came closer to look, he found two bags filled with money on the horse.

\t Yeda uži gulun ader boɣno oqno.
\m yeda uži gulu-n ader b-oɣ-n oq-n
\g DEM2.ISG boy horse-TOP forward III-take.away-PFV.CVB become-PST.UNW
\l The boy drove the horse and went on.

\t Sidaɣ ƛen besun, taqˤorno oqno ik’iƛ’oräy, hunix halmaɣbi dandir keze boqno.
\m sidaɣ ƛe-n b-esu-n taqˤo-r-n oq-n ik’i-ƛ’oräy huni-x halmaɣ-bi dandir keze b-oq-n
\g in.one.place bridge-TOP III-find-PFV.CVB over.there-LAT-TOP become-PFV.CVB go-SIM.CVB way-AD.ESS friend-PL towards meet I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l He found a bridge somewhere and while he was going over it, some friends came toward him on his way.

\t Qˤišdäy sodersi zaman baynosi, yizirabi rešt’izi boqanix sidaɣ sanaʕataw mečoƛ’or bayn.
\m qˤišdäy soder-si zaman b-ay-nosi yizirabi rešt’izi b-oq-ani-x sidaɣ sanaʕataw moči-ƛ’or b-ay-n
\g at.noon.APUD.ABL after-ATTR time III-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.PL take.a.rest I.PL-become-MSD-AD.ESS in.one.place comfortable place-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l When the afternoon had come, they came to a comfortable place to take a rest.

\t Yisi užis šeyxa badiru ʕaq’lun rok’ƛ’or bayn, qˤišodäy soder ħon xäcinƛin, howt’o rešt’izi boqanƛin hudulzaqor xabar boynosi, žedur biča retinanu, ħon xecan ži yedu elaƛin, pesaxamuƛ’ žan ayrno, hunix boqno.
\m yisi uži-s šayx-a b-odi-ru ʕaq’lu-n rok’u-ƛ’or b-ay-n qˤišod-ay soder ħon xeci-n-ƛin howt’o rešt’izi b-oq-an-ƛin hudul-bi-qor xabar b-odi-nosi žedu-r b-iči-a r-eti-n-anu ħon xeci-an ži yedu elu-a-ƛin pesaxamu-ƛ’ ža-n ayr-n huni-x b-oq-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-GEN1 sheikh-ERG III-do-PST.PRT advice-TOP heart-SUPER.LAT III-come-PFV.CVB at.noon-IN.ABL after mountain go.up-PROHIB-QUOT here take.a.rest I.PL-become-FUT.DEF-QUOT friend-PL-POSS.LAT story III-do-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT I.PL-wait-INF IV-want-PFV.CVB-NEG mountain go.up-FUT.DEF now DEM2.IISG we(I).OBL-ERG-QUOT coward-SUPER.ESS DEM1.SG-TOP call-PFV.CVB way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The boy remembered the advice the sheikh gave: "Don't go up a mountain in the afternoon!", and told his friends: "We'll take a rest here.", but they didn't want to wait, "We will go up the mountain now.", called him a coward and got on their way.

\t Uži yołi isin, qeman raynč’iza paraxat oqno ičäsi zown sasaqosi ɣudi qˤašaceƛin.
\m uži yołi isi-n qema-n r-ay-č’i-za paraxat oq-n iči-asi zow-n sasaqosi ɣudi qˤaši-ace-ƛin
\g boy however snow-and rain-and II.PL-come-NEG.FUT.CVB-LCV calm become-PFV.CVB wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW in.the.morning day set.in-TERM-QUOT
\l The boy however calmly waited where the snow and rain didn't come to until the day set in the next morning.

\t Q’arƛ’o izin maħorno oqno ezuzaƛ’, yisir rocasi ɣudin resux, c’oxäsigon boboru buqno bukayx.
\m q’ar-ƛ’ izi-n maħor-n oq-n ezu-zaƛ’ yisi-r r-ocu-asi ɣudi-n r-esu-x c’ox-asi-gon boboru buq-n b-ukad-x
\g early-SUPER.ESS get.up-PFV.CVB outside-TOP become-PFV.CVB look-CSL.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-become.clean-RES.PRT day-TOP IV-find-IPFV.CVB hit-RES.PRT-CNTR hot sun-TOP III-see-PRS
\l When he got up early and went outside, he found a clear day and the hot sun shining.

\t Išno-utin, partalno rutirno, nesä nesiz hunix ik’iƛ’oräy, aziroyn, k’omo biłet’a boqno bexasi halmaɣbi besun.
\m iš~uti-n partal-n r-utir-n nesi-a nesi-z huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy azirod-n k’omo b-iłe-t’a b-oq-n b-exu-asi halmaɣ-bi b-esu-n
\g eat-PFV.CVB belongings-TOP IV-gather-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB freeze.to.death-PFV.CVB ball I.PL-as-DISTR I.PL-become-PFV.CVB I.PL-die-RES.PRT friend-PL I.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l He ate, gathered his belongings, and while he went on his way, he found his friends, frozen to death and each one rolled together like a ball.

\t Allahes ħukmu nediw zownƛin šukrun bodin, nełaz ža q’aʕidaƛ’ yisä yizi buyn šušin, elaygon bitor ik’in.
\m Allah-s ħukmu nediw zow-n-ƛin šukru-n b-odi-n neła-z ža q’aʕida-ƛ’ yisi-a yizi b-uy-n šuši-n ele-ay-gon bitor ik’i-n
\g God-GEN1 decision such be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT patience-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 DEM1.SG manner-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL III-indeed-TOP bury-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither go-PST.UNW
\l "So was Allah's decision.", he [said,] showed patience, burried them in its manner and went away from there.

\t Sidaɣ rut’uga quqirxo bazargan esun.
\m sidaɣ rut’uga quqi-r-x bazargan esu-n
\g in.one.place carpet dry.out-CAUS-IPFV.CVB merchant find-PST.UNW
\l In some place, he found a merchant who was drying a carpet.

\t Žoyän nesiq neširu raqru łinałäy esin.
\m uži-a-n nesi-q neširu r-oq-ru łina-łay esi-n
\g boy-ERG-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS at.night IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW
\l The boy also told him what had happened at night.

\t Nesä eƛin, ele eže žek’us ʕaq’lu biszaƛ’, Allahätow xʷasar oyn miƛin.
\m nesi-a eƛi-n ele eže žek’u-s ʕaq’lu b-is-zaƛ’ Allah-a-tow xʷasar odi-n mi-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW here old man-GEN1 advice III-take-CSL.CVB God-ERG-EMPH rescue do-PST.UNW you-QUOT
\l He said: "Because you sticked to an old man's advice, God himself has rescued you!"

\t Qˤišodes mixno bayäsi boqzaƛ’, bazarganä yeda uži išʷanix goƛ’in.
\m qˤišod-s mix-n b-ay-asi b-oq-zaƛ’ bazargan-a yeda uži iš-ani-x goƛ’i-n
\g dinner-GEN1 time-TOP III-come-RES.PRT III-begin-CSL.CVB merchant-ERG DEM2.ISG boy eat-MSD-AD.ESS invite-PST.UNW
\l When the dinner time began, the merchant invited the boy to eat.

\t Mekoyx oqłin, išinč’ey baq’ˤu zamanno zowzaƛ’, yeda uži sosisi išxanuƛin ičäsi zown, kʷat’izi oqnäy di t’otow äčiƛin.
\m mekod-x oq-łin iš-č’ey b-aq’ˤu zaman-n zow-zaƛ’ yeda uži sosi-si iš-x-anu-ƛin iči-asi zow-n kʷat’izi oq-näy di t’o-tow iči-ƛin
\g be.hungry-IPFV.CVB begin-CNC.CVB eat-NEG.PST.CVB III-much time-TOP be.NPRS-CSL.CVB DEM2.ISG boy at.first-ATTR eat-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.late become-CND.CVB me here-EMPH wait-QUOT
\l Although he was hungry and hadn't eaten for a long time, the boy waited at first: "I won't eat. If it gets late, I will wait here."

\t Bazarganä roƛik’no eƛuk’yazay bišan, axbin rodin, kʷaxatow hunix boqno.
\m bazargan-a r-oƛik’-n eƛuk’-azay bišʷa-n ax-bi-n r-odi-n kʷaxa-tow huni-x b-oq-n
\g merchant-ERG IV-pull.out-PFV.CVB leather.sack-IN.ABL.DIST food-and belly-PL-TOP IV.PL-do-PFV.CVB soon-EMPH way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The merchant pulled out food from a leather sack, they stuffed their tummies and soon went on their way.

\t Adäz keze baqru halmaɣłi iłeda yeda esanƛin rok’ƛ’ort’a rayx zown žas.
\m adäz keze b-oq-ru halmaɣłi iłe-da yeda esu-an-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or-t’a r-ay-x zow-n uži-s
\g ahead meet I.PL-become-PST.PRT friendship as-COND DEM2.ISG exist-FUT.DEF-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT-DISTR IV-come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW boy-GEN1
\l The boy thought several times: "Maybe he will be just like the friends he met before."

\t Zamanałäy bik’in q’ˤunesno ƛirbabi yałza sida ʕaƛar baynosi, yizi q’ˤunesno daʕba boqno, däz ƛirbadäɣor bik’ixƛin bazargan zown, ay däzodäɣorƛin uži zown ičäsi.
\m zaman-łay b-ik’i-n q’ˤuna-s-n ƛirba-bi yoł-za sida ʕaƛ-ar b-ay-nosi yizi q’ˤuna-s-n daʕba b-oq-n di-z ƛirba-däɣor b-ik’i-x-ƛin bazargan zow-n ay di-zo-däɣor-ƛin uži zow-n iči-asi
\g time-CONT.ABL I.PL-go-PFV.CVB two.OBL-GEN1-TOP comrade-PL be-LCV one.OBL village-IN.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL two.OBL-GEN1-TOP dispute I.PL-become-PFV.CVB me-GEN2 comrade-APUD.VERS I.PL-go-PRS-QUOT merchant be.NPRS-PFV.CVB come me-ATTR.OBL-APUD.VERS-QUOT boy be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT
\l After some time, when they came to a village where they both had comrades, the two of them got into a dispute: "We are going to my comrade.", said the merchant and "Come to mine!" said the boy.

\t Xizaɣor bazarganä uži muk’urno oyn, nesä nesiz ƛirbadäɣor bik’inosi, elo sisxoli ɣˤanabi yesun.
\m xizaɣor bazargan-a uži muk’ur-n odi-n nesi-a nesi-z ƛirba-däɣor b-ik’i-nosi elo sisxoli ɣˤanabi y-esu-n
\g finally merchant-ERG boy persuade-TOP do-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 comrade-APUD.VERS I.PL-go-ANT.CVB there alone woman II-find-PST.UNW
\l Finally the merchant persuaded the boy and when they went to his own comrade, they found a single woman.

\t Dicegon bazarganä ħaƛoƛin c’ok’inayn yaħmoƛ’ ayra oqłin, uži et’un k’oƛin ičin ħaƛuxanuƛin.
\m dice-gon bazargan-a ħaƛu-o-ƛin c’ok’inad-n yaħ-ƛ’ ayr-a oq-łin uži et’u-n k’oƛi-n iči-n ħaƛu-x-anu-ƛin
\g how.much-CNTR merchant-ERG drink-IMPR-QUOT scold-PFV.CVB conscience-SUPER.ESS bring-INF become-CNC.CVB boy jump-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB be-PFV.CVB drink-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l How much the merchant scolded him to bring him to his conscience: "Drink!", the boy ran away [saying]: "I don't drink."

\t Bazargan yołi ħaƛaniłer oqno.
\m bazargan yołi ħaƛu-ani-łer oq-n
\g merchant however drink-MSD-CONT.LAT begin-PST.UNW
\l The merchant however began to drink.

\t Zamanałäygon neside puħo, puräzagon t’asno eqerno, ža ɣˤanabin q’ˤida yičin.
\m zaman-łay-gon nesi-de pu-x pu-aza-gon t’as-n eqer-n ža ɣˤanabi-n q’ˤida y-iči-n
\g time-CONT.ABL-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS side-AD.ESS side-IN.VERS.DIST-CNTR washbowl-TOP put-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG woman-TOP down II-sit-PST.UNW
\l And after some time the woman sat down next to him and put a washbowl at his side.

\t Bazarganä q’ˤunerno yic’xot’a t’akan et’nosi, nesä ħaƛux zown, yiła enduräz t’asmaɣor yiħurxo zown.
\m bazargan-a q’ˤuna-r-n y-ic’-x-t’a t’akan et’-nosi nesi-a ħaƛu-x zow-n yiła-a endur-az t’as-ɣor y-iħur-x zow-n
\g merchant-ERG two.OBL-LAT-TOP II-fill-IPFV.CVB-DISTR glass pour-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG drink-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG that.way-IN.ESS.DIST washbowl-IN.ALL II-pour-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After the merchant poured a glass full for each of them, he drank, and she poured it into the washbowl in the same way.

\t Bigza ħalałno ħaƛun, q’ˤimär baynosi, utin c’oxno mežä kecno ičin.
\m b-ig-za ħal-ł-n ħaƛu-n q’ˤim-ar b-ay-nosi uti-n c’ox-n muži-a kec-n iči-n
\g III-good-ZA strength-CONT.ESS-TOP drink-PFV.CVB head-IN.LAT III-come-ANT.CVB turn-PFV.CVB hit-PFV.CVB mattress-IN.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l Having drunken heavily, and after it got into his head, he went to bed and slept.

\t Uži mažgityaɣor keca ik’ixƛin oqnosi, yedu ƛ’iri yutin ƛirba kecanix mažgityaɣor egiranix elude lamusaw šebin yołƛin.
\m uži mažgit-aɣor kec-a ik’i-x-ƛin oq-nosi yedu ƛ’iri y-uti-n ƛirba kec-ani-x mažgit-aɣor egir-ani-x elu-de lamusaw šebin yoł-ƛin
\g boy mosque-IN.VERS sleep-INF go-PRS-QUOT become-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG above II-turn-PFV.CVB comrade sleep-MSD-AD.ESS mosque-IN.VERS let-MSD-AD.ESS we(I).OBL-APUD.ESS shameful thing be-QUOT
\l When the boy was about to go to the mosque to sleep, she insisted: "It is a shame for us to send a comrade to the mosque for him to sleep!"

\t Eludegon ƛirbałix keze oqno idu teł kecnäy lamus bičixosiƛin, oqno ičin.
\m elu-de-gon ƛirbałi-x keze oq-n idu teł kec-näy lamus b-iči-xosi-ƛin oq-n iči-n
\g we(I).OBL-APUD.ESS-CNTR hospitality-AD.ESS meet become-PFV.CVB home inside sleep-CND.CVB shame III-be-PRS.PRT-QUOT become-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l And he was like: "And for us it's a shame if someone is a guest and sleeps in one's home."

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, eƛin užä dahawcen ičin, mažgityaɣorno ik’ač’in, idun kecač’in.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin eƛi-n uži-a dahaw-ce-n iči-n mažgit-aɣor-n ik’i-ač’in idu-n kec-ač’in
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy-ERG a.little-EQU1-TOP wait-PFV.CVB mosque-IN.VERS-and go-NEG.FUT.DEF home-and sleep-NEG.FUT.DEF
\l "If that's the case," said the boy, "I'll wait a little, and will neither go to the mosque, nor sleep here at home.

\t Raɣäza akix där muži kuroƛin.
\m raɣi-aza aki-x di-r muži kur-o-ƛin
\g veranda-IN.VERS.DIST window-AD.ESS me-LAT mattress spread.out-IMPR-QUOT
\l Spread out a mattress for me at the window on the veranda!"

\t P’estow anusi, xalq’i kecnaƛin maħorno yoqno yezu-yoƛ’ˤun, boƛik’u xalq’i kecani boqzaƛ’, yutin idurno nexno, dahawgon q’ˤidan yičin sosigon yeza yoqnosi, sidakin ɣˤutka č’ura rukaynanu.
\m p’es-tow anu-si xalq’i kec-n-a-ƛin maħor-n y-oq-n y-ezu~oƛ’ˤu-n boƛik’u xalq’i kec-ani b-oq-zaƛ’ y-uti-n idu-r-n nex-n dahaw-gon q’ˤida-n y-iči-n sosi-gon y-ezu-a y-oq-nosi sida-kin ɣˤutku-a č’ura r-ukad-n-anu
\g sound-EMPH be.NEG-ATTR people sleep-PFV.CVB-Q-QUOT outside-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB II-examine-PFV.CVB half people sleep-MSD III-become-CSL.CVB II-return-PFV.CVB home-LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB a.little-CNTR down-TOP II-sit-PFV.CVB again-CNTR II-look-INF II-begin-ANT.CVB one.OBL-even house-IN.ESS light IV-see-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l Without any sound, she went outside and examined if the people were asleep, and because half the people weren't sleeping [yet], she came back home, sat down a little and when she started to look again, not even in one single house she saw a light.

\t Maħazay yutin yedu yayzaƛ’orgon, käcrus riłen rodin mežä utin c’oxno užin ičin, šebičey yiła radiƛin.
\m ma-x-azay y-uti-n yedu y-ay-zaƛ’or-gon kec-ru-s r-iłe-n r-odi-n muži-a uti-n c’ox-n uži-n iči-n šebi-čey yiła-a r-odi-ƛin
\g outside-AD.ESS-IN.ABL.DIST II-return-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG II-come-POST.CVB-CNTR sleep-PST.PRT-GEN1 IV-as-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB mattress-IN.ESS turn-PFV.CVB hit-PFV.CVB boy-TOP be-PFV.CVB what-INTS DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG IV-do-QUOT
\l Before she came back from outside, the boy layed down on the mattress and pretended to sleep [thinking]: "What the heck will she do?"

\t Idur yaynosi, užigon kecäsi esunosi, asoqtow yitin.
\m idu-r y-ay-nosi uži-gon kec-asi esu-nosi as-q-tow y-iti-n
\g home-LAT II-come-ANT.CVB boy-CNTR sleep-RES.PRT find-ANT.CVB sky-POSS.ESS-EMPH II-touch-PST.UNW
\l When she came home, she found the boy sleeping and was in seventh heaven.

\t Zamanaƛ’azay bak’arizin boqno ʕagarłisno, ʕaƛosno ʕoloqbin bayn, reƛ’ibin ricin bexuranixƛin bižiƛ’oräy užä eƛin, mežur šebintow riynč’ey šida eli bexura bižix.
\m zaman-ƛ’azay bak’arizi-n b-oq-n ʕagarłi-s-n ʕaƛ-s-n ʕoloq-bi-n b-ay-n reƛ’a-bi-n r-ici-n b-exur-ani-x-ƛin b-iži-ƛ’oräy uži-a eƛi-n mežu-r šebin-tow r-iy-č’ey šida eli b-exur-a b-iži-x
\g time-SUPER.ABL.DIST gathering-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB relatives-GEN1-and village-GEN1-and young.person-PL-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB hand-PL-TOP IV.PL-tie-PFV.CVB I.PL-kill-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT I.PL-take.out-SIM.CVB boy-ERG say-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-LAT thing-EMPH IV-know-NEG.PST.CVB why we I.PL-kill-INF I.PL-take.out-PRS
\l After some time, the young persons from the relatives and the village came together, bandaged their hands and while they took them out to kill them, the boy said: "Why are you taking us out to kill us without knowing anything?!

\t Nełas uži ela exuräsi esunäy, bazarganzo čantasi t’aqˤ mežur ruqäsi räsu, neła exuräsi esunäy raɣˤäsi räsuƛin.
\m neła-s uži elu-a exur-asi esu-näy bazargan-z čanta-a-si t’aqˤ mežu-r r-uqi-asi r-esu neła-a exur-asi esu-näy r-ˤaɣˤi-asi r-esu-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 son we(I).OBL-ERG kill-RES.PRT exist-CND.CVB merchant-GEN2 pocket-IN.ESS-ATTR knife you(I).PL.OBL-LAT IV-close-RES.PRT IV-find DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG kill-RES.PRT exist-CND.CVB IV-open-RES.PRT IV-exist-QUOT
\l If we have killed her son, you will find the knife in the merchant's pocket closed, if she has killed him, it will be open.

\t Yizä xal bodinosi, bazarganzo čanta teł iyos ric’äsi, raɣˤäsitow t’aqˤ resunosi dandi yizi bužzi boqno.
\m yizi-a xal b-odi-nosi bazargan-z čanta-a teł iyo-s r-ic’-asi r-ˤaɣˤi-asi-tow t’aqˤ r-esu-nosi dandi yizi bužzi b-oq-n
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG examination III-do-ANT.CVB merchant-GEN2 pocket-IN.ESS inside blood-GEN1 IV-fill-RES.PRT IV-open-RES.PRT-EMPH knife IV-find-ANT.CVB now DEM2.IPL believe I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l They did an examination, found the blood-stained, open knife in the merchant's pocket and now believed them.

\t Xizyo užä sadaq raqru łinałäyn esin.
\m xizyo uži-a sadaq r-oq-ru łina-łay-n esi-n
\g afterwards boy-ERG all IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP tell-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards the boy told them everything that had happened.

\t Neła buqˤno zawruni q’ayn bižin, žeda žedus ʕaƛazaɣorno bik’in.
\m neła-a b-uqˤi-n zow-ru-ni q’ay-n b-iži-n žedu-a žedu-s ʕaƛ-bi-aɣor-n b-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG III-hide-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF article-TOP III-take.out-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 village-PL-IN.VERS-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB
\l They took out the article that she hid, and went to their own villages.

\t ʕAƛoz xalq’imon, ʕagarłän t’ok’ow nełqay reƛ’an kurno, howłaƛ’aygon žuk yičiƛin.
\m ʕaƛ-z xalq’i-a-n ʕagarłi-a-n t’ok’ow neła-qay reƛ’a-n kur-n howła-ƛ’ay-gon žuk y-iči-ƛin
\g village-GEN2 people-ERG-and relatives-ERG-and anymore DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL hand-TOP spread.out-PFV.CVB DEM3.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL-CNTR worse II-live-QUOT
\l The people from the village and the relatives all took their hands from her[, saying]: "Live worse than that!"

\t Ik’in ʕaƛar yeda uži aynosi, nesä nesis ɣˤutku k’edix yałzay, qiƛ’orok’uƛ’ay dandir barun keze yoqno, sadaq iduɣor bik’in.
\m ik’i-n ʕaƛ-ar yeda uži ay-nosi nesi-a nesi-s ɣˤutku k’edi-x yoł-zay qiƛ’orok’uƛ’ay dandir baru-n keze y-oq-n sadaq idu-ɣor b-ik’i-n
\g go-PFV.CVB village-IN.LAT DEM2.ISG boy come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 house search-IPFV.CVB be-SIM.CVB by.accident together wife-TOP meet II-become-PFV.CVB together home-IN.ALL I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l When the boy came into the village, he met his wife by accident while he was searching for his own house, and they went home together.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder yizä łinasno q’ʷariłi anusi bercinłiƛ’ ʕumru bižin.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder yizi-a łina-s-n q’ʷariłi anu-si bercinłi-ƛ’ ʕumru b-iži-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG what.OBL-GEN1-TOP sadness be.NEG-ATTR beauty-SUPER.ESS life III-lead-PST.UNW
\l After that they lead a beautiful life without any sadness whatsoever.

\t Howžin hemedurtow yołƛax žedu.
\m howži-n hemedur-tow yoł-ƛax žedu
\g now-TOP so-EMPH be-QUOT DEM1.IPL
\l And it's said they still are like that.

\t Zownƛax zownanuƛax ader zamanał Ceƛ’o sida ʕaƛa Ražbadinƛin ci rik’äsi bahadur.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax ader zaman-ł Ceƛ’o sida ʕaƛ-a Ražbadin-ƛin ci r-ik’i-asi bahadur
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT earlier time-CONT.ESS Tsetlo one.OBL village-IN.ESS Razhbadin-QUOT name IV-go-RES.PRT hero
\l Once upon a long time ago in the Tsetlo village there was a hero who went by the name of "Razhbadin".

\t Sida quł yeda dawlaƛ’ Huläɣor ik’a ħadur oqxo.
\m sida qu-ł yeda dawla-ƛ’ Hulä-aɣor ik’i-a ħadur oq-x
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.ISG prey-SUPER.ESS Georgia-IN.VERS go-INF prepare become-IPFV.CVB
\l One day he prepared to go to Georgia for hunting.

\t Ražbadin ħadur oqxon iyn, ʕaƛoz ʕoloqza nesiq harizi rodin, elin Huläɣor dawlaƛ’ bižoƛin.
\m Ražbadin ħadur oq-x-n iy-n ʕaƛ-z ʕoloq-bi-a nesi-q harizi r-odi-n eli-n Hulä-aɣor dawla-ƛ’ b-iži-o-ƛin
\g Razhbadin prepare become-IPFV.CVB-TOP know-PFV.CVB village-GEN2 young.person-PL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PST.UNW we-TOP Georgia-IN.VERS prey-SUPER.ESS I.PL-lead-IMPR-QUOT
\l Knowing that Razhbadin was preparing, the young people from the village asked him: "Lead us to Georgia for hunting as well!"

\t Bahadur igtow razi oqxo sadaqor halmaɣłi roqxoƛin.
\m bahadur ig-tow razi oq-x sadaq-r halmaɣłi r-oq-x-ƛin
\g hero well-EMPH agree become-IPFV.CVB together-LAT friendship IV-become-PRS-QUOT
\l The hero accepted well that there were friends with him.

\t Sida quł rocazo ɣudƛ’o yizirabi hunix boqxo.
\m sida qu-ł r-ocu-azo ɣudi-ƛ’ yizirabi huni-x b-oq-x
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS IV-become.clean-RES.PRT.OBL day-SUPER.ESS DEM2.PL way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PRS
\l On a clear day then, they got on their way.

\t Sadaq bik’iƛ’orey, sida sidqo xabaryabi esix Ražbadinno halmaɣbin cezyazno qazaqzazno ʕurqixor bayx.
\m sadaq b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy sida-a sida-q xabar-bi esi-x Ražbadin-n halmaɣ-bi-n cez-z-n qazaq-bi-z-n ʕurqi-xor b-ay-x
\g together I.PL-go-SIM.CVB one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.ESS story-PL tell-IPFV.CVB Razhbadin-and friend-PL-and Tsez-GEN2-and Georgian-PL-GEN2-and border-AD.LAT I.PL-come-PRS
\l While they were walking together, Razhbadin and his friends were talking with each other and came to the Tsez and Georgian border.

\t Elo yizir qazaqzas bˤeƛ’es reqenyabi resux.
\m elo yizi-r qazaq-bi-s bˤeƛ’-s reqen-bi r-esu-x
\g there DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT Georgian-PL-GEN1 sheep-GEN1 herd-PL III.PL-find-IPFV.CVB
\l There they found herds of sheep from the Georgians.

\t Horoƛin, eƛix xizyo Ražbadinä halmaɣłiqor, Huläɣor eli łinar bik’an, howt’aytow bˤeƛ’no rok’ek’no xizor butin rigu anaƛin.
\m horo-ƛin eƛi-x xizyo Ražbadin-a halmaɣłi-qor Hulä-aɣor eli łinar b-ik’i-an howt’ay-tow bˤeƛ’-n r-ok’ek’-n xizor b-uti-n r-igu anu-a-ƛin
\g come.IMPR-QUOT say-IPFV.CVB afterwards Razhbadin-ERG friendship-POSS.LAT Georgia-IN.VERS we why I.PL-go-FUT.DEF from.here-EMPH sheep-TOP III.PL-steal.from-PFV.CVB back III-return-PFV.CVB IV-good be.NEG-Q-QUOT
\l "Come", said Razhbadin to his friends afterwards, "why shouldn't it be better for us to go back to Georgia, steal some from the flock and then return?"

\t Bahadurzo pikruƛ’ ʕoloqbi razi boqno.
\m bahadur-z pikru-ƛ’ ʕoloq-bi razi b-oq-n
\g hero-GEN2 idea-SUPER.ESS young.person-PL agree I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The young people agreed on the hero's idea.

\t ʕOloqzas zigara boƛixno, howži šebi rodanƛin.
\m ʕoloq-bi-s zigara b-oƛix-n howži šebi r-odi-an-ƛin
\g young.person-PL-GEN1 complaint III-appear-PST.UNW now what IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The young people started to complain: "What shall we do now?"

\t Bahadurä eƛin, howži di exasi žek’u yoł.
\m bahadur-a eƛi-n howži di exu-asi žek’u yoł
\g hero-ERG say-PST.UNW now me die-RES.PRT man be
\l The hero said: "Now I am a dying man.

\t Däxor bičinč’ey, qˤalmoƛ din uqˤo, xexłiƛ’ mežin xizor butiƛin.
\m di-xor b-iči-č’ey qˤal-ƛ di-n uqˤi-o xexłi-ƛ’ meži-n xizor b-uti-ƛin
\g me-AD.LAT I.PL-wait-NEG.PST.CVB brushwood-SUB.ESS me-TOP hide-IMPR quickness-SUPER.ESS you.PL-TOP back I.PL-return-QUOT
\l Don't wait for me, hide me under the brushwood and go back quickly!"

\t Qazaqzar roda šebinon koƛ’inč’ey, sasiw ɣudin roqzaƛ’, xizaz k’oƛin bik’iƛ’orey, yizi rešt’izi boqno Ražbadin aqˤza mečox igo.
\m qazaq-bi-r r-odi-a šebinon koƛ’i-č’ey sasiw ɣudi-n r-oq-zaƛ’ xizaz k’oƛi-n b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy yizi rešt’izi b-oq-n Ražbadin uqˤi-za moči-x igo
\g Georgian-PL-LAT IV-do-INF something understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB gloomy day-TOP IV-become-CSL.CVB from.behind run-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-SIM.CVB DEM2.IPL take.a.rest I.PL-become-PFV.CVB Razhbadin hide-LCV place-AD.ESS near
\l The Georgians didn't know what to do because the day got gloomy; and while running behind them they took a rest near the place where Razhbadin was hiding.

\t K’edin esurno yizä Ražbadin žeduz odoman Tawadider ižin.
\m k’edi-n esur-n yizi-a Ražbadin žedu-z odoman Tawadi-der iži-n
\g search-PFV.CVB find-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG Razhbadin DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 chief Tavadi-APUD.LAT lead-PST.UNW
\l They searched and found Razhbadin, and lead him to their leader Tavadi.

\t Qazaqza eƛix zown, yisir ʕazabno teƛno exurno kuranƛin.
\m qazaq-bi-a eƛi-x zow-n yisi-r ʕazab-n teƛ-n exur-n kur-an-ƛin
\g Georgian-PL-ERG say-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT torture-TOP give-PFV.CVB kill-PFV.CVB throw-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The Georgians were saying: "We will torture him, kill him and then throw him away!"

\t Nesiq reƛ’an ata regirinč’ey Tawadä eƛin, yeda eluł teł sisxoli yoł.
\m nesi-q reƛ’a-n at-a r-egir-č’ey Tawadi-a eƛi-n yeda elu-ł teł sisxoli yoł
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS hand-TOP touch-INF IV-let-NEG.PST.CVB Tavadi-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG we(I).OBL-CONT.ESS inside alone be
\l Tavadi didn't let them touch him and said: "He is alone among us."

\t Šebigon ela royłin yisä ɣˤaɣˤno äči.
\m šebi-gon elu-a r-odi-łin yisi-a ɣˤaɣˤ-n iči
\g what-CNTR we(I).OBL-ERG IV-do-CNC.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG endure-PFV.CVB be
\l Whatever we do to him, he will endure it.

\t Yisir rodixosi šebin därtow räyƛin.
\m yisi-r r-odi-xosi šebin di-r-tow r-iy-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-do-PRS.PRT thing me-LAT-EMPH IV-know-QUOT
\l I'll know what we do to him."

\t Hudayzikotow Tawadä Ražbadin Telawi šaharyarno ižin riguƛ’ay rigut’a daruyabin risno saɣ odix.
\m hudayziko-tow Tawadi-a Ražbadin Telawi šahar-ar-n iži-n r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu-t’a daru-a-bi-n r-is-n saɣ odi-x
\g the.next.day-EMPH Tavadi-ERG Razhbadin Telavi city-IN.LAT-TOP lead-PFV.CVB IV-good-SUPER.ABL IV-good-DISTR medicine-Q-PL-TOP IV-buy-PFV.CVB cure do-PRS
\l The next day Tavadi lead Razhbadin to the city of Telavi, bought him the best medicine and cured him.

\t Zamanałäy q’ˤimes idusi žek’u iłe oqxo yisis Ražbadin.
\m zaman-łay q’ˤim-s idu-si žek’u iłe oq-x yisi-s Ražbadin
\g time-CONT.ABL oneself-GEN1 home-ATTR man as become-PRS DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 Razhbadin
\l After a while Razhbadin became like a member of his own family.

\t Yoƛo ƛˤeb yik’inosi, Tawadi ixiw suħmat roda iħux.
\m y-oƛƛo ƛˤeb y-ik’i-nosi Tawadi ixiw suħmat r-odi-a iħu-x
\g II-middle year II-go-ANT.CVB Tavadi big celebration IV-do-INF begin-PRS
\l After a year had passed, Tavadi began to organize a big celbration.

\t Ražbadinä, yisä royxosi šebinno bič’zi roqinč’ey, esirno yisiq, ya žax baruwa yowxanu mi, ya xedyox kidwa yegirxanu.
\m Ražbadin-a yisi-a r-odi-xosi šebin-n bič’zi r-oq-č’ey esir-n yisi-q ya uži-x baru-a y-ow-x-anu mi ya xediw-x kid-a y-egir-x-anu
\g Razhbadin-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG IV-do-PRS.PRT thing-TOP understand IV-become-NEG.PST.CVB ask-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS neither son-AD.ESS wife-Q II-marry-IPFV.CVB-NEG you neither husband-AD.ESS daughter-Q II-send-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l Razhbadin, who did not understand what he [Tavadi] was doing, asked him: "You neither mary off your son, nor your daughter.

\t Šebin roƛor risno yedu suħmat royx mi.
\m šebin r-oƛƛo-r r-is-n yedu suħmat r-odi-x mi
\g thing IV-middle-LAT IV-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG celebration IV-do-PRS you
\l You took the thing to the middle and organize this celebration.(?)

\t Tawadä eƛix yisiqor, mi däde sadaq ƛˤeb yaɣrus yedu rok’uɣʷey rodixƛin.
\m Tawadi-a eƛi-x yisi-qor mi di-de sadaq ƛˤeb y-oɣ-ru-s yedu rok’uɣʷey r-odi-x-ƛin
\g Tavadi-ERG say-PRS DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT you me-APUD.ESS together year II-spend.time-PST.PRT-GEN1 DEM2.IISG banquet IV-do-PRS-QUOT
\l Tavadi said to him: "You and me, we will prepare the banquet of our spending together one year."

\t Ža nesä eƛinosi yeda igtow lamus oqxo, qazaqä yisir bodixosi ħurmat bukayzaƛ’.
\m ža nesi-a eƛi-nosi yeda ig-tow lamus oq-x qazaq-a yisi-r b-odi-xosi ħurmat b-ukad-zaƛ’
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG much-EMPH shame become-PRS Georgian-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT III-do-PRS.PRT respect III-see-CSL.CVB
\l When he [Tavadi] said that, he [Razhbadin] became very ashamed, because he saw the respect that the Georgian showed him.

\t Reže nesiz ħurmatyoxaysi rok’uɣʷeyn rodin, sida zamanaƛ’aza Ražbadin haq’uzaƛ’ hulin, žeduƛ’ ezu-ʕoƛ’a ʕaƛaɣor ik’a retin.
\m r-eže nesi-z ħurmat-xay-si rok’uɣʷey-n r-odi-n sida zaman-ƛ’aza Ražbadin haq’u-bi-ƛ’ huli-n žedu-ƛ’ ezu~oƛ’ˤu-a ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-a r-eti-n
\g IV-big DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 respect-AD.ABL-ATTR banquet-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB one.OBL time-SUPER.VERS.DIST Razhbadin family-PL-SUPER.ESS miss-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS visit-INF village-IN.VERS go-INF IV-want-PST.UNW
\l They organized the big banquet because of his respect, and at some point in time, Razhbadin missed his family and wanted to go to the village to visit them.

\t Mi izmu neƛnay di žeduƛ’no ezun, mi bukaru zamanaƛ’or xizor utin ayanƛin.
\m mi izmu neƛ-näy di žedu-ƛ’-n ezu-n mi b-ukar-ru zaman-ƛ’or xizor uti-n ay-an-ƛin
\g you permission give-CND.CVB me DEM1.IPL-SUPER.ESS-TOP look-PFV.CVB you III-show-PST.PRT time-SUPER.LAT back return-PFV.CVB come-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l If you give the permission, I will visit them and come back at the time you showed me."

\t Deber rig räyƛin, eƛin Tawadä, deber t’o č’alʕizin roqno räsu.
\m mi-r r-ig r-iy-ƛin eƛi-n Tawadi-a mi-r t’o č’alʕizi-n r-oq-n r-esu
\g you-LAT IV-well IV-know-QUOT say-PST.UNW Tavadi-ERG you-LAT here boredom-TOP IV-become-PFV.CVB IV-exist
\l "You know well," said Tavadi, "that you've grown bored of here.

\t Ik’in däz guluzaƛ’no ezu, deber bätiru howlay łˤono gulu łet’oƛin.
\m ik’i-n di-z gulu-bi-ƛ’-n ezu mi-r b-eti-ru howlay łˤono gulu łet’i-o-ƛin
\g go-PFV.CVB me-GEN2 horse-PL-SUPER.ESS-TOP look you-LAT III-want-PST.PRT from.there three horse pick-IMPR-QUOT
\l Go and see my horses, then pick the three horses that you want out of them.

\t Q’ˤimez ʕoƛoz raʕalłixor aynosi, Ražbadiner eže žek’u keze oqno.
\m q’ˤim-z ʕoƛo-z raʕalłi-xor ay-nosi Ražbadin-r eže žek’u keze oq-n
\g oneself-GEN2 village-GEN2 edge-AD.LAT come-ANT.CVB Razhbadin-LAT old man meet become-PST.UNW
\l When he came to the edge of his own village, Razhbadin met an old man.

\t Salamno bisno ečruni žek’a yisiq esirno, debi t’o ƛirba yołäƛin.
\m salam-n b-is-n ečru-ni žek’u-a yisi-q esir-n mi-s t’o ƛirba yoł-a-ƛin
\g greeting-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB old-DEF man-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW you-GEN1 here comrade be-Q-QUOT
\l The old man greeted him and asked him: "Do you have a comrade here?"

\t Yisä eƛin, dey t’o ƛirba Ražbadin yołƛin.
\m yisi-a eƛi-n di-s t’o ƛirba Ražbadin yoł-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN1 here comrade Razhbadin be-QUOT
\l He said: "My comrade here is Razhbadin."

\t Eženi žek’a eƛin, ža Hulaɣor dawlaƛ’ äk’izay, qazaqza exursiƛin.
\m eže-ni žek’u-a eƛi-n ža Hulä-aɣor dawla-ƛ’ ik’i-zay qazaq-bi-a exu-r-si-ƛin
\g old-DEF man-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.SG Georgia-IN.VERS prey-SUPER.ESS go-SIM.CVB Georgian-PL-ERG die-CAUS-ATTR-QUOT
\l The old man said: "While he went to Georgia for prey, the Georgians have killed him."

\t Yałi ža c’aq’aw baħarči zowsƛin.
\m yałi ža c’aq’aw baħarči zow-s-ƛin
\g else DEM1.SG excellent brave.young.man be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "Otherwise he was an excellent brave young man."

\t Yisä esirno, nesiz idu žek’u yołäƛin.
\m yisi-a esir-n nesi-z idu žek’u yoł-a-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 home man be-Q-QUOT
\l He asked: "Does anyone live at his home?"

\t Ražbadinez idu barun, xexbin yołƛin, žawab teƛno ečruni žek’a.
\m Ražbadin-z idu baru-n xexbi-n yoł-ƛin žawab teƛ-n ečru-ni žek’u-a
\g Razhbadin-GEN2 home wife-and children-and be-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW old-DEF man-ERG
\l "His wife and children live at Razhbadin's home", answered the old man.

\t Yizirabi q’ˤanon Ražbadinzo barudäɣorno, xexzadäɣorno bik’in.
\m yizirabi q’ˤano-n Ražbadin-z baru-däɣor-n xexbi-däɣor-n b-ik’i-n
\g DEM2.PL two-TOP Razhbadin-GEN2 wife-APUD.VERS-and children-APUD.VERS-and I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l And the two of them went to his wife and the children.

\t Adäy aderno ik’in ečruni žek’a nesiz baruqor eƛin, mežoxor Ražbadines ƛirba aynƛin.
\m adäy ader-n ik’i-n ečru-ni žek’u-a nesi-z baru-qor eƛi-n meža-xor Ražbadin-s ƛirba ay-n-ƛin
\g ahead forward-TOP go-PFV.CVB old-DEF man-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 wife-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you(II-AD.LAT Razhbadin-GEN1 comrade come-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The old man went ahead and said to his wife: "A comrade of Razhbadin has come to you."

\t Rigutow riguƛin rok’ƛ’orno rayn, maħorno yoqno yiła guluzaƛ’ay q’ayn boɣno pikru bodin, Ražbadinqo iłäsi iłewa yeda där iyäƛin.
\m r-igu-tow r-igu-ƛin rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n maħor-n y-oq-n yiła-a gulu-bi-ƛ’ay q’ay-n b-oɣ-n pikru b-odi-n Ražbadin-q iłi-asi iłe-a yeda di-r iy-a-ƛin
\g IV-good-EMPH IV-good-QUOT heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB outside-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG horse-PL-SUPER.ABL article-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB idea III-do-PFV.CVB Razhbadin-POSS.ESS resemble-RES.PRT as-Q DEM2.ISG me-LAT know-Q-QUOT
\l "Very good", she thought, came outside and took the articles off the horse and thought: "He looks like Razhbadin."

\t Esnabi ħayran boqno ƛexun.
\m esyu-bi ħayran b-oq-n ƛexu-n
\g brother-PL be.astonished I.PL-become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l The brothers were astonished.

\t Elay bik’in idur bayrun, esnazar ža Ražbadin yałru iynosi, sidä sis ałnoxay begirinč’ey zown ʕuraw mixƛ’or.
\m ele-ay b-ik’i-n idu-r b-ay-run esyu-bi-r ža Ražbadin yoł-ru iy-nosi sida-a sis ałno-xay b-egir-č’ey zow-n ʕuraw mix-ƛ’or
\g there-IN.ABL I.PL-go-PFV.CVB home-LAT I.PL-come-IMM.ANT.CVB brother-PL-LAT DEM1.SG Razhbadin be-PST.PRT know-ANT.CVB one.OBL-ERG one embrace-AD.ABL I.PL-let-NEG.PST.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW much time-SUPER.LAT
\l Immediately when they came home, they knew it was Razhbadin, they didn't let each other out of the arms again for a long time.

\t Ražbadinä nazoƛ’no rayrno Tawadä nesiq regäru saɣyatyabi.
\m Ražbadin-a nazo-ƛ’-n r-ayr-n Tawadi-a nesi-q r-egir-ru saɣyat-bi
\g Razhbadin-ERG everyone.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP III.PL-bring-PST.UNW Tavadi-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-send-PST.PRT present-PL
\l Razhbadin brought to everyone the presents Tavadi has sent him.

\t Esnaza eƛin, mi äxuzay iłe izin ayzaƛ’, debez ħurmatyoxay ela beže bertenno bodin sis kid debex yowa yoł.
\m esyu-bi-a eƛi-n mi exu-zay iłe izi-n ay-zaƛ’ mi-z ħurmat-xay elu-a b-eže berten-n b-odi-n sis kid mi-x y-ow-a yoł
\g brother-PL-ERG say-PFV.CVB you die-SIM.CVB as get.up-PFV.CVB come-CSL.CVB you-GEN2 respect-AD.ABL we(I).OBL-ERG III-big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB one girl you-AD.ESS II-marry-INF be
\l The brothers said: "Because you came back like from the dead, we will organize a big marriage out of respect for you and marry of a girl to you.

\t ʕAƛa sis bercinaw kidno yoł, žan debex gurow nexxanuƛin.
\m ʕaƛ-a sis bercinaw kid-n yoł ža-n mi-x gurow nex-x-anu-ƛin
\g village-IN.ESS one beautiful girl-TOP be DEM1.SG-TOP you-AD.ESS except come-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l In the village there's a beautiful girl and she comes only to you."

\t Nełaƛ’ barun razi yoqno.
\m neła-ƛ’ baru-n razi y-oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS wife-TOP agree II-become-PST.UNW
\l Also his wife agreed on that.

\t Necetow žedu ƛ’iri butizaƛ’, yedan razi oqxo.
\m nece-tow žedu ƛ’iri b-uti-zaƛ’ yeda-n razi oq-x
\g so.much-EMPH DEM1.IPL above I.PL-turn-CSL.CVB DEM2.ISG-TOP agree become-IPFV.CVB
\l Because they insisted so much, he also agreed.

\t Kidbes babiwgon nesis halmaɣ zown.
\m kid-s babiw-gon nesi-s halmaɣ zow-n
\g girl-GEN1 father-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 friend be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The girl's father was his friend.

\t Ža kid idutow yesun.
\m ža kid idu-tow y-esu-n
\g DEM1.SG girl home-EMPH II-exist-PST.UNW
\l The girl was at home.

\t Suƛƛi sider sis bukayrun yizis roƛ’i boqxo.
\m suƛƛi sida-r sis b-ukad-run yizi-s roƛ’i b-oq-x
\g immediately one.OBL-LAT one I.PL-see-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 love III-become-PRS
\l Immediately when they saw each other, they fell in love.

\t ʕAƛar aynƛin teqzaƛ’ortow Ražbadin yizzoxor oƛixzaƛ’, kidbez babiya bigtow tamašan bodin, yisiz ħurmatyoxay rigu bišʷan rodin.
\m ʕaƛ-ar ay-n-ƛin teq-zaƛ’or-tow Ražbadin yizi-zo-xor oƛix-zaƛ’ kid-z babi-a b-ig-tow tamaša-n b-odi-n yisi-z ħurmat-xay r-igu bišʷa-n r-odi-n
\g village-IN.LAT come-PFV.CVB-QUOT hear-POST.CVB-EMPH Razhbadin DEM2.IPL.OBL-ATTR.OBL-AD.LAT appear-CSL.CVB girl-GEN2 dad-ERG III-much-EMPH astonished-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 respect-AD.ABL IV-good food-TOP IV-do-PST.UNW
\l Because Razhbadin appeared at their place before he heard that he had come to the village, the girl's dad was very surprised and out of respect for him he prepared a good meal.

\t Bišno-butin łiynosi halmaɣä esirno, ya le hudul Ražbadin, ʕaƛar aynƛin teqzaƛ’ortow mi däder ayrus ʕilla biya betinƛin.
\m b-iš~uti-n łiy-nosi halmaɣ-a esir-n ya le hudul Ražbadin ʕaƛ-ar ay-n-ƛin teq-zaƛ’or-tow mi di-der ay-ru-s ʕilla b-iy-a b-eti-n-ƛin
\g I.PL-eat-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB friend-ERG ask-PST.UNW well hey friend Razhbadin village-IN.LAT come-PST.UNW-QUOT hear-POST.CVB-EMPH you me-APUD.LAT come-PST.PRT-GEN1 reason III-know-INF III-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l After they finished eating, his friend asked: "Well, hey, friend Razhbadin, I want to know the reason why you came to me before I heard that you came to the village."

\t Ražbadinä eƛix, dey halmaɣ, di nexäsi yoł debez kidbes reƛ’an esirnoƛin.
\m Ražbadin-a eƛi-x di-s halmaɣ di nex-asi yoł mi-z kid-s reƛ’a-n esir-n-ƛin
\g Razhbadin-ERG say-PRS me-GEN1 friend me come-RES.PRT be you-GEN2 daughter-GEN1 hand-TOP ask-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l Razhbadin said: "My friend, I've come to ask for your daughters hand."

\t Babiwqay kidbes rožin riqirno ɣˤaɣˤun izin Ražbadin iduɣor ik’iƛ’oräy, dandir keze aqru esiwq babiw razi oqsiƛin esin.
\m babiw-qay kid-s roži-n r-iqir-n ɣˤaɣˤu-n izi-n Ražbadin idu-ɣor ik’i-ƛ’oräy dandir keze oq-ru esiw-q babiw razi oq-s-ƛin esi-n
\g father-POSS.ABL daughter-GEN1 word-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB be.happy-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB Razhbadin home-IN.ALL go-SIM.CVB together meet become-PST.PRT brother-POSS.ESS father agree become-PST.WIT-QUOT tell-PST.UNW
\l Razhbadin took the girl's word from the father, got happy and while he went home, he told his brother whom he met, that the father agreed.

\t Esiya eƛin, rigutow ħadurłi rodaniƛäy ħonƛ’ay bˤeƛ’ rowa ik’an diƛin.
\m esyu-a eƛi-n r-igu-tow ħadurłi r-odi-ani-ƛay ħon-ƛ’ay bˤeƛ’ r-ow-a ik’i-an di-ƛin
\g brother-ERG say-PST.UNW IV-good-EMPH preparation IV-do-MSD-SUB.ABL mountain-SUPER.ABL sheep III.PL-bring-INF go-FUT.DEF me-QUOT
\l His brother said: "Because this has to be well prepared, I'll go bring a flock of sheep down from the mountain."

\t Hudun meža di berten bodinč’ey xecinč’u.
\m hudun mežu-a di berten b-odi-č’ey xeci-č’u
\g nevertheless you(I).PL.OBL-ERG me marriage III-do-NEG.PST.CVB leave-NEG.PST.WIT
\l "Nevertheless you all didn't let me *not* have a marriage.

\t ƛ’irigon ħažat roqxosi šebin idun yoł.
\m ƛ’iri-gon ħažat r-oq-xosi šebin idu-n yoł
\g above-CNTR necessary IV-become-PRS.PRT thing home-TOP be
\l Furthermore, a home is a necessary thing.

\t Telawä dey sisgon Tawadiƛin esiw yoł, ža t’or ayzaƛ’or di berten badinč’iƛin.
\m Telawi-a di-s sis-gon Tawadi-ƛin esiw yoł ža t’o-r ay-zaƛ’or di berten b-odi-č’i-ƛin
\g Telavi-IN.ESS me-GEN1 one-CNTR Tavadi-QUOT brother be DEM1.SG here-LAT come-POST.CVB me marriage III-do-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l In Telavi there's one brother of mine, named Tavadi; before he comes here, I won't marry."

\t Ražbadinzo pikruƛ’ esnabin c’aq’tow razi boqno.
\m Ražbadin-z pikru-ƛ’ esyu-bi-n c’aq’-tow razi b-oq-n
\g Razhbadin-GEN2 idea-SUPER.ESS brother-PL-TOP much-EMPH agree I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l His brothers heavily agreed on Razhbadin's idea.

\t Kaɣatno caxno, ʕaƛatow łet’in sis zap’ana gulun biqirno, Tawadider bertenyołer goƛ’anix žek’u egirxo.
\m kaɣat-n cax-n ʕaƛ-a-tow łet’i-n sis zap’ana gulu-n b-iqir-n Tawadi-der berten-łer goƛ’i-ani-x žek’u egir-x
\g letter-TOP write-PFV.CVB village-IN.ESS-EMPH pick-PFV.CVB one strong horse-TOP III-find-PFV.CVB Tavadi-APUD.LAT marriage-CONT.LAT invite-MSD-AD.ESS man send-PRS
\l He wrote a letter, picked a strong horse in the village and sent a man to Tavadi in order to invite him to the marriage.

\t Bertenyołer ħadurłin rodin Ražbadin halmaɣqor ezun ičix.
\m berten-łer ħadurłi-n r-odi-n Ražbadin halmaɣ-qor ezu-n iči-x
\g marriage-CONT.LAT preparation-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB Razhbadin friend-POSS.LAT look-PFV.CVB wait-PRS
\l Razhbadin did the preparation for the wedding and waited for his friend.

\t Hemełƛ’o elo akiłäza łäs bic’äsi tungin bižin Ražbadinxo esäruni kid yik’äsi zown.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ elo aki-łaza łi-s b-ic’-asi tungi-n b-iži-n Ražbadin-x esir-ru-ni kid y-ik’i-asi zow-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS there window-CONT.VERS.DIST water-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT copper.jug-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB Razhbadin-AD.ESS ask-PST.PRT-DEF girl II-go-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The girl that Razhbadin asked [= his fiancée] carried a copper jug filled with water and was going to a window up there.

\t Yedu kidgon Ražbadinqor baqru ʕišq’ud, netey yedu berten bodixƛin, iduɣor yik’ixosi hunin šuƛ’in qˤilo yok’ełxo.
\m yedu kid-gon Ražbadin-qor b-oq-ru ʕišq’u-d neti-ey yedu berten b-odi-x-ƛin idu-ɣor y-ik’i-xosi huni-n šuƛ’i-n qˤilo y-ok’eł-x
\g DEM2.IISG girl-CNTR Razhbadin-POSS.LAT III-become-PST.PRT love-INSTR when-DUB DEM2.IISG marriage III-do-PRS-QUOT home-IN.ALL II-go-PRS.PRT way-TOP forget-PFV.CVB erroneously II-go.away-PRS
\l The girl was so in love with Razhbadin, and because she prepared that marriage, she forgot the way home and got lost.

\t Sadaq zawru halmaɣłi šebi yisir roqäƛin ħayran boqno ƛexun.
\m sadaq zow-ru halmaɣłi šebi yisi-r r-oq-a-ƛin ħayran b-oq-n ƛexu-n
\g all be.NPRS-PST.PRT friendship what DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT be.astonished I.PL-become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l All the friends who were there wondered what happened to him.

\t Ražbadinä ik’in Tawadiqor eƛin, šebi deber roqä, šida mi neł rok’uɣʷeymołäy oxä.
\m Ražbadin-a ik’i-n Tawadi-qor eƛi-n šebi mi-r r-oq-a šida mi neła rok’uɣʷey-łay oxi-a
\g Razhbadin-ERG go-PFV.CVB Tavadi-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW what you-LAT IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT why you DEM1.IISG.OBL banquet-CONT.ABL run.away-PST.WIT.INT
\l Razhbadin went and said to Tavadi: "What happened to you? Why did you run away from that banquet?

\t Tawadä yisir žawab teƛno, där siskin šebin roqäsianu.
\m Tawadi-a yisi-r žawab teƛ-n di-r siskin šebin r-oq-asi-anu
\g Tavadi-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT answer give-PST.UNW me-LAT any thing IV-happen-RES.PRT-NEG
\l Tavadi answered him: "Nothing has happened to me.

\t Mi badiru ħurmatno där ʕezen boqno ƛ’iräza k’oƛäsi yoł.
\m mi b-odi-ru ħurmat-n di-r ʕeze-n b-oq-n ƛ’iri-aza k’oƛi-asi yoł
\g you III-do-PST.PRT respect-TOP me-LAT be.enough-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB above-IN.VERS.DIST jump-RES.PRT be
\l And your respect was enough for me, more than necessary.

\t Ražbadin ħayran oqno ezun ƛexun Tawadiq esirxo, hudu deber roqäsi šebintow šebiƛin.
\m Ražbadin ħayran oq-n ezu-n ƛexu-n Tawadi-q esir-x hudu mi-r r-oq-asi šebin-tow šebi-ƛin
\g Razhbadin be.astonished become-PFV.CVB look-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB Tavadi-POSS.ESS ask-PRS so you-LAT IV-happen-RES.PRT thing-EMPH what-QUOT
\l Razhbadin looked surprised and asked Tavadi: "So what is that thing that has happened to you?"

\t Igtow yeda ƛ’iri utizaƛ’ Tawadä esin, mi yowxozo barurno, deberno saɣłin rodin ħaƛanix di t’akan yizärun, gugyoq tungin bisno akiƛäza yik’ix yukayru kidbeƛ’ ozurin c’oxno, nełaz bercinłä ʕadal oys.
\m ig-tow yeda ƛ’iri uti-zaƛ’ Tawadi-a esi-n mi y-ow-xozo baru-r-n mi-r-n saɣłi-n r-odi-n ħaƛu-ani-x di t’akan y-izir-run gugu-q tungi-n b-is-n aki-ƛaza y-ik’i-x y-ukad-ru kid-ƛ’ ozuri-n c’ox-n neła-z bercinłi-a ʕadal odi-s
\g much-EMPH DEM2.ISG above turn-CSL.CVB Tavadi-ERG tell-PST.UNW you II-marry-PRS.PRT.OBL wife-LAT-and you-LAT-and health-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB drink-MSD-AD.ESS me glass II-lift-IMM.ANT.CVB back-POSS.ESS copper.jug-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB window-SUB.VERS II-go-IPFV.CVB II-see-PST.PRT girl-SUPER.ESS eye-TOP hit-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 beauty-ERG intoxication do-PST.WIT
\l Because he insisted so much, Tavadi told him: "Right after lifting my glass to drink on your and your soon to be married wife, my eye met this girl whom I saw going under the window and taking a jar on her back, and her beauty was intoxicating."

\t Mi nedurä hudu zownƛin, eƛin Ražbadinä, nedur resunäy, ela sosi debi berten boda yoł, xizyo di baru yowa yołƛin.
\m mi nedur-a hudu zow-n-ƛin eƛi-n Ražbadin-a nedur r-esu-näy elu-a sosi mi-s berten b-odi-a yoł xizyo di baru y-ow-a yoł-ƛin
\g you so-Q though be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT say-PST.UNW Razhbadin-ERG so IV-exist-CND.CVB we(I).OBL-ERG at.first you-GEN1 marriage III-do-INF be afterwards me wife II-marry-INF be-QUOT
\l "So that way you are," said Razhbadin, "if that's the case, we will first prepare your wedding and afterwards I will marry my wife."

\t Elo Ražbadinä ʕoloqzaqor eƛix, pulanaw mečoƛ’or ʕaƛa yałru kidbabi rutirƛin.
\m elo Ražbadin-a ʕoloq-bi-qor eƛi-x pulanaw moči-ƛ’or ʕaƛ-a yoł-ru kid-bi r-utir-ƛin
\g there Razhbadin-ERG young.person-PL-POSS.LAT say-PRS some place-SUPER.LAT village-IN.ESS be-PST.PRT girl-PL II.PL-gather-QUOT
\l There, Razhbadin said to the young people: "Gather the girls from the village on some place!

\t Din Tawadin elor baya yołƛin.
\m di-n Tawadi-n elo-r b-ay-a yoł-ƛin
\g me-and Tavadi-and there-LAT I.PL-come-INF be-QUOT
\l Tavadi and I are going to go there."

\t Ražbadinzo halmaɣza ʕaƛos kidbabi sidaɣ mečoƛ’orno rutirno pˤaƛux zurma, bok’xo q’ili, k’oƛix łočyaƛ’.
\m Ražbadin-z halmaɣ-bi-a ʕaƛ-s kid-bi sidaɣ moči-ƛ’or-n r-utir-n pˤaƛu-x zurma b-ok’-x q’ili k’oƛi-x łoč-ƛ’
\g Razhbadin-GEN2 friend-PL-ERG village-GEN1 girl-PL in.one.place place-SUPER.LAT-TOP II.PL-gather-PFV.CVB thrash-IPFV.CVB zurna III-beat-IPFV.CVB drum jump-IPFV.CVB dance-SUPER.ESS
\l Razhbadin's friends gathered the village's girls in one place somewhere, thrashed the zurna, beated the drum and danced.

\t Tawadä bigza ħalał xal bodinosi, elo nesir sosi ozuri c’oxno yätiruni kid yukaynanu.
\m Tawadi-a b-ig-za ħal-ł xal b-odi-nosi elo nesi-r sosi ozuri c’ox-n y-eti-ru-ni kid y-ukad-n-anu
\g Tavadi-ERG III-much-ZA strength-CONT.ESS examination III-do-ANT.CVB there DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT at.first eye meet-PFV.CVB II-love-PST.PRT-DEF girl II-see-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l When Tavadi looked intently, he didn't see a girl that he fell in love with at first sight.

\t Xizyogon Ražbadinä äƛiruxor božarawni ʕoloqza ʕaƛos baħarayƛ’ rayzaƛ’or nasin kidbabi rutirno.
\m xizyogon Ražbadin-a eƛi-ru-xor božaraw-ni ʕoloq-bi-a ʕaƛ-s baħaray-ƛ’ r-ay-zaƛ’or nasin kid-bi r-utir-n
\g then Razhbadin-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT reliable-DEF young.person-PL-ERG village-GEN1 fiancée-SUPER.ESS II.PL-come-POST.CVB all girl-PL II.PL-gather-PST.UNW
\l Then, according to what Razhbadin had said, the reliable young people gathered all girls of the village, including the bride.

\t Tawadi bercingo ezun ičäsi yałzay, sid žoyä Ražbadinxo yowxozo baħarayz hibon bok’no łočyaƛ’ yoɣno.
\m Tawadi bercingo ezu-n iči-asi yoł-zay sida uži-a Ražbadin-x y-ow-xozo baħaray-z hibo-n b-ok’-n łoč-ƛ’ y-oɣ-n
\g Tavadi well look-PFV.CVB wait-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB one.OBL boy-ERG Razhbadin-AD.ESS II-marry-PRS.PRT.OBL fiancée-GEN2 stick-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB dance-SUPER.ESS II-take.away-PST.UNW
\l While Tavadi was looking carefully, one boy hit the bride that was to marry Razhbadin with a stick and took her away to dance.

\t Igtow ɣˤaɣˤun izin Tawadä nesis roƛ’i baqruni kid Ražbadinqo yukarno.

\l Tavadi became very happy and showed Razhbadin the girl that became his love.

\t Ža kid nesä yižixosi yałrułi Tawadir riyx zownanu.

\l Tavadi didn't know that this girl was the one he was going to marry.

\t Idur Ražbadin aynosi, kidbez babiya nesił adäza bišʷa ħaƛin.

\l When Razhbadin went to the home, the girl's father put food before him.

\t Bišƛ’oräytow nesä kidbez babiwqor xabar boƛik’no, hemedur sis beže q’ʷariʕelno dowqor keze boqno, mi ža t’ubazi badiƛin debeƛ’ rok’un rayn nexäsi yoł di dowderƛin.
\m b-iš-ƛ’oräy-tow nesi-a kid-z babiw-qor xabar b-oƛik’-n hemedur sis b-eže q’ʷariʕel-n mi-qor keze b-oq-n mi ža t’ubazi b-odi-ƛin mi-ƛ’ rok’u-n r-ay-n nex-asi yoł di mi-der-ƛin

\l While they were eating, he started a conversation with the girl's father: "So there is a big necessity you have to do, and I have come to you and am convinced you can fulfill it."

\t Kidbez babiya eƛin, dey halmaɣ, šida mi äƛiru t’ubazi royxanu, mi elur howži äxuzay izin ayru iłe iyxƛin.
\m kid-z babi-a eƛi-n di-s halmaɣ šida mi eƛi-ru t’ubazi r-odi-x-anu mi elu-r howži exu-zay izi-n ay-ru iłe iy-x-ƛin
\g girl-GEN2 dad-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN1 friend why you say-PST.PRT fulfill IV-do-IPFV.CVB-NEG you we(I).OBL-LAT now die-SIM.CVB get.up-PFV.CVB come-PST.PRT as feel-PRS-QUOT
\l The girl's father said: "My friend, why would I not fulfill what you said? We now have the feeling as if you came from getting up while you were dying."

\t Bužzi odin yisä Ražbadin.
\m bužzi odi-n yisi-a Ražbadin
\g trust do-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG Razhbadin
\l He trusted Razhbadin.

\t Ražbadinä eƛin, däder ayru ƛirba deber ukayn esunäy, ža qazaq yoł.

\l Razhbadin said: "You saw that the comrade that came to me is Georgian.

\t Šebigo oqłin ža dey esiw yoł.
\m šebi-go oq-łin ža di-s esiw yoł
\g who-COND happen-CNC.CVB DEM1.SG me-GEN1 brother be
\l Whoever he was, he is my brother.

\t Nesiz kumakyoƛ’aza di elo č’agu ƛexus exurxo zawru.

\t Nesiƛ’ ci Tawadi yoł.

\t Di bertenyołer goƛ’in ayäsi yoł ža.

\g me marriage-CONT.LAT invite-PFV.CVB come-RES.PRT be DEM1.SG
\l I invited him to the wedding and he has come.

\t Nesiq esinč’u ža kid däx yowxosi yałrułi.

\t Ža bertenyołkin ičinč’ey xizor ik’a oqno zawru, di ħalaxor eč’räsi yoł.

\l Without even being on the marriage, he started to go back, and I could hardly stop him.

\t Howži dey murad yoł, där saɣłin, wacłin radiru baħarčix däxtow yowx zawruni debi kid Tawadix esirno nexäsi yoł di.
\m howži di-s murad yoł di-r saɣłi-n wacłi-n r-adiru baħarči-x di-x-tow y-ow-x zow-ru-ni mi-s kid Tawadi-x esir-n nex-asi yoł di
\g now me-GEN1 wish be me-LAT health-and brotherhood-and III.PL-fulfilled brave.young.man-AD.ESS me-AD.ESS-EMPH II-marry-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF you-GEN1 daughter Tavadi-AD.ESS ask-PFV.CVB come-RES.PRT be me
\l Now this is my wish; I have come to ask you to marry off your daughter who was to marry me, to Tavadi, the brave young man who acted so well and brotherly towards me.

\t Šebi mi nełqor äƛi.
\m šebi mi neła-qor eƛi
\g what you DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say
\l What will you say about that?

\t Mi däƛ’ ʕayibno badin, di dowder harizi oqno aysƛin.

\l Don't blame me [that] I came to ask you.

\l The girl's father said: "At the very beginning, after you came to me to ask for my daughter, I gave you its permission.

\t Retinäy debex mi yižo, retinäy q’ˤuyzix yegir.

\l If you want, marry her yourself, or if you want, send her to someone else.

\t Debex yižixosi kid qazaqxo yegira mi razi oqzaƛ’, diyä razi oqač’inƛin.

\l But if you agree to send the girl that should marry you to a Georgian, how could I not agree?"

\t Hemedur raziłi zahir rodin kidbez babiya.

\l So the father expressed his agreement.

\l The Georgian was on cloud nine, when his friend told him the story.

\t Neła quł neširutow Ražbadinä dibirno goƛ’in Tawadiƛ’ mahar erno.

\t Hudayzikotow Ražbadiner bodixosi berten Tawadiƛ’ar butirno.

\t Neła quł neširu ža äčiza ɣutkaɣorgon baħarayn yižin.

\t Teł iduɣor yoqƛ’oräy, yiłas qoqoƛu regix.

\l Inside, while she came into the house, she bursted into laughter.

\t Baħarayä eƛin, di debeƛ’ qoqoƛixanu.

\l The bride said: "I am not laughing about you."

\t Deber di dice yetix, där mi nełƛ’aygon aq’ˤu etix.

\g you-LAT me how.much II-love-IPFV.CVB me-LAT you DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL-CNTR much love-PRS
\l However much you love me, I love you even more than that.

\t Dey qoqoƛu łinaƛ’ rägiru riya retin resunäy, esan debeq di.

\l If it is the case that you want to know what I laughed about, I'll tell you.

\t Di dowdäɣor nexƛ’oräy, madazax zawruni ʕoloqza žeda žeduqor eƛix, Ražbadinłäy baħarčiƛinä eƛan, nesä nesix yižixosi baħaray šebi eƛa äynč’iru qazaqxo yegirxoƛin.
\m di mi-däɣor nex-ƛ’oräy ma-bi-x zow-ru-ni ʕoloq-bi-a žedu-a žedu-qor eƛi-x Ražbadin-łay baħarči-ƛin-a eƛi-an nesi-a nesi-x y-iži-xosi baħaray šebi eƛi-a iy-č’i-ru qazaq-x y-egir-x-ƛin
\g me you-APUD.VERS come-SIM.CVB yard-PL-AD.ESS be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF young.person-PL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PRS Razhbadin-CONT.ABL brave.young.man-QUOT-Q say-FUT.DEF DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS II-lead-PRS.PRT fiancée what say-INF know-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT Georgian-AD.ESS II-send-PRS-QUOT
\l When I came to you, the young people who were in their yards, were saying to each other: "Razhbadin is a brave young man, to send the bride he was to marry to an unknown Georgian."

\t Ele žeduz ʕaq’lu anunč’uru xabaryoƛ’ dey qoqoƛu regis.
