\l There, I'm laughing about their mindless gossip.

\t Mi däƛ’ ƛ’iräy oqƛin.
\m mi di-ƛ’ ƛ’iräy oq-ƛin
\g you me-SUPER.ESS from.above become-QUOT
\l Forgive me."

\t Ža xabarno bexurno baħaray Tawadidäɣor bitoxƛ’oräy, hobolo q’ˤida yičin yičiƛin, yisä igor nexa yegirxanu.
\m ža xabar-n b-exur-n baħaray Tawadi-däɣor bitox-ƛ’oräy hobolo q’ˤida y-iči-n y-iči-ƛin yisi-a igo-r nex-a y-egir-x-anu
\g DEM1.SG story-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB fiancée Tavadi-APUD.VERS move-SIM.CVB there down II-sit-PFV.CVB II-wait-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG near-LAT come-INF II-let-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l When the bride had finished her story and approached Tavadi, "Sit down there and wait!" he [said and] didn't let her come closer.

\t Yedatow q’ˤidan ičin t’amačno, q’alamno risno Ražbadinƛ’or kaɣat caxa iħun, Ražbadin, mi däƛ’ ʕayibno badin, däƛ’ ƛ’iräyn oq.
\m yeda-tow q’ˤida-n iči-n t’amač-n q’alam-n r-is-n Ražbadin-ƛ’or kaɣat cax-a iħu-n Ražbadin mi di-ƛ’ ʕayib-n b-odi-n di-ƛ’ ƛ’iräy-n oq
\g DEM2.ISG-EMPH down-TOP sit-PFV.CVB leaflet-and pencil-and III.PL-take-PFV.CVB Razhbadin-SUPER.LAT letter write-INF begin-PFV.CVB Razhbadin you me-SUPER.ESS fault-TOP III-do-PROHIB me-SUPER.ESS from.above-TOP become
\l He sat down, took a sheet of paper and a pencil and started writing a letter to Razhbadin: "Razhbadin, don't blame me, forgive me.

\t Yedu šebin nedur zawrułi där riyäsi zownč’u.

\l I didn't know that things were like that.

\t Di yiła kidbes maharno roɣsi, yiłaq dey bašakin buyn bitinč’u.

\l I got divorced from that girl and indeed didn't even touch her with my finger.

\t Mi dey halmaɣ esunäy, yedu kid debi mi yižo.

\g you me-GEN1 friend exist-CND.CVB DEM2.IISG girl you-GEN1 you II-lead-IMPR
\l If you are my friend, marry this girl yourself.

\t Nagaħ mi ža yownč’inäy, mi din šuƛ’ir, di min šuƛ’iran, ela elułsi halmaɣłin łiyranƛin.
\m nagaħ mi ža y-ow-č’i-näy mi di-n šuƛ’ir di mi-n šuƛ’ir-an elu-a elu-ł-si halmaɣłi-n łiyr-an-ƛin
\g suppose you DEM1.SG II-marry-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB you me-TOP forget me you-TOP forget-FUT.DEF we(I).OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-CONT.ESS-ATTR friendship-TOP finish-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Suppose you won't marry her, then forget about me and I will forget about you, and we will finish the friendship between us.

\t Ža kaɣat kidbeqor teƛƛ’oräy Tawadä eƛin, di maqˤir ok’łacen yičin yedu kaɣat Ražbadinqor teƛ.
\m ža kaɣat kid-qor teƛ-ƛ’oräy Tawadi-a eƛi-n di maqˤi-r ok’eł-ace-n y-iči-n yedu kaɣat Ražbadin-qor teƛ
\g DEM1.SG letter girl-POSS.LAT give-SIM.CVB Tavadi-ERG say-PST.UNW me far.away-LAT go.away-TERM-TOP II-wait-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG letter Razhbadin-POSS.LAT give
\l While he gave the letter to the girl, Tavadi said: "Until I got far away, wait and give this letter to Razhbadin.

\t Mi dey t’ok’ow baru anu esiw yołƛin.
\m mi di-s t’ok’ow baru anu esiw yoł-ƛin
\g you me-GEN1 anymore wife be.NEG sister be-QUOT
\l You are not my wife anymore, you're my sister."

\t Žan eƛin Tawadi maħor oqno.

\l Tavadi said that and went outside.

\t Ražbadinno goƛ’in nesiqor eƛin, eli howži halmaɣbin sadaq bik’a bayxosi, gulubi ħadur rodoƛin.
\m Ražbadin-n goƛ’i-n nesi-qor eƛi-n eli howži halmaɣ-bi-n sadaq b-ik’i-a b-ay-xosi gulu-bi ħadur r-odi-o-ƛin
\g Razhbadin-TOP call-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW we now friend-PL-and together I.PL-go-INF I.PL-must-PRS.PRT horse-PL prepare III.PL-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l He called Razhbadin and said to him: "My friends and I must leave now, prepare the horses."

\t Telawärno bik’in xizor eli butinosi, bertenno bodan.

\g Telavi-IN.LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB back we I.PL-return-ANT.CVB marriage-TOP III-do-FUT.DEF
\l After we returned to Telavi, we will organize a marriage.

\t Yedu kidno t’otow xecixƛin.
\m yedu kid-n t’o-tow xeci-x-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG girl-TOP here-EMPH leave-PRS-QUOT
\l I am also leaving that girl here.

\t Ražbadinä reƛ’ibin risno, Tawadisno nesiz halmaɣzasno hunin regirno, xizor iduɣor utin.
\m Ražbadin-a reƛ’a-bi-n r-is-n Tawadi-s-n nesi-z halmaɣ-bi-s-n huni-n r-egir-n xizor idu-ɣor uti-n
\g Razhbadin-ERG hand-PL-TOP IV.PL-take-PFV.CVB Tavadi-GEN1-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 friend-PL-GEN1-and way-TOP IV-send-PFV.CVB back home-IN.ALL return-PST.UNW
\l Razhbadin took the hands of Tavadi and his friends, sent them on their way and returned home.

\t Žedu bik’in xomi zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, kidbä Ražbadinqor Tawadä caxruni kaɣat teƛno.
\m žedu b-ik’i-n xomi zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow kid-a Ražbadin-qor Tawadi-a cax-ru-ni kaɣat teƛ-n
\g DEM1.IPL I.PL-go-PFV.CVB too.much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH girl-ERG Razhbadin-POSS.LAT Tavadi-ERG write-PST.PRT-DEF letter give-PST.UNW
\l Not too much time has passed since they had left, and the girl gave Razhbadin the letter that Tavadi had written.

\t Kaɣat t’et’ernosi, Ražbadin ħayran oqno ƛexun yedu šebi daq roqäƛin.
\m kaɣat t’et’r-nosi Ražbadin ħayran oq-n ƛexu-n yedu šebi di-q r-oq-a-ƛin
\g letter read-ANT.CVB Razhbadin be.astonished become-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG what me-POSS.ESS IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l After he had read the letter, Razhbadin wondered in surprise: "What happened to me?"

\t Nesir res boqnoanu ža kid yižinč’ey.
\m nesi-r res b-oq-n-anu ža kid y-iži-č’ey
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT possibility III-become-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.SG girl II-lead-NEG.PST.CVB
\l He had no choice not to marry her.

\t Boƛƛo tabanaw mix bik’inosi, Ražbadinƛ’or Tawadis kaɣat yayx, ec’noni barun yown pulanaw ɣudƛ’or Telawär horo, Tiblisä t’et’erno łiyn ayru užis berten boyxosiƛin.
\m b-oƛƛo tabanaw mix b-ik’i-nosi Ražbadin-ƛ’or Tawadi-s kaɣat y-ay-x ec’no-ni baru-n y-ow-n pulanaw ɣudi-ƛ’or Telawi-ar horo Tiblis-a t’et’r-n łiy-n ay-ru uži-s berten b-odi-xosi-ƛin
\g III-middle long time III-go-ANT.CVB Razhbadin-SUPER.LAT Tavadi-GEN1 letter II-come-IPFV.CVB new-DEF wife-TOP II-bring-PFV.CVB a.certain day-SUPER.LAT Telavi-IN.LAT come.IMPR Tbilisi-IN.ESS learn-PFV.CVB end-PFV.CVB come-PST.PRT son-GEN1 marriage III-do-PRS.PRT-QUOT
\l After quite a long time has passed, a letter from Tavadi came to Razhbadin: "Come to Telavi on a certain day and bring your new wife; we are preparing the marriage of my son who came from finishing his studies in Tbilisi."

\t Nełƛ’orsi kʷaxatow Ražbadinno barun Tawadiz žar saɣatyabin rižin Telawäɣor bik’ix.
\m nełƛ’o-r-si kʷaxa-tow Ražbadin-n baru-n Tawadi-z uži-r saɣyat-bi-n r-iži-n Telawi-aɣor b-ik’i-x
\g at.that.time-LAT-ATTR soon-EMPH Razhbadin-and wife-and Tavadi-GEN2 son-LAT present-PL-TOP III.PL-carry-PFV.CVB Telavi-IN.VERS I.PL-go-PRS
\l Soon after that Razhbadin and his wife went to Telavi with presents for Tavadi's son.

\t Elor bayza quł yizir Tawadis uži ayäsi esunanu.
\m elo-r b-ay-za qu-ł yizi-r Tawadi-s uži ay-asi esu-n-anu
\g there-LAT I.PL-come-LCV day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT Tavadi-GEN1 son come-RES.PRT find-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l On the day they arrived there, they didn't find Tavaid's son having come.

\t Neła quł neširu yizirabi kecno baq’ˤu mix bik’izaƛ’ortow, Tawadis uži ayn.
\m neła qu-ł neširu yizirabi kec-n b-aq’ˤu mix b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow Tawadi-s uži ay-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS evening DEM2.PL sleep-PFV.CVB III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH Tavadi-GEN1 son come-PST.UNW
\l On the same evening, before they slept too long, Tavadis son came.

\t Sida mixƛ’o moƛaxay Ražbadin č’ariłxo.
\m sida mix-ƛ’ moƛu-xay Ražbadin č’arił-x
\g one.OBL time-SUPER.ESS sleep-AD.ABL Razhbadin wake.up-PRS
\l At some point in time, Razhbadin woke up from his sleep.

\t Yisiz barude puħo kecäsi ʕoloqanaw žek’u ukaynosi, yeda tamaša oqno ƛexun.
\m yisi-z baru-de pu-x kec-asi ʕoloqanaw žek’u ukad-nosi yeda tamaša oq-n ƛexu-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 wife-APUD.ESS side-AD.ESS sleep-RES.PRT young man see-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG astonished become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l When he saw a young man sleeping at the side of his wife, he was surprised.

\t Aq’ˤu urɣizi oqxo ičinč’ey izin Ražbadinä bˤałayn risno barude kecno äsuruni žek’us gič’orabi rodin kurno.
\m aq’ˤu urɣizi oq-x iči-č’ey izi-n Ražbadin-a bˤałay-n r-is-n baru-de kec-n esu-ru-ni žek’u-s gič’o-bi r-odi-n kur-n
\g much thinking become-IPFV.CVB be-NEG.PST.CVB get.up-PFV.CVB Razhbadin-ERG dagger-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB wife-APUD.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB find-PST.PRT-DEF man-GEN1 piece-PL IV-do-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l Without thinking too much, Razhbadin got up, took his dagger and cut the man whom he found sleeping with his wife to pieces.

\t Elay Ražbadin Tawadiƛ’ ƛ’irir ik’in, nesiqor c’ok’inayn, yedu šebi šebin mi där rodä bertenyołerno goƛ’inƛin.
\m ele-ay Ražbadin Tawadi-ƛ’ ƛ’iri-r ik’i-n nesi-qor c’ok’inad-n yedu šebi šebin mi di-r r-odi-a berten-łer-n goƛ’i-n-ƛin
\g there-IN.ABL Razhbadin Tavadi-SUPER.ESS on-LAT go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT scold-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG what thing you me-LAT IV-do-INF marriage-CONT.LAT-TOP invite-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l From there, Razhbadin went up to Tavadi and scolded him: "What is that thing you did to me, inviting me to a marriage?!"

\t Tawadä Ražbadin bužzi odin, nediw ħalikataw šebin debeł teł roda dey pikrukin zownč’u, rodäsin anuƛin.
\m Tawadi-a Ražbadin bužzi odi-n nediw ħalikataw šebin mi-ł teł r-odi-a di-s pikru-kin zow-č’u r-odi-asi-n anu-ƛin
\g Tavadi-ERG Razhbadin convince do-PFV.CVB such mean thing you-CONT.ESS inside IV-do-INF me-GEN1 idea-even be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT IV-do-RES.PRT-TOP be.NEG-QUOT
\l Tavadi convinced Razhbadin: "I would not have he idea to do such a mean thing to you, I haven't done anything."

\t Iduɣor beza bik’inosi, Tawadir exurno gič’orabin rodin kuräsi uži esun.
\m idu-ɣor b-ezu-a b-ik’i-nosi Tawadi-r exur-n gič’o-bi-n r-odi-n kur-asi uži esu-n
\g home-IN.ALL I.PL-look-INF I.PL-go-ANT.CVB Tavadi-LAT kill-PFV.CVB piece-PL-TOP IV.PL-do-PFV.CVB throw-RES.PRT son find-PST.UNW
\l When they went to look into the room, Tavadi found his son cut dead into pieces.

\t Xizyo nesä Ražbadinqor eƛin, riynč’ey raqru łinarno šebin rodan.
\m xizyo nesi-a Ražbadin-qor eƛi-n r-iy-č’ey r-oq-ru łina-r-n šebin r-odi-an
\g afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG Razhbadin-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW IV-know-NEG.PST.CVB IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-LAT-TOP thing IV-do-FUT.DEF
\l Then he said to Razhbadin: "This happened by accident, what shall we do?"

\t Howži min barun ʕaƛaɣor bik’in.
\m howži mi-n baru-n ʕaƛ-aɣor b-ik’i-n
\g now you-and wife-and village-IN.VERS I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l You and your wife go into the village now.

\t Ražbadin igtow pašman oqno, yedu šebi däq roqäƛin.
\m Ražbadin ig-tow pašman oq-n yedu šebi di-q r-oq-a-ƛin
\g Razhbadin very-EMPH become.sad become-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG what me-POSS.ESS IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Razhbadin became very sad: "What happened to me?"

\t Hudun riynč’ey raqru łinarno yoda sabaw anuƛin barun ader yoɣno Ražbadin ʕaƛoxaɣor nexno.
\m hudun r-iy-č’ey r-oq-ru łina-r-n y-odi-a sabaw anu-ƛin baru-n ader y-oɣ-n Ražbadin ʕaƛ-xaɣor nex-n
\g nevertheless IV-know-NEG.PST.CVB IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-LAT-TOP II-do-INF amulet be.NEG-QUOT wife-TOP forward II-take.away-PFV.CVB Razhbadin village-AD.VERS come-PST.UNW
\l "Nevertheless there's no amulet to do anything about what has happened by accident.", Razhbadin said and took his wife with him to the village.

\t Didurgo šebigo roqsi eƛin ži ƛ’iräy din oqsi min oq.
\m didur-go šebi-go r-oq-s eƛi-n ži ƛ’iräy di-n oq-si mi-n oq
\g how-COND what-COND IV-happen-PST.WIT say-PFV.CVB now from.above me-TOP become-ATTR you-TOP become
\l Whatever and however it happened, [said?], I forgave you now, so forgive me too.

\t Ela elus halmaɣłi rexura raynč’i.
\m elu-a elu-s halmaɣłi r-exur-a r-ay-č’i
\g we(I).OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-GEN1 friendship IV-kill-INF IV-must-NEG.FUT
\l We mustn't destroy our friendship.

\t Debi łˤono uži yoł, dey siskin anuru deberno iyx äsu.
\m mi-s łˤono uži yoł di-s siskin anu-ru mi-r-n iy-x esu
\g you-GEN1 three son be me-GEN1 anyone be.NEG-PST.PRT you-LAT-TOP know-IPFV.CVB exist
\l You have three sons and should know that I don't have anyone.

\t Horo eli sidqo sis biłaniƛäyn, dey rok’u riq’ˤaniƛäyn, łˤonon debi užibi däz žaz mečʷa bexuranix dadäɣor begirnäy där räti.
\m horo eli sida-q sis b-iłi-ani-ƛay-n di-s rok’u r-iq’ˤi-ani-ƛay-n łˤono-n mi-s uži-bi di-z uži-z meča b-exur-ani-x di-däɣor b-egir-näy di-r r-eti
\g come.IMPR we one.OBL-POSS.ESS one III-resemble-MSD-SUB.ABL-and me-GEN1 heart IV-approach-MSD-SUB.ABL-and three-TOP you-GEN1 son-PL me-GEN2 son-GEN2 instead.of I.PL-kill-MSD-AD.ESS me-APUD.VERS I.PL-send-CND.CVB me-LAT IV-want
\l So that we resemble one another and that you approach my heart, I'd love if you could send your three sons to me so I could kill them instead of my son."

\t Yedu kaɣat yaynosi, Ražbadinä łˤonon užin goƛ’in žeduł adäz t’et’erno.
\m yedu kaɣat y-ay-nosi Ražbadin-a łˤono-n uži-n goƛ’i-n žedu-ł adäz t’et’r-n
\g DEM2.IISG letter II-come-ANT.CVB Razhbadin-ERG three-TOP son-TOP call-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS before read-PST.UNW
\l When the letter arrived, Razhbadin called his three sons and read it out to them.

\t Ža kaɣat t’et’erno łiynosi, łˤoran xexza nesiqor eƛin, eli łˤonon bik’a yoł debez halmaɣ Tawadidäɣor.
\m ža kaɣat t’et’r-n łiy-nosi łˤora-n xexbi nesi-qor eƛi-n eli łˤono-n b-ik’i-a yoł mi-z halmaɣ Tawadi-däɣor
\g DEM1.SG letter read-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB three.OBL-TOP children DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW we three-TOP I.PL-go-INF be you-GEN2 friend Tavadi-APUD.VERS
\l When he finished reading the letter, his three children said to him: "We three will go to your friend Tavadi.

\t Meža mežuł raqru halmaɣłi eli sabawłun rexarno.
\m mežu-a mežu-ł r-oq-ru halmaɣłi eli sabawłun r-exur-n
\g you(I).PL.OBL-ERG you(I).PL.OBL-CONT.ESS IV-become-PST.PRT friendship we for.the.sake.of IV-kill-PROHIB
\l Don't destroy the friendship that is between you because of us!

\t Mežus halmaɣłi rexuzaƛ’or eli bexun biguƛin.
\m mežu-s halmaɣłi r-exu-zaƛ’or eli b-exu-n b-igu-ƛin
\g you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 friendship IV-die-POST.CVB we I.PL-die-PFV.CVB I.PL-good-QUOT
\l Before your friendship dies, rather we would die!"

\t Neła kaɣatyoƛ’ Ražbadinä Tawadiq harizi rodix, raqru łinaƛ’no ƛ’irayn oq, eluł teł zawru huinłin, halmaɣłin rexarno, sid dowzo žaz meča di łˤonon uži egirxo dowdär žedus deber iyon ħalal bodinƛin.
\m neła kaɣat-ƛ’ Ražbadin-a Tawadi-q harizi r-odi-x r-oq-ru łina-ƛ’-n ƛ’iri-ay-n oq elu-ł teł zow-ru huinłi-n halmaɣłi-n r-exur-n sida mi-z uži-z meča di łˤono-n uži egir-x mi-dar žedu-s mi-r iyo-n ħalal b-odi-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL letter-SUPER.ESS Razhbadin-ERG Tavadi-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PRS IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP on-IN.ABL-TOP become we(I).OBL-CONT.ESS inside be.NPRS-PST.PRT cordiality-and friendship-and IV-kill-PROHIB one.OBL you-GEN2 son-GEN2 instead.of me three-TOP son send-IPFV.CVB you-APUD.VERS DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 you-LAT blood-TOP be.permitted III-do-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l In that letter Razhbadin was asking Tavadi: "Forgive me what has happened, don't destroy the cordiality and friendship that are between us; I am sending you my three sons instead of your son, I permit you their blood."

\t ʕAƛoz ʕoloqza Ražbadinƛ’o ʕayib erxo zown bexuranix xexbi begirnoƛin, nesä yołi halmaɣłi łet’in.
\m ʕaƛ-z ʕoloq-bi-a Ražbadin-ƛ’ ʕayib er-x zow-n b-exur-ani-x xexbi b-egir-n-ƛin nesi-a yołi halmaɣłi łet’i-n
\g village-GEN2 young.person-PL-ERG Razhbadin-SUPER.ESS fault put-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB I.PL-kill-MSD-AD.ESS children I.PL-send-PFV.CVB-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG however friendship pick-PST.UNW
\l The young people of the village were blaming Razhbadin for sending his children for them to get killed, whereas he, however, choose friendship.

\t Łˤonon užibi bezunč’ey Tawadiƛ’ ƛ’irirno bik’in, nesiqor babiya yegaru kaɣat teƛno.
\m łˤono-n uži-bi b-ezu-č’ey Tawadi-ƛ’ ƛ’iri-r-n b-ik’i-n nesi-qor babi-a y-egir-ru kaɣat teƛ-n
\g three-TOP son-PL I.PL-look-NEG.PST.CVB Tavadi-SUPER.ESS on-LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT dad-ERG II-send-PST.PRT letter give-PST.UNW
\l Without looking, the three sons went to Tavadi and gave him the letter sent by their father.

\t Ža kaɣat t’et’ernosi, Tawadi igtow ɣˤaɣˤu izix.
\m ža kaɣat t’et’r-nosi Tawadi ig-tow ɣˤaɣˤu izi-x
\g DEM1.SG letter read-ANT.CVB Tavadi very-EMPH be.happy get.up-PRS
\l When Tavadi read the letter, he became very happy.

\t Ražbadines xexbi bexuranis mečʷa, Tawadä žedu nesis uži zawza Tiblisäɣor t’et’ranixno begirno, riyrxo žeduq, dey izmu anusi eni- babiwƛ’or kaɣat caxnoƛin.
\m Ražbadin-s xexbi b-exur-ani-s meča Tawadi-a žedu nesi-s uži zow-za Tiblis-aɣor t’et’r-ani-x-n b-egir-n r-iyr-x žedu-q di-s izmu anu-si eni babiw-ƛ’or kaɣat cax-n-ƛin
\g Razhbadin-GEN1 children I.PL-kill-MSD-GEN1 instead.of Tavadi-ERG DEM1.IPL DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 son be.NPRS-LCV Tbilisi-IN.VERS learn-MSD-AD.ESS-TOP I.PL-send-PFV.CVB IV-explain-PRS DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS me-GEN1 permission be.NEG-ATTR mother father-SUPER.LAT letter write-PROHIB-QUOT
\l Instead of killing Razhbadin's children, Tavadi sent them to study in Tbilisi where his son was, and explained to them: "Don't write a letter to your parents without my permission!"

\t Užibi bayzaƛ’ortow, Tawadä Ražbadinƛ’or kaɣat yegiräsi zown, debi di łˤonon užin exursi, däz žade puħon šušis žedu.
\m uži-bi b-ay-zaƛ’or-tow Tawadi-a Ražbadin-ƛ’or kaɣat y-egir-asi zow-n mi-s di łˤono-n uži-n exur-s di-z uži-de pu-x-n šuši-s žedu
\g boy-PL I.PL-come-POST.CVB-EMPH Tavadi-ERG Razhbadin-SUPER.LAT letter II-send-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW you-GEN1 me three-TOP son-TOP kill-PST.WIT me-GEN2 son-APUD.ESS side-AD.ESS-TOP bury-PST.WIT DEM1.IPL
\l Shortly before the boys came, Tavadi had sent a letter to Razhbadin: "I killed your three sons and burried them next to my son.

\t Hoboy eli sidqo sisno biłis, däƛ’ ƛ’iräy urɣelno bok’ełsiƛin.
\m hoboy eli sida-q sis-n b-iłi-s di-ƛ’ ƛ’iräy urɣel-n b-ok’eł-s-ƛin
\g now we one.OBL-POSS.ESS one-TOP I.PL-resemble-PST.WIT me-SUPER.ESS from.above sorrow-TOP III-go.away-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Now we became similar to one another and the sorrow went away from me."

\t Nełƛ’ay soder halmaɣza sida sidƛ’or kaɣatyabin caxnoanu, sidä sidderno bik’inanu.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder halmaɣ-bi-a sida-a sida-ƛ’or kaɣat-bi-n cax-n-anu sida-a sida-der-n b-ik’i-n-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after friend-PL-ERG one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-SUPER.LAT letter-PL-TOP write-PFV.CVB-NEG one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-APUD.LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l After that, the friends didn't write any letters to each other and didn't visit each other anymore.

\t Kaɣatyoƛ’ rukaräsi zown Tawadä, däz žade sadaq Tiblisä t’et’erxo zawru halmaɣbin bayxosi yołƛin.
\m kaɣat-ƛ’ r-ukar-asi zow-n Tawadi-a di-z uži-de sadaq Tiblis-a t’et’r-x zow-ru halmaɣ-bi-n b-ay-xosi yoł-ƛin
\g letter-SUPER.ESS IV-show-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB Tavadi-ERG me-GEN2 son-APUD.ESS together Tbilisi-IN.ESS learn-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT friend-PL-TOP I.PL-come-PRS.PRT be-QUOT
\l In the letter it was also pointed out that some friends who were studying together with the son in Tbilisi were coming.

\t Ža kaɣat yayrun, Ražbadinno, barun Telawäɣor halmaɣdäɣor bik’ix.
\m ža kaɣat y-ay-run Ražbadin-n baru-n Telawi-aɣor halmaɣ-däɣor b-ik’i-x
\g DEM1.SG letter II-come-IMM.ANT.CVB Razhbadin-and wife-and Telavi-IN.VERS friend-APUD.VERS I.PL-go-PRS
\l Right after the letter arrived, Razhbadin and his wife went to Telavi to their friend.

\t Elor bayrun, yizi žazas šudabi rukaranixƛin bižix.
\m elo-r b-ay-run yizi uži-bi-s šuda-bi r-ukar-ani-x-ƛin b-iži-x
\g there-LAT I.PL-come-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL son-PL-GEN1 graveyard-PL IV.PL-show-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT I.PL-lead-PRS
\l When they arrived there, they were immediately guided to their sons' graves.

\t Žazasƛin elo q’ˤač’azi rodasi šudabi rukarnosi, eniw yigtow q’ʷarid yoqxo, babiya yołi eƛace ħal čuqernoanu.
\m uži-bi-s-ƛin elo q’ˤač’azi r-odi-asi šuda-bi r-ukar-nosi eniw y-ig-tow q’ʷarid y-oq-x babi-a yołi eƛi-ace ħal čuqer-n-anu
\g son-PL-GEN1-QUOT there get.ready IV-do-RES.PRT graveyard-PL IV.PL-show-ANT.CVB mother II-very-EMPH sadness II-become-IPFV.CVB dad-ERG however say-TERM condition reveal-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l When they saw the graves that were made up as of their sons, the mother became very sad; the father, however, didn't reveal any condition.

\t Elay boqno iduzaɣor bik’inosi, yizir elo łˤonon ʕoloqant’a oqäsi žeduzoq biłäsi biłet’a užibi besux.
\m ele-ay b-oq-n idu-bi-ɣor b-ik’i-nosi yizi-r elo łˤono-n ʕoloqan-t’a oq-asi žedu-zo-q b-iłi-asi b-iłe-t’a uži-bi b-esu-x
\g there-IN.ABL I.PL-become-PFV.CVB home-PL-IN.ALL I.PL-go-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT there three-TOP young-DISTR become-RES.PRT DEM1.IPL.OBL-ATTR.OBL-POSS.ESS I.PL-resemble-RES.PRT I.PL-as-DISTR boy-PL I.PL-find-PRS
\l When they went home from there, they found three boys who resembled their own sons when they where young.

\t Däz žas halmaɣbi yoł yiziƛin, esin nesä Ražbadinqo.
\m di-z uži-s halmaɣ-bi yoł yizi-ƛin esi-n nesi-a Ražbadin-q
\g me-GEN2 son-GEN1 friend-PL be DEM2.IPL-QUOT tell-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG Razhbadin-POSS.ESS
\l "They're my son's friends.", he told Razhbadin.

\t Tawadiz harimoxor Ražbadinä nesirtow hič’č’a eɣeni užin xecin.
\m Tawadi-z hari-xor Ražbadin-a nesi-r-tow hič’č’a eɣe-ni uži-n xeci-n
\g Tavadi-GEN2 request-AD.LAT Razhbadin-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT-EMPH the.most young-DEF son-TOP leave-PST.UNW
\l According to Tavadi's request, Razhbadin left the youngest son to him.

\t Ražbadinan, baran Tawadir beže barkalan teƛno, bežet’asini q’ˤanon užibin bown ʕaƛoxaɣor nexno.
\m Ražbadin-a-n baru-a-n Tawadi-r b-eže barkala-n teƛ-n b-eže-t’a-si-ni q’ˤano-n uži-bi-n b-ow-n ʕaƛ-xaɣor nex-n
\g Razhbadin-ERG-and wife-ERG-and Tavadi-LAT III-big thank-TOP give-PFV.CVB I.PL-old-DISTR-ATTR-DEF two-TOP boy-PL-TOP I.PL-bring-PFV.CVB village-AD.VERS come-PST.UNW
\l Razhbadin and his wife thanked Tavadi very much and went to their village together with their two oldest boys.

\t Ader zamanał sida eniws roda risa šebin koƛ’ixanusi kid zown.
\m ader zaman-ł sida eniw-s r-odi-a r-is-a šebin koƛ’i-xanusi kid zow-n
\g earlier time-CONT.ESS one.OBL mother-GEN1 IV-do-INF IV-take-INF thing understand.to-NEG.PRS.PRT daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Once upon a time there was a mother who had a daughter, who didn't understand how to do things.

\t Yišan, kecan gurow t’ok’ow q’ˤuya ħalt’i boda koƛ’ix zownanu yiła kidber.
\m y-iš-a-n kec-a-n gurow t’ok’ow q’ˤuya ħalt’i b-odi-a koƛ’i-x zow-n-anu yiła kid-r
\g II-eat-INF-and sleep-INF-and except more other work III-do-INF understand.to-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM2.IISG.OBL girl-LAT
\l That girl didn't know how to do any other work besides to eat and to sleep.

\t Allahä bižaraw šibaw ɣudeł yiła oč’inot’a mučari rac’xo zown.
\m Allah-a bižaraw šibaw ɣudi-ł yiła-a oč’ino-t’a mučari r-ac’-x zow-n
\g God-ERG ?? every day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG nine-DISTR cumin IV-eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Every day she ate nine cumin cakes.

\t Sida quł neła kidbes eniw qˤišoder sis mučarin rižin ħonƛ’aɣor yik’ix zown.
\m sida qu-ł neła kid-s eniw qˤišoder sis mučari-n r-iži-n ħon-ƛ’aɣor y-ik’i-x zow-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-GEN1 mother at.noon one cumin-TOP IV-carry-PFV.CVB mountain-SUPER.VERS II-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l One day that girl's mother went to the mountain with a cumin cake.

\t Hunixgon yiłar ħonƛ’aɣortow ik’ixosi aħo keze oqno.
\m huni-x-gon yiła-r ħon-ƛ’aɣor-tow ik’i-xosi aħo keze oq-n
\g way-AD.ESS-CNTR DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT mountain-SUPER.VERS-EMPH go-PRS.PRT shepherd meet become-PST.UNW
\l On her way she met a shepherd who was also going to the mountain.

\t Harihun xabaryayx baƛ’ix žedu bik’iƛ’oräy, nełał xizay qˤaƛanayx durimoƛ’ k’oƛin kid yayx yukayn, eni, howlo yiči, oč’ira däz mučariłäy sis kamiruni mučari miyä risäƛin.
\m harihun xabaryad-x b-aƛ’i-x žedu b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy neła-ł xizay qˤaƛanad-x durimoƛ’ k’oƛi-n kid y-ay-x y-ukad-n eni howlo y-iči oč’ira di-z mučari-łay sis kami-ru-ni mučari mi-a r-is-a-ƛin
\g slowly talk-IPFV.CVB I.PL-talk-IPFV.CVB DEM1.IPL I.PL-go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind yell-IPFV.CVB running run-PFV.CVB daughter II-come-IPFV.CVB II-see-PFV.CVB mother there II-remain nine me-GEN2 cumin-CONT.ABL one get.lost-PST.PRT-DEF cumin you-Q IV-take-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l While they were going slowly and talking, they saw her daughter running and yelling behind them: "Mother, stay there, did you take the one cumin cake that got lost from my nine?"

\t Žan di riža retinč’ey, dey boyxosi ħalt’i bexuxƛin, xizay yayn.
\m ža-n di r-iži-a r-eti-č’ey di-s b-odi-xosi ħalt’i b-exu-x-ƛin xizay y-ay-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP me II.PL-carry-INF II.PL-want-NEG.PST.CVB me-GEN1 III-do-PRS.PRT work III-die-PRS-QUOT from.behind II-come-PST.UNW
\l She came behind us, because she doesn't want me to take it with me, because my work that I do is coming to and end.

\t Howlotow eniwqor xabarno boƛik’no, žan razi yoyn, zamanałäygon kidbeqay rožin riqirno, nełƛ’osi kʷaxatow bertenno boyn, aħozä ža kidno yown.
\m howlo-tow eniw-qor xabar-n b-oƛik’-n ža-n razi y-odi-n zaman-łay-gon kid-qay roži-n r-iqir-n nełƛ’osi kʷaxa-tow berten-n b-odi-n aħo-a ža kid-n y-ow-n
\g there-EMPH mother-POSS.LAT story-TOP III-push.out-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP accept II-do-PFV.CVB time-CONT.ABL-CNTR girl-POSS.ABL word-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB of.that.time soon-EMPH marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB shepherd-ERG DEM1.SG girl-TOP II-marry-PST.UNW
\l Right there he started talking to the mother, she accepted it, and after some time he took her word and soon after that they celebrated the wedding and the shepherd married that girl.

\t Boƛƛo zaman bik’inosi yeda yisä yisis bˤeƛ’xo ik’iƛ’oräy baruqor eƛin, ele deber hisno, hiƛun, ʕoƛ’no.
\m b-oƛƛo zaman b-ik’i-nosi yeda yisi-a yisi-s bˤeƛ’-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy baru-qor eƛi-n ele mi-r his-n hiƛu-n ʕoƛ’-n
\g III-middle time III-go-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 sheep-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB wife-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB here you-LAT spring.wool-and comb-and spindle-and
\l After some time has passed, while he went to his flock of sheep, he said to his wife: "Here is wool, a comb and a spindle for you.

\t Di ayzaƛ’or xuxin ek’no hisno, där bigu, qema regirxanusi butni bodoƛin.
\m di ay-zaƛ’or xuxi-n ek’-n his-n di-r b-igu qema r-egir-xanusi butni b-odi-o-ƛin
\g me come-POST.CVB comb-PFV.CVB spin-PFV.CVB spring.wool-TOP me-LAT III-good rain IV-let-NEG.PRS.PRT burka III-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l Before I come back, comb and spin the wool, and make a good burka for me, that doesn't let the rain go through."

\t T’ok’ow roda šebinon koƛ’inč’ey, hisno, hiƛun, ʕoƛ’no, nucosgon bankan bisno, yedu kid beqaɣor yoqno.
\m t’ok’ow r-odi-a šebinon koƛ’i-č’ey his-n hiƛu-n ʕoƛ’-n nuci-s-gon banka-n b-is-n yedu kid buq-aɣor y-oq-n
\g anymore IV-do-INF something understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB spring.wool-and comb-and spindle-and honey-GEN1-CNTR jar-and III-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG girl sun-IN.VERS II-become-PST.UNW
\l Not knowing what to do anymore, the girl took the wool, the comb, the spindle and a jar of honey and went into the sun.

\t Nucoł his roqux xuxix zown neła, hiƛurqaygon roɣłinč’ey ʕiyayx zown.
\m nuci-ł his r-oqu-x xuxi-x zow-n neła-a hiƛu-qay-gon r-oɣ-ł-č’ey ʕiyad-x zow-n
\g honey-CONT.ESS spring.wool IV-stick-IPFV.CVB comb-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG comb-POSS.ABL-CNTR IV-take.away-POT-NEG.PST.CVB cry-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l She sticked the wool into the honey and combed it, and when she couldn't take it off the comb anymore, she cried.

\t Yiłas guru maduhalzas kidbazar teqxo zown.
\m yiła-s guru maduhal-bi-s kid-bi-r teq-x zow-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 crying neighbor-PL-GEN1 daughter-PL-LAT hear-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The neighbors' daughters heared her crying.

\t Kidbä his xuxiƛ’oräy, nełaƛ’ yałru aq’ˤuban, q’ʷariłin bukaynosi, yisiq reže qoqoƛu regin.
\m kid-a his xuxi-ƛ’oräy neła-ƛ’ yoł-ru aq’ˤuba-n q’ʷariłi-n b-ukad-nosi yisi-q r-eže qoqoƛu r-egi-n
\g girl-ERG spring.wool comb-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS be-PST.PRT torture-and sadness-and III-see-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-big laughter IV-be.emitted-PST.UNW
\l While the girl was combing the wool, he laughed loudly, when he saw the torture and sadness that was upon her.

\t Nesiz resmozax rizin zawru q’ˤutno pˤoƛin, yeda uži saɣ oqno.
\m nesi-z res-bi-x r-izi-n zow-ru q’ˤut-n pˤoƛi-n yeda uži saɣ oq-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 throat-PL-AD.ESS IV.PL-get-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT abscess-TOP explode-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG boy cure become-PST.UNW
\l The abscess that had gotten onto his throat exploded and the boy got cured.

\t Nasin esnabi ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu rizin, elas esiw aħozis bara saɣ oysƛin.
\m nasin esyu-bi ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu r-izi-n ela-s esiw aħo-s baru-a saɣ odi-s-ƛin
\g all sister-PL very be.happy II.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB we(II-GEN1 brother shepherd-GEN1 wife-ERG cure do-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l All the sisters were very happy: "Our brother was cured by the shepherd's wife!"

\t Hemełtow zamanał, k’oƛin rik’in yizi aħozis barur kumak boda.
\m hemeł-tow zaman-ł k’oƛi-n r-ik’i-n yizi aħo-s baru-r kumak b-odi-a
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH time-CONT.ESS run-PFV.CVB II.PL-go-PST.UNW DEM2.IPL shepherd-GEN1 wife-LAT help III-do-INF
\l At that time they ran to help the shepherd's wife.

\t Sidä his xuxix zown, sis ek’anił c’oxno, ɣoq’ˤot’aniza butnin, xaličabin rodin.
\m sida-a his xuxi-x zow-n sis ek’-ani-ł c’ox-n ɣoq’ˤo-t’a-ni-bi-a butni-n xaliča-bi-n r-odi-n
\g one.OBL-ERG spring.wool comb-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB one spin-MSD-CONT.ESS hit-PFV.CVB other-DISTR-DEF-PL-ERG burka-and mat-PL-and IV-do-PST.UNW
\l One was combing the wool, one was hitting it to spin, the others made the burka and mats.

\t Boyxosi ħalt’i łiynosi, esnabin iduɣor rik’in.
\m b-odi-xosi ħalt’i łiy-nosi esyu-bi-n idu-ɣor r-ik’i-n
\g III-do-PRS.PRT work end-ANT.CVB sister-PL-TOP home-IN.ALL II.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l When they finished the work, the sisters went home.

\t Yizin xaličabin ok’qo rixin, xedyoqor yezun barun yičin.
\m y-izi-n xaliča-bi-n ok’-q r-ixi-n xediw-qor y-ezu-n baru-n y-iči-n
\g II-get.up-PFV.CVB mat-PL-TOP nail-POSS.ESS III.PL-hang-PFV.CVB husband-POSS.LAT II-look-PFV.CVB wife-TOP II-wait-PST.UNW
\l The wife got up, hung the mats onto a nail and waited for her husband.

\t Neširu idur aynosi, qidozaq rixäsi xaličabin, butnin bukaynosi haqa ogun ƛexun.
\m neširu idu-r ay-nosi qido-bi-q r-ixi-asi xaliča-bi-n butni-n b-ukad-nosi haqu-a ogu-n ƛexu-n
\g evening home-LAT come-ANT.CVB wall-PL-POSS.ESS III.PL-hang-RES.PRT mat-PL-and burka-and III-see-ANT.CVB mouth-ERG gape-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l In the evening, when he came home and saw the mats hanging on the wall and the burka, his mouth gaped.

\t Nesis rok’ƛ’or rayn, nełaz eniya däqor neširur oč’ino q’ˤap’o boyxosiƛin eƛizaƛ’ di ʕadadawa bužzi oqinč’ey ičäsi zown.
\m nesi-s rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-n neła-z eni-a di-qor neširu-r oč’ino q’ˤap’o b-odi-xosi-ƛin eƛi-zaƛ’ di ʕadada-a bužzi oq-č’ey iči-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 mother-ERG me-POSS.LAT evening-LAT nine spindle III-do-PRS.PRT-QUOT say-CSL.CVB me in.vain-Q believe become-NEG.PST.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l It came onto his mind: "I seemingly didn't believe in vain that her mother said she could prepare nine spindles until the evening.

\t Yaqˤuł yiła däz bara oč’ira ɣˤanazacewa ħalt’i bodin.
\m yaqˤuł yiła-a di-z baru-a oč’ira ɣˤanabi-a-ce-a ħalt’i b-odi-n
\g today DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG me-GEN2 wife-ERG nine woman-ERG-EQU1-Q work III-do-PST.UNW
\l Today my wife worked like nine women.

\t Aħo oqłin taliħ yołäsiwa zown diƛin, eƛin nesä nesiƛ nucoł roqux his xuxix baru yukaynč’izaƛ’.
\m aħo oq-łin taliħ yoł-asi-a zow-n di-ƛin eƛi-n nesi-a nesi-ƛ nuci-ł r-oqu-x his xuxi-x baru y-ukad-č’i-zaƛ’
\g shepherd become-CNC.CVB fortune be-RES.PRT-Q be.NPRS-PFV.CVB me-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUB.ESS honey-CONT.ESS IV-stick-IPFV.CVB spring.wool comb-IPFV.CVB wife II-see-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB
\l It turns out I became a lucky shepherd.", he said to himself, because he didn't saw his wife combing the wool that stuck in the honey.

\t Xizyo neł kidbeƛ’or keč’ boɣno:
\m xizyo neła kid-ƛ’or keč’ b-oɣ-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-SUPER.LAT song III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards he sang a song about this girl:

\t Kecno moƛał ʕumru bäk’iru debi,
\m kec-n moƛu-ł ʕumru b-ik’i-ru mi-s
\g sleep-PFV.CVB dream-CONT.ESS life III-go-PST.PRT you-GEN1
\l The life you led was in a dream,

\t Yaqˤuł maduhales kidbabi ħalar,
\m yaqˤuł maduhal-s kid-bi ħal-ar
\g today neighbor-GEN1 daughter-PL help-IN.LAT
\l Today the neighbor's daughters [came] to help,

\t Ɣudezoni ɣudä šow roƛäx deber.
\m ɣude-zo-ni ɣudi-a šow r-oƛix mi-r
\g tomorrow-ATTR.OBL-DEF day-IN.ESS who IV-appear you-LAT
\l and tomorrow who will appear to you?

\t Oč’ino mučari ɣudest’a rac’zaƛ’,
\m oč’ino mučari ɣudes-t’a r-ac’-zaƛ’
\g nine cumin daily-DISTR IV-eat-CSL.CVB
\l Because you ate nine cumin cakes a day,

\t Hudunč’e nucoł his roqux ƛexun mi.
\m hudun-č’e nuci-ł his r-oqu-x ƛexu-n mi
\g nevertheless-INTS honey-CONT.ESS spring.wool IV-stick-IPFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW you
\l you nevertheless were sticking the wool into the honey.

\t Taliħ boqno debi xizay yäk’iru,
\m taliħ b-oq-n mi-s xizay y-ik’i-ru
\g fortune III-become-PFV.CVB you-GEN1 behind II-go-PST.PRT
\l That you went behind [me] became your luck,

\t Eniya aħozi iqäru deber.
\m eni-a aħo iqir-ru mi-r
\g mother-ERG shepherd find-PST.PRT you-LAT
\l your mother has found a shepherd for you.

\t Oč’ira mučaris bahana besun,
\m oč’ira mučari-s bahana b-esu-n
\g nine cumin-GEN1 excuse III-find-PFV.CVB
\l She found the excuse for the nine cumin cakes,

\t His- musoƛ’or rutin, aħozi oqzaƛ’.
\m his mus-o-ƛ’or r-uti-n aħo oq-zaƛ’
\g spring.wool hair-IMPR-SUPER.LAT IV.PL-turn-PST.UNW shepherd become-CSL.CVB
\l and because there was a shepherd, they turned into wool.

\t Bayru ħalt’os baq’ˤu mukno bisxo zownanu Ħasanä, sida quł išʷaniƛer taraw.
\m b-ay-ru ħalt’i-s b-aq’ˤu muk-n b-is-x zow-n-anu Ħasan-a sida qu-ł iš-ani-ƛer taraw
\g III-come-PST.PRT work-GEN1 III-much salary-TOP III-take-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG Hassan-ERG one.OBL day-CONT.ESS eat-MSD-SUB.LAT except.for
\l For the work he did, Hassan did not earn much money but for one day to eat.

\t Howži yisi Ħasanes ečriłno lagis tatun bexun, ħalt’i boda biynč’us oqʷa iħun.
\m howži yisi Ħasan-s ečrił-n laga-s tatu-n b-exu-n ħalt’i b-odi-a b-iy-č’u-si oq-a iħu-n
\g now DEM2.ISG.OBL Hassan-GEN1 get.old-PFV.CVB body-GEN1 power-TOP III-die-PFV.CVB work III-do-INF III-know-NEG.PST.WIT-ATTR become-INF begin-PFV.CVB
\l Now Hassan's old body ran out of power, and he started getting unable to do the work.

\t Yisä pikru bodin, didiwgon boqłin sida maxšelyoƛ’or ečula ʕUmar ruhun oqanix t’et’ra ižanƛin.
\m yisi-a pikru b-odi-n didiw-gon b-oq-łin sida maxšel-ƛ’or ečula ʕUmar ruhun oq-ani-x t’et’r-a iži-an-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG idea III-do-PFV.CVB which-CNTR III-become-CNC.CVB one.OBL skill-SUPER.LAT grandchild Umar learn become-MSD-AD.ESS learn-INF lead-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l He thought: "I'll lead my grandson Umar to learn so he can learn at least one skill."

\t Hunixor qˤišon erno, saparyox boqno.
\m huni-xor qˤišo-n er-n sapar-x b-oq-n
\g way-AD.LAT leftovers-TOP put-PFV.CVB journey-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l They took some leftovers for the way and went on a journey.

\t Sasaqay neširur bik’in yizi sida oreznixor bayn.
\m sasaq-ay neširu-r b-ik’i-n yizi sida orezni-xor b-ay-n
\g in.the.morning-IN.ABL evening-LAT I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL one.OBL pond-AD.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l They went from the morning to the evening and came to a pond.

\t Elor bayrun, muši begira Ħasan q’ˤida ičiƛ’oräy ox̌-x̌o-x̌oyƛin eƛin.
\m elo-r b-ay-run muši b-egi-r-a Ħasan q’ˤida iči-ƛ’oräy ox̌~x̌o~x̌oy-ƛin eƛi-n
\g there-LAT I.PL-come-IMM.ANT.CVB breath I.PL-be.emitted-CAUS-INF Hassan down sit-SIM.CVB oh~ho~hoy-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l As soon as they arrived there, while Hassan sat down to take a breath, he said: "Oh-ho-hoy!"

\t Ža nesiq eƛin rok’äłrun, oƛixno sis eže žek’u k’oƛin, łu di goƛ’äƛin.
\m ža nesi-q eƛi-n r-ok’eł-run oƛix-n sis eže žek’u k’oƛi-n łu di goƛ’i-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS say-PFV.CVB IV-lose-IMM.ANT.CVB appear-PFV.CVB one old man jump-PFV.CVB who.ERG me call-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Right after he said that [to him?], an old man appeared jumping: "Who called me?"

\t Mi łukin goƛ’inč’uƛin, eƛin yisi Ħasanä.
\m mi łu-kin goƛ’i-č’u-ƛin eƛi-n yisi Ħasan-a
\g you who.ERG-even call-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL Hassan-ERG
\l "Nobody called you.", said Hassan.

\t Ox̌oyoƛin łu eƛäƛin, esirno yisi žek’a yiziq.
\m Ox̌oyo-ƛin łu eƛi-a-ƛin esir-n yisi žek’u-a yizi-q
\g Ohoyo-QUOT who.ERG say-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL man-ERG DEM2.IPL-POSS.ESS
\l "Who said Ohoyo?", that man asked him.

\t Akiłzaƛ’ di eƛisƛin, Ħasanä žawab teƛno.
\m akił-zaƛ’ di eƛi-s-ƛin Ħasan-a žawab teƛ-n
\g get.tired-CSL.CVB me say-PST.WIT-QUOT Hassan-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "I said it, because I got tired.", answered Hassan.

\t Elexa, hudulaw žek’u ža Ox̌oyo di yoł.
\m ele-xa hudulaw žek’u ža Ox̌oyo di yoł
\g here-INT so man DEM1.SG Ohoyo me be
\l "Lo and behold, dear man, I am this Ohoyo.

\t Ha, hudu Allahä begirłi nar meži boqäsiƛin, c’aq’tow ħerenno oqno esirno nesi žek’a.
\m ha hudu Allah-a b-egir-łi nar meži b-oq-asi-ƛin c’aq’-tow ħeren-n oq-n esir-n nesi žek’u-a
\g well so God-ERG I.PL-send-CND.CVB.IRR where you.PL I.PL-become-RES.PRT-QUOT very-EMPH politely-TOP become-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG
\l Well, so God will, where are you going?", the man asked very politely.

\t Enda dey ečuy t’et’ra ižixƛin, esin Ħasanä raqru šebin.
\m enda di-s ečuy t’et’r-a iži-x-ƛin esi-n Ħasan-a r-oq-ru šebin
\g DEM3b.SG me-GEN1 grandchild learn-INF lead-IPFV.CVB-QUOT tell-PST.UNW Hassan-ERG IV-happen-PST.PRT thing
\l "I am bringing my grandson here to school.", Hassan told what had happened.

\t Din siħrus ʕilmu mołixosi yoł, retinäy dädertow egirƛin, eƛin Ox̌oyä.
\m di-n siħru-s ʕelmu mołi-xosi yoł r-eti-näy di-der-tow egir-ƛin eƛi-n Ox̌oyo-a
\g me-TOP slyness-GEN1 science teach-PRS.PRT be IV-want-CND.CVB me-APUD.LAT-EMPH send-QUOT say-PST.UNW Ohoyo-ERG
\l "I am also teaching the science of slyness; if you want, send him to me!", said Ohoyo.

\t Howži, nesä bexaru xabaryoƛ’ Ħasanä imanno erno, razin oqno, yisi Ox̌oyode zendi ečula ʕUmarno egirno.
\m howži nesi-a b-exu-ru xabar-ƛ’ Ħasan-a iman-n er-n razi-n oq-n yisi Ox̌oyo-de zendi ečula ʕUmar-n egir-n
\g now DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG III-die-PST.PRT story-SUPER.ESS Hassan-ERG faith-TOP put-PFV.CVB agree-TOP become-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL Ohoyo-APUD.ESS accompanying grandchild Umar-TOP send-PST.UNW
\l Now, Hassan believed in the what he got told, he agreed and sent his grandchild Umar together with Ohoyo.

\t Ox̌oya ʕUmar iduɣorno ižin, siħrus ʕilmu moła iħun.
\m Ox̌oyo-a ʕUmar idu-ɣor-n iži-n siħru-s ʕelmu mołi-a iħu-n
\g Ohoyo-ERG Umar home-IN.ALL-TOP lead-PFV.CVB slyness-GEN1 science teach-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l Ohoyo lead Umar to his home and began to teach him the science of slyness.

\t Yisä yeda onočaƛ’or, ƛelƛ’or, cek’ƛ’or bełiƛ’or, beƛ’q’ˤuƛ’or, ziyƛ’or, isƛ’or utanix ruhun odin.
\m yisi-a yeda onoču-ƛ’or ƛeli-ƛ’or cek’i-ƛ’or bełi-ƛ’or bˤeƛ’q’ˤu-ƛ’or ziya-ƛ’or is-ƛ’or uti-ani-x ruhun odi-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG hen-SUPER.LAT lamb-SUPER.LAT goat.kid-SUPER.LAT deer-SUPER.LAT sheep-SUPER.LAT cow-SUPER.LAT bull-SUPER.LAT turn-MSD-AD.ESS teach do-PST.UNW
\l He taught him how to turn into a hen, a lamb, a goat kid, a deer, a sheep, a cow and a bull.

\t Hemedur q’ˤano ƛˤebce zaman bik’in.
\m hemedur q’ˤano ƛˤeb-ace zaman b-ik’i-n
\g so two year-TERM time III-go-PST.UNW
\l So two years passed by.

\t Neła kidbes ʕUmarqor šuliyaw roƛ’i boqno.
\m neła kid-s ʕUmar-qor šuliyaw roƛ’i b-oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-GEN1 Umar-POSS.LAT strong love III-become-PST.UNW
\l That girl fell deeply in love with Umar.

\t Sida quł yiła Ox̌oyo šebi žek’u yałrułi ʕUmarqo esin.
\m sida qu-ł yiła-a Ox̌oyo šebi žek’u yoł-rułi ʕUmar-q esi-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG Ohoyo what man be-MSD Umar-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW
\l One day she told Umar what man Ohoyo was.

\t ʕUmar, sanaʕałi boqno xizaz mi t’ay xexłiƛ’ oxi.
\m ʕUmar sanaʕałi b-oq-n xizaz mi t’ay xexłi-ƛ’ oxi
\g Umar chance III-become-PFV.CVB from.behind you from.here quickness-SUPER.ESS run.away
\l "Umar, when the chance arises, quickly run away from here!

\t Nesä mi kʷaxatow posurƛ’orno utirno ac’a yoł.
\m nesi-a mi kʷaxa-tow posu-ƛ’or-n utir-n ac’-a yoł
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you soon-EMPH cattle-SUPER.LAT-TOP turn-PFV.CVB eat-INF be
\l He will soon turn you into a cattle and eat you.

\t Ža posurƛ’ort’a butirxo xalq’i bac’xosi žek’u yołƛin, ʕaq’lu boyn neła kidbä.
\m ža posu-ƛ’or-t’a b-utir-x xalq’i b-ac’-xosi žek’u yoł-ƛin ʕaq’lu b-odi-n neła kid-a
\g DEM1.SG cattle-SUPER.LAT-DISTR III-turn-IPFV.CVB people III-eat-PRS.PRT man be-QUOT advice III-do-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-ERG
\l He is a man who turns people into cattle and eats them!", advised the girl.

\t Neła quł sasaq, č’urqˤotow, yeda ʕUmar izin oxin.
\m neła qu-ł sasaq č’urqˤo-tow yeda ʕUmar izi-n oxi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS tomorrow in.the.morning-EMPH DEM2.ISG Umar get.up-PFV.CVB run.away-PST.UNW
\l The next day in the morning, Umar got up and ran away.

\t Žan riyn nesiłtow xizay Ox̌oyon k’oƛin.
\m ža-n r-iy-n nesi-ł-tow xizay Ox̌oyo-on k’oƛi-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP IV-know-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-EMPH behind Ohoyo-CND run-PST.UNW
\l When he knew it, Ohoyo ran behind him.

\t Iqira yisä iħurƛ’oräy ʕUmar onočaƛ’or utin oxin.
\m iqir-a yisi-a iħur-ƛ’oräy ʕUmar onoču-ƛ’or uti-n oxi-n
\g catch-INF DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG begin-SIM.CVB Umar hen-SUPER.LAT turn-PFV.CVB run.away-PST.UNW
\l When he began to catch up, Umar turned into a hen and ran away.

\t Kurzak’ugon yisiłäyn boqno xizay k’oƛin.
\m kurzak’u-gon yisi-łay-n b-oq-n xizay k’oƛi-n
\g falcon-CNTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB from.behind run-PST.UNW
\l And he became a falcon and ran afterwards.

\t Xizyogon ʕUmar ƛelƛ’or utin, Ox̌oyo ziruƛ’or utin, cek’ƛ’or ʕUmar - yeda ceyƛ’or, beƛ’q’ˤuƛ’or yeda - boc’ƛ’or Ox̌oyo, ziyƛ’or ʕUmar utin - zeyƛ’or ža.
\m xizyogon ʕUmar ƛeli-ƛ’or uti-n Ox̌oyo ziru-ƛ’or uti-n cek’i-ƛ’or ʕUmar - yeda cey-ƛ’or bˤeƛ’q’ˤu-ƛ’or yeda - boc’i-ƛ’or Ox̌oyo ziya-ƛ’or ʕUmar uti-n - zey-ƛ’or ža
\g then Umar lamb-SUPER.LAT turn-PFV.CVB Ohoyo fox-SUPER.LAT turn-PFV.CVB goat.kid-SUPER.LAT Umar - DEM2.ISG eagle-SUPER.LAT sheep-SUPER.LAT DEM2.ISG - wolf-SUPER.LAT Ohoyo cow-SUPER.LAT Umar turn-PST.UNW - bear-SUPER.LAT DEM1.SG
\l Then Umar turned into a lamb, Ohoyo turned into a fox, Umar into a goat kid - he into an eagle, he into a sheep - Ohoyo into a wolf, Umar turned into a cow - he into a bear.

\t Howžiƛa iqirxoƛin zawrułer, t’ok’ow łinasnotow čaran bexun ʕUmar at’ƛ’or utin ičin.
\m howži-ƛa iqir-x-ƛin zow-ru-łer t’ok’ow łina-s-n-tow čara-n b-exu-n ʕUmar at’-ƛ’or uti-n iči-n
\g now-INDEF catch-IPFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.PRT-CONT.LAT anymore what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-EMPH possibility-TOP III-die-PFV.CVB Umar wheat-SUPER.LAT turn-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l "Now he's catching me.", Umar had no other choice anymore and turned into wheat.

\t Yedagon onočaƛ’orno utin at’ rac’a iħun.
\m yeda-gon onoču-ƛ’or-n uti-n at’ r-ac’-a iħu-n
\g DEM2.ISG-CNTR hen-SUPER.LAT-TOP turn-PFV.CVB wheat IV-eat-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l The other one turned into a hen and began to eat the wheat.

\t Sida ƛäxuru muhumołäy ʕUmar kurzak’aƛ’orno utin, onočaƛ’or atiruni Ox̌oyoƛ’ c’oxno.
\m sida ƛexu-ru muhu-łay ʕUmar kurzak’u-ƛ’or-n uti-n onoču-ƛ’or uti-ru-ni Ox̌oyo-ƛ’ c’ox-n
\g one.OBL remain-PST.PRT granule-CONT.ABL Umar falcon-SUPER.LAT-TOP turn-PFV.CVB hen-SUPER.LAT turn-PST.PRT-DEF Ohoyo-SUPER.ESS pounce-PST.UNW
\l From a single remaining grain, Umar turned into a falcon again and pounced upon Ohoyo who had turned into a hen.

\t ʕAƛoxor aynosigon dibirno goƛ’in, maharno erno, ixiw bertenno bodin.
\m ʕaƛ-xor ay-nosi-gon dibir-n goƛ’i-n mahar-n er-n ixiw berten-n b-odi-n
\g village-AD.LAT come-ANT.CVB-CNTR imam-TOP call-PFV.CVB wedding-TOP put-PFV.CVB big marriage-TOP III-do-PST.UNW
\l When he came into he village, he called the imam, organized a wedding and threw a big marriage.

\t Ža eženi ečuy Ħasan žaqˤułno ʕaƛox yołƛax ʕUmares xexbin šet’u butirno žeduq kesubi esix.
\m ža eže-ni ečuy Ħasan žaqˤuł-n ʕaƛ-x yoł-ƛax ʕUmar-s xexbi-n šet’u b-utir-n žedu-q kesu-bi esi-x
\g DEM1.SG old-DEF grandfather Hassan today-TOP village-AD.ESS be-QUOT Umar-GEN1 children-TOP around I.PL-gather-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS tale-PL tell-PRS
\l They say that the old grandfather Hassan is still living in the the village and, surrounded by Umar's children, tells them tales.

\t Žeduder ƛirbałix din aysi, där žeda rigu ƛirbałin roysi, din nexsi mežuq yedu kesu esanix.
\m žedu-der ƛirbałi-x di-n ay-s di-r žedu-a r-igu ƛirbałi-n r-odi-s di-n nex-s mežu-q yedu kesu esi-ani-x
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.LAT hospitality-AD.ESS me-and come-PST.WIT me-LAT DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG IV-good hospitality-TOP IV-do-PST.WIT me-TOP come-PST.WIT you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM2.IISG tale tell-MSD-AD.ESS
\l I came to them as a guest as well, they treated me great and I have come to tell you this story.

\t Žedus sistow sis uži zowno.
\m žedu-s sis-tow sis uži zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-GEN1 one-EMPH one son be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They had only one son.

\t Žeda ža hemece etizaq ƛ’at’umoƛ’no egirno siskin nesir q’ʷariłi bukara begirinč’ey q’ˤida äčizar kikix zowno.
\m žeda-a ža hemece eti-zaq ƛ’at’u-ƛ’-n egir-n siskin nesi-r q’ʷariłi b-ukar-a b-egir-č’ey q’ˤida iči-za-r kiki-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG such love-CSL.CVB caprice-SUPER.ESS-TOP let-PFV.CVB anything DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT sadness III-show-INF III-let-NEG.PST.CVB down sit-LCV-LAT feed-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Because they loved him so much, they let him be capricious, had him sit down and fed him, without showing him anything sad.

\t Sida quł babiya užin goƛ’in nesiqor eƛix, uži, di ži eže izäsi oqzaƛ’, eynoda iyxanu.
\m sida qu-ł babi-a uži-n goƛ’i-n nesi-qor eƛi-x uži di ži eže izi-asi oq-zaƛ’ eynod-a iy-x-anu
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS dad-ERG son-TOP call-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-IPFV.CVB son me now old get-RES.PRT become-CSL.CVB work-INF know-IPFV.CVB-NEG
\l One day the father called his son saying to him: "Son, because I have become old now, I can't work anymore.

\t Deber mi ħak’o t’alam bodaniƛäy eynodanix debi zaman baynƛin.
\m mi-r mi ħak’o t’alam b-odi-ani-ƛay eynod-ani-x mi-s zaman b-ay-n-ƛin
\g you-LAT you khinkali care III-do-MSD-SUB.ABL work-MSD-AD.ESS you-GEN1 time III-come-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The time has come for you to work for the khinkali yourself."

\t Babiya uži eynodanixno egirno, nesä badiru micxir bukarerno.
\m babi-a uži eynod-ani-x-n egir-n nesi-a b-odi-ru micxir b-ukar-r-n
\g dad-ERG son work-MSD-AD.ESS-TOP send-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG III-do-PST.PRT money III-show-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l The father sent his son to work and made him show the money he earned.

\t Babiyagon nesiqayn bisno, ža micxir c’idaɣor kurno.
\m babi-a-gon nesi-qay-n b-is-n ža micxir c’i-daɣor kur-n
\g dad-ERG-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG money fire-APUD.VERS throw-PST.UNW
\l The father than took the money from him and threw it into the fire.

\t Babiwr čuqˤno užiqor micxir eniwqay biqixosi yałrułi.
\m babiw-r čuqˤ-n uži-qor micxir eniw-qay b-iqi-xosi yoł-rułi
\g father-LAT notice-PST.UNW boy-POSS.LAT money mother-POSS.ABL III-get-PRS.PRT be-MSD
\l The father noticed that the boy got the money from his mother.

\t Eniwqno nesi užä esix zownanu babiya ža micxir c’idaɣor kurxoƛin.
\m eniw-q-n nesi uži-a esi-x zow-n-anu babi-a ža micxir c’i-daɣor kur-x-ƛin
\g mother-POSS.ESS-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL son-ERG tell-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG dad-ERG DEM1.SG money fire-APUD.VERS throw-PRS-QUOT
\l The son didn't tell his mother that the father was throwing the money into the fire.

\t Xizaɣor, hudun nełar riyx babiya užiqay bisxot’a micxir c’idaɣor kurxosi yałrułi.
\m xizaɣor hudun neła-r r-iy-x babi-a uži-qay b-is-x-t’a micxir c’i-daɣor kur-xosi yoł-rułi
\g finally nevertheless DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT IV-know-PRS dad-ERG boy-POSS.ABL III-take-IPFV.CVB-DISTR money fire-APUD.VERS throw-PRS.PRT be-MSD
\l Nevertheless she finally found out that the father was throwing the money that the boy earned into the fire.

\t Xizyo eniya užiqor eƛix, bik’uranircetow micxir elzox anuƛin.
\m xizyo eni-a uži-qor eƛi-x b-ik’u-r-ani-r-ce-tow micxir ele-zo-x anu-ƛin
\g afterwards mother-ERG son-POSS.LAT say-PRS I.PL-burn-CAUS-MSD-LAT-EQU1-EMPH money here-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS be.NEG-QUOT
\l Afterwards the mother said to her son: "There is no money here to be burnt."

\t Užä nesä nesir micxir boda oqno.
\m uži-a nesi-a nesi-r micxir b-odi-a oq-n
\g boy-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT money III-do-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l The boy started to earn money himself.

\t Sida bečedaw žek’uderno ik’in, nesiz k’udoz baɣman eynoyn, micxirno bodin, bižin babiwqor teƛno.
\m sida bečedaw žek’u-der-n ik’i-n nesi-z k’udi-z baɣ-a-n eynod-n micxir-n b-odi-n b-iži-n babiw-qor teƛ-n
\g one.OBL wealthy man-APUD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 vine-GEN2 garden-IN.ESS-TOP work-PFV.CVB money-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB III-carry-PFV.CVB father-POSS.LAT give-PST.UNW
\l He went to a wealthy man, worked on his vineyard, earned money and carried it to give it to his father.

\t Babiyagon hemedurtow c’idaɣor kurƛ’oräy, užä k’oƛin babiws mecun biqirno eƛin, yedu micxir eynoyn, dey di eɣʷedin et’no biqiräsi yołƛin.
\m babi-a-gon hemedur-tow c’i-daɣor kur-ƛ’oräy uži-a k’oƛi-n babiw-s mecu-n b-iqir-n eƛi-n yedu micxir eynod-n di-s di eɣʷedi-n et’-n b-iqir-asi yoł-ƛin
\g dad-ERG-CNTR so-EMPH fire-APUD.VERS throw-SIM.CVB boy-ERG jump-PFV.CVB father-GEN1 hand-TOP III-stop-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG money work-PFV.CVB me-GEN1 me sweat-TOP pour-PFV.CVB III-win-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l When the father was throwing it into the fire likewise, the boy jumped up and stopped the father's hand and said: "I worked for that money, it is earned with my own sweat."

\t Ele hoboda debi mi eɣʷedin et’no biqiräsi micxir boqzaƛ’, c’idaɣor kura baynč’iƛin, eƛin babiya, užä nesä nesir micxir boda oqsiƛin rok’u č’eze roqnosi.
\m ele hoboda mi-s mi eɣʷedi-n et’-n b-iqir-asi micxir b-oq-zaƛ’ c’i-daɣor kur-a b-ay-č’i-ƛin eƛi-n babi-a uži-a nesi-a nesi-r micxir b-odi-a oq-s-ƛin rok’u č’eze r-oq-nosi
\g there that you-GEN1 you sweat-TOP pour-PFV.CVB III-win-RES.PRT money III-become-CSL.CVB fire-APUD.VERS throw-INF III-must-NEG.FUT-QUOT say-PFV.CVB dad-ERG boy-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT money III-do-INF begin-PST.WIT-QUOT heart convinced[?] IV-become-ANT.CVB
\l "There, because it's the money you earned with your own sweat, I don't have to throw it into the fire.", said the father, and was convinced that his son earned money for himself.

\t Esin šebi xecin šebi, zownƛax sis q’ˤanon halmaɣbi.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi zow-n-ƛax sis q’ˤano-n halmaɣ-bi
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT one two-TOP friend-PL
\l Once upon a time there were two friends.

\t Sidƛ’o ʕAt’idƛin, sideniƛ’gon Q’arumƛin cirabi yołäsi.
\m sida-ƛ’ ʕAt’id-ƛin sideni-ƛ’-gon Q’arum-ƛin ci-bi yoł-asi
\g one.OBL-SUPER.ESS Atid-QUOT the.other.one-SUPER.ESS-CNTR Qarum-QUOT name-PL be-RES.PRT
\l One was named Atid, the other one Qarum.

\t Sida quł žedu sadaq hunix boqno.
\m sida qu-ł žedu sadaq huni-x b-oq-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.IPL together way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l One day they went together on a way.

\t Q’arumä adäz äru šebin rac’no.
\m Q’arum-a adäz er-ru šebin r-ac’-n
\g Qarum-ERG ahead put-PST.PRT thing IV-eat-PST.UNW
\l Qarum ate the things that were put in front [of him].

\t ʕEziyaw bišnosi, roč’iw łin ħaƛun halmaɣbi elaygon bitor hunix boqno.
\m ʕeziyaw b-iš-nosi r-oč’iw łi-n ħaƛu-n halmaɣ-bi ele-ay-gon bitor huni-x b-oq-n
\g much I.PL-eat-ANT.CVB IV-cold water-TOP drink-PFV.CVB friend-PL there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l After they had eaten much, the friends drank cold water and set out from there.

\t Sasiła zaman baynosi, žeda ħuħ eqra sanaʕataw moči k’edin.
\m sasił-a zaman b-ay-nosi žedu-a ħuħ eqer-a sanaʕataw moči k’edi-n
\g get.dark-INF time III-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG cheek put-INF comfortable place search-PST.UNW
\l After the darkness came, they searched for a comfortable place to put their cheek on.

\t Nesä hut’bi ragi-rac’xotow išanixno oqno ʕAt’idzo čanta yałru kinaw šebin łiyrno.
\m nesi-a hut’-bi r-agi~ac’-x-tow iš-ani-x-n oq-n ʕAt’id-z čanta-a yoł-ru kinaw šebin łiyr-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG lip-PL IV-lick.up-IPFV.CVB-EMPH eat-MSD-AD.ESS-TOP begin-PFV.CVB Atid-GEN2 pocket-IN.ESS be-PST.PRT entire thing finish-PST.UNW
\l Licking his lips, he began to eat and finished everything that was in Atid's pocket.

\t Neła quł hudayziko sasaqasi zaman baynosi, žedur bišanix retin, hudun Q’arumä nesiqosini biša ader roƛik’noanu.
\m neła qu-ł hudayziko sasaq-si zaman b-ay-nosi žedu-r b-iš-ani-x r-eti-n hudun Q’arum-a nesi-q-si-ni bišʷa ader r-oƛik’-n-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS the.next.day in.the.morning-ATTR time III-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT I.PL-eat-MSD-AD.ESS IV-want-PFV.CVB nevertheless Qarum-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-ATTR-DEF food forward IV-pull.out-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l A day later, when the morning time came, they wanted to eat, but Qarum didn't take out the food that he had.

\t Qˤišodes zaman baynosin hemedurtow ičin Q’arum.
\m qˤišod-s zaman b-ay-nosi-n hemedur-tow iči-n Q’arum
\g dinner-GEN1 time III-come-ANT.CVB-TOP so-EMPH be-PST.UNW Qarum
\l And when the time for dinner came, Qarum was likewise.

\t Neširur ža aderzotow sida šušuliłäsi aɣˤuxor aynosi, sasaqor howlotow ičanix ħukmu boqxo.
\m neširu-r ža ader-z-tow sida šušuli-ł-asi aɣˤu-xor ay-nosi sasaq-qor howlo-tow iči-ani-x ħukmu b-oq-x
\g evening-LAT DEM1.SG forward-GEN2-EMPH one.OBL demolish-POT-RES.PRT mill-AD.LAT come-ANT.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT there-EMPH wait-MSD-AD.ESS decision III-become-PRS
\l By the evening he came to a demolished mill and decided to wait there until morning.

\t ʕAt’idä c’in rit’erno qˤiči riħurxozoni koboraxaza uqˤełno ičin.
\m ʕAt’id-a c’i-n r-it’r-n qˤiči r-iħur-xozo-ni koboro-xaza uqˤeł-n iči-n
\g Atid-ERG fire-TOP IV-extinguish-PFV.CVB harvest IV-pour-PRS.PRT.OBL-DEF granary-AD.VERS.DIST hide-PFV.CVB wait-PST.UNW
\l Atid put out the fire and hid in the granary where one pours the harvest.

\t Aɣˤa tełxor zeyn, boc’in, zirun roqno.
\m aɣˤu-a teł-xor zey-n boc’i-n ziru-n r-oq-n
\g mill-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT bear-and wolf-and fox-and III.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l Into the mill came a bear, a wolf and a fox.

\t Eli t’ay narnokin bik’ixanuƛin, bet’un k’oƛin ziru bičin.
\m eli t’ay nar-n-kin b-ik’i-x-anu-ƛin b-et’u-n k’oƛi-n ziru b-iči-n
\g we from.here where-TOP-even I.PL-go-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT III-jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB fox III-be-PST.UNW
\l "We are not going anywhere from here!", the fox jumped up.

\t Yoɣno kurno yičäruni aɣˤux elus xabaryabin teqerno siskin buyn bäčinč’i, hudu t’o ela sidä sidqo kesubi esix sasaqor bičan.
\m y-oɣ-n kur-n y-iči-ru-ni aɣˤu-x elu-s xabar-bi-n teqer-n siskin b-uy-n b-iči-č’i hudu t’o elu-a sida-a sida-q kesu-bi esi-x sasaq-qor b-iči-an
\g II-take.away-PFV.CVB throw-PFV.CVB II-be-PST.PRT-DEF mill-AD.ESS we(I).OBL-GEN1 story-PL-TOP listen.to-PFV.CVB anyone III-indeed-TOP III-be-NEG.FUT.CVB so here we(I).OBL-ERG one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.ESS secret-PL tell-IPFV.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT I.PL-wait-FUT.DEF
\l In this abandoned mill no one will hear what we say, so we will wait here until the morning telling each other secrets.

\t Zira äƛiru łinaƛ’no nasin razi roqno.
\m ziru-a eƛi-ru łina-ƛ’-n nasin razi r-oq-n
\g fox-ERG say-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP all agree III.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l All agreed on what the fox said.

\t Hič’č’a adäza zira esa boqno xabar, sasaq yił aɣˤuz ƛ’ˤuƛ’or mesedyosno, micxiryosno, ixinno ric’no beže aw bayxosi.
\m hič’č’a adäza ziru-a esi-a b-oq-n xabar sasaq yiła aɣˤu-z ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or mesed-s-n micxir-s-n ixin-n r-ic’-n b-eže aw b-ay-xosi
\g the.most ahead fox-ERG tell-INF III-begin-PFV.CVB story tomorrow DEM2.IISG.OBL mill-GEN2 roof-SUPER.LAT gold-GEN1-and money-GEN1-and bag-TOP IV-fill-PFV.CVB III-big mouse III-come-PRS.PRT
\l At first, the fox began to tell a story: "Tomorrow a big mouse will come onto the roof of this mill with a bag filled with gold and money.

\t Howlotow žan bet’irno ža beqa kecxosi yoł.
\m howlo-tow ža-n b-et’ir-n ža buq-a kec-xosi yoł
\g there-EMPH DEM1.SG-TOP III-make.a.bed-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG sun-IN.ESS sleep-PRS.PRT be
\l And there it will make a bed and is going to sleep under the sun.

\t Elo aw käczar hibon bok’no ža bexarur räqi ixina tełsi bečełiƛin.
\m elo aw kec-za-r hibo-n b-ok’-n ža b-exur-ru-r r-iqi ixin-a teł-si bečełi-ƛin
\g there mouse sleep-LCV-LAT stick-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG III-kill-PST.PRT-LAT IV-get bag-IN.ESS inside-ATTR riches-QUOT
\l And there beat a stick on where the mouse sleeps to kill her and get the riches from inside her bag!"

\t Xizyogon xabar esanix boc’i boqno, eluz maduhalłiq ičixozo xanez kidbes sis ozuri rexasi yoł.
\m xizyogon xabar esi-ani-x boc’i b-oq-n elu-z maduhalłi-q iči-xozo xan-z kid-s sis ozuri r-exu-asi yoł
\g then story tell-MSD-AD.ESS wolf III-begin-PST.UNW we(I).OBL-GEN2 neighbourhood-POSS.ESS live-PRS.PRT.OBL khan-GEN2 daughter-GEN1 one eye IV-die-RES.PRT be
\l Then the wolf began to tell a story: "The daughter of the king who lives in our neighbourhood is blind on one eye.

\t Nełas ža ozuri saɣ radirur xanä beže sayɣat bodanƛin ƛ’iri risäsi.
\m neła-s ža ozuri saɣ r-odi-ru-r xan-a b-eže sayɣat b-odi-an-ƛin ƛ’iri r-is-asi
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 DEM1.SG eye cure IV-do-PST.PRT-LAT khan-ERG III-big present III-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT above IV-take-RES.PRT
\l To he, who cures her eye, the king will give a big present.", he added.

\t Nełar ɣʷays gurow ozuri dandi keze roqxosi anuƛin.
\m neła-r ɣˤʷay-s gurow ozuri dandi keze r-oq-xosi anu-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT dog-GEN1 except eye only meet IV-become-PRS.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l "Only a dog's eye will fit her."

\t Zeyä xizyogon esin, eluz maduhalłiq yałru ʕaƛa łi ħaƛanix posu sida maqˤi yałruni keroqor rik’ixosi.
\m zey-a xizyogon esi-n elu-z maduhalłi-q yoł-ru ʕaƛ-a łi ħaƛu-ani-x posu sida maqˤi yoł-ru-ni kero-qor r-ik’i-xosi
\g bear-ERG then tell-PST.UNW we(I).OBL-GEN2 neighbourhood-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT village-IN.ESS water drink-MSD-AD.ESS cattle one.OBL far.away be-PST.PRT-DEF ravine-POSS.LAT IV-go-PRS.PRT
\l The bear then told: "In a village in our neighbourhood, the cattle has to go to a ravine that is far a way in order to drink water.

\t Žamaʕatyor riyx zows yołi žeduz ʕaƛoł boƛƛo sida ixiw aħinyoƛ teł kik yałrułi, elur ža dawla biqa zownč’uƛin.
\m žamaʕat-r r-iy-x zow-s yołi žedu-z ʕaƛ-ł b-oƛƛo sida ixiw aħin-ƛ teł kik yoł-rułi elu-r ža dawla b-iqi-a zow-č’u-ƛin
\g population-LAT IV-know-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT if DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 village-CONT.ESS III-middle one.OBL big rock-SUB.ESS inside spring be-MSD we(I).OBL-LAT DEM1.SG prey III-get-INF be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l If the population knew that in the middle of their village under a rock there is a spring, we would not get the prey."

\t Kinaw žedu bałgołibin esin halmaɣbi maħor roqno.
\m kinaw žedu bałgołi-bi-n esi-n halmaɣ-bi maħor r-oq-n
\g entire DEM1.IIPL secret-PL-TOP tell-PFV.CVB friend-PL outside III.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The friends had told all the secrets and went outside.

\t Žedułtow xizay iłegon ʕAt’idno oqno.
\m žedu-ł-tow xizay iłe-gon ʕAt’id-n oq-n
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS-EMPH behind as-CNTR Atid-TOP become-PST.UNW
\l And also Atid went behind them.

\t Sis beže hibon bisno ʕAt’id aw bayace ezun ičin.
\m sis b-eže hibo-n b-is-n ʕAt’id aw b-ay-ace ezu-n iči-n
\g one III-big stick-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB Atid mouse III-come-TERM look-PFV.CVB wait-PST.UNW
\l Atid took a big stick and waited until the mouse came.

\t Mesedyosno micxiryosno ric’äsi reže ixinno gugyoq caƛin aw boƛixno ƛ’ˤuƛ’orno bizin beqa kecno bičin.
\m mesed-s-n micxir-s-n r-ic’-asi r-eže ixin-n gugu-q caƛi-n aw b-oƛi-x-n ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or-n b-izi-n buq-a kec-n b-iči-n
\g gold-GEN1-and money-GEN1-and IV-fill-RES.PRT IV-big bag-TOP back-POSS.ESS throw-PFV.CVB mouse III-half-AD.ESS-TOP roof-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB sun-IN.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB III-be-PST.UNW
\l The mouse with the big bag filled with gold and money threwn over [its back] got up halfway on the roof and went to sleep in the sun.

\t T’eq’erbašiƛ’orno ičin ʕAt’idä bok’no hibon howlortow aw bexurno.
\m t’eq’erbaši-ƛ’or-n iči-n ʕAt’id-a b-ok’-n hibo-n howlo-r-tow aw b-exur-n
\g cautiousness-SUPER.LAT-TOP wait-PFV.CVB Atid-ERG III-beat-PFV.CVB stick-TOP there-LAT-EMPH mouse III-kill-PST.UNW
\l Atid waited cautiously, hit the stick on it and killed the mouse.

\t Ric’äsi mesedyosno, micxiryosno ixinno sadaq risno, ža kid saɣ yodanixƛin xander ik’in.
\m r-ic’-asi mesed-s-n micxir-s-n ixin-n sadaq r-is-n ža kid saɣ y-odi-ani-x-ƛin xan-der ik’i-n
\g IV-fill-RES.PRT gold-GEN1-and money-GEN1-and bag-TOP all IV-take-PST.UNW DEM1.SG daughter cure II-do-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT khan-APUD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l He took the entire bag filled with gold and money and went to the king in order to cure his daughter.

\t Nesi xanzo raƛ’mar aynosi, ʕAt’idä naysinan xabaryabi regirno, di boƛ’araw unti saɣ boyxosi yołƛin.
\m nesi xan-z raƛ’-r ay-nosi ʕAt’id-a naysinan xabar-bi r-egir-n di boƛ’araw unti saɣ b-odi-xosi yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL khan-GEN2 land-LAT come-ANT.CVB Atid-ERG everywhere story-PL IV-send-PST.UNW me any illness cure III-do-PRS.PRT be-QUOT
\l When coming onto the king's land, Atid spread the story everywhere: "I can cure any illness!"

\t Xanä wazirzaqor amru bodin, ʕAt’id xexłiƛ’ däder ayroƛin.
\m xan-a wazir-bi-qor amru b-odi-n ʕAt’id xexłi-ƛ’ di-der ayr-o-ƛin
\g khan-ERG vizier-PL-POSS.LAT command III-do-PFV.CVB Atid quickness-SUPER.ESS me-APUD.LAT bring-IMPR-QUOT
\l The king commanded his viziers: "Bring Atid to me quickly!"

\t Nesä ik’in xanez kidbes räxuruni ozuras meča ɣʷays ozuri ernosi, nełar nełaz ozuriƛ’aygon rig rukada roqno.
\m nesi-a ik’i-n xan-z kid-s r-exu-ru-ni ozuri-s meča ɣˤʷay-s ozuri er-nosi neła-r neła-z ozuri-ƛ’ay-gon r-ig r-ukad-a r-oq-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG go-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 daughter-GEN1 IV-die-PST.PRT-DEF eye-GEN1 instead.of dog-GEN1 eye put-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 eye-SUPER.ABL-CNTR IV-well IV-see-INF IV-begin-PST.UNW
\l He went and after putting a dog's eye in place of the princess' dead eye, she began to see well again from her eye.

\t Xanä nesir beže saɣyatno bodin baq’ˤu mesedno, micxirno, gulun, yaraɣno teƛno.
\m xan-a nesi-r b-eže saɣyat-n b-odi-n b-aq’ˤu mesed-n micxir-n gulu-n yaraɣ-n teƛ-n
\g khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT III-big present-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB III-much gold-and money-and horse-and weapon-and give-PST.UNW
\l The king gave him a big present; he gave him much gold and money and a horse and weapons.

\t Elaygon bitor ʕAt’id kik waħo bik’ix zawruni yeženi ɣˤulxor ik’in.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor ʕAt’id kik waħo b-ik’i-x zow-ru-ni y-eže-ni ɣˤul-xor ik’i-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither Atid spring below III-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF II-big-DEF stone-AD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l From there Atid went to a big stone, where a spring was flowing below.

\t Neł ʕaƛasi žamaʕattow yisir q’ʷariłiƛ’ bičäsi besun, ɣudes boc’ä, zeyza rexuräsit’a posu resuzaƛ’.
\m neła ʕaƛ-asi žamaʕat-tow yisi-r q’ʷariłi-ƛ’ b-iči-asi b-esu-n ɣudes boc’a-a zey-bi-a r-exur-asi-t’a posu r-esu-zaƛ’
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL village-RES.PRT population-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT sadness-SUPER.ESS III-be-RES.PRT III-exist-PST.UNW daily wolf.PL-ERG bear-PL-ERG III.PL-kill-RES.PRT-DISTR cattle IV-find-CSL.CVB
\l The population of the village was being sad because every day they found their cattle killed by wolves and bears.

\t Ža gurow łin žeda maqˤiƛ’ay rixra rayx zown.
\m ža gurow łi-n žedu-a maqˤi-ƛ’ay r-ixer-a r-ay-x zow-n
\g DEM1.SG except water-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG far.away-SUPER.ABL IV-take-INF IV-come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Except of that, they had to bring the water from far away.

\t ʕAt’idä qaħłi begirzaƛ’or aħinyoƛ waħo gondu yič’inosi, tełäzay roč’iw łäs qˤuqˤu boƛixno.
\m ʕAt’id-a qaħłi b-egir-zaƛ’or aħin-ƛ waħo gondu y-ič’i-nosi teł-azay r-oč’iw łi-s qˤuqˤu b-oƛix-n
\g Atid-ERG dawn III-let-POST.CVB rock-SUB.ESS below big.hole II-dig-ANT.CVB inside-IN.ABL.DIST IV-cold water-GEN1 stream III-appear-PST.UNW
\l Atid digged a big hole under the rock before the dawn set in, and then a stream of cold water appeared from inside.

\t Žamaʕatyo ɣˤaɣˤu bizizaq nesir baq’ˤu mesedno teƛno, reže suħmatno rodin hunix egirno.
\m žamaʕat-a ɣˤaɣˤu b-izi-zaq nesi-r b-aq’ˤu mesed-n teƛ-n r-eže suħmat-n r-odi-n huni-x egir-n
\g population-ERG be.happy III-get-CSL.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT III-much gold-TOP give-PFV.CVB IV-big celebration-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB way-AD.ESS let-PST.UNW
\l Because the population got happy, they gave him much gold, organized a big party and let him go on his way.

\t Q’arum ħayran oqnon ƛexun ʕAt’idzo bečełiƛ’, esirno nesiq, didur mi nece bečed oqäƛin.
\m Q’arum ħayran oq-n-n ƛexu-n ʕAt’id-z bečełi-ƛ’ esir-n nesi-q didur mi nece bečed oq-a-ƛin
\g Qarum be.astonished become-PFV.CVB-TOP remain-PFV.CVB Atid-GEN2 riches-SUPER.ESS ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS how you so.much wealthy.man become-Q-QUOT
\l Qarum was astonished about Atid's riches and asked him: "How did you become such a wealthy man?"

\t ʕAt’idä nesiq kinaw raqru łinałäy esin.
\m ʕAt’id-a nesi-q kinaw r-oq-ru łina-łay esi-n
\g Atid-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS entire IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW
\l Atid told about everything that had happened to him.

\t Q’arumerno retis hemediwtow taliħ aderzoni aɣˤux besuranix.
\m Q’arum-r-n r-eti-s hemediw-tow taliħ ader-z-ni aɣˤu-x b-esur-ani-x
\g Qarum-LAT-TOP IV-want-PST.WIT such.a-EMPH fortune earlier-GEN2-DEF mill-AD.ESS III-find-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Qarum wanted to find the same fortune at the former mill.

\t Elorno ik’in, teł c’in erno, c’idox tataniłxo ičäsi zown.
\m elo-r-n ik’i-n teł c’i-n er-n c’i-x tatanił-x iči-asi zow-n
\g there-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB inside fire-TOP set.up-PFV.CVB fire-AD.ESS warmthen.oneself-IPFV.CVB wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He went there, set up a fire inside and waited warmthening himself on the fire.

\t Q’arum et’un k’oƛin aɣˤuz kobora teł uqˤełno ičin.
\m Q’arum et’u-n k’oƛi-n aɣˤu-z koboro-a teł uqˤeł-n iči-n
\g Qarum jump-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB mill-GEN2 granary-IN.ESS inside hide-PFV.CVB wait-PST.UNW
\l Qarum jumped up, ran and hid inside the mill's granary.

\t Elo tełer zeyn, zirun, boc’in rayn.
\m elo tełer zey-n ziru-n boc’i-n r-ay-n
\g there to.the.inside bear-and fox-and wolf-and III.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l There a bear, a fox and a wolf came inside.

\t Zeyä eƛin, adäza ela eluq t’o kesubi esiƛ’oräy, šebiƛa teqerno ičäsi zown.
\m zey-a eƛi-n adäza elu-a elu-q t’o kesu-bi esi-ƛ’oräy šebi-ƛa teqer-n iči-asi zow-n
\g bear-ERG say-PST.UNW before we(I).OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS here secret-PL tell-SIM.CVB who-INDEF listen.to-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The bear said: "When we were telling secrets here before, someone was listening to us.

\t Nełƛ’aza rayn kesubi esa adäza, eli bezu-bˤoƛ’a bay yołä t’oza xalq’i anaƛin.
\m neła-ƛ’aza r-ay-n kesu-bi esu-a adäza eli b-ezu~oƛ’ˤu-a b-ay yoł-a t’o-za xalq’i anu-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS.DIST III.PL-come-PFV.CVB secret-PL find-INF before we III-visit-INF I.PL-must be-Q here-ZA people be.NEG-Q-QUOT
\l Because of that [...?], we must look if there are people here.

\t Naysinan k’edinosi, aɣˤuz kobora uqˤłäsi Q’arum esun.
\m naysinan k’edi-nosi aɣˤu-z koboro-a uqˤeł-asi Q’arum esu-n
\g everywhere search-ANT.CVB mill-GEN2 granary-IN.ESS hide-RES.PRT Qarum find-PST.UNW
\l After they had searched everywhere, they found Qarum hiding in the mill's granary.

\t Elo tełäyn ƛisin, łaymoƛ’ay ik’ace žeda ža uyn žek’no oɣno maħor kurno.
\m elo teł-ay-n ƛisi-n łay-ƛ’ay ik’i-ace žeda-a ža uy-n žek’-n oɣ-n maħor kur-n
\g there inside-IN.ABL-TOP pull-PFV.CVB mind-SUPER.ABL go-TERM DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG indeed-TOP beat-PFV.CVB take.away-PFV.CVB outside throw-PST.UNW
\l They pulled him outside there, beated him unconscious, took him up and threw him outside.

\t Žin Q’arum howlo žäk’ruxaysi saɣ oqaniƛax.
\m žin Q’arum howlo žek’-ru-xay-si saɣ oq-ani-ƛax
\g now Qarum there beat-PST.PRT-AD.ABL-ATTR cure become-MSD-QUOT
\l They say that Qarum still didn't recover from the beatings.

\t Sis zown babiwn nesisgon łˤono užin.
\m sis zow-n babiw-n nesi-s-gon łˤono uži-n
\g one be.NPRS-PST.UNW father-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR three son-and
\l Once there was a father and his three sons.

\t Ža babiw ɣudes bełiƛ’t’a ik’ix bełi bayrxo ayx zown.
\m ža babiw ɣudes bełi-ƛ’-t’a ik’i-x bełi b-ayr-x ay-x zow-n
\g DEM1.SG father daily hunting-SUPER.ESS-DISTR go-IPFV.CVB hunting III-bring-IPFV.CVB come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The father went hunting every day and came back with prey.

\t Eže izäsin oqzaƛ’, ɣudi räk’iruce nesis tatu bexux bik’ix zown.
\m eže izi-asi-n oq-zaƛ’ ɣudi r-ik’i-ru-ce nesi-s tatu b-exu-x b-ik’i-x zow-n
\g old get-RES.PRT-TOP become-CSL.CVB day IV-go-PST.PRT-EQU1 DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 power III-die-IPFV.CVB III-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Because he was getting old, his power was dying as a day passed.

\t Sida quł bełiƛ’ ik’in q’ˤoq’ˤoru xizor utin ayn.
\m sida qu-ł bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-n q’ˤoq’ˤoru xizor uti-n ay-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS hunting-SUPER.ESS go-PFV.CVB empty back return-PFV.CVB come-PST.UNW
\l One day he went hunting and came back without anything.

\t Hudayziko ža roƛan utirno, uykin ik’iłnoanu.
\m hudayziko ža r-oƛ-an utir-n uy-kin ik’i-ł-n-anu
\g the.next.day DEM1.SG IV-be.sick-FUT.CVB turn-PFV.CVB just-even go-POT-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l The next day he grew sick and really could not go.

\t Roƛxo mežiƛ’ yałzay, nesä užizaqor eƛin, di exunosi meži buq bätuzaɣor taraw bełiƛ’ bäk’inƛin.
\m r-oƛ-x muži-ƛ’ yoł-zay nesi-a uži-bi-qor eƛi-n di exu-nosi meži buq b-etu-zo-aɣor taraw bełi-ƛ’ b-ik’i-n-ƛin
\g IV-be.sick-IPFV.CVB mattress-SUPER.ESS be-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG son-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW me die-ANT.CVB you.PL sun III-set-ATTR.OBL-IN.VERS except.for hunting-SUPER.ESS I.PL-go-PROHIB-QUOT
\l While he was in his bed being sick, he said to his sons: "When I have died, you cannot go hunting anywhere besides in the west!"

\t Zamanałäy žedus babiw exun.
\m zaman-łay žedu-s babiw exu-n
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 father die-PST.UNW
\l After some time, their father died.

\t Žan šušin q’ulhu bet’unosi, žedus xabar boqno bełiƛ’ bik’anƛin.
\m ža-n šuši-n q’ulhu b-et’u-nosi žedu-s xabar b-oq-n bełi-ƛ’ b-ik’i-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG-TOP bury-PFV.CVB funeral.feast III-stay.behind-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 story III-become-PFV.CVB hunting-SUPER.ESS I.PL-go-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l After they burried him and the funeral feast was over, their plan was: "We'll go hunting."

\t Babiya badiru wasimoxor, žedu netintow bełiƛ’ buq bätuzaɣort’a bik’ix zown.
\m babi-a b-odi-ru wasi-xor žedu netin-tow bełi-ƛ’ buq b-etu-zo-aɣor-t’a b-ik’i-x zow-n
\g dad-ERG III-do-PST.PRT testament-AD.LAT DEM1.IPL always-EMPH hunting-SUPER.ESS sun III-set-ATTR.OBL-IN.VERS-DISTR I.PL-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l According to the testament that their father gave, they always went hunting in the west.

\t Hemedur anƛ’ima baħnayn žeduq sosikin bełi biqinanu.
\m hemedur anƛ’i-a b-aħnad-n žedu-q sosi-kin bełi b-iqi-n-anu
\g so week-IN.ESS I.PL-walk.around-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS at.first-even hunting III-get-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l So they walked around for a week and at first didn't get any prey.

\t Sida quł eženi esiya eƛin, yaqˤuł di bełiƛ’ buq boƛaxza puƛ’aɣor ik’ix.
\m sida qu-ł eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n yaqˤuł di bełi-ƛ’ buq b-oƛix-za pu-ƛ’aɣor ik’i-x
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS old-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW today me hunting-SUPER.ESS sun III-appear-LCV side-SUPER.VERS go-PRS
\l One day the oldest brother said: "Today I'll go hunting in the east.

\t Guluƛ’no zown, tupin ħirar kurno eženi esiw bełiƛ’ oqno.
\m gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n tupi-n ħiro-ar kur-n eže-ni esiw bełi-ƛ’ oq-n
\g horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB rifle-TOP shoulder-IN.LAT throw-PFV.CVB old-DEF brother hunting-SUPER.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l The older brother sat on his horse, threw the rifle on his shoulder and went hunting.

\t Ik’in, ik’in ža sidaɣ kikxor ayn.
\m ik’i-n ik’i-n ža sidaɣ kik-xor ay-n
\g go-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG in.one.place spring-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He went and went and came to a spring.

\t Elo xizaɣorsi yeda uyn išno, bišʷan łiyn.
\m elo xizaɣor-si yeda uy-n iš-n bišʷa-n łiy-n
\g there finally-ATTR DEM2.ISG indeed-TOP eat-PFV.CVB food-TOP end-PST.UNW
\l There he finally ate and finished up his food.

\t Elaygon bitor hunix ik’iƛ’oräy, zamanałäz yisiƛ’ meko c’oxno.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy zaman-łaz yisi-ƛ’ meko c’ox-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB time-CONT.ESS.DIST DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS hunger hit-PST.UNW
\l While he was going away from there on his way, after a while the hunger hit him.

\t Yeda sidaɣ ciqo č’iħodyos ažombin šet’ur, roƛƛo azbarno yałza mečoƛ’or ayn.
\m yeda sidaɣ ciq č’iħo-s ažo-bi-n šet’ur r-oƛƛo azbar-n yoł-za moči-ƛ’or ay-n
\g DEM2.ISG in.one.place forest fruit-GEN1 tree-PL-TOP around IV-middle palace-TOP be-LCV place-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l In some place he found a forest with fruit trees all around, and in the middle he came to a place with a palace in the middle.

\t Dicegon mekoyx oqłin sis ya geni, ya heneš elay bet’uranix ʕuƛ’no ža.
\m dice-gon mekod-x oq-łin sis ya geni ya heneš ele-ay b-et’ur-ani-x ˤuƛ’-n ža
\g how.much-CNTR be.hungry-IPFV.CVB become-CNC.CVB one either pear either apple there-IN.ABL III-pull.out-MSD-AD.ESS be.afraid-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l But no matter how hungry he was, he was afraid to pluck either a pear or an apple.

\t Azbaryoxor aynosi, yeda ħayranno oqno ezun ƛexux.
\m azbar-xor ay-nosi yeda ħayran-n oq-n ezu-n ƛexu-x
\g palace-AD.LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG be.astonished-TOP become-PFV.CVB look-PFV.CVB remain-PRS
\l When he came to the palace, he remained looking at it in astonishment.

\t Tełäzay sis žuka ɣˤanabin yoƛixno esirno nesiq, heresi esa kaƛ’iya, kaƛ’inč’a.
\m teł-azay sis žuka ɣˤanabi-n y-oƛix-n esir-n nesi-q heresi esi-a koƛ’i-a koƛ’i-č’u-a
\g inside-IN.ABL.DIST one bad woman-TOP II-appear-PFV.CVB ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS lie tell-INF understand.to-Q understand.to-NEG.PST.WIT-Q
\l From inside a bad woman appeared and asked him: "Can you tell a lie or not?

\t Mi ya heneš, ya geni bet’uriya, bet’urinč’aƛin.
\m mi ya heneš ya geni b-et’ur-ya b-et’ur-č’u-a-ƛin
\g you either apple either pear III-pull.out-PST.WIT.Q III-pull.out-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Have you plucked an apple or a pear, or not?"

\t Bet’urinč’uƛin, žawab teƛno nesä.
\m b-et’ur-č’u-ƛin žawab teƛ-n nesi-a
\g III-pull.out-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "I haven't plucked.", he answered.

\t Nedur resunäy, hi hudu deberƛin mač’an exuran exurno, taxeƛ žan eqerno idu akäza yezun yičin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy hi hudu mi-r-ƛin mač’a-n exur-an exur-n tax-ƛ ža-n eqer-n idu aki-aza y-ezu-n y-iči-n
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB take.IMP so you-LAT-QUOT dagger-TOP kill-FUT.CVB kill-PFV.CVB ottoman-SUB.ESS DEM1.SG-TOP put-PFV.CVB home window-IN.VERS.DIST II-look-PFV.CVB II-wait-PST.UNW
\l "If that's the case, take [this]!", and a dagger killed him; she put him under the ottoman and waited looking out of the window at her home.

\t Ayn žan eženi esiw ayruni kikxortow.
\m ay-n ža-n eže-ni esiw ay-ru-ni kik-xor-tow
\g come-PST.UNW DEM1.SG-TOP old-DEF brother come-PST.PRT-DEF spring-AD.LAT-EMPH
\l Also he came to the spring the older brother came to.

\t Elay bitor išno-utin ik’inosi, hemełtow azbaryoxor ayn.
\m ele-ay bitor iš~uti-n ik’i-nosi hemeł-tow azbar-xor ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL thither eat-PFV.CVB go-ANT.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH palace-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He ate and from there he went further and came to the same palace.

\t Mekoyx oqłin siskin č’iħo nesän ɣunoqayn ret’urno rac’noanu.
\m mekod-x oq-łin siskin č’iħo nesi-a-n ɣun-qay-n r-et’ur-n r-ac’-n-anu
\g be.hungry-IPFV.CVB become-CNC.CVB any fruit DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP tree-POSS.ABL-TOP IV-pull.out-PFV.CVB IV-eat-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l Although he was hungry, he didn't pluck and eat any fruit from the tree either.

\t Azbaryoz madaxorno ayn ža hemedur ezun ƛexasi yałzay, yoƛixno hemełatow ɣˤanaza esirno, deber heresi mec esa koƛ’ixosiya, koƛ’ixosi anaƛin.
\m azbar-z ma-xor-n ay-n ža hemedur ezu-n ƛexu-asi yoł-zay y-oƛix-n hemeła-tow ɣˤanabi-a esir-n mi-r heresi mec esi-a koƛ’i-xosi-a koƛ’i-xosi anu-a-ƛin
\g palace-GEN2 gate-AD.LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG so look-PFV.CVB remain-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB II-appear-PFV.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH woman-ERG ask-PST.UNW you-LAT false language tell-INF understand.to-PRS.PRT-Q understand.to-PRS.PRT be.NEG-Q-QUOT
\l He came to the palace's gate, and when he remained looking likewise, the same woman appeared and asked him: "Can you lie or can you not?"

\t Nesan hemedurtow kaƛ’inč’iƛin žawab teƛno.
\m nesi-a-n hemedur-tow koƛ’i-č’i-ƛin žawab teƛ-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP so-EMPH understand.to-NEG.FUT-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW
\l Also he gave the answer likewise: "I can't."

\t Xizyo neła esirno, ya heneš, yagi geni bet’uriyä mi t’ayƛin.
\m xizyo neła-a esir-n ya heneš yagi geni b-et’ur-ya mi t’ay-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW either apple or pear III-pull.out-PST.WIT.Q you from.here-QUOT
\l Afterwards she asked: "Have you plucked an apple or a pear from here?"

\t Hi hudu deber nedur resunäyƛin, rok’no mač’an exurno eženi esiwdetow puräza taxeƛno eqerno akäza baɣmaɣorno yezun yičin.
\m hi hudu mi-r nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin r-ok’-n mač’a-n exur-n eže-ni esiw-de-tow pu-aza tax-ƛ-n eqer-n aki-aza baɣ-ɣor-n y-ezu-n y-iči-n
\g take.IMP so you-LAT so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT IV-hit-PFV.CVB dagger-TOP kill-PFV.CVB old-DEF brother-APUD.ESS-EMPH side-IN.VERS.DIST ottoman-SUB.ESS-TOP put-PFV.CVB window-IN.VERS.DIST garden-IN.ALL-TOP II-look-PFV.CVB II-wait-PST.UNW
\l "So take [this], if that's the case!", and she hit and killed him with the dagger, put him under the ottoman to the oldest brother's side and waited looking out of the window into the garden.

\t Ik’in, ik’in ža sidaɣ kikxor ayn.
\m ik’i-n ik’i-n ža sidaɣ kik-xor ay-n
\g go-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG in.one.place spring-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He went and went and came to a spring somewhere.

\t Elo ža išno-utin, łin ħaƛun, elaygon bitor hunix oqno ik’in neł ɣˤanazaz baɣmoxor ayn.
\m elo ža iš~uti-n łi-n ħaƛu-n ele-ay-gon bitor huni-x oq-n ik’i-n neła ɣˤanabi-z baɣ-xor ay-n
\g there DEM1.SG eat-PFV.CVB water-TOP drink-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither way-AD.ESS become-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-GEN2 garden-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l There he ate and drank the water, and went on on his way and came to that woman's garden.

\t Elo nesä elo c’oxno, t’o c’oxno č’iħo rac’a bašla bodin.
\m elo nesi-a elo c’ox-n t’o c’ox-n č’iħo r-ac’-a bašla b-odi-n
\g there DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG there pounce-PFV.CVB there pounce-PFV.CVB fruit IV-eat-INF begin III-do-PST.UNW
\l There, pouncing here and there, he began to eat the fruits.

\t Azbaryoz mada gulun bicin, nełał adäzar ʕuraw henešno čˤaƛin, elotow ičix zawru iłe iduɣor ik’in.
\m azbar-z ma-a gulu-n b-ici-n neła-ł adäz-ar ʕuraw heneš-n čˤaƛi-n elo-tow iči-x zow-ru iłe idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g palace-GEN2 outside-IN.ESS horse-TOP III-tie-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT many apple-TOP pour.out-PFV.CVB there-EMPH live-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT as home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l He tied the horse outside the palace, poured many apples in front of it and went into the house like someone who lived there.

\t Nesä sadaq royxosi šebin neła ɣˤanazar rukayx zown.
\m nesi-a sadaq r-odi-xosi šebin neła ɣˤanabi-r r-ukad-x zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG all IV-do-PRS.PRT thing DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-LAT IV-see-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l That woman was seeing all the things he did.

\t Nełaz rok’ƛ’or rayn, yeda däder igu žek’u aynč’uƛin.
\m neła-z rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-n yeda di-der igu žek’u ay-č’u-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG me-APUD.LAT good man come-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l She thought: "He didn't come to me as a good man."

\t Neła nesiqno esirno, deber heresi esa kaƛ’iyä kaƛ’inč’aƛin.
\m neła-a nesi-q-n esir-n mi-r heresi esi-a koƛ’i-a koƛ’i-č’u-a-ƛin
