\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP ask-PST.UNW you-LAT lie tell-INF understand.to-PST.WIT.INT understand.to-NEG.PST.WIT-Q-QUOT
\l She asked him as well: "Can you tell a lie or not?"

\t Kaƛ’iƛin, žawab teƛno nesä.
\m koƛ’i-ƛin žawab teƛ-n nesi-a
\g understand.to-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "I can.", he answered.

\t Mi dey č’iħo rac’iyäƛin, esirno xizyogon nełä.
\m mi di-s č’iħo r-ac’-ya-ƛin esir-n xizyogon neła-a
\g you me-GEN1 fruit IV-eat-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT ask-PST.UNW then DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG
\l "Did you eat my fruits?", she asked again.

\t Debi di č’iħotow rac’äsi anuƛin, žawab teƛno žoyä.
\m mi-s di č’iħo-tow r-ac’-asi anu-ƛin žawab teƛ-n uži-a
\g you-GEN1 me fruit-EMPH IV-eat-RES.PRT be.NEG-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "Your fruits I haven't eaten.", answered the boy.

\t Elo žedus daʕban boqno ħukmu bodin, boƛ’arawgo roqłin sida esiƛ’oräy p’es anusi bičanixƛin.
\m elo žedu-s daʕba-n b-oq-n ħukmu b-odi-n boƛ’araw-go r-oq-łin sida-a esi-ƛ’oräy p’es anu-si b-iči-ani-x-ƛin
\g there DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 dispute-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB decision III-do-PST.UNW any-COND IV-happen-CNC.CVB one.OBL-ERG tell-SIM.CVB sound be.NEG-ATTR I.PL-wait-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l Then they argued and decided: "No matter what happens, when someone speaks, the other has to wait silently."

\t Nagaħ sidä xabar esiƛ’oräy, hoq’ˤonä sis roži roƛik’näy howlortow exuranixƛin.
\m nagaħ sida-a xabar esi-ƛ’oräy hoq’ˤo-ni-a sis roži r-oƛik’-näy howlo-r-tow exur-ani-x-ƛin
\g suppose one.OBL-ERG story tell-SIM.CVB other-DEF-ERG one word IV-let.appear-CND.CVB there-LAT-EMPH kill-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l Suppose someone says something while the other one is telling a story, he/she is to be killed on the spot.

\t Uži xabar esa oqno, di ʕaƛa zows.
\m uži xabar esi-a oq-n di ʕaƛ-a zow-s
\g boy story tell-INF begin-PST.UNW me village-IN.ESS be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l The boy began to tell a story: "I was in a village.

\t Elo dey recenyocet’a isʷa zows.
\m elo di-s recenyo-ce-t’a is-bi zow-s
\g there me-GEN1 ant-EQU1-DISTR bull-PL be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l There I had bulls, each one like an ant.

\t Žedaq di łˤora ɣudir ħonce qaca ʕaƛaɣor riħurno łiyrsi.
\m žeda-q di łˤora ɣudi-r ħon-ce qaca ʕaƛ-aɣor r-iħur-n łiy-r-si
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-POSS.ESS me three.OBL day-LAT mountain-EQU1 firewood village-IN.VERS IV-pour-PFV.CVB end-CAUS-ATTR
\l I made them pull a mountain of firewood to the village for three days.

\t Elaygon beƛ’q’ˤun bižin aħołun ik’is.
\m ele-ay-gon bˤeƛ’q’ˤu-n b-iži-n aħo-łun ik’i-s
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR sheep-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB shepherd-LHUN go-PST.WIT
\l From there I went as a shepherd to carry sheep.

\t Ħonƛ’or baynosi, sida beƛ’q’ˤa sasaqor oc’ino ʕazar ƛeli bodin.
\m ħon-ƛ’or b-ay-nosi sida bˤeƛ’q’ˤu-a sasaq-qor oc’ino ʕazar ƛeli b-odi-n
\g mountain-SUPER.LAT III-come-ANT.CVB one.OBL sheep-ERG in.the.morning-POSS.LAT ten thousand lamb III-do-PST.UNW
\l When they arrived on the mountain, one sheep gave birth to ten thousand lambs in the morning.

\t Žedaxay bitor di q’ˤida ičinč’ey bixno kosix zows.
\m žeda-xay bitor di q’ˤida iči-č’ey bix-n kosi-x zow-s
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-AD.ABL thither me down sit-NEG.PST.CVB grass-TOP mow-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l Because of them, I didn't sit down but mowed grass.

\t Sida quł bˤeƛ’łer boc’i k’oƛinosi, nełał xizayn k’oƛin nełaz di xarcelin caƛin žirbał šiširsi.
\m sida qu-ł bˤeƛ’-łer boc’i k’oƛi-nosi neła-ł xizay-n k’oƛi-n neła-z di xarceli-n caƛi-n žirba-ł šiši-r-si
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS sheep-CONT.LAT wolf run-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind-TOP run-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 me scythe-TOP throw-PFV.CVB rib-CONT.ESS get.stuck-CAUS-ATTR
\l One day a wolf ran into the flock of sheep, so I threw my scythe and made it stuck inside its ribs.

\t Elay bitor boxin bik’ix boc’in axoł šäširuni xarcelid bix kosix, xizazgon et’unč’ey neła kasiruni bix rutirxo din ik’ix zows, neduräy žagon bˤeƛ’än rac’xo zows.
\m ele-ay bitor b-oxi-n b-ik’i-x boc’i-n ax-ł šiši-ru-ni xarceli-d bix kosi-x xizaz-gon et’u-č’ey neła-a kosi-ru-ni bix r-utir-x di-n ik’i-x zow-s nedur-ay ža-gon bˤeƛ’-a-n r-ac’-x zow-s
\g there-IN.ABL thither III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-go-IPFV.CVB wolf-TOP belly-CONT.ESS get.stuck-PST.PRT-DEF scythe-INSTR grass mow-IPFV.CVB behind-CNTR stay.behind-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG mow-PST.PRT-DEF grass IV-gather-IPFV.CVB me-TOP go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT so-IN.ABL DEM1.SG-CNTR sheep-ERG-TOP IV-eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT
\l From there the wolf ran away with the scythe being stuck in the belly mowing grass, but I didn't stay behind but went gathering the mowed grass; so the sheep were eating it.

\t Hemedur di oc’ino ƛˤeb yoɣsi.
\m hemedur di oc’ino ƛˤeb y-oɣ-s
\g so me ten year II-spend.time-PST.WIT
\l I spent ten years like this.

\t Sida quł däder q’arza bˤeƛ’ roɣoƛin Allah ays.
\m sida qu-ł di-der q’arza bˤeƛ’ r-oɣ-o-ƛin Allah ay-s
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS me-APUD.LAT duty sheep III.PL-take.away-IMPR-QUOT God come-PST.WIT
\l One day God came to me: "Take the duty for the sheep away!"

\t Di nesir sadaq bˤeƛ’ teƛsi.
\m di nesi-r sadaq bˤeƛ’ teƛ-s
\g me DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT all sheep give-PST.WIT
\l I gave Him all my sheep."

\t Nedurgon roqxa žaƛin, nełaq esirno rok’äłrun, rok’no bˤałayn eɣeni esiya ža yoƛƛi yegirno.
\m nedur-gon r-oq-x-a ža-ƛin neła-q esir-n r-ok’eł-run r-ok’-n bˤałay-n eɣe-ni esyu-a ža y-oƛƛi y-egi-r-n
\g so-CNTR IV-happen-PRS-Q DEM1.SG-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB IV-escape-IMM.ANT.CVB IV-hit-PFV.CVB dagger-TOP young-DEF brother-ERG DEM1.SG II-middle II-break.apart-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l "Did it happen like this?!" she accidentally said, and right after that the young brother hit her with the dagger and split her in the middle.

\t Elo azbarya teł ža ezu-ʕaƛ’unosi, taxeƛ yisir bexuräsi esnabi besun.
\m elo azbar-a teł ža ezu~oƛ’ˤu-nosi tax-ƛ yisi-r b-exur-asi esyu-bi b-esu-n
\g there palace-IN.ESS inside DEM1.SG examine-ANT.CVB ottoman-SUB.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT I.PL-kill-RES.PRT brother-PL I.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l When he examined inside the palace, he found his killed brothers under the ottoman.

\t Nełaz ža q’aʕidaƛ’ žedun šušin, nesä nesir azbarno riqirno, barun yown, eniwn nesä nesidäɣor yižin.
\m neła-z ža q’aʕida-ƛ’ žedu-n šuši-n nesi-a nesi-r azbar-n r-iqir-n baru-n y-ow-n eniw-n nesi-a nesi-däɣor y-iži-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 DEM1.SG manner-SUPER.ESS DEM1.IPL-TOP bury-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT palace-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB wife-TOP II-marry-PFV.CVB mother-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.VERS II-lead-PST.UNW
\l He burried them in his own manner, took the palace for himself, married a wife and brought his mother to himself.

\t Žedus užin kidno zownƛax.
\m žedu-s uži-n kid-n zow-n-ƛax
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 son-and daughter-and be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l It's said they had a son and a daughter.

\t Beɣet’a yizi yałzaytow yizis eniwn yexun, babiya baru yownƛax.
\m b-eɣe-t’a yizi yoł-zay-tow yizi-s eniw-n y-exu-n babi-a baru y-ow-n-ƛax
\g I.PL-young-DISTR DEM2.IPL be-SIM.CVB-EMPH DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 mother-TOP II-die-PFV.CVB dad-ERG wife II-marry-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l It is said that when they both were young, their mother died and their father married a[nother] wife.

\t Nełasno sis kid zown.
\m neła-s-n sis kid zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-TOP one daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l She also had one daughter.

\t Xedyos kid bercinaw zown.
\m xediw-s kid bercinaw zow-n
\g husband-GEN1 daughter beautiful be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The husband's daughter was beautiful.

\t Barus yołi kid łinasnotow hunarno, maxšelno, bažarin anusi zown.
\m baru-s yołi kid łina-s-n-tow hunar-n maxšel-n bažari-n anu-si zow-n
\g wife-GEN1 however daughter what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-EMPH talent-and skill-and skill-and be.NEG-ATTR be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The wife's daughter however had no talent or skill whatsoever.

\t K’ox eƛa yawruni barur best’al kid yetix zownanu, neła nełar urɣizi boda ħilla xecix zownanu, nełdäy yet’u-t’it’iran yetin.
\m k’ox eƛi-a y-ow-ru-ni baru-r best’al kid y-eti-x zow-n-anu neła-a neła-r urɣizi b-odi-a ħilla xeci-x zow-n-anu neła-day y-et’u~t’it’ir-an y-eti-n
\g twice say-INF II-marry-PST.PRT-DEF wife-LAT step daughter II-like-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT thinking III-do-INF trickery leave-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ABL II-get.rid-FUT.CVB II-want-PST.UNW
\l His second wife didn't like her step-daughter, she didn't leave out any tricks to think about and wanted to get rid of her.

\t Sida quł bet’erhanno bet’erhanes užin ƛˤoreł bik’inosi, yiła neł ʕaƛos dibir iduɣor goƛ’in.
\m sida qu-ł bet’erhan-n bet’erhan-s uži-n ƛˤori-ł b-ik’i-nosi yiła-a neła ʕaƛ-s dibir idu-ɣor goƛ’i-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS master-and master-GEN1 son-and war-CONT.ESS I.PL-go-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL village-GEN1 imam home-IN.ALL invite-PST.UNW
\l One day, when the master and the master's son went to war, she invited the village's imam to their home.

\t Bet’erhanes kidno ħamimyołxor yegirno, nełałtow xizaygon dibirno egirno, micxir neƛanƛin.
\m bet’erhan-s kid-n ħamim-łxor y-egir-n neła-ł-tow xizay-gon dibir-n egir-n micxir neƛ-an-ƛin
\g master-GEN1 daughter-TOP hot.springs-CONT.VERS II-send-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-EMPH behind-CNTR imam-TOP send-PFV.CVB money give-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l She sent the master's daughter to the hot springs and sent the imam behind her, "I'll give you money."

\t Elo ža dibir neła kidbeł xizay oqno.
\m elo ža dibir neła kid-ł xizay oq-n
\g there DEM1.SG imam DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-CONT.ESS behind become-PST.UNW
\l So the imam followed that girl.

\t Didurnokin ħal bayxanusi biyzaƛ’, kidbä siħirno yoqno dibir šeƛ’u roɣa egirno.
\m didur-n-kin ħal b-ay-xanusi b-iy-zaƛ’ kid-a siħir-n y-oq-n dibir šeƛ’u r-oɣ-a egir-n
\g how-TOP-even trouble III-come-NEG.PRS.PRT III-know-CSL.CVB girl-ERG sly.person-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB imam clothing IV-take.away-INF let-PST.UNW
\l When she knew he had no trouble [following her], the girl became a sly person and let the imam take off his clothes.

\t Xizyo yiła nesiƛ’or qˤaradamu łäs bic’asi t’asno biħurno, ža mežärsi odin.
\m xizyo yiła-a nesi-ƛ’or qˤaradamu łi-s b-ic’-asi t’as-n b-iħur-n ža muži-ar-si odi-n
\g afterwards DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT boiling water-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT washbowl-TOP III-pour-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG mattress-IN.LAT-ATTR do-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, she poured a washbowl filled with boiling water over him, and made him bed-ridden.

\t Ža xabar best’alawni eniwrno teqno.
\m ža xabar best’alaw-ni eniw-r-n teq-n
\g DEM1.SG story step-DEF mother-LAT-TOP hear-PST.UNW
\l Also her step-mother heard that story.

\t Ža kid dicegon bac’ałiƛ’ yoqłin, neła xediwƛ’or kaɣat caxno, debi kid neširuxayt’a q’ʷat’azaq yaħna-yik’ix yičixƛin.
\m ža kid dice-gon bac’ałi-ƛ’ y-oq-łin neła-a xediw-ƛ’or kaɣat cax-n mi-s kid neširu-xay-t’a q’ʷat’-bi-q y-aħna~ik’i-x y-iči-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG daughter how.much-CNTR cleanness-SUPER.ESS II-become-CNC.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG husband-SUPER.LAT letter write-PST.UNW you-GEN1 daughter at.night-AD.ABL-DISTR street-PL-POSS.ESS II-walk.for.a.while-IPFV.CVB II-be-PRS-QUOT
\l Although the daughter was very cleanly, she wrote a letter to her husband: "Your daughter is being wandering through the streets at night."

\t Kaɣat koyär yäsruntow, babiya uži egirno, debi mi esiwn yexurno, nełas rok’u däq rukaranix raƛin.
\m kaɣat kʷay-ar y-is-run-tow babi-a uži egir-n mi-s mi esiw-n y-exur-n neła-s rok’u di-q r-ukar-ani-x r-ow-ƛin
\g letter hand-IN.LAT II-take-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH dad-ERG son send-PST.UNW you-GEN1 you sister-TOP II-kill-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 heart me-POSS.ESS IV-show-MSD-AD.ESS IV-bring-QUOT
\l As soon as the father took the letter in his hand, he said to his son: "Kill your sister, and bring me her heart to show it to me!"

\t Idur aynosi užä nesä nesis esiy guluƛ’no zowerno ciqaɣor yižin, hudun rok’u gurħizi roqzaƛ’, yexurnoanu.
\m idu-r ay-nosi uži-a nesi-a nesi-s esyu gulu-ƛ’-n zowr-n ciq-aɣor y-iži-n hudun rok’u gurħizi r-oq-zaƛ’ y-exur-n-anu
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB son-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 sister horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP seat-PFV.CVB forest-IN.VERS II-lead-PFV.CVB nevertheless heart pity IV-become-CSL.CVB II-kill-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l When the son came home, he seated his own sister onto a horse and led her into the forest, but because his heart felt sorry, he didn't kill her.

\t Nełaz meča sis ɣˤʷayn bexurno, nełas rok’un roɣno, babiwder ik’in, ele däz esiws rok’uƛin.
\m neła-z meča sis ɣˤʷay-n b-exur-n neła-s rok’u-n r-oɣ-n babiw-der ik’i-n ele di-z esiw-s rok’u-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 instead.of one dog-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 heart-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB father-APUD.LAT go-PFV.CVB here me-GEN2 sister-GEN1 heart-QUOT
\l Instead of her, he killed a dog and took out its heart and went to his father: "Here, my sister's heart."

\t Ciqqo ƛäxuru esiyä sasaqor ɣudi sida ɣunoƛ gonda teł yuqˤełno qˤaširno.
\m ciq-q ƛexu-ru esyu-a sasaq-qor ɣudi sida ɣun-ƛ gondu-a teł y-uqˤeł-n qˤašir-n
\g forest-POSS.ESS remain-PST.PRT sister-ERG in.the.morning-POSS.LAT day one.OBL tree-SUB.ESS big.hole-IN.ESS inside II-hide-PFV.CVB dawn-PST.UNW
\l His sister, who stayed in the forest, hid inside a hole under a tree, then it dawned.

\t Yezunosi yiłar bercinaw, gelmač’u, ozuri bic’äsi uži ukayn nełał adäzarno oqno ičäsi.
\m y-ezu-nosi yiła-r bercinaw gelmač’u ozuri b-ic’-asi uži ukad-n neła-ł adäz-ar-n oq-n iči-asi
\g II-look-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT beautiful round eye III-fill-RES.PRT boy see-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT-TOP become-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT
\l She looked around and saw a boy with handsome, round eyes having come in front of her.

\t Nesä nełƛ’ay ozuri boɣinč’ey ezun ičäsi zownƛax.
\m nesi-a neła-ƛ’ay ozuri b-oɣ-č’ey ezu-n iči-asi zow-n-ƛax
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL eye III-take.away-NEG.PST.CVB look-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l He looked at her without taking his eyes of her, they say.

\t Yoƛo ƛˤeb yik’izaƛ’ortow yizir užin odin.
\m y-oƛƛo ƛˤeb y-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow yizi-r uži-n odi-n
\g II-middle year II-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT boy-TOP do-PST.UNW
\l After less then a year had passed, a son was born to them.

\t Hemedur yizi yałzay sida bečedaw žek’a bertenyołxor goƛ’ixƛin yiziƛ’or xabar bayrno, hemełatowgon zamanał xediw goƛ’in ƛˤoreł ižin.
\m hemedur yizi yoł-zay sida bečedaw žek’u-a berten-łxor goƛ’i-x-ƛin yizi-ƛ’or xabar b-ayr-n hemeła-tow-gon zaman-ł xediw goƛ’i-n ƛˤori-ł iži-n
\g so DEM2.IPL be-SIM.CVB one.OBL wealthy man-ERG marriage-CONT.VERS invite-PRS-QUOT DEM2.IPL.OBL-SUPER.LAT story III-bring-PFV.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH-CNTR time-CONT.ESS husband call-PFV.CVB war-CONT.ESS take.out-PST.UNW
\l While they were living like that, the story came that a wealthy man invited to his marriage, and at this time, her husband was called to war.

\t Ozyode sadaq yeda ƛˤoreł ik’a keze oqno.
\m oz-de sadaq yeda ƛˤori-ł ik’i-a keze oq-n
\g army-APUD.ESS together DEM2.ISG war-CONT.ESS go-INF meet become-PST.UNW
\l In the army, he had to go to the war.

\t Barun užin yisä rok’u rayru sida žek’ude sadaq bertenyołxor begirno.
\m baru-n uži-n yisi-a rok’u r-ay-ru sida žek’u-de sadaq berten-łxor b-egir-n
\g wife-and son-and DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG heart IV-come-PST.PRT one.OBL man-APUD.ESS together marriage-CONT.VERS III-send-PST.UNW
\l His wife and son he sent to the marriage together with a reliable person.

\t Elaɣor yizi gamiƛ’no zown, raładno boɣno bik’a bayx zown.
\m ele-aɣor yizi gama-ƛ’-n zow-n raład-n b-oɣ-n b-ik’i-a b-ay-x zow-n
\g here-IN.VERS DEM2.IPL boat-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB sea-TOP III-cross-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-INF I.PL-come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They came back in a boat to cross the sea.

\t Raładyoł boƛor gama baynosi, nesi žek’atown ža ɣˤanabi ozƛ’o yisa oqno.
\m raład-ł b-oƛƛo-r gama b-ay-nosi nesi žek’u-a-tow-n ža ɣˤanabi ozuri-ƛ’ y-is-a oq-n
\g sea-CONT.ESS III-middle-LAT boat III-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG-EMPH-TOP DEM1.SG woman eye-SUPER.ESS II-take-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l When the boat came to the middle of the sea, that man began to mock at the woman.

\t Siħirno yoqno neła ɣˤanaza harizi rodin, gama tełäy maħor yoqa yegir diƛin.
\m siħir-n y-oq-n neła ɣˤanabi-a harizi r-odi-n gama-a teł-ay maħor y-oq-a y-egir di-ƛin
\g sly.person-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-ERG request IV-do-PST.UNW boat-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL outside II-become-INF II-let me-QUOT
\l The woman was a sly person and pleaded: "Let me get out of the inside of the boat!"

\t Užin koyä isno yisä nełaqay, narce yedu yäk’iƛin gama tełäy yoqa yegirno xecin.
\m uži-n kʷay-a is-n yisi-a neła-qay nar-ace yedu y-ik’i-ƛin gama-a teł-ay y-oq-a y-egir-n xeci-n
\g son-TOP hand-IN.ESS take-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL where-TERM DEM2.IISG II-go-QUOT boat-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL II-become-INF II-let-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW
\l He took the son from her into his hand, [thinking] "Where could she go?" and let her get out of the boat's inside.

\t Maħor yaqrun yedu raładyołer k’oƛin yičin.
\m maħor y-oq-run yedu raład-łer k’oƛi-n y-iči-n
\g outside II-become-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG sea-CONT.LAT jump-PFV.CVB II-be-PST.UNW
\l As soon as she came outside, she jumped into the sea.

\t Elo yedu q’ˤuya gamiƛ’arno yizin ħaƛ’ala xʷasarno yoqno lilyoxar yok’ełno.
\m elo yedu q’ˤuya gama-ƛ’ar-n y-izi-n ħaƛ’ala xʷasar-n y-oq-n lilyo-xar y-ok’eł-n
\g there DEM2.IISG other boat-SUPER.VERS-TOP II-get-PFV.CVB hardly rescue-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB river.bank-AD.VERS II-escape-PST.UNW
\l There she got to another boat, was bearly rescued and escaped to the shore.

\t Elaygon bitor yik’iƛ’oräy yedu sida beže ʕaƛar yayn.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor y-ik’i-ƛ’oräy yedu sida b-eže ʕaƛ-ar y-ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither II-go-SIM.CVB DEM2.IISG one.OBL III-big village-IN.LAT II-come-PST.UNW
\l When she went further from there, she came to a big village.

\t Elo yedu ʕaƛoz raʕalłix yičixozo sida q’orolayä ƛirbałix yižin.
\m elo yedu ʕaƛ-z raʕalłi-x y-iči-xozo sida q’orolay-a ƛirbałi-x y-iži-n
\g there DEM2.IISG village-GEN2 edge-AD.ESS II-live-PRS.PRT.OBL one.OBL widow-ERG hospitality-AD.ESS II-lead-PST.UNW
\l There she was hosted by a widow living in the village's suburb.

\t Q’orolayz xabaryoƛ’ay yiłar riyn neł ʕaƛa teł nasin sida bečedaw žek’uz bertenyołer boqxosi yałrułi.
\m q’orolay-z xabar-ƛ’ay yiła-r r-iy-n neła ʕaƛ-a teł nasin sida bečedaw žek’u-z berten-łer b-oq-xosi yoł-rułi
\g widow-GEN2 story-SUPER.ABL DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT IV-know-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL village-IN.ESS inside all one.OBL wealthy man-GEN2 marriage-CONT.LAT I.PL-become-PRS.PRT be-MSD
\l From the widow's telling, she knew that everyone in this village was going to the wedding of a rich man.

\t Bertenyoł šeƛ’anix baħarčis šeƛ’ureł xizay yiłagon q’orolay yegirno, neła nełas šeƛ’un nełar xecin.
\m berten-ł šeƛ’u-ani-x baħarči-s šeƛ’u-ł xizay yiła-a-gon q’orolay y-egir-n neła-a neła-s šeƛ’u-n neła-r xeci-n
\g marriage-CONT.ESS put.on-MSD-AD.ESS brave.young.man-GEN1 clothing-CONT.ESS behind DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR widow II-let-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 put.on-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT leave-PST.UNW
\l In order to dress up for the marriage, she let the widow look after young men's clothings and left her own clothes with her.

\t Elay yizin yedu howlo igozatow yałruni ħonƛ’aɣor yik’in aħoziz q’aymoxor yayn.
\m ele-ay y-izi-n yedu howlo igo-za-tow yoł-ru-ni ħon-ƛ’aɣor y-ik’i-n aħo-z q’ay-xor y-ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL II-get-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG there near-ZA-EMPH be-PST.PRT-DEF mountain-SUPER.VERS II-go-PFV.CVB shepherd-GEN2 shelter-AD.LAT II-come-PST.UNW
\l From there, she went further toward a mountain nearby and came to a shepherd's shelter.

\t Baħarčiƛin yizä yedu žeda žeduz kumakyor xecin.
\m baħarči-ƛin yiza-a yedu žedu-a žedu-z kumak-r xeci-n
\g brave.young.man-QUOT DEM2.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 help-LAT leave-PST.UNW
\l Taking her for a young man, they let her help themselves.

\t ƛˤorłäy xizor utin aynosi, nesir barun užin besunanu.
\m ƛˤori-łay xizor uti-n ay-nosi nesi-r baru-n uži-n b-esu-n-anu
\g war-CONT.ABL back return-PFV.CVB come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT wife-and son-and I.PL-find-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l When [the husband] came back from the war, he didn't find his wife and son.

\t Nełde sadaq egirno zawruni žek’u nesir teqno xizor utin aynƛin.
\m neła-de sadaq egir-n zow-ru-ni žek’u nesi-r teq-n xizor uti-n ay-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS together send-PST.UNW be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF man DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT hear-PFV.CVB back return-PFV.CVB come-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The man who was sent together with her - he heared - has returned.

\t Didur, šebi roqäƛin nesiq esirnosi, nesä heresi esin, raładno k’ek’-bik’no gaman butin debi baru ɣanq’izi yoqsi, uži däq xʷasar oda k’ʷeze oqsiƛin.
\m didur šebi r-oq-a-ƛin nesi-q esir-nosi nesi-a heresi esi-n raład-n k’ek’~ik’-n gama-a-n b-uti-n mi-s baru ɣanq’izi y-oq-s uži di-q xʷasar odi-a k’ʷeze oq-s-ƛin
\g how what IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG lie tell-PST.UNW sea-TOP move-PFV.CVB boat-Q-TOP III-turn-PFV.CVB you-GEN1 wife drown II-become-PST.WIT son me-POSS.ESS rescue do-INF can become-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l When he asked: "How and what happened?", he lied: "The sea was moved and the boat turned around, your wife drowned; I was able to rescue the boy."

\t ʕUraw q’ʷarid oqno ža, šet’ursi dunyaltow qˤabir butin nesir nece yetixozo baruƛ’ay bat’a oqzaƛ’.
\m ʕuraw q’ʷarid oq-n ža šet’u-r-si dunyal-tow qˤabi-r b-uti-n nesi-r nece y-eti-xozo baru-ƛ’ay bat’a oq-zaƛ’
\g very sadness become-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG around-LAT-ATTR world-EMPH black-LAT III-turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT so.much II-love-PRS.PRT.OBL wife-SUPER.ABL seperation become-CSL.CVB
\l He became very sad, the world around him turned black because he got seperated from the wife he loved so much.

\t Ža xabar yisä aħyaxorkin begirnoanu, baru yowač’inƛin di hedizi oqäsiƛin, t’ok’ow ža xabar meža haqazay maħor baɣnoƛin.
\m ža xabar yisi-a aħya-xor-kin b-egir-n-anu baru y-ow-ač’in-ƛin di hedizi oq-asi-ƛin t’ok’ow ža xabar mežu-a haqu-azay maħor b-oɣ-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG story DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ear-AD.LAT-even III-let-PFV.CVB-NEG wife II-marry-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT me swear become-RES.PRT-QUOT anymore DEM1.SG story you(I).PL.OBL-ERG mouth-IN.ABL.DIST outside III-take.away-PROHIB-QUOT
\l These words he didn't let to his ears, "I won't marry another wife!"... "I swear!"... "Don't say that anymore!",

\t Hemedur ƛˤebrebi rik’in nesis uži aq’ˤiłno ʕoloqan oqno, baru yowa mix bayn nesis.
\m hemedur ƛˤeb-bi r-ik’i-n nesi-s uži aq’ˤił-n ʕoloqan oq-n baru y-ow-a mix b-ay-n nesi-s
\g so year-PL II.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 son grow.up-PFV.CVB young become-PFV.CVB wife II-marry-INF time III-come-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1
\l So the years went by, his son grew up and became a young man, and the time came for him to marry.

\t Ixiw berten bodin nesi užis, šet’ur yałruni ʕaƛozałäy xalq’in goƛ’in.
\m ixiw berten b-odi-n nesi uži-s šet’ur yoł-ru-ni ʕaƛ-bi-łay xalq’i-n goƛ’i-n
\g big marriage III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-GEN1 around be-PST.PRT-DEF village-PL-CONT.ABL people-TOP invite-PST.UNW
\l He arranged the boy's big marriage and invited the people from the villages around.

\t Elo bertenyoł žedur imadu esa koƛ’ixosi žek’utow iqinanu.
\m elo berten-ł žedu-r imadu esi-a koƛ’i-xosi žek’u-tow iqi-n-anu
\g there marriage-CONT.ESS DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT tale tell-INF understand.to-PRS.PRT man-EMPH get-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l They couldn't get a man there on the wedding, who could tell tales [to them?].

\t Bertenyołer goƛ’in zawruni žedu aħozä eƛin, eluz bˤeƛ’xo imadabi esanix beže maxšel yołäsi sis žek’u yoł.
\m berten-łer goƛ’i-n zow-ru-ni žedu aħo-a eƛi-n elu-z bˤeƛ’-x imadu-bi esi-ani-x b-eže maxšel yoł-asi sis žek’u yoł
\g marriage-CONT.LAT invite-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF DEM1.IPL shepherd-ERG say-PST.UNW we(I).OBL-GEN2 sheep-AD.ESS tale-PL tell-MSD-AD.ESS III-big skill be-RES.PRT one man be
\l A shepherd who was invited to the wedding, said: "There is a man with our sheep who has a big talent of telling tales.

\t Ža goƛ’anix xizay žek’u egirƛin.
\m ža goƛ’i-ani-x xizay žek’u egir-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG invite-MSD-AD.ESS from.behind man send-QUOT
\l Send someone to invite him!"

\t Xizay žek’un egirno goƛ’in ayrno, sis kepaw imadu esoƛin žeda ža t’amizi odin.
\m xizay žek’u-n egir-n goƛ’i-n ayr-n sis kepaw imadu esi-o-ƛin žedu-a ža t’amizi odi-n
\g from.behind man-TOP send-PFV.CVB invite-PFV.CVB bring-PFV.CVB one merry tale tell-IMPR-QUOT DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG force do-PST.UNW
\l And they sent a man, invited and brought him; "Tell us a merry tale!", they forced him.

\t Ričiƛƛin, razi oqno ža, amma imadu esa adäza meža yiła ɣˤutkoq acno ħišin reka däqor neƛa ray.
\m r-iči-ƛ-ƛin razi oq-n ža amma imadu esi-a adäza mežu-a yiła ɣˤutku-q ac-n ħiši-n reka di-qor neƛ-a r-ay
\g IV-be-OPT-QUOT agree become-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG but tale tell-INF before you(I).PL.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL house-POSS.ESS door-TOP lock-PFV.CVB key me-POSS.LAT give-INF IV-must
\l "So be it!", he agreed, "but before I tell the tale, you must lock the door of this house and give me the key."

\t Gap yäsu yisä yoyxƛin, yizä nesä äƛiruxor acno ħišin, rekarbi yisiqor teƛno.
\m gap y-esu yisi-a y-odi-x-ƛin yiza-a nesi-a eƛi-ru-xor ac-n ħiši-n reka-bi yisi-qor teƛ-n
\g merriment II-exist DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG II-do-PRS-QUOT DEM2.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT door-TOP lock-PFV.CVB key-PL DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT give-PST.UNW
\l "He must be joking!" [they thought], as he said they locked the door and gave him the keys.

\t Ħaširu acmoqosi rekan čantaɣor eqerno, yiła imadu esa bašla bodin:
\m ħiši-ru ac-q-si reka-n čanta-aɣor eqer-n yiła-a imadu esi-a bašla b-odi-n
\g lock-PST.PRT door-POSS.ESS-ATTR key-TOP pocket-IN.VERS put-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG tale tell-INF begin III-do-PST.UNW
\l Having put the key to the locked door into the pocket, she began telling the tale:

\t Zownƛax, zownanuƛax sis bečedaw žek’u.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax sis bečedaw žek’u
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT one wealthy man
\l Once upon a time there was a rich man.

\t Nesis zown užin kidno.
\m nesi-s zow-n uži-n kid-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW son-and daughter-and
\l He had a son and a daughter.

\t Žedu beɣet’atow yałzay xexbi eniwn yexun ƛexunƛax.
\m žedu b-eɣe-t’a-tow yoł-zay xexbi eniw-n y-exu-n ƛexu-n-ƛax
\g DEM1.IPL I.PL-young-DISTR-EMPH be-SIM.CVB children mother-TOP II-die-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l When these children were young, their mother died.

\t Baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow nesi bečedawni žek’a q’ˤuya baru yižisƛax.
\m b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow nesi bečedaw-ni žek’u-a q’ˤuya baru y-iži-s-ƛax
\g III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL wealthy-DEF man-ERG other wife II-lead-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l After much time had passed, the rich man took another wife.

\t Nełasgon łinasnokin hunar anusi kid zownƛax.
\m neła-s-gon łina-s-n-kin hunar anu-si kid zow-n-ƛax
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-even talent be.NEG-ATTR daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l She had a daughter with no talent whatsoever.

\t Xedyosni yołi maʕdinaw tarbiya yołäsi kid zown.
\m xediw-s-ni yołi maʕdinaw tarbiya yoł-asi kid zow-n
\g husband-GEN1-DEF however pretty upbringing be-RES.PRT daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The husband, however, had a daughter of pretty upbringing.

\t Zamanałäy neła ɣˤanazas xediwn, nesisgon užin ozno bižin ƛˤoreł bik’inosi, nełar retäsi zown best’alawni kid elo iday yok’ek’anix.
\m zaman-łay neła ɣˤanabi-s xediw-n nesi-s-gon uži-n oz-n b-iži-n ƛˤori-ł b-ik’i-nosi neła-r r-eti-asi zow-n best’alaw-ni kid elo idu-ay y-ok’ek’-ani-x
\g time-CONT.ABL DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-GEN1 husband-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR son-and army-and I.PL-lead-PFV.CVB war-CONT.ESS I.PL-go-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT IV-want-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB step-DEF daughter there home-IN.ABL II-remove-MSD-AD.ESS
\l After some time, after the woman's husband, his son and the army went to war, she wanted to remove the step-daughter from their home.

\t (Nełas xediw ensi žek’uq iłäsi zownƛin, neła nełas babiw ukarno).
\m neła-s xediw endu-si žek’u-q iłi-asi zow-n-ƛin neła-a neła-s babiw ukar-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 husband this-ATTR man-POSS.ESS resemble-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 father show-PST.UNW
\l ("Her husband resembled this man", she pointed to her father.)

\t Ža kaɣat yaynosi babiya uži egirno, ciqqorno yižin esiwn yexurno nełas rok’u däq rukaranix ħamayn roɣno raƛin.
\m ža kaɣat y-ay-nosi babi-a uži egir-n ciq-qor-n y-iži-n esiw-n y-exur-n neła-s rok’u di-q r-ukar-ani-x ħam-ay-n r-oɣ-n r-ow-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG letter II-come-ANT.CVB dad-ERG son send-PST.UNW forest-POSS.LAT-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB sister-TOP II-kill-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 heart me-POSS.ESS IV-show-MSD-AD.ESS chest-IN.ABL-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB IV-bring-QUOT
\l After reading the letter, the father sent his son: "Lead your sister into the forest and kill her, take away her heart out of her chest and bring it here to show it to me."

\t Nexno nesä guluƛ’no zowerno ciqaɣor esiwn yižin ik’in.
\m nex-n nesi-a gulu-ƛ’-n zowr-n ciq-aɣor esiw-n y-iži-n ik’i-n
\g come-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP seat-PFV.CVB forest-IN.VERS sister-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l He came, seated his sister onto the horse and lead her into the forest.

\t Elor aynosi q’ˤimzo esiwƛ’or yexuranix reƛ’a rizira k’ʷeze roqnoanu nesiq.
\m elo-r ay-nosi q’ˤim-z esiw-ƛ’or y-exur-ani-x reƛ’a r-izir-a k’ʷeze r-oq-n-anu nesi-q
\g there-LAT come-ANT.CVB oneself-GEN2 sister-SUPER.LAT II-kill-MSD-AD.ESS hand IV-lift-INF can IV-become-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l When he came there, he couldn't lift his hand to kill his own sister.

\t Xizyo žeduł xizay bik’ix zawru ɣˤʷayn bexurno, nełas rok’un rižin ik’in babiwder, di esiw yexursiƛin eƛanix.
\m xizyo žedu-ł xizay b-ik’i-x zow-ru ɣˤʷay-n b-exur-n neła-s rok’u-n r-iži-n ik’i-n babiw-der di esiw y-exur-s-ƛin eƛi-ani-x
\g afterwards DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS behind III-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT dog-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 heart-TOP IV-take.out-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB father-APUD.LAT me sister II-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT say-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Afterwards, he killed a dog that was following them, he took out its heart and went to his father to say: "I killed my sister."

\t Esiw nesä howlotow ciqqo xecin.
\m esiw nesi-a howlo-tow ciq-q xeci-n
\g sister DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG there-EMPH forest-POSS.ESS leave-PST.UNW
\l His sister he left there in the forest.

\t (Ža ensi žek’uq iłäsi zownƛin bašan boyn neła nełas esiw ukarno).
\m ža endu-si žek’u-q iłi-asi zow-n-ƛin baša-n b-odi-n neła-a neła-s esiw ukar-n
\g DEM1.SG this-ATTR man-POSS.ESS resemble-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT finger-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 brother show-PST.UNW
\l ("He resembled this man.", she pointed her finger onto her brother.)

\t Sisxoli ciqqo ƛäxuru kidbä ɣunoz gonda teł sasaqorsi ɣudi qˤaširno.
\m sisxoli ciq-q ƛexu-ru kid-a ɣun-z gondu-a teł sasaq-qor-si ɣudi qˤašir-n
\g alone forest-POSS.ESS remain-PST.PRT girl-ERG tree-GEN2 big.hole-IN.ESS inside tomorrow-POSS.LAT-ATTR day dawn-PST.UNW
\l The girl who stayed in the forest alone [VERB] inside a hole in a tree, then the next day started to dawn.

\t Yesunosi adäza hečk’er izin ičäsi ʕoloqan uži yołƛax.
\m y-esu-nosi adäza hečk’er izi-n iči-asi ʕoloqan uži yoł-ƛax
\g II-find-ANT.CVB before upright get.up-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT young boy be-QUOT
\l After he found her, there was a young boy standing upright before her.

\t (Ža yołƛax ensi baħarčiq iłäsiƛin, neła nełas xediw ukarno).
\m ža yoł-ƛax endu-si baħarči-q iłi-asi-ƛin neła-a neła-s xediw ukar-n
\g DEM1.SG be-QUOT this-ATTR brave.young.man-POSS.ESS resemble-RES.PRT-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 husband show-PST.UNW
\l ("He resembled this young man", she pointed to her husband.)

\t Nesir ža yukayrun roƛ’in boqno ža kid nesä barułun yižin.
\m nesi-r ža y-ukad-run roƛ’i-n b-oq-n ža kid nesi-a baru-łun y-iži-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.SG II-see-IMM.ANT.CVB love-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG girl DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG wife-LHUN II-lead-PST.UNW
\l When he saw her, he immediately fell in love with her and took her as a wife.

\t Yoƛƛo ƛˤeb yik’izaƛ’ortow žedur užin oynƛax.
\m y-oƛƛo ƛˤeb y-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow žedu-r uži-n odi-n-ƛax
\g II-middle year II-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT son-TOP do-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l After less than a year has gone by, a son was born to them.

\t Hemedur žedu yałzay, sida bečedaw žek’a xabar bayrno bertenyołxor horoƛin.
\m hemedur žedu yoł-zay sida bečedaw žek’u-a xabar b-ayr-n berten-łxor horo-ƛin
\g so DEM1.IPL be-SIM.CVB one.OBL wealthy man-ERG story III-bring-PST.UNW marriage-CONT.VERS come.IMPR-QUOT
\l While they were like this [i.e., married], a rich man spread the word: 'Come to my marriage!'.

\t Elaɣor bik’anix ħadur boqƛ’orey, xedyoƛ’or aħin bayn, askarno boɣno ƛˤoreł ik’in.
\m ele-aɣor b-ik’i-ani-x ħadur b-oq-ƛ’oräy xediw-ƛ’or aħin b-ay-n askar-n b-oɣ-n ƛˤori-ł ik’i-n
\g there-IN.VERS I.PL-go-MSD-AD.ESS prepare I.PL-become-SIM.CVB husband-SUPER.LAT rock III-come-PFV.CVB army-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB war-CONT.ESS go-PST.UNW
\l While they prepared themselves to go there, the alarm came unto the husband, he took the army and went to war.

\t Xedya, ƛˤoreł ik’a adäza, sida božaraw žek’ude sadaq barun užin bertenyołxor begirno.
\m xediw-a ƛˤori-ł ik’i-a adäza sida božaraw žek’u-de sadaq baru-n uži-n berten-łxor b-egir-n
\g husband-ERG war-CONT.ESS go-INF before one.OBL reliable man-APUD.ESS together wife-and son-and marriage-CONT.VERS I.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l The husband, before he went to war, sent his wife and son to the marriage together with a reliable man.

\t Gamiƛ’no zown žedu raładyołäza bik’a bayx zown.
\m gama-ƛ’-n zow-n žedu raład-łaza b-ik’i-a b-ay-x zow-n
\g boat-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL sea-CONT.VERS.DIST I.PL-go-INF I.PL-must-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l On a boat they had to cross the sea.

\t Boƛƛi raładyołer baynosi nesi sadaq zawruni žek’a ža ozƛ’o yisa oqno.
\m b-oƛƛi raład-łer b-ay-nosi nesi sadaq zow-ru-ni žek’u-a ža ozuri-ƛ’ y-is-a oq-n
\g III-middle sea-CONT.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL together be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF man-ERG DEM1.SG eye-SUPER.ESS II-take-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l When they came to the middle of the sea, the man that was together with them, started to mock her.

\t Neła harizi rodin, habsaʕat maħorno yoqno yayan diƛin.
\m neła-a harizi r-odi-n habsaʕat maħor-n y-oq-n y-ay-an di-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG request IV-do-PST.UNW now outside-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB II-come-FUT.DEF me-QUOT
\l She pleaded: "I'll get outside and come back!"

\t Nesiqor užin teƛno, gama tełäyn yoqno ža raładyołer k’oƛin.
\m nesi-qor uži-n teƛ-n gama-a teł-ay-n y-oq-n ža raład-łer k’oƛi-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT son-TOP give-PFV.CVB boat-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG sea-CONT.LAT jump-PST.UNW
\l She gave him the son, got out of the boat's inside and jumped into the sea.

\t Elay bitorgon bik’ixozo q’ˤuya gamiƛ’aɣorno yizin ža xʷasarno yoqno, nełaƛ’town raładyoz lilyoxaɣor yok’ełno.
\m ele-ay bitor-gon b-ik’i-xozo q’ˤuya gama-ƛ’aɣor-n y-izi-n ža xʷasar-n y-oq-n neła-ƛ’-tow-n raład-z lilyo-xaɣor y-ok’eł-n
\g there-IN.ABL thither-CNTR I.PL-go-PRS.PRT.OBL other boat-SUPER.VERS-TOP II-get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG rescue-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-EMPH-TOP sea-GEN2 river.bank-AD.VERS II-escape-PST.UNW
\l She got to another boat that was going from there to somewhere else, got rescued and escaped on it to the seashore.

\t Sida bečedaw žek’uz bertenyołer ħadur boqxoƛin, q’orolayä eƛin.
\m sida bečedaw žek’u-z berten-łer ħadur b-oq-x-ƛin q’orolay-a eƛi-n
\g one.OBL wealthy man-GEN2 marriage-CONT.LAT prepare I.PL-become-PRS-QUOT widow-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "We are getting ready for a rich man's wedding", a widow said.

\t Ža ɣˤanabi yałrułi žedurno yiynanu.
\m ža ɣˤanabi yoł-rułi žedu-r-n y-iy-n-anu
\g DEM1.SG woman be-MSD DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT-TOP II-know-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l And they didn't know that she was a woman.

\t Neła imadał yoƛäk’ru ɣˤanabin di yołƛin, neła nełaƛ’ay aħozis k’uk boɣno.
\m neła imadu-ł y-oƛik’-ru ɣˤanabi-n di yoł-ƛin neła-a neła-ƛ’ay aħo-s k’uk b-oɣ-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL tale-CONT.ESS II-let.appear-PST.PRT woman-TOP me be-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL shepherd-GEN1 cap III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l And I am the woman who appeared in this tale.", [she said] and took away the shepherd's cap.

\t Bertenyoł zawru nasin xalq’i ħayran boqno ƛexun.
\m berten-ł zow-ru nasin xalq’i ħayran b-oq-n ƛexu-n
\g marriage-CONT.ESS be.NPRS-PST.PRT all people be.astonished III-become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l All people on the marriage were surprised.

\t Q’ˤiday bet’un k’oƛin xediwn užin nełaq łeɣin, babiwn esiwn ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu bizin.
\m q’ˤida-ay b-et’u-n k’oƛi-n xediw-n uži-n neła-q łeɣi-n babiw-n esiw-n ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu b-izi-n
\g down-IN.ABL I.PL-jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB husband-and son-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS grasp-PFV.CVB father-and brother-and very be.happy I.PL-get-PST.UNW
\l The husband and the son jumped up and grasped her, the father and the brother got very happy.

\t Best’al eniwn, bužin erno nełade sadaq egäruni žek’un guluzaz maħizaqorno bicin ʕaƛay maħor boxirno.
\m best’al eniw-n buži-n er-n neła-de sadaq egir-ru-ni žek’u-n gulu-bi-z maħi-bi-qor-n b-ici-n ʕaƛ-ay maħor b-oxir-n
\g step mother-and hope-TOP put-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS together send-PST.PRT-DEF man-and horse-PL-GEN2 tail-PL-POSS.LAT-TOP I.PL-tie-PFV.CVB village-IN.ABL outside I.PL-chase-PST.UNW
\l The step-mother and the man she sent together with her, who was put hope into, were tied to horses' tails and were chased out of the village.

\t Babiwr kidno, esiwr esiyn, xedyor barun, žar eniwn č’agu yoqnoƛax.
\m babiw-r kid-n esiw-r esyu-n xediw-r baru-n uži-r eniw-n č’agu y-oq-n-ƛax
\g father-LAT daughter-and brother-LAT sister-and husband-LAT wife-and son-LAT mother-and alive II-become-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l For the father his daughter, for the brother his sister, for the husband his wife and for the son his mother was alive.

\t Howt’or bayza imadun łiynƛax.
\m howt’o-r b-ay-za imadu-n łiy-n-ƛax
\g here-LAT III-come-LCV tale-TOP end-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l And the tale also ends where it came to, here.

\t Esin šebi, xecin šebi, zownƛax, zownanuƛax eniwn užin.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax eniw-n uži-n
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT mother-and son-and
\l Once upon a time there was a mother and her son.

\t Žedu c’aq’tow c’aq’ miskinłiƛ’ zownƛax.
\m žedu c’aq’-tow c’aq’ miskinłi-ƛ’ zow-n-ƛax
\g DEM1.IPL much-EMPH much poverty-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l They lived in much, much poverty.

\t Sida quł žoyä eniwqor eƛin, di eynoda ik’ix, nedur yaziqłiƛ’ netayrce eli bičanƛin.
\m sida qu-ł uži-a eniw-qor eƛi-n di eynod-a ik’i-x nedur yaziqłi-ƛ’ netayr-ace eli b-iči-an-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS son-ERG mother-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW me work-INF go-PRS so poverty-SUPER.ESS how.much-TERM we I.PL-live-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l One day the son said to his mother: "I will go to work; how much longer will we live in poverty like this?"

\t Eniya užir aq’ˤlu bodin, nagaħ xalq’imo hunizax ruħč’agoyaw šebin q’ʷarid royx resunäy, mi ža xʷasar rodoƛin.
\m eni-a uži-r ʕaq’lu b-odi-n nagaħ xalq’i-a huni-bi-x ruħč’agoyaw šebin q’ʷarid r-odi-x r-esu-näy mi ža xʷasar r-odi-o-ƛin
\g mother-ERG son-LAT advice III-do-PST.UNW suppose people-ERG way-PL-AD.ESS living thing hurt IV-do-IPFV.CVB IV-exist-CND.CVB you DEM1.SG rescue IV-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l The mother gave the son an advice: "If someone on your way hurts an animal, rescue it!"

\t Mi äƛiruxor rodanƛin, eniwr rožin teƛno, uži ʕaƛay maħor hunix oqno.
\m mi eƛi-ru-xor r-odi-an-ƛin eniw-r roži-n teƛ-n uži ʕaƛ-ay maħor huni-x oq-n
\g you say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT mother-LAT word-TOP give-PFV.CVB son village-IN.ABL outside way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l The son gave his mother his word: "I'll do what you said!", and went on his way out of the village.

\t Ik’ix, ik’ix yeda uži sidaɣ ciqqor ayn.
\m ik’i-x ik’i-x yeda uži sidaɣ ciq-qor ay-n
\g go-IPFV.CVB go-IPFV.CVB DEM2.ISG boy in.one.place forest-POSS.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Going and going, the boy came to some forest.

\t Elo yisir qaca reč’xo ečru žek’u esun.
\m elo yisi-r qaca r-eč’-x ečru žek’u esu-n
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT firewood IV-cut-IPFV.CVB old man find-PST.UNW
\l There he found an old man cutting firewood.

\t Salamno teƛno, yisi užä esirno, deber ħalt’uqan etixanaƛin.
\m salam-n teƛ-n yisi uži-a esir-n mi-r ħalt’uqan eti-x-anu-a-ƛin
\g greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-ERG ask-PST.UNW you-LAT worker want-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q-QUOT
\l The boy greeted him and asked: "Don't you need a worker?"

\t Wallah, etixƛin, eƛin ečruni žek’a.
\m wallah eti-x-ƛin eƛi-n ečru-ni žek’u-a
\g wallah want-PRS-QUOT say-PST.UNW old-DEF man-ERG
\l "By God, I do!", said the old man.

\t Łˤono qacis hoko t’it’inäy, łˤono ɣˤuruš neƛanƛin q’ut’in bodin, eynoda egirno xecin.
\m łˤono qaci-s hoko t’it’i-näy łˤono ɣˤuruš neƛ-an-ƛin q’ut’i-n b-odi-n eynod-a egir-n xeci-n
\g three firewood-GEN1 carriage fell-CND.CVB three ruble give-FUT.DEF-QUOT agreement-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB work-INF let-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW
\l "If you fell three carriages with firewood, I'll give you three rubles."; they made an agreement and he let him work and left.

\t Neširur ħalt’in łiyrno, ečruni žek’a näƛruni łˤono ɣurušno eqerno, uži eniwdäɣor iduɣor ik’ix zown.
\m neširu-r ħalt’i-n łiyr-n ečru-ni žek’u-a neƛ-ru-ni łˤono ɣˤuruš-n eqer-n uži eniw-däɣor idu-ɣor ik’i-x zow-n
\g at.night-LAT work-TOP finish-PFV.CVB old-DEF man-ERG give-PST.PRT-DEF three ruble-TOP put-PFV.CVB boy mother-APUD.VERS home-IN.ALL go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The boy finished his work late at night, took the three rubles that the old man gave him, and went home to his mother.

\t ʕAƛoxar baya adäza sidade bikori žek’xo ʕoloqbi besun.
\m ʕaƛ-xar b-ay-a adäza sida-de bikori žek’-x ʕoloq-bi b-esu-n
\g village-AD.VERS III-come-INF before one.OBL-APUD.ESS snake beat-IPFV.CVB young.person-PL I.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l At one point, before coming to the village, he found young people beating a snake.

\t Užä žeduqor eƛin, ža bikori sida ħala xec meža, neła mežur royxosi žukłi šebiƛin.
\m uži-a žedu-qor eƛi-n ža bikori sida ħal-a xeci mežu-a neła-a mežu-r r-odi-xosi žukłi šebi-ƛin
\g boy-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM1.SG snake one.OBL condition-IN.ESS leave you(I).PL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you(I).PL.OBL-LAT IV-do-PRS.PRT evil what-QUOT
\l The boy said to them: "Let go of the snake, what's the evil thing it has done to you?!"

\t Xecač’inƛin inkar bodin žeda, bexurinč’ey xeca betinäy, łˤono ɣuruš neƛ elurƛin boqno bičin yizi.
\m xeci-ač’in-ƛin inkar b-odi-n žedu-a b-exur-č’ey xeci-a b-eti-näy łˤono ɣˤuruš neƛ elu-r-ƛin b-oq-n b-iči-n yizi
\g leave-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT rejection I.PL-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG III-kill-NEG.PST.UNW leave-INF III-want-CND.CVB three ruble give we(I).OBL-LAT-QUOT I.PL-become-PFV.CVB I.PL-be-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL
\l "We won't leave it.", they rejected, "If you want us not to kill it, give us three rubles!".

\t Žedur łˤono ɣˤurušno teƛno, nesi užä ža bikori xʷasar bodin.
\m žedu-r łˤono ɣˤuruš-n teƛ-n nesi uži-a ža bikori xʷasar b-odi-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT three ruble-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG DEM1.SG snake rescue III-do-PST.UNW
\l The boy gave them the three rubles and rescued the snake.

\t Idur aynosi, eniya esirno: ha dey uži, eynoyn micxirkin biqiyä deberƛin.
\m idu-r ay-nosi eni-a esir-n ha di-s uži eynod-n micxir-kin b-iqi-ya mi-r-ƛin
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB mother-ERG ask-PST.UNW well me-GEN1 son work-PFV.CVB money-even III-get-PST.WIT.Q you-LAT-QUOT
\l When he came home, his mother asked: "Well, my son, have you worked and got money for it?"

\t Sida ečru žek’ur ciqqo qacis łˤono hoko t’ät’irus łˤono ɣˤuruš yiqäsi zows, hudun iduɣor ayƛ’oräy, bikori bexurxo ʕoloqbin besun, ža begirno xecaniƛ žedur łˤonon ɣˤuruš teƛsi diƛin, esin žoyä.
\m sida ečru žek’u-r ciq-q qaci-s łˤono hoko t’it’i-ru-s łˤono ɣˤuruš y-iqi-asi zow-s hudun idu-ɣor ay-ƛ’oräy bikori b-exur-x ʕoloq-bi-n b-esu-n ža b-egir-n xeci-ani-ƛ žedu-r łˤono-n ɣˤuruš teƛ-s di-ƛin esi-n uži-a
\g one.OBL old man-LAT forest-POSS.ESS firewood-GEN1 three carriage fell-PST.PRT-GEN1 three ruble II-get-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT nevertheless home-IN.ALL come-SIM.CVB snake III-kill-IPFV.CVB young.person-PL-TOP I.PL-find-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG III-let-PFV.CVB leave-MSD-SUB.ESS DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT three-TOP ruble give-PST.WIT me-QUOT tell-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "I got three rubles for felling three carriages full of firewood for an old man; but while I was coming home, I found some young people who were killing a snake and I gave them the three rubles for letting go of it.", he told.

\t Mi näƛru ʕaq’ˤlun rok’ƛ’or bayn, bikorin xʷasar bodin nexƛ’oräy, däłtow xizayn bayn neła esirsi, nazosnotow tušman šida mi bexura begirno xecinč’uƛin.
\m mi neƛ-ru ʕaq’lu-n rok’u-ƛ’or b-ay-n bikori-n xʷasar b-odi-n nex-ƛ’oräy di-ł-tow xizay-n b-ay-n neła-a esir-s nazo-s-n-tow tušman šida mi b-exur-a b-egir-n xeci-č’u-ƛin
\g you give-PST.PRT advice-TOP heart-SUPER.LAT III-come-PFV.CVB snake-TOP rescue III-do-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB me-CONT.ESS-EMPH behind-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.WIT everyone.OBL-GEN1-TOP-EMPH enemy why you III-kill-INF III-let-PFV.CVB leave-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "I remembered the advice you gave me and rescued the snake, and when I came back, it came behind me and asked: 'Why didn't you let them kill the enemy of everyone?'"

\t Debeƛ’no gurħizi oqno bexurƛ’oräysi mi di xʷasar boysƛin, di nełqor eƛis.
\m mi-ƛ’-n gurħizi oq-n b-exur-ƛ’oräy-si mi di xʷasar b-odi-s-ƛin di neła-qor eƛi-s
\g you-SUPER.ESS-TOP pity become-PFV.CVB III-kill-SIM.CVB-ATTR you me rescue III-do-PST.WIT-QUOT me DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.WIT
\l 'I felt sorry for you and rescued you from getting killed', I said to it.

\t Nedur resunäy mi däde sadaq ƛaƛin ižis neła di.
\m nedur r-esu-näy mi di-de sadaq ƛa-ƛin iži-s neła-a di
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB you me-APUD.ESS together go.IMPR-QUOT lead-PST.WIT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG me
\l 'If that's the case, you go together with me!', it [said and] lead me.

\t Nełas gondu yałruni mečoƛ’or baynosi, ža elo tełxor biħusƛin.
\m neła-s gondu yoł-ru-ni moči-ƛ’or b-ay-nosi ža elo teł-xor b-iħu-s-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 big.hole be-PST.PRT-DEF place-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG there inside-AD.LAT III-come.to-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l When we came to the place where its hole was, it went inside.

\t Tełäzay teqxo där, šida mi dey kid yaqˤuł nece kʷat’izi yoqäƛin, insanzo mecrexor eƛix.
\m teł-azay teq-x di-r šida mi di-s kid yaqˤuł nece kʷat’izi y-oq-a-ƛin insan-z mec-xor eƛi-x
\g inside-IN.ABL.DIST hear-IPFV.CVB me-LAT why you me-GEN1 daughter today so.much be.late II-become-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT human-GEN2 language-AD.LAT say-PRS
\l I was hearing from inside: "Why are you, my daughter, so late today?", said in a human voice.

\t Neła bikorzo sipatyoƛ’ bercinaw kid zown.
\m neła bikori-zo sipat-ƛ’ bercinaw kid zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL snake-ATTR.OBL appearance-SUPER.ESS beautiful girl be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l It was a beautiful girl with the look of this snake.

\t Neła eniwqor eƛix, sidade ʕoloqza di yexurƛ’oräy, eloš madax ičin zawruni užä ƛ’irirno ayn, žedur łˤono ɣˤurušno teƛno xʷasar yoysƛin.
\m neła-a eniw-qor eƛi-x sida-de ʕoloq-bi-a di y-exur-ƛ’oräy eloš ma-x iči-n zow-ru-ni uži-a ƛ’iri-r-n ay-n žedu-r łˤono ɣˤuruš-n teƛ-n xʷasar y-odi-s-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG mother-POSS.LAT say-PRS one.OBL-APUD.ESS young.person-PL-ERG me II-kill-SIM.CVB over.there outside-AD.ESS be-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF boy-ERG above-LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT three ruble-TOP give-PFV.CVB rescue II-do-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l She said to her mother: 'When somewhere some young people were killing me, the boy who is standing over there outside came about, gave them three rubles and saved [me].'

\t Sayɣat teƛanix ža uži tełxor aƛin eniya nełaq di goƛ’irersi.
\m sayɣat teƛ-ani-x ža uži teł-xor a-ƛin eni-a neła-q di goƛ’i-r-r-s
\g present give-MSD-AD.ESS DEM1.SG boy inside-AD.LAT bring.IMP-QUOT mother-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS me call-CAUS-CAUS-PST.WIT
\l 'Bring the boy inside, in order to give him a present!', and the mother let her call me."

\t Tełxor ižiƛ’oräy, kidbä nesi žaqor aq’ˤlu bodin, barkatawni ħiƛ’oqu gurow q’ˤuya šebin eniwqay risanix mi razi aqno.
\m teł-xor iži-ƛ’oräy kid-a nesi uži-qor ʕaq’lu b-odi-n barkataw-ni ħiƛ’oqu gurow q’ˤuya šebin eniw-qay r-is-ani-x mi razi oq-n
\g inside-AD.LAT lead-SIM.CVB girl-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-POSS.LAT advice III-do-PFV.CVB blessed-DEF handkerchief except other thing mother-POSS.ABL IV-take-MSD-AD.ESS you agree become-PROHIB
\l When she led him inside, the girl gave the boy an advice: 'Don't agree to take anything else from my mother than the blessed handkerchief!'

\t Kidbez eniya nesir ya micxir, ya mesed, ya q’ˤuya riguƛ’ay rigu šebinabi teƛxo zown, hudun užä žedu šebinabi risnoanu.
\m kid-z eni-a nesi-r ya micxir ya mesed ya q’ˤuya r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu šebin-bi teƛ-x zow-n hudun uži-a žedu šebin-bi r-is-n-anu
\g girl-GEN2 mother-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT either money either gold either other IV-good-SUPER.ABL IV-good thing-PL give-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB nevertheless boy-ERG DEM1.IIPL thing-PL IV.PL-take-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l The girl's mother was about to give him money or gold or other precious things, but the boy didn't take those things.

\t Šebitow deber hudu retinƛin neła esirnosi, där barkatawni ħiƛ’oqu neƛƛin, eƛin užä.
\m šebi-tow mi-r hudu r-eti-n-ƛin neła-a esir-nosi di-r barkataw-ni ħiƛ’oqu neƛ-ƛin eƛi-n uži-a
\g what-EMPH you-LAT then IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-ANT.CVB me-LAT blessed-DEF handkerchief give-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "What do you want then?", she asked, and the boy answered: "Give me the blessed handkerchief!"

\t Sosisi ža dey anuƛinno yičin, yedu xizyo ža teƛanix razi yoqno.
\m sosi-si ža di-s anu-ƛin-n y-iči-n yedu xizyo ža teƛ-ani-x razi y-oq-n
\g at.first-ATTR DEM1.SG me-GEN1 be.NEG-QUOT-TOP II-be-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG afterwards DEM1.SG give-MSD-AD.ESS agree II-become-PST.UNW
\l At first she was like "I don't have it.", afterwards she agreed to give it away.

\t Žan risno iduɣor ik’iƛ’orey, xizayn bayn neł bikorä esirno, deber ža ħiƛ’oqu reynoyrakin koƛ’ixosi yołäƛin.
\m ža-n r-is-n idu-ɣor ik’i-ƛ’oräy xizay-n b-ay-n neła bikori-a esir-n mi-r ža ħiƛ’oqu r-eynod-r-a-kin koƛ’i-xosi yoł-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-SIM.CVB from.behind-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL snake-ERG ask-PST.UNW you-LAT DEM1.SG handkerchief IV-work-CAUS-INF-even understand.to-PRS.PRT be-Q-QUOT
\l And he took it and while he was going home, that snake followed him and asked: "Do you know how to get this handkerchief to work?"

\t Q’ˤanon bišno q’iday bizinosi, kidbä mołin, didur ža rutirno tełxor eqra rayxosi yałrułi.
\m q’ˤano-n b-iš-n q’ˤida-ay b-izi-nosi kid-a mołi-n didur ža r-utir-n teł-xor eqer-a r-ay-xosi yoł-rułi
\g two-TOP I.PL-eat-PFV.CVB down-IN.ABL I.PL-get.up-ANT.CVB girl-ERG teach-PST.UNW how DEM1.SG IV-turn-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT put-INF IV-must-PRS.PRT be-MSD
\l After the two ate and got up, the girl taught [him] how one has to turn and put it inside.

\t Xizyo deber rätiru šebin t’ubazi radi yiła barkatawni ħiƛ’oqaƛinno eƛin, bikorä uži hunix egirno.
\m xizyo mi-r r-eti-ru šebin t’ubazi r-odi yiła barkataw-ni ħiƛ’oqu-ƛin-n eƛi-n bikori-a uži huni-x egir-n
\g afterwards you-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT thing fulfill IV-do DEM2.IISG.OBL blessed-DEF handkerchief-QUOT-TOP say-PFV.CVB snake-ERG boy way-AD.ESS let-PST.UNW
\l "Afterwards this blessed handkerchief will fulfill anything you want.", the snake said and let the boy go.

\t Ža šinaw šebin eniwq esinosi, ħiƛ’oqus ħal biyranix hemedurtow užä q’ˤida kurno.
\m ža šinaw šebin eniw-q esi-nosi ħiƛ’oqu-s ħal b-iyr-ani-x hemedur-tow uži-a q’ˤida kur-n
\g DEM1.SG every thing mother-POSS.ESS tell-ANT.CVB handkerchief-GEN1 condition III-explain-MSD-AD.ESS so-EMPH boy-ERG down spread.out-PST.UNW
\l After he had told his mother everything, in order to show the handkerchief's condition, the boy spread it out.

\t Howžin hemedurtow bišadyos niʕmatyabi ašiłno nełaƛ’ ƛ’iri.
\m howži-n hemedur-tow bišad-s niʕmat-bi ašił-n neła-ƛ’ ƛ’iri
\g now-TOP so-EMPH food-GEN1 bliss-PL grow-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS on
\l And again now delicacies grew on it.

\t Bišno łiynosi, eniya žaqor eƛin, howži elur mesedyos ƛ’ˤu yołäsi ɣˤutku retinƛin.
\m b-iš-n łiy-nosi eni-a uži-qor eƛi-n howži elu-r mesed-s ƛ’ˤu yoł-asi ɣˤutku r-eti-n-ƛin
\g I.PL-eat-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB mother-ERG son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW now we(I).OBL-LAT gold-GEN1 roof be-RES.PRT house IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l After they had finished eating, the mother said to the son: "Now we want a house with a golden roof!"

\t Žan riča yołƛin, žoyä eniw neła nełaz ɣˤutkaɣor yegirno.
\m ža-n r-iči-a yoł-ƛin uži-a eniw neła-a neła-z ɣˤutku-aɣor y-egir-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP IV-be-INF be-QUOT boy-ERG mother DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 room-IN.VERS II-send-PST.UNW
\l "And it will be!", the boy sent his mother into her own room.

\t Sasaqosi moƛaxay yäziru eniw, ɣˤutkoł adäza mesedyos ƛ’ˤu yołäsi ɣˤutku rukayn.
\m sasaqosi moƛu-xay y-izi-ru eniw ɣˤutku-ł adäza mesed-s ƛ’ˤu yoł-asi ɣˤutku r-ukad-n
\g in.the.morning sleep-AD.ABL II-get.up-PST.PRT mother house-CONT.ESS before gold-GEN1 roof be-RES.PRT house IV-see-PST.UNW
\l The next morning the mother who got up from her sleep, saw a house with a golden roof in front of her house.

\t Užin č’arik’no neła eƛin, eliz ɣˤutkoł adäza mesedyos ƛ’ˤu yołäsi ɣˤutku yoł, łasey ža resanƛin.
\m uži-n č’arik’-n neła-a eƛi-n eli-z ɣˤutku-ł adäza mesed-s ƛ’ˤu yoł-asi ɣˤutku yoł ła-s-ey ža r-esu-an-ƛin
\g boy-TOP wake.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW we-GEN2 house-CONT.ESS before gold-GEN1 roof be-RES.PRT house be who.OBL-GEN1-DUB DEM1.SG IV-exist-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l She woke up the boy and said: "In front of our house there's a house with a golden roof, whose might that be?"

\t Ža ɣˤutku eli yołƛin, žoyä eniw ɣˤaɣˤu yizirno.
\m ža ɣˤutku eli yoł-ƛin uži-a eniw ɣˤaɣˤu y-izir-n
\g DEM1.SG house we.SPEC.GEN1 be-QUOT boy-ERG mother be.happy II-lift-PST.UNW
\l "This house is ours.", the boy [said and] made his mother happy.

\t Hoboy mi, eni, eloš nesi bečedawni maduhales kidno däx esirno yik’iƛin, eƛin užä.
\m hoboy mi eni eloš nesi bečedaw-ni maduhal-s kid-n di-x esir-n y-ik’i-ƛin eƛi-n uži-a
\g now you mother over.there DEM1.ISG.OBL wealthy-DEF neighbor-GEN1 daughter-TOP me-AD.ESS ask-PFV.CVB II-go-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "Now you, mom, go over there and ask the wealthy neighbour's daughter out for me!", said the boy.

\t Mežiz madaxay däz madaxor mi mesedyos qˤiƛurabi roynäy, debez žax di kid yegiranƛin eniwƛ’or xabar bayn.
\m meži-z ma-xay di-z ma-xor mi mesed-s qˤiƛuri-bi r-odi-näy mi-z uži-x di kid y-egir-an-ƛin eniw-ƛ’or xabar b-ay-n
\g you.PL-GEN2 door-AD.ABL me-GEN2 door-AD.LAT you gold-GEN1 step-PL IV.PL-do-CND.CVB you-GEN2 son-AD.ESS me daughter II-send-FUT.DEF-QUOT mother-SUPER.LAT story III-come-PST.UNW
\l The mother got the answer: "If you can build golden stairs from your door to my door, I will send my daughter to your son."

\t Neła qułtow neširu užä q’ˤida ħiƛ’oqun raħno, eƛin, eliz madaxay bečedawni maduhalzo madaxor mesedyos qˤiƛurabi rodoƛin.
\m neła qu-ł-tow neširu uži-a q’ˤida ħiƛ’oqu-n r-aħ-n eƛi-n eliz ma-xay bečedaw-ni maduhal-z ma-xor mesed-s qˤiƛuri-bi r-odi-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS-EMPH evening boy-ERG down handkerchief-TOP IV-lay-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW we.SPEC.GEN1 door-AD.ABL wealthy-DEF neighbor-GEN2 door-AD.LAT gold-GEN1 step-PL IV.PL-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l On that day in the evening, the boy laid down the handkerchief and said: "Build golden stairs from our door to the wealthy neighbor's door!"

\t Sasaq moƛaxay izizaƛ’or mesedyos qˤiƛurabi resuzaƛ’, bečedawni žek’a kidno yegirno nesi žax, neła qˤiƛurazaƛ’aza baħarayn iduɣor yižin, nasin ʕaƛos xalq’in goƛ’in bertenno bodin.
\m sasaq moƛu-xay izi-zaƛ’or mesed-s qˤiƛuri-bi r-esu-zaƛ’ bečedaw-ni žek’u-a kid-n y-egir-n nesi uži-x neła qˤiƛuri-bi-ƛ’aza baħaray-n idu-ɣor y-iži-n nasin ʕaƛ-s xalq’i-n goƛ’i-n berten-n b-odi-n
\g in.the.morning sleep-AD.ABL get.up-POST.CVB gold-GEN1 step-PL IV.PL-find-CSL.CVB wealthy-DEF man-ERG daughter-TOP II-send-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-AD.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL step-PL-SUPER.VERS.DIST fiancée-TOP home-IN.ALL II-lead-PFV.CVB all village-GEN1 people-TOP invite-PFV.CVB marriage-TOP III-do-PST.UNW
\l The neex morning, before the wealthy man got up from his sleep, he sent his daughter to that boy, because he found the golden steps; [NELHA] lead his fiancée over the steps to his home, they invited all people of the village and married.

\t Eniwn, užin, barun bečełiƛ’ zown, miskin xalq’imor sadaq’a teƛxo žeda ʕaƛos žamaʕattown bečed bodin.
\m eniw-n uži-n baru-n bečełi-ƛ’ zow-n miskin xalq’i-r sadaq’a teƛ-x žedu-a ʕaƛ-s žamaʕat-tow-n bečed b-odi-n
\g mother-and son-and wife-and riches-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB poor people-LAT alms give-IPFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG village-GEN1 population-EMPH-TOP wealthy.man III-do-PST.UNW
\l The mother, her son and his wife lived wealthily, and by giving alms to the poor people, they enriched the population of the village.

\t Zownƛax, zownanuƛax sida ʕaƛa q’ˤano q’orolay.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax sida ʕaƛ-a q’ˤano q’orolay
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT one.OBL village-IN.ESS two widow
\l Once upon a time there lived two widows in a village.

\t Sidas zown sis uži, sidenis ʕoƛno uži zown.
\m sida-s zow-n sis uži sideni-s ʕoƛno uži zow-n
\g one.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PFV.CVB one son the.other.one-GEN1 seven son be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l One had one son, the other one had seven sons.

\t Sisxolisini q’orolas uži ziya bexadanix razi oqno.
\m sisxolisi-ni q’orol-s uži ziya b-exʷad-ani-x razi oq-n
\g lonely-DEF widow-GEN1 son cow III-slaughter-MSD-AD.ESS agree become-PST.UNW
\l The lonely widow's son agreed to slaughter the cow.

\t Neła ziys reƛno rac’no łiyrno, ħaħno ƛäxuru ƛuzazaq nesis raɣin ric’erno, ʕoƛnon esnabin boqno bik’in, yedan žeda žedudäy et’urno.
\m neła ziya-s reƛ-n r-ac’-n łiyr-n ħaħ-n ƛexu-ru ƛuza-bi-q nesi-s raɣi-n r-ic’r-n ʕoƛ-nan esyu-bi-n b-oq-n b-ik’i-n yeda-n žedu-a žedu-day et’ur-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL cow-GEN1 meat-TOP IV-eat-PFV.CVB finish-PFV.CVB gnaw-PFV.CVB remain-PST.PRT bone-PL-POSS.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 veranda-TOP IV-fill-PFV.CVB handle-INT brother-PL-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ABL pull.out-PST.UNW
\l After they had eaten up that cow's meat, the brothers left his veranda filled with the gnawed bones and left him behind.

\t Nełas siskin urɣel boynanu bat’iyaw sisxolizoni q’orolaz užä.
\m neła-s siskin urɣel b-odi-n-anu bat’iyaw sisxoli-zo-ni q’orol-z uži-a
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 any sorrow III-do-PFV.CVB-NEG other alone-ATTR.OBL-DEF widow-GEN2 son-ERG
\l The son of the other widow who was alone, did not have any sorrow.

\t ʕOƛiran esnaza radiru rešonin sidaƛ’or rutirno, ixinno nełas ric’no, žan risno hunix oqno.
\m ʕoƛira-n esyu-bi-a r-odi-ru rešoni-n sida-ƛ’or r-utir-n ixin-n neła-s r-ic’-n ža-n r-is-n huni-x oq-n
\g seven.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG IV-do-PST.PRT garbage-TOP one.OBL-SUPER.LAT IV-gather-PFV.CVB bag-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 IV-fill-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB way-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l He gathered the garbage that the seven brothers had produced in one, filled a bag with it and took it on his way.

\t Zamanałäza nesił dandir bazarganbi c’oxno hisos urgubi q’urec’niƛ’no erno rižin bik’ix.
\m zaman-łaza nesi-ł dandir bazargan-bi c’ox-n his-s urgu-bi q’urec’ni-ƛ’-n er-n r-iži-n b-ik’i-x
\g time-CONT.VERS.DIST DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS towards merchant-PL meet-PFV.CVB spring.wool-GEN1 sack-PL mule-SUPER.ESS-TOP put-PFV.CVB IV-carry-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PRS
\l After a while, he met some merchants carrying sacks with wool on a mule.

\t Žedu nexxo bukaynosi, yeda neł ixinoxorno oqno ʕuraw q’ʷaridno oqno ičin.
\m žedu nex-x b-ukad-nosi yeda neła ixin-xor-n oq-n ʕuraw q’ʷarid-n oq-n iči-n
\g DEM1.IPL come-IPFV.CVB I.PL-see-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG DEM1.IISG.OBL bag-AD.LAT-TOP become-PFV.CVB very sadness-TOP become-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l When he saw them coming, he came next to that bag and became very sad.

\t Salamno teƛno, bazarganza yisiq esirno, šebi roqno nece q’ʷaridno oqno ƛexasiƛin.
\m salam-n teƛ-n bazargan-bi-a yisi-q esir-n šebi r-oq-n nece q’ʷarid-n oq-n ƛexu-asi-ƛin
\g greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB merchant-PL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW what IV-happen-PFV.CVB so.much sadness-TOP become-PFV.CVB remain-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l The merchants greeted him and asked: "What happened, that you are so sad?"

\t Užä žawab teƛno, wallah howda mesedyos ric’ali ixin riža roqinč’ey urɣelyozał ƛexasi yołƛin.
\m uži-a žawab teƛ-n wallah howda mesed-s r-ic’-ali ixin r-iži-a r-oq-č’ey urɣel-bi-ł ƛexu-asi yoł-ƛin
\g boy-ERG answer give-PST.UNW wallah DEM3.SG gold-GEN1 IV-fill-ATTR bag IV-carry-INF IV-become-NEG.PST.CVB sorrow-PL-CONT.ESS remain-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l The boy answered: "By God, I can't carry this bag filled with gold, [that's why] I'm in sorrow."

\t Mi nełas rask’i urɣel badinƛin, sida q’urec’niƛ’ ƛ’iri ixin erno, hisos urgubi äruni sideni q’urec’niƛ’ ƛ’iri yeda zowerno.
\m mi neła-s rask’i urɣel b-odi-n-ƛin sida q’urec’ni-ƛ’ ƛ’iri ixin er-n his-s urgu-bi er-ru-ni sideni q’urec’ni-ƛ’ ƛ’iri yeda zowr-n
\g you DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 no.at.all sorrow III-do-PROHIB-QUOT one.OBL mule-SUPER.ESS on bag put-PFV.CVB spring.wool-GEN1 sack-PL put-PST.PRT-DEF other mule-SUPER.ESS on DEM2.ISG seat-PST.UNW
\l "Don't worry!", they put his bag onto the mule and seated him on the other mule that carried the sacks of wool.

\t Boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, ža uži žeduqay et’un.
\m b-oƛƛo b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow ža uži žedu-qay et’u-n
\g III-middle III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM1.SG boy DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ABL part-PST.UNW
\l After a while, the boy seperated from them.

\t Eniw tamaša yoqno ƛexun, nay ža deber nece his riqäƛin.
\m eniw tamaša y-oq-n ƛexu-n nay ža mi-r nece his r-iqi-a-ƛin
\g mother astonished II-become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW from.where DEM1.SG you-LAT so.much spring.wool IV-get-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l His mother was astonished: "Where did you get so much wool from?"

\t Užä eniwq bazarganzał raqru šebin esin.
\m uži-a eniw-q bazargan-bi-ł r-oq-ru šebin esi-n
\g boy-ERG mother-POSS.ESS merchant-PL-CONT.ESS IV-happen-PST.PRT thing tell-PST.UNW
\l The boy told his mother what had happened about the merchants.

\t Bayn ʕoƛiran esnaza esirno, na debi uži yoł, ukayxanuwa yedaƛin.
\m b-ay-n ʕoƛira-n esyu-bi-a esir-n na mi-s uži yoł ukad-x-anu-a yeda-ƛin
\g I.PL-come-PFV.CVB seven.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG ask-PST.UNW where you-GEN1 son be see-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q DEM2.ISG-QUOT
\l The seven brothers came and asked: "Where is your son? [Why] Didn't we see him?"

\t Eniya eƛin, nagon ža äči, eloš hisołäy tuturłi hok’xo yołƛin.
\m eni-a eƛi-n na-gon ža iči eloš his-łay tuturłi hok’-x yoł-ƛin
\g mother-ERG say-PST.UNW where-CNTR DEM1.SG be over.there spring.wool-CONT.ABL dirt pull.out-IPFV.CVB be-QUOT
\l The mother said: "Where could he be; he is pulling out the dirt from the whool over there."

\t Tełer bik’in bezuzaƛ’, ʕoƛnon esnabi haqa bogun bezun ƛexun.
\m tełer b-ik’i-n b-ezu-zaƛ’ ʕoƛno-n esyu-bi haqu-a b-ogu-n b-ezu-n ƛexu-n
\g to.the.inside I.PL-go-PFV.CVB I.PL-look-CSL.CVB seven-TOP brother-PL mouth-IN.ESS I.PL-gape-PFV.CVB I.PL-look-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l When the seven brothers went inside and took a look, they remained looking with an open mouth.

\t Žeda esirno, nay yedu deber nece raq’ˤu his riqäƛin.
\m žedu-a esir-n nay yedu mi-r nece r-aq’ˤu his r-iqi-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL-ERG ask-PST.UNW from.where DEM2.IISG you-LAT so.much IV-much spring.wool IV-get-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l They asked: "Where did you get so much wool from?"

\t Užä žawab teƛno, meža neła quł däz raɣä režigon raq’ˤu rešoni roys yołi ƛuzabin čˤaƛin, režigon raq’ˤu his räqi där bazaryayƛin.
\m uži-a žawab teƛ-n mežu-a neła qu-ł di-z raɣi-a r-eži-gon r-aq’ˤu rešoni r-odi-s yołi ƛuza-bi-n čˤaƛi-n r-eži-gon r-aq’ˤu his r-iqi di-r bazar-ay-ƛin
\g boy-ERG answer give-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS me-GEN2 veranda-IN.ESS IV-more-CNTR IV-much garbage IV-do-PST.WIT if bone-PL-TOP throw-PFV.CVB IV-more-CNTR IV-much spring.wool IV-get me-LAT bazar-IN.ABL-QUOT
\l The boy answered: "If you had produced more garbage and threw the bones onto my veranda that day, I would've got much more wool from the market."

\t Hobolaytow idurno bik’in žedu esnabi, žeda žedus posun rexayn, nełas reƛno rac’no, xizor ƛäxuru ƛuzazas ixinabin ric’no bazaryaɣor bik’in.
\m hobolo-ay-tow idu-r-n b-ik’i-n žedu esyu-bi žedu-a žedu-s posu-n r-exʷad-n neła-s reƛ-n r-ac’-n xizor ƛexu-ru ƛuza-bi-s ixin-bi-n r-ic’-n bazar-aɣor b-ik’i-n
\g there-IN.ABL-EMPH home-LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL brother-PL DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 cattle-TOP IV-slaughter-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 meat-TOP IV-eat-PFV.CVB back remain-PST.PRT bone-PL-GEN1 bag-PL-TOP IV.PL-fill-PFV.CVB bazar-IN.VERS I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l From there the brothers went home, slaughtered their cattle, ate its mean and filled bags with the remaining bones and went to the market.

\t Yizä eli inžit bodixƛin, nasin xalq’i ƛ’irin butin, hut’-mˤalä nocu caƛix bazar xecirerno žeduq.
\m yizi-a eli inžit b-odi-x-ƛin nasin xalq’i ƛ’iri-n b-uti-n hut’~mˤali-a nocu caƛi-x bazar xeci-r-r-n žedu-q
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG we disgrace I.PL-do-PRS-QUOT all people above-TOP I.PL-turn-PFV.CVB front.part.of.the.face-IN.ESS saliva throw-IPFV.CVB bazar leave-CAUS-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l "They are disgracing us!", all people insisted and spitting in their faces caused them to leave the market.

\t Dahawgon zaman bik’inosi, hemełatown bexayruni ziys ħošin bižin q’orolas uži bazaryaɣor ik’in.
\m dahaw-gon zaman b-ik’i-nosi hemeła-tow-n b-exʷad-ru-ni ziya-s ħoši-n b-iži-n q’orol-s uži bazar-aɣor ik’i-n
\g a.little-CNTR time III-go-ANT.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH-TOP III-slaughter-PST.PRT-DEF cow-GEN1 hide-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB widow-GEN1 son bazar-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l After a little while, the widow's son carried the slaughtered cow's hide to the market.

\t Yisił dandir nuci teƛxosi bazargan c’oxno.
\m yisi-ł dandir nuci teƛ-xosi bazargan c’ox-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS towards honey sell-PRS.PRT merchant meet-PST.UNW
\l He met a merchant who was selling honey.

\t Nesä užiq esirno, yedu ziya teƛxanaƛin.
\m nesi-a uži-q esir-n yedu ziya teƛ-x-anu-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG boy-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG cow sell-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q-QUOT
\l He asked the boy: "Don't you sell that cow?"

\t Ax roqace nuci raganix egirno xecinäy neƛanƛin eƛin užä.
\m ax r-oq-ace nuci r-agi-ani-x egir-n xeci-näy neƛ-an-ƛin eƛi-n uži-a
\g belly IV-become-TERM honey IV-lick-MSD-AD.ESS let-PFV.CVB leave-CND.CVB give-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "If you let me lick a belly-full of honey, I'll give it to you.", said the boy.

\t Bazarganä bisno adäza ħaƛin nucos bic’äsi q’ut’u.
\m bazargan-a b-is-n adäza ħaƛi-n nuci-s b-ic’-asi q’ut’u
\g merchant-ERG III-take-PFV.CVB ahead push-PST.UNW honey-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT earthen.jug
\l The merchant took a jug filled with honey and pushed it in front of him.

\t Užä ža ragin łiyrxo rukaynosi, bazarganä yeda xizor oxirno.
\m uži-a ža r-agi-n łiyr-x r-ukad-nosi bazargan-a yeda xizor oxir-n
\g boy-ERG DEM1.SG IV-lick-PFV.CVB finish-IPFV.CVB IV-see-ANT.CVB merchant-ERG DEM2.ISG back chase-PST.UNW
\l When he saw that the boy was eating it up, the merchant chased him.

\t Elaygon bitor ħošin bižin yeda ik’iƛ’oräy, yiside dandir quqäsi reƛ teƛxo bazargan c’oxxo.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor ħoši-n b-iži-n yeda ik’i-ƛ’oräy yisi-de dandir quqäsi reƛ teƛ-x bazargan c’ox-x
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither hide-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS towards dry meat sell-IPFV.CVB merchant meet-PRS
\l While he was going on with the hide, he met a merchant who was selling dried meat.

\t Nesän hemedurtow esirno užiq, ža ziys ħoši teƛxanaƛin.
\m nesi-a-n hemedur-tow esir-n uži-q ža ziya-s ħoši teƛ-x-anu-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP so-EMPH ask-PFV.CVB boy-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG cow-GEN1 hide sell-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q-QUOT
\l He asked the boy likewise: "Aren't you going to sell that cow hide?"

\t Ax roqace reƛ rac’a egirno xecinäy, neƛanƛin eƛin užä.
\m ax r-oq-ace reƛ r-ac’-a egir-n xeci-näy neƛ-an-ƛin eƛi-n uži-a
\g belly IV-become-TERM meat IV-eat-INF let-PFV.CVB leave-CND.CVB give-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "If you let me eat a belly-full of meat, then I'll give it to you.", said the boy.

\t Bisno bazarganä yisił adäza raħiräsi reƛis ħit’u eqerno.
\m b-is-n bazargan-a yisi-ł adäza r-aħi-r-asi reƛ-s ħit’u eqer-n
\g III-take-PFV.CVB merchant-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before IV-cook-CAUS-RES.PRT meat-GEN1 pan put-PST.UNW
\l The merchant took a pan of cooked meat and put it before him.

\t Užä ħit’ures iƛ’u nec’irxotow yižix yukaynosi, reƛ teƛxozoni bazarganä ža xizor oxirno.
\m uži-a ħit’u-s iƛ’u nec’ir-x-tow y-iži-x y-ukad-nosi reƛ teƛ-xozo-ni bazargan-a ža xizor oxir-n
\g boy-ERG pan-GEN1 bottom empty-IPFV.CVB-EMPH II-take.out-IPFV.CVB II-see-ANT.CVB meat sell-PRS.PRT.OBL-DEF merchant-ERG DEM1.SG back chase-PST.UNW
\l When he saw that the boy was emptying the bottom of the pan, the meat-selling merchant chased him.

\t Elaygon bitor ik’iƛ’oräy nesi užił sis ɣˤanabi c’oxno.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor ik’i-ƛ’oräy nesi uži-ł sis ɣˤanabi c’ox-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither go-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-CONT.ESS one woman meet-PST.UNW
\l While he went further from there, that boy met a woman.

\t Mix bik’äsi zamanno boqzaƛ’, yiła ɣˤanaza yeda neła nełdäɣor ƛirbałix ižix.
\m mix b-ik’i-asi zaman-n b-oq-zaƛ’ yiła ɣˤanabi-a yeda neła-a neła-däɣor ƛirbałi-x iži-x
\g time III-go-RES.PRT time-TOP III-become-CSL.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL woman-ERG DEM2.ISG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.VERS hospitality-AD.ESS lead-PRS
\l Because some time had passed, that woman let him be her guest.

\t Sida zamanałäza acmoq deqƛin.
\m sida zaman-łaza ac-q deqƛi-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.VERS.DIST door-POSS.ESS knock-PST.UNW
\l After a while, it knocked on the door.

\t Dey xediw nexxoƛin, yiła yeda sida yeže ɣamasya tełxor uqˤno.
\m di-s xediw nex-x-ƛin yiła-a yeda sida y-eže ɣamas-a teł-xor uqˤi-n
\g me-GEN1 husband come-PRS-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG one.OBL II-big box-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT hide-PST.UNW
\l "My husband is coming!", she [said and] hid him inside a large box.

\t Ža nuci teƛxo zawruni bazargan zown.
\m ža nuci teƛ-x zow-ru-ni bazargan zow-n
\g DEM1.SG honey sell-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF merchant be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l It was the merchant who had been selling honey.

\t Dahawtowgon zaman bik’izaƛ’or, xizyogon acmoq deqƛin.
\m dahaw-tow-gon zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or xizyogon ac-q deqƛi-n
\g a.little-EMPH-CNTR time III-go-POST.CVB again door-POSS.ESS knock-PST.UNW
\l After a little while, it knocked on the door again.

\t Dey xediw nexxoƛin yiła yeda nuci teƛxosi bazargan nesi žade puräza ɣamasya teł uqˤno.
\m di-s xediw nex-x-ƛin yiła-a yeda nuci teƛ-xosi bazargan nesi uži-de pu-aza ɣamas-a teł uqˤi-n
\g me-GEN1 husband come-PRS-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG honey sell-PRS.PRT merchant DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-APUD.ESS side-IN.VERS.DIST box-IN.ESS inside hide-PST.UNW
\l "My husband is coming!", she [said and] hid that honey-selling merchant in the box next to the boy.

\t Oƛixno k’oƛin tełer reƛ teƛxo zawruni bazargan.
\m oƛix-n k’oƛi-n tełer reƛ teƛ-x zow-ru-ni bazargan
\g appear-PFV.CVB jump-PST.UNW to.the.inside meat sell-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF merchant
\l The merchant who had been selling the meat jumped inside.

\t Nełƛ’osi baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, łox äƛirugon acmoq deqƛin.
\m nełƛ’osi b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow łox äƛiru-gon ac-q deqƛi-n
\g of.that.time III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH thrice ORD-CNTR door-POSS.ESS knock-PST.UNW
\l And alot more time after that, it knocked on the door a third time.

\t Hemedurtow, dey xediw nexxoƛin, reƛ teƛxosini bazarganno yizide sadaq ɣamasya teł uqˤno yiła.
\m hemedur-tow di-s xediw nex-x-ƛin reƛ teƛ-xosi-ni bazargan-n yizi-de sadaq ɣamas-a teł uqˤi-n yiła-a
\g so-EMPH me-GEN1 husband come-PRS-QUOT meat sell-PRS.PRT-DEF merchant-TOP DEM2.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS together box-IN.ESS inside hide-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG
\l Again she said "My husband is coming!", and also hid the meat-selling merchant inside the box together with them.

\t Žigoƛ’ay uyn oƛixno k’oƛin nełas xediw.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay uy-n oƛix-n k’oƛi-n neła-s xediw
\g again-SUPER.ABL indeed-TOP appear-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 husband
\l This time her husband jumped in indeed.

\t Iš-utin ža kecanix puƛ’or utinosi, užä eƛin žeduqor, diƛa ik’anƛin yołƛin.
\m iš~uti-n ža kec-ani-x pu-ƛ’or uti-nosi uži-a eƛi-n žedu-qor di-ƛa ik’i-an-ƛin yoł-ƛin
\g eat-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG sleep-MSD-AD.ESS side-SUPER.LAT turn-ANT.CVB boy-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT me-INDEF go-FUT.CVB-QUOT be-QUOT
\l When he ate and turned onto his side to sleep, the boy said to them: "I'm going to go."

\t Elin dowde sadaq bižoƛin, bazarganbi harizi boqno.
\m eli-n mi-de sadaq b-iži-o-ƛin bazargan-bi harizi b-oq-n
\g we-TOP you-APUD.ESS together I.PL-lead-IMPR-QUOT merchant-PL request I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l "Take us with you, too!", the merchants requested.

\t Meži di bižan mežuq yałru kinaw micxir där neƛnäyƛin.
\m meži di b-iži-an mežu-q yoł-ru kinaw micxir di-r neƛ-näy-ƛin
\g you.PL me III-lead-FUT.DEF you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT entire money me-LAT give-CND.CVB-QUOT
\l "I will take you with me, if you give me all the money you have."

\t Razi boqno žedu nełaƛ’.
\m razi b-oq-n žedu neła-ƛ’
\g agree I.PL-become-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS
\l They agreed on that.

\t Nuci teƛno bäqirun, reƛ teƛno bäqirun šinaw micxir bazarganza q’orolaz užiqor butirno.
\m nuci teƛ-n b-iqi-ru-n reƛ teƛ-n b-iqi-ru-n šinaw micxir bazargan-bi-a q’orol-z uži-qor b-utir-n
\g honey sell-PFV.CVB III-get-PST.PRT-and meat sell-PFV.CVB III-get-PST.PRT-and every money merchant-PL-ERG widow-GEN2 son-POSS.LAT III-give.back-PST.UNW
\l The merchants gave all the money they got for selling honey and for selling meat to the widow's son.

\t Suƛƛisi oƛixno k’oƛin ɣamasyayn uži oxin maħor ok’ełno, ža iqiranixƛin nesił xizaygon č’ariƛ’ zawruni xediwn k’oƛin.
\m suƛƛi-si oƛix-n k’oƛi-n ɣamas-ay-n uži oxi-n maħor ok’eł-n ža iqir-ani-x-ƛin nesi-ł xizay-gon č’ari-ƛ’ zow-ru-ni xediw-n k’oƛi-n
\g suddenly-ATTR appear-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB box-IN.ABL-TOP boy run.away-PFV.CVB outside escape-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG catch-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind-CNTR wakeness-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF husband-TOP run-PST.UNW
\l Suddenly the boy jumped out of the box, ran outside and escaped; and in order to catch him ran the husband behind him, who was awake.

\t Xediw maħor ok’äłrungon, ɣamasya tełäy maħorno boqno elay boxin bazarganbin bok’ełno.
\m xediw maħor ok’eł-run-gon ɣamas-a teł-ay maħor-n b-oq-n ele-ay b-oxi-n bazargan-bi-n b-ok’eł-n
\g husband outside go.away-IMM.ANT.CVB-CNTR box-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL outside-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL I.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB merchant-PL-TOP I.PL-escape-PST.UNW
\l Right after the husband went outside, the merchants got out of the box and ran away.

\t Yizi xʷasar badiruni užin neła ɣˤanazaz xediwq iqinanu.
\m yizi xʷasar b-odi-ru-ni uži-n neła ɣˤanabi-z xediw-q iqi-n-anu
\g DEM2.IPL rescue III-do-PST.PRT-DEF boy-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-GEN2 husband-POSS.ESS get-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l The boy who rescued them was not caught by the woman's huband.

\t Elay bitor ok’ełnosi, boɣno ziyas ħošin kurno, oqno iduɣor ik’in.
\m ele-ay bitor ok’eł-nosi b-oɣ-n ziya-s ħoši-n kur-n oq-n idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g there-IN.ABL thither escape-ANT.CVB III-take.away-PFV.CVB cow-GEN1 hide-TOP throw-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l When he had escaped from there, he threw the cow's hide away and went home.

\t Eniw yežigon ħayran yoqno, nece baq’ˤu micxirno bayrno uži idur ayzaƛ’.
\m eniw y-eži-gon ħayran y-oq-n nece b-aq’ˤu micxir-n b-ayr-n uži idu-r ay-zaƛ’
\g mother II-more-CNTR be.astonished II-become-PST.UNW so.much III-much money-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB son home-LAT come-CSL.CVB
\l His mother was even more astonished, because her son had brought so much money home.

\t Xizyogon bayn žedu ʕoƛiran esnaza nełaq esirno, ya le q’orolay, debi užitowwa ukayxanu, na yoł žaƛin.
\m xizyogon b-ay-n žedu ʕoƛira-n esyu-bi-a neła-q esir-n ya le q’orolay mi-s uži-tow-a ukad-x-anu na yoł ža-ƛin
\g then I.PL-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL seven.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW well hey widow you-GEN1 son-EMPH-Q see-IPFV.CVB-NEG where be DEM1.SG-QUOT
\l Then came the seven brothers and asked her: "Well, hey widow, we don't see your son, where is he?"

\t Neła eƛin, dey uži eloš neła ɣˤutka teł micxir t’et’erxo ičäsi yołƛin.
\m neła-a eƛi-n di-s uži eloš neła ɣˤutku-a teł micxir t’et’r-x iči-asi yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN1 son over.there DEM1.IISG.OBL room-IN.ESS inside money count-IPFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l She said: "My son is counting money in that room over there."

\t Tełerno bik’in bezunosi, esnazar ža micxiryos šemno bodin t’et’erxo esun.
\m tełer-n b-ik’i-n b-ezu-nosi esyu-bi-r ža micxir-s šem-n b-odi-n t’et’r-x esu-n
\g to.the.inside-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB I.PL-look-ANT.CVB brother-PL-LAT DEM1.SG money-GEN1 pile-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB count-IPFV.CVB find-PST.UNW
\l When they went inside and looked, the brothers found him making piles of money and counting it.

\t Hoboy ħayran boqno ƛexun žedu esnabi, tamaša boqno, nesiq nece baq’ˤu micxirno bukayn yizis tatutown bitin, nay yedu micxir biqäƛin esiriłinč’ey bičiłnoanu yizirabi.
\m hoboy ħayran b-oq-n ƛexu-n žedu esyu-bi tamaša b-oq-n nesi-q nece b-aq’ˤu micxir-n b-ukad-n yizi-s tatu-tow-n b-iti-n nay yedu micxir b-iqi-a-ƛin esir-ł-č’ey b-iči-ł-n-anu yizirabi
\g now be.astonished I.PL-become-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL brother-PL be.surprised I.PL-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS so.much III-much money-TOP III-see-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 cheerfulness-EMPH-TOP III-touch-PFV.CVB from.where DEM2.IISG money III-get-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-POT-NEG.PST.CVB I.PL-be-POT-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM2.PL
\l Now the brothers were astonished, and they were surprised as it shocked them to see so much money, and they couldn't help but ask: "Where did you get that money from?"

\t Užä žeduqor eƛin, neła ziys ħošis režigon reɣet’a t’it’urbi roys yołi, bežigon baq’ˤu łemu där micxir bäqiƛin.
\m uži-a žedu-qor eƛi-n neła ziya-s ħoši-s r-eži-gon r-eɣe-t’a t’it’u-bi r-odi-s yołi b-eži-gon b-aq’ˤu łemu di-r micxir b-iqi-ƛin
\g boy-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL cow-GEN1 hide-GEN1 IV-more-CNTR IV-small-DISTR piece-PL IV.PL-do-PST.WIT if III-more-CNTR III-much then.would me-LAT money III-get-QUOT
\l The boy said to them: "If you had made even smaller pieces, then I would've gotten even more money."

\t Xizyo žedu teƛanix bazaryaɣor bik’in.
\m xizyo žedu teƛ-ani-x bazar-aɣor b-ik’i-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IPL sell-MSD-AD.ESS bazar-IN.VERS I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, they went to the marked to sell them.

\t Yizi didiwtow xalq’i, ziys ħošos reɣet’a t’it’urbi bazarya teƛanix nexxosi, yizä elułäy ʕabdalbitowwa boyxƛin, nasin xalq’in ƛ’iri butin, ʕoƛnon esnabi nocubi caƛix bazaryay boxirno.
\m yizi didiw-tow xalq’i ziya-s ħoši-s r-eɣe-t’a t’it’u-bi bazar-a teƛ-ani-x nex-xosi yizi-a elu-łay ʕabdal-bi-tow-a b-odi-x-ƛin nasin xalq’i-n ƛ’iri b-uti-n ʕoƛno-n esyu-bi nocu-bi caƛi-x bazar-ay b-oxir-n
\g DEM2.IPL which-EMPH people cow-GEN1 hide-GEN1 IV-small-DISTR piece-PL bazar-IN.ESS sell-MSD-AD.ESS come-PRS.PRT DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-CONT.ABL fool-PL-EMPH-Q III-do-PRS-QUOT all people-TOP above III-turn-PFV.CVB seven-TOP brother-PL saliva-PL throw-IPFV.CVB bazar-IN.ABL I.PL-chase-PST.UNW
