\l "What kind of people are they, coming to sell small pieces of cow hide on the market; are they making fools of us?!", all the people insisted and spitting on the seven brothers chased them off the market.

\t Hoboy q’orolaz užä yizi baƛ’ärułi riynosi, ʕoƛiran esnaza q’ut’i bodin ža exuranixƛin.
\m hoboy q’orol-z uži-a yizi b-aƛ’ir-rułi r-iy-nosi ʕoƛira-n esyu-bi-a q’ut’i b-odi-n ža exur-ani-x-ƛin
\g now widow-GEN2 son-ERG DEM2.IPL I.PL-cheat-MSD IV-know-ANT.CVB seven.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG agreement III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG kill-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l Now, after the seven brothers knew that the widow's son had cheated them, they agreed to kill him.

\t Iqiran iqirno yizä ža beže iħuz lilyoxor ižin.
\m iqir-an iqir-n yizi-a ža b-eže iħu-z lilyo-xor iži-n
\g catch-FUT.CVB catch-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG III-big river-GEN2 river.bank-AD.LAT carry-PST.UNW
\l They caught him and brought him to the bank of a large river.

\t Elor aynosi, ža uži qˤaƛanada oqno, were meža di aħinyoqorno icin iħułer kuro, qaciz ruk’uqorno icin karnoƛin.
\m elo-r ay-nosi ža uži qˤaƛanad-a oq-n were mežu-a di aħin-qor-n ici-n iħu-łer kur-o qaci-z ruk’u-qor-n ici-n kur-n-ƛin
\g there-LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG boy yell-INF begin-PFV.CVB well you(I).PL.OBL-ERG me rock-POSS.LAT-TOP tie-PFV.CVB river-CONT.LAT throw-IMPR firewood-GEN2 bundle-POSS.LAT-TOP tie-PFV.CVB throw-PROHIB-QUOT
\l When he arrived there, the boy started to yell: "Well, tie me to a rock and throw me into the river, but don't tie me to a bundle of wood and throw me in!"

\t Hemeł mixƛ’o bˤeƛ’es reqenno adäz boc’no aħo oƛixno.
\m hemeł mix-ƛ’ bˤeƛ’-s reqen-n adäz b-oc’-n aħo oƛix-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL time-SUPER.ESS sheep-GEN1 herd-TOP ahead III-drive-PFV.CVB shepherd appear-PST.UNW
\l At that time, a shepherd appeared who drove a flock of sheep ahead.

\t Aħa igorno ayn esirno, šebi roqäsi šebin yoł, łinax mi zigaryayxƛin.
\m aħo-a igo-r-n ay-n esir-n šebi r-oq-asi šebin yoł łinax mi zigaryad-x-ƛin
\g shepherd-ERG near-LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW what IV-happen-RES.PRT thing be how you complain-PRS-QUOT
\l The shepherd came closer and asked: "What happened? Why are you complaining?"

\t Užä eƛin, dey biƛnon baru yoł, oč’ino äƛirugon baru yaƛin bežet’ani esnaza däƛ’ ɣudi rayrxo.
\m uži-a eƛi-n di-s biƛno-n baru yoł oč’ino äƛiru-gon baru y-a-ƛin b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-a di-ƛ’ ɣudi r-ayr-x
\g boy-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN1 eight-TOP wife be nine ORD-CNTR wife II-marry.IMP-QUOT I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL-ERG me-SUPER.ESS day IV-bring-PRS
\l The boy said: "I have eight wives, and my older brothers are torturing me: 'marry the ninth!'

\t Nełaƛ’ razi oqinč’izaƛ’, tamiħyorƛin žeda howt’o iħuz lilyoxor kuräsiƛin, rok’u rexałxor iłe xabaryayn yeda.
\m neła-ƛ’ razi oq-č’i-zaƛ’ tamiħ-r-ƛin žedu-a howt’o iħu-z lilyo-xor kur-asi-ƛin rok’u r-exu-a-łxor iłe xabaryad-n yeda
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS agree become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB punishment-LAT-QUOT DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG here river-GEN2 river.bank-AD.LAT throw-RES.PRT-QUOT heart IV-die-INF-CONT.VERS as talk-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG
\l Because we couldn't come to an agreement, they throw me here onto the river bank as a punishment.", he talked to evoke sympathy.

\t Aħos nesix rok’un rexun, ža icin zawruni ročyabi reč’-t’it’in roɣno.
\m aħo-s nesi-x rok’u-n r-exu-n ža ici-n zow-ru-ni roč-bi r-eč’~t’it’i-n r-oɣ-n
\g shepherd-GEN1 DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS heart-TOP IV-die-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG tie-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF rope-PL IV.PL-split-PFV.CVB IV.PL-take.away-PST.UNW
\l The shepherd had deep sympathy for him, and cut off the ropes that restrained him.

\t Were hoboy mi, yedu bˤeƛ’es reqenno bižin, t’ay xizor ik’iƛin, nesä nesis šeƛ’un šeƛ’urno uži egirno.
\m were hoboy mi yedu bˤeƛ’-s reqen-n b-iži-n t’ay xizor ik’i-ƛin nesi-a nesi-s šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-r-n uži egir-n
\g well now you DEM2.IISG sheep-GEN1 herd-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB from.here back go-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 put.on-PFV.CVB put.on-CAUS-PFV.CVB boy send-PST.UNW
\l "Well, alright, you, lead my flock of sheep and go away!", he [said and] dressed the boy in his [own] clothings and sent him away.

\t Yisisgon šeƛ’u nesän šeƛ’un, aħon iħuz lilyox ičin.
\m yisi-s-gon šeƛ’u nesi-a-n šeƛ’u-n aħo-n iħu-z lilyo-x iči-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR clothing DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB shepherd-TOP river-GEN2 river.bank-AD.ESS wait-PST.UNW
\l And the shepherd put on his clothings and waited at the river bank.

\t Ciqqay qacan t’it’in, ruk’un rayrno esnabi bayn.
\m ciq-qay qaca-n t’it’i-n ruk’u-n r-ayr-n esyu-bi b-ay-n
\g forest-POSS.ABL firewood-TOP fell-PFV.CVB bundle-TOP IV-bring-PFV.CVB brother-PL I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l From the forest the brothers came, having chopped wood, with the bundle.

\t Neła qaciz ruk’uqorno icin iħułxor kurxosi yałrułin čuqˤno, ža qˤaƛanada oqno, di ža uži anu, di bˤeƛ’xosi aħo yołƛin.
\m neła qaci-z ruk’u-qor-n ici-n iħu-łxor kur-xosi yoł-ru-łi-n čuqˤ-n ža qˤaƛanad-a oq-n di ža uži anu di bˤeƛ’-x-si aħo yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL firewood-GEN2 bundle-POSS.LAT-TOP tie-PFV.CVB river-CONT.VERS throw-PRS.PRT be-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and notice-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG yell-INF begin-PST.UNW me DEM1.SG boy be.NEG me sheep-AD.ESS-ATTR shepherd be-QUOT
\l They tied him to that bundle of wood and when he noticed that they were about to throw him into the river, he started yelling: "I am not the boy, I am a shepherd with a flock of sheep!"

\t Žigoƛ’aygon mi eli baƛ’ärinč’iƛin, esnaza aħo qaciz ruk’uzaqorno icin iħuq egirno.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon mi eli b-aƛ’ir-č’i-ƛin esyu-bi-a aħo qaci-z ruk’u-bi-qor-n ici-n iħu-q egir-n
\g again-SUPER.ABL-CNTR you we I.PL-cheat-NEG.FUT-QUOT brother-PL-ERG shepherd firewood-GEN2 bundle-PL-POSS.LAT-TOP tie-PFV.CVB river-POSS.ESS let-PST.UNW
\l "You're not going to cheat us again!", the brothers [said,] tied the shepherd to the bundles of wood and let him into the river.

\t Elo q’orolay dandir c’oxnosi, nełaq esirno, debi uži ukayxanuwa na ža yołƛin.
\m elo q’orolay dandir c’ox-nosi neła-q esir-n mi-s uži ukad-x-anu-a na ža yoł-ƛin
\g there widow towards meet-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW you-GEN1 son see-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q where DEM1.SG be-QUOT
\l When they met the widow there, they asked her: "We can't see your son, where is he?"

\t Nagon ža äči, bˤeƛ’ez reqenyołäy, miƛ’bin aqonibin hok’xo mecrax yołƛin.
\m na-gon ža iči bˤeƛ’-z reqen-łay miƛ’i-bi-n aqoni-bi-n hok’-x mecra-x yoł-ƛin
\g where-CNTR DEM1.SG be sheep-GEN2 herd-CONT.ABL ram-PL-and one.year.old.lamb-PL-and pull.out-IPFV.CVB enclosure-AD.ESS be-QUOT
\l "Where should he be, he's in the sheep pen seperating the rams and the lambs from the flock of sheep."

\t Nasin esnabi aderzoni žeduz halmaɣzo mecraxor bik’inosi, elo aqonibin, miƛ’bin hok’xo bˤeƛ’ez reqenyoł esun.
\m nasin esyu-bi ader-zo-ni žedu-z halmaɣ-z mecra-xor b-ik’i-nosi elo aqoni-bi-n miƛ’i-bi-n hok’-x bˤeƛ’-z reqen-ł esu-n
\g all brother-PL earlier-ATTR.OBL-DEF DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 friend-GEN2 enclosure-AD.LAT I.PL-go-ANT.CVB there one.year.old.lamb-PL-and ram-PL-and pull.out-IPFV.CVB sheep-GEN2 herd-CONT.ESS find-PST.UNW
\l When all brothers went to their younger friend's enclosure, they found him there among the flock of sheep, seperating the lambs and the rams.

\t ʕOƛnon esnabi haqa bogun ƛexun esirno, nece ixiw yedu deber bˤeƛ’es reqen nay biqäƛin.
\m ʕoƛno-n esyu-bi haqu-a b-ogu-n ƛexu-n esir-n nece ixiw yedu mi-r bˤeƛ’-s reqen nay b-iqi-a-ƛin
\g seven-TOP brother-PL mouth-IN.ESS I.PL-gape-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW so.much big DEM2.IISG you-LAT sheep-GEN1 herd from.where III-get-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The seven brothers remained gaping and asked: "Where did you get this large flock of sheep from?!"

\t Užä žawab teƛno, meža aħinyoqorno icingon di iħułxor kursi yołi, bežigon ixiw reqen där bäqiƛin.
\m uži-a žawab teƛ-n mežu-a aħin-qor-n ici-n-gon di iħu-łxor kur-s yołi b-eži-gon ixiw reqen di-r b-iqi-ƛin
\g boy-ERG answer give-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-ERG rock-POSS.LAT-TOP tie-PFV.CVB-CNTR me river-CONT.VERS throw-PST.WIT if III-more-CNTR big herd me-LAT III-get-QUOT
\l The boy answered: "If you had thrown me into the river tied to a rock, then I would've gotten an even bigger flock."

\t Howži ʕoƛnon esnabi yisiq hardizi boqsiƛax, aħinyoqorno bicin eli iħułxor kuroƛin.
\m howži ʕoƛno-n esyu-bi yisi-q hardizi b-oq-s-ƛax aħin-qor-n b-ici-n eli iħu-łxor kur-o-ƛin
\g now seven-TOP brother-PL DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS request I.PL-become-PST.WIT-QUOT rock-POSS.LAT-TOP I.PL-tie-PFV.CVB we river-CONT.VERS throw-IMPR-QUOT
\l Now it's said that the seven brothers asked him: "Tie us to a rock and throw us into the river!"

\t Ža ħalt’i mežur di buytown badinč’iƛin, uži razi oqnoanu.
\m ža ħalt’i mežu-r di b-uy-tow-n b-odi-č’i-ƛin uži razi oq-n-anu
\g DEM1.SG work you(I).PL.OBL-LAT me III-gratis-EMPH-TOP III-do-NEG.FUT-QUOT boy agree become-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l "That work I won't do for you for free.", the boy disagreed.

\t Esnaza yisir ʕuraw micxir teƛsiƛax, taliħ neƛoƛ deber eli aħinyoqorno bicin iħułxor kuroƛin.
\m esyu-bi-a yisi-r ʕuraw micxir teƛ-s-ƛax taliħ neƛ-ƛ mi-r eli aħin-qor-n b-ici-n iħu-łxor kur-o-ƛin
\g brother-PL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT much money give-PST.WIT-QUOT happiness give-OPT you-LAT we rock-POSS.LAT-TOP I.PL-tie-PFV.CVB river-CONT.VERS throw-IMPR-QUOT
\l It's said that the brothers gave him much money: "May you be given happiness, but tie us to a rock and throw us into the river!"

\t Yisä yizi ʕoƛnon esnabi sist’a aħinyoqorno bicin, iħuz iƛ’aqaɣort’a begirno.
\m yisi-a yizi ʕoƛno-n esyu-bi sist’a aħin-qor-n b-ici-n iħu-z iƛ’u-qaɣor-t’a b-egir-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL seven-TOP brother-PL one.at.a.time rock-POSS.LAT-TOP I.PL-tie-PFV.CVB river-GEN2 bottom-POSS.VERS-DISTR I.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l He tied these seven brothers one at a time to the rock and sent them to the bottom of the river.

\t Hemełƛ’ay soder q’orolaz užis raħataw, paraxataw ʕumru zown, ħalikatawt’ani halmaɣzaqay bat’an oqno.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ay soder q’orol-z uži-s raħataw paraxataw ʕumru zow-n ħalikataw-t’a-ni halmaɣ-bi-qay bat’a-n oq-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after widow-GEN2 son-GEN1 serene quiet life be.NPRS-PFV.CVB mean-DISTR-DEF friend-PL-POSS.ABL seperation-TOP become-PST.UNW
\l After that, the widow's son lead a serene, quiet life, bereft of mean friends.

\t Sidaɣ bičix zownƛax babiwn, užin.
\m sidaɣ b-iči-x zow-n-ƛax babiw-n uži-n
\g in.one.place I.PL-live-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT father-and son-and
\l It's said that in some place there lived a father and his son.

\t Žaq oč’ino ƛˤeb yaynosi, babiwz rok’ƛ’or rayn, ʕarab ʕilmu t’et’ra ižanƛin.
\m uži-q oč’ino ƛˤeb y-ay-nosi babiw-z rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-n ʕarab ʕelmu t’et’r-a iži-an-ƛin
\g son-POSS.ESS nine year II-come-ANT.CVB father-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come-PST.UNW Arabic science learn-INF lead-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l When the son became nine years old, the father had an idea: "I will send him to learn the Arabian science."

\t Sida quł yizi hunix boqno sidaɣ yeže gogaƛ’or baynƛax.
\m sida qu-ł yizi huni-x b-oq-n sidaɣ y-eže goga-ƛ’or b-ay-n-ƛax
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IPL way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PFV.CVB in.one.place II-big meadow-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l One day, they went on their way and came to a big meadow somewhere.

\t Elo yoƛi gogaƛ’ Okuƛin eƛixosi žek’u maħor oƛixno ičin.
\m elo y-oƛi goga-ƛ’ Oku-ƛin eƛi-xosi žek’u maħor oƛix-n iči-n
\g there II-half meadow-SUPER.ESS Oku-QUOT say-PRS.PRT man outside appear-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l There in the middle of the meadow, a man appeared who called himself Oku.

\t Assalamu ʕalaykumƛin salamno teƛno, babiwderno, žaderno dandirno nexno nesä esirno, meža sapar naɣor bicäsi yołƛin.
\m assalamu ʕalaykum-ƛin salam-n teƛ-n babiw-der-n uži-der-n dandir-n nex-n nesi-a esir-n mežu-a sapar na-aɣor b-ici-asi yoł-ƛin
\g peace. ...be.with.you-QUOT greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB father-APUD.LAT-and son-APUD.LAT-and together-TOP come-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-ERG journey where-IN.VERS I.PL-follow-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l "Peace be with you!", he greeted and came with the father and his son and asked: "Where are you heading?"

\t Babiya eƛin, wallah, howda uži ʕarab ʕilmu t’et’ranix ižixƛin.
\m babi-a eƛi-n wallah howda uži ʕarab ʕelmu t’et’r-ani-x iži-x-ƛin
\g dad-ERG say-PST.UNW wallah DEM3.SG son Arabic science learn-MSD-AD.ESS lead-PRS-QUOT
\l The father said: "By God, I am leading my son here to learn the Arabic science."

\t Oka eƛin, däde sadaq egirno xec yeda debi uži, xizyo ƛˤebaq ƛˤeb ħišiłnosi, hobołatow mečoƛ’or horo mi yisił xizayƛin.
\m Oku-a eƛi-n di-de sadaq egir-n xeci yeda mi-s uži xizyo ƛˤeb-q ƛˤeb ħišił-nosi hobo-ła-tow moči-ƛ’or horo mi yisi-ł xizay-ƛin
\g Oku-ERG say-PST.UNW me-APUD.ESS together send-PFV.CVB leave DEM2.ISG you-GEN1 son afterwards year-POSS.ESS year be.over-ANT.CVB this-DUB-EMPH field-SUPER.LAT come.IMPR you DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind-QUOT
\l Oku said: "Send your son together with me, and when the year after next year is over, come to this very field and follow him."

\t Babiya uži Okude sadaq egirno xecin.
\m babi-a uži Oku-de sadaq egir-n xeci-n
\g dad-ERG son Oku-APUD.ESS together send-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW
\l The father sent his son together with Oku.

\t Hemeł mixƛ’o, yoƛi gogan č’ˤaƛiłno, ozuri buqin baɣˤizaƛ’or, Okun, užin wˤałzoni dunyalƛ’aɣor bok’ełno.
\m hemeł mix-ƛ’ y-oƛi goga-n č’ˤaƛił-n ozuri b-uqi-n b-ˤaɣˤi-zaƛ’or Oku-n uži-n wˤał-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’aɣor b-ok’eł-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL time-SUPER.ESS II-half meadow-TOP be.cut-PFV.CVB eye III-close-PFV.CVB III-open-POST.CVB Oku-and son-and downward-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.VERS I.PL-go.away-PST.UNW
\l After that, the middle of the meadow opened, and in the wink of an eye, Oku and his son had gone into the underworld.

\t Wˤałzoni dunyalƛ’or aynosi, užir elo Okus bercinaw kid yesun.
\m wˤał-z-ni dunyal-ƛ’or ay-nosi uži-r elo Oku-s bercinaw kid y-esu-n
\g downward-GEN2-DEF world-SUPER.LAT come-ANT.CVB boy-LAT there Oku-GEN1 beautiful daughter II-find-PST.UNW
\l When he came into the underworld, the boy found Oku's beautiful daughter there.

\t Howži Oka nesiq ʕarab ʕilmu mołix zown.
\m howži Oku-a nesi-q ʕarab ʕelmu mołi-x zow-n
\g now Oku-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS Arabic science teach-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Now Oku was teaching him the Arabic language.

\t Babiw idu anunč’izay, igorno yayn, Okuz kidbä nesiqor eƛin, were mi dicegon yaq’ˤu ʕilmu deber yiqiłin, mi siskin šebin riyxanuƛin iča ay.
\m babiw idu anu-č’i-zay igo-r-n y-ay-n Oku-z kid-a nesi-qor eƛi-n were mi dice-gon y-aq’ˤu ʕelmu mi-r y-iqi-łin mi siskin šebin r-iy-x-anu-ƛin iči-a ay
\g father home be.NEG-NEG.FUT.CVB-SIM.CVB near-LAT-TOP II-come-PFV.CVB Oku-GEN2 daughter-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW well you how.much-CNTR II-much science you-LAT II-get-CNC.CVB you any thing IV-know-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT be-INF must
\l While her father wasn't at home, Oku's daughter came nearer and said to him: "Well, no matter how much science you will get, you must say that you don't know anything!"

\t Šidaƛin, ħayran oqno ƛexun uži.
\m šida-ƛin ħayran oq-n ƛexu-n uži
\g why-QUOT be.astonished become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW boy
\l "Why?", the boy was astonished.

\t Šida yałru debertow räyƛin, kidbä uži ezuranix bitazoni ɣˤutkaɣor ižin.
\m šida yoł-ru mi-r-tow r-iy-ƛin kid-a uži ezur-ani-x bitasi-ni ɣˤutku-aɣor iži-n
\g why be-PST.PRT you-LAT-EMPH IV-know-QUOT girl-ERG boy show-MSD-AD.ESS next-DEF room-IN.VERS lead-PST.UNW
\l "You will know why", the girl [said and] lead the boy into the next room to show him.

\t Reɣet’a ƛuzazas ric’äsi ɣutkutow rukayn elo yisir.
\m r-eɣe-t’a ƛuza-bi-s r-ic’-asi ɣˤutku-tow r-ukad-n elo yisi-r
\g IV-small-DISTR bone-PL-GEN1 IV-fill-RES.PRT room-EMPH IV-see-PFV.CVB there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT
\l There he saw that the room was filled with small bones.

\t Kidbä eƛin, ʕilmu yiyxosi nasin babiya bexurxosi, ele hemedurt’a bexaruzas ƛuzabi yoł yiziƛin.
\m kid-a eƛi-n ʕelmu y-iy-xosi nasin babi-a b-exur-xosi ele hemedur-t’a b-exur-ru-bi-s ƛuza-bi yoł yizi-ƛin
\g girl-ERG say-PST.UNW science II-know-PRS.PRT all dad-ERG I.PL-kill-PRS.PRT here so-DISTR I.PL-kill-PST.PRT-PL-GEN1 bone-PL be DEM2.IPL-QUOT
\l The girl said: "My father kills all who know about science, these here are the bones of the thus killed."

\t Hemełƛ’ay soder uži där siskin šebin riyxanuƛin ičix zown.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ay soder uži di-r siskin šebin r-iy-x-anu-ƛin iči-x zow-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after boy me-LAT any thing IV-know-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After that, the boy was always like: "I don't know anything."

\t Mi didiwtow siskin šebin riyxanusi uži iča ayxƛin, Oku aƛ’in nesiqor.
\m mi didiw-tow siskin šebin r-iy-xanusi uži iči-a ay-x-ƛin Oku aƛ’i-n nesi-qor
\g you which-EMPH any thing IV-know-NEG.PRS.PRT boy be-INF must-PRS-QUOT Oku talk-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l "What kind of boy must you be, who doesn't know anything.", spoke Oku.

\t Huday ƛˤeba waħazoni dunyalƛ’azay hemełatow gogaƛ’or užin ižin Oku ik’inosi, elo yiziqor ezun ičäsi žas babiw esun.
\m huday ƛˤeb-a waħo-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’azay hemeła-tow goga-ƛ’or uži-n iži-n Oku ik’i-nosi elo yizi-qor ezu-n iči-asi uži-s babiw esu-n
\g next year-IN.ESS below-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.ABL.DIST DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH meadow-SUPER.LAT boy-TOP lead-PFV.CVB Oku go-ANT.CVB there DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT look-PFV.CVB wait-RES.PRT boy-GEN1 father find-PST.UNW
\l In the following year, when Oku went with the boy from the world below onto the same meadow, they found the boy's father there who was waiting and looking for them.

\t Debez yisi ʕantawni užä mołin ʕilmu yisinč’u, debi mi uži xizor ižoƛinno eƛin, Oku ozƛäyn gugin hoq’ˤoni dunyalƛ’aɣor ik’in.
\m mi-z yisi ʕantaw-ni uži-a mołi-n ʕelmu y-is-č’u mi-s mi uži xizor iži-o-ƛin-n eƛi-n Oku ozuri-ƛay-n gugi-n hoq’ˤo-ni dunyal-ƛ’aɣor ik’i-n
\g you-GEN2 DEM2.ISG.OBL stupid-DEF son-ERG teach-PFV.CVB science II-take-NEG.PST.WIT you-GEN1 you son back lead-IMPR-QUOT-TOP say-PFV.CVB Oku eye-SUB.ABL-TOP escape-PFV.CVB other-DEF world-SUPER.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l "This stupid son of yours didn't get anything of the science I tought him, take your son back!", said Oku, escaped from the eyes and went into the other world.

\t Hudu t’ok’ow šebi rodanƛin, užin ižin babiw iduɣor ik’ix zown.
\m hudu t’ok’ow šebi r-odi-an-ƛin uži-n iži-n babiw idu-ɣor ik’i-x zow-n
\g so more what IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT boy-TOP lead-PFV.CVB father home-IN.ALL go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "So what more shall I do?", the father [said and] lead the boy home.

\t Xizyo babiwn oqno ža biqiranixƛin.
\m xizyo babiw-n oq-n ža b-iqir-ani-x-ƛin
\g afterwards father-TOP begin-PST.UNW DEM1.SG III-catch-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l Then the father began [trying] to catch him.

\t Užä eƛin, baba, elur caxinč’iru šebin riqa zaħmataw ričixosi yoł.
\m uži-a eƛi-n baba elu-r cax-č’i-ru šebin r-iqi-a zaħmataw r-iči-xosi yoł
\g boy-ERG say-PST.UNW daddy we(I).OBL-LAT write-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT thing IV-get-INF difficult IV-be-PRS.PRT be
\l The boy said: "Father, it is difficult to get a thing that is not destined for us."

\t K’ox äƛirugon užiłäy mesedyos šilabi yołäsi miƛ’i boqno.
\m k’ox äƛiru-gon uži-łay mesed-s šilu-bi yoł-asi miƛ’i b-oq-n
\g twice ORD-CNTR boy-CONT.ABL gold-GEN1 horn-PL be-RES.PRT ram III-become-PST.UNW
\l For the second time, the boy became a ram with golden horns.

\t Babiwq žan biqira k’ʷeze boqnoanu.
\m babiw-q ža-n b-iqir-a k’ʷeze b-oq-n-anu
\g father-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG-TOP III-catch-INF can III-become-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l The father couldn't catch him either.

\t Xizyo xizaza uži aynosi, babiw hemedurtow žaqor aƛ’in.
\m xizyo xizaz-a uži ay-nosi babiw hemedur-tow uži-qor aƛ’i-n
\g afterwards from.behind-IN.ESS boy come-ANT.CVB father so-EMPH son-POSS.LAT talk-PST.UNW
\l Then, when the boy came from behind, the father said the same to his son.

\t Užä wˤałerno utin eƛin, baba, deber caxinč’iru šebin riqa zaħmataw ričixosi yoł.
\m uži-a wˤał-r-n uti-n eƛi-n baba mi-r cax-č’i-ru šebin r-iqi-a zaħmataw r-iči-xosi yoł
\g son-ERG downward-LAT-TOP turn-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW daddy you-LAT write-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT thing IV-get-INF difficult IV-be-PRS.PRT be
\l The son bowed downward and said: "Father, it is difficult to get a thing that is not destined for us."

\t Igza ħalał žan akik’no, gulu biqa bičin.
\m ig-za ħal-ł ža-n akik’-n gulu b-iqi-a b-iči-n
\g well-ZA condition-CONT.ESS DEM1.SG-TOP tire-PFV.CVB horse III-get-INF III-remain-PST.UNW
\l The horse tired him well, and then let him catch itself.

\t Howži ʕuraw mixƛ’or ezun ičin babiw uži ayxanaƛin.
\m howži ʕuraw mix-ƛ’or ezu-n iči-n babiw uži ay-x-anu-a-ƛin
\g now much time-SUPER.LAT look-PFV.CVB be-PFV.CVB father son come-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q-QUOT
\l Now, after much time, the father was looking why his son didn't came.

\t Xizaɣor ža ayaniqaysi rok’un roč’iłno, guluƛ’no zown iduɣor ik’in.
\m xizaɣor ža ay-ani-qay-si rok’u-n roč’i-ł-n gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g finally DEM1.SG come-MSD-POSS.ABL-ATTR heart-TOP frost-CONT.ESS-TOP horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l Finally he lost hope that he would come, and rode home on the horse.

\t Rečuƛ gulun bicin, žaqor ezun ičin, ayxana yeda žigonƛin.
\m reču-ƛ gulu-n b-ici-n uži-qor ezu-n iči-n ay-x-anu-a yeda žigon-ƛin
\g cattleshed-SUB.ESS horse-TOP III-tie-PFV.CVB son-POSS.LAT look-PFV.CVB wait-PFV.CVB come-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q DEM2.ISG again.now-QUOT
\l He tied the horse to the cattleshed and waited for his son: "Why isn't he coming again now?"

\t Xizyo neła gulułäy yałru užin oqno, babiwdäɣor ik’in.
\m xizyo neła gulu-łay yoł-ru uži-n oq-n babiw-däɣor ik’i-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL horse-CONT.ABL be-PST.PRT boy-TOP become-PFV.CVB father-APUD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, that horse became the boy that it used to be again and went to his father.

\t Užä eƛin, ƛa boqzaƛ’ beza bik’an nełaƛ’ƛin.
\m uži-a eƛi-n ƛa b-oq-zaƛ’ b-ezu-a b-ik’i-an neła-ƛ’-ƛin
\g boy-ERG say-PST.UNW go.IMPR III-become-CSL.CVB I.PL-look-INF I.PL-go-FUT.DEF DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-QUOT
\l The boy said: "Let's go, if it is, we'll look at it!"

\t Howži mix bik’äsi zaman yoł, sasaq bukaran ža debeq diƛin, babiya eƛin.
\m howži mix b-ik’i-asi zaman yoł sasaq b-ukar-an ža mi-q di-ƛin babi-a eƛi-n
\g now time III-go-RES.PRT time be tomorrow III-show-FUT.DEF DEM1.SG you-POSS.ESS me-QUOT dad-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "Now it's late, tomorrow I will show it to you.", said the father.

\t Sasaqosi babiya uži rečuƛer ižin, ƛa guluƛ’ beza bik’ixƛin.
\m sasaqosi babi-a uži reču-ƛer iži-n ƛa gulu-ƛ’ b-ezu-a b-ik’i-x-ƛin
\g in.the.morning dad-ERG son cattleshed-SUB.LAT lead-PST.UNW go.IMPR horse-SUPER.ESS I.PL-look-INF I.PL-go-PRS-QUOT
\l In the morning, the father lead the son to the cattleshed: "Let's go, we go to look at the horse!"

\t Rečuƛer yizi bik’inosi, anuƛax elo gulu.
\m reču-ƛer yizi b-ik’i-nosi anu-ƛax elo gulu
\g cattleshed-SUB.LAT DEM2.IPL I.PL-go-ANT.CVB be.NEG-QUOT there horse
\l When they went to the shed, the horse wasn't there.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo žoyä babiwq esin, ža miƛ’in di zows, gulun di zows, hemediw hunar yoł däz lagiłƛin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo uži-a babiw-q esi-n ža miƛ’i-n di zow-s gulu-n di zow-s hemediw hunar yoł di-z laga-ł-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after boy-ERG father-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW DEM1.SG ram-TOP me be.NPRS-PST.WIT horse-TOP me be.NPRS-PST.WIT such.a talent be me-GEN2 body-CONT.ESS-QUOT
\l After that, the boy told his father: "That ram was me; and the horse was me; such a talent is in my body."

\t Mi ža bazaryaɣorno bižin łera ʕazara ɣˤurušyoƛ teƛ, moƛ’oqˤoy yołi łeno bišom ɣˤuruš neƛłikin täƛno, dey ruħ nełał bičixosi yoł, nagaħ mi ža teƛnäy, di exuxosi yołƛin.
\m mi ža bazar-aɣor-n b-iži-n łera ʕazar ɣˤuruš-ƛ teƛ moƛ’oqˤoy yołi łeno bišom ɣˤuruš neƛ-łi-kin teƛ-n di-s ruħ neła-ł b-iči-xosi yoł nagaħ mi ža teƛ-näy di exu-xosi yoł-ƛin
\g you DEM1.SG bazar-IN.VERS-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB five.OBL thousand ruble-SUB.ESS sell bridle however five hundred ruble give-CND.CVB.IRR-even sell-PROHIB me-GEN1 soul DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS III-be-PRS.PRT be suppose you DEM1.SG sell-CND.CVB me die-PRS.PRT be-QUOT
\l Lead it to the market and sell it for 5,000 rubles, the bridle however don't sell even if you were given 500 rubles, my soul will be inside; if you sell it, I will die."

\t Hemeła quł Okur čuqˤno, yisi užä nesiqay ʕilmu yiqärułi.
\m hemeła qu-ł Oku-r čuqˤ-n yisi uži-a nesi-qay ʕelmu y-iqir-ru-łi
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS Oku-LAT notice-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL science II-take.away-PST.PRT-CND.CVB.IRR
\l That day, Oku noticed that the boy took away the science from him.

\t Žas babiw gulun bižin bazaryaɣor äk’irun, Okä ayn esirno nesiq, yedu gulu teƛxosi ana, šebi yiłas bahaƛin.
\m uži-s babiw gulu-n b-iži-n bazar-aɣor ik’i-run Oku-a ay-n esir-n nesi-q yedu gulu teƛ-xosi anu-a šebi yiła-s baha-ƛin
\g boy-GEN1 father horse-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB bazar-IN.VERS go-IMM.ANT.CVB Oku-ERG come-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM2.IISG horse sell-PRS.PRT be.NEG-Q what DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 price-QUOT
\l Just as the boy's father had lead the horse to the market, Oku came and asked him: "Won't you sell this horse, what is its price?"

\t Babiya eƛin, moƛ’oqˤoy anusi gulus baha łeno ʕazar ɣuruš yołƛin.
\m babi-a eƛi-n moƛ’oqˤoy anu-si gulu-s baha łeno ʕazar ɣˤuruš yoł-ƛin
\g dad-ERG say-PST.UNW bridle be.NEG-ATTR horse-GEN1 price five thousand ruble be-QUOT
\l The father said: "The price of the horse without the bridle is 5,000 rubles."

\t Waħƛin, eƛin Okä, moƛ’oqˤoy sadaq anusi gulu teƛxosi moči žäd där bukadäsi zownč’u, moƛ’oqˤoyn neƛa rayƛin.
\m waħ-ƛin eƛi-n Oku-a moƛ’oqˤoy sadaq anu-si gulu teƛ-xosi moči žäd di-r b-ukad-asi zow-č’u moƛ’oqˤoy-n neƛ-a r-ay-ƛin
\g whoa-QUOT say-PST.UNW Oku-ERG bridle together be.NEG-ATTR horse sell-PRS.PRT place still me-LAT III-see-RES.PRT be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT bridle-TOP sell-INF IV-must-QUOT
\l "Whoa!", said Oku, "I haven't seen a place yet that sold a horse without the bridle; you must sell the bridle too!"

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, eƛin babiya, moƛ’oqˤoys baha łeno bišom ɣˤuruš yołƛin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin eƛi-n babi-a moƛ’oqˤoy-s baha łeno bišom ɣˤuruš yoł-ƛin
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW dad-ERG bridle-GEN1 price five hundred ruble be-QUOT
\l "If that's the case," said the father, "the bridle's price is 500 rubles."

\t Hemedur Okä babiw mak’ur odin guludetow sadaq moƛ’oqˤoyn łera ʕazara łera bišomra ɣˤurušyoƛ teƛanix, dicegon užä moƛ’oqˤoy täƛnoƛin eƛinłin.
\m hemedur Oku-a babiw mak’ur odi-n gulu-de-tow sadaq moƛ’oqˤoy-n łera ʕazar łera bišom ɣˤuruš-ƛ teƛ-ani-x dice-gon uži-a moƛ’oqˤoy teƛ-n-ƛin eƛi-n-łin
\g so Oku-ERG father persuade do-PFV.CVB horse-APUD.ESS-EMPH together bridle-TOP five.OBL thousand five.OBL hundred ruble-SUB.ESS sell-MSD-AD.ESS how.much-CNTR boy-ERG bridle sell-PROHIB-QUOT say-PST.UNW-CNC.CVB
\l So Oku persuaded the father to sell him the horse together with the bridle for 5,500 rubles, no matter how much the boy told him not to sell the bridle.

\t Neła guluƛ’no zown, waħazoni dunyalƛ’o idur aynosi, Okä kidbeqor maħlazaytow qˤaƛin, xexłiƛ’ bˤałay maħor roƛik’ gulu bexada retinƛin.
\m neła gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n waħo-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’ idu-r ay-nosi Oku-a kid-qor maħla-azay-tow qˤaƛi-n xexłi-ƛ’ bˤałay maħor r-oƛik’ gulu b-exʷad-a r-eti-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB below-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.ESS home-LAT come-ANT.CVB Oku-ERG daughter-POSS.LAT court-IN.ABL.DIST-EMPH shout-PST.UNW quickness-SUPER.ESS dagger outside IV-pull.out horse III-slaughter-INF IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l He rode home on that horse and when he came home into the underworld, Oku shouted to his daughter from the court: "Quick, get the dagger outside, I wanted to slaughter a horse!"

\t Kidber riyn nełaz babiwł adäza t’et’erxo zawruni užiłäy gulu baqrułi.
\m kid-r r-iy-n neła-z babiw-ł adäza t’et’r-x zow-ru-ni uži-łay gulu b-oq-rułi
\g daughter-LAT IV-know-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 father-CONT.ESS before learn-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF boy-CONT.ABL horse III-become-MSD
\l His daughter knew that the horse used to be the boy, who learned in front of her father.

\t Q’ˤunader recurno c’idaɣor žan kurno, där bˤäłay resuxanuƛin neła babiwqor qˤaƛin.
\m q’ˤuna-der r-ecur-n c’i-daɣor ža-n kur-n di-r bˤałay r-esu-x-anu-ƛin neła-a babiw-qor qˤaƛi-n
\g two.OBL-APUD.LAT IV-break-PFV.CVB fire-APUD.VERS DEM1.SG-TOP throw-PFV.CVB me-LAT dagger IV-find-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG father-POSS.LAT shout-PST.UNW
\l She broke it into two, threw it into the fire and shouted to her father: "I don't find the dagger!"

\t Babiya qˤaƛin, bˤałay ditow k’edan, enda gulu biqira horo miƛin.
\m babi-a qˤaƛi-n bˤałay di-tow k’edi-an enda gulu b-iqir-a horo mi-ƛin
\g dad-ERG shout-PST.UNW dagger me-EMPH search-FUT.DEF DEM3b.SG horse III-catch-INF come.IMPR you-QUOT
\l The father shouted: "I'll search the dagger, you come here to hold the horse!"

\t Tełxor yeda äk’iruntow, gulu begirnon xecin kidbä, xizyo qˤaƛin babiwqor, gulu boxin bik’isƛin.
\m teł-xor yeda ik’i-run-tow gulu b-egir-nan xeci-n kid-a xizyo qˤaƛi-n babiw-qor gulu b-oxi-n b-ik’i-s-ƛin
\g inside-AD.LAT DEM2.ISG go-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH horse III-let-INT leave-PFV.CVB girl-ERG afterwards shout-PST.UNW father-POSS.LAT horse III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Right after he went inside, the girl let the horse go and then shouted to her father: "The horse has run away!"

\t Maħor k’aƛirun, yisir bukayn gulu t’umiƛ’orno butin boržizi boqno hawaƛ’ boxix.
\m maħor k’oƛi-run yisi-r b-ukad-n gulu t’umi-ƛ’or-n b-uti-n boržizi b-oq-n hawa-ƛ’ b-oxi-x
\g outside run-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT III-see-PFV.CVB horse pigeon-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-turn-PFV.CVB fly III-become-PFV.CVB air-SUPER.ESS III-run.away-IPFV.CVB
\l As soon as he ran outside, he saw the horse had turned into a pigeon and was flying away in the air.

\t Kurzak’uƛ’orgon Okun utin, nełał xizay k’oƛin.
\m kurzak’u-ƛ’or-gon Oku-n uti-n neła-ł xizay k’oƛi-n
\g falcon-SUPER.LAT-CNTR Oku-TOP turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS from.behind run-PST.UNW
\l And Oku turned into a falcon and followed it.

\t Q’ˤimzo ʕaƛar ža t’umi baynosi, akä q’ˤida yäčiru sida kidbez koyä heqno.
\m q’ˤim-z ʕaƛ-ar ža t’umi b-ay-nosi aki-a q’ˤida y-iči-ru sida kid-z kʷay-a heq-n
\g oneself-GEN2 village-IN.LAT DEM1.SG pigeon III-come-ANT.CVB window-IN.ESS under II-sit-PST.PRT one.OBL girl-GEN2 hand-IN.ESS sit.down-PST.UNW
\l When the pigeon had come to its own village, it sat down in the hand of a girl who was sitting under a window.

\t ʕOloqan užiƛ’orgon utin ƛ’irir Okun ayn.
\m ʕoloqan uži-ƛ’or-gon uti-n ƛ’iri-r Oku-n ay-n
\g young boy-SUPER.LAT-CNTR turn-PFV.CVB above-LAT Oku-TOP come-PST.UNW
\l Oku turned into a young boy and came upstairs.

\t Nesä kidbeqor eƛin, yedu t’umi dey yoł, xizor dey däqor neƛƛin.
\m nesi-a kid-qor eƛi-n yedu t’umi di-s yoł xizor di-s di-qor neƛ-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG girl-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG pigeon me-GEN1 be back me-GEN1 me-POSS.LAT give-QUOT
\l He said to the girl: "That pigeon is mine; give it back to me!"

\t Kidbä eƛin, nay yedu debi biča bayx, däz koyä heqäsi bukayxa.
\m kid-a eƛi-n nay yedu mi-s b-iči-a b-ay-x di-z kʷay-a heq-asi b-ukad-x-a
\g girl-ERG say-PST.UNW from.where DEM2.IISG you-GEN1 III-be-INF III-must-IPFV.CVB me-GEN2 hand-IN.ESS sit.down-RES.PRT III-see-IPFV.CVB-Q
\l The girl said: "From where must it be yours, it is sitting on my hand."

\t Xizyo t’umi maqiz muhuzaƛ’or butin, onočaƛ’orgon Okun utin.
\m xizyo t’umi maqi-z muhu-bi-ƛ’or b-uti-n onoču-ƛ’or-gon Oku-n uti-n
\g afterwards pigeon barley-GEN2 granule-PL-SUPER.LAT III-turn-PFV.CVB hen-SUPER.LAT-CNTR Oku-TOP turn-PST.UNW
\l Then, the pigeon turned into barley grains and Oku turned into a hen.

\t ƛ’iri bičin onoča muhubin rut’in, siskin t’ok’ow muhu xecinč’uƛin rok’u č’odinosi, onoču akäza maħorno k’oƛin boržizin boqno bik’in.
\m ƛ’iri b-iči-n onoču-a muhu-bi-n r-ut’i-n siskin t’ok’ow muhu xeci-č’u-ƛin rok’u č’odi-nosi onoču aki-aza maħor-n k’oƛi-n boržizi-n b-oq-n b-ik’i-n
\g above III-be-PFV.CVB hen-ERG granule-PL-TOP III.PL-collect-PFV.CVB any anymore granule leave-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT heart get.tight-ANT.CVB hen window-IN.VERS.DIST outside-TOP jump-PFV.CVB fly-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.UNW
\l The hen tried hard and pecked up all grains, and after making sure that it didn't left out any grain, the hen jumped out of the window and flew away.

\t Kidbez gedmoq łeɣin ƛexun zawruni sistow sis muhu užiƛ’or butin.
\m kid-z ged-q łeɣi-n ƛexu-n zow-ru-ni sis-tow sis muhu uži-ƛ’or b-uti-n
\g girl-GEN2 shirt-POSS.ESS grasp-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF one-EMPH one granule boy-SUPER.LAT III-turn-PST.UNW
\l One single grain that remained hanging on the girl's shirt, turned into the boy.

\t Užin, kidnogon sida sidƛ’or bezun ƛexun, žedur žedu betin.
\m uži-n kid-n-gon sida sida-ƛ’or b-ezu-n ƛexu-n žedu-r žedu b-eti-n
\g boy-and girl-and-CNTR one.OBL one.OBL-SUPER.LAT I.PL-look-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT DEM1.IPL III-love-PST.UNW
\l The boy and the girl were looking at each other and fell in love.

\t Žan sadaq yižin uži babiwz ʕaƛaɣor ik’in.
\m ža-n sadaq y-iži-n uži babiw-z ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP together II-lead-PFV.CVB boy father-GEN2 village-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l The boy took her together to his father's village.

\t Ozzałäy č’uran risno esun yisir babiw.
\m ozuri-bi-łay č’ura-n r-is-n esu-n yisi-r babiw
\g eye-PL-CONT.ABL light-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB find-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT father
\l He found the father having gone blind.

\t Šebi deber roqäƛin, yisä esirnosi, nesä esin, ʕažaibaw maxšel, hunar yołäsi uži zows dey.
\m šebi mi-r r-oq-a-ƛin yisi-a esir-nosi nesi-a esi-n ʕažaibaw maxšel hunar yoł-asi uži zow-s di-s
\g what you-LAT IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG tell-PST.UNW amazing skill talent be-RES.PRT son be.NPRS-PST.WIT me-GEN1
\l "What happened to you?", he [the son] asked, and he [the father] said: "I had a talented son with amazing skills.

\t Sida quł ža guluƛ’orno utin, ža di bazaryarno bižin teƛsi.
\m sida qu-ł ža gulu-ƛ’or-n uti-n ža di bazar-ar-n b-iži-n teƛ-s
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.SG horse-SUPER.LAT-TOP turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG me bazar-IN.LAT-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB sell-PST.WIT
\l One day he turned into a horse, and I led him to the market and sold him.

\t Užä eƛäsi zows moƛ’oqˤoy sadaq täƛnoƛin.
\m uži-a eƛi-asi zow-s moƛ’oqˤoy sadaq teƛ-n-ƛin
\g son-ERG say-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT bridle together sell-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l My son said: 'Don't sell the bridle [together [{with me}]!'

\t Sis žek’un ayn howlor hemecetow ƛ’iri utizaƛ’, moƛ’oqˤoyn sadaq däq teƛno rok’ełsi.
\m sis žek’u-n ay-n howlo-r hemece-tow ƛ’iri uti-zaƛ’ moƛ’oqˤoy-n sadaq di-q teƛ-n r-ok’eł-s
\g one man-TOP come-PFV.CVB there-LAT such-EMPH above turn-CSL.CVB bridle-TOP together me-POSS.ESS sell-PFV.CVB IV-lose-PST.WIT
\l And there came a man and because he insisted so much, I sold also the bridle and lost it.

\t Hemełƛ’ay soder dey užin na eƛakin iynč’u.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ay soder di-s uži-n na eƛi-a-kin iy-č’u
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after me-GEN1 son-TOP where say-INF-even know-NEG.PST.WIT
\l I don't even know where my son went to, after that.

\t Nesił xizay ʕiyayn, däzno ozzałäy kanłi bissi, uyn ečriłsiƛin, babiya zigara boɣno.
\m nesi-ł xizay ʕiyad-n di-z-n ozuri-bi-łay kanłi b-is-s uy-n ečrił-s-ƛin babi-a zigara b-oɣ-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind cry-PFV.CVB me-GEN2-TOP eye-PL-CONT.ABL light III-take-PST.WIT indeed-TOP get.old-PST.WIT-QUOT dad-ERG complaint III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l I bemoaned his loss, and lost my eyesight; I indeed got old.", complained the father.

\t Hi enda ħiƛ’oqu debez mi ozurazaq riħoƛin, žoyä babiwqor teƛno.
\m hi enda ħiƛ’oqu mi-z mi ozuri-bi-q r-iħi-o-ƛin uži-a babiw-qor teƛ-n
\g take.IMP DEM3b.SG handkerchief you-GEN2 you eye-PL-POSS.ESS IV-smear-IMPR-QUOT boy-ERG father-POSS.LAT give-PST.UNW
\l "Take this handkerchief and rub it on your eyes.", the boy gave it to his father.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo babiwz ozzałer č’uran rayn, ža nesis uži yałrułin iyn.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo babiw-z ozuri-bi-łer č’ura-n r-ay-n ža nesi-s uži yoł-ru-łi-n iy-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after father-GEN2 eye-PL-CONT.LAT light-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 son be-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and know-PST.UNW
\l After that, the father's eyesight came back and he knew it was his son.

\t Howžin yołƛax žedu łinasnokin ħažałi anusi, paraxat babiwde sadaq ʕumru boyx.
\m howži-n yoł-ƛax žedu łina-s-n-kin ħažałi anu-si paraxat babiw-de sadaq ʕumru b-odi-x
\g now-TOP be-QUOT DEM1.IPL what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-even need be.NEG-ATTR calm father-APUD.ESS together life I.PL-do-PRS
\l It is said they're still alive now and are living together with the father a calm life without a need for anything.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Zownƛax sida ʕaƛa bičix babiwn, nesisgon łˤono užin.
\m zow-n-ƛax sida ʕaƛ-a b-iči-x babiw-n nesi-s-gon łˤono uži-n
\g be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT one.OBL village-IN.ESS I.PL-live-IPFV.CVB father-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR three son-and
\l Once upon a time there lived a father and his three sons in a village.

\t Exa adäza babiya užizaqor wasi bodin, were, dey xexbi, di exunosi, šibaw ruzman ɣudƛ’o däz šudaƛ’orno nexno meža q’ulhut’a t’et’roƛin.
\m exu-a adäza babi-a uži-bi-qor wasi b-odi-n were di-s xexbi di exu-nosi šibaw ruzman ɣudi-ƛ’ di-z šuda-ƛ’or-n nex-n mežu-a q’ulhu-t’a t’et’r-o-ƛin
\g die-INF before dad-ERG son-PL-POSS.LAT testament III-do-PST.UNW well me-GEN1 children me die-ANT.CVB every Friday day-SUPER.ESS me-GEN2 graveyard-SUPER.LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-ERG funeral.prayer-DISTR read-IMPR-QUOT
\l Before he died, the father did his testament: "Well, my children, after I have died, come to my grave every Friday and read a funeral prayer each time."

\t Nełƛ’osi baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow žedus babiw exun.
\m nełƛ’osi b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow žedu-s babiw exu-n
\g of.that.time III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 father die-PST.UNW
\l Before much time had passed after that, their father died.

\t Bežet’ani esnabi babiwz šudaƛ’or baħnaynanuƛax.
\m b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi babiw-z šuda-ƛ’or b-aħnad-n-anu-ƛax
\g I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL father-GEN2 graveyard-SUPER.LAT I.PL-walk.around-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l The older brothers, so it's said, did not walk to their father's grave.

\t Eɣeni esiw yołi, šibaw ruzman ɣudƛ’ot’a babiwz šudaƛ’or ik’ix zown.
\m eɣe-ni esiw yołi šibaw ruzman ɣudi-ƛ’-t’a babiw-z šuda-ƛ’or ik’i-x zow-n
\g young-DEF brother however every Friday day-SUPER.ESS-DISTR father-GEN2 graveyard-SUPER.LAT go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The younger brother, however, went to his fathers grave every Friday.

\t Sida quł yisir šudaƛ’or gulun bayäsi besun, ža elay xizor boxira oqno.
\m sida qu-ł yisi-r šuda-ƛ’or gulu-n b-ay-asi b-esu-n ža ele-ay xizor b-oxir-a oq-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT graveyard-SUPER.LAT horse-TOP III-come-RES.PRT III-find-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG there-IN.ABL back III-chase-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l One day he found a horse that had come onto the grave, and he began to chase it away.

\t Insanzo mecrexorno xabaryayn neła eƛin, mi di t’äy boxärno, däz maħiłäy łˤono musno bet’urno iduɣor ik’i, debeƛ’ ɣudi rayza quł žedu rik’urnosi, debez ħalarno nexno boqxosi kumak bodanƛin.
\m insan-z mec-xor-n xabaryad-n neła-a eƛi-n mi di t’ay b-oxir-n di-z maħi-łay łˤono mus-n b-et’ur-n idu-ɣor ik’i mi-ƛ’ ɣudi r-ay-za qu-ł žedu r-ik’u-r-nosi mi-z ħal-ar-n nex-n b-oq-xosi kumak b-odi-an-ƛin
\g human-GEN2 language-AD.LAT-TOP talk-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW you me from.here III-chase-PROHIB me-GEN2 tail-CONT.ABL three hair-TOP III-pull.out-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go you-SUPER.ESS day IV-come-LCV day-CONT.ESS DEM1.IIPL III.PL-burn-CAUS-ANT.CVB you-GEN2 strength-IN.LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB III-begin-PRS.PRT help III-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l It talked in human language and said: "Don't chase me away from here; pull out three hairs from my tail and go home; on a day that you are in trouble, after you burned them, I  will help you to regain your strength."

\t Gulun howlo xecin, nełaz maħiłäy baɣruni łˤono musno butirno k’ukya tełxor eqerno, babiwz šudaƛ’ q’ulhun begirno, uži iduɣor ik’in.
\m gulu-n howlo xeci-n neła-z maħi-łay b-oɣ-ru-ni łˤono mus-n b-utir-n k’uk-a teł-xor eqer-n babiw-z šuda-ƛ’ q’ulhu-n b-egir-n uži idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g horse-TOP there leave-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 tail-CONT.ABL III-take.away-PST.PRT-DEF three hair-TOP III-gather-PFV.CVB cap-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT put-PFV.CVB father-GEN2 graveyard-SUPER.ESS funeral.prayer-TOP III-send-PFV.CVB boy home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l The horse left and the boy gathered the three hairs he took out of its tail and put them inside his cap, then he spoke the funeral prayer on his father's grave and went home.

\t Hemeła zamanał ʕaƛa xabar boƛixno, qalamez ƛ’ˤuƛ’or gulun bizirno, elay kid yok’ek’a k’ʷeze yaqru žek’ux xanä ža yegirxoƛin.
\m hemeła zaman-ł ʕaƛ-a xabar b-oƛix-n qala-z ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or gulu-n b-izir-n ele-ay kid y-ok’ek’-a k’ʷeze y-oq-ru žek’u-x xan-a ža y-egir-x-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL time-CONT.ESS village-IN.ESS story III-appear-PST.UNW fortress-GEN2 roof-SUPER.LAT horse-TOP III-lift-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL daughter II-remove-INF can II-become-PST.PRT man-AD.ESS khan-ERG DEM1.SG II-send-PRS-QUOT
\l At some time, a rumor appeared in the village: The king would marry off his daughter to the man who is able to lift a horse onto the roof of his fortress and to steal his daughter from there.

\t Nesis łˤono kid zown.
\m nesi-s łˤono kid zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 three daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had three daughters.

\t Žedaƛ’or ʕišq’un erno yisis bežet’ani esnabi žeda žeduz ʕomoyzaƛ’no zown ɣudes elor baħnayx zown.
\m žeda-ƛ’or ʕišq’u-n er-n yisi-s b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi žedu-a žedu-z ʕomoy-bi-ƛ’-n zow-n ɣudes elo-r b-aħnad-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUPER.LAT love-TOP put-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 donkey-PL-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB daily there-LAT I.PL-walk.around-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His older brothers fell in love with them and rode to there every day on their donkeys.

\t Gulukin bizanix zaħmataw qalamzo ƛ’ˤuƛ’or, ʕomoybigon nay žeduq elo ƛ’irir rizix.
\m gulu-kin b-izi-ani-x zaħmataw qala-z ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or ʕomoy-bi-gon nay žedu-q elo ƛ’iri-r r-izi-x
\g horse-even III-get.up-MSD-AD.ESS difficult fortress-GEN2 roof-SUPER.LAT donkey-PL-CNTR from.there DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS there above-LAT III.PL-get.up-PRS
\l But it's difficult for a horse to get up the fortress' roof, but the donkeys they could get on it.

\t Eɣeni esiya, när meži bik’äsi zowäƛin žeduq esirłin, žeda esix zownanu, ža debi iš anu, ħažat anuru šebin eluq esärnoƛin.
\m eɣe-ni esyu-a na-ar meži b-ik’i-asi zow-a-ƛin žedu-q esir-łin žedu-a esi-x zow-n-anu ža mi-s iš anu ħažat anu-ru šebin elu-q esir-n-ƛin
\g young-DEF brother-ERG where-IN.LAT you.PL I.PL-go-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-CNC.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG tell-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.SG you-GEN1 concern be.NEG necessity be.NEG-PST.PRT thing we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PROHIB-QUOT
\l Although the younger brother asked them: "Where are you going?", they didn't tell him [but said]: "It's not your business, don't ask us unnecessary things!"

\t Xizaɣor eɣeni esiwr riyn, esnabi bik’ixosi moči.
\m xizaɣor eɣe-ni esiw-r r-iy-n esyu-bi b-ik’i-xosi moči
\g finally young-DEF brother-LAT IV-know-PST.UNW brother-PL I.PL-go-PRS.PRT place
\l In the end the younger brother knew the place his brothers were going to.

\t Yisiz rok’ƛ’or rayn, k’ukya teł ruqˤno xecin zawruni gulus musrebi.
\m yisi-z rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-n k’uk-a teł r-uqˤi-n xeci-n zow-ru-ni gulu-s mus-bi
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT III.PL-come-PST.UNW cap-IN.ESS inside IV-hide-PFV.CVB leave-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF horse-GEN1 hair-PL
\l He remembered the horse's hairs that he had hidden inside his cap.

\t Bežet’ani q’ˤanon esnabi iday maħor boqnosi, yisä łˤonon mus bik’urno.
\m b-eže-t’a-ni q’ˤano-n esyu-bi idu-ay maħor b-oq-nosi yisi-a łˤono-n mus b-ik’u-r-n
\g I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF two-TOP brother-PL home-IN.ABL outside I.PL-become-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG three-TOP hair III-burn-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l When the two older brothers went outside the house, he burnt the three hairs.

\t Łˤonon gulubi rayn adäza ričin aluk’an, qˤaban, c’udan.
\m łˤono-n gulu-bi r-ay-n adäza r-iči-n aluk’a-n qˤaba-n c’uda-n
\g three-TOP horse-PL III.PL-come-PFV.CVB before III.PL-wait-PFV.CVB white-and black-and red-and
\l Three horses came and waited in front [of him], a white one, a black one and a red one.

\t Aluk’anin, qˤabanin q’ˤanon gulubi rečuƛ ruqˤno xecinƛax.
\m aluk’a-ni-n qˤaba-ni-n q’ˤano-n gulu-bi reču-ƛ r-uqˤi-n xeci-n-ƛax
\g white-DEF-and black-DEF-and two-TOP horse-PL cattleshed-SUB.ESS III.PL-hide-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The white and the black horses he left hidden in the cattleshed.

\t C’udani guluƛ’no zown, c’udagon šeƛ’un šeƛ’un, yaraɣno koyä bisno yeda xanzo qalamqaɣor ik’in.
\m c’uda-ni gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n c’uda-gon šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n yaraɣ-n kʷay-a b-is-n yeda xan-z qala-qaɣor ik’i-n
\g red-DEF horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB red-CNTR clothing-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB weapon-TOP hand-IN.ESS III-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG khan-GEN2 fortress-POSS.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l The red one he rode, put on red clothes, took a weapon in his hand and rode to the king's fortress.

\t Roƛik’u huni bežet’ani esnazaq xizor ƛexuzaƛ’ortow, yeda xizayn ayn biqirno žedu, hudun yizir yeda iynanuƛax.
\m r-oƛƛik’u huni b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-q xizor ƛexu-zaƛ’or-tow yeda xizay-n ay-n b-iqir-n žedu hudun yizi-r yeda iy-n-anu-ƛax
\g IV-half way I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL-POSS.ESS back remain-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM2.ISG from.behind-TOP come-PFV.CVB I.PL-catch-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL nevertheless DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT DEM2.ISG know-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l Before half the way remained for the older brothers, he came from behind and overtook them, nevertheless they didn't recognize him.

\t Bayruntow yisis gulu qalamzo ƛ’ˤuƛ’orno bet’un k’oƛin, elay hič’č’a yeɣeni xanes kidno yok’ek’no iduɣor nexno.
\m b-ay-run-tow yisi-s gulu qala-z ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or-n b-et’u-n k’oƛi-n ele-ay hič’č’a y-eɣe-ni xan-s kid-n y-ok’ek’-n idu-ɣor nex-n
\g III-come-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 horse fortress-GEN2 roof-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL the.most II-young-DEF khan-GEN1 daughter-TOP II-steal-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL come-PST.UNW
\l Right after it arrived, his horse jumped onto the fortress' roof and from there he stole the youngest daughter of the king and came home.

\t Gulun rečuƛ bicin, ža kidno q’ˤuya ɣˤutka teł yuqˤno, esnabi bayaniqor idu ezun ičäsi zown.
\m gulu-n reču-ƛ b-ici-n ža kid-n q’ˤuya ɣˤutku-a teł y-uqˤi-n esyu-bi b-ay-ani-qor idu ezu-n iči-asi zow-n
\g horse-TOP cattleshed-SUB.ESS III-tie-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG girl-TOP other room-IN.ESS inside II-hide-PFV.CVB brother-PL I.PL-come-MSD-POSS.LAT home look-PFV.CVB wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He tied the horse into the shed, hid the girl in another room and waited at home for his brothers to come.

\t Neširu bežet’ani esnabi q’ʷarid boqno biłe baynosi, yisä esirno, šebi mežur roqno hemecetow pašman boqa keze boqnäy, šebi necetow beže q’ʷariłi mežuƛ’or bayäsiƛin.
\m neširu b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi q’ʷarid b-oq-n b-iłe b-ay-nosi yisi-a esir-n šebi mežu-r r-oq-n hemece-tow pašman b-oq-a keze b-oq-näy šebi nece-tow b-eže q’ʷariłi mežu-ƛ’or b-ay-asi-ƛin
\g evening I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL sad I.PL-become-PFV.CVB I.PL-as I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW what you(I).PL.OBL-LAT IV-happen-PFV.CVB such-EMPH become.sad I.PL-become-INF meet I.PL-become-CND.CVB what so.much-EMPH III-big sadness you(I).PL.OBL-SUPER.LAT III-come-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l In the evening, when the brothers came looking sad, he asked: "What happened to you that you became so sad? What a big sadness has come upon you!"

\t Debi iš anu žaƛin, bežet’ani esnabi bixzin boqno xabaryayn yisiqor rok’ƛ’osi murad t’ubazi boqinč’izaƛ’.
\m mi-s iš anu ža-ƛin b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi bixzi-n b-oq-n xabaryad-n yisi-qor rok’u-ƛ’-si murad t’ubazi b-oq-č’i-zaƛ’
\g you-GEN1 concern be.NEG DEM1.SG-QUOT I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL angry-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB tell-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT heart-SUPER.ESS-ATTR wish fulfill III-become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB
\l "That's not your business.", said the older brothers angrily because their hearts' desire was not fulfilled.

\t Neła quł sasaqosigon esnabi madaħor boqnosi, eɣeni esiw qˤabani guluƛ’no zown, q’ˤuya šeƛ’un šeƛ’un, yaraɣno lagiqor kurno ik’in.
\m neła qu-ł sasaqosi-gon esyu-bi madaħor b-oq-nosi eɣe-ni esiw qˤaba-ni gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n q’ˤuya šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n yaraɣ-n laga-qor kur-n ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning-CNTR brother-PL outside I.PL-become-ANT.CVB young-DEF brother black-DEF horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB other put.on-PFV.CVB put.on-PFV.CVB weapon-TOP body-POSS.LAT throw-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l The next morning when the brothers went outside, the young brother rode the black horse, put on different clothes, threw a weapon around his body and rode off.

\t Hemedurtow xanes yoƛƛosini kidno qalamäy yoɣno, xizor utin iduɣor nexno.
\m hemedur-tow xan-s y-oƛƛo-si-ni kid-n qala-ay y-oɣ-n xizor uti-n idu-ɣor nex-n
\g so-EMPH khan-GEN1 II-middle-ATTR-DEF daughter-TOP fortress-IN.ABL II-take.away-PFV.CVB back return-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL come-PST.UNW
\l In the same way he took the king's middle daughter from the fortress and came back home.

\t Yeɣeni esiwde sadaq žan yuqˤno, gulun rečuƛ bicin, bežet’ani esnabi bayaniqor idu ezun ičäsi zown.
\m y-eɣe-ni esiw-de sadaq ža-n y-uqˤi-n gulu-n reču-ƛ b-ici-n b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi b-ay-ani-qor idu ezu-n iči-asi zow-n
\g II-young-DEF sister-APUD.ESS together DEM1.SG-TOP II-hide-PFV.CVB horse-TOP cattleshed-SUB.ESS III-tie-PFV.CVB I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL I.PL-come-MSD-POSS.LAT home look-PFV.CVB wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He hid her together with her younger sister, tied the horse to the shed, and waited at home for his older brothers to come.

\t Neła qułno yizi esnabi q’ʷarid boqno bayn, sistow sis kid xanes hoboy ƛexus, žakin yiqixana elułäy sidernoƛin.
\m neła qu-ł-n yizi esyu-bi q’ʷarid b-oq-n b-ay-n sis-tow sis kid xan-s hoboy ƛexu-s ža-kin y-iqi-x-anu-a elu-łay sida-r-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS-TOP DEM2.IPL brother-PL sad I.PL-become-PFV.CVB I.PL-come-PFV.CVB one-EMPH one daughter khan-GEN1 now remain-PST.WIT DEM1.SG-even II-get-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q we(I).OBL-CONT.ABL one.OBL-LAT-TOP-QUOT
\l And the next day, the brothers came home sad: "One single daughter of the king remain's now, and just one of us will get her."

\t Łˤono äƛiru ɣudƛ’ogon č’urqˤotown q’ˤanon bežet’ani esnabi hunix boqno, yaqˤułgon yiqixana eluq yok’ek’anix sistow sis ƛäxuruni xanes kidƛin.
\m łˤono eƛi-ru ɣudi-ƛ’-gon č’urqˤo-tow-n q’ˤano-n b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi huni-x b-oq-n yaqˤuł-gon y-iqi-x-anu-a elu-q y-ok’ek’-ani-x sis-tow sis ƛexu-ru-ni xan-s kid-ƛin
\g three say-PST.PRT day-SUPER.ESS-CNTR in.the.morning-EMPH-TOP two-TOP I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PFV.CVB today-CNTR II-get-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS II-steal-MSD-AD.ESS one-EMPH one remain-PST.PRT-DEF khan-GEN1 daughter-QUOT
\l The third day then, in the morning, the two older brothers went on their way: "Today we might succeed in stealing the single remaining daughter from the king."

\t Žeduł xizay iłetowgon q’ˤuya šeƛ’un šeƛ’un, aluk’a guluƛ’no zown eɣeni esiw maħor oqno.
\m žedu-ł xizay iłe-tow-gon q’ˤuya šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n aluk’a gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n eɣe-ni esiw maħor oq-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS behind as-EMPH-CNTR other put.on-PFV.CVB put.on-PFV.CVB white horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother outside become-PST.UNW
\l But behind them rode the younger brother, dressed in different clothings on the white horse.

\t Žigoƛ’aygon xanes yeženi kidno yok’ek’no, xizor utin idur bežet’ani esnazaƛ’ay ader ayn.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon xan-s y-eže-ni kid-n y-ok’ek’-n xizor uti-n idu-r b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-ƛ’ay ader ay-n
\g now-SUPER.ABL-CNTR khan-GEN1 II-old-DEF daughter-TOP II-steal-PFV.CVB back return-PFV.CVB home-LAT I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL-SUPER.ABL before come-PST.UNW
\l And now he stole the king's oldest daughter and returned home before his older brothers.

\t Žan hemedurtow nełaz esnazaden yuqˤno, šeƛ’un nesä nesis šeƛ’un, gulun rečuƛ buqˤno, idu q’ˤidan ičin žedu bayaniqor ezun ičäsi zown.
\m ža-n hemedur-tow neła-z esyu-bi-de-n y-uqˤi-n šeƛ’u-n nesi-a nesi-s šeƛ’u-n gulu-n reču-ƛ b-uqˤi-n idu q’ˤida-n iči-n žedu b-ay-ani-qor ezu-n iči-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP so-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 sister-PL-APUD.ESS-TOP II-hide-PFV.CVB put.on-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 put.on-PFV.CVB horse-TOP cattleshed-SUB.ESS III-hide-PFV.CVB home down-TOP sit-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL I.PL-come-MSD-POSS.LAT look-PFV.CVB wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He likewise hid her next to her sisters, put on his own clothes, hid the horse in the shed, sat down at home and waited for them to come.

\t Bežet’ani esnabi baynosi, yisä yiziq esin, žedu łˤonon gulun dey zows, žedu łˤonon xanes kidbabin qalamzo ƛ’ˤuƛ’azan roɣno rok’ek’no di rowsƛin.
\m b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi b-ay-nosi yisi-a yizi-q esi-n žedu łˤono-n gulu-n di-s zow-s žedu łˤono-n xan-s kid-bi-n qala-z ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’aza-n r-oɣ-n r-ok’ek’-n di r-ow-s-ƛin
\g I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL three-TOP horse-TOP me-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.WIT DEM1.IPL three-TOP khan-GEN1 daughter-PL-TOP fortress-GEN2 roof-SUPER.VERS.DIST-TOP II.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB II.PL-steal-PFV.CVB me II.PL-bring-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l When the older brothers came home, he told them: "These three horses are mine, and these three daughters of the king I stole from the roof of the fortress and brought them here."

\t Žedu bužzi boqnoanu, mi iłeni łaciraqa xanes kidbabi rawnč’i, nediwt’a gulubi yołi nay deber riqixƛin.
\m žedu bužzi b-oq-n-anu mi iłe-ni łaciraq-a xan-s kid-bi r-ow-č’i nediw-t’a gulu-bi yołi nay mi-r r-iqi-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL believe I.PL-become-PFV.CVB-NEG you as-DEF light.headed.person-ERG khan-GEN1 daughter-PL II.PL-bring-NEG.FUT such-DISTR horse-PL however from.where you-LAT IV-get-PRS-QUOT
\l They didn't believe him: "A light-headed person like you wouldn't bring the king's daughters, however, where did you get such horses from?"

\t ƛa beza bik’anƛin yisä esnabi gulubi rukaranix bižin, xizyogon xanes kidbabi ruqˤno zawruni iduɣor bižin, ele žedu łˤonon kidbabi ent’o yołƛin.
\m ƛa b-ezu-a b-ik’i-an-ƛin yisi-a esyu-bi gulu-bi r-ukar-ani-x b-iži-n xizyogon xan-s kid-bi r-uqˤi-n zow-ru-ni idu-ɣor b-iži-n ele žedu łˤono-n kid-bi ent’o yoł-ƛin
\g go.IMPR I.PL-look-INF I.PL-go-FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG brother-PL horse-PL III.PL-show-MSD-AD.ESS I.PL-lead-PFV.CVB then khan-GEN1 daughter-PL II.PL-hide-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF home-IN.ALL I.PL-lead-PST.UNW here DEM1.IIPL three-TOP daughter-PL here be-QUOT
\l "Come, we'll go looking.", and he led his brothers to show them the horses, and then he led them to the room where he was hiding the king's daughters, "So here are the three daughters."

\t Ħayran boqno ƛexun bežet’ani esnabi, nay yedu deber gulubi riqäƛin esirno.
\m ħayran b-oq-n ƛexu-n b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi nay yedu mi-r gulu-bi r-iqi-a-ƛin esir-n
\g be.astonished I.PL-become-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL from.where DEM2.IISG you-LAT horse-PL III.PL-get-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-PST.UNW
\l The older brothers were astonished and asked: "From where did you get these horses?"

\t Yisä kinaw šebinon esin, q’ˤunan esnazar gulubi sayɣat rodin.
\m yisi-a kinaw šebinon esi-n q’ˤuna-n esyu-bi-r gulu-bi sayɣat r-odi-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG entire something tell-PST.UNW two.OBL-TOP brother-PL-LAT horse-PL present III.PL-do-PST.UNW
\l He told everything and gave his two brothers horses as a present.

\t Eženi esiwr yeženi xanes kidno teƛno, oƛozonirgon yoƛosin teƛno, c’udani gulun, yeɣenigon kidno nesä nesir xecin.
\m eže-ni esiw-r y-eže-ni xan-s kid-n teƛ-n oƛƛo-zo-ni-r-gon y-oƛƛo-si-n teƛ-n c’uda-ni gulu-n y-eɣe-ni-gon kid-n nesi-a nesi-r xeci-n
\g old-DEF brother-LAT II-old-DEF khan-GEN1 daughter-TOP give-PFV.CVB middle-ATTR.OBL-DEF-LAT-CNTR II-middle-ATTR-TOP give-PFV.CVB red-DEF horse-and II-young-DEF-CNTR daughter-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT leave-PST.UNW
\l To the older brother he gave the older daughter of the king, to the middle he gave the middle, and the red horse and the youngest daughter he left for himself.

\t C’aq’ maʕdinay, ozäy ozuri boɣxanusi yiłe šebin zown ža.
\m c’aq’ maʕdinay ozuri-ay ozuri b-oɣ-xanusi y-iłe šebin zow-n ža
\g very lovely eye-IN.ABL eye III-take.away-NEG.PRS.PRT II-as thing be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l She was very lovely and one couldn't take one's eye off of hers.

\t Radiru rigłin riynč’ey, bežet’ani esnaza daʕba bodin, hič’č’a bercinaw kid deber šida yiča yayxƛin.
\m r-odi-ru r-ig-łin r-iy-č’ey b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-a daʕba b-odi-n hič’č’a bercinaw kid mi-r šida y-iči-a y-ay-x-ƛin
\g IV-do-PST.PRT IV-good-CNC.CVB IV-know-NEG.PST.CVB I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL-ERG dispute III-do-PFV.CVB the.most beautiful girl you-LAT why II-be-INF II-must-PRS-QUOT
\l The other brothers didn't know what good he had done, and began to argue: "Why must the most beautiful girl be for you?"

\t Q’ˤanon bežet’ani esnabi yisir rek’ bodanixƛin urɣizi boqno.
\m q’ˤano-n b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi yisi-r rek’ b-odi-ani-x-ƛin urɣizi b-oq-n
\g two-TOP I.PL-old-DISTR-DEF brother-PL DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT trick III-do-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT thinking I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The two older brothers thought about playing a trick on him.

\t Sasaqosi maħor oqƛ’oräy, eɣeni esiw gondaɣor ʕoƛ’un.
\m sasaqosi maħor oq-ƛ’oräy eɣe-ni esiw gondu-aɣor ˤoƛ’u-n
\g in.the.morning outside become-SIM.CVB young-DEF brother big.hole-IN.VERS fall-PST.UNW
\l In the morning when he went outside, the young brother fell into the hole.

\t Soder iziłinč’ey hemedur yeda yałzay, aki riłe moči nesir elo besun.
\m soder izi-ł-č’ey hemedur yeda yoł-zay aki r-iłe moči nesi-r elo b-esu-n
\g upward get-POT-NEG.PST.CVB so DEM2.ISG be-SIM.CVB window IV-as place DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT there III-find-PST.UNW
\l While he wasn't able to get upwards like this, he found a place there that looked like a window.

\t ƛ’ˤuƛ’ay łinaƛa haraƛ’ bizirsiƛin, q’orola kid yegirno, šebi elo roqnoƛin yezu-yoƛ’ˤanix.
\m ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’ay łina-ƛa haraƛ’ b-izir-s-ƛin q’orol-a kid y-egir-n šebi elo r-oq-n-ƛin y-ezu~oƛ’ˤu-ani-x
\g roof-SUPER.ABL what.OBL-INDEF noise III-lift-PST.WIT-QUOT widow-ERG daughter II-send-PFV.CVB what there IV-happen-PST.UNW-QUOT II-examine-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Because something produced a noise from the roof, the widow sent her daughter to check out what was happening there.

\t Kidbä eƛin, t’o sis aq’iw ʕoloqanaw uži yoł, eluz ʕaƛaysin anu žaƛin.
\m kid-a eƛi-n t’o sis aq’iw ʕoloqanaw uži yoł elu-z ʕaƛ-ay-si-n anu ža-ƛin
\g girl-ERG say-PST.UNW there one strange young boy be we(I).OBL-GEN2 village-IN.ABL-ATTR-TOP be.NEG DEM1.SG-QUOT
\l The girl said: "There is a strange young boy and he is not someone from our village."

\t Kidbä goƛ’in ža ƛirbałix ik’inč’izaƛ’, yoƛixno nełaz eniya goƛ’in ižin ža iduɣor.
\m kid-a goƛ’i-n ža ƛirbałi-x ik’i-č’i-zaƛ’ y-oƛix-n neła-z eni-a goƛ’i-n iži-n ža idu-ɣor
\g girl-ERG invite-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG hospitality-AD.ESS go-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB II-appear-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 mother-ERG invite-PFV.CVB lead-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG home-IN.ALL
\l Because he didn't go in as a guest when the girl invited hem, her mother appeared and invited him and lead him into the house.

\t Suƛƛi teł iduɣor aqruntow yisä yiłaq ħaƛanix łi esirnosi, lamusno yoqno eƛin, deber idu ħaƛanix łi anu, t’o kikƛ’o aždaħ baq’ˤułäsi yoł, ɣudes nełar yac’anix q’ˤimaku teƛinč’inäy, neła yiła ʕaƛor łi regirxosi anu.
\m suƛƛi teł idu-ɣor oq-run-tow yisi-a yiła-q ħaƛu-ani-x łi esir-nosi lamus-n y-oq-n eƛi-n mi-r idu ħaƛu-ani-x łi anu t’o kik-ƛ’ aždaħ b-aq’ˤuł-asi yoł ɣudes neła-r y-ac’-ani-x q’ˤimaku teƛ-č’i-näy neła-a yiła ʕaƛ-r łi r-egir-xosi anu
\g immediately inside home-IN.ALL become-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS drink-MSD-AD.ESS water ask-ANT.CVB conscience-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW you-LAT home drink-MSD-AD.ESS water be.NEG here spring-SUPER.ESS dragon III-sit-RES.PRT be daily DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT II-eat-MSD-AD.ESS grown.up give-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL village-LAT water IV-let-PRS.PRT be.NEG
\l Immediately after coming into the house, he asked her for water to drink, and .......... she said: "You can't drink water here at home, there is a dragon sitting on the spring, and every day if someone doesn't give him a grown-up to eat, he won't let water to the village."

\t Sis q’ut’u neƛčey däqor, di ħal biyrančey neła aždaħesƛin eƛin, uži kikxar łi ric’a ik’in.
\m sis q’ut’u neƛ-čey di-qor di ħal b-iyr-an-čey neła aždaħ-s-ƛin eƛi-n uži kik-xar łi r-ic’-a ik’i-n
\g one earthen.jug give-INTS me-POSS.LAT me condition III-find.out-FUT.CVB-INTS DEM1.IISG.OBL dragon-GEN1-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy spring-AD.VERS water IV-fill-INF go-PST.UNW
\l "Please give me a jug, I will find out the dragon's condition.", the boy [said and] went to the spring to fill it with water.

\t ƛ’iri ayäsi ƛirba oqzaƛ’ aždaħa p’estow anusi kikxay łäs q’ut’u bic’a begirno.
\m ƛ’iri ay-asi ƛirba oq-zaƛ’ aždaħ-a p’es-tow anu-si kik-xay łi-s q’ut’u b-ic’-a b-egir-n
\g above come-RES.PRT guest become-CSL.CVB dragon-ERG voice-EMPH be.NEG-ATTR spring-AD.ABL water-GEN1 earthen.jug III-fill-INF III-let-PST.UNW
\l Because it was a guest who was coming, the dragon let him fill his jug with water from the spring without saying anything.

\t Hunix dandir c’axru ahlimo esirzaƛ’, žedur teƛxo užä łäs bic’äsi q’ut’u łiyrno.
\m huni-x dandir c’ox-ru ahli esir-zaƛ’ žedu-r teƛ-x uži-a łi-s b-ic’-asi q’ut’u łiyr-n
\g way-AD.ESS towards meet-PST.PRT people ask-CSL.CVB DEM1.IPL-LAT give-IPFV.CVB boy-ERG water-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT earthen.jug finish-PST.UNW
\l Because on the way, people whom he met on the way, asked him, the boy was giving them [water] and the jug filled with water was finished.

\t K’ox äƛirugon uži kikxor łi ric’a ik’in.
\m k’ox äƛiru-gon uži kik-xor łi r-ic’-a ik’i-n
\g twice ORD-CNTR boy spring-AD.LAT water IV-fill-INF go-PST.UNW
\l A second time the boy went to the spring to fill it with water.

\t Łäs q’ut’un bic’no xizor utin nexƛ’oräy, xizaz aždaħä qˤaƛin, t’ok’ow näxno mi łi ric’a, nagaħ nexnäy, mi di č’aguyawtow axaɣor igin kura yołƛin.
\m łi-s q’ut’u-n b-ic’-n xizor uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy xizaz aždaħ-a qˤaƛi-n t’ok’ow nex-n mi łi r-ic’-a nagaħ nex-näy mi di č’aguyaw-tow ax-aɣor igi-n kur-a yoł-ƛin
\g water-GEN1 earthen.jug-TOP III-fill-PFV.CVB back return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB from.behind dragon-ERG shout-PST.UNW anymore come-PROHIB you water IV-fill-INF suppose come-CND.CVB you me living-EMPH belly-IN.VERS swallow-PFV.CVB throw-INF be-QUOT
\l He filled the jug with water and while he was coming back, the dragon shouted from behind: "Don't you come to fill [it with] water anymore! If you come, I am going to throw you into my belly and swallow you alive!"

\t Łox äƛirugon mač’an risno ik’in ža kikxaɣor q’ut’u bic’a.
\m łox äƛiru-gon mač’a-n r-is-n ik’i-n ža kik-xaɣor q’ut’u b-ic’-a
\g thrice ORD-CNTR dagger-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW DEM1.SG spring-AD.VERS earthen.jug III-fill-INF
\l The third time he took a dagger and went to the spring to fill the jug with water.

\t Kikxor ayruntow aždaħä ža č’aguyawtow axaɣor igin kurno.
\m kik-xor ay-run-tow aždaħ-a ža č’aguyaw-tow ax-aɣor igi-n kur-n
\g spring-AD.LAT come-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH dragon-ERG DEM1.SG living-EMPH belly-IN.VERS swallow-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l And immediately when he came to to the spring, the dragon swallowed him alive.

\t Yisägon roɣno mač’an tełäza aždaħno t’it’i-beč’no, axaza egin maħorno oqno nełas q’ˤim ret’urno kurno.
\m yisi-a-gon r-oɣ-n mač’a-n teł-aza aždaħ-n t’it’i~eč’-n ax-aza egi-n maħor-n oq-n neła-s q’ˤim r-et’ur-n kur-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR IV-take.away-PFV.CVB dagger-TOP inside-IN.VERS.DIST dragon-TOP cut.into.pieces-PFV.CVB belly-IN.VERS.DIST break.apart-PFV.CVB outside-TOP become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 head IV-hack-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l He took out his dagger and cut the dragon into pieces from inside, broke him apart from out of the belly, got outside and chopped off its head.

\t Elor ža q’orolayn yayn.
\m elo-r ža q’orolay-n y-ay-n
\g there-LAT DEM1.SG widow-TOP II-come-PST.UNW
\l And the widow came to there.

\t Neła eƛin, aždaħ bexaruni uži elzox yołƛin.
\m neła-a eƛi-n aždaħ b-exur-ru-ni uži ela-zo-x yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW dragon III-kill-PST.PRT-DEF boy we(II-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS be-QUOT
\l She said: "The boy who killed the dragon is living at our place."

\t Xalq’imo yeda ħaladtow ižin elo ʕaƛos žamaʕat batiza mečoƛ’or.
\m xalq’i-a yeda ħal-d-tow iži-n elo ʕaƛ-s žamaʕat b-uti-za moči-ƛ’or
\g people-ERG DEM2.ISG trouble-INSTR-EMPH lead-PFV.CVB there village-GEN1 assembly III-turn-LCV place-SUPER.LAT
\l The people lead him with trouble to the place were the village's assembly met.

\t Šebi deber retix, šebi deber neƛanƛin, nazon xalq’imo yeda šet’u utirno, mi äƛiru šebin ela t’ubazi rodanƛin, koyä isxo yeda cuƛert’a kurxo zown, hemece ɣˤaɣˤu bizizaq.
\m šebi mi-r r-eti-x šebi mi-r neƛ-an-ƛin nazo-n xalq’i-a yeda šet’u utir-n mi eƛi-ru šebi-n elu-a t’ubazi r-odi-an-ƛin kʷay-a is-x yeda cuƛer-t’a kur-x zow-n hemece ɣˤaɣˤu b-izi-zaq
\g what you-LAT IV-want-PRS what you-LAT give-FUT.DEF-QUOT all.OBL-TOP people-ERG DEM2.ISG around gather-PST.UNW you say-PST.PRT what-TOP we(I).OBL-ERG fulfill IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT hand-IN.ESS take-IPFV.CVB DEM2.ISG upward-DISTR throw-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB such be.happy I.PL-get.up-CSL.CVB
\l "What do you want? What shall we give you?", all the people gathered around him: "We will fulfill what you say."; and they took him into their hands and threw him upward [several times], because they got so happy.

\t Neła ħurmatyor mustaħiq’aw žek’u anu diƛin, q’ˤidar egirerno užä.
\m neła ħurmat-r mustaħiq’aw žek’u anu di-ƛin q’ˤida-r egir-r-n uži-a
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL respect-LAT suitable man be.NEG me-QUOT down-LAT let-CAUS-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "I'm not a man suitable for such respect!", the boy let them let him down.

\t Där rätiruƛa šebin mežuq raqinč’i, ƛ’irizoni dunyalƛ’aɣor didur meža di izirxo.
\m di-r r-eti-ru-ƛa šebi-n mežu-q r-oq-č’i ƛ’iri-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’aɣor didur mežu-a di izir-x
\g me-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT-INDEF what-TOP you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-become-NEG.FUT.CVB above-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.VERS how you(I).PL.OBL-ERG me lift-IPFV.CVB
\l "You won't be able to give me whatever I want; how will you lift me to the world above?"

\t Raq ža eluqƛin, yizä yeda ɣˤaɣˤu izirno.
\m r-oq ža elu-q-ƛin yizi-a yeda ɣˤaɣˤu izi-r-n
\g IV-become DEM1.SG we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS-QUOT DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG be.happy get-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l "We will do that!", they cheered him up.

\t Elo ʕaƛox sis beže cey zown.
\m elo ʕaƛ-x sis b-eže cey zow-n
\g there village-AD.ESS one III-big eagle be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In the village there lived a big eagle.

\t Nełaƛ’no zowerno yeda ƛ’irizoni dunyalƛ’aɣor egirno.
\m neła-ƛ’-n zowr-n yeda ƛ’iri-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’aɣor egir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP seat-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG above-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.VERS send-PST.UNW
\l They seated him onto it and sent him to the world above.

\t Ačqˤaynosi ceyä q’ˤʷa-q’ˤʷaƛin eƛinosi, užä ozäy mowt’a yoƛ’ˤurxo zown ceyz haqar.
\m ačqˤad-nosi cey-a q’ˤʷa-q’ˤʷa-ƛin eƛi-nosi uži-a ozuri-ay mow-t’a y-ˤoƛ’u-r-x zow-n cey-z haqu-ar
\g be.thirsty-ANT.CVB eagle-ERG krwa-krwa-QUOT say-ANT.CVB boy-ERG eye-IN.ABL tear-DISTR II-fall-CAUS-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW eagle-GEN2 mouth-IN.LAT
\l When the thirsty eagle said "krwa-krwa", the boy let tears fall down from his eyes into the eagle's mouth.

\t Mekoynosigon qʷa-qʷaƛin neła qˤaƛinosi, k’onč’aqay reč’no reƛ teƛxo zown.
\m mekod-nosi-gon qʷa-qʷa-ƛin neła-a qˤaƛi-nosi k’onč’u-qay r-eč’-n reƛ teƛ-x zow-n
\g be.hungry-ANT.CVB-CNTR khwa-khwa-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG shout-ANT.CVB leg-POSS.ABL IV-cut-PFV.CVB meat give-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l When it got hungry and shouted "khwa-khwa", he cut meat from his leg and gave it to it.

\t Hemedur ƛ’irizoni dunyalƛ’or yedan ayrno, xizor butin ceyn bik’in.
\m hemedur ƛ’iri-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’or yeda-n ayr-n xizor b-uti-n cey-n b-ik’i-n
\g so above-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.LAT DEM2.ISG-TOP bring-PFV.CVB back III-return-PFV.CVB eagle-TOP III-go-PST.UNW
\l So the eagle brought him into the world above and turned back.

\t Mow yoƛ’ˤaru ozuri yisis bat’yaw roqno, reƛ räč’runi k’onč’un, liɣˤonyayx zown.
\m mow y-ˤoƛ’u-r-ru ozuri yisi-s bat’iyaw r-oq-n reƛ r-eč’-ru-ni k’onč’u-n liɣˤonyad-x zow-n
\g tear II-fall-CAUS-PST.PRT eye DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 other IV-become-PFV.CVB meat IV-cut-PST.PRT-DEF leg-TOP be.lame-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His eye, which shed the tear, changed, and the leg he cut the meat from, got lame.

\t Nełƛ’aza ʕaƛar aynosi yeda xalq’imorkin iynanu.
\m neła-ƛ’aza ʕaƛ-ar ay-nosi yeda xalq’i-r-kin iy-n-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS.DIST village-IN.LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG people-LAT-even know-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l Because of that, the people didn't even recognize him, when he came into the village.

\t ʕAƛaza ec’no xabar šebiƛin yisä esirnosi, sida maduhalä esin, xanez yeɣeni kidbeƛäy bitor sidä sis esnabi bexursiƛin.
\m ʕaƛ-aza ec’no xabar šebi-ƛin yisi-a esir-nosi sida maduhal-a esi-n xan-z y-eɣe-ni kid-ƛay bitor sida-a sis esyu-bi b-exur-s-ƛin
\g village-IN.VERS.DIST new story what-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-ANT.CVB one.OBL neighbor-ERG tell-PST.UNW khan-GEN2 II-young-DEF daughter-SUB.ABL because.of one.OBL-Q one brother-PL I.PL-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l When he asked: "What's new in the village?", a neighbor told: "The brothers killed each other because of the king's youngest daughter."

\t Dicegon žeda rek’ boyłin, yisis žedux rok’u rexun.
\m dice-gon žedu-a rek’ b-odi-łin yisi-s žedu-x rok’u r-exu-n
\g how.much-CNTR DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG trick III-do-CNC.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 DEM1.IPL.OBL-AD.ESS heart IV-die-PST.UNW
\l No matter how much they played tricks, he felt sorry for them.

\t Žedus šudabi rukaranix ža maduhal yisä sadaq ižin.
\m žedu-s šuda-bi r-ukar-ani-x ža maduhal yisi-a sadaq iži-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 graveyard-PL IV-show-MSD-AD.ESS DEM1.SG neighbor DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG together lead-PST.UNW
\l In order to show him their grave, he took the neighbor together with himself.

\t Šudaƛ’ yeda ʕiyayx ukayzaƛ’ maduhaler iyn ža žedus eɣeni esiw yałrułi.
\m šuda-ƛ’ yeda ʕiyad-x ukad-zaƛ’ maduhal-r iy-n ža žedu-s eɣe-ni esiw yoł-rułi
\g graveyard-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG cry-IPFV.CVB see-CSL.CVB neighbor-LAT know-PST.UNW DEM1.SG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 young-DEF brother be-MSD
\l Because he saw him crying on the grave, the neighbor knew that he was their younger brother.

\t ʕAƛtown zigaraƛ’ bayn xizyo yisider.
\m ʕaƛ-tow-n zigara-ƛ’ b-ay-n xizyo yisi-der
\g village-EMPH-TOP condolence-SUPER.ESS I.PL-come-PFV.CVB afterwards DEM2.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT
\l Then the villagers came for condolence.

\t Xanes kidbabin ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu rizin.
\m xan-s kid-bi-n ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu r-izi-n
\g khan-GEN1 daughter-PL-TOP very be.happy IV-get-PST.UNW
\l Also the king's daughters got very happy.

\t Kʷaxatow bertenno boyn, yeɣeni kid nesä yown.
\m kʷaxa-tow berten-n b-odi-n y-eɣe-ni kid nesi-a y-ow-n
\g soon-EMPH marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB II-young-DEF daughter DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG II-marry-PST.UNW
\l And soon they organized a marriage and he married the young daughter.

\t Yeženin, yoƛosinin nesä nesiz q’ˤunan hič’č’a bigut’ani halmaɣzax regirno.
\m y-eže-ni-n y-oƛƛo-si-ni-n nesi-a nesi-z q’ˤuna-n hič’č’a b-igu-t’a-ni halmaɣ-bi-x r-egir-n
\g II-old-DEF-and II-middle-ATTR-DEF-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 two.OBL-TOP the.most I.PL-good-DISTR-DEF friend-PL-AD.ESS II.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l The older and the middle one he sent to his two best friends.

\t Žedu łˤonon haq’ubi ʕaƛa teł taliħawn, bigut’aƛinno esix zown.
\m žedu łˤono-n haq’u-bi ʕaƛ-a teł taliħaw-n b-igu-t’a-ƛin-n esi-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL three-TOP family-PL village-IN.ESS inside happy-and III-good-DISTR-QUOT-and tell-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They said that these three families in the village were very happy and good.

\t Žin yołƛax žedu hemedurtow bercinłiƛ’.
\m žin yoł-ƛax žedu hemedur-tow bercinłi-ƛ’
\g now be-QUOT DEM1.IPL so-EMPH beauty-SUPER.ESS
\l And now, they say, they also live happily.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Sis zownƛax bečedaw žek’u, nesis zownƛax q’ˤano kid.
\m sis zow-n-ƛax bečedaw žek’u nesi-s zow-n-ƛax q’ˤano kid
\g one be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT wealthy man DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT two daughter
\l Once there was a rich man who had two daughters.

\t Sis zown eniwn yexun best’alłiƛ’ ƛexasi, sideni q’ˤano äƛiru barułäysi zown.
\m sis zow-n eniw-n y-exu-n best’alłi-ƛ’ ƛexu-asi sideni q’ˤano äƛiru baru-łay-si zow-n
\g one be.NPRS-PFV.CVB mother-TOP II-die-PFV.CVB orphanhood-SUPER.ESS remain-RES.PRT the.other.one two ORD wife-CONT.ABL-ATTR be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l One was then orphan whose mother had died, the other one was from his second wife.

\t Best’al eniya mect’a boyx babiya q’ʷarid yoyx zown eniwn yexun ƛäxuruni kid.
\m best’al eni-a mec-t’a b-odi-x babi-a q’ʷarid y-odi-x zow-n eniw-n y-exu-n ƛexu-ru-ni kid
\g step mother-ERG language-DISTR III-do-IPFV.CVB dad-ERG hurt II-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB mother-TOP II-die-PST.UNW remain-PST.PRT-DEF daughter
\l The step mother slandered the stepdaughter and the father hurt his daughter whose mother had died.

\t Šomoraxno ziyde puräza rečuƛt’a yizä ža yišix zown.
\m šomorax-n ziya-de pu-aza reču-ƛ-t’a yizi-a ža y-iši-x zow-n
\g how.often-TOP cow-APUD.ESS side-IN.VERS.DIST cattleshed-SUB.ESS-DISTR DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG II-lock.up-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Often they locked her into the cattleshed next to the cow(s).

\t Sida quł babiyan, best’al eniyan yedu ʕaƛoz posurxo yegirno, qˤašder boƛik’u magalun erno.
\m sida qu-ł babiw-a-n best’al eni-a-n yedu ʕaƛ-z posu-x y-egir-n qˤaši-der boƛik’u magalu-n er-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS father-ERG-and step mother-ERG-and DEM2.IISG village-GEN2 cattle-AD.ESS II-send-PFV.CVB dawn-APUD.LAT half bread-TOP put-PST.UNW
\l One day the father and the stepmother sent her to the village's cattle, preparing for her half of the bread for lunch.

\t Ħonƛ’or yayruntow kidbä sida ɣunoz ɣeduƛxorno yoqno q’ˤidan yičin, q’ʷaridaw maq’anyoƛ’ keč’ qˤaƛa yoqno.
\m ħon-ƛ’or y-ay-run-tow kid-a sida ɣun-z ɣedu-ƛxor-n y-oq-n q’ˤida-n y-iči-n q’ʷaridaw maq’an-ƛ’ keč’ qˤaƛi-a y-oq-n
\g mountain-SUPER.LAT II-come-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH girl-ERG one.OBL tree-GEN2 shade-SUB.LAT-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB down-TOP II-sit-PFV.CVB sad melody-SUPER.ESS song sing-INF II-begin-PST.UNW
\l When she came to a mountain, she sat down in the shade of a tree and began to sing a song in a sad melody.

\t Posures ʕadlu sadaq zawru ɣˤʷayä boyx zown.
\m posu-s ʕadlu sadaq zow-ru ɣˤʷay-a b-odi-x zow-n
\g cattle-GEN1 order together be.NPRS-PST.PRT dog-ERG III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l And a dog that was together [with her] brought the cattle in order.

\t Qˤišdes zaman baynosi, boƛik’u magalu yiła bet’urno ɣˤʷayr kurno.
\m qˤišdes zaman b-ay-nosi boƛik’u magalu yiła-a b-et’ur-n ɣˤʷay-r kur-n
\g noon.GEN1 time III-come-ANT.CVB half bread DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG III-pull.out-PFV.CVB dog-LAT throw-PST.UNW
\l When the dinner time came, she pulled out half the bread and threw it to the dog.

\t Buqbetaxar kidbä siskin ziya kamirinč’ey, posures reqenno ʕaƛar bayrno yayn.
\m buqbeta-xar kid-a siskin ziya kamir-č’ey posu-s reqen-n ʕaƛ-ar b-ayr-n y-ay-n
\g sunset-AD.VERS girl-ERG any cow lose-NEG.PST.CVB cattle-GEN1 herd-TOP village-IN.LAT III-lead-PFV.CVB II-come-PST.UNW
\l Toward sunset, the girl hadn't lost any cow and led the cattle's herd back to the village and came back.

\t ʕAƛos xalq’in nełaƛ’ ʕuraw razi boqno.
\m ʕaƛ-s xalq’i-n neła-ƛ’ ʕuraw razi b-oq-n
\g village-GEN1 people-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS very agree III-become-PST.UNW
\l The village people were very pleased with her.

\t Hudayzikogon ʕaƛoz posurxo best’al eniya neła nełas kid yegirno.
\m hudayziko-gon ʕaƛ-z posu-x best’al eni-a neła neła-s kid y-egir-n
\g the.next.day-CNTR village-GEN2 cattle-AD.ESS step mother-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter II-send-PST.UNW
\l The next day the stepmother sent her own daughter to the village's cattle.

\t Yiłar yołi qˤišoder riguƛ’ay rigu biša ersiƛax.
\m yiła-r yołi qˤišoder r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu bišʷa er-s-ƛax
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT however for.dinner IV-good-SUPER.ABL IV-good food put-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l For her, however, she prepared the best food for dinner.

\t Nełde sadaqno zown ɣˤʷay.
\m neła-de sadaq-n zow-n ɣˤʷay
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS together-TOP be.NPRS-TOP dog
\l A dog was together with her as well.

\t Nełaq dicegon raq’ˤu biša roqłin, ɣˤʷayr neła magalas sis t’it’ukin kurnoanu.
\m neła-q dice-gon r-aq’ˤu bišʷa r-oq-łin ɣˤʷay-r neła magalu-as sis t’it’u-kin kur-n-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS how.much-CNTR IV-much food IV-become-CNC.CVB dog-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL bread-FUT2 one piece-even throw-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l But no matter how much food she had, she didn't throw even one piece of the bread to the dog.

\t Neširaɣor xizyo yiłaq ʕaƛoxor dahaw taraw posu raynanu.
\m neširu-aɣor xizyo yiła-q ʕaƛ-xor dahaw taraw posu r-ay-n-anu
\g evening-IN.VERS after DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS village-AD.LAT a.little except.for cattle IV-come-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l After it got evening, only some of the cattle came back to the village with her.

\t ʕAƛoz xalq’imon nełaƛ’ ʕayib erno, best’al kidbä rig posu ričirsi, mi yołi kamirno rayrsiƛin.
\m ʕaƛ-z xalq’i-a-n neła-ƛ’ ʕayib er-n best’al kid-a r-ig posu r-ičir-s mi yołi kamir-n r-ayr-s-ƛin
\g village-GEN2 people-ERG-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS fault put-PST.UNW step daughter-ERG IV-well cattle IV-restrain-PST.WIT you however lose-PST.UNW IV-bring-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l And the people of the village blamed her: "The stepdaughter kept the cattle well; you, however, brought them back and have lost some."

\t Best’al kidbes sis ziya zown.
\m best’al kid-s sis ziya zow-n
\g step daughter-GEN1 one cow be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The stepdaughter had a cow.

\t Ža c’aq’ c’odoraw ħaywan zown.
\m ža c’aq’ c’odoraw ħaywan zow-n
\g DEM1.SG very clever animal be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l It was a very clever animal.

\t Hudayziko ža ziya bexayn.
\m hudayziko ža ziya b-exʷad-n
\g the.next.day DEM1.SG cow III-slaughter-PST.UNW
\l The next day the cow was slaughtered.

\t Nełas ža ƛ’irisi reƛno rac’no xizor ƛäxuru ƛuzabi yiła ža bicixozoni hisonä teł eqerno.
\m neła-s ža ƛ’iri-si reƛ-n r-ac’-n xizor ƛexu-ru ƛuza-bi yiła-a ža b-ici-xozo-ni hisono-a teł eqer-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 DEM1.SG above-ATTR meat-TOP IV-eat-PFV.CVB back remain-PST.PRT bone-PL DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG III-tie-PRS.PRT.OBL-DEF trough-IN.ESS inside put-PST.UNW
\l They ate its meat, and then put the remaining bones inside the trough that she [the cow] was tied to.

\t Sida quł neła ʕaƛa sida bečedaw žek’a beže berten bodix zown.
\m sida qu-ł neła ʕaƛ-a sida bečedaw žek’u-a b-eže berten b-odi-x zow-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL village-IN.ESS one.OBL wealthy man-ERG III-big marriage III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l One day a rich man in that village was making a big marriage.

\t Babiwn, best’al eniwn, esiwn goƛ’in bertenyołxorno bik’in, best’al kid sisxoli idu ƛexun.
\m babiw-n best’al eniw-n esiw-n goƛ’i-n berten-łxor-n b-ik’i-n best’al kid sisxoli idu ƛexu-n
\g father-and step mother-and sister-and invite-PFV.CVB marriage-CONT.VERS-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB step daughter alone home remain-PST.UNW
\l The father, the stepmother and her sister were invited and went to the marriage, the stepdaughter remained home alone.

\t Yayn sida yeže ɣˤanaza yiłaq esirno, mi šida bertenyołxor yik’ixanuƛin.
\m y-ay-n sida y-eže ɣˤanabi-a yiła-q esir-n mi šida berten-łxor y-ik’i-x-anu-ƛin
