\g II-come-PFV.CVB one.OBL II-old woman-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW you why marriage-CONT.VERS II-go-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l An old woman came along and asked her: "Why don't you go to the marriage?"

\t Elo šeƛ’anix däq ec’no šeƛ’u anuƛin, eƛin kidbä.
\m elo šeƛ’u-ani-x di-q ec’no šeƛ’u anu-ƛin eƛi-n kid-a
\g there put.on-MSD-AD.ESS me-POSS.ESS new clothing be.NEG-QUOT say-PST.UNW girl-ERG
\l "I have no new clothings to put on there", said the girl.

\t Yeženä esin nełaq hemeła ziys ƛuzabi eqärza hisonär yezanix yik’iƛin.
\m y-eže-ni-a esi-n neła-q hemeła ziya-s ƛuza-bi eqer-za hisono-ar y-ezu-ani-x y-ik’i-ƛin
\g II-old-DEF-Q tell-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM4.IISG.OBL cow-GEN1 bone-PL put-LCV trough-IN.LAT II-look-MSD-AD.ESS II-go-QUOT
\l The old one told her: "Go look at the trough were you put that cow's bones!"

\t Yik’inƛax yedu, resun elo ec’no, rigu šeƛ’u.
\m y-ik’i-n-ƛax yedu r-esu-n elo ec’no r-igu šeƛ’u
\g II-go-PFV.CVB-QUOT DEM2.IISG IV-find-PST.UNW there new IV-pretty clothing
\l She went and found new, pretty clothes there.

\t Ža šeƛ’un šeƛ’un best’al kidno bertenyołxor yik’in.
\m ža šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n best’al kid-n berten-łxor y-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG clothing-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB step daughter-TOP marriage-CONT.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l The stepdaughter put on the clothes and went to the marriage.

\t Yeženi ɣˤanaza eƛin, mi berten łiyace yičinč’ey xexłiƛ’ idurno nexno, hisona teł šeƛ’un eqro, min nexno idu yičiƛin.
\m y-eže-ni ɣˤanabi-a eƛi-n mi berten łiy-ace y-iči-č’ey xexłi-ƛ’ idu-r-n nex-n hisono-a teł šeƛ’u-n eqer-o mi-n nex-n idu y-iči-ƛin
\g II-old-DEF woman-ERG say-PST.UNW you marriage end-TERM II-wait-NEG.PST.CVB quickness-SUPER.ESS home-LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB trough-IN.ESS inside clothing-TOP put-IMPR you-TOP come-PFV.CVB home II-wait-QUOT
\l The old woman said: "Before the marriage ends, come home quickly, put the clothes into the trough, get home and wait."

\t Bertenyoł best’alawni esiw neła nełaz esiwde q’ˤida yičin.
\m berten-ł best’alaw-ni esiw neła-a neła-z esiw-de q’ˤida y-iči-n
\g marriage-CONT.ESS step-DEF sister DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 sister-APUD.ESS down II-sit-PST.UNW
\l On the marriage, the stepsister sat down next to her own sister.

\t Yedu haqa yogun ƛexun, nece bercinawn, č’uħarawn šeƛ’u yiła best’alawni kidber naey riqisƛin.
\m yedu haqu-a y-ogu-n ƛexu-n nece bercinaw-n č’uħaraw-n šeƛ’u yiła best’alaw-ni kid-r na-ey r-iqi-s-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG mouth-IN.ESS II-gape-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW so.much beautiful-and gorgeous-and clothing DEM2.IISG.OBL step-DEF girl-LAT where-DUB IV-get-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l She was gaping: "Where the heck did the 'stepgirl' get so beautiful and gorgeous clothes from?"

\t Zamanaƛ’aza best’alawni kidbeder, ža łočyaƛ’ yoɣanir nełaz eniws ƛirbas uži ayn.
\m zaman-ƛ’aza best’alaw-ni kid-der ža łoč-ƛ’ y-oɣ-ani-r neła-z eniw-s ƛirba-s uži ay-n
\g time-SUPER.VERS.DIST step-DEF girl-APUD.LAT DEM1.SG dance-SUPER.ESS II-take.away-MSD-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 mother-GEN1 guest-GEN1 son come-PST.UNW
\l After a while, to the stepgirl came the son of her mother's guest in order to invite her for a dance.

\t Kid yet’un k’oƛin yičin, di łočyaƛ’ k’oƛixosi anuƛin.
\m kid y-et’u-n k’oƛi-n y-iči-n di łoč-ƛ’ k’oƛi-xosi anu-ƛin
\g girl II-jump-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB II-be-PFV.CVB me dance-SUPER.ESS jump-PRS.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l The girl jumped up and was like: "I don't dance!"

\t ʕUraw mixƛ’or yedu elo łočyaƛ’ k’oƛixozoƛ’ yezunon yičin, berten łiya biħuƛ’oräy, xizor yik’anix ħadur yoqno, hemeła yeženä äƛiru šebinon rok’ƛ’orno rayn.
\m ʕuraw mix-ƛ’or yedu elo łoč-ƛ’ k’oƛi-xozo-ƛ’ y-ezu-n-n y-iči-n berten łiy-a b-iħu-ƛ’oräy xizor y-ik’i-ani-x ħadur y-oq-n hemeła y-eže-ni-a eƛi-ru šebinon rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-n
\g much time-SUPER.LAT DEM2.IISG there dance-SUPER.ESS jump-PRS.PRT.OBL-SUPER.ESS II-look-PFV.CVB-TOP II-be-PFV.CVB marriage end-INF III-come.to-SIM.CVB back II-go-MSD-AD.ESS prepare II-become-PFV.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL II-old-DEF-ERG say-PST.PRT something heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-PST.UNW
\l She was looking at the dancing one's there for a long time, and before the marriage ended, she prepared to go back, and remember what that old one said.

\t Maħor yoqƛ’oräy yiłas rorqosi xot’oqay roɣełno.
\m maħor y-oq-ƛ’oräy yiła-s rori-q-si xot’o-qay r-oɣeł-n
\g outside II-become-SIM.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 foot-POSS.ESS-ATTR foot-POSS.ABL IV-come.off-PST.UNW
\l While she got outside, a shoe fell from her foot.

\t Ža riqin yedu łočyaƛ’ yoɣxo zawruni yiziz ƛirbas užiqor.
\m ža r-iqi-n yedu łoč-ƛ’ y-oɣ-x zow-ru-ni yizi-z ƛirba-s uži-qor
\g DEM1.SG IV-get-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG dance-SUPER.ESS II-take.away-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN2 guest-GEN1 son-POSS.LAT
\l The guest's boy who invited her for dancing, took it.

\t Xizor yutin idur yaynosi, best’alawni kid ziya bicix zawruni hisona kecno yičin.
\m xizor y-uti-n idu-r y-ay-nosi best’alaw-ni kid ziya b-ici-x zow-ru-ni hisono-a kec-n y-iči-n
\g back II-return-PFV.CVB home-LAT II-come-ANT.CVB step-DEF daughter cow III-tie-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF trough-IN.ESS sleep-PFV.CVB II-wait-PST.UNW
\l The stepdaughter returned and while she came home, she waited sleeping in the trough the cow was tied to.

\t Xizyo nełas esiw idur yayn.
\m xizyo neła-s esiw idu-r y-ay-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 sister home-LAT II-come-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, he sister came home.

\t Neła babiwqor eƛin, howža best’alawni esiw yexura yay, ža č’agun yičin dey dunyalƛ’o netikin taliħ boqa anuƛin.
\m neła-a babiw-qor eƛi-n howža best’alaw-ni esiw y-exur-a y-ay ža č’agu-n y-iči-n di-s dunyal-ƛ’ neti-kin taliħ b-oq-a anu-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG father-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM4.SG step-DEF sister II-kill-INF II-must DEM1.SG alive-TOP II-be-TOP me-GEN1 world-SUPER.ESS when-even happiness III-become-INF be.NEG-QUOT
\l She said to her father: "You must kill this stepsister, when she is alive, I will not get happy again ever in my world."

\t Hemedurtow nesiƛ’or nełas eniwn yutin, mi ža kid yexurinč’inäy, dey di kidno yižin dowdäy yoxa yołƛin.
\m hemedur-tow nesi-ƛ’or neła-s eniw-n y-uti-n mi ža kid y-exur-č’i-näy di-s di kid-n y-iži-n mi-day y-oxi-a yoł-ƛin
\g so-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 mother-TOP II-turn-PST.UNW you DEM1.SG girl II-kill-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB me-GEN1 me daughter-TOP II-carry-PFV.CVB you-APUD.ABL II-run.away-INF be-QUOT
\l Her mother likewise turned to him: "If you don't kill the girl, I will take my daughter with me and run away from you."

\t Kidbezno baruzno rožƛ’ay iziłxanusi žek’u zown ža.
\m kid-z-n baru-z-n roži-ƛ’ay izi-ł-xanusi žek’u zow-n ža
\g daughter-GEN2-and wife-GEN2-and word-SUPER.ABL get-POT-NEG.PRS.PRT man be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l The man could not get away from his daughter's and his wife's words.

\t Žeda äƛiruxor, yisä yedu sidaɣ ciqa teł maqˤiƛ’or yižin ik’in.
\m žedu-a eƛi-ru-xor yisi-a yedu sidaɣ ciq-a teł maqˤi-ƛ’or y-iži-n ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG in.one.place forest-IN.ESS inside far.away-SUPER.LAT II-lead-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l According to what they said, he brought her far away into some forest.

\t Elo yisä tełer gondun yič’in, ƛ’irigon zozis ƛ’ˤun bodin, howlo kidno xecin, iduɣor oxin žan nexno.
\m elo yisi-a tełer gondu-n y-ič’i-n ƛ’iri-gon zozi-s ƛ’ˤu-n b-odi-n howlo kid-n xeci-n idu-ɣor oxi-n ža-n nex-n
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG to.the.inside big.hole-TOP II-dig-PFV.CVB above-CNTR moss-GEN1 roof-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB there daughter-TOP leave-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL run.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP come-PST.UNW
\l There inside he dug a hole, made a moss roof on it, left his daughter there and went back home.

\t Idur aynosigon, eniyan, kidbäntow, rok’u č’eze roqaniƛäy, best’alawni kid yexuriyäƛin, esirno nesiq.
\m idu-r ay-nosi-gon eni-a-n kid-a-n-tow rok’u č’eze r-oq-ani-ƛay best’alaw-ni kid y-exur-ya-ƛin esir-n nesi-q
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB-CNTR mother-ERG-and daughter-ERG-and-EMPH heart convinced[?] IV-become-MSD-SUB.ABL step-DEF daughter II-kill-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l After he came home, the mother and her daughter asked him: "Did you kill the stepdaughter?" to become convinced.

\t Yexursiƛingon žawab nesän teƛno.
\m y-exur-s-ƛin-gon žawab nesi-a-n teƛ-n
\g II-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT-CNTR answer DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP give-PST.UNW
\l "I killed her.", he answered.

\t Boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, elo best’alawni kidbede igor sis žek’un ayn nesä eƛin, aki raɣˤoƛin.
\m b-oƛƛo b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow elo best’alaw-ni kid-de igo-r sis žek’u-n ay-n nesi-a eƛi-n aki r-ˤaɣˤi-o-ƛin
\g III-middle III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH there step-DEF daughter-APUD.ESS near-LAT one man-TOP come-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW window IV-open-IMPR-QUOT
\l Before much time had passed, a man came to the stepdaughter and he said: "Open the window!"

\t Anunč’iza mečoƛ’ di t’o aki na raɣˤanƛin, kidbä žawab teƛno.
\m anu-č’i-za moči-ƛ’ di t’o aki na r-ˤaɣˤi-an-ƛin kid-a žawab teƛ-n
\g be.NEG-NEG.FUT.CVB-LCV place-SUPER.ESS me here window where IV-open-FUT.DEF-QUOT girl-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "Where shall I open a window here in the place that has none?", answered the girl.

\t Eženä mołin, ent’o q’ˤim rok’oƛin.
\m eže-ni-a mołi-n ent’o q’ˤim r-ok’-ƛin
\g old-DEF-ERG teach-PST.UNW here head IV-hit-QUOT
\l The old one explained: "Hit your head here!"

\t Q’ˤim rak’za mečoƛ’ reže aki roqno.
\m q’ˤim r-ok’-za moči-ƛ’ r-eže aki r-oq-n
\g head IV-hit-LCV place-SUPER.ESS IV-big window IV-happen-PST.UNW
\l On the place where she hit her head, a big window appeared.

\t Xizyogon eženä, ac yaɣˤoƛin, eƛin.
\m xizyogon eže-ni-a ac y-ˤaɣˤi-o-ƛin eƛi-n
\g then old-DEF-ERG door II-open-IMPR-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l Then the old one said: "Open the door!"

\t Anunč’iza mečoƛ’ di t’o ac na yaɣˤanƛin, kidbä žawab teƛno.
\m anu-č’i-za moči-ƛ’ di t’o ac na y-ˤaɣˤi-an-ƛin kid-a žawab teƛ-n
\g be.NEG-NEG.FUT.CVB-LCV place-SUPER.ESS me here door where II-open-FUT.DEF-QUOT girl-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "Where could I open a door here, in a place which has none?", answered the girl.

\t Eženi žek’a mołin, eloš gugu caƛoƛin.
\m eže-ni žek’u-a mołi-n eloš gugu caƛi-o-ƛin
\g old-DEF man-ERG teach-PST.UNW over.there back throw-IMPR-QUOT
\l The old man explained: "Throw your back over there!"

\t Kidbä gugu caƛiza mečoƛ’ ac yoqno.
\m kid-a gugu caƛi-za moči-ƛ’ ac y-oq-n
\g girl-ERG back throw-LCV place-SUPER.ESS door II-become-PST.UNW
\l On the place where the girl threw her back to, a door appeared.

\t Didur di biša rodan, eženi, biša rodanix t’o šebintow roqinč’inäyƛin, kidbä eƛin.
\m didur di bišʷa r-odi-an eže-ni bišʷa r-odi-ani-x t’o šebin-tow r-oq-č’i-näy-ƛin kid-a eƛi-n
\g how me food IV-do-FUT.DEF old-DEF food IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS here thing-EMPH IV-become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB-QUOT girl-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "How shall I prepare food, old man, if there aren't things to prepare it with, here?", the girl said.

\t Eženi žek’a kid kikxor yegirno, elo deber biša räsuƛin.
\m eže-ni žek’u-a kid kik-xor y-egir-n elo mi-r bišʷa r-esu-ƛin
\g old-DEF man-ERG girl spring-AD.LAT II-send-PST.UNW there you-LAT food IV-find-QUOT
\l The old man sent the girl to the spring: "There you will find food."

\t Yik’inƛax ža kikxor, elo yiłar ʕuraw biša resun.
\m y-ik’i-n-ƛax ža kik-xor elo yiła-r ʕuraw bišʷa r-esu-n
\g II-go-PFV.CVB-QUOT DEM1.SG spring-AD.LAT there DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT much food IV-find-PST.UNW
\l She went to the spring and found much food there.

\t Iduɣorno rown ža yiła, adäzno ħaƛin bišno-butin łiynosi, eženä kidbeqor eƛin, sasaq mi ƛ’ˤaz č’imix yiči, ƛ’iräy ƛ’iyor yoƛ’ˤun q’ˤano k’emot’ yay, sidä qurun-qaranƛin” qˤaƛi, sidenägon c’urun-c’aranƛin” qˤaƛi.
\m idu-ɣor-n r-ow-n ža yiła-a adäz-n ħaƛi-n b-iš~uti-n łiy-nosi eže-ni-a kid-qor eƛi-n sasaq mi ƛ’ˤu-z č’im-x y-iči ƛ’iräy ƛ’iyor y-ˤoƛ’u-n q’ˤano k’emot’ y-ay sida-a qurun-qaran-ƛin qˤaƛi sideni-a-gon c’urun-c’aran-ƛin qˤaƛi
\g home-IN.ALL-TOP IV-bring-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG ahead-TOP push-PFV.CVB I.PL-eat-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB old-DEF-ERG girl-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW tomorrow you roof-GEN2 edge-AD.ESS II-wait from.above downwards II-fall-PFV.CVB two wooden.case II-come one.OBL-IN.ESS kurun-karan-QUOT shout the.other.one-IN.ESS-CNTR tsurun-tsaran-QUOT shout
\l She brought it home and pushed it ahead and when they finished eating, the old one said to the girl: "Tomorrow wait on the edge of the roof, from above two crates will come falling down, shout 'Kurun-karan!' ot the one and 'Tsurun-tsaran!' to the other one!"

\t C’urun-c’aranƛin” eƛin yayxosi k’emot’ mi yiqir, ža hoq’ˤoni reƛ’a atinč’ey q’ˤidar yegirƛin.
\m c’urun-c’aran-ƛin eƛi-n y-ay-xosi k’emot’ mi y-iqir ža hoq’ˤo-ni reƛ’a at-č’ey q’ˤida-r y-egir-ƛin
\g tsurun-tsaran-QUOT say-PFV.CVB II-come-PRS.PRT wooden.case you II-take.away DEM1.SG other-DEF hand touch.with-NEG.PST.CVB down-LAT II-let-QUOT
\l Take away the crate that came down when you said 'Tsurun-tsaran!', let the other one down without touching it with the hand!"

\t Sasaq qaħłiƛ’aɣor best’alawni kid ƛ’ˤuƛ’or yizin.
\m sasaq qaħłi-ƛ’aɣor best’alaw-ni kid ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or y-izi-n
\g in.the.morning dawn-SUPER.VERS step-DEF girl roof-SUPER.LAT II-get.up-PST.UNW
\l The next morning after dawn, the stepdaughter got onto the roof.

\t ƛ’ˤaz č’imix yedu yałzay, qurun-qaranƛin” qˤaƛix ƛ’iräy ƛ’iyor sis k’emot’ yayn.
\m ƛ’ˤu-z č’im-x yedu yoł-zay qurun-qaran-ƛin qˤaƛi-x ƛ’iräy ƛ’iyor sis k’emot’ y-ay-n
\g roof-GEN2 edge-AD.ESS DEM2.IISG be-SIM.CVB kurun-karan-QUOT shout-IPFV.CVB from.above downwards one wooden.case II-come-PST.UNW
\l When she was on the roof's edge and was shouting: "Kurun-karan!", one crate came down from above.

\t Yiła reƛ’a atinč’eytow ža k’emot’ q’ˤidar yegirno.
\m yiła-a reƛ’a at-č’ey-tow ža k’emot’ q’ˤida-r y-egir-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG hand touch.with-NEG.PST.CVB-EMPH DEM1.SG wooden.case down-LAT II-let-PST.UNW
\l Not touching it with the hand, she let the crate down.

\t Xizyogon c’urun-c’aranƛin” eƛixosi k’emot’ wˤałer yayn.
\m xizyogon c’urun-c’aran-ƛin eƛi-xosi k’emot’ wˤał-r y-ay-n
\g then tsurun-tsaran-QUOT say-PRS.PRT wooden.case downward-LAT II-come-PST.UNW
\l Then the crate came down that she said "Tsurun-tsaran!" to.

\t Kidbä ža koyärno yiqirno iduɣor yižin.
\m kid-a ža kʷay-ar-n y-iqir-n idu-ɣor y-iži-n
\g girl-ERG DEM1.SG hand-IN.LAT-TOP II-take.away-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL II-carry-PST.UNW
\l The girl took it into her hand and carried it home.

\t Yaɣˤin tełer yezunosi, elo neła best’alawni kidbes eniw yołƛax.
\m y-ˤaɣˤi-n tełer y-ezu-nosi elo neła-a best’alaw-ni kid-s eniw yoł-ƛax
\g II-open-PFV.CVB to.the.inside II-look-ANT.CVB there DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG step-DEF girl-GEN1 mother be-QUOT
\l She opened it and when she looked inside, there was the stepdaughter's mother inside.

\t Kidbä eniwq esinƛax kinaw nełał raqru łinałäyn.
\m kid-a eniw-q esi-n-ƛax kinaw neła-ł r-oq-ru łina-łay-n
\g girl-ERG mother-POSS.ESS tell-PFV.CVB-QUOT entire DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP
\l The girl told her mother about everything that had happened to her.

\t Xizyo babiwzno yedu kid rok’ƛ’or yaysƛax.
\m xizyo babiw-z-n yedu kid rok’u-ƛ’or y-ay-s-ƛax
\g afterwards father-GEN2-TOP DEM2.IISG daughter heart-SUPER.LAT II-come-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Afterwards also the father remembered that daughter.

\t Šebiey yiłar roqsiƛin, yeda ezu-ʕoƛ’a ik’in.
\m šebi-ey yiła-r r-oq-s-ƛin yeda ezu~oƛ’ˤu-a ik’i-n
\g what-DUB DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT IV-happen-PST.WIT-QUOT DEM2.ISG visit-INF go-PST.UNW
\l "What in the world has happened to her?", he went to visit her.

\t Zozis ƛ’ˤu yołäsi qoš zawru, howži elo rigu bercinaw ɣˤutku yołƛax.
\m zozi-s ƛ’ˤu yoł-asi qoš zow-ru howži elo r-igu bercinaw ɣˤutku yoł-ƛax
\g moss-GEN1 roof be-RES.PRT shelter be.NPRS-PST.PRT now there IV-good beautiful house be-QUOT
\l Where the shelter with the moss roof used to be, there was now a good, beautiful house.

\t Eniya hibon bok’no ža q’ˤidar bˤoƛ’urno.
\m eni-a hibo-n b-ok’-n ža q’ˤida-r b-ˤoƛ’ur-n
\g mother-ERG stick-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG down-LAT III-let.fall-PST.UNW
\l The mother struck with a stick and let it fall down.

\t Sidaƛ’or rutirno žan babiw ʕaƛaɣor ik’in.
\m sida-ƛ’or r-utir-n ža-n babiw ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-n
\g one.OBL-SUPER.LAT IV.PL-gather-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP father village-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l The father gathered everything together and went into the village.

\t Idur aynosi yisä esin, hemediw šebin roqno di kid xäciza mečoƛ’ƛin.
\m idu-r ay-nosi yisi-a esi-n hemediw šebin r-oq-n di kid xeci-za moči-ƛ’-ƛin
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG tell-PST.UNW such.a thing IV-happen-PFV.CVB me daughter leave-LCV place-SUPER.ESS-QUOT
\l When he came home, he told: "Such a thing has happened on the place where I left my daughter."

\t Žeduz kidberno retisƛax esiwq yiłanix, din xec elo ciqqoƛin, yedu babiwq harizi yoqno.
\m žedu-z kid-r-n r-eti-s-ƛax esiw-q y-iłi-ani-x di-n xeci elo ciq-q-ƛin yedu babiw-q harizi y-oq-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 daughter-LAT-TOP IV-want-PST.WIT-QUOT sister-POSS.ESS II-resemble-MSD-AD.ESS me-TOP leave there forest-POSS.ESS-QUOT DEM2.IISG father-POSS.ESS request II-become-PST.UNW
\l Their daughter wanted to be like her sister and requested before her father: "Leave me there in the forest as well!"

\t Sidaɣ maqˤir ciqaɣorno yisä yedu yižin, hemedurtow gondun yič’in, ƛ’irigon zozis ƛ’ˤun bodin howlo žan xecin babiw xizor utin nexno.
\m sidaɣ maqˤi-r ciq-aɣor-n yisi-a yedu y-iži-n hemedur-tow gondu-n y-ič’i-n ƛ’iri-gon zozi-s ƛ’ˤu-n b-odi-n howlo ža-n xeci-n babiw xizor uti-n nex-n
\g in.one.place far.away-LAT forest-IN.VERS-TOP DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG II-lead-PFV.CVB so-EMPH big.hole-TOP II-dig-PFV.CVB above-CNTR moss-GEN1 roof-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB there DEM1.SG-TOP leave-PFV.CVB father back return-PFV.CVB come-PST.UNW
\l The father led her to a place far away in the forest, likewise dug a hole and built a roof of moss ontop, left her there and returned.

\t Yisiƛ’ bužzin yoqinč’ey nełas eniw yäk’iru, žan hemedurtow aždaħä yexurno.
\m yisi-ƛ’ bužzi-n y-oq-č’ey neła-s eniw y-ik’i-ru ža-n hemedur-tow aždaħ-a y-exur-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS believe-TOP II-become-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 mother II-go-PST.PRT DEM1.SG-TOP so-EMPH dragon-ERG II-kill-PST.UNW
\l That dragon likewise killed her mother, who didn't believe this, and went there.

\t Hemediw žedaƛ’or bayru balahno bukayn, babiw best’al kidbedäɣor oxin.
\m hemediw žeda-ƛ’or b-ay-ru balah-n b-ukad-n babiw best’al kid-däɣor oxi-n
\g such.a DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUPER.LAT III-come-PST.PRT misfortune-TOP III-see-PFV.CVB father step daughter-APUD.VERS run.away-PST.UNW
\l The father saw what misfortune had come upon tem and ran away to his stepdaughter.

\t Elogon yisir č’agu yoqäsi kidbes eniwn yesun.
\m elo-gon yisi-r č’agu y-oq-asi kid-s eniw-n y-esu-n
\g there-CNTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT alive II-become-RES.PRT daughter-GEN1 mother-TOP II-find-PST.UNW
\l And there he found that his daughter's mother had become alive.

\t Łˤonon req’ezin boqno, bercinaw bigu maʕišat howžin žeda elo boyxƛax.
\m łˤono-n req’ezi-n b-oq-n bercinaw b-igu maʕišat howži-n žedu-a elo b-odi-x-ƛax
\g three-TOP approach-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB beautiful III-good fortune now-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG there III-do-PRS-QUOT
\l The three of them came together and they say they're still making a beautiful, good fortune now.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’, ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Zownƛax, zown anuƛax sida ʕaƛa busurmanaw xan.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sida ʕaƛ-a busurmanaw xan
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT one.OBL village-IN.ESS Muslim khan
\l Once upon a time in a village there was a Muslim king.

\t Šibaw ruzman ɣudƛ’o nesä nesiz ulkas nasin ahli sadaqor butirxo zown.
\m šibaw ruzman ɣudi-ƛ’ nesi-a nesi-z ulka-s nasin ahli sadaq-r b-utir-x zow-n
\g every Friday day-SUPER.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 country-GEN1 all people together-LAT III-gather-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Every Friday he gathered together all the people of his country.

\t Hemeła ɣudƛ’ot’a q’ˤuya ulkał ičixosi Muħamadƛin ci yołäsi muʔmin žek’u elor aħnayx zown.
\m hemeła ɣudi-ƛ’-t’a q’ˤuya ulka-ł iči-xosi Muħamad-ƛin ci yoł-asi muʔmin žek’u elo-r aħnad-x zow-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL day-SUPER.ESS-DISTR other country-CONT.ESS live-PRS.PRT Muhammad-QUOT name be-RES.PRT pious man there-LAT walk.around-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l On each of those days, a pious man who lived in another country came walking there.

\t Nesis Pat’imatƛin c’aq’ bercinaw, c’odoraw, ʕaq’ilaw kid zown.
\m nesi-s Pat’imat-ƛin c’aq’ bercinaw c’odoraw ʕaq’ilaw kid zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 Fatima-QUOT very beautiful clever intelligent daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He had a very beautiful, clever and intelligent daughter named Fatima.

\t Sida quł ruzmanƛ’o xanä nazołno adäza sual erno, hič’č’an qˤaba hič’č’an kokoru, hič’č’an ʕedeʕaraw šebin šebiƛin.
\m sida qu-ł ruzman-ƛ’ xan-a nazo-ł-n adäza sual er-n hič’č’a-n qˤaba hič’č’a-n kokoru hič’č’a-n ʕedeʕaraw šebin šebi-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS Friday-SUPER.ESS khan-ERG everyone.OBL-CONT.ESS-TOP ahead question put-PST.UNW the.most-and black the.most-and soft the.most-and quick thing what-QUOT
\l One Friday the king asked a question before everyone: "What is the blackest, softest and quickest thing?"

\t Neła sualyor žawab neƛxosi žek’u elo mužmareł oƛixnoanu.
\m neła sual-r žawab neƛ-xosi žek’u elo mužmar-ł oƛix-n-anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL question-LAT answer give-PRS.PRT man there Friday-CONT.ESS appear-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l A man who could give the answer to that question didn't appear there on this Friday.

\t Neła quł elo yeda Muħamadno zown.
\m neła qu-ł elo yeda Muħamad-n zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS there DEM2.ISG Muhammad-TOP be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l On that day, Muhammad was there.

\t Mužmarłäzay iduɣor aynosi, Pat’imater babiw q’ʷarid iłe ukayzaƛ’ yiła nesiq esirno, šida mi nece pašman oqno ičäsiƛin.
\m mužmar-łazay idu-ɣor ay-nosi Pat’imat-r babiw q’ʷarid iłe ukad-zaƛ’ yiła-a nesi-q esir-n šida mi nece pašman oq-n iči-asi-ƛin
\g Friday-CONT.ABL.DIST home-IN.ALL come-ANT.CVB Fatima-LAT father sadness as see-CSL.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW why you so.much become.sad become-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l After he came home from the Friday (prayer), Fatima asked her father because she saw him being so sad: "Why are you so sad?"

\t Sosisi yisä esinč’ey iča oqäsi zown, xizyo kidbä xecinč’izaƛ’ esin, hemedur xanä mužmareł sual neƛsi, hič’č’an qˤaban, hič’č’an kokorun, hič’č’an ʕedeʕaraw šebin šebiƛin.
\m sosi-si yisi-a esi-č’ey iči-a oq-asi zow-n xizyo kid-a xeci-č’i-zaƛ’ esi-n hemedur xan-a mužmar-ł sual neƛ-s hič’č’a-n qˤaba-n hič’č’a-n kokoru-n hič’č’a-n ʕedeʕaraw šebin šebi-ƛin
\g at.first-ATTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG tell-NEG.PST.CVB be-INF begin-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB afterwards daughter-ERG leave-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB tell-PST.UNW so khan-ERG Friday-CONT.ESS question give-PST.WIT the.most-and black-and the.most-and soft-and the.most-and quick thing what-QUOT
\l At first he didn't want to tell it, but then, because his daughter wouldn't leave him, he told: "The king asked a question this Friday: 'What is the blackest, softest and quickest thing?'

\t Nełar žawabtow biqinč’izaƛ’ ƛexasi yoł di q’ʷariłiłerno egin.
\m neła-r žawab-tow b-iqi-č’i-zaƛ’ ƛexu-asi yoł di q’ʷariłi-łer-n egi-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT answer-EMPH III-get-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB remain-RES.PRT be me sadness-CONT.LAT-TOP go.into-PST.UNW
\l Because I could not get an answer to this, I got so sad."

\t Deber riyxa ža huduƛin, esirno babiya kidbeq.
\m mi-r r-iy-x-a ža hudu-ƛin esir-n babi-a kid-q
\g you-LAT IV-know-PRS-Q DEM1.SG so-QUOT ask-PST.UNW dad-ERG daughter-POSS.ESS
\l "So you know it?", the father asked his daughter.

\t Riyxƛin, eƛin kidbä, ža yoł insanes rok’u.
\m r-iy-x-ƛin eƛi-n kid-a ža yoł insan-s rok’u
\g IV-know-PRS-QUOT say-PST.UNW daughter-ERG DEM1.SG be human-GEN1 heart
\l "I know it," said his daughter, "it is the human heart."

\t Bigtow cim bizäsi yałzay ža qˤaba roqxosi, aħin boqno žek’u k’oƛinosi, ʕedeʕaraw ričixosi, awadanłiƛ’ insan yałzay, kokoru ričixosi.
\m b-ig-tow cim b-izi-asi yoł-zay ža qˤaba r-oq-xosi aħi-n b-oq-n žek’u k’oƛi-nosi ʕedeʕaraw r-iči-xosi awadanłi-ƛ’ insan yoł-zay kokoru r-iči-xosi
\g III-much-EMPH malice III-get.up-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB DEM1.SG black IV-become-PRS.PRT alarm-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB man run-ANT.CVB quick IV-be-PRS.PRT joy-SUPER.ESS human be-SIM.CVB soft IV-be-PRS.PRT
\l While one is very angry, it becomes black, when there's alarm and a man runs, it becomes quick, and when a human is in joy, it is soft.

\t Hudayƛ’ayzoni mužmarƛ’ogon xanä esirno, neła däz sualyor žawab besuyä mežurƛin.
\m huday-ƛ’ay-z-ni mužmar-ƛ’-gon xan-a esir-n neła di-z sual-r žawab b-esu-a mežu-r-ƛin
\g next-SUPER.ABL-GEN2-DEF Friday-SUPER.ESS-CNTR khan-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL me-GEN2 question-LAT answer III-find-PST.WIT.INT you(I).PL.OBL-LAT-QUOT
\l The next Friday, the king asked: "Have you found the answer to my question?"

\t Nasin p’estow anusi bičizaƛ’, Muħamadä izin kidbä äsiruxor esin.
\m nasin p’es-tow anu-si b-iči-zaƛ’ Muħamad-a izi-n kid-a esi-ru-xor esi-n
\g all voice-EMPH be.NEG-ATTR III-be-CSL.CVB Muhammad-ERG get.up-PFV.CVB daughter-ERG tell-PST.PRT-AD.LAT tell-PST.UNW
\l Because all were quiet, Muhammad got up and spoke according to what his daughter told him.

\t Xizyo xanä nesiq esirno, räk’iru mužmarƛ’o mi ža esinč’uwa, hoboy łu ža debeq esäƛin.
\m xizyo xan-a nesi-q esir-n r-ik’i-ru mužmar-ƛ’ mi ža esi-č’u-a hoboy łu ža mi-q esi-a-ƛin
\g afterwards khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW IV-go-PST.PRT Friday-SUPER.ESS you DEM1.SG tell-NEG.PST.WIT-Q now who.ERG DEM1.SG you-POSS.ESS tell-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Then the king asked him: "You didn't tell this past Friday, now who told this to you?"

\t Esinč’ey ičäsi zown Muħamadä, xizyo, necetow ƛ’iri xan utizaƛ’, däz kidbä esisƛin eƛin.
\m esi-č’ey iči-asi zow-n Muħamad-a xizyo nece-tow ƛ’iri xan uti-zaƛ’ di-z kid-a esi-s-ƛin eƛi-n
\g tell-NEG.PST.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB Muhammad-ERG afterwards so.much-EMPH above khan turn.back-CSL.CVB me-GEN2 daughter-ERG tell-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l Muhammad wasn't telling it, but then, because the king insisted so much, he said: "My daughter told me."

\t C’aq’ c’odoraw kid yäsu ža debi, dey dowqor sis šebin yoł, ža mi ƛ’iri risa rayƛin eƛin Muħamadqor.
\m c’aq’ c’odoraw kid y-esu ža mi-s di-s mi-qor sis šebin yoł ža mi ƛ’iri r-is-a r-ay-ƛin eƛi-n Muħamad-qor
\g very clever daughter II-exist DEM1.SG you-GEN1 me-GEN1 you-POSS.LAT one thing be DEM1.SG you above IV-take-INF IV-must-QUOT say-PST.UNW Muhammad-POSS.LAT
\l "You seem to have a very clever daughter; I have one thing for you, you have to fulfil it.", he said to Muhammad.

\t Ele enła onočas k’eneč’yabin rižin iduɣorno ik’in, sasaqor k’eneč’yołäy xexoybin roɣno däqor rown horoƛin.
\m ele enła onoču-s k’eneč’-bi-n r-iži-n idu-ɣor-n ik’i-n sasaq-qor k’eneč’-łay xexoy-bi-n r-oɣ-n di-qor r-ow-n horo-ƛin
\g there DEM3b.IISG.OBL hen-GEN1 egg-PL-TOP IV-carry-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL-TOP go-PFV.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT egg-CONT.ABL young.animal-PL-TOP III.PL-hatch-PFV.CVB me-POSS.LAT III.PL-bring-PFV.CVB come.IMPR-QUOT
\l "Here, carry these chicken eggs to your home; tomorrow bring me the chicks that have hatched from the egg."

\t Igtow q’ˤimłerno aɣˤun babiw idur ayn.
\m ig-tow q’ˤim-łer-n aɣˤu-n babiw idu-r ay-n
\g very-EMPH head-CONT.LAT-TOP be.full-PFV.CVB father home-LAT come-PST.UNW
\l The father came home very puzzled.

\t Kidbä esirno, šebi roqno, šida mi necetow pašmanłiƛ’ ičäsiƛin.
\m kid-a esir-n šebi r-oq-n šida mi nece-tow pašmanłi-ƛ’ iči-asi-ƛin
\g daughter-ERG ask-PST.UNW what IV-happen-PST.UNW why you so.much-EMPH sadness-SUPER.ESS be-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l His daughter asked: "What happened? Why are you so sad?"

\t Babiya esin xanä nesiq ƛ’iri risäru łinałäy.
\m babi-a esi-n xan-a nesi-q ƛ’iri r-is-r-ru łina-łay
\g dad-ERG tell-PST.UNW khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS above IV-take-CAUS-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL
\l The father told about what the king told him to fulfil.

\t Žedu k’eneč’yabi na yołƛin, esirno Pat’imatä.
\m žedu k’eneč’-bi na yoł-ƛin esir-n Pat’imat-a
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL egg-PL where be-QUOT ask-PST.UNW Fatima-ERG
\l "Where are these eggs?", asked Fatima.

\t Babiya k’eneč’yabi risno kidbeqor teƛno.
\m babi-a k’eneč’-bi r-is-n kid-qor teƛ-n
\g dad-ERG egg-PL II.PL-take-PFV.CVB daughter-POSS.LAT give-PST.UNW
\l The father took the eggs and gave them to the daughter.

\t Nełagon žedas xawoc’in rodin, hi rac’oƛin, babiwł adäza eqerno.
\m neła-a-gon žeda-s xawoc’i-n r-odi-n hi r-ac’-o-ƛin babiw-ł adäza eqer-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR DEM1.IIPL.OBL-GEN1 omelette-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB take.IMP IV-eat-IMPR-QUOT father-CONT.ESS before put-PST.UNW
\l And she made and omelette out of them and put it before his father: "Here, eat!"

\t Kidbä mołin nesiq, žeda k’eneč’yozałäy raɣruni xexoybi t’or rownäy, mekoyn räxuƛin, eƛo mi xanqor, ele enza ɣˤulaz zarbazałäygon mi žedar teƛanix muhubi rodo, rišerno ruħno bayrno xizyo rowan di žedu t’orƛin.
\m kid-a mołi-n nesi-q žeda k’eneč’-bi-łay r-oɣ-ru-ni xexoy-bi t’o-r r-ow-näy mekod-n r-exu-ƛin eƛi-o mi xan-qor ele enza ɣˤul-z zarba-bi-łay-gon mi žeda-r teƛ-ani-x muhu-bi r-odi-o r-iš-r-n ruħ-n b-ayr-n xizyo r-ow-an di žedu t’o-r-ƛin
\g daughter-ERG teach-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.IIPL.OBL egg-PL-CONT.ABL IV-hatch-PST.PRT-DEF young.animal-PL here-LAT III.PL-bring-CND.CVB be.hungry-PFV.CVB IV-die-QUOT say-IMPR you khan-POSS.LAT there DEM3b.IIPL.OBL stone-GEN2 crushed.stone-PL-CONT.ABL-CNTR you DEM1.IIPL.OBL-LAT give-MSD-AD.ESS granule-PL IV-do-IMPR IV-eat-CAUS-PFV.CVB power-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB afterwards IV-bring-FUT.DEF me DEM1.IIPL.OBL here-LAT-QUOT
\l His daughter explained to him: "'Because I brought these young animals here, which hatched from the eggs, they will die of hunger.', tell this to the king, 'make grain out of these crushed stones to give it to me, I'll feed it and it will bring power to them, afterwards I will bring them here.'"

\t Howži xaner riyn ža äɣurułi.
\m howži xan-r r-iy-n ža eɣu-rułi
\g now khan-LAT IV-know-PST.UNW DEM1.SG be.defeated-MSD
\l Now the king knew that he had been defeated.

\t Sis isno adäz boc’no egirno yisä Muħamad, bexayn žan, ħalalawni reƛ mežan rac’no, ħaramawni där raƛin.
\m sis is-n adäz b-oc’-n egir-n yisi-a Muħamad b-exʷad-n ža-n ħalalaw-ni reƛ meža-a-n r-ac’-n ħaramaw-ni di-r r-a-ƛin
\g one bull-TOP ahead III-drive-PFV.CVB let-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG Muhammad III-slaughter-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP permitted-DEF meat you(II-ERG-TOP IV-eat-PFV.CVB prohibited-DEF me-LAT IV-bring.IMP-QUOT
\l He let Muhammad drive a bull ahead: "Slaughter it, and [y'all] eat the permitted meat, and bring the prohibited [meat] to me!"

\t Madaxaɣor isno boxirno, yisä kidbeq esin, žigoƛ’aygon hemediw šebin daq ƛ’iri risrersiƛin.
\m ma-xaɣor is-n b-oxir-n yisi-a kid-q esi-n žigo-ƛ’ay-gon hemediw šebin di-q ƛ’iri r-is-r-r-s-ƛin
\g yard-AD.VERS bull-TOP III-chase-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG daughter-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW again-SUPER.ABL-CNTR such.a thing me-POSS.ESS above IV-take-CAUS-CAUS-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l He chased the bull to the yard and told his daughter: "And once again he lets me fulfil such a thing."

\t Ža bihayaw šebin yołƛin, eƛin kidbä.
\m ža bihayaw šebin yoł-ƛin eƛi-n kid-a
\g DEM1.SG easy thing be-QUOT say-PST.UNW daughter-ERG
\l "It's an easy thing.", said his daughter.

\t Xizyo neła babiw is bexada egirno.
\m xizyo neła-a babiw is b-exʷad-a egir-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG father bull III-slaughter-INF let-PST.UNW
\l Then she let her father slaughter the bull.

\t Režet’ani ƛoħazaɣor reƛno riħurno, waħaza c’i erno.
\m r-eže-t’a-ni ƛoħo-bi-aɣor reƛ-n r-iħur-n waħo-aza c’i er-n
\g IV-big-DISTR-DEF pan-PL-IN.VERS meat-TOP IV-pour-PFV.CVB below-IN.VERS.DIST fire set.up-PST.UNW
\l They poured the meat into big pans and set up a fire below.

\t ʕAƛos nasin žamaʕatno butirno, reƛis ric’xot’a ħurubi eqerno žeduł adäza.
\m ʕaƛ-s nasin žamaʕat-n b-utir-n reƛ-s r-ic’-x-t’a ħuru-bi eqer-n žedu-ł adäza
\g village-GEN1 all population-TOP III-gather-PFV.CVB meat-GEN1 IV-fill-IPFV.CVB-DISTR basin-PL put-PST.UNW DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS before
\l They gathered the village's entire population and put basins filled with meat before them.

\t Nazołno adäzagon kidbä sist’a nigaɣˤič’is t’it’u eqerno, mežuz k’icazał räk’iru reƛ roɣno enłaƛ’ eqroƛin.
\m nazo-ł-n adäza-gon kid-a sist’a nigaɣˤič’i-s t’it’u eqer-n mežu-z k’icu-bi-ł r-ik’i-ru reƛ r-oɣ-n enła-ƛ’ eqer-o-ƛin
\g all.OBL-CONT.ESS-TOP before-CNTR girl-ERG one.at.a.time cloth-GEN1 piece put-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-GEN2 tooth-PL-CONT.ESS IV-go-PST.PRT meat IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM3b.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS put-IMPR-QUOT
\l In front of everyone, the girl put a piece of cloth: "[Y'all] take the meat that is stuck between your teeth and put it on it."

\t Nasin bišno-butin maħor bik’inosi, xalq’imo k’icazałäy raɣruni reƛ Pat’imatä rutirno.
\m nasin b-iš~uti-n maħor b-ik’i-nosi xalq’i-a k’icu-bi-łay r-oɣ-ru-ni reƛ Pat’imat-a r-utir-n
\g all I.PL-eat-PFV.CVB outside I.PL-go-ANT.CVB people-ERG tooth-PL-CONT.ABL IV-take.away-PST.PRT-DEF meat Fatima-ERG IV-gather-PST.UNW
\l They all ate and after they went outside, Fatima gathered the meat that the people took out of their teeth.

\t Sida ħiƛ’oquqno rutirno xanƛ’or regirno, ele enda ħaramaw reƛ yołƛin.
\m sida ħiƛ’oqu-q-n r-utir-n xan-ƛ’or r-egir-n ele enda ħaramaw reƛ yoł-ƛin
\g one.OBL handkerchief-POSS.ESS-TOP IV-gather-PFV.CVB khan-SUPER.LAT IV-send-PST.UNW there DEM3b.SG prohibited meat be-QUOT
\l They gathered it in one handkerchief and sent it to the king: "There is the prohibited meat."

\t ʕUraw ħayran oqno xan, neła kidbes c’odorłin ʕaq’ilłin rukayn.
\m ʕuraw ħayran oq-n xan neła kid-s c’odorłi-n ʕaq’ilłi-n r-ukad-n
\g very be.astonished become-PFV.CVB khan DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-GEN1 cleverness-and intelligence-and IV.PL-see-PST.UNW
\l The king became very suprised, and he saw that girl's cleverness and intelligence.

\t Ža kid mi däx yegira yayƛin, yisä Muħamadqor eƛin.
\m ža kid mi di-x y-egir-a y-ay-ƛin yisi-a Muħamad-qor eƛi-n
\g DEM1.SG girl you me-AD.ESS II-send-INF II-must-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG Muhammad-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l "You must marry this girl off to me!", he said to Muhammad.

\t Yegirxanuƛin et’un k’oƛin ičäsi zown yeda.
\m y-egir-x-anu-ƛin et’u-n k’oƛi-n iči-asi zow-n yeda
\g II-send-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT jump-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG
\l "I won't marry her off.", he jumped up.

\t Igtow xan ƛ’iri utinosi, yisä roži teƛno.
\m ig-tow xan ƛ’iri uti-nosi yisi-a roži teƛ-n
\g much-EMPH khan above turn-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG word give-PST.UNW
\l After the king insisted so much, he gave his word.

\t Xanä yisił adäza sual erno, kid yižiƛ’oräy bodač’in berten, nagaħ yoxiraniƛ’or yaynäy, hemełƛ’o bodanƛin.
\m xan-a yisi-ł adäza sual er-n kid y-iži-ƛ’oräy b-odi-ač’in berten nagaħ y-oxir-ani-ƛ’or y-ay-näy hemeł-ƛ’ b-odi-an-ƛin
\g khan-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before question put-PST.UNW girl II-lead-SIM.CVB III-do-NEG.FUT.DEF marriage suppose II-chase-MSD-SUPER.LAT II-must-CND.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS III-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The king asked him a question: "While I am going to marry the girl, I will not make a wedding; if I have to chase her away, I will do it."

\t Nełaƛ’no kidbes babiw razin oqno, berten boynč’eytown xanxo Pat’imatno yegirno.
\m neła-ƛ’-n kid-s babiw razi-n oq-n berten b-odi-č’ey-tow-n xan-x Pat’imat-n y-egir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP girl-GEN1 father agree-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB marriage III-do-NEG.PST.CVB-EMPH-TOP khan-AD.ESS Fatima-TOP II-send-PST.UNW
\l After that, the girl's father agreed and married Fatima off to the king without having a wedding.

\t Idur yižinosi xanä nełaq riyrno, nagaħ daʕban boqno dowder žek’ubi baynäy, mi ža t’ubazi badino, nagaħ mi ža t’ubazi bodinäy, mi di yoxira yołƛin.
\m idu-r y-iži-nosi xan-a neła-q r-iyr-n nagaħ daʕba-n b-oq-n mi-der žek’u-bi b-ay-näy mi ža t’ubazi b-odi-n nagaħ mi ža t’ubazi b-odi-näy mi di y-oxir-a yoł-ƛin
\g home-LAT II-lead-ANT.CVB khan-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-explain-PST.UNW suppose dispute-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB you-APUD.LAT man-PL III-come-CND.CVB you DEM1.SG fulfill III-do-PROHIB suppose you DEM1.SG fulfill III-do-CND.CVB you me II-chase-INF be-QUOT
\l After leading her home, the king explained to her: "If a dispute arises and men will come to you, don't fulfill [their requests]; if you do fulfill them, I will chase you away."

\t Nełƛ’osi, łˤono ɣudin rik’in uyra äƛiru ɣudƛ’o sidä sideł daʕban boqno yiłader q’ˤano žek’u ayn.
\m nełƛ’osi łˤono ɣudi-n r-ik’i-n uyno äƛiru ɣudi-ƛ’ sida-a sida-ł daʕba-n b-oq-n yiła-der q’ˤano žek’u ay-n
\g of.that.time three day-TOP IV-go-PFV.CVB four ORD day-SUPER.ESS one.OBL-IN.ESS one.OBL-CONT.ESS dispute-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT two man come-PST.UNW
\l After that, three days passed and on the fourth day two men came to her who had a dispute among them.

\t Pat’imatä esirno, łinałäy mežus daʕbaƛin.
\m Pat’imat-a esir-n łina-łay mežu-s daʕba-ƛin
\g Fatima-ERG ask-PST.UNW what.OBL-CONT.ABL you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 dispute-QUOT
\l Fatima asked: "What is your dispute about?"

\t Sidä eƛin, yisä däqay moƛał ʕazar ɣuruš yoɣäsi zows, hoboy ža yisä xizor neƛxanuƛin.
\m sida-a eƛi-n yisi-a di-qay moƛu-ł ʕazar ɣˤuruš y-oɣ-asi zow-s hoboy ža yisi-a xizor neƛ-x-anu-ƛin
\g one.OBL-IN.ESS say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG me-POSS.ABL dream-CONT.ESS thousand ruble II-take.away-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT now DEM1.SG DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG back give-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l One said: "He took a thousand rubles away from me in my dream, now he doesn't give them back to me."

\t Hoq’ˤonägon eƛin, di yisiqay kapekkin yisäsi anuƛin.
\m hoq’ˤo-ni-a-gon eƛi-n di yisi-qay kapek-kin y-is-asi anu-ƛin
\g other-DEF-ERG-CNTR say-PST.UNW me DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL kopeck-even II-take-RES.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l The other one said: "I didn't even take one kopeck from him."

\t Yiła yiziqor eƛin, sis guluƛ’ zown, sideni q’ˤidan ik’in, buq betunosi xizyo žek’us ɣedun bown ent’or horo mežiƛin.
\m yiła-a yizi-qor eƛi-n sis gulu-ƛ’ zow-n sideni q’ˤida-n ik’i-n buq b-etu-nosi xizyo žek’u-s ɣedu-n b-ow-n ent’o-r horo meži-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW one horse-SUPER.ESS ride-PFV.CVB the.other.one down-TOP go-PFV.CVB sun III-set-ANT.CVB after man-GEN1 shade-TOP III-get-PFV.CVB here-LAT come.IMPR you.PL-QUOT
\l She said to them: "One will ride on a horse and the other one will walk below; after the sun has set, get me a man's shadow and come here!"

\t Ɣedu biqiranƛin bik’inƛax žedu, mark’ač’uxar xizor butin bayn, eluq ɣedu biqinč’uƛin.
\m ɣedu b-iqir-an-ƛin b-ik’i-n-ƛax žedu mark’ač’u-xar xizor b-uti-n b-ay-n elu-q ɣedu b-iqi-č’u-ƛin
\g shade III-take.away-FUT.DEF-QUOT I.PL-go-PFV.CVB-QUOT DEM1.IPL twilight-AD.VERS back I.PL-turn.back-PFV.CVB I.PL-come-PFV.CVB we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS shade III-get-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "We will take the shadow", and they went on and came back in the twilight: "We didn't get the shadow."

\t Moƛał rukayru šebinon hemedurtow eluq riqixosi anuƛin, Pat’imatä žedu xizor boxirno.
\m moƛu-ł r-ukad-ru šebinon hemedur-tow elu-q r-iqi-xosi anu-ƛin Pat’imat-a žedu xizor b-oxir-n
\g dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-PST.PRT something so-EMPH we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS IV-get-PRS.PRT be.NEG-QUOT Fatima-ERG DEM1.IPL back I.PL-chase-PST.UNW
\l "Likewise we cannot get something that we saw in a dream.", Fatima said and chased them back.

\t Xizyo xaner riyn neła q’ˤuna žek’us zawru daʕba łiyärułi.
\m xizyo xan-r r-iy-n neła-a q’ˤuna žek’u-s zow-ru daʕba łiyr-rułi
\g afterwards khan-LAT IV-know-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG two.OBL man-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.PRT dispute finish-MSD
\l Afterwards the king found out that she had finished the two men's dispute.

\t Ža yoxärus, äƛiruxor, xanä bertenno bodin, deber rätiru šebinon riso iduɣor yik’iƛin riyrno.
\m ža y-oxir-ru-s eƛi-ru-xor xan-a berten-n b-odi-n mi-r r-eti-ru šebinon r-is-o idu-ɣor y-ik’i-ƛin r-iyr-n
\g DEM1.SG II-chase-PST.PRT-GEN1 say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT khan-ERG marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB you-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT something IV-take-IMPR home-IN.ALL II-go-QUOT IV-explain-PST.UNW
\l The king, as he had said, organized a wedding on the [day of the] divorce and explained: "Take everything you want and go home!"

\t Xizyo yiła idäy rätiru łinasno hokon bic’no, wazirzaqorgon eƛin, hokomƛ’aɣor xan izirƛin.
\m xizyo yiła-a idu-ay r-eti-ru łina-s-n hoko-n b-ic’-n wazir-bi-qor-gon eƛi-n hoko-ƛ’aɣor xan izir-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG home-IN.ABL IV-want-PST.PRT what.OBL-GEN1-TOP carriage-TOP III-fill-PFV.CVB vizier-PL-POSS.LAT-CNTR say-PST.UNW carriage-SUPER.VERS khan lift-QUOT
\l Afterwards, she filled a carriage with what she wanted and said to the vizier: "Lift the king onto the carriage!"

\t Žeda isno hokomƛ’o ħaliłäsi xan eqerno.
\m žedu-a is-n hoko-ƛ’ ħalił-asi xan eqer-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG take-PFV.CVB carriage-SUPER.ESS get.drunk-RES.PRT khan put-PST.UNW
\l They took the drunken king and put him onto the carriage.

\t Roc’no isʷan, babiwz ʕaƛaɣorno yezun Pat’imatno yik’ix zown.
\m r-oc’-n is-bi-n babiw-z ʕaƛ-aɣor-n y-ezu-n Pat’imat-n y-ik’i-x zow-n
\g III.PL-drive-PFV.CVB bull-PL-TOP father-GEN2 village-IN.VERS-TOP II-look-PFV.CVB Fatima-TOP II-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Fatima drove the bulls and went looking toward her father's village.

\t Hemedur ħonbin, iħubin, xecin nexƛ’oräy, sidaɣ keroqor baynosi hoko buta boqno.
\m hemedur ħon-bi-n iħu-bi-n xeci-n nex-ƛ’oräy sidaɣ kero-qor b-ay-nosi hoko b-uti-a b-oq-n
\g so mountain-PL-and river-PL-and leave-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB in.one.place ravine-POSS.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB carriage III-turn-INF III-begin-PST.UNW
\l So while they left mountains and rivers behind, they came to a ravine and began to turn the carriage.

\t Zek’ egin xan č’ariłno.
\m zek’ egi-n xan č’arił-n
\g jerk let.go-PFV.CVB khan wake.up-PST.UNW
\l The king shuddered and woke up.

\t Puräza barun hokomƛ’on zown ik’ixƛax.
\m pu-aza baru-n hoko-ƛ’-n zow-n ik’i-x-ƛax
\g side-IN.VERS.DIST wife-TOP carriage-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB go-PRS-QUOT
\l Apparently he was riding on a carriage next to his wife.

\t Mi di naɣor ižixƛin, esirno yisä.
\m mi di na-aɣor iži-x-ƛin esir-n yisi-a
\g you me where-IN.VERS lead-PRS-QUOT ask-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "Where are you leading me?", he asked.

\t Elus q’ut’i zownč’a där rätiru šebin sadaq rižanix regira, din där rätiru šebin hokomƛ’o ersiƛin.
\m elu-s q’ut’i zow-č’u-a di-r r-eti-ru šebin sadaq r-iži-ani-x r-egir-a di-n di-r r-eti-ru šebin hoko-ƛ’ er-s-ƛin
\g we(I).OBL-GEN1 agreement be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT.INT me-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT thing all IV-carry-MSD-AD.ESS IV-let-INF me-TOP me-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT thing carriage-SUPER.ESS put-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "Didn't we have an agreement so you let me carry all the things I wanted? I put the things I wanted onto the carriage."

\t Nedur resunäy hoko xizor butirƛin, eƛin xanä.
\m nedur r-esu-näy hoko xizor b-utir-ƛin eƛi-n xan-a
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB carriage back III-turn-QUOT say-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l "If that's the case, turn the carriage back!", said the king.

\t Xizor utin Pat’imatno yižin nesä nesiz ʕaƛaɣorno ik’in, mi däƛ’ay ʕaq’ilawn, c’odorawn zownƛin xanłin nełaqor teƛno žan paraxat ičin.
\m xizor uti-n Pat’imat-n y-iži-n nesi-a nesi-z ʕaƛ-aɣor-n ik’i-n mi di-ƛ’ay ʕaq’ilaw-n c’odoraw-n zow-n-ƛin xanłi-n neła-qor teƛ-n ža-n paraxat iči-n
\g back turn.back-PFV.CVB Fatima-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 village-IN.VERS-TOP go-PST.UNW you me-SUPER.ABL intelligent-and clever-and be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT khanate-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT give-PST.UNW DEM1.SG-TOP calmly live-PST.UNW
\l He returned with Fatima into his own village: "You are more intelligent and cleverer than me!", gave her the kingdom and lived calmly ever after.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay!
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Xediw zown ʕaƛatow ci rik’äsi q’ebed.
\m xediw zow-n ʕaƛ-a-tow ci r-ik’i-asi q’ebed
\g husband be.NPRS-PST.UNW village-IN.ESS-EMPH name IV-go-RES.PRT smith
\l The husband was a famous smith in the village.

\t Babiya žaqor eƛin, elin bežet’a bizin ži, deberno maʕišat betix boqzaƛ’, q’ebedłiƛ’or ruhun oqƛin.
\m babi-a uži-qor eƛi-n eli-n b-eže-t’a b-izi-n ži mi-r-n maʕišat b-eti-x b-oq-zaƛ’ q’ebed-łi-ƛ’or ruhun oq-ƛin
\g dad-ERG son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW we-TOP I.PL-old-DISTR I.PL-get-PFV.CVB now you-LAT-TOP fortune III-want-IPFV.CVB III-begin-CSL.CVB smith-NMLZ-SUPER.LAT learn become-QUOT
\l The father said to his son: "We are getting old now, when you begin to want [to make] a fortune, learn to work as a smith!"

\t Užiz rok’ä bisnoanu babiws maxšel.
\m uži-z rok’u-a b-is-n-anu babiw-s maxšel
\g son-GEN2 heart-IN.ESS III-take-PFV.CVB-NEG father-GEN1 skill
\l The son didn't want to take over the father's skill.

\t Baq’ˤu mix bik’izaƛ’ortow babiwn exun nesis, xizaygon eniwn yexun, sisxoli uži ƛexun.
\m b-aq’ˤu mix b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow babiw-n exu-n nesi-s xizay-gon eniw-n y-exu-n sisxoli uži ƛexu-n
\g III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH father-and die-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 behind-CNTR mother-and II-die-PFV.CVB alone son remain-PST.UNW
\l Before a long time had passed, his father died and afterwards his mother died, and the son remained alone.

\t Nagaħ uži miskinłiƛ’or aynäy, babiyä kobora teł eqerno xecäsi micxiryosno, mesedyosno ric’äsi ixin zown.
\m nagaħ uži miskinłi-ƛ’or ay-näy babi-a koboro-a teł eqer-n xeci-asi micxir-s-n mesed-s-n r-ic’-asi ixin zow-n
\g suppose boy poverty-SUPER.LAT come-CND.CVB dad-ERG granary-IN.ESS inside put-PFV.CVB leave-RES.PRT money-GEN1-TOP gold-GEN1-TOP IV-fill-RES.PRT bag be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In case the boy would hit poverty, there was a bag filled with money and gold left inside the granary, put there by the father.

\t Sida quł q’ebedes uži istolowäɣor išanix ik’in.
\m sida qu-ł q’ebed-s uži istolow-aɣor iš-ani-x ik’i-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS smith-GEN1 son dining.room-IN.VERS eat-MSD-AD.ESS go-PST.UNW
\l One day the smith's son went to eat in the dining room.

\t Hemediwtow best’alaw uži nesir elo esun išanix q’ˤida ičäsi.
\m hemediw-tow best’alaw uži nesi-r elo esu-n iš-ani-x q’ˤida iči-asi
\g such.a-EMPH orphan boy DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT there find-PFV.CVB eat-MSD-AD.ESS down sit-RES.PRT
\l There he found a similar orphan boy sitting down to eat.

\t Nesä q’ebedzo žaqor eƛin, sosi däq yałru micxir bac’no łiyran, xizyo dowqosi łiyranƛin.
\m nesi-a q’ebed-z uži-qor eƛi-n sosi di-q yoł-ru micxir b-ac’-n łiyr-an xizyo mi-q-si łiyr-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG smith-GEN2 son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW at.first me-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT money III-eat-PFV.CVB finish-FUT.CVB afterwards you-POSS.ESS-ATTR finish-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l He said to the smith's son: "First we'll spend my money, then we'll spend yours."

\t Hemedur q’ˤunesno micxirno łiyn, babiya žarƛin c’unzi rodin xecin zawruni micxiryosno, mesedyosno ixinno łiyrno yizä.
\m hemedur q’ˤuna-s-n micxir-n łiy-n babi-a uži-r-ƛin c’unzi r-odi-n xeci-n zow-ru-ni micxir-s-n mesed-s-n ixin-n łiyr-n yizi-a
\g so two.OBL-GEN1-TOP money-TOP end-PFV.CVB dad-ERG son-LAT-QUOT guard IV-do-PFV.CVB leave-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF money-GEN1-and gold-GEN1-and bag-TOP finish-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL-ERG
\l So the two guys' money was finished, and the bag of money and gold that the father left for his son they finished as well.

\t Ist’olowä äsuruni q’ebedzo užä eƛin, ɣudes ʕazart’a ɣuruš yiqixozo mečoƛ’or mi di egiranƛin.
\m istolow-a esu-ru-ni q’ebed-z uži-a eƛi-n ɣudes ʕazar-t’a ɣˤuruš y-iqi-xozo moči-ƛ’or mi di egir-an-ƛin
\g dining.room-IN.ESS find-PST.PRT-DEF smith-GEN2 son-ERG say-PST.UNW daily thousand-DISTR ruble II-get-PRS.PRT.OBL place-SUPER.LAT you me let-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The smith's son said to the one he found in the dining room: "I'll send you to a place where you can get thousand rubles a day."

\t Ža didurƛin yisä esirnosi, nesi užä eƛin, sis ħumukulin bisno, neła tełäy axorekasin roɣno elo teł mi eqra ayƛin.
\m ža didur-ƛin yisi-a esir-nosi nesi uži-a eƛi-n sis ħumukuli-n b-is-n neła-a teł-ay axorekasi-n r-oɣ-n elo teł mi eqer-a ay-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG how-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG say-PST.UNW one camel-TOP III-buy-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG inside-IN.ABL giblets-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB there inside you put-INF must-QUOT
\l When he asked: "How that?", the boy said: "You must buy a camel, remove its giblets and put yourself inside!

\t Xizyo neła mi ʕazart’a ʕuruš yiqixozo mečoƛ’or ayärƛin.
\m xizyo neła-a mi ʕazar-t’a ɣˤuruš y-iqi-xozo moči-ƛ’or ayr-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS you thousand-DISTR ruble II-get-PRS.PRT.OBL place-SUPER.LAT bring-QUOT
\l Then it will bring you to the place where you get thousand rubles."

\t Ħumukulin bisno yizä, tełäy axorekasin roɣno, nełaz axä tełxor q’ebedes uži egirno.
\m ħumukuli-n b-is-n yizi-a teł-ay axorekasi-n r-oɣ-n neła-z ax-a teł-xor q’ebed-s uži egir-n
\g camel-TOP III-buy-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG inside-IN.ABL giblets-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 belly-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT smith-GEN1 son let-PST.UNW
\l They bought a camel, removed its giblets and let the smith's son inside its belly.

\t Xizyo neła ħumukulä ža sida ħonƛ’or ayrno.
\m xizyo neła ħumukuli-a ža sida ħon-ƛ’or ayr-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL camel-ERG DEM1.SG one.OBL mountain-SUPER.LAT bring-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards that camel brought him onto a mountain.

\t Elo yisir besun bexasin, untaraw bexaniƛ’or bayäsin xalq’i.
\m elo yisi-r b-esu-n b-exu-asi-n untaraw b-exu-ani-ƛ’or b-ay-asi-n xalq’i
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT III-find-PST.UNW III-die-RES.PRT-and sick III-die-MSD-SUPER.LAT III-must-RES.PRT-TOP people
\l There he found dead and terminally ill people.

\t Žeda yisiqor eƛin, wey uži, mi łinar t’aɣor nexä, eluƛ’ yałru ʕazabno, ʕaq’uban bukayxanä deberƛin.
\m žedu-a yisi-qor eƛi-n wey uži mi łinar t’o-aɣor nex-a elu-ƛ’ yoł-ru ʕazab-n ʕaq’uba-n b-ukad-x-anu-a mi-r-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW hey boy you why here-IN.VERS come-PST.WIT.INT we(I).OBL-SUPER.ESS be-PST.PRT torture-and torture-and III-see-PRS-NEG-Q you-LAT-QUOT
\l They said to him: "Hey boy, why have you come here; don't you see the torture and pain that is upon us?

\t Xexłiƛ’ t’ay xizor ik’iƛin, qˤaƛanayn žedu q’ebedzo užiqor.
\m xexłi-ƛ’ t’ay xizor ik’i-ƛin qˤaƛanad-n žedu q’ebed-z uži-qor
\g quickness-SUPER.ESS from.here back go-QUOT yell-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL smith-GEN2 son-POSS.LAT
\l Get back away quickly!", they yelled at the smith's son.

\t Elay izin ik’in yeda, ʕazara ƛˤeba ik’in, ʕazara ɣudi ik’in, sida iħuz lilyoxor ayn.
\m ele-ay izi-n ik’i-n yeda ʕazar ƛˤeb-a ik’i-n ʕazar ɣudi ik’i-n sida iħu-z lilyo-xor ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL get-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG thousand year-IN.ESS go-PFV.CVB thousand day go-PFV.CVB one.OBL river-GEN2 river.bank-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l From there he got away and went on a thousand years and a thousand days and came to a riverbank.

\t Xot’on pˤaƛirno ʕoƛ’un iħułxor yeda ik’iƛ’oräy, reƛ’iƛer yäqiru t’it’oraq exoriłno ƛexun.
\m xot’o-n pˤaƛir-n ˤoƛ’u-n iħu-łxor yeda ik’i-ƛ’oräy reƛ’a-ƛer y-iqi-ru t’it’ora-q exorił-n ƛexu-n
\g foot-TOP glide.off-PFV.CVB fall-PFV.CVB river-CONT.VERS DEM2.ISG go-SIM.CVB hand-SUB.LAT II-hold-PST.PRT shrubbery-POSS.ESS hang-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l His foot glided off and while he was falling into the river, he could hold to a bush with his hand.

\t Elaygon izin ik’in yeda hemełatow iħuz lilyox qoqbi yałza mečoƛ’or ayn.
\m ele-ay-gon izi-n ik’i-n yeda hemeła-tow iħu-z lilyo-x qoq-bi yoł-za moči-ƛ’or ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR get.up-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH river-GEN2 river.bank-AD.ESS cliff-PL be-LCV place-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He got up from there, went along that river bank and came to a place where a cliff was.

\t Elaz egin oqanƛin zawru yeda iħułxor ʕoƛ’un ik’in besuroz haqar keze oqno.
\m ele-az egi-n oq-an-ƛin zow-ru yeda iħu-łxor ˤoƛ’u-n ik’i-n besuro-z haqu-ar keze oq-n
\g there-IN.ESS.DIST go.into-PFV.CVB become-FUT.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.PRT DEM2.ISG river-CONT.VERS fall-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB fish-GEN2 mouth-IN.LAT meet become-PST.UNW
\l He was about to go that way, but fell into the river and into the jaws of a fish.

\t Neła esirno, bitazoni puƛ’aɣorä oɣan, ent’azoni puƛ’aɣorä oɣanƛin.
\m neła-a esir-n bitasi-ni pu-ƛ’aɣor-a oɣ-an ent’a-azo-ni pu-ƛ’aɣor-a oɣ-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW next-DEF side-SUPER.VERS-Q take.away-FUT.CVB from.here-RES.PRT.OBL-DEF side-SUPER.VERS-Q take.away-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l It asked: "Shall I take you to the next side, or to this side here?"

\t Nesi užä besuroqor eƛin, bitazoni puƛ’aɣor oɣoƛin.
\m nesi uži-a besuro-qor eƛi-n bitasi-ni pu-ƛ’aɣor oɣ-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG fish-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW next-DEF side-SUPER.VERS take.away-IMPR-QUOT
\l The boy said to the fish: "Take me to the next side!"

\t Elo yisir zirun, zeyn besun daʕbał gulun, ħurženyabin, dabaɣyołäy bodalini k’ukno riłu rodin žeda žeduƛ’ rułira koƛ’inč’ey ƛexasi.
\m elo yisi-r ziru-n zey-n b-esu-n daʕba-ł gulu-n ħuržen-bi-n dabaɣ-łay b-odi-ali-ni k’uk-n riłu r-odi-n žedu-a žedu-ƛ’ r-ułir-a koƛ’i-č’ey ƛexu-asi
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT fox-and bear-and III-find-PFV.CVB dispute-CONT.ESS horse-and bag-PL-TOP leather-CONT.ABL III-do-ATTR-DEF cap-and equality IV-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS IV-share-INF understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB remain-RES.PRT
\l There he found a fox and a bear arguing, as they didn't know how to share among them a horse, bags and a cap made of leather equally.

\t Zira eƛix zown, ħurženyabin, k’ukno där keze roqxoƛin.
\m ziru-a eƛi-x zow-n ħuržen-bi-n k’uk-n di-r keze r-oq-x-ƛin
\g fox-ERG say-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW bag-PL-and cap-and me-LAT meet III.PL-become-PRS-QUOT
\l The fox was saying: "The bags and the cap belong to me!"

\t Zeygon bet’un k’oƛin bičäsi zown, ħurženyabin, gulun där biča bayƛin.
\m zey-gon b-et’u-n k’oƛi-n b-iči-asi zow-n ħuržen-bi-n gulu-n di-r b-iči-a b-ay-ƛin
\g bear-CNTR III-jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB III-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW bag-PL-and horse-and me-LAT III-be-INF III-must-QUOT
\l And the bear jumped and was like: "The bags and the horse must be for me!"

\t Howži yeda q’ebedes uži ƛ’irir aynosi, zeyän, ziran yisiq harizi rodin howziri łˤonon: gulun, ħurženyabin, k’ukno eluƛ’ riłixor rułirƛin.
\m howži yeda q’ebed-s uži ƛ’iri-r ay-nosi zey-a-n ziru-a-n yisi-q harizi r-odi-n howziri łˤono-n gulu-n ħuržen-bi-n k’uk-n elu-ƛ’ riłu-xor r-ułir-ƛin
\g now DEM2.ISG smith-GEN1 son above-LAT come-ANT.CVB bear-ERG-and fox-ERG-and DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PFV.CVB DEM3.IPL three-TOP horse-and bag-PL-and cap-and we(I).OBL-SUPER.ESS equality-AD.LAT III.PL-share-QUOT
\l Now that the son of the smith came, the bear and the fox asked him: "Share these three items: the horse, the bags and the cap among us equally!"

\t Yisä eƛin, di c’eruc’as hil kurnosi, adäza ža däqor xizor yutirno yayäru rätiru šebin žeda łˤorałäyn łet’a begira yołƛin.
\m yisi-a eƛi-n di c’eruc’a-s hil kur-nosi adäza ža di-qor xizor y-utir-n y-ayr-ru r-eti-ru šebin žedu-a łˤora-łay-n łet’i-a b-egir-a yoł-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me bow-GEN1 arrow shoot.from-ANT.CVB before DEM1.SG me-POSS.LAT back II-turn-PFV.CVB II-bring-PST.PRT IV-want-PST.PRT thing DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG three.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP pick-INF III-let-INF be-QUOT
\l He said: "After I have shot an arrow, the one who brings it back first, I will let pick the thing he wants from the three items."

\t Žedun razi roqno, kurno yisä c’eruc’as hil.
\m žedu-n razi r-oq-n kur-n yisi-a c’eruc’a-s hil
\g DEM1.IIPL-TOP agree II.PL-become-PFV.CVB shoot.from-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG bow-GEN1 arrow
\l They agreed and he shot the arrow.

\t Nełał xizaygon zirun zeyn durimoƛ’ k’oƛin rik’in.
\m neła-ł xizay-gon ziru-n zey-n durimoƛ’ k’oƛi-n r-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind-CNTR fox-and bear-and running run-PFV.CVB III.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l The fox and the bear went running behind it.

\t Yedagon et’un k’oƛin guluƛ’orno izin, xizazagon ħurženyabin ricin, q’ˤimƛ’ogon k’ukno erno elay bitor oxin.
\m yeda-gon et’u-n k’oƛi-n gulu-ƛ’or-n izi-n xizaz-a-gon ħuržen-bi-n r-ici-n q’ˤim-ƛ’-gon k’uk-n er-n ele-ay bitor oxi-n
\g DEM2.ISG-CNTR jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.LAT-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB behind-IN.ESS-CNTR bag-PL-and III.PL-tie-PFV.CVB head-SUPER.ESS-CNTR cap-TOP put-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL thither run.away-PST.UNW
\l He, however, jumped onto the horse, tied the bags onto it, put the cap onto his head and rode away from there.

\t Ayn ža sidaɣ ixiw gogaƛ’or.
\m ay-n ža sidaɣ ixiw goga-ƛ’or
\g come-PST.UNW DEM1.SG in.one.place big meadow-SUPER.LAT
\l And he came to some big meadow.

\t Elo räsuru ɣˤutkaɣor ik’inosi, teł qartay yołƛax, q’ˤunader čˤaƛin kočorin q’ˤidan yičin yičäsi.
\m elo r-esu-ru ɣˤutku-aɣor ik’i-nosi teł qartay yoł-ƛax q’ˤuna-der čˤaƛi-n kočori-n q’ˤida-n y-iči-n y-iči-asi
\g there IV-exist-PST.PRT house-IN.VERS go-ANT.CVB inside witch be-QUOT two.OBL-APUD.LAT pour.out-PFV.CVB forelock-TOP down-PFV.CVB II-sit-PFV.CVB II-be-RES.PRT
\l When he went into a house that stood there, inside there was supposed to be a witch, that was sitting down with hear hear spread.

\t Tełer ayrun yisä sida reƛ’id nełas kočori biqirno, sidenigon reƛ’id hibon bisno žek’no yedu, neła mi dey uži yołƛin eƛace.
\m tełer ay-run yisi-a sida reƛ’a-d neła-s kočori b-iqir-n sideni-gon reƛ’a-d hibo-n b-is-n žek’-n yedu neła-a mi di-s uži yoł-ƛin eƛi-ace
\g to.the.inside come-IMM.ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG one.OBL hand-INSTR DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 forelock III-take.away-PFV.CVB the.other.one-CNTR hand-INSTR stick-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB beat-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you me-GEN1 son be-QUOT say-TERM
\l Immediately after going inside, he took her hair with one hand and took a stick with the other hand and hit her until she said: "You're my son!"

\t Däq hemedur eƛin rok’łinč’us yołiƛin, eƛin qartayä, di mi aħirno, ešayn ac’a zowsƛin.
\m di-q hemedur eƛi-n rok’u-łi-č’u-si yołi-ƛin eƛi-n qartay-a di mi aħi-r-n ešad-n ac’-a zow-s-ƛin
\g me-POSS.ESS so say-PST.UNW heart-NMLZ-NEG.PST.WIT-ATTR if-QUOT say-PST.UNW witch-ERG me you cook-CAUS-PFV.CVB bake-PFV.CVB eat-INF be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "If I hadn't said so," the with said, "I would've cooked, baked and eaten you!"

\t Elo q’ebedes užin xecin xizyo qartay ħadur yoqno yik’anix.
\m elo q’ebed-s uži-n xeci-n xizyo qartay ħadur y-oq-n y-ik’i-ani-x
\g there smith-GEN1 son-TOP leave-PFV.CVB afterwards witch prepare II-become-PFV.CVB II-go-MSD-AD.ESS
\l And the witch prepared to go away, leaving the smith's son there.

\t Mi nar yik’ixƛin, esirno uža yiłaq neła eƛin, nar yik’ixosi debeq di äsinč’i, łˤora beciƛ’aza gurow di yayxosi anuƛin.
\m mi nar y-ik’i-x-ƛin esir-n uži-a yiła-q neła-a eƛi-n nar y-ik’i-xosi mi-q di esi-č’i łˤora buci-ƛ’aza gurow di y-ay-xosi anu-ƛin
\g you where II-go-PRS-QUOT ask-PFV.CVB boy-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW where II-go-PRS.PRT you-POSS.ESS me tell-NEG.FUT.CVB three.OBL month-SUPER.VERS.DIST except me II-come-PRS.PRT be.absent-QUOT
\l "Where are you going?", asked the boy her, and she said: "I won't tell you where I am going, and I won't come back before the next three months."

\t Xizyo neła nesiqor kinaw ɣˤutkozas rekarbi teƛno, di yayace mi t’o iči, elo waħozoni ɣˤutka tełxor äk’inoƛin riyrno qartayä nesiq.
\m xizyo neła-a nesi-qor kinaw ɣˤutku-bi-s reka-bi teƛ-n di y-ay-ace mi t’o iči elo waħo-zo-ni ɣˤutku-a teł-xor ik’i-n-ƛin r-iyr-n qartay-a nesi-q
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT entire room-PL-GEN1 key-PL give-PFV.CVB me II-come-TERM you here live there below-ATTR.OBL-DEF room-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT go-PROHIB-QUOT IV-explain-PST.UNW witch-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l Then she gave him the keys to all the rooms: "You will live here until I come back, but don't go into the lower room!", explained the witch to him.

\t Yoqno qartayn yik’in, sisxoli ɣˤutka teł q’ebedes užin ƛexun.
\m y-oq-n qartay-n y-ik’i-n sisxoli ɣˤutku-a teł q’ebed-s uži-n ƛexu-n
\g II-become-PFV.CVB witch-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB alone house-IN.ESS inside smith-GEN1 son-TOP remain-PST.UNW
\l So the witch went away and the smith's son remained in her house alone.

\t Łˤora ɣudi yaħ bodin nesä, elay soder yaħ boqnoanu nesiq.
\m łˤora ɣudi yaħ b-odi-n nesi-a ele-ay soder yaħ b-oq-n-anu nesi-q
\g three.OBL day conscience III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG there-IN.ABL upward conscience III-become-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l Three days he had his conscience, then his conscience wasn't enough anymore.

\t Acno serun tełxor ik’in.
\m ac-n seru-n teł-xor ik’i-n
\g door-TOP unlock-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l He unlocked the door and went inside.

\t Elo bäsuru sis ixiw posu suƛƛisi nesiƛ’orno k’oƛin q’ebedes užin exurno.
\m elo b-esu-ru sis ixiw posu suƛƛi-si nesi-ƛ’or-n k’oƛi-n q’ebed-s uži-n exur-n
\g there III-exist-PST.PRT one big cattle suddenly-ATTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT-TOP jump-PFV.CVB smith-GEN1 son-TOP kill-PST.UNW
\l Suddenly a big animal that was there inside, jumped onto him and killed the smith's son.

\t Ele hemedur roqxosi äƛiru šebin risinč’izaƛ’.
\m ele hemedur r-oq-xosi eƛi-ru šebin r-is-č’i-zaƛ’
\g there so IV-become-PRS.PRT say-PST.PRT thing IV-take-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB
\l Such a thing there happens if you don't take what is being said.

\t Zownƛax, zownanuƛax sis xan, nesis zown sistow sis kid.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax sis xan nesi-s zow-n sis-tow sis kid
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT one khan DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW one-EMPH one daughter
\l Once upon a time there was a king who had just one daughter.

\t Xanä ža maħortow yegirxo zownanu.
\m xan-a ža maħor-tow y-egir-x zow-n-anu
\g khan-ERG DEM1.SG outside-EMPH II-let-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW-NEG
\l The king didn't let her go outside.

\t Sida quł, šaharyaɣor xan ik’inosi, ɣarabašza xanes kid iħułxor esanada yegirno.
\m sida qu-ł šahar-aɣor xan ik’i-nosi ɣarabaš-bi-a xan-s kid iħu-łxor esanad-a y-egir-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS city-IN.VERS khan go-ANT.CVB servant-PL-ERG khan-GEN1 daughter river-CONT.VERS swim-INF II-let-PST.UNW
\l One day, after the king went into the city, the servants let the princess swim in the river.

\t Nazay eƛa iynč’ey ayru qˤaba guluƛ’no zown qˤaba žek’a xanez kidbes šeƛ’un rok’ek’no rižin, ik’in sida ɣunoƛ q’ˤida ičin.
\m nazay eƛi-a iy-č’ey ay-ru qˤaba gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n qˤaba žek’u-a xan-z kid-s šeƛ’u-n r-ok’ek’-n r-iži-n ik’i-n sida ɣun-ƛ q’ˤida iči-n
\g from.where say-INF know-NEG.PST.CVB come-PST.PRT black horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB black man-ERG khan-GEN2 daughter-GEN1 clothing-TOP IV-steal-PFV.CVB IV-carry-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB one.OBL tree-SUB.ESS under sit-PST.UNW
\l And a black man riding on a black horse who came out of who-knows-where stole the princess' clothes, carried them away and sat down under a tree.

\t Esanayn łiynosi, yizir xanez kidbes šeƛ’u resunanu.
\m esanad-n łiy-nosi yizi-r xan-z kid-s šeƛ’u r-esu-n-anu
\g swim-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT khan-GEN2 daughter-GEN1 clothing IV-find-PST.UNW-NEG
\l After she finished swimming, they couldn't find the princess' clothes.

\t Žeda nesiqor eƛin, šeƛ’u xizor neƛƛin.
\m žedu-a nesi-qor eƛi-n šeƛ’u xizor neƛ-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW clothing back give-QUOT
\l They said to him: "Give the clothes back!"

\t Nesä eƛin, xanes kidtow yegir šeƛ’u risanix.
\m nesi-a eƛi-n xan-s kid-tow y-egir šeƛ’u r-is-ani-x
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW khan-GEN1 daughter-EMPH II-send clothing IV-take-MSD-AD.ESS
\l He said: "Send the princess to take the clothes!"

\t Ža risanixƛin xanes kid igor yik’inosi, qˤabani žek’a, qˤabani guluƛ’no zowerno, yok’ek’no yižin.
\m ža r-is-ani-x-ƛin xan-s kid igo-r y-ik’i-nosi qˤaba-ni žek’u-a qˤaba-ni gulu-ƛ’-n zowr-n y-ok’ek’-n y-iži-n
\g DEM1.SG IV-take-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT khan-GEN1 daughter near-LAT II-go-ANT.CVB black-DEF man-ERG black-DEF horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP seat-PFV.CVB II-steal-PFV.CVB II-carry-PST.UNW
\l When the princess came closer to take them, the black man seated her onto the black horse, stole her and carried her away.

\t Boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow xaner uži odin.
\m b-oƛƛo b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow xan-r uži odi-n
\g III-middle III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH khan-LAT son do-PST.UNW
\l And before too much time had passed, the king got a son.

\t Ža aq’ˤiłxotow ik’ix zown, sida ɣudƛ’or buci bayruce, sis buci baynosi ƛˤeb yayru iłe.
\m ža aq’ˤił-x-tow ik’i-x zow-n sida ɣudi-ƛ’or buci b-ay-ru-ce sis buci b-ay-nosi ƛˤeb y-ay-ru iłe
\g DEM1.SG grow.up-IPFV.CVB-EMPH go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB one.OBL day-SUPER.LAT month III-come-PST.PRT-EQU1 one month III-come-ANT.CVB year II-come-PST.PRT as
\l While he was growing up, one day became like a month and one month was like a year.

\t Sida quł xexzade k’ešonayƛ’oräy, sida xexzas yisiq žirbabi recun.
\m sida qu-ł xexbi-de k’ešonad-ƛ’oräy sida xexbi-s yisi-q žirba-bi r-ecu-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS children-APUD.ESS play-SIM.CVB one.OBL child-GEN1 DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS rib-PL IV.PL-break-PST.UNW
\l One day, while playing with other children, one child broke its ribs.

\t ƛ’irir yayru žaz eniya eƛin, xexzas žirbabi recurxo ičinč’ey, yok’ek’no yäžiruni debez mi esiws ʕadlu šida boyxanuƛin.
\m ƛ’iri-r y-ay-ru uži-z eni-a eƛi-n xexbi-s žirba-bi r-ecur-x iči-č’ey y-ok’ek’-n y-iži-ru-ni mi-z mi esiw-s ʕadlu šida b-odi-x-anu-ƛin
\g above-LAT II-come-PST.PRT boy-GEN2 mother-ERG say-PST.UNW child-GEN1 rib-PL IV.PL-break-IPFV.CVB be-NEG.PST.CVB II-steal-PFV.CVB II-carry-PST.PRT-DEF you-GEN2 you sister-GEN1 order why III-do-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l The boy's mother came and said: "There child's ribs were not broken, why don't you fulfill your stolen sister's orders?"

\t Howlay idurno ik’in, xanez užä eniwq esirno, dey aqiw esiw zowwäƛin.
\m howlay idu-r-n ik’i-n xan-z uži-a eniw-q esir-n di-s aqiw esiw zow-ya-ƛin
\g from.there home-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 boy-ERG mother-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW me-GEN1 female sister be.NPRS-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l He went home and the prince asked his mother: "Did I have a sister?"

\t Zownč’uƛin neła ot’ bisno, esan retinč’ey.
\m zow-č’u-ƛin neła-a ot’ b-is-n esi-an r-eti-č’ey
\g be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG rejection III-take-PFV.CVB tell-FUT.CVB IV-want-NEG.PST.UNW
\l "No, you didn't.", she rejected and didn't want to tell it.

\t Uži ƛ’iri utizaq, esin yiła, debi esiw qˤabani žek’a yok’ek’no yižisƛin.
\m uži ƛ’iri uti-zaq esi-n yiła-a mi-s esiw qˤaba-ni žek’u-a y-ok’ek’-n y-iži-s-ƛin
\g son above turn-CSL.CVB tell-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG you-GEN1 sister black-DEF man-ERG II-steal-PFV.CVB II-carry-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Because the son insisted, she told: "Your sister was stolen by a black man."

\t Užä eniwqor eƛin, koyä bisanix kikiw, rac’anix t’aʕam yołäsi biša där ero, di esiw k’edanix ik’anƛin yoł.
\m uži-a eniw-qor eƛi-n kʷay-a b-is-ani-x kikiw r-ac’-ani-x t’aʕam yoł-asi bišʷa di-r er-o di esiw k’edi-ani-x ik’i-an-ƛin yoł
\g boy-ERG mother-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW hand-IN.ESS III-take-MSD-AD.ESS light IV-eat-MSD-AD.ESS taste be-RES.PRT food me-LAT set.up-IMPR me sister search-MSD-AD.ESS go-FUT.DEF-QUOT be
\l The boy said to his mother: "Prepare me some food that's light to take into the hand but tasty to eat; I will go to search my sister."

\t Hemedur guluƛ’no zown xanes uži maħor oqno yok’ek’alini esiwł xizay.
\m hemedur gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n xan-s uži maħor oq-n y-ok’ek’-ali-ni esiw-ł xizay
\g so horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 son outside become-PST.UNW II-steal-ATTR-DEF sister-CONT.ESS behind
\l So the prince rode on his horse outside behind his stolen sister.

\t Sis elus ħon xecin nesä, q’ˤano žek’us ħon xecin, sis kero boɣno, q’ˤano kero boɣno xizaɣor xanes uži sida yeže gogaƛ’or ayn.
\m sis elu-s ħon xeci-n nesi-a q’ˤano žek’u-s ħon xeci-n sis kero b-oɣ-n q’ˤano kero b-oɣ-n xizaɣor xan-s uži sida y-eže goga-ƛ’or ay-n
\g one we(I).OBL-GEN1 mountain leave-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG two man-GEN1 mountain leave-PFV.CVB one ravine III-cross-PFV.CVB two ravine III-cross-PFV.CVB finally khan-GEN1 son one.OBL II-big meadow-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He left our one mountain behind, left two other mountains behind, crossed one ravine, crossed two ravines and finally the prince came onto a big meadow.

\t Elo yisir kecäsi sis žek’u esun, bišra gulun begirno xecin.
\m elo yisi-r kec-asi sis žek’u esu-n b-iš-r-a gulu-n b-egir-n xeci-n
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT sleep-RES.PRT one man find-PFV.CVB III-eat-CAUS-INF horse-TOP III-let-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW
\l There he found a sleeping man, who left his horse there to feed it.

\t Nesä nesis gulun hemedurtow bišra begirno, yedan bixiƛ’ ƛ’iri kecno ičin.
\m nesi-a nesi-s gulu-n hemedur-tow b-iš-r-a b-egir-n yeda-n bix-ƛ’ ƛ’iri kec-n iči-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 horse-TOP so-EMPH III-eat-CAUS-INF III-let-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG-TOP grass-SUPER.ESS above sleep-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l He likewise let his horse there to feed it and went to sleep on the grass as well.

\t Sida mixƛ’o, moƛaxay xanes uži č’ariłzaƛ’or, q’ˤidan ičin išxoƛax yisir elo äsuruni žek’u.
\m sida mix-ƛ’ moƛu-xay xan-s uži č’arił-zaƛ’or q’ˤida-n iči-n iš-x-ƛax yisi-r elo esu-ru-ni žek’u
\g one.OBL time-SUPER.ESS sleep-AD.ABL khan-GEN1 son wake.up-POST.CVB down-PFV.CVB sit-PFV.CVB eat-IPFV.CVB-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT there find-PST.PRT-DEF man
\l After a while, before the prince woke up from his sleep, the man he found there sat down and ate.

\t Q’ˤidayn izin xanes užin išno.
\m q’ˤida-ay-n izi-n xan-s uži-n iš-n
\g down-IN.ABL-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 son-TOP eat-PST.UNW
\l Up also got the prince and ate.

\t Elo äsuruni žek’a išno xizor ƛäxuruni šebin eƛuk’yaɣorno rutirno, ħurženya tełxor eqerno.
\m elo esu-ru-ni žek’u-a iš-n xizor ƛexu-ru-ni šebin eƛuk’-aɣor-n r-utir-n ħuržen teł-xor eqer-n
\g there find-PST.PRT-DEF man-ERG eat-PFV.CVB back remain-PST.PRT-DEF thing leather.sack-IN.VERS-TOP IV-gather-PFV.CVB bag inside-AD.LAT put-PST.UNW
\l The man he found there ate and gathered the leftovers into a leather sack and put it into his bag.

\t Xanzo žas rok’ƛ’or rayn, deyn zows yołi bišadyoqor hemediw eƛuk’ƛin.
\m xan-z uži-s rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-n di-s-n zow-s yołi bišad-qor hemediw eƛuk’-ƛin
\g khan-GEN2 son-GEN1 heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come-PFV.CVB me-GEN1-TOP be.NPRS-PST.WIT if food-POSS.LAT such.a leather.sack-QUOT
\l The prince thought: "If I only had such a leather sack for my food."

\t Ħurženyaɣor reƛ’a regirnosi, xanzo užir hemesi žek’uzoq riłäsi eƛuk’ resun.
\m ħuržen-ɣor reƛ’a r-egir-nosi xan-z uži-r hemesi žek’u-zo-q r-iłi-asi eƛuk’ r-esu-n
\g bag-IN.ALL hand IV-let-ANT.CVB khan-GEN2 son-LAT DEM4.ISG.OBL man-ATTR.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-resemble-RES.PRT leather.sack IV-find-PST.UNW
\l The prince reached his hand into the bag and found a leather sack that resembled the man's.

\t Raɣˤin tełer ezunosi, elo teł rigu biša resun.
\m r-ˤaɣˤi-n tełer ezu-nosi elo teł r-igu bišʷa r-esu-n
\g IV-open-PFV.CVB to.the.inside look-ANT.CVB there inside IV-good food IV-find-PST.UNW
\l After he opened it and looked inside, he found good food in it.

\t Xizyogon ħurženya eƛuk’no eqerno, hečk’er izin.
\m xizyogon ħuržen-a eƛuk’-n eqer-n hečk’er izi-n
\g then bag-IN.ESS leather.sack-TOP put-PFV.CVB upright get.up-PST.UNW
\l Then he put the leather sack into the bag and got up.

\t Elo äsuruni žek’u guluƛ’no zown, bˤałno žan bižin ik’iƛ’oräy, sidaɣ mečoƛ’ aħinno yizirno, wˤałzoni dunyalƛ’aɣor oqno, nesiłgon xizay wˤałzoni dunyalƛ’aɣor xanes užin ik’in.
\m elo esu-ru-ni žek’u gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n b-ˤał-n ža-n b-iži-n ik’i-ƛ’oräy sidaɣ moči-ƛ’ aħin-n y-izir-n wˤał-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’aɣor oq-n nesi-ł-gon xizay wˤał-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’aɣor xan-s uži-n ik’i-n
\g there find-PST.PRT-DEF man horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB III-strike-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB go-SIM.CVB in.one.place place-SUPER.ESS rock-TOP II-lift-PFV.CVB downward-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.VERS become-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-CNTR behind downward-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.VERS khan-GEN1 son-TOP go-PST.UNW
\l The man he had found got on his horse, and while he got away, he lifted a rock in some place and got down into the underworld, and the prince followed him and went into the underworld as well.

\t Elo žedu sida ixiw keroqor bayn.
\m elo žedu sida ixiw kero-qor b-ay-n
\g there DEM1.IPL one.OBL big ravine-POSS.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l There they came to a big ravine.

\t Gogaƛ’ äsuruni žek’a eƛin, yedu dey kero yoł, debi esiwn t’o yołƛin.
\m goga-ƛ’ esu-ru-ni žek’u-a eƛi-n yedu di-s kero yoł mi-s esiw-n t’o yoł-ƛin
\g meadow-SUPER.ESS find-PST.PRT-DEF man-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG me-GEN1 ravine be you-GEN1 sister-TOP there be-QUOT
\l The man he found on the meadow said: "This is my ravine, your sister is there as well.

\t Di ža keč’oz reƛ’id aɣˤuroƛ’ eqersi, kut’yoz reƛ’id q’ˤidar yoɣsi, deber retinäy, iduɣor yižo ža, retinäy - däx yegir žaƛin, eƛin nesä xanez užiqor.
\m di ža keč’o-z reƛ’a-d aɣˤur-ƛ’ eqer-s kut’yo-z reƛ’a-d q’ˤida-r y-oɣ-s mi-r r-eti-näy idu-ɣor y-iži-o ža r-eti-näy - di-x y-egir ža-ƛin eƛi-n nesi-a xan-z uži-qor
\g me DEM1.SG left.side-GEN2 hand-INSTR wheel-SUPER.ESS put-PST.WIT right.side-GEN2 hand-INSTR down-LAT II-take.away-PST.WIT you-LAT IV-want-CND.CVB home-IN.ALL II-carry-IMPR DEM1.SG IV-want-CND.CVB - me-AD.ESS II-send DEM1.SG-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG khan-GEN2 boy-POSS.LAT
\l I've put her on the wheel with my left hand, I took her down with my right hand, if you want, carry her home; if you want, marry her off to me!", he said to the prince.

\t Xanez užä nesix esiw yegirnoƛax.
\m xan-z uži-a nesi-x esiw y-egir-n-ƛax
\g khan-GEN2 son-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS sister II-send-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The prince married his sister off to him, it is said.

\t Neširu yeda kecäsi yałzay, ƛ’iri idazay kurno eč’in yayrno, kidbes rožin rodin eƛix teqno, mi nesix esiw yegirłin, nesä nesis maʕišat bukarinč’uwa debeqƛin.
\m neširu yeda kec-asi yoł-zay ƛ’iri idu-azay kur-n eč’i-n y-ayr-n kid-s roži-n r-odi-n eƛi-x teq-n mi nesi-x esiw y-egir-łin nesi-a nesi-s maʕišat b-ukar-č’u-a mi-q-ƛin
\g at.night DEM2.ISG sleep-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB above room-IN.ABL.DIST throw-PFV.CVB pebble-TOP II-bring-PFV.CVB girl-GEN1 word-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW you DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS sister II-send-CNC.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 fortune III-show-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT.INT you-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l At night while he was asleep, [from the room/house above he throw a pebble and brought it???], he heard the girl's voice say: "Although you married your sister off to him, didn't he show you his fortune?"

\t Sasaqosi xanes uži q’ʷarid oqno ičin.
\m sasaqosi xan-s uži q’ʷarid oq-n iči-n
\g in.the.morning khan-GEN1 son sad become-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW
\l In the morning the prince was sad.

\t Mi aħyabin rˤoƛ’urno šida ičäsiƛin esirnosi, yisä eƛin, debex di esiw yegirłin, mi däq debi mi maʕišat bukarxanuƛin.
\m mi aħya-bi-n r-ˤoƛ’ur-n šida iči-asi-ƛin esir-nosi yisi-a eƛi-n mi-x di esiw y-egir-łin mi di-q mi-s mi maʕišat b-ukar-x-anu-ƛin
\g you ear-PL-TOP IV-let.fall-PFV.CVB why be-RES.PRT-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW you-AD.ESS me sister II-send-CNC.CVB you me-POSS.ESS you-GEN1 you fortune III-show-PRS-NEG-QUOT
\l When in the morning he asked: "Why are you sitting there with your ears fallen down?", he answered: "Although I married off my sister to you, you don't show me your fortune."

\t Xanes uži yisä akiłno q’ˤidar ʕoƛ’ace naysinan kerozaq ezu-ʕaƛ’urno, amma ƛ’irizoni ɣˤutkaɣor ezura ižinanu yisä yeda.
\m xan-s uži yisi-a akił-n q’ˤida-r ˤoƛ’u-ace naysinan kero-bi-q ezu~oƛ’ˤu-r-n amma ƛ’iri-zo-ni ɣˤutku-aɣor ezur-a iži-n-anu yisi-a yeda
\g khan-GEN1 son DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG get.tired-PFV.CVB down-LAT fall-TERM everywhere ravine-PL-POSS.ESS examine-CAUS-PFV.CVB but above-ATTR.OBL-DEF room-IN.VERS show-INF lead-PFV.CVB-NEG DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG
\l He lead him through the ravines and showed him everything until he got tired and fell down, but he didn't lead him to show him the room above.

\t Q’ˤuna äƛiru ɣudƛ’on neširu kecno äčizar xanez užis hemełatow ɣˤutkazay eč’i caƛin yayrno.
\m q’ˤuna äƛiru ɣudi-ƛ’-n neširu kec-n iči-za-r xan-z uži-s hemeła-tow ɣˤutku-azay eč’i caƛi-n y-ayr-n
\g two.OBL ORD day-SUPER.ESS-TOP at.night sleep-PFV.CVB be-LCV-LAT khan-GEN2 son-GEN1 DEM4.IISG.OBL-EMPH room-IN.ABL.DIST pebble throw-PFV.CVB II-bring-PST.UNW
\l And on the second day, at night, he threw a pebble from the prince's room down to where he was sleeping.

\t Xizyo hemedurtow kidbes rožin rodin eƛix teqno, nesir mi etix zows yołi, nesä mi ƛ’irizoni ɣˤutkaɣor ezanix egärƛin.
\m xizyo hemedur-tow kid-s roži-n r-odi-n eƛi-x teq-n nesi-r mi eti-x zow-s yołi nesi-a mi ƛ’iri-zo-ni ɣˤutku-aɣor ezu-ani-x egir-ƛin
\g afterwards so-EMPH girl-GEN1 word-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT you love-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT if DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you above-ATTR.OBL-DEF room-IN.VERS look-MSD-AD.ESS let-QUOT
\l Afterwards he likewise heard a girl's voice say: "If he loved you, he will let you look into the upper room."

\t Sisgon mołin neła, elorno ezun xizor ik’iƛ’oräygon, nesä debeq esär, šebi deber t’ay neƛanƛin.
\m sis-gon mołi-n neła-a elo-r-n ezu-n xizor ik’i-ƛ’oräy-gon nesi-a mi-q esir šebi mi-r t’ay neƛ-an-ƛin
\g one-CNTR teach-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG there-LAT-TOP look-PFV.CVB back go-SIM.CVB-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG you-POSS.ESS ask what you-LAT from.here give-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l She taught him another thing: "While you go back after having looked, he will ask you what he shall give to you.

\t Hudun mi ya micxir bäsno, ya mesed bäsno, ya q’ˤuya bečełi räsnoƛin.
\m hudun mi ya micxir b-is-n y-a mesed b-is-n y-a q’ˤuya bečełi r-is-n-ƛin
\g nevertheless you bring.IMP money III-take-PROHIB II-bring.IMP gold III-take-PROHIB II-bring.IMP other riches IV-take-PROHIB-QUOT
\l Nevertheless, don't take the money, don't take the gold and don't take any other riches!

\t Maħix micxir t’aħiruni ɣˤʷay neƛƛin eƛo mi nesiqor.
\m maħi-x micxir t’aħi-ru-ni ɣˤʷay neƛ-ƛin eƛi-o mi nesi-qor
\g tail-AD.ESS money tie-PST.PRT-DEF dog give-QUOT say-IMPR you DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT
\l Say to him: 'Give me the dog with money tied to its tail!'"

\t Sasaqosi moƛaxay izinosi, xanes uži aħyabin rˤoƛ’urno ukayzaƛ’, esiwz xediya esirno, šebi deber roqäsi, šida mi nece q’ʷarid ičäsiƛin.
\m sasaqosi moƛu-xay izi-nosi xan-s uži aħya-bi-n r-ˤoƛ’ur-n ukad-zaƛ’ esiw-z xediw-a esir-n šebi mi-r r-oq-asi šida mi nece q’ʷarid iči-asi-ƛin
\g in.the.morning sleep-AD.ABL get.up-ANT.CVB khan-GEN1 son ear-PL-TOP IV.PL-let.fall-PFV.CVB see-CSL.CVB sister-GEN2 husband-ERG ask-PST.UNW what you-LAT IV-happen-RES.PRT why you so.much sad be-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l When he saw the prince getting up from his sleep in the morning and hanging his head, the sister's husband asked him: "What happened to you; why are you so sad?"

\t Yisä eƛin, debex di esiw yegirłin, mi di ƛ’irizoni ɣˤutka tełer ezura egirinč’uƛin.
\m yisi-a eƛi-n mi-x di esiw y-egir-łin mi di ƛ’iri-zo-ni ɣˤutku-a tełer ezur-a egir-č’u-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW you-AD.ESS me sister II-send-CNC.CVB you me above-ATTR.OBL-DEF room-IN.ESS into show-INF let-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l He said: "Although you married your sister off to me, you didn't let me look into the upper room."

\t Yisä yeda uži suƛƛitow ƛ’irizoni ɣˤutkaɣor ezuranix ižin.
\m yisi-a yeda uži suƛƛi-tow ƛ’iri-zo-ni ɣˤutku-aɣor ezur-ani-x iži-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG boy immediately-EMPH above-ATTR.OBL-DEF room-IN.VERS show-MSD-AD.ESS lead-PST.UNW
\l He immediately led the boy into the upper room to show it to him.

\t Ɣˤutkos ac yaɣˤiruntow, akiłno q’ˤidar ʕoƛ’a isno yeda, elo teł zawruni bercinawni kidbez suratyoƛ’ ozuri c’axrun.
\m ɣˤutku-s ac y-ˤaɣˤi-run-tow akił-n q’ˤida-r ˤoƛ’u-a is-n yeda elo teł zow-ru-ni bercinaw-ni kid-z surat-ƛ’ ozuri c’ox-run
\g room-GEN1 door II-open-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH get.tired-PFV.CVB down-LAT fall-INF take-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG there inside be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF beautiful-DEF girl-GEN2 picture-SUPER.ESS eye meet-IMM.ANT.CVB
