\l As soon as he opened the room's door, he almost fell down, right when his eye met the picture of a beautiful girl inside there.

\t Howži elay izin oqƛ’oräy, xanez žaq esiwz xediya esirno, šebi deber di t’ay neƛanƛin, micxirä, mesedä, q’ˤuya maʕišatäƛin.
\m howži ele-ay izi-n oq-ƛ’oräy xan-z uži-q esiw-z xediw-a esir-n šebi mi-r di t’ay neƛ-an-ƛin micxir-a mesed-a q’ˤuya maʕišat-a-ƛin
\g now there-IN.ABL get.up-PFV.CVB begin-SIM.CVB khan-GEN2 son-POSS.ESS sister-GEN2 husband-ERG ask-PST.UNW what you-LAT me from.here give-FUT.DEF-QUOT money-Q gold-Q other fortune-Q-QUOT
\l Now, while he began to get up from there again, the prince was asked by his sister's husband: "What shall I give you from there? Money, gold or another fortune?"

\t Mi där eloša maħiq micxir t’aħiruni ɣˤʷay neƛƛin, esirno užä.
\m mi di-r eloša maħi-q micxir t’aħi-ru-ni ɣˤʷay neƛ-ƛin esir-n uži-a
\g you me-LAT there tail-POSS.ESS money tie-PST.PRT-DEF dog give-QUOT ask-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "Give me the dog with the money tied to its tail, there", the boy asked.

\t Neła esiwz xedyos kid zown rätiru łinaƛ’or yutanix hunar yołäsi.
\m neła esiw-z xediw-s kid zow-n r-eti-ru łina-ƛ’or y-uti-ani-x hunar yoł-asi
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL sister-GEN2 husband-GEN1 daughter be.NPRS-PFV.CVB IV-want-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.LAT II-turn-MSD-AD.ESS talent be-RES.PRT
\l That sister's husband had a daughter, who had the talent to turn into whatever she wanted.

\t Yiłaz babiwr čuqˤno, ža ɣˤʷay esiranix xanes uži neła kidbä rok’uƛ’ esärułi.
\m yiła-z babiw-r čuqˤ-n ža ɣˤʷay esir-ani-x xan-s uži neła kid-a rok’u-ƛ’ esir-rułi
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN2 father-LAT notice-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG dog ask-MSD-AD.ESS khan-GEN1 son DEM1.IISG.OBL daughter-ERG heart-SUPER.ESS ask-MSD
\l Her father noticed that the daughter asked on her heart(?) that the prince should ask for the dog.

\t Maħiqor micxir bäciruni ɣˤʷayn teƛno, yisä xanes uži hunix egirno.
\m maħi-qor micxir b-ici-ru-ni ɣˤʷay-n teƛ-n yisi-a xan-s uži huni-x egir-n
\g tail-POSS.LAT money III-tie-PST.PRT-DEF dog-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG khan-GEN1 son way-AD.ESS send-PST.UNW
\l He gave him the dog with the money tied to its tail and sent the prince on his way.

\t Encetow bitaɣor bok’ełnosi, maħiq micxir t’aħiruni ɣˤʷayä yeda ƛ’irizoni dunyalƛ’aɣor izirno.
\m ence-tow bita-aɣor b-ok’eł-nosi maħi-q micxir t’aħi-ru-ni ɣˤʷay-a yeda ƛ’iri-zo-ni dunyal-ƛ’aɣor izir-n
\g a.little-EMPH distance-IN.VERS I.PL-escape-ANT.CVB tail-POSS.ESS money tie-PST.PRT-DEF dog-ERG DEM2.ISG above-ATTR.OBL-DEF world-SUPER.VERS lift-PST.UNW
\l After they had escaped into a little distance, the dog with the money tied to its tail lifted him into the upper world.

\t Xizyo ža ɣˤʷay kidbeƛ’orno butin, neła esirno, hemełƛ’o däz babiwz ƛ’irizoni ɣˤutka teł suratyoƛ’ yukayruni kid deber yiqa rätiyäƛin.
\m xizyo ža ɣˤʷay kid-ƛ’or-n b-uti-n neła-a esir-n hemeł-ƛ’ di-z babiw-z ƛ’iri-zo-ni ɣˤutku-a teł surat-ƛ’ y-ukad-ru-ni kid mi-r y-iqi-a r-eti-a-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.SG dog girl-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS me-GEN2 father-GEN2 above-ATTR.OBL-DEF room-IN.ESS inside picture-SUPER.ESS II-see-PST.PRT-DEF girl you-LAT II-get-INF IV-want-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Afterwards that dog turned into a girl again and asked: "Then, do you want to ge the girl you saw on the picture inside my father's upper room?"

\t Rätiƛin, žawab teƛno xanez užä.
\m r-eti-ƛin žawab teƛ-n xan-z uži-a
\g IV-want-QUOT answer give-PST.UNW khan-GEN2 son-ERG
\l "I want to.", answered the prince.

\t Nedur resunäy, deber yätiruni kidbeł xizäy bik’an eliƛin, encetow k’ek’-yik’no yedu guluƛ’or yutin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy mi-r y-eti-ru-ni kid-ł xizay b-ik’i-an eli-ƛin ence-tow k’ek’~ik’-n yedu gulu-ƛ’or y-uti-n
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB you-LAT II-want-PST.PRT-DEF girl-CONT.ESS behind I.PL-go-FUT.DEF we-QUOT a.little-EMPH move-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG horse-SUPER.LAT II-turn-PST.UNW
\l "If that's the case, we will go behind the girl you want", she moved a little and then turned into a horse.

\t Nełaƛ’ zown yizi bik’in sida šaharyar bayn.
\m neła-ƛ’ zow-n yizi b-ik’i-n sida šahar-ar b-ay-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS ride-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL I.PL-go-PFV.CVB one.OBL city-IN.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l Riding on it, they went on and came to a city.

\t Kidbä xanez užiqor eƛin, deber elo reže ƛoħo räsu, nełaz ač’urqo mi gulun bico, k’ula bäsuru ʕoloqzaqor ik’in eƛo, däł meža maxsar boyłin, gulułgon maxsara badinƛin.
\m kid-a xan-z uži-qor eƛi-n mi-r elo r-eže ƛoħo r-esu neła-z ač’u-q mi gulu-n b-ici-o k’uli-a b-esu-ru ʕoloq-bi-qor ik’i-n eƛi-o di-ł mežu-a maxsar b-odi-łin gulu-ł-gon maxsar-a b-odi-n-ƛin
\g girl-ERG khan-GEN2 son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you-LAT there IV-big pan IV-find DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 handle-POSS.ESS you horse-TOP III-tie-IMPR side.street-IN.ESS III-find-PST.PRT young.person-PL-POSS.LAT go-PFV.CVB say-IMPR me-CONT.ESS you(I).PL.OBL-ERG joke III-do-CNC.CVB horse-CONT.ESS-CNTR joke-IN.ESS III-do-PROHIB-QUOT
\l The girl said to the prince: "You will find a big pan there, tie the horse to its handle, then go to the young people you find in the side street and say: 'Although you make jokes about me, don't make jokes about the horse!'

\t Nagaħ žeda di k’irik’näy, ƛoħo rutin c’ax, mi ža ħiƛ’oqadno rizirno yałza mečoƛ’ eqroƛin.
\m nagaħ žedu-a di k’irik’-näy ƛoħo r-uti-n c’ox mi ža ħiƛ’oqu-d-n r-izir-n yoł-za moči-ƛ’ eqer-o-ƛin
\g suppose DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG me frighten-CND.CVB pan IV-turn-PFV.CVB hit you DEM1.SG handkerchief-INSTR-TOP IV-lift-PFV.CVB be-LCV place-SUPER.ESS put-IMPR-QUOT
\l If they frighten me, the pan will turn around and hit, and you will lift it with a handkerchief and put it where it to the place where it was.

\t Neła äƛiruxor, xanez užä ač’urqor gulun bicin, k’ulä bäsuru ahlimoqor salamno teƛno eƛin, däqor meža maxsar boyłin, yiła guluqor badinoƛin.
\m neła-a eƛi-ru-xor xan-z uži-a ač’u-qor gulu-n b-ici-n k’uli-a b-esu-ru ahli-qor salam-n teƛ-n eƛi-n di-qor mežu-a maxsar b-odi-łin yiła gulu-qor b-odi-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT khan-GEN2 son-ERG handle-POSS.LAT horse-TOP III-tie-PFV.CVB side.street-IN.ESS I.PL-find-PST.PRT people-POSS.LAT greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW me-POSS.LAT you(I).PL.OBL-ERG joke III-do-CNC.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL horse-POSS.LAT III-do-PROHIB-QUOT
\l According to what she said, the prince tied the horse to the handle gave a greeting to the people he found in the side street and said: "Although you can make jokes about me, do not make jokes about this horse!"

\t Hudun žeda diduräyƛa gulun k’irik’no, ƛoħo rutirno caƛin.
\m hudun žedu-a didur-ay-ƛa gulu-n k’irik’-n ƛoħo r-utir-n caƛi-n
\g nevertheless DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG how-IN.ABL-INDEF horse-TOP frighten-PFV.CVB pan IV-turn-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l Nevertheless they frightened the horse somehow and it turned the pan and threw it to them.

\t Yisägon ħiƛ’oqadno rizirno yałza mečoƛ’ eqerno.
\m yisi-a-gon ħiƛ’oqu-d-n r-izir-n yoł-za moči-ƛ’ eqer-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR handkerchief-INSTR-TOP IV-lift-PFV.CVB be-LCV place-SUPER.ESS put-PST.UNW
\l And he lifted it with a handkerchief and put it back to the place where it was.

\t Howži yisä eloza ičanix moči k’edin.
\m howži yisi-a elo-za iči-ani-x moči k’edi-n
\g now DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG there-ZA sit-MSD-AD.ESS place search-PST.UNW
\l Now he searched a place there to live.

\t Xizyo yeda neła šaharyoz xandäɣor ik’in.
\m xizyo yeda neła šahar-z xan-däɣor ik’i-n
\g afterwards DEM2.ISG DEM1.IISG.OBL city-GEN2 khan-APUD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards he went to that city's king.

\t Xanä esirno, debi murad šebi, šebi deber retinƛin.
\m xan-a esir-n mi-s murad šebi šebi mi-r r-eti-n-ƛin
\g khan-ERG ask-PST.UNW you-GEN1 wish what what you-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The king asked: "What is your wish, what do you want?"

\t Užä eƛin, wallah, di debi kidno esirno nexäsi yołƛin.
\m uži-a eƛi-n wallah di mi-s kid-n esir-n nex-asi yoł-ƛin
\g boy-ERG say-PST.UNW wallah me you-GEN1 daughter-TOP ask-PFV.CVB come-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l The boy said: "By God, I have come to ask for [the hand of] your daughter."

\t Xanä eƛin, di äƛiru łˤono hunar mi boynäy, debex di kid yegiranƛin.
\m xan-a eƛi-n di eƛi-ru łˤono hunar mi b-odi-näy mi-x di kid y-egir-an-ƛin
\g khan-ERG say-PST.UNW me say-PST.PRT three talent you III-do-CND.CVB you-AD.ESS me daughter II-send-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The king said: "If you fulfill the three talents I tell you, I will marry my daughter off to you.

\t Hič’č’a adäza, sasaq mi däz gander biħanada ganin bown horoƛin, egirno nesä.
\m hič’č’a adäza sasaq mi di-z gani-der b-iħanad-a gani-n b-ow-n horo-ƛin egir-n nesi-a
\g the.most ahead tomorrow you me-GEN2 bull.calf-APUD.LAT III-fight-INF bull.calf-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB come.IMPR-QUOT send-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l The first one: Come tomorrow and bring a young bull to fight against my young bull.", he [said and] sent him away.

\t Howži aħyabin rˤoƛ’urno xanes uži yeda ičix zawru mečoƛ’or ayn.
\m howži aħya-bi-n r-ˤoƛ’ur-n xan-s uži yeda iči-x zow-ru moči-ƛ’or ay-n
\g now ear-PL-TOP IV.PL-let.fall-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 son DEM2.ISG live-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT place-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Now, the prince hang his head and went to the place where he was living.

\t Nedur yeda ukaynosi, kidbä šebi roqäƛin esirno.
\m nedur yeda ukad-nosi kid-a šebi r-oq-a-ƛin esir-n
\g so DEM2.ISG see-ANT.CVB girl-ERG what IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-PST.UNW
\l When she saw him like that, the girl asked: "What happened?"

\t Yisä esin, xanä nesił adäza äru masalałäy.
\m yisi-a esi-n xan-a nesi-ł adäza er-ru masala-łay
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG tell-PST.UNW khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before set.up-PST.PRT task-CONT.ABL
\l He told about the task the king had set up before him.

\t Mi nełas pikru bäsno, sasaq di ganƛ’orno yutin, xanez ganzo axarno k’oƛin, nełas mo yac’anƛin, eƛin kidbä uži ɣˤaɣˤu izirno.
\m mi neła-s pikru b-is-n sasaq di gani-ƛ’or-n y-uti-n xan-z gani-z ax-ar-n k’oƛi-n neła-s mo y-ac’-an-ƛin eƛi-n kid-a uži ɣˤaɣˤu izir-n
\g you DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 idea III-take-PROHIB tomorrow me bull.calf-SUPER.LAT-TOP II-turn-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 bull.calf-GEN2 belly-IN.LAT-TOP run-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 fat II-eat-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW girl-ERG boy be.happy lift-PST.UNW
\l "Don't think about it; tomorrow I will turn into a young bull, run into the king's bull's belly and eat its fat.", said the girl and made the boy happy.

\t Sasaqosi k’uläɣor ganbi riħada rižinosi, ganƛ’or yutin zawru kid ɣalbac’ƛ’orno yutin, xanez ganzo axarno k’oƛin, mo yac’xo zown.
\m sasaqosi k’uli-aɣor gani-bi r-iħad-a r-iži-nosi gani-ƛ’or y-uti-n zow-ru kid ɣalbac’-ƛ’or-n y-uti-n xan-z gani-z ax-ar-n k’oƛi-n mo y-ac’-x zow-n
\g in.the.morning side.street-IN.VERS bull.calf-PL IV-fight-INF IV-lead-ANT.CVB bull.calf-SUPER.LAT II-turn-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT girl lion-SUPER.LAT-TOP II-turn-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 bull.calf-GEN2 belly-IN.LAT-TOP run-PFV.CVB fat II-eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The next morning, he lead the young bull into the side street to fight, the girl who had turned into a bull turned into a lion then and ran into the belly of the king's bull and was eating its fat.

\t Xizyo xan qˤaƛanada oqno, eleley, yedu didiw karamałi, debez buɣa däz buɣaz axʷay mo yac’xoƛin.
\m xizyo xan qˤaƛanad-a oq-n eleley yedu didiw karamałi mi-z buɣa-a di-z buɣa-z ax-ay mo y-ac’-x-ƛin
\g afterwards khan yell-INF begin-PFV.CVB behold DEM2.IISG which miracle you-GEN2 stock.bull-ERG me-GEN2 stock.bull-GEN2 belly-IN.ABL fat II-eat-PRS-QUOT
\l Then the king began to yell: "Behold, what miracle is that, your bull is eating the fat out of my bull's belly!"

\t Ele hemediw yoł dey ganiƛin, eƛin užä.
\m ele hemediw yoł di-s gani-ƛin eƛi-n uži-a
\g there such.a be me-GEN1 bull.calf-QUOT say-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "Well, so is my bull.", said the boy.

\t Xizyo xanä q’ˤano äƛirugon hunar bukar mi däqƛin užiqor eƛin, sasaq däz gulude biħanadanix debi mi gulu baƛin.
\m xizyo xan-a q’ˤano äƛiru-gon hunar b-ukar mi di-q-ƛin uži-qor eƛi-n sasaq di-z gulu-de b-iħanad-ani-x mi-s mi gulu b-a-ƛin
\g afterwards khan-ERG two ORD-CNTR talent III-show you me-POSS.ESS-QUOT boy-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW tomorrow me-GEN2 horse-APUD.ESS III-fight-MSD-AD.ESS you-GEN1 you horse III-bring.IMP-QUOT
\l "Show me the second talent;", the king said to the boy afterwards, "bring your horse tomorrow in order to fight next to my horse!"

\t Hemedurtow aħyabin rˤoƛ’urno ayn yisä kidbeq esin, xanzo gulude biħanayranix gulu biqira bay elaƛin.
\m hemedur-tow aħya-bi-n r-ˤoƛ’ur-n ay-n yisi-a kid-q esi-n xan-z gulu-de b-iħanad-r-ani-x gulu b-iqir-a b-ay elu-a-ƛin
\g so-EMPH ear-PL-TOP IV.PL-let.fall-PFV.CVB come-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG girl-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW khan-GEN2 horse-APUD.ESS III-fight-CAUS-MSD-AD.ESS horse III-find-INF III-must we(I).OBL-ERG-QUOT
\l And again he hung his head, came and told the girl: "We must find a horse in order to let it fight next to the king's horse."

\t Kidbä eƛin, mi łinasnokin urɣel badinoƛin.
\m kid-a eƛi-n mi łina-s-n-kin urɣel b-odi-n-ƛin
\g girl-ERG say-PST.UNW you what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-even sorrow III-do-PROHIB-QUOT
\l The girl said: "Don't worry!

\t Xanez gulude biħanayƛ’oräy, šidqay ƛ’iyorno kurno, ƛ’irirno bizin ža di xot’ozad łełanƛin, eƛin kidbä.
\m xan-z gulu-de b-iħanad-ƛ’oräy šid-qay ƛ’iyor-n kur-n ƛ’iri-r-n b-izi-n ža di xot’o-bi-d łełi-an-ƛin eƛi-n kid-a
\g khan-GEN2 horse-APUD.ESS III-fight-SIM.CVB wall-POSS.ABL downwards-TOP throw-PFV.CVB above-LAT-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG me foot-PL-INSTR trample.down-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW girl-ERG
\l "While I am fighting next to the king's horse, I will throw it down from the street wall, get up again and trample it down with my feet

\t Sasaqosi gulubi riħanada regirnosi, žaz gula ɣunyabin rok’no šidqay ƛ’iyorno kurno, bet’un ƛ’irirno k’oƛin, q’ˤidarno bˤoƛ’urno xanes gulu xot’ozad łełno.
\m sasaqosi gulu-bi r-iħanad-a r-egir-nosi uži-z gulu-a ɣun-bi-n r-ok’-n šid-qay ƛ’iyor-n kur-n b-et’u-n ƛ’iri-r-n k’oƛi-n q’ˤida-r-n b-ˤoƛ’ur-n xan-s gulu xot’o-bi-d łełi-n
\g in.the.morning horse-PL IV-fight-INF III.PL-let-ANT.CVB boy-GEN2 horse-ERG hind.leg-PL-TOP IV.PL-hit-PFV.CVB wall-POSS.ABL downwards-TOP throw-PFV.CVB III-jump-PFV.CVB above-LAT-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB down-LAT-PFV.CVB III-let.fall-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 horse foot-PL-INSTR trample.down-PST.UNW
\l The next morning, after they let their horses fight, the boy's horse hit it with its hind legs and threw it down from the wall, jumped on it and let it fall down and trampled down the king's horse with its feet.

\t Žedu q’ˤanon hunar xanqo bukarnosi, łˤono äƛirugon nasi debeq di hunar bukaranƛin uži xande igor ik’inosi, nesä eƛin, däz łiboqande c’oxranix debi mi łiboqan aƛin.
\m žedu q’ˤano-n hunar xan-q b-ukar-nosi łˤono äƛiru-gon nasi mi-q di hunar b-ukar-an-ƛin uži xan-de igo-r ik’i-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n di-z łiboqan-de c’ox-r-ani-x mi-s mi łiboqan a-ƛin
\g DEM1.IIPL two-TOP talent khan-POSS.ESS III-show-ANT.CVB three ORD-CNTR which you-POSS.ESS me talent III-show-FUT.DEF-QUOT boy khan-APUD.ESS near-LAT go-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN2 wrestler-APUD.ESS hit-CAUS-MSD-AD.ESS you-GEN1 you wrestler bring.IMP-QUOT
\l Having shown these two talents to the king, the boy went to the king: "Which is the third one I shall show you?", and he said: "Bring your wrestler in order to fight with my wrester."

\t Idur aynosi, nesi užä kidbeq esin, hemedur xanzo łiboqande c’oxranix łiboqan elur žigoƛ’ay etixƛin.
\m idu-r ay-nosi nesi uži-a kid-q esi-n hemedur xan-z łiboqan-de c’ox-r-ani-x łiboqan elu-r žigo-ƛ’ay eti-x-ƛin
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG girl-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW so khan-GEN2 wrestler-APUD.ESS hit-CAUS-MSD-AD.ESS wrestler we(I).OBL-LAT again-SUPER.ABL want-PRS-QUOT
\l When he came home, the boy told the girl: "And this time we want a wrestler in order to fight with the king's wrestler."

\t Kidbä eƛin, xanes łiboqan nesistow kid yołƛin, nełde łiboƛ’ izanix mitow oqa ayƛin.
\m kid-a eƛi-n xan-s łiboqan nesi-s-tow kid yoł-ƛin neła-de łibo-ƛ’ izi-ani-x mi-tow oq-a ay-ƛin
\g girl-ERG say-PST.UNW khan-GEN1 wrestler DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH daughter be-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS wrestling-SUPER.ESS get.up-MSD-AD.ESS you-EMPH become-INF must-QUOT
\l The girl said: "The king's wrestler is his daughter. You have to get into a wrestling fight with her.

\t Łiboƛ’ iziƛ’orey, mi kidbez hut’-mˤalär äzuno, yałi nełaz bercinłä akik’no mi q’ˤidar ʕoƛ’arƛin, mołin yiła yisi užiq.
\m łibo-ƛ’ izi-ƛ’oräy mi kid-z hut’~mˤali-ar ezu-n yałi neła-z bercinłi-a akik’-n mi q’ˤida-r ˤoƛ’ur-ƛin mołi-n yiła-a yisi uži-q
\g wrestling-SUPER.ESS get.up-SIM.CVB you girl-GEN2 front.part.of.the.face-IN.LAT look-PROHIB else DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 beauty-ERG tire-PFV.CVB you down-LAT let.fall-QUOT teach-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-POSS.ESS
\l In the fight, don't look into the girl's face, or else her beauty will tire you and make you fall down.", she explained to the boy.

\t Sasaqosi yizi łiboƛ’ biza begirnosi, xanes uži kidbez ozär ezunč’eyn izin, xanes kid q’ˤida caƛin.
\m sasaqosi yizi łibo-ƛ’ b-izi-a b-egir-nosi xan-s uži kid-z ozuri-ar ezu-č’ey-n izi-n xan-s kid q’ˤida caƛi-n
\g in.the.morning DEM2.IPL wrestling-SUPER.ESS I.PL-get.up-INF I.PL-let-ANT.CVB khan-GEN1 son girl-GEN2 eye-IN.LAT look-NEG.PST.CVB-and get.up-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 daughter down throw-PST.UNW
\l The next morning when they were let into the wrestling fight, the prince didn't look into the girl's eyes and threw the princess down.

\t Łˤonon hunar yisä bukarzaƛ’, łˤoran ɣudi bertenno bodin xanä nesä nesis kid xanzo užix yegirno.
\m łˤono-n hunar yisi-a b-ukar-zaƛ’ łˤora-n ɣudi berten-n b-odi-n xan-a nesi-a nesi-s kid xan-z uži-x y-egir-n
\g three-TOP talent DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG III-show-CSL.CVB three.OBL-TOP day marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter khan-GEN2 boy-AD.ESS II-send-PST.UNW
\l Because he had shown him the three talents, the king organized a three-day-long wedding and married of his own daughter to the prince.

\t Xizyo baħarayn yižin xanes užin ik’in nesä nesiz babiwdäɣor, sadaqgon nesiz esiws xedyos kidno yižin.
\m xizyo baħaray-n y-iži-n xan-s uži-n ik’i-n nesi-a nesi-z babiw-däɣor sadaq-gon nesi-z esiw-s xediw-s kid-n y-iži-n
\g afterwards fiancée-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 son-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 father-APUD.VERS together-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 sister-GEN1 husband-GEN1 daughter-TOP II-lead-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, the prince took the fiancée with himself and went to his own father, and together with him he took his sister's husband's daughter.

\t Idur baynosigon elon žeda ixiw berten bodin.
\m idu-r b-ay-nosi-gon elo-n žedu-a ixiw berten b-odi-n
\g home-LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB-CNTR there-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG big marriage III-do-PST.UNW
\l After they came home, they also celebrated a big wedding there.

\t Elo neł ħukmatyozał di aq’ˤu aħnays, łukin bertenyozałxorno goƛ’inč’u, uyn išrinč’u.
\m elo neła ħukmat-bi-ł di aq’ˤu aħnad-s łu-kin berten-bi-łxor-n goƛ’i-č’u uy-n iš-r-č’u
\g there DEM1.IISG.OBL country-PL-CONT.ESS me much walk.around-PST.WIT who.ERG-even marriage-PL-CONT.VERS-TOP invite-NEG.PST.WIT indeed-TOP eat-CAUS-NEG.PST.WIT
\l I was walking around much through these countries, but no one had invited me to the weddings and didn't even gave me to eat.

\t Sida xanes zownƛax sis kid.
\m sida xan-s zow-n-ƛax sis kid
\g one.OBL khan-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT one daughter
\l Once there was a king who had one daughter.

\t Gulučini esnazałäy eženiq oc’ino ƛˤeb zown, nesiqayzoniq - oč’ino ƛˤeb, aqugani esiw žeduł teł hič’č’a yeɣe zown.
\m guluči-ni esyu-bi-łay eže-ni-q oc’ino ƛˤeb zow-n nesi-qay-zo-ni-q - oč’ino ƛˤeb aqiw-ga-ni esiw žedu-ł teł hič’č’a y-eɣe zow-n
\g male-DEF brother-PL-CONT.ABL old-DEF-POSS.ESS ten year be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL-ATTR.OBL-DEF-POSS.ESS - nine year female-ATTR-DEF sister DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside the.most II-young be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Of the brothers, the old one was ten years old, the other one was nine; and the sister was the youngest among them.

\t Baluɣłiƛ’or bayace žeda bet’erbaqi boyx zown, sides rok’ek’no šebin, sideniłgon adäza micxiryoƛ beynoyn.
\m baluɣłi-ƛ’or b-ay-ace žedu-a bet’erbaqi b-odi-x zow-n sida-s r-ok’ek’-n šebin sideni-ł-gon adäza micxir-ƛ b-eynod-n
\g maturity-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-TERM DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG life III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB one.OBL-GEN1 IV-steal-PFV.CVB thing the.other.one-CONT.ESS-CNTR before money-SUB.ESS I.PL-work-PST.UNW
\l Until they reached maturity, they were living their life stealing things from one, and working for money for the other.

\t Sida quł q’ˤanon esnabi urɣizi boqno xanez iday micxir bok’ek’anƛin.
\m sida qu-ł q’ˤano-n esyu-bi urɣizi b-oq-n xan-z idu-ay micxir b-ok’ek’-an-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS two-TOP brother-PL thinking I.PL-become-PST.UNW khan-GEN2 home-IN.ABL money III-steal-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l One day the two brothers thought: "We'll steal money from the king's home!"

\t Sosi bok’ek’no, k’ox bok’ek’no xanes bečełi yizä ragixtow rižix zown.
\m sosi b-ok’ek’-n k’ox b-ok’ek’-n xan-s bečełi yizi-a r-agi-x-tow r-iži-x zow-n
\g at.first III-steal-PFV.CVB twice III-steal-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 riches DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG IV-lick-IPFV.CVB-EMPH IV-carry-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They stole once, they stole twice, and the king's riches they were "licking" and carrying away.

\t Xizyo xanä sis siħiray q’orolayn goƛ’in nesä nesidäɣor, nełaq esin, däz iday micxir nar eƛa biynč’ey gugix, łu bok’ek’xosi yałrułin didurnokin riyxanuƛin.
\m xizyo xan-a sis siħiray q’orolay-n goƛ’i-n nesi-a nesi-däɣor neła-q esi-n di-z idu-ay micxir nar eƛi-a b-iy-č’ey gugi-x łu b-ok’ek’-xosi yoł-ru-łi-n didur-n-kin r-iy-x-anu-ƛin
\g afterwards khan-ERG one cunning.II widow-TOP invite-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.VERS DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW me-GEN2 home-IN.ABL money where say-INF III-know-NEG.PST.CVB escape-IPFV.CVB who.ERG III-steal-PRS.PRT be-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and how-and-even IV-know-PRS-NEG-QUOT
\l Then the king invited a cunning widow to himself and he told her: "Money has vanished from my home to who-knows-where, I don't know whatsoever who might have stolen."

\t Q’orola xanqo mołin, c’ohor nexxozo mečoƛ’ mi nucos bic’äsi q’ili eqroƛin.
\m q’orol-a xan-q mołi-n c’ohor nex-xozo moči-ƛ’ mi nuci-s b-ic’-asi q’ili eqer-o-ƛin
\g widow-ERG khan-POSS.ESS teach-PST.UNW thief come-PRS.PRT.OBL place-SUPER.ESS you honey-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT qili put-IMPR-QUOT
\l The widow explained to the king: "Put a pot filled with honey to the place the thief came to."

\t Nucos bic’äsi q’ilima tełer keze aqru žek’u maħorno oqäłinč’i, hemedur ža c’ohorno mi iqärƛin.
\m nuci-s b-ic’-asi q’ili-a tełer keze oq-ru žek’u maħor-n oq-ł-č’i hemedur ža c’ohor-n mi iqir-ƛin
\g honey-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT qili-IN.ESS into meet become-PST.PRT man outside-TOP become-POT-NEG.FUT.CVB so DEM1.SG thief-TOP you catch-QUOT
\l The man who falls into the pot filled with honey won't come outside, so you will catch the thief.

\t Q’orola äsiruxor rodin xanä.
\m q’orol-a esi-ru-xor r-odi-n xan-a
\g widow-ERG tell-PST.PRT-AD.LAT IV-do-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l The king acted as the widow told.

\t Neširugon žedu baħnayx zawrunitow hunäza q’ˤanon esnabi micxir bok’ek’anix bayn.
\m neširu-gon žedu b-aħnad-x zow-ru-ni-tow huni-aza q’ˤano-n esyu-bi micxir b-ok’ek’-ani-x b-ay-n
\g at.night-CNTR DEM1.IPL I.PL-walk.around-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF-EMPH way-IN.VERS.DIST two-TOP brother-PL money III-steal-MSD-AD.ESS I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l At night, then, the two brothers came on the same way they had been walking on, to steal the money.

\t Elo yizi nucos bic’äsi q’ilima teł šišin.
\m elo yizi nuci-s b-ic’-asi q’ili-a teł šiši-n
\g there DEM2.IPL honey-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT qili-IN.ESS inside get.stuck-PST.UNW
\l There they got stuck in the pot filled with honey.

\t Eženi esiya eɣeniq reƛ’a caƛix kumak nesir boyx zown, yedakin ok’ełxanaƛin.
\m eže-ni esyu-a eɣe-ni-q reƛ’a caƛi-x kumak nesi-r b-odi-x zow-n yeda-kin ok’eł-x-anu-a-ƛin
\g old-DEF brother-ERG young-DEF-POSS.ESS hand throw-IPFV.CVB help DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG-even escape-PRS-NEG-Q-QUOT
\l The older brother was helping giving his hand to the younger one, so at least he might escape.

\t Didurnokin žedus bok’ełxosi ħal boqnoanu neła boc’oqaqay”.
\m didur-n-kin žedu-s b-ok’eł-xosi ħal b-oq-n-anu neła boc’oqu-qay
\g how-and-even DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 I.PL-escape-PRS.PRT strength I.PL-become-PST.UNW-NEG DEM1.IISG.OBL trap-POSS.ABL
\l However, they were not able to escape from that "trap".

\t Xizyo eženi esiya eƛin, q’ˤanon bexa adäza sis exun riguƛin.
\m xizyo eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n q’ˤano-n b-exu-a adäza sis exu-n r-igu-ƛin
\g afterwards old-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW two-TOP I.PL-die-INF before one die-PST.UNW IV-good-QUOT
\l Then the older brother said: "Before two die, it's better if [just] one dies.

\t Xaner šebi yałru iyač’iniƛäy mi dey q’ˤimno reč’o, iyos orezni boqnosi min ok’äł t’ayƛin, xizyo nesiqor amanat bodin, mi dey q’ˤimno ruqˤo, yeɣeni esiwqno rukarno, nagaħ dey laga debeq biqinäy, q’ˤimde sadaq buyn šušoƛin.
\m xan-r šebi yoł-ru iy-a-č’i-niƛäy mi di-s q’ˤim-n r-eč’-o iyo-s orezni b-oq-nosi mi-n ok’eł t’ay-ƛin xizyo nesi-qor amanat b-odi-n mi di-s q’ˤim-n r-uqˤi-o y-eɣe-ni esiw-q-n r-ukar-n nagaħ di-s laga mi-q b-iqi-näy q’ˤim-de sadaq b-uy-n šuši-o-ƛin
\g khan-LAT who be-PST.PRT know-INF-NEG.FUT-PURP.CVB you me-GEN1 head-TOP IV-cut-IMPR blood-GEN1 pond III-become-ANT.CVB you-TOP escape from.here-QUOT afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT order III-do-PFV.CVB you me-GEN1 head-TOP IV-hide-IMPR II-young-DEF sister-POSS.ESS-TOP IV-show-PROHIB suppose me-GEN1 body you-POSS.ESS III-get-CND.CVB head-APUD.ESS together III-indeed-TOP bury-IMPR-QUOT
\l For the king won't know who it was, cut off my head and escape from there after there is a large pool of blood!"; then he gave him the order: "And hide my head, don't show it to our little sister, if you can get my body, bury it together with my head."

\t Hudun eženi esiya xecinč’izaƛ’, nesä äƛiruxor rodin.
\m hudun eže-ni esyu-a xeci-č’i-zaƛ’ nesi-a eƛi-ru-xor r-odi-n
\g nevertheless old-DEF brother-ERG leave-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT IV-do-PST.UNW
\l Nevertheless, because the older brother wouldn't leave it be, he did what he said.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo nucos bic’alini q’ilimay yeda maħorno oqno, eženi esiws q’ˤimno risno iduɣor oxin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo nuci-s b-ic’-ali-ni q’ili-ay yeda maħor-n oq-n eže-ni esiw-s q’ˤim-n r-is-n idu-ɣor oxi-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after honey-GEN1 III-fill-ATTR-DEF qili-IN.ABL DEM2.ISG outside-TOP become-PFV.CVB old-DEF brother-GEN1 head-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL run.away-PST.UNW
\l After that, he got out of the honey-filled pot, took the older brother's head and ran home.

\t Ža q’ˤimno ruqˤno yeda esiwde igor ayn.
\m ža q’ˤim-n r-uqˤi-n yeda esiw-de igo-r ay-n
\g DEM1.SG head-TOP IV-hide-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG sister-APUD.ESS near-LAT come-PST.UNW
\l That head he hid and went toward his sister.

\t Elus esiw na yołƛin neła esirnosi, q’ˤuya šaharyaɣor ik’äsiƛin, yaƛ’irno nesä ža.
\m elu-s esiw na yoł-ƛin neła-a esir-nosi q’ˤuya šahar-aɣor ik’i-asi-ƛin y-aƛ’ir-n nesi-a ža
\g we(I).OBL-GEN1 brother where be-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-ANT.CVB other city-IN.VERS go-RES.PRT-QUOT II-cheat-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG
\l When she asked: "Where is our brother?", he lied to her: "He has gone to another city."

\t Sasaqosi xan ezu-ʕaƛ’un, nucoz q’ilima teł c’ohortow yołäƛin.
\m sasaqosi xan ezu~oƛ’ˤu-n nuci-z q’ili-a teł c’ohor-tow yoł-a-ƛin
\g in.the.morning khan examine-PFV.CVB honey-GEN2 qili-IN.ESS inside thief-EMPH be-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The next morning the king examined, if ther was a thief in the honey pot.

\t Elo yisir q’ˤim anusi lagax laga besun.
\m elo yisi-r q’ˤim anu-si laga-x laga b-esu-n
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT head be.NEG-ATTR body-AD.ESS body III-find-PST.UNW
\l There he found a body without a head.

\t Xaner bič’zi roqno elo q’ˤano c’ohor zawrułin, sisinigon elay oxin äk’irułin.
\m xan-r bič’zi r-oq-n elo q’ˤano c’ohor zow-ru-łi-n sisi-ni-gon ele-ay oxi-n ik’i-ru-łi-n
\g khan-LAT understand IV-become-PST.UNW there two thief be.NPRS-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and other-DEF-CNTR here-IN.ABL run.away-PFV.CVB go-PST.PRT-NMLZ-and
\l The king understood that there were two thiefs and the other one had run away from there.

\t Ža q’orolay yisä iduɣorno goƛ’in, razi yodaniƛäy nełar ʕuraw saɣyatyabi teƛno.
\m ža q’orolay yisi-a idu-ɣor-n goƛ’i-n razi y-odi-ani-ƛay neła-r ʕuraw saɣyat-bi teƛ-n
\g DEM1.SG widow DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG home-IN.ALL-TOP invite-PFV.CVB agree II-do-MSD-SUB.ABL DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT many present-PL give-PST.UNW
\l He invited the widow into his house again, and for her to agree he gave her many presents.

\t Žigoƛ’aygon neła xanqo mołin, eloša debi aluk’ani ħumukuli maħor begir, c’ohorä ža bok’ek’inč’ey xäcinč’i.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon neła-a xan-q mołi-n eloša mi-s aluk’a-ni ħumukuli maħor b-egir c’ohor-a ža b-ok’ek’-č’ey xeci-č’i
\g again-SUPER.ABL-CNTR DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG khan-POSS.ESS teach-PST.UNW there you-GEN1 white-DEF camel outside III-let thief-ERG DEM1.SG III-steal-NEG.PST.CVB leave-NEG.FUT
\l Once again she explained to the king: "Let your white camel out there, the thief won't leave it unstolen.

\t Xizyo ža c’ohor k’edin esuranix di ƛ’iri risxo, daruyar ħumukulis reƛ där retinƛin iduzan yaħnaynƛin.
\m xizyo ža c’ohor k’edi-n esur-ani-x di ƛ’iri r-is-x daru-r ħumukuli-s reƛ di-r r-eti-n-ƛin idu-bi-a-n y-aħnad-n-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.SG thief search-PFV.CVB find-MSD-AD.ESS me above IV-take-IPFV.CVB medicine-LAT camel-GEN1 meat me-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT home-PL-IN.ESS-TOP II-walk.around-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l Afterwards I will take actions to search and find the thief, walking around the homes [saying] that I want camel meat for a medicine."

\t Neła qułtow nesi eɣeni esiws nełaƛ’ ozuri c’oxnoƛax.
\m neła qu-ł-tow nesi eɣe-ni esiw-s neła-ƛ’ ozuri c’ox-n-ƛax
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL young-DEF sister-GEN1 DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS eye meet-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l That very day it caught the younger sister's eye.

\t Sasiłacen ičin, iduɣorno bižin yisä yedu ħumukuli buyn bexayn, waħazoni ɣˤutka nełas reƛno ruqˤno.
\m sasił-ace-n iči-n idu-ɣor-n b-iži-n yisi-a yedu ħumukuli b-uy-n b-exʷad-n waħo-zo-ni ɣˤutku-a neła-s reƛ-n r-uqˤi-n
\g get.dark-TERM-TOP wait-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG camel III-indeed-TOP III-slaughter-PFV.CVB below-ATTR.OBL-DEF room-IN.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 meat-TOP IV-hide-PST.UNW
\l She waited until it got dark, lead that camel home and indeed slaughtered it and hid it's meat in the cellar.

\t Žeda žedur ʕeziyaw reƛ raħiranixgon esiwn yegirno.
\m žedu-a žedu-r ʕeziyaw reƛ r-aħi-r-ani-x-gon esiw-n y-egir-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT much meat IV-cook-LAT-MSD-AD.ESS-CNTR sister-TOP II-let-PST.UNW
\l The sister did that so they would have much meat for themselves.

\t Raħäruni reƛno rac’no, ence mazaħarno xizor utin iduɣor nexƛ’oräy, yiziz ɣˤutka tełäzay maħor yoqxo howža q’orolay yukayn.
\m r-aħi-r-ru-ni reƛ-n r-ac’-n ence mazaħ-ar-n xizor uti-n idu-ɣor nex-ƛ’oräy yizi-z ɣˤutku-a teł-azay maħor y-oq-x howža q’orolay y-ukad-n
\g IV-cook-CAUS-PST.PRT-DEF meat-TOP IV-eat-PFV.CVB a.little outside-IN.LAT-TOP back return-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL come-SIM.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN2 house-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL.DIST outside II-become-IPFV.CVB DEM4.SG widow II-see-PST.UNW
\l He ate the cooked meat and while coming home again, he saw that widow getting out of their house.

\t Migon nazay t’or yiħułäƛin, esirno yisä q’orolaq.
\m mi-gon nazay t’o-r y-iħu-ł-a-ƛin esir-n yisi-a q’orol-q
\g you-CNTR from.where here-LAT II-come.to-POT-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG widow-POSS.ESS
\l "Now where have you come from, here?", he asked the widow.

\t Daruyar ħumukulis reƛ riqač’ineyƛin maħor yoqäsi zows, debez esiwqay ence dahaw räqiru reƛno risno yik’ix hoboyƛin, eƛin q’orolayä.
\m daru-r ħumukuli-s reƛ r-iqi-ač’in-ey-ƛin maħor y-oq-asi zow-s mi-z esiw-qay ence dahaw r-iqi-ru reƛ-n r-is-n y-ik’i-x hoboy-ƛin eƛi-n q’orolay-a
\g medicine-LAT camel-GEN1 meat IV-get-NEG.FUT.DEF-DUB-QUOT outside II-become-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT you-GEN2 sister-POSS.ABL a.little a.little IV-get-PST.PRT meat-TOP IV-buy-PFV.CVB II-go-IPFV.CVB now-QUOT say-PST.UNW widow-ERG
\l "I didn't get camel's meat for a medicine.", she came outside, "Now I got a little bit from your sister and am going now.", the widow said.

\t Xizyo reƛ’an reč’no, waħozoni ɣˤutka q’orolan šušin, k’uläɣor žamaʕatyołxor ik’in.
\m xizyo reƛ’a-n r-eč’-n waħo-z-ni ɣˤutku-a q’orol-n šuši-n k’uli-aɣor žamaʕat-łxor ik’i-n
\g afterwards hand-TOP IV-cut-PFV.CVB below-GEN2-DEF room-IN.ESS widow-TOP bury-PFV.CVB side.street-IN.VERS assembly-CONT.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l Then he cut off her hand, and burried the widow in the cellar, then he went to the village's assembly in a side street.

\t Elo yisir imyoq bicäsi q’ˤim anusi esiws žanaza bukayn.
\m elo yisi-r im-q b-ici-asi q’ˤim anu-si esiw-s žanaza b-ukad-n
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT pole-POSS.ESS III-tie-RES.PRT head be.NEG-ATTR brother-GEN1 corpse III-see-PST.UNW
\l There he saw the headless corpse of his brother tied to a pole.

\t Xizyo iduɣorno nexno yisä yeɣeni esiwq esin kinaw eženi esiwr raqru łinałayn.
\m xizyo idu-ɣor-n nex-n yisi-a y-eɣe-ni esiw-q esi-n kinaw eže-ni esiw-r r-oq-ru łina-łay-n
\g afterwards home-IN.ALL-TOP come-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG II-young-DEF sister-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW entire old-DEF brother-LAT IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP
\l Afterwards he came home and told his younger sister everything that had happened to their older brother.

\t Howži yiła eƛin, didur di hoboy łaƛ’or yik’iƛ’oräy esiws žanaza bukaynosi, ʕiyaynč’ey yik’anƛin.
\m howži yiła-a eƛi-n didur di hoboy łi-ƛ’or y-ik’i-ƛ’oräy esiw-s žanaza b-ukad-nosi ʕiyad-č’ey y-ik’i-an-ƛin
\g now DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW how me now water-SUPER.LAT II-go-SIM.CVB brother-GEN1 corpse III-see-ANT.CVB cry-NEG.PST.CVB II-go-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Now she said: "How, while I'm going to fetch water, am I going to go without crying when I see my brother's corpse?"

\t Mi ʕiyaynäy, ahlimos šakno bäk’i, yižin xander min karƛin.
\m mi ʕiyad-näy ahli-s šak-n b-ik’i y-iži-n xan-der mi-n kur-ƛin
\g you cry-CND.CVB people-GEN1 suspicion-TOP III-go II-carry-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.LAT you-TOP throw-QUOT
\l "If you cry, people will get suspicious and throw you before the king."

\t Eženi esiya esin, č’ikays tungin bisno łäħorno yik’i, kikxar yik’iƛ’oräy yaħno bodo, elazay tungin bic’no nexƛ’oräy, esiwz žanazaxor yaynosi, tungi q’ˤidar bˤoƛ’a begirno xec.
\m eže-ni esyu-a esi-n č’ikay-s tungi-n b-is-n łi-xor-n y-ik’i kik-xar y-ik’i-ƛ’oräy yaħ-n b-odi-o ele-azay tungi-n b-ic’-n nex-ƛ’oräy esiw-z žanaza-xor y-ay-nosi tungi q’ˤida-r b-ˤoƛ’u-a b-egir-n xeci
\g old-DEF brother-ERG tell-PST.UNW glass-GEN1 copper.jug-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB water-AD.LAT-TOP II-go spring-AD.VERS II-go-SIM.CVB patience-TOP III-do-IMPR there-IN.ABL.DIST copper.jug-TOP III-fill-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB brother-GEN2 corpse-AD.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB copper.jug down-LAT III-fall-INF III-let-PFV.CVB leave
\l The older brother told: "Take a glass jug and go to the water; when you go to the spring, be patient and when you fill the jug there, come to your brother's corpse, let the jug fall down and leave.

\t Tungi becunosi, mi ʕiyada behizi yaq.
\m tungi b-ecu-nosi mi ʕiyad-a behizi y-oq
\g copper.jug III-break-ANT.CVB you cry-INF permit II-become
\l After the jug broke, you may cry.

\t Bäxuruni tungił xizay yedu ʕiyayxƛin xalq’imozgon rok’ƛ’orno rayƛin.
\m b-exu-ru-ni tungi-ł xizay yedu ʕiyad-x-ƛin xalq’i-z-gon rok’u-ƛ’or-n r-ay-ƛin
\g III-die-PST.PRT-DEF copper.jug-CONT.ESS behind DEM2.IISG cry-PRS-QUOT people-GEN2-CNTR heart-SUPER.LAT-TOP IV-come-QUOT
\l And the people will think that you're crying for the broken jug."

\t Esiya małiruxor, č’ikays tungin bisno, yedu łäħor yik’in.
\m esyu-a mołi-ru-xor č’ikay-s tungi-n b-is-n yedu łi-xor y-ik’i-n
\g brother-ERG teach-PST.PRT-AD.LAT glass-GEN1 copper.jug-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG water-AD.LAT II-go-PST.UNW
\l According to what the brother had said, she took a glass jug and went to get water.

\t Łäs tungin bic’no xizor yutin yedu nexƛ’oräy, esiwz žanazał adäzar yaynosi, gugyoq caƛin bowx zawru tungi begirno xecin yiła q’ˤidar.
\m łi-s tungi-n b-ic’-n xizor y-uti-n yedu nex-ƛ’oräy esiw-z žanaza-ł adäz-ar y-ay-nosi gugu-q caƛi-n b-ow-x zow-ru tungi b-egir-n xeci-n yiła-a q’ˤida-r
\g water-GEN1 copper.jug-TOP III-fill-PFV.CVB back II-return-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG come-SIM.CVB brother-GEN2 corpse-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB back-POSS.ESS throw-PFV.CVB III-bring-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT copper.jug III-let-PFV.CVB leave-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG down-LAT
\l She filled the jug with water and while she was coming back, she came to the corpse of her brother, let the jug fall down, which was [bringing/thrown at her back???], and left.

\t Tungi bexunosi, ʕiyayn yičin yedu.
\m tungi b-exu-nosi ʕiyad-n y-iči-n yedu
\g copper.jug III-die-ANT.CVB cry-PFV.CVB II-be-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG
\l When the jug broke, she was crying.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo xanes nukarbi yiłade igorno bayn esirno, yeda šebi deber oqxo, šida mi ʕiyayxƛin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo xan-s nukar-bi yiła-de igo-r-n b-ay-n esir-n yeda šebi mi-r oq-x šida mi ʕiyad-x-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after khan-GEN1 henchman-PL DEM2.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS near-LAT-TOP I.PL-come-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG what you-LAT happen-IPFV.CVB why you cry-PRS-QUOT
\l After that, the king's henchmen came near her and asked: "What is he to you; why are you crying?"

\t Di nesix ʕiyayxanu, enła bäxuruni tungix ʕiyayxƛin, žagon där iyxosi žek’ukin anuƛin.
\m di nesi-x ʕiyad-x-anu enła-a b-exu-ru-ni tungi-x ʕiyad-x-ƛin ža-gon di-r iy-xosi žek’u-kin anu-ƛin
\g me DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS cry-IPFV.CVB-NEG DEM3b.IISG.OBL-ERG III-die-PST.PRT-DEF copper.jug-AD.ESS cry-PRS-QUOT DEM1.SG-CNTR me-LAT know-PRS.PRT man-even be.NEG-QUOT
\l "I am not crying for him, I'm crying for the broken jug. I don't know this man."

\t Xanes nukarbi, nełaƛ’ bužzin boqno, xizor bik’in.
\m xan-s nukar-bi neła-ƛ’ bužzi-n b-oq-n xizor b-ik’i-n
\g khan-GEN1 henchman-PL DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS believe-PFV.CVB I.PL-become-PFV.CVB back I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l The king's henchmen believed her and went back.

\t Tungiƛ’ay yok’äłru kidno, esiwx ʕiyayx iduɣor yik’in.
\m tungi-ƛ’ay y-ok’eł-ru kid-n esiw-x ʕiyad-x idu-ɣor y-ik’i-n
\g copper.jug-SUPER.ABL II-go.away-PST.PRT girl-TOP brother-AD.ESS cry-IPFV.CVB home-IN.ALL II-go-PST.UNW
\l And the girl who was going away from the jug went home crying for her brother.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder xanä nesä nesis kid xaliča rišanix mažgityaɣort’a yegirxo zown, neširu ayn c’ohorä nesir žukłi radinƛin.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder xan-a nesi-a nesi-s kid xaliča r-iš-ani-x mažgit-aɣor-t’a y-egir-x zow-n neširu ay-n c’ohor-a nesi-r žukłi r-odi-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 daughter mat IV-weave-MSD-AD.ESS mosque-IN.VERS-DISTR II-send-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB at.night come-PFV.CVB thief-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT evil IV-do-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l After that, the king was sending his own daughter to the mosque to weave mats, thinking that in the night the thief might come and do evil to him.

\t Žan c’unzi yodin elogon xanä nukarbin xecin.
\m ža-n c’unzi y-odi-n elo-gon xan-a nukar-bi-n xeci-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP guard II-do-PFV.CVB there-CNTR khan-ERG henchman-PL-TOP leave-PST.UNW
\l To guard her, the king left his henchmen there.

\t Ža šebin yisi eɣeni esiwr teqno.
\m ža šebin yisi eɣe-ni esiw-r teq-n
\g DEM1.SG thing DEM2.ISG.OBL young-DEF brother-LAT hear-PST.UNW
\l And the young brother heard of that.

\t Q’orolas reč’alini reƛ’an rižin, yeda mažgityoz akixor ik’in.
\m q’orol-s r-eč’-ali-ni reƛ’a-n r-iži-n yeda mažgit-z aki-xor ik’i-n
\g widow-GEN1 IV-cut-ATTR-DEF hand-TOP IV-take.out-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG mosque-GEN2 window-AD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l He took out the cut-off hand of the widow and went to the moque's window.

\t Izin akiqno t’it’aħin, tełxor q’orolas reƛ’a roƛik’no, elo žan c’unizi yodin bäčiruni nukarza, rok’no mač’an reč’no roɣno.
\m izi-n aki-q-n t’it’aħi-n teł-xor q’orol-s reƛ’a r-oƛik’-n elo ža-n c’unzi y-odi-n b-iči-ru-ni nukar-bi-a r-ok’-n mač’a-n r-eč’-n r-oɣ-n
\g get.up-PFV.CVB window-POSS.ESS-TOP clutch-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT widow-GEN1 hand IV-let.appear-PFV.CVB there DEM1.SG-TOP guard II-do-PFV.CVB III-be-PST.PRT-DEF henchman-PL-ERG IV-hit-PFV.CVB saber-TOP IV-cut-PFV.CVB IV-take.away-PST.UNW
\l He got up and clutched at the window, and let the widow's hand appear inside, and the henchmen who were guarding her cut it off with their saber(s).

\t Xizyo xanä nazon nukarzaq riyrno, c’ohor yoł t’oza sis reƛ’a anusi, meži nasin nesił xizay boq, ža meža iqira ayƛin.
\m xizyo xan-a nazo-n nukar-bi-q r-iyr-n c’ohor yoł t’o-za sis reƛ’a anu-si meži nasin nesi-ł xizay b-oq ža mežu-a iqir-a ay-ƛin
\g afterwards khan-ERG all.OBL-TOP henchman-PL-POSS.ESS IV-explain-PFV.CVB thief be here-ZA one hand be.NEG-ATTR you.PL all DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind I.PL-become DEM1.SG you(I).PL.OBL-ERG catch-INF must-QUOT
\l Afterwards the king explained to all his henchmen: "The thief lacks one hand; y'all get behind him, you must catch him!"

\t Neła q’orolays zownƛax sis nełƛ’aygon siħiraw yacʕal.
\m neła q’orolay-s zow-n-ƛax sis neła-ƛ’ay-gon siħiraw yacʕal
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL widow-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT one DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL-CNTR cunning female.cousin
\l That widow, so it's said, had a (female) cousin who was more cunning than her.

\t Sida quł xanderno yayn neła eƛin, hay i wele, däq ža reƛ’a rukarƛin.
\m sida qu-ł xan-der-n y-ay-n neła-a eƛi-n hay i wele di-q ža reƛ’a r-ukar-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS khan-APUD.LAT-TOP II-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW so.then and look.out.IMP me-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG hand IV-show-QUOT
\l One day, she came to the king and said: "Lo and behold, show me this hand!"

\t Howlotow nełar riyn ža reƛ’a łas yałrułi, neła q’orolays reƛ’a yoł žaƛin esin neła xanqo.
\m howlo-tow neła-r r-iy-n ža reƛ’a ła-s yoł-rułi neła q’orolay-s reƛ’a yoł ža-ƛin esi-n neła-a xan-q
\g there-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT IV-know-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG hand who.OBL-GEN1 be-MSD DEM1.IISG.OBL widow-GEN1 hand be DEM1.SG-QUOT tell-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG khan-POSS.ESS
\l And there she knew whose hand it was: "It's this widow's hand.", she told the king.

\t Xizyogon urɣizi oqno xan, c’ohores q’ˤim anunč’uruni cudi sidaɣ qunyoxorno bayran, nesiz ʕagarłä ža šudał šušanix elay bižinč’ey xäcinč’i, hemełƛ’o där šebi ža c’ohor yałrun äyƛin.
\m xizyogon urɣizi oq-n xan c’ohor-s q’ˤim anu-č’u-ru-ni cudi sidaɣ qun-xor-n b-ayr-an nesi-z ʕagarłi-a ža šuda-ł šuši-ani-x ele-ay b-iži-č’ey xeci-č’i hemeł-ƛ’ di-r šebi ža c’ohor yoł-ru-n iy-ƛin
\g then thinking become-PST.UNW khan thief-GEN1 head be.NEG-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.PRT-DEF corpse in.one.place farmstead-AD.LAT-TOP III-bring-FUT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 relatives-ERG DEM1.SG graveyard-CONT.ESS bury-MSD-AD.ESS there-IN.ABL III-carry-NEG.PST.CVB leave-NEG.FUT DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS me-LAT who DEM1.SG thief be-PST.PRT-TOP know-QUOT
\l Then the king pondered: "I will bring the thief's headless corpse to the farmstead, his relatives won't leave without taking him from there to bury him on a graveyard."

\t Baq’ˤu mix bik’izaƛ’ortow, eɣeni esiwr teqxo xabar, yisiz eženi esiws cudi nukarza c’unzi bodix sida qunyox yołƛin.
\m b-aq’ˤu mix b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow eɣe-ni esiw-r teq-x xabar yisi-z eže-ni esiw-s cudi nukar-bi-a c’unzi b-odi-x sida qun-x yoł-ƛin
\g III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH young-DEF brother-LAT hear-PRS story DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 old-DEF brother-GEN1 corpse henchman-PL-ERG guard I.PL-do-IPFV.CVB one.OBL farmstead-AD.ESS be-QUOT
\l Before much time has passed, the younger brother was hearing the story that his older brother's corpse was at a farmstead being guarded by henchman.

\t Q’ˤanoqu nukar xanä egirno elo qunyoxor c’ohores ʕagarłi biyrno biqiraniƛäy.
\m q’ˤanoqu nukar xan-a egir-n elo qun-xor c’ohor-s ʕagarłi b-iyr-n b-iqir-ani-ƛay
\g forty henchman khan-ERG send-PST.UNW there farmstead-AD.LAT thief-GEN1 relatives III-find.out-PFV.CVB III-catch-MSD-SUB.ABL
\l The king sent forty henchmen to that farmstead in order to find out and catch the thief's relatives.

\t Elon eɣeni esiya žedur sis ħilla urɣizi bodin, araq’is bic’äsi q’urec’nin bižin ik’in, xanes nukarbin ħalik’no, elay eženi esiws cudi bok’ek’anƛin.
\m elo-n eɣe-ni esyu-a žedu-r sis ħilla urɣizi b-odi-n araq’i-s b-ic’-asi q’urec’ni-n b-iži-n ik’i-n xan-s nukar-bi-n ħalik’-n ele-ay eže-ni esiw-s cudi b-ok’ek’-an-ƛin
\g there-TOP young-DEF brother-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT one trickery thinking III-do-PST.UNW vodka-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT mule-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 henchman-PL-TOP water-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL old-DEF brother-GEN1 corpse III-steal-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l There the younger brother thought of playing a trickery on them: he would lead a mule packed with vodka and would "water" the king's henchmen and then would steal his older brother's corpse from there.

\t Q’urec’niƛ’ ƛ’iri q’ˤano t’ik’in caƛin, yeda oqno qunyoxaɣor ik’in.
\m q’urec’ni-ƛ’ ƛ’iri q’ˤano t’ik’i-n caƛi-n yeda oq-n qun-xaɣor ik’i-n
\g mule-SUPER.ESS on two waterskin-TOP throw-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG become-PFV.CVB farmstead-AD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l On the mule he threw two waterskins onto the mule and went began to go to the farm.

\t Araq’i yołƛin, esin užä.
\m araq’i yoł-ƛin esi-n uži-a
\g vodka be-QUOT tell-PST.UNW boy-ERG
\l "It's vodka", told the boy.

\t Howži žedu nesiƛ’or butin, neƛ elur araq’iƛin.
\m howži žedu nesi-ƛ’or b-uti-n neƛ elu-r araq’i-ƛin
\g now DEM1.IPL DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT I.PL-turn-PFV.CVB give we(I).OBL-LAT vodka-QUOT
\l Now they turned on him: "Give us the vodka!"

\t Hudun nesä žedur bukaynč’iruxor araq’i q’ˤidat’a biħurxo zown.
\m hudun nesi-a žedu-r b-ukad-č’i-ru-xor araq’i q’ˤida-t’a b-iħur-x zow-n
\g nevertheless DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT III-see-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT-AD.LAT vodka down-DISTR III-pour-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Nevertheless he poured the vodka down, so they didn't see it.

\t Sidqor sis bicin howlotow žedun xecin, q’urec’niƛ’ ƛ’iri esiws cudin erno, oqno iduɣor žan ik’in.
\m sida-qor sis b-ici-n howlo-tow žedu-n xeci-n q’urec’ni-ƛ’ ƛ’iri esiw-s cudi-n er-n oq-n idu-ɣor ža-n ik’i-n
\g one.OBL-POSS.LAT one III-tie-PFV.CVB there-EMPH DEM1.IPL-TOP leave-PFV.CVB mule-SUPER.ESS on brother-GEN1 corpse-TOP put-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL DEM1.SG-TOP go-PST.UNW
\l He tied them one on one and left them there, then he put his brother's corpse onto the mule and began to go home.

\t Q’ˤimde sadaq lagan šušin, eɣeni esiya rok’un hiƛirno.
\m q’ˤim-de sadaq laga-n šuši-n eɣe-ni esyu-a rok’u-n hiƛir-n
\g head-APUD.ESS together body-TOP bury-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother-ERG heart-TOP place.comfortably-PST.UNW
\l The young brother buried the body together with the head and calmed down.

\t Xizyo xaner riyn, c’ohoresno, nesiz nukarzasno qunyox raqru łinałäyn.
\m xizyo xan-r r-iy-n c’ohor-s-n nesi-z nukar-bi-s-n qun-x r-oq-ru łina-łay-n
\g afterwards khan-LAT IV-know-PST.UNW thief-GEN1-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 henchman-PL-GEN1-and farmstead-AD.ESS IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP
\l Then the king found out what had happened to the thief and to his henchmen on the farmstead.

\t Nesä naysinan nesiz raƛ’ma xabar begirno, c’ohor däƛ’ay ežis, di nesił q’ˤim rok’siƛin.
\m nesi-a naysinan nesi-z raƛ’-a xabar b-egir-n c’ohor di-ƛ’ay eži-s di nesi-ł q’ˤim r-ok’-s-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG everywhere DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 land-IN.ESS story III-send-PFV.CVB thief me-SUPER.ABL win-PST.WIT me DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS head IV-beat-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l He spread the story everywhere that "The thief has won over me, I declare my defeat.

\t Ža däde igor aynäy, nesir di roƛik’u xanłin teƛan, kidno yegirno mezałin nesił di risanƛin.
\m ža di-de igo-r ay-näy nesi-r di r-oƛƛik’u xanłi-n teƛ-an kid-n y-egir-n meza-łi-n nesi-ł di r-is-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG me-APUD.ESS near-LAT come-CND.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT me IV-half khanate-TOP give-FUT.DEF daughter-and II-send-PFV.CVB son~in~law-NMLZ-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS me IV-take-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l If he comes to me, I will give him half my kingdom, marry off my daughter to him and I'll take him as my son-in-law."

\t Baq’ˤu xalq’i nesider bayn, di ža c’ohor yołƛin.
\m b-aq’ˤu xalq’i nesi-der b-ay-n di ža c’ohor yoł-ƛin
\g III-many people DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT III-come-PST.UNW me DEM1.SG thief be-QUOT
\l Many people came to him: "I am that thief."

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo eɣeni esiw k’oƛin ik’in xander.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo eɣe-ni esiw k’oƛi-n ik’i-n xan-der
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after young-DEF brother run-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW khan-APUD.LAT
\l After that, the young brother came running to the king.

\t Xanä nesiq esirno, didur debeq hawšinaw šebin roda k’ʷeze roqäƛin.
\m xan-a nesi-q esir-n didur mi-q hawšinaw šebin r-odi-a k’ʷeze r-oq-a-ƛin
\g khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW how you-POSS.ESS so.many thing IV-do-INF can IV-become-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The king asked him: "How could you do so many things?!"

\t Yisä yałruxor kinaw raqrun, nesa rayrun łinałäy esin nesiq.
\m yisi-a yoł-ru-xor kinaw r-oq-ru-n nesi-a r-odi-ru-n łina-łay esi-n nesi-q
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG be-PST.PRT-AD.LAT entire IV-happen-PST.PRT-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG IV-do-PST.PRT-and what.OBL-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l He told him about everything that had happened and that he had done.

\t Xanä nesir roƛik’u nesä nesis xanłin teƛno, kidno yegirno.
\m xan-a nesi-r r-oƛƛik’u nesi-a nesi-s xanłi-n teƛ-n kid-n y-egir-n
\g khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-half DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 khanate-and give-PFV.CVB daughter-and II-send-PST.UNW
\l The king gave him half of his kingdom and married his daughter off to him.

\t Kʷaxatowngon nesä nesiz mečar xanłungon egirno.
\m kʷaxa-tow-n-gon nesi-a nesi-z meča-r xan-łun-gon egir-n
\g soon-EMPH-TOP-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 instead-LAT khan-LHUN-CNTR let-PST.UNW
\l And very soon then, he even let him be the king.

\t Žedus zownƛax q’ˤimaku, xedyox regiracet’a roqäsi łˤonon kidbabi.
\m žedu-s zow-n-ƛax q’ˤimaku xediw-x r-egir-ace-t’a r-oq-asi łˤono-n kid-bi
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT grown.up husband-AD.ESS II.PL-send-TERM-DISTR II.PL-begin-RES.PRT three-TOP daughter-PL
\l They had three daughters that were in the age of getting married.

\t Šomon ʕoloqan baħarči ik’ix zown žedun esirno, kidbabi didurnokin razi roqxo zownanu.
\m šomo-n ʕoloqan baħarči ik’i-x zow-n žedu-n esir-n kid-bi didur-n-kin razi r-oq-x zow-n-anu
\g how.many-TOP young brave.young.man go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL-TOP ask-PFV.CVB girl-PL how-TOP-even accept II.PL-become-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW-NEG
\l So many brave young men were coming and asked them out, but the girls refused them.

\t Sida quł, babiya igorno goƛ’in kidbazaq riyrno, sasaq eli bet’erbaqi bodanix maħor boqa bayƛin.
\m sida qu-ł babiw-a igo-r-n goƛ’i-n kid-bi-q r-iyr-n sasaq eli bet’erbaqi b-odi-ani-x maħor b-oq-a b-ay-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS father-ERG near-LAT-TOP call-PFV.CVB daughter-PL-POSS.ESS IV-explain-PST.UNW tomorrow we life III-do-MSD-AD.ESS outside I.PL-become-INF I.PL-must-QUOT
\l One day, the father called them to himself and explained to the daughters: "Tomorrow we have to go outside to do work."

\t Hudayziko qˤaħłiqtow babiw kidbabi saparyox boqno.
\m hudayziko qaħłi-q-tow babiw kid-bi sapar-x b-oq-n
\g the.next.day dawn-POSS.ESS-EMPH father daughter-PL journey-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The next day at dawn the father (and) the daughters went on their journey.

\t Babiw pikruzał ik’ix zown, didurey yizidäy hozur ok’łanƛin.
\m babiw pikru-bi-ł ik’i-x zow-n didur-ey yizi-day hozur ok’eł-an-ƛin
\g father idea-PL-CONT.ESS go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW how-DUB DEM2.IPL.OBL-APUD.ABL separately lose-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The father was going with the thoughts: "How can I get rid of them?"

\t Šomon ɣudi hunixno roɣno, yizi sida yeže gogaƛ’or bayn.
\m šomo-n ɣudi huni-x-n r-oɣ-n yizi sida y-eže goga-ƛ’or b-ay-n
\g how.many-TOP day way-AD.ESS-TOP IV-spend.time-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL one.OBL II-big meadow-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l They spent many days on their way, then they came to a big meadow.

\t Elo babiya kidbazaqor eƛin, meži däqor rezun howt’o ričinčey, di ezu-ʕaƛ’a ik’an sasaqor ɣudi qˤaširanix elur t’ozoƛ’ay bigu moči yołäƛin.
\m elo babiw-a kid-bi-qor eƛi-n meži di-qor r-ezu-n howt’o r-iči-n-čey di ezu~oƛ’ˤu-a ik’i-an sasaq-qor ɣudi qˤašir-ani-x elu-r t’o-zo-ƛ’ay b-igu moči yoł-a-ƛin
\g there father-ERG daughter-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you.PL me-POSS.LAT II.PL-look-PFV.CVB here II.PL-wait-PFV.CVB-INTS me examine-INF go-FUT.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT day dawn-MSD-AD.ESS we(I).OBL-LAT here-ATTR.OBL-SUPER.ABL I.PL-good place be-Q-QUOT
\l There the father told them: "Wait for me here, I will go and have a look around if there is a better place to spend the night than this one here."

\t Žan eƛin, babiw gogaƛ’ay oqno bitor ik’in, kidbabin babiw ayaniqor rezun howlotow ričäsi zown.
\m ža-n eƛi-n babiw goga-ƛ’ay oq-n bitor ik’i-n kid-bi-n babiw ay-ani-qor r-ezu-n howlo-tow r-iči-asi zow-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP say-PFV.CVB father meadow-SUPER.ABL become-PFV.CVB thither go-PFV.CVB girl-PL-TOP father come-MSD-POSS.LAT II.PL-look-PFV.CVB there-EMPH II.PL-wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Having said that, the father left the meadow and went away, and the girls waited there for their father to return.

\t Dahaw zaman bik’in, baq’ˤu zaman bik’in, roƛi qur rayn, hudun babiw aynanu.
\m dahaw zaman b-ik’i-n b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-n r-oƛi qu-r r-ay-n hudun babiw ay-n-anu
\g a.little time III-go-PFV.CVB III-much time III-go-PFV.CVB IV-half day-LAT II.PL-come-PFV.CVB nevertheless father come-PST.UNW-NEG
\l A little time passed, much time passed, it became midnight; nevertheless their father didn't come back.

\t Hoboy kidbazar čuqˤno, žedu roɣno kurno babiw äk’irułi.
\m hoboy kid-bi-r čuqˤ-n žedu r-oɣ-n kur-n babiw ik’i-rułi
\g now girl-PL-LAT notice-PST.UNW DEM1.IIPL II.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB throw-PFV.CVB father go-MSD
\l Now the girls noticed that their father abandoned them and went away.

\t Sasaqosi elo yizi zawza mečoƛ’or ƛ’irir neła ħukmatyos xan keze oqno.
\m sasaqosi elo yizi zow-za moči-ƛ’or ƛ’iri-r neła ħukmat-s xan keze oq-n
\g in.the.morning there DEM2.IPL be.NPRS-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.LAT on-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL country-GEN1 khan meet become-PST.UNW
\l In the morning, to the place where they were came that country's king for a meeting.

\t Nesä esirno, aɣikin bayxanuzo yiła gogaƛ’or mežigon nazay t’or rayäƛin.
\m nesi-a esir-n aɣi-kin b-ay-xanuzo yiła goga-ƛ’or meži-gon nazay t’o-r r-ay-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW bird-even III-come-NEG.PRS.PRT.OBL DEM2.IISG.OBL meadow-SUPER.LAT you.PL-CNTR from.where here-LAT II.PL-come-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l He asked: "From where did you come here to this meadow, where even birds do not come?"

\t Kidbazä esin, eli babiwde sadaq saparyox roqäsi zows, babiwn gugin howt’o ƛexasi yoł, ela debez ɣunoqay dahaw henešno but’in bac’siƛin.
\m kid-bi-a esi-n eli babiw-de sadaq sapar-x r-oq-asi zow-s babiw-n gugi-n howt’o ƛexu-asi yoł ela-a mi-z ɣun-qay dahaw heneš-n b-ut’i-n b-ac’-s-ƛin
\g girl-PL-ERG tell-PST.UNW we father-APUD.ESS together journey-AD.ESS II.PL-become-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT father-TOP escape-PFV.CVB here remain-RES.PRT be we(II-ERG you-GEN2 tree-POSS.ABL a.little apple-TOP III-rip.out-PFV.CVB III-eat-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The girls said: "We were travelling together with our father, and he ran away and we were staying here; and we picked some apples from your tree and ate them."

\t Šebi mežas maxšel yołƛin, xanä yizaq esirno.
\m šebi meža-s maxšel yoł-ƛin xan-a yiza-q esir-n
\g what you(II-GEN1 skill be-QUOT khan-ERG DEM2.IIPL.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l "What are your skills?", asked the king.

\t Yeženi esiya eƛin, hisos ric’no urgu däqor neƛnäy, nazon debez nukarzaz guluzaƛ’ ƛ’iri kuranix xaličabi rišan diƛin.
\m y-eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n his-s r-ic’-n urgu di-qor neƛ-näy nazo-n mi-z nukar-bi-z gulu-bi-ƛ’ ƛ’iri kur-ani-x xaliča-bi r-iši-an di-ƛin
\g II-old-DEF sister-ERG say-PST.UNW spring.wool-GEN1 IV-fill-PFV.CVB sack me-POSS.LAT give-CND.CVB all.OBL-TOP you-GEN2 henchman-PL-GEN2 horse-PL-SUPER.ESS on spread.out-MSD-AD.ESS mat-PL IV.PL-weave-FUT.DEF me-QUOT
\l The oldest sister said: "If you fill a sack with wool and give it to me, I will weave mats to put on all the horses of your henchmen."

\t Yoƛozoni esiya eƛin, däqor at’es sis saħ neƛnäy, debez ozyortow ʕeze roqace magalabi rodan diƛin.
\m y-oƛƛo-zo-ni esyu-a eƛi-n di-qor at’-s sis saħ neƛ-näy mi-z oz-r-tow ʕeze r-oq-ace magalu-bi r-odi-an di-ƛin
\g II-middle-ATTR.OBL-DEF sister-ERG say-PST.UNW me-POSS.LAT wheat-GEN1 one sah give-CND.CVB you-GEN2 army-LAT-EMPH be.enough III.PL-become-TERM bread-PL III.PL-do-FUT.DEF me-QUOT
\l The middle sister said: "If you give me one sah of wheat, I will make breads enough for your army."

\t Yeɣenä eƛin, di nesir marɣalyos k’icu yołäsi užin odan, mesedyosgon žežu yołäsi kidno yodanƛin.
\m y-eɣe-ni-a eƛi-n di nesi-r marɣal-s k’icu yoł-asi uži-n odi-an mesed-s-gon žežu yoł-asi kid-n y-odi-an-ƛin
\g II-young-DEF-ERG say-PST.UNW me DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT pearl-GEN1 tooth be-RES.PRT son-and do-FUT.CVB gold-GEN1-CNTR ponytail be-RES.PRT daughter-and II-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The young one said: "I will give birth to a son with a pearl tooth and a daughter with a golden ponytail."

\t Nedur resunäy, däde sadaq ƛaƛin, xanä žedu łˤonon iduɣor rižin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy di-de sadaq ƛa-ƛin xan-a žedu łˤono-n idu-ɣor r-iži-n
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB me-APUD.ESS together go.IMPR-QUOT khan-ERG DEM1.IIPL three-TOP home-IN.ALL II.PL-lead-PFV.CVB
\l "If that is the case, come with me!", said the king and lead the three of them to his home.

\t Risno yeženi esiwqor xanä rut’ugabi rišanix hisos ric’äsi urgu teƛno.
\m r-is-n y-eže-ni esiw-qor xan-a rut’uga-bi r-iši-ani-x his-s r-ic’-asi urgu teƛ-n
\g IV-take-PFV.CVB II-old-DEF sister-POSS.LAT khan-ERG carpet-PL IV.PL-weave-MSD-AD.ESS spring.wool-GEN1 IV-fill-RES.PRT sack give-PST.UNW
\l The king gave the oldest sister a sack filled with wool for her to weave carpets.

\t Qˤašizaƛ’or rišin neła rut’ugabi, łˤonoqu äƛiru rut’ugar dahaw moxon ʕeze boqinč’ey, q’ˤuyaniƛ’ay ža q’ˤuna bašice k’ot’ono roqno.
\m qˤaši-zaƛ’or r-iši-n neła-a rut’uga-bi łˤonoqu äƛiru rut’uga-r dahaw mo-x-n ʕeze b-oq-č’ey q’ˤuya-ni-ƛ’ay ža q’ˤuna baša-ce k’ot’ono r-oq-n
\g dawn-POST.CVB IV.PL-weave-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG carpet-PL sixty ORD carpet-LAT a.little fat-AD.ESS-TOP be.enough III-become-NEG.PST.CVB other-DEF-SUPER.ABL DEM1.SG two.OBL finger-EQU1 short IV-become-PST.UNW
\l Until dawn she weaved carpets, but the thread was a little too short for the sixtieth carpet, so it became two fingers shorter than the others.

\t Sasaqosi xanqo esin, sis xaliča dahaw k’ot’ono riłe yołƛin.
\m sasaqosi xan-q esi-n sis xaliča dahaw k’ot’ono r-iłe yoł-ƛin
\g in.the.morning khan-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW one mat a.little short IV-as be-QUOT
\l In the morning they told the king: "One mat is a little shorter."

\t Mi äƛiru roži t’ubazi rodinč’uƛin, xanä yeženi esiw xizor yoxirno.
\m mi eƛi-ru roži t’ubazi r-odi-č’u-ƛin xan-a y-eže-ni esiw xizor y-oxir-n
\g you say-PST.PRT word fulfill IV-do-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT khan-ERG II-old-DEF sister back II-chase-PST.UNW
\l "You didn't keep your word!" said the king and chased the oldest sister back.

\t Nesä nesiz nukarzaƛ’ xaličabin rułirno.
\m nesi-a nesi-z nukar-bi-ƛ’ xaliča-bi-n r-ułir-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 henchman-PL-SUPER.ESS mat-PL-TOP IV.PL-share-PST.UNW
\l And the mats he shared among his own henchmen.

\t Hudayziko yoƛozoni esiwqor gegmus ric’äsi saħ teƛno, däz ozyor rac’anix ʕeziyaw magalabi rodoƛin.
\m hudayziko y-oƛƛo-zo-ni esiw-qor gegmu-s r-ic’-asi saħ teƛ-n di-z oz-r r-ac’-ani-x ʕeziyaw magalu-bi r-odi-o-ƛin
\g the.next.day II-middle-ATTR.OBL-DEF sister-POSS.LAT flour-GEN1 IV-fill-RES.PRT sah give-PST.UNW me-GEN2 army-LAT IV-eat-MSD-AD.ESS many bread-PL III.PL-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l The next day, he gave a sah filled with flour to the middle sister, [saying]: "Make many breads for my army to eat!"

\t Nełaqno sis magalu beɣe biłe boqno.
\m neła-q-n sis magalu b-eɣe b-iłe b-oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP one bread III-small III-as III-become-PST.UNW
\l For her one bread became too small.

\t Xander yik’in esin neła, sis magalu beɣe biłe boqno, deber näƛru roži daq t’ubazi roqinč’uƛin.
\m xan-der y-ik’i-n esi-n neła-a sis magalu b-eɣe b-iłe b-oq-n mi-r neƛ-ru roži di-q t’ubazi r-oq-č’u-ƛin
\g khan-APUD.LAT II-go-PFV.CVB tell-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG one bread III-small III-as III-become-PFV.CVB you-LAT give-PST.PRT word me-POSS.ESS fulfill IV-become-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l She went to the king and told him: "One bread became a bit smaller, the word that I have given to you didn't fulfill."

\t Yoqzaƛ’ yeženi esiwł xizaytow min yik’iƛin, xanä yoƛƛosin esiw maħor yoxirno.
\m y-oq-zaƛ’ y-eže-ni esiw-ł xizay-tow mi-n y-ik’i-ƛin xan-a y-oƛƛo-si-n esiw maħor y-oxir-n
\g II-happen-CSL.CVB II-old-DEF sister-CONT.ESS behind-EMPH you-and II-go-QUOT khan-ERG II-middle-ATTR-and sister outside II-chase-PST.UNW
\l "Because this happened, go after your older sister!", and the king also chased the middle sister away.

\t Magalabin nesä hemedurtow nesä nesiz nukarzaƛ’ rułirno.
\m magalu-bi-n nesi-a hemedur-tow nesi-a nesi-z nukar-bi-ƛ’ r-ułir-n
\g bread-PL-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG so-EMPH DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 henchman-PL-SUPER.ESS III.PL-share-PST.UNW
\l The bread he also shared among his own henchmen.

\t Reɣeni xaliča räqiruni nukarertow biqin beɣeni magalun.
\m r-eɣe-ni xaliča r-iqi-ru-ni nukar-r-tow b-iqi-n b-eɣe-ni magalu-n
\g IV-small-DEF mat IV-get-PST.PRT-DEF henchman-LAT-EMPH III-get-PST.UNW III-small-DEF bread-and
\l And the henchman who got the small mat also got the small bread.

\t Łˤora äƛiru ɣudƛ’ogon xanä bertenno bodin yeɣeni esiw yown.
\m łˤora äƛiru ɣudi-ƛ’-gon xan-a berten-n b-odi-n y-eɣe-ni esiw y-ow-n
\g three.OBL ORD day-SUPER.ESS-CNTR khan-ERG marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB II-young-DEF sister II-marry-PST.UNW
\l And on the third day the king arranged a marriage and married the young sister.

\t Xexbi roda netiey zaman bayanƛin, xanä ɣudbi t’et’erxo ičäsi zown.
\m xexbi r-odi-a neti-ey zaman b-ay-an-ƛin xan-a ɣudi-bi t’et’r-x iči-asi zow-n
\g children III.PL-do-INF when-DUB time III-come-FUT.DEF-QUOT khan-ERG day-PL count-IPFV.CVB wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The king waited and counted the days until the time when the children would be born.

\t Sida quł sasaqosi bara eƛin, di yaqˤuł xexbi royxosi, mi däde igono näxno, č’uħaraw šeƛ’un šeƛ’un madaħarno oƛäxnoƛin.
\m sida qu-ł sasaqosi baru-a eƛi-n di yaqˤuł xexbi r-odi-xosi mi di-de igo-n nex-n č’uħaraw šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n madaħ-ar-n oƛix-n-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning wife-ERG say-PST.UNW me today children III.PL-do-PRS.PRT you me-APUD.ESS near-TOP come-PROHIB gorgeous clothing-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB outside-IN.LAT-and appear-PROHIB-QUOT
\l One day in the morning the wife said: "Today I am giving birth to the children, do not come near me and do not go outside in gorgeous clothing!"

\t Sasiłzaƛ’or xan idurno ik’inanu, č’uħaraw šeƛ’un šeƛ’unanu.
\m sasił-zaƛ’or xan idu-r-n ik’i-n-anu č’uħaraw šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n-anu
\g get.dark-POST.CVB khan home-LAT-and go-PFV.CVB-NEG gorgeous clothing-and put.on-PST.UNW-NEG
\l Until it got dark, the king neither went home nor put on gorgeous clothing.

\t Neširaygon soder yisä č’uħaraw šeƛ’un šeƛ’un madazaħ aħnayx zown.
\m neširu-ay-gon soder yisi-a č’uħaraw šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n ma-bi-x aħnad-x zow-n
\g evening-IN.ABL-CNTR after DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG gorgeous clothing-and put.on-PFV.CVB outside-PL-AD.ESS walk.around-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After the evening, however, he put on gorgeous clothes and took a walk outside.

\t Žedu režet’ani esnazar retinanu yeɣeni esiw xanxo yik’izaƛ’, yizi urɣizi roqno, šebiey nełar elaq žukłi roqanƛin.
\m žedu r-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-r r-eti-n-anu y-eɣe-ni esiw xan-x y-ik’i-zaƛ’ yizi urɣizi r-oq-n šebi-ey neła-r ela-q žukłi r-oq-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL II.PL-old-DISTR-DEF sister-PL-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-NEG II-young-DEF sister khan-AD.ESS II-go-CSL.CVB DEM2.IPL thinking IV-become-PFV.CVB what-DUB DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT we(II-POSS.ESS evil IV-happen-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The older sisters didn't want that, because the younger sister went to the king, he would think, that something evil with us might happen to her.

\t Hemeła qułtow žeda pikru bodin, yaqˤuł elas esiya xexbi roda rayxosi anaƛin.
\m hemeła qu-ł-tow žeda-a pikru b-odi-n yaqˤuł ela-s esyu-a xexbi r-odi-a r-ay-xosi anu-a-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS-EMPH DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG idea III-do-PST.UNW today we(II-GEN1 sister-ERG children III.PL-do-INF III.PL-must-PRS.PRT be.NEG-Q-QUOT
\l On that very day they thought: "Shouldn't our sister give birth to the children today?"

\t Elay rizin yizi sida siħirawni q’orolaydäɣor rik’in, yeɣeni esiwde puħay xexbi rok’ek’anix sis ħilla urɣizi bodoƛin.
\m ele-ay r-izi-n yizi sida siħiraw-ni q’orolay-däɣor r-ik’i-n y-eɣe-ni esiw-de puħo-ay xexbi r-ok’ek’-ani-x sis ħilla urɣizi b-odi-o-ƛin
\g there-IN.ABL II.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL one.OBL cunning-DEF widow-APUD.VERS II.PL-go-PST.UNW II-young-DEF sister-APUD.ESS next.to-IN.ABL children III.PL-steal-MSD-AD.ESS one trickery thinking III-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l They got up from there and went to a cunning widow: "Think of a trickery in order to steal the children from our younger sister's side!"

\t Ža q’orolay xanez ɣˤutkoz madaxor yik’in.
\m ža q’orolay xan-z ɣˤutku-z ma-xor y-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG widow khan-GEN2 house-GEN2 gate-AD.LAT II-go-PST.UNW
\l That widow then went to the gate of the king's house.

\t Č’uħaraw šeƛ’un šeƛ’un iduza, madazax aħna-ik’ix yołƛax xan.
\m č’uħaraw šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n idu-bi-a ma-bi-x aħna~ik’i-x yoł-ƛax xan
\g gorgeous clothing-and put.on-PFV.CVB home-PL-IN.ESS outside-PL-AD.ESS walk.for.a.while-IPFV.CVB be-QUOT khan
\l The king is said to have gone outside in his gorgeous clothes, taking a walk.

\t Yiła esirno, yaqˤuł debez bara xexbiya royxosi yołƛin.
\m yiła-a esir-n yaqˤuł mi-z baru-a xexbi-a r-odi-x-si yoł-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW today you-GEN2 wife-ERG children-Q III.PL-do-IPFV.CVB-ATTR be-QUOT
\l She asked: "Is your wife giving birth to the children today?"

\t Sosisi xan royxosi anuƛin ičäsi zown, yigtow q’orolay ƛ’iri yutizaƛ’, xanä esin.
\m sosi-si xan r-odi-x-si anu-ƛin iči-asi zow-n y-ig-tow q’orolay ƛ’iri y-uti-zaƛ’ xan-a esi-n
\g at.first-ATTR khan III.PL-do-IPFV.CVB-ATTR be.NEG-QUOT be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB II-much-EMPH widow above II-turn-CSL.CVB khan-ERG tell-PST.UNW
\l At first the king was like: "She doesn't.", but because the widow insisted so much, the king told her.

\t Xizyo yiła yisiqor eƛin, däqkin šida mi esinč’u, xexbi royxosi ɣˤanabi nedur sisxoli xeca yayxosi anu.
\m xizyo yiła-a yisi-qor eƛi-n di-q-kin šida mi esi-č’u xexbi r-odi-x-si ɣˤanabi nedur sisxoli xeci-a y-ay-x-si anu
\g afterwards DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW me-POSS.ESS-even why you tell-NEG.PST.WIT children III.PL-do-IPFV.CVB-ATTR woman so alone leave-INF II-must-IPFV.CVB-ATTR be.NEG
\l Then she said to him: "Why didn't you tell me? One musn't let a woman who gives birth to children so alone.

\t Ya yexun yäsu ža, ya č’agu yäsuƛin xanqorno eƛin, yedu režet’ani esnazadäɣor yik’in, xanesno yiłasno baqru xabaryołäy esanix.
\m ya y-exu-n y-esu ža ya č’agu y-esu-ƛin xan-qor-n eƛi-n yedu r-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-däɣor y-ik’i-n xan-s-n yiła-s-n b-oq-ru xabar-łay esi-ani-x
\g either II-die-PFV.CVB II-exist DEM1.SG either alive II-exist-QUOT khan-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG IV-old-DISTR-DEF sister-PL-APUD.VERS II-go-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1-and DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1-and III-happen-PST.PRT story-CONT.ABL tell-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Maybe she is dead, or maybe she is alive." she said to the king, went to the older sister and told that story that happened to her and the king.

\t Sis k’ucin, k’et’us xexoyn ałux ruqˤno žedun rižin q’orolay xanez barudäɣor yik’in.
\m sis k’uci-n k’et’u-s xexoy-n ału-x r-uqˤi-n žedu-n r-iži-n q’orolay xan-z baru-däɣor y-ik’i-n
\g one puppy-and cat-GEN1 young.animal-and skirt-AD.ESS III.PL-hide-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL-and III.PL-carry-PFV.CVB widow khan-GEN2 wife-APUD.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l The widow hid a puppy and a kitten under her skirt and carried them to the king's wife.

\t Neła kidno, užin rodäsi resun.
\m neła-a kid-n uži-n r-odi-asi r-esu-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG daughter-and son-and III.PL-do-RES.PRT II.PL-exist-PST.UNW
\l She had given birth to a daughter and a son.

\t Nełdäy xexbin rižin, k’ucin, k’et’us xexoybin nełder kurno.
\m neła-day xexbi-n r-iži-n k’uci-n k’et’u-s xexoy-bi-n neła-der kur-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ABL children-TOP III.PL-take.out-PFV.CVB puppy-and cat-GEN1 young.animal-PL-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT spread.out-PST.UNW
\l She took away the children from her and put the puppy and the kitten do her.

\t Žedu q’ˤanon xexbin rižin q’orolay duri bižin režet’ani esnazadäɣor yik’in.
\m žedu q’ˤano-n xexbi-n r-iži-n q’orolay duri b-iži-n r-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-däɣor y-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IIPL two-TOP children-TOP III.PL-carry-PFV.CVB widow run III-carry-PFV.CVB IV-old-DISTR-DEF sister-PL-APUD.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l The widow carried the two children and ran to the older sisters.

\t Žeda q’orolaq harizi rodin, yizi xexbi mi kikoƛin.
\m žeda q’orol-q harizi r-odi-n yizi xexbi mi kiki-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL widow-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PST.UNW DEM2.IPL children you feed-IMPR-QUOT
\l They asked the widow: "Please feed these children!"

\t Kudrä tełno bičirno, q’orola žedu kikix zown.
\m kud-a teł-n b-ičir-n q’orol-a žedu kiki-x zow-n
\g cradle-IN.ESS inside-TOP I.PL-hand.over-PFV.CVB widowed-ERG DEM1.IIPL feed-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The widow put them into a cradle and fed them.

\t Xanzo barus naysinan ci rik’inƛax ɣˤʷays k’ucin, k’et’us xexoyn neła ƛuƛin rodinƛin.
\m xan-z baru-s naysinan ci r-ik’i-n-ƛax ɣˤʷay-s k’uci-n k’et’u-s xexoy-n neła-a ƛuƛi-n r-odi-n-ƛin
\g khan-GEN2 wife-GEN1 everywhere name IV-go-PST.UNW-QUOT dog-GEN1 puppy-and cat-GEN1 young.animal-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG give.birth-PFV.CVB III.PL-do-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l The king's wife became known everywhere for the fact that she gave birth to a puppy and a kitten.

\t Sida quł neširu aħna-ik’anix maħor oqnosi, reɣeni xaličan, beɣenigon magalun bäqiruni xanzo nukarer q’orolaz idäzay beɣe xexzas guru teqno.
\m sida qu-ł neširu aħna~ik’i-ani-x maħor oq-nosi r-eɣe-ni xaliča-n b-eɣe-ni-gon magalu-n b-iqi-ru-ni xan-z nukar-r q’orol-z idu-azay b-eɣe xexbi-s guru teq-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS evening walk.for.a.while-MSD-AD.ESS outside become-ANT.CVB IV-small-DEF mat-and III-small-DEF-CNTR bread-and III-get-PST.PRT-DEF khan-GEN2 henchman-LAT widow-GEN2 home-IN.ABL.DIST I.PL-young children-GEN1 crying hear-PST.UNW
\l One day, in the evening, one of the king's henchmen who went outside to walk for a while and got a small mat and a small bread heard the crying of young children from the home of the widow.

\t Q’arƛ’otow izin ik’in yisä xanqo esin, neširu q’orolaz iday, hemedur, beɣe xexzas där guru teqsi, žedu xexbi debikin besač’ineyƛin.
\m q’ar-ƛ’-tow izi-n ik’i-n yisi-a xan-q esi-n neširu q’orol-z idu-ay hemedur b-eɣe xexbi-s di-r guru teq-s žedu xexbi mi-s-kin b-esu-ač’in-ey-ƛin
\g early-SUPER.ESS-EMPH get.up-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG khan-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW evening widow-GEN2 home-IN.ABL so I.PL-young children-GEN1 me-LAT crying hear-PST.WIT DEM1.IPL children you-GEN1-even I.PL-appear-NEG.FUT.DEF-DUB-QUOT
\l He got up early, went to the king and told him: "So yesterday night I heard the crying of young children from the widow's home; couldn't those children be yours?"

\t ʕAƛoz ɣˤanaza nediw šebin radinč’iƛin, eƛin xanä.
\m ʕaƛ-z ɣˤanabi-a nediw šebin r-odi-č’i-ƛin eƛi-n xan-a
\g village-GEN2 woman-ERG such thing IV-do-NEG.FUT-QUOT say-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l "The village's woman wouldn't do such a thing," said the king.

\t Hudu xexbi anuru ɣˤanazaz iday guru šida teqa bayxƛin, nukarä eƛin.
\m hudu xexbi anu-ru ɣˤanabi-z idu-ay guru šida teq-a b-ay-x-ƛin nukar-a eƛi-n
\g then children be.NEG-PST.PRT woman-GEN2 home-IN.ABL crying why hear-INF III-must-PRS-QUOT henchman-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "Then how comes that one hears crying from the home of a woman who does not have children?", the henchman said.

\t Wallah, bužzi boqanix zaħmataw šebin yołƛin.
\m wallah bužzi b-oq-ani-x zaħmataw šebin yoł-ƛin
\g wallah believe I.PL-become-MSD-AD.ESS difficult thing be-QUOT
\l "By God, this is difficult to believe."

\t Yizis baqru xabarno teqerno, q’ˤanon xanes nukarbi - režet’ani xanes esnabi - bičäsi zown.
\m yizi-s b-oq-ru xabar-n teqer-n q’ˤano-n xan-s nukar-bi - r-eže-t’a-ni xan-s esyu-bi - b-iči-asi zow-n
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 III-happen-PST.PRT story-TOP listen.to-PFV.CVB two-TOP khan-GEN1 henchman-PL - II.PL-old-DISTR-DEF khan-GEN1 sister-PL - III-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Their talking was heard by two of the king's henchmen - the king's older sisters.

\t Bik’in yizä xanesno nesi nukaresno baqru xabar q’ˤunan esnazaq esin.
\m b-ik’i-n yizi-a xan-s-n nesi nukar-s-n b-oq-ru xabar q’ˤuna-n esyu-bi-q esi-n
\g I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG khan-GEN1-and DEM1.ISG.OBL henchman-GEN1-and III-happen-PST.PRT story two.OBL-TOP sister-PL-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW
\l They went away and told the story that happened between the king and that henchman to the two sisters.

\t Howlaytow yizi q’orolader k’oƛin, hemediw xabar elur teqsiƛin esanix.
\m howlay-tow yizi q’orol-der k’oƛi-n hemediw xabar elu-r teq-s-ƛin esi-ani-x
\g then-EMPH DEM2.IPL widow-APUD.LAT run-PST.UNW such.a story we(I).OBL-LAT hear-PST.WIT-QUOT tell-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Right then they ran to the widow to tell her: "We have heard such a story."

\t Yiłagon q’ˤanon xanes xexbi - užin, kidno k’emot’ya tełno eqerno, iħułxor kurno.
\m yiła-gon q’ˤano-n xan-s xexbi - uži-n kid-n k’emot’-a teł-n eqer-n iħu-łxor kur-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-CNTR two-TOP khan-GEN1 children - son-and daughter-and wooden.case-IN.ESS inside-TOP put-PFV.CVB river-CONT.VERS throw-PST.UNW
\l But those two children of the king - the son and the daughter - she put into a wooden case and threw them into the river.

\t Łiya yižin k’emot’ sida aɣˤuz łiłiroł adäzan c’oxno yičin.
\m łi-a y-iži-n k’emot’ sida aɣˤu-z łiłiro-ł ad-aza-n c’ox-n y-iči-n
\g water-ERG II-carry-PFV.CVB wooden.case one.OBL mill-GEN2 ditch-CONT.ESS before-IN.VERS.DIST-TOP hit-PFV.CVB II-remain-PST.UNW
\l The water carried the case before a mill's ditch, it hit it and remained there.

\t Yeynoyxosi aɣˤur yičinosi, maħorno yoqno habihanes baru yezun.
\m y-eynod-xosi aɣˤu y-iči-nosi maħor-n y-oq-n habihan-s baru y-ezu-n
\g II-work-PRS.PRT mill II-cease-ANT.CVB outside-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB miller-GEN1 wife II-look-PST.UNW
\l When the working mill stopped working, the miller's wife went outside and had a look.

\t Beɣe xexzas guru teqnosi, zer rok’un regin, aɣˤʷa tełxorno yoxin, xedyoq esin.
\m b-eɣe xexbi-s guru teq-nosi zer rok’u-n r-egi-n aɣˤu-a teł-xor-n y-oxi-n xediw-q esi-n
\g I.PL-young children-GEN1 crying hear-ANT.CVB shuddering heart-TOP IV-go.into-PFV.CVB mill-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT-TOP II-run.away-PFV.CVB husband-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW
\l When she heard the crying of the small children, her heart shuddered, she ran into the mill and told her husband.

\t Xedya yisno tełxor yayrno k’emot’.
\m xediw-a y-is-n teł-xor y-ayr-n k’emot’
\g husband-ERG II-take-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT II-bring-PST.UNW wooden.case
\l The husband took the wooden case and brought it inside.

\t Yaɣˤin tełer bezunosi, marɣalyos k’icu yołäsi užin esun, mesedyos žežu yołäsi kidno yesun.
\m y-ˤaɣˤi-n tełer b-ezu-nosi marɣal-s k’icu yoł-asi uži-n esu-n mesed-s žežu yoł-asi kid-n y-esu-n
\g II-open-PFV.CVB to.the.inside I.PL-look-ANT.CVB pearl-GEN1 tooth be-RES.PRT boy-and find-PFV.CVB gold-GEN1 ponytail be-RES.PRT girl-and II-find-PST.UNW
\l When they opened it and looked inside, they found a boy with a pearl tooth and a girl with a golden ponytail.

\t ʕUraw ɣˤaɣˤu bizin habihanno, barun, xexbi anusi žedur nazay eƛa biynč’ey žedu kurzaƛ’.
\m ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu b-izi-n habihan-n baru-n xexbi anu-si žedu-r nazay eƛi-a b-iy-č’ey žedu kur-zaƛ’
\g very be.happy I.PL-get-PFV.CVB miller-and wife-and children be.NEG-ATTR DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT from.where say-INF I.PL-know-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.IPL throw-CSL.CVB
\l The miller and his wife, not having children themselves, got very happy because they were thrown to them from who-knows-where.

\t ƛ’iri bičin žeda kikizaƛ’, xexbi baq’ˤiłxotow bik’ix zown.
\m ƛ’iri b-iči-n žedu-a kiki-zaƛ’ xexbi b-aq’ˤił-x-tow b-ik’i-x zow-n
\g above I.PL-remain-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-ERG feed-CSL.CVB children I.PL-grow.up-IPFV.CVB-EMPH I.PL-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l They diligently fed them and the children grew up steadily.

\t Sida quł maħorno oqno uži nesicetow sida žaƛ’no iħanayn, yisiq nesis mecu q’ˤažun.
\m sida qu-ł maħor-n oq-n uži nesi-ce-tow sida uži-ƛ’-n iħanad-n yisi-q nesi-s mecu q’ˤažu-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS outside-TOP become-PFV.CVB boy DEM1.ISG.OBL-EQU1-EMPH one.OBL boy-SUPER.ESS-TOP fight-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 hand dislocate-PST.UNW
\l One day the boy went outside and had a fight with a peer, and he dislocated his hand.

\t Neła ƛˤorłäyn teqno ƛ’irir yayru nesi žaz eniya nesiqor qˤaƛin, iħäzoni łiyä bown kurali mežikin sida ħala bičix yołiƛin.
\m neła ƛˤori-łay-n teq-n ƛ’iri-r y-ay-ru nesi uži-z eni-a nesi-qor qˤaƛi-n iħu-a-zo-ni łi-a b-ow-n kur-ali meži-kin sida ħal-a b-iči-x yołi-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL war-CONT.ABL-TOP hear-PFV.CVB above-LAT II-come-PST.PRT DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-GEN2 mother-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT shout-PST.UNW river-IN.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF water-ERG I.PL-bring-PFV.CVB throw-ATTR you.PL-even one.OBL condition-IN.ESS I.PL-remain-IPFV.CVB however-QUOT
\l The moter of that boy heard of their battle and came up and shouted to him: "You two, brought by the river's water and thrown here, be normal!"

\t Žan yisir ʕuraw isałno, oqno aɣˤuxaɣor ik’in.
\m ža-n yisi-r ʕuraw isał-n oq-n aɣˤu-xaɣor ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT very be.difficult-TOP become-PFV.CVB mill-AD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l That was very hard for him and he went back to the mill.

\t Xizyo xexza esirno, eli mežusä yoł xexbi, žek’usä yołƛin.
\m xizyo xexbi-a esir-n eli mežu-s-a yoł xexbi žek’u-s-a yoł-ƛin
\g afterwards children-ERG ask-PST.UNW we you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1-Q be children man-GEN1-Q be-QUOT
\l Then the children asked: "Are we your children or someone else's?"

\t Łas yałru esinäy, biša yołä mežiƛin, esirno habihanä.
\m ła-s yoł-ru esi-näy b-iš-a yoł-a meži-ƛin esir-n habihan-a
\g who.OBL-GEN1 be-PST.PRT tell-CND.CVB I.PL-eat-INF be-Q you.PL-QUOT ask-PST.UNW miller-ERG
\l "If I tell you whose you are, will you eat?", asked the miller.

\t Yisän eƛin, meža eluq buyxor xabar esinäy, biša yołƛin.
\m yisi-a-n eƛi-n mežu-a elu-q b-uy-xor xabar esi-näy b-iš-a yoł-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP say-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS III-true-AD.LAT story tell-CND.CVB I.PL-eat-INF be-QUOT
\l He said: "If you tell us the truth, we will eat."

\t Howži hudu žedu xexbi ax roqacet’a bišno.
\m howži hudu žedu xexbi ax r-oq-ace-t’a b-iš-n
\g now then DEM1.IPL children belly IV-happen-TERM-DISTR I.PL-eat-PST.UNW
\l From now on these children ate their bellies full.

\t Mežur beže barkala yoł eli nedur beže boqace käkirus, howži elur mežudäy bik’a retin.
\m mežu-r b-eže barkala yoł eli nedur b-eže b-oq-ace kiki-ru-s howži elu-r mežu-day b-ik’i-a r-eti-n
\g you(I).PL.OBL-LAT III-big thank be we so I.PL-big I.PL-become-TERM feed-PST.PRT-GEN1 now we(I).OBL-LAT you(I).PL.OBL-APUD.ABL I.PL-go-INF IV-want-PST.UNW
\l "Thank you very much for feeding us until we got that big, now we wanted to leave you.

\t Łˤora ɣudi ʕeze roqace elur bišan ero, elin hunix begirƛin, eƛin xexza harizi rodin.
