\m łˤora ɣudi ʕeze r-oq-ace elu-r bišʷa-n er-o eli-n huni-x b-egir-ƛin eƛi-n xexbi-a harizi r-odi-n
\g three.OBL day be.enough IV-become-TERM we(I).OBL-LAT food-TOP set.up-IMPR we-TOP way-AD.ESS I.PL-let-QUOT say-PFV.CVB children-ERG request IV-do-PST.UNW
\l Prepare us food for three days and let us go on our way," requested the children.

\t Elay bizin bik’in yizi xanez madaxor bayn.
\m ele-ay b-izi-n b-ik’i-n yizi xan-z ma-xor b-ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL I.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL khan-GEN2 door-AD.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l The left and went on and then came to the king's door.

\t Yizir ža xan łinax iyx yizis babiw yałrułi.
\m yizi-r ža xan łinax iy-x yizi-s babiw yoł-rułi
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT DEM1.SG khan how know-PRS DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 father be-MSD
\l How should they know that this king is their father?

\t Xanerno hemedurtow yizi biynanu.
\m xan-r-n hemedur-tow yizi b-iy-n-anu
\g khan-LAT-and so-EMPH DEM2.IPL I.PL-know-PST.UNW-NEG
\l And the king didn't know them either.

\t Yizi elor bayzaƛ’, imyoq yicäsi nesä nesis barun yukarno, xanä eƛin, naʕanan bodin eloš neła ɣˤanazas nocu caƛoƛin.
\m yizi elo-r b-ay-zaƛ’ im-q y-ici-asi nesi-a nesi-s baru-n y-ukar-n xan-a eƛi-n naʕana-n b-odi-n eloš neła ɣˤanabi-s nocu caƛi-o-ƛin
\g DEM2.IPL there-LAT I.PL-come-CSL.CVB pole-POSS.ESS II-tie-RES.PRT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 wife-TOP II-show-PFV.CVB khan-ERG say-PST.UNW curse-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB over.there DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-GEN1 saliva throw-IMPR-QUOT
\l Because they came there, the king showed them his wife, tied to the pole, and said: "Curse and spit on that women over there!"

\t Xexza eƛin, eli maħor xalq’i q’ʷarid bodanix boqäsi anuƛin.
\m xexbi eƛi-n eli maħor xalq’i q’ʷarid b-odi-ani-x b-oq-asi anu-ƛin
\g children say-PST.UNW we outside people hurt III-do-MSD-AD.ESS I.PL-become-RES.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l Then children said: "We did not come outside in order to offend people."

\t Užä, bežigon, eƛuk’yay bisno magalu teƛno imyoq yicali ɣˤanazar.
\m uži-a b-eži-gon eƛuk’-ay b-is-n magalu teƛ-n im-q y-ici-ali ɣˤanabi-r
\g boy-ERG III-more-CNTR leather.sack-IN.ABL III-take-PFV.CVB bread give-PST.UNW pole-POSS.ESS II-tie-ATTR woman-LAT
\l The boy, moreover, took a bread out of his sack and gave it to the women tied to the pole.

\t Elaygon bitor žedu bik’inƛax, rigu hawan, bac’adaw łin, raqˤäsi bix yałzarno, žek’utow anuza mečoƛ’or baynƛax.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor žedu b-ik’i-n-ƛax r-igu hawa-n bac’adaw łi-n r-ˤaqi-asi bix yoł-za-r-n žek’u-tow anu-za moči-ƛ’or b-ay-n-ƛax
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither DEM1.IPL I.PL-go-PFV.CVB-QUOT IV-good air-and clean water-and IV-accumulate-RES.PRT grass be-LCV.CVB-LAT-and man-EMPH be.absent-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l From there they went on and came to a deserted place with good air, clean water and where the grass was thick.

\t Elo yizi xexza žeda žedur ɣˤutku rodanix ros bič’a bašla bodin.
\m elo yizi xexbi-a žedu-a žedu-r ɣˤutku r-odi-ani-x ros b-ič’i-a bašla b-odi-n
\g there DEM2.IPL.OBL children-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT house IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS base III-dig-INF begin III-do-PST.UNW
\l There these children began to dig a base for building a house for themselves.

\t Howlo xizyo yizi q’ˤanon esnabi akiłno moƛan biqirno, łerakin ɣudi č’ariłnoanu.
\m howlo xizyo yizi q’ˤano-n esyu-bi akił-n moƛu-n b-iqir-n łera-kin ɣudi č’arił-n-anu
\g there afterwards DEM2.IPL two-TOP brother-PL get.tired-PFV.CVB sleep-TOP III-catch-PFV.CVB five.OBL-even day wake.up-PST.UNW-NEG
\l Afterwards these two siblings got tired and caught some sleep, and didn't even woke up for five days.

\t Sosi moƛaxay uži č’ariłno - tamaša oqno ƛexun yeda, xanzoƛ’aygon rigu ɣˤutku moƛaxay izizaƛ’or elo resuzaƛ’.
\m sosi moƛu-xay uži č’arił-n - tamaša oq-n ƛexu-n yeda xan-z-ƛ’ay-gon r-igu ɣˤutku moƛu-xay izi-zaƛ’or elo r-esu-zaƛ’
\g at.first sleep-AD.ABL boy wake.up-PST.UNW - be.surprised become-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG khan-GEN2-SUPER.ABL-CNTR IV-pretty house sleep-AD.ABL get.up-POST.CVB there IV-find-CSL.CVB
\l At first, the boy woke up from his sleep - he was surprised because he found the house to be prettier than even the king's one, when he got up.

\t Xizyogon esiwn č’ariłno.
\m xizyogon esiw-n č’arił-n
\g then sister-TOP wake.up-PST.UNW
\l Then his sister woke up.

\t Eleley, esiwƛin, eƛin yiła, din kumakyor anusi yedu nece reže ɣˤutku didur debeq rodiłä, dikin šida moƛaxay č’arik’inč’uƛin.
\m eleley esiw-ƛin eƛi-n yiła-a di-n kumak-r anu-si yedu nece r-eže ɣˤutku didur mi-q r-odi-ł-a di-kin šida moƛu-xay č’arik’-č’u-ƛin
\g behold brother-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG me-TOP help-LAT be.absent-ATTR DEM2.IISG so.much IV-big house how you-POSS.ESS IV-do-POT-PST.WIT.INT me-even why sleep-AD.ABL wake.up-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l "Wow, brother!", said she, "Without my help you have built such a big house; why didn't you wake me up from my sleep?"

\t Mi moƛaxay yiziranix ħažałi zownč’u, baq’ˤu xalq’i däz kumakyor bayäsi zows, dikin žeda eynoda egirinč’uƛin, eƛin yisä.
\m mi moƛu-xay y-izir-ani-x ħažałi zow-č’u b-aq’ˤu xalq’i di-z kumak-r b-ay-asi zow-s di-kin žedu-a eynod-a egir-č’u-ƛin eƛi-n yisi-a
\g you sleep-AD.ABL II-lift-MSD-AD.ESS need be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT III-many people me-GEN2 help-LAT III-come-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT me-even DEM1.IPL-ERG work-INF let-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "There was no need to wake you up from your sleep, many people were coming to help me and they even didn't let me work.", she said.

\t Elo ɣˤutkaɣorno boqno, žeda žedur maʕišat boyx bičin q’ˤanon esnabi.
\m elo ɣˤutku-aɣor-n b-oq-n žedu-a žedu-r maʕišat b-odi-x b-iči-n q’ˤano-n esyu-bi
\g there house-IN.VERS-TOP I.PL-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT fortune III-do-IPFV.CVB III-live-PST.UNW two-TOP brother-PL
\l Then moved into the house there, and lived there engaging in their household.

\t Uži ɣudes bełiƛ’t’a ik’ix zown, netikin yeda bełi č’aq’irinč’ey xizor utix zownanu.
\m uži ɣudes bełi-ƛ’-t’a ik’i-x zow-n neti-kin yeda bełi č’aq’ˤir-č’ey xizor uti-x zow-n-anu
\g boy daily hunting-SUPER.ESS-DISTR go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB when-even DEM2.ISG deer kill-NEG.PST.CVB back return-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW-NEG
\l The boy went hunting daily and never ever came back without having killed a deer.

\t Yeda bełiƛ’ ik’a aqzay soder xanez nukarzaskin bełis bax bexun.
\m yeda bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-a oq-zay soder xan-z nukar-bi-s-kin bełi-s bax b-exu-n
\g DEM2.ISG hunting-SUPER.ESS go-INF begin-SIM.CVB after khan-GEN2 henchman-PL-GEN1-even hunting-GEN1 success III-die-PST.UNW
\l After he began to go hunting, even the king's henchmen's hunting luck deteriorated.

\t Sida qułgon bełiƛ’ ik’iƛ’oräy, cey žek’xo yisir xexbi besun.
\m sida qu-ł-gon bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-ƛ’oräy cey žek’-x yisi-r xexbi b-esu-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS-CNTR hunting-SUPER.ESS go-SIM.CVB eagle beat-IPFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT children I.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l One day when he was on a hunt, he found children beating an eagle.

\t Boržizi boqno bik’a adäza ceyä yisiqor neła nełałäy boɣno sis ħulin teƛno eƛin, dowƛ’or ħal baynosi, yedu mi bik’urnäy, yiła deber kumak badiƛin.
\m boržizi b-oq-n b-ik’i-a adäza cey-a yisi-qor neła-a neła-łay b-oɣ-n sis ħuli-n teƛ-n eƛi-n mi-ƛ’or ħal b-ay-nosi yedu mi b-ik’u-r-näy yiła-a mi-r kumak b-odi-ƛin
\g fly III-become-PFV.CVB III-go-INF before eagle-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ABL III-take.away-PFV.CVB one feather-TOP give-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW you-SUPER.LAT trouble III-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG you III-burn-CAUS-CND.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG you-LAT help III-do-QUOT
\l Before the eagle flew away, it plucked a feather from itself, gave it to him and said: "When trouble comes upon you, if you burn it, it will help you."

\t Elaygon bitor ik’iƛ’oräy, yisir sis ħalaq’aw gulu besun.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor ik’i-ƛ’oräy yisi-r sis ħalaq’aw gulu b-esu-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT one thin horse III-find-PST.UNW
\l When he went on from there, he found a thin horse.

\t Neła yisiqor eƛin, mi di q’ˤuya guluƛno ħažin, din xecin q’ˤuya guluƛ’no mi zawnoƛin.
\m neła-a yisi-qor eƛi-n mi di q’ˤuya gulu-ƛ-n ħaži-n di-n xeci-n q’ˤuya gulu-ƛ’-n mi zow-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you me other horse-SUB.ESS-TOP exchange-PROHIB me-TOP leave-PFV.CVB other horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP you ride-PROHIB-QUOT
\l It said to him: "Do not change me for another horse, and do not leave me and ride on another horse!"

\t Hemeł zamanał xanes roƛno.
\m hemeł zaman-ł xan-s r-oƛ-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL time-CONT.ESS khan-GEN1 IV-be.sick-PST.UNW
\l At this time the king got sick.

\t Doxturza nesiqor eƛin, budalazaqor (łarašaw ɣˤanazas axʷay bäžiru xexbi) bexada bäqinč’iru bełis reƛ rac’näy, mi saɣ aqƛin.
\m doxtur-bi-a nesi-qor eƛi-n budala-bi-qor łarašaw ɣˤanabi-s ax-ay b-iži-ru xexbi b-exʷad-a b-iqi-č’i-ru bełi-s reƛ r-ac’-näy mi saɣ oq-ƛin
\g doctor-PL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW budalay-PL-POSS.LAT pregnant woman-GEN1 belly-IN.ABL III-take.out-PST.PRT child III-slaughter-INF III-get-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT deer-GEN1 meat III.PL-eat-CND.CVB you cure become-QUOT
\l The doctors said to him: "If you eat meat of a deer which did not get slaughtered for the budalays, you will get cured."

\t Neła reƛił xizay bełiƛ’ xanes łˤonoqu nukar oqno.
\m neła reƛ-ł xizay bełi-ƛ’ xan-s łˤonoqu nukar oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL meat-CONT.ESS behind hunting-SUPER.ESS khan-GEN1 sixty henchman become-PST.UNW
\l Sixty of the king's henchmen went behind that meat.

\t Anƛ’ima baħnayłin žeduq nedugani reƛis sis t’it’ukin riqinanu.
\m anƛ’i-a b-aħnad-łin žedu-q nedu-ga-ni reƛ-s sis t’it’u-kin r-iqi-n-anu
\g week-IN.ESS I.PL-walk.around-CNC.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS such-ATTR-DEF meat-GEN1 one piece-even IV-get-PST.UNW-NEG
\l Although they walked around for a week, they could not get even a piece of such a meat.

\t Rok’un roč’iłno, xizor butin nexƛ’oräy, yizi žedu esnazader bayn.
\m rok’u-n r-oč’ił-n xizor b-uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy yizi žedu esyu-bi-der b-ay-n
\g heart-TOP IV-freeze-PFV.CVB back I.PL-return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB DEM2.IPL DEM1.IPL.OBL brother-PL-APUD.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l They lost all their hope, and while they were coming back, they ran into those siblings.

\t Yizä nesi užiq esirno, debeqkin ana xaner daruyarsi reƛ, nełas siskin t’it’u anusi xizor butanix bˤuƛ’xo eliƛin.
\m yizi-a nesi uži-q esir-n mi-q-kin anu-a xan-r daru-r-si reƛ neła-s siskin t’it’u anu-si xizor b-uti-ani-x b-ˤuƛ’-x eli-ƛin
\g DEM2.IPL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW you-POSS.ESS-even be.NEG-Q khan-LAT medicine-LAT-ATTR meat DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 any piece be.NEG-ATTR back I.PL-return-MSD-AD.ESS I.PL-be.afraid-PRS we-QUOT
\l They asked that boy: "Do you not have a meat for medicine for the king? We are afraid to return without any piece."

\t Di mežur t’it’u neƛač’in, q’ulaʕitow neƛanƛin, užä žedu razi bodin.
\m di mežu-r t’it’u neƛ-ač’in q’ulaʕi-tow neƛ-an-ƛin uži-a žedu razi b-odi-n
\g me you(I).PL.OBL-LAT piece give-NEG.FUT.DEF carcass-EMPH give-FUT.DEF-QUOT boy-ERG DEM1.IPL agree I.PL-do-PST.UNW
\l "I won't give you a piece, I will give you a whole carcass.", the boy agreed to them.

\t Xander baynosi, yedu reƛ di riqirsiƛin sidä eƛin, ay di riqirsiƛin sis ičin, hemedur nukarza xanqo heresi esin.
\m xan-der b-ay-nosi yedu reƛ di r-iqir-s-ƛin sida-a eƛi-n ay di r-iqir-s-ƛin sis iči-n hemedur nukar-bi-a xan-q heresi esi-n
\g khan-APUD.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG meat me IV-catch-PST.WIT-QUOT one.OBL-ERG say-PFV.CVB no me IV-catch-PST.WIT-QUOT one remain-PFV.CVB so henchman-PL-ERG khan-POSS.ESS lie tell-PST.UNW
\l After they came to the king, one said: "I caught this meat.", one insisted: "No, I caught it!", so the henchmen lied to the king.

\t Žedu nasin maħor boqnosi, reɣeni xaličan, beɣeni magalun bäqiruni nukarä xizyo yałruxor esin, anƛ’ima baħna-bik’inkin räqinč’iru eluq reƛ, hemesi dowzoniƛ’aygon rigu ɣˤutku yałruni užä neƛsi, debi xexbikin besač’iney žeduƛin.
\m žedu nasin maħor b-oq-nosi r-eɣe-ni xaliča-n b-eɣe-ni magalu-n b-iqi-ru-ni nukar-a xizyo yoł-ru-xor esi-n anƛ’i-a b-aħna~ik’i-n-kin r-iqi-č’i-ru elu-q reƛ hemesi mi-z-ni-ƛ’ay-gon r-igu ɣˤutku yoł-ru-ni uži-a neƛ-s mi-s xexbi-kin b-esu-ač’in-ey žedu-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL all outside I.PL-become-ANT.CVB IV-small-DEF mat-and III-small-DEF bread-and I.PL-get-PST.PRT-DEF henchman-ERG afterwards be-PST.PRT-AD.LAT tell-PFV.CVB week-IN.ESS I.PL-walk.for.a.while-PFV.CVB-even IV-get-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT we(I).OBL-POSS.ESS meat DEM4.ISG.OBL you-GEN2-DEF-SUPER.ABL-CNTR IV-pretty house be-PST.PRT-DEF boy-ERG give-PST.WIT you-GEN1 children-even I.PL-exist-NEG.FUT.DEF-DUB DEM1.IPL-QUOT
\l After they all went outside, the henchman who got the small mat and the small bread afterwards told him: "We were walking for a week and this boy with the house even prettier than yours gave us the meat that we didn't get; they even might be your children."

\t Žedu bukada ik’anix dey saɣłikin roqač’ineyƛin, mušin kurno eƛin xanä.
\m žedu b-ukad-a ik’i-ani-x di-s saɣłi-kin r-oq-ač’in-ey-ƛin muši-n kur-n eƛi-n xan-a
\g DEM1.IPL I.PL-see-INF go-MSD-AD.ESS me-GEN1 health-even IV-happen-NEG.FUT.DEF-DUB-QUOT breath-TOP exhale-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l "I wonder if I won't get healthy again, in order to go see them," the king said and breathed heavily.

\t Žedus baqru nasin xabar teqno žedu q’ˤunan nukarzar - režet’ani esnazas halmaɣzar.
\m žedu-s b-oq-ru nasin xabar teq-n žedu q’ˤuna-n nukar-bi-r - r-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-s halmaɣ-bi-r
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 III-happen-PST.PRT all story hear-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL two.OBL-TOP henchman-PL-LAT - IV-old-DISTR-DEF sister-PL-GEN1 friend-PL-LAT
\l Their whole discussion was overheard by those two henchmen - the friends of the older sisters.

\t Hemełƛ’otow bik’in žeda žedu esnazaq esin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’-tow b-ik’i-n žedu-a žedu esyu-bi-q esi-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-EMPH I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IIPL.OBL sister-PL-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW
\l Immediately they went and told those sisters of this.

\t Xizyogon žeda q’orolay yegirno, žedu xexzar rek’ bodanix.
\m xizyogon žedu-a q’orolay y-egir-n žedu xexbi-r rek’ b-odi-ani-x
\g then DEM1.IPL-ERG widow II-send-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL children-LAT trick III-do-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Then they sent the widow to play a trick on the children.

\t Elo žeduz ɣˤutkar yaynosi, kid idu yesun.
\m elo žedu-z ɣˤutku-ar y-ay-nosi kid idu y-esu-n
\g there DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 house-IN.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB girl home II-find-PST.UNW
\l When she came into the house there, she found the girl at home.

\t Q’orola nełqor eƛin, łäxor mi yik’iƛ’oräy yok’ek’anix ʕoloqbi urɣizi boqxo, hudu mi esiwqor eƛo, zam-zames łi et’näy, madaxtow nełas kik boƛixxosi, nełał xizay ik’iƛƛin.
\m q’orol-a neła-qor eƛi-n łi-xor mi y-ik’i-ƛ’oräy y-ok’ek’-ani-x ʕoloq-bi urɣizi b-oq-x hudu mi esiw-qor eƛi-o zam-zam-s łi et’-näy ma-x-tow neła-s kik b-oƛix-xosi neła-ł xizay ik’i-ƛ-ƛin
\g widow-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW water-AD.LAT you II-go-SIM.CVB II-steal-MSD-AD.ESS young.person-PL thinking I.PL-become-PRS so you brother-POSS.LAT say-IMPR Zam-Zam-GEN1 water pour-CND.CVB outside-AD.ESS-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 spring III-appear-PRS.PRT DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind go-OPT-QUOT
\l The widow said to her: "Some young men are thinking about kidnapping you when you go to get water, so tell your brother that if he pours out holy water, then outside a spring of it will appear, behind which he should go."

\t Ža xabarno esin q’orolayn yik’in elay.
\m ža xabar-n esi-n q’orolay-n y-ik’i-n ele-ay
\g DEM1.SG story-TOP tell-PFV.CVB widow-TOP II-go-PST.UNW there-IN.ABL
\l Having told this, the widow went away.

\t Bełiƛ’ay xizor utin yeda aynosi, yisir q’ʷariłiłer yegäsi esiw yesun.
\m bełi-ƛ’ay xizor uti-n yeda ay-nosi yisi-r q’ʷariłi-łer y-egi-asi esiw y-esu-n
\g hunting-SUPER.ABL back return-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT sadness-CONT.LAT II-go.into-RES.PRT sister II-find-PST.UNW
\l After he came back from hunting, he found his sister being sad.

\t Šebi deber roqno, mi c’aq’ pašmanłiƛ’wa yičäsiƛin, esiya esirnosi, yiła eƛin, maqˤiƛ’ay łi ric’a yik’iƛ’oräy, ʕoloqzas rok’uƛ’ yołƛax di yok’ek’anƛin.
\m šebi mi-r r-oq-n mi c’aq’ pašmanłi-ƛ’-a y-iči-asi-ƛin esyu-a esir-nosi yiła-a eƛi-n maqˤi-ƛ’ay łi r-ic’-a y-ik’i-ƛ’oräy ʕoloq-bi-s rok’u-ƛ’ yoł-ƛax di y-ok’ek’-an-ƛin
\g what you-LAT IV-happen-PST.UNW you much sadness-SUPER.ESS-Q II-be-RES.PRT-QUOT brother-ERG ask-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW far.away-SUPER.ABL water IV-fill-INF II-go-SIM.CVB young.person-PL-GEN1 heart-SUPER.ESS be-QUOT me II-steal-FUT.CVB-QUOT
\l "What happened to you, to make you so sad?", the brother asked, and she said: "When I went from afar to get water, some young guys planned to kidnap me.

\t Debeq ža äsirus haqu azirodoƛƛin, esiya eƛin.
\m mi-q ža esi-ru-s haqu azirod-ƛ-ƛin esyu-a eƛi-n
\g you-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG tell-PST.PRT-GEN1 mouth freeze.to.death-OPT-QUOT brother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "May the mouth of the person who told you that freeze off!", the brother said.

\t Hudayziko č’urqˤotow izin yeda zam-zames łäł xizay oqno.
\m hudayziko č’urqˤo-tow izi-n yeda zam-zam-s łi-ł xizay oq-n
\g the.next.day in.the.morning-EMPH get.up-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG Zam-Zam-GEN1 water-CONT.ESS behind become-PST.UNW
\l The next day he got up early and went out to get the holy water.

\t Ik’in, ik’in yeda sida osiw qoqƛer aynƛax.
\m ik’i-n ik’i-n yeda sida osiw qoq-ƛer ay-n-ƛax
\g go-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG one.OBL high cliff-SUB.LAT come-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l He went and went and arrived under a high cliff.

\t Soder ezunosi, ƛ’iräy ƛ’iyor łäs čok boɣäsiƛax, wˤałer ezuzaƛ’ q’ˤidar axukin yayxanuƛax.
\m soder ezu-nosi ƛ’iräy ƛ’iyor łi-s čok b-oɣ-asi-ƛax wˤał-r ezu-zaƛ’ q’ˤida-r axu-kin y-ay-x-anu-ƛax
\g upward look-ANT.CVB from.above downwards water-GEN1 stream III-hatch-RES.PRT-QUOT downward-LAT look-CSL.CVB down-LAT drop-even II-come-PRS-NEG-QUOT
\l When he looked upwards, a stream of water flowed down, but when he looked down, not even a drop of water came down.

\t Xizyo užä neła ceys ħuli bik’urno.
\m xizyo uži-a neła cey-s ħuli b-ik’u-r-n
\g afterwards boy-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL eagle-GEN1 feather III-burn-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l Then the boy burned that eagle's feather.

\t Šebi deber retinƛin, cey hawaƛ’ bayn k’oƛin.
\m šebi mi-r r-eti-n-ƛin cey hawa-ƛ’ b-ay-n k’oƛi-n
\g what you-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT eagle air-SUPER.ESS III-come-PFV.CVB run-PST.UNW
\l "What did you want?", the eagle came flying.

\t Eloš neła zam-zames łäs q’ut’u där bic’a betinƛin, užä žawab teƛno.
\m eloš neła zam-zam-s łi-s q’ut’u di-r b-ic’-a b-eti-n-ƛin uži-a žawab teƛ-n
\g over.there DEM1.IISG.OBL Zam-Zam-GEN1 water-GEN1 earthen.jug me-LAT III-fill-INF III-want-PST.UNW-QUOT boy-ERG answer give-PST.UNW
\l "I wanted to fill the jug with the holy water over there.", the boy answered.

\t Ceyä eƛin, hoboy mi däƛ’ ƛ’irin zow, elor bayrun mi q’ut’u bic’no, di xexłiƛ’ xizor butanixƛin.
\m cey-a eƛi-n hoboy mi di-ƛ’ ƛ’iri-n zow elo-r b-ay-run mi q’ut’u b-ic’-n di xexłi-ƛ’ xizor b-uti-ani-x-ƛin
\g eagle-ERG say-PST.UNW now you me-SUPER.ESS on-TOP ride there-LAT III-come-IMM.ANT.CVB you earthen.jug III-fill-PFV.CVB me quickness-SUPER.ESS back III-return-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l The eagle said: "Ride on me now, so that I can return quickly, right after I come to there and you filled the jug!"

\t Yizi boržizi boqno bik’in osaxor bizinosi, žeduł adäzasi ħon yaɣˤiłno yik’in.
\m yizi boržizi b-oq-n b-ik’i-n osa-xor b-izi-nosi žedu-ł adäz-asi ħon y-ˤaɣˤi-ł-n y-ik’i-n
\g DEM2.IPL fly I.PL-become-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PFV.CVB height-AD.LAT I.PL-get.up-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS before-RES.PRT mountain II-open-ITR-PFV.CVB II-go-PST.UNW
\l When they flew up into the height, the mountain opened up in front of them.

\t Łäs q’ut’un bic’no xizor butin nexzey, ħonbi dandir rik’in c’oxsiƛax, ceyes k’onč’aqaygon ret’un reƛno rik’isƛax.
\m łi-s q’ut’u-n b-ic’-n xizor b-uti-n nex-zey ħon-bi dandir r-ik’i-n c’ox-s-ƛax cey-s k’onč’u-qay-gon r-et’u-n reƛ-n r-ik’i-s-ƛax
\g water-GEN1 earthen.jug-TOP III-fill-PFV.CVB back I.PL-turn.back-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB mountain-PL together II.PL-go-PFV.CVB hit-PST.WIT-QUOT eagle-GEN1 leg-POSS.ABL-CNTR II.PL-come.off-PFV.CVB meat-TOP IV-go-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l He filled the jug with water and when when they returned, the mountains went together and closed and some flesh came off the eagle's leg.

\t Užä nesä nesis oˤɣqay reč’no reƛ łeɣirsiƛax ceyez k’onč’aq.
\m uži-a nesi-a nesi-s oˤɣ-qay r-eč’-n reƛ łeɣir-s-ƛax cey-z k’onč’u-q
\g boy-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 thigh-POSS.ABL IV-cut-PFV.CVB meat glue-PST.WIT-QUOT eagle-GEN2 leg-POSS.ESS
\l The boy cut flesh from his own thigh and glued it to the eagle's leg.

\t Q’ˤida raƛ’moƛ’or yizi baynosi, ceyä eƛin, däqay deber t’ok’ow kumak bäqinč’i, mi xexłiƛ’ iduɣor ik’iƛin.
\m q’ˤida raƛ’-ƛ’or yizi b-ay-nosi cey-a eƛi-n di-qay mi-r t’ok’ow kumak b-iqi-č’i mi xexłi-ƛ’ idu-ɣor ik’i-ƛin
\g down earth-SUPER.LAT DEM2.IPL I.PL-come-ANT.CVB eagle-ERG say-PST.UNW me-POSS.ABL you-LAT more help III-get-NEG.FUT you quickness-SUPER.ESS home-IN.ALL go-QUOT
\l When they came down to earth again, the eagle said: "You will not get help from me anymore, go home quickly!"

\t Hunixor oqnosi, yisis k’onč’u yoƛa yoqno, t’ok’ow čaran bexun, elay bitor ik’iłnoanu yeda.
\m huni-xor oq-nosi yisi-s k’onč’u y-oƛ-a y-oq-n t’ok’ow čara-n b-exu-n ele-ay bitor ik’i-ł-n-anu yeda
\g way-AD.LAT become-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 leg II-hurt-INF II-begin-PFV.CVB more possibility-TOP III-die-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL thither go-POT-PST.UNW-NEG DEM2.ISG
\l After he went on their way, his leg began to hurt and he could not go on anymore.

\t Hemełƛ’o ceyä eƛin, hi debi deber k’onč’aƛ’osi reƛno, yedun yałza caƛo, ƛ’irigon debez min zam-zames łi riħo, däzno hemedurtow riħoƛin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ cey-a eƛi-n hi mi-s mi-r k’onč’u-ƛ’-si reƛ-n yedu-n yoł-za caƛi-o ƛ’iri-gon mi-z mi-n zam-zam-s łi r-iħi-o di-z-n hemedur-tow r-iħi-o-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS eagle-ERG say-PST.UNW take.IMP you-GEN1 you-LAT leg-SUPER.ESS-ATTR meat-TOP DEM2.IISG-TOP be-LCV.CVB stick-IMPR above-CNTR you-GEN2 you-TOP Zam-Zam-GEN1 water IV-smear-IMPR me-GEN2-TOP so-EMPH IV-smear-IMPR-QUOT
\l Then the eagle said: "Take the meat of your own leg and stick it where it used to be! And smear holy water on yours and smear it also on mine."

\t Ža łi ƛ’iri riħinosi, siskin raqinč’iru riłe užisno, ceyesno raqˤyabi ixin.
\m ža łi ƛ’iri r-iħi-nosi siskin r-oq-č’i-ru r-iłe uži-s-n cey-s-n raqˤ-bi ixi-n
\g DEM1.SG water above IV-smear-ANT.CVB anything IV-happen-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT IV-as boy-GEN1-and eagle-GEN1-and wound-PL heal-PST.UNW
\l He smeared the water on it and the boy's and the eagle's wounds healed like nothing had happened.

\t Elay oqno nexno yeda idur ayn.
\m ele-ay oq-n nex-n yeda idu-r ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL become-PFV.CVB come-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG home-LAT come-PST.UNW
\l He went away from there and came to his home.

\t Yisä yisiz madax łäs bic’äsi q’ut’u biħurnosi, zam-zames łäs kik boƛixno.
\m yisi-a yisi-z ma-x łi-s b-ic’-asi q’ut’u b-iħur-nosi zam-zam-s łi-s kik b-oƛix-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 yard-AD.ESS water-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT earthen.jug III-pour-ANT.CVB Zam-Zam-GEN1 water-GEN1 spring III-appear-PST.UNW
\l After he poured out the water-filled jug in his yard, a spring of holy water appeared.

\t Teł iduɣorno oqno, esiyqor nesä eƛin, ačqˤaq quqix di, ħaƛanix łi neƛ därƛin.
\m teł idu-ɣor-n oq-n esyu-qor nesi-a eƛi-n ačqˤa-q quqi-x di ħaƛu-ani-x łi neƛ di-r-ƛin
\g inside home-IN.ALL-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB sister-POSS.LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW thirst-POSS.ESS dry.out-PRS me drink-MSD-AD.ESS water give me-LAT-QUOT
\l He went inside into the home and said to his sister: "I am drying out because of thirst, give me some water to drink!"

\t Idu łi anuƛin, esiya eƛin.
\m idu łi anu-ƛin esyu-a eƛi-n
\g home water be.NEG-QUOT sister-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "There is no water at home", said the sister.

\t Eloš madaxtow ana łiƛin, yisä esiw yezuranix yižin - čˤʷaħƛin rik’ixƛax, kikxo riłe, zam-zames łi.
\m eloš ma-x-tow anu-a łi-ƛin yisi-a esiw y-ezu-r-ani-x y-iži-n - čˤʷaħ-ƛin r-ik’i-x-ƛax kik-x r-iłe zam-zam-s łi
\g over.there yard-AD.ESS-EMPH be.NEG-Q water-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG sister II-look-CAUS-MSD-AD.ESS II-take.out-PST.UNW - splash-QUOT IV-go-PRS-QUOT spring-AD.ESS IV-as Zam-Zam-GEN1 water
\l "Isn't there water over there in the yard?", he took his sister outside to let her have a look, "Splash!" the holy water made just like out of the spring.

\t Xexłiƛ’ yiła howlaytow ħaƛanix esiwr łäs zok’i ric’no teƛno.
\m xexłi-ƛ’ yiła howlay-tow ħaƛu-ani-x esiw-r łi-s zok’i r-ic’-n teƛ-n
\g quickness-SUPER.ESS DEM2.IISG.OBL then-EMPH drink-MSD-AD.ESS brother-LAT water-GEN1 mug IV-fill-PFV.CVB give-PST.UNW
\l Quickly she then filled a mug with water for the brother to drink and gave it to him.

\t Sida zamanałäzagon xanes roƛno.
\m sida zaman-łaza-gon xan-s r-oƛ-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.VERS.DIST-CNTR khan-GEN1 IV-be.sick-PST.UNW
\l After some time, the king got sick again.

\t Žigoƛ’aygon dunyalƛ’otow ci rik’äsi doxtur goƛ’in nesider.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon dunyal-ƛ’-tow ci r-ik’i-asi doxtur goƛ’i-n nesi-der
\g now-SUPER.ABL-CNTR world-SUPER.ESS-EMPH name IV-go-RES.PRT doctor call-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT
\l But this time he called the most famous doctor in the world to himself.

\t Nesä xanqor eƛin, zam-zames łi ħaƛunay, saɣ oqno ciqqosi bełi iłe aq miƛin.
\m nesi-a xan-qor eƛi-n zam-zam-s łi ħaƛu-näy saɣ oq-n ciq-q-si bełi iłe oq mi-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG khan-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW Zam-Zam-GEN1 water drink-CND.CVB cure become-PFV.CVB forest-POSS.ESS-ATTR deer as become you-QUOT
\l He said to the king: "If you drink the holy water, you will get cured and become [as healthy] as a forest deer!"

\t Łˤonoqu nukar egirno xanä zam-zames łäł xizay.
\m łˤonoqu nukar egir-n xan-a zam-zam-s łi-ł xizay
\g sixty henchman send-PST.UNW khan-ERG Zam-Zam-GEN1 water-CONT.ESS behind
\l The king sent sixty henchmen behind the holy water.

\t Buciƛ’ay baq’ˤu zaman bik’in yiziq ža łi k’edix, hudun resunanu.
\m buci-ƛ’ay b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-n yizi-q ža łi k’edi-x hudun r-esu-n-anu
\g month-SUPER.ABL III-much time III-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG water search-IPFV.CVB nevertheless IV-find-PST.UNW-NEG
\l More than a month passed that they were searching that water, but nevertheless they didn't find it.

\t Łinasnotow čaran bexun, rok’un roč’iłno yizis ža łi riqanixaysi, xizor butin nexƛ’oräy, yizi esnabi bičixozoni mečoƛ’or bayn.
\m łina-s-n-tow čara-n b-exu-n rok’u-n r-oč’ił-n yizi-s ža łi r-iqi-ani-xay-si xizor b-uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy yizi esyu-bi b-iči-xozo-ni moči-ƛ’or b-ay-n
\g what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-EMPH possibility-TOP III-die-PFV.CVB heart-TOP IV-freeze-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 DEM1.SG water IV-get-MSD-AD.ABL-ATTR back I.PL-return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB DEM2.IPL brother-PL I.PL-live-PRS.PRT.OBL-DEF place-SUPER.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l Their chances died and their hearts freezed from not getting that water, and while they were returning, they came to the place where the brother and the sister lived.

\t Elo yizä yizis murad esnosi, mežur rätiruce rižoƛin užä zam-zames kik žeduq bukarno.
\m elo yizi-a yizi-s murad esi-nosi mežu-r r-eti-ru-ce r-iži-o-ƛin uži-a zam-zam-s kik žedu-q b-ukar-n
\g there DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 wish tell-ANT.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT-EQU1 IV-take.out-IMPR-QUOT boy-ERG Zam-Zam-GEN1 spring DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS III-show-PST.UNW
\l There, after they told their wish, the boy [said] "Take as much as you want!" and showed them the holy spring.

\t ʕEze roqace łin rixerno, xizor butin nexƛ’oräy, nukarza hunixtow ħaƛun łiyrno ža łi.
\m ʕeze r-oq-ace łi-n r-ixer-n xizor b-uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy nukar-bi-a huni-x-tow ħaƛu-n łiyr-n ža łi
\g be.enough IV-become-TERM water-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB back I.PL-return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB henchman-PL-ERG way-AD.ESS-EMPH drink-PFV.CVB finish-PST.UNW DEM1.SG water
\l They took as much water as would be enough, and when they were going back, the henchmen drank up the water on their way.

\t Reɣeni xaličan, beɣeni magalun bäqiruni nukarqo, łi ƛäxurułi riyn yizir.
\m r-eɣe-ni xaliča-n b-eɣe-ni magalu-n b-iqi-ru-ni nukar-q łi ƛexu-rułi r-iy-n yizi-r
\g IV-small-DEF mat-and III-small-DEF bread-and III-get-PST.PRT-DEF henchman-POSS.ESS water remain-MSD IV-know-PST.UNW DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT
\l They knew that the henchman who got the small mat and the small bread still had water remaining.

\t Nasin butin žan žek’no, nesiqay łin roɣno, žan rižin nukarbi bik’in, elur resus yedu łiƛin eƛin.
\m nasin b-uti-n ža-n žek’-n nesi-qay łi-n r-oɣ-n ža-n r-iži-n nukar-bi b-ik’i-n elu-r r-esu-s yedu łi-ƛin eƛi-n
\g all I.PL-turn.back-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP beat-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL water-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP IV-carry-PFV.CVB henchman-PL I.PL-go-PFV.CVB we(I).OBL-LAT IV-find-PST.WIT DEM2.IISG water-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l The henchmen all turned back, beat him up and carried away the water from him, and said: "We found this water!"

\t Žeda žäk’runi nukar xandäɣor ik’ixno ukayn, žedu q’ˤanon nukarbi durimoƛ’ xanzo acmoxorno bik’in, elo baqru xabar teqerno bičin.
\m žedu-a žek’-ru-ni nukar xan-däɣor ik’i-x-n ukad-n žedu q’ˤano-n nukar-bi durimoƛ’ xan-z ac-xor-n b-ik’i-n elo b-oq-ru xabar teqer-n b-iči-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG beat-PST.PRT-DEF henchman khan-APUD.VERS go-IPFV.CVB-TOP see-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL two-TOP henchman-PL running khan-GEN2 door-AD.LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB there III-happen-PST.PRT story listen.to-PFV.CVB I.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l Having seen the henchman that got beaten up go to the king, those two henchmen ran to the king's door and there listened to their conversation.

\t Žek’alini nukarä eƛix teqno, nukarza debeq heresin esis, ža łin žeda esnabi bičixozo mečoƛ’ay ric’si, žedu xexbi debikin besač’ineyƛin.
\m žek’-ali-ni nukar-a eƛi-x teq-n nukar-bi-a mi-q heresi-n esi-s ža łi-n žedu-a esyu-bi b-iči-xozo moči-ƛ’ay r-ic’-s žedu xexbi mi-s-kin b-esu-ač’in-ey-ƛin
\g beat-ATTR-DEF henchman-ERG say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW henchman-PL-ERG you-POSS.ESS lie-TOP tell-PST.WIT DEM1.SG water-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG brother-PL I.PL-live-PRS.PRT.OBL place-SUPER.ABL IV-fill-PST.WIT DEM1.IPL children you-GEN1-even III-find-NEG.FUT.DEF-DUB-QUOT
\l They heard the beaten henchman say: "The henchmen lied to you, they filled that water from the place where the siblings live; couldn't these children perhaps be yours?"

\t Žedudäɣor ik’ałxor ħal anu deyƛin, xanä mušin kurno eƛin.
\m žedu-däɣor ik’i-a-łxor ħal anu di-s-ƛin xan-a muši-n kur-n eƛi-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.VERS go-INF-CONT.VERS strength be.NEG me-GEN1-QUOT khan-ERG breath-TOP exhale-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW
\l "I do not have the strength to go to them," the king sighed and said.

\t Esnazagon ža q’orolayq esin.
\m esyu-bi-a-gon ža q’orolay-q esi-n
\g sister-PL-ERG-CNTR DEM1.SG widow-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW
\l And the sisters then told it to the widow.

\t Yizin yik’in q’orolay esnabi bičixozo mečoƛ’or yaynosi, elo idu sisxoli esiy yesun.
\m y-izi-n y-ik’i-n q’orolay esyu-bi b-iči-xozo moči-ƛ’or y-ay-nosi elo idu sisxoli esyu y-esu-n
\g II-get.up-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB widow brother-PL I.PL-live-PRS.PRT.OBL place-SUPER.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB there home alone sister II-find-PST.UNW
\l The widow got up, went to the place where the siblings lived and found the sister alone at home.

\t Q’orolayä nełaqor eƛin, deber žukłi rodanix xalq’i urɣizi boqäsi yołƛin.
\m q’orolay-a neła-qor eƛi-n mi-r žukłi r-odi-ani-x xalq’i urɣizi b-oq-asi yoł-ƛin
\g widow-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you-LAT evil IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS people thinking I.PL-become-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l The widow told them: "Some people are thinking of harming you.

\t Di äƛiru rodinosi, mežiz mada zam-zames kikno boƛixsi.
\m di eƛi-ru r-odi-nosi meži-z ma-a zam-zam-s kik-n b-oƛix-s
\g me say-PST.PRT IV-do-ANT.CVB you.PL-GEN2 yard-IN.ESS Zam-Zam-GEN1 spring-TOP III-appear-PST.WIT
\l After you did what I said, a holy spring appeared in your yard.

\t Mi esiwq eso, sidaɣ mečoƛ’ sis aždaħno, nełasgon łˤono xexoyn yoł.
\m mi esiw-q esi-o sidaɣ moči-ƛ’ sis aždaħ-n neła-s-gon łˤono xexoy-n yoł
\g you brother-POSS.ESS tell-IMPR in.one.place place-SUPER.ESS one dragon-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR three young.animal-and be
\l Tell your brother that there is a dragon and its three youngs in some place.

\t Sis aždaħes xexoy biqirno ent’or bownäy, neła ʕazara roqˤuma igor nexa žek’u egirxosi anuƛin.
\m sis aždaħ-s xexoy b-iqir-n ent’o-r b-ow-näy neła-a ʕazar roqˤu-a igo-r nex-a žek’u egir-xosi anu-ƛin
\g one dragon-GEN1 young.animal III-take.away-PFV.CVB here-LAT III-bring-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG thousand step-IN.ESS near-LAT come-INF man let-PRS.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l If you take away one of the dragon's youngs and bring it here, it will not let any man come closer than a thousand steps.

\t Kidbä bełis oɣˤno teƛno, q’orolay iduɣor yegirno.
\m kid-a bełi-s oˤɣ-n teƛ-n q’orolay idu-ɣor y-egir-n
\g girl-ERG deer-GEN1 thigh-TOP give-PFV.CVB widow home-IN.ALL II-send-PST.UNW
\l The girl gave the widow a deer's thigh and sent her home.

\t Bełiƛ’ay xizor utin idur aynosi, yisir pašmanno yoqno yičäsi esiy yesux.
\m bełi-ƛ’ay xizor uti-n idu-r ay-nosi yisi-r pašman-n y-oq-n y-iči-asi esyu y-esu-x
\g hunting-SUPER.ABL back turn.back-PFV.CVB home-LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT become.sad-PFV.CVB II-become-PFV.CVB II-be-RES.PRT sister II-find-PRS
\l When he came back from hunting, he found his sister being sad.

\t Šebi roqäƛin esirnosi, neła esin, där žukłi rodanix xalq’i urɣizi boqxoƛax, mi bełiƛ’ ik’inosi, di t’o sisxoli yuƛ’ˤxo.
\m šebi r-oq-a-ƛin esir-nosi neła-a esi-n di-r žukłi r-odi-ani-x xalq’i urɣizi b-oq-x-ƛax mi bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-nosi di t’o sisxoli y-ˤuƛ’-x
\g what IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG tell-PST.UNW me-LAT evil IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS people thinking III-become-PRS-QUOT you hunting-SUPER.ESS go-ANT.CVB me here alone II-be.afraid-PRS
\l After he asked: "What happened?", she told: "Some people are apparently planning to harm me; after you went hunting, I was afraid here alone.

\t Mi t’or aždaħes xexoy ba di c’unzi yoda, howlo sidaɣ yołƛin teqsi där aždaħno, nełdegon sadaq łˤono xexoynƛin.
\m mi t’o-r aždaħ-s xexoy b-a di c’unzi y-odi-a howlo sidaɣ yoł-ƛin teq-si di-r aždaħ-n neła-de-gon sadaq łˤono xexoy-n-ƛin
\g you here-LAT dragon-GEN1 young.animal III-bring.IMP me guard II-do-INF there in.one.place be-QUOT hear-ATTR me-LAT dragon-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS-CNTR together three young.animal-and-QUOT
\l Bring me a dragon's young to guard me; I heard somewhere there there is a dragon and beside it three youngs."

\t Ža debeq äsirus haqu azirodoƛƛin, eƛin esiya.
\m ža mi-q esi-ru-s haqu azirod-ƛ-ƛin eƛi-n esyu-a
\g DEM1.SG you-POSS.ESS tell-PST.PRT-GEN1 mouth freeze.to.death-OPT-QUOT say-PST.UNW brother-ERG
\l "May the mouth of the one who told you that freeze over!", said the brother.

\t Hudayziko esiw maħor oqno neła aždaħeł xizay.
\m hudayziko esiw maħor oq-n neła aždaħ-ł xizay
\g the.next.day brother outside become-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL dragon-CONT.ESS behind
\l The next day the brother went outside in search of the dragon.

\t Hunix ik’iƛ’oräy, neła ħalaq’awni gula nesiqor eƛin, aždaħ kecäsi yałzay, buq bayäsi bičixosi, q’ˤiday bizinosi ža bičixozoni gogaƛ’ ɣedu boqxosi, elo nełaqgon šet’ur k’ešonayx xexoybi ričixosiƛin.
\m huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy neła ħalaq’aw-ni gulu-a nesi-qor eƛi-n aždaħ kec-asi yoł-zay buq b-ay-asi b-iči-x-si q’ˤida-ay b-izi-nosi ža b-iči-xozo-ni goga-ƛ’ ɣedu b-oq-xosi elo neła-q-gon šet’ur k’ešonad-x xexoy-bi r-iči-xosi-ƛin
\g way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL thin-DEF horse-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW dragon sleep-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB sun III-come-RES.PRT III-be-IPFV.CVB-ATTR down-IN.ABL III-get.up-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG III-be-PRS.PRT.OBL-DEF meadow-SUPER.ESS shade III-happen-PRS.PRT there DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-CNTR around play-IPFV.CVB young.animal-PL III.PL-be-PRS.PRT-QUOT
\l While he went on his way, that thin horse said to him: "While the dragon sleeps, the sun goes up, and after he gets up a shadow appears on the meadow, there around it the youngs are playing.

\t Yeda neła gogaƛ’or aynosi, naysinan c’oxäsi buqno yołƛax, elozagon k’ešonayx xexoybin resun.
\m yeda neła goga-ƛ’or ay-nosi naysinan c’ox-asi buq-n yoł-ƛax elo-za-gon k’ešonad-x xexoy-bi-n r-esu-n
\g DEM2.ISG DEM1.IISG.OBL meadow-SUPER.LAT come-ANT.CVB everywhere hit-RES.PRT sun-TOP be-QUOT there-DIST-CNTR play-IPFV.CVB young.animal-PL-TOP III.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l When he came on that meadow, the sun shined everywhere, and he found the youngs playing over there.

\t ƛ’irir ik’in sis xexoyn biqirno, et’un guluƛ’orno k’oƛin, sosi čuret’ bok’no.
\m ƛ’iri-r ik’i-n sis xexoy-n b-iqir-n et’u-n gulu-ƛ’or-n k’oƛi-n sosi čuret’ b-ok’-n
\g on-LAT go-PFV.CVB one young.animal-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.LAT-TOP jump-PFV.CVB once whip III-beat-PST.UNW
\l He came closer, grabbed one young dragon, jumped onto his horse and cracked the whip once.

\t ʕOƛno ħonno xecin yizi bitaɣor bok’ełno.
\m ʕoƛno ħon-n xeci-n yizi bita-aɣor b-ok’eł-n
\g seven mountain-TOP go.up-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL distance-IN.VERS I.PL-escape-PST.UNW
\l They went over seven mountains and escaped into the distance.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo aždaħ č’ariłno.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo aždaħ č’arił-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after dragon wake.up-PST.UNW
\l After that the dragon woke up.

\t Neła karu rok’xayzo mušimo ħalaq’awni gulus maħi ƛ’iräytow ret’urno roɣno.
\m neła kur-ru rok’u-xay-zo muši-mo ħalaq’aw-ni gulu-s maħi ƛ’iräy-tow r-et’ur-n r-oɣ-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL exhale-PST.PRT heart-AD.ABL-ATTR.OBL breath-ERG thin-DEF horse-GEN1 tail from.above-EMPH IV-pull.out-PFV.CVB IV-take.away-PST.UNW
\l Its breath, exhaled from the heart, pulled out the tail from the thin horse.

\t Elo igoza bäsuru yizir ɣˤays oreznar k’oƛinosi, gulun saɣ boqno, adäzoƛ’aygon rigu rexora maħin roƛixno.
\m elo igo-za b-esu-ru yizi-r ɣˤay-s orezni-ar k’oƛi-nosi gulu-n saɣ b-oq-n adäz-ƛ’ay-gon r-igu r-exora maħi-n r-oƛix-n
\g there near-ZA III-find-PST.PRT DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT milk-GEN1 pond-IN.LAT jump-ANT.CVB horse-TOP cure III-become-PFV.CVB before-SUPER.ABL-CNTR IV-pretty IV-long tail-TOP IV-appear-PST.UNW
\l There the jumped into a milky lake that they had found nearby, and the horse gut cured; its tail appeared, prettier and longer than before.

\t Aždaħes xexoyn bižin yeda idur aynosi, yisä yedu ɣˤʷay biłe ɣˤutkox ɣuɣudoxor bicin.
\m aždaħ-s xexoy-n b-iži-n yeda idu-r ay-nosi yisi-a yedu ɣˤʷay b-iłe ɣˤutku-x ɣuɣudi-xor b-ici-n
\g dragon-GEN1 young.animal-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG home-LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG dog III-as house-AD.ESS big.chain-AD.LAT III-tie-PST.UNW
\l He carried the dragon's young home and tied it on a chain to the house, like a dog.

\t Neła quł sasaq, esiw bełiƛ’ ik’inosi, ža q’orolay žigon yayn k’oƛin idur.
\m neła qu-ł sasaq esiw bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-nosi ža q’orolay žigon y-ay-n k’oƛi-n idu-r
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning brother hunting-SUPER.ESS go-ANT.CVB DEM1.SG widow again.now II-come-PFV.CVB run-PST.UNW home-LAT
\l The next morning when the brother had gone hunting, that widow ran back to their home once again.

\t Neła kidbeqor eƛin, ele žigoƛ’aygon deber däƛ’aza aždaħes xexoyn biqis, howži mi esiwqor eƛo, deber halmaɣłun yičaniƛäyn, nesirgon barułun yičaniƛäyn Beqes ʕUneyzat yowanix ik’iƛƛin.
\m neła-a kid-qor eƛi-n ele žigo-ƛ’ay-gon mi-r di-ƛ’aza aždaħ-s xexoy-n b-iqi-s howži mi esiw-qor eƛi-o mi-r halmaɣ-łun y-iči-ani-ƛay-n nesi-r-gon baru-łun y-iči-ani-ƛay-n buq-s ʕUneyzat y-ow-ani-x ik’i-ƛ-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG girl-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW here again-SUPER.ABL-CNTR you-LAT me-SUPER.VERS.DIST dragon-GEN1 young.animal-TOP III-get-PST.WIT now you brother-POSS.LAT say-IMPR you-LAT friend-LHUN II-be-MSD-SUB.ABL-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT-CNTR wife-LHUN II-be-MSD-SUB.ABL-and sun-GEN1 Uneyzat II-marry-MSD-AD.ESS go-OPT-QUOT
\l She said to the girl: "Again now because of me you got hold of a dragon's young, now say to your brother that he go and mary the Sun's Uneyzat, so she may become a friend to you and a wife to him."

\t Bełis reƛno teƛno kidbä q’orolay yegirno.
\m bełi-s reƛ-n teƛ-n kid-a q’orolay y-egir-n
\g deer-GEN1 meat-TOP give-PFV.CVB girl-ERG widow II-send-PST.UNW
\l The girl gave the widow deer meat and sent her away.

\t Bełiƛ’ay xizor utin idur aynosi, hemedurtow yisir q’ʷaridno yoqno yičäsi esiw yesun.
\m bełi-ƛ’ay xizor uti-n idu-r ay-nosi hemedur-tow yisi-r q’ʷarid-n y-oq-n y-iči-asi esiw y-esu-n
\g hunting-SUPER.ABL back return-PFV.CVB home-LAT come-ANT.CVB so-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT sad-TOP II-become-PFV.CVB II-be-RES.PRT sister II-find-PST.UNW
\l When he came back home from hunting, he found his sister once again being sad.

\t Šebi deber roqnoƛin yisä esirnosi, yiła yisiq q’orolayä äsiru xabar esin.
\m šebi mi-r r-oq-n-ƛin yisi-a esir-nosi yiła-a yisi-q q’orolay-a esi-ru xabar esi-n
\g what you-LAT IV-happen-PST.UNW-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-ANT.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS widow-ERG tell-PST.PRT story tell-PST.UNW
\l When he asked: "What happened to you?", she told him what the widow had told her.

\t Ža debeq äsirus haqu azirodoƛ, mi där łˤora ɣudi ʕeze roqace biša eroƛin, esiwqorno eƛin, išno-utin kecno yeda.
\m ža mi-q esi-ru-s haqu azirod-ƛ mi di-r łˤora ɣudi ʕeze r-oq-ace bišʷa er-o-ƛin esiw-qor-n eƛi-n iš~uti-n kec-n yeda
\g DEM1.SG you-POSS.ESS tell-PST.PRT-GEN1 mouth freeze.to.death-OPT you me-LAT three.OBL day be.enough IV-become-TERM food put-IMPR-QUOT sister-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB eat-PFV.CVB sleep-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG
\l "May the mouth of the one who told you that freeze over! Prepare me food enough for three days!", he said, ate and slept.

\t Qˤaħłi äruntow yeda saparyox oqno.
\m qaħłi er-run-tow yeda sapar-x oq-n
\g dawn set.up-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM2.ISG journey-AD.ESS become-PST.UNW
\l Right after dawn set it, he went on his journey.

\t Hunix ik’iƛ’oräy gula eƛin, łˤono ħonno xecin bitaza äsu deber mecyozaƛ’aygon rexorat’a kikibi yołäsi žek’u.
\m huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy gulu-a eƛi-n łˤono ħon-n xeci-n bita-aza esu mi-r mecu-bi-ƛ’ay-gon r-exora-t’a kiki-bi yoł-asi žek’u
\g way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB horse-ERG say-PST.UNW three mountain-TOP leave-PFV.CVB distance-IN.VERS.DIST find you-LAT hand-PL-SUPER.ABL-CNTR III.PL-long-DISTR breast-PL be-RES.PRT man
\l While he was on his way, the horse said: "After three mountains, in the distance there you will find a man with breasts even longer than his arms.

\t Mi iynč’ey nesił xizazarno ik’in, riqirno łox kikibi ƛiso, mi dey uži yołƛin eƛace.
\m mi iy-č’ey nesi-ł xizaz-ar-n ik’i-n r-iqir-n łox kiki-bi ƛisi-o mi di-s uži yoł-ƛin eƛi-ace
\g you know-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS from.behind-IN.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB III.PL-catch-PFV.CVB thrice breast-PL pull-IMPR you me-GEN1 son be-QUOT say-TERM
\l Go to him from behind without him knowing, catch his breasts and pull them three times until he says "You are my son"!"

\t Bayn žedu elor, esun yisir ža ečruni žek’u.
\m b-ay-n žedu elo-r esu-n yisi-r ža ečru-ni žek’u
\g I.PL-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL there-LAT find-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.SG old-DEF man
\l They came there and found this old man.

\t Mi dey uži yołƛin nesä eƛizaƛ’or, łox kikibi ƛisin užä nesis.
\m mi di-s uži yoł-ƛin nesi-a eƛi-zaƛ’or łox kiki-bi ƛisi-n uži-a nesi-s
\g you me-GEN1 son be-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-POST.CVB thrice breast-PL pull-PST.UNW boy-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1
\l Until he said "You are my son.", the boy pulled his breasts three times.

\t Ečruni žek’a esirno nesiq, šebi debi murad yołƛin.
\m ečru-ni žek’u-a esir-n nesi-q šebi mi-s murad yoł-ƛin
\g old-DEF man-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS what you-GEN1 wish be-QUOT
\l The old man asked: "What is your wish?"

\t Užä žawab teƛno, där retin Beqes ʕUneyzat barułun yowanixƛin.
\m uži-a žawab teƛ-n di-r r-eti-n buq-s ʕUneyzat baru-łun y-ow-ani-x-ƛin
\g boy-ERG answer give-PST.UNW me-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW sun-GEN1 Uneyzat wife-LHUN II-marry-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l The boy answered: "I wanted to marry Sun's Uneyzat."

\t Eženä eƛin, sidaɣ hemeła mečoƛ’ dey baru yäsu deber, mi p’es anusi nełar iynč’ey ik’in, kiki xiro, xizyo neła deber kumak badiƛin.
\m eže-ni-a eƛi-n sidaɣ hemeła moči-ƛ’ di-s baru y-esu mi-r mi p’es anu-si neła-r iy-č’ey ik’i-n kiki xir-o xizyo neła-a mi-r kumak b-odi-ƛin
\g old-DEF-ERG say-PST.UNW in.one.place DEM4.IISG.OBL place-SUPER.ESS me-GEN1 wife II-find you-LAT you sound be.NEG-ATTR DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT know-NEG.PST.CVB go-PFV.CVB breast suck-IMPR afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you-LAT help III-do-QUOT
\l The old man said: "In some place you will find my wife; go to her without making a sound and without her knowing it and suck at her breast, afterwards she will help you."

\t Tabanaw manzilno xecin ik’inosi, yisir his xuxix yeže ɣˤanabi yesun.
\m tabanaw manzil-n xeci-n ik’i-nosi yisi-r his xuxi-x y-eže ɣˤanabi y-esu-n
\g long distance-TOP leave-PFV.CVB go-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT spring.wool comb-IPFV.CVB II-old woman II-find-PST.UNW
\l After having gone a long distance, he found a woman combing wool.

\t Ayruntow yisä nełas kiki xirno.
\m ay-run-tow yisi-a neła-s kiki xir-n
\g come-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 breast suck-PST.UNW
\l Just when he came, he sucked at her breast.

\t Neła eƛin, beže taliħ boqsi debi, yaqˤułäy soder mi dey uži yoł, howži debi mi murad eso däqƛin.
\m neła-a eƛi-n b-eže taliħ b-oq-s mi-s yaqˤuł-ay soder mi di-s uži yoł howži mi-s mi murad esi-o di-q-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW III-big fortune III-happen-PST.WIT you-GEN1 today-IN.ABL after you me-GEN1 son be now you-GEN1 you wish tell-IMPR me-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l She said: "You have good luck, as of today you are my son; now tell me your wish!"

\t Beqes ʕUneyzateł xizay di oqäsi yołƛin, esin yisä.
\m buq-s ʕUneyzat-ł xizay di oq-asi yoł-ƛin esi-n yisi-a
\g sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-CONT.ESS behind me become-RES.PRT be-QUOT tell-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "I am looking for Sun's Uneyzat," he said.

\t Yeženä eƛin, hemeła pulanaw mečoƛ’ yoł ža, elor ayrun, kakno rodo, łox nełas ci qˤaƛo.
\m y-eže-ni-a eƛi-n hemeła pulanaw moči-ƛ’ yoł ža elo-r ay-run kak-n r-odi-o łox neła-s ci qˤaƛi-o
\g II-old-DEF-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM4.IISG.OBL a.certain place-SUPER.ESS be DEM1.SG there-LAT come-IMM.ANT.CVB prayer-TOP IV-do-IMPR thrice DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 name shout-IMPR
\l The old woman said: "She lives at that certain place, when you arrive there, say a prayer and shout her name three times!"

\t Neła roži roɣinč’inäy, mi beroz k’icaƛ’or ati, roži roɣnäy yäqi ža deberƛin.
\m neła-a roži r-oɣ-č’i-näy mi bero-z k’icu-ƛ’or uti roži r-oɣ-näy y-iqi ža mi-r-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG word IV-take.away-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB you ice-GEN2 tooth-SUPER.LAT turn word IV-take.away-CND.CVB II-get DEM1.SG you-LAT-QUOT
\l If she doesn't say a word, then you will turn on the ice tooth, and if she says a word then, she will get to you."

\t Užä guluq esirno, yedu šebi šebinƛin.
\m uži-a gulu-q esir-n yedu šebi šebin-ƛin
\g boy-ERG horse-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG what thing-QUOT
\l The boy asked the horse: "What thing is that?!"

\t Gula eƛin, mi iłet’ani bahadurzas šudbi yoł t’oƛin.
\m gulu-a eƛi-n mi iłe-t’a-ni bahadur-bi-s šud-bi yoł t’o-ƛin
\g horse-ERG say-PST.UNW you as-DISTR-DEF hero-PL-GEN1 grave-PL be there-QUOT
\l The horse said: "The graves of heroes like you are there."

\t Sida zamanałäza yeda Beqes ʕUneyzates ɣˤutkoł adäzar ayn.
\m sida zaman-łaza yeda buq-s ʕUneyzat-s ɣˤutku-ł adäz-ar ay-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.VERS.DIST DEM2.ISG sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-GEN1 house-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l After a while he came before the house of Sun's Uneyzat.

\t Yisis ħalaq’awni gulu bera biqirno.
\m yisi-s ħalaq’aw-ni gulu bero-a b-iqir-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 thin-DEF horse ice-IN.ESS III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l His thin horse covered itself with ice.

\t Yiła užiqor eƛin, kakno royn mi däƛ’ ƛ’iri zow, nełaz akixor bik’anix.
\m yiła-a uži-qor eƛi-n kak-n r-odi-n mi di-ƛ’ ƛ’iri zow neła-z aki-xor b-ik’i-ani-x
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG boy-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW prayer-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB you me-SUPER.ESS on ride DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 window-AD.LAT I.PL-go-MSD-AD.ESS
\l It said to the boy: "Do a prayer with me and sit on me, so we can get in through her window."

\t Akiƛer aynosi, ʕUneyzatƛin qˤaƛin, roži roɣnoanu.
\m aki-ƛer ay-nosi ʕUneyzat-ƛin qˤaƛi-n roži r-oɣ-n-anu
\g window-SUB.LAT come-ANT.CVB Uneyzat-QUOT shout-PFV.CVB word IV-take.away-PST.UNW-NEG
\l When they came under the window, he shouted "Uneyzat!", but there was no response.

\t K’ox äƛirugon qˤaƛin - šebiƛin esirxo tełäzay roži teqno.
\m k’ox äƛiru-gon qˤaƛi-n - šebi-ƛin esir-x teł-azay roži teq-n
\g twice ORD-CNTR shout-PFV.CVB - what-QUOT ask-IPFV.CVB inside-IN.ABL.DIST word hear-PST.UNW
\l He shouted a second time and heard an answer from inside, asking "What?"

\t Hemełƛ’o guluƛay dahaw bero becin bik’in.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ gulu-ƛay dahaw bero b-eci-n b-ik’i-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS horse-SUB.ABL a.little ice III-thaw-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.UNW
\l After that, a little ice thawed away from the horse.

\t Łox äƛirugon, akäzno yoƛixno, tełxor oqƛin eƛin.
\m łox äƛiru-gon aki-az-n y-oƛix-n teł-xor oq-ƛin eƛi-n
\g thrice ORD-CNTR window-IN.ESS.DIST-TOP II-appear-PFV.CVB inside-AD.LAT become-QUOT say-PST.UNW
\l But at the third time, she appeared in the window and said: "Come inside!"

\t Xizyo yołi guluƛ’ zawru kinawtow bero becin bik’in.
\m xizyo yołi gulu-ƛ’ zow-ru kinaw-tow bero b-eci-n b-ik’i-n
\g afterwards however horse-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-PST.PRT entire-EMPH ice III-thaw-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.UNW
\l Then, however, the entire ice that was on the horse thawed away.

\t Neła (gula) užiqor eƛin xecin, xizor butin nexƛ’oräy däƛ’ gurow zawnoƛin.
\m neła-a gulu-a uži-qor eƛi-n xeci-n xizor b-uti-n nex-ƛ’oräy di-ƛ’ gurow zow-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG horse-ERG boy-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW back I.PL-return-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB me-SUPER.ESS except ride-PROHIB-QUOT
\l It (the horse) said and left: "When we come back, only ride on me!"

\t Madax gulun bicin xecin, uži Beqes ʕUneyzatdäɣor ik’in.
\m ma-x gulu-n b-ici-n xeci-n uži buq-s ʕUneyzat-däɣor ik’i-n
\g door-AD.ESS horse-TOP III-tie-PFV.CVB leave-PFV.CVB boy sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-APUD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l The boy left the horse tied to the door and went next to Sun's Uneyzat.

\t Neła esirno, šebi deber retinƛin.
\m neła-a esir-n šebi mi-r r-eti-n-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW what you-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l She asked: "Whad did you want?"

\t Yisä eƛin, mi barułun yižanix debeł xizay nexäsi yoł diƛin.
\m yisi-a eƛi-n mi baru-łun y-iži-ani-x mi-ł xizay nex-asi yoł di-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW you wife-LHUN II-take.out-MSD-AD.ESS you-CONT.ESS behind come-RES.PRT be me-QUOT
\l He said: "I came to you in order to take you as a wife."

\t Nazay eƛa iynč’ey ayn dibirä yiłaƛ’ mahar erno.
\m nazay eƛi-a iy-č’ey ay-n dibir-a yiła-ƛ’ mahar er-n
\g from.where say-INF know-NEG.PST.CVB come-PFV.CVB imam-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS wedding set.up-PST.UNW
\l Unknown from where there came an imam and set up the wedding for them.

\t Ħažataw q’ʷarʕaraw q’ayn sidaƛ’or butirno, maħor boqanix ħadur boqnosi, Beqes ʕUneyzatä eƛin, däz guluƛ’ zown bik’anƛin.
\m ħažataw q’ʷarʕaraw q’ay-n sida-ƛ’or b-utir-n maħor b-oq-ani-x ħadur b-oq-nosi buq-s ʕUneyzat-a eƛi-n di-z gulu-ƛ’ zow-n b-ik’i-an-ƛin
\g necessary necessary article-TOP one.OBL-SUPER.LAT III-gather-PFV.CVB outside I.PL-become-MSD-AD.ESS prepare I.PL-become-ANT.CVB sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN2 horse-SUPER.ESS ride-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l They gathered all necessary articles together, and when they prepared to go outside, Sun's Uneyzat said: "We will ride on my horse."

\t Bik’ixanu - däz guluƛ’ bik’anƛin yedan ičin.
\m b-ik’i-x-anu - di-z gulu-ƛ’ b-ik’i-an-ƛin yeda-n iči-n
\g I.PL-go-PRS-NEG - me-GEN2 horse-SUPER.ESS I.PL-go-FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM2.ISG-TOP remain-PST.UNW
\l "We're not going - we will ride on my horse," he insisted.

\t Hemedur q’ecenyayx žedu ʕuraw mixƛ’or ƛexun.
\m hemedur q’ecenyad-x žedu ʕuraw mix-ƛ’or ƛexu-n
\g so argue-IPFV.CVB DEM1.IPL much time-SUPER.LAT remain-PST.UNW
\l So they were arguing for a long time.

\t Xizaɣor užiq ža muk’urno yoqno, yisiz guluƛ’no zown bik’in.
\m xizaɣor uži-q ža muk’ur-n y-oq-n yisi-z gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n b-ik’i-n
\g finally boy-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG persuade-PFV.CVB II-become-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l Finally she became persuaded by the boy and they both sat on his horse and they went away.

\t Bayn yizi aziroyn xalq’imołäy berobi raqru ħonƛ’or.
\m b-ay-n yizi azirod-n xalq’i-łay bero-bi r-oq-ru ħon-ƛ’or
\g I.PL-come-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL freeze.to.death-PFV.CVB people-CONT.ABL ice-PL III.PL-become-PST.PRT mountain-SUPER.LAT
\l They came to the mountain, which arose from the ice of the frozen people.

\t Xedya eƛin, wey dey baru, beroz gup’rezaƛ’or batiru xalq’i č’agu odoƛin.
\m xediw-a eƛi-n wey di-s baru bero-z gup’-bi-ƛ’or b-uti-ru xalq’i č’agu odi-o-ƛin
\g husband-ERG say-PST.UNW hey me-GEN1 wife ice-GEN2 hill-PL-SUPER.LAT III-turn-PST.PRT people alive do-IMPR-QUOT
\l The husband said: "Hey, my wife, revive the people who turned into icy hills."

\t Bara eƛin, žedu č’agu boynäy, dowƛ’orno, däƛ’ornotow žeda sis balah bayär, xec žedu sida ħalaƛin.
\m baru-a eƛi-n žedu č’agu b-odi-näy mi-ƛ’or-n di-ƛ’or-n-tow žedu-a sis balah b-ayr xeci žedu sida ħal-a-ƛin
\g wife-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL alive I.PL-do-CND.CVB you-SUPER.LAT-and me-SUPER.LAT-and-EMPH DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG one misfortune III-bring leave DEM1.IPL one.OBL condition-IN.ESS-QUOT
\l The wife said: "If we revive them, they will bring misfortune unto both you and me; leave them in their condition!"

\t Xediya äƛiru rodo miƛin, yeda baruƛ’ ƛ’iri utin.
\m xediw-a eƛi-ru r-odi-o mi-ƛin yeda baru-ƛ’ ƛ’iri uti-n
\g husband-ERG say-PST.PRT IV-do-IMPR you-QUOT DEM2.ISG wife-SUPER.ESS on return-PST.UNW
\l "Do what your husband said!", he insisted on his wife.

\t Xizyo Beqes ʕUneyzat bero beciranix yoqno.
\m xizyo buq-s ʕUneyzat bero b-eci-r-ani-x y-oq-n
\g afterwards sun-GEN1 Uneyzat ice III-thaw-CAUS-MSD-AD.ESS II-begin-PST.UNW
\l Then Sun's Uneyzat began to melt the ice.

\t Bero beca baqruntow t’ay eli boxin bok’ła bayƛin yiłä äƛirun, bet’un guluƛ’orno k’oƛin, čuret’ bak’runtow, ʕoƛno ħonno xecin bitaɣor bok’ełno.
\m bero b-eci-a b-oq-run-tow t’ay eli b-oxi-n b-ok’eł-a b-ay-ƛin yiła-a eƛi-run b-et’u-n gulu-ƛ’or-n k’oƛi-n čuret’ b-ok’-run-tow ʕoƛno ħon-n xeci-n bita-aɣor b-ok’eł-n
\g ice III-thaw-INF III-begin-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH from.here we I.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB I.PL-escape-INF I.PL-must-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-IMM.ANT.CVB I.PL-jump-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.LAT-TOP jump-PFV.CVB whip III-beat-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH seven mountain-TOP go.up-PFV.CVB distance-IN.VERS I.PL-escape-PST.UNW
\l "Immediately after the ice has begun to thaw, we must run away and escape from here!", she said and right away they jumped onto the horse, cracked the whip and immediately crossed the seven mountains and escaped into the distance.

\t Hawaƛ’ k’oƛin guluzaƛ’ biłe nexxoƛax yiził xizay beron becin č’agu baqruni žek’ubi.
\m hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n gulu-bi-ƛ’ b-iłe nex-x-ƛax yizi-ł xizay bero-n b-eci-n č’agu b-oq-ru-ni žek’u-bi
\g air-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB horse-PL-SUPER.ESS I.PL-as come-PRS-QUOT DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS behind ice-TOP III-thaw-PFV.CVB alive I.PL-become-PST.PRT-DEF man-PL
\l Like on a horse the men who became alive after the ice thawed came behind them.

\t Xizay bayru žedu ʕoloqzaqor yeženä eƛin, nesis hunar mežizoƛ’ay bežis, meža royxosi šebin šebi, dey xexbiƛin.
\m xizay b-ay-ru žedu ʕoloq-bi-qor y-eže-ni-a eƛi-n nesi-s hunar meži-z-ƛ’ay b-eži-s mežu-a r-odi-xosi šebin šebi di-s xexbi-ƛin
\g from.behind I.PL-come-PST.PRT DEM1.IPL.OBL young.person-PL-POSS.LAT II-old-DEF-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 talent you.PL-GEN2-SUPER.ABL III-win-PST.WIT you(I).PL.OBL-ERG IV-do-PRS.PRT thing what me-GEN1 children-QUOT
\l The old woman said to those young peple who came behind them: "He is more talented than you all, what is what you do, my children?

\t Elaɣor bik’iƛ’oräy meža dey kiki xiräsi boqzaƛ’, mežus di eniw yoqxo, hudu meža eniya äƛiru rodoƛin.
\m ele-aɣor b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy mežu-a di-s kiki xir-asi b-oq-zaƛ’ mežu-s di eniw y-oq-x hudu mežu-a eni-a eƛi-ru r-odi-o-ƛin
\g there-IN.VERS I.PL-go-SIM.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-ERG me-GEN1 breast suck-RES.PRT I.PL-begin-CSL.CVB you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 me mother II-become-PRS so you(I).PL.OBL-ERG mother-ERG say-PST.PRT IV-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l When you go there, I become your mother, because you will have sucked on my breast, so do what your mother says!"

\t Nesi užä mežus ʕumru xʷasar bodäsi boqzaƛ’, nesiłno, Beqes ʕUneyzatełno esnałin risno žeduz bertenyołxor bik’i, ent’aytow ħaƛu-bišanix šebinon rižin.
\m nesi uži-a mežu-s ʕumru xʷasar b-odi-asi b-oq-zaƛ’ nesi-ł-n buq-s ʕUneyzat-ł-n esnałin r-is-n žedu-z berten-łxor b-ik’i ent’a-ay-tow ħaƛu~iš-ani-x šebinon r-iži-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-ERG you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 life rescue III-do-RES.PRT III-become-CSL.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-and sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-CONT.ESS-and brother IV-take-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 marriage-CONT.VERS I.PL-go from.here-IN.ABL-EMPH eat.and.drink-MSD-AD.ESS something IV-take.out-PFV.CVB
\l Because that boy saved your life, you should fraternize with him and Sun's Uneyzat and go to their marriage after taking something to eat and drink with you."

\t Nełaƛ’ žedun razi boqno.
\m neła-ƛ’ žedu-n razi b-oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS DEM1.IPL-TOP agree I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l With that they agreed.

\t Yeženä Beqes ʕUneyzatno, xediwn mˤaliz qˤodreza tełäy maħor begirno, howži mežus req’el boqsiƛin.
\m y-eže-ni-a buq-s ʕUneyzat-n xediw-n mˤali-z qˤod-bi-a teł-ay maħor b-egir-n howži mežu-s req’el b-oq-si-ƛin
\g II-old-DEF-ERG sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-and husband-and nose-GEN2 hole-PL-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL outside I.PL-let-PFV.CVB now you(I).PL.OBL-GEN1 peace I.PL-become-ATTR-QUOT
\l The old woman let Sun's Uneyzat and her husband out of her nostril [and said]: "Now you're at peace."

\t Idur bayruntow dahaw mušin begirno, bertenyołer butin yizi.
\m idu-r b-ay-run-tow dahaw muši-n b-egir-n berten-łer b-uti-n yizi
\g home-LAT I.PL-come-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH a.little breath-TOP III-let-PFV.CVB marriage-CONT.LAT I.PL-return-PST.UNW DEM2.IPL
\l Right when they came home, they took a little rest and returned to the marriage again.

\t Zamanaƛ’äza xan saɣ oqnoƛax.
\m zaman-ƛ’aza xan saɣ oq-n-ƛax
\g time-SUPER.VERS.DIST khan cure become-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l After some time the king got cured.

\t Elzox idu ƛirba yoł, elor nexa resno, sanaʕałin anu elusƛin, xizor begirno užä nukarbi.
\m ela-zo-x idu ƛirba yoł elo-r nex-a res-n sanaʕałi-n anu elu-s-ƛin xizor b-egir-n uži-a nukar-bi
\g we(II-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS home guest be there-LAT come-INF possibility-and chance-and be.NEG we(I).OBL-GEN1-QUOT back I.PL-send-PST.UNW boy-ERG henchman-PL
\l "We have a guest at home, we don't have a possibility or a chance to come there," the boy said and sent the henchmen back.

\t Hudayzikon xanä žeduder begirno nukarbi.
\m hudayziko-n xan-a žedu-der b-egir-n nukar-bi
\g the.next.day-TOP khan-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.LAT I.PL-send-PST.UNW henchman-PL
\l The next day the king sent his henchmen to them again.

\t Hemedurtow eƛin užä žedu xizor begirno xandäɣor.
\m hemedur-tow eƛi-n uži-a žedu xizor b-egir-n xan-däɣor
\g so-EMPH say-PFV.CVB boy-ERG DEM1.IPL back I.PL-send-PST.UNW khan-APUD.VERS
\l The boy answered likewise and sent them back to the king.

\t Łˤono äƛiru ɣudƛ’ogon xanä łˤonoqu nukar egirno ayrno, q’ˤanon esnabin, Beqes ʕUneyzatno sadaq yowanixƛin.
\m łˤono äƛiru ɣudi-ƛ’-gon xan-a łˤonoqu nukar egir-n ayr-n q’ˤano-n esyu-bi-n buq-s ʕUneyzat-n sadaq y-ow-ani-x-ƛin
\g three ORD day-SUPER.ESS-CNTR khan-ERG sixty henchman send-PFV.CVB call-PST.UNW two-TOP brother-PL-and sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-and together II-bring-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l On the third day, the king sent sixty henchmen and let them bring the two siblings and Sun's Uneyzat.

\t Maħlar bayruntow, xanä eƛin, eloš neła imyoqor yicalini ɣˤanazar naʕanan bodo, nocun caƛo nełasƛin.
\m maħla-ar b-ay-run-tow xan-a eƛi-n eloš neła im-qor y-ici-ali-ni ɣˤanabi-r naʕana-n b-odi-o nocu-n caƛi-o neła-s-ƛin
\g court-IN.LAT I.PL-come-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH khan-ERG say-PST.UNW over.there DEM1.IISG.OBL pole-POSS.LAT II-tie-ATTR-DEF woman-LAT curse-and III-do-IMPR saliva-and shoot.with-IMPR DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-QUOT
\l When they came into the court, the king said: "Curse and spit on that woman over there, who is tied to that pole!"

\t Ela nełar naʕanan bodač’in, nocun caƛač’in, ža sadaq anusi eli debez ɣˤutka tełxorkin buyn baqinč’iƛin, Beqes ʕUneyzat yičin.
\m elu-a neła-r naʕana-n b-odi-ač’in nocu-n caƛi-ač’in ža sadaq anu-si eli mi-z ɣˤutku-a teł-xor-kin b-uy-n b-oq-č’i-ƛin buq-s ʕUneyzat y-iči-n
\g we(I).OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT curse-and III-do-NEG.FUT.DEF saliva-and shoot.with-NEG.FUT.DEF DEM1.SG together be.NEG-ATTR we you-GEN2 house-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT-even I.PL-indeed-TOP I.PL-become-NEG.FUT-QUOT sun-GEN1 Uneyzat II-remain-PST.UNW
\l "We will neither curse her, nor spit on her, and we will not even get into your house without her!", Sun's Uneyzat insisted.

\t Ganzo ħošoq yutiräsi ža ɣˤanabi łinar mežur yetäsiƛin, eƛin xanä.
\m gani-z ħoši-q y-utir-asi ža ɣˤanabi łinar mežu-r y-eti-asi-ƛin eƛi-n xan-a
\g bull.calf-GEN2 hide-POSS.ESS II-turn-RES.PRT DEM1.SG woman why you(I).PL.OBL-LAT II-want-RES.PRT-QUOT say-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l "Why do you want this women who is wrapped in a bull's hide?", said the king.

\t Tatanu łäs bic’äsi t’asno, sop’onno yowo ent’o däqor, elay bitorsi šebin dey di rodanƛin, eƛin xanqor Beqes ʕUneyzatä.
\m tatanu łi-s b-ic’-asi t’as-n sop’on-n y-ow-o ent’o di-qor ele-ay bitor-si šebi-n di-s di r-odi-an-ƛin eƛi-n xan-qor buq-s ʕUneyzat-a
\g hot water-GEN1 III-fill-RES.PRT washbowl-and soap-and II-bring-IMPR here me-POSS.LAT here-IN.ABL thither-ATTR what-TOP me-GEN1 me IV-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW khan-POSS.LAT sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-ERG
\l "Bring me a bowl filled with hot water and soap here, I will do the rest from then on.", said Sun's Uneyzat to the king.

\t Neła ža imyoq yicin zawruni ɣˤanabi elar yutirxo, t’ar yutirxo esayn q’ˤimaku yiłe yodin yegirno.
\m neła-a ža im-q y-ici-n zow-ru-ni ɣˤanabi ele-ar y-utir-x t’ar y-utir-x esad-n q’ˤimaku y-iłe y-odi-n y-egir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG pole-POSS.ESS II-tie-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF woman here-IN.LAT II-turn-IPFV.CVB thither II-turn-IPFV.CVB wash-PFV.CVB grown.up II-as II-do-PFV.CVB II-let-PST.UNW
\l She washed the woman who was tied to the pole, turning her hither and thither, and let her look like a grown-up.

\t Xizyo yizi uynon xanez ɣˤutka tełxor boqno.
\m xizyo yizi uyno-n xan-z ɣˤutku-a teł-xor b-oq-n
\g afterwards DEM2.IPL four-TOP khan-GEN2 house-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l Then the four of them went into the king's house.

\t Q’ˤida bičanix yiziƛer uyno q’ˤuri rayrno.
\m q’ˤida b-iči-ani-x yizi-ƛer uyno q’ˤuri r-ayr-n
\g down I.PL-sit-MSD-AD.ESS DEM2.IPL.OBL-SUB.LAT four chair IV-bring-PST.UNW
\l He brought four chairs for them to sit down.

\t Xanä madaxozoniqor eƛin, mesedyos q’ˤuri užiƛer teƛ, micxiryos - kidbeƛer, pakmos - ƛirbaqor, qacis q’ˤuri imyoqor yicin zawruni ɣˤanazaqor teƛƛin.
\m xan-a ma-x-zo-ni-qor eƛi-n mesed-s q’ˤuri uži-ƛer teƛ micxir-s - kid-ƛer pak-s - ƛirba-qor qaci-s q’ˤuri im-qor y-ici-n zow-ru-ni ɣˤanabi-qor teƛ-ƛin
\g khan-ERG gate-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW gold-GEN1 chair boy-SUB.LAT give silver-GEN1 - girl-SUB.LAT copper-GEN1 - guest-POSS.LAT wood-GEN1 chair pole-POSS.LAT II-tie-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF woman-POSS.LAT give-QUOT
\l The king said to the guard: "Give the golden chair to the boy, the silver one to the girl, the copper one to the guest and the wooden one give to the woman who was tied to the pole."

\t Nełaƛ’ razin yoqinč’ey, Beqes ʕUneyzatä mesedyos q’ˤuri imyoqor yicin zawruni ɣˤanazaƛer teƛno, micxiryosni - užiƛer, pakmosni - kidbeƛer, qacisni neła nełƛer risno.
\m neła-ƛ’ razi-n y-oq-č’ey buq-s ʕUneyzat-a mesed-s q’ˤuri im-qor y-ici-n zow-ru-ni ɣˤanabi-ƛer teƛ-n micxir-s-ni - uži-ƛer pak-s-ni - kid-ƛer qaci-s-ni neła-a neła-ƛer r-is-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS agree-TOP II-become-NEG.PST.CVB sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-ERG gold-GEN1 chair pole-POSS.LAT II-tie-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF woman-SUB.LAT give-PFV.CVB silver-GEN1-DEF - boy-SUB.LAT copper-GEN1-DEF - girl-SUB.LAT wood-GEN1-DEF DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUB.LAT IV-take-PST.UNW
\l Sun's Uneyzat didn't agree to this and gave the golden chair to the girl that used to be tied to the pole, the silver one to the boy, the copperone to the girl and the wooden one she took for herself.

\t Xizyo yiził adäza biša erno.
\m xizyo yizi-ł adäza bišʷa er-n
\g afterwards DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS before food put-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards food was served before them.

\t Bišadyoƛ’orƛin yizä reƛ’a regirƛ’oräy, Beqes ʕUneyzatä xizor roɣrerno yiziq, dahaw zamanał bičiƛin.
\m bišad-ƛ’or-ƛin yizi-a reƛ’a r-egir-ƛ’oräy buq-s ʕUneyzat-a xizor r-oɣ-r-r-n yizi-q dahaw zaman-ł b-iči-ƛin
\g food-SUPER.LAT-QUOT DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG hand IV-let-SIM.CVB sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-ERG back IV.PL-take.away-CAUS-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS a.little time-CONT.ESS I.PL-wait-QUOT
\l When they reached for the food with their hands, Sun's Uneyzat ordered them to take them back: "Wait a little!"

\t Elor sis qˤaba k’et’u k’oƛin bayn, bisno yiłar magalu kurnosi, howlortow bexun ža.
\m elo-r sis qˤaba k’et’u k’oƛi-n b-ay-n b-is-n yiła-r magalu kur-nosi howlo-r-tow b-exu-n ža
\g there-LAT one black cat run-PFV.CVB III-come-PFV.CVB III-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT bread throw-ANT.CVB there-LAT-EMPH III-die-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l A black cat came running there, and after she took a [piece of] bread and threw it to the cat, it immediately died.

\t Xaner žan bukaynč’ey, meži šida bišxanuƛin esirno.
\m xan-r ža-n b-ukad-č’ey meži šida b-iš-x-anu-ƛin esir-n
\g khan-LAT DEM1.SG-TOP III-see-NEG.PST.CVB you.PL why III-eat-PRS-NEG-QUOT ask-PST.UNW
\l The king didn't see that and asked: "Why aren't you eating?"

\t Didur eli bišan, bäšru k’et’ukin bexusƛin eƛin xanqor Beqes ʕUneyzatä.
\m didur eli b-iš-an b-iš-ru k’et’u-kin b-exu-s-ƛin eƛi-n xan-qor buq-s ʕUneyzat-a
\g how we III-eat-FUT.DEF III-eat-PST.PRT cat-even III-die-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW khan-POSS.LAT sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-ERG
\l "How could we eat, if even the cat who ate died?", said Sun's Uneyzat to the king.

\t K’ox äƛiru rayäru bišadyołno besun zahru.
\m k’ox äƛiru r-ayr-ru bišad-ł-n b-esu-n zahru
\g twice ORD IV-bring-PST.PRT food-CONT.ESS-TOP III-exist-PST.UNW poison
\l And for the second time there was poison in the food they had brought.

\t Łox äƛiru rayäru bišadyoł zahru anuru biyn yizir, elay bet’urno magalu kurnosi k’et’u bexunč’izaƛ’.
\m łox äƛiru r-ayr-ru bišad-ł zahru anu-ru b-iy-n yizi-r ele-ay b-et’ur-n magalu kur-nosi k’et’u b-exu-č’i-zaƛ’
\g thrice ORD IV-bring-PST.PRT food-CONT.ESS poison be.NEG-PST.PRT III-know-PST.UNW DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT there-IN.ABL III-pull.out-PFV.CVB bread throw-ANT.CVB cat III-die-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB
\l The third time they knew that there was no poison in the food they brought, because the cat for which a [piece of] bread was pulled out and thrown to, wouldn't die.

\t Howži yołi yizide sadaq xannonan ax roqace išno.
\m howži yołi yizi-de sadaq xan-n-nan ax r-oq-ace iš-n
\g now however DEM2.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS together khan-and-INT belly IV-become-TERM eat-PST.UNW
\l Now, however, even the king ate together with them until his belly was full.

\t Xizyo xanä esirno, ha eso, łas meži xexbi boqxo.
\m xizyo xan-a esir-n ha esi-o ła-s meži xexbi b-oq-x
\g afterwards khan-ERG ask-PST.UNW well tell-IMPR who.OBL-GEN1 you.PL children I.PL-become-PRS
\l Afterwards the king asked: "So tell me, whose children are you?"

\t Hemełƛ’o Beqes ʕUneyzatä kidbez q’ˤimƛ’ay pardagi roɣno caƛin eƛin, yedu yoł mesedyos žežu yołalini debi kidƛin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ buq-s ʕUneyzat-a kid-z q’ˤim-ƛ’ay pardagi r-oɣ-n caƛi-n eƛi-n yedu yoł mesed-s žežu yoł-ali-ni mi-s kid-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-ERG girl-GEN2 head-SUPER.ABL scarf IV-take.away-PFV.CVB throw-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG be gold-GEN1 ponytail be-ATTR-DEF you-GEN1 daughter-QUOT
\l Thereupon Sun's Uneyzat threw away the scarf off the girl's head and said: "She is your daughter with the golden ponytail.

\t Yeda marɣalyos k’icu yołalini debi uži yołƛin, eƛin neła nełaz xediwƛ’or bašan boyn ukarno.
\m yeda marɣal-s k’icu yoł-ali-ni mi-s uži yoł-ƛin eƛi-n neła-a neła-z xediw-ƛ’or baša-n b-odi-n ukar-n
\g DEM2.ISG pearl-GEN1 tooth be-ATTR-DEF you-GEN1 son be-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 husband-SUPER.LAT finger-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB show-PST.UNW
\l And he is your son with the pearl tooth.", she said and pointed her finger to her husband.

\t Hemedur yiła kinaw raqru šebin esin.
\m hemedur yiła-a kinaw r-oq-ru šebin esi-n
\g so DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG entire IV-happen-PST.PRT thing tell-PST.UNW
\l So she told everything that had happened.

\t Q’orola radirun, habihander yizi didur keze baqrułäyn, elo žedudäy xizor bäk’irułäyn, esnaza boyx zawru rek’mołäyn - nasin šebin Beqes ʕUneyzatä esin.
\m q’orol-a r-odi-ru-n habihan-der yizi didur keze b-oq-ru-łay-n elo žedu-day xizor b-ik’i-ru-łay-n esyu-bi-a b-odi-x zow-ru rek’-łay-n - nasin šebin buq-s ʕUneyzat-a esi-n
\g widow-ERG IV-do-PST.PRT-and miller-APUD.LAT DEM2.IPL how meet I.PL-become-PST.PRT-CONT.ABL-and there DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ABL back I.PL-go-PST.PRT-CONT.ABL-and sister-PL-ERG III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT trick-CONT.ABL-and - all thing sun-GEN1 Uneyzat-ERG tell-PST.UNW
\l About what the widow did, and about how they met the miller, and about how they went back from there, and about the tricks that their sisters played - all these things Sun's Uneyzat told.

\t Yizi kecäsi yałzay, yizir ɣˤutkun di roys, yiziz ɣˤutkoxay, debez ɣˤutkoxor mesedyos ƛen di ersi.
\m yizi kec-asi yoł-zay yizi-r ɣˤutku-n di r-odi-s yizi-z ɣˤutku-xay mi-z ɣˤutku-xor mesed-s ƛe-n di er-s
\g DEM2.IPL sleep-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT house-and me IV-do-PST.WIT DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN2 house-AD.ABL you-GEN2 house-AD.LAT gold-GEN1 bridge-and me set.up-PST.WIT
\l "While they were asleep, I built a house for them, and I set up a golden bridge from their house to your house."

\t Xizyo xanä nesä nesider goƛ’in barus esnabin, nukarbin, ža q’orolayn.
\m xizyo xan-a nesi-a nesi-der goƛ’i-n baru-s esyu-bi-n nukar-bi-n ža q’orolay-n
\g afterwards khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT invite-PST.UNW wife-GEN1 sister-PL-and henchman-PL-and DEM1.SG widow-and
\l After that, the king invited to himself the wife's sisters, the henchmen and that widow.

\t Ža reɣeni xaličan, beɣeni magalun bäqiru nukar yołi xanä wazirłunno oyn, kidno yegirno nesix, barun žanon req’ezi boqno.
\m ža r-eɣe-ni xaliča-n b-eɣe-ni magalu-n b-iqi-ru nukar yołi xan-a wazir-łun-n odi-n kid-n y-egir-n nesi-x baru-n ža-n-n req’ezi b-oq-n
\g DEM1.SG IV-small-DEF mat-and III-small-DEF bread-and III-get-PST.PRT henchman however khan-ERG vizier-LHUN-TOP do-PFV.CVB daughter-TOP II-send-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS wife-and DEM1.SG-and-TOP come.to.terms I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The henchman who got the small mat and the small bread, however, the king made a vizier and married off his daughter to him, while he and his wife came to terms.

\t Xanno, barun q’ˤimes ɣˤutka bičin, mezarno kidberno ec’no ɣˤutku rodin, Beqez ʕUneyzatä radiruni ɣˤutka žan, xediwn bičin.
\m xan-n baru-n q’ˤim-s ɣˤutku-a b-iči-n meza-r-n kid-r-n ec’no ɣˤutku r-odi-n buq-z ʕUneyzat-a r-odi-ru-ni ɣˤutku-a ža-n xediw-n b-iči-n
\g khan-and wife-and oneself-GEN1 house-IN.ESS I.PL-live-PFV.CVB son~in~law-LAT-and daughter-LAT-and new house IV-do-PFV.CVB sun-GEN2 Uneyzat-ERG IV-do-PST.PRT-DEF house-IN.ESS DEM1.SG-and husband-and I.PL-live-PST.UNW
\l The king and his wife lived in their own house, for the son-in-law and the daughter they built a new house and in the house that Sun's Uneyzat built lived she herself and her husband.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder łˤoran haq’uzas bigu ʕumru boqno.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder łˤora-n haq’u-bi-s b-igu ʕumru b-oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after three.OBL-TOP family-PL-GEN1 III-pretty life III-become-PST.UNW
\l As of then, the three families' lives became pretty.

\t Nagaħ ħalikataw, žuka žek’u yołƛin teqnäy, ħukmatyołäy maħor nedugani oxirxo zown, bac’c’adaw mečoƛ’ qˤaba t’ank’i erxoƛin.
\m nagaħ ħalikataw žuka žek’u yoł-ƛin teq-näy ħukmat-łay maħor nedu-ga-ni oxir-x zow-n bac’c’adaw moči-ƛ’ qˤaba t’ank’i er-x-ƛin
\g suppose mean bad man be-QUOT hear-CND.CVB country-CONT.ABL outside such-ATTR-DEF chase-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB clean place-SUPER.ESS black stain set.up-PRS-QUOT
\l If you ever heard about a mean and bad man, such a person will be chased outside of that country because he makes a black stain on a clean place.

\t Zownƛax zown anuƛax sis xan.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis xan
\g be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG-QUOT one khan
\l Once upon a time there was a king.

\t Nesis zownƛax sistow sis uži.
\m nesi-s zow-n-ƛax sis-tow sis uži
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT one-EMPH one son
\l He had just one single son.

\t Nesiƛ’ cin Ismaʕilƛin zown.
\m nesi-ƛ’ ci-n Ismaʕil-ƛin zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS name-TOP Ismail-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His name was Ismail.

\t Žaq ʕaƛno ƛˤeb yayzay soder, idur own muʕalimno, xanä ža ʕilmuƛ’or oɣno.
\m uži-q ʕaƛno ƛˤeb y-ay-zay soder idu-r ow-n muʕalim-n xan-a ža ʕelmu-ƛ’or oɣ-n
\g son-POSS.ESS seven year II-come-SIM.CVB after home-LAT bring-PST.UNW teacher-TOP khan-ERG DEM1.SG science-SUPER.LAT spend.time-PST.UNW
\l When the son became seven years old, the king brought a teacher into his home and he spent time on science.

\t Muʕalimkin nesä maħor egirinč’iey, žaq darsi mołirxo ičirxo zown.
\m muʕalim-kin nesi-a maħor egir-č’i-ey uži-q darsi mołi-r-x ičir-x zow-n
\g teacher-even DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG outside let-NEG.FUT.CVB-DUB son-POSS.ESS lesson teach-CAUS-IPFV.CVB stop-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l He didn't even let the teacher go outside until he finished teaching lessons to his son.

\t Ismaʕilqo oc’ino biƛno ƛˤeb yaynosi, muʕalimä xanqo riyrno, ƛuza teł yołäsi reƛ täƛno nesirƛin.
\m Ismaʕil-q oc’ino biƛno ƛˤeb y-ay-nosi muʕalim-a xan-q r-iyr-n ƛuza teł yoł-asi reƛ teƛ-n nesi-r-ƛin
\g Ismail-POSS.ESS ten eight year II-come-ANT.CVB teacher-ERG khan-POSS.ESS IV-explain-PST.UNW bone inside be-RES.PRT meat give-PROHIB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT-QUOT
\l When Ismail became eighteen years old, the teacher explained to the king: "Do not give him meat that contains bones!"

\t Yisiq qu ƛˤeb yaynosi, riynč’ey reƛił ƛuza riqin.
\m yisi-q qu ƛˤeb y-ay-nosi r-iy-č’ey reƛ-ł ƛuza r-iqi-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS twenty year II-come-ANT.CVB IV-know-NEG.PST.CVB meat-CONT.ESS bone IV-get-PST.UNW
\l When he became twenty years old, he found bones in his meat.

\t Haqayn roɣno ža ƛuza Ismaʕila akiq karu šebinon rˤołun maħor roɣno rižirno.
\m haqu-ay-n r-oɣ-n ža ƛuza Ismaʕil-a aki-q kur-ru šebinon rˤołu-n maħor r-oɣ-n r-iži-r-n
\g mouth-IN.ABL-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG bone Ismail-ERG window-POSS.ESS throw-PST.PRT something drill-PFV.CVB outside IV-take.away-PFV.CVB IV-take.out-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l Ismail took that bone out of his mouth and threw it outside, where it bored itself through the window and everything.

\t Neła ƛuza radiru qˤodaza beqes rešambi c’oxno.
\m neła ƛuza-a r-odi-ru qˤod-aza buq-s reša-bi c’ox-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL bone-ERG IV-do-PST.PRT hole-IN.VERS.DIST sun-GEN1 ray-PL hit-PST.UNW
\l Through the hole that the bone had made, the sun's ray shined.

\t Yedu šebi nece bercinaw šebinƛin, yeda rešambi riqiranix c’oxno.
\m yedu šebi nece bercinaw šebin-ƛin yeda reša-bi r-iqir-ani-x c’ox-n
\g DEM2.IISG what so.much beautiful thing-QUOT DEM2.ISG ray-PL IV.PL-catch-MSD-AD.ESS hit-PST.UNW
\l "What beautiful thing is this?!", he tried to catch the rays.

\t Riqixa hudu yisiq beqes rešambi?
\m r-iqi-x-a hudu yisi-q buq-s reša-bi
\g IV.PL-get-PRS-Q so DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS sun-GEN1 ray-PL
\l How could he get the sunrays like this?

\t Xizyo haqar mužno bisno, kodin bitin Ismaʕil q’ˤidar ʕaƛ’un.
\m xizyo haqu-ar muž-n b-is-n kodi-n b-iti-n Ismaʕil q’ˤida-r ˤaƛ’u-n
\g afterwards mouth-IN.LAT foam-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB hair-TOP III-touch-PFV.CVB Ismail down-LAT fall-PST.UNW
\l Then foam came to his mouth, he touched his hair and fell down.

\t ƛ’irir žas muʕalim ayn.
\m ƛ’iri-r uži-s muʕalim ay-n
\g above-LAT son-GEN1 teacher come-PST.UNW
\l Suddenly the son's teacher came.

\t Nesä eƛin, šida meža žar teƛxozo reƛił ƛuza xecäƛin.
\m nesi-a eƛi-n šida mežu-a uži-r teƛ-xozo reƛ-ł ƛuza xeci-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW why you(I).PL.OBL-ERG son-LAT give-PRS.PRT.OBL meat-CONT.ESS bone leave-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l He said: "Why did you leave a bone in the meat that you gave your son?"

\t Xizyo xanä naysinän xabaryabin regirno, kaɣatyabin caxno doxturbi goƛ’in.
\m xizyo xan-a na-ay-si-nan xabar-bi-n r-egir-n kaɣat-bi-n cax-n doxtur-bi goƛ’i-n
\g afterwards khan-ERG where-IN.ABL-ATTR-INT story-PL-and III.PL-send-PFV.CVB letter-PL-and write-PFV.CVB doctor-PL invite-PST.UNW
\l After that, the king sent the news and wrote letters everywhere and invited doctors.

\t Nełƛ’osi yayn sida q’orolayä eƛin, ʕoƛira ɣudi uži meža sida ħala xec.
\m nełƛ’osi y-ay-n sida q’orolay-a eƛi-n ʕoƛira ɣudi uži mežu-a sida ħal-a xeci
\g of.that.time II-come-PFV.CVB one.OBL widow-ERG say-PST.UNW seven.OBL day boy you(I).PL.OBL-ERG one.OBL condition-IN.ESS leave
\l At that time came a widow and said: "Leave the boy alone for seven days!

\t Yisän sida kidbän ʕišq’us łin ħaƛun, yisis bašiqˤoy nełas bašiqor rayn, nełasgon Ismaʕilzo bašiqor raynƛin.
\m yisi-a-n sida kid-a-n ʕišq’u-s łi-n ħaƛu-n yisi-s bašiqˤoy neła-s baša-qor r-ay-n neła-s-gon Ismaʕil-z baša-qor r-ay-n-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-and one.OBL girl-ERG-and love-GEN1 water-TOP drink-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 ring DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 finger-POSS.LAT IV-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR Ismail-GEN2 finger-POSS.LAT IV-come-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l He and some girl drank a love potion, his ring came onto her finger, and hers came on Ismail's finger."

\t ʕOƛira ɣudƛ’aza Ismaʕilesno ričin, nesir darsi eranix muʕalimno ayn.
\m ʕoƛira ɣudi-ƛ’aza Ismaʕil-s-n r-iči-n nesi-r darsi er-ani-x muʕalim-n ay-n
\g seven.OBL day-SUPER.VERS.DIST Ismail-GEN1-TOP IV-live-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT lesson set.up-MSD-AD.ESS teacher-TOP come-PST.UNW
\l After seven days, Ismail got well, and the teacher came to teach him again.

\t ʕIšq’a halag adiru ʕoloqan žek’u darsimoƛ’orä reʕizi oqxo.
\m ʕišq’u-a halag odi-ru ʕoloqan žek’u darsi-ƛ’or-a reʕizi oq-x
\g love-ERG excite do-PST.PRT young man lesson-SUPER.LAT-Q have.no.time begin-PRS
\l The young man, being excited by love, how could he have time for lessons?!

\t Sis ħon xecin, q’ano ħon xecin, łˤono ħon xecin yeda q’ˤuya ħukmatyołxor ok’ełno.
\m sis ħon xeci-n q’ˤano ħon xeci-n łˤono ħon xeci-n yeda q’ˤuya ħukmat-łxor ok’eł-n
\g one mountain leave-PFV.CVB two mountain leave-PFV.CVB three mountain leave-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG other country-CONT.VERS go.away-PST.UNW
\l He left one mountain behind himself, left two mountains behind himself, left three mountains behind himself and came into another country.

\t Roƛiqur raynosi yeda sida ʕaƛarno ayn, adäza räsuru ɣˤutkaɣor ik’in.
\m roƛiqur r-ay-nosi yeda sida ʕaƛ-ar-n ay-n adäza r-esu-ru ɣˤutku-aɣor ik’i-n
\g at.midnight IV-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG one.OBL village-IN.LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB ahead IV-exist-PST.PRT house-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l At midnight he came into a village and went into the house that lay before him.

\t Tełxor oqnosi, elo yisir bercinaw, ozuri bic’äsi kid yesun.
\m teł-xor oq-nosi elo yisi-r bercinaw ozuri b-ic’-asi kid y-esu-n
\g inside-AD.LAT become-ANT.CVB there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT beautiful eye III-fill-RES.PRT girl II-find-PST.UNW
\l After he went inside, he found a girl with beautiful eyes there.

\t Ismaʕilä esirno, t’o sasaqor iča behizi aqäƛin.
\m Ismaʕil-a esir-n t’o sasaq-qor iči-a behizi oq-a-ƛin
