\g Ismail-ERG ask-PST.UNW here in.the.morning-POSS.LAT live-INF permit become-Q-QUOT
\l Ismail asked: "May I spend the night here?"

\t Aqƛin, eƛin roƛik’no žaƛer q’ˤurin teƛno, q’ˤida ičirno.
\m oq-ƛin eƛi-n r-oƛik’-n uži-ƛer q’ˤuri-n teƛ-n q’ˤida iči-r-n
\g become-QUOT say-PFV.CVB IV-let.appear-PFV.CVB boy-SUB.LAT chair-TOP give-PFV.CVB down sit-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l "You may." she said, produced a chair, put it under the boy and sat him down.

\t Kidbä žawab teƛno, dey eniwn anu, babiwn anu, ʕoƛno esiw yołƛin.
\m kid-a žawab teƛ-n di-s eniw-n anu babiw-n anu ʕoƛno esiw yoł-ƛin
\g girl-ERG answer give-PST.UNW me-GEN1 mother-and be.NEG father-and be.NEG seven brother be-QUOT
\l The girl answered: "I have neither mother nor father, [but] I have seven brothers."

\t Žedu na yołƛin esirnosi, sosi esa retinč’ey yičäsi zown, xizyogon esin, di yok’ek’anixƛin maduhalłiq yałru xanes ozno rayn, žeduƛ’ biħanadaƛin bik’äsi dey ʕoƛnon esiwƛin.
\m žedu na yoł-ƛin esir-nosi sosi esi-a r-eti-č’ey y-iči-asi zow-n xizyogon esi-n di y-ok’ek’-ani-x-ƛin maduhalłi-q yoł-ru xan-s oz-n r-ay-n žedu-ƛ’ b-iħanad-a-ƛin b-ik’i-asi di-s ʕoƛno-n esiw-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL where be-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB at.first tell-INF IV-want-NEG.PST.CVB II-be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB then tell-PST.UNW me II-steal-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT neighbourhood-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT khan-GEN1 army-TOP IV-come-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS III-fight-INF-QUOT I.PL-go-RES.PRT me-GEN1 seven-TOP brother-QUOT
\l When he asked: "Where are they?", she didn't want to tell it at first, but then she told: "A king's army of a neighbouring country came to steal me, and my seven brothers went to fight against them."

\t Elay izin ik’in bigtow manzil xecinosi, žedu esnabi biħanayx zawru mečoƛ’or ayn yeda.
\m ele-ay izi-n ik’i-n b-ig-tow manzil xeci-nosi žedu esyu-bi b-iħanad-x zow-ru moči-ƛ’or ay-n yeda
\g there-IN.ABL get.up-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB III-much-EMPH distance leave-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL brother-PL I.PL-fight-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT place-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG
\l He got up and went away, and when he left a great distance after himself, he came to the place where those brothers were fighting.

\t Ismaʕila pikru bodin, ʕoƛiran esnazar kumak bodinäy, dandir biħanayxozoz rok’ƛ’or ray, dice č’uħaraw žek’u yoł yedaƛin, žedurgon kumak bodinäy, esnazaz rok’ƛ’or ray, dice ħalikataw žek’u yeda yołƛin.
\m Ismaʕil-a pikru b-odi-n ʕoƛira-n esyu-bi-r kumak b-odi-näy dandir b-iħanad-xozo-zo rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay dice č’uħaraw žek’u yoł yeda-ƛin žedu-r-gon kumak b-odi-näy esyu-bi-z rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay dice ħalikataw žek’u yeda yoł-ƛin
\g Ismail-ERG idea III-do-PST.UNW seven.OBL-TOP brother-PL-LAT help III-do-CND.CVB towards I.PL-fight-PRS.PRT.OBL-ATTR.OBL heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come how.much proud man be DEM2.ISG-QUOT DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT-CNTR help III-do-CND.CVB brother-PL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come how.much mean man DEM2.ISG be-QUOT
\l Ismail thought: "If I help the seven brothers, the ones they are fighting will notice what a proud man I am, but if I help them instead, the brothers will notice, what a mean man I am."

\t Yisä ħukmu bodin, igorno ik’in salam teƛno bäsrur, di kumak bodanƛin.
\m yisi-a ħukmu b-odi-n igo-r-n ik’i-n salam teƛ-n b-is-ru-r di kumak b-odi-an-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG decision III-do-PST.UNW near-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB greeting give-PFV.CVB III-take-PST.PRT-LAT me help I.PL-do-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l He made a decision: "I will go into the vicinity and greet them, and I will help those who answer my greeting."

\t Yizi biħanayxozo mečoƛ’or ayn, yisä salam teƛnosi, ʕoƛiran esnaza yisis salam butirno, yiziƛ’ biħanada bayrut’anibi yołi täqinč’irus riłe royn bičin.
\m yizi b-iħanad-xozo moči-ƛ’or ay-n yisi-a salam teƛ-nosi ʕoƛira-n esyu-bi-a yisi-s salam b-utir-n yizi-ƛ’ b-iħanad-a b-ay-ru-t’a-ni-bi yołi teq-č’i-ru-s r-iłe r-odi-n b-iči-n
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL I.PL-fight-PRS.PRT.OBL place-SUPER.LAT come-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG greeting give-ANT.CVB seven.OBL-TOP brother-PL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 greeting III-give.back-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS I.PL-fight-INF I.PL-come-PST.PRT-DISTR-DEF-PL however hear-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT-GEN1 IV-as IV-do-PFV.CVB I.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l He went to the place where they were fighting, and when he greeted them, the seven brothers gave back the greeting, the ones they were fighting however pretended not to have heard anything.

\t Yizi esnazaqor Ismaʕilä eƛin, howži mežin xizoxno sisxoli di žedude dandir egirƛin.
\m yizi esyu-bi-qor Ismaʕil-a eƛi-n howži meži-n xizox-n sisxoli di žedu-de dandir egir-ƛin
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL brother-PL-POSS.LAT Ismail-ERG say-PST.UNW now you.PL-TOP withdraw-PFV.CVB alone me DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS towards let-QUOT
\l Ismail said to those brothers: "Now withdraw and let me go against them alone!"

\t Suƛƛi yeda Ismaʕil ozyoł łic’axrun, t’it’in bešerxotow bižix zown yisä xanes oz.
\m suƛƛi yeda Ismaʕil oz-ł łic’ax-run t’it’i-n b-eš-r-x-tow b-iži-x zow-n yisi-a xan-s oz
\g immediately DEM2.ISG Ismail army-CONT.ESS join-IMM.ANT.CVB fell-PFV.CVB I.PL-fall-CAUS-IPFV.CVB-EMPH I.PL-take.out-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG khan-GEN1 army
\l And immediately that Ismail joined that army and fell, cut down and took out the king's army.

\t Baq’ˤu xalq’i bexurxo bukaynosi, ƛäxuru boxin bik’in.
\m b-aq’ˤu xalq’i b-exur-x b-ukad-nosi ƛexu-ru b-oxi-n b-ik’i-n
\g III-much people III-kill-IPFV.CVB III-see-ANT.CVB remain-PST.PRT I.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l Having seen the many killed people, the remaining ones ran away.

\t Howži yizi esnaza ħukmu bodin, yisi užä elur kumak bodinč’us yołi, yiła ƛˤoreł eli beɣa zows, horo ela yisix elus esiy yegiranƛin.
\m howži yizi esyu-bi-a ħukmu b-odi-n yisi uži-a elu-r kumak b-odi-č’u-si yołi yiła ƛˤori-ł eli b-eɣu-a zow-s horo elu-a yisi-x elu-s esyu y-egir-an-ƛin
\g now DEM2.IPL.OBL brother-PL-ERG decision III-do-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-ERG we(I).OBL-LAT help III-do-NEG.PST.WIT-ATTR if DEM2.IISG.OBL war-CONT.ESS we I.PL-be.defeated-INF be.NPRS-PST.WIT come.IMPR we(I).OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS we(I).OBL-GEN1 sister II-send-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Now those brothers came to a decision: "If that boy hadn't helped us, we would have been defeated in that war; so come, let's marry off our sister to him!"

\t Eženi esiya eƛin Ismaʕilqor, mi č’uħizi oqinč’inäy, debex ela elus esiw yegiranƛin yoł eli.
\m eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n Ismaʕil-qor mi č’uħizi oq-č’i-näy mi-x elu-a elu-s esiw y-egir-an-ƛin yoł eli
\g old-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW Ismail-POSS.LAT you be.proud become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB you-AD.ESS we(I).OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-GEN1 sister II-send-FUT.DEF-QUOT be we
\l The oldest brother said: "If you are not too proud(?), we will marry off our sister to you."

\t Behizi raqƛin, razi oqno yeda.
\m behizi r-oq-ƛin razi oq-n yeda
\g permit IV-become-QUOT agree become-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG
\l "I permit it.", he agreed.

\t Howlay bik’in idur baynosi, bertenno bodin, esnaza žeda žedus esiw Ismaʕilxo yegirno.
\m howlay b-ik’i-n idu-r b-ay-nosi berten-n b-odi-n esyu-bi-a žedu-a žedu-s esiw Ismaʕil-x y-egir-n
\g from.there I.PL-go-PFV.CVB home-LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB brother-PL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 sister Ismail-AD.ESS II-send-PST.UNW
\l From there they went home and arranged the marriage and the brothers married off their own sister to Ismail.

\t Neširu sadaq kecnosi, Ismaʕilä baħarayłno, nesä nesiłno roƛƛo bˤałäyn eqerno, debi ged ent’aɣor yaynäy, debi di meč’ beč’a yołƛin riyrno.
\m neširu sadaq kec-nosi Ismaʕil-a baħaray-ł-n nesi-a nesi-ł-n r-oƛƛo bˤałay-n eqer-n mi-s ged ent’a-aɣor y-ay-näy mi-s di meč’ b-eč’-a yoł-ƛin r-iyr-n
\g at.night together sleep-ANT.CVB Ismail-ERG fiancée-CONT.ESS-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-and IV-middle dagger-TOP put-PFV.CVB you-GEN1 shirt here-IN.VERS II-come-CND.CVB you-GEN1 me neck III-cut-INF be-QUOT IV-explain-PST.UNW
\l At night, when they were sleeping together, Ismail put a dagger inbetween his bride and himself: "If your shirt comes onto my side, I will cut your neck!", he explained.

\t Šidaƛin, esirno neła.
\m šida-ƛin esir-n neła-a
\g why-QUOT ask-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG
\l "Why?", she asked.

\t Ismaʕilä eƛin, där moƛał yukayru kid yiqizaƛ’or, di ɣˤanazaq reƛ’a atixosi anuƛin.
\m Ismaʕil-a eƛi-n di-r moƛu-ł y-ukad-ru kid y-iqi-zaƛ’or di ɣˤanabi-q reƛ’a iti-xosi anu-ƛin
\g Ismail-ERG say-PST.UNW me-LAT dream-CONT.ESS II-see-PST.PRT girl II-get-POST.CVB me woman-POSS.ESS hand touch-PRS.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l Ismail said: "Until I get the girl that I saw in my dream, I will not lay hand on any woman."

\t Ža kidno esnazade xecin, yaraɣno ħiroq caƛin, guluƛ’no zown Ismaʕil oqno ik’in sida ʕaƛar ayn.
\m ža kid-n esyu-bi-de xeci-n yaraɣ-n ħiro-q caƛi-n gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n Ismaʕil oq-n ik’i-n sida ʕaƛ-ar ay-n
\g DEM1.SG girl-TOP brother-PL-APUD.ESS leave-PFV.CVB weapon-TOP shoulder-POSS.ESS throw-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB Ismail become-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB one.OBL village-IN.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Ismail left that girl with her brothers, threw his weapon over his shoulder, mounted his horse, rode off and came to a village.

\t Elo sida azbarya teł yisir žek’u esun, ixiw ƛoħon c’idoƛ’ erno, simildi raħirxo.
\m elo sida azbar-a teł yisi-r žek’u esu-n ixiw ƛoħo-n c’i-ƛ’ er-n simildi r-aħi-r-x
\g there one.OBL palace-IN.ESS inside DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT man find-PFV.CVB big pan-TOP fire-SUPER.ESS put-PFV.CVB maize IV-cook-CAUS-IPFV.CVB
\l There, inside a palace, he found a man who put a big pan onto the fire and cooked corn.

\t Igtow mekoyx oqzaƛ’, guluƛ’ay q’ˤidarno oqno, ƛoħayn roɣno, Ismaʕilä ax roqace simildi rac’no.
\m ig-tow mekod-x oq-zaƛ’ gulu-ƛ’ay q’ˤida-r-n oq-n ƛoħo-ay-n r-oɣ-n Ismaʕil-a ax r-oq-ace simildi r-ac’-n
\g very-EMPH be.hungry-IPFV.CVB become-CSL.CVB horse-SUPER.ABL down-LAT-TOP become-PFV.CVB pan-IN.ABL-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB Ismail-ERG belly IV-become-TERM maize IV-eat-PST.UNW
\l Because he became very hungry, Ismail got down of his horse, took a corncob out of the pan and ate his fill.

\t Sida zamanaƛ’aza ʕArabuzanƛin eƛixosi ɣˤanabi yayn, didiw žek’a ža dey simildi rac’xoƛin.
\m sida zaman-ƛ’aza ʕArabuzan-ƛin eƛi-xosi ɣˤanabi y-ay-n didiw žek’u-a ža di-s simildi r-ac’-x-ƛin
\g one.OBL time-SUPER.VERS.DIST Arabuzan-QUOT say-PRS.PRT woman II-come-PST.UNW which man-ERG DEM1.SG me-GEN1 maize IV-eat-PRS-QUOT
\l After some time, a woman named Arabuzan came: "What man is eating my corn?!"

\t Di iłeni žek’a rac’xoƛin, et’un k’oƛin žawab teƛno Ismaʕilä nełar.
\m di iłe-ni žek’u-a r-ac’-x-ƛin et’u-n k’oƛi-n žawab teƛ-n Ismaʕil-a neła-r
\g me as-DEF man-ERG IV-eat-PRS-QUOT jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB answer give-PST.UNW Ismail-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT
\l "A man like me is eating it!", Ismail answered and jumped toward her.

\t Alay-bulayƛin eƛixozo guluqorno qˤaƛin, ʕoƛira putce yoq’ˤiw kedonno yisno, ža Ismaʕilƛ’or yoqno.
\m Alay~bulay-ƛin eƛi-xozo gulu-qor-n qˤaƛi-n ʕoƛira put-ce y-oq’ˤiw kedon-n y-is-n ža Ismaʕil-ƛ’or y-oq-n
\g Alay~bulay-QUOT say-PRS.PRT.OBL horse-POSS.LAT-TOP shout-PFV.CVB seven.OBL pood-EQU1 II-heavy sledgehammer-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG Ismail-SUPER.LAT II-become-PST.UNW
\l She shouted after her horse names Alay-bulay, took a 7-pood heavy sledgehammer and went to Ismail.

\t Biƛira putcegon kedonno yisno, yedan et’un guluƛ’or k’oƛin.
\m biƛira put-ce-gon kedon-n y-is-n yeda-n et’u-n gulu-ƛ’or k’oƛi-n
\g eight.OBL pood-EQU1-CNTR sledgehammer-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG-TOP jump-PFV.CVB horse-SUPER.LAT jump-PST.UNW
\l He also took a sledgehammer of 8 pood and jumped onto his horse.

\t Q’ˤanon kedonyabi sida sidqo rak’ruz ruk’yo, kodin bitin łaymoƛ’äyn bik’in Ismaʕilno, ʕArabuzanno guluƛ’ay bˤoƛ’un.
\m q’ˤano-n kedon-bi sida sida-q r-ok’-ru-zo ruk’ kodi-n b-iti-n łay-ƛ’ay-n b-ik’i-n Ismaʕil-n ʕArabuzan-n gulu-ƛ’ay b-ˤoƛ’u-n
\g two-TOP sledgehammer-PL one.OBL one.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-hit-PST.PRT-ATTR.OBL roar hair-TOP III-touch-PFV.CVB mind-SUPER.ABL-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB Ismail-and Arabuzan-and horse-SUPER.ABL I.PL-fall-PST.UNW
\l From the roar of hitting the two sledgehammers against one another, both Ismail and Arabuzan fainted, lost consciousness and fell of their horses.

\t Łaymoƛ’or aynosi, Ismaʕil nełde puħor k’oƛin.
\m łay-ƛ’or ay-nosi Ismaʕil neła-de pu-xor k’oƛi-n
\g mind-SUPER.LAT come-ANT.CVB Ismail DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS side-AD.LAT run-PST.UNW
\l When Ismail came to, he run to her side.

\t Ungotow mi č’agu yołäƛin, esirno ʕArabuzanä yisiq, igor aynosi.
\m ungo-tow mi č’agu yoł-a-ƛin esir-n ʕArabuzan-a yisi-q igo-r ay-nosi
\g really-EMPH you alive be-Q-QUOT ask-PST.UNW Arabuzan-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS near-LAT come-ANT.CVB
\l "Are you really alive?", asked him Arabuzan, when he came close.

\t Min ƛexuna yexunč’eyƛin, Ismaʕila nełaqno esirno, č’agu yesunäy, yowan mi diƛin.
\m mi-n ƛexu-n-a y-exu-č’ey-ƛin Ismaʕil-a neła-q-n esir-n č’agu y-esu-näy y-ow-an mi di-ƛin
\g you-and remain-PST.UNW-Q II-die-NEG.PST.CVB-QUOT Ismail-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-and ask-PST.UNW alive II-exist-CND.CVB II-marry-FUT.DEF you me-QUOT
\l "And did you survive too, without dying?", Ismail asked her as well, "If you're alive, then I will marry you."

\t Behizi raqƛin, roži nełan teƛno.
\m behizi r-oq-ƛin roži neła-a-n teƛ-n
\g permit IV-become-QUOT word DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-TOP give-PST.UNW
\l "I permit it.", she gave her word.

\t Dibirno goƛ’in, nuʕbin bayrno, neła quł neširutown Ismaʕilä ʕArabuzan yown.
\m dibir-n goƛ’i-n nuʕ-bi-n b-ay-r-n neła qu-ł neširu-tow-n Ismaʕil-a ʕArabuzan y-ow-n
\g mullah-and call-PFV.CVB witness-PL-and I.PL-come-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS evening-EMPH-TOP Ismail-ERG Arabuzan II-marry-PST.UNW
\l They called the mullah, let witnesses come and on that very day in the same evening, Ismail married Arabuzan.

\t Neširu mežaɣor bizinosi, Ismaʕila q’ˤunełno roƛƛo bˤałayn erno eƛin nełqor, howłaq ged yitirłi debi meč’, dey bˤałayƛin.
\m neširu muži-aɣor b-izi-nosi Ismaʕil-a q’ˤuna-ł-n r-oƛƛo bˤałay-n er-n eƛi-n neła-qor howła-q ged y-itir-łi mi-s meč’ di-s bˤałay-ƛin
\g evening mattress-IN.VERS I.PL-get-ANT.CVB Ismail-ERG two.OBL-CONT.ESS-TOP IV-middle dagger-TOP put-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT DEM3.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS shirt II-touch-CND.CVB.IRR you-GEN1 neck me-GEN1 dagger-QUOT
\l In the evening, when they got onto the bed, Ismail put a dagger in the middle between the two and said to her: "If your shirt touches it, so will my dagger [touch] your neck."

\t Nedur mi eƛanix ʕilla šebiƛin, ʕArabuzanä esirnosi, yisä eƛin, där moƛał yukayru kid yiqizaƛ’or di ɣˤanazaq reƛ’a atixosi anuƛin.
\m nedur mi eƛi-ani-x ʕilla šebi-ƛin ʕArabuzan-a esir-nosi yisi-a eƛi-n di-r moƛu-ł y-ukad-ru kid y-iqi-zaƛ’or di ɣˤanabi-q reƛ’a iti-xosi anu-ƛin
\g so you say-MSD-AD.ESS reason what-QUOT Arabuzan-ERG ask-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me-LAT dream-CONT.ESS II-see-PST.PRT girl II-get-POST.CVB me woman-POSS.ESS hand touch-PRS.PRT be.NEG-QUOT
\l When Arabuzan asked: "So what is your reason to say that?", he said: "Before I get the girl that I saw in my dreams, I will not lay my hand on a woman."

\t Sasaq qˤašinosi, Ismaʕil hunixor oqanix ħadur oqxo ukaynosi, ʕArabuzanä gulu bˤaƛoyn, din dowde sadaq yik’ixƛin.
\m sasaq qˤaši-nosi Ismaʕil huni-xor oq-ani-x ħadur oq-x ukad-nosi ʕArabuzan-a gulu b-ˤaƛod-n di-n mi-de sadaq y-ik’i-x-ƛin
\g in.the.morning get.up-ANT.CVB Ismail way-AD.LAT become-MSD-AD.ESS prepare become-IPFV.CVB see-ANT.CVB Arabuzan-ERG horse III-harness-PFV.CVB me-and you-APUD.ESS together II-go-PRS-QUOT
\l After she got up in the morning and saw that Ismail was preparing to get on his way, Arabuzan harnessed her horse: "I am going with you."

\t Guluzaƛ’ zown žedu bik’iƛ’oräy, yizi q’ˤuya ħukmatyołer bayn.
\m gulu-bi-ƛ’ zow-n žedu b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy yizi q’ˤuya ħukmat-łer b-ay-n
\g horse-PL-SUPER.ESS ride-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL I.PL-go-SIM.CVB DEM2.IPL other country-CONT.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l While they rode on their horses, they came to another country.

\t ʕUraw zaman bik’inosi yizi sidaɣ šaharyar bayn.
\m ʕuraw zaman b-ik’i-nosi yizi sidaɣ šahar-ar b-ay-n
\g much time III-go-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL in.one.place city-IN.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l Much time passed by and they came to a city somewhere.

\t Elo adäz räsuru ɣˤutkoxorno bik’in ac deqƛirnosi, tełäzay yeže ɣˤanabi yoƛixno.
\m elo adäz r-esu-ru ɣˤutku-xor-n b-ik’i-n ac deqƛi-r-nosi teł-azay y-eže ɣˤanabi y-oƛix-n
\g there ahead IV-find-PST.PRT house-AD.LAT-TOP I.PL-go-PFV.CVB door knock-CAUS-ANT.CVB inside-IN.ABL.DIST II-old woman II-appear-PST.UNW
\l There they went to the house that was just ahead, and after they knocked at the door, an old woman appeared from the inside.

\t Sasaqor biča moči yołäƛin, esirnosi, neła eƛin, sasaqor biča močiƛa yoł, mežuƛ waħħo kuranix muži anuƛin.
\m sasaq-qor b-iči-a moči yoł-a-ƛin esir-nosi neła-a eƛi-n sasaq-qor b-iči-a moči-ƛa yoł mežu-ƛ waħo-x kur-ani-x muži anu-ƛin
\g tomorrow-POSS.LAT I.PL-live-INF place be-Q-QUOT ask-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW tomorrow-POSS.LAT I.PL-live-INF place-INDEF be you(I).PL.OBL-SUB.ESS below-AD.ESS spread.out-MSD-AD.ESS mattress be.NEG-QUOT
\l When they asked: "Is there a place [for us] to stay until tomorrow?", she said: "There is some place to stay until tomorrow, but there is no mattress to spread out under you."

\t Xizyo ʕArabuzanä qot ric’no micxir teƛno nełaqor enłaƛ elur retixosi šebin risoƛin.
\m xizyo ʕArabuzan-a qot r-ic’-n micxir teƛ-n neła-qor enła-ƛ elu-r r-eti-xosi šebin r-is-o-ƛin
\g afterwards Arabuzan-ERG handfull IV-fill-PFV.CVB money give-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT DEM3b.IISG.OBL-SUB.ESS we(I).OBL-LAT IV-want-PRS.PRT thing IV-buy-IMPR-QUOT
\l Then Arabuzan gave her a handfull of money: "Buy the things we want with it!"

\t Yizin yik’in yeženä risno mužibin, bišanin, guluzar bixno rayrno yayn.
\m y-izi-n y-ik’i-n y-eže-ni-a r-is-n muži-bi-n b-iš-a-ni-n gulu-bi-r bix-n r-ayr-n y-ay-n
\g II-get.up-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB II-old-DEF-ERG III.PL-buy-PFV.CVB mattress-PL-and III-eat-INF-DEF-and horse-PL-LAT hay-and III.PL-bring-PFV.CVB II-come-PST.UNW
\l The old one got up and went away, bought and brought a mattress, something to eat and hay for the horses.

\t Hemedur yizi elo sasaqor bičin.
\m hemedur yizi elo sasaq-qor b-iči-n
\g so DEM2.IPL there in.the.morning-POSS.LAT I.PL-live-PST.UNW
\l So they stayed there until the morning.

\t Way, dey užiƛin, eƛin yeženä, eluz xanez kidbes anƛ’imasi berten boyx, nesi baħarawx di yik’ixanuƛin yedu yičäsi.
\m way di-s uži-ƛin eƛi-n y-eže-ni-a elu-z xan-z kid-s anƛ’i-a-si berten b-odi-x nesi baħaraw-x di y-ik’i-x-anu-ƛin yedu y-iči-asi
\g o.dear me-GEN1 son-QUOT say-PST.UNW II-old-DEF-ERG we(I).OBL-GEN2 khan-GEN2 daughter-GEN1 week-IN.ESS-ATTR marriage III-do-IPFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL fiancé-AD.ESS me II-go-PRS-NEG-QUOT DEM2.IISG II-be-RES.PRT
\l "Oh my son!", said the old woman, "They're celebrating our king's daughter's marriage the whole week, she was like: 'I won't go to that fiancé!'."

\t Ismaʕilä bašiqay roɣno bašiqˤoy teƛno yeženiqor, enda xanez kidbeqor teƛa bažarizi raqä debeqƛin.
\m Ismaʕil-a baša-qay r-oɣ-n bašiqˤoy teƛ-n y-eže-ni-qor enda xan-z kid-qor teƛ-a bažarizi r-oq-a mi-q-ƛin
\g Ismail-ERG finger-POSS.ABL IV-take.away-PFV.CVB ring give-PFV.CVB II-old-DEF-POSS.LAT DEM3b.SG khan-GEN2 daughter-POSS.LAT give-INF able IV-become-Q you-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l Ismail took a ring from his finger and gave it to the old woman: "Could you give it to the king's daughter?"

\t Bažarizi raq, šida däq roqxanuƛin, yeženä bašiqˤoyn risno yizin xanzo madazaxaɣor yik’in.
\m bažarizi r-oq šida di-q r-oq-x-anu-ƛin y-eže-ni-a bašiqˤoy-n r-is-n y-izi-n xan-z ma-bi-xaɣor y-ik’i-n
\g able IV-become why me-POSS.ESS IV-become-PRS-NEG-QUOT II-old-DEF-ERG ring-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB II-get.up-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 yard-PL-AD.VERS II-go-PST.UNW
\l "I can, why not?", the old woman took the ring, got up and went to the king's yards.

\t Nukarä ža tełxor yegirinč’ey yičiräsi zown.
\m nukar-a ža teł-xor y-egir-č’ey y-ičir-asi zow-n
\g henchman-ERG DEM1.SG inside-AD.LAT II-let-NEG.PST.CVB II-restrain-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The henchmen were not letting her get inside.

\t Xanez kidbes eniw yoł di, där ža xedyox yik’izaƛ’or yukada retinƛin, yiła ader xot’o boɣno.
\m xan-z kid-s eniw yoł di di-r ža xediw-x y-ik’i-zaƛ’or y-ukad-a r-eti-n-ƛin yiła-a ader xot’o b-oɣ-n
\g khan-GEN2 daughter-GEN1 mother be me me-LAT DEM1.SG husband-AD.ESS II-go-POST.CVB II-see-INF IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG forward foot III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l "I am the king's daughter's mother, I wanted to see her before she'd go to that husband.", and she put her foot forward.

\t Yizis xabar xanez kidberno teqno, yedu maħor yoƛixno, didiw ža dey eniw yiča yayxƛin, kid maħor yoqno.
\m yizi-s xabar xan-z kid-r-n teq-n yedu maħor y-oƛix-n didiw ža di-s eniw y-iči-a y-ay-x-ƛin kid maħor y-oq-n
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 story khan-GEN2 daughter-LAT-TOP hear-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG outside II-appear-PST.UNW which DEM1.SG me-GEN1 mother II-be-INF II-come-PRS-QUOT girl outside II-become-PST.UNW
\l This story was overheard by the king's daughter, who appeared outside: "Which one is my mother?!", the girl went outside.

\t Yedu yukayrun, yeženä bašiqˤoy erali reƛ’a nełar rukadałxor soder rizirno.
\m yedu y-ukad-run y-eže-ni-a bašiqˤoy er-ali reƛ’a neła-r r-ukad-a-łxor soder r-izir-n
\g DEM2.IISG II-see-IMM.ANT.CVB II-old-DEF-ERG ring put-ATTR hand DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT IV-see-INF-CONT.VERS after IV-lift-PST.UNW
\l After she saw her, the old woman lifted the hand with the ring put inside, so she could see it.

\t Ozuri c’axrun kidber riyn ža nełas bašiqˤoy yałrułi.
\m ozuri c’ox-run kid-r r-iy-n ža neła-s bašiqˤoy yoł-rułi
\g eye hit-IMM.ANT.CVB girl-LAT IV-know-PST.UNW DEM1.SG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 ring be-MSD
\l When the girl saw it, she immediately knew that it was her ring.

\t Dey eniw yoł ža yegir tełxorƛin, kidbä nukarqor eƛin.
\m di-s eniw yoł ža y-egir teł-xor-ƛin kid-a nukar-qor eƛi-n
\g me-GEN1 mother be DEM1.SG II-let inside-AD.LAT-QUOT girl-ERG henchman-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l "It is my mother, let her inside!", said the girl to the henchmen.

\t Howži kidbä esirno, na ža uži yoł, didiw žek’u ža yołƛin.
\m howži kid-a esir-n na ža uži yoł didiw žek’u ža yoł-ƛin
\g now girl-ERG ask-PST.UNW where DEM1.SG boy be which man DEM1.SG be-QUOT
\l Now the girl asked: "Where is this boy? What kind of man is he?"

\t Xizyo neła eƛin, sasaqosigon ɣudi ƛexasi berten łiya.
\m xizyo neła-a eƛi-n sasaqosi-gon ɣudi ƛexu-asi berten łiy-a
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW in.the.morning-CNTR day remain-RES.PRT marriage end-INF
\l Then she said: "One a day remains for the marriage to end."

\t Kidbazade sadaq di baɣmaɣor yoqan yaħna-yik’anix, elay di yok’ek’anix nesis hunar ʕeze boqnäy, nesis murad t’ubazi baqƛin.
\m kid-bi-de sadaq di baɣ-ɣor y-oq-an y-aħna~ik’i-ani-x ele-ay di y-ok’ek’-ani-x nesi-s hunar ʕeze b-oq-näy nesi-s murad t’ubazi b-oq-ƛin
\g girl-PL-APUD.ESS together me garden-IN.ALL II-become-FUT.DEF II-walk.for.a.while-MSD-AD.ESS there-IN.ABL me II-steal-MSD-AD.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 talent be.enough III-become-CND.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 wish fulfill III-become-QUOT
\l "I will go out into the garden together with the girls to take a walk, if his talent is enough to steal me from there, his wish will be fulfilled."

\t Yeženir barkalan bodin, yizi keca bik’in.
\m y-eže-ni-r barkala-n b-odi-n yizi kec-a b-ik’i-n
\g II-old-DEF-LAT thank-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL sleep-INF I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l He thanked the old woman and they went to sleep.

\t Sasaq qaħłi begirnosi, Ismaʕilän, ʕArabuzanän gulubin rˤaƛoyn, ħadur boqno bičin.
\m sasaq qaħłi b-egir-nosi Ismaʕil-a-n ʕArabuzan-a-n gulu-bi-n r-ˤaƛod-n ħadur b-oq-n b-iči-n
\g in.the.morning dawn III-send-ANT.CVB Ismail-ERG-and Arabuzan-ERG-and horse-PL-TOP III.PL-harness-PFV.CVB prepare I.PL-become-PFV.CVB I.PL-be-PST.UNW
\l The next day, after the sun rose, Ismail and Arabuzan harnessed the horses and got prepared.

\t Xanes kid c’unzi yodanix sis oz bayn, xizay biłetow sisgon bayn.
\m xan-s kid c’unzi y-odi-ani-x sis oz b-ay-n xizay b-iłe-tow sis-gon b-ay-n
\g khan-GEN1 daughter guard II-do-MSD-AD.ESS one army I.PL-come-PFV.CVB from.behind I.PL-as-EMPH one-CNTR I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l In order to protect the king's daughter, an army came, and behind it another similar army came.

\t Sida zamanaƛ’aza, kidbazade sadaq xanes kid baɣmaɣor yoqno.
\m sida zaman-ƛ’aza kid-bi-de sadaq xan-s kid baɣ-ɣor y-oq-n
\g one.OBL time-SUPER.VERS.DIST girl-PL-APUD.ESS with khan-GEN1 girl garden-IN.ALL II-become-PST.UNW
\l nan

\t Nasi yołƛin, išara bodin esirno ʕArabuzanä.
\m nasi yoł-ƛin išara b-odi-n esir-n ʕArabuzan-a
\g which be-QUOT signal III-do-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW Arabuzan-ERG
\l "Which one is she?", signaled and asked Arabuzan.

\t Yoƛosini, hič’č’an bercinawni xanes kid yołƛin, yukarno Ismaʕilä.
\m y-oƛƛo-si-ni hič’č’a-n bercinaw-ni xan-s kid yoł-ƛin y-ukar-n Ismaʕil-a
\g II-middle-ATTR-DEF the.most-TOP beautiful-DEF khan-GEN1 daughter be-QUOT II-show-PST.UNW Ismail-ERG
\l "The middle one, the most beautiful daughter of the king.", Ismail showed here.

\t Hemeła zamanał, łaci yiłe yaƛˤo neładerno yik’in, ʕArabuzanä xanes kid yown Ismaʕilzo guluƛ’ caƛin.
\m hemeła zaman-ł łaci y-iłe y-ˤaƛo neła-der-n y-ik’i-n ʕArabuzan-a xan-s kid y-ow-n Ismaʕil-z gulu-ƛ’ caƛi-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL time-CONT.ESS wind II-as II-quickly DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB Arabuzan-ERG khan-GEN1 daughter II-bring-PFV.CVB Ismail-GEN2 horse-SUPER.ESS throw-PST.UNW
\l In that moment, Arabuzan went to him quickly as the wind and brought the king's daughter and threw it onto Ismail's horse.

\t Howži mi ader ik’iƛin eƛin, yedu ozyoƛ’ yiħanada yoqno.
\m howži mi ader ik’i-ƛin eƛi-n yedu oz-ƛ’ y-iħanad-a y-oq-n
\g now you forward go-QUOT say-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG army-SUPER.ESS II-fight-INF II-begin-PST.UNW
\l "Now go forward!", she said and began to fight the army.

\t Bešerxotow bižix zown neła xanes oz, xizaɣor ƛäxurubi boxin bok’ełno.
\m b-eš-r-x-tow b-iži-x zow-n neła xan-s oz xizaɣor ƛexu-ru-bi b-oxi-n b-ok’eł-n
\g I.PL-fall-CAUS-IPFV.CVB-EMPH I.PL-take.out-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL khan-GEN1 army finally remain-PST.PRT-PL I.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB I.PL-escape-PST.UNW
\l She took out and brought to fall that king's armies, and finally the remaining ones fled.

\t Yoqno yik’isƛax xizyo ʕArabuzan Ismaʕilełno, xanez kidbełno xizay.
\m y-oq-n y-ik’i-s-ƛax xizyo ʕArabuzan Ismaʕil-ł-n xan-z kid-ł-n xizay
\g II-become-PST.UNW II-go-PST.WIT-QUOT afterwards Arabuzan Ismail-CONT.ESS-and khan-GEN2 daughter-CONT.ESS-and behind
\l And afterwards Arabuzan came behind Ismail and the king's daughter.

\t Sida ɣunoz ɣeduƛ kecäsi besun yiłar yizi.
\m sida ɣun-z ɣedu-ƛ kec-asi b-esu-n yiła-r yizi
\g one.OBL tree-GEN2 shade-SUB.ESS sleep-RES.PRT I.PL-find-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT DEM2.IPL
\l She found them sleeping in the shade of a tree.

\t ʕArabuzanä yizi moƛaxayn č’arik’no yiła yiłaz ɣˤutkaɣor bižin.
\m ʕArabuzan-a yizi moƛu-xay-n č’arik’-n yiła-a yiła-z ɣˤutku-aɣor b-iži-n
\g Arabuzan-ERG DEM2.IPL sleep-AD.ABL-TOP wake.up-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN2 house-IN.VERS I.PL-lead-PST.UNW
\l Arabuzan woke them up and led them to her home.

\t Sasaqosigon yizi ʕoƛnon esiw yałruni kidbedäɣor bizin bik’in, sadaq žan yižanix.
\m sasaqosi-gon yizi ʕoƛno-n esiw yoł-ru-ni kid-däɣor b-izi-n b-ik’i-n sadaq ža-n y-iži-ani-x
\g in.the.morning-CNTR DEM2.IPL seven-TOP brother be-PST.PRT-DEF girl-APUD.VERS I.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PST.UNW together DEM1.SG-TOP II-lead-MSD-AD.ESS
\l The next morning, they set out and went to the girl who had the seven brothers to take her with them.

\t Howži Ismaʕil ezunč’ey ʕaƛaɣor ik’in nesä nesis łonon barubin rižin.
\m howži Ismaʕil ezu-č’ey ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-n nesi-a nesi-s łˤono-n baru-bi-n r-iži-n
\g now Ismail look-NEG.PST.CVB village-IN.VERS go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 three-TOP wife-PL-TOP II.PL-lead-PST.UNW
\l Now Ismail went into the village without looking and took his three wives with him.

\t Žedu barubi Ismaʕilä babiwder rižinč’ey, qalamä teł ruqˤno xecin.
\m žedu baru-bi Ismaʕil-a babiw-der r-iži-č’ey qala-a teł r-uqˤi-n xeci-n
\g DEM1.IIPL wife-PL Ismail-ERG father-APUD.LAT II.PL-lead-NEG.PST.CVB fortress-IN.ESS inside II.PL-hide-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW
\l These wives Ismail didn't lead to his father, but left them hidden inside a fortress.

\t Hemełƛ’o sida nukarer qalamä teł xanez užä ruqˤno zawruni barubi rukayn.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ sida nukar-r qala-a teł xan-z uži-a r-uqˤi-n zow-ru-ni baru-bi r-ukad-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS one.OBL henchman-LAT fortress-IN.ESS inside khan-GEN2 boy-ERG II.PL-hide-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF wife-PL II.PL-see-PST.UNW
\l Then one henchman saw the wives that the king's son had hidden inside the fortress.

\t Nexno nesä xanqor eƛin, migon xanä yoł, xan oqxo debi uži, rown qalamä teł nesä raqˤru baruzaƛ’ eza ik’iƛin.
\m nex-n nesi-a xan-qor eƛi-n mi-gon xan-a yoł xan oq-x mi-s uži r-ow-n qala-a teł nesi-a r-uqˤeł-ru baru-bi-ƛ’ ezu-a ik’i-ƛin
\g come-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG khan-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you-CNTR khan-Q be khan become-IPFV.CVB you-GEN1 son II.PL-bring-PFV.CVB fortress-IN.ESS inside DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG II.PL-hide-PST.PRT wife-PL-SUPER.ESS look-INF go-QUOT
\l He came to the king and said: "Aren't you the king? Your son is going to become the king; go to look at the wives that he brought and hid in the fortress!"

\t Xanes zer rok’u regin, žoyä däqay xanłi raɣƛin.
\m xan-s zer rok’u r-egi-n uži-a di-qay xanłi r-oɣ-ƛin
\g khan-GEN1 shuddering heart IV-go.through-PST.UNW son-ERG me-POSS.ABL khanship IV-take.away-QUOT
\l Shuddering went through the king's heart: "My son is going to take away my throne?"

\t Yisä ħukmu boyx sistow sis yałru uži exuranixƛin.
\m yisi-a ħukmu b-odi-x sis-tow sis yoł-ru uži exur-ani-x-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG decision III-do-PRS one-EMPH one be-PST.PRT son kill-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l He made the decision to kill his one and only son.

\t Rigu bišan rodin, sida quł neširu babiya Ismaʕil iduɣor goƛ’in.
\m r-igu bišʷa-n r-odi-n sida qu-ł neširu babiw-a Ismaʕil idu-ɣor goƛ’i-n
\g IV-good food-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB one.OBL day-CONT.ESS evening father-ERG Ismail home-IN.ALL invite-PST.UNW
\l The father prepared good food and one day in the evening he invited Ismail into his house.

\t ʕArabuzanä nesiqor eƛin, babiwz rok’ƛ’o yoł deber ħilla bodanix, gaƛ’izar ik’inč’ey ičanixgon resno anuƛin.
\m ʕArabuzan-a nesi-qor eƛi-n babiw-z rok’u-ƛ’ yoł mi-r ħilla b-odi-ani-x goƛ’i-za-r ik’i-č’ey iči-ani-x-gon res-n anu-ƛin
\g Arabuzan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW father-GEN2 heart-SUPER.ESS be you-LAT trickery III-do-MSD-AD.ESS invite-LCV.CVB-LAT go-NEG.PST.CVB be-MSD-AD.ESS-CNTR possibility-TOP be.NEG-QUOT
\l Arabuzan said to him: "Your father has the idea of tricking you!", but it wasn't possible to not go to where he was invited.

\t Ik’inč’ey ok’ełxanusi esunäy, hi enda bašiqˤoyn, yedu mi łox bišadyoƛ’ ƛ’iri rutir, babiwn łi risa egirno.
\m ik’i-č’ey ok’eł-xanusi esu-näy hi enda bašiqˤoy-n yedu mi łox bišad-ƛ’ ƛ’iri r-utir babiw-n łi r-is-a egir-n
\g go-NEG.PST.CVB escape-NEG.PRS.PRT exist-CND.CVB take.IMP DEM3b.SG ring-TOP DEM2.IISG you thrice food-SUPER.ESS above IV-turn father-TOP water IV-take-INF send-PFV.CVB
\l "If we cannot get around going there, take this ring and turn it over the food three times when you have sent the father to fetch some water.

\t Uži idur aynosi, babiya nesił adäza zaɣrušaw biša erno.
\m uži idu-r ay-nosi babiw-a nesi-ł adäza zaɣru-šaw bišʷa er-n
\g son home-LAT come-ANT.CVB father-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before poison-ATTR food put-PST.UNW
\l When the son came home, his father put poisoned food in front of him.

\t Łi rowa ik’iƛin babiwqorno eƛin, Ismaʕilä bišadyoƛ’ ƛ’iri ʕArabuzanä teƛno zawruni bašiqˤoy łox šet’u rutirno.
\m łi r-ow-a ik’i-ƛin babiw-qor-n eƛi-n Ismaʕil-a bišad-ƛ’ ƛ’iri ʕArabuzan-a teƛ-n zow-ru-ni bašiqˤoy łox šet’u r-utir-n
\g water IV-bring-INF go-QUOT father-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB Ismail-ERG food-SUPER.ESS above Arabuzan-ERG give-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF ring thrice around IV-turn-PST.UNW
\l "Go and bring some water!", Ismail said to his father and turned the ring that Arabuzan had given to him over the food three times.

\t Išno oqnosi yisir siskin roqinč’uƛax.
\m iš-n oq-nosi yisi-r siskin r-oq-č’u-ƛax
\g eat-PFV.CVB become-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT anything IV-happen-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l After he ate, nothing happened to him.

\t Xanä xizyo sisgon ħilla urɣizi bodin.
\m xan-a xizyo sis-gon ħilla urɣizi b-odi-n
\g khan-ERG afterwards one-CNTR trickery thinking III-do-PST.UNW
\l The king afterwards thought of yet another trickery.

\t Nesä nukarzaqor amru bodin, dey užin exurno, iyos ric’äsi nesis šeƛ’u däder rown horoƛin.
\m nesi-a nukar-bi-qor amru b-odi-n di-s uži-n exur-n iyo-s r-ic’-asi nesi-s šeƛ’u di-der r-ow-n horo-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG henchman-PL-POSS.LAT command III-do-PST.UNW me-GEN1 son-TOP kill-PFV.CVB blood-GEN1 IV-fill-RES.PRT DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 clothing me-APUD.LAT IV-bring-PFV.CVB come.IMPR-QUOT
\l He commanded his henchmen: "Kill my son, and bring me back his clothings drenched in blood!"

\t Nukarza Ismaʕil ciqaɣorno ižin, exuran k’ʷeze roqinč’ey, ozurabin roɣno yizä ža howlotow ɣunoqor icin xecin.
\m nukar-bi-a Ismaʕil ciq-aɣor-n iži-n exur-a-n k’ʷeze r-oq-č’ey ozuri-bi-n r-oɣ-n yizi-a ža howlo-tow ɣun-qor ici-n xeci-n
\g henchman-PL-ERG Ismail forest-IN.VERS-TOP carry-PFV.CVB kill-INF-TOP can IV-become-NEG.PST.CVB eye-PL-TOP IV.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG there-EMPH tree-POSS.LAT tie-PFV.CVB leave-PST.UNW
\l The henchmen carried Ismail into the forest, but couldn't kill him; so they pricked out his eyes, bound him to a tree and left him there.

\t Ciqez aɣzas iyoq šeƛ’un rodin (tutirno), xizorno nexno xanqo rukarno, ele debez žas šeƛ’uƛin.
\m ciq-z aɣi-bi-s iyo-q šeƛ’u-n r-odi-n tuti-r-n xizor-n nex-n xan-q r-ukar-n ele mi-z uži-s šeƛ’u-ƛin
\g forest-GEN2 bird-PL-GEN1 blood-POSS.ESS clothing-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB be.stained-CAUS-PFV.CVB back-TOP come-PFV.CVB khan-POSS.ESS IV-show-PST.UNW here you-GEN2 son-GEN1 clothing-QUOT
\l They put (stained) the clothings with the blood of forest birds, came back and showed them to the king: "Behold, your son's clothings."

\t Howži hudu xan oqno Ismaʕiles barubi q’ˤuyzix regiranix.
\m howži hudu xan oq-n Ismaʕil-s baru-bi q’ˤuya-zo-x r-egir-ani-x
\g now then khan begin-PST.UNW Ismail-GEN1 wife-PL other-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS II.PL-send-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Now the king began to send Ismail's wives to others.

\t Žedu rowanixƛin oz rik’inƛax yisi qalamäɣor.
\m žedu r-ow-ani-x-ƛin oz r-ik’i-n-ƛax yisi qala-aɣor
\g DEM1.IIPL II.PL-get-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT army IV-go-PFV.CVB-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL fortress-IN.VERS
\l In order to get them, an army went out to that fortress.

\t Hudun ʕArabuzanä žedu igorkin nexa begirno anu.
\m hudun ʕArabuzan-a žedu igo-r-kin nex-a b-egir-n anu
\g nevertheless Arabuzan-ERG DEM1.IIPL near-LAT-even come-INF I.PL-let-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l Nevertheless, Arabuzan didn't even let them come close.

\t Ismaʕil äciruni ɣunoƛ’ ƛ’iri t’umin, nełas xexoyn heqno.
\m Ismaʕil ici-ru-ni ɣun-ƛ’ ƛ’iri t’umi-n neła-s xexoy-n heq-n
\g Ismail tie-PST.PRT-DEF tree-SUPER.ESS on pigeon-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 young.animal-and sit.down-PST.UNW
\l On that tree where Ismail was tied, a pigeon and its chick sat down.

\t Xexoyä neła nełas eniwqor eƛin, wey eni, yisi žaƛ’ yałru ɣudi, babiya yeda ozurabin roɣno ent’o icin xecäsi yołƛin.
\m xexoy-a neła neła-s eniw-qor eƛi-n wey eni yisi uži-ƛ’ yoł-ru ɣudi babiw-a yeda ozuri-bi-n r-oɣ-n ent’o ici-n xeci-asi yoł-ƛin
\g young.animal-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 mother-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW hey mother DEM2.ISG.OBL boy-SUPER.ESS be-PST.PRT day father-ERG DEM2.ISG eye-PL-TOP IV.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB here tie-PFV.CVB leave-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l The chick said to its mother: "Hey mother, this boy is so tortured, his father pricked his eyes out and left him tied here."

\t Ža žedus xabar Ismaʕiler teqno.
\m ža žedu-s xabar Ismaʕil-r teq-n
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.IIPL.OBL-GEN1 story Ismail-LAT hear-PST.UNW
\l Ismail heard their talking.

\t Ža lel yoƛ’ˤun ƛ’iräzay nesis koyär yayn.
\m ža lela y-ˤoƛ’u-n ƛ’iri-azay nesi-s kʷay-ar y-ay-n
\g DEM1.SG feather II-fall-PFV.CVB above-IN.ABL.DIST DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 hand-IN.LAT II-come-PST.UNW
\l The feather fell down and into his hand.

\t Ozzaq ža yiħinosi, Ismaʕiler č’ura rukayn, hudun yisis ozurabi rošun c’oxno, iyxanusi iłe oqno.
\m ozuri-bi-q ža y-iħi-nosi Ismaʕil-r č’ura r-ukad-n hudun yisi-s ozuri-bi r-ošu-n c’ox-n iy-xanusi iłe oq-n
\g eye-PL-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG II-smear-ANT.CVB Ismail-LAT light IV-see-PFV.CVB nevertheless DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 eye-PL IV.PL-bend-PFV.CVB hit-PFV.CVB know-NEG.PRS.PRT as become-PST.UNW
\l Ismail smeared it on his eyes and could see again, but nevertheless, his eyes became slanted and he was like someone unknown.

\t Elay izin ik’iƛ’orey, riƛu riƛix yisir sis žek’u esux.
\m ele-ay izi-n ik’i-ƛ’oräy riƛu r-iƛi-x yisi-r sis žek’u esu-x
\g there-IN.ABL get.up-PFV.CVB go-SIM.CVB field IV-plough-PRS DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT one man find-PRS
\l He got away from there and while he is going, he finds a man plowing a field.

\t Ismaʕilä eƛin, di meka isäsi yoł, ence där rac’a šebin neƛƛin.
\m Ismaʕil-a eƛi-n di meka-a is-asi yoł ence di-r r-ac’-a šebin neƛ-ƛin
\g Ismail-ERG say-PST.UNW me hunger-ERG take-RES.PRT be a.little me-LAT IV-eat-INF thing give-QUOT
\l Ismail said: "I am hungry, give me a little to eat!"

\t Eženä eƛin, debi xabar Ismaʕilzoq biłäsiwa yołƛin.
\m eže-ni-a eƛi-n mi-s xabar Ismaʕil-zo-q b-iłi-asi-a yoł-ƛin
\g old-DEF-ERG say-PST.UNW you-GEN1 story Ismail-ATTR.OBL-POSS.ESS III-resemble-RES.PRT-Q be-QUOT
\l The old man said: "Doesn't your way of speaking resemble Ismail's?"

\t Yisä eƛin, Ismaʕiles netitow ƛuzabi q’iq’isƛin.
\m yisi-a eƛi-n Ismaʕil-s neti-tow ƛuza-bi q’iq’i-s-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW Ismail-GEN1 when-EMPH bone-PL rot-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l He said: "Ismail's bones had rotten a long time ago."

\t Eženä yeda yisä yisir užiłun xecin.
\m eže-ni-a yeda yisi-a yisi-r uži-łun xeci-n
\g old-DEF-ERG DEM2.ISG DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT son-LHUN leave-PST.UNW
\l The old man adopted him as his own son.

\t Sida zamanałäza xabar teqxo, xanä nesä nesiz ozyołer ʕoloqbi bisxoƛin.
\m sida zaman-łaza xabar teq-x xan-a nesi-a nesi-z oz-łer ʕoloq-bi b-is-x-ƛin
\g one.OBL time-CONT.VERS.DIST story hear-PRS khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 army-CONT.LAT young.person-PL I.PL-take-PRS-QUOT
\l After a while he hears the story that the king is taking young people into his army.

\t Din ik’ixƛin, eƛin Ismaʕil izin xanderno ik’in, nukarłun di ukarƛin nesiq harizi rodin.
\m di-n ik’i-x-ƛin eƛi-n Ismaʕil izi-n xan-der-n ik’i-n nukar-łun di ukar-ƛin nesi-q harizi r-odi-n
\g me-and go-PRS-QUOT say-PFV.CVB Ismail get.up-PFV.CVB khan-APUD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB henchman-LHUN me appoint-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PST.UNW
\l "I will go as well!", said Ismail, went to the king and asked him: "Appoint me a henchman!"

\t Xaner iyn anu yeda nesis uži yałrułi.
\m xan-r iy-n anu yeda nesi-s uži yoł-rułi
\g khan-LAT know-PST.UNW be.NEG DEM2.ISG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 son be-MSD
\l The king didn't know that he was his own son.

\t Xizyo žoyä babiwqor eƛin, hemesi Ismaʕiles zawru yaraɣno, gulun däqor neƛnäy, howža ʕArabuzan q’ˤidan caƛin nełas meč’ beč’a mi di egiranƛin.
\m xizyo uži-a babiw-qor eƛi-n hemesi Ismaʕil-s zow-ru yaraɣ-n gulu-n di-qor neƛ-näy howža ʕArabuzan q’ˤida-n caƛi-n neła-s meč’ b-eč’-a mi di egir-an-ƛin
\g afterwards son-ERG father-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM4.ISG.OBL Ismail-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.PRT weapon-and horse-and me-POSS.LAT give-CND.CVB DEM4.SG Arabuzan down-TOP throw-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 neck III-cut-INF you me let-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Then the son said to his father: "If you give me that Ismail's weapon and horse, I will throw that Arabuzan down and let you cut her neck."

\t Xanä eƛin, Ismaʕil äxuzay soder nesiz gulude puħor ik’iłxosi žek’u oqinč’u, min hemedurtow ik’äłinč’iƛin.
\m xan-a eƛi-n Ismaʕil exu-zay soder nesi-z gulu-de pu-xor ik’i-ł-xosi žek’u oq-č’u mi-n hemedur-tow ik’i-ł-č’i-ƛin
\g khan-ERG say-PST.UNW Ismail die-SIM.CVB after DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 horse-APUD.ESS side-AD.LAT go-POT-PRS.PRT man become-NEG.PST.WIT you-and so-EMPH go-POT-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l The king said: "Ever since Ismail died, there was no man who could go near his horse; and you won't be able to do so either."

\t Bˤałno gulun yeda qalamäɣor, nesä nesiz baruzadäɣor ezunč’ey ik’in.
\m b-ˤał-n gulu-n yeda qala-aɣor nesi-a nesi-z baru-bi-däɣor ezu-č’ey ik’i-n
\g III-strike-PFV.CVB horse-TOP DEM2.ISG fortress-IN.VERS DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 wife-PL-APUD.VERS look-NEG.PST.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l His horse rushed on to that fortress and he went to his wives straight without looking.

\t Qalameł adäza butirno gulun bičirno, qˤaƛin Ismaʕilä, ʕArabuzan, hič’č’a deber rukada rätiru łinaƛ’no yezanix maħor yoqƛin.
\m qala-ł adäza b-utir-n gulu-n b-iči-r-n qˤaƛi-n Ismaʕil-a ʕArabuzan hič’č’a mi-r r-ukad-a r-eti-ru łina-ƛ’-n y-ezu-ani-x maħor y-oq-ƛin
\g fortress-CONT.ESS before III-gather-PFV.CVB horse-TOP III-wait-CAUS-PFV.CVB shout-PST.UNW Ismail-ERG Arabuzan the.most you-LAT IV-see-INF IV-want-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP II-look-MSD-AD.ESS outside II-become-QUOT
\l Ismail came before the fortress and let his horse wait there and shouted: "Arabuzan, come outside to look at what you want to see most!"

\t Yedu Ismaʕiles qˤaƛu yołƛin, łˤonon barubi ret’un k’oƛin maħor roƛixno.
\m yedu Ismaʕil-s qˤaƛu yoł-ƛin łˤono-n baru-bi r-et’u-n k’oƛi-n maħor r-oƛix-n
\g DEM2.IISG Ismail-GEN1 shout be-QUOT three-TOP wife-PL II.PL-jump-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB outside II.PL-appear-PST.UNW
\l "That's Ismail's shouting!", the three wives ran outside.

\t ʕArabuzan yayn Ismaʕileł adäza yičin.
\m ʕArabuzan y-ay-n Ismaʕil-ł adäza y-iči-n
\g Arabuzan II-come-PFV.CVB Ismail-CONT.ESS before II-be-PST.UNW
\l Arabuzan came before Ismail.

\t Nesä yiłaqor eƛin, sasaq q’arƛ’o ʕoƛno put yołali kedonno yisno din ayan, biƛno put yołäsi yisno min horoƛin.
\m nesi-a yiła-qor eƛi-n sasaq q’ar-ƛ’ ʕoƛno put yoł-ali kedon-n y-is-n di-n ay-an biƛno put yoł-asi y-is-n mi-n horo-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW tomorrow early-SUPER.ESS seven pood be-ATTR sledgehammer-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB me-and come-FUT.DEF eight pood be-RES.PRT II-take-PFV.CVB you-and come.IMPR-QUOT
\l He said to her: "Tomorrow in the morning, I will come with the seven-pood sledgehammer, and you come with the eight-pood sledgehammer!

\t Žedu sidqo sis rok’nosi, eli akiłno (kodin bitin) guluzaƛ’ay bˤaƛ’u.
\m žedu sida-q sis r-ok’-nosi eli akił-n kodi-n b-iti-n gulu-bi-ƛ’ay b-ˤaƛ’u
\g DEM1.IIPL one.OBL-POSS.ESS one II.PL-hit-ANT.CVB we get.tired-PFV.CVB hair-TOP III-touch-PFV.CVB horse-PL-SUPER.ABL I.PL-fall
\l When we hit them together, we will loose consciousness and fall off our horses.

\t Xizyo q’ˤidayn izin di dowderno nexno babiwqor eƛan, horo howži yiłas meč’ beč’oƛin.
\m xizyo q’ˤida-ay-n izi-n di mi-der-n nex-n babiw-qor eƛi-an horo howži yiła-s meč’ b-eč’-o-ƛin
\g afterwards down-IN.ABL-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB me you-APUD.LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB father-POSS.LAT say-FUT.DEF come.IMPR now DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 neck III-cut-IMPR-QUOT
\l Then, when I got up, I will come to you and say to my father: 'Come now, cut off her neck!'

\t Elay bitor nesir roda rayxosi šebin debertow räyƛin.
\m ele-ay bitor nesi-r r-odi-a r-ay-xosi šebin mi-r-tow r-iy-ƛin
\g there-IN.ABL thither DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-do-INF IV-must-PRS.PRT thing you-LAT-EMPH IV-know-QUOT
\l And what you have to do to him from then on, you know yourself."

\t ʕArabuzanqor ža xabarno boyn, Ismaʕil eženidäɣor ik’in.
\m ʕArabuzan-qor ža xabar-n b-odi-n Ismaʕil eže-ni-däɣor ik’i-n
\g Arabuzan-POSS.LAT DEM1.SG story-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB Ismail old-DEF-APUD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l After he told this to Arabuzan, Ismail went to the old woman.

\t Sasaq yeda xanez ozyode sadaq qalamäɣor ik’in.
\m sasaq yeda xan-z oz-de sadaq qala-aɣor ik’i-n
\g tomorrow DEM2.ISG khan-GEN2 army-APUD.ESS with fortress-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l The next day, he went to the fortress together with the king's army.

\t ʕArabuzanno qalamäy maħor yoqno, Alay-bulayƛin eƛixozoni nełaznitow guluƛ’no zown.
\m ʕArabuzan-n qala-ay maħor y-oq-n Alay~bulay-ƛin eƛi-xozo-ni neła-z-ni-tow gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n
\g Arabuzan-TOP fortress-IN.ABL outside II-become-PST.UNW Alay~bulay-QUOT say-PRS.PRT.OBL-DEF DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2-DEF-EMPH horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB
\l And Arabuzan came out of the fortress, riding on her horse named Alay-Bulay.

\t Ozno xizok’no biłe bičirno Ismaʕil ʕArabuzande dandir ik’in ʕoƛira putceni kedonno yisno, biƛira putcenigon kedon nełaqno zown.
\m oz-n xizok’-n b-iłe b-iči-r-n Ismaʕil ʕArabuzan-de dandir ik’i-n ʕoƛira put-ce-ni kedon-n y-is-n biƛira put-ce-ni-gon kedon neła-q-n zow-n
\g army-TOP push.back-PFV.CVB I.PL-as I.PL-remain-CAUS-PFV.CVB Ismail Arabuzan-APUD.ESS towards go-PFV.CVB seven.OBL pood-EQU1-DEF sledgehammer-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB eight.OBL pood-EQU1-DEF-CNTR sledgehammer DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Ismail [kept the army as if they were pushed back?] and went towards Arabuzan, having taken the seven-pood sledgehammer, while she took the eight-pood sledgehammer.

\t Sidä sidqo rak’ru kedonyozaz haraƛ’yo, akiłno (kodin bitin) q’ˤanontow q’ˤidar bˤoƛ’un.
\m sida-a sida-q r-ok’-ru kedon-bi-z haraƛ’-a akił-n kodi-n b-iti-n q’ˤano-n-tow q’ˤida-r b-ˤoƛ’u-n
\g one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.ESS II.PL-hit-PST.PRT sledgehammer-PL-GEN2 noise-ERG get.tired-PFV.CVB hair-TOP III-touch-PFV.CVB two-TOP-EMPH down-LAT I.PL-fall-PST.UNW
\l The noise of the sledgehammers, when they hit one another, made the two of them loose conscience and fall down.

\t Łaymoƛ’or aynosi, Ismaʕil izin ʕArabuzande igorno ik’in xanqor eƛin, horo hoboy yiłas meč’ beč’oƛin.
\m łay-ƛ’or ay-nosi Ismaʕil izi-n ʕArabuzan-de igo-r-n ik’i-n xan-qor eƛi-n horo hoboy yiła-s meč’ b-eč’-o-ƛin
\g mind-SUPER.LAT come-ANT.CVB Ismail get.up-PFV.CVB Arabuzan-APUD.ESS near-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB khan-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW come.IMPR now DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 neck III-cut-IMPR-QUOT
\l After he came to, Ismail got up and went to Arabuzan and said to the king: "Come now, cut off her neck!"

\t Xan igaɣor ayƛ’oräy, yet’un k’oƛin ʕArabuzanä biƛira putceni hec’oq’no caƛin, kodin bitin xan q’ˤidar ʕoƛ’un.
\m xan igo-aɣor ay-ƛ’oräy y-et’u-n k’oƛi-n ʕArabuzan-a biƛira put-ce-ni hec’oq’-n caƛi-n kodi-n b-iti-n xan q’ˤida-r ˤoƛ’u-n
\g khan near-IN.VERS come-SIM.CVB II-jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB Arabuzan-ERG eight.OBL pood-EQU1-DEF hammer-TOP shoot.with-PFV.CVB hair-TOP III-touch-PFV.CVB khan down-LAT fall-PST.UNW
\l When the king came nearer, Arabuzan jumped up and hit him with the eight-pood hammer, and the king lost consciousness and fell down.

\t T’ok’ow bäxuru onočas xexoycekin elay iziłno anu.
\m t’ok’ow b-exu-ru onoču-s xexoy-ce-kin ele-ay izi-ł-n anu
\g anymore III-die-PST.PRT hen-GEN1 young.animal-EQU1-even there-IN.ABL get.up-POT-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l He couldn't get up anymore, just like the little chicks of a dead hen.

\t Elus xan exursiƛin, ozno, xalq’in roxin rik’iƛ’oräy, sidaɣaza puƛ’azar Ismaʕil k’oƛin, sidaɣazar ʕArabuzan yoqno nasin ahli dandirno butirno, xanłun ʕArabuzanno xecin, Ismaʕilgon wizirłunno ičin.
\m elu-s xan exur-s-ƛin oz-n xalq’i-n r-oxi-n r-ik’i-ƛ’oräy sidaɣ-aza pu-ƛ’azar Ismaʕil k’oƛi-n sidaɣ-azar ʕArabuzan y-oq-n nasin ahli dandir-n b-utir-n xan-łun ʕArabuzan-n xeci-n Ismaʕil-gon wizir-łun-n iči-n
\g we(I).OBL-GEN1 khan kill-PST.WIT-QUOT army-and people-and III.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB III.PL-go-SIM.CVB in.one.place-IN.VERS.DIST side-SUPER.LAT.DIST Ismail run-PFV.CVB in.one.place-IN.LAT.DIST Arabuzan II-become-PFV.CVB all people together-TOP III-gather-PFV.CVB khan-LHUN Arabuzan-TOP leave-PFV.CVB Ismail-CNTR vizier-LHUN-TOP be-PST.UNW
\l "They killed our king!", the army and the people ran away and at the same time, Ismail ran to one side, and Arabuzan ran to the other side, and they gathered all the people together and Arabuzan was elected king/queen and Ismail became vizier.

\t Łˤonon barubin rown, Ismaʕilä nełqay ža łˤora ɣudi bertenno boyn.
\m łˤono-n baru-bi-n r-ow-n Ismaʕil-a neła-qay ža łˤora ɣudi berten-n b-odi-n
\g three-TOP wife-PL-TOP II.PL-marry-PFV.CVB Ismail-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL DEM1.SG three.OBL day marriage-TOP III-do-PST.UNW
\l Ismail married the three wives and three days in a row celebrated his marriage.

\t Din zows žeduz bertenyoł, hudun k’onč’abin roƛno, łočyaƛ’ k’oƛa oqinč’u.
\m di-n zow-s žedu-z berten-ł hudun k’onč’u-bi-n r-oƛ-n łoč-ƛ’ k’oƛi-a oq-č’u
\g me-and be.NPRS-PST.WIT DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 marriage-CONT.ESS nevertheless leg-PL-TOP II.PL-hurt-PFV.CVB dance-SUPER.ESS jump-INF become-NEG.PST.WIT
\l I was on this marriage as well, however, my legs hurted, so I didn't dance.

\t Esan retin anu, esinč’ey xecan retin anu, sis endiw šebin roqnoƛax.
\m esi-an r-eti-n anu esi-č’ey xeci-an r-eti-n anu sis endiw šebin r-oq-n-ƛax
\g tell-FUT.CVB IV-want-PST.UNW be.NEG tell-NEG.PST.CVB leave-FUT.CVB IV-want-PST.UNW be.NEG one such.a thing IV-happen-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l I didn't want to tell this; I didn't want to leave this untold, but such a thing did happen.

\t Žedus zownƛax sis biƛixosi močin, sis gulun, sisgon bˤeƛ’es reqenno.
\m žedu-s zow-n-ƛax sis b-iƛi-x-si moči-n sis gulu-n sis-gon bˤeƛ’-s reqen-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT one III-plough-IPFV.CVB-ATTR field-and one horse-and one-CNTR sheep-GEN1 herd-and
\l They had, as is said, a field for plowing, a horse and a flock of sheep.

\t Žedur užin odin, nesiƛ’ Ħon-Bahadurƛin ci cedinƛax.
\m žedu-r uži-n odi-n nesi-ƛ’ Ħon~Bahadurƛi-ƛin ci cedi-n-ƛax
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-LAT son-TOP do-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS Mountain~Hero-QUOT name name-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l A son was born to them and they named him "Mountain~Hero".

\t Łeno ƛˤeb yayzay sodertow yisir guluƛ’ zown aħnada koƛ’ix zown.
\m łeno ƛˤeb y-ay-zay soder-tow yisi-r gulu-ƛ’ zow-n aħnad-a koƛ’i-x zow-n
\g five year II-come-SIM.CVB after-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT horse-SUPER.ESS ride-PFV.CVB walk.around-INF understand.to-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l After he became five years old, he understood to ride around on a horse.

\t Neside sadaqosin nesä łiboƛ’ beɣurxo zown, hemediw q’uwataw uži oqxo zown ža.
\m nesi-de sadaq-si-n nesi-a łibo-ƛ’ b-eɣu-r-x zow-n hemediw q’uwataw uži oq-x zow-n ža
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS with-ATTR-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG wrestling-SUPER.ESS I.PL-be.defeated-CAUS-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB such.a strong boy become-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l He defeated all his peers in wrestling, and became such a strong boy.

\t Sida quł neširu yisir moƛał rukayn: ħonzaq aħnayƛ’oräy, yisir łˤono gagali besuxƛax - sis mesedyos biłe ƛ’er yołäsi, sideni žawharyos biłe ƛ’er yołäsi, sidenigon yaq’utyos biłe ƛ’er yołäsi.
\m sida qu-ł neširu yisi-r moƛu-ł r-ukad-n ħon-bi-q aħnad-ƛ’oräy yisi-r łˤono gagali b-esu-x-ƛax - sis mesed-s b-iłe ƛ’er yoł-asi sideni žawhar-s b-iłe ƛ’er yoł-asi sideni-gon yaq’ut-s b-iłe ƛ’er yoł-asi
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS at.night DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-PST.UNW mountain-PL-POSS.ESS walk.around-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT three flower III-find-PRS-QUOT - one gold-GEN1 III-as color be-RES.PRT the.other.one pearl-GEN1 III-as color be-RES.PRT the.other.one-CNTR ruby-GEN1 III-as color be-RES.PRT
\l One night he had a dream: while walking around the mountains, he found three flowers - one in the color of gold, another one in the color of a pearl and yet another one in the color of ruby.

\t Žedu ret’uranƛin yeda oqnosi, oc’ino q’ˤano q’ˤim yołali aždaħä yok’ek’no yižix sis bercinaw kid yukayn.
\m žedu r-et’ur-an-ƛin yeda oq-nosi oc’ino q’ˤano q’ˤim yoł-ali aždaħ-a y-ok’ek’-n y-iži-x sis bercinaw kid y-ukad-n
\g DEM1.IPL III.PL-pull.out-FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM2.ISG begin-ANT.CVB ten two head be-ATTR dragon-ERG II-steal-PFV.CVB II-carry-IPFV.CVB one beautiful girl II-see-PST.UNW
\l When he was just about to pluck them, he saw a twelve-headed dragon, which had kidnapped a beautiful girl.

\t Neła kidbä Ħon-Bahadurqor reƛ’i-bašid, xizor oxiƛin, eƛix zown.
\m neła kid-a Ħon~Bahadurƛi-qor reƛ’a~baša-d xizor oxi-ƛin eƛi-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-ERG Mountain~Hero-POSS.LAT hands.and.fingers-INSTR back run.away-QUOT say-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l That girl was telling Mountain~Hero with her hands and fingers to run back.

\t Ža yołi elay k’ek’kin ik’no anu.
\m ža yołi ele-ay k’ek’-kin ik’i-n anu
\g DEM1.SG however there-IN.ABL moving-even go-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l But he didn't even move from there.

\t Zamanałäzay boržizin boqno q’ˤano t’umi bayn.
\m zaman-łazay boržizi-n b-oq-n q’ˤano t’umi b-ay-n
\g time-CONT.ABL.DIST fly-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB two pigeon III-come-PST.UNW
\l After some time two pigeons came flying.

\t Žeda kidbeqor kurno lel yayrno.
\m žeda-a kid-qor kur-n lel y-ayr-n
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG girl-POSS.LAT throw-PFV.CVB wing II-lead-PST.UNW
\l They threw their wings up to the girl.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo t’umiƛ’orno yutin, hawaƛ’ k’oƛin yoxin, aždaħä yok’ek’no yižix zawru kid.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo t’umi-ƛ’or-n y-uti-n hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n y-oxi-n aždaħ-a y-ok’ek’-n y-iži-x zow-ru kid
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after pigeon-SUPER.LAT-TOP II-turn-PFV.CVB air-SUPER.ESS jump-PFV.CVB II-run.away-PST.UNW dragon-ERG II-steal-PFV.CVB II-carry-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT girl
\l After that, the girl who had been kidnapped and carried away by the dragon turned into a pigeon and flew away.

\t Aždaħä kidbeł xizay qˤaƛanayn, xizor yutin horo, nexinč’inäy - sosigon yäqi mi däqƛin.
\m aždaħ-a kid-ł xizay qˤaƛanad-n xizor y-uti-n horo nex-č’i-näy - sosi-gon y-iqi mi di-q-ƛin
\g dragon-ERG girl-CONT.ESS behind yell-PST.UNW back II-turn.back-PFV.CVB come.IMPR come-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB - again-CNTR II-get you me-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l The dragon yelled after the girl: "Come back! If you don't come back, I will get you again!"

\t Sida quł babiya nesiq esirno, šida mi nece q’ʷarid oqno ičäsi, šebi deber roqnoƛin.
\m sida qu-ł babiw-a nesi-q esir-n šida mi nece q’ʷarid oq-n iči-asi šebi mi-r r-oq-n-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS father-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW why you so.much sad become-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT what you-LAT IV-happen-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l One day the father asked him: "Why are you so sad, what has happened to you?"

\t Ɣudƛ’ay ɣudƛ’or uži ħalaq’ oqxo ik’ix ukayn, sosigon babiya esirno nesiq, šebi deber roqno, šida mi ɣˤuč’ iłe oqxo ik’ixƛin.
\m ɣudi-ƛ’ay ɣudi-ƛ’or uži ħalaq’ oq-x ik’i-x ukad-n sosi-gon babiw-a esir-n nesi-q šebi mi-r r-oq-n šida mi ɣˤuč’ iłe oq-x ik’i-x-ƛin
\g day-SUPER.ABL day-SUPER.LAT son meager become-IPFV.CVB go-IPFV.CVB see-PFV.CVB again-CNTR father-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS what you-LAT IV-happen-PST.UNW why you stick as become-IPFV.CVB go-PRS-QUOT
\l Seeing that from day to day the son went on to become thin, so the father asked him again: "What happened to you? Why are you becoming like a stick?"

\t Xizyo Ħon-Bahadurä babiwq nesir yukayru moƛałäy esin, howža moƛał yukayru kidbeł xizay ik’a retinƛin.
\m xizyo Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a babiw-q nesi-r y-ukad-ru moƛu-łay esi-n howža moƛu-ł y-ukad-ru kid-ł xizay ik’i-a r-eti-n-ƛin
\g afterwards Mountain~Hero-ERG father-POSS.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT II-see-PST.PRT dream-CONT.ABL tell-PST.UNW DEM4.SG dream-CONT.ESS II-see-PST.PRT girl-CONT.ESS behind go-INF IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l Then Mountain~Hero told his father about the dream he had seen: "I want to go after the girl that I had seen in that dream."

\t Łˤora äƛiru ɣudƛ’o yeda sida osiw hunoxor ayn.
\m łˤora äƛiru ɣudi-ƛ’ yeda sida osiw huni-o-xor ay-n
\g three.OBL ORD day-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG one.OBL high way-IMPR-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l On the third day he came to a high way.

\t Elor sasaqor ɣudi qˤaširaniƛ’or ħukmu bik’in yisi.
\m elo-r sasaq-qor ɣudi qˤašir-ani-ƛ’or ħukmu b-ik’i-n yisi
\g there-LAT in.the.morning-POSS.LAT day dawn-MSD-SUPER.LAT decision III-go-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL
\l He decided to go there until the days would dawn in the morning.

\t Yeda moƛałer ik’iƛ’oräy, reže łaci rizin.
\m yeda moƛu-łer ik’i-ƛ’oräy r-eže łaci r-izi-n
\g DEM2.ISG sleep-CONT.LAT go-SIM.CVB IV-big wind IV-get.up-PST.UNW
\l When he went to sleep, a big storm came up.

\t Ɣudin qˤašin, sasaqosi zamanno bayn, buq boƛixno.
\m ɣudi-n qˤaši-n sasaqosi zaman-n b-ay-n buq b-oƛix-n
\g day-TOP dawn-PFV.CVB in.the.morning time-TOP III-come-PFV.CVB sun III-appear-PST.UNW
\l The day dawned, the morning time came and the sun appeared.

\t Buq bätuza puƛ’azay guluƛ’no zown yisir eže žek’u nexxo ukayn.
\m buq b-etu-za pu-ƛ’azay gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n yisi-r eže žek’u nex-x ukad-n
\g sun III-set-LCV.CVB side-SUPER.ABL.DIST horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT old man come-IPFV.CVB see-PST.UNW
\l In the south he saw an old man riding on a horse coming towards him.

\t Yisił dandir c’axrun eženä eƛin, horo ela gulubi ħažan, yiła sis čuret’ bok’näy ʕoƛno ħon xecixosi, ži di eže izäsi oqzaƛ’, yedu deber biča bayƛin.
\m yisi-ł dandir c’ox-run eže-ni-a eƛi-n horo elu-a gulu-bi ħaži-an yiła-a sis čuret’ b-ok’-näy ʕoƛno ħon xeci-xosi ži di eže izi-asi oq-zaƛ’ yedu mi-r b-iči-a b-ay-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS towards meet-IMM.ANT.CVB old-DEF-ERG say-PST.UNW come.IMPR we(I).OBL-ERG horse-PL exchange-FUT.DEF DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG one whip III-beat-CND.CVB seven mountain leave-PRS.PRT now me old get-RES.PRT become-CSL.CVB DEM2.IISG you-LAT III-be-INF III-must-QUOT
\l Right when he came towards him, the old man said: "Come, let's exchange horses! When I beat the whip, he lets seven mountains behind him; because I have become old now, he shall be yours."

\t ƛ’iri roži anusi Ħon-Bahadurä eženir gulu ħažin.
\m ƛ’iri roži anu-si Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a eže-ni-r gulu ħaži-n
\g above word be.NEG-ATTR Mountain~Hero-ERG old-DEF-LAT horse exchange-PST.UNW
\l Without saying another word, Mountain~Hero exchanged the horse with the old man.

\t Nesiz guluƛ’no zown, bok’no yisä čuret’, ʕoƛno ħonno xecin raładyoz lilyoxor ayn yeda.
\m nesi-z gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n b-ok’-n yisi-a čuret’ ʕoƛno ħon-n xeci-n raład-z lilyo-xor ay-n yeda
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB III-beat-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG whip seven mountain-TOP leave-PFV.CVB sea-GEN2 river.bank-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG
\l He sat on the horse, beated the whip and having left seven mountains behind him, he came to the coast of the sea.

\t Sisgon čuret’ bok’nosi, raładyos bitazoni lilyoxar boqno yizi.
\m sis-gon čuret’ b-ok’-nosi raład-s bitasi-ni lilyo-xar b-oq-n yizi
\g one-CNTR whip III-beat-ANT.CVB sea-GEN1 next-DEF river.bank-AD.VERS I.PL-become-PST.UNW DEM2.IPL
\l He beat the whip once more and they came to the other coast of the sea.

\t Elo sida ixiw aħinoƛno biqin łˤono q’ˤim yołäsi bikori č’ač’aƛix yisir bukayn.
\m elo sida ixiw aħin-ƛ-n b-iqi-n łˤono q’ˤim yoł-asi bikori č’ač’aƛi-x yisi-r b-ukad-n
\g there one.OBL big rock-SUB.ESS-TOP III-get-PFV.CVB three head be-RES.PRT snake squeak-IPFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT III-see-PST.UNW
\l There he saw a three-headed snake that got under a big rock and was squeaking there.

\t Neła Ħon-Bahadurqor eƛin, mi däƛ’ay yedu ħal boɣnäy, deber din nagon boqłin kumakyor besanƛin.
\m neła-a Ħon~Bahadurƛi-qor eƛi-n mi di-ƛ’ay yedu ħal b-oɣ-näy mi-r di-n na-gon b-oq-łin kumak-r b-esu-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG Mountain~Hero-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you me-SUPER.ABL DEM2.IISG trouble III-take.away-CND.CVB you-LAT me-TOP where-CNTR III-happen-CNC.CVB help-LAT III-find-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l It said to Mountain~Hero: "If you take away this trouble from me, I will help you whereever you are."

\t Ħon-bahadurä rok’no mač’an łˤonon bikoris q’ˤim reč’no kurno.
\m Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a r-ok’-n mač’a-n łˤono-n bikori-s q’ˤim r-eč’-n kur-n
\g Mountain~Hero-ERG IV-beat-PFV.CVB dagger-TOP three-TOP snake-GEN1 head IV.PL-cut-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l Mountain~Hero beated with his dagger and chopped off the tree heads of the snake.

\t Elay bitor bik’in yizi sida ʕalazanyoz lilyoxor bayn.
\m ele-ay bitor b-ik’i-n yizi sida ʕalazan-z lilyo-xor b-ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL thither I.PL-go-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL one.OBL lake-GEN2 river.bank-AD.LAT I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l The went on and came to the coast of a lake.

\t Gulu bišan begirno puƛ’or ʕoƛ’unosi, yeda moƛa iqirxo.
\m gulu b-iš-an b-egir-n pu-ƛ’or ˤoƛ’u-nosi yeda moƛu-a iqir-x
\g horse III-eat-FUT.CVB III-let-PFV.CVB side-SUPER.LAT fall-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG sleep-ERG take.away-PRS
\l He let the horse eat, fell onto the side and the sleep took him away.

\t Łˤoran ƛˤeba yeda elo kecno ƛexux.
\m łˤora-n ƛˤeb-a yeda elo kec-n ƛexu-x
\g three.OBL-TOP year-IN.ESS DEM2.ISG there sleep-PFV.CVB remain-PRS
\l And he remained there sleeping for three years.

\t Xizyo nesiz aħya tełer kičuričus biłe haraƛ’ bayn.
\m xizyo nesi-z aħya-a tełer kičuriču-s b-iłe haraƛ’ b-ay-n
\g afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 ear-IN.ESS into earthquake-GEN1 III-as noise III-come-PST.UNW
\l Then, a noise like an earthquake came into his ear.

\t Yeda zek’no egin č’ariłno.
\m yeda zek’-n egi-n č’arił-n
\g DEM2.ISG jerk-TOP let.go-PFV.CVB wake.up-PST.UNW
\l He shuddered and woke up.

\t Ezuzaƛ’ oč’ino q’ˤim yołäsi aždaħ ƛ’irir nexxoƛax.
\m ezu-zaƛ’ oč’ino q’ˤim yoł-asi aždaħ ƛ’iri-r nex-x-ƛax
\g look-CSL.CVB nine head be-RES.PRT dragon on-LAT come-PRS-QUOT
\l He looked: A nine-headed dragon was coming to him.

\t Cimyarno bizin neła eƛin, dey eniw yexaru tušman didur mi t’aɣor nexłäƛin.
\m cim-ar-n b-izi-n neła-a eƛi-n di-s eniw y-exur-ru tušman didur mi t’o-aɣor nex-ł-a-ƛin
\g malice-IN.LAT-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN1 mother II-kill-PST.PRT enemy how you here-IN.VERS come-POT-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l He, who got furiated, said: "How could you who killed my mother come here?!"

\t Ħon-bahadurä eƛin, debi eniwn yexursi, min bexuran, mi biłet’ani bišom bexurełxosi bahadur oqzaƛ’ nexsi di t’orƛin.
\m Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a eƛi-n mi-s eniw-n y-exur-s mi-n b-exur-an mi b-iłe-t’a-ni bišom b-exur-ł-xosi bahadur oq-zaƛ’ nex-si di t’o-r-ƛin
\g Mountain~Hero-ERG say-PST.UNW you-GEN1 mother-and II-kill-PST.WIT you-and III-kill-FUT.DEF you III-as-DISTR-DEF hundred I.PL-kill-POT-PRS.PRT hero become-CSL.CVB come-ATTR me here-LAT-QUOT
\l Mountain~Hero said: "I killed your mother, and I will kill you! I have come here, for I am the hero who has killed a hundred just like you."

\t Ħon-bahadurä sosi rak’ru mač’id łˤonon q’ˤim nełas reč’no roɣno, k’ox äƛiru rok’nosi hemedurtow łˤonosinigon q’ˤim reč’no roɣno, łox äƛirugon regirnosi, aždaħes oč’inon q’ˤim reč’no.
\m Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a sosi r-ok’-ru mač’i-d łˤono-n q’ˤim neła-s r-eč’-n r-oɣ-n k’ox äƛiru r-ok’-nosi hemedur-tow łˤono-si-ni-gon q’ˤim r-eč’-n r-oɣ-n łox äƛiru-gon r-egir-nosi aždaħ-s oč’ino-n q’ˤim r-eč’-n
\g Mountain~Hero-ERG once IV-hit-PST.PRT dagger-INSTR three-TOP head DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 IV-cut-PFV.CVB IV-take.away-PFV.CVB twice ORD IV-hit-ANT.CVB so-EMPH three-ATTR-DEF-CNTR head IV-cut-PFV.CVB IV-take.away-PFV.CVB thrice ORD-CNTR IV-let-ANT.CVB dragon-GEN1 nine-TOP head IV-cut-PST.UNW
\l Mountain~Hero hit him once with the dagger and cut three heads off of him; when he hit him for the second time, he cut three of his heads off as well; and when he did it for the third time then, he cut off all the nine heads.

\t Nełałäy bäk’iru iya šet’urtow oreznabi rodin, howlortow aždaħno bexun.
\m neła-łay b-ik’i-ru iyo-a šet’ur-tow orezni-bi r-odi-n howlo-r-tow aždaħ-n b-exu-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ABL III-go-PST.PRT blood-ERG around-EMPH pond-PL IV.PL-do-PFV.CVB there-LAT-EMPH dragon-TOP III-die-PST.UNW
\l The blood that came out of it, formed ponds all around, and there the dragon died.

\t Ža sidaɣ ħonƛ’o bišxo besun.
\m ža sidaɣ ħon-ƛ’ b-iš-x b-esu-n
\g DEM1.SG in.one.place mountain-SUPER.ESS III-eat-IPFV.CVB III-find-PST.UNW
\l He found it eating somewhere on a mountain.

\t Łˤoran ƛˤeba na mi zowäƛin, esirno gula nesiq.
\m łˤora-n ƛˤeb-a na mi zow-a-ƛin esir-n gulu-a nesi-q
\g three.OBL-TOP year-IN.ESS where you be.NPRS-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT ask-PST.UNW horse-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l "Where have you been these three years?", asked him the horse.

\t Moƛa iqirno ƛexun, xizyogon di oč’ino q’ˤim yołäsi aždaħ bexursiƛin, esin yisä.
\m moƛu-a iqir-n ƛexu-n xizyogon di oč’ino q’ˤim yoł-asi aždaħ b-exur-s-ƛin esi-n yisi-a
\g sleep-ERG take.away-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB then me nine head be-RES.PRT dragon III-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT tell-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "I was sleeping, and then I killed a nine-headed dragon.", he told.

\t T’ok’ow mi nedur tox oqno äčinƛin, eƛin gulä łˤono t’umi ent’oza hawaƛ’ baħnayx zows, žeda nan moƛaq iqirerno äsu miƛin.
\m t’ok’ow mi nedur tox oq-n iči-n-ƛin eƛi-n gulu-a łˤono t’umi ent’o-za hawa-ƛ’ b-aħnad-x zow-s žeda-a nan moƛu-q iqir-r-n esu mi-ƛin
\g anymore you so be.careless become-PFV.CVB be-PROHIB-QUOT say-PST.UNW horse-ERG three pigeon here-ZA air-SUPER.ESS III-walk.around-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG even sleep-POSS.ESS take.away-CAUS-PFV.CVB find you-QUOT
\l "Don't you get careless anymore!", the horse said, "Three pigeons were flying here in the air, and might have made you fall asleep."

\t T’umzałäy xabar täqruntow, akäłru iłen oqno Ħon-Bahadurä eƛin, di žedał xizaynč’e oqäsiƛin.
\m t’umi-bi-łay xabar teq-run-tow akił-ru iłe-n oq-n Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a eƛi-n di žeda-ł xizay-n-č’e oq-asi-ƛin
\g pigeon-PL-CONT.ABL story hear-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH get.tired-PST.PRT as-TOP become-PFV.CVB Mountain~Hero-ERG say-PST.UNW me DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS behind-TOP-INTS become-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l When Mountain~Hero heard the story about the pigeons, he wasn't tired anymore and said: "I will search for them!"

\t Elay bizin bik’iƛ’oräy žedude dandir nexxo iłno q’ˤim yołäsi aždaħ bukayn.
\m ele-ay b-izi-n b-ik’i-ƛ’oräy žedu-de dandir nex-x iłno q’ˤim yoł-asi aždaħ b-ukad-n
\g there-IN.ABL I.PL-get.up-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-SIM.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS towards come-IPFV.CVB six head be-RES.PRT dragon III-see-PST.UNW
\l From there they got up, and saw a six-headed dragon coming towards them.

\t Yizi bukayrun, aždaħä zudäy roɣno ixiw riris ɣun yiził adäzar rayrno kurno.
\m yizi b-ukad-run aždaħ-a zudi-ay r-oɣ-n ixiw riri-s ɣun yizi-ł adäz-ar r-ayr-n kur-n
\g DEM2.IPL I.PL-see-IMM.ANT.CVB dragon-ERG root-IN.ABL IV-take.away-PFV.CVB big alder-GEN1 tree DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT IV-bring-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l When he saw them, the dragon tore out an alder tree from its roots and threw it before them.

\t Dandi yizi huniƛxor k’oƛin bok’ełno, žedu zawza mečoƛ’ ža ɣunno rik’in c’oxno.
\m dandi yizi huni-ƛxor k’oƛi-n b-ok’eł-n žedu zow-za moči-ƛ’ ža ɣun-n r-ik’i-n c’ox-n
\g only DEM2.IPL way-SUB.LAT run-PFV.CVB I.PL-escape-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL be.NPRS-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.ESS DEM1.SG tree-TOP IV-go-PFV.CVB hit-PST.UNW
\l They had just gotten out of the way, and that tree hit the place where they had been.

\t Ħon-bahadurä kurno c’eruc’as hil, aždaħzo yoƛƛo hut’-mˤalä c’oxno.
\m Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a kur-n c’eruc’a-s hil aždaħ-z y-oƛƛo hut’~mˤali-a c’ox-n
\g Mountain~Hero-ERG shoot.from-PFV.CVB bow-GEN1 arrow dragon-GEN2 II-middle front.part.of.the.face-IN.ESS hit-PST.UNW
\l Mountain~Hero shot an arrow from his bow and hit the dragon in the middle of its face.

\t Aždaħa qˤaƛu rok’nosi kičuriču rayzaƛ’ riłe raƛ’no k’ek’-rik’no, yizin bižin taqˤo č’aq’ˤirno.
\m aždaħ-a qˤaƛu r-ok’-nosi kičuriču r-odi-zaƛ’ r-iłe raƛ’-n r-k’ek’~ik’-n yizi-n b-iži-n taqˤo č’aq’ˤir-n
\g dragon-ERG shout IV-hit-ANT.CVB earthquake IV-do-CSL.CVB IV-as earth-TOP IV-move-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB far.away let.fall-PST.UNW
\l The dragon released a shout, and moved the earth like by an earthquake, and thus caused them to fall far away.

\t K’ox äƛirugon Ħon-Bahadurä kurno c’eruc’a - aždaħez rok’eł č’aq’ˤin.
\m k’ox äƛiru-gon Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a kur-n c’eruc’a - aždaħ-z rok’u-ł č’aq’ˤi-n
\g twice ORD-CNTR Mountain~Hero-ERG shoot.from-PFV.CVB bow - dragon-GEN2 heart-CONT.ESS hit-PST.UNW
\l Mountain~Hero shot a second time with his bow and hit the dragons heart.

\t T’ok’ow k’ek’-bik’łinč’ey howlortow bexun ža - iłno q’ˤim yołali aždaħ.
\m t’ok’ow k’ek’~ik’-ł-č’ey howlo-r-tow b-exu-n ža - iłno q’ˤim yoł-ali aždaħ
\g anymore move-POT-NEG.PST.CVB there-LAT-EMPH III-die-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG - six head be-ATTR dragon
\l The dragon with the six heads couldn't move anymore and died there.

\t Kʷaxatow yeda sida azbaryoz madaxor ayn.
\m kʷaxa-tow yeda sida azbar-z ma-xor ay-n
\g soon-EMPH DEM2.ISG one.OBL palace-GEN2 gate-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Soon he came to the gate of a palace.

\t Elo azbaryoł adäza mesedyos č’iħo roqxosi baɣ yołƛax.
\m elo azbar-ł adäza mesed-s č’iħo r-oq-xosi baɣ yoł-ƛax
\g there palace-CONT.ESS before gold-GEN1 fruit IV-become-PRS.PRT garden be-QUOT
\l There, in front of the palace, was a garden where golden fruits were growing.

\t Elo yisir łˤonon esnabi besun sideł sis boɣnoyx.
\m elo yisi-r łˤono-n esyu-bi b-esu-n sida-ł sis b-oɣnod-x
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT three-TOP brother-PL I.PL-find-PST.UNW one.OBL-CONT.ESS one I.PL-argue-IPFV.CVB
\l There he found three brothers arguing with each other.

\t Salamno teƛno, yisä esnazaq esirno, šida meži boɣnoyxƛin.
\m salam-n teƛ-n yisi-a esyu-bi-q esir-n šida meži b-oɣnod-x-ƛin
\g greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG brother-PL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW why you.PL I.PL-argue-PRS-QUOT
\l He greeted and asked the brothers: "Why are you arguing?"

\t Eženi esiya eƛin, ɣudes neširuxay eluz baɣmay sist’a č’iħomes ɣun rok’ek’äsit’a resux, łu rok’ek’xosin elur riyxanu.
\m eže-ni esyu-a eƛi-n ɣudes neširu-xay elu-z baɣ-ay sist’a č’iħo-s ɣun r-ok’ek’-asi-t’a r-esu-x łu r-ok’ek’-xosi-n elu-r r-iy-x-anu
\g old-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW daily at.night-AD.ABL we(I).OBL-GEN2 garden-IN.ABL one.at.a.time fruit-GEN1 tree IV-steal-RES.PRT-DISTR IV-find-IPFV.CVB who.ERG IV-steal-PRS.PRT-TOP we(I).OBL-LAT IV-know-PRS-NEG
\l The old brother said: "Every night, there seems to be someone who steals one fruit tree from our garden, and we don't know who it is."

\t Neširu elo nełax sasaqor šebi ičixozoł boɣnayx ƛexasi eliƛin.
\m neširu elo neła-x sasaq-qor šebi iči-xozo-ł b-oɣnod-x ƛexu-asi eli-ƛin
\g at.night there DEM1.IISG.OBL-AD.ESS in.the.morning-POSS.LAT who wait-PRS.PRT.OBL-CONT.ESS I.PL-argue-PRS remain-RES.PRT we-QUOT
\l "We are arguing who will wait at night until the morning, there.

\t Roƛiqur raynosi, Ħon-Bahadurer sis beže cey baɣmoxar hawaƛ’ k’oƛin bayx bukayn.
\m roƛiqur r-ay-nosi Ħon~Bahadurƛi-r sis b-eže cey baɣ-xar hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n b-ay-x b-ukad-n
\g at.midnight IV-come-ANT.CVB Mountain~Hero-LAT one III-big eagle garden-AD.VERS air-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB III-come-IPFV.CVB III-see-PST.UNW
\l At midnight, Mountain~Hero saw a big eagle which flew into the garden.

\t Elo yizi sidä sidƛ’o łeɣin, q’ˤanon akiłace biħanayn.
\m elo yizi sida-a sida-ƛ’ łeɣi-n q’ˤano-n akił-ace b-iħanad-n
\g there DEM2.IPL one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-SUPER.ESS grasp-PFV.CVB two-TOP get.tired-TERM I.PL-fight-PST.UNW
\l There they grasped each other and fought until the two of them got tired.

\t Xizaɣor tatu łiynosi, cey ħalica Ħon-Bahadurzo mač’iqay bok’ełno.
\m xizaɣor tatu łiy-nosi cey ħalica Ħon~Bahadurƛi-z mač’i-qay b-ok’eł-n
\g finally power end-ANT.CVB eagle by.wonder Mountain~Hero-GEN2 dagger-POSS.ABL III-escape-PST.UNW
\l Finally his power ended and the eagle escaped like through a wonder(?) from Mountain~Hero's dagger.

\t Xizazgon yisän qˤaƛin nełqor, beže taliħ boqsi debi nedur mi boxin bok’äłruƛin.
\m xizaz-gon yisi-a-n qˤaƛi-n neła-qor b-eže taliħ b-oq-si mi-s nedur mi b-oxi-n b-ok’eł-ru-ƛin
\g from.behind-CNTR DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP shout-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT III-big fortune III-become-ATTR you-GEN1 so you III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-escape-PST.PRT-QUOT
\l From behind he shouted: "Your luck was big for having escaped!"

\t Sasaqosi esnazar łuq’zi boqali ceyłäy bäk’iru iyon, nełqay rˤaƛ’uru lelabin rukayn.
\m sasaqosi esyu-bi-r łuq’zi b-oq-ali cey-łay b-ik’i-ru iyo-n neła-qay r-ˤaƛ’u-ru lel-bi-n r-ukad-n
\g in.the.morning brother-PL-LAT hurt III-become-ATTR eagle-CONT.ABL III-go-PST.PRT blood-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ABL II.PL-fall-PST.PRT feather-PL-and III.PL-see-PST.UNW
\l In the morning the brothers saw the blood that came out of the wounded eagle and the feathers that fell from it.

\t Esnabi ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤun bizin, Ħon-Bahadurer saɣyatyabin rodin, riguƛ’ay rigu bišadyos ħurženyabin ric’no, yedan hunix egirno.
\m esyu-bi ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu-n b-izi-n Ħon~Bahadurƛi-r saɣyat-bi-n r-odi-n r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu bišad-s ħuržen-bi-n r-ic’-n yeda-n huni-x egir-n
\g brother-PL very be.happy-TOP I.PL-get-PFV.CVB Mountain~Hero-LAT present-PL-and III.PL-do-PFV.CVB IV-good-SUPER.ABL IV-good food-GEN1 bag-PL-and IV.PL-fill-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG-TOP way-AD.ESS send-PST.UNW
\l The brothers got very happy, gave Mountain~Hero presents and filled a bag with the best food and sent him on his way.

\t Sida mixƛ’aza hawaƛ’ k’oƛin łˤono t’umi bayn.
\m sida mix-ƛ’aza hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n łˤono t’umi b-ay-n
\g one.OBL time-SUPER.VERS.DIST air-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB three pigeon III-come-PST.UNW
\l After a little while, the three pigeons came flying.

\t ƛ’iräy ħulin kurno, bercinawt’a kidbazaƛ’orno rutin, ɣˤayz orezna teł žedu esanadanix roqno.
\m ƛ’iräy ħuli-n kur-n bercinaw-t’a kid-bi-ƛ’or-n r-uti-n ɣˤay-z orezni-a teł žedu esanad-ani-x r-oq-n
\g from.above feather-TOP throw-PFV.CVB beautiful-DISTR girl-PL-SUPER.LAT-TOP II.PL-turn-PFV.CVB milk-GEN2 pond-IN.ESS inside DEM1.IIPL bathe-MSD-AD.ESS II.PL-begin-PST.UNW
\l Having thrown off their feathers, they turned into beautiful girls and began to bathe in the pond of milk.

\t Howži Ħon-Bahadurä k’oƛin ik’in hič’č’a bercinawni kidbes lelno yisno, ɣunoł xizaza uqˤełno ičin.
\m howži Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a k’oƛi-n ik’i-n hič’č’a bercinaw-ni kid-s lel-n y-is-n ɣun-ł xizaz-a uqˤeł-n iči-n
\g now Mountain~Hero-ERG run-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB the.most beautiful-DEF girl-GEN1 feather-TOP II-take-PFV.CVB tree-CONT.ESS behind-IN.ESS hide-PFV.CVB wait-PST.UNW
\l Now Mountain~Hero ran and took the feathers of the most beautiful girl and ran back to hide behind the tree.

\t Esanayn łiynosi, q’ˤunan kidbaza žeda žedus lelazas šeƛ’un šeƛ’un, t’umizaƛ’orno rutin hawaƛ’ k’oƛin rik’in.
\m esanad-n łiy-nosi q’ˤuna-n kid-bi-a žeda-a žedu-s lel-bi-s šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n t’umi-bi-ƛ’or-n r-uti-n hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n r-ik’i-n
\g bathe-PFV.CVB end-ANT.CVB two.OBL-TOP girl-PL-ERG DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IIPL.OBL-GEN1 feather-PL-GEN1 clothing-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB pigeon-PL-SUPER.LAT-TOP II.PL-turn-PFV.CVB air-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB II.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l After having finished bathing, two of the girls put on their feathery clothes, turned into pigeons and flew away.

\t Hič’č’a bercinawni kid šeƛ’un resunč’ey, howlotow ƛexun.
\m hič’č’a bercinaw-ni kid šeƛ’u-n r-esu-č’ey howlo-tow ƛexu-n
\g the.most beautiful-DEF girl clothing-TOP IV-find-NEG.PST.CVB there-EMPH remain-PST.UNW
\l The most beautiful girl didn't find her clothes and thus stayed there.

\t Hawaƛ’ k’oƛin rik’a adäza q’ˤunan esnaza yiłaqor eƛin, howži mi eladay hozuƛ’or k’oƛis, ƛ’irir ayn sida bahadurä yäži miƛin.
\m hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n r-ik’i-a adäza q’ˤuna-n esyu-bi-a yiła-qor eƛi-n howži mi ela-day hozu-ƛ’or k’oƛi-s ƛ’iri-r ay-n sida bahadur-a y-iži mi-ƛin
\g air-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB II.PL-go-INF before two.OBL-TOP sister-PL-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW now you we(II-APUD.ABL seperatedly-SUPER.LAT run-PST.WIT above-LAT come-PFV.CVB one.OBL hero-ERG II-take.out you-QUOT
\l Before the two sisters flew into the air, they said to her: "Now you seperated yourself from us. But one hero came around to take you with him."

\t Žedu t’umibi hawaƛ’ k’oƛin rik’inosi, Ħon-Bahadurä neła kidbederno ik’in eƛin, mi där moƛał yukadäsi zowsƛin.
\m žedu t’umi-bi hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n r-ik’i-nosi Ħon~Bahadurƛi-a neła kid-der-n ik’i-n eƛi-n mi di-r moƛu-ł y-ukad-asi zow-s-ƛin
\g DEM1.IIPL pigeon-PL air-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB III.PL-go-ANT.CVB Mountain~Hero-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-APUD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW you me-LAT dream-CONT.ESS II-see-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l After those pigeons had flown away, Mountain~Hero went to that girl and said: "I have seen you in a dream."

\t Nełagon eƛis, ukayruntow etis mi därƛin.
\m neła-a-gon eƛi-s ukad-run-tow eti-s mi di-r-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-CNTR say-PST.WIT see-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH love-PST.WIT you me-LAT-QUOT
\l And she said: "Right when I saw you, I fell in love with you."

\t Hemedur dandixno yizi.
\m hemedur dandix-n yizi
\g so gather-PST.UNW DEM2.IPL
\l So they came together.

\t Hemedurtow nasin sider sis bätirut’anibin dandixoƛ!
\m hemedur-tow nasin sida-r sis b-eti-ru-t’a-ni-bi-n dandix-ƛ
\g so-EMPH all one.OBL-LAT one I.PL-love-PST.PRT-DISTR-DEF-PL-TOP gather-OPT
\l May all lovers come together likewise!

\t Baruƛ’ ci Bilq’isdiƛin zown.
\m baru-ƛ’ ci Bilq’isdi-ƛin zow-n
\g wife-SUPER.ESS name Bilqisdi-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The wife's name was Bilqisdi.

\t Ža c’aq’ bercinaw, ʕadanłi yołäsi, Allahä hari q’abul boyxosi ɣˤanabi zown.
\m ža c’aq’ bercinaw ʕadanłi yoł-asi Allah-a hari q’abul b-odi-xosi ɣˤanabi zow-n
\g DEM1.SG very beautiful respect be-RES.PRT God-ERG request receive III-do-PRS.PRT woman be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l She was a very beautiful and respectful woman whose prayers Allah received.

\t Bilq’isdis xedyos eɣeni esiw ičix zown netey xalq’imor žukłi roda riqanƛin, žedu sidä sidƛ’or codix.
\m Bilq’isdi-s xediw-s eɣe-ni esiw iči-x zow-n neti-ey xalq’i-r žukłi r-odi-a r-iqi-an-ƛin žedu sida-a sida-ƛ’or codi-x
\g Bilqisdi-GEN1 husband-GEN1 young-DEF brother be-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB when-DUB people-LAT evil IV-do-INF IV-get-FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM1.IPL one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-SUPER.LAT incite-PRS
\l Bilqisdi's husband had a younger brother, whenever possible he harmed people; and he incited them against one another.

\t Xediw maħor oqno ɣudbi rik’inosi, nesis esiya diwanbegderno ik’in ʕarza boɣno, Bilq’isdä neširuxayt’a idur ʕoloqbin butirno sasaqor elay suħmat kamirxanuƛin.
\m xediw maħor oq-n ɣudi-bi r-ik’i-nosi nesi-s esyu-a diwanbeg-der-n ik’i-n ʕarza b-oɣ-n Bilq’isdi-a neširu-xay-t’a idu-r ʕoloq-bi-n b-utir-n sasaq-qor ele-ay suħmat kamir-x-anu-ƛin
\g husband outside become-PFV.CVB day-PL IV.PL-go-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 brother-ERG judge-APUD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB complaint III-hatch-PFV.CVB Bilqisdi-ERG at.night-AD.ABL-DISTR home-LAT young.person-PL-TOP I.PL-gather-PFV.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT there-IN.ABL celebration lose-PRS-NEG-QUOT
\l After some days that the husband had been gone, his brother went to the judge and complained that Bilqisdi would gather young men in her home at night and wouldn't losen the celebration until the morning.

\t Diwanbegä nesiqor eƛin, mi iłet’a ʕorƛ’ilawbi bižin iħuxay eč’ibi rutirƛin.
\m diwanbeg-a nesi-qor eƛi-n mi iłe-t’a ʕorƛ’ilaw-bi b-iži-n iħu-xay eč’i-bi r-utir-ƛin
\g judge-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you as-DISTR young.man-PL I.PL-lead-PFV.CVB river-AD.ABL pebble-PL II.PL-gather-QUOT
\l The judge said to him: "Bring some fine men just like you and gather pebbles at the river."

\t Howži yeda ʕoloqbin bižin iħuxorno ik’in, eč’izas šemrebi rutirno žeda.
\m howži yeda ʕoloq-bi-n b-iži-n iħu-xor-n ik’i-n eč’i-bi-s šem-bi r-utir-n žedu-a
\g now DEM2.ISG young.person-PL-TOP I.PL-lead-PFV.CVB river-AD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB pebble-PL-GEN1 pile-PL III.PL-gather-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG
\l Now he lead young men to the river and they collected piles of pebbles

\t Xizyo diwanbegä ħukmun beč’no, žeduq riyrno, Bilq’isdin hečker yičirno, ža cucixace eč’ibi kuro nełaƛ’orƛin.
\m xizyo diwanbeg-a ħukmu-n b-eč’-n žedu-q r-iyr-n Bilq’isdi-n hečker y-iči-r-n ža cucix-ace eč’i-bi kur-o neła-ƛ’or-ƛin
\g afterwards judge-ERG decision-TOP III-cut-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-explain-PST.UNW Bilqisdi-TOP upright II-be-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG be.buried-TERM pebble-PL throw-IMPR DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT-QUOT
\l Then the judge made a decision and explained to them: "Let her stand up and throw pebbles onto her until she is burried under them."

\t ʕAƛox bitaz yałruni gogaƛ’arno yižin, ʕoloqza eč’ibi caƛix Bilq’isdi tełxor cucik’no.
\m ʕaƛ-x bita-az yoł-ru-ni goga-ƛ’ar-n y-iži-n ʕoloq-bi-a eč’i-bi caƛi-x Bilq’isdi teł-xor cucik’-n
