\g village-AD.ESS distance-IN.ESS.DIST be-PST.PRT-DEF meadow-SUPER.VERS-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB young.person-PL-ERG pebble-PL throw-IPFV.CVB Bilqisdi inside-AD.LAT bury-PST.UNW
\l The young people led her onto a meadow that was distant from the village, threw pebbles onto her and buried her under them.

\t Neła quł yizis ʕaƛoxaza egin nesä nesiz q’ʷariʕelyoł xan ik’ix zown.
\m neła qu-ł yizi-s ʕaƛ-xaza egi-n nesi-a nesi-z q’ʷariʕel-ł xan ik’i-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IPL.OBL-GEN1 village-AD.VERS.DIST go.through-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 necessity-CONT.ESS khan go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l On that day, the king was going through their village for his own needs.

\t Elaz ik’iƛ’oräy, yisir ɣˤanazas roži teqno, daƛ’ gurħizi oqxosi žek’utow ana t’ozaƛin.
\m ele-az ik’i-ƛ’oräy yisi-r ɣˤanabi-s roži teq-n di-ƛ’ gurħizi oq-xosi žek’u-tow anu-a t’o-zo-a-ƛin
\g there-IN.ESS.DIST go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT woman-GEN1 word hear-PST.UNW me-SUPER.ESS pity become-PRS.PRT man-EMPH be.NEG-Q here-ATTR.OBL-IN.ESS-QUOT
\l While he was going there, he heard the words of a woman: "Isn't there a man here who pities me?"

\t Nesä neside sadaqno yižin, eɣeni žas t’alam boda xecin.
\m nesi-a nesi-de sadaq-n y-iži-n eɣe-ni uži-s t’alam b-odi-a xeci-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS with-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB young-DEF son-GEN1 care III-do-INF leave-PST.UNW
\l He took her with himself and left her to the care of his youngest son.

\t Xanes sis ħalikataw madaxosi žek’u zown.
\m xan-s sis ħalikataw ma-x-si žek’u zow-n
\g khan-GEN1 one mean gate-AD.ESS-ATTR man be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The king had a mean guard.

\t Nesä Bilq’isdiqor eƛin, mi däx nexa yayƛin.
\m nesi-a Bilq’isdi-qor eƛi-n mi di-x nex-a y-ay-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG Bilqisdi-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you me-AD.ESS come-INF II-must-QUOT
\l He said to Bilqisdi: "You must come with me."

\t Neła eƛin, dey xediw yoł, oqinč’iłin debex di näxinč’iƛin.
\m neła-a eƛi-n di-s xediw yoł oq-č’i-łin mi-x di nex-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me-GEN1 husband be become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CNC.CVB you-AD.ESS me come-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l She said: "I have a husband, but no matter if I hadn't one, I still wouldn't come with you."

\t Nełaƛ’or cim bäziru nesi madaxozoni žek’a, qˤirič’no risno, xaner hič’č’an betixozoni gulus maħi reč’no roɣno.
\m neła-ƛ’or cim b-izi-ru nesi ma-x-zo-ni žek’u-a qˤirič’-n r-is-n xan-r hič’č’a-n b-eti-xozo-ni gulu-s maħi r-eč’-n r-oɣ-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT malice III-get.up-PST.PRT DEM1.ISG.OBL gate-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF man-ERG scissors-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB khan-LAT the.most-TOP III-love-PRS.PRT.OBL-DEF horse-GEN1 tail IV-cut-PFV.CVB IV-take.away-PFV.CVB
\l Being full of anger toward her, that guard took a pair of scissors and cut off the tail of the king's favorite horse.

\t Ža qˤirič’ nesä Bilq’isdis mežiƛ ruqˤno.
\m ža qˤirič’ nesi-a Bilq’isdi-s muži-ƛ r-uqˤi-n
\g DEM1.SG scissors DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG Bilqisdi-GEN1 mattress-SUB.ESS IV-hide-PST.UNW
\l The scissors he hid under Bilqisdi's mattress.

\t Sasaqosi maħor oqnosi, xaner rukayn, nesiz gulur radiru inžitłi.
\m sasaqosi maħor oq-nosi xan-r r-ukad-n nesi-z gulu-r r-odi-ru inžitłi
\g in.the.morning outside become-ANT.CVB khan-LAT IV-see-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 horse-LAT IV-do-PST.PRT abuse
\l When he went outside in the morning, the king saw the abuse done to his horse.

\t Madaxosini žek’un goƛ’in, xanä nesiq esirno, yedu däz gulus maħi łu reč’äƛin.
\m ma-x-si-ni žek’u-n goƛ’i-n xan-a nesi-q esir-n yedu di-z gulu-s maħi łu r-eč’-a-ƛin
\g gate-AD.ESS-ATTR-DEF man-TOP call-PFV.CVB khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG me-GEN2 horse-GEN1 tail who.ERG IV-cut-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The king called the guard and asked him: "Who has cut off the tail of this horse of mine?"

\t Bilq’isdiƛ’or šakno bižirerno xanes nesi madaxozoni žek’ä, xizyo yeda qˤirič’ k’edaniłer oqno.
\m Bilq’isdi-ƛ’or šak-n b-iži-r-r-n xan-s nesi ma-x-zo-ni žek’u-a xizyo yeda qˤirič’ k’edi-ani-łer oq-n
\g Bilqisdi-SUPER.LAT suspicion-TOP III-carry-CAUS-CAUS-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 DEM1.ISG.OBL gate-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF man-ERG afterwards DEM2.ISG scissors search-MSD-CONT.LAT begin-PST.UNW
\l The guard let the king suspect Bilqisdi and then he began to search for the scissors.

\t Naysinan ža qˤirič’ k’edixozos riłen rodin, xizaɣor Bilq’isdiz mežiƛäzay risno xanqor teƛno, ele debez gulus maħi räč’runi qˤirič’ƛin.
\m naysinan ža qˤirič’ k’edi-xozo-s r-iłe-n r-odi-n xizaɣor Bilq’isdi-z muži-ƛäzay r-is-n xan-qor teƛ-n ele mi-z gulu-s maħi r-eč’-ru-ni qˤirič’-ƛin
\g everywhere DEM1.SG scissors search-PRS.PRT.OBL-GEN1 IV-as-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB finally Bilqisdi-GEN2 mattress-SUB.ABL.DIST IV-take-PFV.CVB khan-POSS.LAT give-PFV.CVB here you-GEN2 horse-GEN1 tail IV-cut-PST.PRT-DEF scissors-QUOT
\l He pretended to search for the scissors everywhere and finally took it from under Bilqisdi's mattress and gave it to the king: "Here, the scissors which cut off your horses tail."

\t Xanä goƛ’in esirnosi, di reč’äsi anuƛin eƛinč’ey, yedu p’es anus yičin.
\m xan-a goƛ’i-n esir-nosi di r-eč’-asi anu-ƛin eƛi-č’ey yedu p’es anu-s y-iči-n
\g khan-ERG call-PFV.CVB ask-ANT.CVB me IV-cut-RES.PRT be.NEG-QUOT say-NEG.PST.CVB DEM2.IISG voice be.NEG-PST.WIT II-remain-PST.UNW
\l When the king called her and asked, she just stood there silently and didn't say that she didn't cut it off.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo xanä Bilq’isdiqor eƛin, deber rätiru šebinon risno, mi t’ay xizor yik’iƛin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo xan-a Bilq’isdi-qor eƛi-n mi-r r-eti-ru šebinon r-is-n mi t’ay xizor y-ik’i-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after khan-ERG Bilqisdi-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT something IV-take-PFV.CVB you from.here back II-go-QUOT
\l After that, the king said to Bilqisdi: "Take what you want and leave here!"

\t Hunixor ʕeziyaw micxirno teƛno, xanä Bilq’isdi yegirno, deber rätizaɣor yik’iƛin.
\m huni-xor ʕeziyaw micxir-n teƛ-n xan-a Bilq’isdi y-egir-n mi-r r-eti-zo-aɣor y-ik’i-ƛin
\g way-AD.LAT much money-TOP give-PFV.CVB khan-ERG Bilqisdi II-send-PFV.CVB you-LAT IV-want-ATTR.OBL-IN.VERS II-go-QUOT
\l The king gave her a lot of money for the way and sent Bilqisdi away: "Go wherever you want!"

\t Elo yiłar ʕuraw q’ʷariłiƛ’ sis ečru žek’u esun.
\m elo yiła-r ʕuraw q’ʷariłi-ƛ’ sis ečru žek’u esu-n
\g there DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT much sadness-SUPER.ESS one old man find-PST.UNW
\l There she found an old man in big sadness.

\t Šida mi nece q’ʷarid oqno ičäsiƛin, yiła nesiq esirno.
\m šida mi nece q’ʷarid oq-n iči-asi-ƛin yiła-a nesi-q esir-n
\g why you so.much sad become-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW
\l "Why are you so sad?", she asked him.

\t Ečruni žek’a esin yiłaq, dey łˤonon uži tusnaq’ä teł yoł, žedu maħor boɣanix micxir anusi di ƛexäsi yołƛin.
\m ečru-ni žek’u-a esi-n yiła-q di-s łˤono-n uži tusnaq’-a teł yoł žedu maħor b-oɣ-ani-x micxir anu-si di ƛexu-asi yoł-ƛin
\g old-DEF man-ERG tell-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS me-GEN1 three-TOP son prison-IN.ESS inside be DEM1.IPL outside I.PL-take.away-MSD-AD.ESS money be.NEG-ATTR me remain-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l The old man told her: "My three brothers are in prison, and I don't have the money to buy them free."

\t Ža bihayaw šebin yołƛin, Bilq’isdä nełaq yałru micxir ečruni žek’uqor teƛno.
\m ža bihayaw šebin yoł-ƛin Bilq’isdi-a neła-q yoł-ru micxir ečru-ni žek’u-qor teƛ-n
\g DEM1.SG easy thing be-QUOT Bilqisdi-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT money old-DEF man-POSS.LAT give-PST.UNW
\l "That's an easy thing.", said Bilqisdi and gave the old man all the money she had.

\t Žan bisno ik’in, łˤonon užibin tełäy boɣno, kʷaxatow ečruni žek’u xizor utin ayn.
\m ža-n b-is-n ik’i-n łˤono-n uži-bi-n teł-ay b-oɣ-n kʷaxa-tow ečru-ni žek’u xizor uti-n ay-n
\g DEM1.SG-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB three-TOP son-PL-TOP inside-IN.ABL I.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB quickly-EMPH old-DEF man back return-PFV.CVB come-PST.UNW
\l The old man took it and went away, freed his three sons and quickly came back.

\t Elay bitor yizi łenon sadaq hunix boqno.
\m ele-ay bitor yizi łeno-n sadaq huni-x b-oq-n
\g there-IN.ABL thither DEM2.IPL five-TOP together way-AD.ESS I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The five of them went on their way together, from there.

\t Bilq’isdis bercinłin rukayn, ečruni žek’us hič’č’a eženi užä nełqor eƛin, mi däx nexa yayƛin.
\m Bilq’isdi-s bercinłi-n r-ukad-n ečru-ni žek’u-s hič’č’a eže-ni uži-a neła-qor eƛi-n mi di-x nex-a y-ay-ƛin
\g Bilqisdi-GEN1 beauty-TOP IV-see-PFV.CVB old-DEF man-GEN1 the.most old-DEF son-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB you me-AD.ESS come-INF II-must-QUOT
\l When he saw Bilqisdi's beauty, the old man said to her: "You must come to me!"

\t Xizyogon oƛƛosini uži łic’oxno, debi baru yoł, yedu di yowa yayƛin.
\m xizyogon oƛƛo-si-ni uži łic’ox-n mi-s baru yoł yedu di y-ow-a y-ay-ƛin
\g then middle-ATTR-DEF son intervene-PST.UNW you-GEN1 wife be DEM2.IISG me II-marry-INF II-must-QUOT
\l Then the middle son intevened: "You have a wife, I have to marry her!"

\t Hič’č’a yeɣenigon hardizi oqa oqno, däx horoƛin.
\m hič’č’a y-eɣe-ni-gon hardizi oq-a oq-n di-x horo-ƛin
\g the.most II-young-DEF-CNTR request become-INF begin-PST.UNW me-AD.ESS come.IMPR-QUOT
\l Then the youngest one began to request: "Come to me!"

\t Hemełƛ’o hudu babiya žazaqor eƛin, meža ža nełaz ža ħala xec, koyiq yałru šinaw micxirno däqor neƛno, neła meži tusnaq’äy boɣsiƛin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ hudu babiw-a uži-bi-qor eƛi-n mežu-a ža neła-z ža ħal-a xeci kʷay-q yoł-ru šinaw micxir-n di-qor neƛ-n neła-a meži tusnaq’-ay b-oɣ-s-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS then father-ERG son-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 DEM1.SG condition-IN.ESS leave hand-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT every money-TOP me-POSS.LAT give-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you.PL prison-IN.ABL I.PL-take.away-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l After that the father then said to his sons: "Leave her in peace, she has given me all the money she had oh her hands and released you from prison."

\t Hudun žedu nełaƛ’ ƛ’iri butin ɣudi rayrno, elułäy sidxokin mi nexinč’inäy, bazaryarno yižin teƛa yołƛin.
\m hudun žedu neła-ƛ’ ƛ’iri b-uti-n ɣudi r-ayr-n elu-łay sida-x-kin mi nex-č’i-näy bazar-ar-n y-iži-n teƛ-a yoł-ƛin
\g nevertheless DEM1.IPL DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS on I.PL-turn-PFV.CVB day IV-bring-PFV.CVB we(I).OBL-CONT.ABL one.OBL-AD.ESS-even you come-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB bazar-IN.LAT-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB sell-INF be-QUOT
\l Nevertheless, they tortured her again: "If you don't marry any of us, we will take you to the market and sell you!"

\t Didurnokin yiła žedu sidxokin yik’anix roži teƛno anu, dey xediw yołƛin.
\m didur-n-kin yiła-a žedu sida-x-kin y-ik’i-ani-x roži teƛ-n anu di-s xediw yoł-ƛin
\g how-TOP-even DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL one.OBL-ADV-even II-go-MSD-AD.ESS word give-PFV.CVB be.NEG me-GEN1 husband be-QUOT
\l However she did not agree to go to anyone of them: "I have a husband."

\t Esnaza Bilq’isdi yižin gamiƛ’zoni žek’ur teƛno.
\m esyu-bi-a Bilq’isdi y-iži-n gama-ƛ’-z-ni žek’u-r teƛ-n
\g brother-PL-ERG Bilqisdi II-lead-PFV.CVB boat-SUPER.ESS-GEN2-DEF man-LAT sell-PST.UNW
\l The brothers took Bilqisdi and sold her to a sailor.

\t Gamiƛ’no zown baħna-bik’iƛ’orey, ža gamiƛ’osi žek’un, däx horoƛin, hemedurtow ƛ’iri utin.
\m gama-ƛ’-n zow-n b-aħna~ik’i-ƛ’oräy ža gama-ƛ’-si žek’u-n di-x horo-ƛin hemedur-tow ƛ’iri uti-n
\g boat-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB I.PL-walk.for.a.while-SIM.CVB DEM1.SG boat-SUPER.ESS-ATTR man-TOP me-AD.ESS come.IMPR-QUOT so-EMPH above turn-PST.UNW
\l When they were walking around on the boat, that sailor insisted again: "Come with me!"

\t Yiła nesiqorno eƛin, dey xediw yoł, žan ičin di q’ˤuyzix yik’a behizi yaqinč’iƛin.
\m yiła-a nesi-qor-n eƛi-n di-s xediw yoł ža-n iči-n di q’ˤuya-zo-x y-ik’i-a behizi y-oq-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PST.UNW me-GEN1 husband be DEM1.SG-TOP be-PFV.CVB me other-ATTR.OBL-AD.ESS II-go-INF permit II-become-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l She said to him: "I have a husband, and I won't be allowed to go to someone else."

\t Xizyo Bilq’isdä bazaryarno yik’in, ʕoloqzas šeƛ’un risno, xizor yutin iduɣorno nexno, žan šeƛ’un, maħor yoqno.
\m xizyo Bilq’isdi-a bazar-ar-n y-ik’i-n ʕoloq-bi-s šeƛ’u-n r-is-n xizor y-uti-n idu-ɣor-n nex-n ža-n šeƛ’u-n maħor y-oq-n
\g afterwards Bilqisdi-ERG bazar-IN.LAT-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB young.person-PL-GEN1 clothing-TOP IV-buy-PFV.CVB back II-return-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL-TOP come-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB outside II-become-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, Bilqisdi went to the market, bought men's clothings, came back home, put it on and went outside.

\t Raładyazay xizor utin ayzaƛ’or, yisir ža idu yesun anu.
\m raład-azay xizor uti-n ay-zaƛ’or yisi-r ža idu y-esu-n anu
\g sea-IN.ABL.DIST back return-PFV.CVB come-POST.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.SG home II-find-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l When he came back from the sea, he didn't find her at home.

\t Elay yoqno yik’in Bilq’isdi sida ʕaƛar yayn.
\m ele-ay y-oq-n y-ik’i-n Bilq’isdi sida ʕaƛ-ar y-ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL II-become-PFV.CVB II-go-PFV.CVB Bilqisdi one.OBL village-IN.LAT II-come-PST.UNW
\l From there Bilqisdi left and came to a village.

\t ʕAƛoł roƛo yałru mažgityoz akäzay sida žek’a Q’urʔan t’et’erxo yiłar teqno.
\m ʕaƛ-ł r-oƛƛo yoł-ru mažgit-z aki-azay sida žek’u-a Q’urʔan t’et’r-x yiła-r teq-n
\g village-CONT.ESS IV-middle be-PST.PRT mosque-GEN2 window-IN.ABL.DIST one.OBL man-ERG Qur'ân read-IPFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-LAT hear-PST.UNW
\l In the city center, out of the mosque's window she heard how a man was reading from the Qur'ân.

\t Baħarčä biłe salamno teƛno, yedu tełxor yoqno.
\m baħarči-a b-iłe salam-n teƛ-n yedu teł-xor y-oq-n
\g brave.young.man-ERG III-as greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG inside-AD.LAT II-become-PST.UNW
\l She greeted him like a young man and came inside.

\t Bilq’isdä nesiqor eƛin, mi Q’urʔan yaqino, där teqa retin didur mi ža t’et’erxoƛin.
\m Bilq’isdi-a nesi-qor eƛi-n mi Q’urʔan y-uqi-n di-r teq-a r-eti-n didur mi ža t’et’r-x-ƛin
\g Bilqisdi-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you Qur'ân II-close-PROHIB me-LAT hear-INF IV-want-PST.UNW how you DEM1.SG read-IPFV.CVB-QUOT
\l Bilqisdi said to him: "Don't close the Qur'ân, I want to hear you reading it."

\t Qˤaƛin Q’urʔan t’et’ra oqno dibir.
\m qˤaƛin Q’urʔan t’et’r-a oq-n dibir
\g loudly Qur'ân read-INF begin-PST.UNW imam
\l The imam began to read out the Qur'ân loudly.

\t Xizyo nełar nesis ɣalat’yabi riyn.
\m xizyo neła-r nesi-s ɣalat’-bi r-iy-n
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 mistake-PL IV.PL-know-PST.UNW
\l Then she knew his mistakes.

\t Däqor neƛƛin, yisno yiła Q’urʔan t’et’erƛ’oräy, haqa ogun ƛexun dibir, nesiq eƛa rožitow riqin anu.
\m di-qor neƛ-ƛin y-is-n yiła-a Q’urʔan t’et’r-ƛ’oräy haqu-a ogu-n ƛexu-n dibir nesi-q eƛi-a roži-tow r-iqi-n anu
\g me-POSS.LAT give-QUOT II-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG Qur'ân read-SIM.CVB mouth-IN.ESS gape-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB imam DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS say-INF word-EMPH IV-get-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l "Give me!", and she took the Qur'ân and while she read it, the imam stood there with an open mouth and couldn't say a word.

\t ƛirbas nediw bažarin bukayn, dibirä eƛin, yiła ʕaƛa xanłi roda ray debeqƛin.
\m ƛirba-s nediw bažari-n b-ukad-n dibir-a eƛi-n yiła ʕaƛ-a xanłi r-odi-a r-ay mi-q-ƛin
\g guest-GEN1 such skill-TOP III-see-PFV.CVB imam-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL village-IN.ESS khanship IV-do-INF IV-must you-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l Having seen this kind of skill of his guest, the imam said: "You must become king in this village!"

\t Bilq’isdä dibirqor eƛin, mežur di ʕaƛos xanłi rodan, žamaʕatyo di äƛiru łˤono šebin rodanix ƛ’iri risnäyƛin.
\m Bilq’isdi-a dibir-qor eƛi-n mežu-r di ʕaƛ-s xanłi r-odi-an žamaʕat-a di eƛi-ru łˤono šebin r-odi-ani-x ƛ’iri r-is-näy-ƛin
\g Bilqisdi-ERG imam-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-LAT me village-GEN1 khanship IV-do-FUT.DEF population-ERG me say-PST.PRT three thing IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS on IV-take-CND.CVB-QUOT
\l Bilqisdi said to the imam: "I will take over the kingship over the village for you all, if the population does the three things that I say."

\t Bilq’isdi xanłun xecanix žamaʕat razi boqno.
\m Bilq’isdi xan-łun xeci-ani-x žamaʕat razi b-oq-n
\g Bilqisdi khan-LHUN leave-MSD-AD.ESS population agree III-become-PST.UNW
\l The population agreed to let Bilqisdi become king.

\t Sosi däde puħor oc’ino q’ˤimakun yayr, q’ˤano äƛiru sidä sidde igot’a q’ˤano šudbin rič’o, łˤono äƛirugon där rigu ɣˤutkun rodoƛin.
\m sosi di-de pu-xor oc’ino q’ˤimaku-n y-ayr q’ˤano äƛiru sida-a sida-de igo-t’a q’ˤano šud-bi-n r-ič’i-o łˤono äƛiru-gon di-r r-igu ɣˤutku-n r-odi-o-ƛin
\g at.first me-APUD.ESS side-AD.LAT ten grown.up-TOP II-bring two ORD one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-APUD.ESS near-DISTR two grave-PL-TOP IV.PL-dig-IMPR three ORD-CNTR me-LAT IV-good house-TOP IV-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l "First, bring ten women to my side! Second, dig two graves, next to each other! And third, build me a good house!"

\t Žamaʕatyo bizin nełas ƛ’iri räsru šebinon rodin, Bilq’isdin žedus xanłun yičin.
\m žamaʕat-a b-izi-n neła-s ƛ’iri r-is-ru šebinon r-odi-n Bilq’isdi-n žedu-s xan-łun y-iči-n
\g population-ERG III-get-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 above IV-take-PST.PRT something IV-do-PFV.CVB Bilqisdi-TOP DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 khan-LHUN II-be-PST.UNW
\l The population did what she told them to do, and Bilqisdi became their king.

\t Xizyo yiła Allahqo harizi rodin, där žukłi radiru šinaw xalq’imos ozzałäy kanłi bisoƛƛin.
\m xizyo yiła-a Allah-q harizi r-odi-n di-r žukłi r-odi-ru šinaw xalq’i-s ozuri-bi-łay kanłi b-is-ƛ-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG God-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PST.UNW me-LAT evil IV-do-PST.PRT every people-GEN1 eye-PL-CONT.ABL light III-take-OPT-QUOT
\l Then she pleaded God: "May you take away the eyesight of everyone who did evil to me."

\t Bilq’isdis duʕan q’abul bodin, ozzataw oqno xediwn, xedyos esiwn, ža xanez madaxosini žek’un, eženis łˤonon užin, yedu teƛno zawruni gamiƛ’osi žek’un.
\m Bilq’isdi-s duʕa-n q’abul b-odi-n ozuri-bi-taw oq-n xediw-n xediw-s esiw-n ža xan-z ma-x-si-ni žek’u-n eže-ni-s łˤono-n uži-n yedu teƛ-n zow-ru-ni gama-ƛ’-si žek’u-n
\g Bilqisdi-GEN1 prayer-TOP receive III-do-PFV.CVB eye-PL-without become-PFV.CVB husband-and husband-GEN1 brother-and DEM1.SG khan-GEN2 gate-AD.ESS-ATTR-DEF man-and old-DEF-GEN1 three-TOP son-and DEM2.IISG sell-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF boat-SUPER.ESS-ATTR man-and
\l Bilqisdis prayer was received, the husband, the husband's brother, that king's guard, the three sons of the old man and the sailor to whom they sold her got blind.

\t Howži yiła naysinan riyrno, di ozurazas doxtur yołƛin.
\m howži yiła-a naysinan r-iyr-n di ozuri-bi-s doxtur yoł-ƛin
\g now DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG everywhere IV-explain-PST.UNW me eye-PL-GEN1 doctor be-QUOT
\l Now she explained everywhere: "I am an eye doctor."

\t Ža xabar šet’ur ʕaƛozałno bik’in.
\m ža xabar šet’ur ʕaƛ-bi-ł-n b-ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG story around village-PL-CONT.ESS-TOP III-go-PST.UNW
\l This story went through all the villages around.

\t Hič’č’a adäza yiłader gamiƛ’osini žek’u ayn.
\m hič’č’a adäza yiła-der gama-ƛ’-s-ni žek’u ay-n
\g the.most ahead DEM2.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT boat-SUPER.ESS-GEN1-DEF man come-PST.UNW
\l At first came the sailor to her.

\t Adäza q’ˤidan ičirno Bilq’isdä nesiq esirno, howła ɣudzał mi meq’aw šebin rodäsi zowwäƛin.
\m adäza q’ˤida-n iči-r-n Bilq’isdi-a nesi-q esir-n howła ɣudi-bi-ł mi meq’aw šebin r-odi-asi zow-ya-ƛin
\g ahead down-TOP sit-CAUS-PFV.CVB Bilqisdi-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW DEM3.IISG.OBL day-PL-CONT.ESS you wrong thing IV-do-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l Bilqisdi sat him down before her and asked him: "Have you done wrong things in these days?"

\t Zownč’uƛin, eƛin gamiƛ’ozoni žek’a.
\m zow-č’u-ƛin eƛi-n gama-ƛ’-z-ni žek’u-a
\g be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW boat-SUPER.ESS-GEN2-DEF man-ERG
\l "I haven't.", said the sailor.

\t Ruyxor mi esinč’inäy deber daru buyxor c’axinč’iƛin yiła eƛinosi, esin yisä yiłałno nesiłno raqru łinałäyn.
\m r-uy-xor mi esi-č’i-näy mi-r daru b-uy-xor c’ox-č’i-ƛin yiła-a eƛi-nosi esi-n yisi-a yiła-ł-n nesi-ł-n r-oq-ru łina-łay-n
\g IV-true-AD.LAT you tell-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB you-LAT medicine III-true-AD.LAT match-NEG.FUT.CVB-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-ANT.CVB tell-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-TOP IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP
\l When she said that the medicine won't have an effect if he doesn't tell the truth, he told her what had happened to him.

\t Ozurazaq reƛ’an riħin egirno yiła yeda, kʷaxatow debez ozzar č’ura rukayƛin.
\m ozuri-bi-q reƛ’a-n r-iħi-n egir-n yiła-a yeda kʷaxa-tow mi-z ozuri-bi-r č’ura r-ukad-ƛin
\g eye-PL-POSS.ESS hand-TOP IV-smear-PFV.CVB send-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG soon-EMPH you-GEN2 eye-PL-LAT light IV-see-QUOT
\l She lead her hands over his eyes and sent him away: "Soon your eyes are going to see the light again."

\t Allahzo ħalk’ołiƛ’aza ɣˤutkoxor ayzaƛ’ortow gamiƛ’ozoni žek’uz ozzałer č’ura rayn.
\m Allah-z ħalk’ołi-ƛ’aza ɣˤutku-xor ay-zaƛ’or-tow gama-ƛ’-z-ni žek’u-z ozuri-bi-łer č’ura r-ay-n
\g God-GEN2 might-SUPER.VERS.DIST house-AD.LAT come-POST.CVB-EMPH boat-SUPER.ESS-GEN2-DEF man-GEN2 eye-PL-CONT.LAT light IV-come-PST.UNW
\l Through Allah's might, the light came back to the sailor's eyes even before he had come to his house.

\t Xizyogon Bilq’isdider nesi eženis łˤonon užibin bayn, xanez madaxosini žek’un, nełastow xediwn, xedyosgon esiwn.
\m xizyogon Bilq’isdi-der nesi eže-ni-s łˤono-n uži-bi-n b-ay-n xan-z ma-x-si-ni žek’u-n neła-s-tow xediw-n xediw-s-gon esiw-n
\g then Bilqisdi-APUD.LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL old-DEF-GEN1 three-TOP son-PL-and I.PL-come-PST.UNW khan-GEN2 gate-AD.ESS-ATTR-DEF man-and DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-EMPH husband-and husband-GEN1-CNTR brother-and
\l Then to Bilqisdi came the three sons of the old man, and the king's guard, her husband and her husband's brother.

\t Badiru daru baqinč’iƛin Bilq’isdä nesi eženi žek’us łˤonon užibi muk’urno boyrerno, buyxor xabarno esirerno žeduq.
\m b-odi-ru daru b-oq-č’i-ƛin Bilq’isdi-a nesi eže-ni žek’u-s łˤono-n uži-bi muk’ur-n b-odi-r-r-n b-uy-xor xabar-n esir-r-n žedu-q
\g III-do-PST.PRT medicine III-become-NEG.FUT-QUOT Bilqisdi-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL old-DEF man-GEN1 three-TOP son-PL confess-TOP I.PL-do-CAUS-CAUS-PFV.CVB III-true-AD.LAT story-TOP ask-CAUS-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS
\l "(Otherwise) the medication won't work.", Bilqisdi made the old man's three sons confess and made them tell the true story.

\t Sosisi esinč’eyn bičin, xizaɣor esin, sis bercinaw ɣˤanabi ela gamiƛ’ozoni žek’ur teƛsiƛin.
\m sosi-si esi-č’ey-n b-iči-n xizaɣor esi-n sis bercinaw ɣˤanabi elu-a gama-ƛ’-z-ni žek’u-r teƛ-s-ƛin
\g at.first-ATTR tell-NEG.PST.CVB-and I.PL-remain-PFV.CVB finally tell-PST.UNW one beautiful woman we(I).OBL-ERG boat-SUPER.ESS-GEN2-DEF man-LAT sell-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l At first they didn't tell, but finally they told: "We sold a beautiful woman to a sailor."

\t Ozzaq reƛ’ibin riħin, č’uran rukarerno, Bilq’isdä žedu xizor begirno.
\m ozuri-bi-q reƛ’a-bi-n r-iħi-n č’ura-n r-ukar-r-n Bilq’isdi-a žedu xizor b-egir-n
\g eye-PL-POSS.ESS hand-PL-TOP IV.PL-smear-PFV.CVB light-TOP IV-show-CAUS-PFV.CVB Bilqisdi-ERG DEM1.IPL back I.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l Bilqisdi put her hands over their eyes and caused them to see the light, then she sent them back.

\t Žigoƛ’ay nełader xanez madaxosini žek’u ayn.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay neła-der xan-z ma-x-si-ni žek’u ay-n
\g now-SUPER.ABL DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT khan-GEN2 gate-AD.ESS-ATTR-DEF man come-PST.UNW
\l This time the king's guard came to her.

\t Lamusyoq esinč’eyn ičin, xizyo nesän esin, sida bercinaw ɣˤanazar di rek’ bodäsi zows, däx horoƛin di eƛinosi, dey xediw yołƛin neła där roži neƛinč’izaƛ’.
\m lamus-q esi-č’ey-n iči-n xizyo nesi-a-n esi-n sida bercinaw ɣˤanabi-r di rek’ b-odi-asi zow-s di-x horo-ƛin di eƛi-nosi di-s xediw yoł-ƛin neła-a di-r roži neƛ-č’i-zaƛ’
\g shame-POSS.ESS tell-NEG.PST.CVB-and be-PFV.CVB afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP tell-PST.UNW one.OBL beautiful woman-LAT me trick III-do-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT me-AD.ESS come.IMPR-QUOT me say-ANT.CVB me-GEN1 husband be-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG me-LAT word give-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB
\l He was too ashamed to tell, but then he told: "I played a trick on one beautiful woman, because she said she already had a husband and didn't give me her word when I asked her to marry me.

\t Nełar žukłi roda retizaƛ’, di xaner hič’č’a betixozoni gulus maħin reč’no, qˤirič’ nełaz mežiƛ ruqˤsi, nełƛ’or rutiraniƛäy.
\m neła-r žukłi r-odi-a r-eti-zaƛ’ di xan-r hič’č’a b-eti-xozo-ni gulu-s maħi-n r-eč’-n qˤirič’ neła-z muži-ƛ r-uqˤi-s neła-ƛ’or r-utir-ani-ƛay
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT evil IV-do-INF IV-want-CSL.CVB me khan-LAT the.most III-love-PRS.PRT.OBL-DEF horse-GEN1 tail-TOP IV-cut-PFV.CVB scissors DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 mattress-SUB.ESS IV-hide-PST.WIT DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT IV-turn-MSD-SUB.ABL
\l Because I wanted to harm her, I cut off the tail of the king's most beloved horse and hid the scissors under her mattress, so it would turn onto her.

\t Xizyo xanä ža iday maħor yoxirsiƛin.
\m xizyo xan-a ža idu-ay maħor y-oxir-s-ƛin
\g afterwards khan-ERG DEM1.SG home-IN.ABL outside II-chase-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l After that, the king chased her out of his home."

\t Howžäy soder nediw šebin radinƛin, reƛ’an ozzaq riħin č’uran rukarerno, Bilq’isdä ža maħor egirno.
\m howži-ay soder nediw šebin r-odi-n-ƛin reƛ’a-n ozuri-bi-q r-iħi-n č’ura-n r-ukar-r-n Bilq’isdi-a ža maħor egir-n
\g now-IN.ABL after such thing IV-do-PROHIB-QUOT hand-TOP eye-PL-POSS.ESS IV-smear-PFV.CVB light-TOP IV-show-CAUS-PFV.CVB Bilqisdi-ERG DEM1.SG outside send-PST.UNW
\l "From now on, don't do such things anymore!", Bilqisdi put her hands onto his eyes, gave him back his eyelight and sent him outside.

\t Howži tełxorno goƛ’in, neła nełaz xediwqor yiła eƛin, howła xizaɣorzo zamanał deber baqru q’ʷariłiłäy mi däq esoƛin.
\m howži teł-xor-n goƛ’i-n neła-a neła-z xediw-qor yiła-a eƛi-n howła xizaɣor-zo zaman-ł mi-r b-oq-ru q’ʷariłi-łay mi di-q esi-o-ƛin
\g now inside-AD.LAT-TOP invite-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 husband-POSS.LAT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM3.IISG.OBL finally-ATTR.OBL time-CONT.ESS you-LAT III-happen-PST.PRT sadness-CONT.ABL you me-POSS.ESS tell-IMPR-QUOT
\l Now she invited her own husband in and said: "Tell me about the bad things that had happened to you lately?"

\t Xediya eƛin, di saparyox ik’in xizor utin ayzaƛ’or, iday baru där gugäsi yesusƛin.
\m xediw-a eƛi-n di sapar-x ik’i-n xizor uti-n ay-zaƛ’or idu-ay baru di-r gugi-asi y-esu-s-ƛin
\g husband-ERG say-PST.UNW me journey-AD.ESS go-PFV.CVB back return-PFV.CVB come-POST.CVB home-IN.ABL wife me-LAT escape-RES.PRT II-find-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The husband said: "Before I came back from a journey, I found my wife had escaped from my home."

\t Ozzałer č’uran rayrerno, yiła xediw howlotow ičirno.
\m ozuri-bi-łer č’ura-n r-ayr-r-n yiła-a xediw howlo-tow iči-r-n
\g eye-PL-CONT.LAT light-TOP IV-bring-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG husband there-EMPH wait-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l She brought the light back to his eyes but let her husband wait there.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo xedyos esiw tełer ayn.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo xediw-s esiw tełer ay-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after husband-GEN1 brother to.the.inside come-PST.UNW
\l After that, the husband's brother came inside.

\t Elo teł esiw esuzaƛ’, roda šebin łaħin ƛexun yeda.
\m elo teł esiw esu-zaƛ’ r-odi-a šebi-n łaħi-n ƛexu-n yeda
\g there inside brother find-CSL.CVB IV-do-INF what-TOP forget-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG
\l When he found his brother inside there, he didn't know what to do.

\t Howži Bilq’isdä nesiq esirno, howła xizaɣorzo zamanał mi łarnokin žukłi rodäsi zowwäƛin.
\m howži Bilq’isdi-a nesi-q esir-n howła xizaɣor-zo zaman-ł mi ła-r-n-kin žukłi r-odi-asi zow-ya-ƛin
\g now Bilqisdi-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW DEM3.IISG.OBL finally-ATTR.OBL time-CONT.ESS you who.OBL-LAT-TOP-even evil IV-do-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l Now Bilqisdi asked him: "Have you done anything evil to anyone lately?"

\t Zownč’uƛin, et’un k’oƛin ičin xedyos esiw.
\m zow-č’u-ƛin et’u-n k’oƛi-n iči-n xediw-s esiw
\g be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT jump-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB be-PST.UNW husband-GEN1 brother
\l "No, I haven't.", said the husband's brother jumping(?).

\t Xizyo diwanbegä ħukmun beč’no, ža eč’izad yexursiƛin.
\m xizyo diwanbeg-a ħukmu-n b-eč’-n ža eč’i-bi-d y-exur-s-ƛin
\g afterwards judge-ERG decision-TOP III-cut-PST.UNW DEM1.SG pebble-PL-INSTR II-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Then the judge made the decision that she was to be killed by stoning."

\t Hemełƛ’o ozzaq reƛ’an riħin, xedyoz esiwq Bilq’isdä č’ura rukarerno.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ ozuri-bi-q reƛ’a-n r-iħi-n xediw-z esiw-q Bilq’isdi-a č’ura r-ukar-r-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS eye-PL-POSS.ESS hand-TOP IV-smear-PFV.CVB husband-GEN2 brother-POSS.ESS Bilqisdi-ERG light IV-show-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l Thereupon, Bilqisdi laid her hand on his eyes and restored the eyesight for her husband's brother.

\t Xediwqorno eƛin yiła, yeda t’o ʕaƛay maħor oxirƛin.
\m xediw-qor-n eƛi-n yiła-a yeda t’o ʕaƛ-ay maħor oxir-ƛin
\g husband-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG here village-IN.ABL outside chase-QUOT
\l And she said to her husband: "Chase him out of the village here!"

\t Elo xediwn xecin maħor oqƛ’oräy, Bilq’isdä nesiqor eƛin, deber rac’anixno, ħaƛnixno t’o ʕeziyaw šebin yoł, di yayace t’ay äk’inƛin.
\m elo xediw-n xeci-n maħor oq-ƛ’oräy Bilq’isdi-a nesi-qor eƛi-n mi-r r-ac’-ani-x-n ħaƛu-ni-x-n t’o ʕeziyaw šebin yoł di y-ay-ace t’ay ik’i-n-ƛin
\g there husband-TOP leave-PFV.CVB outside become-SIM.CVB Bilqisdi-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you-LAT IV-eat-MSD-AD.ESS-TOP drink-DEF-AD.ESS-TOP here many thing be me II-come-TERM from.here go-PROHIB-QUOT
\l She left the husband there and while she went outside, Bilqisdi said to him: "There is a lot to eat and drink for you here, do not go away until I come back!"

\t Yiłade sadaq idu zawruni kidbabin roɣno yedu maħor yoqno.
\m yiła-de sadaq idu zow-ru-ni kid-bi-n r-oɣ-n yedu maħor y-oq-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS with home be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF girl-PL-TOP II.PL-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG outside II-become-PST.UNW
\l She went outside and took the girls with her that were at home with her.

\t Sasiłace yaħna-yik’ix madazaħno yičin, xizor yutin idur yaynosi, žeda kidbazaqor yiła eƛin, howžär di mežar užiłun zows, amma di kid yołƛin.
\m sasił-ace y-aħna~ik’i-x ma-bi-x-n y-iči-n xizor y-uti-n idu-r y-ay-nosi žeda kid-bi-qor yiła-a eƛi-n howži-ar di meža-r uži-łun zow-s amma di kid yoł-ƛin
\g get.dark-TERM II-walk.for.a.while-IPFV.CVB outside-PL-AD.ESS-TOP II-be-PFV.CVB back II-return-PFV.CVB home-LAT II-come-ANT.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL girl-PL-POSS.LAT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW now-IN.LAT me you(II-LAT boy-LHUN be.NPRS-PST.WIT but me girl be-QUOT
\l Until it got dark she was outside walking around, and after she came back home, she said to those girls: "Until now I was a boy for you, but I am a girl."

\t Xizyo Bilq’isdä ƛ’iräy k’ukno boɣno, bexorani neła nełas žežun bukarno, žedaqorno eƛin, howži meži iduzaɣor rik’iƛin, xizor žedun regirno.
\m xizyo Bilq’isdi-a ƛ’iräy k’uk-n b-oɣ-n bexora-ni neła-a neła-s žežu-n b-ukar-n žeda-qor-n eƛi-n howži meži idu-bi-ɣor r-ik’i-ƛin xizor žedu-n r-egir-n
\g afterwards Bilqisdi-ERG from.above cap-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB lengthy-DEF DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 ponytail-TOP III-show-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB now you.PL home-PL-IN.ALL II.PL-go-QUOT back DEM1.IIPL-TOP II.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l Then Bilqisdi took off her cap, showed her long ponytail and said to them: "Now go to your homes.", and she sent them back.

\t Xediw yałru ɣˤutkaɣorno yik’in, nesiqorno eƛin yiła, di debi baru Bilq’isdi yołƛin.
\m xediw yoł-ru ɣˤutku-aɣor-n y-ik’i-n nesi-qor-n eƛi-n yiła-a di mi-s baru Bilq’isdi yoł-ƛin
\g husband be-PST.PRT house-IN.VERS-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG me you-GEN1 wife Bilqisdi be-QUOT
\l She went to the house where the husband was and said to him: "I am your wife Bilqisdi."

\t Xizyo ɣˤanazas šeƛ’un šeƛ’un, nesidäɣorno yik’in, sasaqor sadaq ɣudi qˤaširno.
\m xizyo ɣˤanabi-s šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n nesi-däɣor-n y-ik’i-n sasaq-qor sadaq ɣudi qˤašir-n
\g afterwards woman-GEN1 clothing-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.VERS-TOP II-go-PFV.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT together day dawn-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards she put on woman's clothings, went to him and they stayed together until in the morning the day dawned.

\t Sasaqosi moƛaxay yizinosi, Bilq’isdä Allahqo harizi rodin, eli q’ˤanon debi laɣbi deber betixozołäysi besunäy, howt’otow elus ruħ boɣoƛin.
\m sasaqosi moƛu-xay y-izi-nosi Bilq’isdi-a Allah-q harizi r-odi-n eli q’ˤano-n mi-s laɣ-bi mi-r b-eti-x-zo-łay-si b-esu-näy howt’o-tow elu-s ruħ b-oɣ-o-ƛin
\g in.the.morning sleep-AD.ABL II-get.up-ANT.CVB Bilqisdi-ERG God-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PST.UNW we two-TOP you-GEN1 slave-PL you-LAT I.PL-love-IPFV.CVB-ATTR.OBL-CONT.ABL-ATTR I.PL-appear-CND.CVB here-EMPH we(I).OBL-GEN1 soul III-take.away-IMPR-QUOT
\l In the morning, when she got up from her sleep, Bilqisdi prayed to Allah: "If we two are not among the slaves you love, then take our souls right here!"

\t Allahes q’adar nediw boqzaƛ’, žedu q’ˤanon sadaq, Bilq’isdin xediwn, howlotown bexun.
\m Allah-s q’adar nediw b-oq-zaƛ’ žedu q’ˤano-n sadaq Bilq’isdi-n xediw-n howlo-tow-n b-exu-n
\g God-GEN1 fate such III-happen-CSL.CVB DEM1.IPL two-TOP together Bilqisdi-and husband-and there-EMPH-TOP I.PL-die-PST.UNW
\l And because Allah's fate was such that the two of them, Bilqisdi and her husband, died there together.

\t Adäztown rič’in zawru šuda teł žedun šušin.
\m adäz-tow-n r-ič’i-n zow-ru šuda-a teł žedu-n šuši-n
\g before-EMPH-TOP IV-dig-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT graveyard-IN.ESS inside DEM1.IPL-TOP bury-PST.UNW
\l And they were buried in the grave they had digged before.

\t ʕAƛos ahli ziyaratyoƛ’t’a xizyo bik’ix zown žeduz šudaƛ’or.
\m ʕaƛ-s ahli ziyarat-ƛ’-t’a xizyo b-ik’i-x zow-n žedu-z šuda-ƛ’or
\g village-GEN1 people visit-SUPER.ESS-DISTR after I.PL-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 graveyard-SUPER.LAT
\l And the people of the village were coming to visit their grave.

\t Zownƛax, zown anuƛax sis giħono xan.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis giħono xan
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG-QUOT one cruel khan
\l Once upon a time there was a cruel king.

\t Nesis sis bercinaw, q’ˤimaku yoqäsi kid zownƛax.
\m nesi-s sis bercinaw q’ˤimaku y-oq-asi kid zow-n-ƛax
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 one beautiful grown.up II-become-RES.PRT daughter be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l He had a beautiful, grown-up daughter.

\t Žek’u iziłxanuzo sida osiw ezä tełno yičirno, q’ˤida mečoƛ’ortown yegirinč’ey ža xanä kikix zown.
\m žek’u izi-ł-xanuzo sida osiw ez-a teł-n y-iči-r-n q’ˤida moči-ƛ’or-tow-n y-egir-č’ey ža xan-a kiki-x zow-n
\g man get.up-POT-NEG.PRS.PRT.OBL one.OBL high fortress-IN.ESS inside-TOP II-live-CAUS-PFV.CVB down place-SUPER.LAT-EMPH-TOP II-let-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.SG khan-ERG feed-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The king forced her to live inside a high fortress that was impossible for people to get into, and he fed her without letting her come to any lower places,

\t Xanes q’ˤanoqu ʕaq’lu boyxosi žek’u zown.
\m xan-s q’ˤanoqu ʕaq’lu b-odi-xosi žek’u zow-n
\g khan-GEN1 forty advice III-do-PRS.PRT man be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The king had 40 advisors.

\t Žeduł tełäy hič’č’a ʕaq’ilawƛin ci rik’äsi zown Kusaƛin ci yołäsi sida wizirłäy.
\m žedu-ł teł-ay hič’č’a ʕaq’ilaw-ƛin ci r-ik’i-asi zow-n Kusa-ƛin ci yoł-asi sida wizir-łay
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside-IN.ABL the.most intelligent-QUOT name IV-go-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB Kusa-QUOT name be-RES.PRT one.OBL vizier-CONT.ABL
\l Among them, the one who was famous as the most intelligent was a vizier with the name Kusa.

\t Sida quł hemedur žedu butiräsi yałzay, xanä sis ʕabasin cuƛer kurno eƛin, k’ešonad mi, pakmos ʕabasi, hudun debeq siskin šebin raqinč’iƛin.
\m sida qu-ł hemedur žedu b-utir-asi yoł-zay xan-a sis ʕabasi-n cuƛer kur-n eƛi-n k’ešonad mi pak-s ʕabasi hudun mi-q siskin šebin r-oq-č’i-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS so DEM1.IPL I.PL-gather-RES.PRT be-SIM.CVB khan-ERG one coin-TOP upward throw-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW play you copper-GEN1 coin nevertheless you-POSS.ESS any thing IV-become-NEG.FUT.CVB-QUOT
\l One day, when they were gathered again, the king threw a coin up and said: "Play, copper coin, you will not become anything anyway!"

\t Kusa urɣizi oqno, šida ža ʕabasi yaqˤuł nesä cuƛer kuräƛin, hudun nesir nełas maʕnatow biyn anu.
\m Kusa urɣizi oq-n šida ža ʕabasi yaqˤuł nesi-a cuƛer kur-a-ƛin hudun nesi-r neła-s maʕna-tow b-iy-n anu
\g Kusa thinking become-PFV.CVB why DEM1.SG coin today DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG upward throw-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT nevertheless DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 sense-EMPH III-know-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l Kusa thought: "Why did he throw that coin up today?", nevertheless he could not know its sense.

\t K’oxäƛirun ʕaq’lus xalq’i butirnosi, xanä cuƛer ʕabasin kurno hemedurtow eƛin, k’ešonad mi, pakmos ʕabasi, łinarnotow hunarno anu debi, siskin šebinon deber roda koƛ’ixanuƛin.
\m k’ox-äƛiru-n ʕaq’lu-s xalq’i b-utir-nosi xan-a cuƛer ʕabasi-n kur-n hemedur-tow eƛi-n k’ešonad mi pak-s ʕabasi łina-r-n-tow hunar-n anu mi-s siskin šebinon mi-r r-odi-a koƛ’i-x-anu-ƛin
\g twice-ORD-TOP advice-GEN1 people I.PL-gather-ANT.CVB khan-ERG upward coin-TOP throw-PFV.CVB so-EMPH say-PST.UNW play you copper-GEN1 coin what.OBL-LAT-TOP-EMPH talent-TOP be.NEG you-GEN1 any something you-LAT IV-do-INF understand.to-PRS-NEG-QUOT
\l The second time the king gathered his advisors, he also threw a coin up and said likewise: "Play, copper coin, you have no talent to whatsoever, you don't know what to do!"

\t Žigoƛ’ayn Kusa urɣizi oqno, šebitowey yiłas maʕna boqxoƛin, hudun yisiz q’ˤimłer šebintow rik’in anu.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-n Kusa urɣizi oq-n šebi-tow-ey yiła-s maʕna b-oq-x-ƛin hudun yisi-z q’ˤim-łer šebin-tow r-ik’i-n anu
\g now-SUPER.ABL-and Kusa thinking become-PFV.CVB what-EMPH-DUB DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 sense III-become-PRS-QUOT nevertheless DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 head-CONT.LAT thing-EMPH IV-go-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l And also now Kusa was thinking: "What sense does this make?", but nothing came into his head.

\t Łoxäƛirugon xanä ʕaq’lus xalq’i sadaqor butirnosi, Kusa mesedyos ʕabasin yižin elor ik’in.
\m łox-äƛiru-gon xan-a ʕaq’lu-s xalq’i sadaq-r b-utir-nosi Kusa mesed-s ʕabasi-n y-iži-n elo-r ik’i-n
\g thrice-ORD-CNTR khan-ERG advice-GEN1 people together-LAT I.PL-gather-ANT.CVB Kusa gold-GEN1 coin-TOP II-carry-PFV.CVB there-LAT go-PST.UNW
\l When the king gathered his advisors for the third time, Kusa carried a golden coin with himself.

\t Xanä hemedurtow pakmos ʕabasin cuƛer kurno eƛinosi, Kusagon mesedyos ʕabasin cuƛer kurno eƛin, k’ešonad mi, mesedyos ʕabasi, dunyalƛ’o debeq roqxanusi šebintow anuƛin.
\m xan-a hemedur-tow pak-s ʕabasi-n cuƛer kur-n eƛi-nosi Kusa-gon mesed-s ʕabasi-n cuƛer kur-n eƛi-n k’ešonad mi mesed-s ʕabasi dunyal-ƛ’ mi-q r-oq-xanusi šebin-tow anu-ƛin
\g khan-ERG so-EMPH copper-GEN1 coin-TOP upward throw-PFV.CVB say-ANT.CVB Kusa-CNTR gold-GEN1 coin-TOP upward throw-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW play you gold-GEN1 coin world-SUPER.ESS you-POSS.ESS IV-become-NEG.PRS.PRT thing-EMPH be.NEG-QUOT
\l When the king threw the copper coin upward and said his phrase, Kusa threw up the golden coin up and said: "Play, golden coin, there is nothing in the world that you couldn't become!"

\t Kusas ža xabar täqruntow, q’ˤuyasi ʕaq’lus xalq’in maħor begirno, xanä nesiq esirno, šida mi mesedyos ɣurušno cuƛer kurno, nedur eƛäƛin.
\m Kusa-s ža xabar teq-run-tow q’ˤuya-si ʕaq’lu-s xalq’i-n maħor b-egir-n xan-a nesi-q esir-n šida mi mesed-s ɣˤuruš-n cuƛer kur-n nedur eƛi-a-ƛin
\g Kusa-GEN1 DEM1.SG story hear-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH other-ATTR advice-GEN1 people-TOP outside I.PL-send-PFV.CVB khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW why you gold-GEN1 ruble-TOP upward throw-PFV.CVB so say-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l When he heard what Kusa said, the king immediately sent the other advisors outside and asked him: "Why did you throw a golden ruble up and said this?"

\t Kusa nesir žawab teƛno, mesedyoz ʕabasä royxanusi šebintow roqinč’izaƛ’ƛin.
\m Kusa nesi-r žawab teƛ-n mesed-z ʕabasi-a r-odi-xanusi šebin-tow r-oq-č’i-zaƛ’-ƛin
\g Kusa DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT answer give-PST.UNW gold-GEN2 coin-ERG IV-do-NEG.PRS.PRT thing-EMPH IV-become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB-QUOT
\l Kusa answered him: "There is nothing that a gold coin couldn't do."

\t Xizyogon nesä xanqo esirno, hudu mi šida eƛa, k’ešonad mi, pakmos ʕabasi, debeq hudun siskin šebin roqxanuƛin.
\m xizyogon nesi-a xan-q esir-n hudu mi šida eƛi-a k’ešonad mi pak-s ʕabasi mi-q hudun siskin šebin r-oq-x-anu-ƛin
\g then DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG khan-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW so you why say-PST.WIT.INT play you copper-GEN1 coin you-POSS.ESS nevertheless any thing IV-become-PRS-NEG-QUOT
\l Then he asked the king: "So why did you say: 'Play, copper coin, nothing can become of you anyway!'?"

\t Xanä eƛin, osiw ezä teł yałru däz kidbeder ik’iłxo oqinč’izaƛ’ dicego baq’ˤu micxir yałru žek’ukin.
\m xan-a eƛi-n osiw ez-a teł yoł-ru di-z kid-der ik’i-ł-x oq-č’i-zaƛ’ dice-go b-aq’ˤu micxir yoł-ru žek’u-kin
\g khan-ERG say-PST.UNW high fortress-IN.ESS inside be-PST.PRT me-GEN2 daughter-APUD.LAT go-POT-PRS become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB how.much-COND III-much money be-PST.PRT man-even
\l The king said: "No matter how much money a man has, he cannot go to my daughter who is inside the high fortress."

\t Kusa eƛin, baq’ˤu micxir boqnäyƛa, qalamäɣorno izin, ik’an di nełdäɣorƛin.
\m Kusa-a eƛi-n b-aq’ˤu micxir b-oq-näy-ƛa qala-aɣor-n izi-n ik’i-an di neła-däɣor-ƛin
\g Kusa-ERG say-PST.UNW III-much money III-become-CND.CVB-INDEF fortress-IN.VERS-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB go-FUT.DEF me DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.VERS-QUOT
\l Kusa said: "If I had a lot of money, I would go up into the fortress to her."

\t Howži hudu xanä nesiqor eƛin, nedur resunäy, hi, enda micxir beč’xosi kesun biso, iłira becider mi nełdär ezäɣor izinč’inäy, debi di meč’ beč’a yołƛin.
\m howži hudu xan-a nesi-qor eƛi-n nedur r-esu-näy hi enda micxir b-eč’-x-si kesu-n b-is-o iłira buci-der mi neła-dar ez-aɣor izi-č’i-näy mi-s di meč’ b-eč’-a yoł-ƛin
\g now then khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW so IV-find-CND.CVB take.IMP DEM3b.SG money III-cut-IPFV.CVB-ATTR form-TOP III-take-IMPR six.OBL month-APUD.LAT you DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.VERS fortress-IN.VERS get.up-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB you-GEN1 me neck III-cut-INF be-QUOT
\l Then the king said to him: "If that's the case, here, take the coining form, and if you haven't gotten up the fortress to her within six months, I will cut off your neck."

\t Micxir beč’xosi kesun bisno, Kusa iduɣor ik’in.
\m micxir b-eč’-x-si kesu-n b-is-n Kusa idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g money III-cut-IPFV.CVB-ATTR form-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB Kusa home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l Having taken the coining form, he went home.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder raq’ˤu saɣyatyabi nesä xanez kidber regirno.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder r-aq’ˤu saɣyat-bi nesi-a xan-z kid-r r-egir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after III.PL-many present-PL DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG khan-GEN2 daughter-LAT III.PL-send-PST.UNW
\l After that he sent many presents to the king's daughter.

\t Šebigon nesä royłin, nełade igor qalamär yeda didurnokin egin anu.
\m šebi-gon nesi-a r-odi-łin neła-de igo-r qala-ar yeda didur-n-kin egi-n anu
\g what-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG IV-do-CNC.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS near-LAT fortress-IN.LAT DEM2.ISG how-TOP-even go.into-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l But no matter what he did, he didn't get into fortress near her.

\t Hemedur nesiq łˤono buci bik’in.
\m hemedur nesi-q łˤono buci b-ik’i-n
\g so DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS three month III-go-PST.UNW
\l And so three months passed for him.

\t Sida quł sasaqaza Kusa istolowäy išxo zown.
\m sida qu-ł sasaq-aza Kusa istolow-ay iš-x zow-n
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS in.the.morning-IN.VERS.DIST Kusa dining.room-IN.ABL eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l One day in the morning, Kusa was eating in the dining room.

\t Nesił adäza anusi šebintow zown anu, hudun nesiq elay risno siskin šebin rac’ełxo zown anu hemedur yeda yałzay elor łˤonon esnabi bayn.
\m nesi-ł adäza anu-si šebin-tow zow-n anu hudun nesi-q ele-ay r-is-n siskin šebin r-ac’-ł-x zow-n anu hemedur yeda yoł-zay elo-r łˤono-n esyu-bi b-ay-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS before be.NEG-ATTR thing-EMPH be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG nevertheless DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS there-IN.ABL IV-take-PFV.CVB any thing IV-eat-POT-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG so DEM2.ISG be-SIM.CVB there-LAT three-TOP brother-PL I.PL-come-PST.UNW
\l No matter what he had before himself, he couldn't take and eat anything; meanwhile three brothers came there.

\t Beže maxšel yołäsi esnabi zownƛax žedu.
\m b-eže maxšel yoł-asi esyu-bi zow-n-ƛax žedu
\g III-big skill be-RES.PRT brother-PL be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT DEM1.IPL
\l There were brothers with great skills, it is said.

\t Elo bišanixƛin q’ˤida bičinosi žedus Kusaƛ’ ozuri c’oxno.
\m elo b-iš-ani-x-ƛin q’ˤida b-iči-nosi žedu-s Kusa-ƛ’ ozuri c’ox-n
\g there I.PL-eat-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT down I.PL-sit-ANT.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 Kusa-SUPER.ESS eye meet-PST.UNW
\l After they sat down in order to eat, their eyes fell on Kusa.

\t Ħayran boqno yizä sidä sidqor eƛin, eloš nesi žek’uł adäza anusi šebinonwa anu, hudun nesiq łinaƛ’orkin reƛ’a regirełxanuwaƛin.
\m ħayran b-oq-n yizi-a sida-a sida-qor eƛi-n eloš nesi žek’u-ł adäza anu-si šebinon-a anu hudun nesi-q łina-ƛ’or-kin reƛ’a r-egir-ł-x-anu-a-ƛin
\g be.astonished I.PL-become-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL-ERG one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW over.there DEM1.ISG.OBL man-CONT.ESS before be.NEG-ATTR something-Q be.NEG nevertheless DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS what.OBL-SUPER.LAT-even hand IV-let-POT-PRS-NEG-Q-QUOT
\l They were surprised and talked among each other: "Isn't there everything possible on the table, but he nevertheless can't let his hand to any of it?"

\t Eɣeni esiya eƛin, horo igorno ik’in esiran nesiq di, šebi debeƛ’ necetow q’ʷariłi yołƛin.
\m eɣe-ni esyu-a eƛi-n horo igo-r-n ik’i-n esir-an nesi-q di šebi mi-ƛ’ nece-tow q’ʷariłi yoł-ƛin
\g young-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW come.IMPR near-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB ask-FUT.DEF DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS me what you-SUPER.ESS so.much-EMPH sadness be-QUOT
\l The younger brother said: "Come, I'll go to him and will ask what's wrong with him."

\t Eženi esiya eč’erno ža, beže mečoƛ’ eynoyxosi žek’u äsu yeda, mi iłeniqor ža uykin xabaryaynč’iƛin.
\m eže-ni esyu-a eč’er-n ža b-eže moči-ƛ’ eynod-xosi žek’u esu yeda mi iłe-ni-qor ža uy-kin xabaryad-č’i-ƛin
\g old-DEF brother-ERG stop-PST.UNW DEM1.SG III-big place-SUPER.ESS work-PRS.PRT man find DEM2.ISG you as-DEF-POSS.LAT DEM1.SG indeed-even talk-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l The elder brother stopped him: "He is probably a man working in a high position, he probably won't even talk to you."

\t Bišanon bišno, Kusaqor siskin xabar boynč’ey, łˤonon esnabi maħor boqno.
\m bišʷa-non b-iš-n Kusa-qor siskin xabar b-odi-č’ey łˤono-n esyu-bi maħor b-oq-n
\g food-TOP III-eat-PFV.CVB Kusa-POSS.LAT any story III-do-NEG.PST.CVB three-TOP brother-PL outside I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l Having eaten their food, the three brothers went outside without having talked to Kusa.

\t Qˤišodgon yizi bišanix elor baynosi, hemedurtow siskin šebin rac’inč’ey, q’ˤunan reƛ’izad q’ˤimno riqirno esun Kusa esnazar.
\m qˤišod-gon yizi b-iš-ani-x elo-r b-ay-nosi hemedur-tow siskin šebin r-ac’-č’ey q’ˤuna-n reƛ’a-bi-d q’ˤim-n r-iqir-n esu-n Kusa esyu-bi-r
\g at.noon-CNTR DEM2.IPL I.PL-eat-MSD-AD.ESS there-LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB so-EMPH any thing IV-eat-NEG.PST.CVB two.OBL-TOP hand-PL-INSTR head-TOP IV-stop-PFV.CVB find-PST.UNW Kusa brother-PL-LAT
\l When they came there to eat dinner, the three brothers found Kusa there without eating anything and with his two hands supporting his head.

\t Žigoƛ’aygon eɣeni esiw nesiq esiranix oqno, šida mi nece pašmanłiƛ’ ičäsiƛin.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon eɣe-ni esiw nesi-q esir-ani-x oq-n šida mi nece pašmanłi-ƛ’ iči-asi-ƛin
\g now-SUPER.ABL-CNTR young-DEF brother DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-MSD-AD.ESS begin-PST.UNW why you so.much sadness-SUPER.ESS be-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l And now the younger brother began to ask him: "Where is there so much sadness on you?"

\t Bežet’ani esnaza yeda hemedurtow egirno anu.
\m b-eže-t’a-ni esyu-bi-a yeda hemedur-tow egir-n anu
\g I.PL-big-DISTR-DEF brother-PL-ERG DEM2.ISG so-EMPH let-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l The elder brothers didn't let him do so.

\t Neširun biša bik’inosi, esnazar howžatow žek’u esun q’ˤunan reƛ’izad q’ˤimno riqirno, bišadyoƛ’or aq’ˤułno ičäsi.
\m neširu-n b-iš-a b-ik’i-nosi esyu-bi-r howža-tow žek’u esu-n q’ˤuna-n reƛ’a-bi-d q’ˤim-n r-iqir-n bišad-ƛ’or aq’ˤuł-n iči-asi
\g at.night-TOP I.PL-eat-INF I.PL-go-ANT.CVB brother-PL-LAT DEM4.SG-EMPH man find-PFV.CVB two.OBL-TOP hand-PL-INSTR head-TOP IV-stop-PFV.CVB food-SUPER.LAT sit-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT
\l When they came to eat dinner there, the brothers found that man there with his two hands supporting him and sitting over his food.

\t Eɣeni esiya ƛ’iri risno, žigoƛ’ayƛa didurnokin iča anu nesi žek’uƛ’ yałru q’ʷariłi biyrinč’eyƛin.
\m eɣe-ni esyu-a ƛ’iri r-is-n žigo-ƛ’ay-ƛa didur-n-kin iči-a anu nesi žek’u-ƛ’ yoł-ru q’ʷariłi b-iyr-č’ey-ƛin
\g young-DEF brother-ERG above IV-take-PST.UNW now-SUPER.ABL-INDEF how-TOP-even be-INF be.NEG DEM1.ISG.OBL man-SUPER.ESS be-PST.PRT sadness III-find.out-NEG.PST.CVB-QUOT
\l The younger brother insisted: "And now there is no way whatsoever to find out what is bothering this man."

\t Bišno boqnosi, esnabin maħor begirno, eɣeni esiya igorno ik’in Kusaq esirno, sasaqay soder q’ˤimno riqirno, bišadyoƛ’orno aq’ˤułnowa mi ičäsi, šebi deber q’ʷariłi boqäsiƛin.
\m b-iš-n b-oq-nosi esyu-bi-n maħor b-egir-n eɣe-ni esyu-a igo-r-n ik’i-n Kusa-q esir-n sasaq-ay soder q’ˤim-n r-iqir-n bišad-ƛ’or-n aq’ˤuł-n-a mi iči-asi šebi mi-r q’ʷariłi b-oq-asi-ƛin
\g I.PL-eat-TOP I.PL-begin-ANT.CVB brother-PL-TOP outside I.PL-send-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother-ERG near-LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB Kusa-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW in.the.morning-IN.ABL after head-TOP IV-stop-PFV.CVB food-SUPER.LAT-TOP sit-PFV.CVB-Q you be-RES.PRT what you-LAT sadness III-happen-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l After having eaten, the young brother sent his brothers outside, approached Kusa and asked him: "What sadness has happened to you so that you are sitting there over your food holding your head."

\t Kusa nesir raqru łinałäyn esin eɣeni esiwq, dicegon baq’ˤu micxirno, mesedno boqłin, däq siskin šebin roda roqxanuƛin.
\m Kusa-a nesi-r r-oq-ru łina-łay-n esi-n eɣe-ni esiw-q dice-gon b-aq’ˤu micxir-n mesed-n b-oq-łin di-q siskin šebin r-odi-a r-oq-x-anu-ƛin
\g Kusa-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP tell-PST.UNW young-DEF brother-POSS.ESS how.much-CNTR III-much money-and gold-and III-become-CNC.CVB me-POSS.ESS any thing IV-do-INF IV-become-PRS-NEG-QUOT
\l Kusa told the younger brother what had happened to him: "No matter how much money and gold I have, I don't manage to do anything.

\t Howžäy soder łˤora becider xanez kidbedäɣor ezäɣor di iziłinč’inäy, nesä dey meč’ beč’xosiƛin.
\m howži-ay soder łˤora buci-der xan-z kid-däɣor ez-aɣor di izi-ł-č’i-näy nesi-a di-s meč’ b-eč’-xosi-ƛin
\g now-IN.ABL after three.OBL month-APUD.LAT khan-GEN2 daughter-APUD.VERS fortress-IN.VERS me get.up-POT-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG me-GEN1 neck III-cut-PRS.PRT-QUOT
\l In three months after now, if I won't get up into the fortress to the king's daughter, he is going to cut off my neck."

\t Eɣeni esiya eƛin, ža bihayawtow šebin yoł, di mi didurgon oqłin nełder ayranƛin.
\m eɣe-ni esyu-a eƛi-n ža bihayaw-tow šebin yoł di mi didur-gon oq-łin neła-der ayr-an-ƛin
\g young-DEF brother-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.SG easy-EMPH thing be me you how-CNTR become-CNC.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT lead-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The young brother said: "This is an easy thing, no matter how, I will lead you to her."

\t Didur mi di nełader ayrxoƛin, Kusa tamašatow bodin.
\m didur mi di neła-der ayr-x-ƛin Kusa-a tamaša-tow b-odi-n
\g how you me DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.LAT lead-PRS-QUOT Kusa-ERG be.surprised-EMPH III-do-PST.UNW
\l "How do you lead me to her?", Kusa asked surprised.

\t Tełazatow ac seruxosin, ħišixosin, ža yexurxosin rekarbi dowqor neƛan.
\m teł-aza-tow ac seru-xosi-n ħiši-xosi-n ža y-exur-xosi-n reka-bi mi-qor neƛ-an
\g inside-IN.VERS.DIST-EMPH door unlock-PRS.PRT-and lock-PRS.PRT-and DEM1.SG II-kill-PRS.PRT-and key-PL you-POSS.LAT give-FUT.DEF
\l And I will give you the keys which will unlock, lock the door and demolish it.

\t Di ža ɣamas bercinaw yodan, ƛ’iri mesedyos łin regirno, nełas baq’ˤu micxirno esan, xanqo taraw neƛełxanuce.
\m di ža ɣamas bercinaw y-odi-an ƛ’iri mesed-s łi-n r-egir-n neła-s b-aq’ˤu micxir-n esu-an xan-q taraw neƛ-ł-x-anu-ace
\g me DEM1.SG box beautiful II-do-FUT.DEF above gold-GEN1 water-TOP IV-let-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 III-much money-TOP appear-FUT.CVB khan-POSS.ESS except.for sell-POT-IPFV.CVB-NEG-TERM
\l I will make this box so beautiful, and I'll put liquid gold on it, so that its worth will appear so much that it could not be sold to anyone besides the king.

\t Elo teł min uqˤno, ža ɣamasno hokomƛ’o eqerno, di xanes ez yałza mečoƛ’ar ik’an.
\m elo teł mi-n uqˤi-n ža ɣamas-n hoko-ƛ’ eqer-n di xan-s ez yoł-za moči-ƛ’ar ik’i-an
\g there inside you-TOP hide-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG box-TOP carriage-SUPER.ESS put-PFV.CVB me khan-GEN1 fortress be-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.VERS go-FUT.DEF
\l I will hide you inside it, put that box onto a carriage and go to the place where the king's fortress is.

\t Xizyo ɣamasya tełäzay xanez kidber riguƛ’ay rigut’a maq’anyabi teqnosi, neła ža micxiryoƛ yisinč’ey yäčinč’i.
\m xizyo ɣamas-a teł-azay xan-z kid-r r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu-t’a maq’an-bi teq-nosi neła-a ža micxir-ƛ y-is-č’ey y-iči-č’i
\g afterwards box-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL.DIST khan-GEN2 daughter-LAT III.PL-pretty-SUPER.ABL III.PL-pretty-DISTR melody-PL hear-ANT.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG money-SUB.ESS II-buy-NEG.PST.CVB II-be-NEG.FUT
\l Then, after the king's daughter heard the prettiest melodies coming out of the box, she just had to buy it.

\t Neła ža yižin idu eqernosi, acno serun nełde puħorno ik’in, royxosi šebinon royn, mi tełerno oqno ɣamas yexar, xizyo žeda ža q’ač’azi yodanixƛin elay xizor yegärƛin.
\m neła-a ža y-iži-n idu eqer-nosi ac-n seru-n neła-de pu-xor-n ik’i-n r-odi-x-si šebinon r-odi-n mi tełer-n oq-n ɣamas y-exur xizyo žedu-a ža q’ˤač’azi y-odi-ani-x-ƛin ele-ay xizor y-egir-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG II-carry-PFV.CVB home put-ANT.CVB door-TOP unlock-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS side-AD.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB IV-do-IPFV.CVB-ATTR something IV-do-PFV.CVB you to.the.inside-TOP become-PFV.CVB box II-kill afterwards DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG get.ready II-do-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT there-IN.ABL back II-send-QUOT
\l After she carried you inside, unlock the door, and go to her side, do what is to be done, go back inside and destroy the box; afterwards they will send it back to be repaired.

\t Kusa ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu izin, nece beže maxšel yołäsi žek’u kumakyor iqizaƛ’ƛin.
\m Kusa ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu izi-n nece b-eže maxšel yoł-asi žek’u kumak-r iqi-zaƛ’-ƛin
\g Kusa very be.happy get-PST.UNW so.much III-big skill be-RES.PRT man help-LAT get-CSL.CVB-QUOT
\l Kusa got very happy because he got such a skilled man for help.

\t Bigza ħalał ust’arer micxirno teƛno eɣeni esiya, Kusa teł uqˤanirsi yiłe k’emot’no yodin, ƛ’irigon mesedno begirno bercinaw yodaniƛäy, riguƛ’ay rigu maq’anyabi rok’xosi teł pelun eqerno.
\m b-ig-za ħal-ł ust’ar-r micxir-n teƛ-n eɣe-ni esyu-a Kusa teł uqˤi-ani-r-si y-iłe k’emot’-n y-odi-n ƛ’iri-gon mesed-n b-egir-n bercinaw y-odi-ani-ƛay r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu maq’an-bi r-ok’-xosi teł pelu-n eqer-n
\g III-much-ZA condition-CONT.ESS master-LAT money-TOP give-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother-ERG Kusa inside hide-MSD-LAT-ATTR II-as wooden.case-TOP II-do-PFV.CVB above-CNTR gold-TOP III-let-PFV.CVB beautiful II-do-MSD-SUB.ABL III.PL-pretty-SUPER.ABL III.PL-pretty melody-PL III.PL-beat-PRS.PRT inside pipe-TOP put-PST.UNW
\l The younger brother gave the master pretty much money, that one made a wooden case so that he could hide Kusa inside, put gold onto it, in order to make it beautiful, and put a pipe inside that makes the most beautiful melodies.

\t Howži ža ɣamasno hokomƛ’o erno, eɣeni esiw xanes kid yałruni qalamxaɣor ik’in.
\m howži ža ɣamas-n hoko-ƛ’ er-n eɣe-ni esiw xan-s kid yoł-ru-ni qala-xaɣor ik’i-n
\g now DEM1.SG box-TOP carriage-SUPER.ESS put-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother khan-GEN1 daughter be-PST.PRT-DEF fortress-AD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l Now they put the box onto a carriage and the young brother went to the fortress where the king's daughter was.

\t Nasin xalq’i bezun ƛexun, sosisi yisanixƛin beč’ułno, nesä baq’ˤu micxir esizaƛ’, ɣamas yisełxosi žek’u oƛixno anu.
\m nasin xalq’i b-ezu-n ƛexu-n sosi-si y-is-ani-x-ƛin b-eč’uł-n nesi-a b-aq’ˤu micxir esi-zaƛ’ ɣamas y-is-ł-x-si žek’u oƛix-n anu
\g all people III-look-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB at.first-ATTR II-buy-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT III-flow.out-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG III-much money tell-CSL.CVB box II-buy-POT-IPFV.CVB-ATTR man appear-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l All the people came out to look and buy it immediately, but when he said how much money it costs, there was no man who could buy the box.

\t Xanez kidber ža maq’anyabi teqnosi, akäzayn yoƛixno yezun, yedu šebi šebin eloƛin.
\m xan-z kid-r ža maq’an-bi teq-nosi aki-azay-n y-oƛix-n y-ezu-n yedu šebi šebin elo-ƛin
\g khan-GEN2 daughter-LAT DEM1.SG melody-PL hear-ANT.CVB window-IN.ABL.DIST-TOP II-appear-PFV.CVB II-look-PFV.CVB DEM2.IISG what thing there-QUOT
\l After the king's daughter heard these melodies, she appeared at the window and looked out, wondering: "What is this thing there?"

\t Howlotow yedu babiƛ’ ƛ’iri yutin, ža ɣamas micxiryoƛ yisoƛin.
\m howlo-tow yedu babiw-ƛ’ ƛ’iri y-uti-n ža ɣamas micxir-ƛ y-is-o-ƛin
\g there-EMPH DEM2.IISG father-SUPER.ESS above II-return-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG box money-SUB.ESS II-buy-IMPR-QUOT
\l Thereupon she insisted that her father buy this box for the money.

\t Boƛik’u xanez maħišatyoce micxirno teƛno, yisno xanä ɣamas kidbez idu eqerno.
\m boƛik’u xan-z maħišat-ce micxir-n teƛ-n y-is-n xan-a ɣamas kid-z idu eqer-n
\g half khan-GEN2 fortune-EQU1 money-TOP give-PFV.CVB II-buy-PFV.CVB khan-ERG box daughter-GEN2 room put-PST.UNW
\l The king gave half of his fortune, bought the box and put it into his daughter's room.

\t Ustarän riyrno xanqor, nagaħ ža yexunäy, q’ač’azi yoda däder yaƛin.
\m ustar-a-n r-iyr-n xan-qor nagaħ ža y-exu-näy q’ˤač’azi y-odi-a di-der y-a-ƛin
\g master-ERG-TOP IV-explain-PST.UNW khan-POSS.LAT suppose DEM1.SG II-die-CND.CVB repair II-do-INF me-APUD.LAT II-bring.IMP-QUOT
\l The master explained to the king: "If it gets broken, bring it to me so I can repear it."

\t Hemedur Kusa ayn osugani ezä teł babiya yuqˤno yičirno zawruni kidbeder.
\m hemedur Kusa ay-n osuga-ni ez-a teł babiw-a y-uqˤi-n y-iči-r-n zow-ru-ni kid-der
\g so Kusa come-PFV.CVB high-DEF fortress-IN.ESS inside father-ERG II-hide-PFV.CVB II-remain-CAUS-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF girl-APUD.LAT
\l So Kusa came to the girl who was being grounded hidden inside the high fortress by her father.

\t Moƛaxay žan č’arik’no, nesä eƛin, di malaik yoł, asatow maharno erno, mi yowanix nexäsi t’aɣor, neširu di dowde puħo keca ayƛin.
\m moƛu-xay ža-n č’arik’-n nesi-a eƛi-n di malaik yoł as-a-tow mahar-n er-n mi y-ow-ani-x nex-asi t’o-aɣor neširu di mi-de puħo kec-a ay-ƛin
\g sleep-AD.ABL DEM1.SG-TOP wake.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW me angel be sky-IN.ESS-EMPH wedding-TOP set.up-PFV.CVB you II-marry-MSD-AD.ESS come-RES.PRT here-IN.VERS at.night me you-APUD.ESS next.to sleep-INF must-QUOT
\l He woke her up from her sleep and said: "I am an angel, I will arange a wedding in the heavens for I have come here to marry you; I must sleep next to you at night."

\t Kidbezgon rok’ƛ’or rayn, di moƛałtow yołƛin, yedu t’o roqxosi šebinon där moƛał rukayxƛin.
\m kid-z-gon rok’u-ƛ’or r-ay-n di moƛu-ł-tow yoł-ƛin yedu t’o r-oq-x-si šebinon di-r moƛu-ł r-ukad-x-ƛin
\g girl-GEN2-CNTR heart-SUPER.LAT IV-come-PST.UNW me dream-CONT.ESS-EMPH be-QUOT DEM2.IISG here IV-happen-IPFV.CVB-ATTR something me-LAT dream-CONT.ESS IV-see-PRS-QUOT
\l The girl thought: "I am in a dream, and what is happening here I am dreaming."

\t Xizyo Kusa xanez kidbeden kecno, qˤašiƛ’aɣor kid moƛaq yiqirnosi, elayn izin ɣamasya tełerno oqno, tełäzgon žan ħišin, maq’anyabi rižixosi pelun yexurno.
\m xizyo Kusa-a xan-z kid-de-n kec-n qˤaši-ƛ’aɣor kid moƛu-q y-iqir-nosi ele-ay-n izi-n ɣamas-a tełer-n oq-n teł-az-gon ža-n ħiši-n maq’an-bi r-iži-x-si pelu-n y-exur-n
\g afterwards Kusa-ERG khan-GEN2 daughter-APUD.ESS-TOP sleep-PFV.CVB dawn-SUPER.VERS girl sleep-POSS.ESS II-stop-ANT.CVB there-IN.ABL-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB box-IN.ESS into-TOP become-PFV.CVB inside-IN.ESS.DIST-CNTR DEM1.SG-TOP lock-PFV.CVB melody-PL III.PL-carry-IPFV.CVB-ATTR pipe-TOP II-kill-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards, when Kusa had slept with the king's daughter, and the girl had stopped sleeping, he got up from there and went into the box, locked it from inside and destroyed the pipes which played the melodies.

\t Nuʕłimorƛin yisä nełaz bašiłäyn roɣno bašiqˤoyn sadaq risno, žežułäy beč’no kodin bisno, gedmoqaygon yeč’no č’irno yisno.
\m nuʕłi-ar-ƛin yisi-a neła-z baša-łay-n r-oɣ-n bašiqˤoy-n sadaq r-is-n žežu-łay b-eč’-n kodi-n b-is-n ged-qay-gon y-eč’-n č’ir-n y-is-n
\g proof-IN.LAT-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 finger-CONT.ABL-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB ring-and together IV-take-PFV.CVB ponytail-CONT.ABL III-cut-PFV.CVB hair-and III-take-PFV.CVB shirt-POSS.ABL-CNTR II-cut-PFV.CVB ribbon-and II-take-PST.UNW
\l As a proof he took a ring from her finger and took it with himself, he cut a hair from her ponytail and took it with himself, and he cut off a ribbon from her shirt and took it with himself as well.

\t Sasaqosi moƛaxay yizizaƛ’or kidber ɣamas yexasi yesun.
\m sasaqosi moƛu-xay y-izi-zaƛ’or kid-r ɣamas y-exu-asi y-esu-n
\g in.the.morning sleep-AD.ABL II-get.up-POST.CVB girl-LAT box II-die-RES.PRT II-find-PST.UNW
\l When the girl got up in the morning, she found that the box was broken.

\t Yiła maq’anyabi qˤaƛixanu, ust’arder yedu yayrƛin yiła ɣarabašzaqor eƛin.
\m yiła-a maq’an-bi qˤaƛi-x-anu ust’ar-der yedu y-ayr-ƛin yiła-a ɣarabaš-bi-qor eƛi-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG melody-PL sing-PRS-NEG master-APUD.LAT DEM2.IISG II-bring-QUOT DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG servant-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW
\l "It doesn't play melodies anymore, bring it to the master!", she said to the servants.

\t Žeda ža yižin eɣeni esiwqor yayrno.
\m žedu-a ža y-iži-n eɣe-ni esiw-qor y-ayr-n
\g DEM1.IPL-ERG DEM1.SG II-carry-PFV.CVB young-DEF brother-POSS.LAT II-bring-PST.UNW
\l They carried it away and brought it to the younger brother.

\t Elo tełäygon Kusan oqno.
\m elo teł-ay-gon Kusa-n oq-n
\g there inside-IN.ABL-CNTR Kusa-TOP become-PST.UNW
\l And Kusa got out of it.

\t Howži xanä Kusar teƛno zawruni iłno buci łiyxosi zaman bayn.
\m howži xan-a Kusa-r teƛ-n zow-ru-ni iłno buci łiy-xosi zaman b-ay-n
\g now khan-ERG Kusa-LAT give-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF six month end-PRS.PRT time III-come-PST.UNW
\l Now came the time that the six months that the six months the king had given Kusa ended.

\t Diwanyoƛ’or goƛ’inosi, Kusa eƛin, di xanez kidbede zows, nełar nuʕłi rodanix šebin däq yołƛin, yisä nełas bašiqˤoyn, žežuqay räč’ru musrabin, gedmoqay yeč’no zawruni č’irno yukarno.
\m diwan-ƛ’or goƛ’i-nosi Kusa-a eƛi-n di xan-z kid-de zow-s neła-r nuʕłi r-odi-ani-x šebin di-q yoł-ƛin yisi-a neła-s bašiqˤoy-n žežu-qay r-eč’-ru mus-bi-n ged-qay y-eč’-n zow-ru-ni č’ir-n y-ukar-n
\g judgement-SUPER.LAT invite-ANT.CVB Kusa-ERG say-PST.UNW me khan-GEN2 daughter-APUD.ESS be.NPRS-PST.WIT DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT proof IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS thing me-POSS.ESS be-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 ring-and ponytail-POSS.ABL IV-cut-PST.PRT hair-PL-and shirt-POSS.ABL II-cut-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF ribbon-and II-show-PST.UNW
\l After Kusa was invited to the court, he said: "I have been with the king's daughter, and I have things with me to prove that!"; he showed her ring, the hairs cut from her ponytail and the ribbon that he cut from her shirt.

\t Xanno, diwan boyxosi xalq’in, kidbeder ays žaƛin, Kusaƛ’ bužzi boqno anu.
\m xan-n diwan b-odi-xosi xalq’i-n kid-der ay-s ža-ƛin Kusa-ƛ’ bužzi b-oq-n anu
\g khan-and judgement III-do-PRS.PRT people-and girl-APUD.LAT come-PST.WIT DEM1.SG-QUOT Kusa-SUPER.ESS believe I.PL-become-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l The king and the judges did not believe that Kusa had come to the girl.

\t Žedu rätiruxor riqira k’ʷeze roqxosi šebinabi yołƛin.
\m žedu r-eti-ru-xor r-iqir-a k’ʷeze r-oq-xosi šebin-bi yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.IIPL IV-want-PST.PRT-AD.LAT IV-take.away-INF can IV-become-PRS.PRT thing-PL be-QUOT
\l "These are things that one can get wherever one wants."

\t Xizyo Kusa žeduqor eƛin, xexbi riqirna riqirno ana nełaƛin riyranix, xanez kidbeder ɣˤanabi yegirƛin.
\m xizyo Kusa-a žedu-qor eƛi-n xexbi r-iqir-n-a r-iqir-n anu-a neła-a-ƛin r-iyr-ani-x xan-z kid-der ɣˤanabi y-egir-ƛin
\g afterwards Kusa-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW child III.PL-catch-PFV.CVB-Q III.PL-catch-PFV.CVB be.NEG-Q DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-QUOT IV-find.out-MSD-AD.ESS khan-GEN2 daughter-APUD.LAT woman II-send-QUOT
\l Afterwards Kusa said to them: "Send a woman to the king's daughter to find out if she is pregnant or not."

\t Däz kidbes cin rexurno, buhtan erayä oqäsi miƛin, cimyarno izin xan nesiƛ’ łeɣaniƛ’or ayäsi zown.
\m di-z kid-s ci-n r-exur-n buhtan er-a-a oq-asi mi-ƛin cim-ar-n izi-n xan nesi-ƛ’ łeɣi-ani-ƛ’or ay-asi zow-n
\g me-GEN2 daughter-GEN1 name-TOP IV-kill-PFV.CVB slander set.up-INF-Q become-RES.PRT you-QUOT malice-IN.LAT-TOP get-PFV.CVB khan DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS clutch-MSD-SUPER.LAT come-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l "Did you dishonor my daughter's name and ...?", the king got mad and was about to pound on him.

\t Didurgon, šebigon resułin xal bodanix elor ɣˤanabi yegira yay, yałi - ela badiru ħukmu meq’aw bäčiƛin, diwan boyxozo xalq’imo xan wˤałer ezurerno.
\m didur-gon šebi-gon r-esu-łin xal b-odi-ani-x elo-r ɣˤanabi y-egir-a y-ay yałi - elu-a b-odi-ru ħukmu meq’aw b-iči-ƛin diwan b-odi-xozo xalq’i-a xan wˤał-r ezur-r-n
\g how-CNTR what-CNTR IV-find-CNC.CVB examination III-do-MSD-AD.ESS there-LAT woman II-send-INF II-must else - we(I).OBL-ERG III-do-PST.PRT decision wrong III-be-QUOT judgement III-do-PRS.PRT.OBL people-ERG khan downward-LAT show-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l "How- and whatever it is, we must send a woman there to make an examination, or else the decision we make will be wrong.", the judges said and calmed down the king.

\t Yeza yak’iru ɣˤanabi xizor yutin yayn eƛin, xanez kidbä xexbi riqarzäy soder łˤono buci yołƛin.
\m y-ezu-a y-ik’i-ru ɣˤanabi xizor y-uti-n y-ay-n eƛi-n xan-z kid-a xexbi r-iqir-zay soder łˤono buci yoł-ƛin
\g II-look-INF II-go-PST.PRT woman back II-return-PFV.CVB II-come-PFV.CVB say-PST.UNW khan-GEN2 daughter-ERG child III.PL-find-SIM.CVB after three month be-QUOT
\l The woman who had gone looking returned and said: "It has been three months since the king's daughter has conceived her child."

\t Maharno erno xanä kid Kusaxno yegirno, nesä nesis mečar xanłunno egirno.
\m mahar-n er-n xan-a kid Kusa-x-n y-egir-n nesi-a nesi-s meča-r xan-łun-n egir-n
\g wedding-TOP set.up-PFV.CVB khan-ERG daughter Kusa-AD.ESS-TOP II-send-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 instead.of-LAT khan-LHUN-TOP send-PST.UNW
\l The king organized a wedding, married off his daughter to Kusa and gave him his kingdom.

\t Xanłi koyär riqinosi, Kusa žedu łˤonon esnabi nesä neside ust’arbiłun xecin, žedus eɣeni esiw hič’č’a adäsi nesis ʕaq’lus žek’ułun odin.
\m xanłi kʷay-ar r-iqi-nosi Kusa-a žedu łˤono-n esyu-bi nesi-a nesi-de ust’ar-bi-łun xeci-n žedu-s eɣe-ni esiw hič’č’a ad-asi nesi-s ʕaq’lu-s žek’u-łun odi-n
\g khanship hand-IN.LAT IV-get-ANT.CVB Kusa-ERG DEM1.IPL three-TOP brother-PL DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS master-PL-LHUN leave-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 young-DEF brother the.most in.front-RES.PRT DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 advice-GEN1 man-LHUN do-PST.UNW
\l When Kusa had the kingship in his hands, he named the three brothers masters for himself and named the youngest brother his foremost advisor.

\t Esin šebi, xecin šebi, sidaquł ʕomoyn bižin ciqaɣor qaciƛ’orƛin ʕoloqan žek’u ik’äsi zown.
\m esi-n šebi xeci-n šebi sidaquł ʕomoy-n b-iži-n ciq-aɣor qaci-ƛ’or-ƛin ʕoloqan žek’u ik’i-asi zow-n
\g tell-PFV.CVB what leave-PFV.CVB what one.day donkey-TOP III-lead-PFV.CVB forest-IN.VERS firewood-SUPER.LAT-QUOT young man go-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l What should I tell, what should I leave; once upon a time a young man went with a donkey into the forest to collect firewood.

\t Nesis ʕomoy bičinč’ey ħoʕƛix zown.
\m nesi-s ʕomoy b-iči-č’ey ħoʕƛi-x zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 donkey III-cease-NEG.PST.CVB shout-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His donkey was shouting without stopping.

\t Ciq łäyzaza puƛ’aza yisił dandir c’oxno oč’ino taraw mešok’las mus ħuħqo anuru sis kusa.
\m ciq łiy-zaz pu-ƛ’aza yisi-ł dandir c’ox-n oč’ino taraw mešok’la-s mus ħuħ-q anu-ru sis kusa
\g forest end-LOC.ORIG side-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS towards meet-PST.UNW nine except.for moustache-GEN1 hair cheek-POSS.ESS be.NEG-PST.PRT one beardless.man
\l At the end of the forest he met a man who had merely 9 hairs on his cheek where the moustache would be.

\t ʕOloqan žek’a nesiq esirno, di netiey exanƛin.
\m ʕoloqan žek’u-a nesi-q esir-n di neti-ey exu-an-ƛin
\g young man-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW me when-DUB die-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The young man asked him: "When will I die?"

\t Siskin urɣizi oqxo ičinč’ey, kusa nesiqor eƛin, ʕomoyä łox ħoʕni roɣnosi äxu miƛin.
\m siskin urɣizi oq-x iči-č’ey kusa nesi-qor eƛi-n ʕomoy-a łox ħoʕni r-oɣ-nosi exu mi-ƛin
\g anything thinking become-IPFV.CVB be-NEG.PST.CVB beardless.man DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW donkey-ERG thrice shout IV-take.away-ANT.CVB die you-QUOT
\l Without thinking, the beardless man said to him: "When the donkey has shouted three times, you will die."

\t Ža kusaq eƛin łiyzaƛ’ortow, ʕomoyä ħoʕni rizirno.
\m ža kusa-q eƛi-n łiy-zaƛ’or-tow ʕomoy-a ħoʕni r-izir-n
\g DEM1.SG beardless.man-POSS.ESS say-PFV.CVB end-POST.CVB-EMPH donkey-ERG shout IV-lift-PST.UNW
\l Even before the beardless man had finished saying this, the donkey gave out a shout.

\t Hemełaƛ’ ʕoloqan žek’a eƛin, howži dey ruħ boɣno xot’ozaxor baysƛin.
\m hemeła-ƛ’ ʕoloqan žek’u-a eƛi-n howži di-s ruħ b-oɣ-n xot’o-bi-xor b-ay-s-ƛin
\g then-SUPER.ESS young man-ERG say-PST.UNW now me-GEN1 soul III-take.away-PFV.CVB foot-PL-AD.LAT III-come-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Then the young man said: "Now my soul has been taken away and it has come up to my feet."

\t K’oxäƛirugon ʕomoy ħoʕƛinosi, nesä eƛin, žigoƛ’ay dey ruħ boɣno ašuƛäyr baysƛin.
\m k’ox-äƛiru-gon ʕomoy ħoʕƛi-nosi nesi-a eƛi-n žigo-ƛ’ay di-s ruħ b-oɣ-n ašu-ƛer b-ay-s-ƛin
\g twice-ORD-CNTR donkey shout-ANT.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW now-SUPER.ABL me-GEN1 soul III-take.away-PFV.CVB waist-SUB.LAT III-come-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l When the donkey shouted a second time, he said: "Now my soul has been taken away and it has come up to my waist."

\t Elorgon yeda moƛa iqirno.
\m elo-r-gon yeda moƛu-a iqir-n
\g there-LAT-CNTR DEM2.ISG sleep-ERG take.away-PST.UNW
\l There the sleep took him away.

\t ʕOmoy neła nełaƛ, hunäsi hunä bik’ix zown.
\m ʕomoy neła-a neła-ƛ huni-a-si huni-a b-ik’i-x zow-n
\g donkey DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUB.ESS way-IN.ESS-ATTR way-IN.ESS III-go-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The donkey walked on the way on its own.

\t Sasaqosi moƛaxayn č’ariłno, iduɣor ik’iƛ’oräy, nesir ʕomoy boc’ä bexuräsi besun.
\m sasaqosi moƛu-xay-n č’arił-n idu-ɣor ik’i-ƛ’oräy nesi-r ʕomoy boc’a-a b-exur-asi b-esu-n
\g in.the.morning sleep-AD.ABL-TOP wake.up-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT donkey wolf.PL-ERG III-kill-RES.PRT III-find-PST.UNW
\l In the morning, when the woke up from his sleep and went home, he found the donkey having being killed by wolves.

\t ƛäxuru nełas reƛ ɣˤʷadä rac’ƛ’oräy, žedał xizay k’oƛin, mi yołin biqirinč’ey xecač’inƛin.
\m ƛexu-ru neła-s reƛ ɣˤʷadi-a r-ac’-ƛ’oräy žeda-ł xizay k’oƛi-n mi yołi-n b-iqir-č’ey xeci-ač’in-ƛin
\g remain-PST.PRT DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 meat crow-ERG IV-eat-SIM.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS from.behind run-PFV.CVB you indeed-TOP III-catch-NEG.PST.CVB leave-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l While a crow was eating the remaining flesh of it, he ran after them: "I'll get you!"

\t Hawaƛ’ k’oƛin bik’in ɣˤʷadi sidaɣ qidoz qˤoda tełxor buqˤełno.
\m hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n b-ik’i-n ɣˤʷadi sidaɣ qido-z qˤod-a teł-xor b-uqˤeł-n
\g air-SUPER.ESS jump-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB crow in.one.place wall-GEN2 hole-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT III-hide-PST.UNW
\l The crow flew up into the air and hid inside a hole in the wall.

\t Xizayn k’oƛin ʕoloqan žek’a elaɣor reƛ’a regirnosi, beč’ułno elazay micxirno, mesedno bayn.
\m xizay-n k’oƛi-n ʕoloqan žek’u-a ele-aɣor reƛ’a r-egir-nosi b-eč’uł-n ele-azay micxir-n mesed-n b-ay-n
\g from.behind-TOP run-PFV.CVB young man-ERG there-IN.VERS hand IV-let-ANT.CVB III-flow.out-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL.DIST silver-and gold-and III-come-PST.UNW
\l When the young man ran behind him and put his hand into there, silver and gold came out of there.

\t Yedu t’azay reɣet’ani bikorbi roƛixsiƛin, oxix yeda elay.
\m yedu t’o-azay r-eɣe-t’a-ni bikori-bi r-oƛix-s-ƛin oxi-x yeda ele-ay
\g DEM2.IISG here-IN.ABL.DIST IV-small-DISTR-DEF snake-PL III.PL-appear-PST.WIT-QUOT run.away-PRS DEM2.ISG there-IN.ABL
\l "There are small snakes there!", he said and ran away from there.

\t Hemedur oxin yeda ik’iƛ’oräy, yisił dandir q’ˤanon esnabi c’oxxo - sis c’odoraw, sideni - ʕantaw.
\m hemedur oxi-n yeda ik’i-ƛ’oräy yisi-ł dandir q’ˤano-n esyu-bi c’ox-x - sis c’odoraw sideni - ʕantaw
\g so run.away-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS towards two-TOP brother-PL meet-PRS - one clever the.other.one - stupid
\l While he was running, he met two brothers - one was clever, the other one stupid.

\t Žeda yisiq esirno, šebi roqä deber, šida mi oxin ik’ixƛin.
\m žedu-a yisi-q esir-n šebi r-oq-a mi-r šida mi oxi-n ik’i-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW what IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT you-LAT why you run.away-PFV.CVB go-PRS-QUOT
\l They asked him: "What happened to you, why are you running away?"

\t Yisä eƛin, eloš neła guħxaza regin däł xizay bikorbi nexxoƛin.
\m yisi-a eƛi-n eloš neła guħ-xaza r-egi-n di-ł xizay bikori-bi nex-x-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW over.there DEM1.IISG.OBL hill-AD.VERS.DIST III.PL-be.emitted-PFV.CVB me-CONT.ESS behind snake-PL come-PRS-QUOT
\l He said: "Over there, behind that hill, snakes are coming behind me."

\t Elayn duri bok’no ik’in, kʷaxatow ʕoloqan žek’u ozƛäy gugin.
\m ele-ay-n duri b-ok’-n ik’i-n kʷaxa-tow ʕoloqan žek’u ozuri-ƛay gugi-n
\g there-IN.ABL-TOP run III-hit-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB soon-EMPH young man eye-SUB.ABL escape-PST.UNW
\l The young man ran further away from there and soon escaped from their eyes.

\t Elo esnazar q’ˤidar beč’ułäsi ukrun, micxirno besun.
\m elo esyu-bi-r q’ˤida-r b-eč’uł-asi ukru-n micxir-n b-esu-n
\g there brother-PL-LAT down-LAT III-flow.out-RES.PRT silver-and money-and III-find-PST.UNW
\l There the brothers found the silver and money that had flown down.

\t Ixinabin ric’no yizä ža ukrun, micxirno iduɣor bižin.
\m ixin-bi-n r-ic’-n yizi-a ža ukru-n micxir-n idu-ɣor b-iži-n
\g bag-PL-TOP IV.PL-fill-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG silver-and money-and home-IN.ALL III-carry-PST.UNW
\l Having filled their bags, they brought the silver and money home.

\t C’odorawni esiya ʕantawni esiw ukrun, micxirno rasada q’ilimoł xizay dibirder egirno.
\m c’odoraw-ni esyu-a ʕantaw-ni esiw ukru-n micxir-n r-asad-a q’ili-ł xizay dibir-der egir-n
\g clever-DEF brother-ERG stupid-DEF brother silver-and money-and III.PL-measure-INF qili-CONT.ESS behind mullah-APUD.LAT send-PST.UNW
\l The clever brother sent his stupid brother to the mullah for qilis to measure the amount of silver and money.

\t Yisiq riyrno, dibirqor mi äƛino, ukrun, micxirno rasadanix q’ili betinƛin, mi eƛo at’ rasadanix betinƛin.
\m yisi-q r-iyr-n dibir-qor mi eƛi-n ukru-n micxir-n r-asad-ani-x q’ili b-eti-n-ƛin mi eƛi-o at’ r-asad-ani-x b-eti-n-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-explain-PST.UNW mullah-POSS.LAT you say-PROHIB silver-and money-and III.PL-measure-MSD-AD.ESS qili III-want-PST.UNW-QUOT you say-IMPR wheat IV-measure-MSD-AD.ESS III-want-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l He explained to him: "Don't tell the mullah that we want the qilis to measure silver and money, but tell him that we want the qilis to measure wheat!"

\t ʕAntawnä dibirqo hudun esin, ukrun, micxirno basadanix betixƛin.
\m ʕantaw-ni-a dibir-q hudun esi-n ukru-n micxir-n b-asad-ani-x b-eti-x-ƛin
\g stupid-DEF-ERG mullah-POSS.ESS nevertheless tell-PST.UNW silver-and money-and III-measure-MSD-AD.ESS III-want-PRS-QUOT
\l The stupid one nevertheless told the mullah: "We want them to measure silver and gold."

\t Nedur resunäyƛin, eƛin dibirez barä, din yik’an dowde sadaq, därno ence betäsi ukrun, micxirnoƛin.
\m nedur r-esu-näy-ƛin eƛi-n dibir-z baru-a di-n y-ik’i-an mi-de sadaq di-r-n ence b-eti-asi ukru-n micxir-n-ƛin
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW mullah-GEN2 wife-ERG me-and II-go-FUT.DEF you-APUD.ESS with me-LAT-and a.little III-want-RES.PRT silver-and money-and-QUOT
\l "If that is the case," said the mullah's wife, "I will also go with you, because I also want silver and money."

\t Q’ˤida muqno boɣno ʕantawnä nełaq riyrno, enda bexurno ent’aɣor yoqnäy yexura yołƛin.
\m q’ˤida muq-n b-oɣ-n ʕantaw-ni-a neła-q r-iyr-n enda b-exur-n ent’a-aɣor y-oq-näy y-exur-a yoł-ƛin
\g down line-TOP III-hatch-PFV.CVB stupid-DEF-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-explain-PST.UNW DEM3b.SG III-kill-PFV.CVB here-IN.VERS II-become-CND.CVB II-kill-INF be-QUOT
\l The stupid one drew a line on the floor and explained to her: "When you cross over this line, I will kill you."

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo ʕantawnä dibires baru oq’ˤraq q’ilin bok’no, q’ˤidar yoƛ’ˤurno.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo ʕantaw-ni-a dibir-s baru oq’ˤra-q q’ili-n b-ok’-n q’ˤida-r y-ˤoƛ’u-r-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after stupid-DEF-ERG mullah-GEN1 wife skull-POSS.ESS qili-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB down-LAT II-fall-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l After that the stupid one beat the mullah's wife with a qili on her skull and made her fall down.

\t Howži yedu yexusƛin, yisä rečuƛerno yižin, rekuł šušin.
\m howži yedu y-exu-s-ƛin yisi-a reču-ƛer-n y-iži-n reku-ł šuši-n
\g now DEM2.IISG II-die-PST.WIT-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG cattleshed-SUB.LAT-TOP II-carry-PFV.CVB manure-CONT.ESS bury-PST.UNW
\l "Now she died.", he (tought and) carried her into the cattleshed and buried her in manure.

\t Xizyo q’ilin bisno, oqno iduɣor ik’in.
\m xizyo q’ili-n b-is-n oq-n idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g afterwards qili-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB become-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards he took the qili and went home.

\t C’odorawni esiya yisiq esirno, q’ili bisƛ’oräy mi šebi eƛäƛin.
\m c’odoraw-ni esyu-a yisi-q esir-n q’ili b-is-ƛ’oräy mi šebi eƛi-a-ƛin
\g clever-DEF brother-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW qili III-take-SIM.CVB you what say-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The clever brother asked him: "When you got the qili, what did you say?"

\t ʕAntawnä esin dibires baru yexarułäyn, ža yižin rečuƛ rekuyał šaširułäyn.
\m ʕantaw-ni-a esi-n dibir-s baru y-exur-ru-łay-n ža y-iži-n reču-ƛ reku-ł šuši-ru-łay-n
\g stupid-DEF-ERG tell-PST.UNW mullah-GEN1 wife II-kill-PST.PRT-CONT.ABL-and DEM1.SG II-carry-PFV.CVB cattleshed-SUB.ESS manure-CONT.ESS bury-PST.PRT-CONT.ABL-and
\l The stupid one told about him killing the mullah's wife, carrying her into the cattleshed and burying her in manure.

\t Nesiqor didiwnokin xabar boynč’ey, c’odorawni esiw dibirzo rečuƛerno ik’in, sis čanya bexurno elo rekuyał šušin, elayn yoɣno q’ˤuya mečoƛ’ dibires barun šušin yisä.
\m nesi-qor didiw-n-kin xabar b-odi-č’ey c’odoraw-ni esiw dibir-z reču-ƛer-n ik’i-n sis čan b-exur-n elo reku-ł šuši-n ele-ay-n y-oɣ-n q’ˤuya moči-ƛ’ dibir-s baru-n šuši-n yisi-a
