\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT which-TOP-even story III-do-NEG.PST.CVB clever-DEF brother mullah-GEN2 cattleshed-SUB.LAT-TOP go-PFV.CVB one she.goat III-kill-PFV.CVB there manure-CONT.ESS bury-PFV.CVB here-IN.ABL-TOP II-take.away-PFV.CVB other place-SUPER.ESS mullah-GEN1 wife-TOP bury-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l Not telling him anything, the clever brother went into the mullah's shed, killed a goat and burried it in the manure there and took out the mullah's wife from there and burried her in another place.

\t Esiwłtow xizay iłe maħor oqno zawru ʕantawni esiwł dandir dibir c’oxno.
\m esiw-ł-tow xizay iłe maħor oq-n zow-ru ʕantaw-ni esiw-ł dandir dibir c’ox-n
\g brother-CONT.ESS-EMPH behind as outside become-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT stupid-DEF brother-CONT.ESS towards mullah meet-PST.UNW
\l The stupid brother however who went outside behind his brother, ran into the mullah.

\t Dibirä nesiq esirno, dey baru yukaynč’a deberƛin.
\m dibir-a nesi-q esir-n di-s baru y-ukad-č’u-a mi-r-ƛin
\g mullah-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW me-GEN1 wife II-see-NEG.PST.WIT-Q you-LAT-QUOT
\l The mullah asked him: "You haven't seen my wife, have you?"

\t Yisä eƛin, yexuran yexurno di ža rečuƛ rekuyał šušisƛin, dibirä ʕantawni esiw ižin baru šaširuni moči bukarera.
\m yisi-a eƛi-n y-exur-an y-exur-n di ža reču-ƛ reku-ł šuši-s-ƛin dibir-a ʕantaw-ni esiw iži-n baru šuši-ru-ni moči b-ukar-r-a
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW II-kill-FUT.CVB II-kill-PFV.CVB me DEM1.SG cattleshed-SUB.ESS manure-CONT.ESS bury-PST.WIT-QUOT mullah-ERG stupid-DEF brother lead-PST.UNW wife bury-PST.PRT-DEF place III-show-CAUS-INF
\l He said: "I have indeed killed your wife and burried her in the manure in the shed.", and the mullah led the stupid brother to show him the place where he burried his wife.

\t Žedus xabarno teqno žeduł xizay iłetow c’odorawni esiwn ik’in.
\m žedu-s xabar-n teq-n žedu-ł xizay iłe-tow c’odoraw-ni esiw-n ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN1 story-TOP hear-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS behind as-EMPH clever-DEF brother-TOP go-PST.UNW
\l Having heard their talking, the clever brother went behind them likewise.

\t Xizyo c’odorawni esiw oqno ʕantawnä bukaruni moči bič’a.
\m xizyo c’odoraw-ni esiw oq-n ʕantaw-ni-a b-ukar-ru-ni moči b-ič’i-a
\g afterwards clever-DEF brother become-PST.UNW stupid-DEF-ERG III-show-PST.PRT-DEF place III-dig-INF
\l After that, the clever brother went to dig at the place the stupid brother had shown.

\t Ezun dibirno ičäsi zown.
\m ezu-n dibir-n iči-asi zow-n
\g look-PFV.CVB mullah-TOP wait-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l And the mullah waited and looked.

\t ƛ’iräy reku roɣnosi, čanyas maħi roƛixno.
\m ƛ’iräy reku r-oɣ-nosi čan-s maħi r-oƛix-n
\g from.above manure IV-take.away-ANT.CVB she.goat-GEN1 tail IV-appear-PST.UNW
\l After they had taken away the manure, a goat's tail appeared.

\t C’odorawnä esirno, eleley dibir, debez baruq maħi zowwäƛin.
\m c’odoraw-ni-a esir-n eleley dibir mi-z baru-q maħi zow-ya-ƛin
\g clever-DEF-ERG ask-PST.UNW behold mullah you-GEN2 wife-POSS.ESS tail be.NPRS-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l The clever one asked: "Lo and behold, mullah, did your wife have a tail?"

\t Dibir haqa ogun ƛexun, eƛa rožin riqinč’ey.
\m dibir haqu-a ogu-n ƛexu-n eƛi-a roži-n r-iqi-č’ey
\g mullah mouth-IN.ESS gape-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB say-INF word-TOP IV-get-NEG.PST.UNW
\l The mullah was gaping in surprise and had no word to say.

\t Encegon ƛ’iray reku roɣnosi, čanyas šilabi maħor roƛixno.
\m ence-gon ƛ’iri-ay reku r-oɣ-nosi čan-s šilu-bi maħor r-oƛix-n
\g a.little-CNTR above-IN.ABL manure IV-take.away-ANT.CVB she.goat-GEN1 horn-PL outside II.PL-appear-PST.UNW
\l They took away a little more manure from above and a goat's horns appeared.

\t Howžigoƛ’aygon c’odorawnä esirno dibirqo, debez baruq šilabi zowwäƛin.
\m howži-go-ƛ’ay-gon c’odoraw-ni-a esir-n dibir-q mi-z baru-q šilu-bi zow-ya-ƛin
\g now-COND-SUPER.ABL-CNTR clever-DEF-ERG ask-PST.UNW mullah-POSS.ESS you-GEN2 wife-POSS.ESS horn-PL be.NPRS-PST.WIT.Q-QUOT
\l This time the clever one asked the mullah: "Did your wife have horns?"

\t Howsi ʕabdalƛ’o bužzi oqsi diƛin, izin elay oqno maħor ik’in dibir, q’ˤuya mečoƛ’ baru k’edanixƛin.
\m howsi ʕabdal-ƛ’ bužzi oq-s di-ƛin izi-n ele-ay oq-n maħor ik’i-n dibir q’ˤuya moči-ƛ’ baru k’edi-ani-x-ƛin
\g that fool-SUPER.ESS believe become-PST.WIT me-QUOT get.up-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL become-PFV.CVB outside go-PST.UNW mullah other place-SUPER.ESS wife search-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l "And I had believed in that fool!", said the mullah, got up from there and went away to search for his wife in another place.

\t Hemedur c’odorłiƛ’aza q’ˤanon esnabi tambiħyoƛäy bok’ełno.
\m hemedur c’odorłi-ƛ’aza q’ˤano-n esyu-bi tambiħ-ƛay b-ok’eł-n
\g so cleverness-SUPER.VERS.DIST two-TOP brother-PL punishment-SUB.ABL I.PL-escape-PST.UNW
\l And so the two brothers escaped from punishment, due to their cleverness.

\t Žedu bičix zown ciqo sidaɣ qunyox.
\m žedu b-iči-x zow-n ciq sidaɣ qun-x
\g DEM1.IPL I.PL-live-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW forest in.one.place farmstead-AD.ESS
\l They were living on a farmstead somewhere in the forest.

\t Sebixaza žedu rˤełayzał zown.
\m sebi-xaza žedu rˤełay-bi-ł zow-n
\g autumn-AD.VERS.DIST DEM1.IPL threshing.floor-PL-CONT.ESS be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l In autumn they were on the threshing floor.

\t Hemedur howloza rˤałayzał xexbi yałzay, eɣeni esiwr keroqazay nexxo aždaħ bukayn.
\m hemedur howlo-za rˤełay-bi-ł xexbi yoł-zay eɣe-ni esiw-r kero-qazay nex-x aždaħ b-ukad-n
\g so there-ZA threshing.floor-PL-CONT.ESS children be-SIM.CVB young-DEF brother-LAT ravine-POSS.ABL.DIST come-IPFV.CVB dragon III-see-PST.UNW
\l While the children were there on the harvest like that, the young brother saw a dragon coming to them through the ravine.

\t Ocätow isʷan xecin, elay boxin bik’in, xexbi idun bˤuqełno, tełäzagon acno ħišin.
\m oc-a-tow is-bi-n xeci-n ele-ay b-oxi-n b-ik’i-n xexbi idu-n b-uqˤeł-n teł-aza-gon ac-n ħiši-n
\g threshing.floor-IN.ESS-EMPH bull-PL-TOP leave-PFV.CVB there-IN.ABL I.PL-run.away-PFV.CVB I.PL-go-PFV.CVB children home-TOP I.PL-hide-PFV.CVB inside-IN.VERS.DIST-CNTR door-TOP lock-PST.UNW
\l Leaving the bulls on the threshing floor, the children ran away from there, hid in their home and locked the door from inside.

\t Elor bayru aždaħä, ocä räsuru isʷa rigintow kurno.
\m elo-r b-ay-ru aždaħ-a oc-a r-esu-ru is-bi r-igi-n-tow kur-n
\g there-LAT I.PL-come-PST.PRT dragon-ERG threshing.floor-IN.ESS III.PL-exist-PST.PRT bull-PL III.PL-swallow-PFV.CVB-EMPH throw-PST.UNW
\l The dragon, having come there, swallowed the bulls that were on the threshing floor.

\t Xizyo yiził xizay aždaħ ɣˤutkoxor bayn.
\m xizyo yizi-ł xizay aždaħ ɣˤutku-xor b-ay-n
\g afterwards DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS behind dragon house-AD.LAT III-come-PST.UNW
\l Then the dragon came after them to the house.

\t Ac ħišäsi yesuzaƛ’, ƛ’ˤuƛ’orno bizin, gondun yoɣno, tełerno boqno, łenon užin igin kurno.
\m ac ħiši-asi y-esu-zaƛ’ ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or-n b-izi-n gondu-n y-oɣ-n tełer-n b-oq-n łeno-n uži-n igi-n kur-n
\g door lock-RES.PRT II-find-CSL.CVB roof-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-get.up-PFV.CVB big.hole-TOP II-take.away-PFV.CVB to.the.inside-TOP III-become-PFV.CVB five-TOP son-TOP swallow-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l Because it found the door locked, it got onto the roof, made a hole, got inside and gobbled the five sons up.

\t Maħor boqanƛin zawru yedu, gondaz beginč’ey howlotow ƛexun.
\m maħor b-oq-an-ƛin zow-ru yedu gondu-az b-egi-č’ey howlo-tow ƛexu-n
\g outside III-become-FUT.DEF-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.PRT DEM2.IISG big.hole-IN.ESS.DIST III-go.into-NEG.PST.CVB there-EMPH remain-PST.UNW
\l He wanted to get out, couldn't get through the hole and stayed there.

\t Šebey roqsiƛin, idur bik’inosi, ɣˤutkos ac tełäz ħišäsi yesun.
\m šebi-ey r-oq-s-ƛin idu-r b-ik’i-nosi ɣˤutku-s ac teł-az ħiši-asi y-esu-n
\g what-DUB IV-happen-PST.WIT-QUOT home-LAT I.PL-go-ANT.CVB house-GEN1 door inside-IN.ESS.DIST lock-RES.PRT II-find-PST.UNW
\l "What happened?", they asked and when they went home, they found the house door locked from inside.

\t ƛ’ˤuƛ’or bizin bezunosi, elo yizir gondu yesun, elo tełer bezunosi, aždaħ bukayn.
\m ƛ’ˤu-ƛ’or b-izi-n b-ezu-nosi elo yizi-r gondu y-esu-n elo tełer b-ezu-nosi aždaħ b-ukad-n
\g roof-SUPER.LAT I.PL-get.up-PST.UNW I.PL-look-ANT.CVB there DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT big.hole II-find-PFV.CVB there into I.PL-look-ANT.CVB dragon III-see-PST.UNW
\l They got up onto the roof, had a look and found a big hole; when they looked into it, they saw the dragon.

\t Howlaytow yiza aħi begirno elo igo yałru ʕaƛołer.
\m howlay-tow yizi-a aħi b-egir-n elo igo yoł-ru ʕaƛ-łer
\g from.there-EMPH DEM2.IPL.OBL-ERG alarm III-send-PST.UNW there near be-PST.PRT village-CONT.LAT
\l From there they alarmed the nearby village.

\t Kʷaxatow baq’ˤu ahli kumakyorƛin bayn k’oƛin.
\m kʷaxa-tow b-aq’ˤu ahli kumak-r-ƛin b-ay-n k’oƛi-n
\g quickly-EMPH III-many people help-LAT-QUOT III-come-PFV.CVB run-PST.UNW
\l Quickly many people came running in order to help.

\t Nasin ƛ’irin butin žan bexurno, tełäy maħor q’ˤanon isno boɣno, łenon užin oɣno.
\m nasin ƛ’iri-n b-uti-n ža-n b-exur-n teł-ay maħor q’ˤano-n is-n b-oɣ-n łeno-n uži-n oɣ-n
\g all above-TOP I.PL-turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB inside-IN.ABL outside two-TOP bull-and III-take.away-PFV.CVB five-TOP son-and take.away-PST.UNW
\l They all got onto it and killed it, then pulled the bulls and the five sons out of it.

\t Zownƛax, zown anuƛax sida ʕaƛa eže žek’u.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sida ʕaƛ-a eže žek’u
\g be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG-QUOT one.OBL village-IN.ESS old man
\l Once upon a time in a village there was an old man.

\t Nesis zownƛax sis ʕoloqanaw uži.
\m nesi-s zow-n-ƛax sis ʕoloqanaw uži
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT one young son
\l It's said that he had a young son.

\t Eženi žek’a ɣudes ƛirba ayruxort’a bˤeƛ’es šebin rexayx zown.
\m eže-ni žek’u-a ɣudes ƛirba ay-ru-xor-t’a bˤeƛ’-s šebi-n r-exʷad-x zow-n
\g old-DEF man-ERG daily guest come-PST.PRT-AD.LAT-DISTR sheep-GEN1 what-TOP IV-slaughter-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The old man slaughtered one of his sheep for guests who were coming.

\t Hudun nesis bˤeƛ’ reɣułatow reɣułxo zown anu.
\m hudun nesi-s bˤeƛ’ r-eɣuł-a-tow r-eɣuł-x zow-n anu
\g nevertheless DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 sheep III.PL-get.fewer-INF-EMPH III.PL-get.fewer-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l Nevertheless, his flock of sheep never got smaller.

\t Sida zamanaƛ’aza babiw roƛa utirno.
\m sida zaman-ƛ’aza babiw r-oƛ-a utir-n
\g one.OBL time-SUPER.VERS.DIST father IV-be.sick-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l After a while the father became sick.

\t Nesiƛ’ bezanixƛin bayru ahlimor žoyä bˤeƛ’es šebint’a teƛxo zown.
\m nesi-ƛ’ b-ezu-ani-x-ƛin b-ay-ru ahli-r uži-a bˤeƛ’-s šebin-t’a teƛ-x zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS I.PL-look-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT I.PL-come-PST.PRT people-LAT son-ERG sheep-GEN1 thing-DISTR give-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l The son gave out one sheep each for every person who came to look after him.

\t Exaniƛ’or aynosi, eženä žaqor wasi bodin, di exunosi łinaqnokin baraxšizi oqinč’ey sadaq’an rułir, buq boƛäxza puƛ’aɣor gurow saparno bäcinoƛin.
\m exu-a-ni-ƛ’or ay-nosi eže-ni-a uži-qor wasi b-odi-n di exu-nosi łina-q-n-kin baraxšizi oq-č’ey sadaq’a-n r-ułir buq b-oƛix-za pu-ƛ’aɣor gurow sapar-n b-ici-n-ƛin
\g die-INF-DEF-SUPER.LAT come-ANT.CVB old-DEF-ERG son-POSS.LAT testament III-do-PST.UNW me die-ANT.CVB what.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP-even pity become-NEG.PST.CVB alms-TOP IV-share sun III-appear-LCV.CVB side-SUPER.VERS except journey-TOP III-follow-PROHIB-QUOT
\l When his dead came, the old one made a testament to his son: "After I have died, do not pity anything but share the alms and go on a journey only to the place where the sun goes up!"

\t Kʷaxatow babiw exunƛax.
\m kʷaxa-tow babiw exu-n-ƛax
\g soon-EMPH father die-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l Soon the father died.

\t Babiwł xizay užä raq’ˤu sadaq’a rexurno.
\m babiw-ł xizay uži-a r-aq’ˤu sadaq’a r-exur-n
\g father-CONT.ESS behind son-ERG IV-much alms IV-kill-PST.UNW
\l After the father's death, the son gave away much alms.

\t Babiw exun q’ˤanoqu ɣudi rik’inosi, idu sida quł rac’ace at’no ƛexasi resun, rečuƛgon sis miƛ’in besun.
\m babiw exu-n q’ˤanoqu ɣudi r-ik’i-nosi idu sida qu-ł r-ac’-ace at’-n ƛexu-asi r-esu-n reču-ƛ-gon sis miƛ’i-n b-esu-n
\g father die-PFV.CVB forty day IV-go-ANT.CVB home one.OBL day-CONT.ESS IV-eat-TERM wheat-and remain-RES.PRT IV-exist-PFV.CVB cattleshed-SUB.ESS-CNTR one ram-and III-exist-PST.UNW
\l When the father had been dead for forty days, at home only remained wheat to eat for one day and one ram in the shed.

\t Neła quł yisider ƛirbałix ayn ašuƛärce mešok’la yołäsi sis eže žek’u.
\m neła qu-ł yisi-der ƛirbałi-x ay-n ašu-ƛer-ce mešok’la yoł-asi sis eže žek’u
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT hospitality-AD.ESS come-PFV.CVB waist-SUB.LAT-EQU1 moustache be-RES.PRT one old man
\l One day an old man with a moustache reaching down to his waist came as a guest.

\t Užä izin, miƛ’in bexayn, ƛäxuruni at’es magalun boyn.
\m uži-a izi-n miƛ’i-n b-exʷad-n ƛexu-ru-ni at’-s magalu-n b-odi-n
\g son-ERG get.up-PFV.CVB ram-TOP III-slaughter-PFV.CVB remain-PST.PRT-DEF wheat-GEN1 bread-TOP III-do-PST.UNW
\l The son got up, slaughtered the ram and made a bread from the remaining wheat.

\t Eženi žek’a nesiqor eƛin, he, dey uži, sistow sis yałru miƛ’in bexays mi, idu ƛexun zawruni at’es magalun bodis, howži hudu šebi roda rok’ƛ’o yoł debezƛin.
\m eže-ni žek’u-a nesi-qor eƛi-n he di-s uži sis-tow sis yoł-ru miƛ’i-n b-exʷad-s mi idu ƛexu-n zow-ru-ni at’-s magalu-n b-odi-s howži hudu šebi r-odi-a rok’u-ƛ’ yoł mi-z-ƛin
\g old-DEF man-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW hey me-GEN1 son one-EMPH one be-PST.PRT ram-and III-slaughter-PST.WIT you home remain-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF wheat-GEN1 bread-and III-do-PST.WIT now so what IV-do-INF heart-SUPER.ESS be you-GEN2-QUOT
\l The old man said to him: "Hey, my son, you slaughtered the one and only ram; and you made bread from the wheat that remained in your home; so what are you planning to do now?"

\t Užä eƛin, Allahä didurƛa caxäsi resan, däz babiyan ƛirba ayruxort’a bˤeƛ’es šebin rexayx zows, sida qułkin ža bišan kamin (giħiłno) ƛexunč’u ža, din hemedurtow ƛäxunč’iƛin.
\m uži-a eƛi-n Allah-a didur-ƛa cax-asi r-esu-an di-z babiw-a-n ƛirba ay-ru-xor-t’a bˤeƛ’-s šebin r-exʷad-x zow-s sida qu-ł-kin ža bišʷa-n kami-n giħił-n ƛexu-č’u ža di-n hemedur-tow ƛexu-č’i-ƛin
\g boy-ERG say-PST.UNW God-ERG how-INDEF write-RES.PRT IV-find-FUT.DEF me-GEN2 father-ERG-and guest come-PST.PRT-AD.LAT-DISTR sheep-GEN1 thing IV-slaughter-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.WIT one.OBL day-CONT.ESS-even DEM1.SG food-TOP get.lost-PFV.CVB be.lacking-PFV.CVB remain-NEG.PST.WIT DEM1.SG me-and so-EMPH remain-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l The boy said: "God might have written it somehow; my father used to slaughter a sheep for every guest who came, and he wasn't without food for even a day; so I will be as well."

\t Xizyogon eženi žek’a eƛin, howži deber sis iman yołäsi baru yiča yay, nełał xizay oqa deber zaman bayn.
\m xizyogon eže-ni žek’u-a eƛi-n howži mi-r sis iman yoł-asi baru y-iči-a y-ay neła-ł xizay oq-a mi-r zaman b-ay-n
\g then old-DEF man-ERG say-PST.UNW now you-LAT one faith be-RES.PRT wife II-be-INF II-must DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind become-INF you-LAT time III-come-PST.UNW
\l Then the old man said: "Now you need to have a faithful wife, the time has come to go after her!

\t Łˤora ɣudƛ’aza maduhalłiq yałru ʕaƛoł berten bičixosi.
\m łˤora ɣudi-ƛ’aza maduhalłi-q yoł-ru ʕaƛ-ł berten b-iči-xosi
\g three.OBL day-SUPER.VERS.DIST neighbourhood-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT village-CONT.ESS marriage III-be-PRS.PRT
\l Three days later in a neighboring village there is a marriage.

\t Elorno nexno, mi siskin lamus oqinč’ey eƛo, yedu dey baħaray meža xedyox šida yegirxoƛin.
\m elo-r-n nex-n mi siskin lamus oq-č’ey eƛi-o yedu di-s baħaray mežu-a xediw-x šida y-egir-x-ƛin
\g there-LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB you any shame become-NEG.PST.CVB say-IMPR DEM2.IISG me-GEN1 fiancée you(I).PL.OBL-ERG husband-AD.ESS why II-send-PRS-QUOT
\l Go there and without any shame say: 'Why are you marrying off my fiancée to some other husband?'

\t Yedu debeq di äsiru šebin łaqnokin äsinƛin eƛin, eženi oqno maħor ik’in.
\m yedu mi-q di esi-ru šebi-n ła-q-n-kin esi-n-ƛin eƛi-n eže-ni oq-n maħor ik’i-n
\g DEM2.IISG you-POSS.ESS me tell-PST.PRT what-TOP who.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP-even tell-PROHIB-QUOT say-PFV.CVB old-DEF become-PFV.CVB outside go-PST.UNW
\l Don't tell anyone what I told you!", the old man told and went outside.

\t Sasaqosi moƛaxay izinosi, užir ric’äsi at’es ixinno resun, rečuƛgon łˤono miƛ’in besun.
\m sasaqosi moƛu-xay izi-nosi uži-r r-ic’-asi at’-s ixin-n r-esu-n reču-ƛ-gon łˤono miƛ’i-n b-esu-n
\g in.the.morning sleep-AD.ABL get.up-ANT.CVB boy-LAT IV-fill-RES.PRT wheat-GEN1 bag-and IV-find-PFV.CVB cattleshed-SUB.ESS-CNTR three ram-and III-find-PST.UNW
\l In the morning after waking up from his sleep, the boy found a bag filled with wheat and three rams in his shed.

\t Yedu šebi ħikmatƛin, ʕažaib oqno ƛexun yeda.
\m yedu šebi ħikmat-ƛin ʕažaib oq-n ƛexu-n yeda
\g DEM2.IISG what wonder-QUOT surprise become-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG
\l "What a surprise!", he said surprisedly.

\t Nesi eženä äƛiruxor, łˤora ɣudƛ’aza yeda maduhalłiq yałru ʕaƛaɣor ik’in.
\m nesi eže-ni-a äƛiru-xor łˤora ɣudi-ƛ’aza yeda maduhalłi-q yoł-ru ʕaƛ-aɣor ik’i-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL old-DEF-ERG ORD-AD.LAT three.OBL day-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM2.ISG neighbourhood-POSS.ESS be-PST.PRT village-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l As that old man had said, after three days he came to a village in the neighborhood.

\t Elo nesir berten eräsi besun.
\m elo nesi-r berten er-asi b-esu-n
\g there DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT marriage set.up-RES.PRT III-find-PST.UNW
\l There he found a wedding that was organized.

\t Yeda, łukin tełxorno goƛ’inč’ey, best’alawni iłe kawumox hečk’er ƛexun.
\m yeda łu-kin teł-xor-n goƛ’i-č’ey best’alaw-ni iłe kawu-x hečk’er ƛexu-n
\g DEM2.ISG who.ERG-even inside-AD.LAT-TOP invite-NEG.PST.CVB orphan-DEF as gate-AD.ESS upright remain-PST.UNW
\l Because no one invited him inside, he stood there upright at the gate like an orphan.

\t Zamanaƛ’aza yeda sida šebi eƛa äynč’iru žek’a tełxor ižin, sida ɣˤanazagon šešoƛ’no oɣno.
\m zaman-ƛ’aza yeda sida šebi eƛi-a iy-č’i-ru žek’u-a teł-xor iži-n sida ɣˤanabi-a-gon šešo-ƛ’-n oɣ-n
\g time-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM2.ISG one.OBL who say-INF know-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT man-ERG inside-AD.LAT lead-PFV.CVB one.OBL woman-ERG-CNTR dance-SUPER.ESS-TOP take.away-PST.UNW
\l After some time, a man unbeknownst to him lead him inside and a woman invited him to dance.

\t Xizyo yisä eƛin, yedu dey baħaray meža šida xedyox yegirxoƛin.
\m xizyo yisi-a eƛi-n yedu di-s baħaray mežu-a šida xediw-x y-egir-x-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG me-GEN1 fiancée you(I).PL.OBL-ERG why husband-AD.ESS II-send-PRS-QUOT
\l Afterwards he said: "Why do you marry off my fiancee to another husband?"

\t Bertenyoł zawruni ahli ʕažaib boqno nesä äƛiru łinaƛ’no.
\m berten-ł zow-ru-ni ahli ʕažaib b-oq-n nesi-a eƛi-ru łina-ƛ’-n
\g marriage-CONT.ESS be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF people surprise I.PL-become-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP
\l The people who were on the marriage were surprised about what he had said.

\t Xexłiƛ’ yeda maħor t’ay oxirƛin, sis xalq’i qˤaƛanayn.
\m xexłi-ƛ’ yeda maħor t’ay oxir-ƛin sis xalq’i qˤaƛanad-n
\g quickness-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG outside from.here chase-QUOT one people yell-PST.UNW
\l "Quickly chase him out of here!" the people yelled.

\t Hemełƛ’o ƛ’irir ayn k’oƛin kot’u yexorani eženi žek’u.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ ƛ’iri-r ay-n k’oƛi-n kot’u y-exora-ni eže-ni žek’u
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS on-LAT come-PFV.CVB jump-PFV.CVB beard II-long-DEF old-DEF man
\l On that moment appeared the old man with the long beard.

\t Nesä eƛin, were meži dahaw wˤałer bik’i, bertenyołäy xalq’i maħor roxira rayxosi anu.
\m nesi-a eƛi-n were meži dahaw wˤał-r b-ik’i berten-łay xalq’i maħor r-oxir-a r-ay-xosi anu
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW well you.PL a.little downward-LAT I.PL-go marriage-CONT.ABL people outside III.PL-chase-INF IV-must-PRS.PRT be.NEG
\l He said: "Well, calm down a little, one must not chase away people from a marriage."

\t Horo, meža yaqˤuł dey sis ʕaq’lu bisoƛin.
\m horo mežu-a yaqˤuł di-s sis ʕaq’lu b-is-o-ƛin
\g come.IMPR you(I).PL.OBL-ERG today me-GEN1 one advice III-take-IMPR-QUOT
\l Come, take my advice today!

\t Enda užin, baħarawn sidä sidde puħon bičirno, yiził roƛƛo ciqqay reč’no rown hečk’er ɣunno eqerno, ža ɣun ładäɣor rutix, nesix yedu baħarayn yegira yayƛin.
\m enda uži-n baħaraw-n sida-a sida-de pu-x-n b-iči-r-n yizi-ł r-oƛƛo ciq-qay r-eč’-n r-ow-n hečk’er ɣun-n eqer-n ža ɣun ła-däɣor r-uti-x nesi-x yedu baħaray-n y-egir-a y-ay-ƛin
\g DEM3b.SG boy-and fiancé-and one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-APUD.ESS side-AD.ESS-TOP I.PL-remain-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS IV-middle forest-POSS.ABL IV-cut-PFV.CVB IV-bring-PFV.CVB upright tree-TOP put-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG tree who.OBL-APUD.VERS IV-turn-IPFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS DEM2.IISG fiancée-TOP II-send-INF II-must-QUOT
\l That boy and the groom we let stand side to side, and in their middle we'll put upright a tree that we cut from the forest and brought here, to whomever the tree falls, he must be married to the bride.

\t Ža užin, baħarawn sadaqno bičirno, žeduł roƛƛo hečk’er eqerno ciqqay reč’no rawruni ɣun.
\m ža uži-n baħaraw-n sadaq-n b-iči-r-n žedu-ł r-oƛƛo hečk’er eqer-n ciq-qay r-eč’-n r-ow-ru-ni ɣun
\g DEM1.SG boy-and fiancé-and together-TOP I.PL-remain-CAUS-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS IV-middle upright put-PFV.CVB forest-POSS.ABL IV-cut-PFV.CVB IV-bring-PST.PRT-DEF tree
\l nan

\t Zamanaƛ’aza ža rutin rik’in eženä egirno zawruni uži äčiza puƛ’aɣor.
\m zaman-ƛ’aza ža r-uti-n r-ik’i-n eže-ni-a egir-n zow-ru-ni uži iči-za pu-ƛ’aɣor
\g time-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM1.SG IV-turn-PFV.CVB IV-go-PFV.CVB old-DEF-ERG send-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF boy be-LCV.CVB side-SUPER.VERS
\l After some time it fell to the side where the old man had placed the boy.

\t Howlotow erno maharno, nesi žax baħarayn yegirno.
\m howlo-tow er-n mahar-n nesi uži-x baħaray-n y-egir-n
\g there-EMPH set.up-PFV.CVB wedding-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL boy-AD.ESS fiancée-TOP II-send-PST.UNW
\l There they set up the wedding and the bride was married off to the boy.

\t Hudayziko, boc’no adäza ziyan xediw bazaryaɣor ik’in.
\m hudayziko b-oc’-n adäza ziya-n xediw bazar-aɣor ik’i-n
\g the.next.day III-drive-PFV.CVB ahead cow-TOP husband bazar-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l The next day the husband chased the cow to the market.

\t Yisił dandir c’axru bełiqa esirno, yedu ziya naɣor bižix miƛin.
\m yisi-ł dandir c’ox-ru bełiqu-a esir-n yedu ziya na-aɣor b-iži-x mi-ƛin
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS towards meet-PST.PRT hunter-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG cow where-IN.VERS III-lead-PRS you-QUOT
\l A hunter whom he met asked him: "Where are you bringing that cow to?"

\t Bazaryaɣor teƛa bižixƛin, yisä yałru šebin esin.
\m bazar-aɣor teƛ-a b-iži-x-ƛin yisi-a yoł-ru šebin esi-n
\g bazar-IN.VERS sell-INF III-lead-PRS-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG be-PST.PRT thing tell-PST.UNW
\l "I'm bringing it to the market for selling." he told the things as they were.

\t Bełiqa eƛin, horo, oxi där tupiƛ ħažoƛin.
\m bełiqu-a eƛi-n horo oxi di-r tupi-ƛ ħaži-o-ƛin
\g hunter-ERG say-PST.UNW come.IMPR run.away me-LAT rifle-SUB.ESS exchange-IMPR-QUOT
\l The hunter said: "Come, exchange it for my rifle!"

\t Ziyan tupiƛ teƛno, yeda uži uyxor bazaryaɣor ik’in, žan teƛnogon šeƛ’u risanƛin.
\m ziya-n tupi-ƛ teƛ-n yeda uži uyxor bazar-aɣor ik’i-n ža-n teƛ-n-gon šeƛ’u r-is-an-ƛin
\g cow-TOP rifle-SUB.ESS sell-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG boy straight bazar-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW DEM1.SG-TOP sell-PFV.CVB-CNTR clothing IV-buy-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The boy sold his cow for the rifle and went straight to the market with the intention of selling it and buying clothes.

\t Dandir c’axru bazarganza esirno, ža tupi teƛxosi ana miƛin.
\m dandir c’ox-ru bazargan-bi-a esir-n ža tupi teƛ-xosi anu-a mi-ƛin
\g towards meet-PST.PRT merchant-PL-ERG ask-PST.UNW DEM1.SG rifle sell-PRS.PRT be.NEG-Q you-QUOT
\l Some merchants whom he met asked him: "Aren't you selling this rifle?"

\t Yedun teƛno där šeƛ’u risa retinƛin, eƛin yisä.
\m yedu-n teƛ-n di-r šeƛ’u r-is-a r-eti-n-ƛin eƛi-n yisi-a
\g DEM2.IISG-TOP sell-PFV.CVB me-LAT clothing IV-buy-INF IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "I want to sell it and buy clothes.", he said.

\t Elur k’ukyoƛ ħažoƛin, ƛ’iri butin žedu.
\m elu-r k’uk-ƛ ħaži-o-ƛin ƛ’iri b-uti-n žedu
\g we(I).OBL-LAT cap-SUB.ESS exchange-IMPR-QUOT above I.PL-turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL
\l "Exchange it for a cap with us!", they proposed.

\t Bazarganzar k’ukyoƛ tupin ħažin, žedudetow sadaq xizor utin nexxo zown ža.
\m bazargan-bi-r k’uk-ƛ tupi-n ħaži-n žedu-de-tow sadaq xizor uti-n nex-x zow-n ža
\g merchant-PL-LAT cap-SUB.ESS rifle-TOP exchange-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-APUD.ESS-EMPH with back return-PFV.CVB come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l Having exchanged the rifle for a cap with the merchants, he returned with them.

\t Buqbetaxor yizi sida iħuz lilyoxor baynosi, muši begiranix bazarganbin, yedan q’ˤida bičin.
\m buqbeta-xor yizi sida iħu-z lilyo-xor b-ay-nosi muši b-egir-ani-x bazargan-bi-n yeda-n q’ˤida b-iči-n
\g sunset-AD.LAT DEM2.IPL one.OBL river-GEN2 river.bank-AD.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB breath III-let-MSD-AD.ESS merchant-PL-and DEM2.ISG-and down I.PL-sit-PST.UNW
\l Toward sunset, when they came to a river bank, the merchants and he sat down to take a break.

\t Iħäy łi ħaƛanƛin yeda wˤałer užinosi, q’ˤimƛ’ay bˤoƛ’un bik’in k’uk, ƛ’iräy wˤałer łiya bižin.
\m iħu-ay łi ħaƛu-an-ƛin yeda wˤał-r uži-nosi q’ˤim-ƛ’ay b-ˤoƛ’u-n b-ik’i-n k’uk ƛ’iräy wˤał-r łi-a b-iži-n
\g river-IN.ABL water drink-FUT.DEF-QUOT DEM2.ISG downward-LAT bow.down-ANT.CVB head-SUPER.ABL III-fall-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB cap from.above downward-LAT water-ERG III-carry-PST.UNW
\l With the intention to drink from the river, he bowed down and the cap fell down off is head and was carried downstream by the water.

\t Xizay ezun yedan ƛexun.
\m xizay ezu-n yeda-n ƛexu-n
\g behind look-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG-TOP remain-PST.UNW
\l And he stood there looking behind it.

\t Howži bazarganza yisiqor eƛin, neširu mi idur ik’ixanusi elur riyxƛin.
\m howži bazargan-bi-a yisi-qor eƛi-n neširu mi idu-r ik’i-xanusi elu-r r-iy-x-ƛin
\g now merchant-PL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW evening you home-LAT go-NEG.PRS.PRT we(I).OBL-LAT IV-know-PRS-QUOT
\l Now the merchants said to him: "We know that you won't go home tonight."

\t Šida di idur ik’ixanu, dey šebi ɣˤutkuya rik’äsiƛin, eƛin yisä.
\m šida di idu-r ik’i-x-anu di-s šebi ɣˤutku-a r-ik’u-asi-ƛin eƛi-n yisi-a
\g why me home-LAT go-PRS-NEG me-GEN1 what house-IN.ESS IV-burn-RES.PRT-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "Why can't I go home? Did something burn in my house?", he said.

\t Debin barusno c’ok’ini raqƛin, eƛin bazarganza.
\m mi-s-n baru-s-n c’ok’ini r-oq-ƛin eƛi-n bazargan-bi-a
\g you-GEN1-TOP wife-GEN1-TOP scandal IV-happen-QUOT say-PST.UNW merchant-PL-ERG
\l "You will have a quarrel with your wife." said the merchants.

\t Xizyo yizi bazarganza yisił roƛƛo risno, neširu debin barusno c’ok’ini roqnäy, debi yałru maʕišat elur biča yoł, bercingo bara mi iduɣor egirnäy, ele enza łˤoran q’urec’niƛ’osi q’ay ħalalgotow deber biča yołƛin.
\m xizyo yizi bazargan-bi-a yisi-ł r-oƛƛo r-is-n neširu mi-s-n baru-s-n c’ok’ini r-oq-näy mi-s yoł-ru maʕišat elu-r b-iči-a yoł bercingo baru-a mi idu-ɣor egir-näy ele enza łˤora-n q’urec’ni-ƛ’-si q’ay ħalal-go-tow mi-r b-iči-a yoł-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM2.IPL.OBL merchant-PL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS IV-middle IV-take-PST.UNW evening you-GEN1-TOP wife-GEN1-TOP scandal IV-happen-CND.CVB you-GEN1 be-PST.PRT fortune we(I).OBL-LAT III-remain-INF be good wife-ERG you home-IN.ALL let-CND.CVB here DEM3b.IIPL.OBL three.OBL-TOP mule-SUPER.ESS-ATTR article be.permitted-COND-EMPH you-LAT III-be-INF be-QUOT
\l Then the merchants decided among themselves: "In the evening, if your wife makes a scandal, then your fortune will be ours, and when a good wife lets you into the home, all the articles on these three mules shall be yours."

\t Nełaƛ’ yeda užin razi oqno.
\m neła-ƛ’ yeda uži-n razi oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG boy-and agree become-PST.UNW
\l On that also the boy agreed.

\t Acno yaɣˤin tełer aqruntow, suƛƛi dandir nexno bara xedyoq ałni bic’no.
\m ac-n y-ˤaɣˤi-n tełer oq-run-tow suƛƛi dandir nex-n baru-a xediw-q ałni b-ic’-n
\g door-TOP II-open-PFV.CVB to.the.inside become-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH immediately towards come-PFV.CVB wife-ERG husband-POSS.ESS hug III-hug-PST.UNW
\l As soon as he opened the door and stepped inside, his wife came toward him and hugged him.

\t Xedya esin, sosi di bełiqur tupiƛ ziya ħažis, xizyo ža tupin teƛno bazarganzaqay k’uk bissi, ža k’ukgon iħay łi ħaƛaƛin wˤałer užinosi, q’ˤimƛ’ay bˤoƛ’un bik’in łiya boɣno bižisƛin.
\m xediw-a esi-n sosi di bełiqu-r tupi-ƛ ziya ħaži-s xizyo ža tupi-n teƛ-n bazargan-bi-qay k’uk b-is-s ža k’uk-gon iħu-ay łi ħaƛu-a-ƛin wˤał-r uži-nosi q’ˤim-ƛ’ay b-ˤoƛ’u-n b-ik’i-n łi-a b-oɣ-n b-iži-s-ƛin
\g husband-ERG tell-PST.UNW at.first me hunter-LAT rifle-SUB.ESS cow exchange-PST.WIT afterwards DEM1.SG rifle-TOP sell-PFV.CVB merchant-PL-POSS.ABL cap III-buy-PST.WIT DEM1.SG cap-CNTR river-IN.ABL water drink-INF-QUOT downward-LAT bow.down-ANT.CVB head-SUPER.ABL III-fall-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB water-ERG III-take.away-PFV.CVB III-carry-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The husband told: "At first I exchanged the cow for a rifle with a hunter, then I sold the rifle and boughta cap from some merchants, this cap fell down from my head while I was about to drink from the river and the water carried it away."

\t Xizyogon bara yizin xediwq ałni bic’no, nełƛ’ay žuka elur rukaynoƛ, eli saɣłiƛ’ boqnäy, dunyales ɣez bihayaw šebin yołƛin.
\m xizyogon baru-a y-izi-n xediw-q ałni b-ic’-n neła-ƛ’ay žuka elu-r r-ukad-n-ƛ eli saɣłi-ƛ’ b-oq-näy dunyal-s ɣez bihayaw šebin yoł-ƛin
\g then wife-ERG II-get.up-PFV.CVB husband-POSS.ESS hug III-hug-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL bad we(I).OBL-LAT IV-see-PROHIB-OPT we health-SUPER.ESS III-become-CND.CVB world-GEN1 dirt easy thing be-QUOT
\l Then the wife got up and hugged her husband again: "May we not see something worse than this; as long as we are in health, it's an easy thing to find the world's "

\t Ža šinaw šebin teqno acmox aħyan kurno bäčiruni bazarganzar.
\m ža šinaw šebin teq-n ac-x aħya-n kur-n b-iči-ru-ni bazargan-bi-r
\g DEM1.SG every thing hear-PFV.CVB door-AD.ESS ear-TOP spread.out-PFV.CVB III-wait-PST.PRT-DEF merchant-PL-LAT
\l All these things heard the merchants who were waiting at the door spreading out their ears.

\t Eli beɣusƛin, tełxorkin boqinč’ey, badiru q’ut’imoxor, łˤonon q’urec’nin, žedaƛ’ ƛ’iri yałru q’ayn howlotow xecin, bazarganbin xizor bik’in.
\m eli b-eɣu-s-ƛin teł-xor-kin b-oq-č’ey b-adiru q’ut’i-xor łˤono-n q’urec’ni-n žeda-ƛ’ ƛ’iri yoł-ru q’ay-n howlo-tow xeci-n bazargan-bi-n xizor b-ik’i-n
\g we I.PL-be.defeated-PST.WIT-QUOT inside-AD.LAT-even I.PL-become-NEG.PST.CVB III-fulfilled agreement-AD.LAT three-TOP mule-and DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS on be-PST.PRT article-and there-EMPH leave-PFV.CVB merchant-PL-TOP back I.PL-go-PST.UNW
\l "We have lost!"; without even going inside they left the three mules and the wares on them there, to fulfill the agreement, and went back.

\t Maħor boqnosi, bara xediwq esirno, yedu q’urec’nibin, žedaƛ’ ƛ’irisi q’ayn łasey besanƛin.
\m maħor b-oq-nosi baru-a xediw-q esir-n yedu q’urec’ni-bi-n žeda-ƛ’ ƛ’iri-si q’ay-n ła-s-ey b-esu-an-ƛin
\g outside I.PL-become-ANT.CVB wife-ERG husband-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG mule-PL-and DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUPER.ESS on-ATTR article-and who.OBL-GEN1-DUB III-exist-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l When they went outside, the wife asked her husband: "Whose might those mules and the wares on them be?"

\t Xizyo xedya esin bazarganzan nesän roƛo räsrułäy.
\m xizyo xediw-a esi-n bazargan-bi-a-n nesi-a-n r-oƛƛo r-is-ru-łay
\g afterwards husband-ERG tell-PST.UNW merchant-PL-ERG-and DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-and IV-middle IV-take-PST.PRT-CONT.ABL
\l Then the husband told of what was between the merchants and himself.

\t Debez tawakalyoƛ’aza riqäsi bečełi yoł yeduƛin, xediw q’urec’niƛ’ay q’ay boɣaniłer oqno, ža iduɣor bižanix kumakyorgon barun yizin.
\m mi-z tawakal-ƛ’aza r-iqi-asi bečełi yoł yedu-ƛin xediw q’urec’ni-ƛ’ay q’ay b-oɣ-ani-łer oq-n ža idu-ɣor b-iži-ani-x kumak-r-gon baru-n y-izi-n
\g you-GEN2 patience-SUPER.VERS.DIST IV-get-RES.PRT riches be DEM2.IISG-QUOT husband mule-SUPER.ABL article III-take.away-MSD-CONT.LAT begin-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG home-IN.ALL III-carry-MSD-AD.ESS help-LAT-CNTR wife-TOP II-get.up-PST.UNW
\l "Thanks to your patience we got such a wealth!" and the husband began to unload the articles from the mules and his wife helped to carry them home.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu buq bay.
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l All's well that ends well.

\t Zownƛax, zown anuƛax sis best’al uži.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis best’al uži
\g be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG-QUOT one orphan boy
\l Once upon a time there was an orphan boy.

\t Łinaƛ’notow raħmu bisxosi xexbi zown ža.
\m łina-ƛ’-n-tow raħmu b-is-xosi xexbi zow-n ža
\g what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP-EMPH mercy III-take-PRS.PRT child be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l He was a boy who had mercy with everything.

\t Hut’-mˤaliƛ’ häqruni t’ut’ƛ’orkin nesä reƛ’a rizirxo zown anu, žatow boxin bik’ace xecix zown.
\m hut’~mˤali-ƛ’ heq-ru-ni t’ut’-ƛ’or-kin nesi-a reƛ’a r-izir-x zow-n anu ža-tow b-oxi-n b-ik’i-ace xeci-x zow-n
\g front.part.of.the.face-SUPER.ESS sit.down-PST.PRT-DEF fly-SUPER.LAT-even DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG hand IV-lift-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG DEM1.SG-EMPH III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-go-TERM leave-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Even to a fly who was sitting on his face, he did not lift the hand, but he left it there until it flew away.

\t Nesiƛ’ Alimaħamaƛin ci zown.
\m nesi-ƛ’ Alimaħama-ƛin ci zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS Alimagomed-QUOT name be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His name was Alimagomed.

\t Sida zamanał ža maħor oqno, nesä nesir eynodanix močin k’edin.
\m sida zaman-ł ža maħor oq-n nesi-a nesi-r eynod-ani-x moči-n k’edi-n
\g one.OBL time-CONT.ESS DEM1.SG outside become-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT work-MSD-AD.ESS place-TOP search-PFV.CVB
\l After some time, he went out and searched a place for himself to work.

\t Alimaħama maduhalłiqozoni ʕaƛar ayn.
\m Alimaħama maduhalłi-q-zo-ni ʕaƛ-ar ay-n
\g Alimagomed neighbourhood-POSS.ESS-ATTR.OBL-DEF village-IN.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Alimagomed came into a neighboring village.

\t Elo Paxrudinƛin sida žek’a yisir ƛirbałi royn.
\m elo Paxrudin-ƛin sida žek’u-a yisi-r ƛirbałi r-odi-n
\g there Pakhrudin-QUOT one.OBL man-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT hospitality IV-do-PST.UNW
\l There a man named Pakhrudin welcomed him as a guest.

\t ƛ’irir ayru ƛirbaq nesä esirno, šebi retin maħor oqäƛin.
\m ƛ’iri-r ay-ru ƛirba-q nesi-a esir-n šebi r-eti-n maħor oq-a-ƛin
\g above-LAT come-PST.PRT guest-POSS.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-PST.UNW what IV-want-PFV.CVB outside become-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l He asked the upcoming guest: "What did you come out here for?"

\t Ħak’omƛerce šebin riqiraniƛäy, eynodanix močin k’edin oqäsi yołƛin, esin Alimaħama.
\m ħak’o-ƛer-ce šebin r-iqir-ani-ƛay eynod-ani-x moči-n k’edi-n oq-asi yoł-ƛin esi-n Alimaħama-a
\g khinkali-SUB.LAT-EQU1 thing IV-win-MSD-SUB.ABL work-MSD-AD.ESS place-TOP search-PFV.CVB become-RES.PRT be-QUOT tell-PST.UNW Alimagomed-ERG
\l "I have come to search a place to work in order to earn some food."

\t Däde yoł deber eynodanix moči, bˤeƛ’xo aħołun ik’anix mi razi oqnäyƛin, eƛin Paxrudinä.
\m di-de yoł mi-r eynod-ani-x moči bˤeƛ’-x aħo-łun ik’i-ani-x mi razi oq-näy-ƛin eƛi-n Paxrudin-a
\g me-APUD.ESS be you-LAT work-MSD-AD.ESS place sheep-AD.ESS shepherd-LHUN go-MSD-AD.ESS you agree become-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW Pakhrudin-ERG
\l "I have a place for you to work, if you agree to become a shepherd.", said Pakhrudin.

\t Nełƛ’ay bigu eynodanix moči där anuƛin, Alimaħama razi oqno.
\m neła-ƛ’ay b-igu eynod-ani-x moči di-r anu-ƛin Alimaħama razi oq-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL III-good work-MSD-AD.ESS place me-LAT be.NEG-QUOT Alimagomed agree become-PST.UNW
\l "There is no better place for me to work!", Alimagomed agreed.

\t Nełƛ’osi ɣudbi rik’inosi, sida quł iħuz lilyox yisir bikori besun.
\m nełƛ’osi ɣudi-bi r-ik’i-nosi sida qu-ł iħu-z lilyo-x yisi-r bikori b-esu-n
\g of.that.time day-PL IV.PL-go-ANT.CVB one.OBL day-CONT.ESS river-GEN2 river.bank-AD.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT snake III-find-PST.UNW
\l From then on the days went by, and one day he found a snake at the river bank.

\t Yisä yedu hibon bok’no bexurno.
\m yisi-a yedu hibo-n b-ok’-n b-exur-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IISG stick-TOP III-beat-PFV.CVB III-kill-PST.UNW
\l He beat it with a stick and killed it.

\t Netin t’ut’ƛ’orkin reƛ’a rizärinč’iru, yedu šebi där yaqˤuł roqäƛin, bikorin bexurno yisiz rok’uƛ’ nexełno.
\m netin t’ut’-ƛ’or-kin reƛ’a r-izir-č’i-ru yedu šebi di-r yaqˤuł r-oq-a-ƛin bikori-n b-exur-n yisi-z rok’u-ƛ’ nex-ł-n
\g always fly-SUPER.LAT-even hand IV-lift-NEG.FUT.CVB-PST.PRT DEM2.IISG what me-LAT today IV-happen-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT snake-TOP III-kill-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 heart-SUPER.ESS come-POT-PST.UNW
\l "I never even lifted my hand to a fly, what has happened to me today?!", he realized that he killed the snake.

\t Hemełƛ’o bayn adäz qˤays xexoyn bičin yisiqor eƛin, mi siskin pašman aqno, yaqˤuł mi elus tušman bexursi, hoboy mi däz eniwdäɣor däde sadaq ƛa.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ b-ay-n adäz qˤay-s xexoy-n b-iči-n yisi-qor eƛi-n mi siskin pašman oq-n yaqˤuł mi elu-s tušman b-exur-s hoboy mi di-z eniw-däɣor di-de sadaq ƛa
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS III-come-PFV.CVB ahead hare-GEN1 young.animal-TOP III-sit-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you any become.sad become-PROHIB today you we(I).OBL-GEN1 enemy III-kill-PST.WIT now you me-GEN2 mother-APUD.VERS me-APUD.ESS with go.IMPR
\l Then came a rabbit's young and sat down in front of him and said to him: "Don't become sad! Today you have killed our enemy; now come with me to my mother!

\t Bikori bexarus neła deber saɣyat neƛa yaq.
\m bikori b-exur-ru-s neła-a mi-r saɣyat neƛ-a y-oq
\g snake III-kill-PST.PRT-GEN1 DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG you-LAT present give-INF II-become
\l For that you killed the snake, she will give you a present.

\t Mi ža bäsno, debez mecreq mec bitirerƛo, q’ˤuya debi šebin där retin anuƛin eniwqor eƛoƛin, mołin qˤayz xexoyä Alimaħamaq.
\m mi ža b-is-n mi-z mec-q mec b-itir-r-ƛ-o q’ˤuya mi-s šebin di-r r-eti-n anu-ƛin eniw-qor eƛi-o-ƛin mołi-n qˤay-z xexoy-a Alimaħama-q
\g you DEM1.SG III-take-PROHIB you-GEN2 tongue-POSS.ESS tongue III-touch-CAUS-OPT-IMPR other you-GEN1 thing me-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW be.NEG-QUOT mother-POSS.LAT say-IMPR-QUOT teach-PST.UNW hare-GEN2 young.animal-ERG Alimagomed-POSS.ESS
\l Do not take it up, but ask her to touch your tongue with her tongue, tell my mother that you don't want other things.", explained the young rabbit to Alimagomed.

\t Qˤayz xexoył xizay yeda sidaɣ mečoł gonda tełxor ik’in.
\m qˤay-z xexoy-ł xizay yeda sidaɣ moči-ł gondu-a teł-xor ik’i-n
\g hare-GEN2 young.animal-CONT.ESS behind DEM2.ISG in.one.place place-CONT.ESS big.hole-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l He went behind the rabbit's young and went into a burrow somewhere.

\t K’ak’aryar baynosi yisä eƛin, howt’äy bitor di ik’äłinč’iƛin.
\m k’ak’ar-ar b-ay-nosi yisi-a eƛi-n howt’ay bitor di ik’i-ł-č’i-ƛin
\g constriction-IN.LAT I.PL-come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW from.here thither me go-POT-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l When they came to a narrow point, he said: "I cannot go on from here."

\t Oqnäyƛin, eƛin qˤayz xexoyä, di eniw goƛ’an bik’an, deber rätiru łinałäyn di nełaq esanƛin.
\m oq-näy-ƛin eƛi-n qˤay-z xexoy-a di eniw goƛ’i-an b-ik’i-an mi-r r-eti-ru łina-łay-n di neła-q esi-an-ƛin
\g happen-CND.CVB-QUOT say-PST.UNW hare-GEN2 young.animal-ERG me mother call-FUT.CVB III-go-FUT.DEF you-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP me DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l "If that's the case," said the rabbit's young, "I will go to call mother and you will tell her about what you want."

\t Bik’anon bik’in, xexoyä eniwq esin, yaqˤuł sida aħozä elus tušman bexursiƛin.
\m b-ik’i-a-non b-ik’i-n xexoy-a eniw-q esi-n yaqˤuł sida aħo-a elu-s tušman b-exur-s-ƛin
\g III-go-INF-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB young.animal-ERG mother-POSS.ESS tell-PST.UNW today one.OBL shepherd-ERG we(I).OBL-GEN1 enemy III-kill-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The rabbit's young went and told its mother: "Today a shepherd has killed our enemy."

\t Šebi hudu nesir saɣyatyor retinƛin, esirno qˤayä.
\m šebi hudu nesi-r saɣyat-r r-eti-n-ƛin esir-n qˤay-a
\g what so DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT present-LAT IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT ask-PST.UNW hare-ERG
\l "So what present does he want?" asked the rabbit.

\t Nesir siskin šebin retixanu, debez mecqo mec bitirnäy ʕeze raqƛin eƛis nesäƛin, esin xexoyä.
\m nesi-r siskin šebin r-eti-x-anu mi-z mec-q mec b-itir-näy ʕeze r-oq-ƛin eƛi-s nesi-a-ƛin esi-n xexoy-a
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT any thing IV-want-PRS-NEG you-GEN2 tongue-POSS.ESS tongue III-touch-CND.CVB be.enough IV-become-QUOT say-PST.WIT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-QUOT tell-PST.UNW young.animal-ERG
\l "He doesn't want anything, if he can touch your tongue with his tongue, it will be enough, he said.", explained her young.

\t Nesiq ža esizaƛ’ debi haqo azirodoƛƛin, c’ok’inayn qˤay xexoyqor.
\m nesi-q ža esi-zaƛ’ mi-s haqu azirod-ƛ-ƛin c’ok’inad-n qˤay xexoy-qor
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG tell-CSL.CVB you-GEN1 mouth freeze.to.death-OPT-QUOT scold-PST.UNW hare young.animal-POSS.LAT
\l "May your mouth freeze for telling him that!", the rabbit scolded her young.

\t Xizyo neła eƛin, bik’anon bik’in debi mi mec bitir nesizoq, riya rodanixgon nesis hibon bisno däqor baƛin.
\m xizyo neła-a eƛi-n b-ik’i-a-non b-ik’i-n mi-s mi mec b-itir nesi-zo-q r-iy-a r-odi-ani-x-gon nesi-s hibo-n b-is-n di-qor b-a-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW III-go-INF-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB you-GEN1 you tongue III-touch DEM1.ISG.OBL-ATTR.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-know-INF IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS-CNTR DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 stick-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB me-POSS.LAT III-bring.IMP-QUOT
\l Then she said: "Go, go, and touch his tongue with yours, and take his stick and bring it to me so I can mark it."

\t Howži qˤays yxexoy aħo xäciza mečoƛ’orno bik’in, nełaz mecreq yisis mecno bitirerno, riya rodanix aħozis hibon bisno, xizor butin eniwdäɣortown butin.
\m howži qˤay-s y-xexoy aħo xeci-za moči-ƛ’or-n b-ik’i-n neła-z mec-q yisi-s mec-n b-itir-r-n r-iy-a r-odi-ani-x aħo-s hibo-n b-is-n xizor b-uti-n eniw-däɣor-tow-n b-uti-n
\g now hare-GEN1 II-young.animal shepherd leave-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.LAT-TOP III-go-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 tongue-POSS.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 tongue-TOP III-touch-CAUS-PFV.CVB IV-know-INF IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS shepherd-GEN1 stick-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB back III-return-PFV.CVB mother-APUD.VERS-EMPH-TOP III-return-PST.UNW
\l Now the rabbit's young went to the place where it had left the shepherd, touched his tongue with its own tongue and took the shepherd's stick for marking it, and returned back to its mother.

\t Qˤayä hiboq neła nełas mecno bitirno, xizyo xexoyn begirno xizor, aħoziqor bižin teƛƛin.
\m qˤay-a hibo-q neła-a neła-s mec-n b-itir-n xizyo xexoy-n b-egir-n xizor aħo-qor b-iži-n teƛ-ƛin
\g hare-ERG stick-POSS.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 tongue-TOP III-touch-PST.UNW afterwards young.animal-TOP III-send-PST.UNW back shepherd-POSS.LAT III-carry-PFV.CVB give-QUOT
\l The rabbit touched the stick with its tongue and then sent the young one back: "Carry it back and give it to the shepherd!"

\t Bˤeƛ’no adäz roc’no neširur iduɣor ik’iƛ’oräy, Alimaħamar teqno bˤeƛ’ sidä sidqor xabaryayx.
\m bˤeƛ’-n adäz r-oc’-n neširu-r idu-ɣor ik’i-ƛ’oräy Alimaħama-r teq-n bˤeƛ’ sida-a sida-qor xabaryad-x
\g sheep-TOP ahead III.PL-drive-PFV.CVB evening-LAT home-IN.ALL go-SIM.CVB Alimagomed-LAT hear-PST.UNW sheep one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.LAT talk-IPFV.CVB
\l When he drove the sheep home in the evening, Alimagomed heard them talking to each other.

\t Žeda eƛixƛax, howlo rečuƛ dice buħi bičix, hohomaw mečoƛ’ ocä xecix yołi dice rigu räči, elaƛ’ ƛ’iri hisno rigu raq łemuƛin.
\m žeda-a eƛi-x-ƛax howlo reču-ƛ dice buħi b-iči-x hohomaw moči-ƛ’ oc-a xeci-x yołi dice r-igu r-iči ela-ƛ’ ƛ’iri his-n r-igu r-oq łemu-ƛin
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG say-PRS-QUOT there cattleshed-SUB.ESS how.much heat III-be-PRS fresh place-SUPER.ESS threshing.floor-IN.ESS leave-IPFV.CVB if how.much IV-good IV-be we(II-SUPER.ESS on spring.wool-TOP IV-good IV-become then.would-QUOT
\l They were saying: "There in the shed is so much heat, if he would leave us in a chilly place, on the threshing floor, how good that would be, and then our wool would be better, too!"

\t Idur aynosi, yisä Paxrudinqor eƛin, bˤeƛ’ hohomłix ocä xeca rayƛin.
\m idu-r ay-nosi yisi-a Paxrudin-qor eƛi-n bˤeƛ’ hohomłi-x oc-a xeci-a r-ay-ƛin
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG Pakhrudin-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW sheep chilliness-AD.ESS threshing.floor-IN.ESS leave-INF III.PL-must-QUOT
\l When he came home, he said to Pakhrudin: "The sheep must be left on the threshing floor in the cool air."

\t Hemełƛ’ay soder bˤeƛ’ ocät’a ričirxo zown.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ay soder bˤeƛ’ oc-a-t’a r-iči-r-x zow-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after sheep threshing.floor-IN.ESS-DISTR III.PL-be-CAUS-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards he brought the sheep to the threshing floor.

\t Posures mec nesir biyxozołäy Alimaħama łaqnokin esin anu, esinäy mi äxuƛin nesiq riyräsi roqzaƛ’ qˤayz xexoyä.
\m posu-s mec nesi-r b-iy-x-zo-łay Alimaħama-a ła-q-n-kin esi-n anu esi-näy mi exu-ƛin nesi-q r-iyr-asi r-oq-zaƛ’ qˤay-z xexoy-a
\g cattle-GEN1 language DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT III-know-AD.ESS-ATTR.OBL-CONT.ABL Alimagomed-ERG who.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP-even tell-PFV.CVB be.NEG tell-CND.CVB you die-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-explain-RES.PRT IV-become-CSL.CVB hare-GEN2 young.animal-ERG
\l Alimagomed told to no one about his knowing the animals' language, because the rabbit's young had explained to him: "If you tell it, you'll die!"

\t Hudayzikon teqno yisir bˤeƛ’ sidä sidqor xabaryayx.
\m hudayziko-n teq-n yisi-r bˤeƛ’ sida-a sida-qor xabaryad-x
\g the.next.day-and hear-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT sheep one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.LAT talk-IPFV.CVB
\l The next day he heard again that the sheep were talking among each other.

\t Žeda eƛix zown, buqbetaxtow aħozä eli iduɣor rižinč’ey, mark’ač’uxor xecix yołi rigu räči yał.
\m žeda-a eƛi-x zow-n buqbeta-x-tow aħo-a eli idu-ɣor r-iži-č’ey mark’ač’u-xor xeci-x yołi r-igu r-iči yoł
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG say-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW sunset-AD.ESS-EMPH shepherd-ERG we home-IN.ALL III.PL-lead-NEG.PST.CVB twilight-AD.LAT leave-IPFV.CVB if IV-good IV-be be
\l They were saying: "If the shepherd wouldn't lead us home when the sun sets, but would leave us until the twilight, that would be good!"

\t Qˤišod buħima rišan retixanu, buqbetaxay soder łasnosi rig rišan roqxo, ɣˤayn yaq’ˤäł łemu, ƛelbin rigu raqƛin.
\m qˤišod buħi-a r-iš-an r-eti-x-anu buqbeta-xay soder łas-nosi r-ig r-iš-an r-oq-x ɣˤay-n y-aq’ˤił łemu ƛeli-bi-n r-igu r-oq-ƛin
\g at.noon heat-IN.ESS III.PL-eat-FUT.CVB IV-want-PRS-NEG sunset-AD.ABL after fade-ANT.CVB III.PL-much III.PL-eat-FUT.CVB IV-become-IPFV.CVB milk-TOP II-increase then.would lamb-PL-TOP III.PL-good III.PL-become-QUOT
\l We don't want to eat in the heat at noon, but we will eat a lot when the sun fades after sunset, then the milk would increase and the lambs woul become better.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder Alimaħama sasiłnosi xizyo gurow bˤeƛ’ iduɣor rowx zown anu.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder Alimaħama-a sasił-nosi xizyo gurow bˤeƛ’ idu-ɣor r-ow-x zow-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after Alimagomed-ERG get.dark-ANT.CVB after except sheep home-IN.ALL III.PL-bring-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l After that Alimagomed only brought the sheep home after it got dark.

\t Sebixasi zaman baynosi, Paxrudinä Alimaħamaqor eƛin, ixdaxor ɣutanłäzay ħonqaɣor bˤeƛ’ rownosi, bˤeƛ’q’uł xizay kami anusi ƛeli bayrnäy, boƛik’u reqen deber xeca yołƛin.
\m sebi-x-asi zaman b-ay-nosi Paxrudin-a Alimaħama-qor eƛi-n ix-xor ɣutan-łazay ħon-qaɣor bˤeƛ’ r-ow-nosi bˤeƛ’q’ˤu-ł xizay kami anu-si ƛeli b-ayr-näy boƛik’u reqen mi-r xeci-a yoł-ƛin
\g autumn-AD.ESS-RES.PRT time III-come-ANT.CVB Pakhrudin-ERG Alimagomed-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW spring-AD.LAT winter.pasture-CONT.ABL.DIST mountain-POSS.VERS sheep III.PL-bring-ANT.CVB sheep-CONT.ESS behind get.lost be.NEG-ATTR lamb III-lead-CND.CVB half herd you-LAT leave-INF be-QUOT
\l When fall came, Pakhrudin said to Alimagomed: "Until spring, after your brought the sheep to the mountains onto the winter pastures, if you lead a lamb that doesn't get lost behind every sheep, then I'll leave you half of the herd."

\t Hemedur roƛon risno, Alimaħama bˤeƛ’no rižin ɣutanyołxor ik’in.
\m hemedur r-oƛƛo-n r-is-n Alimaħama-a bˤeƛ’-n r-iži-n ɣutan-łxor ik’i-n
\g so IV-middle-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB Alimagomed-ERG sheep-TOP III.PL-lead-PFV.CVB winter.pasture-CONT.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l So they agreed and Alimagomed lead the sheep onto the winter pasture.

\t Eƛnin ɣutaneł yoɣno, ħonzaqaɣor bˤeƛ’ rowa oc’ino łeno ɣudi ƛexunosi, aħozir ɣˤʷadbi sidä sidqor xabaryayx teqno.
\m eƛni-n ɣutan-ł y-oɣ-n ħon-bi-qaɣor bˤeƛ’ r-ow-a oc’ino łeno ɣudi ƛexu-nosi aħo-r ɣˤʷadi-bi sida-a sida-qor xabaryad-x teq-n
\g winter-TOP winter.pasture-CONT.ESS II-spend.time-PFV.CVB mountain-PL-POSS.VERS sheep III.PL-bring-INF ten five day remain-ANT.CVB shepherd-LAT crow-PL one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.LAT talk-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW
\l They spent the winter on the winter pasture and when just 15 days remained to bring the sheep back to the mountains, the shepherd heard the crows talking among each other.

\t Žeda eƛixƛax, oc’ira łera ɣudƛ’aza howži ɣutaneł ixiw zigolun yegär, raq’ˤu bˤeƛ’no räxu, rigza ħalał elur reƛno räqiƛin.
\m žeda-a eƛi-x-ƛax oc’ira łera ɣudi-ƛ’aza howži ɣutan-ł ixiw zigolu-n y-egir r-aq’ˤu bˤeƛ’-n r-exu r-ig-za ħal-ł elu-r reƛ-n r-iqi-ƛin
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG say-PRS-QUOT ten.OBL five.OBL day-SUPER.VERS.DIST now winter.pasture-CONT.ESS big hail-TOP II-let IV-many sheep-TOP III.PL-die IV-much-ZA trouble-CONT.ESS we(I).OBL-LAT meat-TOP IV-get-QUOT
\l They were saying: "Fifteen days from now there will be a big hailstorm on the winter pasture, many sheep will die, and we will have a lot of meat in the trouble."

\t Neširu Alimaħama sadaq yałru hudulzaqor eƛin, sasaq ħonqaɣor bˤeƛ’ rižinäy elurtow rigu räčiƛin.
\m neširu Alimaħama-a sadaq yoł-ru hudul-bi-qor eƛi-n sasaq ħon-qaɣor bˤeƛ’ r-iži-näy elu-r-tow r-igu r-iči-ƛin
\g evening Alimagomed-ERG together be-PST.PRT friend-PL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW tomorrow mountain-POSS.VERS sheep IV-lead-CND.CVB we(I).OBL-LAT-EMPH IV-good IV-be-QUOT
\l In the evening Alimagomed said to the friends who were with him: "If we lead the sheep to the mountain tomorrow, it'll be better for us."

\t Žädgon oc’ino łenokin ɣudi yoł bˤeƛ’ ħonqaɣor rižanix zaman baya, eli edeʕizi boqa baynč’iƛin, eƛin žeda.
\m žäd-gon oc’ino łeno-kin ɣudi yoł bˤeƛ’ ħon-qaɣor r-iži-ani-x zaman b-ay-a eli edeʕizi b-oq-a b-ay-č’i-ƛin eƛi-n žeda-a
\g still-CNTR ten five-even day be sheep mountain-POSS.VERS III.PL-lead-MSD-AD.ESS time III-come-INF we hurry I.PL-become-INF I.PL-must-NEG.FUT-QUOT say-PST.UNW DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG
\l "There are still fifteen days left to lead the sheep to the mountain, we don't need to hurry.", they said.

\t Meža mežur rätiru rodo, di sasaq maħor aqƛin, žeduqorno eƛin, saparyox ik’a ħadur oqno.
\m mežu-a mežu-r r-eti-ru r-odi-o di sasaq maħor oq-ƛin žedu-qor-n eƛi-n sapar-x ik’i-a ħadur oq-n
\g you(I).PL.OBL-ERG you(I).PL.OBL-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT IV-do-IMPR me tomorrow outside become-QUOT DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB journey-AD.ESS go-INF prepare become-PST.UNW
\l "Do what you want, I will go out tomorrow.", he said to them and prepared to go on the journey.

\t Oc’ira łera ɣudƛ’or Alimaħama bˤeƛ’ rok’ek’no, dicegon isin, zigolun yegirłin bˤuƛ’a moči anuzaɣor.
\m oc’ira łera ɣudi-ƛ’or Alimaħama-a bˤeƛ’ r-ok’ek’-n dice-gon isi-n zigolu-n y-egir-łin b-ˤuƛ’-a moči anu-zo-aɣor
\g ten.OBL five.OBL day-SUPER.LAT Alimagomed-ERG sheep III.PL-remove-PFV.CVB how.much-CNTR snow-and hail-and II-send-CNC.CVB III-be.afraid-INF place be.NEG-ATTR.OBL-IN.VERS
\l After fifteen days Alimagomed had removed the sheep to a place where they didn't have to be afraid, no matter how much snow and hail was coming.

\t Neła ƛˤeba q’ˤuyazis raq’ˤu bˤeƛ’ rexun, netin yegirxanuzoce zigolun, isin yegirno.
\m neła ƛˤeb-a q’ˤuya-zo-s r-aq’ˤu bˤeƛ’ r-exu-n netin y-egir-xanuzo-ace zigolu-n isi-n y-egir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL year-IN.ESS other-ATTR.OBL-GEN1 III.PL-many sheep III.PL-die-PFV.CVB always II-send-NEG.PRS.PRT.OBL-TERM hail-and snow-and II-send-PST.UNW
\l In this year, many sheep of other people died, as it hailed and snowed as if it had never snowed before.

\t ʕAƛar xabar bayn, hunix zigolun yegirno, raq’ˤu bˤeƛ’ rexunƛin.
\m ʕaƛ-ar xabar b-ay-n huni-x zigolu-n y-egir-n r-aq’ˤu bˤeƛ’ r-exu-n-ƛin
\g village-IN.LAT story III-come-PST.UNW way-AD.ESS hail-TOP II-send-PFV.CVB III.PL-many sheep III.PL-die-PST.UNW-QUOT
\l Into the village came the news that on the way it had hailed and many sheep had died.

\t Paxrudinno zown, nesisno kinawtow bˤeƛ’ rexun räsuƛin.
\m Paxrudin-n zow-n nesi-s-n kinaw-tow bˤeƛ’ r-exu-n r-esu-ƛin
\g Pakhrudin-TOP be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-and entire-EMPH sheep III.PL-die-PFV.CVB IV-find-QUOT
\l Pakhrudin thought that also all of his sheep must have died.

\t Alimaħamaz reqenyoł sida bˤeƛ’q’uł xizay q’ˤano ƛeli nexxo zown.
\m Alimaħama-z reqen-ł sida bˤeƛ’q’ˤu-ł xizay q’ˤano ƛeli nex-x zow-n
\g Alimagomed-GEN2 herd-CONT.ESS one.OBL sheep-CONT.ESS behind two lamb come-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l But in Alimagomed's herd behind one sheep there were two lambs coming.

\t Žeda eniwqor eƛix teqno, bˤaƛo bäk’ino, eli akiłxoƛin.
\m žeda-a eniw-qor eƛi-x teq-n b-ˤaƛo b-ik’i-n eli akił-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG mother-POSS.LAT say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW III-quickly III-go-PROHIB we get.tired-PRS-QUOT
\l He heard them say: "Don't go so quickly, we are getting tired!"

\t Hemełƛ’o aħozä, ƛelzas zigari täqruntow, koyän risno yisä žedu rižin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ aħo-a ƛeli-bi-s zigari teq-run-tow kʷay-a-n r-is-n yisi-a žedu r-iži-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS shepherd-ERG lamb-PL-GEN1 complaint hear-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH hand-IN.ESS-TOP III.PL-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IIPL III.PL-carry-PST.UNW
\l Then, when the shepherd heared the lambs' complaint, he immediately took them onto his arms.

\t Xizyo ƛelza eƛin, wey, eni, dice igu aħo yoł elusƛin.
\m xizyo ƛeli-bi-a eƛi-n wey eni dice igu aħo yoł elu-s-ƛin
\g afterwards lamb-PL-ERG say-PST.UNW hey mother how.much good shepherd be we(I).OBL-GEN1-QUOT
\l Then the lambs said: "Hey mom, what a good shepherd we have!"

\t Howži yeda bˤeƛ’de sadaq ʕaƛoxor ayn.
\m howži yeda bˤeƛ’-de sadaq ʕaƛ-xor ay-n
\g now DEM2.ISG sheep-APUD.ESS with village-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Now he came to the village together with the sheep.

\t Xizyo ƛelbin teƛno yisä yisir roƛi ʕaƛoł rigu ɣˤutkun caƛin, barun yown, biƛanixgon močin bisno.
\m xizyo ƛeli-bi-n teƛ-n yisi-a yisi-r r-oƛi ʕaƛ-ł r-igu ɣˤutku-n caƛi-n baru-n y-ow-n b-iƛi-ani-x-gon moči-n b-is-n
\g afterwards lamb-PL-TOP sell-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-half village-CONT.ESS IV-good house-TOP throw-PFV.CVB wife-TOP II-marry-PFV.CVB III-plough-MSD-AD.ESS-CNTR field-TOP III-buy-PST.UNW
\l Afterwards he sold the lambs, built a good house in the middle of the village, married a wife and bought a field to plow.

\t Elo yisir aɣbi žeda žedaqor xabaryayx teqno, yedu ahli łinaqor rezun ričäsi žin močibi riƛinč’ey.
\m elo yisi-r aɣi-bi žeda-a žeda-qor xabaryad-x teq-n yedu ahli łina-qor r-ezu-n r-iči-asi žin moči-bi r-iƛi-n-č’ey
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT bird-PL DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG DEM1.IIPL.OBL-POSS.LAT talk-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW DEM2.IISG people what.OBL-POSS.LAT IV-look-PFV.CVB IV-be-RES.PRT now field-PL IV-plough-PFV.CVB-NEG.PST.UNW
\l There he heared the birds talking among themselves: "What are those people looking for, why didn't they plow the fields already?

\t ʕUraw rigu qˤiči roqno nesiz mečoł.
\m ʕuraw r-igu qˤiči r-oq-n nesi-z moči-ł
\g very IV-good harvest IV-become-PST.UNW DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 field-CONT.ESS
\l A very good harvest became of his field.

\t Howžiƛa rˤałay roda zaman bayxƛin Alimaħama ciqaɣor ik’in, isʷaqor reƛ’u rodanix c’araʕyor qaca rowanixƛin.
\m howži-ƛa rˤełay r-odi-a zaman b-ay-x-ƛin Alimaħama-a ciq-aɣor ik’i-n is-bi-qor reƛ’u r-odi-ani-x c’araʕ-r qaca r-ow-ani-x-ƛin
\g now-INDEF threshing.floor IV-do-INF time III-come-PRS-QUOT Alimagomed-ERG forest-IN.VERS go-PST.UNW bull-PL-POSS.LAT yoke IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS building.material-LAT firewood IV-bring-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l "Now it's time to do the threshing.", Alimagomed thought and went into the forest to bring wood for building the yoke for the bulls.

\t Žigoƛ’aygon hemedurtow aɣzas xabar teqno yisir.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon hemedur-tow aɣi-bi-s xabar teq-n yisi-r
\g again-SUPER.ABL-CNTR so-EMPH bird-PL-GEN1 story hear-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT
\l Once again he heard the birds speaking:

\t Hudayzikotow ixiw zigolun yayn, qˤiči rexunč’ey žek’ukin ƛexun anu.
\m hudayziko-tow ixiw zigolu-n y-ay-n qˤiči r-exu-č’ey žek’u-kin ƛexu-n anu
\g the.next.day-EMPH big hail-TOP II-come-PFV.CVB harvest IV-die-NEG.PST.CVB man-even remain-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l The next day came a big hailstorm and there remained no man whose harvest didn't die.

\t Rˤałayn rodin, at’no beqa ħolimoƛ’ roɣno, Alimaħama čardaħä q’ˤidan ičin ezun ičäsi zown.
\m rˤełay-n r-odi-n at’-n buq-a ħoli-ƛ’ r-oɣ-n Alimaħama-a čardaħi-a q’ˤida-n iči-n ezu-n iči-asi zow-n
\g threshing.floor-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB wheat-TOP sun-IN.ESS mat-SUPER.ESS IV-take.away-PFV.CVB Alimagomed-ERG balcony-IN.ESS down-TOP sit-PFV.CVB look-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Having done the threshing, Alimagomed put the wheat on a mat in the sun, sat down on a balcony and was looking around.

\t At’ rac’anix q’ˤanon aɣi ocär bayn k’oƛin.
\m at’ r-ac’-ani-x q’ˤano-n aɣi oc-ar b-ay-n k’oƛi-n
\g wheat IV-eat-MSD-AD.ESS two-TOP bird threshing.floor-IN.LAT III-come-PFV.CVB run-PST.UNW
\l Two birds came onto the threshing floor to eat the wheat.

\t Sidä muhubi ħolimoƛ’äytow rac’xo zown, sideni aɣä q’ˤidar räšru rut’ix zown.
\m sida-a muhu-bi ħoli-ƛ’ay-tow r-ac’-x zow-n sideni aɣi-a q’ˤida-r r-eš-ru r-ut’i-x zow-n
\g one.OBL-ERG granule-PL mat-SUPER.ABL-EMPH IV-eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW other bird-ERG down-LAT IV-fall-PST.PRT IV-collect-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l One ate the granules directly from the mat, the other bird collected those that had fallen down.

\t Ħolimoƛ’äy muhubi rut’ixozo aɣä hoq’ˤoniqor eƛin, q’ˤidasini howlotow räči ža, ħolimoƛ’osi muhubi rut’oƛin.
\m ħoli-ƛ’ay muhu-bi r-ut’i-x-zo aɣi-a hoq’ˤo-ni-qor eƛi-n q’ˤida-si-ni howlo-tow r-iči ža ħoli-ƛ’-si muhu-bi r-ut’i-o-ƛin
\g mat-SUPER.ABL granule-PL III.PL-collect-IPFV.CVB-ATTR.OBL bird-ERG other-DEF-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW down-ATTR-DEF there-EMPH III.PL-remain DEM1.SG mat-SUPER.ESS-ATTR granule-PL III.PL-collect-IMPR-QUOT
\l The bird who pecked the granules from the mat said to the other one: "They will remain down there anyway, collect the granules on the mat!"

\t Aɣzas ža xabar teqnosi, Alimaħamas qoqoƛu regin.
\m aɣi-bi-s ža xabar teq-nosi Alimaħama-s qoqoƛu r-egi-n
\g bird-PL-GEN1 DEM1.SG story hear-ANT.CVB Alimagomed-GEN1 laughter IV-be.emitted-PST.UNW
\l When Alimagomed heard the birds talking, he bursted into laughter.

\t Q’ˤidan ičin his xuxix zawru bara esirno, łinaƛ’ mi qoqƛäƛin.
\m q’ˤida-n iči-n his xuxi-x zow-ru baru-a esir-n łina-ƛ’ mi qoqoƛi-a-ƛin
\g down-TOP sit-PFV.CVB spring.wool comb-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT wife-ERG ask-PST.UNW what.OBL-SUPER.ESS you laugh-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l His wife who was sitting there combing wool asked: "What were you laughing about?"

\t Łinaƛ’nokin qoqoƛinč’uƛin, yisä ot’ bisno.
\m łina-ƛ’-n-kin qoqoƛi-č’u-ƛin yisi-a ot’ b-is-n
\g what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP-even laugh-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG rejection III-take-PST.UNW
\l "I laughed about nothing.", he rejected.

\t Howži baru yutin yisiƛ’or, łinaƛ’ mi qoqoƛix zawru esoƛin.
\m howži baru y-uti-n yisi-ƛ’or łina-ƛ’ mi qoqoƛi-x zow-ru esi-o-ƛin
\g now wife II-turn.back-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-SUPER.LAT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS you laugh-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT tell-IMPR-QUOT
\l Now his wife insisted on him: "Tell me what you were laughing about!"

\t Bara yisir ičin močitown xecinč’izaƛ’, xizyo yisä eƛin, ža esinäy, di äxuƛin.
\m baru-a yisi-r iči-n moči-tow-n xeci-č’i-zaƛ’ xizyo yisi-a eƛi-n ža esi-näy di exu-ƛin
\g wife-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT be-PFV.CVB place-EMPH-TOP leave-NEG.FUT.CVB-CSL.CVB afterwards DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW DEM1.SG tell-CND.CVB me die-QUOT
\l Because the wife didn't leave him in peace, he then said: "If I tell you, you will die."

\t Roqnäy däł xizay rexadanix sadaq’ałer ħonƛ’äy bˤeƛ’ rowan ik’an, elazay aynosi, debeq žan esanƛin.
\m r-oq-näy di-ł xizay r-exʷad-ani-x sadaq’a-łer ħon-ƛ’ay bˤeƛ’ r-ow-an ik’i-an ele-azay ay-nosi mi-q ža-n esi-an-ƛin
\g IV-happen-CND.CVB me-CONT.ESS behind III.PL-slaughter-MSD-AD.ESS alms-CONT.LAT mountain-SUPER.ABL sheep III.PL-bring-FUT.CVB go-FUT.DEF here-IN.ABL.DIST come-ANT.CVB you-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG-TOP tell-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l "In that case, I will go and bring the sheep from the mountain for slaughtering them for alms behind me(?), and when I come back here, I will tell it to you."

\t Biša rodanix barun yegirno, yeda maħor oqno, bˤeƛ’ rowa ħonƛ’aɣor ik’ixƛin.
\m bišʷa r-odi-ani-x baru-n y-egir-n yeda maħor oq-n bˤeƛ’ r-ow-a ħon-ƛ’aɣor ik’i-x-ƛin
\g food IV-do-MSD-AD.ESS wife-TOP II-let-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG outside become-PFV.CVB sheep III.PL-bring-INF mountain-SUPER.VERS go-PRS-QUOT
\l He let his wife prepare the meal and went outside: "I am going to the mountains to bring the sheep."

\t Žeda eƛixozo łinasno hiƛ’ar boynč’ey, Alimaħama bˤeƛ’ rowa oqno ħonƛ’aɣor ik’in.
\m žeda-a eƛi-xozo łina-s-n hiƛ’ar b-odi-č’ey Alimaħama bˤeƛ’ r-ow-a oq-n ħon-ƛ’aɣor ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG say-PRS.PRT.OBL what.OBL-GEN1-TOP worry III-do-NEG.PST.CVB Alimagomed sheep III.PL-bring-INF begin-PFV.CVB mountain-SUPER.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l Not worrying about what he said, Alimagomed went onto the mountain and began to bring down the sheep.

\t Ayn yeda sidaɣ bˤeliz ciqłer.
\m ay-n yeda sidaɣ bˤeli-z ciq-łer
\g come-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG in.one.place poplar-GEN2 forest-CONT.LAT
\l He came to a poplar forest.

\t Žeduł teł yałru hič’č’a bexorani bˤeliz ɣunä eƛix teqno, šet’urtow yałru ažomzas ʕadlu däq boqxo, sistow sis yałru barus ʕadlun boqinč’ey, yeda ʕabdal ħonƛ’aɣor ik’ix, nesä nesił xizay rexada šebin rowanixƛin.
\m žedu-ł teł yoł-ru hič’č’a bexora-ni bˤeli-z ɣun-a eƛi-x teq-n šet’ur-tow yoł-ru ažo-bi-s ʕadlu di-q b-oq-x sis-tow sis yoł-ru baru-s ʕadlu-n b-oq-č’ey yeda ʕabdal ħon-ƛ’aɣor ik’i-x nesi-a nesi-ł xizay r-exʷad-a šebin r-ow-ani-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside be-PST.PRT the.most lengthy-DEF poplar-GEN2 tree-ERG say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW around-EMPH be-PST.PRT tree-PL-GEN1 order me-POSS.ESS III-become-PRS one-EMPH one be-PST.PRT wife-GEN1 order-TOP III-become-NEG.PST.CVB DEM2.ISG fool mountain-SUPER.VERS go-IPFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind IV-slaughter-INF thing IV-bring-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l And he heard the highest poplar trees saying among themselves: "I can control the trees that are around me, but this fool cannot even control the single wife that he has, and he is going onto the mountain to bring something to slaughter after himself."

\t Nełaqorno aħya kurinč’ey, yeda oqno ħonƛ’aɣor ik’in.
\m neła-qor-n aħya kur-č’ey yeda oq-n ħon-ƛ’aɣor ik’i-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP ear spread.out-NEG.PST.CVB DEM2.ISG become-PFV.CVB mountain-SUPER.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l Not paying attention to them, he went onto the mountain.

\t Elaygon bitor hunix ik’iƛ’oräy, sidaɣ yisir raqˤäsi bix resun.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy sidaɣ yisi-r r-ˤaqi-asi bix r-esu-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB in.one.place DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-accumulate-RES.PRT grass IV-find-PST.UNW
\l While he went on on his way from there, he found thick grass in one place.

\t Žedał teł elo sis rexora bixis ɣˤuč’ zown.
\m žeda-ł teł elo sis r-exora bix-s ɣˤuč’ zow-n
\g DEM1.IIPL.OBL-CONT.ESS inside there one IV-long grass-GEN1 stick be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l Among it there also was one long blade of grass.

\t Nełan eƛin yisiłäy, mamalayän, bˤeliz ɣunan riłetown.
\m neła-a-n eƛi-n yisi-łay mamalay-a-n bˤeli-z ɣun-a-n r-iłe-tow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG-and say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ABL rooster-ERG-and poplar-GEN2 tree-ERG-and IV-as-EMPH-TOP
\l And it said the same about him as the rooster and the poplar tree.

\t Neła äƛirun aħyałer regirinč’ey, Alimaħama ħonƛ’or ayn.
\m neła-a eƛi-ru-n aħya-łer r-egir-č’ey Alimaħama ħon-ƛ’or ay-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT-TOP ear-CONT.LAT IV-let-NEG.PST.CVB Alimagomed mountain-SUPER.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l Not hearing what it said either, Alimagomed came to the mountain.

\t Elo bˤeƛ’a sidä sidqor eƛix teqno, were, howži gušiwt’ani sida puƛ’aɣor, ƛ’ariyawt’ani sideni puƛ’aɣor roqƛin.
\m elo bˤeƛ’-a sida-a sida-qor eƛi-x teq-n were howži gušiw-t’a-ni sida pu-ƛ’aɣor ƛ’ariyaw-t’a-ni sideni pu-ƛ’aɣor r-oq-ƛin
\g there sheep-ERG one.OBL-ERG one.OBL-POSS.LAT say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW well now thin-DISTR-DEF one.OBL side-SUPER.VERS fat-DISTR-DEF the.other.one side-SUPER.VERS III.PL-become-QUOT
\l There he heard the sheep say to each other: "Well, now the thin ones go to one side and the fat ones to the other side!"

\t ƛ’ariyawt’ani bˤeƛ’ rayn Alimaħamade puħo ričin, gušiwt’ani ħonƛ’otow ričin.
\m ƛ’ariyaw-t’a-ni bˤeƛ’ r-ay-n Alimaħama-de puħo r-iči-n gušiw-t’a-ni ħon-ƛ’-tow r-iči-n
\g fat-DISTR-DEF sheep III.PL-come-PFV.CVB Alimagomed-APUD.ESS next.to III.PL-remain-PFV.CVB thin-DISTR-DEF mountain-SUPER.ESS-EMPH III.PL-remain-PST.UNW
\l The fat sheep came and stood next to Alimagomed and the thin ones remained on the mountain.

\t Žedun adäz roc’no Alimaħama ħonƛ’ay ƛ’iyor oqno.
\m žedu-n adäz r-oc’-n Alimaħama-a ħon-ƛ’ay ƛ’iyor oq-n
\g DEM1.IPL-TOP ahead III.PL-drive-PFV.CVB Alimagomed-ERG mountain-SUPER.ABL downwards become-PST.UNW
\l Alimagomed drove them ahead and went down the mountain.

\t Ža bix yałza mečoƛ’or aynosi, rexorani bixiz ɣˤuč’ä eƛix teqno, yisi žek’us ʕantłi rukayxana mežur, barus ʕadlun boqinč’ey, nesä nesił xizaz rexʷadanix ħonƛ’ay bˤeƛ’no rown nexxoƛin.
\m ža bix yoł-za moči-ƛ’or ay-nosi r-exora-ni bix-z ɣˤuč’-a eƛi-x teq-n yisi žek’u-s ʕantłi r-ukad-x-anu-a mežu-r baru-s ʕadlu-n b-oq-č’ey nesi-a nesi-ł xizaz r-exʷad-ani-x ħon-ƛ’ay bˤeƛ’-n r-ow-n nex-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG grass be-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.LAT come-ANT.CVB IV-long-DEF grass-GEN2 stick-ERG say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL man-GEN1 stupidity IV-see-IPFV.CVB-NEG-Q you(I).PL.OBL-LAT wife-GEN1 order-TOP III-become-NEG.PST.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind III.PL-slaughter-MSD-AD.ESS mountain-SUPER.ABL sheep-TOP III.PL-bring-PFV.CVB come-PRS-QUOT
\l When he came to the place where the grass was, he heard the longest blade of grass say: "Don't you see the ... of this man? He can't control his wife, but brings sheep down from the mountain to slaughter them after himself."

\t Elaygon ƛ’iyor oqno nexƛ’oräy, bˤeliz ciqłer ayn.
\m ele-ay-gon ƛ’iyor oq-n nex-ƛ’oräy bˤeli-z ciq-łer ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR downwards become-PFV.CVB come-SIM.CVB poplar-GEN2 forest-CONT.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l When he came down from there, he came to the poplar's forest.

\t Žigoƛ’aygon neła rexorani bˤeliz ɣuna eƛix teqno, dowƛ’ay ʕadalaw žek’utow äsunč’i, ʕadalaw äsunč’inäy, sis di äƛirun rodin, ħonƛ’or bˤeƛ’no rižin roxir, nišiw ɣˤilyan beč’no, t’ok’ow esirač’inƛin eƛace barun žek’oƛin.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon neła r-exora-ni bˤeli-z ɣun-a eƛi-x teq-n mi-ƛ’ay ʕadalaw žek’u-tow esu-č’i ʕadalaw esu-č’i-näy sis di eƛi-ru-n r-odi-n ħon-ƛ’or bˤeƛ’-n r-iži-n r-oxir nišiw ɣˤilya-n b-eč’-n t’ok’ow esir-ač’in-ƛin eƛi-ace baru-n žek’-o-ƛin
\g now-SUPER.ABL-CNTR DEM1.IISG.OBL IV-long-DEF poplar-GEN2 tree-ERG say-IPFV.CVB hear-PST.UNW you-SUPER.ABL stupid man-EMPH exist-NEG.FUT stupid find-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB one me say-PST.PRT-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB mountain-SUPER.LAT sheep-TOP III.PL-lead-PFV.CVB III.PL-chase narrow stick-TOP III-cut-PFV.CVB anymore ask-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT say-TERM wife-TOP beat-IMPR-QUOT
\l Now he heard that long poplar tree say: "There is no one stupider than you, if you weren't stupid, you'd do what I say and chase the sheep back onto the mountain, cut off a thin stick and beat your wive until she says that she won't ask anymore!"

\t Bara ɣˤaɣˤun yizin esirno, rowwä bˤeƛ’ƛin?
\m baru-a ɣˤaɣˤu-n y-izi-n esir-n r-ow-ya bˤeƛ’-ƛin
\g wife-ERG be.happy-TOP II-get-PFV.CVB ask-PST.UNW III.PL-bring-PST.WIT.Q sheep-QUOT
\l His wife got happy and asked: "Did you bring the sheep?"

\t Mi žek’anix ɣˤilya bowsƛin eƛin, Alimaħama baruz gugya ɣˤilya basada oqno.
\m mi žek’-ani-x ɣˤilya b-ow-s-ƛin eƛi-n Alimaħama-a baru-z gugu-a ɣˤilya b-asad-a oq-n
\g you beat-MSD-AD.ESS stick III-bring-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PFV.CVB Alimagomed-ERG wife-GEN2 back-IN.ESS stick III-measure-INF begin-PST.UNW
\l "I brought a stick to beat you!", said Alimagomed and began to hit his wife's back with the stick.

\t Kʷaxatow xizyo baruq regin, xec di yiča yegirno, t’ok’ow esirač’inƛin.
\m kʷaxa-tow xizyo baru-q r-egi-n xec di y-iči-a y-egir-n t’ok’ow esir-ač’in-ƛin
\g soon-EMPH afterwards wife-POSS.ESS IV-be.emitted-PST.UNW enough me II-be-INF II-let-PFV.CVB anymore ask-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Soon from his wife could be heard: "Enough, let it be, I won't ask anymore!"

\t Nełƛ’ay soder, dicegon Alimaħama qoqoƛiłin, šida mi qoqoƛixƛin, bara esirno anu.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder dice-gon Alimaħama qoqoƛi-łin šida mi qoqoƛi-x-ƛin baru-a esir-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after how.much-CNTR Alimagomed laugh-CNC.CVB why you laugh-PRS-QUOT wife-ERG ask-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l After that, no matter how often Alimagomed laughed, his wife didn't ask "Why are you laughing?" ever again.

\t Howłaƛ’ dey emadun łiys, keca zamanno bays.
\m howła-ƛ’ di-s emadu-n łiy-s kec-a zaman-n b-ay-s
\g DEM3.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS me-GEN1 fairy.tale-TOP end-PST.WIT sleep-INF time-TOP III-come-PST.WIT
\l With that my story ends, now sleeping time has come.

\t K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay!
\m k’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi r-ocu buq b-ay
\g Kuruch pearl day IV-become.clean sun III-come
\l Kurch, pearl, may the weather be good and the sun come out.

\t Zownƛax, zown anuƛax sis bełiqu.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax sis bełiqu
\g be.NPRS-PST.UNW-QUOT be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG-QUOT one hunter
\l Once upon a time there was a hunter.

\t Nesis haq’u bełiq’ay bišxo zown.
\m nesi-s haq’u bełi-q’ay b-iš-x zow-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 family hunting-EQU2 III-eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW
\l His family made a living from the hunting.

\t Bełiqu eže izinosi, ozzas č’uran łiyn, koyär tupi risa ħalno zown anu.
\m bełiqu eže izi-nosi ozuri-bi-s č’ura-n łiy-n kʷay-ar tupi r-is-a ħal-n zow-n anu
\g hunter old get-ANT.CVB eye-PL-GEN1 light-TOP end-PFV.CVB hand-IN.LAT rifle IV-take-INF strength-TOP be.NPRS-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l When the hunter got old, he lost his eyesight and he didn't have the strength to take up the rifle into his hand anymore.

\t Sida quł bełiquz užä eniwqor eƛin, howži bełiƛ’ ik’iłaniƛ’ dey rok’u rayxƛin.
\m sida qu-ł bełiqu-z uži-a eniw-qor eƛi-n howži bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-ł-ani-ƛ’ di-s rok’u r-ay-x-ƛin
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS hunter-GEN2 son-ERG mother-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW now hunting-SUPER.ESS go-POT-MSD-SUPER.ESS me-GEN1 heart IV-come-PRS-QUOT
\l One day the hunter's son said to his mother, "Now I am convinced that I can go on a hunt."

\t Žäd mi eɣetow yołƛin, eniya eƛin.
\m žäd mi eɣe-tow yoł-ƛin eni-a eƛi-n
\g still you young-EMPH be-QUOT mother-ERG say-PST.UNW
\l "But you're still young," his mother said.

\t Žedu xabaryayxno teqno, bełiqa baruqor eƛin, mi uži bełiƛ’ egir, ža bełiƛ’ ik’inč’inäy, q’ˤuyzadäzay hudun elur ħak’omƛer šebin räqinč’iƛin.
\m žedu xabaryad-x-n teq-n bełiqu-a baru-qor eƛi-n mi uži bełi-ƛ’ egir ža bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-č’i-näy q’ˤuya-bi-däzay hudun elu-r ħak’o-ƛer šebin r-iqi-č’i-ƛin
\g DEM1.IPL talk-IPFV.CVB-TOP hear-PFV.CVB hunter-ERG wife-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you son hunting-SUPER.ESS let DEM1.SG hunting-SUPER.ESS go-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB other-PL-APUD.ABL.DIST nevertheless we(I).OBL-LAT khinkali-SUB.LAT thing IV-get-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l When he heard them talking, the hunter said to his wife, "Let the son on a hunt, if he won't go hunting, we won't have anything for our khinkali anyway."

\t Tupin teƛno uži egirnosi, neširur bełin č’aq’ˤirno xizor utin ayn.
\m tupi-n teƛ-n uži egir-nosi neširu-r bełi-n č’aq’ˤir-n xizor uti-n ay-n
\g rifle-TOP give-PFV.CVB son send-ANT.CVB evening-LAT deer-TOP kill-PFV.CVB back return-PFV.CVB come-PST.UNW
\l After he gave his son the rifle and sent him away, the son came back in the evening with the deer he had killed.

\t Puħorno goƛ’in, neširu babiya žaqor eƛin, howži mi bełiƛ’ ik’ace oqäsi oqzaƛ’ di ɣˤaɣˤu izäsi yoł, hudun mi dey sis ʕaq’lu teqroƛin.
\m pu-xor-n goƛ’i-n neširu babiw-a uži-qor eƛi-n howži mi bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-ace oq-asi oq-zaƛ’ di ɣˤaɣˤu izi-asi yoł hudun mi di-s sis ʕaq’lu teqer-o-ƛin
\g side-AD.LAT-TOP call-PFV.CVB evening father-ERG son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW now you hunting-SUPER.ESS go-TERM become-RES.PRT become-CSL.CVB me be.happy get-RES.PRT be nevertheless you me-GEN1 one advice listen.to-IMPR-QUOT
\l In the evening the father called his son to his said and told him, "I am happy that you have grown to be able to go hunting, nevertheless listen to one advice!

\t Deber sis aɣi bäsu, were mi nełas tupi caƛin, nełaz tupi caƛinäy, deber žuk roqa yołƛin.
\m mi-r sis aɣi b-esu were mi neła-s tupi caƛi-n neła-z tupi caƛi-näy mi-r žuk r-oq-a yoł-ƛin
\g you-LAT one bird III-find well you DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 rifle shoot.with-PROHIB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 rifle shoot.with-CND.CVB you-LAT worse IV-become-INF be-QUOT
\l You will find a bird, well, don't shoot it with your rifle, if you shoot it with the rifle, it is going to be bad for you."

\t Ɣudes uži bełiƛ’ aħnayx, bełiqanzo haq’us maʕišat bigełno (bigu boqno).
\m ɣudes uži bełi-ƛ’ aħnad-x bełiqan-z haq’u-s maʕišat b-igeł-n b-igu b-oq-n
\g daily son hunting-SUPER.ESS walk.around-IPFV.CVB hunter-GEN2 family-GEN1 fortune III-improve-PST.UNW III-good III-become-PST.UNW
\l Daily the son went hunting and thus the hunter's family's fortune improved (they got wealthy).

\t Sida quł bełiƛ’ äk’iru žaq didurnokin bełi č’aq’ˤin anu.
\m sida qu-ł bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-ru uži-q didur-n-kin bełi č’aq’ˤi-n anu
\g one.OBL day-CONT.ESS hunting-SUPER.ESS go-PST.PRT son-POSS.ESS how-TOP-even deer hit-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l One day the son who went hunting somehow didn't manage to shoot a deer.

\t Zamanaƛ’aza nesir sis aɣi bukayx.
\m zaman-ƛ’aza nesi-r sis aɣi b-ukad-x
\g time-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT one bird III-see-PRS
\l After some time he saw a bird.

\t Nełaz maʕdinłiƛ’ yeda ħayran oqno ezun ƛexun.
\m neła-z maʕdinłi-ƛ’ yeda ħayran oq-n ezu-n ƛexu-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 beauty-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG be.astonished become-PFV.CVB look-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l He was astonished by its beauty and kept looking.

\t Rutirno yisä nełƛ’ar tupi caƛin ičin howlortow bexurno.
\m r-utir-n yisi-a neła-ƛ’ar tupi caƛi-n iči-n howlo-r-tow b-exur-n
\g IV-turn-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.VERS rifle shoot.with-PFV.CVB be-PFV.CVB there-LAT-EMPH III-kill-PST.UNW
\l He turned the rifle toward it, shot there and killed it.

\t Neła quł yeda idur mix bexunosi ayn.
\m neła qu-ł yeda idu-r mix b-exu-nosi ay-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.ISG home-LAT time III-die-ANT.CVB come-PST.UNW
\l On that day he came home only after a long time had passed.

\t ʕAƛoz č’imix yisił xanes nukar c’oxno.
\m ʕaƛ-z č’im-x yisi-ł xan-s nukar c’ox-n
\g village-GEN2 edge-AD.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS khan-GEN1 henchman meet-PST.UNW
\l On the village's edge he met the king's henchman.

\t Nesä užiqor eƛin, ža aɣi däqor neƛ xaner bižanixƛin.
\m nesi-a uži-qor eƛi-n ža aɣi di-qor neƛ xan-r b-iži-ani-x-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG boy-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM1.SG bird me-POSS.LAT give khan-LAT III-carry-MSD-AD.ESS-QUOT
\l He said to the boy, "Give me that bird, so I can carry it to the king."

\t Mi däƛ’ay ežen yoł, däzoƛ’aygon rigu tupin yoł debeq, mitow č’aq’ˤirno nesir bižoƛin eƛin, teƛno anu užä ža aɣi xanez nukarqor.
\m mi di-ƛ’ay eže-n yoł di-zo-ƛ’ay-gon r-igu tupi-n yoł mi-q mi-tow č’aq’ˤir-n nesi-r b-iži-o-ƛin eƛi-n teƛ-n anu uži-a ža aɣi xan-z nukar-qor
\g you me-SUPER.ABL old-TOP be me-ATTR.OBL-SUPER.ABL-CNTR IV-good rifle-TOP be you-POSS.ESS you-EMPH kill-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT III-carry-IMPR-QUOT say-PFV.CVB give-PST.UNW be.NEG boy-ERG DEM1.SG bird khan-GEN2 henchman-POSS.LAT
\l "You are older than me and also you have a rifle better than mine, kill one yourself and carry it to him!" the boy said and didn't give the bird to the king's henchman.

\t Idur aynosi, babiya žaq esirno, yaqˤuł mi šida kʷat’iłäƛin.
\m idu-r ay-nosi babiw-a uži-q esir-n yaqˤuł mi šida kʷat’ił-a-ƛin
\g home-LAT come-ANT.CVB father-ERG son-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW today you why be.late-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l When he came home, the father asked the son, "Why are you so late today?"

\t Bara eƛin, yaqˤuł žaq bełi č’aq’ˤin anu, sis bercinaw aɣin č’aq’irno ža idur aysƛin.
\m baru-a eƛi-n yaqˤuł uži-q bełi č’aq’ˤi-n anu sis bercinaw aɣi-n č’aq’ˤir-n ža idu-r ay-s-ƛin
\g wife-ERG say-PST.UNW today son-POSS.ESS deer hit-PFV.CVB be.NEG one beautiful bird-TOP kill-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG home-LAT come-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The wife said, "Today our son didn't catch any deer, but he killed a beautiful bird and then came home."

\t Way dey užiƛin, regin babiwq, howži deber žukkin roqinč’inäy, di eƛix zownč’a dowqor neła aɣis tupi caƛinƛin.
\m way di-s uži-ƛin r-egi-n babiw-q howži mi-r žuk-kin r-oq-č’i-näy di eƛi-x zow-č’u-a mi-qor neła aɣi-s tupi caƛi-n-ƛin
\g o.dear me-GEN1 son-QUOT IV-be.emitted-PFV.CVB father-POSS.ESS now you-LAT worse-even IV-become-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB me say-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT.INT you-POSS.LAT DEM1.IISG.OBL bird-GEN1 rifle shoot.with-PROHIB-QUOT
\l "Oh dear, my son!", said the father, "Have I not warned you that it would become bad for you now, if you shoot that bird with your rifle?"

\t Hemeła xabaryoł yizi yałzay, nesi nukarä xanqo esix zown, yaqˤuł bełiquz žoyä bercinaw aɣi č’aq’ˤirno bižisƛin.
\m hemeła xabar-ł yizi yoł-zay nesi nukar-a xan-q esi-x zow-n yaqˤuł bełiqu-z uži-a bercinaw aɣi č’aq’ˤir-n b-iži-s-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL story-CONT.ESS DEM2.IPL be-SIM.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL henchman-ERG khan-POSS.ESS tell-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.UNW today hunter-GEN2 son-ERG beautiful bird kill-PFV.CVB III-carry-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l While that conversation was going on, that henchman was telling the king, "Today the hunter's son killed a bird and carried it home."

\t Ža esin nesiq rok’äłruntow, xanä nukar bełiquz žader egirno, ža aɣin bown däder horoƛin, nesiq riyranix.
\m ža esi-n nesi-q r-ok’eł-run-tow xan-a nukar bełiqu-z uži-der egir-n ža aɣi-n b-ow-n di-der horo-ƛin nesi-q r-iyr-ani-x
\g DEM1.SG tell-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-be.in.time-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH khan-ERG henchman hunter-GEN2 son-APUD.LAT send-PST.UNW DEM1.SG bird-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB me-APUD.LAT come.IMPR-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS IV-explain-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Right after he told him that, the king sent the henchman to the hunter's son in order to explain to him, "Come to me and bring me that bird!"

\t Xanä aƛirun rodin, nukar bełiquzaxar ik’in.
\m xan-a eƛi-run r-odi-n nukar bełiqu-bi-xar ik’i-n
\g khan-ERG say-IMM.ANT.CVB IV-do-PFV.CVB henchman hunter-PL-AD.VERS go-PST.UNW
\l The henchman did what the king said and went to the hunters.

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo babiya yisiqor eƛin, howži mi teƛinč’ey ičin ok’äłinč’i, ža aɣin bisno mi xanderno ik’i nesiqor eƛo, debez roƛik’a xanłiƛ neƛan deber aɣiƛin.
