\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo babiw-a yisi-qor eƛi-n howži mi teƛ-č’ey iči-n ok’eł-č’i ža aɣi-n b-is-n mi xan-der-n ik’i nesi-qor eƛi-o mi-z r-oƛik’u xanłi-ƛ neƛ-an mi-r aɣi-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS after father-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW now you give-NEG.PST.CVB be-PFV.CVB escape-NEG.FUT DEM1.SG bird-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB you khan-APUD.LAT-TOP go DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-IMPR you-GEN2 IV-half khanate-SUB.ESS sell-FUT.DEF you-LAT bird-QUOT
\l After that the father said to him, "Now you cannot avoid giving it to him. Take the bird, go to the king and say to him, 'I will sell you the bird for half the kingdom'."

\t Ža aɣin bižin bełiqus uži xander ik’in.
\m ža aɣi-n b-iži-n bełiqu-s uži xan-der ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG bird-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB hunter-GEN1 son khan-APUD.LAT go-PST.UNW
\l The hunter's son carried the bird to the king.

\t Aɣi bukayruntow nełaz maʕdinłiƛ’no ezun xan haqa ogun ƛexun.
\m aɣi b-ukad-run-tow neła-z maʕdinłi-ƛ’-n ezu-n xan haqu-a ogu-n ƛexu-n
\g bird III-see-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 beauty-SUPER.ESS-TOP look-PFV.CVB khan mouth-IN.ESS gape-PFV.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l When the king saw the bird, he stood there gaping about its beauty.

\t Šebi yiłas micxir bäčiƛin, esirno xanä.
\m šebi yiła-s micxir b-iči-ƛin esir-n xan-a
\g what DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 money III-be-QUOT ask-PST.UNW khan-ERG
\l "What will its price be?" the king asked.

\t Debez roƛik’a xanłiƛ neƛanƛin, eƛin bełiquz užä xanqor.
\m mi-z r-oƛik’u xanłi-ƛ neƛ-an-ƛin eƛi-n bełiqu-z uži-a xan-qor
\g you-GEN2 IV-half khanate-SUB.ESS sell-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PST.UNW hunter-GEN2 son-ERG khan-POSS.LAT
\l "For your half kingdom I will sell it," said the hunter's son to the king.

\t Roƛik’u xanłin teƛno, xanä bisno ža.
\m r-oƛƛik’u xanłi-n teƛ-n xan-a b-is-n ža
\g IV-half khanate-TOP give-PFV.CVB khan-ERG III-buy-PST.UNW DEM1.SG
\l The king gave him half the kingdom and bought the bird.

\t Howži xaner retäsi zown neła aɣez bikyos boko bodanix.
\m howži xan-r r-eti-asi zow-n neła aɣi-z bik-s boko b-odi-ani-x
\g now khan-LAT IV-want-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.UNW DEM1.IISG.OBL bird-GEN2 hide-GEN1 fur.coat III-do-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Now the king wanted to make a coat out of that bird's hide.

\t Boko bodacetow ʕeze boqno anu ža.
\m boko b-odi-ace-tow ʕeze b-oq-n anu ža
\g fur.coat III-do-TERM-EMPH be.enough III-become-PST.UNW be.NEG DEM1.SG
\l But it was not enough to make the coat.

\t Wizirä xanqor eƛin, hemeła qalamä teł sis aɣi yoł, nełasgo bik boqnäy, debez bokor ʕeze baqƛin.
\m wizir-a xan-qor eƛi-n hemeła qala-a teł sis aɣi yoł neła-s-go bik b-oq-näy mi-z boko-r ʕeze b-oq-ƛin
\g vizier-ERG khan-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM4.IISG.OBL fortress-IN.ESS inside one bird be DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1-COND hide III-become-CND.CVB you-GEN2 fur.coat-LAT be.enough III-become-QUOT
\l The vizier said to the king, "In that fortress there is a bird, if you can get its hide, it will be enough for your coat."

\t Xanä neła aɣeł xizay baq’ˤu nukarbi begirno, hudun didurnokin žeduq ža biqin anu.
\m xan-a neła aɣi-ł xizay b-aq’ˤu nukar-bi b-egir-n hudun didur-n-kin žedu-q ža b-iqi-n anu
\g khan-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL bird-CONT.ESS behind III-many henchman-PL I.PL-send-PFV.CVB nevertheless how-TOP-even DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS DEM1.SG III-get-PST.UNW be.NEG
\l The king sent many henchman after that bird they didn't get the bird in any way.

\t Xizyo nesi nukarä xanqor eƛin, howža bełiqus uži egirčey neła aɣił xizay, nesä biqär žaƛin.
\m xizyo nesi nukar-a xan-qor eƛi-n howža bełiqu-s uži egir-čey neła aɣi-ł xizay nesi-a b-iqir ža-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.ISG.OBL henchman-ERG khan-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW DEM4.SG hunter-GEN1 son send-INTS DEM1.IISG.OBL bird-CONT.ESS behind DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG III-catch DEM1.SG-QUOT
\l Then the henchman said to the king, "Send that hunter's son after the bird, he will catch it."

\t Hemełƛ’otow xanä nukar egirno, bełiquz žał xizay.
\m hemeł-ƛ’-tow xan-a nukar egir-n bełiqu-z uži-ł xizay
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-EMPH khan-ERG henchman send-PST.UNW hunter-GEN2 son-CONT.ESS behind
\l Upon that the king sent a henchman after the hunter's son.

\t Ik’in k’oƛin nukarä bełiquz žaqor eƛin, mi xanä goƛ’ixƛin.
\m ik’i-n k’oƛi-n nukar-a bełiqu-z uži-qor eƛi-n mi xan-a goƛ’i-x-ƛin
\g go-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB henchman-ERG hunter-GEN2 son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you khan-ERG invite-PRS-QUOT
\l The henchman ran off and told the hunter's son, "The king invites you."

\t Xizyo babiya žaqor eƛin, ele uži, di eƛix zownč’a dowqor ža bercinawni aɣi bexarno mi, šomoraxno žuk roqa yoł deber, howži rok’ƛ’or ayxa di.
\m xizyo babiw-a uži-qor eƛi-n ele uži di eƛi-x zow-č’u-a mi-qor ža bercinaw-ni aɣi b-exur-n mi šomorax-n žuk r-oq-a yoł mi-r howži rok’u-ƛ’or ay-x-a di
\g afterwards father-ERG son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW there son me say-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.WIT.INT you-POSS.LAT DEM1.SG beautiful-DEF bird III-kill-PROHIB you how.often-TOP worse IV-become-INF be you-LAT now heart-SUPER.LAT come-PRS-Q me
\l Afterwards the father said to his son, "There, son, didn't I say to you not to kill that beautiful bird, or bad things would happen to you ever so often, have you understood this now?

\t Xizyo mi däder horo debertown aq’ˤlu betin besunäyƛin, bełiqa xandäɣor uži egirno.
\m xizyo mi di-der horo mi-r-tow-n ʕaq’lu b-eti-n b-esu-näy-ƛin bełiqu-a xan-däɣor uži egir-n
\g afterwards you me-APUD.LAT come.IMPR you-LAT-EMPH-TOP advice III-want-PFV.CVB III-appear-CND.CVB-QUOT hunter-ERG khan-APUD.VERS son send-PST.UNW
\l Then come to me, in case you want some advice," and the hunter sent his son to the king.

\t Xanä bełiquz žaqor eƛin, sida ezä teł aɣi yołƛin teqxo, där howžan bown horo miƛin.
\m xan-a bełiqu-z uži-qor eƛi-n sida ez-a teł aɣi yoł-ƛin teq-x di-r howža-n b-ow-n horo mi-ƛin
\g khan-ERG hunter-GEN2 son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW one.OBL fortress-IN.ESS inside bird be-QUOT hear-PRS me-LAT DEM4.SG-TOP III-bring-PFV.CVB come.IMPR you-QUOT
\l The king said to the hunter' son, "Inside a fortress there is a bird, I hear; bring it to me!"

\t Ža nesiqor äƛiru šebin rodaniƛäy, xanä nesiqor nesä äƛiru gulun, tupin teƛno.
\m ža nesi-qor eƛi-ru šebi-n r-odi-ani-ƛay xan-a nesi-qor nesi-a eƛi-ru gulu-n tupi-n teƛ-n
\g DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.PRT what-TOP IV-do-MSD-SUB.ABL khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT horse-and rifle-and give-PST.UNW
\l For doing what he said, the king gave him the horse and the rifle he had asked for.

\t Xizyo yeda xizor utin babiwdäɣor nexno.
\m xizyo yeda xizor uti-n babiw-däɣor nex-n
\g afterwards DEM2.ISG back return-PFV.CVB father-APUD.VERS come-PST.UNW
\l Then he came back to his father.

\t Nesä žaq mołin, mi roƛiqur ezmoxorno ik’i, waħaza gulun bicin, qidoq soderno izin, sasoxay ža aɣin bisno q’ˤidar oqƛin.
\m nesi-a ža-q mołi-n mi roƛiqur ez-xor-n ik’i waħo-aza gulu-n b-ici-n qido-q soder-n izi-n saso-xay ža aɣi-n b-is-n q’ˤida-r oq-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG-POSS.ESS teach-PST.UNW you at.midnight fortress-AD.LAT-TOP go below-IN.VERS.DIST horse-TOP III-tie-PFV.CVB wall-POSS.ESS upward-TOP get.up-PFV.CVB noise-IMPR.AD.ABL DEM1.SG bird-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB down-LAT become-QUOT
\l He taught him, "At midnight, go to the fortress, tie your horse below it, get up the wall, take the bird while it is dark and get down!

\t Qˤašizaƛ’or mi guluƛ’or izinč’inäy, qalamxo bičixozo qarawulza mi iqärƛin, eƛin babiya uži hunix egirno.
\m qˤaši-zaƛ’or mi gulu-ƛ’or izi-č’i-näy qala-x b-iči-x-zo qarawul-bi-a mi iqir-ƛin eƛi-n babiw-a uži huni-x egir-n
\g dawn-POST.CVB you horse-SUPER.LAT get.up-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB fortress-AD.ESS III-wait-IPFV.CVB-ATTR.OBL guard-PL-ERG you catch-QUOT say-PST.UNW father-ERG son way-AD.ESS send-PST.UNW
\l If you don't get on your horse before it dawns, the guards who are waiting at the fortress will catch you!" the father said and sent his son away.

\t Babiya äƛiruxorno rodin, žoyä biqirno aɣi bižin xanqor teƛno.
\m babiw-a eƛi-ru-xor-n r-odi-n uži-a b-iqir-n aɣi b-iži-n xan-qor teƛ-n
\g father-ERG say-PST.PRT-AD.LAT-TOP IV-do-PFV.CVB son-ERG III-take.away-PFV.CVB bird III-carry-PFV.CVB khan-POSS.LAT give-PST.UNW
\l The son did as the father said, caught the bird, carried it with him and gave it to the king.

\t Howži xanä neła aɣiqayn bik boɣno.
\m howži xan-a neła aɣi-qay-n bik b-oɣ-n
\g now khan-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL bird-POSS.ABL-TOP hide III-take.away-PST.UNW
\l Now the king took away the hide from that bird as well.

\t Q’ˤunan aɣzas bik bokorno, k’ukyorno ʕeziyaw boqno.
\m q’ˤuna-n aɣi-bi-s bik boko-r-n k’uk-r-n ʕeziyaw b-oq-n
\g two.OBL-TOP bird-PL-GEN1 hide fur.coat-LAT-and cap-LAT-and much III-become-PST.UNW
\l The hide of the two birds was enough for the coat and the cap.

\t Hoboygon xan žedu raqˤanix žek’u iqinč’ey ƛexun.
\m hoboy-gon xan žedu r-aqˤu-ani-x žek’u iqi-č’ey ƛexu-n
\g now-CNTR khan DEM1.IIPL III.PL-sew-MSD-AD.ESS man get-NEG.PST.CVB remain-PST.UNW
\l But now the king didn't have anyone to sew them.

\t Xizyogon nukarä xanqor eƛin, raładno boɣno bitaz puƛ’aza yołƛin teqxo bokobin, k’ukyabin raqˤuxosi kidƛin, nełał xizaygon elor egiranix bełiquz užiƛ’ay mustaħiq’aw žek’un anuƛin.
\m xizyogon nukar-a xan-qor eƛi-n raład-n b-oɣ-n bita-az pu-ƛ’aza yoł-ƛin teq-x boko-bi-n k’uk-bi-n r-aqˤu-xosi kid-ƛin neła-ł xizay-gon elo-r egir-ani-x bełiqu-z uži-ƛ’ay mustaħiq’aw žek’u-n anu-ƛin
\g again henchman-ERG khan-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW sea-TOP III-cross-PFV.CVB distance-IN.ESS.DIST side-SUPER.VERS.DIST be-QUOT hear-PRS fur.coat-PL-and cap-PL-and III.PL-sew-PRS.PRT girl-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind-CNTR there-LAT send-MSD-AD.ESS hunter-GEN2 son-SUPER.ABL suitable man-TOP be.NEG-QUOT
\l Again the henchman said to the king, "On the other side of the sea, as I have heard, lives girl wo sews coats and caps; there is no man more suitable than the hunter's son to be sent there after her."

\t Xanä bełiqus uži nesä nesider goƛ’in.
\m xan-a bełiqu-s uži nesi-a nesi-der goƛ’i-n
\g khan-ERG hunter-GEN1 son DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT invite-PST.UNW
\l The king invited the hunter's son to himself.

\t Xander ik’a adäza, babiya užiqor eƛin, howži roda šebin anu, dey uži, mi eƛo xanqor mesedyos bic’no q’ili neƛnäy, guluzaz reqenyołäy sis bigu gulu łet’an egirnäy, di neła kidbeł xizay ik’anƛin.
\m xan-der ik’i-a adäza babiw-a uži-qor eƛi-n howži r-odi-a šebin anu di-s uži mi eƛi-o xan-qor mesed-s b-ic’-n q’ili neƛ-näy gulu-bi-z reqen-łay sis b-igu gulu łet’i-an egir-näy di neła kid-ł xizay ik’i-an-ƛin
\g khan-APUD.LAT go-INF before father-ERG son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW now IV-do-INF thing be.NEG me-GEN1 son you say-IMPR khan-POSS.LAT gold-GEN1 III-fill-PFV.CVB qili give-CND.CVB horse-PL-GEN2 herd-CONT.ABL one III-good horse pick-FUT.CVB let-CND.CVB me DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-CONT.ESS behind go-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Before going to the king, the father said to the son, "Now there's nothing one can do, my son, say to the king, 'If you give me a qili filled with gold and if you let me pick a good horse from the herd, I will go behind that girl'!"

\t Hunix egirƛ’oräy, bełiqa žaqor eƛin, hunix šebigon dandir c’oxłin, mi nełar kumak bodoƛin.
\m huni-x egir-ƛ’oräy bełiqu-a uži-qor eƛi-n huni-x šebi-gon dandir c’ox-łin mi neła-r kumak b-odi-o-ƛin
\g way-AD.ESS send-SIM.CVB hunter-ERG son-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW way-AD.ESS who-CNTR towards meet-CNC.CVB you DEM1.IISG.OBL-LAT help III-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l While sending him on his way, the hunter told his son, "No matter whom you may meet on your way, help them!"

\t Hemedur hunix ik’iƛ’orey, boxin bik’ixosi ziru yisił c’oxno, nełałgon xizay k’oƛin nexxo łˤono boc’in yołƛax.
\m hemedur huni-x ik’i-ƛ’oräy b-oxi-n b-ik’i-xosi ziru yisi-ł c’ox-n neła-ł-gon xizay k’oƛi-n nex-x łˤono boc’i-n yoł-ƛax
\g so way-AD.ESS go-SIM.CVB III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-go-PRS.PRT fox DEM2.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS hit-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS-CNTR behind run-PFV.CVB come-IPFV.CVB three wolf-TOP be-QUOT
\l While he was on his way like that, he met a fox who was fleeing and behind it three wolves came running.

\t Neła zira yisiq harizi rodin, deber taliħ neƛani, žeda boc’aqay di xʷasar bodoƛin.
\m neła ziru-a yisi-q harizi r-odi-n mi-r taliħ neƛ-ani žeda boc’a-qay di xʷasar b-odi-o-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL fox-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PST.UNW you-LAT fortune give-MSD DEM1.IIPL.OBL wolf.PL-POSS.ABL me rescue III-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l That fox pleaded to him, "May fortune be given to you, please rescue me from those wolves!"

\t Durimoƛ’ rayn k’oƛin boc’a eƛin yisiqor, ža ziru eluqor neƛƛin.
\m durimoƛ’ r-ay-n k’oƛi-n boc’a eƛi-n yisi-qor ža ziru elu-qor neƛ-ƛin
\g running III.PL-come-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB wolf.PL say-PST.UNW DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT DEM1.SG fox we(I).OBL-POSS.LAT give-QUOT
\l Then came the wolves running and said to him, "Give us that fox!"

\t Užä eƛin, di c’eruc’as hil kuran, meži nełał xizayn k’oƛin, adäza hilno yayrno xizor butin bayrur di ziru neƛanƛin.
\m uži-a eƛi-n di c’eruc’a-s hil kur-an meži neła-ł xizay-n k’oƛi-n adäza hil-n y-ayr-n xizor b-uti-n b-ay-ru-r di ziru neƛ-an-ƛin
\g boy-ERG say-PST.UNW me bow-GEN1 arrow shoot.from-FUT.DEF you.PL DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind-TOP run-PFV.CVB ahead arrow-TOP II-bring-PFV.CVB back III-return-PFV.CVB III-come-PST.PRT-LAT me fox give-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The boy said, "I will shoot an arrow from my bow and you will run behind it; to the one who first brings it back to me, I will give the fox."

\t Boc’a razi roqno.
\m boc’a razi r-oq-n
\g wolf.PL agree III.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l The wolves agreed.

\t Kurno užä c’eruc’as hil, ciqaɣorno rezun durimoƛ’ boc’an rik’in, zirun žedaqay xʷasar boqno.
\m kur-n uži-a c’eruc’a-s hil ciq-aɣor-n r-ezu-n durimoƛ’ boc’a-n r-ik’i-n ziru-n žeda-qay xʷasar b-oq-n
\g shoot.from-PFV.CVB boy-ERG bow-GEN1 arrow forest-IN.VERS-TOP III.PL-look-PFV.CVB running wolf.PL-TOP III.PL-go-PFV.CVB fox-TOP DEM1.IIPL.OBL-POSS.ABL rescue III-become-PST.UNW
\l The boy shot the arrow from his bow, the wolves ran towards the forest and the fox got rescued from them.

\t Užä ziruqor eƛin, howži deber mi boc’aqay boxin bok’ełƛin.
\m uži-a ziru-qor eƛi-n howži mi-r mi boc’a-qay b-oxi-n b-ok’eł-ƛin
\g boy-ERG fox-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW now you-LAT you wolf.PL-POSS.ABL III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-escape-QUOT
\l The boy said to the fox, "Now run away from the wolves!"

\t Zira yisiqor eƛin, dice di boc’aq bˤuƛ’äsi zowä, žedaƛ’aygon di debeq bˤuƛ’äsi zows, šida mi di howži begirno xecäƛin.
\m ziru-a yisi-qor eƛi-n dice di boc’a-q b-ˤuƛ’-asi zow-a žeda-ƛ’ay-gon di mi-q b-ˤuƛ’-asi zow-s šida mi di howži b-egir-n xeci-a-ƛin
\g fox-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW how.much me wolf.PL-POSS.ESS III-be.afraid-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT.INT DEM1.IIPL.OBL-SUPER.ABL-CNTR me you-POSS.ESS III-be.afraid-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT why you me now III-send-PFV.CVB leave-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l The fox said to him, "I was so afraid of the wolves, and even more afraid of you than of them; why did you leave me here now?"

\t Užä žawab teƛno, šida mi di begirno xecixanu, dowƛ’aygon q’ʷariłiƛ’ din oqzaƛ’ƛin.
\m uži-a žawab teƛ-n šida mi di b-egir-n xeci-x-anu mi-ƛ’ay-gon q’ʷariłi-ƛ’ di-n oq-zaƛ’-ƛin
\g boy-ERG answer give-PST.UNW why you me III-send-PFV.CVB leave-PRS-NEG you-SUPER.ABL-CNTR sadness-SUPER.ESS me-TOP become-CSL.CVB-QUOT
\l The boy answered, "Why would I not leave you, when I'm much more sad than you?"

\t Nece žuka ħalał mi esunäy, hi dowqor enda musno, debeƛ’ ɣudi rayza quł bisno bik’ur ža miƛin.
\m nece žuka ħal-ł mi esu-näy hi mi-qor enda mus-n mi-ƛ’ ɣudi r-ay-za qu-ł b-is-n b-ik’u-r ža mi-ƛin
\g so.much bad condition-CONT.ESS you exist-CND.CVB take.IMP you-POSS.LAT DEM3b.SG hair-TOP you-SUPER.ESS day IV-come-LCV.CVB day-CONT.ESS III-take-PFV.CVB III-burn-CAUS DEM1.SG you-QUOT
\l "If you're in such a trouble, take this hair from me, and on the day when it's worst for you, burn it!"

\t Yisiqor žan teƛno, ziru ozƛäy gugin.
\m yisi-qor ža-n teƛ-n ziru ozuri-ƛay gugi-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT DEM1.SG-TOP give-PFV.CVB fox eye-SUB.ABL escape-PST.UNW
\l The fox gave it to him and disappeared.

\t Zirus musno žimä teł eqerno, bełiqus uži nesä nesiz hunix oqno ik’in.
\m ziru-s mus-n žimu-a teł eqer-n bełiqu-s uži nesi-a nesi-z huni-x oq-n ik’i-n
\g fox-GEN1 hair-TOP pocket-IN.ESS inside put-PFV.CVB hunter-GEN1 son DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN2 way-AD.ESS become-PFV.CVB go-PST.UNW
\l Having put the fox's hair into his pocket, the hunter's son went on his own way.

\t Recenyozaz ɣomał cucixäsi yisir cey besun, žeda ƛ’irirno rutin bac’xo zown ža.
\m recenyo-bi-z ɣomu-ł cucix-asi yisi-r cey b-esu-n žeda-a ƛ’iri-r-n r-uti-n b-ac’-x zow-n ža
\g ant-PL-GEN2 truss-CONT.ESS be.buried-RES.PRT DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT eagle III-find-PFV.CVB DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG above-LAT-TOP III.PL-turn-PFV.CVB III-eat-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG
\l He found an eagle burried in an anthill, and they were already climbing upwards to eat it.

\t ƛ’iräy recenyobin roxirno, yisä cey boržizi boqa begirno.
\m ƛ’iräy recenyo-bi-n r-oxir-n yisi-a cey boržizi b-oq-a b-egir-n
\g from.above ant-PL-TOP III.PL-chase-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG eagle fly III-become-INF III-let-PST.UNW
\l He chased the ants off of it and let the eagle fly away.

\t Hawaƛ’ łox šet’un butin, cey bayn užide puħo heqno.
\m hawa-ƛ’ łox šet’u-n b-uti-n cey b-ay-n uži-de puħo heq-n
\g air-SUPER.ESS thrice around-PFV.CVB III-turn-PFV.CVB eagle III-come-PFV.CVB boy-APUD.ESS next.to sit.down-PST.UNW
\l The eagle turned circles in the air three times and then came to sit down next to the boy.

\t Neła yisiqor eƛin, mi aynosi di bežigon bˤuƛ’si, šida mi di xʷasar bodäƛin.
\m neła-a yisi-qor eƛi-n mi ay-nosi di b-eži-gon b-ˤuƛ’-si šida mi di xʷasar b-odi-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT say-PST.UNW you come-ANT.CVB me III-more-CNTR III-be.afraid-ATTR why you me rescue III-do-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l It said to him, "When you came, I was even more afraid; why did you save me?"

\t Užä eƛin, šida mi di xʷasar boda bayxanu, dowƛ’äygon q’ʷariłiƛ’ oqzaƛ’ diƛin.
\m uži-a eƛi-n šida mi di xʷasar b-odi-a b-ay-x-anu mi-ƛ’ay-gon q’ʷariłi-ƛ’ oq-zaƛ’ di-ƛin
\g boy-ERG say-PST.UNW why you me rescue III-do-INF III-must-PRS-NEG you-SUPER.ABL-CNTR sadness-SUPER.ESS become-CSL.CVB me-QUOT
\l The boy said, "Why would I not save you, when I'm much more sad than you?"

\t Nedur resunäy, hi enda sis lel, debeƛ’ ɣudi rayza quł ža mi yik’urƛin, yisiqorno eƛin, cey hawaƛ’ k’oƛin bik’in.
\m nedur r-esu-näy hi enda sis lel mi-ƛ’ ɣudi r-ay-za qu-ł ža mi y-ik’u-r-ƛin yisi-qor-n eƛi-n cey hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n b-ik’i-n
\g so IV-find-CND.CVB take.IMP DEM3b.SG one feather you-SUPER.ESS day IV-come-LCV.CVB day-CONT.ESS DEM1.SG you II-burn-CAUS-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PST.UNW eagle air-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB III-go-PST.UNW
\l "If that's the case, take this feather, and on a day that brings trouble upon you, burn it!" the eagle said to him and flew away.

\t Elaygon bitor ik’iƛ’oräy, yisir sis zey besun, gonda tełerno bˤoƛ’un, ʕoloqza bexurxo, sida boħt’oryabi caƛix zown, sidägon k’it’imoq boyx zown.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor ik’i-ƛ’oräy yisi-r sis zey b-esu-n gondu-a tełer-n b-ˤoƛ’u-n ʕoloq-bi-a b-exur-x sida-a boħt’or-bi caƛi-x zow-n sida-a-gon k’it’i-q b-odi-x zow-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT one bear III-find-PST.UNW big.hole-IN.ESS into-PFV.CVB III-fall-PFV.CVB young.person-PL-ERG III-kill-IPFV.CVB one.OBL-ERG stone-PL throw-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB one.OBL-ERG-CNTR stick-POSS.ESS III-do-IPFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB
\l When he went further, he found a bear that had fallen into a hole, and people were killing him; one was throwing stones and another one was beating him with a stick.

\t ƛ’irir ayru užiqor žeda eƛin, zey bexuranix tupi neƛƛin.
\m ƛ’iri-r ay-ru uži-qor žedu-a eƛi-n zey b-exur-ani-x tupi neƛ-ƛin
\g above-LAT come-PST.PRT boy-POSS.LAT DEM1.IPL.OBL-ERG say-PST.UNW bear III-kill-MSD-AD.ESS rifle give-QUOT
\l To the approaching boy they said, "Give us your rifle so we can kill the bear!"

\t Yisä tupi teƛno anu, žedä äƛiru mesedno teƛno, yisä žeduqay zey xʷasar bodin.
\m yisi-a tupi teƛ-n anu žeda-a eƛi-ru mesed-n teƛ-n yisi-a žedu-qay zey xʷasar b-odi-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG rifle give-PFV.CVB be.NEG DEM1.IIPL.OBL-ERG say-PST.PRT gold-TOP give-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ABL bear rescue III-do-PST.UNW
\l He didn't give them the rifle, but gave them as much gold as they wanted and rescued the bear from them.

\t Xizyo zeyä yisiq esirno, mi oƛixnosi di bežigon bˤuƛ’si, šida mi di bexurinč’ey xecäƛin.
\m xizyo zey-a yisi-q esir-n mi oƛix-nosi di b-eži-gon b-ˤuƛ’-s šida mi di b-exur-č’ey xeci-a-ƛin
\g afterwards bear-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW you appear-ANT.CVB me III-more-CNTR III-be.afraid-PST.WIT why you me III-kill-NEG.PST.CVB leave-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l Then the bear asked him, "After you appeared I was all the more afraid, why didn't you kill me?"

\t Užä eƛin, šida mi di bexura bayx, dowƛ’äygon q’ʷariłiƛ’ din oqzaƛ’ƛin.
\m uži-a eƛi-n šida mi di b-exur-a b-ay-x mi-ƛ’ay-gon q’ʷariłi-ƛ’ di-n oq-zaƛ’-ƛin
\g boy-ERG say-PST.UNW why you me III-kill-INF III-must-IPFV.CVB you-SUPER.ABL-CNTR sadness-SUPER.ESS me-TOP become-CSL.CVB-QUOT
\l The boy said, "Why would I kill you, when I'm much more sad than you?"

\t Nedur resunäy, hi enda dowqor sis dey musno, debeƛ’ ɣudi rayza quł yedu mi bik’urƛin nesiqorno eƛin, zeyä ciqaɣor zebu yoɣno.
\m nedur r-esu-näy hi enda mi-qor sis di-s mus-n mi-ƛ’ ɣudi r-ay-za qu-ł yedu mi b-ik’u-r-ƛin nesi-qor-n eƛi-n zey-a ciq-aɣor zebu y-oɣ-n
\g so IV-exist-CND.CVB take.IMP DEM3b.SG you-POSS.LAT one me-GEN1 hair-TOP you-SUPER.ESS day IV-come-LCV.CVB day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IISG you III-burn-CAUS-QUOT DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP say-PFV.CVB bear-ERG forest-IN.VERS running II-take.away-PST.UNW
\l "In that case, take this hair of me and when you're in big trouble one day, burn it!" it said to him and ran off to the forest.

\t Elaygon bitor ik’iƛ’oräy, yeda raładyoz lilyoxor ayn.
\m ele-ay-gon bitor ik’i-ƛ’oräy yeda raład-z lilyo-xor ay-n
\g there-IN.ABL-CNTR thither go-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG sea-GEN2 river.bank-AD.LAT come-PST.UNW
\l When he went further, he came to the banks of the sea.

\t Elo yisir besuroqu esun, gamušyozaq ƛisirno sis ixiw besuro bižix.
\m elo yisi-r besuroqu esu-n gamuš-bi-q ƛisi-r-n sis ixiw besuro b-iži-x
\g there DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT fisherman find-PFV.CVB buffalo-PL-POSS.ESS pull-CAUS-PFV.CVB one big fish III-carry-IPFV.CVB
\l There he found a fisherman who was carrying one big fish by buffalos.

\t Baq’ˤu mesedno besuroqur teƛno, yisä ža besuro nesiq raładyołxor begirerno.
\m b-aq’ˤu mesed-n besuroqu-r teƛ-n yisi-a ža besuro nesi-q raład-łxor b-egir-r-n
\g III-much gold-TOP fisherman-LAT give-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.SG fish DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS sea-CONT.VERS III-let-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l He gave the fisherman a lot of gold and had him let the fish into the sea.

\t Hemełƛ’o yisir raładyoz bitazoni lilyox neła kidbes ɣˤutku rukayn.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ yisi-r raład-z bitasi-ni lilyo-x neła kid-s ɣˤutku r-ukad-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT sea-GEN2 next-DEF river.bank-AD.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-GEN1 house IV-see-PST.UNW
\l Thereupon he saw that girl's house on the other side of the sea.

\t Didur hoboy di taqˤor oqanƛin, pikrazałer yeda eginosi, hemełƛ’o raładyołäzay nesä xʷasar bodin zawruni besuro boƛixno k’oƛin.
\m didur hoboy di taqˤo-r oq-an-ƛin pikru-bi-łer yeda egi-nosi hemeł-ƛ’ raład-łazay nesi-a xʷasar b-odi-n zow-ru-ni besuro b-oƛix-n k’oƛi-n
\g how now me over.there-LAT become-FUT.DEF-QUOT idea-PL-CONT.LAT DEM2.ISG go.into-ANT.CVB DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS sea-CONT.ABL.DIST DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG rescue III-do-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF fish III-appear-PFV.CVB run-PST.UNW
\l When he got lost in his thoughts, "How will I get over there, now?" The fish that he had rescued appeared suddenly from out the sea.

\t Besura neła nełaz gugyoƛ’no zowerno, bełiqus uži neła kidbez ɣˤutkoł adäzar ižin kurno.
\m besuro-a neła-a neła-z gugu-ƛ’-n zowr-n bełiqu-s uži neła kid-z ɣˤutku-ł adäz-ar iži-n kur-n
\g fish-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 back-SUPER.ESS-TOP seat-PFV.CVB hunter-GEN1 son DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-GEN2 house-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT carry-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l The fish took the hunter's son onto his back, carried him to that girl's house and threw him off again.

\t Xizyo neła yisiqor mešok’lałäy bet’urno mus teƛno, debeƛ’ ɣudi rayza mečoƛ’ bik’ur mi yeduƛin.
\m xizyo neła-a yisi-qor mešok’la-łay b-et’ur-n mus teƛ-n mi-ƛ’ ɣudi r-ay-za moči-ƛ’ b-ik’u-r mi yedu-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT moustache-CONT.ABL III-pull.out-PFV.CVB hair give-PFV.CVB you-SUPER.ESS day IV-come-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.ESS III-burn-CAUS you DEM2.IISG-QUOT
\l Then it pulled out a hair from its whiskers and gave it to him, "When one day you are in trouble, burn it!"

\t Elo ɣˤutka teł babiwn, kidno besun.
\m elo ɣˤutku-a teł babiw-n kid-n b-esu-n
\g there house-IN.ESS inside father-and daughter-and I.PL-find-PST.UNW
\l There in the house he found father and daughter.

\t Assalama ʕalaykumƛin eƛin, salamno teƛno, uži ɣˤutka tełxor oqno.
\m assalama ʕalaykum-ƛin eƛi-n salam-n teƛ-n uži ɣˤutku-a teł-xor oq-n
\g the.peace. ...be.with.you-QUOT say-PFV.CVB greeting-TOP give-PFV.CVB boy house-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT become-PST.UNW
\l "As-salam alaykum!" said the boy, greeted him and got into the house.

\t Salamno bisno, kidbez babiya esirno, šebi retin nexä, šebi debi muradƛin.
\m salam-n b-is-n kid-z babiw-a esir-n šebi r-eti-n nex-a šebi mi-s murad-ƛin
\g greeting-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB girl-GEN2 father-ERG ask-PST.UNW what IV-want-PFV.CVB come-PST.WIT.INT what you-GEN1 wish-QUOT
\l The girl's father answered the greeting and asked, "What have you come for, what is your wish?"

\t Walla, debi kidno yetin nełał xizay nexäsi yołƛin, žawab teƛno užä.
\m wallah mi-s kid-n y-eti-n neła-ł xizay nex-asi yoł-ƛin žawab teƛ-n uži-a
\g wallah you-GEN1 daughter-TOP II-want-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind come-RES.PRT be-QUOT answer give-PFV.CVB boy-ERG
\l "By God, I want your daughter, I have come for her," the boy answered.

\t Ričiƛƛin, eƛin kidbez babiya, roqnäy mi di łox uqˤłan egiran, sosikin mi där esunč’inäy, kidno neƛno egiran, łˤoran hunix esunäy, debi di meč’ beč’a yołƛin.
\m r-iči-ƛ-ƛin eƛi-n kid-z babiw-a r-oq-näy mi di łox uqˤeł-an egir-an sosi-kin mi di-r esu-č’i-näy kid-n neƛ-n egir-an łˤora-n huni-x esu-näy mi-s di meč’ b-eč’-a yoł-ƛin
\g IV-be-OPT-QUOT say-PST.UNW girl-GEN2 father-ERG IV-happen-CND.CVB you me thrice hide-FUT.CVB let-FUT.DEF once-even you me-LAT find-NEG.FUT.CVB-CND.CVB daughter-TOP give-PFV.CVB send-FUT.DEF three.OBL-TOP way-AD.ESS find-CND.CVB you-GEN1 me neck III-cut-INF be-QUOT
\l "So be it!" the girl's father said. "In that case, I will let you hide three times; if I won't find you even once, I will give you my daughter to marry; but if I will find you three times in a row, I am going to cut off your neck."

\t Rigutow riguƛin, yedan razi oqno ʕuqłanix ik’in.
\m r-igu-tow r-igu-ƛin yeda-n razi oq-n uqˤeł-ani-x ik’i-n
\g IV-good-EMPH IV-good-QUOT DEM2.ISG-TOP agree become-PFV.CVB hide-MSD-AD.ESS go-PST.UNW
\l "Very good!" he agreed and went hiding himself.

\t Hemełƛ’o yisä besuros mus bik’urno.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ yisi-a besuro-s mus b-ik’u-r-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG fish-GEN1 hair III-burn-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l At that point he burned the hair of the fish.

\t Šebi retinƛin, raładyołäy maħor boƛixno k’oƛin nesä xʷasar bodin zawruni besuro.
\m šebi r-eti-n-ƛin raład-łay maħor b-oƛix-n k’oƛi-n nesi-a xʷasar b-odi-n zow-ru-ni besuro
\g what IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT sea-CONT.ABL outside III-appear-PFV.CVB run-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG rescue III-do-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF fish
\l "What do you want?" said the fish that he had saved, after appearing out of the sea.

\t Užä nesä nesis murad esinosi, besura hoqoƛno iqirno, raładyoz iƛ’aqaɣor ižin ža.
\m uži-a nesi-a nesi-s murad esi-nosi besuro-a haqu-ƛ-n iqir-n raład-z iƛ’u-qaɣor iži-n ža
\g boy-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 wish tell-ANT.CVB fish-ERG mouth-SUB.ESS-TOP take.away-PFV.CVB sea-GEN2 bottom-POSS.VERS carry-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG
\l After the boy had told his wish, the fish took him into its mouth and carried him to the bottom of the sea.

\t Babiwn kidno maħor boqno, na ža uqˤełnoƛin bezu-bˤoƛ’anix.
\m babiw-n kid-n maħor b-oq-n na ža uqˤeł-n-ƛin b-ezu~oƛ’ˤu-ani-x
\g father-and daughter-and outside III-become-PST.UNW where DEM1.SG hide-PST.UNW-QUOT I.PL-examine-MSD-AD.ESS
\l Father and daughter came out to find out where the boy had hidden.

\t Yizir ža besuroz haqa raładyoz iƛ’aq ukayn.
\m yizi-r ža besuro-z haqu-a raład-z iƛ’u-q ukad-n
\g DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT DEM1.SG fish-GEN2 mouth-IN.ESS sea-GEN2 bottom-POSS.ESS see-PST.UNW
\l They saw him in the mouth of the fish at the bottom of the sea.

\t Žedu teł iduɣor bik’inosi xizyo, besura uži raładyoz lilyoxor ayrno kurno.
\m žedu teł idu-ɣor b-ik’i-nosi xizyo besuro-a uži raład-z lilyo-xor ayr-n kur-n
\g DEM1.IPL inside home-IN.ALL I.PL-go-ANT.CVB after fish-ERG son sea-GEN2 river.bank-AD.LAT bring-PFV.CVB throw-PST.UNW
\l After they went home, the fish brought him to the bank of the sea and threw him out there.

\t Ayn yisä yiziq esirno, mežur di ukayyäƛin?
\m ay-n yisi-a yizi-q esir-n mežu-r di ukad-a-ƛin
\g come-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PST.UNW you(I).PL.OBL-LAT me see-PST.WIT.INT-QUOT
\l He came and asked them, "Did you see me?"

\t Mi elur raładyoz iƛ’aq besuroz haqa ukaysƛin, eƛin kidbez babiya.
\m mi elu-r raład-z iƛ’u-q besuro-z haqu-a ukad-s-ƛin eƛi-n kid-z babiw-a
\g you we(I).OBL-LAT sea-GEN2 bottom-POSS.ESS fish-GEN2 mouth-IN.ESS see-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW girl-GEN2 father-ERG
\l "We have seen you at the bottom of the see in the fish's mouth," said the girl's father.

\t K’ox äƛirugon uži uqˤełanix ik’in.
\m k’ox äƛiru-gon uži uqˤeł-ani-x ik’i-n
\g twice ORD-CNTR boy hide-MSD-AD.ESS go-PST.UNW
\l For the second time, the boy went into hiding.

\t Howlotow yisä ceyes lel yik’urno.
\m howlo-tow yisi-a cey-s lel y-ik’u-r-n
\g there-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG eagle-GEN1 feather II-burn-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l There he burned the eagle's feather.

\t Šebi retinƛin, cey hawaƛ’ k’oƛin bayn.
\m šebi r-eti-n-ƛin cey hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n b-ay-n
\g what IV-want-PST.UNW-QUOT eagle air-SUPER.ESS jump-PFV.CVB III-come-PST.UNW
\l "What do you want?" the eagle came flying.

\t Neła yeda gugyoƛ’no zowerno soder asaɣor izirno.
\m neła-a yeda gugu-ƛ’-n zowr-n soder as-aɣor izir-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG back-SUPER.ESS-TOP seat-PFV.CVB upward sky-IN.VERS lift-PST.UNW
\l It seated him on its back and brought him up into the sky.

\t Babiwn, kidno uži uqˤäłru moči k’edanix maħor boqno.
\m babiw-n kid-n uži uqˤeł-ru moči k’edi-ani-x maħor b-oq-n
\g father-and daughter-and boy hide-PST.PRT place search-MSD-AD.ESS outside I.PL-become-PST.UNW
\l Father and daughter went outside to search for the place where the boy was hiding.

\t Naysinan bezun yizi.
\m naysinan b-ezu-n yizi
\g everywhere I.PL-look-PST.UNW DEM2.IPL
\l They looked everywhere.

\t Xizaɣor asoƛxor bezunosi, yizir yeda ceyez gugyoƛ’no zown, asoł teł ʕuqłäsi ukayn.
\m xizaɣor as-ƛxor b-ezu-nosi yizi-r yeda cey-z gugu-ƛ’-n zow-n as-ł teł uqˤeł-asi ukad-n
\g finally sky-SUB.LAT I.PL-look-ANT.CVB DEM2.IPL.OBL-LAT DEM2.ISG eagle-GEN2 back-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB sky-CONT.ESS inside hide-RES.PRT see-PST.UNW
\l Finally, when they looked into the sky, they saw him hiding in the sky, riding on the eagle's back.

\t Žedu teł iduɣor boqnosi, ceyä bełiqus uži žeduz ɣˤutkoxor egirno.
\m žedu teł idu-ɣor b-oq-nosi cey-a bełiqu-s uži žedu-z ɣˤutku-xor egir-n
\g DEM1.IPL inside home-IN.ALL III-become-ANT.CVB eagle-ERG hunter-GEN1 son DEM1.IPL.OBL-GEN2 house-AD.LAT let-PST.UNW
\l When they had gone into their house, the eagle let the hunter's son down to their house.

\t Ukayyä mežur diƛin, esiranix yeda iduɣor ik’in.
\m ukad-ya mežu-r di-ƛin esir-ani-x yeda idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g see-PST.WIT.Q you(I).PL.OBL-LAT me-QUOT ask-MSD-AD.ESS DEM2.ISG home-IN.ALL go-PST.UNW
\l He went into their home to ask, "Did you see me?"

\t Ceyez gugyoƛ’no zown, asoł teł mi ʕuqłäsi zowsƛin, eƛin kidbez babiya.
\m cey-z gugu-ƛ’-n zow-n as-ł teł mi uqˤeł-asi zow-s-ƛin eƛi-n kid-z babiw-a
\g eagle-GEN2 back-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB sky-CONT.ESS inside you hide-RES.PRT be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT say-PST.UNW girl-GEN2 father-ERG
\l "You were riding on the back of an eagle, and hiding inside the sky," the girl's father said.

\t Łox äƛirugon yeda ʕuqła ik’inosi, bełiquz užä zeyes mus bik’urno.
\m łox äƛiru-gon yeda uqˤeł-a ik’i-nosi bełiqu-z uži-a zey-s mus b-ik’u-r-n
\g thrice ORD-CNTR DEM2.ISG hide-INF go-ANT.CVB hunter-GEN2 boy-ERG bear-GEN1 hair III-burn-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l After the hunter's son went hiding for the third time, he burnt the bear's hair.

\t Ħibaƛ’ k’oƛin bayn zeyä esirno, šebi deber däqay retixƛin.
\m ħibaƛ’ k’oƛi-n b-ay-n zey-a esir-n šebi mi-r di-qay r-eti-x-ƛin
\g running run-PFV.CVB III-come-PFV.CVB bear-ERG ask-PST.UNW what you-LAT me-POSS.ABL IV-want-PRS-QUOT
\l The bear came running and asked, "What do you want from me?"

\t Užä nesir rätiru šebin esinosi, zeyä yeda ʕoƛno ħonno xecin bitaza sasugani ciqa yałruni imxa tełxor ižin.
\m uži-a nesi-r r-eti-ru šebin esi-nosi zey-a yeda ʕoƛno ħon-n xeci-n bita-aza sasyu-ni ciq-a yoł-ru-ni imxu-a teł-xor iži-n
\g boy-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT thing tell-ANT.CVB bear-ERG DEM2.ISG seven mountain-TOP leave-PFV.CVB distance-IN.VERS.DIST dark-DEF forest-IN.ESS be-PST.PRT-DEF cave-IN.ESS inside-AD.LAT take.out-PFV.CVB
\l After the hunter's son has told what he wanted, the bear took him to the cave behind the seven mountains in the dark forest.

\t Elogon teł sis gondun yič’in, teł yedan uqˤno, ƛ’irigon girimabin kurno, žan ƛ’iqun nełaƛ’ ƛ’irigon zeyä lidu yaq’ˤun.
\m elo-gon teł sis gondu-n y-ič’i-n teł yeda-n uqˤi-n ƛ’iri-gon giri-bi-n kur-n ža-n ƛ’iq-n neła-ƛ’ ƛ’iri-gon zey-a lidu y-aq’ˤuł-n
\g there-CNTR inside one big.hole-TOP II-dig-PFV.CVB inside DEM2.ISG-TOP hide-PFV.CVB above-CNTR pole-PL-TOP throw-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP cover-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS above-CNTR bear-ERG paw II-cover-PFV.CVB
\l The bear dug a big hole there, hid the hunter's son inside, threw the poles above it and covered it with his paw as well.

\t Iduɣor yizi boqnosi, zeyä yeda žeduz ɣˤutkoxor ayrno.
\m idu-ɣor yizi b-oq-nosi zey-a yeda žedu-z ɣˤutku-xor ayr-n
\g home-IN.ALL DEM2.IPL III-happen-ANT.CVB bear-ERG DEM2.ISG DEM1.IPL-GEN2 house-AD.LAT bring-PFV.CVB
\l They went into the house and the bear brought him to their house.

\t Tełerno ik’in, yisä esirno žeduq, di na uqˤäłru iyyä mežurƛin.
\m tełer-n ik’i-n yisi-a esir-n žedu-q di na uqˤeł-ru iy-a mežu-r-ƛin
\g into-TOP go-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL.OBL-POSS.ESS me where hide-PST.PRT know-Q you(I).PL.OBL-LAT-QUOT
\l He got into the house and asked them, "Do you know, where I had hidden?"

\t Howži mežur rätiru rodo, däq bažari bik’inč’u meža äƛiru šebin rodanixƛin, užä yiził q’ˤim rok’no.
\m howži mežu-r r-eti-ru r-odi-o di-q bažari b-ik’i-č’u meža-a eƛi-ru šebin r-odi-ani-x-ƛin uži-a yizi-ł q’ˤim r-ok’-n
\g now you(I).PL.OBL-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT IV-do-IMPR me-POSS.ESS skill III-go-NEG.PST.WIT you(II-ERG say-PST.PRT thing IV.PL-do-MSD-IPFV.CVB-QUOT boy-ERG DEM2.IPL.OBL-CONT.ESS head IV-hit-PFV.CVB
\l "Now, do what you want with me, I did not manage to do what you've said to me," the boy hit with his head.

\t Hemełƛ’o kidbä eƛin, nediw hunar yołäsi t’or siskin uži ayäsi zownč’uƛin, uyraxäƛirugon ʕuqła yeda egirnäy rigu räči yisirƛin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ kid-a eƛi-n nediw hunar yoł-asi t’o-r siskin uži ay-asi zow-č’u-ƛin uyno-x-äƛiru-gon uqˤeł-a yeda egir-näy r-igu r-iči yisi-r-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS girl-ERG say-PFV.CVB such talent be-RES.PRT here-LAT anyone boy come-RES.PRT be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT four-IPFV.CVB-ORD-CNTR hide-INF DEM2.ISG let-CND.CVB IV-good IV-remain DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT-QUOT
\l The girl broke in, "None of the boys with such potentials came here. It will be good to let him hide for the fourth time."

\t Babiwn razi oqno nełaƛ’, bełiqus uži uqˤłanix egirno.
\m babiw-n razi oq-n neła-ƛ’ bełiqu-s uži uqˤeł-ani-x egir-n
\g father-TOP agree become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS hunter-GEN1 son hide-MSD-IPFV.CVB let-PFV.CVB
\l The father agreed and let the hunter's son hide himself.

\t Elay maħor aqruntow, yisä zirus mus bik’urno.
\m ele-ay maħor oq-run-tow yisi-a ziru-s mus b-ik’u-r-n
\g here-IN.ABL outside happen-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG fox-GEN1 hair III-burn-CAUS-PFV.CVB
\l As he was outside, he burnt the fox's hair.

\t Maħi žek’- rok’xotow bayn zira esirno, šebi däqay retixƛin.
\m maħi žek’ r-ok’-x-tow b-ay-n ziru-a esir-n šebi di-qay r-eti-x-ƛin
\g tail beat III.PL-beat-PRS-EMPH III-come-PFV.CVB fox-ERG ask-PFV.CVB what me-POSS.ABL IV-want-PRS-QUOT
\l The fox came wagging her tail and asked, what he wants.

\t Babiwrno, kidberno esuxanuzo mečoƛ’ mi di uqˤek’a ayƛin, raqru nasin šebin yisä ziruq esin.
\m babiw-r-n kid-r-n esu-xanuzo moči-ƛ’ mi di uqˤek’-a ay-ƛin r-oq-ru nasin šebin yisi-a ziru-q esi-n
\g father-LAT-TOP daughter-LAT-TOP find-NEG.PRS.PRT.OBL place-SUPER.ESS you me shut-INF must-QUOT IV-happen-PST.PRT all thing DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG fox-POSS.ESS tell-PFV.CVB
\l He told the fox what has happened and said, "You must hide me in a such place, where the father and his daughter will not find me."

\t Hawaƛ’no, raładyołno, raƛ’moƛ’no žeda di esursi, ana debi q’ˤuya ħilla- makruƛin, esirno užä.
\m hawa-ƛ’-n raład-ł-n raƛ’-ƛ’-n žedu-a di esur-s anu-a mi-s q’ˤuya ħilla makru-ƛin esir-n uži-a
\g air-SUPER.ESS-TOP sea-CONT.ESS-TOP earth-SUPER.ESS-TOP DEM1.IPL-ERG me find-PST.WIT be.NEG-Q you-GEN1 other trickery ruse-QUOT ask-PFV.CVB boy-ERG
\l "They have found me in the air, in the sea and on the earth, do you have another trick?" the boy asked.

\t Di mi žeduq ukarač’inƛin, eƛin zira.
\m di mi žedu-q ukar-ač’in-ƛin eƛi-n ziru-a
\g me you DEM1.IPL-POSS.ESS show-NEG.FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PFV.CVB fox-ERG
\l "I will not show you," the fox said.

\t Di muši pˤaƛunosi, mi nociƛ’or ati, xizyo mi kidbez kočorał teł uqˤeł, ža iduɣor yik’iƛ’oräy, mi q’ˤidar k’oƛo, hemełƛ’o mi di nociƛ’ay užiƛ’or utiran.
\m di muši pˤaƛu-nosi mi noci-ƛ’or uti xizyo mi kid-z kočori-ł teł uqˤeł ža idu-ɣor y-ik’i-ƛ’oräy mi q’ˤida-r k’oƛi-o hemeł-ƛ’ mi di noci-ƛ’ay uži-ƛ’or utir-an
\g me breath thrash-ANT.CVB you louse-SUPER.LAT turn afterwards you girl-GEN2 forelock-CONT.ESS inside hide DEM1.SG home-IN.ALL II-go-SIM.CVB you down-LAT jump-IMPR DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS you me louse-SUPER.ABL boy-SUPER.LAT turn-FUT.DEF
\l "When I blow, you will turn into the louse. Afterwards you will hide youself inside the girl's forelock. Before she go home, jump down and I will turn you back to the boy."

\t Hemedur nociƛ’orno utin, neła kidbez kočorał uqˤełno yeda.
\m hemedur noci-ƛ’or-n uti-n neła kid-z kočori-ł uqˤeł-n yeda
\g so louse-SUPER.LAT-TOP turn-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-GEN2 forelock-CONT.ESS hide-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG
\l So he turned into the louse and hid himself in that girl's forelock.

\t Babiyan, kidbän naysinan k’edin yeda.
\m babiw-a-n kid-a-n naysinan k’edi-n yeda
\g father-ERG-TOP daughter-ERG-TOP everywhere search-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG
\l The father and the daughter looked for him everywhere.

\t Dicegon k’ediłin yizir yeda esun anu.
\m dice-gon k’edi-łin yizi-r yeda esu-n anu
\g how.much-CNTR search-CNC.CVB DEM2.IPL-LAT DEM2.ISG find-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l No matter how long they looked, they did not find him.

\t Howžigoƛ’ay nesä elus ħal bayrinč’uƛin, yizi iduɣor bik’in.
\m howži-go-ƛ’ay nesi-a elu-s ħal b-ay-r-č’u-ƛin yizi idu-ɣor b-ik’i-n
\g now-COND-SUPER.ABL DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-GEN1 strength III-come-CAUS-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT DEM2.IPL home-IN.ALL III-go-PFV.CVB
\l "This time he comes beyond our strength," they said and went home.

\t Kid madaxor yaynosi, iduɣor ža yoqno yok’ełzaƛ’or noci q’ˤimƛ’ay k’oƛin madax ƛexun.
\m kid ma-xor y-ay-nosi idu-ɣor ža y-oq-n y-ok’eł-zaƛ’or noci q’ˤim-ƛ’ay k’oƛi-n ma-x ƛexu-n
\g girl door-AD.LAT II-come-ANT.CVB home-IN.ALL DEM1.SG II-become-PFV.CVB II-be.in.time-POST.CVB louse head-SUPER.ABL jump-PFV.CVB door-AD.ESS remain-PFV.CVB
\l The girl went home and just before the girl entered the house the louse jumped down and remained near the door.

\t Bayn zira, mušin pˤaƛun, noci užiƛ’or butirno.
\m b-ay-n ziru-a muši-n pˤaƛu-n noci uži-ƛ’or b-uti-r-n
\g III-come-PFV.CVB fox-ERG breath-TOP thrash-PFV.CVB louse boy-SUPER.LAT III-turn-CAUS-PST.UNW
\l The fox came, thrashed and turned the louse into the boy.

\t Tełerno ik’in babiwqno, kidbeqno esirno yisä, mežur di ukayyä žigoƛ’ayƛin.
\m tełer-n ik’i-n babiw-q-n kid-q-n esir-n yisi-a mežu-r di ukad-a žigo-ƛ’ay-ƛin
\g into-TOP go-PFV.CVB father-POSS.ESS-TOP daughter-POSS.ESS-TOP ask-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG you(I).PL.OBL-LAT me see-Q again-SUPER.ABL-QUOT
\l He went into the house and asked the father and the daughter, " Did you see me again?"

\t Ukaynč’uƛin, babiw- kidbä nesił q’ˤim rok’no.
\m ukad-č’u-ƛin babiw kid-a nesi-ł q’ˤim r-ok’-n
\g see-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT father daughter-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-CONT.ESS head IV-hit-PFV.CVB
\l "We did not see," the father and his daughter accepted their defeat.

\t Na uqˤłäsi zowäƛin, esirno babiya.
\m na uqˤeł-a-si zow-a-ƛin esir-n babiw-a
\g where hide-PST.WIT.INT-ATTR be.NPRS-Q-QUOT ask-PFV.CVB father-ERG
\l "Where did you hide?" the father asked.

\t Debez kidbez kočorał uqˤłäsi zowsƛin, esin yisä.
\m mi-z kid-z kočori-ł uqˤeł-a-si zow-s-ƛin esi-n yisi-a
\g you-GEN2 daughter-GEN2 forelock-CONT.ESS hide-PST.WIT.INT-ATTR be.NPRS-PST.WIT-QUOT tell-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG
\l "I was hidden in your daughter's hair," the boy told.

\t Roƛo räsruxor, kidno teƛno, kidbez babiya uži hunix nesä nesiz ʕaƛaɣor egirno.
\m r-oƛƛo r-is-ru-xor kid-n teƛ-n kid-z babiw-a uži huni-x nesi-a nesi-z ʕaƛ-aɣor egir-n
