\l According to arrangement, the girl's father gave his daughter to the boy and sent him to his village.

\t Elo yiła xaner bokon, k’ukno baqˤun.
\m elo yiła-a xan-r boko-n k’uk-n b-aqˤu-n
\g there DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG khan-LAT fur.coat-TOP cap-TOP III-sew-PFV.CVB
\l There she sewn a fur coat and a cap for the king.

\t Maharno erno, beže bertenno bodin, ža kidno bełiquz užä yižin.
\m mahar-n er-n b-eže berten-n b-odi-n ža kid-n bełiqu-z uži-a y-iži-n
\g wedding-TOP set.up-PFV.CVB III-big marriage-TOP III-do-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG girl-TOP hunter-GEN2 son-ERG II-take.out-PFV.CVB
\l The wedding was set up and the hunter's son married that girl.

\t Neła bertenyoł din zows, elay izin berten łiyzaƛ’ortow nexa ays yedu imadu mežuq esanix.
\m neła berten-ł di-n zow-s ele-ay izi-n berten łiy-zaƛ’or-tow nex-a ay-s yedu imadu mežu-q esi-ani-x
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL marriage-CONT.ESS me-TOP be.NPRS-PST.WIT there-IN.ABL get.up-PFV.CVB marriage end-POST.CVB-EMPH come-INF must-PST.WIT DEM2.IISG tale you(I).PL.OBL-POSS.ESS tell-MSD-IPFV.CVB
\l I was also there by that marriage and so long as the marriage did not end I had to come to you and tell this tale.

\t Zownƛax, zownanuƛax sis xan, nesisgon łˤono užin zownƛax.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax sis xan nesi-s-gon łˤono uži-n zow-n-ƛax
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT one khan DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1-CNTR three son-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT
\l Once upon a time there was a khan with three sons.

\t Xanes ɣˤutkoł adäza reže baɣ zown, elo anunč’uru č’iħotow zownanu.
\m xan-s ɣˤutku-ł adäza r-eže baɣ zow-n elo anu-č’u-ru č’iħo-tow zow-n-anu
\g khan-GEN1 house-CONT.ESS before IV-big garden be.NPRS-PFV.CVB there be.NEG-NEG.PST.WIT-PST.PRT fruit-EMPH be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG
\l There was a big garden before the khan's house, where the fruits grew.

\t Elo teł mesedyos heneš boqxosi sis ɣun zown.
\m elo teł mesed-s heneš b-oq-xosi sis ɣun zow-n
\g there inside gold-GEN1 apple III-become-PRS.PRT one tree be.NPRS-PFV.CVB
\l There was one tree, which had golden apples.

\t Xizaɣorzo zamanał neširuxayt’a neła ɣunoqay sist’a heneš nar eƛa biynč’ey bok’ełxo zown.
\m xizaɣor-zo zaman-ł neširu-xay-t’a neła ɣun-qay sist’a heneš nar eƛi-a b-iy-č’ey b-ok’eł-x zow-n
\g finally-ATTR.OBL time-CONT.ESS at.night-AD.ABL-DISTR DEM1.IISG.OBL tree-POSS.ABL one.each apple where say-INF III-know-NEG.PST.CVB III-escape-PRS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB
\l Recently in the evenings, apples, one by one, were disappearing from this tree in a strange way.

\t Howži xanä, sida quł neširu eženi uži egirno baɣmox ičanix, heneš bok’ek’anix šebi elor bayxosi yałru riyraniƛäy.
\m howži xan-a sida-a qu-ł neširu eže-ni uži egir-n baɣ-x iči-ani-x heneš b-ok’ek’-ani-x šebi elo-r b-ay-xosi yoł-ru r-iyr-ani-ƛay
\g now khan-ERG one.OBL-ERG day-CONT.ESS evening old-DEF son let-PFV.CVB garden-AD.ESS be-MSD-IPFV.CVB apple III-steal-MSD-PRS who there-LAT III-come-PRS.PRT be-PST.PRT IV-find.out-MSD-SUB.ABL
\l One day in the evening the khan left his elder son in the garden to find out who comes and steals the apples.

\t Baɣma tełer ayruntow, ža moƛan iqirno sasaqor kecno ƛexun.
\m baɣm-a tełer ay-run-tow ža moƛu-n iqir-n sasaq-qor kec-n ƛexu-n
\g garden.OBL-IN.ESS into come-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM1.SG sleep-TOP catch-PFV.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT sleep-PFV.CVB remain-PFV.CVB
\l As he came in the garden, he fell asleep till the morning came.

\t Xizyo sasaqosi babiwderno ayn eƛin, där siskin šebin rukaynč’uƛin.
\m xizyo sasaqosi babiw-der-n ay-n eƛi-n di-r siskin šebin r-ukad-č’u-ƛin
\g afterwards in.the.morning father-APUD.LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB say-PFV.CVB me-LAT any thing IV-see-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l Then in the morning he came back to his father and said that he did not see anything.

\t Bezuzaƛ’ neła quł neširun sis heneš bok’ek’äsi besun neła ɣunoqay.
\m b-ezu-zaƛ’ neła qu-ł neširu-n sis heneš b-ok’ek’-asi b-esu-n neła ɣun-qay
\g III-look-CSL.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL day-CONT.ESS evening-TOP one apple III-steal-RES.PRT III-find-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL tree-POSS.ABL
\l After they have looked, they found out that in that evening one apple from that tree was stolen too.

\t Hudayzikogon neširu xanä baɣmoxor oƛosini uži egirno.
\m hudayziko-gon neširu xan-a baɣ-xor oƛƛo-si-ni uži egir-n
\g the.next.day-CNTR evening khan-ERG garden-AD.LAT middle-ATTR-DEF son send-PFV.CVB
\l Next day in the evening the khan sent his middle son to the garden.

\t Žan hemedurtow kecnon ičin, sasaqosi babiwderno nexno eƛin, där c’ohor ukaynč’uƛin.
\m ža-n hemedur-tow kec-n-n iči-n sasaqosi babiw-der-n nex-n eƛi-n di-r c’ohor ukad-č’u-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG-TOP so-EMPH sleep-PFV.CVB-TOP remain-PFV.CVB in.the.morning father-APUD.LAT-TOP come-PFV.CVB say-PFV.CVB me-LAT thief see-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT
\l He also fell asleep and came in the morning to his father and said, "I did not see the thief."

\t Łˤora äƛirugon ɣudƛ’o neširu babiya eɣeni uži baɣmoxor egirno.
\m łˤora äƛiru-gon ɣudi-ƛ’ neširu babiw-a eɣe-ni uži baɣ-xor egir-n
\g three.OBL ORD-CNTR day-SUPER.ESS evening father-ERG young-DEF son garden-AD.LAT send-PFV.CVB
\l On the third day the father sent his youngest son to the garden.

\t Moƛaq iqirač’iniƛäy yisä yisis baša bicin sasaqor t’eq’erbašiƛ’or ičin.
\m moƛu-q iqir-a-č’i-ni-ƛay yisi-a yisi-s baša b-ici-n sasaq-qor t’eq’erbaši-ƛ’or iči-n
\g dream-POSS.ESS catch-INF-NEG.FUT-MSD-SUB.ABL DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN1 finger III-tie-PFV.CVB in.the.morning-POSS.LAT cautiousness-SUPER.LAT be-PFV.CVB
\l In order not to fall asleep, he tied his finger and was cautious till the morning came.

\t Qˤašiƛ’ɣor hawaƛ’ k’oƛin bayn asasi t’awus ɣunoƛ’ bičin.
\m qˤaši-ƛ’-ɣor hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n b-ay-n as-asi t’awus ɣun-ƛ’ b-iči-n
\g dawn-SUPER.ESS-IN.ALL air-SUPER.ESS jump-PFV.CVB III-come-PFV.CVB sky-RES.PRT peacock tree-SUPER.ESS III-sit-PFV.CVB
\l At dawn the heaven peacock came and sat at the tree.

\t Ža baynosi, šet’urtow dunyal č’urno.
\m ža b-ay-nosi šet’ur-tow dunyal č’ur-n
\g DEM1.SG III-come-ANT.CVB around-EMPH earth illuminate-PFV.CVB
\l As he came, he illuminated the earth around.

\t Xizyo eɣeni esiya nełaz c’eruc’a caƛinosi, sis nełas lel ɣunoƛer yoƛ’ˤun yayn, t’awusno hawaƛ’ k’oƛin boxin bik’in.
\m xizyo eɣe-ni esyu-a neła-z c’eruc’a caƛi-nosi sis neła-s lel ɣun-ƛer y-ˤoƛ’u-n y-ay-n t’awus-n hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n b-oxi-n b-ik’i-n
\g afterwards young-DEF brother-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 bow shoot.with-ANT.CVB one DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 feather tree-SUB.LAT II-fall-PFV.CVB II-come-PFV.CVB peacock-TOP air-SUPER.ESS jump-PFV.CVB III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB
\l Then the youngest brother shot with the bow and the peacock flew away, but one feather fell down under the tree.

\t Ža lelno žimäɣor eqerno, xanes eɣeni uži oqno iduɣor ik’in.
\m ža lel-n žimu-aɣor eqer-n xan-s eɣe-ni uži oq-n idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG feather-TOP pocket-IN.VERS put-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 young-DEF son become-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-PFV.CVB
\l The khan's youngest son put the feather in his pocket and went home.

\t Howda lel yaƛ’ˤuru aɣi eliz baɣmart’a bayx zownƛin, žimäy yoɣno ža lel babiwq yukarnosi, ɣˤutkutow č’urno rik’in.
\m howda lel y-ˤoƛ’u-ru aɣi eliz baɣ-ar-t’a b-ay-x zow-n-ƛin žimu-ay y-oɣ-n ža lel babiw-q y-ukar-nosi ɣˤutku-tow č’ur-n r-ik’i-n
\g DEM3.SG feather II-fall-PST.PRT bird we.SPEC.GEN2 garden-IN.LAT-DISTR III-come-PRS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT pocket-IN.ABL II-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG feather father-POSS.ESS II-show-ANT.CVB house-EMPH illuminate-PFV.CVB IV-go-PFV.CVB
\l "This feather has fallen from the bird, which comes to our garden," and as he took the feather from the pocket and showed it to his father the feather illuminated the whole house.

\t Tupin ħiroq caƛin, gulun bˤaƛoyn, eɣeni uži lel yaƛ’ˤuruni aɣeł xizay oqno.
\m tupi-n ħiro-q caƛi-n gulu-n b-ˤaƛod-n eɣe-ni uži lel y-ˤoƛ’u-ru-ni aɣi-ł xizay oq-n
\g rifle-TOP shoulder-POSS.ESS throw-PFV.CVB horse-TOP III-harness-PFV.CVB young-DEF son feather II-fall-PST.PRT-DEF bird-CONT.ESS behind become-PFV.CVB
\l The youngest son threw the rifle over his shoulder, harnessed the horse and went to find the bird that lost its feather.

\t Sidaɣ gogaƛ’ kikxo išanixƛin yeda q’ˤida ičinosi, ƛ’irir sis ƛ’oxono zey bayn.
\m sidaɣ goga-ƛ’ kik-x iš-ani-x-ƛin yeda q’ˤida iči-nosi ƛ’iri-r sis ƛ’oxono zey b-ay-n
\g in.one.place meadow-SUPER.ESS spring-AD.ESS eat-MSD-PRS-QUOT DEM2.ISG down sit-ANT.CVB above-LAT one huge bear III-come-PFV.CVB
\l As he sat down to eat near the spring on the meadow, a bear came.

\t Neła eƛin, darno rac’anix šebin neƛ, dowƛ’or ɣudi rayza quł, nagon boqłin din bäsu debez ħalarƛin.
\m neła eƛi-n di-r-n r-ac’-ani-x šebin neƛ mi-ƛ’or ɣudi r-ay-za qu-ł na-gon b-oq-łin di-n b-esu mi-z ħal-ar-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL say-PFV.CVB me-LAT-TOP IV-eat-MSD-PRS thing give you-SUPER.LAT day IV-come-LCV.CVB day-CONT.ESS where-CNTR III-happen-CNC.CVB me-TOP III-find you-GEN2 trouble-IN.LAT-QUOT
\l The bear said, "Give me something to eat, one day I will find you, if you will be in trouble."

\t Xanez užä zey ax roqace bišerno.
\m xan-z uži-a zey ax r-oq-ace b-iš-r-n
\g khan-GEN2 son-ERG bear belly IV-happen-TERM III-eat-CAUS-PFV.CVB
\l The khan's son fed down the bear.

\t Biš-butin bizinosi, zeyä yisiq esirno, łinał xizay, šebin retin mi maħor oqäsiƛin.
\m b-iš~uti-n b-izi-nosi zey-a yisi-q esir-n łina-ł xizay šebin r-eti-n mi maħor oq-asi-ƛin
\g III-eat-PFV.CVB III-get.up-ANT.CVB bear-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB what.OBL-CONT.ESS behind thing IV-want-PFV.CVB you outside become-RES.PRT-QUOT
\l After the bear has eaten, he got up and asked, "What are you looking for in your trip?"

\t Žoyä eƛin, däz baɣma mesedyos heneš boqxosi sis ɣun yoł.
\m uži-a eƛi-n di-z baɣ mesed-s heneš b-oq-x-si sis ɣun yoł
\g boy-ERG say-PFV.CVB me-GEN2 garden gold-GEN1 apple III-happen-PRS-ATTR one tree be
\l The boy said, "There is a tree with golden apples in my garden.

\t Ɣudes neširuxay elay sist’a heneš kamäsi besux.
\m ɣudes neširu-xay ele-ay sist’a heneš kami-asi b-esu-x
\g daily evening-AD.ABL there-IN.ABL one.each apple get.lost-RES.PRT III-find-PRS
\l Daily in the evening one apple disappears.

\t Ža elay bok’ek’xo asazo t’awusä.
\m ža ele-ay b-ok’ek’-x as-azo t’awus-a
\g DEM1.SG there-IN.ABL III-steal-PRS sky-RES.PRT.OBL peacock-ERG
\l The heaven peacock steals them.

\t Howži di nełał xizay oqäsi yołƛin.
\m howži di neła-ł xizay oq-asi yoł-ƛin
\g now me DEM1.IISG.OBL-CONT.ESS behind become-RES.PRT be-QUOT
\l That's why I decided to find it."

\t Elay mi sis łaces gulun biqirno, maħor oqno ok’łinč’inäy, t’awuseł xizay k’oƛin debi ħal baynč’iƛin.
\m ele-ay mi sis łaci-s gulu-n b-iqir-n maħor oq-n ok’eł-č’i-näy t’awus-ł xizay k’oƛi-n mi-s ħal b-ay-č’i-ƛin
\g there-IN.ABL you one wind-GEN1 horse-TOP III-catch-PFV.CVB outside become-PFV.CVB be.in.time-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB peacock-CONT.ESS behind run-PFV.CVB you-GEN1 condition III-come-NEG.FUT-QUOT
\l There you will catch one wind horse and come outside, but be in time, because otherwise you will be not able to catch the peacock.

\t Ža gulu debeq biqinäy, nełaƛ’no zown mi q’ˤuya qoq yałza mečoƛ’or ik’a ay.
\m ža gulu mi-q b-iqi-näy neła-ƛ’-n zow-n mi q’ˤuya qoq yoł-za moči-ƛ’or ik’i-a ay
\g DEM1.SG horse you-POSS.ESS III-get-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB you other cliff be-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.LAT go-INF must
\l When you get that horse, you must ride to another cliff.

\t Žan hemedur, q’ˤim ritäruntow baɣˤiłno nexxosi.
\m ža-n hemedur q’ˤim r-iti-run-tow b-ˤaɣˤi-ł-n nex-xosi
\g DEM1.SG-TOP so head IV-touch-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH III-open-POT-PFV.CVB come-PRS.PRT
\l It also opens through the touch with the head.

\t Elo qoqä teł miƛ’iryoz ɣunoƛ’ ƛ’iri raq’ˤu aɣbi ričixosi, t’awus hič’č’a bittaza deber bäsu.
\m elo qoq-a teł miƛ’iryo-z ɣun-ƛ’ ƛ’iri r-aq’ˤuł aɣi-bi r-iči-xosi t’awus hič’č’a bita-aza mi-r b-esu
\g there cliff-IN.ESS inside peach.OBL-GEN2 tree-SUPER.ESS above IV-sit bird-PL IV-be-PRS.PRT peacock the.most distance-IN.VERS.DIST you-LAT III-find
\l There inside the cliff there are many birds above on the peach tree, but you will find the peacock over other side.

\t Ayn yeda zeyä äƛiruni qoqƛer, elo q’ˤim ritäruntow qoq baɣˤiłno bik’in, teł yisir łaces gulubi resun.
\m ay-n yeda zey-a eƛi-ru-ni qoq-ƛer elo q’ˤim r-iti-run-tow qoq b-ˤaɣˤi-ł-n b-ik’i-n teł yisi-r łaci-s gulu-bi r-esu-n
\g come-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG bear-ERG say-PST.PRT-DEF cliff-SUB.LAT there head IV-touch-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH cliff III-open-POT-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB inside DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT wind-GEN1 horse-PL IV-find-PFV.CVB
\l The boy came to the cliff, which the bear was talking about, touched the cliff with his head and after it has opened he went inside and found wind horses.

\t Hič’č’a adäza bäqiruni guluƛ’no zown, xanes uži hawaƛ’ k’oƛin ik’in t’awus bičixozoni qoqxor.
\m hič’č’a adäza b-iqi-ru-ni gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n xan-s uži hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n ik’i-n t’awus b-iči-x-zo-ni qoq-xor
\g the.most ahead III-get-PST.PRT-DEF horse-SUPER.ESS-TOP ride-PFV.CVB khan-GEN1 son air-SUPER.ESS run-PFV.CVB go-PFV.CVB peacock III-be-PRS-ATTR.OBL-DEF cliff-AD.LAT
\l He took the first horse and rode to the cliff where the peacock lives.

\t Q’ˤim rätiruntow žan baɣˤiłno nexno.
\m q’ˤim r-iti-run-tow ža-n b-ˤaɣˤi-ł-n nex-n
\g head IV-touch-IMM.ANT.CVB-EMPH DEM1.SG-TOP III-open-POT-PFV.CVB come-PFV.CVB
\l He touched it with his head, the cliff opened and he came in.

\t Miƛ’iryoz ɣunoƛ’ ƛ’iri heqäsi yisir bercinawt’a aɣbi rukayn.
\m miƛ’iryo-z ɣun-ƛ’ ƛ’iri heq-asi yisi-r bercinaw-t’a aɣi-bi r-ukad-n
\g peach.OBL-GEN2 tree-SUPER.ESS above sit.down-RES.PRT DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT beautiful-DISTR bird-PL IV.PL-see-PFV.CVB
\l He saw beatiful birds sitting on the peach tree.

\t Hič’č’a bercinawni t’awus yisä boƛƛäy boɣƛ’oräy, qarawulza iqirno nesiq esirno, mi nazay, łinar ayäsi žek’u yołƛin.
\m hič’č’a bercinaw-ni t’awus yisi-a b-oƛƛo-ƛay b-oɣ-ƛ’oräy qarawul-bi-a iqir-n nesi-q esir-n mi nazay łinar ay-asi žek’u yoł-ƛin
\g the.most beautiful-DEF peacock DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG III-middle-SUB.ABL III-take.away-SIM.CVB guard-PL-ERG catch-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB you from.where why come-RES.PRT man be-QUOT
\l After he has seized the most beatiful one, the guards caught him and asked, "Where did you come from and why?"

\t Xanez užä žeduq šinaw raqru łinałäyn esin, xizyo žeduq neła t’awuses lel yukarno.
\m xan-z uži-a žedu-q šinaw r-oq-ru łina-łay-n esi-n xizyo žedu-q neła t’awus-s lel y-ukar-n
\g khan-GEN2 son-ERG DEM1.IPL-POSS.ESS every IV-happen-PST.PRT what.OBL-CONT.ABL-TOP tell-PFV.CVB afterwards DEM1.IPL-POSS.ESS DEM1.IISG.OBL peacock-GEN1 feather II-show-PFV.CVB
\l The khan's son told them what had happened and showed the feather of that peacock.

\t Nediw hunar yałru debi murad t’ubazi boynč’inäy, elur ħaq’ bäsuƛin, žedatow bisno yisiqor lel yaƛ’ˤuruni t’awus teƛno.
\m nediw hunar yoł-ru mi-s murad t’ubazi b-odi-č’i-näy elu-r ħaq’ b-esu-ƛin žeda-tow b-is-n yisi-qor lel y-ˤoƛ’u-ru-ni t’awus teƛ-n
\g such talent be-PST.PRT you-GEN1 wish fulfill III-do-NEG.FUT-CND.CVB we(I).OBL-LAT sin III-find-QUOT DEM1.IIPL.OBL-EMPH III-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT feather II-fall-PST.PRT-DEF peacock give-PFV.CVB
\l "If we do not fulfill the wish of a such talented boy, the sin will happen," and they gave him the peacock that lost its feather.

\t Ža nece bercinawni aɣin bižin, łacez guluƛ’no zown, yeda hawaƛ’ k’oƛin iduɣor ik’in.
\m uži-a nece bercinaw-ni aɣi-n b-iži-n łaci-z gulu-ƛ’-n zow-n yeda hawa-ƛ’ k’oƛi-n idu-ɣor ik’i-n
\g boy-ERG so.much beautiful-DEF bird-TOP III-carry-PFV.CVB wind-GEN2 horse-SUPER.ESS-and ride-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG air-SUPER.ESS jump-PFV.CVB home-IN.ALL go-PFV.CVB
\l The boy took this beatiful bird and rode his wind horse home.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder xanez baɣma ɣunoq boqxosini mesedyos heneš łukin bok’ek’xo zown anu.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder xan-z baɣ ɣun-q b-oq-xosi-ni mesed-s heneš łu-kin b-ok’ek’-x zow-n anu
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after khan-GEN2 garden tree-POSS.ESS III-happen-PRS.PRT-DEF gold-GEN1 apple who.ERG-even III-steal-PRS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l After that nobody stole the golden apples growing in the khan's garden.

\t Zownƛax, zownanuƛax sis dunyalƛ’otow ci rik’äsi doxtur.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n-anu-ƛax sis dunyal-ƛ’-tow ci r-ik’i-asi doxtur
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT one world-SUPER.ESS-EMPH name IV-go-RES.PRT doctor
\l Once upon a time there was a worldwide famed doctor.

\t Naysinan nesider bayx zown: beɣen, bežen, miskinawnin bečedawnin.
\m naysinan nesi-der b-ay-x zow-n b-eɣe-n b-eže-n miskinaw-ni-n bečedaw-ni-n
\g everywhere DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT III-come-PRS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB III-young-TOP III-old-TOP poor-DEF-TOP wealthy-DEF-TOP
\l All people came to him: young and old, poor and wealthy.

\t Sida quł nesi doxturder bečedaw žek’u ayn, nesä nesis roƛnoxuni kidno yayrno.
\m sida-a qu-ł nesi doxtur-der bečedaw žek’u ay-n nesi-a nesi-s r-oƛnoxu-ni kid-n y-ayr-n
\g one.OBL-ERG day-CONT.ESS DEM1.ISG.OBL doctor-APUD.LAT wealthy man come-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 IV-sick-DEF daughter-TOP II-bring-PFV.CVB
\l Once a rich man with his sick daughter came to doctor.

\t Nesä doxturqo esirno, debeq yedu kid saɣ yodäłäƛin.
\m nesi-a doxtur-q esir-n mi-q yedu kid saɣ y-odi-ł-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG doctor-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB you-POSS.ESS DEM2.IISG daughter cure II-do-POT-Q-QUOT
\l He asked doctor to cure his daughter.

\t Sida ƛˤebaƛ’aza yiłas di roƛxosi ričiranƛin, eƛin doxturä.
\m sida-a ƛˤeb-ƛ’aza yiła-s di r-oƛ-xosi r-iči-r-an-ƛin eƛi-n doxtur-a
\g one.OBL-ERG year-SUPER.VERS.DIST DEM2.IISG.OBL-GEN1 me IV-be.sick-PRS.PRT IV-be-CAUS-FUT.DEF-QUOT say-PFV.CVB doctor-ERG
\l The doctor promissed to cure her in one year.

\t Hemełƛ’o bečedawni žek’a eƛin, mi dey kid saɣ yodinäy, maharno erno debex ža di yegiran, retinäy boƛi bok’no dey maʕišat neƛanƛin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ bečedaw-ni žek’u-a eƛi-n mi di-s kid saɣ y-odi-näy mahar-n er-n mi-x ža di y-egir-an r-eti-näy b-oƛi b-ok’-n di-s maʕišat neƛ-an-ƛin
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS wealthy-DEF man-ERG say-PFV.CVB you me-GEN1 daughter cure II-do-CND.CVB wedding-TOP set.up-PFV.CVB you-AD.ESS DEM1.SG me II-send-FUT.DEF IV-want-CND.CVB III-half III-hit-PFV.CVB me-GEN1 fortune give-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l Afterwards the rich man suggested, "If you cure my daughter, I will set up the wedding and if you want, I will give you one half of my fortune."

\t Doxturno neła q’ut’oƛ’ razi oqno.
\m doxtur-n neła q’ut’i-ƛ’ razi oq-n
\g doctor-TOP DEM1.IISG.OBL agreement-SUPER.ESS agree become-PFV.CVB
\l The doctor agreed with it.

\t Boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow, neła ħukmatyos xan hemesitow doxturder ayn, roƛnoxuni nesä nesis užin ayrno.
\m b-oƛƛo b-aq’ˤu zaman b-ik’i-zaƛ’or-tow neła ħukmat-s xan hemesi-tow doxtur-der ay-n r-oƛnoxu-ni nesi-a nesi-s uži-n ayr-n
\g III-middle III-much time III-go-POST.CVB-EMPH DEM1.IISG.OBL country-GEN1 khan DEM4.ISG.OBL-EMPH doctor-APUD.LAT come-PFV.CVB IV-sick-DEF DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 son-TOP bring-PFV.CVB
\l It took little time and khan of that country came to the doctor with his sick son.

\t Xanä eƛin, mi dey uži saɣ odinäy, roƛik’u dey bečełi deber neƛanƛin.
\m xan-a eƛi-n mi di-s uži saɣ odi-näy roƛik’u di-s bečełi mi-r neƛ-an-ƛin
\g khan-ERG say-PFV.CVB you me-GEN1 son cure do-CND.CVB half me-GEN1 riches you-LAT give-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l The khan said, "If you cure my son, I will give you one half of my riches."

\t Doxturä nesiqorno hemedurtow eƛin, sida ƛˤebaƛ’aza debez žas di roƛxosi ričiranƛin.
\m doxtur-a nesi-qor-n hemedur-tow eƛi-n sida-a ƛˤeb-ƛ’aza mi-z uži-s di r-oƛ-x-si r-iči-r-an-ƛin
\g doctor-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.LAT-TOP so-EMPH say-PFV.CVB one.OBL-ERG year-SUPER.VERS.DIST you-GEN2 son-GEN1 me IV-be.sick-IPFV.CVB-ATTR IV-be-CAUS-FUT.CVB-QUOT
\l The doctor also said, "I will cure your son in one year."

\t Howži doxtur oqno xanez žarno, bečedawni žek’us kidberno daruyabi rodanix.
\m howži doxtur oq-n xan-z uži-r-n bečedaw-ni žek’u-s kid-r-n daru-bi r-odi-nir
\g now doctor become-PFV.CVB khan-GEN2 son-LAT-TOP wealthy-DEF man-GEN1 daughter-LAT-TOP medicine-PL IV-do-PURP.CVB
\l After that the doctor began to cure the khan's son and the daughter of the rich man.

\t Kid q’arƛ’o saɣ yoqno.
\m kid q’ar-ƛ’ saɣ y-oq-n
\g girl early-SUPER.ESS cure II-become-PFV.CVB
\l The girl recovered soon.

\t Doxturä nełaz babiwƛ’or xabar begirno, debi mi kid xizor yižanix horoƛin.
\m doxtur-a neła-z babiw-ƛ’or xabar b-egir-n mi-s mi kid xizor y-iži-ani-x horo-ƛin
\g doctor-ERG DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 father-SUPER.LAT story III-send-PFV.CVB you-GEN1 you daughter back II-take.out-MSD-AD.ESS come.IMPR-QUOT
\l The doctor said to her father, "Come and take your daughter."

\t Badiru q’ut’imoxor, doxturä nesi bečedawni žek’uqor eƛin, där debi roƛik’u bečełi retin anu, där debi kid yowa yetixƛin.
\m b-odi-ru q’ut’i-xor doxtur-a nesi bečedaw-ni žek’u-qor eƛi-n di-r mi-s roƛik’u bečełi r-eti-n anu di-r mi-s kid y-ow-a y-eti-x-ƛin
\g III-do-PST.PRT agreement-AD.LAT doctor-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL wealthy-DEF man-POSS.LAT say-PFV.CVB me-LAT you-GEN1 half riches IV-want-PFV.CVB be.NEG me-LAT you-GEN1 daughter II-bring-INF II-want-PRS-QUOT
\l As it was arranged, the doctor said to the wealthy man, "I do not want the half of your riches, but I want to marry your daughter."

\t Babiya ža kid nesix yegirno.
\m babiw-a ža kid nesi-x y-egir-n
\g father-ERG DEM1.SG daughter DEM1.ISG.OBL-AD.ESS II-send-PFV.CVB
\l The father gave his daughter.

\t Xanez žarno yetix zown ža kid.
\m xan-z uži-r-n y-eti-x zow-n ža kid
\g khan-GEN2 son-LAT-and II-love-PRS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG girl
\l The khan's son fell in love with her too.

\t ƛˤeb yik’inosigon, užił xizay xan ayn.
\m ƛˤeb y-ik’i-nosi-gon uži-ł xizay xan ay-n
\g year II-go-ANT.CVB-CNTR son-CONT.ESS behind khan come-PFV.CVB
\l One year later the khan came to pick up his son.

\t Ža kid yižinč’ey, babiwde sadaq di äk’inč’iƛingon, xanes uži ičin.
\m ža kid y-iži-č’ey babiw-de sadaq di ik’i-č’i-ƛin-gon xan-s uži iči-n
\g DEM1.SG girl II-take.out-NEG.PST.CVB father-APUD.ESS together me go-NEG.FUT-QUOT-CNTR khan-GEN1 son be-PFV.CVB
\l "I will not go with my father without that girl," the khan's son said.

\t Xanqay roƛik’u bečełin risno, doxturä sider sis nece betixosi kidno, užin sadaq begirno.
\m xan-qay roƛik’u bečełi-n r-is-n doxtur-a sida-r sis nece b-eti-xosi kid-n uži-n sadaq b-egir-n
\g khan-POSS.ABL half riches-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB doctor-ERG one.OBL-LAT one so.much III-want-PRS.PRT girl-TOP boy-TOP together III-send-PFV.CVB
\l If they loved each other so much, the doctor took the half of the khan's riches and sent the boy and the girl together.

\t Neła kidbä rok’un roɣno, yeda doxtur t’ok’ow roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey ƛexun.
\m neła kid-a rok’u-n r-oɣ-n yeda doxtur t’ok’ow r-odi-a šebin koƛ’i-č’ey ƛexu-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL girl-ERG heart-TOP IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG doctor anymore IV-do-INF thing understand.to-NEG.PST.CVB remain-PFV.CVB
\l That girl took away the doctor's heart and he did not understand anymore what was left for him to do.

\t Xizaɣor ɣˤutkun, idusi maʕišatno, daruyabin teƛno micxiryosno, mesedyosno ħurženyabin ric’no, yeda saparyox oqno.
\m xizaɣor ɣˤutku-n idu-si maʕišat-n daru-bi-n teƛ-n micxir-s-n mesed-s-n ħuržen-bi-n r-ic’-n yeda sapar-x oq-n
\g finally house-TOP home-ATTR fortune-TOP medicine-PL-TOP sell-PFV.CVB money-GEN1-TOP gold-GEN1-TOP bag-PL-TOP IV-fill-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG journey-AD.ESS begin-PFV.CVB
\l Finally, he sold his house, fortune, medicine and went on journey with the saddle bags filled with money and gold.

\t Raładyołäza egin gamiƛ’no zown sidade yeda ik’a ayx zown.
\m raład-łaza egi-n gama-ƛ’-n zow-n sida-de yeda ik’i-a ay-x zow-n
\g sea-CONT.VERS.DIST go.into-PFV.CVB boat-SUPER.ESS-TOP be.NPRS-PFV.CVB one.OBL-APUD.ESS DEM2.ISG go-INF come-PRS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB
\l At one place he had to go by boat on the sea.

\t Raładno bigtow halag boqno, yeda ƛ’iri zawruni gama butix zownƛax.
\m raład-n b-ig-tow halag b-oq-n yeda ƛ’iri zow-ru-ni gama b-uti-x zow-n-ƛax
\g sea-TOP III-very-EMPH excite III-become-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG above be.NPRS-PST.PRT-DEF boat III-turn-PRS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT
\l The sea ran high and the boat began to sink.

\t Gamiqanän eƛin, koyiza zawru roq’ˤyabi nazoqno raładyołxor riħura rayn.
\m gamiqan-a-n eƛi-n kʷay-bi-a zow-ru roq’ˤ-a-bi na-zo-q-n raład-łxor r-iħur-a r-ay-n
\g captain-ERG-TOP say-PFV.CVB hand-PL-IN.ESS be.NPRS-PST.PRT burden-ERG-PL where-ATTR.OBL-POSS.ESS-TOP sea-CONT.VERS IV-pour-INF IV-come-PFV.CVB
\l At the order of captain all people had to throw their burden into the sea.

\t Hemełƛ’okin gama xʷasar boda boqnoanu, ƛ’iri zawru nasin xalq’in raładyoł ɣanq’izi boqno.
\m hemeł-ƛ’-kin gama xʷasar b-odi-a b-oq-n-anu ƛ’iri zow-ru nasin xalq’i-n raład-ł ɣanq’izi b-oq-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS-even boat rescue III-do-INF III-happen-PFV.CVB-NEG above be.NPRS-PST.PRT all people-TOP sea-CONT.ESS drown III-happen-PFV.CVB
\l But it did not rescue the boat, all people drowned in the sea.

\t Yisi doxturqor taliħƛin sis q’ˤir koyiƛer riqin, nełaq t’it’aħinno ičin karačelyoza yeda lilyoxaɣor kurno.
\m yisi doxtur-qor taliħ-ƛin sis q’ˤir kʷay-ƛer r-iqi-n neła-q t’it’aħi-n-n iči-n karačelyo-bi-a yeda lilyo-xaɣor kur-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL doctor-POSS.LAT fortune-QUOT one board hand-SUB.LAT IV-get-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-POSS.ESS clutch-PFV.CVB-TOP remain-PFV.CVB wave.OBL-PL-ERG DEM2.ISG river.bank-AD.VERS throw-PFV.CVB
\l Luckily, the doctor got to clutch the board and waves threw him on shore.

\t Hemece raładya caƛi- ok’no yisiz lagiq siskin šebin ƛexun anu.
\m hemece raład caƛi ok’-n yisi-z laga-q siskin šebin ƛexu-n anu
\g such sea throw hit-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 body-POSS.ESS any thing remain-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l The sea threw him many times, but there were no traces on his body.

\t Howži yeda ža yičixozoni ʕaƛaɣorno ik’in, elo rukayru hič’č’a reženi ɣˤutkos ac yaɣˤiƛ’oräy, xan oƛixno maħor k’oƛin.
\m howži yeda ža y-iči-x-zo-ni ʕaƛ-aɣor-n ik’i-n elo r-ukad-ru hič’č’a r-eže-ni ɣˤutku-s ac y-ˤaɣˤi-ƛ’oräy xan oƛix-n maħor k’oƛi-n
\g now DEM2.ISG DEM1.SG II-be-PRS-ATTR.OBL-DEF village-IN.VERS-TOP go-PFV.CVB there IV-see-PST.PRT the.most IV-big-DEF house-GEN1 door II-open-SIM.CVB khan appear-PFV.CVB outside run-PFV.CVB
\l He dropped into the village, where that girl lived, and saw the big house. As he wanted to open the door, the khan appeared outside.

\t Madax doxtur adoru ukayzaƛ’, acno yuqin ža tełxor ik’in.
\m ma-x doxtur adoru ukad-zaƛ’ ac-n y-uqi-n ža teł-xor ik’i-n
\g yard-AD.ESS doctor naked see-CSL.CVB door-TOP II-close-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG inside-AD.LAT go-PFV.CVB
\l Having seen the naked doctor, the khan went inside and closed the door.

\t Xaner ža šebi yałru iyn anu.
\m xan-r ža šebi yoł-ru iy-n anu
\g khan-LAT DEM1.SG who be-PST.PRT know-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l The khan did not recognise him.

\t Xizyo baɣmaɣorno ik’in, ɣunoƛ waħo q’ˤida ičin zown ičäsi, Allahä sis sabaw yoynč’i diƛin.
\m xizyo baɣm-aɣor-n ik’i-n ɣun-ƛ waħo q’ˤida iči-n zow-n iči-asi Allah-a sis sabaw y-odi-č’i di-ƛin
\g afterwards garden.OBL-IN.VERS-TOP go-PFV.CVB tree-SUB.ESS below under sit-PFV.CVB be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be-RES.PRT God-ERG one amulet II-do-NEG.FUT me-QUOT
\l Afterwards he went to the garden and sat down thinking under the tree , "The God will not disregard me."

\t Sida zamanaƛ’aza baɣmar mesedyos yic’äasi ɣamasno yayrno q’ˤano žek’u ayn.
\m sida-a zaman-ƛ’aza baɣm-ar mesed-s y-ic’-a-asi ɣamas-n y-ayr-n q’ˤano žek’u ay-n
\g one.OBL-ERG time-SUPER.VERS.DIST garden.OBL-IN.LAT gold-GEN1 II-fill-PST.WIT.INT-RES.PRT box-TOP II-bring-PFV.CVB two man come-PFV.CVB
\l After a while two men appeared in the garden carrying the box filled with gold.

\t Žedu q’ˤunesno daʕba boqno, elo tełsi mesed boƛi-bok’łinč’ey.
\m žedu q’ˤuna-s-n daʕba b-oq-n elo teł-si mesed b-oƛi~ok’-łin-č’ey
\g DEM1.IPL two.OBL-GEN1-TOP dispute III-become-PFV.CVB there inside-ATTR gold III-divide-CNC.CVB-NEG.PST.UNW
\l These two disputed because they could not divide the gold equally.

\t Sidä eƛin, yisi sisxolizoni žek’urno sis but’a teƛa yaynč’a, nesir eli bukayzaƛ’, yałi nesä xanqon äsi, nesä elus reƛ’ibin räč’ƛin.
\m sida-a eƛi-n yisi sisxoli-zo-ni žek’u-r-n sis but’a teƛ-a y-ay-č’u-a nesi-r eli b-ukad-zaƛ’ yałi nesi-a xan-q-n esi nesi-a elu-s reƛ’a-bi-n r-eč’-ƛin
\g one.OBL-ERG say-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL alone-ATTR.OBL-DEF man-LAT-TOP one part give-INF II-must-NEG.PST.WIT-Q DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT we III-see-CSL.CVB else DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG khan-POSS.ESS-TOP tell DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG we(I).OBL-GEN1 hand-PL-TOP IV-cut-QUOT
\l One man said, "Since this alone man have seen us, we should give him one part, otherwise he will tell it to the khan and the latter will cut up our hands."

\t Sidenägon eƛin, ɣamasno nesirtow xecingon boxinäy, režigon rigu räčiƛin.
\m sideni-a-gon eƛi-n ɣamas-n nesi-r-tow xeci-n-gon b-oxi-näy r-eži-gon r-igu r-iči-ƛin
\g the.other.one-ERG-CNTR say-PFV.CVB box-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-LAT-EMPH leave-PFV.CVB-CNTR III-run.away-CND.CVB IV-more-CNTR IV-good IV-be-QUOT
\l The other one said, "It is better to leave him the box and run away."

\t Yisä žedus šebin elo- t’o esaniqno bˤuƛ’no, c’ohorza mesedyos yic’äsi k’emot’ yisiden xecin, boxin bik’in.
\m yisi-a žedu-s šebin elo t’o esi-ani-q-n b-ˤuƛ’-n c’ohor-bi-a mesed-s y-ic’-asi k’emot’ yisi-de-n xeci-n b-oxi-n b-ik’i-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.IPL-GEN1 thing there here tell-MSD-POSS.ESS-TOP III-be.afraid-PFV.CVB thief-PL-ERG gold-GEN1 II-fill-RES.PRT wooden.case DEM2.ISG.OBL-APUD.ESS-TOP leave-PFV.CVB III-run.away-PFV.CVB III-go-PFV.CVB
\l Being afraid that he will tell about their doings here and there, the thieves left the box filled with gold and ran away.

\t Sasaqosi elo baɣmaz egin ik’ix zawru žek’uqor yisi doxturä eƛin, mi äƛiruce mesed neƛan deber di, där šeƛ’un rown mi nexnäyƛin.
\m sasaqosi elo baɣm-az egi-n ik’i-x zow-ru žek’u-qor yisi doxtur-a eƛi-n mi eƛi-ru-ce mesed neƛ-an mi-r di di-r šeƛ’u-n r-ow-n mi nex-näy-ƛin
\g in.the.morning there garden.OBL-IN.ESS.DIST go.through-PFV.CVB go-PRS be.NPRS-PST.PRT man-POSS.LAT DEM2.ISG.OBL doctor-ERG say-PFV.CVB you say-PST.PRT-EQU1 gold give-FUT.DEF you-LAT me me-LAT clothing-TOP IV-bring-PFV.CVB you come-CND.CVB-QUOT
\l In the morning the doctor said to the man passing through the garden, "If you will bring me clothing, I will give you as much gold as you say."

\t Nesi žek’a rayäru šeƛ’un šeƛ’un, howži nartow di ik’anƛin yeda zawru, ƛ’irir boƛƛozo rihmos ɣˤanabi yayn.
\m nesi žek’u-a r-ayr-ru šeƛ’u-n šeƛ’u-n howži nar-tow di ik’i-an-ƛin yeda zow-ru ƛ’iri-r b-oƛƛo-zo rih-mo-s ɣˤanabi y-ay-n
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL man-ERG IV-bring-PST.PRT clothing-TOP put.on-PFV.CVB now where-EMPH me go-FUT.CVB-QUOT DEM2.ISG be.NPRS-PST.PRT above-LAT III-middle-ATTR.OBL age-ERG-GEN1 woman II-come-PFV.CVB
\l He put on the clothing brought by that man and thought now, "Where shall I go?"  as a woman of middle age came.

\t Neła nesiq esirno, mi šebi žek’u yoł, nazay, didur mi t’or ayäƛin.
\m neła-a nesi-q esir-n mi šebi žek’u yoł nazay didur mi t’o-r ay-a-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB you what man be from.where how you here-LAT come-Q-QUOT
\l She asked him, " Who are you? And where do you come from?"

\t Nesän esin, di dunyalƛ’otow ci rik’äsi doxtur yołƛin.
\m nesi-a-n esi-n di dunyal-ƛ’-tow ci r-ik’i-asi doxtur yoł-ƛin
\g DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG-TOP tell-PFV.CVB me world-SUPER.ESS-EMPH name IV-go-RES.PRT doctor be-QUOT
\l He said, " I am a doctor known in the world."

\t Yiła eƛin, eloš neła łˤora t’alamezni ɣˤutka deber retinäy, łˤora ƛˤeba mi elo doxturłin roynäy, deber di kumak boyxosi ɣˤanabiłun yičanƛin.
\m yiła-a eƛi-n eloš neła-a łˤora t’ala-z-ni ɣˤutku-a mi-r r-eti-näy łˤora ƛˤeb-a mi elo doxtur-łin r-odi-näy mi-r di kumak b-odi-xosi ɣˤanabi-łun y-iči-an-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PFV.CVB over.there DEM1.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS three.OBL floor-GEN2-DEF house-ERG you-LAT IV-want-CND.CVB three.OBL year-IN.ESS you there doctor-CNC.CVB IV-do-CND.CVB you-LAT me help III-do-PRS.PRT woman-LHUN II-remain-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l She said, "If you want to live in this three-floored house and work as a doctor for three years, I will help you."

\t Nełaƛ’ yeda razin oqno, kumakyorgon ža ɣˤanabin yižin, žedu łˤoran ƛˤeba sadaq beynoyn.
\m neła-ƛ’ yeda razi-n oq-n kumak-r-gon ža ɣˤanabi-n y-iži-n žedu łˤora-n ƛˤeb sadaq b-eynod-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS DEM2.ISG agree-TOP become-PFV.CVB help-LAT-CNTR DEM1.SG woman-TOP II-lead-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL three.OBL-TOP year together III-work-PFV.CVB
\l He agreed with it, took the woman as an aid and they worked together during three years.

\t Łˤoran ƛˤeba neła ɣˤanaza doxturqo esirno anu, debi baru yołäƛin.
\m łˤora-n ƛˤeb neła-a ɣˤanabi-a doxtur-q esir-n anu mi-s baru yoł-a-ƛin
\g three.OBL-TOP year DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG woman-ERG doctor-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB be.NEG you-GEN1 wife be-Q-QUOT
\l During these three years the woman did not ask the doctor, whether he has a wife or not.

\t Howži sida quł yiła yisiq esirno, mi baru yowäsi yołäƛin.
\m howži sida qu-ł yiła-a yisi-q esir-n mi baru y-ow-asi yoł-a-ƛin
\g now one.OBL day-CONT.ESS DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB you wife II-get-RES.PRT be-Q-QUOT
\l However one day she asked him, "Do you have a wife?"

\t Žäd di baru yowäsi anuƛin, doxturä žawab teƛno.
\m žäd di baru y-ow-asi anu-ƛin doxtur-a žawab teƛ-n
\g still me wife II-bring-RES.PRT be.NEG-QUOT doctor-ERG answer give-PFV.CVB
\l "I am still unmarried," the doctor gave an answer.

\t Yiła eƛin, mi razi oqnäy, dowxor di sis bercinaw kid yiqiranƛin.
\m yiła-a eƛi-n mi razi oq-näy mi-xor di sis bercinaw kid y-iqir-an-ƛin
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PFV.CVB you agree become-CND.CVB you-AD.LAT me one beautiful girl II-find-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l "if you agree, I will find a beautiful girl for you," the woman said.

\t Mi radiru łinaƛ’no di razi yołƛin, doxturän eƛin.
\m mi r-odi-ru łina-ƛ’-n di razi yoł-ƛin doxtur-a-n eƛi-n
\g you IV-do-PST.PRT what.OBL-SUPER.ESS-TOP me agree be-QUOT doctor-ERG-TOP say-PFV.CVB
\l "I fully agree with you," the doctor said.

\t Hemedur neła ɣˤanaza k’edin, bercinaw, q’ˤimaku kid doxturä yown.
\m hemedur neła ɣˤanabi-a k’edi-n bercinaw q’ˤimaku kid doxtur-a y-ow-n
\g so DEM1.IISG.OBL woman-ERG search-PFV.CVB beautiful grown.up girl doctor-ERG II-marry-PFV.CVB
\l So and so, that woman found a beautiful girl for the doctor and he married.

\t Yisiz bertenyołer xanno, nesä saɣ adiruni ža nesis užin, žasgon ža barun yayn.
\m yisi-z berten-łer xan-n nesi-a saɣ odi-ru-ni ža nesi-s uži-n uži-s-gon ža baru-n y-ay-n
\g DEM2.ISG.OBL-GEN2 marriage-CONT.LAT khan-TOP DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG cure do-PST.PRT-DEF DEM1.SG DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 son-TOP son-GEN1-CNTR DEM1.SG wife-TOP II-come-PFV.CVB
\l The khan and his son, who was cured by this doctor, came to the marriage with his wife.

\t Xan aynosi, doxtur išinč’ey ičin.
\m xan ay-nosi doxtur iš-č’ey iči-n
\g khan come-ANT.CVB doctor eat-NEG.PST.CVB be-PFV.CVB
\l As the khan came, the doctor refused to eat.

\t Xanä nesiq esirno, šida mi išxanuƛin.
\m xan-a nesi-q esir-n šida mi iš-x-anu-ƛin
\g khan-ERG DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ESS ask-PFV.CVB why you eat-IPFV.CVB-NEG-QUOT
\l The khan asked, "Why don't you eat?"

\t Doxturä eƛin, min t’o ičin di äšinč’i, mi dey tušman yoł, mi baq’ˤu ʕazab neƛsiƛin.
\m doxtur-a eƛi-n mi-n t’o iči-n di iš-č’i mi di-s tušman yoł mi b-aq’ˤu ʕazab neƛ-s-ƛin
\g doctor-ERG say-PFV.CVB you-TOP here be-PFV.CVB me eat-NEG.FUT.CVB you me-GEN1 enemy be you III-much torture give-PST.WIT-QUOT
\l The doctor said, "You are my enemy and as long as you are here, I will not eat. You caused me much torture."

\t Xizyo xanä esin, neła baɣma mesedyos yic’äsi k’emot’ yayäru žek’u di yoł, łˤoran ƛˤeba dowde puħo yeynoyx zawru ɣˤanabin dey esiw yoł, yedu łˤoran t’alames ɣˤutkun dey yoł, debex howži yegirxosi kidno dey yołƛin.
\m xizyo xan-a esi-n neła-a baɣm-a mesed-s y-ic’-asi k’emot’ y-ayr-ru žek’u di yoł łˤora-n ƛˤeb-a mi-de puħo y-eynod-x zow-ru ɣˤanabi-n di-s esiw yoł yedu łˤora-n t’ala-s ɣˤutku-n di-s yoł mi-x howži y-egi-r-xosi kid-n di-s yoł-ƛin
\g afterwards khan-ERG tell-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS garden.OBL-IN.ESS gold-GEN1 II-fill-RES.PRT wooden.case II-bring-PST.PRT man me be three.OBL-TOP year-IN.ESS you-APUD.ESS next.to II-work-PRS be.NPRS-PST.PRT woman-TOP me-GEN1 sister be DEM2.IISG three.OBL-TOP floor-GEN1 house-TOP me-GEN1 be you-AD.ESS now II-let.go-CAUS-PRS.PRT daughter-TOP me-GEN1 be-QUOT
\l Afterwards the khan told him, "That man in the garden, who brought the wooden case filled with gold, is me; that woman, who was working next to you during last three years, is my sister; that tree-floored house belongs me and that girl, you are now marrying, is my daughter."

\t Hemełƛ’o xizyo doxtur ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤ izin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ xizyo doxtur ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤ izi-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS afterwards doctor very endure get.up-PFV.CVB
\l Then afterwards the doctor was very happy.

\t Howži sisgon berten bok’a bayƛin, eƛin xanä.
\m howži sis-gon berten b-ok’-a b-ay-ƛin eƛi-n xan-a
\g now one-CNTR marriage III-beat-INF III-must-QUOT say-PFV.CVB khan-ERG
\l "Now we must celebrate one more wedding," the khan said.

\t Łas bertenƛin, doxturä esirno.
\m ła-s berten-ƛin doxtur-a esir-n
\g who.OBL-GEN1 marriage-QUOT doctor-ERG ask-PFV.CVB
\l "Whose wedding?" the doctor asked.

\t Mi saɣ yayruni kid däz žax yaqˤuł yowxƛin, xanä madał adäzar boɣno berten.
\m mi saɣ y-odi-ru-ni kid di-z uži-x yaqˤuł y-ow-x-ƛin xan-a ma-ł adäz-ar b-oɣ-n berten
\g you cure II-do-PST.PRT-DEF girl me-GEN2 son-AD.ESS today II-bring-PRS-QUOT khan-ERG yard-CONT.ESS before-IN.LAT III-take.away-PFV.CVB marriage
\l "My son marry today that girl, you are cured," and khan moved the wedding into the yard.

\t Hemełƛ’ay soder doxtur xanez ʕaƛa ičin.
\m hemeł-ƛ’ay soder doxtur xan-z ʕaƛ-a iči-n
\g DEM4.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL upward doctor khan-GEN2 village-IN.ESS be-PFV.CVB
\l From then onward, the doctor lived in khan's village.

\t Roƛxosi ahli nesider režigon raq’u raya roqno.
\m r-oƛ-xosi ahli nesi-der r-eži-gon r-aq’ˤu r-ay-a r-oq-n
\g IV-be.sick-PRS.PRT people DEM1.ISG.OBL-APUD.LAT IV-more-CNTR IV-much IV-come-INF IV-become-PFV.CVB
\l And more sick people began to come to him.

\t Zownƛax, zown anuƛax eniwn užin.
\m zow-n-ƛax zow-n anu-ƛax eniw-n uži-n
\g be.NPRS-PFV.CVB-QUOT be.NPRS-PFV.CVB be.NEG-QUOT mother-TOP son-TOP
\l Once upon a time there was a mother and her son.

\t Žedu c’aq’ yaziqłiƛ’ zown.
\m žedu c’aq’ yaziqłi-ƛ’ zow-n
\g DEM1.IPL very poverty-SUPER.ESS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB
\l They were very poor.

\t Sida quł užä eniwqay zap’ana hisos k’apyan bisno, žan t’aħin, c’eruc’a rodin.
\m sida-a qu-ł uži-a eniw-qay zap’ana his-s k’apya-n b-is-n ža-n t’aħi-n c’eruc’a r-odi-n
\g one.OBL-ERG day-CONT.ESS son-ERG mother-POSS.ABL strong spring.wool-GEN1 thread-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG-TOP tie-PFV.CVB bow IV-do-PFV.CVB
\l One day the son took a strong wool thread by his mother, strained it and made a bow.

\t Sida quł yeda ža c’eruc’an risno bełiƛ’ ik’in.
\m sida-a qu-ł yeda ža c’eruc’a-n r-is-n bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-n
\g one.OBL-ERG day-CONT.ESS DEM2.ISG DEM1.SG bow-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB hunting-SUPER.ESS go-PFV.CVB
\l One day he went hunting with this bow.

\t Eniya q’oq’ot’as reƛno kurno čorpa rodin.
\m eni-a q’oq’ot’u-s reƛ-n kur-n čorpa r-odi-n
\g mother-ERG partridge-GEN1 meat-TOP throw-PFV.CVB soup IV-do-PFV.CVB
\l The mother cooked a delicious patridge soup.

\t Yiłƛ’ay rigu čorpa netikin riqäsi zownč’uƛin, neła quł neširu eniyan užän rigut’a ax rodin.
\m yiła-ƛ’ay r-igu čorpa neti-kin r-iqi-asi zow-č’u-ƛin neła-a qu-ł neširu eni-a-n uži-a-n r-igu-t’a ax r-odi-n
\g DEM2.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL IV-good soup when-even IV-get-RES.PRT be.NPRS-NEG.PST.WIT-QUOT DEM1.IISG.OBL-IN.ESS day-CONT.ESS evening mother-ERG-TOP son-ERG-and IV-good-DISTR belly IV-do-PFV.CVB
\l They have never had a such delicious soup before, so that evening the mother and the son ate good.

\t Hudayzikon uži bełiƛ’ ik’in, qˤayn č’aq’ˤirno xizor utin ayn.
\m hudayziko-n uži bełi-ƛ’ ik’i-n qˤay-n č’aq’ˤi-r-n xizor uti-n ay-n
\g the.next.day-TOP son hunting-SUPER.ESS go-PFV.CVB hare-TOP hit-CAUS-PFV.CVB back turn.back-PFV.CVB come-PFV.CVB
\l Next day the son went hunting and came back with the hare.

\t Łˤono äƛirugon ɣudƛ’o ik’inosi, siskin šebin riqinč’ey xizor utin bełiƛ’azay nexƛ’oräy, yisir cey bukayn.
\m łˤono äƛiru-gon ɣudi-ƛ’ ik’i-nosi siskin šebin r-iqi-č’ey xizor uti-n bełi-ƛ’azay nex-ƛ’oräy yisi-r cey b-ukad-n
\g three ORD-CNTR day-SUPER.ESS go-ANT.CVB any thing IV-get-NEG.PST.UNW back turn.back-PFV.CVB hunting-SUPER.ABL.DIST come-SIM.CVB DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT eagle III-see-PFV.CVB
\l The third time he went hunting and as he was coming back with empty hands, he saw an eagle.

\t Ža bexuranixƛin yisä c’eruc’a rutirnosi, ceyä eƛin, mi di bexarno, deber di sis bercinaw pardagi neƛanƛin.
\m ža b-exur-a-nir-ƛin yisi-a c’eruc’a r-utir-nosi cey-a eƛi-n mi di b-exur-n mi-r di sis bercinaw pardagi neƛ-an-ƛin
\g DEM1.SG III-kill-INF-PURP.CVB-QUOT DEM2.ISG.OBL-ERG bow IV-turn-ANT.CVB eagle-ERG say-PFV.CVB you me III-kill-PFV.CVB you-LAT me one beautiful scarf give-FUT.DEF-QUOT
\l As he directed his bow to kill the eagle, the latter said, "Don't kill me, I will give you one beautiful scarf."

\t Užä eƛin, pardagi eranix dey ya esiw anu, ya baru anu, där retäsi šebin anu žaƛin.
\m uži-a eƛi-n pardagi er-a-nir di-s ya esiw anu ya baru anu di-r r-eti-asi šebin anu ža-ƛin
\g son-ERG say-PFV.CVB scarf put-INF-PURP.CVB me-GEN1 neither sister be.NEG neither wife be.NEG me-LAT IV-want-RES.PRT thing be.NEG DEM1.SG-QUOT
\l The son said, "I have neither sister nor wife to wear this scarf."

\t Xizyo ceyä eƛin, ža pardagi mi q’ˤida ret’irnäy, nełaƛ’ deber rätiru biša roƛixxosiƛin.
\m xizyo cey-a eƛi-n ža pardagi mi q’ˤida r-et’ir-näy neła-ƛ’ mi-r r-eti-ru bišʷa r-oƛix-x-si-ƛin
\g afterwards eagle-ERG say-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG scarf you down IV-make.a.bed-CND.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ESS you-LAT IV-want-PST.PRT food IV-appear-PRS-ATTR-QUOT
\l Then the eagle said, "If you lay down the scarf, any food you want will appear."

\t Pardagin risno uži idur aynosi, eniya esirno, ža łinar mi rowä, šebi nełas mumpaʕatƛin.
\m pardagi-n r-is-n uži idu-r ay-nosi eni-a esir-n ža łinar mi r-ow-a šebi neła-s mumpaʕat-ƛin
\g scarf-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB son home-LAT come-ANT.CVB mother-ERG ask-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG why you IV-bring-Q what DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN1 benefit-QUOT
\l As the son came home with the scarf, the mother asked, "Why did you bring it, what is it good for?"

\t Užä ža pardagi eniwł adäza ret’irnosi, riguƛ’ay rigu biša roƛixno elo ƛ’iri.
\m uži-a ža pardagi eniw-ł adäza r-et’ir-nosi r-igu-ƛ’ay r-igu bišʷa r-oƛix-n elo ƛ’iri
\g son-ERG DEM1.SG scarf mother-CONT.ESS before IV-make.a.bed-ANT.CVB IV-good-SUPER.ABL IV-good food IV-appear-PFV.CVB there above
\l The son laid down the scarf before his mother and a lot of good food appeared on it.

\t Ɣˤaɣˤun yizin ža xabar esanix eniw bečedawni maduhalzaxar yik’in.
\m ɣˤaɣˤu-n y-izi-n ža xabar esi-ani-x eniw bečedaw-ni maduhal-bi-xar y-ik’i-n
\g be.happy-TOP II-get.up-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG story tell-MSD-AD.ESS mother wealthy-DEF neighbor-PL-AD.VERS II-go-PFV.CVB
\l The mother was happy and went to tell the wealthy neighbors about this.

\t Bečedawni maduhal yiłdetow sadaq iduɣorno nexno, roɣno ža pardagin ik’in, dey zows žaƛin.
\m bečedaw-ni maduhal yiła-de-tow sadaq idu-ɣor-n nex-n r-oɣ-n ža pardagi-n ik’i-n di-s zow-s ža-ƛin
\g wealthy-DEF neighbor DEM2.IISG.OBL-APUD.ESS-EMPH together home-IN.ALL-TOP come-PFV.CVB IV-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.SG scarf-TOP go-PFV.CVB me-GEN1 be.NPRS-PST.WIT DEM1.SG-QUOT
\l But the wealthy neighbor came home together with the mother, took away the scarf and said, "It was my scarf."

\t Xizyo eniwn, užin aderzoxortow miskinłiƛ’or bayn.
\m xizyo eniw-n uži-n ader-zo-xor-tow miskinłi-ƛ’or b-ay-n
\g afterwards mother-TOP son-TOP earlier-ATTR.OBL-AD.LAT-EMPH poverty-SUPER.LAT III-come-PFV.CVB
\l Afterwards the mother and the son lived poor again.

\t Xizyogon yeda uži ceyder ik’in, sosigon där kumak bodoƛin.
\m xizyogon yeda uži cey-der ik’i-n sosi-gon di-r kumak b-odi-o-ƛin
\g then DEM2.ISG son eagle-APUD.LAT go-PFV.CVB again-CNTR me-LAT help III-do-IMPR-QUOT
\l Then the son went to the eagle and said, "Help me again!"

\t Neła eƛin, di näƛru šebin c’unzi rodin iča koƛ’inč’u debeqƛin.
\m neła-a eƛi-n di neƛ-ru šebin c’unzi r-odi-n iči-a koƛ’-č’u mi-q-ƛin
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG say-PFV.CVB me give-PST.PRT thing guard IV-do-PFV.CVB be-INF can-NEG.PST.WIT you-POSS.ESS-QUOT
\l The eagle said, "I gave you something, that you were not able to guard."

\t Ceyä yisir bigu gulu teƛno.
\m cey-a yisi-r b-igu gulu teƛ-n
\g eagle-ERG DEM2.ISG.OBL-LAT III-good horse give-PFV.CVB
\l The eagle gave him a good horse.

\t Hisonax ža bäciza mečoƛ’ sasaqort’a mesed besux zown.
\m hisono-a-x ža b-ici-za moči-ƛ’ sasaq-qor-t’a mesed b-esu-x zow-n
\g trough-ERG-AD.ESS DEM1.SG III-tie-LCV.CVB place-SUPER.ESS in.the.morning-POSS.LAT-DISTR gold III-find-PRS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB
\l In the morning they found gold in the trough, where it was tied.

\t Elo bäsuru mesedyoƛ rac’a šebin risno, bigu bet’erbaqi boqno žedus.
\m elo b-esu-ru mesed-ƛ r-ac’-a šebin r-is-n b-igu bet’erbaqi b-oq-n žedu-s
\g there III-find-PST.PRT gold-SUB.ESS IV-eat-INF thing IV-take-PFV.CVB III-good life III-become-PFV.CVB DEM1.IPL-GEN1
\l In exchange for gold, that was found there, they bought something to eat and lived good.

\t Eniwn, užin hemedur big yołƛin teqnosi, hemesi bečedawni maduhalä neširu rečuƛäy ža gulun bižin, nełaz meča q’ˤuya gulu bicin.
\m eniw-n uži-n hemedur b-ig yoł-ƛin teq-nosi hemesi bečedaw-ni maduhal-a neširu reču-ƛay ža gulu-n b-iži-n neła-z meča q’ˤuya gulu b-ici-n
\g mother-TOP son-TOP so III-good be-QUOT hear-ANT.CVB DEM4.ISG.OBL wealthy-DEF neighbor-ERG evening cattleshed-SUB.ABL DEM1.SG horse-TOP III-take.out-PFV.CVB DEM1.IISG.OBL-GEN2 instead.of other horse III-tie-PFV.CVB
\l That wealthy neighbor heard about good life of that mother and her son and took away that horse out of cattle shed in the evening and tied instead of it another one.

\t Sasaqosi rečuƛer yezunosi, elo mesed besun anu.
\m sasaqosi reču-ƛer y-ezu-nosi elo mesed b-esu-n anu
\g in.the.morning cattleshed-SUB.LAT II-look-ANT.CVB there gold III-find-PFV.CVB be.NEG
\l In the morning the mother looked in the cattle shed and did not find gold.

\t Xizyo yiła užiq esin, howži eliz guluz hisona teł mesed besuxanuƛin.
\m xizyo yiła-a uži-q esi-n howži eliz gulu-z hisono-a teł mesed b-esu-x-anu-ƛin
\g afterwards DEM2.IISG.OBL-ERG son-POSS.ESS tell-PFV.CVB now we.SPEC.GEN2 horse-GEN2 trough-IN.ESS inside gold III-find-PRS-NEG-QUOT
\l Then she told to her son, "Now there is no gold in the trough of our horse."

\t Žar čuqˤno nesi bečedawni maduhales piša yedu yałrułi.
\m uži-r čuqˤ-n nesi bečedaw-ni maduhal-s piša yedu yoł-rułi
\g son-LAT notice-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL wealthy-DEF neighbor-GEN1 deed DEM2.IISG be-MSD
\l The son noticed, that it was a deed of that wealthy neighbor.

\t Žigoƛ’aygon uži ceyder ik’in.
\m žigo-ƛ’ay-gon uži cey-der ik’i-n
\g again-SUPER.ABL-CNTR son eagle-APUD.LAT go-PFV.CVB
\l The son went again to the eagle.

\t Neła žaqor beɣetow hibo teƛno.
\m neła-a uži-qor b-eɣe-tow hibo teƛ-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-ERG boy-POSS.LAT III-small-EMPH stick give-PFV.CVB
\l The eagle gave a small stick to the boy.

\t Biči, hiboƛin, eƛizaƛ’or deber aciru žek’uz gugyoƛ’ yedu biħnayxosiƛin.
\m b-iči hibo-ƛin eƛi-zaƛ’or mi-r aci-ru žek’u-z gugu-ƛ’ yedu b-iħanad-xosi-ƛin
\g III-stop.IMP stick-QUOT say-POST.CVB you-LAT bother-PST.PRT man-GEN2 back-SUPER.ESS DEM2.IISG III-fight-PRS.PRT-QUOT
\l "As long as you do not say 'Stop, stick', it hits on the back of that man, which bothers you."

\t Ža hibon bisno yeda bečedawni maduhalzo ɣˤutkoxor ik’in.
\m ža hibo-n b-is-n yeda bečedaw-ni maduhal-z ɣˤutku-xor ik’i-n
\g DEM1.SG stick-TOP III-take-PFV.CVB DEM2.ISG wealthy-DEF neighbor-GEN2 house-AD.LAT go-PFV.CVB
\l He went with that stick to the house of that wealthy neighbor.

\t Zamanaƛ’aza ɣˤutka tełäzay sis qˤaƛu-bˤaɣu rizin, hiba gugu žek’ƛ’oräy, bečedawni maduhalqo k’ʷač’ni regin.
\m zaman-ƛ’aza ɣˤutku-a teł-azay sis qˤaƛu r-izi-n hibo-a gugu žek’-ƛ’oräy bečedaw-ni maduhal-q k’ʷač’no-ni r-egi-n
\g time-SUPER.VERS.DIST house-IN.ESS inside-IN.ABL.DIST one shout IV-get.up-PFV.CVB stick-ERG back beat-SIM.CVB wealthy-DEF neighbor-POSS.ESS groan-MSD IV-let.go-PFV.CVB
\l Some minutes later one could hear noise and shout inside the house: as the stick beat the wealthy neighbor on his back, he gave a loud groan.

\t Howži maħorno k’oƛin, nesä žaq harizi rodin, debi mi pardagin riso, gulun xizor bižo, yedu hibon beč’erƛin.
\m howži maħor-n k’oƛi-n nesi-a uži-q harizi r-odi-n mi-s mi pardagi-n r-is-o gulu-n xizor b-iži-o yedu hibo-on b-eč’er-ƛin
\g now outside-TOP run-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-ERG boy-POSS.ESS request IV-do-PFV.CVB you-GEN1 you scarf-TOP IV-take-IMPR horse-TOP back III-take.out-IMPR DEM2.IISG stick-CND III-stop-QUOT
\l Later he ran outside and requested the boy, "Take your scarf, take your horse back, but stop this stick."

\t Dahawgon užä hibo begirno xecin, nesis gugu žek’anix.
\m dahaw-gon uži-a hibo b-egir-n xeci-n nesi-s gugu žek’-nir
\g a.little-CNTR boy-ERG stick III-let-PFV.CVB leave-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-GEN1 back beat-PURP.CVB
\l The boy let the stick still beat a little on his back.

\t Xizyo pardagin risno, gulun boɣno nesiqay bižin, uži eniwdäɣor ik’in.
\m xizyo pardagi-n r-is-n gulu-n b-oɣ-n nesi-qay b-iži-n uži eniw-däɣor ik’i-n
\g afterwards scarf-TOP IV-take-PFV.CVB horse-TOP III-take.away-PFV.CVB DEM1.ISG.OBL-POSS.ABL III-take.out-PFV.CVB boy mother-APUD.VERS go-PFV.CVB
\l Afterwards the boy took the scarf, the horse and went to his mother.

\t Nełƛ’ay soder eniwn, užin łinasnotow urɣel anusi bičix zown.
\m neła-ƛ’ay soder eniw-n uži-n łina-s-n-tow urɣel anu-si b-iči-x zow-n
\g DEM1.IISG.OBL-SUPER.ABL after mother-TOP son-TOP what.OBL-GEN1-TOP-EMPH sorrow be.NEG-ATTR III-live-PRS be.NPRS-PFV.CVB
\l From that moment on the mother and the son lived careless.
